Text: Daenerys Targaryen has wed some Dothraki horselord. What of it? Should we send her a wedding gift?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: A knife perhaps, a good sharp one, and a bold man to wield it.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: She's little more than a child.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Soon enough that child will spread her legs and start breeding.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Tell me we're not speaking of this.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Oh, it's unspeakable to you? What her father did to your family... That was unspeakable. What Rhaegar Targaryen did to your sister... the woman I loved. I'll kill every Targaryen I get my hands on.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: But you can't get your hands on this one, can you?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: This Khal Drogo, it's said he has 100,000 men in his horde.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Even a million Dothraki are no threat to the realm, as long as they remain on the other side of the Narrow Sea. They have no ships, Robert.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: There are still those in the Seven Kingdoms who call me Usurper. If the Targaryen boy crosses with a Dothraki horde at his back, the scum will join him.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: He will not cross. And if by chance he does, we'll throw him back into the sea.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: There's a war coming, Ned. I don't know when, I don't know who we'll be fighting, but it's coming.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Back across the sea, Drogo fornicates with Daenerys, she’s clearly not enjoying it.
On their way to the Wall, stopping to set up camp for the night.
Sit. You'll be fed. Untie them.
Speaker: Benjen Stark

Text: Rapers. They were given a choice no doubt... Castration or the Wall. Most choose the knife. Not impressed by your new brothers? Lovely thing about the Watch... You discard your old family and get a whole new one.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Why do you read so much?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Look at me and tell me what you see.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Is this a trick?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: What you see is a dwarf. If I'd been born a peasant they might've left me out in the woods to die. Alas, I was born a Lannister of Casterly Rock. Things are expected of me. My father was the Hand of the King for 20 years.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Until your brother killed that King.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Yes, until my brother killed him. Life is full of these little ironies. My sister married the new King and my repulsive nephew will be King after him. I must do my part for the honor of my house, wouldn't you agree? But how? Well, my brother has his sword and I have my mind. And a mind needs books like a sword needs a whetstone. That's why I read so much. And you? What's your story, bastard?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Ask me nicely and maybe I'll tell you, dwarf.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: A bastard boy with nothing to inherit, off to join the ancient order of the Night's Watch, alongside his valiant brothers-in-arms.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: The Night's Watch protects the realm from...
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Yes yes, against grumpkins and snarks and all the other monsters your wet nurse warned you about. You're a smart boy. You don't believe that nonsense... Everything's better with some wine in the belly.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Bran’s bedroom, Catelyn still at his bedside, Maester Luwin walks in.
It's time we reviewed the accounts, my lady. You'll want to know how much this royal visit has cost us.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: Talk to Poole about it.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Poole went south with Lord Stark, my lady. We need a new steward, and there are several other appointments that require our immediate attention...
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: I don't care about appointments!
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: I'll make the appointments. We'll talk about it first thing in the morning.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Very good, my Lord. My Lady.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: When was the last time you left this room?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: I have to take care of him.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: He's not going to die, mother. Maester Luwin says the most dangerous time has passed.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: What if he's wrong? Bran needs me.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Rickon needs you. He's six. He doesn't know what's happening. He follows me around all day, clutching my leg, crying...
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Close the windows! I can't stand it! Please make them stop! (Wolf’s howling repeatedly)
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Fire. You stay here. I'll come back.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: You're not supposed to be here. No one is supposed to be here. It's a mercy. He's dead already.
Speaker: Assassin

Text: No!
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: The man is an assassin, when he draws his blade, Catelyn begins to fend him off. In the process her hands are both sliced. The man walks within inches of Bran and his direwolf comes in and mauls the assassin.
In Daenerys’ tent across the Narrow Sea.
Have you ever seen a dragon?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Dragon gone, Khaleesi.
Speaker: Irri

Text: Everywhere? Even in the east?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: No dragon. Brave men kill them. It is known.
Speaker: Irri

Text: It is known.
Speaker: Jhiqui

Text: A trader from Garth told me that dragons come from the moon.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: The moon?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: He told me the moon was an egg, Khaleesi, that once there were two moons in the sky. But one wandered too close to the sun and it cracked from the heat. Out of it poured a thousand thousand dragons and they drank the sun's fire.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: Moon is no egg. Moon is goddess... wife of sun. It is known.
Speaker: Irri

Text: It is known.
Speaker: Jhiqui

Text: Leave me with her. Why did the trader from Garth tell you these stories?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Irri leaves the tent.
Men like to talk when they're happy. Before your brother bought me for you, it was my job to make men happy.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: How old were you?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: I was nine when my mother sold me to the pleasure house.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: Nine?!
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: I did not touch a man for three years, Khaleesi. First you must learn.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: Can you teach me how to make the Khal happy?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Yes.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: Will it take three years?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: No.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: Jon, Tyrion, Benjen and company arrive at the wall and look at it from afar.
Welcome.
Speaker: Benjen Stark

Text: Catelyn is on the ground where Bran’s body was discovered, below the tower he fell from. She looks up and sees the window. She now is looking through that same window where Bran fell. She investigates the room, noticing a cleared patch on some flooring, finding a long blonde hair.
Catelyn holds council in the Godswood with Robb, Theon Greyjoy, Rodrick and Maester Luwin.
What I am about to tell you must remain between us. I don't think Bran fell from that tower. I think he was thrown.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: The boy was always sure-footed before.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: Someone tried to kill him twice. Why? Why murder an innocent child? Unless he saw something he wasn't meant to see.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Saw what, my lady?
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: I don't know. But I would stake my life the Lannisters are involved. We already have reason to suspect their loyalty to the crown.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Did you notice the dagger the killer used? It's too fine a weapon for such a man. The blade is Valyrian steel, the handle dragonbone. Someone gave it to him.
Speaker: Rodrick Cassel

Text: They come into our home and try to murder my brother? If it's war they want...
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: If it comes to that, you know I'll stand behind you.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: What, is there going to be a battle in the Godswood? Too easily words of war become acts of war. We don't know the truth yet. Lord Stark must be told of this.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: I don't trust a raven to carry these words.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: I'll ride to King's Landing.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: No. There must always be a Stark in Winterfell. I will go myself.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Mother, you can't.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: I must.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: I'll send Hal with a squad of guardsmen to escort you.
Speaker: Rodrick Cassel

Text: Too large a party attracts unwanted attention. I don't want the Lannisters to know I'm coming.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Let me accompany you at least. The Kingsroad can be a dangerous place for a woman alone.
Speaker: Rodrick Cassel

Text: What about Bran?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: I have prayed to the Seven for more than a month. Bran's life is in their hands now.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Back at Daenerys’ tent, Doreah is on top of her, “teaching” Daenerys how to please Khal Drogo.
No, Khaleesi. You must look in his eyes always. Love comes in at the eyes. It is said that Irogenia of Lys could finish a man with nothing but her eyes.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: Finish a man?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Kings traveled across the world for a night with Irogenia. Magisters sold their palaces. Khals burned her enemies just to have her for a few hours. They say a thousand men proposed to her and she refused them all.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: Well, she sounds like an interesting woman. I don't think that Drogo will like it with me on top.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: You will make him like it, Khaleesi. Men want what they've never had. And the Dothraki take slaves like a hound takes a bitch. Are you a slave, Khaleesi? Then don't make love like a slave. Very good, Khaleesi. Out there he is the mighty Khal, but in this tent, he belongs to you.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: I don't think that this is the Dothraki way.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: If he wanted the Dothraki way, why did he marry you?
Speaker: Doreah

Text: No. No. Tonight I would look upon your face.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: The Lannisters, traveling Starks and all royal guards have stopped for the evening to rest on their way to King’s Landing.
Pardon me, Ser.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Do I frighten you so much, girl? Or is it him there making you shake? He frightens me too. Look at that face.
Speaker: Sandor Clegane

Text: I'm sorry if I offended you, Ser. Why won't he speak to me?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: He hasn't been very talkative these last 20 years. Since the mad King had his tongue ripped out with hot pincers.
Speaker: Sandor Clegane

Text: He speaks damn well with his sword though. Ser Ilyn Payne, the King's justice. The royal executioner. What is it, sweet lady? Does the hound frighten you? Away with you, dog. You're scaring my lady. I don't like to see you upset. The sun is finally shining. Come walk with me.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Stay, Lady. I probably shouldn't have any more. Father only lets us have one cup at feasts.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: My princess can drink as much as she wants. Don't worry... You're safe with me.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: In a field next to a river, off from where everyone else is.
I'll get you!
Speaker: Mycah

Text: Arya!
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: What are you doing here? Go away.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Your sister? And who are you, boy?
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Mycah, my Lord.
Speaker: Mycah

Text: He the butcher's boy.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: He's my friend.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: A butcher's boy who wants to be a Knight, eh? Pick up your sword, butcher's boy. Let's see how good you are.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: She asked me to, my Lord. She asked me to.
Speaker: Mycah

Text: I'm your prince, not your lord, and I said pick up your sword.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: It's not a sword, my prince. It's only a stick.
Speaker: Mycah

Text: And you're not a Knight. Only a butcher's boy. That was my lady's sister you were hitting, do you know that?
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Stop it!
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Arya, stay out of this.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: I won't hurt him... Much. Filthy little bitch!
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: No no, stop it, stop it, both of you. You're spoiling it. You're spoiling everything!
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: I'll gut you, you little cunt!
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Arya!
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Arya then steps in and fights with Joffrey, disarming him and putting him on his back. Her direwolf sees this as a thread and runs in to defend.
Nymeria!
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Please don't.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Arya, leave him alone. My prince, my poor prince, look what they did to you. Stay here, I'll go back to the inn and bring help.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Then go! Don't touch me.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: A hunt has begun for the direwolf that attacked Joffrey.
The wolf's not here. Look down by the stream.
Speaker: Soldier 1

Text: Arya hidden from everyone telling her direwolf to leave.
You've got to go. They'll kill you for what you did to Joffrey. Go on... run. Go! Leave now!
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: It's a direwolf.
Speaker: Soldier 2

Text: I'll check down here.
Speaker: Soldier 1

Text: I think I heard a noise.
Speaker: Soldier 2

Text: Go!
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Jory comes to tell Ned that his daughter has been found.
My lord! My lord! They found her. She's unharmed.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: Where is she?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: She's been taken directly before the King.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: Who took her?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: The Lannisters found her.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: Right, get back.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: The Queen ordered them to bring her straight to him.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: Back! Back to the inn. All back!
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Now back at the Inn where everyone is staying.
I'm sorry.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Are you hurt?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: No.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: It's all right. What is the meaning of this? Why was my daughter not brought to me at once?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: How dare you speak to your King in that manner?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Quiet, woman. Sorry, Ned. I never meant to frighten the girl. But we need to get this business done quickly.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Your girl and that butcher's boy attacked my son. That animal of hers nearly tore his arm off.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: That's not true! She just... Bit him a little. He was hurting Mycah.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Joffrey told us what happened. You and that boy beat him with clubs while you set your wolf on him.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: That's not what happened!
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Yes it is! They all attacked me and she threw my sword in the river.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Liar!
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Shut up!
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Enough! He tells me one thing, she tells me another. Seven hells! What am I to make of this? Where's your other daughter, Ned?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: In bed asleep.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: She's not. Sansa, come here, darling.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Now, child... Tell me what happened. Tell it all and tell it true. It's a great crime to lie to a King.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: I don't know. I don't remember. Everything happened so fast. I didn't see.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Liar! Liar liar liar!
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Arya!
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Stop it! That's enough of that.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Liar liar liar!
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Stop! Arya!
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: She's as wild as that animal of hers. I want her punished.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: What would you have me do, whip her through the streets? Damn it, children fight. It's over.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Joffrey will bear these scars for the rest of his life.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: You let that little girl disarm you? See to it that your daughter is disciplined. I'll do the same with my son.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Gladly, your Grace.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: And what of the direwolf? What of the beast that savaged your son?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: I'd forgot the damned wolf.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: We found no trace of the direwolf, your Grace.
Speaker: Soldier

Text: So be it.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: We have another wolf.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: As you will.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: You can't mean it.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: A direwolf's no pet. Get her a dog. She'll be happier for it.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: He doesn't mean Lady, does he? No no, not Lady! Lady didn't bite anyone! She's good!
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Lady wasn't there! You leave her alone!
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Stop them. Don't let them do it. Please! It wasn't Lady!
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: s this your command... your Grace?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Where is the beast?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Chained up outside, your Grace.
Speaker: Soldier

Text: Ser Ilyn, do me the honor.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: No. Jory... Take the girls to their rooms. If it must be done, then I'll do it myself.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Is this some trick?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: The wolf is of the north. She deserves better than a butcher.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Once outside, before Eddard lays to rest the direwolf.
The butcher's boy... You rode him down?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: He ran... Not very fast.
Speaker: Sandor Clegane

Text: Eddard kills the direwolf on the King’s orders.
The King, Eddard and the rest of the posse have arrived at King’s Landing.
Welcome, Lord Stark. Grand Maester Pycelle has called a meeting of the Small Council. The honor of your presence is requested.
Speaker: King’s Landing Guard

Text: Get the girls settled in. I'll be back in time for supper. And, Jory, you go with them.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Yes, my Lord.
Speaker: Jory Cassel

Text: If you'd like to change into something more appropriate…
Speaker: King’s Landing Guard

Text: Ned Stark gives the guard a blank stare before taking off his gloves, the guard realizes Ned’s disinterest and the two begin walking to the council chamber. First they walk through the Great Hall, where the throne sits. Jaime Lannister is lingering in front of the throne.
Thank the gods you're here, Stark. About time we had some stern northern leadership.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Glad to see you're protecting the throne.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Sturdy old thing. How many kings' asses have polished it, I wonder? What's the line? The King shits and the Hand wipes.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Very handsome armor. Not a scratch on it.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: I know. People have been swinging at me for years, but they always seem to miss.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: You've chosen your opponents wisely then.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: I have a knack for it. It must be strange for you coming into this room. I was standing right here when it happened. He was very brave, your brother. Your father too. They didn't deserve to die like that. Nobody deserves to die like that.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: But you just stood there and watched.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: 500 men just stood there and watched. All the great knights of the Seven Kingdoms. You think anyone said a word, lifted a finger? No, Lord Stark. 500 men and this room was silent as a crypt. Except for the screams, of course, and the Mad King laughing. And later... When I watched the Mad King die, I remembered him laughing as your father burned... It felt like justice.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Is that what you tell yourself at night? You're a servant of justice? That you were avenging my father when you shoved your sword in Aerys Targaryen's back?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Tell me... If I'd stabbed the Mad King in the belly instead of the back, would you admire me more?
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: You served him well, when serving was safe.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Ned enters the small council’s chamber where the others are already awaiting him.
Lord Stark.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Lord Varys.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: I was grievously sorry to hear of your troubles on the Kingsroad. We are all praying for Prince Joffrey's full recovery.
Speaker: Varys

Text: A shame you didn't say a prayer for the butcher's son. Renly! You're looking well.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: And you look tired from the road. I told them this meeting could wait another day, but...
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: But we have a Kingdom to look after. I've hoped to meet you for some time, Lord Stark. No doubt Lady Catelyn has mentioned me.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: She has, Lord Baelish. I understand you knew my brother Brandon as well.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: All too well. I still carry a token of his esteem from navel to collarbone.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Perhaps you chose the wrong man to duel with.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: It wasn't the man that I chose, my Lord. It was Catelyn Tully. A woman worth fighting for, I'm sure you'll agree.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: I humbly beg your pardon, my Lord Stark.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: Grand Maester.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: How many years has it been? You were a young man.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: And you served another King.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: How forgetful of me. This belongs to you, now. Should we begin?
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: Without the King?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Winter may be coming, but I'm afraid the same cannot be said for my brother.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: His Grace has many cares. He entrusts some small matters to us that we might lighten the load.
Speaker: Varys

Text: We are the lords of small matters here.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: My brother instructs us to stage a tournament in honor of Lord Stark's appointment as Hand of the King.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: Mmm, how much?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: 40,000 gold dragons to the champion, 20,000 to the runner-up, 20,000 to the winning archer.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Can the treasury bear such expense?
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: I'll have to borrow it. The Lannisters will accommodate, I expect. We already owe Lord Tywin 3 million gold. What's another 80,000?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Are you telling me the Crown is three million in debt?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: I'm telling you the Crown is six million in debt.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: How could you let this happen?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: The Master of Coin finds the money. The King and the Hand spend it.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: I will not believe Jon Arryn allowed Robert to bankrupt the realm.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Lord Arryn gave wise and prudent advice, but I fear His Grace doesn't always listen.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: "Counting coppers," he calls it.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: I'll speak to him tomorrow. This tournament is an extravagance we cannot afford.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: As you will. But still, we'd best make our plans.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: There will be no plans until I speak to Robert. Forgive me, my Lords. I had a long ride.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: You are the King's Hand, Lord Stark, we serve at your pleasure.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Cersei tending to Joffrey’s “wound”.
Please, it's nearly healed.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: It's ugly.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: A King should have scars, you fought off a direwolf. You're a warrior like your father.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: I'm not like him. I didn't fight off anything. It bit me and all I did was scream. And the two Stark girls saw it, both of them.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: That's not true. You killed the beast. You only spared the girl because of the love your father bears her father. When Aerys Targaryen sat on the Iron Throne, your father was a rebel and a traitor. Someday you'll sit on the throne and the truth will be what you make it.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Do I have to marry her?
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Yes. She's very beautiful and young. If you don't like her, you only need to see her on formal occasions and when the time comes, to make little princes and princesses. And if you'd rather fuck painted whores, you'll fuck painted whores. And if you'd rather lie with noble virgins, so be it. You are my darling boy and the world will be exactly as you want it to be. Do something nice for the Stark girl.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: I don't want to.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: No, but you will. The occasional kindness will spare you all sorts of trouble down the road.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: We allow the northerners too much power. They consider themselves our equals.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: How would you handle them?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: I'd double their taxes and command them to supply 10,000 men to the royal army.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: A royal army?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Why should every lord command his own men? It's primitive, no better than the hill tribes. We should have a standing army of men loyal to the Crown, trained by experienced soldiers... Instead of a mob of peasants who've never held pikes in their lives.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: And if the northerners rebel?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: I'd crush them. Seize Winterfell and install someone loyal to the realm as Warden of the North. Uncle Kevan, maybe.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: And these 10,000 northern troops, would they fight for you or their lord?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: For me. I'm their King.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: But you've just invaded their homeland, asked them to kill their brothers.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: I'm not asking.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: The North cannot be held... not by an outsider. It's too big and too wild. When the winter comes, the Seven gods together couldn't save you and your royal army. A good King knows when to save his strength... And when to destroy his enemies.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: So you agree... The Starks are enemies?
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Everyone who isn't us is an enemy.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Arya, Sansa and their Septa are all around a table eating. Arya is stabbing a knife into the table between her fingers.
Enough of that, young lady. Eat your food.
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: I'm practicing.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Practicing for what?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: The Prince.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Arya, stop!
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: He's a liar and a coward and he killed my friend.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: The Hound killed your friend.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: The Hound does whatever the Prince tells him to do.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: You're an idiot.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: You're a liar. And if you told the truth, Mycah would be alive.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Enough!
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: Septa Mordane begins escorting Arya away from the table as Ned walks in.
What's happening here?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Arya would rather act like a beast than a lady.
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: Go to your room. We'll speak later. That's for you, love…
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Ned places a wrapped package in front of Sansa on the table.
The same dollmaker makes all of Princess Myrcella's toys. Don't you like it?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: I haven't played with dolls since I was eight. May I be excused?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: You've barely eaten a thing.
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: It's all right. Go on.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Sansa gets up from the table, leaving only Ned and Septa Mordane.
War was easier than daughters.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Arya is unsheathing Needle privately in her room as Ned knocks on the door.
Go away!
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Arya, open the door. May I come in? Whose sword is that?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Mine.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Give it to me. I know this maker's mark. This is Mikken's work. Where did you get this? This is no toy. Little ladies shouldn't play with swords.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: I wasn't playing. And I don't want to be a lady.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Come here. Now what do you want with this?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: It's called Needle.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: A blade with a name. And who were you hoping to skewer with Needle? Your sister? Do you know the first thing about sword fighting?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Stick 'em with the pointy end.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: [laughs] That's the essence of it.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: I was trying to learn. I asked Mycah to practice with me. I asked him. It was my fault.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: No, sweet girl. You didn't kill the butcher's boy.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: I hate them! I hate all of them. The Hound, the Queen and the King and Joffrey and Sansa.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Sansa was dragged before the King and Queen... And asked to call the Prince a liar.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: So was I! He is a liar.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Darling, listen to me. Sansa will be married to Joffrey someday. She cannot betray him. She must take his side even when he's wrong.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: But how you can let her marry someone like that?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Well… Look at me. You're a Stark of Winterfell. You know our words.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Winter is coming.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: You were born in the long summer. You've never known anything else. But now winter is truly coming. And in the winter, we must protect ourselves, look after one another. Sansa is your sister.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: I don't hate her. Not really.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: I don't want to frighten you, but I won't lie to you either. We've come to a dangerous place. We cannot fight a war amongst ourselves. All right? Go on. It's yours.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: I can keep it?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Try not to stab your sister with it. If you're going to own a sword, you'd better know how to use it.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Bran’s bedside in Winterfell. A crow lands on his windowsill.
Don't listen to it. Crows are all liars. I know a story about a crow.
Speaker: Old Nan

Text: I hate your stories.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: I know a story about a boy who hated stories. I could tell you about Ser Duncan the Tall. Those were always your favorites.
Speaker: Old Nan

Text: Those weren't my favorites. My favorites were the scary ones.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Oh, my sweet summer child. What do you know about fear? Fear is for the winter, when the snows fall a hundred feet deep. Fear is for the long night, when the sun hides for years and children are born and live and die all in darkness. That is the time for fear, my little Lord, when the White Walkers move through the woods. Thousands of years ago there came a night that lasted a generation. Kings froze to death in their castles, same as the shepherds in their huts. And women smothered their babies rather than see them starve, and wept and felt the tears freeze on their cheeks. So is this the sort of story that you like? In that darkness, the White Walkers came for the first time. They swept through cities and kingdoms, riding their dead horses, hunting with their packs of pale spiders big as hounds…
Speaker: Old Nan

Text: Robb walks into the room, interrupting Old Nan’s story.
What are you telling him now?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Only what the little Lord wants to hear.
Speaker: Old Nan

Text: Get your supper. I want some time with him. One time she told me the sky is blue because we live inside the eye of a blue-eyed giant named Macumber.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Maybe we do.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: How do you feel? You still don't remember anything? I've seen you climb a thousand times. In the wind, in the rain... A thousand times. You never fall.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: I did though. It's true, isn't it... what Maester Luwin says about my legs? I'd rather be dead.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Don't ever say that.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: I'd rather be dead.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Catelyn and Rodrick arrive at King’s Landing, entering through a back entrance.
Fewer eyes back here, my Lady. But still too many.
Speaker: Rodrick Cassel

Text: It's nine years since I've set foot in the capital. And no one knew who I was the last time I came either.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: My Lady.
Speaker: Rodrick Cassel

Text: Two guards pull up to her on horseback and hand her a scroll, informing her that she is to follow them.
Welcome to King's Landing, Lady Stark. Would you mind following us?
Speaker: Guard

Text: I would. We've done nothing wrong.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: We've been instructed to escort you into the city.
Speaker: Guard

Text: Instructed? I don't know who's providing your instructions, but...
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Follow me, Lady Stark.
Speaker: Guard

Text: At Baelish’s brothel.
Cat! Go on. Go upstairs. (to his whores)
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: You little worm! You take me for some back-alley Sally you can drag into a…
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Two naked whores interrupt, Baelish snaps at them to leave.
I meant no disrespect to you of all people.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: How dare you bring me here! Have you lost your mind?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: No one will come looking for you here. Isn't that what like you wanted? I'm truly sorry... about the locale.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: How did you know I was coming to King's Landing?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: A dear friend told me.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Lady Stark.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Lord Varys.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: To see you again after so many years is a blessing. Your poor hands.
Speaker: Varys

Text: How did you know I was coming?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Knowledge is my trade, my Lady. Did you bring the dagger with you, by any chance? My little birds are everywhere. Even in the north. They whisper to me the strangest stories. Valyrian steel.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Do you know whose dagger this is?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: I must admit I do not.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Well well, this is an historic day. Something you don't know that I do. There's only one dagger like this in all of the Seven Kingdoms. It's mine.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Yours?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: At least it was, until the tournament on Prince Joffrey's last nameday. I bet on Ser Jaime in the jousting, as any sane man would. When the Knight of the Flowers unseated him, I lost this dagger.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: To whom?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Tyrion Lannister. The Imp.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: At Castle Black, in a courtyard. Grenn and Jon are swordfighting, Jon getting the best of him and breaking his nose.
If that were a real sword, you'd be dead. Lord Snow here grew up in a castle spitting down on the likes of you. Pyp. Do you think Ned Stark's bastard bleeds like the rest of us?
Speaker: Alliser Thorne

Text: Pyp steps forward and with one move Jon has him on his back.
Next!
Speaker: Alliser Thorne

Text: Jon quickly dispatches of another newcomer, we see Lord Commander Jeor and Tyrion looking on from a balcony.
Next!
Speaker: Alliser Thorne

Text: Another man starts againt Jon Snow, as another joins, Jon defeats the two of them almost instantly.
Lord Snow, it appears you're the least useless person here. Go clean yourselves up. There's only so much I can stomach in a day.
Speaker: Alliser Thorne

Text: Tyrion and Lord Commander talking, overlooking the courtyard.
A charming man.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: I don't need him to be charming. I need him to turn this bunch of thieves and runaways into men of the Night's Watch.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: And how's that going, Commander Mormont?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Slowly. A raven came for Ned Stark's son.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: Good news or bad?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Both.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: Back in the throne room, just outside of the small council chambers.
Lord Stark. I meant to give you this earlier. So forgetful these days. A raven from Winterfell this morning.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: Good news? Perhaps you'd like to share it with your wife?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: My wife is in Winterfell.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Is she?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Baelish leads Ned to the entrance of his brothel. Ned is not so keen on the idea and begins choking Baelish.
I thought that she'd be safest in here. One of several such establishments I own.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: You're a funny man. A very funny man.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Ned! [poking her head out of a window]
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: The Starks... Quick tempers, slow minds.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Jon is in the armory of Castle Black, putting away equipment when a gang of the guys jump him.
You broke my nose, bastard!
Speaker: Grenn

Text: It's an improvement.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: If we threw you over the Wall, wonder how long it'd take you to hit.
Speaker: Grenn

Text: I wonder if they'd find you before the wolves did.
Speaker: Pyp

Text: What're you looking at, halfman?
Speaker: Grenn

Text: I'm looking at you. You've got an interesting face. Very distinctive faces. All of you.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: What do you care about our faces?
Speaker: Rast

Text: It's just I think they would look marvelous decorating spikes in King's Landing. Perhaps I'll write my sister, the Queen, about it.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: We'll talk later, Lord Snow.
Speaker: Grenn

Text: Everybody knew what this place was and no one told me. No one but you. My father knew and left me to rot here at the Wall all the same.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Grenn's father left him too... Outside a farmhouse when he was three. Pyp was caught stealing a wheel of cheese. His little sister hadn't eaten in three days. He was given a choice: his right hand or the Wall. I've been asking the Lord Commander about them. Fascinating stories.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: They hate me because I'm better than they are.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: It's a lucky thing none of them were trained by a master-at-arms like your Ser Rodrik. I don't imagine any of them have ever held a real sword before they came here. Your brother Bran. He's woken up.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: At Baelish’s brothel.
The mere suggestion that the Queen's brother tried to kill your boy would be considered treason.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: We have proof. We have the blade.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Which Lord Tyrion will say was stolen from him. The only man who could say otherwise has no throat, thanks to your boy's wolf.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Petyr has promised to help us find the truth. He's like a little brother to me. He would never betray my trust.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: I'll try to keep you alive, for her sake. A fool's task, admittedly, but I've never been able to refuse your wife anything.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: I won't forget this. You're a true friend.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Don't tell anyone. I have a reputation to maintain.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: In the Queen’s chambers.
How could you be so stupid?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Calm down.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: He's a child... 10 years old. What were you thinking?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: I was thinking of us. You're a bit late to start complaining about it now. What has the boy told them?
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Nothing. He's said nothing. He remembers nothing.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Then what are you raving about?
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: What if it comes back to him? If he tells his father what he saw...
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: We'll say he was lying. We'll say he was dreaming. We'll say whatever we like. I think we can outfox a 10-year-old.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: And my husband?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: I'll go to war with him if I have to. They can write a ballad about us : "The War for Cersei's Cunt."
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Cersei hits Jaime, he spins her around and hugs her from behind, whispering into her ear.
Let me go.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Never.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Let me go.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: The boy won't talk. And if he does, I'll kill him. Him, Ned Stark, the King... the whole bloody lot of them, until you and I are the only people left in this world.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: In a back alley before Catelyn leaves King’s Landing.
I wish I could see the girls.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: It's too dangerous.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Just for a moment.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Until we know who our enemies are...
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: I know they did it, Ned. The Lannisters. In my bones, I know it.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Littlefinger's right. I can't do anything without proof.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: And if you find the proof?
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Then I bring it to Robert... And hope he's still the man I once knew. You watch yourself on the road, huh? That temper of yours is a dangerous thing.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: My temper? Gods be good, you nearly killed poor Littlefinger yesterday.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: He still loves you.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Does he?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Off with you.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: In the King’s chambers, he’s drinking and eating at a table.
It's been a long time. But I still remember every face. You remember your first?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Of course, your Grace.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: Who was it?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: A Tyroshi. Never learned the name.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: How'd you do it?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Lance through the heart.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: Quick one. Lucky for you. Mine was some Tarly boy at the Battle of Summerhall. My horse took an arrow so I was on foot, slogging through the mud. He came running at me, this dumb high-born lad, thinking he could end the rebellion with the single swing of his sword. I knocked him down with the hammer. Gods, I was strong then. Caved in his breastplate. Probably shattered every rib he had. Stood over him, hammer in the air. Right before I brought it down he shouted, "Wait! Wait!"... They never tell you how they all shit themselves. They don't put that part in the songs. Stupid boy. Now the Tarlys bend the knee like everyone else. He could have lingered on the edge of the battle with the smart boys and today his wife would be making him miserable, his sons would be ingrates, and he'd be waking three times in the night to piss into a bowl. Wine! Lancel. Gods, what a stupid name. Lancel Lannister. Who named you? Some halfwit with a stutter? What are you doing?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: It's empty, your Grace.
Speaker: Lancel Lannister

Text: What do you mean it's empty?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: There's no more wine.
Speaker: Lancel Lannister

Text: Is that what empty means?! So get more. Tell your cousin to get in here. Kingslayer! Get in here. Surrounded by Lannisters. Every time I close my eyes I see their blond hair and their smug, satisfied faces. It must wound your pride, huh? Standing out there like a glorified sentry. Jaime Lannister, son of the mighty Tywin... Forced to mind the door while your King eats and drinks and shits and fucks. So come on. We're telling war stories. Who was your first kill, not counting old men?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: One of the outlaws in the Brotherhood.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: I was there that day. You were only a squire, 16 years old.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: You killed Simon Toyne with a counter riposte. Best move I ever saw.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: A good fighter, Toyne, but he lacked stamina.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: Your outlaw... Any last words?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: I cut his head off, so no.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: What about Aerys Targaryen? What did the Mad King say when you stabbed him in the back? I never asked. Did he call you a traitor? Did he plead for a reprieve?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: He said the same thing he'd been saying for hours... "Burn them all." If that's all, your Grace...
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Riding horseback and walking through fields.
: Do the Dothrakis buy their slaves?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: The Dothraki don't believe in money. Most of their slaves were given to them as gifts.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: From whom?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: If you rule a city and you see the horde approaching, you have two choices : pay tribute or fight. An easy choice for most. Of course, sometimes it's not enough. Sometimes a Khal feels insulted by the number of slaves he's given. He might think the men too weak or the women too ugly. Sometimes a Khal decides his riders haven't had a good fight in months and need the practice.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Daenerys sees one of the Dothraki men strike a slave with a whip for not moving fast enough.
Tell them all to stop.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: You want the entire horde to stop? For how long?
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Until I command them otherwise.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: You're learning to talk like a Queen.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Not a Queen. A Khaleesi.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Daenerys dismounts her horse and walks through the field off of the path. She hears noises coming towards her and grass snapping. Her brother Viserys storms into the clearing on horseback wielding a sword.
You dare! You give commands to me? To me? You do not command the dragon. I am Lord of the Seven Kingdoms. I don't take orders from savages or their sluts. Do you hear me?
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: Viserys has his sword to Daenerys’ throat. Rakharo whips Viserys, wrapping it around his neck and yanking him to his back.
Rakharo ask if you want him dead, Khaleesi.
Speaker: Irri

Text: No!
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Rakharo say you should take ear, to teach respect.
Speaker: Irri

Text: Please please, don't hurt him. Tell him I don't want my brother harmed.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Kill these Dothraki dogs! I am your King!
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: Shall we return to the Khalasar, Khaleesi?
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: You walk. [to Viserys]
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: Jon and Benjen looking out over the wall. Benjen saying goodbye.
I wanted to be here when you saw it for the first time. I'm leaving this morning.
Speaker: Benjen Stark

Text: You're leaving?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: I'm the First Ranger. My job is out there. There have been disturbing reports.
Speaker: Benjen Stark

Text: What kind of reports?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: The kind I don't want to believe.
Speaker: Benjen Stark

Text: 'm ready. I won't let you down.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: You're not going. You're no ranger, Jon.
Speaker: Benjen Stark

Text: But I'm better than every...
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Better than no one! Here... A man gets what he earns, when he earns it. We'll speak when I return.
Speaker: Benjen Stark

Text: Yoren and Tyrion getting drunk on wine in a the mess hall of Castle Black.
A bear's balls.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: You're joking?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: And his brains and his guts, his lungs and his heart all fried in his own fat. When you're a hundred miles north of the Wall and you ate your last meal a week ago, you leave nothing for the wolves.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: And how do a bear's balls taste?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: A bit chewy. And what about you, my Lord? What's the strangest thing you've eaten?
Speaker: Yoren

Text: Do Dornish girls count? So you roam the Seven Kingdoms, collaring pickpockets and horse thieves and bringing them here as eager recruits?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: But it's not all of 'em's done bad things. Some of 'em's just poor lads looking for steady feed. Some of 'em's high-born lads looking for glory.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: They have a better chance finding feed than glory.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Benjen enters.
The Night's Watch is a joke to you, is it? Is that what we are, Lannister? An army of jesters in black?
Speaker: Benjen Stark

Text: You don't have enough men to be an army and aside from Yoren here, none of you are particularly funny.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: I hope we've provided you with some good stories to tell when you're back in King's Landing. But something to think about while you're drinking your wine down there, enjoying your brothels... Half the boys you've seen training will die north of the Wall. Might be a wilding's axe that gets them, might be sickness, might just be the cold. They die in pain. And they do it so plump little lords like you can enjoy their summer afternoons in peace and comfort.
Speaker: Benjen Stark

Text: Do you think I'm plump? Listen, Benjen... May I call you Benjen?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Call me what you like.
Speaker: Benjen Stark

Text: I'm not sure what I've done to offend you. I have great admiration for the Night's Watch. I've great admiration for you as First Ranger.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You know, my brother once told me that nothing someone says before the word "but" really counts.
Speaker: Benjen Stark

Text: But... I don't believe that giants and ghouls and White Walkers are lurking beyond the Wall. I believe that the only difference between us and the wildlings is that when the Wall went up, our ancestors happened to live on the right side of it.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You're right. The wildlings are no different from us. A little rougher maybe. But they're made of meat and bone. I know how to track them and I know how to kill them. It's not the wildlings giving me sleepless nights. You've never been north of the Wall, so don't tell me what's out there.
Speaker: Benjen Stark

Text: Are you going below? Keep well, keep warm.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: Enjoy the capital, brother.
Speaker: Benjen Stark

Text: I always do.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: I think he's starting to like me. "Going below"?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Into the tunnel and out the other side. He'll be north of the Wall for a month or two.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: So you're heading down to King's Landing too.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Day after tomorrow. I get about half of my recruits from their dungeons.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: Let's share the road. I could use some decent company.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: I travel a bit on the grubby side, my Lord.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: Not this time. We'll be staying at the finest castles and inns. No one turns away a Lannister.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Irri is braiding Daenerys hair and teaching her Dothraki. She feels Daenerys’ breast.
Yes, Khaleesi.
Speaker: Irri

Text: What are you doing?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: When was last time you bleed, Khaleesi? You change, Khaleesi. It’s a blessing from the Great Stallion.
Speaker: Irri

Text: Jorah and Rakharo around a fire in a tent.

For a man on horseback, the curved blade is a good thing, easier to handle. It's a good weapon for a Dothrakan. But a man in full plate... the arakh won't get through the steel. That's where the broadsword has the advantage. Designed for piercing plate.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Dothraki don’t wear steel dresses.
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: Armor.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Armor. Armor make a man... Vroz?
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: Slow.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Slow.
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: It's true, but it also keeps a man alive.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: My father taught me how to fight. He taught me that speed defeats size.
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: I’ve heard that your father was a famous warrior.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: He was bloodrider to Khal Bharbo. And your father, Jorah the Andal? He was a warrior also?
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: He still is. A man of great honor. And I betrayed him.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: The Khaleesi wants to eat something different tonight. Kill some rabbits.
Speaker: Irri

Text: There are no rabbits.
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: Find some ducks, she likes ducks.
Speaker: Irri

Text: Have you seen any ducks, woman? No rabbits, no ducks. Do you have eyes in your head? Do you?
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: Dog then. I have seen many dogs.
Speaker: Irri

Text: I don't think she wants to eat dog.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: The Khaleesi have baby inside her. It is true. She does not bleed for two moons. Her belly start to swell.
Speaker: Irri

Text: A blessing from the Great Stallion.
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: She does not want to eat horse.
Speaker: Irri

Text: I'll have the boys butcher a goat for supper. I need to ride to Qohor.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: We ride for Vaes Dothrak.
Speaker: Rhakaro

Text: Don't worry. I'll catch you. The horde's easy to find.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Back again in the courtyard of Castle Black. Jon is battling his brothers in black as Tyrion overlooks from the balcony. Jon continuing to defeat them, he begins teaching them.
Don't stand so still. It's harder to hit a moving target. Except for you. You move too much. I could just hold my sword out and let you do the work for me.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Tyrion reenters the hall to speak and drink with Aemon and Lord Commander.
How many winters have you seen, Lord Tyrion?
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: Eight... no, nine.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: All of them brief?
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: They say the winter of my birth was three years long, Maester Aemon.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: This summer has lasted nine. But reports from the Citadel tell us the days grow shorter. The Starks are always right eventually : winter is coming. This one will be long and dark things will come with it.
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: We've been capturing wildlings, more every month. They're fleeing south. The ones who flee... say they've seen the White Walkers.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: Yes, and the fishermen of Lannisport say they see mermaids.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: One of our own rangers swore he saw them kill his companions. He swore it right up to the moment Ned Stark chopped his head off.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: The Night's Watch is the only thing standing between the realm and what lies beyond. And it has become an army of undisciplined boys and tired old men. There are less than a thousand of us now. We can't man the other castles on the Wall. We can't properly patrol the wilderness. We've barely enough resources to keep our lads armed and fed.
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: Your sister sits by the side of the King. Tell her we need help.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: When winter does come, gods help us all if we're not ready.
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: The Khal and Daenerys are intertwined in their tent via candlelight. Daenerys surprises Drogo and speaks Dothraki to him.
It’s a boy.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: How do you know?
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: I know.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Tyrion is pissing off of the wall, when he’s done, Jon and him converse near a fire.
I'm sorry to see you leave, Lannister.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: It's either me or this cold. And it doesn't appear to be going anywhere.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Will you stop at Winterfell on your way South?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: I expect I will. Gods know there aren't many feather beds between here and King's Landing.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: If you see my brother Bran, tell him I miss him. Tell him I'd visit if I could.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Of course.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: He'll never walk again.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: If you're going to be a cripple, it's better to be a rich cripple. Take care, Snow.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Farewell, My Lord.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Arya arrives to her “dance lesson” in King’s Landing.
You are late, boy. Tomorrow you will be here at midday.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Who are you?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Your dancing master, Syrio Forel.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Syrio throws a wooden sword to Arya, she does not catch it, but drops it.
Tomorrow you will catch it. Now pick it up. That is not the way, boy. This is not a great sword that is needing two hands to swing it.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: It's too heavy.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: It is heavy as it needs to be to make you strong. Just so. One hand is all that is needed. Now you are standing all wrong. Turn your body side-face. So. You are skinny. That is good. The target is smaller. Now the grip... Let me see. The grip must be delicate.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: What if I drop it?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: The steel must be part of your arm. Can you drop part of your arm? No. Nine years Syrio Forel was first sword to the Sealord of Braavos. He knows these things. You must listen to me, boy.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: I'm a girl.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Boy, girl... You are a sword, that is all. That is the grip. You are not holding a battle-axe. You are holding...
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: A needle.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Ahhh… Just so. Now we will begin the dance. Remember, child, this is not the dance of the Westeros we are learning... The knight's dance, hacking and hammering. This is the Bravo's dance... The water dance. It is swift and sudden. All men are made of water, do you know this? If you pierce them, the water leaks out and they die. Now you will try to strike me.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Arya takes several attempts as Syrio turns his back, defending her and disarming her constantly. She begins picking up on a few things, but still needs much work. Ned enters in the doorway and his smile turns to a grimace watching his daughter swordfight.
Up! Dead. Dead. Very dead. Come. Again, faster.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Open to Bran Stark dreaming. He is in the courtyard of Winterfell shooting a bow as a raven flies in. As he approaches it, it flies into the crypt, continuously cawing. As Bran enters the crypt he makes direct eye contact with the raven and sees that it has three eyes. He wakes up. Theon enters just as he wakes up.
The little Lord's been dreaming again.
Speaker: Old Nan

Text: We have visitors.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: I don't want to see anyone.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Really? If I was cooped up all day with no one but this old bat for company, I'd go mad. Anyway, you don't have a choice. Robb's waiting.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: I don't want to go.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Neither do I. But Robb's Lord of Winterfell, which means I do what he says and you do what I say. Hodor! (Hodor enters, hoisting up Bran and carrying him away) Help Bran down the hall.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Tyrion standing in front of Robb and Maester Luwin inside the Winterfell castle.
I must say I received a slightly warmer welcome on my last visit.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Any man of the Night's Watch is welcome at Winterfell.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Any man of the Night's Watch, but not I, eh, boy?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: I'm not your boy, Lannister. I'm Lord of Winterfell while my father is away.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Then you might learn a lord's courtesy.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Hodor enters carrying Bran.
So it's true. Hello Bran. Do you remember anything about what happened?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: He has no memory of that day.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: Curious.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Why are you here?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Would your charming companion be so kind as to kneel? My neck is beginning to hurt.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Kneel, Hodor.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Do you like to ride, Bran?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Yes. Well, I mean I did like to.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: The boy has lost the use of his legs.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: What of it? With the right horse and saddle, even a cripple can ride.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: I'm not a cripple.
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: Then I'm not a dwarf. My father will rejoice to hear it. I have a gift for you. Give that to your saddler. He'll provide the rest. You must shape the horse to the rider. Start with a yearling and teach it to respond to the reins and to the boy's voice.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Will I really be able to ride?
Speaker: Bran Stark

Text: You will. On horseback you will be as tall as any of them.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Is this some kind of trick? Why do you want to help him?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: I have a tender spot in my heart for cripples, bastards and broken things.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You've done my brother a kindness. The hospitality of Winterfell is yours.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Spare me your false courtesies, Lord Stark. There's a brothel outside your walls. There I'll find a bed and both of us can sleep easier.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Before Tyrion exits Winterfell for the brothel, Theon sees him off in the courtyard.
Couldn't resist some northern ass? If you like redheads, ask for Ros.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Come to see me off, Greyjoy? Kind of you. Your master doesn't seem to like Lannisters.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: He's not my master.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: No, of course not. What happened here? Where is lady Stark? Why didn't she receive me?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: She wasn't feeling well.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: She's not in Winterfell, is she? Where did she go?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: My lady's whereabouts...
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: My lady? Your loyalty to your captors is touching. Tell me, how do you think Balon Greyjoy would feel if he could see his only surviving son has turned lackey? I still remember seeing my father's fleet burn in Lannisport. I believe your uncles were responsible?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Must have been a pretty sight.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Nothing prettier than watching sailors burn alive. Yes, a great victory for your people. Shame how it all turned out.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: We were outnumbered 10 to one.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: A stupid rebellion then. I suppose your father realized that when your brothers died in battle. Now here you are, your enemy's squire.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Careful, Imp.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: I've offended you. Forgive me, it's been a rough morning. Anyway, don't despair. I'm a constant disappointment to my own father and I've learned to live with it. Your next tumble with Ros is on me. I'll try not to wear her out.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: In the courtyard of Castle Black, Jon Snow is giving the group lessons in fighting. As Alliser marches in with a new recruit, Samwell Tarly.
Leg, shoulder, leg. Left foot forward. Good. Now pivot as you deliver the stroke. Put all your weight behind it.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: What in seven hells is that?
Speaker: Grenn

Text: They'll need an eighth hell to fit him in.
Speaker: Pyp

Text: Tell them your name.
Speaker: Alliser Thorne

Text: Samwell Tarly, of Horn Hill. I mean, I was of Horn Hill. I've come to take the black.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Come to take the black pudding.
Speaker: Rast

Text: Well, you couldn't be any worse than you look. See what he can do.
Speaker: Alliser Thorne

Text: I yield. Please, no more.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: On your feet. Pick up your sword. Hit him till he finds his feet. It seems they've run short of poachers and thieves down south. Now they send us squealing bloody pigs. Again, harder.
Speaker: Alliser Thorne

Text: Enough! He yielded.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Looks like the bastard's in love. All right then, lord Snow, you wish to defend your lady love, let's make it an exercise. You two. Three of you ought to be sufficient to make lady piggy squeal. All you've got to do is get past the bastard.
Speaker: Alliser Thorne

Text: Are you sure you want to do this?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Alliser has the three guys attack Jon, trying to get to Sam, Jon successfully defends them all off.
No. Yield yield yield! I yield.
Speaker: Grenn

Text: We're done for today. Go clean the armory. That's all you're good for.
Speaker: Alliser Thorne

Text: Well fought!
Speaker: Pyp

Text: Piss off.
Speaker: Grenn

Text: Did he hurt you?
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: I've had worse.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: You can call me Sam... If you want. My mother calls me Sam.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: It's not going to get any easier, you know? You'll have to defend yourself.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Why didn't you get up and fight?
Speaker: Grenn

Text: I wanted to. I just couldn't.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Why not?
Speaker: Grenn

Text: I'm a coward. My father always says so.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: The Wall's no place for cowards.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: You're right. I'm sorry. I just... Wanted to thank you.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: A bloody coward. People saw us talking to him. Now they'll think we're cowards too.
Speaker: Grenn

Text: You're too stupid to be a coward.
Speaker: Pyp

Text: You're too stupid to be a...
Speaker: Grenn

Text: Quick now, before summer's over.
Speaker: Pyp

Text: Come on here!
Speaker: Grenn

Text: Daenerys and the horde have arrived to the Dothraki homeland.
Vaes Dothrak. The city of the horselords.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: These are my people now. You shouldn't call them savages.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: I'll call them what I like, because they're my people. This is my army. Khal Drogo is marching the wrong way with my army.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: If my brother was given an army of Dothraki, could you conquer the Seven Kingdoms?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: The Dothraki have never crossed the Narrow Sea. They fear any water their horses can't drink.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: But if they did?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: King Robert is fool enough to meet them in open battle, but the men advising him are different.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: And you know these men?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: I fought beside them once, long ago. Now Ned Stark wants my head. He drove me from my land.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: You sold slaves.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Aye.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Why?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: I had no money and an expensive wife.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: And where is she now?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: In another place, with another man.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Viserys is in a tub inside of a tent, being bathed by Doreah.
Your Grace?
Speaker: Doreah

Text: Yes, my dear?
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: They call you the last dragon...
Speaker: Doreah

Text: They do.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: You have dragon's blood in your veins?
Speaker: Doreah

Text: It's entirely possible.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: What happened to the dragons? I was told that brave men killed them all.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: The brave men didn't kill dragons. The brave men rode them. Rode them from Valyria to build the greatest civilization this world has ever seen. The breath of the greatest dragon forged the Iron Throne, which the Usurper is keeping warm for me. The swords of the vanquished, a thousand of them... melted together like so many candles.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: I have always wanted to see a dragon. There is nothing in the world that I would rather see.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: Really? Why dragons?
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: They can fly. And wherever they are, just a few flaps of their wings and they're somewhere else... Far away. And they can kill. Anyone or anything that tries to hurt them gets burned away to nothing... melted... like so many candles. Seeing a dragon would make me very happy.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: Well, after 15 years in a pleasure house, I imagine just seeing the sky makes you happy.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: I was not locked in. I have seen things.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: What have you seen?
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: I've seen... A man from Asshai with a dagger of real dragonglass. I've seen a man who could change his face the way that other men change their clothes. And I've seen a pirate who wore his weight in gold and whose ship had sails of colored silk. So... Have you seen one?
Speaker: Doreah

Text: A pirate ship?
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: A dragon.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: No, the last one died many years before I was born. I'll tell you what I have seen : their skulls. They used to decorate the throne room in the Red Keep. When I was very young, just 3 or 4, my father used to walk me down the rows and I'd recite their names for him. When I got them all right, he'd give me a sweet. The ones closest to the door were the last ones they were able to hatch and they were all stunted and wrong. Skulls no bigger than dog skulls. But as you got closer to the Iron Throne... They got bigger and bigger and bigger. There was Ghiscar and Valryon, Vermithrax, Essovius, Archonel, Meraxes, Vhagar... And Balerion the Dread... whose fire forged the Seven Kingdoms into one.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: What happened to the skulls?
Speaker: Doreah

Text: I don't know. The Usurper had them smashed to powder, I expect. Scattered to the wind.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: That's very sad.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: Yes, it is. What did I buy you for? To make me sad?
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: No, your Grace. To teach your sister.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: To teach my sister how to be a better lover? You think I bought you to make Khal Drogo happy? You pretty little idiot. Go on then. Get on with it.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: Inside of the throne room at King’s Landing.

Someday your husband will sit there and you will sit by his side. And one day, before too long, you will present your son to the court. All the lords of Westeros will gather here to see the little prince...
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: What if I have a girl?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Gods be good, you'll have boys and girls and plenty of them.
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: What if I only have girls?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: I wouldn't worry about that.
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: Jeyne Poole's mother had five children, all of them girls.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Yes, but it's highly unlikely.
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: But what if?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: If you only had girls, I suppose the throne would pass to Prince Joffrey's little brother.
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: And everyone would hate me.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Nobody could ever hate you.
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: Joffrey does.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Nonsense. Why would you say such a thing? That business with the wolves? I've told you a hundred times... A direwolf is not...
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: Please shut up about it.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Do you remember your lessons? Who built the Iron Throne?
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: Aegon the Conqueror.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: And who built the Red Keep?
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: Maegor the Cruel.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: And how many years did it take to build...
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: My grandfather and uncle were murdered here, weren't they?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: They were killed on the orders of King Aerys, yes.
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: The Mad King.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Commonly known as the Mad King.
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: Why were they killed?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: You should speak to your father about these matters.
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: I don't want to speak to my father, ever.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: You will find it in your heart to forgive your father.
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: No, I won't.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Small council meeting in King’s Landing.
It's the Hand's tournament that's causing all this trouble, my Lords.
Speaker: Janos Slynt

Text: The King's tournament. I assure you the Hand wants no part of it.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Call it what you will, Lord Stark Ser, the city is packed with people and more flooding in every day. Last night we had a tavern riot, a brothel fire, three stabbings and a drunken horse race down the Street of Sisters.
Speaker: Janos Slynt

Text: Dreadful.
Speaker: Varys

Text: If you can't keep the King's peace, perhaps the City Watch should be commanded by someone who can.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: I need more men.
Speaker: Janos Slynt

Text: You'll get 50. Lord Baelish will see it paid for.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: I will?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: You found money for a champion's purse, you can find money to keep the peace. I'll also give you 20 of my household guards till the crowds have left.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Thank you, my Lord Hand Ser. They will be put to good use.
Speaker: Janos Slynt

Text: The sooner this is over, the better.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: The realm prospers from such events, my Lord. They give the great a chance at glory, and the lowly a respite from their woes.
Speaker: Varys

Text: And every inn in the city is full and the whores are walking bow-legged.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: I'm sure the tourney puts coins in many a pocket. Now... If there's nothing else, my Lords?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Eddard dismisses the council, as they are all leaving, Ned stops Pycelle.
This heat. On days like this, I envy you northerners your summer snows. Until tomorrow my Lord.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: I've been hoping to talk to you about Jon Arryn.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Lord Arryn? His death was a great sadness to all of us. I took personal charge of his care, but I could not save him. His sickness struck him very hard and very fast. I saw him in my chambers just the night before he passed. Lord Jon often came to me for counsel.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: Why?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: I have been Grand Maester for many years. Kings and Hands have come to me for advice since...
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: What did Jon want the night before he died?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: He came inquiring after a book.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: A book? What book?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: I fear it would be of little interest to you, my Lord. A ponderous tome.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: I'd like to read it.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Now in Pycelle’s room, he hands a book to Ned.
"The lineages and histories of the great houses of the Seven Kingdoms, with descriptions of many high lords and noble ladies and their children."
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: "Harkon Umber, first of his name, born to lord Hother Umber and lady Amaryllis Umber in the 183rd year after Aegon's landing, at the last hearth. Blue of eye, brown of hair and fair complected, died in his 14th year of a wound sustained
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: in a bear hunt."
As I said, my Lord, a ponderous read.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: Did Jon Arryn tell you what he wanted with it?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: He did not, my Lord. And I did not presume to ask.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: Jon's death...
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Such a tragedy.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: Did he say anything to you during his final hours?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Nothing of import, my Lord. There was one phrase he kept repeating: "The seed is strong," I think it was.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: "The seed is strong"? What does that mean?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: The dying mind is a demented mind, Lord Stark. For all the weight they're given, last words are usually as significant as first words.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: And you're quite certain he died of a natural illness?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: What else could it be?
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: Poison.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: A disturbing thought. I don't think it likely. The Hand was loved by all. What sort of man would dare...
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: I've heard it said that poison is a woman's weapon.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Yes. Women, cravens... and eunuchs. Did you know that lord Varys is a eunuch?
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: Everybody knows that.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Yes, yes, of course. How that sort of person found himself on the King's Council, I will never know.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: I've taken enough of your time.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: No trouble at all, my Lord. It's a great honor...
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: Thank you. I'll find my own way out.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Ned is walking back to his chambers as he sees Arya balancing on one foot in front of a staircase.
Syrio says a water dancer can stand on one toe for hours.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: It's a hard fall down these steps.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Syrio says every hurt is a lesson and every lesson makes you better. Tomorrow I'm going to be chasing cats.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Cats? Syrio says…
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: He says every swordsman should study cats. They're quiet as shadows and as light as feathers. You have to be quick to catch them.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: He's right about that.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Now that Bran's awake will he come live with us?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: He needs to get his strength back first.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: He wants to be a knight of the King’s Guard. He can't be one now, can he?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: No. But someday he could be Lord of a holdfast or sit on the King's Council. Or he might raise castles like Brandon the Builder.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Can I be Lord of a holdfast?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: You will marry a high Lord and rule his castle. And your sons shall be knights and princes and lords.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: No. That's not me.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Keeping watch on the wall, Sam joins Jon as his watch partner.
Hello. Ser Alliser said I'm to be your new watch partner. I should warn you, I don't see all that well.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Come stand by the fire. It's warmer.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: No, that's all right. I'm fine.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: You're not. You're freezing.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: I don't like high places.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: You can't fight. You can't see. You're afraid of heights and almost everything else probably. What are you doing here, Sam?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: On the morning of my 18th nameday, my father came to me. "You're almost a man now," he said, "but you're not worthy of my land and title. Tomorrow, you're going to take the black, forsake all claim to your inheritance and start north. If you do not," he said, "then we'll have a hunt and somewhere in these woods your horse will stumble and you'll be thrown from your saddle to die. Or so I'll tell your mother. Nothing would please me more." Ser Alliser's going to make me fight again tomorrow, isn't he?
