The greatest dynasty this world has ever seen, on my shoulders since I was five years old and no one has ever given me what they gave to her in that tent. Never. Not a piece of it… How can I carry what I need to carry without it? Hmm? Who can rule without wealth, or fear, or love? Oh, you stand there, all nobility and honor. You don’t think I see you looking at my little sister, hmm? Don’t think I know what you want? I don’t care. You can have her. She can be queen of the savages and dine on the finest bloody horseparts, and you can dine on whichever parts of her you like. But let me go.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: You can go, but you can’t have the eggs.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: You swore an oath to me. Does loyalty mean nothing to you?
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: It means everything to me.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: And yet here you stand?
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: And here I stand.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Viserys and Jorah stare at each other for a moment, before Viserys drops the sack containing the dragon eggs to the floor. Jorah steps aside, unblocking the exit. Viserys leaves.
Back at the skycell below the Eyrie. Tyrion is again shouting for Mord.
Mord! Mord! Mord! Mord! Mord!
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Noise again!
Speaker: Mord

Text: About the gold -
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: No gold!
Speaker: Mord

Text: Listen to me! Listen to me! Sometimes possession… is an abstract concept. When they captured me they took my purse, but the gold is still mine.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Where?
Speaker: Mord

Text: Where? I don’t know where, but when they free me -
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You want free? Go be free. (points out of the skycell)
Speaker: Mord

Text: Have you ever heard the phrase “Rich as a Lannister”? Of course you have. You’re a smart man. You know who the Lannisters are. I am a Lannister. Tyrion, son of Tywin! And of course, you have also heard the phrase, “a Lannister always pays his debts.” If you deliver a message from me to Lady Arryn, I will be in your debt. I will owe you gold. If you deliver the message and I live, which I very much intend to do.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: What message?
Speaker: Mord

Text: Tell her I wish to confess my crimes.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: We cut to the throne room, where Lady Arryn and her son Robin are sitting on the throne, at the helm of the room. Catelyn is standing next to them, as Robin is tapping a knife against the throne itself very annoyingly.
You wish to confess your crimes?
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: Yes, my lady. I do, my lady.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Skycells always break them. Speak, Imp. Meet your gods as an honest man.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: Where do I begin, my lords and ladies? I’m a vile man, I confess it. My crimes and sins are beyond counting. I have lied and cheated, gambled and whored. I’m not particularly good at violence, but I’m good at convincing others to do violence for me. You want specifics, I suppose. When I was seven, I saw a servant girl bathing in the river. I stole her robe. She was forced to return to the castle, naked and in tears. I close my eyes, I can still see her tits bouncing. When I was ten, I stuffed my uncle’s boots with goatshit. When confronted with my crime, I blamed a squire. Poor boy was flogged and… I escaped justice. When I was twelve, I milked my eel into a pot of turtle stew. I flogged the one-eyed snake. I skinned my sausage. I made the bald man cry into the turtle stew, which I do believe my sister ate. At least I hope she did. I once brought a jackass and a honeycomb into a brothel -
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Silence!
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: What happened next?!
Speaker: Robin Arryn

Text: What do you think you’re doing?
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: Confessing my crimes.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Lord Tyrion, you are accused of hiring a man to slay my son Bran in his bed, and of conspiring to murder my sister’s husband; Lord Jon Arryn, the Hand of the King.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Oh, I’m very sorry. I don’t know anything about all that.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You’ve had your little joke. I trust you enjoyed it. Mord, take him back to the dungeon. But this time find a smaller cell, with a steeper floor.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: Is this how justice is done in the Vale? you accuse me of crimes, I deny them, so you throw me in a cell to freeze and starve? Where is the King’s Justice? I’m accused and demand a trial.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: If you’re tried and found guilty, then by the king’s own laws you will pay with your life.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: I understand the law.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: We have no executioner in the Eyrie. Life is more elegant here. Open the Moon Door.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: Several men begin unwinding a giant crank on one side of the room. In between Tyrion and the raised throne is what looks like a well. The well’s floor begins to open and wind comes howling through. Robin begins giggling and rapidly clapping his hands. Tyrion looks down and sees that it’s a great distance through this Moon Door to the ground, he would inevitably die if he had to go out this “door”.
You want a trial, my Lord Lannister. Very well. My son will listen to whatever you have to say, and you will hear his judgement. Then you will leave, by one door or the other.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: No need to bother Lord Robin. I demand a trial by combat.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Subdued laughter fills the room, Catelyn and Lysa exchange looks.
You have that right.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: My lady, I beg the honor. Let me be your champion.
Speaker: Knight 1

Text: The honor should be mine. For the love I bore your lord husband let me avenge his death.
Speaker: Knight 2

Text: I’ll fight for you, my Lady.
Speaker: Knight 3

Text: It’ll be my honor.
Speaker: Knight 4

Text: The honor should be mine.
Speaker: Knight 5

Text: Make the bad man fly!
Speaker: Robin Arryn

Text: Ser Vardis… You’re quiet. Did you want to avenge my husband?
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: With all my heart, my Lady. But the Imp is half my size. It would be shameful to slaughter such a man and call it justice.
Speaker: Ser Vardis

Text: Agreed.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You demanded a trial by combat.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: Now I demand a champion. I have that right, same as you.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: My Lady, I would gladly fight the Imp’s champion for you.
Speaker: Ser Vardis

Text: I wouldn’t be too glad, ser. I name my brother, Jaime Lannister.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: The room shudders.
The Kingslayer is hundreds of miles from here.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: Send a raven for him, I’m happy to wait.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: The trial will be today.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: Do I have a volunteer?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Again, the majority of the room laughs quietly.
Anyone?... Anyone?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: I think that we can assume that no one is willing -
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: I’ll stand for the dwarf.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: In the woods, outside of King’s Landing.
More wine, your Grace?
Speaker: Lancel Lannister

Text: Oh, what was I saying?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: A simpler time.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: It was! It was. You’re too young to remember. Wasn’t it, Selmy?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: It was, your Grace.
Speaker: Barriston

Text: The enemy was right there in the open, vicious as you like, all but sending you a bloody invitation. Nothing like today.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Sounds exhilarating.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: Exhilarating, yes. Not as exhilarating as those balls and masquerades you like to throw. (laughs) You ever fucked a Riverlands girl?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Once, I think.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: You think? I think you’d remember. Back in our day, you weren’t a real man until you fucked a girl from each of the Seven Kingdoms and the Riverlands. We called it “making the eight.”
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: Those were some lucky girls.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: You ever make the eight, Barristan?
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: I don’t believe so, your Grace.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: (laughs) Those were the days!
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: What days were those? The ones where half of Westeros fought the other half and millions died? Or before that, when the Mad King slaughtered women and babies because the voices in his head told him they deserved it? Or way before that when dragons burned whole cities to the ground?
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: Easy, boy. You might be my brother, but you’re speaking to the King.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: I suppose it was all rather heroic. If you were drunk enough and had some poor Riverlands whore to shove your price inside and “make the eight.”
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: More wine, your Grace?
Speaker: Lancel Lannister

Text: Renly walks off in the opposite direction of the group. Robert takes a large swig off of the wine and quickly continue walking.

In the throne room of King’s Landing. Ned sits upon the throne as a fill in for Robert, as he is Hand of the King. Baelish is at his right and Grand Maester Pycelle to his left. The room is filled with people.

They burned most everything in the Riverlands, our fields, our granaries, our homes. They took our women and then they took ‘em again. When they was done, they butchered them as if they was animals. They covered our children in pitch and lit them on fire.
Speaker: Man

Text: Brigands, most likely.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: They weren’t thieves, they didn’t steal nothing. They even left something behind, your Grace.
Speaker: Man

Text: It’s the King’s Hand you’re addressing, not the king. The king is hunting.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: A second man walks forward and empties a sack out onto the floor. It’s a pile of fish.
These men, were they flying a sigil? … A banner.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: None, your… Hand. The one who was leading them… Taller by a foot than any man I’ve ever met, saw him cut the blacksmith, saw him take the head off a horse with a single swing of his sword.
Speaker: Man

Text: (whisper) That sounds like someone we know. The Mountain.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: You’re describing Ser Gregor Clegane.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Why should Ser Gregor turn brigand? The man is an anointed knight.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: I’ve heard him called “Tywin Lannister’s mad dog.” I’m sure you have as well. (whispering to Ned) Can you think of any reason the Lannisters might possibly have for being angry with your wife?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: If the Lannisters were to order attacks on villages under the king’s protection, it would be -
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: It would be almost as brazen as attacking the Hand of the King in the streets of the capital.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Wel…
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: I cannot give you back your homes or restore your dead to life. But perhaps I can give you justice in the name of our king, Robert. Lord Beric Dondarrion.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Beric Dondarrion steps from the back of the room forward.
You shall have the command. Assemble 100 men and ride to Ser Gregor’s keep.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: As you command.
Speaker: Beric Dondarrion

Text: Ned stands up with the assistance of a cane. He steps forward.

In the name of Robert of the House Baratheon, the First of his Name, King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm, I charge you to bring the king’s justice to the false knight Gregor Clegane and all those who shared in his crimes. I denounce him and attaint him. I strip him of all ranks and titles of all lands and holdings, and sentence him to death.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: My lord… This… This is a drastic action. It would be better to wait for King Robert’s return.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: Grand Maester Pycelle.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: My Lord.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: Send a raven to Casterly Rock. Inform Tywin Lannister that he has been summoned to court to answer for the crimes of his bannermen. He will arrive within the fortnight, or be branded an enemy of the crown and a traitor to the realm.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: The men all bow their heads in acknowledgement. Ned steps down from the throne, Baelish follows him, speaking only to Ned.
A bold move, my Lord, and admirable. But is it wise to yank the lion’s tail? Tywin Lannister is the richest man in all the Seven Kingdoms. Gold wins wars, not soldiers.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Then how come Robert is king and not Tywin Lannister?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Is it over?
Speaker: Robin Arryn

Text: You don’t fight with honor!
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: No. He did.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Tyrion turns to Mord who uncuffs him.
Can I make the little man fly now?
Speaker: Robin Arryn

Text: Not this little man. This little man is going home. I believe you have something of mine.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Rodrik Cassel tosses Tyrion his purse. Tyrion bows before Catelyn, begins walking out, Bronn following. He tosses Mord the purse full of coins.
A Lannister always pays his debts.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: At King’s Landing, Sansa Stark and Septa Mordane, both sowing.
You wear your hair like a real southern lady now.
Speaker: Mordane

Text: Well, why shouldn’t I? We’re in the south.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: It’s important to remember where you come from. I’m not sure your mother would like these new styles.
Speaker: Mordane

Text: My mother isn’t from the North.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: I’m aware of that.
Speaker: Mordane

Text: Why do you care? Do you even have hair under there?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Yes. I have hair.
Speaker: Mordane

Text: I’ve never seen it.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Would you like to?
Speaker: Mordane

Text: No. Where are you from anyway, the north or the south?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: I come from a very small village in -
Speaker: Mordane

Text: Oh, wait. I just realized… I don’t care.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Sansa -
Speaker: Mordane

Text: Septa.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Now you are being rude.
Speaker: Mordane

Text: A door can be heard closing. Prince Joffrey walks in. Sansa’s eyes light up as both women stand up.
My prince.
Speaker: Mordane

Text: My prince.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: My lady. I fear I have behaved monstrously the past few weeks. With your permission?
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: Joffrey offers Sansa a necklace. She turns around, for him to put it on her, as acceptance.
It’s beautiful. Like the one your mother wears.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: You’ll be queen one day, it’s only fitting that you should look the part. Will you forgive me for my rudeness?
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: There’s nothing to forgive.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: You’re my lady. One day we’ll be married in the throne room. Lords and ladies from all over the Seven Kingdoms will come, from the last hearth in the North, to the salt shore of the south. And you will be queen over all of them.  I’ll never disrespect you again. I’ll never be cruel to you again. Do you understand me? You’re my lady now, from this day, until my last day.
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: The two share their first kiss.
In the woods outside of Winterfell, Theon is riding his horse, alone. He comes to a road and sees a carriage leaving, Ros on the back of it riding south.
Stop! Stop! What are you doing?!
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Going to King’s Landing.
Speaker: Ros

Text: In a turnip cart?
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: I’ll find a ship heading south in White Harbor.
Speaker: Ros

Text: And you can afford that?
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Some of my friends are more generous than others.
Speaker: Ros

Text: There’s a thousand girls like you in King’s Landing.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: I’ll have lots of company…
Speaker: Ros

Text: Yes, you’ll be very popular until some fat lord comes to visit with a big belly and a little prick and he can’t get it up so he knocks all your teeth out.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: (laughs) And what will happen to me if I stay here? Will I become Lady Greyjoy, Mistress of the Iron Islands?
Speaker: Ros

Text: Don’t be a fool.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: I hear Jaime Lannister attacked Lord Stark in the streets of King’s Landing. Every man for a hundred miles will be marching off to war soon and most of them will never come back, there’s nothing more for me here. Let’s go, Steffon.
Speaker: Ros

Text: Let me see it one more time?
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: See what?
Speaker: Ros

Text: The carriage is driving away from Theon, he scrambles and flips Ros a coin. She catches it and lifts up her dress one final time for Theon, while laughing.
I’m going to miss you!
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: I know.
Speaker: Ros

Text: At King’s Landing in Ned’s quarters. Arya and Sansa await as their father limps forward, using his cane for assistance.
I’m sending you both back to Winterfell.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: What?!
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Listen -
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: What about Joffrey?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Are you dying because of your leg? Is that why you’re sending us home?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: What? No.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Please, Father. Please don’t.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: You can’t. I’ve got my lessons with Syrio. I’m finally getting good.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: This isn’t a punishment. I want you back in Winterfell for your own safety.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Can’t we take Syrio back with us?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Who cares about your stupid dancing teacher? I can’t go. I’m supposed to marry Prince Joffrey. I love him and I’m meant to be his queen and have his babies.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Seven hells.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: When you’re old enough, I’ll make you a match with someone who’s worthy of you, someone who’s brave and gentle and strong -
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: I don’t want someone brave and gentle and strong. I want him! He’ll be the greatest king that ever was, a golden lion, and I’ll give him sons with beautiful blond hair.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: The lion’s not his sigil, idiot. He’s a stag, like his father.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: He is not. He’s nothing like that old drunk king.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Go on, girls. Get your septa and start packing your things.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Wait!
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Come on! (dragging Sansa)
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: It’s not fair!
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: The two exit Ned’s room and close the door behind them. Ned slowly makes his way over to his desk, opening the book that Grand Maester Pycelle had given him earlier. The book covers the lineages of all the great Houses of Westeros. Ned turns and reviews the Baratheon page, reading out loud.

“Lord Orys Baratheon, black of hair.” “Axel Baratheon, black of hair.” “Lyonel Baratheon, black of hair.” “Steffon Baratheon, black of hair.” “Robert Baratheon, black of hair.” “Joffrey Baratheon… golden-haired.”
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Ned has a revelation and closes the book.
Back at Vaes Dothrak, in a very large hut. It is a celebration. A pig roasts over a center fire as there are drums being played and people dancing everywhere. Viserys stumbles in, clearly drunk.
Daenerys! Where’s my sister?
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: Daenerys and Jorah both look up, noticing her brother on the opposite side of the hut. Drogo, on another side of the hut also sees Viserys. Jorah stands up and begins walking towards Viserys.
Stop him.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Where is she? I’m here for the feast. The whore’s feast.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: Come.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Get your hands off me! No one touches the dragon!
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: A man sitting next to Drogo says something in Dothraki that makes the Khal laugh. Viserys hears this and spins around.
Khal Drogo! I’m here for the feast.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: (speaks Dothraki, motions to the other side of the hut)
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: Khal Drogo says there is a place for you. Back there.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: That is no place for a king.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: You are no king.
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: Viserys draws his sword, Jorah moves forward, Viserys holds his sword at Jorah.
Keep away from me!
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: The drums stop and now everyone in the hut is paying attention.
Viserys, please.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: There she is.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: Put the sword down. They’ll kill us all.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: They can’t kill us. They can’t shed blood in their sacred city. (moving his sword over everyone in the room, stopping on Daenerys’ stomach) But I can. I want what I came for. I want the crown he promised me. He bought you. But he never paid for you.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: The Khal is fiercely looking at the situation as Viserys has his blade to Daenerys’ stomach. A woman is translating for Drogo as Viserys speaks.
Tell him I want what was bargained for or I’m taking you back. He can keep the baby. I’ll cut it out and leave it for him.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: (speaks Dothraki)
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: What’s he saying?
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: He says yes. You shall have a golden crown, that men shall tremble to behold.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: That was all I wanted. W-what was promised.
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: Viserys takes his blade away from Daenerys’ stomach and steps back, smiling. Drogo stands up and walks to his wife, placing his hand on her belly as they exchange looks. The Khal says something in Dothraki, two men instantly come up behind Viserys, each holding one of his arms. One man breaks Viserys’ right arm as he screams.
No! You cannot touch me! I am the dragon! I am the dragon! I want my crown! Ahh!
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: The two men force Viserys to the ground, still holding him by his arms. The Khal moves towards them and mutters something in Dothraki. A woman tips over a kettle that was over the fire, pouring out it’s contents. Drogo throws some golden jewelry into the kettle.
Look away Khaleesi.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: No.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: No. Dany! Dany, tell them, make them! You can’t!
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: The golden jewelry is now melted down into liquid. Khal Drogo lifts the kettle up and walks over towards the screaming Viserys.
Dany please!
Speaker: Viserys Targaryen

Text: A crown for a king.
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: Khal Drogo raises the kettle over Viserys’ head and pours out the melted gold onto his skull. He screams as the hot liquid solidifies on his skull, the two men release Viserys, he instantly falls to the ground dead.
Khaleesi…
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: He was no dragon. Fire cannot kill a dragon.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Trumpets sounds from the Lannister camp. Going inside a tent, we see Tywin Lannister sharpening his knifes, preparing to skin a deer, while Jaime Lannister starts reading the received letter from Ned Stark.
"Summoned to court to answer for the crimes of your bannerman Gregor Clegane, the Mountain"
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Uh, "arrive within the fortnight or be branded an enemy of the Crown."
Poor Ned Stark. Brave man, terrible judgment.
Attacking him was stupid.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Lannisters don't act like fools.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Are you gonna say something clever? Go on, say something clever.
Catelyn Stark took my brother.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Why is he still alive?
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Tyrion?
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Ned Stark.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: One of our men interfered, speared him through the leg before I could finish him.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Why is he still alive?
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: It wouldn't have been clean.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Clean...
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: You spend too much time worrying about what other people think of you.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: I could care less what anyone thinks of me.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Now that's what you want people to think of you.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: It's the truth.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: When you hear them whispering "Kingslayer" behind your back, doesn't it bother you?
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Of course it bothers me.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: The lion doesn't concern himself with the opinions of the sheep.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: I suppose I should be grateful that your vanity got in the way of your recklessness.
I'm giving you half of our forces. 30,000 men.
You will bring them to Catelyn Stark's girlhood home and remind her that Lannisters pay their debts.
I didn't realize you placed such a high value on my brother's life.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: He's a Lannister. He might be the lowest of the Lannisters, but he's one of us.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: And every day that he remains a prisoner, the less our name commands respect.
So the lion does concern himself with the opinions of..
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: No, it's not an opinion, it's a fact!
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: If another House can seize one of our own and hold him captive with impunity, we are no longer a House to be feared.
Your mother's dead. Before long I'll be dead.
And you and your brother and your sister and all of her children.
All of us dead, all of us rotting in the ground. It's the family name that lives on. It's all that lives on.
Not your personal glory, not your honor, but family.
Do you understand?
Jaime nods gently.
Hmm.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: You're blessed with abilities that few men possess.
You are blessed to belong to the most powerful family in the kingdoms.
And you are still blessed with youth.
And what have you done with these blessings, huh? You've served as a glorified bodyguard for two kings.
One a madman, the other a drunk.
The future of our family will be determined in these next few months.
We could establish a dynasty that will last a thousand years.
Or we could collapse into nothing, as the Targaryens did.
I need you to become a man you were always meant to be.
Not next year. Not tomorrow. Now.
Submissive as he looks, Jaime walks out of the tent.
Back at a garden in Kings Landing, we see Queen Cersei approaching the sitting Ned Stark.
You're in pain.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: I've had worse, my lady.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Perhaps it's time to go home.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: The South doesn't seem to agree with you.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I know the truth Jon Arryn died for.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Do you, Lord Stark? Is that why you called me here, to pose me riddles?
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: Has he done this before?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Jaime would have killed him.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: My brother is worth a thousand of your friend.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: Your brother Or your lover?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: The Targaryens wed brothers and sisters for 300 years to keep bloodlines pure.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: Jaime and I are more than brother and sister.  We shared a womb. We came into this world together. We belong together.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: My son saw you with him.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Do you love your children?
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: With all my heart.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: No more than I love mine.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: And they are all Jaime's.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Thank the Gods.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: In the rare event that Robert leaves his whores for long enough to stumble drunk into my bed, I finish him off in other ways.
In the morning, he doesn't remember.
You've always hated him.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Hated him? I worshiped him.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: Every girl in the Seven Kingdoms dreamed of him, but he was mine by oath.
And when I finally saw him on our wedding day in the Sept of Baelor, lean and fierce and black-bearded, it was the happiest moment of my life.
Then that night he crawled on top of me, stinking of wine and did what he did, what little he could do, and whispered in my ear, "Lyanna".
Your sister was a corpse and I was a living girl and he loved her more than me.
When the King returns from his hunt, I'll tell him the truth.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: You must be gone by then. You and your children.
I will not have their blood on my hands.
Go as far away as you can, with as many men as you can.
Because wherever you go, Robert's wrath will follow you.
And what of my wrath, Lord Stark? You should have taken the realm for yourself.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: Jaime told me about the day King's Landing fell.
He was sitting in the Iron Throne and you made him give it up.
All you needed to do was climb the steps yourself.
Such a sad mistake.
I've made many mistakes in my life, but that wasn't one of them.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Oh, but it was.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: When you play the Game of Thrones, you win or you die. There is no middle ground.
Cersei walks off.

Littlefinger is looking outside his brothel window. Seeing mothers bathing their crying children.Seemingly in thought, he decides to close it. Meanwhile, Ros and Ameca are playing with each other, while Ros is loudly moaning.
Come here.
Speaker: Ros

Text: Oh yes, oh. Oh yes yes yes.
Yes, My Lord.
Speaker: Ros

Text: Let's start over, shall we? You be the man and you be the woman.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Well, go ahead. Slowly.
You're not fooling them. They just paid you. They know what you are.
They know it's all just an act.
Your job is to make them forget what they know.
That takes time. You need to Ease into it.
Go ahead. Ease into it.
He's winning you over in spite of yourself.
You're starting to like this.
He wants to believe you.
He's enjoyed his cock since he was old enough to play with it. Why shouldn't you?
He knows he's better than other men.
He's always known it deep down inside. Now he has proof.
He's so good, he's reaching something deep inside of you that no one even knew was there.
Overcoming your very nature.
Why don't you join us, My Lord?
Speaker: Ros

Text: I'm saving myself for another.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: What she doesn't know won't hurt her.
Speaker: Ros

Text: A stupid saying.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: What we don't know is usually what gets us killed.
She must be very beautiful.
Speaker: Ros

Text: No, not really. Impeccable bloodlines though.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: I do believe my lord's in love.
Speaker: Ros

Text: For many years. Most of my life really.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Play with her ass.
And she loved me too. I was her little confidant, her plaything.
She could tell me anything, anything at all.
She told me about all the horses that she liked.
The castle she wanted to live in and the man that she wanted to marry.
A northerner with a jaw like an anvil.
So I challenged him to a duel. I mean, why not? I'd read all the stories.
The little hero always beats the big villain in all the stories.
In the end, she wouldn't even let him kill me.
"He's just a boy", she said. "Please don't hurt him".
So he gave me a nice little scar to remember him by, and off they went.
Is she still married to him?
Speaker: Ros

Text: Oh no. He got himself killed before the wedding.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: And she ended up with his brother, an even more impressive specimen.
She loves him, I'm afraid.
And why wouldn't she? I mean, who could compare to him? He's just so...good.
Do you know what I learned, losing that duel? I learned that I'll never win. Not that way.
That's their game, their rules. I'm not going to fight them.
I'm going to fuck them. That's what I know. That's what I am.
And only by admitting what we are can we get what we want.
And what do you want?
Speaker: Ros

Text: Oh, everything, my dear. Everything there is.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Now wash yourselves. Both of you are working tonight.
Hmm.
While Ros and Ameca are both walking out, Littlefinger watches them leave.
Back at Winterfell, Osha is walking into a stable, carrying a bale of straw. While bending over and laying down the bale of sraw, Theon Grayjoy arrives.
You're a very lucky girl. Do you know that?
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Where I come from, we don't show mercy to criminals.
Where I come from, if someone like you attacked a little lord, at low tide we'd lay you on your back on the beach, your hands and feet chained to four stakes. The sea would come in closer and closer.
You'd see death creeping toward you a few inches at a time.
Where is it you come from?
Speaker: Osha

Text: The Iron Islands.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: They far away?
Speaker: Osha

Text: You've never heard of the Iron Islands?
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Trust me, you've never heard where I'm from neither.
Speaker: Osha

Text: Trust me, My Lord. You're not living in the wilderness anymore.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: In civilized lands, you refer to your betters by their proper titles.
And what's that?
Speaker: Osha

Text: Lord.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Why?
Speaker: Osha

Text: Why? What do you mean why? My father is Balon Greyjoy, Lord of the Iron Islands.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: What's that got to do with you? If your father's lord, how can you be lord too?
Speaker: Osha

Text: I will be lord after my father.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: So you're not lord now?
Speaker: Osha

Text: No, you...You having a go at me? Is that it?
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: I just don't understand how you Southerners do things.
Speaker: Osha

Text: I'm not a Southerner.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: You're from South of the wall. That makes you a Southerner to me.
Speaker: Osha

Text: You're an impudent little wench, aren't you?
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Couldn't say, My Lord. Don't know what "impunent" means.
Speaker: Osha

Text: Impudent. It means rude. Disrespectful.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Do you want to lose that chain?
Theon Greyjoy! The lady is our guest.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: I thought she was our prisoner.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Are the two mutually exclusive in your experience?
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: Agitated as he is, Theon runs off.
Chances are I won't be nearby the next time that happens.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: I'm used to worse than him.
Speaker: Osha

Text: I'm used to men who could chew that boy up and pick their teeth with his bones.
Speaker: Osha

Text: Why did you come here?
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: Didn't mean to come here. Meant to get much further South than this.
Speaker: Osha

Text: As far South as South goes, before the long night comes.
Why? What are you afraid of?
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: There's things that sleep in the day and hunt at night.
Speaker: Osha

Text: Owls and Shadowcats and...
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: I'm not talking about Owls and Shadowcats.
Speaker: Osha

Text: They wasn't gone, old man. They was sleeping.
Speaker: Osha

Text: And they ain't sleeping no more.
Seeing the wall from above, we see Jon and Sam walking towards the edge.
I miss girls.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Not even talking to them. I never talked to them.
Just looking at them, hearing them giggle.
Don't you miss girls?
Both Jon and Sam are looking down and see a galloping horse.
Riders. The horn. We have to blow the horn.
Why is he alone?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: One blast for a Ranger returning, two for Wildlings, three for...
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: There's no rider.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: While the Wall's gate is being opened, the horse gallops inside the tunnel. Jon and Sam are rushing down, while the stable boy has caught the horse, bringing him towards Jon, Sam and Jeor Mormont.
Whoa, boy, whoa.
Speaker: Night Watch stable boy

Text: That's my Uncle Benjen's horse.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Where's my Uncle?
Returning to Kings Landing, we see Ned and Tomard walking down a hallway. Renly running towards them calling...
Ned! It's Robert.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: We were hunting...a boar...

Surprised yet being shocked as he is, Ned walks towards Robert's chambers. Inside Robert's room, we see Cersei, Joffrey, Barristan Selmy and Maester Pycelle are all present. Robert speaks to joffrey, whom is sitting beside him.
I should have spent more time with you, shown you how to be a man.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: I was never meant to be a father.
Go on. You don't want to see this.
Joffrey walks out of the room.
My fault. Too much wine, missed my thrust.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: It stinks. It stinks like death. Don't think I can't smell it.
I paid the bastard back, Ned. I drove my knife right through his brain.
You ask them if I didn't. Ask them!
I want the funeral feast to be the biggest the Kingdoms ever saw.
And I want everyone to taste the boar that got me.
Now leave us, the lot of you. I need to talk to Ned.
Robert, my sweet...
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: Out, all of you!
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: On Robert's demand, everyone left except for Ned. As soon as the door shuts, Ned talks to Robert.
You damned fool.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Paper and ink on the table, write down what I say.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: "In the name of Robert of the House Baratheon, first of..." you know how it goes. Fill in the damn titles.
"I hereby command Eddard of House Stark" titles, titles.
"To serve as Lord Regent and Protector of the Realm upon my death.
To rule in my stead, until my son Joffrey comes of age".
Give it over.
Ned hands over the letter and quill. It is seen that Robert's signs the letter with his autograph.
Give it to the council after I'm dead.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: At least they'll say I did this right, this one thing.
You'll rule now. You'll hate it worse than I did, but you'll do it well.
The girl, Daenerys. You were right. Varys, Littlefinger, my brother. Worthless.
No one to tell me "no" but you. Only you.
Let her live. Stop it, if it's not too late.
I will.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: And my son Help him, Ned. Make him better than me.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: I'll, I'll do everything I can to honor your memory.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: My memory.
Speaker: Robert Baratheon

Text: King Robert Baratheon, murdered by a pig.
Give me something for the pain and let me die.
Ned walks out of Robert's chamber. Maester Pycelle, Renly, Varys and Barristan Selmy are waiting outside.
Give him milk of the poppy.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Both Maester Pycelle as Renly re-enter Robert's chamber. Still outside a conversation occurs.
He was reeling from the wine.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: He commanded us to step aside, but I failed him.
No man could have protected him from himself.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I wonder, Ser Barristan, who gave the king this wine?
Speaker: Lord Varys

Text: His squire, from the king's own skin.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: His squire? The Lannister boy?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Such a dutiful boy to make sure his Grace did not lack refreshment.
Speaker: Lord Varys

Text: I do hope the poor lad does not blame himself.
His Grace has had a change of heart concerning Daenerys Targaryen.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Whatever arrangements you made, unmake them. At once.
I'm afraid those birds have flown.
Speaker: Lord Varys

Text: The girl is likely dead already.
Ned walks off.
Entering Khal Drogo's tent, Daenerys is braiding Khal Drogo's hair. The conversation is spoken in the Dothraki language.
The stallion who mounts the world, has no need for iron chairs.
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: According to the prophecy, the stallions will ride to the ends of the world.
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: The earth ends at the black salt sea. No horse can cross the poison water.
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: The earth does not end at the sea, there are many dirts beyond the sea.
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: The dirt where I was born.
Not dirt. Lands.
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: Lands, yes...
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: There are thousands of ships in the free cities. Wooden horses that fly across the sea.
Let's speak no more of wooden horses and iron chairs.
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: It's not a chair. It's a... Throne
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: Throne?
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: A chair for a King to sit upon, or a Queen.
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: A King does not need a chair to sit upon. He only needs a horse.
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: Khal Drogo kisses Daenerys and walks out of the tent.
A while later, at one of Vaes Dothrak's markets, Daenerys walks with Jorah Mormont.
Can't you help me make him understand?
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: The Dothraki do things in their own time, for their own reasons.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Have patience, Khaleesi. We will go home, I promise you.
My brother was a fool, I know, but he was the rightful heir to the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: Have I said something funny, Ser?
Forgive me, Khaleesi, but your ancestor Aegon the Conqueror didn't seize six of the kingdoms because they were his right.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: He had no right to them. He seized them because he could.
And because he had dragons.
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: Ah well, having a few dragons makes things easier.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: You don't believe it.
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: Have you ever seen a dragon, Khaleesi? I believe what my eyes and ears report.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: As for the rest It was 300 years ago. Who knows what really happened?
Now if you'll pardon me, I'll seek out the merchant Captain, see if he has any letters for me.
Well, I'll come with you.
Speaker: Deanerys Targarian

Text: No no, don't trouble yourself. Enjoy the market. I'll rejoin you soon enough.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Jorah walks by a few merchants, while a little child is calling him.
Psst, Jorah the Andal.
Speaker: Little Bird

Text: The spider sends his greetings and his congratulations.
A royal pardon. You can go home now.
Jorah seems to have a change of heart. Meanwhile a merchant is heard from afar.
Virzetha gizikhven! Mra qora! Mra qora!
Speaker: Wine Merchant

Text: Sweet reds! I have sweet reds from Lys, Volantis and the Arbor!
Tyrosh pear brandy! Andalish sours! I have them! I have them!
Danaerys approaches the merchant
A taste for the Khaleesi? I have a sweet red from Dorne, my lady.
Speaker: Wine Merchant

Text: One taste and you'll name your first child after me.
My son already has his name, but I'll try your summerwine.
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: Just a taste.
My Lady, you are from Westeros.
Speaker: Wine Merchant

Text: You have the honor of addressing Daenerys of the House Targaryen.
Speaker: Doreah

Text: Khaleesi of the riding men and princess of the Seven Kingdoms.
Princess.
Speaker: Wine Merchant

Text: Rise. I'd still like to taste that wine.
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: That? Dornish swill.
Speaker: Wine Merchant

Text: Not worthy of a princess. I have a dry red from the Arbor. Nectar of the Gods.
Let me give you a cask. Uh... a gift.
You honor me, Ser.
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: The honor...the honor is all mine.
Speaker: Wine Merchant

Text: Huh-uh, huh-uh.
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: Rakharo pulls the cask out of the merchants hands.
You know there are many in your homeland that pray for your return, princess.
Speaker: Wine Merchant

Text: I hope to repay your kindness someday.
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: Rakharo.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Huh.
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: Put down that cask.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Is something wrong?
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: I have a thirst. Open it.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: The wine is for the Khaleesi. It's not for the likes of you.
Speaker: Wine Merchant

Text: Open it.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: The wine merchant obeys and opens the cask.
Pour.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: It would be a crime to drink a wine this rich without at least giving it time to breathe.
Speaker: Wine Merchant

Text: Do as he says.
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: As the princess commands.
Speaker: Wine Merchant

Text: The wine merchant poors the wine into a cup.
Sweet, isn't it? Can you smell the fruit, Ser? Taste it, My Lord.
Speaker: Wine Merchant

Text: Tell me that that is not the finest wine that has ever touched your tongue.
You first.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Me? I'm afraid I am not worthy of the vintage.
Speaker: Wine Merchant

Text: Besides, it is a poor wine merchant who would drink up his own wares.
You will drink.
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: The wine merchant takes Jorah's cup. Looks both Jorah and Daenerys innocently in their eyes, while making a toasting gesture.
As soon as his lips touches his cup, he drops it and tries to flee.
Khaleesi! Stop him!
Speaker: Doreah

Text: After a very short chase, Rakharo was able to capture the wine merchant, grabbing the merchants leg with his whip.
Jorah grabs Daenerys's arm.
Come.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: At the Wall we see Jeor Mormont speaking towards his brothers of the Night's Watch.
You came to us as outlaws, poachers, rapers, killers, thieves.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: You came alone, in chains, without friends nor honor.
You came to us rich and you came to us poor.
Some of you bear the names of proud houses, others only bastard names or no names at all.
It does not matter. All that, is in the past.
Here, on the wall, are all one house.
Tonight...
You're allowed to look happy.
Speaker: Samwel Tarly

Text: You're going to be a Ranger.
Isn't that what you always wanted?
I want to find my Uncle.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: I know he's alive out there. I know he is.
I wish I could help you, but I'm no Ranger.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: It's the steward's life for me.
There's honor in being a steward.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Not much, really. But there's food.
Here you begin anew.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: A man of The Night's Watch lives his life for the realm.
Not for a king, or a lord, or the honor of this house or that house.
Not for gold nor glory nor a woman's love. But for the realm! And all the people in it.
You've all learned the words of the vow.
Think carefully before you say them.
The penalty for desertion, is death.
You can take your vows here tonight, at sunset.
Do any of you still keep the old Gods?
Jon Snow stands.
I do, my lord.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: You'll want to take your vow before a heart tree as your Uncle did.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: Yes, my lord.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: You'll find a Weirwood a mile North of the Wall. And your old Gods too, maybe.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: my lord, might I go as well?
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Does house Tarly keep the old Gods?
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: No, my lord.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: I was named in the light of the Seven, as my father was and his father before him.
Alliser ThorneL  Why would you forsake the Gods of your father and your house?
The Night's Watch is my house now.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: The Seven have never answered my prayers. Perhaps the old Gods will.
As you wish, lad.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: You've all been assigned an order, according to our needs and your strengths.
Halder to the builders. Pyp to the stewards. Toad to the builders.
Grenn to the Rangers. Samwell to the stewards. Matthar to the Rangers.
Dareon to the stewards. Balian to the Rangers. Rast to the Rangers.
Jon to the stewards. Rancer to the builders. Echiel to the builders.
Gordo to the stewards. Niko to the Rangers. Escan to the Rangers.
Vorkoy to the builders. Joby to the stables. Mink to the kitchens.
Allo to the builders. Nelugo to the Rangers.
May all the Gods preserve you.
Rangers with me.
Speaker: Jaremy Rykker

Text: Builders!
Speaker: Othell Yarwyck

Text: Everyone walks to their designated leader. Sam, Jon and Pyp walk towards Maester Aemon and await their tasks.
Samwell, you will assist me in the rookery and library.
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: Pyp, you will report to Bowen Marsh in the kitchens.
Luke, report to one-eyed Joe in the stables.
Dareon, we are sending you to Eastwatch.
Present yourself to Borcas when you arrive. Make no comment about his nose.
Jon Snow, Lord Commander Mormont has requested you for his personal steward.
Will I serve the Lord Commander's meals and fetch hot water for his bath.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Certainly. And keep a fire burning in his chambers.
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: Change his sheets and blankets daily and do everything else the Lord Commander requires of you.
Do you take me for a servant?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: We took you for a man of The Night's Watch.
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: But perhaps we were wrong in that.
May I go?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: As you wish.
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: Jon walks away, while Sam and Pyp follow him.
Jon, wait! Don't you see what they're doing?
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: I see Ser Alliser's revenge, that's all.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: He wanted it and he got it.
Stewards are nothing but maids! I'm a better swordsman and rider than any of you! It's not fair.
Fair? I was singing for a high lord at Acorn Hall when he put his hand on my leg and he wanted to see my cock.
Speaker: Pypar

Text: I pushed him away and he said he'd have my hands cut off for stealing their silver.
So now I'm here. At the end of the world with no one to sing for, but old men and little shits like you.
I'll never see my family again. I'll never be inside a woman again.
So don't tell me about fair.
I thought you were caught stealing a wheel of cheese for your starving sister?
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: You think I was gonna tell a bunch of strangers that a high lord tried to grab my cock?
Speaker: Pypar

Text: Could you sing me a song, Pyp? I'd like to hear a song.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Angrily Pyp walks off. Sam talks to Jon.
Now listen to me. The old man is the Lord Commander of The Night's Watch.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: You'll be with him day and night.
Yes, you'll clean his clothes.But you'll also take his letters, attend him at meetings, squire for him in battle.
You'll know everything, be part of everything. And he asked for you himself.
He wants to groom you for command.
I just, I always wanted to be a Ranger.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: I always wanted to be a Wizard.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Jon laughs out loud.
What? No, I'm serious.
So you'll stay and say your words with me?
In Kings Landing we see Ned Stark walking with his guards, while Renly approaches.
Lord Stark, a moment.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: Alone if you will.
He named you Protector of the Realm.He did.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: She won't care.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: Give me an hour and I can put a hundred swords at your command.
And what should I do with a hundred swords?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Strike! Tonight while the castle sleeps.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: We must get Joffrey away from his mother and into our custody.
Protector of the Realm or no, he who holds the King holds the Kingdom.
Every moment you delay gives Cersei another moment to prepare.
By the time Robert dies, it will be too late for the both of us.
What about Stannis?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Saving the Seven Kingdoms from Cersei and delivering them to Stannis?
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: You have odd notions about protecting the realm.
Stannis is your older brother.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: This isn't about the bloody line of succession.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: That didn't matter when you rebelled against the Mad King. It shouldn't matter now.
What's best for the Kingdoms? What's best for the people we rule? We all know what Stannis is.
He inspires no love or loyalty. He's not a King. I am.
Stannis is a commander. He's led men into war twice.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: He destroyed the Greyjoy fleet.
Yes, he's a good soldier. Everyone knows that. So was Robert.
Speaker: Renly Baratheon

Text: Do you still believe good soldiers make good kings?
Speaker: Tell me something

Text: I will not dishonor Robert's last hours by shedding blood in his halls and dragging frightened children from their beds.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Ned walks off to his chamber, while Renly is left behind agitated.
Entering Ned Starks chamber, we see him writing a letter to Stannis. Giving orders to Tomard.
You will sail to dragonstone tonight.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: You will place this in the hand of Stannis Baratheon.
Not his steward, not his Captain of the guard, and not his wife.
Only Stannis himself.
Yes, My Lord.
Speaker: Tomard

Text: Littlefinger enters the room
Now leave us.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Tomard follows Ned's command and leaves his chamber. Littlefingers starts off the conversation.
My Lord protector.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: The King has no true born sons.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Joffrey and Tommen are Jaime Lannister's bastards.
So when the King dies...
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: The throne passes to his brother Lord Stannis.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: So it would seem. Unless...
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: There is no "unless".
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: He is the rightful heir. Nothing can change that.
And he cannot take the throne without your help.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: You would be wise to deny it to him and to make sure Joffrey succeeds.
Do you have a shred of honor?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: You are now Hand of the King and Protector of the Realm.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: All of the power is yours. You need only reach out and take it.
Make peace with the Lannisters. Release the Imp. Wed your daughter to Joffrey.
We have plenty of time to get rid of Stannis.
And if Joffrey seems likely to cause problems when he comes into his throne, we simply reveal his little secret and seat Lord Renly there instead.
We?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: You'll need someone to share these burdens. I assure you, my price would be modest.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: What you suggest is treason.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Only if we lose.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Make peace with the Lannisters, you say. With the people who tried to murder my boy.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: We only make peace with our enemies, my Lord.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: That's why it's called "making peace".
No. I won't do it.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: So it will be Stannis and war?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: There is no other choice. He is the heir.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: So why did you call me here? Not for my wisdom, clearly.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: You promised Catelyn you would help me.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: The Queen has a dozen knights and a hundred men-at-arms.
Enough to overwhelm what remains of my household guard. I need the gold cloaks.
The City Watch is 2,000 strong and sworn to defend the King's peace.
Look at you. You know what you want me to do.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: You know it has to be done, but it's not honorable so the words stick in your throat.
When the Queen proclaims one King and the Hand proclaims another, whose peace do the Gold Cloaks protect?
Who do they follow?
The man who pays them.
Back at the Wall, we see Jon, Sam and Ghost, walking with a few Night's Watch brothers, on their way to the Weirwood tree.
Upon arrival, they're taking their vows.
Hear my words and bear witness to my vow.
Speaker: Both Jon and Sam

Text: Night gathers and now my watch begins.
It shall not end until my death.
I shall take no wife, hold no lands, father no children.
I shall wear no crowns and win no glory.
I shall live and die at my post.
I am the sword in the darkness.
I am the watcher on the walls.
I am the shield that guards the realms of men.
I pledge my life and honor to The Night's Watch, for this night and all the nights to come.
You knelt as boys.
Speaker: Othell Yarwyck

Text: Rise now as men of The Night's Watch.
Well done. Well done.
Speaker: Fellow Night's Watch brothers

Text: Ghost suddenly appears and is holding onto something.
What's he got there?
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Jon SnowL  To me, Ghost. Bring it here.
It appeared that Ghost was holding a frozen hand.
Gods be good!
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Returning to a tent in Vaes Dothrak, both Daenarys and Jorah are having a conversation, while walking past the captured wine merchant.
What will they do to him?
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: When the Khalasar rides, he'll be leashed to a saddle, forced to run behind the horses for as long as he can.
And when he falls?
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: I saw a man last nine miles once.
King Robert still wants me dead.This poisoner was the first. He won't be the last.
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: I thought he'd leave me alone, now that my brother is gone.
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: He will never leave you alone.
If you ride to darkest Asshai, his assassins will follow you.
If you sailed all the way to the Basilisk Isles, his spies would tell him.
He will never abandon the hunt.
You're a Targaryen. The last Targaryen.
Your son will have Targaryen blood with 40,000 riders behind him.
He will not have my son.
Speaker: Daenerys Stormborn

Text: He will not have you either, Khaleesi.
Khal Drogo enters the tent with a couple of his men. After staring at the scared merchant, he walks towards Daenarys
Moon of my life. Are you hurt?
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: Daenarys gently shakes her head in disapproval. Khal Drogo kisses Daenarys's forehead and talks to Jorah.
Jorah the Andal, I heard what you did.
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: Choose any horse you wish, it is yours.I make this gift to you.
And to my son, the stallion who will mount the world. I will also pledge a gift.I will give him the iron chair, that his mother's father sat upon.
I will give him Seven Kingdoms. I Drogo, will do this.
I will take my Khalasar west to where the world ends and ride wooden horses across the black salt water as no Khal has done before.
I will kill the men in iron suits and tear down their stone houses.
I will rape their women, take their children as slaves and bring their broken gods back to Vaes Dothrak.
This, I vow. I, Drogo, son of Bharbo. I swear before the Mother of Mountains as the stars look down in witness!
As the stars look down in witness!
The Khalasar is moving out of Vaes Dothrak, riding underneath the Horse Gate.
Just as Jorah predicted, the wine merchant is leashed to one of the horses saddles, covered with dirt, struggling to move on.
In Kings Landing Ned stark walks with his men, while being called by a messenger.
Lord Stark!
Speaker: Messenger

Text: Stop!
Speaker: Varly

Text: No, all right.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: It's all right. Let him through.
Lord Stark, King Joffrey and the Queen Regent request your presence in the Throne Room.
Speaker: Messenger

Text: King Joffrey?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: King Robert is gone.
Speaker: Messenger

Text: The Gods give him rest.
Ned seems petrified by the news. Shortly after, Ned arrives close-by the Throne room, where Littlefinger, Varys and a few Stark men await him.
All is accomplished. The City Watch is yours.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Good. Is Lord Renly joining us?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I fear Lord Renly has left the city.
Speaker: Lord Varys

Text: He rode through the old gate an hour before dawn with Ser Loras Tyrell and some 50 retainers.
Last seen galloping South in some haste.
When moving on, affront of the Throne room, Janos Slynt and the Gold Cloaks await Ned.
We stand behind you, Lord Stark.
Speaker: Janos Slynt

Text: All hail his Grace, Joffrey of Houses Baratheon and Lannister, the first of his name, King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm.
Speaker: Messenger

Text: I command the council to make all necessary arrangements for my coronation.
Speaker: King Joffrey

Text: I wish to be crowned within the fortnight.
Today I shall accept oaths of fealty from my loyal councilors.
Ser Barristan, I believe no man here could ever question your honor.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: King Robert's seal. Unbroken.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: "Lord Eddard Stark is herein named Protector of the Realm, to rule as Regent until the heir come of age".
May I see that letter, Ser Barristan?
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: Protector of the realm. Is this meant to be your shield, Lord Stark? A piece of paper?
Cersei shreds Robert's letter to pieces
Those were the King's words.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: We have a new King now.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: Lord Eddard, when we last spoke you offered me some counsel.
Allow me to return the courtesy. Bend the knee, My Lord.
Bend the knee and swear loyalty to my son and we shall allow you to live out your days in the gray waste you call home.Your son has no claim to the throne.
Liar!
Speaker: King Joffrey

Text: You condemn yourself with your own mouth, Lord Stark.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: Ser Barristan, seize this traitor.
Ser Barristan is a good man, a loyal man. Do him no harm.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: You think he stands alone?
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: Cregor Clegane draws his sword.
Kill him! Kill all of them, I command it!
Speaker: King Joffrey

Text: Commander! Take the Queen and her children into custody.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Escort them back to the royal apartments and keep them there, under guard.
Men of the Watch!
Speaker: Janos Slynt

Text: The Gold Cloaks draw their swords.
I want no bloodshed.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Tell your men to lay down their swords. No one needs to die.
Now!
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Suddenly, the Gold Cloaks switch sides and attack the Stark men. Littlefinger sneaks up to Ned Stark.
He grabs him from behind, then holds a dagger to his throat, saying...
I did warn you not to trust me.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Entering King's Landing, we see Syrio Forel dancing with Arya.
Yah! Left high, left low.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: How ironic it seems, how peacefully Arya and Syrio are dancing, near the Throne room, the Kings Guard fights a few Stark men.
Going back again at Arya's dancing training.
Right low, lunge right.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Outside in a courtyard, a few Stark stewards are packing and bringing out the Stark family's belongings.
If you break anything, the Septa will have my head. What is...
Speaker: Steward of House Stark

Text: The stewards are being slaughtered by the Kingsguard.
Going back inside the Red Keep, Sansa is walking down a hallway with her Septa.
Your sister knew perfectly well we were to leave today.
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: How she could forget...
She didn't forget. She's with her dancing master.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: She's with him every morning. She always comes back with scrapes and bruises.
She's so clumsy.
Hush! Go back to your room.
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: Bar the doors and do not open them for anyone you do not know.
What is it? What's happening?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Do as I told you. Run!
Speaker: Septa Mordane

Text: Back at Arya's training.
This way! Left, right.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Rah! Now you are dead.
You said right, but you went left.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: And now you are a dead girl.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Only 'cause you lied.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: My tongue lied.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: My eyes shouted the truth.
You were not seeing.
I was so. I watched, but you...
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Watching is not seeing, dead girl.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: The seeing, the true seeing, that is the heart of swordplay.
The Kingsguard approaches.
Arya Stark, come with us.
Speaker: Meryn Trant

Text: Your father wants to see you.
And why is it that Lord Eddard is sending Lannister men in place of his own? I am wondering.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Mind your place, dancing master.
Speaker: Meryn Trant

Text: This is no concern of yours.
My father wouldn't send you.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: As she picks up her wooden stick from the ground, she says.
And I don't have to go with you if I don't want.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Take her.
Speaker: Maryn Trant

Text: Are you men or snakes, that you would threaten a child?
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Get out of my way, little man.
Speaker: Kings guard

Text: I am Syrio Forel.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Foreign bastard.
Speaker: Kings guard

Text: The Kings guard draws his sword. Before he can strike, Syrio hits him with his wooden stick. Knocking him out.
And you will be speaking to me with more respect.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Kill the Braavosi. Bring the girl.
Speaker: Meryn Trant

Text: Arya child, we are done with dancing for the day.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Run to your father.
Syrio Forel fights three Kings guards at once, eventually knocking them all out.
Bloody oafs.
Speaker: Meryn Trant

Text: Be gone now, Arya.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Come with me. Run.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: The first sword of Braavos does not run.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Meryn Trant strikes Syrio, a short duel takes place. Eventually Meryn Trant cuts Syrio Forel's wooden sword into pieces.
What do we say to the God of death?
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Not today.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Go.
Speaker: Syrio Forel

Text: Arya Stark runs off and hears a bunch of screams from down the hallway. She looks concerned.
Not today. Not today.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Back on the other side of the Red Keep, Sansa runs on, but is stopped by a familiar face.
Stay away from me.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: I'll tell my father. I'll...I'll tell the Queen.
Who do you think sent me?
Speaker: Sandor Clegane

Text: Back to Arya, we see that she has arrived at the slaughtered stewards. She sees her belongings lying on the ground.
Needle.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: A stable boy appears.
There she is.
Speaker: Stable Boy

Text: What do you want?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: I want you, wolf girl. Come here.
Speaker: Stable Boy

Text: Leave me be. My father's a lord. He'll reward you.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: She'll reward me, the Queen!
Speaker: Stable Boy

Text: Stay away!
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Accidentally, she turns around sliding Needle through the stable boys belly. Her first kill is a fact.
Shook as she is, she runs off.
In the dark dungeon cells of Kings Landing we see Ned Stark. He sees a little light approaches him. After a short while it is clear that it's Varys, whom is holding a torch.
Lord Stark, you must be thirsty.
Speaker: Lord Varys

Text: Varys.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: I promise you it isn't poisoned.
Speaker: Lord Varys

Text: Why is it no one ever trusts the eunuch? Not so much, My Lord.
I would save the rest, if I were you.
Hide it. Men have been known to die of thirst in these cells.
What about my daughters?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: The younger one seems to have escaped the castle.
Speaker: Lord Varys

Text: Even my little birds cannot find her.
And Sansa?
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Still engaged to Joffrey.
Speaker: Lord Varys

Text: Cersei will keep her close. The rest of your household though, all dead, it grieves me to say.
I do so hate the sight of blood.
You watched my men being slaughtered and did nothing.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: And would again, My Lord.
Speaker: Lord Varys

Text: I was unarmed, unarmored and surrounded by Lannister swords.
When you look at me do you see a hero?
What madness led you to tell the Queen you had learned the truth about Joffrey's birth?
The madness of mercy. That she might save her children.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Ah, the children. It is always the innocents who suffer.
Speaker: Lord Varys

Text: It wasn't the wine that killed Robert, nor the boar.
The wine slowed him down and the boar ripped him open, but it was your mercy that killed the King.
I trust you know you are a dead man, Lord Eddard?
The Queen can't kill me. Cat holds her brother.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: The wrong brother sadly.
Speaker: Lord Varys

Text: And lost to her. Your wife has let the Imp slip through her fingers.
If that's true, then slit my throat and be done with it.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Not today, My Lord.
Speaker: Lord Varys

Text: Varys is about to walk away, while being stopped by Ned one last time.
Tell me something, Varys.
Speaker: Ned Stark

Text: Who do you truly serve?
The Realm, My Lord.
Speaker: Lord Varys

Text: Someone must.
Varys leaves the dungeons.
At Castle Black a corpses are being carried inside. Some of the Night's brothers are inspecting the two bodies.
It's Othor, without a doubt.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: The other one is Jafer Flowers, My Lord, less the hand the wolf tore off.
Speaker: Othell Yarwyck

Text: Any sign of Benjen or the rest of his party?
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: Just these two, My Lord. Been dead awhile, I'd say.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Mmm.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: The smell.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: What smell?
Speaker: Othell Yarwyck

Text: There is none.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: If they'd be dead for a long time, wouldn't there be rot?
We should burn them.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Snow's not wrong, My Lord.
Speaker: Othell Yarwyck

Text: Fire will do for them. The Wildling way.
I want Maester Aemon to examine them first.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: You may be a coward, Tarly, but you're not stupid.
Get them inside.
You heard him.
Speaker: Othell Yarwyck

Text: Lord Commander, Maester Aemon awaits you in his chambers. A raven from King's Landing.
Speaker: Ser Alliser

Text: Come on, move 'em out.
Speaker: Nights Watch brother

Text: Jon Snow is summoned to Jeor Mormont's chambers. While entering the room, a conversation starts.
Bring me a horn of ale, Snow, and pour one for yourself.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: The King is dead.
Is there any word of my father?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Sit.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: Lord Stark has been charged with treason.
They say he conspired with Robert's brothers to deny the throne to Prince Joffrey.
Jon points to the letter, as he wants to read it. Jeor Mormont hands it over. When reading the letter, Jon stands up and wants to walk away.
I hope you're not thinking of doing anything stupid.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: Your duty lies here now.
My sisters were in King's Landing too.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: I'm sure they'll be treated gently.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: Jon walks out.
Deep inside the Red Keep, Sansa is having a conversation with Cersei.
Grand Maester Pycelle, Varys and Littlefinger being in their presence.
Your father has proved to be an awful traitor, dear.
Speaker: Lord Varys

Text: King Robert's body was still warm when Lord Eddard began plotting to steal Joffrey's rightful throne.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: He wouldn't do that. He knows how much I love Joffrey.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: He wouldn't. Please, Your Grace, there's been a mistake.
Send for my father. He'll tell you, the King was his friend.
Sansa sweetling, you are innocent of any wrong.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: We know that.
Yet you are the daughter of a traitor.
How can I allow you to marry my son?
A child born of a traitor's seed is no fit consort for our King.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: She is a sweet thing now, Your Grace, but in 10 years who knows what treasons she may hatch?
No, I'm not.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: I'll be a good wife to him, you'll see.
I'll be a Queen just like you, I promise.
I won't hatch anything.
The girl is innocent, Your Grace.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: She should be given a chance to prove her loyalty.
Little dove, you must write to Lady Catelyn and your brother, the eldest.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: What's his name?
Robb.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Word of your father's arrest will reach him soon, no doubt.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: Best it comes from you.
If you would help your father, urge your brother to keep the King's peace.
Tell him to come to King's Landing and swear his fealty to Joffrey.
If...if I could see my father, talk to him about...
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: You disappoint me, child.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: We have told you of your father's treason.
Why would you want to speak to a traitor?
I only meant that...what will happen to him?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: That depends.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: On...on what?
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: On your brother. And on you.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: Back at Winterfell, Robb reads the letter Sansa sent.
Treason? Sansa wrote this?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: It is your sister's hand, but the Queen's words.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: You are summoned to King's Landing to swear fealty to the new King.
Joffrey puts my father in chains, now he wants his ass kissed?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: This is a royal command, My Lord.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: If you should refuse to obey...
I won't refuse. His Grace summons me to King's Landing, I'll go to King's Landing.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: But not alone. Call the banners.
All of them, My Lord?
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: They've all sworn to defend my father, have they not?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: They have.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: Now we see what their words are worth.
Yeah.
Speaker: Maester Luwin

Text: Maester Luwin walks off.
Are you afraid?
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: I must be.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Good.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Why is that good?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: It means you're not stupid.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: At the Eyrie, Catelyn rushes to Lysa's chambers. Upon arrival she angrily speaks.
You've had this since dawn?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: He sent it to me, not you.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: I've only shown it to you as a courtesy.
A courtesy?! My husband has been taken prisoner.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: My son intends to declare war.
A war? Your son against the Lannisters?
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: You should go to him. Teach him patience.
Ned rots in a dungeon and you speak of patience? He is your brother by law!Does family mean nothing to you?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Family means everything to me.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: And I will not risk Robin's life to get caught up in another of your husband's wars.
I'm hungry.
Speaker: Robin Arryn

Text: Hush now, darling. You just ate.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: You will not support us then? Do I understand you correctly?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: But I'm hungry!
Speaker: Robin Arryn

Text: Soon, love, soon.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: You're always welcome here, sister.
But if you're asking me to send men from the Vale to fight...
That is what I ask.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Go on, sweet. Time for your bath. I'll feed you after.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: Robin walks out of the room.
If you fear for the safety of your son...
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Of course I fear for the safety of my son!
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: Are you an idiot? They killed my husband.
You say they shoved your boy from a window.
These people will do anything.
And that is why we have to stop them.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: The knights of the Vale will stay in the Vale where they belong, to protect their Lord.
Speaker: Lysa Arryn

Text: Both Tyrion and Bronn are seen walking through the hills of the Vale.
Will you shut up? There's hill tribes all around here.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: If I'm going to die, it may as well be with a song in my heart.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: I should just take your food and leave you here.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Eh? What would you do then?
Starve, most likely.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You don't think I'd do it, do you?
Speaker: Bronn

Text: What do you want, Bronn? Gold? Women? Golden women?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Stick with me and you'll have them all, for as long as I'm around and not for a moment longer.
But you knew that.
That is why you so valiantly took up arms to defend my honor.
Fair enough.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: But don't go looking for me to bend the knee and "My Lord" you every time you take a shit.
I'm not your toady and I'm not your friend.
Though I would treasure your friendship.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: I'm mainly interested in your facility with murder.
And if the day ever comes when you're tempted to sell me out.
Whatever their price, I'll beat it.
Speaker: Remember this

Text: I like living.
A while later, Tyrion and Bronn are seen near a campfire.
Bronn hears noises of approaching men and tries to warn Tyrion.
Tyrion. Tyrion. Tyrion.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Come, share our fire.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Help yourselves to our goat.
When you meet your Gods, you tell them Shagga Son of Dolf of the Stone Crows sent you.
Speaker: Shagga

Text: I am Tyrion son of Tywin of Clan Lannister.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: How would you like to die, Tyrion son of Tywin?
In my own bed, at the age of 80 with a bellyful of wine and a girl's mouth around my cock.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Take the half man.
He can dance for the children. Kill the other one.
No no no no no! My, my House is rich and powerful.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: If you see us through these mountains, my father will shower you with gold.
We have no use for a half man's promises.
Speaker: Shagga

Text: Half a man maybe, but at least I have the courage to face my enemies.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: What do the Stone Crows do? Hide behind rocks and shiver when the knights of the Vale ride by?
Are those the best weapons you could steal? Good enough for killing sheep, if the sheep don't fight back.
Lannister smiths shit better steel.
You think you can win us over with your trinkets?
Speaker: Shagga

Text: That trinket is worth more than everything your tribe owns.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: But if you help us, Shagga Son of Dolf, I will not give you trinkets.
I will give you this.
Tyrion makes a gesture.
What is "this"?
Speaker: Shagga

Text: The Vale of Arryn.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: The Lords of the Vale have always spat upon the hill tribes.
The Lords of the Vale want me dead.
I believe it is time for new Lords of the Vale.
In Castle Black's kitchen, Jon and Sam are preparing a meal, while Ser Alliser approaches.
Now there's a rare sight. Not only a bastard, but a traitor's bastard.
Speaker: Ser Alliser

Text: Jon looks Alliser in his eyes. Silence occur for a few seconds. Then, suddenly Jon tries to strike Alliser, but is stopped by Pypar and Grenn.
Jon, no! Jon, stop, put it down!
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Blood will always tell. You'll hang for this, bastard.
Speaker: Ser Alliser

Text: Ser Alliser had his fun and walks away, while Jeor Mormont saw the incident and walk towards Jon.
I told you not to do anything stupid. You're confined to quarters. Go.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: Jon obeys and walks off.
Later that night, Ghost alerts Jon. He seems to be uneasy. Jon wakes up and talks to Ghost.
Ghost, what's wrong? Is something out there?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Jon decides to get out of bed, gear up and opens the door. Ghost runs off towards Jeor Mormants room.
Mounting his door.
Commander?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Stay.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Ghost waits at the front door, while Jon walks in.
Hello?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Who's there?
Lord Commander?
