As soon as he walks through the door, the door shuts and the corpse of Othor attacks Jon. Jon tries to stab him with his dagger, but nothing seems to phase him. Jon pulls himself loose, draws his sword and cuts off Othor's other hand. Then Jon stabs Othor through the heart. Othor falls down. Suddenly Jeor Mormont arrives.
Snow!?
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: Commander!Othor gets back on his feet, pulling out Jon's sword out of his chest. Outside of the room, Ghost goes beserk, trying to get in.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Jon grabs Jeor's lantern and throws it at Othor. Othor catches fire.
Move move!
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Jon grabs Jeor by his arm and flees inside a room, shutting the door.
The Khalasar have arrived the lands of Lhazar. Dany and her company walk through the burned area.
What did they do?
Speaker: Daenarys Stormborn

Text: Lamb men make good slaves. Khal Drogo will make a gift of them to the slavers.
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: And the slavers will give us gold...and silk and steel.
I thought the Dothraki didn't believe in money.
Speaker: Daenarys Stormborn

Text: Gold to hire ships, Princess. Ships to sail to Westeros.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: While walking a little further, Dany sees Dothraki men looting and holding Lhazareen captive.
Jorah, make them stop.
Speaker: Daenarys Stormborn

Text: Khaleesi?
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: You heard me.
Speaker: Daenarys Stormborn

Text: These men have shed blood for their Khal.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Now they claim their rewards.
She is a lamb girl, Khaleesi. The riders do her honor.
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: If her wailing offends the Khaleesi, I will bring you her tongue.
Princess, you have a gentle heart, but this is how it's always been.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: I do not have a gentle heart, Ser. Do as I command or Khal Drogo will know the reason why.
Speaker: Daenarys Stormborn

Text: Jorah and Rhakharo both obey and run off, trying to stop the Khalasar, while freeing some Lhazareen.
Kash qoy qoyi thira disse. Me qorasokh anni!
Speaker: Rhakharo

Text: While Rhakharo argues with a Dothraki man, Jorah brings over a Lhazareen woman.
Come.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Anha afichak mae m'arakhoon!
Speaker: Dothraki Man

Text: What do you want done with them?
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Bring her to me. And those women there.
Speaker: Daenarys Stormborn

Text: You cannot claim them all, Princess.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: I can, and I will.
Speaker: Daenarys Stormborn

Text: Leaving with a couple of Lhazareen women, Dany arrives at a covered courtyard, where Khal Drogo is having a discussion with Mago.
Me Fati! Khaleesi vazha anhaan qorasokh anni, ch'anha afichak mae m'arakhoon anni!
Speaker: Mago

Text: Me vastoe hatif anni; ahhazaan yer Nemo vacchaki.
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: Moon of my life. Mago says you have taken his spoils.
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: A daughter of a lamb men, who was his to mount. Tell me the truth of this.
Mago speaks the truth, my sun and stars. I have claimed many daughters this day, so they cannot be mounted.
Speaker: Daenarys Stormborn

Text: This is the way of war. These women are slaves now to do with as we please.
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: It pleases me to keep them safe.
Speaker: Daenarys Stormborn

Text: If your riders would mount them, let them take them for wifes.
Does the horse mate with the lamb?
Speaker: Qotho

Text: The dragons feeds on horse and lamb alike.
Speaker: Daenarys Stormborn

Text: You are a foreigner. You do not command me.
Speaker: Mago

Text: I am Khaleesi. I do command you.
Speaker: Daenarys Stormborn

Text: See how fierce she grows?
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: That is my son inside her, the stallion that will mount the world. Filling her with his fire.
I will hear no more.
Mago, find somewhere else to stick your cock.
Mago spits on the ground and draws his sword.
A Khal who takes orders from a foreign whore is no Khal.
Speaker: Mago

Text: When Qotho is trying to interfere, Khal Drogo calls him back.
Ohosa. Os.
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: I will not have your body burned. I will not give you that honor.
Mago points out his sword and pushes it to Khal Drogo's chest.
Khal Drogo grins, it doesn't seem to phase him. He continues talking.
The beetles will feed on your eyes. The worms will crawl through your lungs.
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: Mago starts swinging his sword, while Khal Drogo dodges his attack.
When turning his back on Mago, he grabs his daggers and speaks.
The rain will fall on your rotting skin...
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: Khal Drogo turns around facing Mago and drops his daggers to the ground.
Until nothing is left of you but bones!
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: Khal Drogo runs towards Mago, while dodging his attacks. While attacking, Mago screams.
First you have to kill me!
Speaker: mago

Text: Khal drogo grabs Mago's sword, disarms him and cuts his throat open. He grabs Mago's throat, crushes it and pulls out his tongue.
He shows Mago's tongue to the crowd, walks back to his chair and throws Mago's tongue on a pile of rotting flesh.
While sitting down, Dany runs towards him.
My sun and stars is wounded.
Speaker: Daenarys Stormborn

Text: A scratch, moon of my life.
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: Where are the healers?
Speaker: Daenarys Stormborn

Text: This is the bite of a fly.
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: I can help the great rider with his cut.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: The Khal needs no help from slaves who lie with sheep.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: She is mine let her speak.
Speaker: Daenarys Stormborn

Text: Thank you, silver lady.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: Who are you?
Speaker: Daenarys Stormborn

Text: When "the witch" is trying to approach Dany, Qotho stops her.
I am named Mirri Maz Duur.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: I was the Godswife of this Temple.
A witch.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: And spits on the ground.
My mother was Godswife here before me.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: She taught me how to make healing smokes and ointments.
All men are of one flock, so my people believe.
The Great Shepherd sent me to Earth to heal his...
Qotho slaps "the witch" and says.
Too many words. A witch's words poison the ears.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: lamb or lion, his wound must be washed and sewn or it will fester.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: Let her clean your wound, my sun and stars.
Speaker: Daenarys Stormborn

Text: It makes me hurt to see you bleed.
Khal Drogo lays eyes upon "the witch". While he's seemingly in thought, "the witch" approaches him.
As Dany steps aside, she looks at Khal Drogo's wound.
Entering Winterfell, gathered Stark banner men are having a feast.
We see Greatjon Umber whom is having a conversation with Robb Stark.
For 30 years I've been making corpses out of men, boy.
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: I'm the man you want leading the Vanguard.
Galbart Glover will lead the Van.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: The bloody Wall will melt before an Umber marches behind a Glover.
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: I will lead the Van or I will take my men and march them home.
You are welcome to do so, Lord Umber.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: And when I am done with the Lannisters, I will march back North, root you out of your Keep and hang you for an oathbreaker.
Oathbreaker, is it?!
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: Greatjon stands up as he is offended
I'll not sit here and swallow insults from a boy so green he pisses grass.
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: While Greatjon Umber raises his voice to Robb, Grey Wind rushes towards him and attacks, biting off 2 of his fingers.
My Lord father taught me it was death to bare steel against your Liege Lord.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: But doubtless the Greatjon only meant to cut my meat for me.
Your meat...is bloody tough.
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: Greatjon Umber starts laughing breaking the tension, making everyone laughing along with him.
Later that night, Robb is having a short visit with Brann Stark. Upon entering his room, Brann is stil asleep.
Robb wakes him and a conversation follows.
What is it? What's happened?
Speaker: Brann Stark

Text: Shh, it's all right.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Where are you going?
Speaker: Brann Stark

Text: South. For father.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: But it's the middle of the night.
Speaker: Brann Stark

Text: The Lannisters have spies everywhere.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: I don't want them to know we're coming.
They have more men than we do.
Speaker: Brann Stark

Text: Aye, they do.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Can't I come with you? I can ride now. You've seen me riding.
Speaker: Brann Stark

Text: And I won't get in the way, I...
There must always be a Stark at Winterfell.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Until I return that will be you.
You are not to leave the castle walls while we are gone.
Do you understand?
Listen to Maester Luwin. Look after your little brother.
I will.
Speaker: Brann Stark

Text: I'll send letters whenever I can, but if you don't hear from me, don't be scared.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Until I return.
Robb leaves the room, but as soon as Robb left, Rickon appears.
How long have you been hiding out there?
Speaker: Brann Stark

Text: Robb will be looking for you, to say goodbye.
They've all gone away.
Speaker: Rickon Stark

Text: They'll be back soon.
Speaker: Brann Stark

Text: Robb will free father and they'll come back with mother.
No, they won't.
Speaker: Rickon Stark

Text: Rickon turns arond and leaves the room.
The next morning, Brann is sitting affront of the Weirwood tree.
While saying his prayers, Osha approaches him.
Please watch over Robb.
Speaker: Brann Stark

Text: And watch over all the other men from Winterfell.
And Theon too, I suppose.
You hear them, boy? The Old Gods are answering you.
Speaker: Osha

Text: What are you doing here?
Speaker: Brann Stark

Text: They're my Gods too.
Speaker: Osha

Text: Beyond the Wall, they're the only Gods.
Even slaves are allowed to pray.
You're not a slave.
Speaker: Brann Stark

Text: Osha points out to her chains and wiggles her foot.
Well, your friend did put a knife to my throat.
Speaker: Brann Stark

Text: I'm not complaining, Little Lord, just telling truths.
What did you mean about hearing the Gods?
Speaker: Brann Stark

Text: You asked them, they're answering you.
Speaker: Osha

Text: Shh. Open your ears.
Brann is trying to listen and looks up the Weirwood tree. He hears the wind blowing through the leaves.
It's only the wind.
Speaker: Brann Stark

Text: Who do you think sends the wind if not the Gods?
They see you, boy. They hear you.
Your brother will get no help from them where he's going.
The Old Gods have no power in the South.
The Weirwoods there were all cut down a long time ago.
How can they watch when they have no eyes?
Suddenly Hodor appears.
It appears he was bathing nearby, since he is bare naked holding a towel around his neck.
Well, there's a big man.
Speaker: Osha

Text: He has giants blood in him or I'm the Queen.
Go back and find your clothes, Hodor.
Speaker: Brann Stark

Text: Go dress.
Hodor.
Speaker: Hodor

Text: Hodor obeys and runs off.
Are there really giants beyond the Wall?
Speaker: Brann Stark

Text: Giants and worse than giants.
Speaker: Osha

Text: I tried telling your brother, he's marching the wrong way.All these swords, they should be going North, boy.
North, not south!
The cold winds are rising.
Looking back up to the Weirwood tree, Brann hears the wind again.
At castle Black, the Night's Watch decided to burn the corpse of Othor, whom attacked Jeor Mormant.
Sam decided to share some knowledge.
They were touched by White Walkers.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: That's why they came back.
That's why their eyes turned blue.
Only fire will stop them.
How do you know that?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: I read about it in a book. A very old book in Maester Aemon's library.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: What else did the book say?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: The White Walkers sleep beneath the ice for thousands of years.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: And when they wake up...
And when they wake up, what?
Speaker: Pypar

Text: Sam looks to the top of the Wall.
I hope The Wall is high enough.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: Seemingly worried, the rest of the lot also look towards the top of the Wall.
Catelyn Stark and Ser Rodrik both arrive at Robb Starks camp.
Summer snows, My Lady.
Speaker: Rodrik Cassel

Text: Robb's brought the North with him.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Entering Robbs tent, we see Robb and his banner men discussing tactics.
The River Lords are falling back with Jaime Lannister at their heels.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: And Lord Tywin is bringing around a second Lannister army from the South.
Our scouts confirm it's even larger than the Kingslayer's.
One army or two, the Kings in the North threw back hosts ten times this large.
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: Mother!
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: You look well.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Lady Catelyn, you're a welcome sight in these troubled times.
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: We had not thought to meet you here, My Lady.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: I had not thought to be here.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: I would speak with my son alone. I know you will forgive me, My Lords.
You heard her! Move your asses! Come on, out.
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: You too, Greyjoy.
Are you bloody deaf? Have no fear, My Lady.
We'll shove our swords up Tywin Lannister's bunghole and then it's on to the Red Keep to free Ned.
You old devil, Rodrik.
Jon.
Speaker: Rodrik Cassel

Text: You're not wasting away, are you?
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: As soon as the men left, Catelyn hugs Robb.
I remember the day you came into this world red-faced and squalling.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: And now I find you leading a host to war.
There was no one else.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: No one? Who were those men I saw here?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: None of them are Starks.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: All of them are seasoned in battle.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: If you think you can send me back to Winterfell...
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Oh, would that I could.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: There was a letter. From Sansa.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: From the Queen, you mean.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: There's no mention of Arya.
No.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: How many men do you have?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: 18,000. If I go to King's Landing and bend my knee to Joffrey...
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: you would never be allowed to leave. No.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Our best hope, our only hope, is that you can defeat them in the field.
And if I lose?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Do you know what happened to the Targaryen children, when the Mad King fell?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: They were butchered in their sleep.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: On the orders of Tywin Lannister. And the years have not made him kinder.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: If you lose, your father dies, your sisters die, we die.
Well, that makes it simple then.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: I suppose it does.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Arriving at the foot of the Lannister camp, Tyrion, Bronn, Shagga and the hill tribe, decide to stop for a short while.
A conversation follows.
From here it might be best if Bronn and I continue alone.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Best for Tyrion son of Tywin. Not best for me.
Speaker: Shagga

Text: If the half man betrays us, Shagga son of Dolf will cut off his manhood...
And feed it to the goats, yes.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: All right then. Time to meet my father.
Moving into the Lannister camp, Shagga and the hill tribe follow.
Upon entering the Tywin Lannister's tent, we see Kevan Lannister and Tywin sitting at a table, scheming.
Kevan Lannister  Tyrion.
Uncle. Father.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: The rumors of your demise were unfounded.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Sorry to disappoint you.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: And who are these Companions of yours?
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: This is Shagga Son of Dolf, Chieftain of the Stone Crows.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Timett Son of Timett, ruler of the Burned Men.
This fair maid is Chella daughter of Cheyk, leader of the Black Ears.
And here we have Bronn son of...
You wouldn't know him.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: May I present My Lord Father, Tywin son of Tytos of House Lannister.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Lord of Casterly Rock and Warden of the West. Kind of you to go to war for me.
You left us no choice. The honor of the House was at stake.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Your brother would never have submitted to capture so meekly.
We have our differences, Jaime and I.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: He's braver. I'm better looking.
He's been covering himself in glory.
Speaker: Jamie Lannister

Text: Jaime smashed the River Lords at the Golden Tooth, and now lays siege to Riverrun, Catelyn Stark's homeland.
Speaker: Kevan Lannister

Text: And the Starks? Lord Eddard?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Is our hostage.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: He will lead no armies from his dungeon cell.
How did my sweet sister persuade the King to imprison his dear friend Ned?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Robert Baratheon is dead.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Joffrey rules in King's Landing.
My sister rules, you mean.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Stark's son has called his banners.
Speaker: Kevan Lannister

Text: He moves south with a strong host.
A green boy.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: One taste of battle and he'll run back to Winterfell wi his tail between his legs.
Maybe. Though the boy does have a certain belligerence.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You'd like him.
While we're on the subject of war, I made promises to my friends here and a Lannister always pays his debts.
We shall require 3,000 helms and shields, plus swords, pikes, gorgets, maces...
Suddenly a messenger appears, interrupting Tyrion's request.
If it please My Lord, Ser Addam bids me report that the Northmen have crossed the neck.
Speaker: Messenger

Text: The wolf rushes into the lion's jaws.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: So be it. Kevan, command the drummers beat assembly.
And send word to Jaime that I am moving against Robb Stark.
At once, My Lord.
Speaker: Kevan Lannister

Text: It is said that the men of the Mountain clans are great warriors.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Ride with me against my enemies and you shall have all my son promised you and more.
Only if the half man fights with us.
Speaker: Shagga

Text: Until we hold the steel he pledged us, the little lion's life is ours.
Tywin looks over to Tyrion. Tyrion looks shooked.
Back at Robbs camp, inside his tent we see Robb and his men plotting.
The scouts report Lord Tywin moves north.
Speaker: Rodrik Cassal

Text: We need to get him on broken ground, put his Knights at a disadvantage.
No, we need to get around him and break Jaime Lannister's siege of Riverrun.
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: Do that and the River Lords will join us.
To do either we need to cross the river and the only crossing is at The Twins.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Lord Frey controls that bridge.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Your father's bannerman.
"The late Lord Frey" my father calls him.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: At the Trident, he didn't appear until the battle was done.
Some men takes their oaths more seriously than others.
Meanwhile, outside a few Stark men captured a scout, leading him to Robbs tent.
Robb's right.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: We need that bridge.
So what's it gonna be? Do we move against Jaime or Lord Tywin?
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: Your pardon, my lords.
Speaker: Stark guard

Text: We've captured a Lannister scout.
Theon covers the map with pawns
Don't worry, lad.
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: He won't be leaving this tent with his head.
Where did you find him?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: In the brush above the encampment.
Speaker: Stark guard

Text: He looked to be counting.
Robb walks towards the Lannister scout.
How high did you get?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: 20,000. Maybe more.
Speaker: Lannister scout

Text: Rodrik Cassel  You don't have to do this yourself.
Your father would understand.
My father understands mercy, when there is room for it.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: And he understands honor and courage.
Let him go.
Robb.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Robb looks over his shoulder with a stare. Catelyn understands and looks down in regret.
Tell Lord Tywin, Winter is coming for him.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: To find out if he really does shit gold.
Yes, My Lord. Thank you, My Lord.
Speaker: Lannister scout

Text: Are you touched, boy?! Letting him go?
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: You call me boy again.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Greatjon Umber wants to taunt Robb.
Go on.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Oi.
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: Frustrated, Greatjon Umber walks out of the tent.
In Kings Landing, we see Ned Stark asleep in the dungeons, a guard on patrol kicks his feet waking him up. Then walks on.
Meanwhile, in the Throne room, new roles are being announced by Grand Maester Pycelle.
It is also the wish of His Grace, that his loyal servant Janos Slynt, Commander of the City Watch...
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: While Grand Maester Pycelle is speaking, Sansa walks by a few familiar faces.
Ser Aron.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Be at once raised to the rank of Lord.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: Lord Gyles.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: And granted the ancient seat of Harrenhal, and that his sons and grandsons shall hold this honor after him, until the end of time.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: In the place of the traitor Eddard Stark, it is the wish of his Grace that Tywin Lannister, Lord of Casterly Rock and Warden of the West, be appointed Hand of the King.
Lastly, in these times of treason and turmoil, it is the view of the Council that the life and safety of King Joffrey be of paramount importance.
Ser Barristan Selmy.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: Barristan Selmy approaches.
Your Grace, I am yours to command.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: Rise, Ser Barristan.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: You may remove your helm.
You have served the Realm long and faithfully.
Every man and woman in the Seven Kingdoms owes you thanks.
But it is time to put aside your armor and your sword.
It is time to rest and look back with pride on your many years of service.
Your Grace, the Kingsguard is a sworn brotherhood.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: Our vows are taken for life. Only death relieves us of our sacred trust.
Whose death, Ser Barristan? Yours or your King's?
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: You let my father die.
Speaker: King Joffrey

Text: You're too old to protect anybody.
Your Grace...
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: The Council has determined that Ser Jaime Lannister will take your place as Lord Commander of the Kingsguard.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: The man who profaned his blade with the blood of the King he had sworn to defend!
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: Careful, Ser.
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: We have nothing but gratitude for your long service, good Ser.
Speaker: Lord Varys

Text: You shall be given a stout Keep beside the sea, with servants to look after your every need.
A hall to die in and men to bury me.
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: I am a Knight. I shall die a Knight.
A naked Knight, apparently.
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: Even now I could cut through the five of you like carving a cake!
Speaker: Barristan Selmy

Text: Here, boy! Melt it down and add it to the others.
If any man in this hall has other matters to set before His Grace, let him speak now or go forth and hold his silence.
Speaker: King's Landing Page

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Come forward, My Lady.
Speaker: King Joffrey

Text: Sansa walk forth.
The Lady Sansa of House Stark.
Speaker: King's Landing Page

Text: Do you have some business for the King and the Council, Sansa?
Speaker: Cersei Lannister

Text: I do.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Sansa kneels down.
As it please Your Grace, I ask mercy for my father, Lord Eddard Stark, who was Hand of the King.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Treason is a noxious weed.
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: It should be torn out, root...
Let her speak.
Speaker: King Joffrey

Text: I want to hear what she says.
Thank you, Your Grace.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Do you deny your father's crime?
Speaker: Petyr Baelish

Text: No, My Lords. I know he must be punished.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: All I ask is mercy. I know My Lord father must regret what he did.
He was King Robert's friend and he loved him.
You all know he loved him.
He never wanted to be Hand until the King asked him.
They must have lied to him. Lord Renly or Lord Stannis or somebody.
They must have lied!
He said I wasn't the King. Why did he say that?
Speaker: King Joffrey

Text: He was badly hurt.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Maester Pycelle was giving him milk of the poppy.
He wasn't himself. Otherwise h never would have said it.
A child's faith Such sweet innocence.
Speaker: Lord Varys

Text: And yet they say wisdom oft comes from the mouths of babes.
Treason is treason!
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: Anything else?
Speaker: King Joffrey

Text: If you still have any affection in your heart for me, please do me this kindness, Your Grace.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: Your sweet words have moved me.
Speaker: King Joffrey

Text: But your father has to confess.
He has to confess and say that I'm the King or there'll be no mercy for him.
He will.
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: At the King’s Landing catacombs, Varys goes out to see Ned Stark.
You've seen better days, my lord.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Another visit? lt seems you're my last friend.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: No, no, many still love you. Sansa came to court this morning to plead for your life.
Speaker: Varys

Text: On her knees begging for me. Hm! Did you laugh with the others?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: You do me wrong, my lord. Your blood is the last thing l want.
Speaker: Varys

Text: l don't know what you want. l've given up trying to guess.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Huh. Can you free me from this pit?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: l could. But will l? No. As l said, I'm no hero.
Speaker: Varys

Text: What do you want? Tell me. No riddles, no stories. Tell me, what do you want?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Peace. Did you know that your son is marching south with an army of Northmen? Loyal lad. Fighting for his father's freedom.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Robb? He's just a boy.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Boys have been conquerors before. But the man giving Cersei sleepless nights is the king's the late king's brother. Lord Stannis has the best claim to the throne. He is a proven battle commander and he is utterly without mercy.
Speaker: Varys

Text: Stannis Baratheon is Robert's true heir. The throne is his by rights.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Sansa pleaded so sweetly for your life. lt would be a shame to throw it away. Cersei is no fool. She knows a tame wolf is more use to her than a dead one.
Speaker: Varys

Text: You want me to serve the woman who murdered my king, who butchered my men, who crippled my son?
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: l want you to serve the realm! Tell the queen you will confess your vile treason, tell your son to lay down his sword and proclaim Joffrey as the true heir. Cersei knows you as a man of honor. lf you give her the peace she needs, and promise to carry her secret to your grave, l believe she will allow you to take the black and live out your days on the Wall with your brother and your bastard son.
Speaker: Varys

Text: You think my life is some precious thing to me? That l would trade my honor for a few more years of... of what? You grew up with actors. You learned their craft and you learnt it well. But l grew up with soldiers. l learned how to die a long time ago.
Speaker: Eddard Stark

Text: Pity. Such a pity. What of your daughter's life, my lord? ls that a precious thing to you?
Speaker: Varys

Text: Theon shoots a raven coming from The Twins. Robb picks it up and reads the message.
lt's a birthday message to his grand-niece Walda.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Or so Walder Frey would have you think.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Keep shooting them down. We can't risk Lord Walder sending word of your movements to the Lannisters.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: He's Grandfather's bannerman. We can't expect his support?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Expect nothing of Walder Frey and you'll never be surprised. Look.
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: Father rots in a dungeon. How long before they take his head? We need to cross the Trident and we need to do it now.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Just march up to his gates and tell him you're crossing. We've got five times his numbers. You can take the Twins if you have to.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Not in time. Tywin Lannister marches north as we speak.
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: The Freys have held the crossing for 600 years, and for 600 years they have never failed to exact their toll.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Have my horse saddled and ready.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Enter the Twins alone and he'll sell you to the Lannisters as he likes.
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: Or throw you in a dungeon. Or slit your throat.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: My father would do whatever it took to secure our crossing. Whatever it took. lf l'm going to lead this army, l can't have other men doing my bargaining for me.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: l agree. l'll go.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: You can't!
Speaker: Everyone

Text: l have known Lord Walder since l was a girl. He would never harm me.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Unless there was a profit in it.
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: Catelyn finds herself inside the Twins, which the Freys gathered to watch her audience with Lord Walder.
What do you want?
Speaker: Walder Frey

Text: lt is a great pleasure to see you again after so many years, my lord.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Oh, spare me. Your boy's too proud to come before me himself. What am l supposed to do with you?
Speaker: Walder Frey

Text: Father, you forget yourself. Lady Stark is –
Speaker: Stevron Frey

Text: Who asked you? You're not Lord Frey yet, not until l die. Do l look dead to you?
Speaker: Walder Frey

Text: Father, please –
Speaker: Ryger Rivers

Text: l need lessons in courtesy from you, bastard? Your mother would still be a milkmaid if l hadn't squirted you into her belly.
Speaker: Walder Frey

Text: (gestures to Catelyn) All right, you come forward.
(kisses her hand) There. Now that l've observed the courtesies, perhaps my sons will do me the honor of shutting their mouths.
ls there somewhere we can talk?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: We're talking right now. Fine. Out! All of you!
Speaker: Walder Frey

Text: (taps his new wife on the bottom) Oh! You too.
(To Catelyn) You see that? Fifteen, she is. A little flower. And her honey's all mine.
l'm sure she will give you many sons.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Huh. Your father didn't come to the wedding.
Speaker: Walder Frey

Text: He is quite ill, my lord.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Huh. Didn't come to the last one, either. Or the one before that. Your family has always pissed on me.
Speaker: Walder Frey

Text: My lord, l –
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Don't deny it. You know it's true. The fine Lord Tully would never marry any of his children to mine.
Speaker: Walder Frey

Text: l'm sure there were reasons –
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: l didn't need reasons. l needed to get rid of sons and daughters. You see how they pile up? Why are you here?
Speaker: Walder Frey

Text: To ask you to open your gates, my lord, so my son and his bannermen may cross the Trident and be on their way.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Why should l let him?
Speaker: Walder Frey

Text: lf you could climb your own battlements, you would see that he has 20,000 men outside your walls.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: There will be 20,000 corpses when Tywin Lannister gets here. Don't try and frighten me, Lady Stark. Your husband's in a cell beneath the Red Keep and your son's got no fur to keep his balls warm.
Speaker: Walder Frey

Text: You swore an oath to my father.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Oh, yes, l said some words. And l swore oaths to the crown too, if l remember right. Joffrey's king now, which makes your boy and his corpses-to-be nothing but rebels, it seems to me. lf l had the sense the gods gave a fish, l'd hand you both over to the Lannisters.
Speaker: Walder Frey

Text: Why don't you?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Stark, Tully, Lannister, Baratheon. Give me one good reason why l should waste a single thought on any of you?
Speaker: Walder Frey

Text: At Castle Black, Jon Snow and Commander Mormont are having a chat.
And engage!
Speaker: Voices outside

Text: When does Aemon think you'll be able to use that hand?
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: Soon, he says.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Good. You'll be ready for this, then. l thought a wolf was more appropriate for you than a bear so l had a new pommel made. lt's called Longclaw. Works as well for a wolf as a bear, l think.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: This is Valyrian steel.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: lt was my father's sword, his father before him. The Mormonts have carried it for five centuries. lt was meant for my son Jorah. He brought dishonor to our House, but he had the grace to leave the sword before he fled from Westeros.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: My lord, you honor me, but l can't –
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Oh, you can. And you will. l wouldn't be standing here if it wasn't for you and your beast. A bloody dead man tried to kill me, so you'll take it. l'll hear no more about it. ls that understood?
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: Yes, my lord.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Right. Now, don't think this means l approve of this nonsense with you and Alliser Thorne. That's a man's sword. lt'll take a man to wield it.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: l'll apologize to Ser Alliser tonight.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: No, you won't. l sent him to King's Landing yesterday. The hand that your wolf tore off that thing's wrist – l've ordered Thorne to lay it at the feet of this boy king. That should get young Joffrey's attention. And it, uh, puts a thousand leagues between you and Thorne. Now go and put your sword somewhere safe and bring me my supper.
Speaker: Jeor Mormont

Text: Yes, my lord.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Jon Snow leaves the room and emerges outside, heading towards the mess hall.
Well done. Well done.
Speaker: Unidentified Night’s Watchers

Text: You earned that, Snow.
Speaker: Night’s Watcher #1

Text: Well done.
Speaker: Night’s Watcher #2

Text: Jon arrives at the mess hall. The other men gather around him to see his new sword, but Sam remains seated at a distance, looking distraught.
Go on, let's have a look.
Speaker: Pyp

Text: At what?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: The sword! Show us the sword.
Speaker: Grenn

Text: Sword! Sword! Sword! Sword! Sword! Sword! Sword! Sword! Sword!
Speaker: All

Text: Let's have a look.
Speaker: Pyp

Text: Piss off.
Speaker: Grenn

Text: Come on, l want to have a look at it in the light. Give it here!
Speaker: Pyp

Text: Look at its eyes.
Speaker: Grenn

Text: While the others are playing with the sword, Jon gets seated beside Sam.
What is it?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: You can't what?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: l'm really not supposed to say.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: And yet you really want to say. You want to say that…
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: There was a raven. l read the message to Maester Aemon. lt's your brother Robb.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: What? What about him?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: He's heading south. To war. All his bannermen have rallied to his side, they'll keep him safe.
Speaker: Samwell Tarly

Text: l should be there. l should be with him.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Back at the Crossing, Catelyn returns from her conversation with Walder Frey at the Twins, and finds Robb and the others having a meeting in his tent.
lf we do that, they'll never get back across.
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: Well? What did he say?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Lord Walder has granted your crossing. His men are yours, as well.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Huh.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Less the 400 he will keep here to hold the crossing against any who would pursue you.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: What does he want in return?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: You will be taking on his son Olyvar as your personal squire. He expects a knighthood in good time.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Fine, fine. And?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: And Arya will marry his son Waldron when they both come of age.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: She won't be happy about that. And?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: And when the fighting is done you will marry one of his daughters. Whichever you prefer. He has a number he thinks will be suitable.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: l see. Did you get a look at his daughters?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: l did.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: And?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: One was – Do you consent?
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Can l refuse?
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Not if you want to cross.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: Then l consent.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Robb leaves the meeting right away. Theon laughs while Catelyn watches.
We cut to a shot of Robb’s men on the other side of the river, having already crossed the Green Fork of the Trident and heading south.
Back at Castle Black. Jon goes to see Maester Aemon, finding him cutting meat to serve to the ravens.
Sam said you wanted to see me?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: l did indeed. Perhaps you would be kind enough to assist me. Tell me, did you ever wonder why the men of the Night's Watch take no wives and father no children?
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: No.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: So they will not love. Love is the death of duty. lf the day should ever come when your lord father was forced to choose between honor on the one hand and those he loves on the other, what would he do?
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: He would do whatever was right, no matter what.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Then Lord Stark is one man in 10,000. Most of us are not so strong. What is honor compared to a woman's love? And what is duty against the feel of a newborn son in your arms? Or a brother's smile?
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: Sam told you.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: We're all human. Oh, we all do our duty when there's no cost to it. Honor comes easy then. Yet sooner or later in every man's life there comes a day when it is not easy. A day when he must choose.
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: And this is my day? ls that what you're saying?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: Oh, it hurts, boy. Oh, yes. l know.
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: You do not know. No one knows. l may be a bastard, but he is my father and Robb is my brother.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: The gods were cruel when they saw fit to test my vows. They waited till l was old. What could l do when the ravens brought the news from the South: the ruin of my House, the death of my family? l was helpless, blind, frail. But when l heard they had killed my brother's son and his poor son and the children! Even the little children.
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: Who are you?
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: My father was Maekar, the first of his name. My brother Aegon reigned after him when l had refused the throne. And he was followed by his son Aerys whom they called the Mad King.
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: You're Aemon Targaryen.
Speaker: Jon Snow

Text: l'm a maester of the Citadel, bound in service to Castle Black and the Night's Watch. l will not tell you to stay or go. You must make that choice yourself and live with it for the rest of your days. As l have.
Speaker: Maester Aemon

Text: Across the Narrow Sea, the Dothraki are on the move. Drogo leads them, but seems to have fainted. Daenerys rides right behind him.
(in Dothraki) My lord… My sun and stars… Drogo.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Drogo falls off his horse.
(in Dothraki) My horse…
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: (in Dothraki) Blood of my blood…
Speaker: Cohollo

Text: (in Dothraki) No, l must ride.
Speaker: Khal Drogo

Text: (in Dothraki) He fell from his horse. A Khal who cannot ride is no Khal.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: (in Dothraki) He's tired, that's all. He needs to rest. We've ridden far enough today. We'll camp here.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: (in Dothraki) This is no place to camp. A woman does not give us orders. Not even a Khaleesi.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: (in Dothraki) We'll camp here. Tell them Khal Drogo commanded it.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: (in Dothraki) You do not command me, Khaleesi.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: (in Dothraki) Find Mirri Maz Duur. Bring her to me.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: (in Dothraki) The witch? l'll bring you her head, Khaleesi.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: (in Dothraki) Bring her to me unharmed or Khal Drogo will hear why you denied me.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: (in Dothraki) Hyah! Hyah!
Speaker: Qotho

Text: At the Lannister camp, Tywin is presiding over lunch/war meeting. Tyrion gets there while everyone’s already seated and eating.
Our scouts tell us the Stark host has moved south from the Twins with Lord Frey's levies in tow. They're a day's march north.
Speaker: Kevan Lannister

Text: The boy may lack experience and sense, but he does have a certain mindless provincial courage.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Oh, do continue. Didn't mean to interrupt.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: l do hope your savages are going to be of some use, otherwise we've wasted good steel on them.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: The great hairy one insisted he must have two battleaxes. Heavy black steel, double-sided.
Speaker: Kevan Lannister

Text: Shagga likes axes.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: When the battle commences, you and your wildlings will be in the vanguard.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: The vanguard? Me and the tribesmen on the front lines?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: They do seem rather ferocious.
Speaker: Kevan Lannister

Text: Ferocious? Last night a Moon Brother stabbed a Stone Crow over a sausage. Three Stone Crows seized the Moon Brother and opened his throat. Bronn managed to keep Shagga from chopping off the dead man's cock, which was fortunate, but even still, Ulf is demanding blood money, which Shagga and Gunthor refuse to pay.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: When soldiers lack discipline, the fault lies with their commander.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Surely there are ways to have me killed that would be less detrimental to the war effort.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: There'll be no more discussion on the matter.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: lt appears l'm not hungry after all. Excuse me, my lords.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Back at his tent, Tyrion finds Bronn there with a woman (a prostitute) waiting there too.
Where did you find one so pretty at this hour?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: l took her.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Took her? From whom?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: From, uh, Ser What's-his-name? l don't know. Ginger cunt, three tents down.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: And he didn't have anything to say about it?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: He said something.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Well, the odds of me living long enough for him to retaliate have just dropped drastically. We'll be at the vanguard tomorrow.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Oh, well. l, uh, think l'll go and find myself one.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Bronn leaves. Tyrion addresses the prostitute.
Who are you?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Who would you like me to be?
Speaker: Prostitute

Text: What did your mother call you?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Shae. What did your mother call you?
Speaker: Prostitute

Text: My mother died giving birth to me.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: ls that why l'm here? So we can talk about our mothers?
Speaker: Shae

Text: What sort of accent is that?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Foreign.
Speaker: Shae

Text: For-
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: What do you want from me?
Speaker: Shae

Text: What do l want from you? l want you to share my tent. l want you to pour my wine, laugh at my jokes, rub my legs when they're sore after a day's ride. l want you to take no other man to bed for as long as we're together. And l want you to fuck me like it's my last night in this world. Which it may well be.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: And what do l get?
Speaker: Shae

Text: Who told you this? Women you paid?
Speaker: Shae

Text: Shae gets undressed and kisses Tyrion.
Let's start with your last night in this world.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Back across the Narrow Sea. Drogo is mumbling incoherently in Dothraki (no subtitles provided) inside a tent, Daenerys by his side.
Khaleesi.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Come. He's very strong. No one understands how strong he is.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Jorah removes an herbal treatment from Drogo’s wound, revealing it has become infected.
He will die tonight, Khaleesi.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: He can't. He can't. l won't let him.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Even a queen doesn't have that power. We must go quickly. l've heard there's a good port in Asshai.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: l won't leave him.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: He's already gone, Khaleesi.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Even if he dies, why would l run? l am khaleesi, and my my son will be khal after Drogo.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: This isn't Westeros, where men honor blood. Here they only honor strength. There will be fighting after Drogo dies. Whoever wins that fight will be the new khal. He won't want any rivals. Your boy will be plucked from your breast and given to the dogs.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: l won't leave him.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Mirri Maz Duur enters the tent, and bows to Daenerys. Qotho comes to check on Drogo too, with a few other bloodriders at the entrance.
The wound has festered.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: (in Dothraki) You did this, witch. (pulls a dagger out of its sheath)
Speaker: Qotho

Text: (in Dothraki) Stop it! l don't want her hurt.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: (in Dothraki) No? No? You don't want her hurt? Pray we don't hurt you, too. You let this witch put her hands on our Khal.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: (in Dothraki) Rein in your tongue. She is still your Khaleesi.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: (in Dothraki) Only while the blood of my blood lives. When he dies, she is nothing.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: (in Dothraki) l have never been nothing. l am the blood of the dragon.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: (in Dothraki) The dragons are all dead, Khaleesi.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: Qotho and the other Dothraki leave.
l think you should wear your armor tonight, ser.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: l think you're right.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Jorah leaves the tent.
You've saved me once more.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: And now you must save him.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: He's beyond the healer's skills. All l can do is ease his path.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: Save him and l will free you. l swear it. You must know a way. Some – some magic.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: There is a spell. Some would say death is cleaner.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: Do it. Save him.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: There is a price.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: You'll have gold, whatever you want.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: lt's not a matter of gold. This is blood magic. Only death pays for life.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: My death?
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: No, not your death, Khaleesi. Bring me his horse.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: Daenerys signals to Irri, who leaves to find the horse. We cut to the horse being taken by a rope into to the tent.
Khaleesi, do not do this thing. Let me kill this witch.
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: Kill her and you kill your khal.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: This is blood magic. lt is forbidden.
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: l am your khaleesi. l tell you what is forbidden.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Mirri Maz Duur starts an incantation
Go. Now.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: Take her and leave. Take her!
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: You must go also, lady. Once l begin to sing, no one must enter the tent. The dead will dance here tonight.
Speaker: Mirri Maz Duur

Text: Daenerys caresses Drogo’s forehand as she moves to leave.
No one will enter.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Mirri Maz Duur slits the horse’s throat. Blood spills all over Drogo’s chest and Daenerys’ face.
Bring him back to me.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Daenerys leaves the tent as the horse collapses to the ground, dead. Jorah comes to her.
What have you done?
l have to save him.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: We could have been 10 miles away from here by now, on the way to Asshai. You would have been safe.
(in Dothraki) This must not be.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: (in Dothraki) This must be.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: (in Dothraki) Witch.
Speaker: Qotho

Text: (in Dothraki) Nothing good will come of this.
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: Rakharo tries to talk to Qotho, but gets sucker punched in the face.
(in Dothraki) No, you can't.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Qotho unsheaths his dagger and moves past Daenerys, pushing her towards the ground. Daenerys hits the ground with her belly.
Khaleesi!
Speaker: Irri

Text: (in Dothraki) No further, horselord.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Daenerys starts moaning in pain, while we hear Mirri Maz Duur’s incantations in the background. Qotho turns around and lunges towards Jorah. The two fight, but Jorah gains the upper hand and kills him with a sword blow to the face.
Are you hurt?
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: The baby –
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Hmm?
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: … is coming.
Speaker: Daenerys Targaryen

Text: Fetch the midwives.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: They will not come. They say she is cursed.
Speaker: Rakharo

Text: They'll come or l'll have their heads.
Speaker: Jorah Mormont

Text: Jorah moves inside the tent with Daenerys in his arms, as screams and incantations from the inside start getting louder and louder in tone.
At the Lannister camp, Tyrion, Bronn and Shae are drinking together inside Tyrion’s tent at night, before the battle.
Are you in agony, my lion?
Speaker: Shae

Text: No.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You look like you're in agony. The fire is burning your pretty soft skin.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Ah! Damn you, woman. Are you immune to pain?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Just used to it.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Drink.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Let's play a new game.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: There's a Braavosi knife game l could teach you.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Does it involve the potential for losing fingers?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Not if you win.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: No! No fire games, no knife games. Let's do something l'm good at.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: What are you good at?
Speaker: Shae

Text: l happen to be a great judge of character.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: This sounds like a boring game.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: l don't want to play this game.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Fine. Bronn first. Your father beat you.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Bronn drinks.
But my mother hit harder.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: You killed your first man before you were 12.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: lt was a woman. (Tyrion drinks. Shae looks at Bronn, surprised.) She swung an axe at me.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: You've been north of the Wall.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: What brought you up there?
Speaker: Shae

Text: Work.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: And you once loved a woman many years ago, but it turned out badly so you've never let yourself love again. Oh, wait, that's me. (Tyrion drinks) Your turn, my mysterious foreign beauty.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: l don't want to play.
Speaker: Shae

Text: lt's fun! Look at the fun we're having. Your mother was a whore.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Drink.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Tyrion drinks.
All right. Your father left the family when you were very young, never to return.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Drink.
Speaker: Shae

Text: And we've established the rules about lying?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Drink!
Speaker: Shae

Text: Tyrion drinks.
You wanted a different life. You came from somewhere and you wanted to be elsewhere.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: The whole shit-stained world could drink off that one.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: So, specifics… You wanted to be elsewhere, but how would you get there? l don't believe the life of the Silent Sisters is for you. So, what's a lowborn girl to do?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Drink.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Are you sure –
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Drink! And don't talk about my mother and father ever, or l will carve your eyes from your head.
Speaker: Shae

Text: My dear lady, if l have offended you, l apologize.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: My turn.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Fine, fine. Ask away. Try to penetrate the enigma that is me.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Who were you in love with?
Speaker: Shae

Text: That's not how the game works.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: l don't care the way the game works.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Our lord here used to be married.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Married?
Speaker: Shae

Text: How did you hear that?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You hear lots of things playing dice with Lannister soldiers.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Another night, perhaps.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Not another night. This night.
Speaker: Shae

Text: lt's not a pleasant story.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Oh, maybe l will cry.
Speaker: Shae

Text: l'm guessing the lady and l can tell more unpleasant stories than your lordship.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: So l was 16. My brother Jaime and l were riding, when we heard a scream. She ran out onto the road, clothes half torn off, with two men on her heels. Jaime scared away the men easily enough, while l wrapped her in my cloak. She was too scared to send off on her own, so while Jaime hunted down the rapers l took her to the nearest inn and fed her. Her name was Tysha. She was a wheelwright's orphan. And she was hungry. Together we finished off three chickens and a flagon of wine. lmpossible as it seems, there was a time when l was unaccustomed to wine. l forgot how afraid l was around girls. how l was always waiting for them to laugh at me or look away embarrassed, or ask me about my tall, handsome brother. l forgot about everything but Tysha. And somehow l found myself in her bed.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: For three chickens, l should hope so.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Well, l imagine that was the end of all that.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: l would have killed the man who did that to me.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: You should have known she was a whore.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Really? l was 16, drunk and in love.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: A girl who was almost raped doesn't invite another man into her bed two hours later.
Speaker: Shae

Text: As l said, l was young and stupid.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You are still young and stupid.
Speaker: Shae

Text: Shae starts kissing Tyrion, causing Bronn to leave the tent. The next day, the Lannisters ride to battle; Bronn returns to Tyrion’s tent to wake him and Shae up.
What is it? What do you want?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You're sleeping through the war.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: What?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: They stole a night's march on us. They're a mile north.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Get my squire!
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You don't have a squire.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: lf l die, weep for me.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You'll be dead. How will you know?
Speaker: Shae

Text: l'll know.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Tyrion leaves the tent, fully armoured.
Watch out! Move!
Speaker: Lannister soldier

Text: Out of the way! Move aside!
Speaker: Lannister soldier

Text: Stay low.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Stay low?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: lf you're lucky, no one will notice you.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: l was born lucky. Tribesmen of the Vale, gather round! Stone Crows! Black Ears! Burned Men! Moon Brothers! And Painted Dogs! Your dominion over the Vale begins now! Onward, to claim what is yours!
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Half man! Half man! Half man! Half man! Half man! Half man!
Speaker: Tribesmen of the Vale (chanting)

Text: To battle!
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Tyrion rides to battle with the rest, but turns around quickly after and is hit with a mace from one of the Tribesmen. He passes out. Later, we cut to the end of the battle – dead bodies and swords piling on the ground. Tyrion wakes up to find Bronn talking to him as he’s carried on a wheelbarrow.
You're a shit warrior.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: l'm alive?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: You're alive.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: Did we win?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: We wouldn't be having this conversation if we didn't.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: How did our tribesmen do?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Yeah, good.
Speaker: Bronn

Text: lt's nice to see them getting along.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Tywin shows up next to them, fully armoured and on horseback.
You're wounded.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Good of you to notice. l hear we won.
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: Huh! The scouts were wrong. There were 2,000 Stark bannermen, not 20 [thousand].
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Did we get the Stark boy, at least?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: He wasn't here.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: Where was he?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: With his other 18,000 men.
Speaker: Tywin Lannister

Text: And where are they?
Speaker: Tyrion Lannister

Text: We cut to Catelyn and Rodrik Cassel overlooking the Trident from a safe distance at higher ground.
We should go, my lady.
Speaker: Rodrik Cassel

Text: No!
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: My lady!
Speaker: Rodrik Cassel

Text: Hyah! Hyah!
Speaker: Stark bannermen

Text: The Stark host arrives at the clearing. Robb is amongst them, and he comes carrying a tied and bound Jaime Lannister.
By the time they knew what was happening, it had already happened.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Lady Stark. l'd offer you my sword, but l seem to have lost it.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: lt is not your sword l want. Give me my daughters back. Give me my husband.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: l've lost them too, l'm afraid.
Speaker: Jaime Lannister

Text: Kill him, Robb. Send his head to his father. He cut down ten of our men. You saw him.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: He's more use to us alive than dead.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Take him away and put him in irons.
Speaker: Catelyn Stark

Text: lf we do it your way, Kingslayer, you'd win. We're not doing it your way.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: Come on, pretty man.
Speaker: Greatjon Umber

Text: l sent 2,000 men to their graves today.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: The bards will sing songs of their sacrifice.
Speaker: Theon Greyjoy

Text: Aye. But the dead won't hear them. (making a speech to his bannermen) One victory does not make us conquerors. Did we free my father? Did we rescue my sisters from the queen? Did we free the North from those who want us on our knees? This war is far from over.
Speaker: Robb Stark

Text: At King’s Landing, Arya is chasing down pigeons on the street while staying hidden from the Kingsguard. She catches one and snaps its neck. Soon afterwards, she sees a baker’s stall with pastries on display.
Could l have one? A lemon one or any of them.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Three coppers.
Speaker: King’s Landing Baker

Text: How about a nice fat pigeon?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Oh, piss off now. Go on.
Speaker: King’s Landing Baker

Text: Do you have any stale ones from yesterday? Or any burnt ones?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Piss off!
Speaker: King’s Landing Baker

Text: Everyone starts walking up the street, leaving Arya confused. Two street urchins run past her up the stairs.
Hey, where's everyone going? What's happening?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: They're taking him to the Sept of Baelor.
Speaker: Street Urchin

Text: Who?
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: The Hand of the King.
Speaker: Street Urchin

Text: Arya follows the crowd to the Sept of Baelor. She climbs up the pedestal of Baelor’s statue to get a better view of her surroundings. We cut to Ned Stark being taken from the sept and into the courtyard, in full view of the gathered populace; Baelor’s statue is seen on the background to his left. Ned catches Arya’s eye at the foot of the statue.
Traitor! Coward!
Speaker: Populace

Text: Ned is taken across the populace and runs into Yoren of the Night’s Watch.
Baelor!
Speaker: Eddark Stark

Text: Yoren looks towards the statue knowingly.
Traitor! Traitor!
Speaker: Populace

Text: Ned is taken to a raised platform where Sansa, Cersei, Joffrey, Littlefinger are standing. Sansa smiles warmly at her father as he addresses the crowd.

I am Eddard Stark, Lord of Winterfell and Hand of the King. I come before you to confess my treason in the sight of Gods and men. I betrayed the faith of my King and the trust of my friend Robert. I swore to protect and defend his children, but before his blood was cold I plotted to murder his son and seize the Throne for myself. Let the High Septon and Baelor the Blessed bear witness to what I say: Joffrey Baratheon is the one true heir to the Iron Throne, by the grace of all the Gods, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm.
Speaker: Eddark Stark

Text: As we sin, so do we suffer. This man has confessed his crimes in sight of Gods and men. The Gods are just but beloved Baelor taught us they can also be merciful. What is to be done with this traitor, Your Grace?
Speaker: Grand Maester Pycelle

Text: My mother wishes me to let Lord Eddard join The Night's Watch. Stripped of all titles and powers, he would serve the realm in permanent exile. And My Lady Sansa has begged mercy for her father. But they have the soft hearts of women. So long as I am your King, treason shall never go unpunished. Ser Ilyn, bring me his head!
Speaker: Joffrey Baratheon

Text: The townsfolk roar with approval; Arya leaves the pedestal and runs towards the commotion. Sansa gets visibly distraught and starts yelling as a member of the Kingsguard holds her back.
No, stop! Please, someone stop him!
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: My son, this is madness.
Speaker: Cersei Baratheon

Text: Put him down!
Speaker: Populace

Text: Varys runs to the platform to talk to Cersei and Joffrey, Ilyn Payne puts on his executioner’s mask. Arya marches towards the courtyard but is grabbed by the arm by Yoren.
Don't look!
Speaker: Yoren

Text: Let me go.
Speaker: Arya Stark

Text: Shut your mouth. Look at me.
Speaker: Yoren

Text: Stop him, stop!
Speaker: Sansa Stark

Text: From Ned’s perspective, the roars of the crowd become almost silent; he looks towards Baelor’s statue but finds no one there. He lowers his head in recognition of his fate as the sound of Payne’s longsword cuts through the hushed silence. We see the sword swing until it reaches his head, with a direct cut to Arya as Yoren prevents her from seeing the actual execution. Arya looks at the sky; a flock of pigeons flies away from the courtyard as she holds her head against Yoren’s chest; she sighs heavily, and the screen cuts to black.
TITLE SEQUENCEEXT. KING’S LANDING

The Hound and another man grunt as they duel. Men and women look on from nearby. The Hound knocks the other man’s shield away, and knocks the man off of a wall. The camera pans up from the man to where Joffrey stands in a tent, watching.
(Quietly) Well struck… (Louder) Well struck, Dog.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: The Hound removes his helmet. Joffrey turns to Sansa.
Did you like that?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: It was well struck, Your Grace.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I already said it was well struck.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Yes, Your Grace.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Two men drag the man away, leaving behind a trail of blood. A boy walks over to clean up the blood.
Who's next?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Lothor Brune, freerider in the service of Lord Baelish.
Speaker: ANNOUNCER

Text: The announcer gestures to a man, who then walks over.
Ser Dontos the Red of House Hollard.
Speaker: ANNOUNCER

Text: The announcer gestures in the opposite direction, but no one comes forward.
(Yells) Ser Dontos the Red of House Hollard!
Speaker: ANNOUNCER

Text: Here I am. (Walking down some stairs, awkwardly clutching his helmet and weapon).  Here I am. (Drops his helmet). Sorry, Your Grace. (Puts his helmet on backwards). My deepest apologies. (Puts his helmet on correctly).
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: Are you drunk?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Ser Dontos takes off his helmet.
Two cups? (Dontos nods). That's not much at all. (Joffrey gestures to some wine). Please, have another cup.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Are you sure, Your Grace?
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: Yes, to celebrate my name day. (Smiles) Have two, have as much as you like.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: I would be honored, Your Grace.
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: Ser Dontos bows to Joffrey. Joffrey looks over to Ser Meryn.
Ser Meryn, help Ser Dontos celebrate my name day. See that he drinks his fill.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Ser Meryn and two other kingsguard grab Ser Dontos. They bring him into a more open area nearby. Ser Dontos is forced on his knees. One kingsguard keeps Ser Dontos down. Ser Meryn and the other kingsguard get a funnel and a barrel of wine. Ser Meryn forces the funnel into Ser Dontos’s mouth. The kingsguard with the barrel begins pouring the wine down the funnel. Ser Dontos begins gurgling and struggles a little bit.
You can't!
Speaker: SANSA

Text: What did you say? Did you say I can't?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: I only meant… it would be bad luck to kill a man on your name day.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: What kind of stupid peasant's superstition...
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: The girl is right. What a man sows on his name day, he reaps all year.
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: (Sighs). Take him away. I'll have him killed tomorrow, the fool.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: The barrel and funnel are removed, and Ser Dontos is released. He pukes out a mixture of blood and wine onto the ground.
Did you hear My Lady, Ser Dontos? (Ser Dontos is forced onto his feet). From this day, (Standing up), you'll be my new fool.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Thank you, Your Grace. (Bows). And you, My Lady, thank you.
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: Ser Dontos is taken away by kingsguard.
Beloved nephew.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion, Bronn, and a number of hill tribesman appear from the right. People murmur and look their way.
We looked for you on the battlefield. (Joffrey sits down). You were nowhere to be found.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion begins to pour himself a glass of wine.
I've been here, ruling the kingdoms.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: What a fine job you've done. (Turns to Myrcella). Look at you. (Kisses her). More beautiful than ever. (Turns to Tommen). And you! You, you're going to be bigger than the Hound, but much better looking. (Tyrion smiles. He and Myrcella laugh). This one doesn't like me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion gestures towards the Hound. Bronn looks over at the Hound and smiles wryly.
Can't imagine why.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: We heard you were dead.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: I'm glad you're not dead.
Speaker: MYRCELLA

Text: Tyrion takes a sip of his wine.
Me, too, dear. Death is so boring, especially now with so much excitement in the world. (Looks at Sansa). My Lady, I'm sorry for your loss.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion bows to Sansa. Joffrey looks over at her, and back to Tyrion.
Her loss? Her father was a confessed traitor!
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: But still her father. Surely having so recently lost your own beloved father you can sympathize.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: My father was a traitor. My mother and brother are traitors, too. I am loyal to my beloved Joffrey.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Of course you are.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion smirks sympathetically. Sansa looks away.
Well, (Gulps down his wine), enjoy your name day, Your Grace. Wish I could stay and celebrate, but there is work to be done.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion begins walking away from the tent.
What work? (Bronn and the tribesmen follow Tyrion. Joffrey stands up). Why are you here?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: INT. SMALL COUNCIL MEETING CHAMBER
The council members sit at a table. A man walks to the table with a covered bird cage.

The raven arrived from the Citadel this morning, Your Grace. The conclave has met, (The man sets the cage down and removes the cover), considered reports from Maesters all over the Seven Kingdoms, and declared this great summer done, at last. The longest summer in living memory.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: The peasants say, a long summer means an even longer winter.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: A common superstition.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: We have enough wheat for a five-year winter. If it lasts any longer, (Shrugs indifferently), we'll have fewer peasants.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: The city's drowning in refugees, Your Grace, fleeing the war. We have nowhere to house them, and with winter coming, it'll only get worse.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Cersei gestures to a servant. The servant comes to take the raven off of the table.
You command the City Watch, do you not, Lord Slynt?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I do, Your Grace.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: And are you not a Lord at my command?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I owe my title and lands to your generosity, Your Grace.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Then do your job. Shut the gates to the peasants. They belong in the field, not our capital.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Yes, Your Grace.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Tyrion begins whistling from a distance. Everyone at the table turns to watch him approach.
Don't get up. More ravishing than ever, big sister. (Kisses Cersei on the cheek). War agrees with you. Forgive the interruption, carry on.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What are you doing here?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: (Sits down) It's been a remarkable journey. I, (grabs a glass), pissed off the edge of the Wall, I slept in a sky cell. (Pours himself wine). I fought with the hill tribes. So many adventures, so much to be thankful for.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion begins drinking his wine.
What are you doing here? This is the small council.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Yes., well, I, do believe the Hand of the King is welcome at all small council meetings.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Our father is Hand of the King.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Yes, but in his absence…
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion pulls out a letter. He hands it to Varys, who opens it, and begins reading it.
Your father has named Lord Tyrion to serve as Hand in his stead while he fights -
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Out! All of you out. (The small council members all get up and leave until it is only Cersei and Tyrion. Cersei stands up and approaches Tyrion). I would like to know how you tricked father into this.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: If I were capable of tricking father, I'd be emperor of the world by now. You brought this on yourself. (Cersei sits down).
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I've done nothing.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Quite right. You did nothing when your son called for Ned Stark's head. Now the entire North has risen up against us.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I tried to stop it.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Did you? You failed. That bit of theater will haunt our family for a generation.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Robb Stark is a child.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Who's won every battle he's fought. Do you understand we're losing the war?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What do you know about warfare?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Nothing. But I know people. And I know that our enemies hate each other almost as much as they hate us.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: There is a long pause. Cersei looks over at Tyrion.
Joffrey is King.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Joffrey is King.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You are here to advise him.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I'm only here to advise him. And if the King listens to what I say, the King might just get his Uncle Jaime back.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: How?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You love your children. It's your one redeeming quality. That and your cheekbones. The Starks love their children as well. And we have two of them.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: One.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: One?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Arya, little animal, she disappeared.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Disappeared? What, in a puff of smoke? We had three Starks to trade. You chopped one's head off and let another escape. Father will be furious. It must be odd for you to be the disappointing child.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion smirks, and takes a sip of his wine. Cersei looks away.
WINTERFELL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. OUTSIDE WINTERFELL
A knight sits on a horse alone, holding a banner. Winterfell is seen in the background.
My Lord, may the Old Gods watch over your brother and all our northern sons.
Speaker: LORD

Text: INT. INSIDE WINTERFELL’S KEEP
A long queue of people are waiting to speak with Bran. The man speaking is addressing Bran and Maester Luwin, who are both sitting at a large table.

The walls of my Holdfast will not stand the winter. The stones were last mortared in the time of King Aerys, and I'm afraid the masons today are not fit to carry their fathers' hammers. When I was a boy, I remember seeing them put up a new tower at Torrhen's Square in a summer. Men worked back then. Today, my Holdfast looks like it was built by drunk children. At night you can hear the wind howling through the gaps. And the Gods forbid it rains. Why, I might as well sleep beneath a waterfall.
Speaker: LORD

Text: Maintenance of a Holdfast generally falls to the lord of that Holdfast.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: Generally, yes, but I've sent all the young men off to fight Robb Stark's war.
Speaker: LORD

Text: King Robb. And it's not his war. He didn't choose it.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Maybe not, My Lord, but he called in his Banners, and took the men.
Speaker: LORD

Text: Joffrey killed my father, your liege lord. Do you remember your vows, Ser?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Of course I remember!
Speaker: LORD

Text: We can spare four masons for a week, My Lord. Will that be sufficient to repair your walls?
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: The man walks away. After a moment, Luwin turns to Bran.
We didn't want him here all day, did we?
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: I didn't like the way he was talking about Robb.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Nor did I. But listening to people you'd rather not listen to is one of your responsibilities as Lord of Winterfell. (Bran sighs). Lord Portan.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: (Walks forward). My Lord, may the Old Gods watch over your brother and all our northern sons.
Speaker: PORTAN

Text: EXT. WOODS

The camera changes to first-person. A character is running through the woods, panting.  The character looks up to the red comet above the trees, and then back down to the pool in the godswood. The character approaches the pool and looks down at their reflection, revealing themselves to be Summer, Bran’s direwolf.
INT. BRAN’S BEDROOM
Bran lays in his bed, asleep. His eyes suddenly open.
Hodor walks with Bran on his back, closely following Osha. Osha squats next to some plants. Hodor continues walking.
Boil this for an hour and drink the tea. Makes all your pain go away.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: Osha pockets some of the plant.
Don't have any pain.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Lucky for you.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: That way.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Bran points, and Hodor changes direction, heading for the godswood. Osha turns and begins following them.
You've been having those dreams again.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: I don't dream.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Everyone dreams.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: I don't. Heard some of the men talking about the comet. (Bran looks up at the comet). They say it's an omen. They say it means Robb will win a great victory in the South.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Did they? (Hodor is kneeling next to the pool in the godswood. Osha begins unstrapping Bran from Hodor’s back). I heard some other fools say it's Lannister Red. Means the Lannisters will rule all Seven Kingdoms before long. I heard a stable boy say it's the color of blood, to mark the death of your father.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: Osha places Bran on the ground. He begins crawling towards the edge of the pool.
The stars don't fall for men. The red comet means one thing, boy. Dragons.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: Bran looks at his reflection in the pool.
The dragons are all dead. They've been dead for centuries.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: ESSOS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. DESERT
Some people walk through the desert. The camera pans up to reveal Daenerys, with Drogon on her shoulder, and her Khalasar. Daenerys attempts to feed Drogon some meat, but he refuses.
What did your brother say about them, Khaleesi?
Speaker: DOREAH

Text: He said they ate meat.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: He didn't tell you what kind of meat?
Speaker: DOREAH

Text: My brother didn't know anything about dragons. He didn't know anything about anything.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Doreah looks down dejectedly. Daenerys gets Drogon off of her shoulder and into his cage. At the front of the group, a horse suddenly collapses. Jorah jogs forward to investigate. Daenerys follows after him. Daenerys kneels down to look at the horse. She looks up at Jorah, who shakes his head. Daenerys looks down sadly.
She was Drogo's first gift to me.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I remember.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I promised to protect them. Promised them their enemies would die screaming. How do I make starvation scream?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: A trick I never learned, I'm afraid.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Does it ever end?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: This is further east than I've ever been. But, yes, Khaleesi, everything ends, even the red waste.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: And you're sure there's no other way?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: If we go south to the land of the Lazarheen, the Lamb Men will kill us and take your dragons. If we go west to the Dothraki Sea, the first Khalasar we meet will kill us and take your dragons.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: No one will take my dragons.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They are too weak to fight, as are your people. You must be their strength.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: (Turns to Jorah) As you are mine.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Daenerys says something in Dothraki, calling Rakharo and some others over. She then stands up, and addresses Rakharo and two others.
(Speaking Dothraki) Rakharo, Aggo, Kovarro. Take our remaining horses. You will ride east, you southeast, and you northeast.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (Speaking Dothraki) What do we seek, Khaleesi?
Speaker: RAKHARO

Text: (Speaking Dothraki) Cities, living or dead. Caravans and people. Rivers or lakes or the great salt sea. Find how far the Red Waste extends before us, and what lies on the other side.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Rakharo and the other two riders walk away. Later, as Rakharo is almost ready to leave, Daenerys approaches him.
(Speaking Dothraki) Rokharo, you are my last hope, blood of my blood.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (Speaking Dothraki) I will not fail you, blood of my blood.
Speaker: RAKHARO

Text: You never have.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: This is… bad time to start.
Speaker: RAKHARO

Text: Rakharo and the other two riders take off. Daenerys stares at the red comet, looking troubled.
BEYOND THE WALL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. WOODS
