The large party of Night’s Watchmen continue through the woods on horseback. Sam, Grenn, and Edd surround a sledge trapped in the snow on the side of the road.
Having a rough time of it?
Speaker: JON

Text: Nothing's killed me yet.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Your ass killed the sledge.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: You offered me a ride!
Speaker: SAM

Text: I just wanted you to shut up about your damn blisters.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: The party reaches a large camp. Some of them dismount. The camera pans up to view a large wooden house in the center.
I was born in a place like this. Later, I fell on hard times.
Speaker: EDD

Text: The camera moves through the camp, to show some of the women working.
Are those girls?
Speaker: SAM

Text: Craster's daughters.
Speaker: EDD

Text: I haven't seen a girl in six months.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I'd keep on not seeing them if I were you.
Speaker: EDD

Text: What, he don't like people messing with his daughters?
Speaker: GRENN

Text: (Smirking) He don't like people messing with his wives.
Speaker: EDD

Text: Jon, Sam, and Grenn all look at Edd, surprised.
He marries his daughters, and they give him more daughters, and on, and on it goes.
Speaker: EDD

Text: That's foul.
Speaker: SAM

Text: It's beyond foul.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: All the other wildlings for a hundred leagues have disappeared. Craster's still here. He must be doing something right.
Speaker: EDD

Text: What happens to the boys?
Speaker: JON

Text: Hmm?
Speaker: SAM

Text: He marries his daughters. What does he do with his sons?
Speaker: JON

Text: INT. CRASTER’S LODGE
Craster, Mormont, and a number of watchmen sit around a fire.
He said he planned to stop here on his way to the Frostfangs.
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: People make all sorts of plans. I haven't seen Benjen Stark in three years. Haven't missed him. Always treated me like scum. (Sips his wine). Haven't had any good wine for a long time. You Southerners make good wine, I'll give you that.
Speaker: CRASTER

Text: (Standing off to the side of the room) We're not Southerners.
Speaker: JON

Text: Who's this little girl? You're prettier than half my daughters. You got a nice wet twat between your legs? What's your name?
Speaker: CRASTER

Text: Jon Snow.
Speaker: JON

Text: Snow, eh? Listen to me, bastard. All you lot from south of the Wall, you're Southerners. But now you're in the North, the real North.
Speaker: CRASTER

Text: The lad meant no harm.
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: I catch that pretty little bastard talking to my daughters -
Speaker: CRASTER

Text: No one will talk to your daughters, you have my word. (Turns to Jon) Now, sit down and shut your mouth.
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: Jon takes a seat at the fire.
You bring any of that good wine with you?
Speaker: CRASTER

Text: We did. We passed through six villages on the way here. All six were abandoned. Where have all the wildlings gone?
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: As the conversation continues, Jon looks around at some of Craster’s daughters in the rafters.
I could tell you, but I'm thirsty.
Speaker: CRASTER

Text: There's a barrel of Dornish wine on the sledge. Bring it in here.
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: Yes, commander.
Speaker: WATCHMAN

Text: You want to know where they've all gone? North! To join up with Mance Rayder Your old friend.
Speaker: CRASTER

Text: He's no friend of mine. He broke his vows, betrayed his brothers!
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: Oh, aye. But once he was just a poor black crow. And now he's King-Beyond-the-Wall.
Speaker: CRASTER

Text: He's been calling himself that for years. What’s he king of? A frozen lake somewhere?
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: Craster looks at the watchman sitting next to Mormont and points.
That's a good-looking axe. Fresh forged?
Speaker: CRASTER

Text: Give it here.
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: Mormont beckons to the watchman, who begrudgingly hands Mormont the axe.
You'll have another one made at Castle Black. (Hands the axe to Craster). Here.
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: (Inspecting the axe). Oh, that's some lovely steel. (Loudly brings the axe down). You want to know what Mance Rayder is doing? Gathering an army. What I hear, he's already got more men than any of your southern kings.
Speaker: CRASTER

Text: And where does he plan marching this army?
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: When you're all the way north, there's only one direction to go.
Speaker: CRASTER

Text: These are bad times to be living alone in the wild. The cold winds are rising.
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: Let them come. My roots are sunk deep. (Grabs Gilly) Wife, tell the Lord Crow how content we are.
Speaker: CRASTER

Text: This is our place. Our husband keeps us safe. Better to live free than die a slave.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Don't it make you jealous, old man, to see me with all these young wives and you with no one to warm your bed?
Speaker: CRASTER

Text: We chose different paths.
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: Oh, aye, and you chose the path with no one but boys on it. (Stands up).  You'll be wanting to sleep beneath my roof, I suppose, and eat me out of pigs.
Speaker: CRASTER

Text: (Stands up) A roof would be welcome. It's been hard riding. We've brought our own food and good steel for you.
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: (Addressing the group). Any man lays a hand on one of my wives, he loses the hand. And I see this one, (Gestures towards Jon),  staring too long, I might just gouge his eyes out.
Speaker: CRASTER

Text: Your roof, your rules.
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: The crows all leave the lodge.
EXT. IN THE CAMP
Mormont roughly grabs Jon and pins him against a wooden post.
(Angrily) Who am I? (Jon looks confused) Who am I?
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: Lord commander.
Speaker: JON

Text: And who are you?
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: Jon Snow.
Speaker: JON

Text: Who are you?
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: Your steward.
Speaker: JON

Text: You want to lead one day? (Jon nods). Then learn how to follow.
Speaker: LORD MORMONT

Text: DRAGONSTONE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. BEACH
The camera pans down from the red comet to Maester Cressen, holding a torch and running. Melisandre can be heard speaking in the distance.
Lord of Light, come to us in our darkness. We offer you these false Gods.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Cressen approaches a group gathered on the beach, burning some effigies. Melisandre is speaking to them.
Take them and cast your light upon us. For the night is dark and full of terrors.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: (In unison) For the night is dark and full of terrors.
Speaker: THE GROUP

Text: Cressen reaches the group and hands his torch to another man.
After the long summer, darkness will fall heavy on the world. Stars will bleed.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: (To Davos) We need to stop her!
Speaker: CRESSEN

Text: The cold breath of winter will freeze the seas.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: (Looks to Stannis) Not now.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: And the dead shall rise in the North.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: (Walks forward, interrupting Melisandre). All you men were named in the Light of the Seven! Is this how you treat the Gods of your fathers? Are you so eager to spit on your ancestors?
Speaker: CRESSEN

Text: After a long silence, Melisandre approaches Cressen and caresses his face.
You smell of fear, fear and piss and old bones. Do you want to stop me? Stop me.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: After a moment, Cressen begrudgingly stands aside.
In the ancient books, it's written that a warrior will draw a burning sword from the fire. And that sword shall be Lightbringer. Stannis Baratheon, warrior of light, your sword awaits you.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Stannis approaches one of the burning effigies as everyone else looks on. He pulls a sword out from the base and carries it high, to applause. When he sticks it in the sand, the crowd kneels.
Lord, cast your light upon us!
Speaker: CROWD

Text: For the night is dark and full of terrors.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: For the night is dark and full of terror.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Stannis then walks away, almost forgetting to bring his wife with him. The rest of the crowd gets up to leave moments later. Davos and Cressen stay behind a moment to talk.
This woman will lead him into a war he cannot win.
Speaker: CRESSEN

Text: Stannis is our king. We follow where he leads, even if we don't like the path.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: (Scoffs) King. Since that boar killed his brother, every lord wants a coronation.
Speaker: CRESSEN

Text: I don't serve the others. I serve Stannis.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: As do I, but loyal service means telling hard truths. He's surrounded by fools and fanatics, but he trusts you, Davos. (Davos picks up the sword and inspects it).  If you tell him the truth…
Speaker: CRESSEN

Text: What's the truth?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Cressen looks crestfallen. Davos walks away with the sword. Cressen looks up at the burning effigies.
Matthos reads out a letter for Stannis to proofread, as they and some other characters sit around a table.
“And I declare upon the honor of my house that my beloved brother Robert le-”
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: He wasn't my beloved brother. (Matthos looks up). I didn't love him, he didn't love me.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: A harmless courtesy, Your Grace.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: A lie. Take it out.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Matthos scratches ‘beloved’ off of the letter, and then continues.

“That my brother Robert left no trueborn heirs; the boy Joffrey, the boy Tommen, and the girl Myrcella, being born of incest between Cersei Lannister and her brother Jaime Lannister. By right of birth -"
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: Jaime Lannister, the Kingslayer. Call him what he is.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Matthos adds in ‘the Kingslayer,’ and continues. Davos notices Cressen slip something into his own glass of wine.
"And her brother Jaime Lannister, the Kingslayer. By right of birth and blood, I do this day lay claim -"
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: Make it Ser Jaime Lannister, the Kingslayer. Whatever else he is, the man's still a knight.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: (Adding Ser) "Ser Jaime Lannister, the Kingslayer. By right of birth and blood, I do this day lay claim to the Iron Throne of Westeros. (Stannis nods). Let all true men declare their loyalty.”
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: When Eddard Stark learned the truth, he told only me. I'll not make the same mistake. Send copies of that letter to every corner of the Realm, from the Arbor to the Wall. The time has come to choose. Let no man claim ignorance as an excuse.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Your Grace, the Lannisters are the true enemy. If, for the time being, you could make peace with your brother -
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I'll not make peace with Renly while he calls himself King.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Well, many have already declared for him; Mace Tyrell, Randyll Tarly.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Stannis does not need to beg this lord or that lord for support. The Lord of Light stands behind him.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: And how many ships has the Lord of Light got in his fleet?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: He has no need for ships.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I'm sure he doesn't, but we do if we're going to war. If not Renly, Your Grace, join forces with Robb Stark.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Who would steal the northern half of my kingdom. I've always served thieves according to their desserts, as you well know, Ser Davos. Joffrey, Renly, Robb Stark, they're all thieves. They'll bend the knee or I'll destroy them.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: (Stands up). I owe you an apology, my King. My duty is to serve. You have chosen the new God over the Old Gods. May the Lord of Light watch over us all. Shall we drink together?
Speaker: CRESSEN

Text: (Whispers to Cressen) Don't.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Cressen stands up with the drugged glass of wine, and walks over to where Melisandre is sitting.
A cup of wine to honor the one true God.
Speaker: CRESSEN

Text: Melisandre stands up. Everyone at the table reaches for their own wine glasses. Cressen takes a sip of the drugged wine and offers it to Melisandre. Davos nervously watches her take the glass. Cressen begins to stumble and bleed from his nose. Melisandre drink a large portion of the wine. As he falls to the floor dead, Davos and many others stand up. Melisandre appears unphased by the poison.
The night is dark and full of terrors, old man, but the fire burns them all away. Your Grace.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: NORTH
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. STARK CAMP

The camera pans over a watchtower to a wide shot of the camp. In the camp, Robb stark is led by a man with a torch to where Jaime is being held. Robb enters Jaime’s cage, where he is tied to a wooden pole, a good distance from the walls of the cage.

King in the North. I keep expecting you to leave me in one castle or another for safekeeping, but you drag me along from camp to camp. Have you grown fond of me, Stark? Is that it? I've never seen you with a girl.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: If I left you with one of my bannermen, your father would know within a fortnight, and my bannerman would receive a raven with a message, "Release my son and you'll be rich beyond your dreams. Refuse and your house will be destroyed, root and stem.”
Speaker: ROBB

Text: You don't trust the loyalty of the men following you into battle?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Oh, I trust them with my life. Just not with yours.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Smart boy. What's wrong? Don't like being called ‘boy’? Insulted?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Robb looks behind Jaime’s cage. As Jaime nervously strains to look behind him, Grey Wind can be heard heavily walking to the front of the cage.
You insult yourself, Kingslayer. You've been defeated by a boy.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: With Grey Wind now fully in view, Jaime loses his brave facade.

You're held captive by a boy. Perhaps you'll be killed by a boy. (Grey Wind enters the cage. Jaime looks very nervous). Stannis Baratheon sent ravens to all the high lords of Westeros. King Joffrey Baratheon is neither a true king nor a true Baratheon. (Jaime focuses back on Robb). He's your bastard son.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: If that's true, Stannis is the rightful king. How convenient for him.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: My father learned the truth. That's why you had him executed.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I was your prisoner when Ned Stark lost his head.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Your son killed him so the world wouldn't learn who fathered him. And you... you pushed my brother from a window because he saw you with the queen.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: You have proof? Or do you want to trade gossip like a couple of fishwives?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I'm sending one of your cousins down to King's Landing with my peace terms.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: You think my father's going to negotiate with you? You don't know him very well.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: No, but he's starting to know me.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Three victories don't make you a conqueror.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: It's better than three defeats.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Robb nudges Grey Wind towards Jaime and leaves the cage. Grey Wind growls in Jaime’s face and comes close to biting him. Jaime closes his eyes in preparation, but when he opens them back up, Grey Wind is gone.
KING’S LANDING
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. TYRION’S ROOM
Shae looks out from the balcony in Tyrion’s room.
This city stinks Like dead bodies.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: A bit corpsey, yes.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And shit.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Shae hops down from the balcony, and walks back into the room.
I thought you wanted to come here.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I love it.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: You love the smell of dead bodies and shit?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And cum and garlic and rum.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: You can smell cum from the balcony?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I love the stink. I love the noise. Cities make me want to fuck.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: And so did the country.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Shae lays back on Tyrion’s bed.
This is where I belong.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Yes, well, you need to be careful. No one can know you're here.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No one will know.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: You can't trust anyone in King's Landing. They're all liars; good liars, bad liars, one or two great liars.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What about you?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Me? I'm not from here. I'm a slave to the truth.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Truth? (Laughs) You are the biggest little liar I have ever met.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Why do you think I am so little? I'm being, (Lays down on the bed with Shae), crushed beneath the weight of all that truth.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Ned Stark actually slept on this, as if the poor man didn't suffer enough. One of the many changes we'll have to make around here.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion and Shae kiss as a bell rings in the distance.
INT. HALLWAY
A servant boy can be seen scrubbing something on the floor, as Baelish walks down a hallway next to a courtyard. Cersei and some kingsguard approach from behind.
Lord Baelish.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: I wonder if I might ask you for a favor.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Of course, Your Grace.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Ned Stark's youngest daughter Arya... we can't seem to locate her.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Baelish begins walking with Cersei and her guards.
If she's escaped the capital, Winterfell seems the logical destination.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: And yet my friends in the North report no sign of her.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Curious.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: If we choose to negotiate with the Starks, the girl has some value. Whoever finds her, well, you know what they say about Lannisters and debts.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Well, you could ask Varys where she is. He'll have an answer for you. Whether you believe it,,, Myself, I have always had a hard time trusting eunuchs. (Smiles) Who knows what they want?
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: A mockingbird. (Points to a pin on Baelish’s shirt). You created your own Sigil, didn't you?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Yes.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Appropriate for a self-made man with so many songs to sing.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I'm glad you like it. Some people are fortunate enough to be born into the right family. Others have to find their own way.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: I heard a song once about a boy of modest means who found his way into the home of a very prominent family. He loved the eldest daughter. Sadly, she had eyes for another.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: When boys and girls live in the same home, awkward situations can arise. Sometimes, I've heard, even brothers and sisters develop certain affections. And when these affections become common knowledge, well, that is an awkward situation, indeed. Especially in a prominent family. But prominent families often forget a simple truth, I've found.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: And which truth is that?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Knowledge is power.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Seize him. (Cersei’s guards seize Baelish). Cut his throat. (A guard holds a knife to Baelish’s neck). Stop. Wait. I've changed my mind. Let him go. (The guards let Baelish go). Step back three paces. Turn around. Close your eyes. (The guards do as Cersei says). (To Baelish) Power is power. Do see if you can take some time away from your coins and your whores to locate the Stark girl for me. I would very much appreciate it.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Cersei walks away from Baelish, her guards following close behind. The servant boy scrubbing the floor looks up at Baelish.
NORTH
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. ROBB’S TENT
You're Ser Alton Lannister?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I am, Your Grace.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: I offer your cousins peace if they meet my terms. First, your family must release my sisters. Second, my father's bones must be returned to us so he may rest beside his brother and sister in the crypts beneath Winterfell. And the remains of all those who died in his service must also be returned. Their families can honor them with proper funerals.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: An honorable request, Your Grace.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: Third... Joffrey and the Queen Regent must renounce all claim to dominion of the North. From this time, till the end of time, we are a free and independent kingdom.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Alton looks at him wide-eyed.
The King in the North.
Speaker: SER RODRIK

Text: King in the North.
Speaker: THE OTHERS AT THE TABLE

Text: Neither Joffrey nor any of his men shall set foot in our lands again. If he disregards this command, he shall suffer the same fate as my father, only I don't need a servant to do my beheading for me.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: These are... Your Grace, these are...
Speaker: ALTON

Text: These are my terms. If the Queen Regent and her son meet them, I'll give them peace. If not, I will litter the south with Lannister dead.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: King Joffrey is a Baratheon, Your Grace.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: Oh, is he? You'll ride at daybreak, Ser Alton. That will be all for tonight.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: After everyone else leaves the tent, Theon approaches Robb.
A word, Your Grace?
Speaker: THEON

Text: You don't have to call me ‘Your Grace’ when no one's around.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: It's not so bad once you get used to it.
Speaker: THEON

Text: I'm glad someone's gotten used to it.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: The Lannisters are going to reject your terms, you know?
Speaker: THEON

Text: Of course they are.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: We can fight them in the fields as long as you like, but we won't beat them until you take King's Landing. And we can't take King's Landing without ships. My father has ships and men who know how to sail them.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Men who fought my father.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Men who fought King Robert to free themselves from the yoke of the South, just like you're doing now. I'm his only living son. He'll listen to me. I know he will. I'm not a Stark. I know that. But your father raised me to be an honorable man. We can avenge him together.
Speaker: THEON

Text: You don't want Balon Greyjoy for an ally.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I need his ships. They say he has 200.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: They say a million rats live in the sewers of King's Landing. Shall we rally them to fight for us?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Catelyn is preparing to go somewhere, gathering up various items.
I understand you don't trust Lord Greyjoy.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I don't trust Lord Greyjoy because he is not trustworthy. Your father had to go to war to end his rebellion.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Yes. And now I'm the one rebelling against the throne. Before me, it was father. You married one rebel and mothered another.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I mothered more than just rebels, a fact you seem to have forgotten.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: If I trade the Kingslayer for two girls, my bannermen will string me up by my feet.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: You want to leave Sansa in the Queen's hands? And Arya, I haven't heard a word about Arya. What are we fighting for if not for them?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: It's more complicated than that! You know it is.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: A long pause follows. Catelyn sits down.
It's time for me to go home. I haven't seen Bran or Rickon in months.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: You can't go to Winterfell.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I beg your pardon?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I'll send Rodrik to watch over the boys, ‘cause tomorrow, you'll ride south to the Stormlands.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Why in the name of all the Gods -
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Because I need you to negotiate with Renly Baratheon. He's rallied an army of 100,000. You know him. You know his family.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I haven't seen Renly Baratheon since he was a boy. You have a hundred other lords -
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Which of these lords do I trust more than you? If Renly sides with us, we'll outnumber them two to one. When they feel the jaws beginning to shut, they'll sue for peace. We'll get the girls back. Then we'll all go home for good.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I will ride at first light.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Robb kisses Catelyn’s forehead, and they embrace.
We will all be together again soon, I promise.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: You've done so well. Your father would be proud.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: (Pauses) Give Lord Renly my regards.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: King Renly. There's a king in every corner now.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: KING’S LANDING
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. THRONE ROOM
Cersei and her guards enter the throne room. Extensive work is being done, overseen by Joffrey.
What is all this?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Returning this room to its proper appearance. Say what you will about the Targaryens, they were conquerors. That is a seat for a conqueror. It needs a room to match it, not vines and flowers.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: We can't find Arya Stark.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: With luck, she's dead in a ditch somewhere.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Perhaps. But if not, we need her. They'll never give Jaime back to us for Sansa alone.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I think they might. They're weak. They put too much value on their women. (Walks towards the throne).
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: We need to set our armies to the task of finding her. Send out as many men as we can. I'm sure if you asked grandfather -
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The King does not ask; He commands. And my grandfather's stupidity in the field of battle is the reason Robb Stark has Uncle Jaime in the first place.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: His life is in danger.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: We're at war. All our lives are in danger. I heard a disgusting lie about Uncle Jaime. And you.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Our enemies will say anything to weaken your claim to the throne.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: It's not a claim. The throne is mine.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Of course it is. No one believes this foul gossip -
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Someone believes it. Father had other children? Besides me and Tommen and Myrcella?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: What are you asking?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I'm asking if he fucked other women when he grew tired of you. How many bastards does he have running -
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Cersei instinctively slaps Joffrey. It grows quiet as many workers look over at Joffrey and Cersei. Joffre looks up shocked, and then around to the workers in the room. Cersei appears nervous.
What you just did is punishable by death. You will never do it again. Never. (Joffrey begins to walk away). That will be all, Mother.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: INT. BROTHEL
A man and a woman are having sex. The woman is shrieking loudly.
No, no, no, no. Do you have any idea how ridiculous you sound? Ease into it. Slowly, with passion.
Speaker: ROZ

Text: The man and woman go back to having sex, this time with the woman slowly moaning.
Go wash yourselves. Put some clothes on. Both of you are working tonight.
Speaker: ROZ

Text: Roz walks Daisy through the brothel.
We do things differently here, Daisy. This isn't some five-copper bawdy house in Hayseed Hall.
Speaker: ROZ

Text: Haystack Hall.
Speaker: DAISY

Text: Wherever you're from. Our establishment doesn't cater to ploughmen and goat herders. (Nods to a man walking past). Lord Olsen. Taste is everything here.
Speaker: ROZ

Text: Littlefinger's a fancy man.
Speaker: DAISY

Text: Don't call him Littlefinger, he doesn't like it. Lord Baelish.
Speaker: ROZ

Text: As they enter a new room, a prostitute and two men with her get up to leave.
She pretends she doesn't speak the common tongue so that people will think she's exotic. She grew up just down the road in flea bottom.
Speaker: ROZ

Text: She's beautiful.
Speaker: DAISY

Text: She's a dumb slut, really, but a lid for every pot. (Janos enters the room). Lord Commander. Good to see you, again.
Speaker: ROZ

Text: Janos is followed by a number of gold cloaks, some of whom are dragging along a prisoner. Some leave to search other rooms.
You do realize this establishment is owned by Lord Petyr Baelish, the King's Master of Coin. Coin which goes in many pockets.
Speaker: ROZ

Text: Orders.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Whose orders?
Speaker: ROZ

Text: Someone who doesn't care what Littlefinger thinks.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: No, you can't!
Speaker: MHAEGAN

Text: Some gold cloaks force Mhaegan and her baby, Barra, into the room. She begins crying. The prisoner looks at Barra, and back to Janos. He then nods. A gold cloak lets go of the prisoner and takes the Barra from Mhaegan.
No! Please! No! Not my Barra! Please. Please.
Speaker: MHAEGAN

Text: The gold cloak holds a knife to the baby’s throat, hesitantly. Throughout the whole ordeal, Mhaegan continues begging for Barra’s life.
Enough. Get it done. Kill the bastard.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: After a moment, Janos takes out a knife and grabs the baby.
Give it here.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Janos kills the baby just off screen, and Mhaegan shrieks. Janos and the other gold cloaks leave the brothel.
EXT. A DOCK
Some gold cloaks walk along a dock. They go up some stairs.
Spread out! Search every house, every room. Look in every room.
Speaker: GOLD CLOAK

Text: INT. A HOUSE
Some gold cloaks burst into a house and kill the inhabitants.
EXT. A DOCK
Outside again, a gold cloak tosses a young boy into the water and proceeds to drown him.
EXT. STREET
Some gold cloaks hold back a large mob as a baby is carried away. A gold cloak looks on as the baby is presumably killed.
INT. SMITHY
Janos and a number of gold cloaks arrive at the smithy. A gold cloak is holding the blacksmith’s face near some hot coals.
Gendry! His name is Gendry.
Speaker: BLACKSMITH

Text: Where is the bastard?
Speaker: JANOS

Text: The Night's Watch! Please, stop!
Speaker: BLACKSMITH

Text: Where?
Speaker: JANOS

Text: They took him up the Kingsroad, heading north!
Speaker: BLACKSMITH

Text: How will we know him?
Speaker: JANOS

Text: He's got a bull's head helmet. He made it himself.
Speaker: BLACKSMITH

Text: Find him.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: YOREN’S PARTY
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. A ROAD SURROUNDED BY TREES
Gendry loads some things into a cart, and then helps Arya up onto the cart with him. The camera goes to a wide shot of the group Yoren is leading to the wall.
KING'S LANDING
Speaker: INT

Text: TYRION wakes to echos of the sounds of battle. PYCELLE's face comes into focus. TYRION's head is crudely bandaged, with only one eye revealed. He is disoriented.
Pod.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: PODRICK bursts into the room
Pod! Find Bronn or Varys. Tell them I am here with Maester Pycelle. Tell them I am very much alive.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Yes, my lord.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Would you like something for the pain?
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: What happened?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The murderer and traitor Stannis Baratheon suffered a stunning defeat at the hands of your father.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: Where am I?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: These are your new chambers. A little cramped, perhaps, but you don't need much room, do you? You are no longer Hand of the King.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: PYCELLE turns and begins to leave. A thought occurs to him. He takes out a coin and flicks it to Tyrion
Oh, For your trouble.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: Pycelle exits.
THRONE ROOM
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: A white horse expels manure at the doorway leading to the throne room. TYWIN rides the horse in, through the gathered crowd.  From his throne, JOFFREY addresses the room.

I, Joffrey of the House Baratheon, first of my name, the rightful King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm, do hereby proclaim my grandfather, Tywin Lannister, the savior of the city and the Hand of the King.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Bowing, a page presents a pillow to JOFFREY, who places the Hand's brooch up to TYWIN. TYWIN bows.
Thank you, Your Grace.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: He turns his mount and exits.
Lord Petyr Baelish, step forward.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: LITTLEFINGER steps forward and kneels before JOFFREY.

For your good service and ingenuity in uniting the Houses of Lannister and Tyrell, I declare that you shall be granted the castle of Harrenhal with all its attendant lands and incomes to be held by your sons and grandsons from this day until the end of time.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: You honor me beyond words, Your Grace. I shall have to acquire some sons and grandsons.  The crowd laughs
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Ser Loras Tyrell.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: LORAS steps forward from the crowd and kneels.
Your house has come to our aid. The whole realm is in your debt, none more so than I. If your family would ask anything of me, ask it, and it shall be yours.
Speaker: JOFFFREY

Text: Your Grace, my sister Margaery, her husband was taken from us before . . . She remains innocent. I would ask you to find it in your heart to do us the great honor of joining our houses.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Is this what you want, Lady Margaery?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: MARGAERY takes a few steps forward.
With all my heart, Your Grace. I have come to love you from afar. Tales of your courage and wisdom have never been far from my ears. And those tales have taken root deep inside of me.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I, too, have heard tales of your beauty and grace, but the tales do not do you justice, my lady. It would be an honor to return your love, but I am promised to another. A king must keep his word.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Your Grace, in the judgment of your Small Council, it would be neither proper nor wise for you to wed the daughter of a man beheaded for treason, a girl whose brother is in open rebellion against the throne as we speak. For the good of the realm, your councilors beg you to set Sansa Stark aside.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The crowd murmurs.
Margaery! We want Margaery!
Speaker: CROWD

Text: JOFFREY stands and gestures to quiet the crowd.
I would like to heed your wishes and the wishes of my people, but I took a holy vow.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Your Grace, the gods do indeed hold betrothal solemn, but your father, blessed be his memory, made this pact before the Starks revealed their falseness. I have consulted with the High Septon and he assures me that their crimes against the realm free you from any promise you have made to them in the sight of the gods.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: CERSEI looks across to SANSA. CERSEI is pleased and SANSA is quite worried.
The gods are good. I am free to heed my heart. Ser Loras, I will gladly wed your sweet sister. You will be my queen and I will love you from this day until my last day.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: The crowd applauds.
SANSA walks away, quite solemn. Once she is out of view, she smiles and laughs in relief. LITTLEFINGER catches up to her.
My lady. My sincerest condolences.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: They're right. I'm not good enough for him.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You shouldn't say that. You'll be good enough for many things. He'll still enjoy beating you. And now that you're a woman, he'll be able to enjoy you in other ways as well.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: But, if he's not marrying me
Speaker: SANSA

Text: He'll let you go home? Joffrey's not the sort of boy who gives away his toys. You have a tender heart, just like your mother did at your age. I can see so much of her in you. She was like a sister to me. For her sake, I'll help get you home.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: King's Landing is my home now.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Look around you. We're all liars here. And every one of us is better than you.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: BROTHEL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: ROS applies make-up to her eye. There is a knock on the door. ROS stands up to welcome her client.
Come in. Make yourself comfortable.
Speaker: ROS

Text: A hooded figure walks in, silently. He sits on the end of the bed.
That doesn't look very comfortable. Here, watch me.
Speaker: ROS

Text: The man removes his hood. It is VARYS.
No need for that, my dear.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: You sure? Most men like what they see.
Speaker: ROS

Text: I'm not like most men.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: That's what most men say.
Speaker: ROS

Text: (laughs)
Speaker: VARYS

Text: If you don't want what most men want, then you'd better tell me what you'd like me to do.
Speaker: ROS

Text: I would like you to tell me if working for Lord Baelish has been all you'd hoped it would be.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Have we met?
Speaker: ROS

Text: You wouldn't remember me if we had?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I meet a lot of men.
Speaker: ROS

Text: And I think you remember all of them. I think your true talents are wasted on them.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: You're very kind, my lord. Allow me to return the favor.
Speaker: ROS

Text: ROS reaches to fondle his cock, but finds that VARYS is a eunuch. She is taken aback, and steps backward.
You're afraid. Why? Nothing dangerous down there.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I know who you are.
Speaker: ROS

Text: And, unlike your current employer, I protect those who work for me. I don't abuse them to satisfy royal whims or force them to abuse each other.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: How do you know about that?
Speaker: ROS

Text: I thought you said you knew who I was.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: What can I do for you, Lord Varys?
Speaker: ROS

Text: Littlefinger looks at you and sees a collection of profitable holes. I see a potential partner.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I'm afraid of him.
Speaker: ROS

Text: Oh, you should be. He's a dangerous man. But everyone has their weaknesses. Your current employer hides his very well, but not as well as he thinks.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: WESTERLANDS SHORE
Speaker: EXT

Text: BRIENNE pulls the boat up to the shore. JAIME waits, his hands chained.
You're a virgin, I take it?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Annoyed, BRIENNE pushes him forward. He walks and she follows.
Walk.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Childhood must have been awful for you. Were you a foot taller than all the boys? They laughed at you, called you names? Some boys like a challenge. One or two must have tried to get inside Big Brienne.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: One or two tried.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Ah. But you fought them off. But maybe you wished one of them could overpower you, fling you down, tear off your clothes. But none of them were strong enough. I'm strong enough.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Not interested.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Of course you are. You'd love to know what it feels like to be a woman.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: They encounter three hanged women in the trees.

Ah. "They lay with lions." Tavern girls, I'd say. Probably served my father's soldiers. Maybe one of them gave up a kiss and a feel. That's how they earned this. The glorious work of the Northern freedom fighters. Must make you proud to serve the Starks.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I don't serve the Starks. I serve Lady Catelyn.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Tell yourself that tonight when they swing in your dreams.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE pushes him roughly below the bodies, finally pinning him against a tree, and tying him fast against it.
What are you doing?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Burying them.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: We shouldn't stay here. We should get back on the river.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I think these women would understand if I don't care what you think.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Some men approach
I didn't leave it here.
Speaker: MAN

Text: I had me dagger.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: JAIME, nervously, gesters to BRIENNE.
Untie me. Now!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I gave it to you to cut the rope, and now I don't have me dagger no more.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Three men approach, in leather armor and bearing swords.
So unless it got stuck in your arse on its way to your cunt, it stands to reason that it's gone. Whoa. What's your business here?
Speaker: MAN

Text: Traveling a prisoner.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: The three men laugh hysterically
Well, fuck me!
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: If you've quite finished up
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: The men laugh even harder.
All right, we'll be going.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: She turns to take care of JAIME.
Whoa. Whoa! Who do you fight for?
Speaker: MAN

Text: The Starks.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: What did he do?
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: Apparently eating is now a crime. Who knew?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: No, stealing is a crime.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: But it's not a crime to starve. That's justice for you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Where are you taking him?
Speaker: MAN

Text: To Riverrun.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Why Riverrun?
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: BRIENNE works to unbind JAIME from the tree.
Steal from the Tullys, it's their dungeons you rot in.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Why not kill him?
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: For stealing a pig?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I don't give the orders. He must be important to someone.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Sending him with you? How important could he be?
Speaker: MAN

Text: BRIENNE does not answer.
All right, have it your way, my lady.
Speaker: MAN

Text: MAN #2 moves closer.
Do I know you?
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: Have you been to Ashemark?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: No.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: Then you don't know me.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Do you ever go to the river market at Salt Rock?
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: Is it near Ashemark?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: No.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: I've never been there.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE frees him from the tree, and she and JAIME start to walk away.
What do you think of these beauties?
Speaker: MAN

Text: I hope you gave them quick deaths.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Two of them we did, yeah.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Wait. I do know you. That's Jaime Lannister.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: I wish someone had told me. I wouldn't have had to steal that pig.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: If this is the Kingslayer, I think I'd know about it.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: How do you know what the Kingslayer looks like?
Speaker: MAN

Text: I was at Whispering Wood. I saw him. They dragged him out of the woods and threw him down before the king.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: He's not the Kingslayer. Sorry to disappoint you. If he was, I'd only be traveling his head.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Again, they try to move along.
I have a question for you both. And I want you to answer it at the same time. I count to three, you both answer. What's his name? One. Two. Three.
Speaker: MAN

Text: BRIENNE pushes JAIME aside, draws her sword, and sets on the men, visciously. JAIME is surprised at her prowess in battle. She bests them all, and turns to MAN, who lies on the forest floor. She drops her long sword and draws her short sword.
Two quick deaths.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: She stabs the MEN in the gut, painfully. She plunges deeper, and the MAN dies. She withdraws her sword and steps away.
Those were Stark men.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I don't serve the Starks. I serve Lady Catelyn. I told you I'd take you to King's Landing, and that's what I'm going to do. Stay.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: BRIENNE turns and chops the rope that holds the three women's corpses with a large grunt. JAIME winces as the bodies thud to the ground.
RIVERLANDS AT NIGHT.
Speaker: INT

Text: ROBB sits in his tent. Catelyn sits as well.
Walder Frey is a dangerous man to cross.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I know that.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: And you mean to do it anyway?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I love her.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I know that seems important to you.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: It is important to me.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Your father didn't love me when we married. He hardly knew me or I him. Love didn't just happen to us. We built it slowly over the years, stone by stone, for you, for your brothers and sisters, for all of us. It's not as exciting as secret passion in the woods, but it is stronger. It lasts longer.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: And that is what would be in store for me with one of Walder Frey's daughters,  what you and father had?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Why not? Because she's not beautiful? Because she's not exotic and exciting?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Now you're arguing just to argue because you arranged it.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: And you agreed to it. You gave him your word. Treat your oaths recklessly, and your people will do the same. If your father lived his life for one thing
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: My father is dead. And the only parent I have left has no right to call anyone reckless.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Robb exits.
BARATHEON WAR CAMP AT NIGHT
Speaker: INT

Text: STANNIS sits by a hearth.
You said you saw my victory in the flames.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: l I did. I still see it.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: The flames lied. And I'm no better than a savage trusting in a fire god. I fought for your god in Blackwater Bay. I led my men to the gates of the seventh hell as their brothers burned alive, and for what? Attacked from behind by Tywin Lannister and the Tyrells. If you see so much in your flames, why didn't you warn me?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: The Lord of Light only allows me glimpses.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: You claimed to speak for a god.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Will you quit the war just because you've lost a battle?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: You talk about war as if you understand it.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I've been fighting far longer than you.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Have you? Show me how you fight.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: STANNIS leaps to his feet and starts choking MELISANDRE. She gasps painfully, grabbing his hands.
Show me.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: MELISANDRE removes her hands from his and raises them in surrender.
Where's your god now? Will he save you? Where is your god?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Inside you.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: STANNIS releases her suddenly and MELISANDRE falls to the follow, panting.
I murdered my brother.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: MELISANDRE walks over to STANNIS.
We murdered him. Share the weight with me.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: He wasn't your brother.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: MELISANDRE caresses his head, soothingly.

This war has just begun. It will last for years. Thousands will die at your command. You will betray the men serving you. You will betray your family. You will betray everything you once held dear. And it will all be worth it because you are the Son of Fire. You are the Warrior of Light. You will sweep aside this pretender and that one. You will be king.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: You promise these things, but you don't know. None of us know.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Let me show you.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: She leads him over to the fire.
Look into the fire, my king. Look.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I see fire.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Keep looking. Do you see? Do you see, my king?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Yes.
Speaker: STANNIS stares into the fire. His eyes grow wide and his face softens. MELISANDRE rests her head on his shoulder. Stannis

Text: WINTERFELL
Speaker: INT

Text: THEON throws another log onto his fire, and sits before it, frustrated. A lone horn blows outside the gates of Winterfell.
I will kill that man. I don't care how many arrows they feather me with, how many spears they run through me, I will kill that horn-blowing cunt before I fall.
Speaker: THEON

Text: They want you to know you're surrounded.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: I know I'm surrounded. I know that because I stood on the battlements and saw I was surrounded.
Speaker: THEON

Text: They don't want you to sleep. They want to sap your spirit before
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: Thank you, wise bald man. Thank you for explaining siege tactics to me.
Speaker: THEON

Text: The horn continues.
No word from my father?
Speaker: THEON

Text: No.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: LUWIN crosses the room, and rests.
Send more ravens.
Speaker: THEON

Text: You killed all the ravens.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: The first time I saw Winterfell
Speaker: THEON

Text: The horn blows again. THEON rolls his eyes in anger.

First time I saw Winterfell, it looked like something that had been here for thousands of years and would be here for thousands of years after I was dead. I saw it and I thought, "Of course, Ned Stark crushed our rebellion and killed my brothers. "We never stood a chance against the man who lives here."
Speaker: THEON

Text: Lord Stark went out of his way to make it your home.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: Yes, my captors were so very kind to me. You love reminding me of that. Everyone in this frozen pile of shit has always loved reminding me of that. You know what it's like to be told how lucky you are to be someone's prisoner? To be told how much you owe them? And then to go back home to your real father
Speaker: THEON

Text: The horn sounds again. THEON gets up in a fury. He shakes his fist at the window.
I will kill that man. I swear to the Drowned God, the Old Gods, the New Gods, to every fucking god in every fucking heaven, I will kill that man.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Theon, listen to me. I serve Winterfell. Now Winterfell is yours. I'm bound by oath to serve you.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: And what's your counsel, trusted friend?
Speaker: THEON

Text: Run.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: Five hundred Northmen wait outside the walls. You have 20 men. You can't win. Wait for nightfall and run.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: There's nowhere to run. I'd never make it back to the Iron Islands. And even if I did, even if by some miracle I slipped through the lines and made it home, I'd be a coward. The Greyjoy who ran. The shame of the family.
Speaker: THEON

Text: THEON sits again.
Don't go home. Join the Night's Watch.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: LUWIN leans over THEON's shoulder.
Once a man has taken the black, he's beyond reach of the law. All his past crimes are forgiven.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: I won't make it to the Wall. I won't make it 10 feet past the Winterfell gates.
Speaker: THEON

Text: There are ways. Hidden passageways built so the Lords of Winterfell could escape. The road will be dangerous. But with a little luck...
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: LUWIN faces THEON
The Night's Watch is an ancient, honorable order. You'll have opportunities there.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: THOEN rises.
The opportunity for Jon Snow to cut my throat in my sleep.
Speaker: THEON

Text: The opportunity to make amends for what you've done.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: I've done a lot, haven't I? Things I never imagined myself doing.
Speaker: THEON

Text: I've known you many years, Theon Greyjoy. You're not the man you're pretending to be. Not yet.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: You may be right. But I've gone too far to pretend to be anything else.
Speaker: THEON

Text: LUWIN comforts him with a gentle pat on the shoulder.
WINTERFELL, THE NEXT MORNING
Speaker: EXT

Text: THEON stands in the Winterfell courtyard, addressing his men.
You hear that? That's the mating call of the Northmen. They want to fuck us. Well, I haven't had a good fuck in weeks. I'm ready for one.
Speaker: THEON

Text: The ironborn men laugh.
They say every ironborn man is worth a dozen from the mainland.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Aye!
Speaker: MEN

Text: You think they're right?
Speaker: THEON

Text: Aye.
Speaker: BLACK LORREN

Text: We die today, brothers. We die bleeding from 100 wounds with arrows in our necks and spears in our guts, but our war cries will echo through eternity. They will sing about the battle of Winterfell until the Iron Islands have slipped beneath the waves. Every man, woman and child will know who we were and how long we stood. Aggar and Gelmarr, Wex and Urzen, Stygg and Black Lorren. Ironborn warriors will cry out our names as they leap onto the shores of Seagard and Faircastle.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Aye!
Speaker: MEN

Text: Mothers will name their sons for us.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Aye!
Speaker: MEN

Text: Girls will think of us with their lovers inside them.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Aye!
Speaker: MEN

Text: And whoever kills that fucking horn-blower will stand in bronze above the shores of Pyke!
Speaker: THEON

Text: Aye!
Speaker: MEN

Text: What is dead may never die!
Speaker: THEON

Text: What is dead may never die!
Speaker: MEN

Text: DAGMER hits THEON on the back of the head, knocking him unconscious. The ironborn watch him fall.
Thought he'd never shut up.
Speaker: BLACK LORREN

Text: It was a good speech. Didn't want to interrupt.
Speaker: DAGMER

Text: A man placed a hood over THEON's head.
LUWIN enters.
What is this? What are you doing?
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: DAGMER stabs LUWIN in the gut with his spear. LUWIN crumbles to the ground, groaning in sharp pain.
Let's go home.
Speaker: DAGMER

Text: Come on.
Speaker: MAN

Text: DAGMER and the ironborn exit, dragging THEON with them. LUWIN collapses.
TYRION'S CHAMBERS
Speaker: INT

Text: TYRION sits in bed, his face still bandaged
Why should I believe you?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Why would I lie about it?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: To create strife between my sister and me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Where before there was nothing but love. Ser Mandon Moore tried to kill you on your sister's orders. If it weren't for your squire's bravery, you'd be a dead man.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Pod.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Yes, my lord?
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Would it be excessive of me to ask you to save my life twice in a week?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No, my lord.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: You're a good lad. Get Bronn, tell him I want four of his most loyal gold cloaks outside my door at all times.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (nods)
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I'm afraid your friend has been relieved of his command of the City Watch. The gold cloaks are now firmly in the hands of your father or your sister. It varies from cloak to cloak.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Then my hill tribesmen.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Have gone home. Your father paid them quite handsomely. I'm afraid we won't be seeing each other for some time, my lord.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Don't want to swim too close to a drowning man? And I thought we were friends.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We are. Podrick, would you mind?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: PODRICK opens the door and SHAE enters briskly. She comes to TYRION's side and sits.
There are many who know that without you this city faced certain defeat. The king won't give you any honors, the histories won't mention you, but we will not forget.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: VARYS bows.
Come along now, Podrick.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: VARYS and PODRICK exit.
My love.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: It was good of you to come.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Good of me? Of course I come.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: SHAE reaches to adjust TYRION's bandages, but he prevents her.
I want to see you.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Believe me, you don't.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Have you looked?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: (shakes his head)
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I will be the first.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: She removes the bandages. They stick to the deep wound across TYRION's cheek. He grunts in pain. SHAE takes in the wreck of his cheek.
Well?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You are a mess.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: I'm a monster as well as a dwarf. You should charge me double.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You think I'm here for money?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: That was the arrangement we made. I pay you and you lie to me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Oh. I'm a poor little rich man and nobody loves me, so I make jokes all the time and pay them to laugh. Fuck your money. Let's leave.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Leave?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Leave King's Landing. They tried to kill you. They will try again. Going into wars, fighting soldiers, you're terrible at this. Let's take a boat to Pentos and never come back. You don't belong here.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: What would we do in Pentos?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Eat, drink, fuck, live.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: I want to go with you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: So do it. Your father, your sister, all these bad people, they can't stop you. Forget about them. Come with me.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: I can't. I do belong here. These bad people are what I'm good at. Outtalking them, outthinking them. It's what I am. And I like it. I like it more than anything I've ever done. Are you going to leave?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You have a shit memory. I am yours and you are mine.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: TYRION bursts into tears. SHAE envelops him in her arms. TYRION holds her as well.
THE RIVERLANDS
Speaker: EXT

Text: A SEPTON marries ROBB and TALISA to one another.
In the sight of the Seven, I hereby seal these two souls, binding them as one for eternity. Look upon one another and say the words.
Speaker: SEPTON

Text: Father, smith, warrior, mother ,maiden, crone, stranger.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Father, smith, warrior, mother ,maiden, crone, stranger.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: I am hers and she is mine from this day until the end of my days.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I am his and he is mine from this day until the end of my days.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: They kiss.
QARTH
Speaker: EXT

Text: DAENERYS, JORAH and KOVARRO walk through a garden. It is known.
(dothraki) A house of ghosts, Khaleesi.
Speaker: KOVARRO

Text: They come to the base of the House of the Undying.
Where are the guards?
Speaker: KOVARRO

Text: No guards. The warlocks kill with sorcery, not steel.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Let them try.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They ascend the first flight of stairs, and gaze up to the top of the tower. They cannot find an entrance.
Is this a riddle?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They circle the base. DAENERYS disappears from JORAH's view. He encounters KOVARRO instead.
Khaleesi! Khaleesi!
Speaker: JORAH

Text: INTERIOR OF THE HOUSE OF THE UNDYING
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: DAENERYS stands in darkness. She picks up a torch from the wall.
Are you trying to frighten me with magic tricks? You want me? Here I am. Are you afraid of a little girl?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: A dragon screeches. DAENERYS follows the sound up a stairwell.
SHADOWLANDS
Speaker: EXT

Text: ARYA, GENDRY and HOT PIE trek through the Shadowlands. High above them, JAQEN stands atop a steep cliff.
How did he find us?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: As they pass to the other side of the cliff, JAQEN disappears. Suddenly, he is at ground level, next to ARYA.
What are you doing here?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Waiting for you.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: How did you know we'd come this way?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: They begin to walk.
After all the things you have seen, this is your question?
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: How did you kill those guards? Was it hard?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: No harder than taking a new name, if you know the way. Show me how. I want to be able to do it, too.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: If you would learn, you must come with me.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Where?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Far and away across the Narrow Sea to Braavos.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: My dancing master was from Braavos.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: To be a dancing master is a special thing, but to be a faceless man, that is something else entirely. The girl has many names on her lips. Joffrey, Cersei, Tywin Lannister, llyn Payne, the Hound. Names to offer up to the Red God. She could offer them all one by one.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: I want to. But I can't. I need to find my brother and mother. And my sister. I need to find her, too.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Then we must part. A man has duties as well. Here.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: He offers a coin.
What is it?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A coin of great value.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Could it buy a horse?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: It is not meant for the buying of horses.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Then what good is it?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: If the day comes when you must find me again, just give that coin to any man from Braavos and say these words to him, "Valar Morghulis."
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Valar Morghulis.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: JAQEN begins to walk away
Please don't go, Jaqen.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Jaqen is dead. Say it again. Valar Morghulis.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Valar Morghulis.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Good.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: JAQEN turns away and touches his hand to his face. When he turns back, his face has changed completely.
Farewell, Arya Stark.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: JAQEN exits.
WINTERFELL
Speaker: EXT

Text: OSHA, BRAN, HODOR and RICKON leave their hiding place and enter the courtyard.
Osha, what are you doing?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: They walk through the smouldering courtyard, among bodies and wreckage. They spy Summer and Shaggydog, whimpering in an alcove. BRAN commands HODOR to bring him that way.
THE GODSWOOD OF WINTERFELL
Speaker: EXT

Text: LUWIN lays by the godswood, dying. HODOR, BRAN, OSHA and RICKON walk toward him. Rickon starts to run, and OSHA cannot catch him. LUWIN reaches out, happy to see him and BRAN. RICKON notices the great bloodstain on LUWIN's shirt.
Tell us what medicine to get from your chambers.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: We'll make you better. LUWIN I feel just fine.
Speaker: RICKON

Text: (cries)
Speaker: RICKON

Text: They burned it down. They burned everything.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Not everything. Not you. But they may come back. You have to go. Put on your warmest clothes. Pack as much food as you can carry and go north.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: North's the wrong way. And mother and brother are south. We don't know where.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: There are too many enemies in the south. Go to the Wall, to Jon. He'll look after you and let your mother know you're safe.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: I don't want to leave you.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: No more than I want to leave you. I pulled you into the world. Both of you. I've seen both your faces almost every day since. And for that, I consider myself very, very lucky. Go now with Hodor. Go on. I'll be right here.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: The four of them get up to leave, but OSHA steps back.
Osha. You must protect them. You're the only one who can. You may have to protect them against your own kind.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: I've got no great love for my own kind. I'll get you milk of the poppy. Tell me where to find it. LUWIN I don't want milk of the poppy.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: OSHA shows LUWIN her knife, and he nods his asent.
Do it quickly.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: OSHA draws her blade while looking LUWIN in the eyes.
WINTERFELL
Speaker: EXT

Text: Summer and Shaggydog walk across the fields. OSHA, RICKON, HODOR and BRAN follow. BRAN is in a cart. Behind them, Winterfell burns.
HOUSE OF THE UNDYING
Speaker: INT

Text: DAENERYS continues to search for her dragons. She follows the sound of their screeching through a door. She looks down into a pit before trying a door on the opposite side of the chamber. She goes through and the wind whistles. The large chamber has a broken roof, and snow falls. She sets down her torch, and ascends to a stage with a throne. Dragons screech again, and she does not touch the snowy throne. She walks toward the noises, and a large portal door opens before her. She exits, finding herself in a land of snow and ice. She sees a lone tent in the distance. She walks to it.
TENT
Speaker: INT

Text: DROGO sits, holding their son Rhaego
(dothraki) Moon of my life.
Speaker: DROGO

Text: DAENERYS cannot believe her eyes. She walks closer.
(dothraki)  This is dark magic, like the magic that took you from me. Took you from me before I could even Maybe I am dead and I just don't know it yet. Maybe I am with you in the Night Lands.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (dothraki) Or maybe I refused to enter the Night Lands without you. Maybe I told the Great Stallion to go fuck himself and came back here to wait for you.
Speaker: DROGO

Text: That sounds like something you would do.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS sits next to DROGO, and she caresses RHAEGO's head.
(dothraki) Or maybe it is a dream. Your dream, my dream I do not know. These are questions for wise men with skinny arms.
Speaker: DROGO

Text: DROGO And DAENERYS stare deeply into one another's eyes.
(dothraki) You are the moon of my life. That is all I know and all I need to know.
Speaker: DROGO

Text: They touch foreheads and DROGO caresses her face, gently.
(dothraki)  And if this is a dream I will kill the man who tries to wake me.
Speaker: DROGO

Text: DAENERYS looks down at RHAEGO. Dragons screech.
Until the sun rises in the west and sets in the east, until the rivers run dry and the mountains blow in the wind like leaves.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: She caresses DROGO's face and touches RHAEGO one more time. Then DAENERYS gets up a quickly walks away. DROGO is heartbroken.
HOUSE OF THE UNDYING
Speaker: INT

Text: When DAENERYS leaves the tent, she finds herself back in the House of the Undying. Her three dragons sit on a pedestal. They call out to her, excited. She walks closer, and holds out a hand for them
They miss their mother.
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: DAENERYS turns around, startled. Behind her, another PYATT PREE clone watches while she looks at the one who spoke. The two PYATTs share the dialog, speaking with one mind.
They want to be with you.
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: Do you want to be with them?
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: You will be.
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: When your dragons were born,
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: our magic was born again.
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: It is strongest in their presence.
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: And they are strongest in yours.
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: A third PYATT PREE appears in an alcove.
You will be with them, through winter, summer, winter again. Across a thousand, thousand seasons you will be with them.
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: The sound of chains turning starts to her right.
And we will be with you until time comes to an end.
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: DAENERYS finds that her wrist is chained. PYATT PREE tightens the chain that binds her. DAENERYS is confused. Another PYATT PREE pulls on a chain now attached to her other wrist. Her arms are now outstreched and straining.
Welcome home, Daenerys Stormborn.
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: This is not my home. My home is across the sea, where my people are waiting for me.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They will be waiting a long time.
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: DAENERYS turns to look at her dragons. PYATT PREE peers down at them. DAENERYS turns back to the warlock.
Dracarys.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The dragons breath smoke. Then one spurts out a burp of fire. It catches PYATT PREE's sleeve, and he starts to panic. All three dragons spit fire, past DAENERYS who experiences the ecstasy of the fire. PYATT PREE is consumed by flame. He screams horrible, and falls to the ground. DAENERYS looks back to her dragons. The chains break.
THE FAR NORTH  The wildings lead the captive JON and QHORIN on a march. YGRITTE playfully tortures JON by batting him with his sword, with the RATTLESHIRT walking behind her.
Speaker: EXT

Text: We should be there by sundown. Won't be a fun night for you. Mance knows how to make crows sing. If you know what to say, you might just make it through the night. Not talking's not the way to go.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: Careful with that. You might cut yourself.
Speaker: JON

Text: YGRITTE swings the sword again, JON feints and she misses.
Never swung a sword before, have you? You look like a baby with a rattle.
Speaker: JON

Text: Enough of that!
Speaker: RATTLESHIRT

Text: YGRITTE challenges JON. QHORIN uses the distraction to punch his captor in the face, and steal his sword. He pushes by RATTLESHIRT and attacks JON. JON falls.
Stop!
Speaker: JON

Text: Two wildlings hold QHORIN back.
Why, traitor? So you can give Mance Rayder an invitation to Castle Black?
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: Let 'em fight.
Speaker: RATTLESHIRT

Text: YGRITTE drops JON's sword for him. The wildlings release QHORIN, who charges at JON. He tries to grab his sword while scrambling away from the attack. He gets to his feet, and they battle convincingly. QUORIN forces JON to stumble into two wildlings, who push him back into the fight.
That's it? That's what you can do? You little shit.
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: QHORIN attacks again. JON counters.
Your traitor father teach you that?
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: JON goes on the attack, but QHORIN parries.
Or was it your whore mother?
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: QHORIN headbutts JON, who falls. He gathers himself and charges, disarming QHORIN. He runs Quorin through.
We are the watchers on the Wall.
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: QHORIN falls, dead.
You can tell Mance that's the man who killed Qhorin Halfhand.

Burn the body.

Text: Aye.

Text: You don't want this one coming back for you.
Speaker: RATTLESHIRT

Come along, Jon Snow.

Text: They walk together to the edge of the cliff.
Time to meet the King-beyond-the-Wall.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: She walks down the slope. JON looks back to see the wildlings burning QHORIN's body. He follows YGRITTE.
QARTH
Speaker: INT

Text: XARO sleeps with DOREAH next to him. A curved sword hooks his amulet and steals it away. XARO awakes startled and sits up.
What the
Speaker: XARO

Khaleesi, please. He said you'd never leave Qarth alive.
Speaker: DOREAH

Text: Come.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS turns and walks. XARO makes a sudden move, but JORAH draws his sword and keeps him motionless.
XARO'S SAFE
Speaker: CUT TO

Nothing.

Thank you, Xaro Xhoan Daxos. Thank you for teaching me this lesson.

I am king of Qarth. I can help you now, truly help you. We can take the Iron Throne. I'll bring you a thousand ships.

Text: Please, Khaleesi, I beg you.
Speaker: DOREAH

Text: Khaleesi!

DINING ROOM

It's all a lie.

Looks real enough to me. Real enough to buy a ship?

Is this goat?

It's moose. People shouldn't live anywhere you need to burn shit to keep warm.

If you step back and think about it, the thing about Gilly that's so interesting is
Speaker: SAM

Text: No, truly. The thing about her that I find so interesting is that after all that Craster's done to her, she's still got hope that life might get better.

It's Jon and the Halfhand. They're back.

Two blasts is wildlings. You're not fighting them alone.

Come on.

Edd!

Text: SAM stands. There is a high-pitches squeal. SAM sees figures coming towards him. He hides behind a large boulder. The figures comple closer, walking slowly. They are undead and decaying with blue eyes. An undead horse stops next to sam. A white walker rides it, and he notices SAM. SAM begins to sob. The white walker shrieks and orders his undead followers forward. There are scores of them, a seemingly endless onslaught. Another white walker is mounted behind. He also gives the order forward.

All the other wildlings for a hundred leagues have disappeared. Craster’s still here.

(Reading a letter) My brother Robert left no trueborn heirs, the boy Joffrey being born of incest between Cersei Lannister, and her brother Jaime Lannister. By right of birth, and blood, I do this day lay claim to the Iron Throne of Westeros.

I’m sending one of your cousins down to King’s Landing with my peace terms.

Janos pulls out a knife and kills the infant Barra, as his mother Mhaegen looks on.

Where is the bastard?

TITLE SEQUENCE

Water can be heard trickling down. The opening shot is of Arya, her back to the camera, sitting by a pool of water in the woods. She turns her head to the left. Then some leaves rustle, and she turns to the right. A horse whinnies, and she walks towards some other people. Many of them are gathering wood, and she joins in. Jaqen H’ghar, Rorge, and Biter watch her as she walks past their cage.
(Whispers) Boy.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Arya looks up at the cage.
(Whispers) Lovely boy.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: (Stops walking). What do you want?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A man has a thirst. The man does not drink for a day and a night. A boy could make a friend.

Text: (Walks toward the cave). I have friends.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Give us a beer. Before I skin you.

Text: A man does not choose his companions. These two, they have no courtesy. A man must ask forgiveness. (Pause). You're called Arry. (Arya nods).  This man has the honor to be Jaqen H'ghar. Once of the Free City of Lorath.

Text: Hey, you little shit. Get us beer!

Come closer. And I'll shove that stick up your bunghole and fuck you bloody.

What are gold cloaks doing this far from King's Landing?

What are you doing?

Well the thing is, (Hands back the paper), these gutter rats belong to the Night's Watch now. That puts them beyond the reach of kings and queens.

Text: The gold cloak tries to pull out his sword. Yoren quickly pulls out his dagger and puts it to the man’s leg.

It's a funny thing. People worry so much about their throats, they forget about what's down low. Now I sharpened this blade before breakfast. I could shave a spider's arse if I wanted to. Or, I could nick this artery in your leg and once it's nicked, there's no one around here who knows how to un-nick it.
Speaker: YOREN

Text: Yoren takes the gold cloak’s sword. The other gold cloak pulls his out.

We'll just keep that. Good steel is always needed on the wall. Seems you have a choice. You can die here at this crossroads a long way from home. Or you can go back to your city and tell your masters you didn't find what you were looking for.

Text: We're looking for a boy named Gendry. (Gendry and Arya look shocked). He carries a bull's head helmet. Anyone turning him over will earn the King's reward. We'll be back. With more men. (To Yoren) And I'll be taking your head home along with that bastard boy.

Text: The gold cloaks ride off. Gendry and Arya stands up. Everyone in the party turns to look at Gendry.
