Text: INT. RED KEEP

Tyrion walks through a room and into a hallway, whistling. As he opens the door to his room, Shae laughs, and he stops whistling. Shae and Varys are sitting at a table. Varys stands up, and Tyrion looks at Shae, and closes the door.
My lord.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: You make me wait a long time, but your friend keeps me company.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: We were just speaking of your bravery in the victory against the Stark auxiliary forces.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: It was quite a battle.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion walks over to the window to get some wine.
I heard you suffered a terrible head wound. The northerners are such fearsome warriors.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: And I tell him the story of how we meet.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: To find so lovely creature working in your father's kitchen. It almost beggars belief.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: (Begins to pour wine). Strange things do happen. You should taste her fish pie.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I don't think Lord Varys likes fish pie.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: How can you tell?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I can always tell.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Men like Lord Varys and I can't let our disadvantages get the best of us. We'll make a fisherman of him yet. (Takes a sip).
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I am glad your new friend was able to accompany you to the capital. Friends are such an important part of life. Unfortunate that your father didn't want her to come. But rest easy my lord, I am very good at keeping secrets for my good friends.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Your discretion is legendary, where your friends are concerned.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: How unspeakable of me to go on and on, when all you want to do is rest. I will leave you. (Kisses Shae’s hand). Welcome to Kings Landing, my dear. The city is made brighter by your presence. We have a council meeting, my lord.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Shae stands up, and walks away. Tyrion puts his hand on the door, blocking it from being opened.
I don't like threats.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Who threatened you?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I'm not Ned Stark. I understand the way this game is played.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Ned Stark was a man of honor.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: And I am not. Threaten me again and I will have you thrown into the sea.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You might be disappointed in the results. The storms come and go. The big fish eat the little fish. And I keep on paddling. Come, my lord. We shouldn't keep the queen waiting.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Tyrion opens the door. He and Varys exit. Varys closes the door behind them.
INT. SMALL COUNCIL CHAMBER
The small council sits at their table. Alton stands nearby. Cersei is reading a letter aloud.
“From this time until the end of time, we are not part of your realm, but a free and independent Kingdom of the North.” (Rips up the letter). He has more spirit than his father, I'll give him that.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You've perfected the art of tearing up papers. Give him his father's bones back, at least, as a gesture of good faith.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You'll give the Starks our reply, cousin?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I will, Your Grace.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: Did you see my brother when you were the Starks guest?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Varys and Baelish look annoyed.
I did. They have not broken his spirit, Your Grace.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: If you speak with him, tell him he's not been forgotten.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I will, Your Grace.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: Safe travels, cousin.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Alton leaves the room, followed by two gold cloaks.
You have a deft hand with diplomacy.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: If that's everything?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: (Holding a letter). A raven flew in this morning from Castle Black.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: Pycelle hands the letter to Tyrion, who unfurls it and begins reading.
Trouble with the wildlings?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: That's why they're called wildlings.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Somewhat less wild these days. It seems they've stopped killing each other and started following this King-Beyond-the-Wall.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Another king? How many is that now, Five? I've lost count.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Lord Commander asks that we send more men to man The Wall.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Perhaps he's forgotten we're fighting a war. We have no men to spare.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Cold winds are rising, and the dead rise with them.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The northerners are a superstitious people.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: Everyone but Tyrion stands up to leave.
According to the Commander, one of these dead men attacked him in his chambers. (The other stop leaving). Mormont doesn't lie.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: How do you kill a dead man?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Apparently you burn him.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: One trip to The Wall and you come back believing in grumpkins and snarks. (Walks away, followed by Varys).
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I don't know what I believe, but here's a fact for you. The Night's Watch is the only thing that separates us from what lies beyond the Wall.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I have every confidence the brave men of the Night's Watch will protect us all.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Everyone but Tyrion leaves.
BEYOND THE WALL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. CRASTER’S CAMP
Sam, Edd, and Grenn are standing at a table. Edd and Grenn are cutting food.
Then I said, if the gods wanted us to have dignity, wouldn't make us fart when we died.
Speaker: EDD

Text: We fart when we die?
Speaker: GRENN

Text: My blessed mother was holding her own when she left this world. She farted so hard, the whole bed shook.
Speaker: EDD

Text: Edd makes farting noises with his mouth as they continue to cut food. Sam looks up and watches Gilly walk past.
Seems a bit greedy for one man to have so many wives. Wouldn't two, or three, be enough for him?
Speaker: SAM

Text: We were having a serious discussion.
Speaker: EDD

Text: Grenn looks up to watch some of the women.
Would you look at that.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: Nothing like the sight of a woman walking away.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I prefer watching them come towards me.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: I'm sure that's nice too.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Well, there was a milkmaid named Violet on the next farm over from where I grew up. And we were wrestling together from the time we were six years old. And then we got older, the wrestling, uh, (laughs), changed.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: You were with her? How many times?
Speaker: SAM

Text: Well, as many times as I could.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: Wish I'd grew up on a farm.
Speaker: SAM

Text: We need more potatoes. And get another sack for the sludge. (Sam begins to walk away). Get the turnips too.
Speaker: EDD

Text: As Sam continues walking, a dog barks. Then a woman screams. Sam turns around to see Gilly backed up against a fence post. Ghost stands in front of her, eyeing the meat she is carrying. Sam begins slowly walking over.
No. Ghost, no. No. Ghost, away. Shoo. Shoo! (Ghost walks away). (To Gilly)  You all right? Did he frighten you?
Speaker: SAME

Text: Sam reaches out to touch Gilly, but she flinches back.
You shouldn't touch me.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Oh, oh. Right. I'm sorry. I just wanted to make sure you weren't hurt. (Long pause).
Speaker: SAM

Text: You're very brave.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: The camera moves to a shot of Jon sharpening his sword. He stops and looks up as Sam and Gilly approach him.
What’re you doing?
Speaker: JON

Text: This is Gilly, she's one of Craster's daughters.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Hello, Gilly. What’re you doing?
Speaker: JON

Text: Sam said you could help.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I'm sorry, Sam knows we're not supposed to -
Speaker: JON

Text: She's pregnant. (Gilly encourages Sam to continue). We have to take her with us, when we leave.
Speaker: SAM

Text: What? (Stands up).
Speaker: JON

Text: I know it sounds a bit mad.
Speaker: SAM

Text: No it doesn't sound a bit mad, it's impossible.
Speaker: JON

Text: The Lord Commander, (Jon tries and fails to interrupt Sam), we are sworn to protect -
Speaker: SAM

Text: Sam we can't take her -
Speaker: JON

Text: Please sir, please. I can still run if I have to.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: It's just not possible.
Speaker: JON

Text: I'm going to have a baby, if it's a boy I…
Speaker: GILLY

Text: If it's a boy what? (Gilly looks around and then down, not answering). You want us to risk our lives for you, and you won't even tell us why.
Speaker: JON

Text: Gilly looks taken aback, and then runs off.
Why did you do that?
Speaker: SAM

Text: Do what, ask her a question?
Speaker: JON

Text: You were cruel.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Cruel! Sam are you in such a hurry to lose a hand?
Speaker: JON

Text: I didn't touch her!
Speaker: SAM

Text: No you just want to steal her. What do you think Craster cuts off for that?
Speaker: JON

Text: I can't steal her, she's a person not a goat.
Speaker: SAM

Text: We're heading deeper and deeper into wildling territory. We can't take a girl with us. Mormont wouldn't have it. And even if he would, what would we do with her? Who's gonna deliver her baby? You?
Speaker: JON

Text: I could try. (Jon looks down, annoyed). What? I've read about it. A bit.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I'm sorry Sam, we can't help her.
Speaker: JON

Text: Jon sits back down, and returns to sharpening his sword. Sam walks away. When Sam is gone, Jon sighs deeply.
ESSOS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. DESERT

The camera pans across Daenerys’s people, many of whom appear tired and weak. Jorah and Daenerys sit near each other. After looking out for a few moments, Jorah takes a sip of his water, and then sighs. Then a horse can be heard approaching. Jorah looks up at it, and it is shown to be riderless.
Khaleesi.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Daenerys looks up at the horse. Jorah gets up. The horse is covered in red paint. Jorah walks over to it. A soaking wet sack is attached to it. Some hair can be seen poking out of the top. Flies can be heard buzzing. Jorah feels the hair, and Daenerys gets up from where she was sitting to approach the horse. Jorah pulls the object in the sack out a little bit by the hair, revealing it to be a human head. He then puts it back in the sack. Jorah picks up the ponytail of the head, which has been cut off.
You don't need to see this.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: He is blood of my blood.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Daenerys looks in the sack, and then quickly looks away.
Who did this?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Khal Pono perhaps, Khal Jhaqo They don't like the idea of a woman leading a Khalasaar.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: They will like it far less when I'm done with them.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Irri walks over and sees the head. She then falls to her knees, crying.
No! (Speaking Dothraki, to Daenerys) They killed his soul!
Speaker: IRRI

Text: (Speaking Dothraki) Shh. They cannot kill his soul.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (Speaking Dothraki) They did! They butchered him like an animal. They did not burn his body. (Daenerys kneels to Irri’s level). He can never join his ancestors in the night lands.
Speaker: IRRI

Text: (Speaking Dothraki) Shh. We will build him a funeral pyre.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Daenerys looks up at Jorah. Jorah looks down. Daenerys addresses Irri again, holding her head.
(Speaking Dothraki) And I promise you, Rakharo will ride with his ancestors tonight.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Daenerys continues to comfort Irri as she cries. Irri wails loudly.
IRON ISLANDS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. BOAT
Theon stands on a boat, looking out at the Iron Islands. He smiles. The camera then cuts to him below deck. A naked woman lies in his bed. He walks towards the windows.
Is it as you remember my lord?
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: (Removes his jacket). Looks smaller.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Everything looks bigger when you're a child. I remember my father's cabin, felt like a palace when I was little. Now look at it.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: (Removes more of his clothes). They'll be waiting for me on the docks.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Who will?
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: Anyone who matters, (Takes off his shirt), this is a big day for them. They haven't had much to get excited about since I left. It's a hard place the Iron Islands always has been. It's cold and it's wet.
Speaker: THEON

Text: I love the cold and wet.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: They say hard places breed hard men, (Unbuttons his pants), and hard men rule the world.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Then you'll be king before long.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: (Kneels down). Try smiling with your lips closed. (She does). Hmm, better.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Theon stands up and roughly pushes her back onto the bed.
My father doesn't trust you Iron islanders.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: (Taking off his pants). I don't blame him.
Speaker: THEON

Text: He says that you're all reavers and rapers. And that no matter how many women you have, you'll never be satis-
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: The woman groans as they begin having sex.
Quit talking about your father. He's right about us. Our wives from the Iron Islands, they're for breeding. That's not enough for us. That's why we take saltwives, from the women we capture.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Capture me! Take me with you when you go ashore. Make me your saltwife.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: Your place is on this ship.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Not after you leave. Father will punish me. He'll call me a whore.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: I haven't paid you.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Theon flips her over, and they continue having sex.
KING’S LANDING
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. BROTHEL

A prostitute and a man are having sex. A man is watching them through a small hole, while he himself is getting a blowjob. He holds some keys in his hand, which are jingling as he pushes the prostitute’s head. Baelish, in turn, is watching this man. He hears a noise and turns around, then covers the hole he was watching through. A man emerges from another room. A woman can be heard crying from inside.
I barely touched her. And you charge twice as much as every other brothel. And this is what I get, crying.
Speaker: MAN

Text: One moment, my friend. A moment.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Baelish snaps his fingers, and a woman emerges from another room, covered only in gold jewelry. Out of sight, Baelish wipes some semen from her face with a cloth, and then turns back to the disgruntled man.
Please accept my sincerest apologies. Ramka will take good care of you.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Upon seeing Ramka, the man smiles. As they begin to kiss passionately, Baelish goes to investigate the crying woman. He enters the room to see Roz, curled up on the bed, crying. He walks over to her, putting a hand on her back, and then sits next to her.
I’m sorry, my lord.
Speaker: ROZ

Text: Shhh. Did he hurt you?
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: No, my lord… It’s Mhaegen.
Speaker: ROZ

Text: Who?
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: She works for you. She's the one, the girl whose, they killed her baby.
Speaker: ROZ

Text: Ah, yes, that was poorly handled. Sometimes those with the most power have the least grace.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Can't stop thinking about it, I can't sleep. Her poor little baby.
Speaker: ROZ

Text: You know, you remind me of another girl. A lovely thing I once acquired from an Elysium pleasure house. Beautiful, like yourself, and intelligent as yourself. But she wasn't happy. She cried, often. I asked her why but, we didn't have the kind of rapport that you and I have. Yes, it was quite sad. Girls from Elysium pleasure houses are expensive. Extremely expensive. And this one wasn't making me any money. I hate bad investments. Really, I do. They haunt me. I had no idea how to make her happy, no idea how to mitigate my losses. A very wealthy patron, he offered me a tremendous amount of money to let him transform this lovely, sad girl. To use her in ways that never occur to most men. And you know what occurs to most men. I would not say he succeeded in making her happy but my losses were definitely mitigated. (Stands up). Take tonight off to mourn Mhaegen’s child. I’ll see you tomorrow. But you’ll be happy? (Roz nods and smiles). That makes me happy.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: INT. DINING ROOM
More wine?
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: The scene begins zoomed in on Podrick pouring Janos a glass of wine. He then spills, and we see Tyrion and Janos sitting at a table.
Damn it, boy!
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Apologies, my lord.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Leave us, Podrick. I believe we know how to pour our own wine.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (Podrick leaves). Is that your new squire? Could have found you a proper lad.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Myself, I prefer the improper ones.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Hmm, that's a good red. Dornish?
Speaker: JANOS

Text: You know your wines, my lord.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: That I do. A fine dinner, my lord.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Call me Tyrion, please. I'm sure you're getting used to fine dinners, now that you're a lord.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Maybe I'll hire this cook of yours.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Wars have been started for less.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They both laugh. Janos sips his wine.
I heard there was some trouble in Littlefinger's brothel the other night.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Hmm. Nasty business, had to be done.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Yes, of course. City Watch must keep the peace. Only, I hadn't realized peace depended on killing babies.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Orders are orders.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Quite right. Especially the queen's orders.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I never said they were the queen's orders.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: No, but who else would want to murder King Robert's bastards? She's always been a jealous woman.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You know your sister better than I do.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: You've heard the awful rumors about my brother and sister.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I don't listen to filth.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: That's good of you, but you have heard them. I suppose people who do believe that filth, consider Robert's bastards to be better claimants to the throne than Cersei's children.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Joffrey is my king, the rest doesn't interest me. (Sips his wine).
Speaker: JANOS

Text: I appreciate your loyalty. Tell me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: When your men slaughtered Ned Stark's men in the throne room, did you give the order?
I did. And I would again. The man was a traitor. He tried to buy my loyalty.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: The fool! He had no idea you were already bought.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Are you drunk? I'll not have my honor questioned by an Imp.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: I'm not questioning your honor, Lord Janos. I'm denying its existence.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You think I'll stand here and take this from you, dwarf.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Dwarf? You should have stopped at imp. And yes, you will stand here and take it from me, unless you'd like to take it from my friend here.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion gestures towards Bronn, who has appeared in the room.
I intend to serve as Hand of the King until my father returns from the war, and seeing as you betrayed the last Hand of the King, well, I just wouldn't feel safe with you lurking about.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The queen regent. And you're a fool to believe she's your friend.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We shall hear what Joffrey has to say about this.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: No, we shan't.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion nods at Bronn, who gestures for some armed men to enter the room.

There's a ship leaving for East Watch by the sea tonight. From there, I'm afraid it's rather a long walk to Castle Black. I hope you enjoy the Wall. I found it surprisingly beautiful, in a brutal, horribly uncomfortable sort of way.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The lads will escort you. The streets aren't safe at night, my lord.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: These men are under my command. (Bronn laughs). I command you to arrest this cutthroat.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: His name is Bronn... and he is the new commander of the City Watch.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Boys?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: The gold cloaks in the room escort Janos out. Janos begins shouting as they take him.
I have friends at court! Powerful friends! The king himself made me a lord!
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Janos is escorted out of view. Bronn sits down, and Tyrion pours him a cup of wine.
To the new Commander.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion and Bronn clink their glasses together. Then they both sip.
If I told you to murder, an infant girl say, still at her mother's breast, would you do it without question?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Without question? No. I'd ask how much.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: WOODS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. CAMP NEXT TO A RIVER
Gendry gathers some water in a bucket. Lommy and Hot Pie sit next to the river, washing things. Arya sits away from them, doing the same.
If they come back, I say we yield. Gendry's the one they want. I don't want to get caught in the middle of a battle.
Speaker: LOMMY

Text: I'm not afraid of no battles.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: If you got within a mile of a battle, you'd fill your pants.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I've seen lots of battles. I saw -
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Liar.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I saw a man kill another man just outside a tavern in Flea Bottom. Stabbed him right in the neck.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Two men fighting isn't a battle.
Speaker: LOMMY

Text: They had armor on.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: So?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: So, if they got armor on, it's a battle.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: No, it isn't.
Speaker: LOMMY

Text: What's a dyer's apprentice know about battles anyway?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: (Gendry walks over to get more water). Gendry's an armorer's apprentice. Hot Pie, tell Gendry what makes it a battle.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: (Hesitates) It's when they've got armor on.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Now who told you that.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: A knight?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: How'd you know he was a knight?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Well, cause he got armor on.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: You don't have to be a knight to have armor. Any idiot can buy armor. (Arya smiles).
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: How'd you know?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: ‘Cause I sold armor.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Lommy nudges Hot Pie, and they both get up and leave. Arya stops washing and stands up, walking over to Gendry.
What do the gold cloaks want with you?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: (Turning around) No idea.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: You're a liar.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: (Walking to camp fire). You shouldn't insult people that are bigger than you.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Then I wouldn't get to insult anyone. (Follows him).
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Well, I don’t care what any of them want. No good's ever come of their questions.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: No good's ever come? Who asked questions before?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: How can someone so small be such a huge pain in my ass?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Who asked questions?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The Hand of the King. Er, hands of the King. Lord Arryn came first, a few weeks before he died. And then Lord Stark came, a few weeks before he died.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Lord Stark.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: See? Asking me questions is bad luck. (Walks back to river). You'll probably be dead soon.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: What did they ask about?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: My mom.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Who's your mom?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Just my mom. Worked in a tavern. Died when I was little.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: And who was your father?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: He could be one of those gold-hatted bastards, for all I know. What about you, anyway? You thought they were after you, why? Did you kill someone, or is it just because you're a girl?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I'm not a girl!
Speaker: ARYA

Text: (Walks back to camp fire). Yes you are. You think I'm as stupid as the rest of them?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Stupider. Night's Watch doesn't take girls, everyone knows that.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: That's true. You're still a girl.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I am not!
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Well, pull your cock out and take a piss then.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I don't need to take a piss… Lommy and Hot Pie can’t know. No one can know.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: They won't. Not from me.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: My name's not Arry. It's Arya. Of House Stark. Yoren is taking me home to Winterfell.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: He was your father. The Hand. The traitor.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: He was never a traitor! Joffrey is a liar.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: So you're a highborn, then. You're a lady.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: No. I mean yes. My mother was a lady, and my sister -
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You were a lord's daughter and you lived in a castle. Look, all that about cocks. I should never have said that. I've been pissing in front of you and everything. I should be calling you milady.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Do not call me milady.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: As milady commands. (Arya pushes him). Well, that was unladylike.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Arya pushes Gendry to the ground. He laughs, and she stomps off.
IRON ISLANDS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. DOCKSThe scene starts with a wide shot of the busy docks. Theon stands in a rowboat as is comes up against the side of a wall. He gets out and walks up some stairs. An old man spots him.
What you carrying?
Speaker: MAN

Text: Pears and oranges. Wine from the Arbor. And the heir to Pyke of the Iron Islands. (The man makes no response). The only living son of Balon Greyjoy. (The man continues to make no response). Me.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Don't like wine. Woman's drink. (Returns to his work).
Speaker: MAN

Text: I need to get to Pyke.
Speaker: THEON

Text: The man looks up, but makes no move or response. Theon looks annoyed and pulls out some coins.
I'll find you a horse.
Speaker: MAN

Text: The man takes the coins and walks away. Theon watches as the rowboat that took him there leaves. He looks down.
I'm heading that way. I can take you there.
Speaker: YARA

Text: I bet you can.
Speaker: THEON

Text: You been at sea long? Or were there just no women where you came from?
Speaker: YARA

Text: None like you.
Speaker: THEON

Text: You don't know what I'm like.
Speaker: YARA

Text: You don't know what you're like. You need someone to teach you. Know who I am?
Speaker: THEON

Text: You think I offer free rides to every man in jewelry. Lord Greyjoy.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Yara and Theon pass the man as they are walking. He is leading a horse. Theon gives him some more coins.
Have my things sent up to the castle.
Speaker: THEON

Text: EXT. BEACH
Yara and Theon ride on horseback on a beach. Yara is at the reins.
You should give me the reins, I'm a better rider than you. I've been on horseback for the last nine years.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Nine years. Do you still know your way around a ship? Have these hands ever touched a rope?
Speaker: YARA

Text: Don't you worry about my hands. (Theon begins fondling her). The sea's in my blood.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Your blood will be in the sea if I don't watch where I'm going.
Speaker: YARA

Text: I have a proposal for my father. One that will make him king again. And me after him. You may stay at the castle tonight, if you're lucky.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Is that an offer from my future king?
Speaker: YARA

Text: An order, from your future king. You can tell your grandchildren about this night.
Speaker: THEON

Text: I don't imagine it will be a story fit for children.
Speaker: YARA

Text: As they approach the castle, the camera pans up to view it in its entirety.
INT. INSIDE PYKE
Balon sits in front of a fireplace. Theon enters the room.
Father.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Nine years, is it? They took a frightened boy. What have they given back?
Speaker: BALON

Text: A man. Your blood and your heir.
Speaker: THEON

Text: We shall see. Stark had you longer than I did.
Speaker: BALON

Text: Lord Stark is gone.
Speaker: THEON

Text: And how do you feel about that?
Speaker: BALON

Text: What's done is done. I've brought you a proposal from Robb Stark.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Who gave you those clothes? (Stands up).  Was it Ned Stark's pleasure to make you his daughter?
Speaker: BALON

Text: If my clothes offend you, I will change them.
Speaker: THEON

Text: It will. (Begins walking forward). That bauble around your neck. Did you pay the iron price for it or the gold? (Theon looks down). I asked a question. Did you pull it from the neck of a corpse you made or did you buy it to match your fine clothes? Iron or gold?
Speaker: BALON

Text: Gold.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Balon reaches out and rips the bauble off. Theon’s cloak falls to the ground.
I'll not have my son dressed as a whore. (Balon walks towards the fireplace and looks into it). My fears have come true. The Starks have made you theirs.
Speaker: BALON

Text: (Steps forward). My blood is salt and iron.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Yet, (Turns around), the Stark boy sends you to me like a trained raven, clutching his message.
Speaker: BALON

Text: The offer he makes, is one I proposed.
Speaker: THEON

Text: He heeds your counsel?
Speaker: BALON

Text: I've lived with him, hunted with him, fought at his side, he thinks of me as a brother.
Speaker: THEON

Text: No, not here, (Walks forward), not in my hearing, you will not name him brother. This son of the man who put your true brothers to the sword. Or have you forgotten your own blood?
Speaker: BALON

Text: I forget nothing. I remember my brothers. And I remember when my father was a king.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Theon holds a letter out. Balon takes it and turns around. He then unfurls it and reads it.
I see. I destroy Robb Stark's enemies for him and he will make me King of the Iron Islands once again.
Speaker: BALON

Text: I will lead the attack myself.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Oh, you will?
Speaker: BALON

Text: I'm your son. Your only living heir. Who else?
Speaker: THEON

Text: Someone enters the room. Balon looks behind Theon, and he turns to look as well.
I told you to wait outside. (The person who entered is revealed to be Yara). How did you get past the guards?
Speaker: THEON

Text: Anything with a cock is easy to fool.
Speaker: YARA

Text: (Puts his arm around her). My dear.
Speaker: BALON

Text: Yara?
Speaker: THEON

Text: So good to see you, brother. This is a homecoming I'll tell my grandchildren about.
Speaker: YARA

Text: She can't lead an attack!
Speaker: THEON

Text: And why not?
Speaker: BALON

Text: You're a woman!
Speaker: THEON

Text: You're the one in skirts.
Speaker: YARA

Text: This isn't Winterfell, boy. Your sister took over command of your eldest brother's ship after your new father killed him.
Speaker: BALON

Text: (Theon joins a little late). What's dead may never die.
Speaker: ALL THREE

Text: The only night she's spent off these islands has been spent on the sea. She's commanded men. She's killed men. She knows who she is.
Balon leans down and burns the letter in the fire. Yara smirks at Theon.
(Watching the letter burn in his hand). No man gives me a crown. I pay the iron price. I will take my crown. (Throws the letter in the fire). That is who I am. That is who we have always been.
Speaker: BALON

Text: Balon walks away. Yara follows him. Theon turns around to watch them leave.
You won't stand a chance against the Lannisters on your own.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Who said anything about the Lannisters?
Speaker: BALON

Text: DRAGONSTONE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. BEACH
Davos and Salladhor Saan walk on a beach. Matthos follows closely behind them..
You'll have your gold when we take the treasury at King's Landing.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: All these kings fighting for the throne, and this Stannis has the smallest army. Why would I bet on the man with the worst chance?
Speaker: SAAN

Text: Because you're a smart gambler. Stannis has proved himself in war. Twice. His baby brother has never set foot on a battlefield. Neither has the false king, Joffrey.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: And yet, they both have larger armies.
Speaker: SAAN

Text: Stannis has just begun the fight. His bannermen will rally to his cause. There's no man in the Seven Kingdoms more honorable than Stannis Baratheon. Or more worthy of loyalty.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: What is the world coming to when smugglers must vouch for the honor of kings.
Speaker: SAAN

Text: Mind your words, pirate. (They all stop walking).
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: Matthos.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You think I'm insulted? I am a pirate. I'm an excellent pirate. I don't sail for promises.
Speaker: SAAN

Text: Of course you do. Every time you leave harbor, you're leaving on a promise. A promise that somewhere on the seas, somebody's got some gold and you can take it from them.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: That's a promise that always comes true.
Speaker: SAAN

Text: As is mine. You're not the young man, Salladhor. And correct me if I'm wrong: Most pirates don't grow old.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Only the clever ones.
Speaker: SAAN

Text: You want to spend your last few years on the sea, stealing from Pentoshi cheesemongers and Midanese silk merchants, then go. They're out there waiting for you. That's easy. What I'm offering you is hard. Come with me and plunder the greatest city in Westeros. You'll be the richest man in Lysene. And the most famous. They'll be singing songs about you as long as men have voices to sing.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Salladhor Saan is a good name for songs.
Speaker: SAAN

Text: It is. (Matthos rolls his eyes).
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: One thing, I want the queen.
Speaker: SAAN

Text: The queen?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Cersei, I want her. I'll sail with your fleet, all 30 of my ships, and if we don't drown at the bottom of Blackwater Bay, I will fuck this blonde queen and I will fuck her well.
Speaker: SAAN

Text: This war isn't about you. We're not attacking King's Landing so that you can rape the queen.
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: I'm not going to rape her, I'm going to fuck her.
Speaker: SAAN

Text: As if she would just let you!
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: You don't know how persuasive I am. I never tried to fuck you.
Speaker: SAAN

Text: Stannis is the rightful king, and the Lord of Light. The one true god.
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: I've been all over the world, my boy, and everywhere I go, people tell me about the true god. They all think they found the right one. The one true god is what's between a woman's legs, and better yet a queen's legs.
Speaker: SAAN

Text: Matthos walks away angrily. Saan turns back to Davos.
I never thought you'd have a true believer for a son.
Speaker: SAAN

Text: He's young yet. I promise you the gold. I promise you the glory. I cannot promise you the queen.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You believe your king can win?
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: He is the one true king.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You Westerosee are funny people. A man chops off your fingers and you fall in love with him. (They laugh). I'll sail with you, Davos Seaworth. You are the most honest smuggler I ever met. Make me rich.
Speaker: SAAN

Text: Get me to the gates of King's Landing and I will.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: They shake hands. Davos pats Saan on the back as he walks away. Saan and Matthos eye each other as Saan walks past. Matthos walks back over to his father.
When will the King have a sail?
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: As soon as his God wills it.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: He's my God too, and yours. But you were too blind to see. (As they walk). Let me teach you how to read.
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: Oh you and your mother.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: It won't take long. You already know the letters. The holy books are much more persuasive than I can be.
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: I wish I had a God, truly! I'm not mocking you, but I've seen men pray to every God there is. Pray for wind, pray for rain, pray for home. None of it works!
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: But you always came home.
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: I wasn't praying.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: (They reach their horses). But I was. Every night that you were at sea, I lit a candle and I prayed, for you.
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: You want me to have a god, fine. King Stannis is my god. He raised me up and blessed me with his trust. He gave you a future I could never have imagined. You know how to read, you'll be a knight someday. You think your fire god commanded all that? It was Stannis. Only Stannis.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: (As Davos is mounting his horse). Stannis is my king, but he's only a man.
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: Don't tell him that.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Davos rides away and Matthos watches. In the background, Saan’s boat is in the water.
KING’S LANDING
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. TYRION’S ROOM
Tyrion sits at a table with a cup of wine. Cersei paces in front of him.
Lord Janos Slynt was Commander of the City Watch. You had no right to exile him.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I have every right. I am the King's Hand.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You're serving as the King's Hand until father gets here. I am Queen Regent.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Listen to me, Queen Regent, you're losing the people. Do you hear me?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Ha, the people. You think I care?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You might find it difficult to rule over millions who want you dead. Half the city will starve when winter comes. The other half will plot to overthrow you. And your gold-plated thugs just gave them the rallying cry, “The Queen slaughters babies.” (Cersei says nothing). You don't even have the decency to deny it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Cersei looks down and walks toward the window. Tyrion looks down, and then up at her.
It wasn't you who gave the order, was it? Joffrey didn't even tell you. Or did he tell you? I imagine that would be even worse.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: He did what needed to be done. (Now loudly). You want to be the Hand of the King? You want to rule? This is what ruling is! Lying on a bed of weeds, ripping them out by the root one by one before they strangle you in your sleep.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I'm no king, but I think there's more to ruling that that.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I don't care what you think! You've never taken it seriously. You haven't, Jaime hasn't. (Sits down). It's all fallen on me.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: (Tries not to laugh). As has Jaime repeatedly, according to Stannis Baratheon.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You're funny. (Laughs). You've always been funny. But none of your jokes will ever match the first one, will they? You remember... back when you ripped my mother open on your way out of her and she bled to death.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: She was my mother too.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Now they're gone, for the sake of you. There's no bigger joke in the world than that. (Storms out).
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: DRAGONSTONE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. DRAGONSTONE KEEP
Davos moves some ships around on a model map of Westeros as Matthos looks on. Stannis enters with Melisandre.
Your Grace.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: How did it fare with your pirate?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Salladhor Saan will join our fleet. 30 ships. His men know how to fight.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: In my experience, pirates prefer fighting unarmed men.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Does seem the wiser choice.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: It won't be a choice this time. Do you trust him?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Salladhor Saan is an old friend, I've known him 30 years. I've never trusted him.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: But once he gets the smell of gold, he never stops.
Well if he does his job, he'll have his share. Leave us.

Text: EXT. CRASTER’S KEEP

Jon is sitting by a fire. He hears a noise and looks behind himself, seeing Craster walking away from the camp with a baby. Jon gets up to follow Craster and investigate, and walks into the woods. He begins hearing strange noises, and hides when he sees Craster walking back, without the baby. When Craster is out of sight, he runs in the direction Craster came from. He sees a figure lean down and pick up the baby. He is then startled by Craster, who puts his hand on Jon’s shoulder, and then knocks Jon out.

Text: You know, we've got something in common, me and you. You know that? I must have been a couple of years older than you. I saw my brother stabbed through the heart right on our doorstep. He weren't much of a villain what skewered him. Willem, the lad's name was. He ran off before anyone could spit. And I just stood there, watching my brother die. Here's the funny part. I can't picture my brother's face anymore. But Willem, oh, he was a nice-looking boy. He had good white teeth, blue eyes, one of those dimpled chins all the girls like. I would think about him when I was working, when I was drinking, when I was having a shit. It got to the point where I would say his name every night before I went to bed. Willem. Willem. Willem. A prayer almost. Well, one day, Willem came riding back into town. I buried an ax so deep into Willem's skull they had to bury him with it. Willem's horse got me to the Wall and I've been wearing black ever since. Well... That'll help you sleep, eh?

Text: EXT. OUTSIDE OXCROSS
Thunder rumbles through the darkness. It is raining at the gold cloak encampment. Two gold cloaks are arguing over who is the best fighter.
It's got to be the Mountain. He's the biggest. He's the strongest.
Speaker: GUARD #1

Text: Bulls are bigger than lions. Doesn't mean I'd pick a bull in a fight.
Speaker: RENNICK

Text: If the bull had fangs and claws, I would. Right, the Mountain or our man Jaime.
Speaker: GUARD #1

Text: If he ever gets out.
Speaker: RENNICK

Text: Loras Tyrell?
Speaker: GUARD #1

Text: Loras Tyrell. He's prettier than the Queen.
Speaker: RENNICK

Text: I don't care about pretty. He's better with a sword than any of them.
Speaker: GUARD #1

Text: How good could he be? He's been stabbing Renly Baratheon for years, and Renly ain't dead.
Speaker: RENNICK

Text: They laugh, and a horse neighs nervously.
The horses seem a little spooked to you? They're horses.
Speaker: RENNICK

Text: They get spooked by their own shadows.
Speaker: GUARD #1

Text: Shh. Do you hear that?
Speaker: RENNICK

Text: No.
Speaker: GUARD #1

Text: There's something out there.
Speaker: RENNICK

Text: The soldiers both stand to investigate the darkness. They move forward cautiously, until RENNICK lets out a loud fart. GUARD #1 jumps, and RENNICK laughs raucously.
Oh. Oh, you're a right little prick. You should see your face.
Speaker: GUARD #1

Text: I swear you pissed yourself. "Oh, who goes there? Ahh!"
Speaker: RENNICK

Text: There is something out there.
Speaker: GUARD #1

Text: Yeah, don't even try me.
Speaker: RENNICK

Text: Rennick.
Speaker: GUARD #1

Text: Do you think I'm an idiot?
Speaker: RENNICK

Text: Rennick!
Speaker: GUARD #1

Text: GUARD #1 draws his sword. A direwolf leaps from the darkness and attacks RENNICK. The camera focuses on ROBB's face in the darkness as RENNICK screams. ROBB and his northern men sit quietly on their horses, listening as a pack of wolves descends upon the Lannister men.
King in the North!
Speaker: MAN

Text: The King in the North!
Speaker: MEN

Text: EXT. The battlefield, the next morning.

The northern forces have completed their assault on the emcampment. The camera pans across bodies and wounded men in the mist. Horses niegh and soldiers cry out in pain. ROOSE and ROBB walk through the aftermath, followed by a handful of northern soldiers.
Five Lannisters dead for every one of ours. They're dead. Take everything they've got. We've nowhere to keep all these prisoners. Barely enough food to feed our own.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: We're not executing prisoners, Lord Bolton.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Of course, Your Grace. The officers will be useful. Some of them may be privy to Tywin Lannister's plans.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: I doubt it.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Well, we'll learn soon enough. In my family, we say, "A naked man has few secrets. "A flayed man none."
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: My father outlawed flaying in the North.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: We're not in the North.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: We're not torturing them.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: The high road's very pretty, but you'll have a hard time marching your army down it.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: The Lannisters hold prisoners of their own. I won't give them an excuse to abuse my sisters.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: No, don't! Don't! Please!
Speaker: WOUNDED SOLDIER

Text: Shhh
Speaker: TALISA

Text: A WOUNDED SOLDIER struggles as TALISA removes his tattered pants and tries to tend his bloody legs while another woman tries to help.
The rot's set in.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: No, don't! No, don't!
Speaker: WOUNDED SOLDIER

Text: Shh.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Please, don't! It'll get better. It doesn't even hurt.
Speaker: WOUNDED SOLDIER

Text: The rot will spread. If we don't take the foot now
Speaker: TALISA

Text: No, you can't!
Speaker: WOUNDED SOLDIER

Text: ROBB approaches, looking concerned as he struggles. ROBB kneels and holds the man down.
Ser! Please, ser.  I can't lose
Speaker: WOUNDED SOLDIER

Text: You'll die if she doesn't.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I don't want to be a cripple, please.
Speaker: WOUNDED SOLDIER

Text: Surely one of our men needs your attention more than this cub.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Your men are not my men, my lord.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Put this in your mouth and lie down. You don't want to watch.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: No! You can't!
Speaker: WOUNDED SOLDIER

Text: Bite on it. It's better than biting your own tongue, believe me.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: ROBB holds the WOUNDED SOLDIER down as TALISA saws off his foot. He screams through the gag that ROBB placed in his mouth. Robb watches the resigned TALISA saw through, impressed by her resolve.
Another part of the battleflield.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: A mounted soldier rides slowly, carrying the Stark banner. TALISA readies the cart, carrying a wounded man. It starts forward, and TALISA looks exhausted. ROBB looks over at her. She notices, and turns. ROBB approaches.
What's your name?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Talisa.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Your last name?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: You want to know what side my family fights on?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: You know my family name. You have me at a disadvantage.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: That boy lost his foot on your orders.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: They killed my father.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: That boy did?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: The family he fights for.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Do you think he's friends with King Joffrey? He's a fisherman's son that grew up near Lannisport. He probably never held a spear before they shoved one in his hands a few months ago.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: I have no hatred for the lad.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: That should help his foot grow back.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: TALISA walks away in frustration, carrying a heavy pail. ROBB follows.
You'd have us surrender, end all this bloodshed. I understand. The country would be at peace and life would be just under the righteous hand of good King Joffrey.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: You're going to kill Joffrey?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: If the gods give me strength.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: And then what?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: I don't know. We'll go back to Winterfell. I have no desire to sit on the Iron Throne.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: So who will?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: I don't know.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: You're fighting to overthrow a king, and yet you have no plan for what comes after?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: First we have to win the war.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Frustrated, TALISA climbs onto a horse's cart, and signals it to start off.
You never told me where you're from.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Volantis.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Volantis? You're far from home. The boy was lucky you were here.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: He was unlucky that you were.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: TALISA rides away, and they both watch one another as she gets further and further away.
EXT. KING'S LANDING
INT. THRONE ROOM
JOFFREY aims a crossbow at a kneeling SANSA while the HOUND stands by.
You're here to answer for your brother's latest treasons.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Your Grace, whatever my traitor brother has done, I had no part. You know that. I beg you, please
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Ser Lancel, tell her of this outrage.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: LANCEL address the room, which is taken aback by his recounting.
Using some vile sorcery, your brother fell on Stafford Lannister with an army of wolves. Thousands of good men were butchered. After the slaughter, the Northmen feasted on the flesh of the slain.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: Killing you would send your brother a message.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: (Cries.)
Speaker: SANSA

Text: But my mother insists on keeping you alive. Stand. So we'll have to send your brother a message some other way. Meryn.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: MERYN TRANT approaches SANSA.
Leave her face. I like her pretty.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: SANSA looks aghast at JOFFREY. MERYN punches her full-force in the stomach and she doubles over in pain. JOFFREY looks on cruelly as MERYN cuts SANSA's legs out from under her. She falls to the floor, wailing.
Meryn, my lady is overdressed. Unburden her.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: MERYN rips SANSA's dress from the back. She cries in anguish.
If you want Robb Stark to hear us, we're going to have to speak louder.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: MERYN raises his sword to hit SANSA.
What is the meaning of this?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: MERYN holds, while TYRION and BRONN enter the throne room. JOFFREY looks worried.
What kind of knight beats a helpless girl?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The kind who serves his king, Imp.
Speaker: MERYN

Text: Careful, now. We don't want to get blood all over your pretty white cloak.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Someone get the girl something to cover herself with. She is to be your queen. Have you no regard for her honor?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm punishing her.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: For what crimes? She did not fight her brother's battle, you half-wit.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You can't talk to me like that. The king can do as he likes!
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: The Mad King did as he liked. Has your Uncle Jaime ever told you what happened to him?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No one threatens His Grace in the presence of the Kingsguard.
Speaker: MERYN

Text: I'm not threatening the king, ser. I am educating my nephew. Bronn, the next time Ser Meryn speaks, kill him. That was a threat. See the difference?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: MERYN stares daggers at TYRION. TYRION approaches SANSA and offers his hand. She takes it and stands. They walk out together.
I apologize for my nephew's behavior. Tell me the truth. Do you want an end to this engagement?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I am loyal to King Joffrey, my one true love.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Lady Stark, you may survive us yet.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION watches SANSA walk out of the chamber, in admiration of her strength and clever response.
The little king's backed up. Clogged from balls to brains.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You think dipping his wick will cure what ails him?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: There's no cure for being a cunt. But the boy's at that age. And he's got nothing to do all day but pick wings off flies. Couldn't hurt to get some of the poison out.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: INT. CASTLE.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The HOUND stands in the hallway. JOFFREY enters.
What are you doing here, dog?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Your uncle left your nameday present and asked me to see that you got it.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: And? What is it?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Look inside, Your Grace.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: INT. JOFFREY'S CHAMBERS
JOFFREY enters his chambers to find ROS and DAISY waiting for him.
Your Grace.
Speaker: DAISY

Text: Happy nameday, Your Grace.
Speaker: ROS

Text: My nameday has passed.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: We won't tell if you won't.
Speaker: ROS

Text: She moves to remove Joffrey's pants. He rebuffs her.
No. Her. Touch her.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: ROS undresses DAISY, who stands upon a table. They both giggle, and the second prostitute begins to kiss and fondle the other's stomach. JOFFREY watches, intrigued.
Could you hit her?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: They giggle, and the first prostitute comes down to the floor and presents her ass. The second prostitute spanks her playfully.
My uncle sent you?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Yes, Your Grace. He chose us himself.
Speaker: DAISY

Text: Hmm.
Speaker: ROS

Text: JOFFREY comes closer and presents his large belt to ROS.
Use this.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: ROS hesitates, but takes it. She swings firmly, and ROS reacts, surprised but still enjoying the pain.
Harder.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: DAISY looks worried. ROS hits her with more force, and she cries in pain. DAISY seems disgusted with herself. JOFFREY grabs her chin, roughly.
I said harder. He'd want me to get his money's worth.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: ROS nods meekly. JOFFREY steps away. The spanking begins agian, harder than before. DAISY screams in pain. After multiple spankings, DAISY scrambles onto the bed, crying. Joffrey presents a mace to DAISY, who takes it.
Your Grace, too much pain will spoil the pleasure.
Speaker: ROS

Text: JOFFREY cranks his crossbow. DAISY whimpers and shakes her head in fear. JOFFREY finishes setting the bow.
Please, Your Grace.
Speaker: DAISY

Text: Your Grace, if your uncle finds out
Speaker: ROS

Text: Oh, I want him to find out. You will bring her to his chambers when you're finished and show him what you've done, or the same thing will happen to you.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: JOFFREY threatens her with the loaded crossbow. She pauses.
Begin.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: DAISY begins to cry, and then ROS commences the painful beating with the mace, and the other girl responds with screams of agony.
Harder!
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: The Stormlands
Speaker: EXT

Text: RENLY's war camp is bustling. He walks up to LITTLEFINGER, who awaits him.
Well, if it isn't my favorite whoremonger. Pray I haven't kept you waiting long.
Speaker: RENLY

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Now you do the Lannisters' bidding, is that it? Tell me, was my brother's body even cold before you secured your newest patron?
Speaker: RENLY

Text: I'm a practical man.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Just not a loyal one.
Speaker: RENLY

Text: And who would you have me be loyal to? Your brother's corpse?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I don't like you, Lord Baelish. I don't like your face. I don't like the words that come oozing out of your mouth. I don't want you in my tent one minute more than necessary. So tell me, why are you here?
Speaker: RENLY

Text: LITTLEFINGER's eyes shift to BRIENNE.
You can trust Brienne. Her loyalty comes without charge.
Speaker: RENLY

Text: You still have many friends at court, Your Grace, many who believe Ned Stark erred by not supporting your claim.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: RENLY takes an apple and sits down.
Now I understand. You know I have the numbers. You know I'm marching on King's Landing. When I take the throne, you hope to retain your position. And your head.
Speaker: RENLY

Text: I would give priority to my head.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: (snorts)
Speaker: RENLY

Text: I understand that you don't like me, and while that saddens me greatly, I did not come here today seeking your affection. When you march on King's Landing, you may find yourself facing a protracted siege or open gates.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: RENLY ponders LITTLEFINGER's implications.
The war camp at night.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: LITTLEFINGER stands my a fire, warming himself. LORAS and MARGAERY appreach. LORAS peels off into a nearby tent while MARGAERY walks past LITTLEFINGER. He follows her.
Your Grace.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Lord Baelish.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: All of these tents look the same to me. -Would you be so kind
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: It would be my pleasure. It took me weeks to learn my way around the camp. Twice I walked in on officers in stages of undress. And the moment I learn which tent is mine, we're on the move again.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: "Your tent"? Not "Our tent"? The king snores, perhaps? Or simply prefers solitude? Pressures of command, no doubt. Four kings vying for the throne.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I am not tutored in warfare, but basic arithmetic favors the side with the greater numbers.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: If war were arithmetic, the mathematicians would rule the world. I did notice your brother entering His Grace's tent just now.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: The place of a Kingsguard is by the king's side.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: And on the night of your wedding, who was by the king's side then?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: You seem quite interested in our marriage.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Your marriage is quite interesting. Not only to me, but to the realm. The marriage of a wealthy girl always breeds interest, if nothing else.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: You've never married, have you?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I've been unlucky in my affections, sadly.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: That is sad. Though perhaps it's for the best. The whole notion of marriage seems to confuse you, so allow me to explain. My husband is my king, and my king is my husband. Here is your tent, Lord Baelish. Good night.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: MARGAERY walks away and LITTLEFINGER bows in respect, then ponders.
EXT. OUTSIDE QARTH
A lone horseman, KOVARRO, rides trots through the desert towards DAENERYS, who looks lethargic and desperate.
(Valerian) This isn't your horse.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: KOVARRO dismounts.
(Valerian) It was given to me by the Thirteen. The Elders of Qarth.
Speaker: KOVARRO

Text: (Valerian) Qarth?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (Valerian) Three days to the east, on the sea.
Speaker: KOVARRO

Text: (Valerian) Will they let us in?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (Valerian) They said they would be honored to receive the Mother of Dragons.
Speaker: KOVARRO

Text: DAENERYS turns to JORAH.
What do you know of this place?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Only that the desert around their walls is called the Garden of Bones. Every time the Qartheen shut their gates on a traveler, the garden grows.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: EXT. THE RIVERLANDS
ARYA, GENDRY, HOT PIE and the other Night's Watch recruits are being led towards a misted, ruined Castle. There are groans and screams of pain as the recruits walk, their hands bound.
Go on!
Speaker: MAN #3

Text: You, keep moving!
Speaker: MAN #4

Text: Bring her about!
Speaker: MAN

Text: What kind of fire melts stone?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Dragon fire.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: There's dragons here?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: No, all the dragons are dead.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: What's that smell?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Dead people.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Move.
Speaker: SOLDIER

Text: EXT. PRISONER ENCAMPMENT
Some prisoners are in chains. There are more screams of pain and the prisoners look dejected. Sounds of torture can be heard in the distance while ARYA, GENRY and HOT PIE listen in horror.
Please, please, no, no! No.
Speaker: MAN

Text: There is a cranking of chains, then a thud. The screaming has stopped.
He's dead. He was my son. My sister was three days ago. My husband, the day before that.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: They take someone every day?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: (nods)
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: Does anyone live?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The WOMAN does not answer, and ARYA looks down, hopelessly. She and GENDRY share a glance.
PRISONER ENCAMPMENT AT NIGHT
Speaker: EXT

Text: It is nighttime and raining. ARYA lies in the mud.
Joffrey. Cersei. llyn Payne. The Hound. Joffrey. Cersei. llyn Payne. The Hound. Joffrey. Cersei. llyn Payne. The Hound.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: EXT. THE STORMLANDS
CATELYN sits in her tent. LITTLEFINGER enters, and she rises.
How dare you?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: You may have heard false reports.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: You betrayed Ned.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Betrayed? I wanted him to serve as Protector of the Realm. I begged him to seize the moment.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I trusted you. My husband trusted you. And you repaid our faith with treachery.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: No, my lady.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Get out!
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Cat, I've I've loved you since I was a boy. It seems to me that fate has given us this chance
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: CATELYN draws a knife, threateningly. LITTLEFINGER pauses, thinking.
Have you lost your mind? Get out!
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Do you want to see your girls again? Sansa, more beautiful than ever? And Arya, just as wild as ever?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: You have Arya, too?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Both girls are healthy and safe. For now. But you know the Queen and you know Joffrey. I fear for their longevity if they remain in the capital.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: CATELYN ponders, then lowers the knife and places it down.
What do you want?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: The Lannisters will trade your daughters for the Kingslayer.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Of course they will. Jaime Lannister for two girls? Robb will never agree to those terms.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I'm not bringing these terms to him. I'm bringing them to you.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: You think I keep secrets from my son?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Robb has surprised them all with his skills in battle, but he's not a mother. Consider it, Cat. You may not get another chance. I've brought you a gift.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I don't want your gifts. A token of Tyrion Lannister's goodwill. He wants you to understand that this exchange of prisoners is offered in good faith.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Two servants enter and place down something heavy.
Good faith?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: The servants bow and leave. CATELYN looks ashenly at LITTLEFINGER as she comes to realize what is in the chest before her.
What's this?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: CATELYN kneels slowly over the chest and opens it. She looks down, sadly.
Your husband was an honorable man. He should rest beside his family in the crypts beneath Winterfell. You may not believe
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Get out.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Speechless, LITTLEFINGER leaves. CATELYN begins to cry. She slams the chest closed.
RIVERLANDS PRISONER ENCAMPMENT
Speaker: EXT

Text: ARYA sleeps on the cold, wet ground. Soldiers wake up the prisoners with banging and shouting.
Get up, you dogs!
Speaker: MAN

Text: The recruits stand up as the soldiers move through the camp. The MOUNTAIN strides into camp.
That's him, the one who picks.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: The Mountain. What are you doing?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: He told me he stares at him every day. That's why he doesn't get picked.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: The MOUNTAIN looks over the crowd. Most people look down, but HOT PIE meets his gaze, as does another PRISONER. The MOUNTAIN picks that PRISONER.
You.
Speaker: MOUNTAIN

Text: Move, boy! Move!
Speaker: SOLDIER

Text: HOT PIE is shocked and pisses himself for having listened to the other man.
EXT. TORTURE AREA
The PRISONER is strapped into a chair, his neck and extremities bound. Panic fills his eyes as they tighten the straps and the TICKLER begins his inquisition.
Is there gold and silver in the village?
Speaker: TICKLER

Text: I don't know.
Speaker: PRISONER

Text: Gems?
Speaker: TICKLER

Text: I didn't see any.
Speaker: PRISONER

Text: Where is the Brotherhood?
Speaker: TICKLER

Text: I don't know.
Speaker: PRISONER

Text: The TICKLER gives permission to begin the torture. A SOLDIER pulls out a squealing rat and places it into a bucket. The PRISONER's panic rises.
Where is the Brotherhood?
Speaker: TICKLER

Text: I don't know. Please.
Speaker: PRISONER

Text: Where is the Brotherhood?
Speaker: TICKLER

Text: I don't know.
Speaker: PRISONER

Text: The SOLDIER attaches the bucket to the PRISONER's chest.
Which of the villagers aided them?
Speaker: TICKLER

Text: I don't know.
Speaker: PRISONER

Text: Who?
Speaker: TICKLER

Text: I -
Speaker: PRISONER

Text: The TICKLER nods to the SOLDIER, who pulls a flaming torch out of the fire.
Who?
Speaker: TICKLER

Text: I never saw. Please. Please, stop. Please, it's starting to
Speaker: PRISONER

Text: The rat start to chew on the PRISONER's chest. His eyes widen in pain and panic.
Who?
Speaker: TICKLER

Text: I didn't see anyone help him. Take it off! Take it off!
Speaker: PRISONER

Text: Who helped him?
Speaker: TICKLER

Text: That's better.  You've been very helpful.
Speaker: TICKLER

Text: No, stop, please! What are you doing? Please, stop! Please, stop!
Speaker: PRISONER

Text: The SOLDIER holds the flame to the bucket, and the rat trapped inside shrieks in constant fear.
No! No! I told you everything! No! No!
Speaker: PRISONER

Text: The TICKLER looks on without pity.
INT. PRISONER ENCAMPMENT
ARYA lies in the dark as rain falls.
Joffrey. Cersei. llyn Payne. The Hound.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Please, Polliver. Some food. Just a crust of bread.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: POLIVER punches the WOMAN and she collapses, crying. He then continues walking.
Polliver. The Mountain.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: EXT. STORMLANDS
RENLY, CATELYN, LORAS and BRIENNE facing STANNIS, DAVOS and MELISANDRE
Speaker: RENLY's bannermen sit astride their horses on a cliffside, next to the sea. A strong wind blows. The camera zooms in to show a meeting of the Baratheon Brothers

Text: Lady Stark, I had not thought to find you in the Stormlands.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I had not thought to be here, Lord Stannis.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Can that truly be you?
Speaker: RENLY

Text: Who else might it be?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: When I saw your standard, I couldn't be sure. Whose banner is that?
Speaker: RENLY

Text: My own.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I suppose if we used the same one, the battle would be terribly confusing. Why is your stag on fire?
Speaker: RENLY

Text: The king has taken for his sigil the fiery heart of the Lord of Light.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Ah, you must be this fire priestess we hear so much about. Mmm, brother, now I understand why you found religion in your old age.
Speaker: RENLY

Text: Watch yourself, Renly.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: No, no, I'm relieved. I never really believed you were a fanatic. Charmless, rigid, a bore, yes, but not a godly man.
Speaker: RENLY

Text: You should kneel before your brother. He's the Lord's chosen, born amidst salt and smoke.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: That's twice I've warned you.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Listen to yourselves. If you were sons of mine, I would knock your heads together and lock you in a bedchamber until you remembered that you were brothers.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: It is strange to find you beside my brother, Lady Stark. Your husband was a supporter of my claim. Lord Eddard's integrity cost him his head. And you sit beside this pretender and chastise me.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: We share a common enemy.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: The Iron Throne is mine by right. All those that deny that are my foes.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: The whole realm denies it, from Dorne to the Wall. Old men deny it with their death rattle and unborn children deny it in their mother's wombs. No one wants you for their king. You never wanted any friends, brother. But a man without friends is a man without power.
Speaker: RENLY

Text: For the sake of the mother who bore us, I will give you this one night to reconsider. Strike your banners, come to me before dawn, and I will grant you your old seat in the Council. I'll even name you my heir until a son is born to me. Otherwise I shall destroy you.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: RENLY quickly considers the offer.
Look across those fields, brother. Can you see all those banners?
Speaker: RENLY

Text: You think a few bolts of cloth will make you king?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: No. The men holding those bolts of cloth will make me king.
Speaker: RENLY

Text: We shall see, Renly. Come the dawn, we shall see.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Look to your sins, Lord Renly. The night is dark and full of terrors.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: STANNIS and his party ride off.
Would you believe I loved him once?
Speaker: RENLY

Text: RENLY spurs his mount and his party heads in the opposite direction.
EXT. THE GATES OF QARTH
DAENERYS and her Dothraki sit outside the gates of Qarth. The gates are closed.
I thought we were welcome.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: If you heard a Dothraki horde was approaching your city, you might do the same, Khaleesi.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Horde?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: QARTH soldiers line up outside the gate, at attention. A group of thirteen emissaries from the city walk forward from the gates. A plump SPICE KING leads the group.
My name is Daenerys
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Daenerys Stormborn of the house Targaryen.
Speaker: SPICE KING

Text: You know me, my lord?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Only by reputation, Khaleesi. And I'm no lord, merely a humble merchant. They call you the Mother of Dragons.
Speaker: SPICE KING

Text: And what should I call you?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Oh, my name is quite long and quite impossible for foreigners to pronounce. I am simply a trader of spices. But we are the Thirteen, charged with the governance and protection of Qarth, the greatest city that ever was or will be.
Speaker: SPICE KING

Text: The beauty of Quarth is legendary
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: SPICE KING Qarth.
Qarth.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Might we see the dragons?
Speaker: SPICE KING

Text: DAENERYS looks back to the woven chest that holds the dragons on top of one of their horses. She is nervous, and a bit desperate.
My friend, we have traveled very far. We have no food, no water. Once I see my people fed, I would be honored
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Forgive me, Mother of Dragons, but no man alive has seen a living dragon. Some of my more skeptical friends refuse to believe your children even exist. All we ask is the chance to see for ourselves.
Speaker: SPICE KING

Text: I am not a liar.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Oh, I don't think you are. But as I've never met you before, my opinion on the matter is of limited value.
Speaker: SPICE KING

Text: Where I come from, guests are treated with respect, not insulted at the gates.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Then perhaps you should return to where you come from. We wish you well.
Speaker: SPICE KING

Text: The SPICE KING turns and walks away. DAENERYS steps follows with indignation, and he turns back around.
What are you doing? You promised to receive me.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: We have received you. Here we are, and here you are.
Speaker: SPICE KING

Text: If you do not let us in, all of us will die.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Which we shall deeply regret. But Qarth did not become the greatest city that ever was or will be by letting Dothraki savages through its gates.
Speaker: SPICE KING

Text: The SPICE KING continues to the thirteen, and they begin their walk back into Qarth.
Khaleesi, please be careful.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: DAENERYS finds her resolve and steps forward. The soldiers react by leaning their spears forward in unison, clearly a warning.

Thirteen! When my dragons are grown, we will take back what was stolen from me and destroy those who have wronged me. We will lay waste to armies and burn cities to the ground. Turn us away and we will burn you first.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The SPICE KING steps forward from the thirteen.
Ah. You are a true Targaryen. Only, as you said a moment ago, if we don't let you into the city, you will all die. And so
Speaker: SPICE KING

Text: XARO XHOAN DAXOS steps out from the back of the Thirteen.
Retreating in fear from a little girl is unbecoming of the greatest city that ever was or will be.
Speaker: XARO

Text: The discussion is over, Xaro Xhoan Daxos. The Thirteen have spoken.
Speaker: SPICE KING

Text: I am one of the Thirteen, and I am still speaking.
Speaker: XARO

Text: The girl threatens to burn our city to the ground and you would invite her in for a cup of wine?  She is the Mother of Dragons.
Speaker: SPICE KING

Text: Do you expect her to watch her people starve without breathing fire? I believe we can allow a few Dothraki through our gates without dooming our city. After all, here I am, a savage from the Summer Isles, and Qarth still stands.
Speaker: XARO

Text: DAENERYS recognizes that XARO is a potential ally, but the SPICE KING remains resolute.
Our decision is final.
Speaker: SPICE KING

Text: Very well. I invoke soumai.
Speaker: XARO

Text: The Thirteen react, looking between themselves. XARO draws his dagger, pointing downward and grabs the blade with his left hand. DAENERYS looks to JORAH for council.
I will vouch for her, her people, and her dragons, in accordance with the law.
Speaker: XARO

Text: XARO pulls the dagger up, slicing his palm deeply. He displays the wound to the Thirteen.
Be it on your head.
Speaker: SPICE KING

Text: Welcome to Qarth, my lady.
Speaker: XARO

Text: The SPICE KING rejoins the Thirteen in frustration. XARO gestures a welcome to DAENERYS, and the gates open, noisily. DAENERYS and JORAH share a glance before the Dothraki band walk through the city gates. XARO joins her side.
EXT. THE RIVERLANDS
EXT. A COURTYARD

A soldier mounts the head of the tortured PRISONER on a spike and decends a ladder.  The night's watch recruits are still captive in the ruined building. They hand their heads in subjugation, trying not to be noticed.
(to Gendry) You.
Speaker: MOUNTAIN

Text: GRENDRY and ARYA look at one another in panic. Soldiers grab GENDRY, and he is bound in the torture chair.
Is there gold or silver in the village?
Speaker: TICKLER

Text: I'm not from the village.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Where is the Brotherhood?
Speaker: TICKLER

Text: The TICKLER sits, facing GENDRY while his SOLDIER stands menacingly at his side.
I don't know what that is.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: ARYA stares. The TICKLER nods to his helper to take action. The camera pans across the sullen crowd, including ARYA and HOT PIE. The  SOLDIER places a rat in a bucket and straps it to GENDRY'S chest.
ANOTHER COURTYARD IN THE RUINED CASTLE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: TYWIN rides in, astride a white horse and flanked by gold coats. He looks around in disappointment. He is greeted by the MOUNTAIN.
You two. Take Lord Lannister's things to his quarters.
Speaker: MAN

Text: What's this?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYWIN dismounts while a soldiers takes the reigns of his horse. He then walks forward, inspecting the prisoners and their condition.
We weren't expecting you till tomorrow, Lord Tywin.
Speaker: MOUNTAIN

Text: Evidently not. Why are these prisoners not in their cells?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Cells are overflowing, my lord.
Speaker: MOUNTAIN

Text: This lot won't be here long. Don't need no permanent place. After we interrogate 'em, we usually just
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: Are we so well-manned that we can afford to discard able young bodies and skilled laborers?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: He gets no response. TYWIN continues to inspect the prisoners, and addresses GENDRY.
You, do you have a trade?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: ARYA sits, expressionless, trying not to be noticed.
Smith, my lord.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: POLLIVER notices ARYA's attention, and feels slighted. He draws his sword to threaten her.
What are you looking at? Kneel! Kneel or I'll carve your lungs out, boy.
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: ARYA backs away, and TYWIN intervenes.
He'll do no such thing. This one's a girl, you idiot, dressed as a boy. Why?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Safer to travel, my lord.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Smart. More than I can say for this lot. Get these prisoners to work. Bring the girl. I need a new cupbearer.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: My lord.
Speaker: MOUNTAIN

Text: EXT.KING'S LANDING
INT. HALLWAY OUTSIDE TYRION'S CHAMBERS.
TYRION answers the knocking on his door to find LANCEL LANNISTER.
Your visits are too few, cousin.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Her Grace, the Queen Regent, commands you to release Grand Maester Pycelle. Here's your warrant.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: LANCEL extends a scroll to TYRION, who takes it, unimpressed.
So it is. Will you take a cup with me? I find that mulled wine helps me sleep.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION steps into his chamber and pours himself a cup of wine.
I am here at Her Grace's behest, not to drink with you, Imp.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: If my sister was so concerned for Pycelle, I would have thought she'd come herself.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Instead she sends you. What am I to make of that?
I don't care what you make of it, so long as you release your prisoner immediately.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: LANCEL moves to leave, but TYRION does not let him.
And you've received these instructions directly from Cersei?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: As I said several times.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: And you've waited this long to deliver the information?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: When the Queen Regent gives me a command, I carry it out without delay.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: TYRION ponders the scroll, while LANCEL stands over his desk, annoyed.
Cersei must have great trust in you, allowing you into her chamber during the hour of the wolf.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: LANCEL thinks carefully before responding.
The Queen Regent has a great many responsibilities. She often works from dusk till dawn.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: She must be very glad to have you helping her from dusk till dawn.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: As TYRION walks past LANCEL, he catches a familiar aroma.
Ah. Lavender oil. She always loved lavender oil, even as a girl.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I am a knight!
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: An anointed knight, yes. Tell me, did Cersei have you knighted before or after she took you into her bed? What? Nothing to say? No more warnings for me, ser?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You will withdraw these filthy accusations.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: Have you ever given any thought to what King Joffrey will have to say when he finds out you've been bedding his mother?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: LANCEL sits, and chokes out some frustration.
It's not my fault!
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: Did she take you against your will? Can you not defend yourself, knight?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Your own father, Lord Tywin, when I was named the King's squire, he told me to obey her in everything.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: Did he tell you to fuck her, too?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I only meant I did as I was bid.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: Hated every moment of it, is that what you'll have me believe? A high place in court, a knighthood, my sister's legs spreading open for you at night. Oh, yes, it must have been terrible. Wait here. His Grace will want to hear this.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION moves to leave the chamber to fetch JOFFREY. LANCEL falls to his knees and begs.
Mercy! Mercy, my lord! I beg you.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: Save it for Joffrey. He loves a good grovel.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: My lord, it was your sister's bidding, the Queen. I'll leave the city at once, I swear.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: No, I think not.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: My lord?
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: You heard me. My father told you to obey my sister. Obey her. Stay close to her side. Keep her trust. Pleasure her whenever she requires. No one ever need know, as long as you keep faith with me. I want to know what Cersei is doing, where she goes, who she sees, what they talk of, everything. And you will tell me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Yes, my lord, I will. I swear it, as you command.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: TYRION claps in celebration.

Oh, rise, rise. Let us drink to our understanding. Oh, you don't have a cup. Oh, well. Smile, cousin. My sister is a beautiful woman, and it's all for the good of the realm. Go back and tell her that I beg her forgiveness, that I want no more conflict between us and that, henceforth, I shall do nothing without her consent.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: But her demands?
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: Oh, I'll give her Pycelle.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You will?
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: Yes, I'll release him in the morning. Cersei can keep him as a pet, if she wants, but I will not have him on the Council. I could swear that I had not harmed a single hair on his head, but that would not, strictly speaking, be true. Stay within one table length.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION shuts the chamber door. LANCEL leans against the wall, feeling beaten.
EXT. THE STORMLANDS SEA AT NIGHT
