A boat with a stag figurehead rocks on the calm seas. DAVOS approaches STANNIS on the deck.
Your Grace.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Do your knucklebones bring you luck?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Well, life's been good since you hacked them off, Your Grace. And it's four less fingernails to clean.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Fewer.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Pardon?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Four fewer fingernails to clean. Never understood why you had to wear them.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: It reminds me of where I come from and where I am now. It reminds me of your justice. It was an honest punishment and you were good with the cleaver.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You were a hero and a smuggler. A good act does not wash out the bad, nor a bad the good.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: A lesson I've tried to teach my son.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Does he listen?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: To me? Gods, no. But if your red woman told him to leap from the crow's nest
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: She has a name. I trust you've not forgotten your smuggler's tricks.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I've lived within the law for 17
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I want you to be a smuggler this time.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Any shore, any night. What am I bringing ashore?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The red woman. No one must know what you do and we'll not speak of this again.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I am true to Your Grace and always will be, but surely there are other ways, cleaner ways.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Cleaner ways don't win wars.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: DAVOS nods and walks away. STANNIS stares into the distance.
EXT. THE SHORELINE
DAVOS rows a boat into the shallows. MELISANDRE sits patiently.
Are you afraid, Onion Knight?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Someone once told me the night is dark and full of terrors.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You've carried more unpleasant cargo in your time. Are you a good man, Ser Davos Seaworth?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I'd say my parts are mixed, my lady, good and bad.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: If half an onion is black with rot, it's a rotten onion. A man is good or he is evil.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: And which are you?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Oh, good. I'm a knight myself, of sorts, a champion of light and life.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Well, that must be very nice for you.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS stows the oars and enters the water to lead the boat to shore. He pulls it onto the shore.
Do you love your wife?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I do.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Yet you have known other women.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Don't talk about my wife.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS secures the boat on the shore.
I'm not. I'm talking about other women. Like me, Ser Davos. You want me. You want to see what's beneath this robe.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: DAVOS does not respond.
And you will.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: MELISANDRE turns to grab something from the boat.
INT. A CAVE
DAVOS leads MELISANDRE through the cave, bearing a lantern.
Strange that this Lord of Light asks you to work in the shadows.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Shadows cannot live in the dark, Ser Davos. They are servants of light, the children of fire. And the brighter the flame, the darker they are.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: DAVOS holds up the lantern to bars that obstruct their way.
These weren't here before. They've barred the passage.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: They can't bar our passage.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: MELISANDRE has disrobed, arms outstretched, revealing a swollen, fully pregnant belly. DAVOS is shocked at this sudden change.
Gods protect us.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: There's only one god, Ser Davos, and he only protects those who serve him.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: The lantern flares suddenly, surprising DAVOS, who retreats. MELISANDRE sits down behind him, and assumes a birthing position. She moans in pain as she gives birth. DAVOS watches in apprehension. MELISANDRE screams, and a foul spirit crawls from between her legs. It gathers strength and roars as it expands and takes to the air.
EXT. SHADOWLANDS
RENLY's encampment at night. The camp is alive with activity, in spite of the late hour. Soldiers move in every direction
INT. RENLY's tent. RENLY and CATELYN are seated across from one another while BRIENNE stands at guard.
You swear it?
Speaker: RENLY

Text: By the mother. My son has no interest in the Iron Throne.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: RENLY takes a long sip of wine.

Then I see no reason for hostility between us. Your soncan go on calling himself King in the North. The Starks will have dominion over all lands north of Moat Cailin, provided he swears me an oath of fealty.
Speaker: RENLY

Text: And the wording of this oath?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: The same Ned Stark swore to Robert 18 years ago. Cat, their friendship held the kingdoms together.
Speaker: RENLY

Text: CATELYN considers these terms.
And in return for my son's loyalty?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: In the morning, I'll destroy my brother's army.
Speaker: RENLY

Text: RENLY stands.
When that's done, Baratheon and Stark will fight their common enemy together, as they have done many times before.
Speaker: RENLY

Text: RENLY walks across the tent. BRIENNE removes his cloak.
Our two houses have always been close, which is why I am begging you to reconsider this battle. Negotiate a peace with your brother.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Negotiate with Stannis? You heard him out there. I'd have better luck debating the wind.
Speaker: RENLY

Text: BRIENNE continues to remove RENLY's armor.
Please bring my terms to your son. I believe we are natural allies. I hope he feels the same. Together we could end this war in a fortnight.
Speaker: RENLY

Text: The wind howls, and a dark cloud of mist races into the tent. CATELYN watches it cross the floor. BRIENNE gasps as a dark spirit takes form from the mist, rising up behind RENLY. The dark spirit stabs RENLY in the back, through the heart. RENLY gasps and the spirit hisses.
No! No.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: The dark spirit dissipates into a wind, and RENLY collapses to the ground. BRIENNE lungers forward to catch him, and bring him gently to the ground. Two soldiers leap into the room and draw their swords, believing BRIENNE to have betrayed their king.
Follow me!
Speaker: SOLDIER #1

Text: (to BRIENNE) You'll die for this.
Speaker: SOLDIER #2

Text: No, wait, it wasn't her!
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: The soliders rush past CATELYN to engage with BRIENNE, who meets them in battle. She quickly dispatches one of the soldiers. The second soldiers falls soon after, with BRIENNE plunging her sword down his spine. CATELYN stares while BRIENNE looks upon RENLY's corpse. She staggers and falls to her knees, sobbing over his lifeless body. CATELYN comes beside her to comfort her.
We've got to leave. They'll hang you for this.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Now.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: I won't leave him.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You can't avenge him if you're dead.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Over there, go!
Speaker: MAN

Text: BRIENNE gets up to leave. CATELYN tries to pull her to the front door. BRIENNE resists.
Not that way.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: BRIENNE exits past a tapestery. CATELYN follows.
THE SHADOWLANDS SHORE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: STANNIS's boats sit off the coast. LITTLEFINGER takes them in, then walks towards the camp as soldiers rush by in disorder.
INT. RENLY's tent
Loras mournfully kneels beside RENLY's body. MARGAERY paces in the background.
We need to go home. Loras.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: LITTLEFINGER enters the tent, just short of a panic.
My lord, my lady.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Get out.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Stannis will be here in an hour. When he arrives, Renly's bannermen will flock to him. Your former companions will fight for the privilege of selling you to their new king.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: And you want that privilege for yourself.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: You will note that I am standing here talking to you, not Stannis.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: There's no time for this.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Ride back to Highgarden, sister. I'm not running from Stannis.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Brienne of Tarth murdered Renly.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I don't believe that. You don't believe that. Who gained the most from our king's death?
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Stannis.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I will put a sword through his righteous face.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: You can't stay here.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: He would have been a true king, a good king.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Tell me, Ser Loras, what do you desire most in this world?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Revenge.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: I have always found that to be the purest of motivations, but you won't have a chance to put your sword through Stannis, not today. You'll be cut to pieces before he sets foot on solid ground. If it is justice that you want, be smart about it.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: You can't avenge him from the grave. Bring the horses. Please.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: MARGAERY moves to LORAS's side and caresses his hair. LORAS stands with a grimace. He picks up his sword and leaves. MARGAERY looks upon RENLY's corpse
He was very handsome.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: He was, Your Grace.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: "Your Grace." Calling yourself king doesn't make you one. And if Renly wasn't a king, I wasn't a queen.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Do you want to be a queen?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: No. I want to be the queen.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: MARGAERY turns and faces LITTLEFINGER, resolute.
EXT. KING'S LANDING
Three noble girls play blind man's bluff in a garden while a septa stands by. CERSEI watches from a window above
INT. TYRION's chambers
Killed? By whom?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Accounts differ. Most seem to implicate Catelyn Stark in some way.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION picks up a goblet
Really? Who'd have thought?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Some say it was one of his own Kingsguard, while still others say it was Stannis himself who did it after negotiations went sour.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION pours himself some wine.
Whomever did it, I say well done.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: It's not what Varys says. He says Renly's army is flocking to support Stannis, which would give Stannis superiority over us on both land and sea.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: CERSEI finishes pouring her own wine.
Littlefinger says we can outspend him three to one.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: And I say Father raised you to have too much respect for money. Stannis Baratheon is coming for us, sooner rather than later.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Aren't there other things you should be doing, like sealing my daughter in a crate so you can ship her away?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: She'll be safer in Dorne.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Yes, I know how concerned you are for her safety.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: It so happens that I am. Myrcella is a sweet, innocent girl and I don't blame her at all for you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: So clever. Aren't you always so clever with your schemes and your plots?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI walks past TYRION and sits.
Schemes and plots are the same thing. They are going to attack us. We need to be ready.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No need to concern yourself over it. The king is taking personal charge of siege preparations.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: May I ask specifically what the king has in mind?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You may, specifically, or you may ask vaguely. The answer will be the same.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: It's important that we talk about this.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It's the king's royal prerogative to withhold sensitive information from his councilors.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: TYRION exits in frustration, while CERSEI takes a sip, enjoying the upper hand.
EXT. STREETS OF KING'S LANDING
BRONN stands waiting among the bustling cityfolk next to a small tent, where TYRION and LANCEL meet in secret.
It's wildfire.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: Wildfire? You wouldn't lie to me, would you, cousin?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: That's a lie right there.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It is not a lie. Why would I lie?
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: Tell me, if the vile allegations against my brother and sister are true, do you think it will make Jaime more likely to kill you or less likely? When I tell him you're fucking her, I mean.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm telling you the truth.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: The smart money would be on more likely.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She's making wildfire.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: But then perhaps his own unnatural urges will give him sympathy for yours.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The Alchemists' Guild is being commissioned.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: I suppose there's only one way to find out.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They have thousands of pots already stored in their vaults. They are planning to launch it from the city walls into Stannis' ships and armies. Please.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: When did she tell you this?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I heard her talking with the pyromancer And the other night, after I left her, she went to meet him. I swear to you.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: Swear to me on what?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: On my life.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: But I don't care about your life.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: In the light of the Seven, by all that is holy and right, I, Lancel Lannister, do solemnly vow . . .
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: All right, all right. Enough. Even torturing you is boring. Just get out.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION pushes LANCEL out of the small tent. LANCEL falls to the ground, grunting.
Oh, Lancel, tell my friend Bronn to please kill you if anything should happen to me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Please kill me if anything should happen to Lord Tyrion.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: It will be my pleasure.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: LANCEL runs off down the streets. BRONN smiles.
STORMLANDS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: STANNIS's forces have landed at RENLY's camp. DAVOS meets STANNIS as he enters the main courtyard, and they move through the compound at rapid pace.
Your Grace.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: What is it?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I'm sorry about your brother, Your Grace, I wanted to let you know that people grieve for him.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Fools love a fool. I grieve for him as well, for the boy he was, not the man he grew to be.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I thought I made it clear to you there'd be no need to speak to me on this matter.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Your Grace, I --
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I've never known you to need to hear a thing twice.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: They reach RENLY's tent.
And I've never known you to hide from the truth.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You've come to lecture me on truth?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I've come to tell you that what I saw.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: All my brother's bannermen have come to my side. Except the Tyrells, who fled like cowards. They won't be able to resist us now. Soon I shall be sitting on the Iron Throne.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Nothing is worth what this will cost you, not even the Iron
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I'll hear no more about it.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: STANNIS stands over the war map.
Take a company of men, secure the perimeter.
Speaker: MAN

Text: When do we sail for King's Landing?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: As soon as I've consolidated my troops. We'll make short work of the Lannisters' fleet. Once Blackwater Bay is cleared, we'll deliver our troops to their doorstep and take the city.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: And will you bring Lady Melisandre with you?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: That's not your concern.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: If you take King's Landing with her by your side, the victory will be hers.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I never thought I'd have reason to doubt your loyalty. Was I wrong?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Loyal service means telling hard truths.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Oh, truth again. All right, what's the truth? The hard truth?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: She's a foreigner preaching her foreign religion. Some believe she whispers orders in your ear and you obey.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: What do you believe?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: You won those bannermen from Renly. Don't lose them to her.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: We set out for King's Landing without Lady Melisandre. And you lead the fleet into Blackwater Bay.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Your Grace, I'm honored, but my time on the sea was spent evading ships, not attacking them. The other lords won't be happy.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Most of those lords should consider themselves lucky I don't hang them for treason. Hard truths cut both ways, Ser Davos.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: DAVOS exits.
EXT. KINGS LANDING
A bustling market street. A girl grabs a fish from a bucket.
I've got it! I've got it!
Speaker: GIRL

Text: So it's that one there at the top, on the right.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Buy my fruit, my lord. Fresh fruit.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: The lord is revealed to be TYRION, with BRONN walking behind him.
Stannis has more infantry, more ships, more horses. What do we have?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: There's that mind of yours you keep going on about.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Well, I've never actually been able to kill people with it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Good thing. I'd be out of a job. What about your father?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: He hasn't sent a raven in weeks. He's very busy. Being repeatedly humiliated by Robb Stark is time-consuming. We won't be able to hold the city against Stannis, not the way Joffrey's planning on holding it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They come upon a crowd listening to a rabblerouser.
Corruption.
Speaker: PROTESTER

Text: Yes!
Speaker: CROWD

Text: We are swollen, bloated, foul. Brother fornicates with sister in the bed of kings and we're surprised when the fruit of their incest is rotten? Yes, a rotten king.
Speaker: PROTESTER

Text: It's hard to argue with his assessment.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Not after what he did to your birthday present.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: The king is a lost cause. It's the rest of us I'm worried about now.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: A dancing king, prancing down his bloodstained halls to the tune of a twisted demon monkey.
Speaker: MAN

Text: You have to admire his imagination.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: He's talking about you.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: What? Demon monkey?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: People think you're pulling the king's strings. They blame you for the city's ills.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Blame me? I'm trying to save them.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You don't need to convince me.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Demon monkey.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: IRON ISLANDS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: THEON, walks up from a dock., in armor It is morning. He gazes on a ship and smiles. The crew walks up noisily.
Yeah, come on.
Speaker: MAN

Text: You're the crew of the Sea Bitch? I'm your commander. Welcome.
Speaker: THEON

Text: The crew ignores THEON.
Stop. Stop! Your captain commands you to stop!
Speaker: THEON

Text: Where are we headed, Captain?
Speaker: BLACK LORREN

Text: The Stony Shore, to raid their villages. There'll be spoils in it for you, and women, if you do your jobs well.
Speaker: THEON

Text: And who decides if we've done our jobs well?
Speaker: BLACK LORREN

Text: I do. Your captain.
Speaker: THEON

Text: BLACK LORREN stands directly in front of THEON, challenging him.

I have been reaving and raping since before you left Balon's balls, Captain Don't reckon I've got much use for your ideas on how to do it. Don't reckon I've got much use for a captain at all. I'm thinking I can do the job of captain real well myself. All I need is a ship. You wouldn't know where I could find myself a ship now, would you?
Speaker: BLACK LORREN

Text: BLACK LORREN walks away down the steps to the dock.
You could do that, take the ship, head out on your own. And I will hunt you down, drag you back here in chains and hang you for a traitor.
Speaker: THEON

Text: (laughs)
Speaker: BLACK LORREN

Text: YARA enters.
Stop. We yield.
Speaker: YARA

Text: The iron born laugh
Congratulations on your first command.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Thank you. Kind of you to come see me off.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Oh, I'm not here for you. I was just on my way to Red Harbor. I've got 30 ships. There's nowhere to put them here. Too narrow.
Speaker: YARA

Text: You'd better get out there. Wouldn't want her to set sail without you.
Speaker: THEON

Text: That would never happen. My crew would wait on deck for a year if I asked them to. This lot, though Enjoy the Stony Shore.
Speaker: YARA

Text: THEON's crew pushes off from the dock. They row away without him, laughing. DAGMER enters.
Come on, I'll take you out.
Speaker: DAGMER

Text: Who are you?
Speaker: THEON

Text: Dagmer, your first mate.
Speaker: DAGMER

Text: Why aren't you with the rest of them? Or did they send you to row me out and dump me halfway in the sea? That would be good for a laugh.
Speaker: THEON

Text: They're not gonna respect you until you prove yourself.
Speaker: DAGMER

Text: And how am I supposed to prove myself by pillaging piss-poor fishing villages?
Speaker: THEON

Text: You're not.
Speaker: DAGMER

Text: And yet that's the task my father has given me to prove that I'm a true Iron Islander.
Speaker: THEON

Text: They're all Iron Islanders. Do they do as they're told or do they do as they like?
Speaker: DAGMER

Text: THEON follows DAGMER onto a dock, where he attends to a boat.
The Stony Shore's not far from Torrhen's Square.
Speaker: THEON

Text: No, we could. We could never hold it for more than a few days. As soon as Winterfell got word that we'd taken Torrhen's Square, the Starks would send their men to take it back. And then
Speaker: THEON

Text: THEON pauses and the idea of how to take advantage of the betrayal comes to full. He laughs, and DAGMER smiles back.
Take me to my ship.
Speaker: THEON

Text: THE RIVERLANDS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. A CASTLE
While ARYA prepares food, TYRION presides over his war council.
The Starks have overextended their lines. Now that summer's over, they'll have a hard time keeping their men and horses fed.
Speaker: REGINALD

Text: The Starks understand winter better than we ever will. The cold won't beat them.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Our spies report growing discontent among the Northern lords. They want to return home and gather the harvest before the crops turn.
Speaker: AMORY

Text: And I'm sure if those same spies snuck into our own encampments, they would report growing discontent amongst the Southern lords. This is war, no one's content. We've underestimated the Stark boy for too long. He has a good mind for warfare, his men worship him. And as long as he keeps winning battles, they'll keep believing he is King in the North. You've been waiting for him to fail. He is not going to fail, not without our help. So how do we stop him?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: We've worked through the night, my lord. Perhaps we'd profit from some sleep.
Speaker: REGINALD

Text: Yes, I think you would, Reginald. And because you're my cousin, I might even let you wake from that sleep. Go, I'm sure your wife must miss you.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: My wife's in Lannisport.
Speaker: REGINALD

Text: Well, then you'd better start riding. Go, before I change my mind and send her your head.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: REGINALD  rises, in scared disbelief.
If your name wasn't Lannister, you'd be scrubbing out pots in the cook's tent. Go!
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: REGINALD  exits. ARYA comes to TYWIN's side to pour him some wine. He stops her.
Not wine, water. We'll be here for some time. Girl, where are you from?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Maidenpool, my lord.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: And who are the Lords of Maidenpool? Remind me.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: House Mooton, my lord.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: And what is their sigil?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: ARYA does not answer, she does not know.
A red salmon. I think a Maidenpool girl would remember that. You're a Northerner, aren't you?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: (nods.)
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Good. One more time, where are you from?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Barrowton, my lord. House Dustin. Two crossed longaxes beneath a black crown.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: And what do they say of Robb Stark in the North?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: They call him the Young Wolf.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: And?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: They say he rides into battle on the back of a giant direwolf. They say he can turn into a wolf himself when he wants. They say he can't be killed.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: And do you believe them?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: No, my lord. Anyone can be killed.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: They stare at one another, unblinking.
Fetch that water.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: ARYA exits.
EXT. The exterior of the castle.

Arya walks to fetch water. She turns a corner and sees JAQEN coming towards her, dressed as a gold cloak. She lowers her head, trying to be unnoticed. They pass, and she continues. She enters the catacombs and passes a helmet. She realizes that JAQEN has forgotten it, and that he might return. Indeed, JAQEN turns the corner, walking slowly.
A girl says nothing.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: (gasps)
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A girl keeps her mouth closed. No one hears, and friends may talk in secret, yes? A boy becomes a girl.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: I was always a girl.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: And I was always aware. But the girl keeps secrets. It is not for a man to spoil them.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: You're one of them now. I should have let you burn.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA picks up the helmet and thrusts it into JAQEN's hands.
And you fetch water for one of them now. Why is this right for you and wrong for me?
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: I didn't have a choice.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You did. I did. And here we are.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: ARYA fills her water pitcher, and steps back as JAQEN approaches her.
A man pays his debts. A man owes three.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Three what?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The Red God takes what is his, lovely girl. And only death may pay for life. You saved me and the two I was with. You stole three deaths from the Red God. We have to give them back. Speak three names and the man will do the rest. Three lives I will give you, no more, no less, and we're done.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: I can name anyone and you'll kill him?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A man has said.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: The one who tortures everyone.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A man needs a name.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: I don't know his name. They call him the Tickler.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: That is enough. Go now, girl. Your master is thirsty.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: ARYA exits quickly.
The North
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. A winter landscape. Some men pull a large sled. The Night's Watch marches, single file.
He's not here yet. He'd have seen us, blown the horn.
Speaker: JEOR

Text: When will he come?
Speaker: JON

Text: The Halfhand does things in his own time.
Speaker: JEOR

Text: My uncle told me stories about him.
Speaker: JON

Text: Most of them are true.
Speaker: JEOR

Text: I heard the Halfhand spent half of last winter beyond the Wall.
Speaker: JON

Text: The whole winter. He was north of the Skirling Pass when the snows came. Had to wait for the thaw.
Speaker: JEOR

Text: So it is possible for someone to survive out here on their own.
Speaker: JON

Text: Well, possible for the Halfhand.
Speaker: JEOR

Text: Beautiful, isn't it? Gilly would love it here.
Speaker: SAM

Text: (to GRENN) There's nothing more sickening than a man in love.
Speaker: EDDISON TOLLETT

Text: EXT. A snowy cliffside
One of the Night's Watch stands guard while the other set up camp .
About time you did something. At least you'll keep warm.
Speaker: MAN

Text: The Fist of the First Men. Think of how old this place is. Before the Targaryens defeated the Andals, before the Andals took Westeros from the First Men.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Before I die, please, stop talking.
Speaker: EDDISON TOLLETT

Text: Thousands and thousands of years ago, the First Men stood here where we're standing all through the long night. What do you think they were like, the First Men?
Speaker: SAM

Text: Stupid. Smart people don't find themselves in places like this.
Speaker: EDDISON TOLLETT

Text: (laughs)
Speaker: GRENN

Text: I think they were afraid. I think they came here to get away from something. And I don't think it worked.
Speaker: JON

Text: A horn sounds, and the men pause from their labor to see what is going on.
Wildlings?
Speaker: GRENN

Text: One blast is for rangers returning. Wildlings is two blasts.
Speaker: JON

Text: So you got to stand there waiting, wondering. One blast for friends, two for foes.
Speaker: EDDISON TOLLETT

Text: And three for White Walkers. It's been a thousand years, but that's the only time they blow the horn three times.
Speaker: SAM

Text: But if it's been a thousand years, how do you know?
Speaker: GRENN

Text: Well I read it in a book.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I read it in a book.
Speaker: EDDISON TOLLETT

Text: and GRENN start to walk off
Speaker: EDDISON TOLLETT

Text: Look. It's Qhorin Halfhand.
Speaker: JON

Text: Aye, we'll live another day. Hurrah.
Speaker: EDDISON TOLLETT

Text: EDDISON TOLLETT leaves.
KINGS LANDING
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: TYRION is in a basement, holding a pot of wildfire.
Take care, my lord.
Speaker: HAYLENE

Text: I remember reading an old sailors' proverb, "Piss on wildfire and your cock burns off. "
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Oh, I have not conducted this experiment. It could well be true. The substance burns so hot, it melts wood, stone, even steel, and, of course, flesh. The substance burns so hot, it melts flesh like tallow.
Speaker: HAYLENE

Text: TYRION hands the pot to HAYLENE, happy to give over the foul alchemy.
After the dragons died, wildfire was the key to the Targaryen power.
Speaker: HAYLENE

Text: (scoffs)
Speaker: BRONN

Text: My companion takes issue.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: If I could tell you how many crazy old men I've seen pushing carts around army camps making grand claims about jars full of pig shit. No offense meant.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Our order does not deal in pig shit. The substance is fire given form. And we have been perfecting it since the days of Maegor.
Speaker: HAYLENE

Text: To do what?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: The jars are put in catapults and flung at the enemy.
Speaker: HAYLENE

Text: How much do you have?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: HAYLENE starts to lead the others through a door and darker catacombs. TYRION and BRONN follow.
If you could get real soldiers to man the catapults, then maybe you'd hit your target one time in ten, but all the real soldiers are in the Riverlands with your father.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: My lord, this man is insulting.
Speaker: HAYLENE

Text: I don't know if you've ever seen a battle, old man, but things can get a bit messy. 'Cause when we're flinging things at Stannis, he's flinging them right back at us. Men die, men shit themselves, men run, which means pots falling, which means fire inside the walls, which means the poor cunts trying to defend the city end up burning it down.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: My friend remains unconvinced.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: He would not dare insult my order whilst Aerys Targaryen lived.
Speaker: HAYLENE

Text: Well, he's not living anymore. And all his pots of wildfire didn't help him, did they? Men win wars, not magic tricks.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: HAYLENE forces open an ancient door. They enter a storeroom. TYRION is amazed at how much wildfire they have produced.
We have been working tirelessly, day and night, ever since your royal sister commanded us to do so. Our present count stands at 7,811. Enough to burn Stannis Baratheon's fleet and armies both.
Speaker: HAYLENE

Text: This is a shit idea.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I'm afraid I have to concur with my advisor, Wisdom Haylene. The contents of this room could lay King's Landing low. You won't be making wildfire for my sister any longer. You'll be making it for me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: QARTH
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: DAENERYS and DOREAH are on a balcony with Drogon, one of the dragons.
Dracarys. Dracarys.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The dragon spits forth a small flame which cooks the raw meat before him. The women laugh and applaud.He easts
He'll be able to feed himself from now on.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DOREAH reaches for Drogon.
Let him sleep, Doreah.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Yes, Khaleesi.
Speaker: DOREAH

Text: Drogon climbs on DOREAH hand.
(amused) He loves you.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (Dothraki) I rewove this part of the top. And I fixed the heel on this one.
Speaker: IRRI

Text: Thank you, my friend.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Did you see the dress Xaro had made for you? They say he's the wealthiest man in Qarth.
Speaker: DOREAH

Text: It is known.
Speaker: IRRI

Text: And if Qarth is the wealthiest city in Essos
Speaker: DOREAH

Text: The last time a rich man gave me a dress, he was selling me to Khal Drogo.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (Dothraki) May he ride forever through the night lands.
Speaker: IRRI

Text: Xaro is our host, but we know nothing about him. Men like to talk about other men when they're happy.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (chuckles) You would look like a real princess in Xaro's
Speaker: DOREAH

Text: She's not a princess. She's a Khaleesi. You should wear it, Khaleesi.
Speaker: IRRI

Text: All three are quiet in the awkward moment.
You are their guest. It would be rude not to.
Speaker: IRRI

Text: IRRI exits.
EXT. QARTH GARDEN PARTY
DAENERYS mingles during an elegant garden party.
And you must visit the night market. The Qartheen night market is like no night market you've ever seen.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: It sounds wonderful.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Meereenis think they have a night market. I will take you there myself.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: Please excuse me for a moment.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS joins JORAH, who is speaking with two Dothraki.
(speakss Dothraki)
Speaker: JORAH

Text: What are they doing?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Malakko says the statue is too heavy to carry. Kovarro says that Malakko is an idiot. They can pry out the gems, the rest is pure gold. Very soft. He can chop off as much as we can carry.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: (Dothraki) Or melt it. Very simple.
Speaker: KOVARRO

Text: (Dothraki)  We are his guests! You can't pry it or chop it or melt it.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (Dothraki) Of course not, Khaleesi! We will wait until we leave.
Speaker: KOVARRO

Text: (Dothraki) Not even when we leave.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (Dothraki) Why not?
Speaker: KOVARRO

Text: (Dothraki) Our host saved us from the Red Waste and you want to steal from him? I will hear no more.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: KOVARRO and MALAKKO exit. KOVARRO steals a goblet along the way.
My brother used to say the only thing the Dothraki knew how to do was steal things better men have built.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: It's not the only thing. They're quite good at killing the better men.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: That's not the kind of queen I'm going to be.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: PYATT PREE approaches them and bows.
Mother of Dragons. On behalf of the warlocks of Qarth, I welcome you. A demonstration?
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: PYATT PREE offers his hand and DAENERYS takes it. He places a gem in her palm.
Take this gem. Look at it. Into its depths. So many facets. Look closely enough and you can see yourself in them. Often more than once.
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: PYATT PREE looks over his shoulder to his own doppelganger, who stands motionless. The crowd gasps.
Should you grow tired of Xaro's baubles and trinkets, it would be an honor to host you at the House of the Undying. You are always welcome, Mother of Dragons.
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: PYATT PREE and his twin both leave. The crowd applauds at the illusion. XARO comes to DAENERYS's side from the crowd.
My apologies. Pyatt Pree is one of the Thirteen. It was customary for me to extend him an invitation. Customs die slow deaths in Qarth.
Speaker: XARO

Text: What is the House of the Undying?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: It is where the warlocks go to squint at dusty books and drink shade of the evening. It turns their lips blue and their minds soft. So soft, they actually believe their parlor tricks are magic.
Speaker: XARO

Text: XARO leads DAENERYS away, leaving JORAH behind. QUAITHE, a masked woman, talks to JORAH.s
You watch over her.
Speaker: QUAITHE

Text: Do I know you?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I know you. Jorah Mormont of Bear Island.
Speaker: QUAITHE

Text: Who are you?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I'm no one. But she is the Mother of Dragons. She needs true protectors, now more than ever. They shall come day and night to see the wonder born into the world again. And when they see, they shall lust, for dragons are fire made flesh. And fire is power.
Speaker: QUAITHE

Text: QUAITHE leaves.
WOODS IN THE SHADOWLANDS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: BRIENNE and CATELYN stand next to a stream, having stopped to water their horses.
It looked like Stannis.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: To me it just looked like... A shadow in the shape of a man.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: In the shape of Stannis.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: CATELYN is unsure.
We should reach my son's camp tomorrow.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Will you stay there long, my lady?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Only long enough to tell Robb what I have seen. After that, I will leave for Winterfell. My two youngest need me. I've been away from them for far too long.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I never knew my mother.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I'm sorry.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: CATELYN walks to the fire and sits.  BRIENNE follows.
My own mother died on the birthing bed when I was very young.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: It's a bloody business.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: What comes after is even harder.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Once you're safely back amongst your own people, will you give me leave to go, my lady?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You mean to kill Stannis.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I swore a vow.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: But Stannis has a great army around him. His own guards are sworn to keep him safe.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I'm as good as any of them. I should never have fled.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Renly's death was no fault of yours. You served him bravely.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I only held him that once as he was dying.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: CATELYN stands and faces BRIENNE.
He's gone, Brienne. You serve nothing and no one by following him into the earth. Renly's enemies are Robb's enemies as well.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I do not know your son, my lady. But I could serve you, if you would have me. You have courage. Not battle courage, perhaps, but, I don't know, a woman's kind of courage. And I think that when the time comes, you will not hold me back. Promise me that you will not hold me back from Stannis.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: When the time comes, I will not hold you back.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: BRIENNE draws her sword and kneels to pledge her loyalty.
Then I am yours, my lady. I will shield your back and give my life for yours, if it comes to that. I swear it by the Old Gods and the new.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I vow that you shall always have a place in my home and at my table and that I shall ask no service of you that might bring you dishonor. I swear it by the Old Gods and the new.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: WINTERFELL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. The main hall of Winterfell.
RICKON cracks nuts while BRAN receives visitors. LUWIN sits at his side.

And it's not just thieves, my lord. There's wolves in them hills now, more than I ever seen. They come down in the night and they kill my sheep. My three sons is away fighting for your brother, my lord. They'll fight, keep fighting till they're told to go home. I have no one to man my flock now. Only me. I can't keep watch all day and all night.
Speaker: WINTERFELL SHEPHERD

Text: We can send two orphan boys from Winterstown home with you to help watch over your flock if you can give them room and board.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: My wife always prayed for more children. We'll look after them. Thank you, my lord. And may the gods bless you and yours.
Speaker: WINTERFELL SHEPHERD

Text: The WINTERFELL SHEPHERD leaves.
(to RICKON) Stop it. If that's everyone, I'm going to go for a ride before dark.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Good.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: Hodor.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: RODRIK enters.
Bran! Lord Stark.  Torrhen's Square is under siege.
Speaker: RODRIK

Text: Torrhen's Square is barely 40 leagues from here. How can the Lannisters strike so far north?
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: Might be a raiding party led by the mountain. Might be sellswords paid by Tywin Lannister.
Speaker: RODRIK

Text: We have to help them.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Most of the fighting men are away with Robb, but I can gather 200 decent men.
Speaker: RODRIK

Text: Do you need so many?
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: If we can't protect our own bannermen, why should they protect us? Go, Ser Rodrik. Take the men you need.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Won't take long, my lord. Southerners don't do well up here.
Speaker: RODRIK

Text: RODRIK exits with his entourage.
EXT WINTERFELL
HODOR carries BRAN through the courtyard. OSHA walks beside him.
So, what does it mean?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Ask your Maester Luwin. He's the one studying books all the time.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: I did ask him. He'd never heard of a three-eyed raven.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Must not mean anything, then.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: You're lying.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You might be a little lord, but don't you call me a liar.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: You know what it means.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I never said I didn't.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: You didn't give me an honest answer.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: That's not the same as being a liar.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: Well, it's not far off.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: So, you've been dreaming of a three-eyed raven again? In the godswood, you told me you didn't dream. Now who's a liar? What did you see in your dream?
Speaker: OSHA

Text: BRAN doesn't answer.
Something bad? Tell me, boy.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: I dreamt that the sea came to Winterfell. I saw waves crashing against the gates and the water came flowing over the walls It flooded the castle. Drowned men were floating here, in the yard. Ser Rodrik was one of them.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: The sea is hundreds of miles away.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: I know. It's just a stupid dream.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I've got to get these potatoes to the kitchen. Otherwise they'll put me in chains again.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: Osha. The three-eyed raven, what do they say about it north of the Wall?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: They say all sorts of crazy things north of the Wall.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: OSHA exits.
NORTH OF THE WALL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. A winter storm howls as the Knight's Watchmen persevere.
There.
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: Where?
Speaker: JEOR

Text: On that mountain.
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: I don't see very well.
Speaker: SAM

Text: A fire.
Speaker: JON

Text: There's a fire. The people sitting around it have better eyes than yours or mine. When they see us coming, that fire becomes a signal. Gives Mance Rayder plenty of time to throw a party in our honor.
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: How many wildlings have joined him?
Speaker: JEOR

Text: From what we can tell, all of them. Mance has gathered them all like deer against the wolves. They're almost ready to make their move.
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: Where?
Speaker: JON

Text: Somewhere safe. Somewhere south. Can't just march into their midst. And we can't wait for them here with nothing but a pile of stones to protect us.
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: You saying we should fall back to the Wall?
Speaker: JEOR

Text: Mance was one of us once. Now he's one of them. He's going to teach them our way of doing things. They'll hit us in force and they won't run away when we hit back. They're gonna be more organized than before, more disciplined, more like us. So we need to be more like them, do things their way. Sneak in, kill Mance, and scatter them to the winds before they can march on the Wall. And to do that
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: We need to get rid of those lookouts.
Speaker: JEOR

Text: It's not a job for 400 men. I need to move fast and silent. Harker, Stonesnake, Borba.
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: Lord Commander, I'd like to join Lord Qhorin.
Speaker: JON

Text: I've been called lots of things, but that might be my first Lord Qhorin. You're a steward, Snow, not a ranger.
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: I've fought and killed a wight. How many rangers can say that?
Speaker: JON

Text: He's the one?
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: Aye. You killed a wight. You also let an old man beat you bloody and take your sword.
Speaker: JEOR

Text: Craster? In the boy's defense, that's a tough old goat.
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: I could take up Jon's duties while he's gone, my lord. It would be no trouble.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Well, I hope you make a better ranger than you do a steward. Go on.
Speaker: JEOR

Text: EXT. QARTH GARDEN
The garden party has continued into the night.
So, tell me, how long has your manservant been in love with you?
Speaker: XARO

Text: He's not my manservant and he's not in love with me. He's my advisor and he's my friend.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Unlikely. I can almost always tell what a man wants.
Speaker: XARO

Text: And what about what a woman wants?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Much more complicated. You, for example, what do you want?
Speaker: XARO

Text: To cross the Narrow Sea and take back the Iron Throne.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Why?
Speaker: XARO

Text: Because I promised my khalasar I'd protect them and find them a safe home.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You want to conquer the Seven Kingdoms for the Dothraki?
Speaker: XARO

Text: I want them because they're mine by right. The Iron Throne is mine and I will take it.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Ah, a conqueror.
Speaker: XARO

Text: And how did you get all of this? Did someone give it to you?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: No. I come from nothing. I hit the docks like a piece of cargo, except someone normally cares what happens to cargo.
Speaker: XARO

Text: So you wanted more than you had and you took it. You're a conqueror, too. You're just less ambitious.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (chuckles)
Speaker: XARO

Text: What do you want, Xaro Xhoan Daxos? At the gates of the city, you bled for me. Why?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I will show you why.
Speaker: XARO

Text: He leads her away.
INT. A VAULT.
XARO strikes the door of the vault with a sword.

The door and the vault is made of Valyrian stone. The hardest steel does not make a mark. I offered the greatest locksmiths in Qarth their weight in gold if they could break into it. I made the same offer to the greatest thieves. They all went home empty-handed. The only thing that can open this door is this key.
Speaker: XARO

Text: And behind the door?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (chuckles)
Speaker: XARO

Text: And it can all be mine?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: All? Let us say half. More than enough to buy horses, ships, armies.  Enough to go home.
Speaker: XARO

Text: All I have to do?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Is marry me.
Speaker: XARO

Text: That was a romantic proposal.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I've already married once for love, but the gods stole her from me. I come from nothing. My mother and father never owned a pair of shoes. But marry me, and I will give you the Seven Kingdoms and our children will be princes and princesses.
Speaker: XARO

Text: DAENERYS thinks about his proposition.
See? I have more ambition than you thought. The time is right, Daenerys Targaryen, First of Your Name. Robert Baratheon is dead.
Speaker: XARO

Text: INT. DAENERYS'S CHAMBERS
If you cross the sea with an army you bought and a foreign husband who paid for it . . .
Speaker: JORAH

Text: The Seven Kingdoms are at war with one another. Four false kings destroying the country.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: To win Westeros, you need support from Westeros.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: The usurper is dead.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (laughs)
Speaker: JORAH

Text: The Starks fight the Lannisters, and Baratheons fight each other.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: According to your new friend who earned your trust by cutting his hand?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: The time to strike is now. We need to find ships and an army or we'll spend the rest of our lives rotting away at the edge of the world.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Rich men do not become rich by giving more than they get. They'll give you ships and soldiers and they'll own you forever. Moving carefully is the hard way, but it's the right way.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: And if I'd listened to that advice outside the gates of Qarth, we'd all be dead by now.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Do not speak to me like I'm a child.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I only want
Speaker: JORAH

Text: What do you want? Tell me.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: To see you on the Iron Throne.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Why?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You have a good claim. A title. A birthright. But you have something more than that. You may cover it up and deny it, but you have a gentle heart. You would not only be respected and feared, you would be loved. Someone who can rule and should rule. Centuries come and go without a person like that coming into the world. There are times when I look at you and I still can't believe you're real.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: So what would you have me do, as my advisor?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Make your own way. Find your own ship. You only need one. The allies we need are in Westeros, not Qarth.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: And how do I get the ship?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I'll find it for you. A sound ship with a good captain.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I look forward to meeting him.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Khaleesi.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: JORAH bows and exits.
EXT. RIVERLANDS
Tywin's emcampment with the recruits still held prisoner.

You should stand sideface.

Guards! Did you see anything? Go up there. Go and see where he fell from.

Text: That's the price you pay if you want to be a man of the Night's Watch.
Speaker: JON

Text: So instead of getting naked with a girl, you'd prefer to invade our lands
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: Invade your lands? Wildlings raid our lands all the time. Some of them tried to kill my little brother, a crippled boy!
Speaker: JON

Text: Yhey're not your lands! We've been here the whole time. You lot came along and just put up a big wall and said it was yours.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: My father was Ned Stark. I have the blood of the First Men. My ancestors lived here, same as yours.
Speaker: JON

Text: So why are you fighting us?
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: YGRITTE turns and walks down the slope. JON follows.
SHADOWLANDS COURTYARD
Speaker: EXT

Text: In a misty morning, a man twitches while hung by a noose. Another screams in pain.
Go on. Now I want you to tell me what happened. Come on, this way. Come on, speak up. Speak up.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Above the courtyard, TYWIN listens, and sniffs a wooden toothpick
Wolfsbane. A rare substance. This is no common assassin.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: We hanged 20 men last night.
Speaker: MOUNTIAN

Text: I don't care if you hanged 100. A man tried to kill me. I want his name and I want his head.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: ARYA sets the table and listens.
We think it was an infiltrator from the Brotherhood Without Banners.
Speaker: MOUNTAIN

Text: Pretentious name for a band of outlaws. We can't allow rebels behind our lines to harass us with impunity. We look like fools and they look like heroes. That's how kings fall. I want them dead, every one.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Killing them isn't the problem. It's finding them. Have you gone soft, Clegane? I always thought you had a talent for violence.
Speaker: MOUNTAIN

Text: Burn the villages, burn the farms. Let them know what it means to choose the wrong side.
Speaker: TWYIN

Text: The MOUNTAIN exits.
Mmm. Is that mutton?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Yes, my lord.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Don't like mutton.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I'll bring something else.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Leave it. Are you hungry?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: No.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Of course you are. Eat.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I'll eat in the kitchen later.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: It's bad manners to refuse a lord's offer. Sit. Eat.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: ARYA sits and eats the mutton.
You're small for your age. I suppose you've been underfed your whole life.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I eat a lot. I just don't grow.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: TYWIN looks out the window.
Mmm. This will be my last war. Win or lose.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Have you ever lost before?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Do you think I'd be in my position if I had lost a war?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: (shakes her head)
Speaker: ARYA

Text: But this is the one I'll be remembered for. The War of Five Kings, they're calling it. My legacy will be determined in the coming months.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: ARYA realizes that TYWIN has let his guard down, and considers her options. But he turns back to her and she starts, suddenly.

Do you know what legacy means? It's what you pass down to your children and your children's children. It's what remains of you when you're gone. Harren the Black thought this castle would be his legacy. The greatest fortress ever built.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYWIN walks to the fireplace.  The tallest towers, the strongest walls. The Great Hall had 35 hearths. Thirty-five. Can you imagine? Look at it now. A blasted ruin. Do you know what happened?
Dragons?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Yes. Dragons happened.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYWIN pours himself some wine.

Harrenhal was built to withstand an attack from the land. A million men could have marched on these walls, and a million men would have been repelled. But an attack from the air with dragon fire Mmm-mmm. Harren and all his sons roasted alive within these walls. Aegon Targaryen changed the rules. That's why every child alive still knows his name
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Aegon and his sisters.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Mmm?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: It wasn't just Aegon riding his dragon. It was Rhaenys and Visenya, too.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Correct. A student of history, are you?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Rhaenys rode Meraxes. Visenya rode Vhagar.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I'm sure I knew that when I was a boy.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Visenya Targaryen was a great warrior. She had a Valyrian steel sword she called Dark Sister.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Hmm. She's a heroine of yours, I take it?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: (smiles)
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Aren't most girls more interested in the pretty maidens from the songs? Jonquil with the flowers in her hair?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Most girls are idiots.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You remind me of my daughter. Where did you learn all this stuff about Visenya and her Valyrian steel sword?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: From my father.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: He was a well-read stonemason. Can't say I've ever met a literate stonemason.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Have you met many stonemasons, my lord?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Careful now, girl. I enjoy you, but be careful. Take that back to the kitchen. Eat what you want.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: ARYA rises, clearing the dishes and walking away.
And, girl.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: ARYA stops.
"M'lord.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: ARYA turns, confused.
" Lowborn girls say "m'lord," not "my lord. " If you're going to pose as a commoner, you should do it properly.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: My mother served Lady Dustin for many years, my lord. She taught me how to speak proper Properly.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You're too smart for your own good. Has anyone told you that?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Yes.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Go on.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: ARYA exits and TYWIN ponders, and drinks his wine.
KING'S LANDING
Speaker: INT

Text: SANSA walks through a castle hallway. The HOUND comes in the other direction.
I beg pardon, ser. I should have come to you after to thank you for saving me. You were so brave.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Brave? A dog doesn't need courage to chase off rats.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Does it give you joy to scare people?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: No, it gives me joy to kill people.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: (gasps)
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Spare me. You can't tell me Lord Eddard Stark of Winterfell never killed a man.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: It was his duty. He never liked it.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Is that what he told you? He lied. Killing is the sweetest thing there is.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Why are you always so hateful?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You'll be glad of the hateful things I do someday when you're queen and I'm all that stands between you and your beloved king.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: SANSA turns and walks away.
QARTH GARDEN
Speaker: EXT

Text: DAENERYS and XARO walk through the garden, anxiously.
I've demanded a meeting of the Thirteen. One of them did this or knows who did.
Speaker: XARO

Text: You are one of the Thirteen.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: If I wanted your dragons, I would have taken them. They mean nothing to me on their own.
Speaker: XARO

Text: Nothing? They're more valuable than anything in the world.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Shall we look inside my vault and see what selling your dragons would buy me I cannot buy already? We will get them back.
Speaker: XARO

Text: There is no we, so why would you help me get them back?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I took you under my protection in front of the rulers of my city. A man is what others say he is and no more. If they say that Xaro Xhoan Daxos is a liar, my word is worth nothing. I cannot let this thing happen to you under my roof.
Speaker: XARO

Text: But it did happen under your roof.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Khaleesi, many times in my life, I have been
Speaker: XARO

Text: I don't care where you've been.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS steps quickly up the stairs. MALAKKO blocks XARO's way.
THE FAR NORTH
Speaker: EXT

Text: JON and YGRITTE continue their trek among the mountaintops. JON keeps looking back at her.

You think we're savages because we don't live in stone castles. We can't make steel as good as yours, it's true, but We're free. If someone tried to tell us we couldn't lie down as man and woman, we'd shove a spear up his arse. We don't go serving some shit king who's only king because his father was.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: No. No, you serve Mance Rayder, the King beyond the Wall.
Speaker: JON

Text: We chose Mance Rayder to lead us. He was a crow, same as you, but he wanted to be free. You could be free, too. You don't need to live your whole life taking commands from old men. Wake up when you want to wake up. I could show you the streams to fish, the woods to hunt. Build yourself a cabin and find a woman to lie with in the night.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: YGRITTE comes closer.
You're a pretty lad. The girls would claw each other's eyes out to get naked with you.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: Walk.
Speaker: JON

Text: I could teach you how to do it.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: I know how to do it.
Speaker: JON

Text: You know nothing, Jon Snow.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: YGRITTE walks ahead. JON follows.
THE RIVERLANDS
Speaker: EXT

Text: The Stark war camp is quiet. SER ALTON reports to ROBB stark while RIKARD KARSTARK, ROOSE and ??? look on.
And what did she say?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: She admired your spirit, Your Grace.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: And what then?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: She
Speaker: ALTON

Text: If every man were held accountable for the actions of every distant relative, Ser Alton, we'd all hang.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: She tore the paper in half, Your Grace.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: You've acted with honor. I thank you for it. Lord Karstark, see that Ser Alton's pen is clean, and give him a hot supper.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Ser Alton's pen is occupied, Your Grace. The prisoners from the Yellow Fork.
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: Too many prisoners.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Is there room for Ser Alton?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Does he need to lie down?
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: Have the men build him a new pen. Put him in with the Kingslayer for now. Have your boy watch over them.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Torrhen.
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: TORRHEN grabs ALTON's should to lead him away
That will be all.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: ALTON, TORRHEN, RICKARD KARSTARK and ??? leave. TALISA enters.
Your Grace. A minute of your time?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: ROOSE leaves, eying TALISA.
I've been treating your wounded men.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: And my enemies, as some of my bannermen are fond of mentioning.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: They're not my enemies.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: That's what I tell my bannermen.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I've already run through the supplies I brought with me. Some are easily replaced. Egg yolks, turpentine, oil of roses. But some are not. I need silk for stitching. I need fennel root for those with fever, willow bark. Mostly I need milk of the poppy. You saw what it was like to amputate a foot without any. I assume there will be more loss of limb before this war is over.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: If you need help finding these
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I know where to find them. I'm sorry, I shouldn't interrupt you.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Continue, my lady.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: You're riding to the Crag to negotiate a surrender?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Yes.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: The Crag will have a maester and he will have what I need.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: I expect he will.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: If I could write a list.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Come with me to the Crag.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I don't think that will be
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Let the maester show you his stores. I want the wounded men to be treated well, all the wounded men.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: ROBB exits.
FARM OUTSIDE WINTERFELL
Speaker: EXT

Text: THEON's search party has come upon the farmhouse. They mill around, trying to pick up the scent.
Children, come inside, quick. Come on.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: Hurry up!
Speaker: CHILD

Text: Can't find anything, ser. They've lost the scent.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Try again.
Speaker: THEON

Text: We've circled this farmhouse twice. There's no sign of them.
Speaker: MAN

Text: The MAN continues to lead his dog through the farm.
We could start the search fresh in the morning, my lord.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: THEON grabs LUWIN.

I'm looking at spending the rest of my life being treated like a fool and a eunuch by my own people. Ask yourself, is there anything I wouldn't do to stop that from happening? The hounds will find the scent again. I'll beat them until they do. I'll whip every man here until I have both those boys in hand. And once I've got them, the pampered little shits It's better to be cruel than weak.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Two ironborn lead the WINTERFELL SHEPHERD to THEON.
Prince Theon.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: Where are they?
Speaker: THEON

Text: Who, m'lord?
Speaker: WINTERFELL SHEPHERD

Text: The Stark boys. Where are they?
Speaker: THEON

Text: I don't know. I seen no one.
Speaker: WINTERFELL SHEPHERD

Text: THEON punches him in the gut.
Think harder.
Speaker: THEON

Text: I swear, m'lord. I don't know.
Speaker: WINTERFELL SHEPHERD

Text: THEON makes to punch him again, but DAGMER has found something by the hay bales.
My lord, over here. I think I've found what we're looking for.
Speaker: DAGMER

Text: THEON comes over and DAGMER shows him a handful of walnut shells. THEON looks around
Send the old man home.
Speaker: DAGMER

Text: (nods)
Speaker: THEON

Text: THEON walks up to LUWIN.
Go back to Winterfell. Take him back.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Theon, don't do this.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: The ironborn take LUWIN away.
DAENERYS'S ROOM IN QARTH
Speaker: INT

Text: DAENERYS stands sadly. JORAH enters.
You came back.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: As soon as I heard. Do you know anything?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Irri is dead.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I know. She was a good
Speaker: JORAH

Text: She's dead. She died alone. She died for me and I couldn't protect her.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Doreah?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: We can't find her. She must be dead, too. I led my people out of the Red Waste and into the slaughterhouse.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I should have been here.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You went to find me a ship.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: My place is by your side. I shouldn't have left you alone with these people.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: "These people"?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They are not to be trusted.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: And who is to be trusted? Who are my people? The Targaryens? I only knew one, my brother, and he would have let a thousand men rape me if it had got him the crown. The Dothraki? Most of them turned on me the day that Khal Drogo fell from his horse.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your people are in Westeros.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: The people in Westeros don't know I'm alive.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They will soon enough.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: And then what? They'll pray for my return? They'll wave dragon banners and shout my name? That's what my brother believed and he was a fool.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You are not your brother.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Trust me, Khaleesi.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: There it is. "Trust me. " And it's you I should trust, Ser Jorah? Only you? I don't need trust any longer. I don't want it and I don't have room for it.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You are too young to be so
Speaker: JORAH

Text: JORAH reaches for her.
And you are too familiar.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Forgive me, Khaleesi. No one can survive in this world without help. No one. Let me help you, please. Tell me how.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Find my dragons.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JORAH exits.
THE FAR NORTH
Speaker: EXT

Text: JON and YGRITTE are still walking in the desolate snowlands.
How long till we get back to your crows?
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: We're close.
Speaker: JON

Text: What, a day? A half-day? You don't know, do you? Do you even know where they are?
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: We're close.
Speaker: JON

Text: What do you think they'll say when they hear about you and me?
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: Nothing happened between you and me.
Speaker: JON

Text: "I swear it, Old Master King Crow, ser, "we were only close together for warmth. "And then I felt it, right up against me backside like a club. "I can show you the bruise on me tailbone. "And before I knew what was where, his his "Well, it was all out in the open, all angry as you like. "And I didn't want to want it, but oh, I did! "And he spread me legs and ruined. "The shame of it. "Now I can never marry a perfumed lord. "What will me poor savage father say?"
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: Turn back around.
Speaker: JON

Text: "And I thought that we were done, but he said, "'Turn back around." I'll tell you what, Jon Snow. Since it's gonna be your word against mine, and since you can't talk about it without blushing, we may as well just JON: What, right here in the muck?
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: I'll keep you warm enough.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: JON pulls on her restraints, releasing her hands.
Are you that afraid of it?
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: That's enough.
Speaker: JON

Text: It's nice and wet and warm.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: Enough!
Speaker: JON

Text: It don't have teeth.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: YGRITTE comes closer. JON is tempted, but comes to his senses and grab the hilt of his sword. YGRITTE backs off.
All right! All right. Gods, you're dull.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: YGRITTE quickly snares the rope around her leg and pulls JON down to the ground. He grunts and she takes off running. Jon gets up and chases her. She disappears down a slope. Jon runs to where he last saw her, and finds her bindings, cut. He hears a whistle, and looks up to see YGRITTE and two other wildlings on a ledge above him. She is smiling. Jon looks around to see that he is surrounded by wildlings.
Should have took me while you had the chance.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: KING'S LANDING
Speaker: INT

Text: SANSA is having a nightmare, reliving the attempted rape by the rioters.
No, no!
Speaker: SANSA

Text: She wakes in a start, and pulls back the covers to see that her first period has begun. She is distraught
No. Oh, no.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA gets up, grabs a knife and tries to remove the bloodstain. SHAE enters the chamber with SANSA's breakfast. She rushes over to help
It's all right. Give me that.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: If the Queen sees, I can have Joffrey's children now.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Help me flip it over.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: While SHAE and SANSA try to flip the mattress, another handmaiden enters. They stop. The handmaiden turns and rushes out of the room. After exchanging a glance with SANSA, SHAE follows her.
DARK HALLWAY
Speaker: INT

Text: The handmaiden moves quickly. SHAE pursuers her.
Where are you going?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: To tell Her Grace.
Speaker: HANDMAIDEN

Text: SHAE pulls a knife and holds it to the handmaiden's throat.
You'll say nothing to anyone. Do you understand?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: The HANDMAIDEN nods in fear and then runs off. SHAE watches her go, then returns.
SANSA'S ROOM
Speaker: INT

Text: SHAE rushes back to SANSA's room. The HOUND is already there. SANSA sits on her bed, dejected.
CERSEI'S ROOM
Speaker: INT

Text: CERSEI and SANSA enter.
Your mother might have prepared you. You flowered, my dear. No more.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: My mother told me, but I thought it would be different.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: In what way?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I thought it would be less Less messy.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Wait until you birth a child.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: SANSA sits on the edge of the bed.
You're a woman now. Do you have any idea what that means?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I'm fit to bear children for the king?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: A prospect that once delighted you, bringing little princes and princesses into the world, the greatest honor for a queen.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: (nods)
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Joffrey has always been difficult. Even his birth, I labored a day and a half to bring him into this world. You cannot imagine the pain. I screamed so loudly, I was sure Robert would hear me in the Kingswood.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: His Grace was not with you?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Robert was hunting. That was his custom. Whenever my time was near, my royal husband would flee to the trees with his huntsmen and his hounds. And when he returned, he would present me with some pelts or a stag's head, and I would present him with a baby. Not that I wanted him there, mind you. I had Grand Maester Pycelle, an army of midwives, and I had my brother. When they told Jaime he wasn't allowed in the birthing room, he smiled and asked which one of them proposed to keep him out. Joffrey will show you no such devotion.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: SANSA looks down.
You may never love the king, but you will love his children.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I love His Grace with all my heart.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: That's so very touching to hear. Permit me to share some womanly wisdom with you on this very special day. The more people you love, the weaker you are. You'll do things for them that you know you shouldn't do. You'll act the fool to make them happy, to keep them safe. Love no one but your children. On that front, a mother has no choice.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: But shouldn't I love Joffrey, Your Grace?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You can try, little dove.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: SANSA looks down, sadly.
RIVERLANDS AT NIGHT
Speaker: EXT

Text: A guard checks on the prisoners in the Stark encampment. JAIME and ALTON share a cell.
Who did you say your mother was again?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Cinda Lannister.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: Is she the fat one?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Well, perhaps she's gotten a little larger than she
Speaker: ALTON

Text: No, no. There's only one fat Lannister. If she was your mother, you'd know it.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I squired for you once, you know.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: When?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The tournament, the day of Willem Frey's wedding.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: I went to Willem Frey's wedding?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You did. Your squire had gotten so drunk the night before that he threw up.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: He threw up on his horse on the way to the tourney grounds. What was his name?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Bryan.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: Poor lad. That was my brother's doing, I seem to recall. I remember you. You'd never squired for anyone before.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: That's right. I ran up and volunteered. "Let me, my lord. Let me. " My father was furious. Afraid I'd embarrass our family in front of the Family.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: You didn't, though.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You really remember?
Speaker: ALTON

Text: You knew when you were needed and when to go away. It's a rare talent. Most of my squires, they mean well, but young men with big jobs, they tend to overdo them.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: When I think back to that day
Speaker: ALTON

Text: Shh!
Speaker: GUARD

Text: You were saying?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I Never mind. It's embarrassing.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: More embarrassing than being chained to a post covered in your own shit?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I remember everything about that day, your helmet, your horse, the rake lines in the dirt along the list, where the sun was in the sky when you knocked Balon from his horse, and the dent in your shield when you handed it back to me. I'll remember it all until I die. That was the best day of my life. And I remember being on the field after it was over. All the competitors were done. I was the last one out there. And I couldn't leave. I couldn't bring myself to go and sit with my family at a table so far on the edge of the feast you could barely even see the bride. And I couldn't bear to tell them what it had been like squiring for you, when I knew that they could never have the faintest idea what I was talking about.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: I understand completely.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: How could you? Sorry, I I didn't mean to doubt you.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: It's just that I I was 16 once. I also had to replace someone's squire on short notice.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Which knight was it?
Speaker: ALTON

Text: Barristan Selmy. The fight against the Kingswood Outlaws. Before your time.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: What was he like?
Speaker: ALTON

Text: He was A painter. A painter who only used red. I couldn't imagine being able to fight like that, not back then. And to help him do that, to be a part of something that perfect. I don't need to explain how that felt, not to you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: It's hard to put into words.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: It's like stepping into a dream you've been dreaming for as long as you can remember, and finding out that the dream is more real than your life.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: (nods) Leaving that battlefield was like being dragged off to prison.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: Did you squire for him again?
Speaker: ALTON

Text: No. I didn't have your gift. He couldn't take a step without stepping on me. I was awful, a complete liability. Until one of the outlaws decided to take on a 16-year-old squire.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: (smiles)
Speaker: ALTON

Text: It's a good thing I am who I am. I'd have been useless at anything else. I'm not well-suited for imprisonment. Shocking, I know. Some men are. Ned Stark, I imagine he made an excellent prisoner right up until the end. Not me, though. My life has left me uniquely unfit for constraint.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And have you thought about
Speaker: ALTON

Text: Of course. Every day.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And?
Speaker: ALTON

Text: Good prisoners breed good jailers, apparently. The Starks are very careful.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: (nods)
Speaker: ALTON

Text: But there is a way, I think. It wasn't possible until now.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: What is it?
Speaker: ALTON

Text: JAIME looks out at the guards.
It's actually quite simple.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Well, let me help you.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: You'll only have to do one thing.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Tell me.
Speaker: ALTON

Text: (whispers)You'll have to die.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME headbutts ALTON and then beats him to death with his chained hands. TORRHEN comes to check on his bloodied body. JAIME chokes him with his chained hands until his neck snaps. JAIME takes the keys to complete his escape.
QARTH GARDEN
Speaker: EXT

Text: JORAH enters a garden where QUAITH covers the back of a man with symbols painted in blood.
Jorah the Andal. This man must sail past old Valyria. All who travel too close to the doom must have protection.
Speaker: QUAITH

Text: I didn't come here for lessons.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: No, you came for the dragons.
Speaker: QUAITH

Text: You have them? Where are they?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Draw your sword. See what your steel is worth. You want to please the Mother of Dragons.
Speaker: QUAITH

Text: JORAH does not answer. She returns to painting.
You love her.
Speaker: QUAITH

Text: Where are the dragons?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Will you betray her again, Jorah the Andal?
Speaker: QUAITH

Text: JORAH does not answer.
Will you betray her again?
Speaker: QUAITH

Text: Never.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: The thief you seek is with her now.
Speaker: QUAITH

Text: QUAITH returns to painting and JORAH exits, quickly.
QARTH COUNCIL OF THE THIRTEEN
Speaker: INT

Text: DAENERYS appears before the Thirteen to plead for her dragon's return.
I did not leave the comfort of my home to come to yours and be called a thief.
Speaker: SPICE KING

Text: No one is calling you a thief. Who is she to accuse us?
Speaker: XARO

Text: Please, they're my children. I'm begging you.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Begging us? It wasn't very long ago you were threatening us.
Speaker: SILK KING

Text: Without me, the dragons will die.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: It will be for the best. Your dragons will bring the world nothing but death and misery, my dear. If I knew where they were, I would not tell you.
Speaker: SPICE KING

Text: You are cruel, my friend. The Mother of Dragons is in the right. She must be reunited with her babies. I will help you, Khaleesi.
Speaker: PYAT PREE

Text: How?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I will take you to the House of the Undying where I have put them.
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: You have my dragons?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: When I learned you were coming to our city, I made an arrangement with the King of Qarth. He procured them for me.
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: But there is no King of Qarth.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: There is now. That was the other half of the arrangement.
Speaker: XARO

Text: XARO stands.

You would keep your gates and your minds closed to everything outside your walls, but Qarth cannot remain the greatest city that ever was if it refuses to change. I will open Qarth to the world as I have forced it to open itself to me.
Speaker: XARO

Text: PYATT PREE joins XARO's side.
Your ambition is an inspiration. But like all upstarts, you overreach. Three dragons the size of cats and an alliance with a charlatan do not make you a king.
Speaker: SPICE KING

Text: An upstart and a charlatan? Empires have been built by less. Those on the margins often come to control the center, and those in the center make room for them, willingly or otherwise.
Speaker: XARO

Text: The Mother of Dragons will be with her babies. She will give them her love and they will thrive by her side, forever.
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: PYATT PREE's doppelgangers slit the throats of the other members of the Thirteen, simultaneously. DAENERYS is horrified, and flees. She encounters another PYATT PREE clone. KOVARRO comes to her side to defend her, but JORAH stabs PYATT PREE from behind first.
A mother should be with her children.
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: JORAH removes his sword and PYATT PREE collapses into a pile of empty clothes, an illusion. Another clone appears.
Where will you run to, Daenerys Stormborn? Your dragons wait for you in the House of the Undying. Come see them.
Speaker: PYATT PREE

Text: DAENERYS, JORAH and KOVARRO exit.
RIVERLANDS
Speaker: INT

Text: CATELYN sits in her tent, writing. JACKS tries to enter.
Lady Stark!
Speaker: JACKS

Text: BRIENNE blocks JACKS at the door.
No farther.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Keep your hands off me, woman.
Speaker: JACKS
