Text: Don't enter without an invitation, man.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Forgive me. Lady Stark.
Speaker: JACKS

Text: What is it?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: They caught the Kingslayer.
Speaker: JACKS

Text: THE CAMP
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: JAIME is being led in chains by a mounted soldier, back into camp. The other soldiers assault him verbally. They jostle at one another in an attempt to make the assault physical, but his captors keep the other men away.
Kingslayer!
Speaker: MAN

Text: Kill the fucking Kingslayer!
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: Hang him!
Speaker: MAN #3

Text: Hang him!
Speaker: MAN #4

Text: You'll die today.
Speaker: MAN #5

Text: Justice for the Karstark.
Speaker: MAN #6

Text: They proceed further into the camp, but the angry soldiers eventually overpower JAIME's protectors. One man clubs him over the head and JAIME falls. The crowd gathers around to further abuse him. JAIME lies in pain. The horseman rides away, leaving JAIME in the hands of his captors, with a thick crowd behind him. They bring JAIME to his feet. He walks a few paces and then falls to his knees under the pressure of the crowd.
Gut him!
Speaker: MAN

Text: RICKARD KARSTARK swiftly approaches the crowd and draws his sword.
Get back! I want his head! Any man who stands between a father and his vengeance asks for death.
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: CATELYN, BRIENNE and JACKS enter.
Lord Karstark, this man is our prisoner.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: This monster killed my son.
Speaker: RICKARD

Text: And crippled mine. He will answer for his crimes, I promise you, but not here.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I will have his head. And if you try and stop me
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: You will strike me down? Have you forgotten me, ser? I am the widow of your liege, Lord Eddard Stark. I am the mother of your king!
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: And where is our king now?
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: You know very well.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: He has gone to the Crag to accept the surrender. Aye, gone to the Crag, but not to negotiate. He brought that foreign bitch with him.
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: How dare you!
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: BRIENNE starts to draw her sword.
Threatening my lady is an act of treason.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Treason? How can it be treason to kill Lannisters?
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: I understand your grief, my lord, better than most, I understand it. But in the name of my son, the King in the North, stand down.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: When your son returns, I will demand this murderer's head.
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: Wise men do not make demands of kings.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Fathers who love their sons do. I will have his head.
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: RICKARD KARSTARK exits
Thank you for fighting on my behalf, Lady Stark. I would have come to your defense, but
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Take him to the stockades. Bind him with every chain you can find!
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: You've become a real she-wolf in your later years. There's not much fish left in you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And gag him!
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: KING'S LANDING
Speaker: INT

Text: CERSEI and TYRION are in her bedroom. CERSEI is lighting candles with a long straw.
Since when do you light your own candles?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Since I decided that I can't stand to look at any of my handmaidens for another instant.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: She blows out the flame on the straw's end.
How many times can you read one raven scroll?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Stannis Baratheon's fleet has been spotted sailing north past Tarth, 200 ships.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: More than we have.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Yes, that's more than we have. He'll be at our gates within five days, four if he has the wind.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We have strong, high walls. We'll rain fire down on them from above.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: "Rain fire on them from above." You're quoting Father, aren't you?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Why not? He has a good mind for strategy, doesn't he?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Call it tactics, not strategy. But, yes, he does have a good mind for it. The best mind, some would say. Sadly, he's not here. It's just you, me and Joffrey, the Lord of the Seven Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm sure you'll make a point eventually.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: He needs to start acting like a king. This war you started is coming to our doorstep. And if the entire city wants Joffrey dead
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm not the one giving the boy whores to abuse.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I thought the girls might help him.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Did you?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I was wrong. If we can't control him
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Do you think I haven't tried? He doesn't listen to me.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: It's hard to put a leash on a dog once you've put a crown on its head.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I always hoped he'd be like Jaime. He looks like him. In a certain light.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The boy is more Robert than Jaime.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Robert was a drunken fool, but he didn't enjoy cruelty. Sometimes I wonder. What? If this is the price for what we've done, for our sins.
Speaker: CESEI

Text: Sins?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The Targaryens Wed brother and sister for hundreds of years, I know. That's what Jaime and I would say to each other in our moments of doubt. It's what I told Ned Stark when he was stupid enough to confront me. Half the Targaryens went mad, didn't they? What's the saying? "Every time a Targaryen is born, the Gods flip a coin."
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You've beaten the odds. Tommen and Myrcella are good, decent children, both of them.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: CERSEI begins to cry. TYRION approaches, perhaps to comfort her, but there is no closeness between them.
ROBB'S CAMP AT NIGHT
Speaker: EXT

Text: The soldiers mill about. Two of them are engaged in an argument.
Then why wait?
Speaker: MAN

Text: We're sworn to the king.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: There's not a king.
Speaker: MAN

Text: That's treason.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: So is saving Lannisters, yeah?
Speaker: MAN

Text: Back off, you.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: No, I won't.
Speaker: MAN

Text: BRIENNE and CATELYN watch from a distance, concerned about the lack of order.
Your son returns at dawn, my lady?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: So they say.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: The Kingslayer won't last the night. The more they drink, the angrier they'll get. And when the Karstarks draw their swords Who wants to die defending a Lannister?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Come.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: BRIENNE follows CATELYN. A guard leads them into JAIME's cage. He is covered in blood.
I need to be alone with him.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: My lady, our orders
Speaker: GUARD

Text: Your orders, which I just gave you, are to leave me alone with him.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: The guard exists. BRIENNE moves outside the cage.
Come to say goodbye, Lady Stark? I believe it's my last night in this world. Is that a woman?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Do you hear them out there? They want your head.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Old Lord Karstark doesn't seem to like me.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You strangled his son with your chains.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Oh. Oh. Was he the one on guard duty? He was in my way. Any knight would have done the same.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You are no knight. You have forsaken every vow you ever took.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: So many vows. They make you swear and swear. Defend the king, obey the king, obey your father, protect the innocent, defend the weak. But what if your father despises the king? What if the king massacres the innocent? It's too much. No matter what you do, you're forsaking one vow or another. Where did you find this beast?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: She is a truer knight than you will ever be, Kingslayer.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Kingslayer. What a king he was. Here's to Aerys Targaryen, the Second of His Name, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms, Protector of the Realm, and to the sword I shoved in his back.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You are a man without honor.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Do you know, I've never been with any woman but Cersei. So in my own way, I have more honor than poor old dead Ned. What was the name of that bastard he fathered?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Brienne.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: No, that wasn't it. Snow, a bastard from the North. Now, when When good old Ned came home with some whore's baby, did you pretend to love it? No. You're not very good at pretending. You're an honest woman. You hated that boy, didn't you? How could you not hate him? The walking, talking reminder that the honorable Lord Eddard Stark fucked another woman.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: (to BRIENNE) Your sword.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: BRIENNE unsheathes her sword and hands it to CATELYN.
WINTERFELL
Speaker: EXT

Text: THEON address the crowd.
I told you what would happen. All of you. I told you what would happen if you served me loyally. And what would happen if you did not.
Speaker: THEON

Text: DAGMER and an iron born raider lead LUWIN through the crowd.
What are you doing? What have you done?
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: If there are any who still question whether your new lord means what he says, here is the answer to your question.
Speaker: THEON

Text: THEON gestures behind him. The raiders raise two bodies of children, hanged by their necks and burned beyond recognition. The crowd is horrified.
No!
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: THEON looks upon the bodies, and then looks down, feeling a pang of guilt.
WINTERFELL
Speaker: EXT

Text: A soldier empties a basket of dead ravens out a tower window. They collect at the feet of THEON and DAGMER.
Riders approaching!
Speaker: MAN

Text: Open the gate!
Speaker: MAR #2

Text: The gates open slowly and a band of riders canter into the courtyard. Among them is YARA, who exchanges glances with THEON before she circles him.
DINING HALL OF WINTERFELL
Speaker: INT

Text: Yara and her men have made themselves at home, feasting and sitting leisurely at the table. THEON enters.
Why, it's the Prince of Winterfell.
Speaker: YARA

Text: The men laugh.
Envy isn't attractive.
Speaker: THEON

Text: What envy?
Speaker: YARA

Text: You should be proud of your brother's achievement. I took the great castle of Winterfell with 20 men.
Speaker: THEON

Text: You're a great warrior. I saw the bodies above your gates. Which one gave you the tougher fight, the cripple or the six-year-old?
Speaker: YARA

Text: I treated the Stark boys with honor, and they repaid me with treachery.
Speaker: THEON

Text: You treated them with honor? By butchering them?
Speaker: YARA

Text: You seized their home, as is your right. We're ironborn, we take what we need.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Exactly.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Then you made them prisoners in their home and they ran away. Is that treachery? I'd call it bravery.
Speaker: YARA

Text: They made me a promise
Speaker: THEON

Text: Your little boy prisoners made you a promise and you got mad when they broke it? Are you the dumbest cunt alive?
Speaker: YARA

Text: Don't call me
Speaker: THEON

Text: A cunt. A dumb cunt who killed the only two Starks in Winterfell. You know how valuable those boys were?
Speaker: YARA

Text: If I hadn't killed them, the Northerners would think me weak.
Speaker: THEON

Text: You are weak. And you're stupid.
Speaker: YARA

Text: I'm warning you.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Go on, then. Warn me.
Speaker: YARA

Text: THEON pauses.
You haven't brought enough men. How am I supposed to defend Winterfell with just this lot?
Speaker: THEON

Text: You're not. I've come to bring you home. Father wants a word.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Is this a joke? Winterfell is the heart of the North.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Aye, it is, hundreds of miles from the sea. We're islanders, baby brother. Had you forgotten that? Our power comes from our ships. And now that you've decorated your walls with the bodies of the Stark boys, every man in the North wants to see you hanged. When Robb Stark finds out
Speaker: YARA

Text: He won't find out. We've killed all the ravens. We have all the horses. I've taken Winterfell. And I will keep Winterfell.
Speaker: THEON

Text: (to her men) Leave us.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Her ironborn men get up from the table and exit. YARA gets up and faces THEON.
Theon, you're my blood. We both loved our mother. We both endured our father. Come home with me. Don't die here alone.
Speaker: YARA

Text: I don't intend to die.
Speaker: THEON

Text: You were a terrible baby, do you know that? Bawling all the time, never sleeping. And one night, you just wouldn't shut up, screaming like a dying pig. I walked over to your crib, I looked down at you. I wanted to strangle you. And you looked up at me and you stopped screaming. You smiled at me. Don't die so far from the sea.
Speaker: YARA

Text: YARA exits.
NORTH OF THE WALL
Speaker: EXT

Text: A party of wildlings, including JON and YGRITTE cross a frozen lake, joining a large band nearer the shore. The LORD OF BONES walks forward to meet them.
I've brought you a present, Lord of Bones.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: I already got one crow. Don't need two.
Speaker: LORD OF BONES

Text: Mance will want to question this one. Knows all about where the crows are and what they're planning.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: The Halfhand knows more. This one is just a little boy. Gut him.
Speaker: LORD OF BONES

Text: He could have killed me half a dozen times.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: And now he wishes he did. Gut him.
Speaker: LORD OF BONES

Text: A wildling draws a knife at the command.
He's a bastard of Winterfell, Ned Stark's son.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: LORD OF BONES turns around.  Mance will want him.
What does Mance want with a dead man's bastard?
Speaker: LORD OF BONES

Text: I don't know. I think he'll want to decide for himself.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: The LORD OF BONES walks to face YGRITTE
He runs, I'll chop his balls off.
Speaker: LORD OF BONES

Text: He runs, I'll do it meself.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: The LORD OF BONES walks away.
We're even now, Jon Snow.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: YGRITTE exits. The wildlings force JON down on his knees, next to QHORIN, who also been captured.
I couldn't do it. I had the sword on her neck, I just couldn't
Speaker: JON

Text: I know.
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: The others?
Speaker: JON

Text: When you didn't come back, we went looking for you. We found your tracks fast enough. But they found us before we found you.
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: They died because of me.
Speaker: JON

Text: See that it wasn't for nothing.
Speaker: QHORIN

Text: Two wildlings approach, and lift QHORIN to his feet.
All right, up, lad.
Speaker: WILDLING

Text: Come on, on your feet, now. Move it.
Speaker: WILDLING #2

Text: WOODS IN THE RIVERLANDS
Speaker: EXT

Text: ROBB and TALISA walk through the trees as the sun sets, followed by soldiers and horses.
Is she beautiful?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: I've never met her.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: What's her name?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Frey, I suppose. I don't know her first name.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I'm sure you'll be very happy.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: They laugh together.
And you're marrying her for a bridge?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: An important bridge.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Ah.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: It was before they killed my father. I still thought I could march south and rescue him in time, but only if I crossed that bridge.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: When I speak to people from the North, they all loved your father.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: He was the best man I ever met. I know children always think that about their fathers, but
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Children do not always think that about their fathers, believe me.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: He once told me that being a lord is like being a father, except you have thousands of children and you worry about all of them. The farmers plowing the fields are yours to protect. The charwomen scrubbing the floors, yours to protect. The soldiers you order into battle. He told me he woke with fear in the morning and went to bed with fear in the night. I didn't believe him. I asked him, "How can a man be brave if he's afraid?" "That is the only time a man can be brave," he told me.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I wish I could have met him.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: He would have liked you.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: (chuckles) Most lords worry more about their gold and their glory than the charwomen scrubbing their floors.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: He didn't care much about gold or glory.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: And you? You think I'm fighting this war so they'll sing songs about me? I want to go home. I want the men following me to go home.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Then why don't you?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Because we'll never be safe until the Lannisters are defeated. And because I believe in justice.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Chopping off Joffrey's head, you mean.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: That would be a start.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Riders appraoch.
Your Grace, milady. The Kingslayer, he escaped in the night.
Speaker: RIDER

Text: How? How?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: CATELYN'S TENT
Speaker: INT

Text: ROBB enters, finding CATELYN at her desk.
Tell me this isn't true.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: CATELYN doesn't answer. She looks up at him.
Why?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: For the girls.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: You betrayed me.
Speaker: -ROBB

Text: Robb
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: No! You knew I would not allow it and you did it anyway.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Bran and Rickon are captives in Winterfell. Sansa and Arya are captives in King's Landing. I have five children, and only one of them is free.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I lost one son fighting by your son's side. I lost another to the Kingslayer, strangled with a chain. You commit treason because your children are prisoners? I would carve out my heart and offer it to the Father, if he would let my sons wake from their graves and step into a prison cell.
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: I grieve for your sons, my lord.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I don't want your grief. I want my vengeance. And you stole it from me.
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: Killing Jaime Lannister would not buy life for your children, but returning him to King's Landing may buy life for mine.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Jaime Lannister has played you for a fool. You've weakened our position. You've brought discord into our camp. And you did it all behind my back. Make sure she's guarded day and night.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Robb. How many men did we send in pursuit of the Kingslayer?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Forty, Your Grace.
Speaker: SOLDIER

Text: Send another 40 with our fastest horses.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Robb.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: ROBB exits.
RIVERLANDS WOODS.
Speaker: EXT

Text: A white horse gallops over a small hill, riderless. Nearby, BRIENNE pushes JAIME off his mount, hooded and chained. She sends the horse off. She helps him up
Damn.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: She unhoods him. and helps him tstand.
You're much uglier in daylight. What's your name? I'm Jaime Lannister of Casterly Rock, son of Tywin.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE leads the chained JAIME forward.
A captive knight has a right to know his captor's identity.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Brienne of Tarth.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Tarth, Tarth, Tarth. Crescent moons and starbursts. Lord Selwyn Tarth. Your father. Do you have any brothers and sisters, my lady? It's a long way to King's Landing. Might as well get to know one another.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Have you known many men? I suppose not. Women? Horses? Ah.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BIRENNE forces him down to his knees on the riverbank. A canoe sits nearby.
I didn't mean to give offense, my lady. Forgive me.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE looks off down the river, concerned of being seen.
Your crimes are past forgiveness, Kingslayer.
Speaker: BRINENNE

Text: Why do you hate me so much? Have I ever harmed you?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You've harmed others, those you were sworn to protect, the weak, the innocent.
Speaker: BRINENNE

Text: Has anyone ever told you you're as boring as you are ugly?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE pulls JAIME up and leads him to the river's edge.
You will not provoke me to anger.
Speaker: BRINENNE

Text: I already have. Look at you. You're ready to chop my head off. Do you think you could? Do you think you could beat me in a fair fight?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I've never seen you fight.
Speaker: BRINENNE

Text: The answer is no. There are three men in the kingdoms who might have a chance against me. You're not one of them.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: All my life men like you have sneered at me. And all my life I've been knocking men like you into the dust.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: If you're so confident, unlock my chains. Let's see what happens.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Do you take me for an idiot? In!
Speaker: BRINENNE

Text: JAIME enters the canoe and lies down. BRIENNE boards as well and sits in the stern.
I took you for a fighter, a man Pardon. Woman of honor. Was I wrong? You're afraid.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Maybe one day we'll find out, Kingslayer.
Speaker: BRINENNE

Text: BRIENNE launches the canoe and paddles it downstream.
CASTLE RUINS IN THE SHADOWLANDS
Speaker: INT

Text: TYWIN sits in council with KEVAN LANNISTER and other Lannister bannermen. ARYA attends to them, and listens intently
King's Landing will fall an hour after Stannis lands his force. It's not too late for King Joffrey and Cersei and the court to ride west to safety.
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: Surrender the Iron Throne?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Better than seeing their heads mounted on the city gates. Stannis will execute them all.
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: No, a king who runs will not be king for long. He's a Lannister. He'll stand and fight. Stannis, two days from the capital and the wolf at my doorstep.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: The scouts assure us Robb Stark remains north of Ashemark.
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: Ha! The last time the scouts assured us of Stark's movement, he lured us into a trap. Which is why my son is his prisoner.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: ARYA serves win to the table
Too close to Casterly Rock.
Speaker: TWYIN

Text: He sent a splinter force to recapture Winterfell. The Greyjoys have done us a great favor. Stark won't risk marching on Casterly Rock until he's at full force.
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: He's a boy and he's never lost a battle. He'll risk anything at any time because he doesn't know enough to be afraid.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYWIN ponders for a while by the hearth. He makes his decision.

We'll ride at nightfall. I want a full night's march before he knows we're on the move. Clegane, you'll maintain a garrison here at Harrenhal. Track down this brotherhood and destroy them. The girl has proven herself a good servant. She'll stay on with you. See that he doesn't get drunk in the evenings. He's poor company when he's sober, but he's better at his work.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: ARYA looks worried.
CASTLE RUINS IN THE SHADOWLANDS
Speaker: EXT

Text: ARYA walks through the dismal courtyard. Soldiers torture their prisoners.
You've got some questions to answer.
Speaker: GUARD

Text: Who killed Ser Amory?
Speaker: MAN

Text: I don't know! Please!
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: Give me the name. Take this one out for the crows.
Speaker: MAN

Text: I told you, I don't know. Please.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: ARYA comes across RORGE, and BITER, sitting with some Lannister soldiers.
Look, it's Yoren's little cunt. Used to be a boy, now it's a girl.
Speaker: RORGE

Text: Where's Jaqen?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Don't care. Where's your stick now, bitch? I promised to fuck you with it.
Speaker: RORGE

Text: Come on, time to kill some wolves.
Speaker: GUARD

Text: They stand. Both RORGE and BITER eye ARYA as they walk past.
THE FORGE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: HOT PIE sits talking while GENDRY works some horse shoes, listless.

You need sour cherries to make it right. And the secret is you dry the stones, and then you break them with a mallet. That's where the real flavor is. You crush 'em up real fine. And then when you're finished, you sprinkle them over the piecrust.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: ARYA enters.
Where's Jaqen?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: How would I know?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: I need him now. Lord Tywin's marching tonight.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You need him?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: He's helping me.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I saw him.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Where?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: HOT PIE shrugs and pops his pastry in his mouth. ARYA comes over and grabs his ears.
Where?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Ow!
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Where?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: They went riding out the gates a few hours ago.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: ARYA tightens her grip.
On patrol. Let go of my ears.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: She does. ARYA turns at sound of horses, and watches TYWIN mount. She walks towards him
What do you want with him anyway?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: ARYA watches TYWIN and his men ride off.
THE NORTH
Speaker: EXT

Text: Mance is gonna march on the Wall. When he does, one brother inside his army will be worth 1,000 fighting against it.
Speaker: QUORIN

Text: They'll never trust me.
Speaker: JON

Text: They might. If you do what needs to be done.
Speaker: QUORIN

Text: What?
Speaker: JON

Text: (yelling) How does it feel knowing those men all died so you could skip through the snow with your little savage girl?
Speaker: QUORIN

Text: I didn't.
Speaker: JON

Text: I should have known better, trusting a traitor's bastard.
Speaker: QUORIN

Text: QHORIN pushes Jon roughly, sending him tumbling down the side of the hill. The LORD OF BONES confronts QUORIN
He's not yours to kill, crow.
Speaker: LORD OF BONES

Text: The LORD OF BONES pushes QHORIN forward. YGRITTE pauses and looks sympathetically down the slope at JON, reconsidering him. JON sits up and looks back at her.
KING'S LANDING
Speaker: INT

Text: BRONN and TYRION sit in his chambers. TYRION is attempting to read, but he is annoyed by BRONN's fingernail scraping with a compass.  TYRION; Do you have to do that here?
I like to keep me hands clean.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Yes, but do you have to do it here?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: BRONN looks at TYRION, then throws the compass down on the desk in front of him.
You should start wearing the gold cloak.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I don't want to wear a gold cloak.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You're commander of the City Watch. You shouldn't be dressed like a common
Speaker: TYRION

Text: A cloak slows you down in a fight. Makes it hard to move quietly. And the gold catches the light, so you're nice and easy to spot at night.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Well, you're not sneaking through alleyways any longer. You're supposed to stand out.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We had a deal and wearing a gold cloak wasn't part of it.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Fine, fine. No gold cloak.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION goes back to his work. BRONN sucks his teeth and drums his finger, continuing to look at TYRION.
What?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: What? What? Why are you staring at me?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (scoffs) You don't want me cleaning me nails. You don't want me looking your way. Why am I here?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: To help me plan the defense of King's Landing.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: BRONN laughs as he stands up, and begins to pace around.
Stannis will be here any day.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: BRONN picks up a book from the pile as he walks past.
And one of these explains how to beat him?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: TYRION gestures to the volume that he is reading.
"An History of the Great Sieges of Westeros. " By Archmaester Shevelathin. Shevelatesh.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Chevalteesh. I'd swap all your books for a few good archers.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: VARYS enters.
My Lord Hand. Commander. I must compliment you on the gold cloaks' performance these last few weeks. Did you know there has been a marked drop in thievery?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: He sits.
I did not know. And how did you accomplish this marked drop in thievery?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Me and the lads rounded up all the known thieves.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: For questioning?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No. It's just the unknown thieves we need to worry about now.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: We talked about this.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Aye, we talked about it. Have you ever been in a city under siege? Maybe this part's not in your books. See, it's not the fighting that kills most people. It's the starving. Food's worth more than gold. Noble ladies sell their diamonds for a sack of potatoes. Things get bad enough, the poor start eating each other.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: BRONN sits back down at the table.
The thieves, they love a siege. Soon as the gates are sealed, they steal all the food. By the time it's all over, they're the richest men in town.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Given the circumstances, my lord, I believe extreme measures are warranted.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: (nods)
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Ah. "The Great Sieges of Westeros." Thrilling subject. Shame Archmaester Ch'Vyalthan wasn't a better writer.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: TYRION grabs a parchment and unrolls it.

Stannis knows King's Landing. He knows where the walls are strongest, and he knows which gates are weakest. The Mud Gate. A good ram will batter it down in minutes, and it's only 50 yards from the water. That's where he'll land.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And if Stannis does attack the Mud Gate, what is our plan?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: We could throw books at his men.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: We don't have that many books.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: We don't have that many men, either.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: What do we have?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Pig shit.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: THE FAR NORTH
Speaker: EXT

Text: The Night's Watch camps on the top of a cliff. The wind howls. GRENN, EDDISION TOLLETT and SAM dig in the snow.
(panting) I'm not cut out for this sort of work.
Speaker: SAM

Text: SAM sits down to rest. The others continue to dig.
I always imagined meself doing something much worse.
Speaker: EDDISON

Text: We're digging latrine pits at the end of the world. I can't imagine anything much worse.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: You lack imagination.
Speaker: EDDISON

Text: Where do you think Jon is right now?
Speaker: SAM

Text: He went off with the Halfhand. He didn't come back. A betting man would go with dead.
Speaker: EDDISION

Text: He's not dead. No, Jon's a great fighter.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Well, he's better than me and a lot better than you.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: He's got a Valyrian steel sword.
Speaker: SAM

Text: So did his father.
Speaker: EDDISION

Text: And Qhorin Halfhand is the greatest ranger alive.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Great rangers never get old is the problem. Shit ones neither. It's them in the middle that last a long time.
Speaker: EDDISON

Text: GRENN's shovel clangs against something metal.
What in seven hells is that?
Speaker: GRENN

Text: He plants his shovel and starts digging and clearing with his hands. SAM comes over to see. GRENN reveals a round stone cover, engraved with markings.
The First Men made these marks. Help me with it.
Speaker: SAM

Text: GRENN lifts the cover and finds a bundle wrapped in a cloak.
Look.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: If you find something you're not supposed to, best thing to do is pretend you've never seen it.
Speaker: EDDISION

Text: That's a Night's Watch cloak.
Speaker: SAM

Text: It's been here a long time.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: GRENN opens the bundle to reveal a set of obsidian knifes.
Oh. Must be dragonglass.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Dragonglass?
Speaker: GRENN

Text: The maesters call it obsidian.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Why would a brother hide it here?
Speaker: GRENN

Text: I expect it's 'cause he wanted somebody to find it.
Speaker: EDDISON

Text: HARRENHALL COURTYARD
Speaker: EXT

Text: ARYA caries a yoke with two buckets of water. She bumps into a Lannister soldier, and the contraption falls, spilling her load.
Mind where you're going.
Speaker: SOLDIER

Text: The SOLDIER smacks her across the head. ARYA looks dejected and crouches to pick up the empty bucket.  A SOLDIER stops next to her.
I'm sorry. I'll
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA stands, and realized that it is JAQEN.
(annoyed) Where were you?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A man has patrol duty.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Tywin Lannister was right here, and now he's gone.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A girl owes one more name. The Red God demands it. Give the man a name.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: How long after I give you the name does it take you to kill someone?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A minute, an hour, a month. Death is certain, the time is not.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: JAQEN puts down his helmet and sits.
He's taking his army to attack my brother. I need him dead right now.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: This a man cannot do.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: He pours some water from a pitcher, and drinks.
You promised you'd help me.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Help was not promised, lovely girl. Only death. There must be others. Give a name, any name.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: And you'll kill them? Anybody?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: By the Seven New Gods and the Old Gods beyond counting, I swear it.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: All right. Jaqen H'ghar.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: JAQEN considers.
A girl gives a man his own name?
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: That's right.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Gods are not mocked. This is no joking thing.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: I'm not joking. A man can go kill himself.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Un-name me.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: No.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Please?
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: I'll un-name you.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Thank you.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: If you help me and my friends escape.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: This would require more than one life. This is not part of our bargain.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Fine, Jaqen H'ghar.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A girl lacks honor. If I do this thing, a girl must obey.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: A girl will obey.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A girl and her friends will walk through the gate at midnight.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: JAQEN exits.
KING'S LANDING
Speaker: INT

Text: CERSEI'S CHAMBERS
PODRICK pours wine for TYRION, who is seated at a table. CERSEI stands in the background.
Thank you, Podrick.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Odd little boy.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I have a certain sympathy for odd little boys.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You and Varys both.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: TYRION removes his napkin from his neck and wipes his face.

Excellent lamprey pie. Were you slaving away in the kitchen all day? I hear Joffrey plans on fighting. An inspiration for the troops. The young king in his shining armor fighting to defend the capital against the wicked old rebel.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: He's only a boy.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Younger boys are off fighting his war.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: He's not ready.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: What is he, 17? Remember Jaime at 17?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Better than you. Some men have a gift for this sort of thing, some don't. His place is not on the battlefield.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: It's not on the throne, either, sadly for all of us.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: PODRICK snickers.
Do you think I'm an idiot?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No, I'd say you possess above-average intelligence.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You shipped off my only daughter. And now you want to send my eldest son to the battlefield to die.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: He'll have his Kingsguard protecting him. He has the finest armor gold can buy. He needs to be out there. The men will fight more fiercely seeing their king fighting beside them instead of hiding behind his mother's skirts. Any dessert?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Do you know why Varys is so dangerous?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Because he has thousands of spies in his employ. Because he knows everything we do before we do it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Because he doesn't have a cock.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Neither do you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Perhaps I'm dangerous, too. You, on the other hand, are as big a fool as every other man. That little worm between your legs does half your thinking.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: It's not that little.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (laughs)
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Why are you smiling?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Because I'm happy.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: And why are you happy?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She sits.
Because I have your little whore.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I thought you preferred blondes.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Such a droll little fellow. Tell me, have you married this one yet? No? Good. Father will be so pleased.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Why do you care who I fuck?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Because a Lannister always pays her debts. You stole my only daughter, you plot to have Joffrey killed.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: This is madness. Stannis will be here in days. You need me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: For what? Your skill in battle? Pretty thing, your whore. Lovely body. The bruises will heal in time.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Where did you find her?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Varys isn't the only one who hears whispers. Really, a Lannister lion necklace? You need to hide your secret whores more carefully.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You've forgotten the most important thing about whores.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Oh? Well, you're the expert. Tell me.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You don't buy them, you only rent them.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You're usually a better liar, baby brother. This one you like. You like her very much. Could it be love? Don't worry, she'll be treated gently enough. Unless Joffrey is hurt. And then every wound he suffers, she'll suffer, too. And if he dies, there isn't a man alive who could devise a more painful death for your little cunt.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: And how do I know you haven't killed her already?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Would you like to see her? I thought you might. Ser Mandon, bring in my brother's whore.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: MANDON moves behind her and opens the chamber door. TYRION looks worried. Two guards bring in ROS, rather than SHAE.  TYRION looks her over.
I'm sorry they hurt you. You must be brave.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION takes her hand.
I promise I will free you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Don't forget me.
Speaker: WHORE

Text: Never.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The guards take her away. CERSEI looks pleased.
I will hurt you for this. A day will come when you think you're safe and happy, and your joy will turn to ashes in your mouth. And you will know the debt is paid.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Get out.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: KING'S LANDING
Speaker: INT

Text: TYRION walks through the hallway and bursts into his chambers.
Shae!
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I've been waiting all night. What is wrong?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: You're beautiful.
Speaker: TRION

Text: SHAE smiles and kisses him.
Then why do you look sad?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: TYRION kneels before her.
We have to be more careful.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Don't be afraid. I can take care of myself.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: There are people who want to hurt me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I know. I won't let them. I'll cut off their faces. I will.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: I would kill for you. Do you know that? I expect I'll have to before this is over. You're mine.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm yours.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Promise me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm yours, and you are mine.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: They kiss.
THE RIVERLANDS
Speaker: INT

Text: ROBB and ROOSE sit in conference.
Still no word?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: We've sent a dozen ravens. None have returned. My bastard is only a few days from Winterfell. Once he captures the castle
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Theon has my brothers. If we storm the castle
Speaker: ROBB

Text: He wouldn't dare hurt the boys. They're his only hope of escaping the North with his head.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Send word to your son. Any ironborn who surrender will be allowed to return safely to their homes.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: A touch of mercy is a virtue, Your Grace. Too much
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Any ironborn with the exception of Theon Greyjoy. He betrayed our cause. He betrayed me. And we will hunt him down no matter where he runs.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I expect his countrymen will turn on him the minute they hear the offer.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: TALISA enters. They stand
Your pardon, my lord. Your Grace.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: My lady.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: ROOSE exits.
How are you?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: How am I? I've had to arrest my mother. The Lannisters have my sisters. The man I considered my closest friend has seized my home and my brothers. I'm fighting a war and I don't know if I should march south or north.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I'm sorry. It was a stupid question. I'm sorry.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: No. Forgive me. You're being kind. I have no right.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: You have every right. You're a king.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: That's not the kind of king I want to be.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: What kind do you want to be?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: I don't know. The good kind. Most kings grew up as princes. They spend their whole lives preparing for the crown. I was raised to be Lord of Winterfell.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I was raised to be a proper little lady, to play the harp and dance the latest steps and recite Valyrian poetry.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: I'd like to hear you play the harp.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: No. No, you would not.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: They laugh. Robb pours some wine and hands it to her.
How did you go from reciting Valyrian poetry to sawing off men's feet?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: When I was 12, my mother and father went to a wedding. Weddings in Volantis last for days, you know. And they left me with my little brother. The second afternoon they were gone was the hottest day in the three-year summer. We couldn't bear to be inside, so we ran down to the Rhoyne. Every child in Volantis was in the Rhoyne that day. The rich, the poor, we were all there. Naked, screaming, racing to the little islands. Drummers were playing for coppers on the east bank. I was treading water, talking to a friend, when I realized I hadn't seen my brother. I called his name. Then I started screaming his name. And then I saw him floating face down. My heart just stopped. I was I dragged him from the water. My friend helped me, I think. I don't even remember. He was so little. Then we pulled him onto the riverbank. And I screamed at him and I shook him. And he was dead. Just dead. A man ran over. He had a fish tattoo on his face. In Volantis, the slaves have tattoos. So you know what they are without having to talk to them. And this man worked on a fishing boat. And he pushed me out of the way. You have to understand, for a slave to push a highborn girl, that's death for the man, a terrible death. But he pushed me out of the way, and he started pressing on my brother's chest again and again and again, until my brother spat out half of the Rhoyne and cried out. And the man cradled his head and told him to be calm. I decided two things that day. I would not waste my years planning dances and masquerades with the other noble ladies. And when I came of age, I would never live in a slave city again. I'm sorry, Your Grace. You told me of your problems and I've blathered on.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: They both stand.
I don't want to marry the Frey girl.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I don't want you to marry her.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: But you needed that bridge. I hope it's a very beautiful bridge.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: They kiss passionately, and undress one another in a fury. They make love on the floor.
THE SHADOWLANDS
Speaker: EXT

Text: The courtyard at night.
The sour cherries was all crushed up and ready.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Shut up.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Probably in the piecrust by now. In the oven. The nice, warm oven.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Shut up. What did you bring?
Speaker: AYRA

Text: The cheese could be better. I did get some nice sausages. GENDRY What did he want us to do about those guards?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: He didn't say. He just said, "Walk through the gates."
Speaker: ARYA

Text: What about the guards?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: He didn't say anything about the guards.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: What, he left that bit out? It's a pretty important part, don't you think?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: We have to trust him.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Trust him? You trusted him to fight with us when you set him free and he ran.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I want to go back to the kitchens.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Shut up. Stay here if you're afraid.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA gets up and walks towards the gate.
Arry, don't.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: GENDRY and HOT PIE follow. When they reach the guards, they realize that all have been slaughtered. They walk through the gate.
STANNIS'S FLEET
Speaker: EXT

Text: Soldiers fire a large crossbow in the night.
Away! Reset!
Speaker: MAN

Text: DAVOS and STANNIS stand on deck.
If the wind holds, we'll reach King's Landing in a day.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Will it hold?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Can't make promises for the wind, Your Grace.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: They walk down some steps to the main deck and continue on.
Again, pull!
Speaker: MAN

Text: I admire you, Ser Davos.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I thank you, Your Grace.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Pleased to hear it. Some highborn fools call you Onion Knight and think they insult you. So you take the onion for your sigil, sew it on your coat, fly the onion flag.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: My son wishes me to change it. Three mermen with tridents, something like that. I understand why the older families look down at me.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Do you? Why?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: My father was a crabber.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: And?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Well, sons of lords don't like to break bread with sons of crabbers. Our hands stink.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: And where were those lords when Storm's End starved?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Many fought bravely for your brother. Many fought for the Mad King.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You defend these men who insult you behind your back.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Some are happy to do it to my face.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: We were forgotten. Robert and Ned Stark, they were the heroes. The glorious rebels marching from battle to battle, liberating towns from the yoke of the Mad King, while I held Storm's End with 500 men.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: No one has forgotten, Your Grace.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: No? Robert did. He gave Storm's End to Renly after the war. Renly never fought a day in his life.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: He was only a boy.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Then why'd he give him Storm's End?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: (exhales)
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: First, we ate the horses. We weren't riding anywhere, not with the castle surrounded. We couldn't feed them, so fine, the horses. Then the cats. Never liked cats. So fine. I do like dogs. Good animals. Loyal. But we ate them. Then the rats. The night before you slipped through, I thought my wife was dying. She couldn't speak anymore, she was so frail. And then you made it through the lines. Slipped right through in your little black sailboat with your onions.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: And potatoes. Some salted beef, I believe.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Every man in Storm's End wanted to kiss you that night.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I was relieved they did not.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Robert told me to hold Storm's End, so I held it. Then he told me he was giving it to Renly, so I gave it up. Insult or no, I gave it up. Because Robert was my older brother, and he was the king and I've always done my duty. But now, I'm the rightful king by every law of Westeros. And when I sit the Iron Throne, you'll be my Hand.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Your Grace, I pray I serve you well.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I expect you'll be the first crabber's son to wear the badge.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: KING'S LANDING
Speaker: EXT

Text: JOFFREY, VARYS and TYRION walk through the streets of King's Landing
You're the Master of Whisperers. You're supposed to know everything.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: No man can be in all rooms at all times. I have many little birds in the North, my lord, but I haven't heard their songs since Theon Greyjoy captured Winterfell.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: The Stark forces are distracted. Now is the time to strike.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: To strike? My dear nephew, you do see these men preparing the walls for siege? You do understand Stannis Baratheon sails this way?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: If my Uncle Stannis lands on the shores of King's Landing, I'll ride out to greet him.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: A brave choice, Your Grace. I'm sure your men will line up behind you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They say Stannis never smiles. I'll give him a red smile from ear to ear.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: JOFFREY exits.
Imagine Stannis' terror.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I am trying.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: You're an intelligent man. I'd like to think I'm an intelligent man.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Oh, no one disputes that, my lord, not even the multitudes who despise you.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I wish we could converse as two honest, intelligent men.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I wish we could, too.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: What do you want? Tell me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: If we're going to play, you'll have to start.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: My brother was the youngest Kingsguard in history. My sister became queen at the age of 19. When I reached manhood, my father put me in charge of all the drains and cisterns in Casterly Rock.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: A most highborn plumber.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: The water never flowed better. And all the shit found its way to the sea. I never expected to have any real power. So when my father named me acting Hand
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I do. Last thing I expected.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And you play it well.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I'd like to keep playing it. If Stannis breaches the gates, the game is over.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They say he burns his enemies alive to honor the Lord of Light.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: The Lord of Light wants his enemies burned, the Drowned God wants them drowned. Why are all the gods such vicious cunts? Where is the god of tits and wine?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: In the Summer Isles, they worship a fertility goddess with 16 teats.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: We should sail there immediately.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: This morning, I heard a song all the way from Qarth beyond the Red Waste. Daenerys Targaryen lives.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: A girl at the edge of the world is the least of our problems.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She has three dragons. But even if what they say is true, it'll be years before they are fully grown. And then there will be nowhere to hide.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: One game at a time, my friend.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: QARTH
Speaker: EXT

Text: DAENERYS peers through a boarded entryway
Careful, Khaleesi. Xaro owns this city and the warlocks have a thousand eyes watching for you. I found one. A ship with a good captain. She leaves for Astapor tomorrow.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Astapor?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: We cannot stay here.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: They have my dragons. A mother does not flee without her children.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They're not your children. I know they call you the Mother of Dragons and I know you love them, but you didn't grow them in your womb. They didn't suckle at your breast. They are dragons, Khaleesi. And if we stay in Qarth, we'll die.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You should sail to Astapor. I'm sure you'll be safe there.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You know I would die for you. I will never abandon you. I'm sworn to protect you, to serve.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Then serve me. If my dragons are in the House of the Undying, then take me there.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: That's what the warlock wants. He told you so himself. If you enter that place, you will never leave again. His magic is strong.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: And what of my magic? You saw me step into the fire. You watched the witch burn. What did the flames do to me? Do you remember?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Until my last breath, I will remember. After I have forgotten my mother's face.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: DAENERYS touches JORAH's face.
They are my children. And they are the only children I will ever have. Take me to them.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (nods)
Speaker: JORAH

Text: WINTERFELL
Speaker: EXT

Text: We should bury them.
Speaker: THEON

Text: I'd leave 'em up a few more days. Sends a message.
Speaker: DAGMER

Text: If they haven't got the damn message yet, a few more days won't help. As you say. But it don't hurt to let 'em rot a while longer.
Speaker: THEON

Text: What's this?
Speaker: DAGMER

Text: Gold for the farmer. For his trouble.
Speaker: THEON

Text: His troubles are done. He's feeding the crops now.
Speaker: DAGMER

His wife, too. You want to keep a man silent, you silence him.

DARKNESS
Speaker: CUT TO

Got as far as the farm and then doubled back. Walked through the stream to throw off the hounds. Hoped this would be the last place they'd think to look.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: You're right so far.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: Who was that out there hung up at the gates?
Speaker: OSHA

Text: Must have been the farmer's boys.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: He killed them and burned them and passed them off as the little lords?
Speaker: OSHA

Text: They mustn't know. Bran would blame himself.
Speaker: LUWIN

Text: They'll never hear it from me. The little lads have suffered enough.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: BRAN sits just out of sight, having heard everything. HODOR and RICKON sleep.
EXT. THE SEA AT NIGHT
STANNIS's fleet sails through the night.
DAVOS walks the deck, and looks out the stern at the rest of the ships.
STANNIS looks ahead
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Soldiers sitting below, tired and waiting. One vomits from sea sickness.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: MATTHOS and DAVOS above deck.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: That's it. The tide's against us.
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: Aye, but we have the wind. She'll blow us straight to the gates.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You're coming home.
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: King's Landing hasn't been home for 20 years. I spent most of my life dodging the royal fleet. And now I'm sailing right at them.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: This is the royal fleet. And you're not a smuggler anymore, you're the high captain.
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: Of course, there are several royal fleets at the moment.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Not after tonight. When the sun rises, Stannis will sit on the Iron Throne and you will be his Hand.
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: Gods be good.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: God. Father, there is only one and he watches over us.
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: But not over them?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Over all of us. The people of King's Landing did not choose the false king, Joffrey Baratheon. They will be glad to see his head on a spike.
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: Well, first, we have to put it there.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Our ships outnumber theirs 10-to-1.
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: Our army outnumber theirs 5-to-1. Those walls have never been breached, and the men guarding the walls, when they see you, they don't see a liberator, they see a stranger come to set their city on fire.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I have faith in the Lord of Light. I have faith in our cause. And I have faith in my captain.
Speaker: MATTHOS

Text: KING'S LANDING AT NIGHT
Speaker: INT

Text: TYRION and SHAE lie in bed in his chambers.
Are you afraid, my lion?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: If the city falls, Stannis will burn every Lannister he can find. Of course I'm afraid.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I won't let them hurt you.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: I'm a Lannister. I don't have a choice in all this. But it's not your war.
Speaker: TYRION

It is now.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: You can't fuck your way out of everything.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I have so far. Do you remember what you said when you met me in your tent? That I should make love to you like it was your last day on this earth.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: They kiss.
CERSEI'S CHAMBERS
Speaker: INT

As you know, Your Grace, it is not only the sworn duty of a maester to carry out the wishes of the house he serves, but also to offer guidance and counsel in times of war.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: Your words are always wise and measured.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You brought me something?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Yes. Essence of nightshade is as dangerous as it is efficacious. A single drop in a cup of wine suffices to soothe ragged nerves. Three drops will bring on a deep and dreamless sleep. Ten drops, however

Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your Grace, if I may ask

Text: Yes. A siege is very

Text: Your Grace.

Text: BRONN and the soldiers of King's Landing are drinking and singing, with some prostitutes mingling among them. BRONN has his arm around a prostitute.
(singing) And so he spoke That Lord of Castamere But now the rains weep o'er his halls With no one there to hear Yes, now the rains weep o'er his halls And not a soul to hear -

You've got a pretty voice.

Well, now let's see. First time, I was five. My mam smacked me with an iron poker.

Text: Oh.

Text: It wasn't me she was aiming at. She was trying for my little brother. Now he was a real pest.

Second time, I was nine. Got in a scrap with a few older boys. They won. Third time

Eh, you don't want to know about the third time.
Speaker: BRONN

Poor nose.

Text: Don't feel sorry for him. He'll be halfway up your arse before the night's through.

The HOUND and a soldier enter.
Welcome, friends. This round's on me.

Text: The HOUND and his companion stand in front of a table. The two men sitting there vacate if for them, silently. They sit down. The HOUND drinks from the mug sitting there.
(whispering) I don't think he likes me.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You think you're a hard man?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: I know it.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: The men laugh.
It's warm in here. We've got beautiful women and good brown ale. Plenty for everyone. And all you want is to put one of us in the cold ground with no women to keep us company.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Oh, there's women in the ground. I put some there myself. So have you. You like fucking and drinking and singing. But killing, killing's the thing you love. You're just like me.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: He stands and walks towards BRONN.
Only smaller.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: And quicker. Eh?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Your Lord Imp's going to miss you.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: BRONN pats the prostitute on the knee, and she gets off his lap. He stands to face the HOUND.
Aye I expect he will someday.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: He reaches behind him to a dagger sheathed at his waist. A bell tolls. The soldiers get up and leave.
Here we are.

Text: One more drink before the war? Shall we?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: The HOUND backs off. They both exit.
TYRION'S CHAMBERs
Speaker: INT

Text: VARYS stands by the window while PODRICK helps to dress TYRION in his armor.
I've always hated the bells. They ring for horror. A dead king, a city under siege.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: A wedding.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Exactly. Podrick, is that it?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: "Is that it?" Nice touch. As if you don't know the name of every boy in town.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm not entirely sure what you're suggesting.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I'm entirely sure you're entirely sure what I'm suggesting.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Do you trust him?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Oddly enough, I do.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Good.
Speaker: VARYS

The map you asked for.
Speaker: VARYS

There must be 20 miles of tunnels beneath the city.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Closer to 50. The Targaryens built this city to withstand a siege and to provide escape if necessary.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I'm not escaping. Strange as it sounds, I'm the captain of the ship, and if the ship goes down, I go with her.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: That is good to hear. Though I'm sure many captains say the same while their ship is afloat. You look well suited for battle, my lord.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Well, I'm not.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: For all our sakes, I hope you are wrong. My little birds tell me that Stannis Baratheon has taken up with a red priestess from Asshai.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: What of it?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You don't believe in the old powers, my lord?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Blood spells, curses, shape-shifting. What do you think?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I think you believe in what you see and in what those you trust have seen. You probably don't entirely trust me.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Mmm, don't take it personally. I don't entirely trust myself.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And yet I have seen things and heard things, things you have not, things I wish I had not. I don't believe I've ever told you how I was cut.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: No, I don't believe you have.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: One day, I will. The dark arts have provided Lord Stannis with his armies and paved his path to our door. For a man in service to such powers to sit on the Iron Throne, I can think of nothing worse. And tonight, I believe you are the only man who can stop him.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: PODRICK hands TYRION his war axe.

King's Landing

Lady Sansa and Sheila.

Sansa.

Stay safe, my lady.

My new blade. Hearteater, I've named it. Kiss it.

Speaker: EXT

No plan and Stannis Baratheon sacks this city, takes the Iron Throne, puts your pinched little head atop a gate somewhere. It might be quite amusing, except that my head would be up there, too. I've never much liked my head, but I don't want to see it removed just yet.

The ghoul shakes his way free and claws forward to Sam, grabbing at his legs. As Sam scrambles backwards, a torch lights the ghoul on fire. Engulfed in flames, the undead wildling finally collapses. Text: (Shakes his head.)
Speaker: SAM

Text: That was your job. Your only job. We need to get back to the Wall. It's a long march. We know what's out there, but we have to make it, have to warn them or before winter's done, everyone you've ever known will be dead.
Speaker: JEOR

Text: MAIN CREDITS
Beyond the Wall
Speaker: EXT

Text: The party, including RATTLESHIRT, JON SNOW and YGRITTE,  return to the  bustling wildling camp. A giant walks by, carrying a bundle of huge stakes. JON is awed.
First time you've seen a giant, Jon Snow?
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: (Nods)
Speaker: JON

Text: The giant  drives a large stake into the ground.
Well, don't stare too long. They're shy. When they stop being shy, they get angry. And when they're angry, I've seen them pound a man straight into the ground like a hammer on a nail.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: The giant finishes his work and looks at Jon, growling. The party continues to walk through the camp, and the wildlings heckle JON has he passes.
Crow!
Speaker: MAN

Text: Crow!
Speaker: BOY

Text: Look over there!
Speaker: GIRL

Text: Crow!
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: Crow! Look over here! Look!
Speaker: GIRL

Text: Ah, look, crow coming!
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: Crow!
Speaker: BOY

Text: You're wearing the wrong color.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: Mance was a ranger.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: In your hearts, all you crows want to fly free.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: When I'm free, will I be free to go?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Crow!
Speaker: BOY

Text: Crow!
Speaker: BOY

Text: Boys throw rocks at JON SNOW.
Sure, you will.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: YGRITTE swats a boy with her staff.
Oh! ( laughter )
Speaker: BOY

Text: And I'll be free to kill you. Got no respect, this lot. Got no fathers to slap 'em when they're foul.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: What happened to their fathers?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Some of them were killed by crows like you. Don't look so grim, Jon Snow. If Mance Rayder likes you, you'll live another day. And if he don't...
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: A freefolk tent
Speaker: INT

Text: RATTLESHIRT, JON and YGRITTE enter the tent. TORMUND eats hungrily by the fire.
I smell a crow.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: We killed his friends. Thought you'd want to question this one.
Speaker: LORD OF BONES

Text: What do we want with a baby crow?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: This baby killed Qhorin Halfhand. He wants to be one of us.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: TORMUND rises and stares at JON.
That half-handed cunt killed friends of mine. Friends twice your size.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: My father told me big men fall just as quick as little ones if you put a sword through their hearts.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Plenty of little men tried to put their swords through my heart. And there's plenty of little skeletons buried in the woods. What's your name, boy?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Jon Snow.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: JON kneels before TORMUND, mistaking him for MANCE RAYDER, the King-beyond-the-Wall.
Your Grace.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: The wildlings laugh
Your Grace?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Did you hear that? From now on, you'd better kneel every time I fart. ( Laughs. )
Mance rises from the back of the tent.
Stand, boy. We don't kneel for anyone beyond the Wall.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: JON rises.
So, you're Ned Stark's bastard. Thank you for the gift, Lord of Bones. You can leave us.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Lord of Bones leaves. YGRITTE gives JON a look, and exits as well.
The girl likes you. You like her back, Snow? That why you want to join us?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Don't panic, boy. This isn't the damned Night's Watch where we make you swear off girls.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: This chicken eater you thought was king is Tormund Giantsbane.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Can't believe this pup killed the Halfhand.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: He was our enemy and I'm glad he's dead.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: MANCE extends his hand,  and JON SNOW shakes it. Mance holds on firmly.
He was my brother once. Back when he had a whole hand. What were you doing with him?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: The Lord Commander sent me to the Halfhand for seasoning.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Why?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: He wants me to lead one day.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: But here you are, a traitor kneeling before the King-beyond-the-Wall.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: If I'm a traitor, then you are, too.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: TORMUND glowers.
Why do you want to join us, Jon Snow?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: (Hesitates.) I want to be free.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: No, I don't think so. I think what you want most of all is to be a hero. I'll ask you one last time ... why do you want to join us?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: MANCE's guard rise and close in, menacingly.
We stopped at Craster's Keep on the way north. I saw...
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: You saw what?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: I saw Craster take his own baby boy and leave it in the woods. I saw what took it.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: You're telling me you saw one of them? And why would that make you desert your brothers?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Because when I told the Lord Commander, he already knew. Thousands of years ago, the First Men battled the White Walkers and defeated them. I want to fight for the side that fights for the living. Did I come to the right place?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: We'll need to find you a new cloak.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: EXT. King's Landing
Children chatter and play in the water outside of King's Landing
INT. KIng's Landing Whorehouse
BRONN and a WHORE lie abed, enjoying themselves.
What if you took off that bit there?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Don't you want to leave something to the imagination?
Speaker: WHORE

Text: Trouble is, I've never had much imagination.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: She rises.
I want you to take it off.
Speaker: WHORE

Text: BRONN moves to remove it, and she tsks, putting her finger to her lips.
Mouth.
Speaker: WHORE

Text: A door opens, and PODRICK enters.
Ser Bronn. Ser Bronn.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I didn't hear that.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Apologies, ser.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Back away. Keep backing away till you're outside this establishment. Then back away some more.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Lord Tyrion sent me.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I will murder you, boy.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: He said it was a matter of life and death.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: INT. Tyrion's quarters
Tyrion looks at his scar in the mirror. There is a knocking at the door.
Pod?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Cersei: It's your sister. The queen.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Tyrion puts down the mirror and moves a stool to the door. He opens the door's window looks through the door to see Cersei and guards Meryn Trant and Taryn Mant.
What are they doing here?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Protecting me, I assume. Will you let me in?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No, I don't think so.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: If I wanted to kill you, do you think I'd let a wooden door stop me?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Tyrion considers.
They stay outside.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm not afraid of you, little brother.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Tyrion grabs an axe, and opens the door cautiously. As soon as Cersei enters, he secures the door closed..
Why are you here?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I wanted to see your face. They said you'd lost your nose, but it's not as gruesome as all that.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The man who cut me lost more than his nose.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I should hope so. The rebels came for Joffrey's head, they lost their own. Thanks to Father.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Thanks to Father. Of course, it wasn't a rebel who tried to kill me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No? Curious. Bit of a comedown from chamber of the Hand. But then I don't suppose you need much room.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Tyrion pours himself some wine.
Grand Maester Pycelle made the same joke. You must be proud to be as funny as a man whose balls brush his knees.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You're meeting Father today?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: How do you know that?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Because I have hundreds of spies in my employ. The Master of Whisperers owes me a favor or two. Father told me. What do you want from him?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: What do I want from him? He's my father. Do I need to want something? I'm sure he loves me dearly, as any father loves his child, his baby boy. Yet he hasn't come to visit once since arriving in King's Landing. I lay here, my face split in half, but Father never came.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You're going to make me cry.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Why do you care what I want from him?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Because you've slandered me to Father before.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Slandered? When?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You told him I had my guards beat that servant girl at Casterly Rock.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You did have your guards beat her. A girl of nine, I believe.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I was nine, too.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: She lost an eye, if I remember correctly.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: If I remember correctly, she never stole a necklace again.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: It's not slander if it's true.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And what's this truth you plan on telling him today?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Why are you so nervous about what I'm going to say to Father?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Because you're a liar. I expect you'll tell lies about me, about Joffrey.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Any lies in particular?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You're a clever man, but you're not half as clever as you think you are.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Still makes me more clever than you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: INT. outside Tyrion's quarters.
Taryn Mant and Meryn Trant stand guard. A door opens and BRONN and PODROCK enter.
Oh, look at these two shining warriors. Ser Taryn Mant and... Ser Whosit of Whocares.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Ser Meryn Trant.
Speaker: MERYN TRANT

Text: Ser Bronn of the Blackwater.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You're no knight.
Speaker: MERYN TRANT

Text: Pod.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Ser Bronn of the Blackwater was anointed by the king himself.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: You're an up-jumped cutthroat, nothing more.
Speaker: MERYN TRANT

Text: That's exactly who I am. And you're a grub in fancy armor who's better at beating little girls than fighting men. Now, I have an appointment with Lord Tyrion.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Bronn strides forward, and the two guard block him.
You put your hand on that door, you lose the hand.
Speaker: MERYN TRANT

Text: They begin to draw their weapons. At that moment, Tyrion's door opens, and Cersei exits Tyrion's chambers. She walks away with Meryn Trant and Taryn Mant. Bronn sheaths his dagger.
EXT. King's Landing
Tyrion, Bronn and Podrick walk along the wall.
As much as I appreciate a walk in the sunshine, your lordship, I am wondering why you sent for me.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: A number of people in this city want to kill me. You're here to protect me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I've been doing that for a while now.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Do you grow bored protecting me?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I grow poor protecting you.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Poor? Poor? Under my patronage you've become a knight, you've served as Commander of the City Watch.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Briefly.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I'm sure you filled your pockets.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And now my pockets are empty. You've given me a taste for the finer things. And if you want me to carry on protecting you, you'll need to pay more.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I thought we were friends.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We are. But I'm a sellsword. I sell my sword. I don't loan it out to friends as a favor.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: How much?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Double.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Double?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm a knight now. Knights are worth double.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I don't even know how much I'm paying you now.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Which means you can afford it.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: EXT.  Blackwater Bay

Davos lies on a rocky shore, bruised, battered, and dehydrated. He looks out to the sea and sees a boat in the distance. He climbs atop the rocks and starts waving. He removes his shirt in desperation and waves that as well.
Here. Here! Help me!
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Davos starts to lose hope. Then a horn blows from the distant boat. He is relieved.
the same shore, a bit later.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: A ships' boat has made it to Davos. He greets them as they row to him
Who are you?
Speaker: MAN

Text: I was in the battle at Blackwater. I was a captain and a knight.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Aye, ser, and serving which king?
Speaker: MAN

Text: Davos hesitates.
The one true king of Westeros ...  Stannis Baratheon.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The man smiles slightly and throws a rope to Davos.
INT. Salladhor's ship
Davos and Salladhor sit in the captain's quarters. Davos sits and Salladhor stands above him.
I thought you were dead. Everyone thought you were dead. And your son?
Speaker: SALLADHOR

Text: (Nods)
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: He may have swam ashore as you did.
Speaker: SALLADHOR

Text: No, the wildfire took him. I saw it.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Salladhor sits.
I'm so sorry, my friend. I, too, have lost a son. There is nothing worse in this world. But, Davos, you were a good father.
Speaker: SALLADHOR

Text: If I was a good father, he'd still be here. Stannis lives?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: He licks his wounds at Dragonstone.
Speaker: SALLADHOR

Text: Will you take me there?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: There is nothing for me at Dragonstone.
Speaker: SALLADHOR

Text: This war is not over.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Not for you, maybe. But for Salladhor Saan, the war is over.
Speaker: SALLADHOR

Text: We're both sworn to King Stannis.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I am sworn to no man. I promised you 30 ships and you promised me riches and glory. I delivered the ships.
Speaker: SALLADHOR

Text: Stannis never gives up. Never. Now he will regroup ...
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: He's a broken man. His fleet lies at the bottom of Blackwater Bay. They say he sees no one ... not his generals, not even his wife. Only the Red Woman whispering in his ear, telling him what she sees in the flames and burning men alive.
Speaker: SALLADHOR

Text: What?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: They built a great fire when Stannis returned. All those who spoke against her she called servants of darkness. They say she sang to them as they burned.
Speaker: SALLADHOR

Text: Salladhor stands and pours himself some wine, then sits again
I'm a pirate.
Speaker: SALLADHOR

Text: You're a smuggler.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Servants of darkness. I'm thinking Dragonstone is a good place for us to avoid.
Speaker: SALLADHOR

Text: Take me back there, please.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You cannot turn Stannis against her.
Speaker: SALLADHOR

Text: Maybe not, but I could carve her heart out.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You could try. If you fail, they will burn you. If you succeed, they'll burn you. And you've only just come back to life. Stay alive a little longer, my friend.
Speaker: SALLADHOR

Text: You call me friend. You drank with me on my wedding day.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: And you drank with me on four of my wedding days, but I don't ask you for favors.
Speaker: SALLADHOR

Text: I have to stop her. Please, do this for me.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: When you are dead, I will gather your bones in a little sack and let your widow wear them around her neck.
Speaker: SALLADHOR

Text: EXT. Outside Harrenhal
Horses trot as Robb's army is on the move.
We should set the siege lines 1,000 yards from Harrenhal.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: There won't be a siege. The Mountain can't defend a ruin.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I imagine the Mountain will defend whatever Tywin Lannister tells him to defend.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: The Lannisters have been running from us since Oxcross. I'd love a fight. The men would love a fight. I don't think we're going to get one.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Robb's army advances
EXT. Harrenhall
Robb's forces have arrived at Harrenhall. ROBB surveys a courtyard that littered with bodies. Flies buzz noisily among the corpses. RICKARD KARSTARK and ROOSE BOLTON enter.
200 Northmen slaughtered like sheep.
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: The debt will be repaid, my friend. For them and for your sons.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: Will it? They rot in the ground while their killer runs free.
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: The Kingslayer won't remain free for long. My best hunters are after him.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: Robb and Catelyn walk somberly  through the courtyard.
Robb: A Mallister?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Ser Jeremy. My father's bannerman.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: RICKARD KARSTART and ROOSE BOLTON exit.
Find her a chamber that will serve as a cell.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Talisa approaches.
Talisa: She's your mother.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: She freed Jaime Lannister. The Lannisters robbed them of their sons and she robbed them of their justice.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Qyburn coughs nearby, and Talisa moves to tend to him
( coughing ) Water. Water.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: This needs to be cleaned and closed.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: What's your name, friend?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Qyburn.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: You're lucky to be alive.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Lucky?
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: INT. King's Landing.
The Hand's Chambers. Tywin works at his desk while Tyrion looks on.
( sighs ) The badge looks good on you. Almost as good as it looked on me. Are you enjoying your new position?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Am I enjoying it?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I was very happy as Hand of the King.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: ( chuckles ) Yes. I heard how happy you were. ( blows ) You brought a whore into my bed.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: It wasn't your bed at the time.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tywin seals the letter he has finished.
I sent you here to advise the king. I gave you real power and authority. You chose to spend your days as you always have, bedding harlots and drinking with thieves.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Occasionally I drank with the harlots.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What do you want, Tyrion?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Why does everyone assume I want something? Can't I simply visit with my beloved father? My beloved father who somehow forgot to visit his wounded son after he fell on the battlefield.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tywin stands and takes a goblet of wine.
Maester Pycelle assured me your wounds were not fatal.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I organized the defense of this city while you held court in the ruins of Harrenhal.
