I led the foray when the enemies were at the gate while your grandson, the king, quivered in fear behind the walls. I bled in the mud for our family. And as my reward, I was trundled off to some dark little cell. But what do I want? A little bloody gratitude would be a start.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Jugglers and singers require applause. You are a Lannister. Do you think I demanded a garland of roses every time I suffered a wound on a battlefield? Hmm? Now, I have seven kingdoms to look after and three of them are in open rebellion. So tell me what you want.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Tywin sits.

I want what is mine by right. Jaime is your eldest son, heir to your lands and titles. But he is a Kingsguard, forbidden from marriage or inheritance. The day Jaime put on the white cloak, he gave up his claim to Casterly Rock. I am your son and lawful heir.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You want Casterly Rock?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: It is mine by right.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: ( sighs ) We'll find you accommodations more suited to your name and as a reward for your accomplishments during the battle of Blackwater Bay. And when the time is right, you will be given a position fit for your talents so that you can serve your family and protect our legacy. And if you serve faithfully, you will be rewarded with a suitable wife. And I would let myself be consumed by maggots before mocking the family name and making you heir to Casterly Rock.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Why?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Why? You ask that? You, who killed your mother to come into the world? You are an ill-made, spiteful little creature full of envy, lust, and low cunning. Men's laws give you the right to bear my name and display my colors since I cannot prove that you are not mine. And to teach me humility, the gods have condemned me to watch you waddle about wearing that proud lion that was my father's sigil and his father's before him. But neither gods nor men will ever compel me to let you turn Casterly Rock into your whorehouse. Go, now. Speak no more of your rights to Casterly Rock. Go.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Tyrion gets up, dejected, and starts to leave.
Oh, one more thing. The next whore I catch in your bed I'll hang.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Tyrion exits briskly in anger.
EXT. King's Landing Shore
Sansa and Shea sit on a dock.
Dorne. It's going to Dorne.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Why Dorne?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: It's carrying silk and it's supposed to bring back wine in exchange. But it's not coming back. The captain's tired of risking his life so King's Landing lords and ladies can get drunk on better wine than they deserve. He's going to stay in Dorne. Wait out the winter where it's beautiful and warm.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I met some people in Dorne who weren't so beautiful and warm.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Don't ruin the game.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I told you, I don't want to play.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: (pointing to another ship) What about that one there?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: That one? It's going to Volantis.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Why?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Because when I got on a ship in Volantis, it looked like that one.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: That's not how the game works. You're not supposed to just blurt out the right answer. You've got to invent a story about where the ship is going and why.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Why should I make up a story when I know the truth?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Littlefinger and Ros walk onto the dock.
Because the truth is always either terrible or boring.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Littlefinger approaches.
Lovely day for it. Watching the ships.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Lord Baelish.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Might I speak with Lady Sansa alone for a moment?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Shae looks to Sansa, then stands and walks back to Ros.
I saw your mother not long ago. She's very eager to see you. And your sister.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Arya's alive? You said you'd take me home.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You said King's Landing was your home. You are the property of the crown. Stealing you would be treason. If you were to tell just one person ...
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I won't tell anyone.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: How do I know?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Because I'm a terrible liar. You said so yourself. Please, Lord Baelish. Tell me what to do. Tell me when.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I'm waiting for word on an assignment that will take me far away from the capital. When I set sail, I might be able to take you with me. But you'll need to be ready to leave on a moment's notice.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Further back on the dock, Ros approaches Shae
You're her handmaiden?
Speaker: ROS

Text: Yes. And you're his...?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: I help manage his affairs.
Speaker: ROS

Text: He's an important person.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: So is she. I grew up in the shadow of her father's castle. The day she was born, they rang the bells from sunrise till sunset. We've both done rather well, you and I.
Speaker: ROS

Text: Yes.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Given where we started.
Speaker: ROS

Text: And where is that?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: It's not easy for girls like us to dig our way out. Watch out for her.
Speaker: ROS

Text: Littlefinger leaves Shae and walks towards them.
I always do.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Watch out for her with him.
Speaker: ROS

Text: EXT. The Seas outside Slaver's Bay

Dragons  screech as they fly next to a boat at sea. On the deck are DAENERYS and JORAH watch them. Drogon dives and catches a fish. He cooks it with his fire breath and swallows it. He lands next to DAENERYS for affection.
They're growing fast.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Not fast enough. I can't wait that long. I need an army
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Drogon screeches again and takes flight.
We'll be in Astapor by nightfall. Some say the Unsullied are the greatest soldiers in the world.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: The greatest slave-soldiers in the world. The distinction means a good deal to some people.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Do those people have any better ideas about how to put you on the Iron Throne?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: It's too beautiful a day to argue.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: A Dothraki man vomits on the deck below
You're right. Another lovely day on the high seas.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Don't mock them. They're the first Dothraki who have ever been on a ship. They followed me across the poison water. If they'll do it, others will. And with a true khalasar ...
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Dothraki follow strength above all, khaleesi. You'll have a true khalasar when you prove yourself strong. And not before.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: EXT. The shore outside Dragonstone.
The ship's boat has dropped Davos off below Dragonstone, and started back to sea. Davos begins to walk to the castle.
INT. Dragonstone war room.
Stannis sits, looking out to the sea, with Melissandre standing beside him. Davos enters.
Your Grace.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I heard you were dead.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Not yet.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I had hoped to speak to you alone, Your Grace.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: We are alone.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Davos approaches to address Stannis.
Your Grace, you are the rightful king. Not only by blood. You're an honorable man, a just man. And there is still a war to fight.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I am fighting.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: By burning prisoners alive?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: How would you punish the infidels, Ser Davos?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I do not judge people for the gods they worship. If I did, I'd have thrown you in the sea before you ever set foot on Dragonstone.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I'm not your enemy.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: You are my enemy.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Was it me you fought on Blackwater Bay? Did I set your ships ablaze? I wasn't there when the wildfire killed our men by the thousands. I could have saved those men. You would have taken the city, Stannis would now sit upon his rightful throne, and you would stand beside him. But I wasn't there because you convinced your king to leave me behind. Do you hear them screaming? All those burning men in the water crying for their mothers, for their gods for help? Until the moment the Blackwater swallowed them.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Melissandre touches Davos's cheek, and he recoils.
( gasps )
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Don't despair, Ser Davos. What I told your son is true.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: She whispers in his ear
Death by fire is the purest death.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Enraged, Davos draws his dagger and raises it to stab her. The guard hold him back.
( growls ) This woman is evil! She's the mother of demons.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Take him to the dungeon and lock him in a cell.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: The guards pull him backwards out of the room
Your Grace!
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Come on.
Speaker: GUARD

Text: You've chosen the darkness, Ser Davos.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: She will destroy us all!
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I will pray for you.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Your Grace!
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The guards remove him from the chamber.
EXT. Streets of King's Landing.
Joffrey and Margaery are being transported through King's Landing in their royal palanquin, borne by the Kings guard.
Guard: Halt. Down.
Speaker: GUARD

Text: Guard #2: Halt. Down.
Speaker: GUARD #2

Text: The palaquin are set down, and Joffrey is confused and irritated.
Why have we stopped?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: It's Lady Margaery, Your Grace.
Speaker: GUARD

Text: Joffrey looks out of his palquin, and sees Margaery stepping into the streets.
Joffrey: What is she doing? Who gave her permission?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: The nearby streets.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Margaery walks with purpose, and her maid tries to keep up.
My lady. We should have guards, my lady.
Speaker: MAID

Text: Why?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Margaery is blocked by a disfigured commoner, who looks at her with disdain. She smiles at him.
Pardon me.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: A woman empties a bucket of feces just in front of Margaery's path. She continues, optimistic and undeterred.
Stop, my lady. You'll ruin your dress.
Speaker: MAID

Text: I have others.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: She steps across the puddle of filth and her handmaid follows.
Joffrey's palaquin.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Would you like to speak with her, Your Grace?
Speaker: GUARD

Text: No.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Margaery sitting in a small courtyard, surrounded by children.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: He was a soldier. He went to fight on the walls when the ships came into Blackwater Bay. He never came back.
Speaker: CHILD

Text: And your mother?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: She died when she had me.
Speaker: CHILD

Text: Bad men wanted to come into this city and do terrible things, but your father stopped them.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Margaery hands him a toy knight carved from wood.
Whenever you look at this knight, I want you to remember your father.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: He wasn't a knight. He was just a soldier.
Speaker: CHILD

Text: And what do knights swear to do? Protect the weak and uphold the good. Your father did that. Be proud of him.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: She turns to Child #2.
Was your father a soldier, too?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Child #2 nods
You should be proud, too. Under King Joffrey's leadership, your fathers saved the city. They saved us all. From now on, we're going to take care of you. All of you.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Women hand out food to the children.
The streets, a little later.
Speaker: Cut to

Text: Margaery holds hands with two children as she walks. Children laugh and play. She speaks to their caretaker.
Come to me for whatever you need to feed them, clothe them, or house them. Directly to me.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: INT. Joffrey's dining table that night
The doors open. Joffrey and Cersei join  Margaery  and Loras  for dinner.
Your Grace.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: They bow.
Please, sit. Sit. I do apologize, my lady. Small council meetings. At what point does it become treason to waste the king's time?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: ( laughs )
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: That's a lovely gown, my lady.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Yes, it suits you perfectly. I imagine you might be rather cold.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The climate is a bit more forgiving back in Highgarden, Your Grace.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Shall I have them bring you a shawl, my lady?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: I am touched by your concern, Your Grace. Luckily for us Tyrells, our blood runs quite warm. Doesn't it, Loras?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Yes.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Loras, isn't the queen's gown magnificent? The fabric, the embroidery, the metalwork. I've never seen anything like it.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: They all sit at the table, and servants begin to pour the wine.
You might find a bit of armor quite useful once you become queen. Perhaps before. Joffrey tells me you stopped your carriage at Flea Bottom on your way back from the sept this morning.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Yes. I paid a visit to an orphanage the High Septon told me about.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Margaery does a great deal of work with the poor back in Highgarden.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: The lowest among us are no different from the highest if you give them a chance and approach them with an open heart.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Cersei: An open heart is what you'll get in Flea Bottom if you're not careful, my dear. Not long ago, we were attacked by a mob there. We had a full complement of guards that didn't stop them. The king barely escaped with his life.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: My mother's always had a penchant for drama. Facts become less and less important to her as she grows older. Our lives were never truly in danger.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: You're right, of course. But you are your father's son. We can't all have a king's bravery.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: There is an awkward pause as the main course is brought to the table.

Hunger turns men into beasts. I'm glad House Tyrell has been able to help in this regard. They tell me 100 wagons arrive daily now from the Reach. Wheat, barley, apples. We've had a blessed harvest. And, of course, it's our duty to assist the capital in time of need.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Well, as Ser Loras said, Lady Margaery has done this sort of... charitable work before. I'm sure she knows what she's doing.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: I'm sure she does.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: EXT. Approaching the harbor of Astapor
DAENERYS stands on deck, watching their approach to the city.
The path leading to Astapor
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Kraznys mo Nakloz leads Daenerys, Jorah and Missandei. Missandei translates for Kraznys.
( speaking Valyrian )
Speaker: KRAZNYS MO NAKLOZ

Text: The Unsullied have stood here for a day and a night with no food or water.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: They approach the gate.
( speaking Valyrian )
Speaker: KRAZNYS MO NAKLOZ

Text: They will stand until they drop.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: ( speaking Valyrian )
Speaker: KRAZNYS MO NAKLOZ

Text: Such is their obedience.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: The foursome walks though a battalion of Unsullied warriors, standing at attention, who have made an aisle for them to pass through.
They may suit my needs. Tell me of their training.
Speaker: DANAERYS

Text: (speaking Valeryan) The Westrosi woman is pleased with them, but speaks no praise to keep the price down. She wished to know how they are trained.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: ( speaking Valyrian ) Tell her what she would know and be quick about it.
Speaker: KRAZNYS MO NAKLOZ

Text: Once they are through, the Unsullied reform at attention. The four ascend a platform at the end of the yeard, the sea behind them, to survey the soldiers.

They begin their training at five. Every day they drill from dawn to dusk until they have mastered the shortsword, the shield, and the three spears. Only one boy in four survives this rigorous training.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: ( speaking Valyrian )
Speaker: KRAZNYS MO NAKLOZ

Text: Their discipline and loyalty are absolute. They fear nothing.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Even the bravest men fear death.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: ( speaking Valyrian )
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: ( speaking Valyrian )
Speaker: KRAZNYS MO NAKLOZ

Text: ( speaking Valyrian ) The knight says even brave men fear death.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: ( speaking Valyrian ) Tell the old man he smells of piss.
Speaker: KRAZNYS MO NAKLOZ

Text: ( speaking Valyrian ) Truly, master?
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: ( speaking Valyrian ) No, not truly. Are you a girl or a goat to ask such a thing? (Continues in Valyrian)
Speaker: KRAZNYS MO NAKLOZ

Text: Missandei: My master says the Unsullied are not men. Death means nothing to them.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: ( speaking Valyrian ) Tell this ignorant whore of a Westerner to open her eyes and watch.
Speaker: KRAZNYS MO NAKLOZ

Text: KRAZNYS steps forward and descents to the yard.
He begs you attend to this carefully, Your Grace.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: ( speaking Valyrian )
Speaker: KRAZNYS MO NAKLOZ

Text: Kraznys calles an Unsullied forward. He pushes the man's shield and spear aside. He takes the Unsullied's knife and cuts away part of his leather chest armor
Tell the good master there is no need.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: KRAZNYS grabs hold of the man's exposed nipple.
( speaking Valyrian ) She's worried about their nipples? Doers the dumb bitch know we've cut off their balls?
Speaker: KRAZNYS MO NAKLOZ

Text: KRAZNYS slices off the man's nipple, throwing it to the ground. The solder does not flinch.
My master points out that men don't need nipples.
Speaker: Missandei

Text: KRAZNYS replaces the armor strap, and returns the soldier's arms to the ready.
( speaking Valyrian ) Here, I'm done with you.
Speaker: KRAZNYS MO NAKLOZ

Text: ( speaking Valyrian ) This one is pleased to have served you.
Speaker: UNSULLIED

Text: KRAZNYS turns around to face DAENERYS. The Unsullied soldier steps back into formation.
( speaking Valyrian )
Speaker: KRAZNYS MO NAKLOZ

Text: To win his shield, an Unsullied must go to the slave marts with a silver mark, find a newborn and kill it before its mother's eyes. This way, my master says, we make certain there is no weakness left in them.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: You take a babe from its mother's arms, kill it as she watches, and pay for her pain with a silver coin?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: ( speaking Valyrian ) She is offended. She asks if you pay a sliver coin to the mother for her dead baby.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: ( speaking Valyrian ) What a soft mewling fool this one is. ( continues in Valyrian )
Speaker: KRAZNYS MO NAKLOZ

Text: My master would like you to know that the silver is paid to the baby's owner, not the mother.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: How many do you have to sell?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: ( Missandei speaking Valyrian )
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: KRAZNYS holds up eight fingers.
( speaking Valyrian ) Tell the Westerosi whore she has until tomorrow.
Speaker: KRAZNYS MO NAKLOZ

Text: Master Kraznys asks that you please hurry. Many other buyers are interested.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: KRAZNYS sheaths the knife. The Unsullied make way for KRAZNYS and MISSANDEI as the exit, then return to formation.
Slaver's Bay shoreline
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Daenerys and Jorah walk along the shore.
8,000 dead babies.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Unsullied are a means to an end.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Once I own them, these men ...
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They're not men. Not anymore.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Once I own an army of slaves, what will I be?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Do you think these slaves will have better lives serving Kraznys and men like him or serving you?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: They come upon a busy yard where people work and some children play. One CHILD in particular looks at them as she tosses a wooded ball to herself. JORAH and DAENERYS continue into the yard.
You'll be fair to them. You won't mutilate them to make a point.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: The child remains just ahead of them. Meanwhile, a dark hooded figure follows behind.
You won't order them to murder babies. You'll see they're properly fed and sheltered. A great injustice has been done to them. Closing your eyes will not undo it.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: The Child rolls her wooden ball to DAENERYS, who picks it up. The CHILD motions for her to open it. Behind her, the hooded figure draws a knife. He knocks the ball out of her hand before she can twist it open. JORAH grabs the man and wrestles him to the ground, revealing  BARRISTAN SELMY. DAENERYS has been knocked to the ground, and the ball sits inches from her face. It opens, and a chittering, shiny scorpion crawls out and unfolds itself into display. It launches itself at DAENERYS, but is skewered by BARRISTAN's knife before it reaches her. He studies the pierced arachnid
( hisses )
Speaker: CHILD

Text: BARRISTAN flicks the scorpion off his knife. The CHILD, whose mouth is now a corrupt shade of green, flees and jumps off the dock to the water. But when BARRISTAN reaches the edge, the CHILD is nowhere to be seen. He sheaths his knife, confused. DAENERYS and JORAH spot the CHILD on the overlook above them before she walks away.
(to Jorah) The warlocks.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: She walks towards BARRISTAN.
I owe you my life, ser.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The honor is mine, my queen.
Speaker: BARRISTAN SELMY

Text: He lowers his hood
You know this man?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (Nods.) I know him as one of the greatest fighters the Seven Kingdoms has ever seen and as the Lord Commander of Robert Baratheon's Kingsguard.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Barristan approaches.
King Robert is dead. I have been searching for you, Daenerys Stormborn, to ask your forgiveness. I was sworn to protect your family. I failed them.
Speaker: BARRISTAN SELMY

Text: BARRISTAN kneels before her.
I am Barristan Selmy, Kingsguard to your father. Allow me to join your Queensguard and I will not fail you again.
BARRISTAN lowers his head in deference. DAENERYS considers his offer.
The Twins, Night
Speaker: EXT

Text: ROOSE BOLTON climbs the stairs to the top of the Twins. The sounds of the battle below draw him to the edge.  The Stark camp is engulfed in flames as the battle rages on.
The Stark encampment
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The battle outside the castle walls is fierce. Stark bannermen and  Frey forces battle for their lives. Swords clash, and some men are set aflame. One man is strung up by his neck into the trees.
It's too late.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Yah! Yah!
Speaker: Man #2

Text: The HOUND rides out from the castle, ARYA slumped in front of him. He surveys the battle and picks up a Stark banner as he rides by. He urges his mount forward and they trot into the flames.
Go, move out!
Speaker: MAN

Text: The HOUND pauses amidst the blinding smoke and flames. His horse whinnies nerviously. The chants of the Frey men grow louder.
The King in the North! The King in the North! he King in the North! The King in the North!
Speaker: FREY MEN

Text: Frey men march out of the castle. Mounted behind them, ROBB STARK's headless body has been turned into a grotesque effigy. It is tied roughly onto a post. Grey Wind's head has been mounted to the corpse's shoulders.
The King in the North! The King in the North!
Speaker: FREY MEN

Text: Here comes the King in the North! Here comes the King in the North!
Speaker: FREY MAN

Text: ARYA rouses in front of the HOUND. She watches in horror as the Frey men lead the awkward effigy into the yard.
The King in the North! The King in the North!
Speaker: FREY MEN

Text: Here comes
Speaker: FREY MAN

Text: ARYA is dejected and the HOUND has fear in his eyes. He spurs the horse forward, and they ride away through the fire and battle. A Stark banner succumbs to the flames.
King's Landing Garden
Speaker: EXT

Text: SANSA and TYRION stroll side-by-side through the gardens on a beautiful day. SHAE follows, a few paces back. ELDRICK and DESMOND pass, snickering at them
Hmm. Ser Eldrick Sarsfield and Lord Desmond Crakehall. Ser Eldrick Sarsfield and Lord Desmond Crakehall.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What are you doing?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I have a list.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: A list of people you mean to kill?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: For laughing at me? Do I look like Joffrey to you? No, death seems a bit extreme. Fear of death, on the other hand--
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You should learn to ignore them.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: My lady, people have been laughing at me far longer than they've been laughing at you. I'm the Halfman, the Demon Monkey, the Imp.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You're a Lannister. I am the disgraced daughter of the traitor Ned Stark.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: The disgraced daughter and the Demon Monkey. We're perfect for each other.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (laughs)
Speaker: SANSA

Text: TYRION realizes that SHAE overheard that comment. He looks back, embarrassed, and she returns his look, cooly.
So how should we punish them?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Who? Whom?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Ser Eldrick Sarsfield and Lord Desmond Crakehall.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Ah. I could speak to Lord Varys and learn their perversions. Anyone named Desmond Crakehall must be a pervert.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I hear that you're a pervert.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I am the Imp. I have certain standards to maintain.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (chuckles) We could sheep shift Lord Desmond's bed. You cut a little hole in his mattress and you stuff sheep dung inside. Then you sew up the hole and make his bed again. His room will stink, but he won't know where it's coming from.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Lady Sansa!
Speaker: TYRION

Text: My sister used to do that when she was angry with me. And she was always angry with me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Why sheep shift?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: That's the vulgar word for dung.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: My lady--
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Well, you asked me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: PODRICK runs down the steps of the garden, looking for TYRION.
Oh! That's him!
Speaker: GIRL

Text: My lord, my lady. Your father has called a meeting of the small council.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: The Hand's Chamber  TYRION enters. TYWIN, CERSEI, VARYS and PYCELLE are already seated. JOFFREY walks behind his grandfather, excited and grinning.
Speaker: INT

Text: Killed a few puppies today?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Show him. Come on, show him.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Hand shaking, PYCELLE offers a scroll to TYRION. He drops it before TYRION can grab it.
Oh, apologies, my lord. Old fingers.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: Annoyed, TYRION reaches to the floor and snatches the scroll. He reads it. JOFFREY is manic with energy.
'Roslin caught a fine fat trout. Her brothers gave her a pair of wolf pelts for her wedding. Signed Walder Frey.' Is that bad poetry or is it supposed to mean something?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Robb Stark is dead. And his bitch mother. (to Pycelle) Write back to Lord Frey. Thank him for his service and command him to send Robb Stark's head. I'm going to serve it to Sansa at my wedding feast.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Your Grace, Lady Sansa is your aunt by marriage.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: A joke. Joffrey did not mean it.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Yes, I did. I'm going to have it served to Sansa at my wedding feast.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: No. She is no longer yours to torment.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Everyone is mine to torment. You'd do well to remember that, you little monster.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Oh, I'm a monster. Perhaps you should speak to me more softly, then. Monsters are dangerous and just now kings are dying like flies.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The room goes silent. JOFFREY is aghast at the slight.
I could have your tongue out for saying that.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: CERSEI takes JOFFREY's hand to calm him.
Let him make his threats. Hmm? He's a bitter little man.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Lord Tyrion should apologize immediately. Unacceptable, disrespectful, and in very bad taste.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: JOFFREY pulls his hand free from his mother's caress.
I am the king! I will punish you.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Any man who must say, 'I am the king' is no true king. I'll make sure you understand that when I've won your war for you.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: My father won the real war. He killed Prince Rhaegar. He took the crown while you hid under Casterly Rock!
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Once again, the room goes silent as the depth of the insult sinks in.
The king is tired. See him to his chambers.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: CERSEI stands and tries to lead JOFFREY away.
Come along.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I'm not tired.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: We have so much to celebrate. A wedding to plan. You must rest.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI pulls JOFFREY towards the door.
Grand Maester, perhaps some essence of nightshade to help him sleep.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I'm not tired!
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Come.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI and JOFFREY exit. PYCELLE stands, takes the scroll from the table, and shuffles out. Next, VARYS rises smoothly to depart. TYRION cautiously swivels to leave as well.
Not you.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYRION measures the situation as VARYS exits.
You just sent the most powerful man in Westeros to bed without his supper.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You're a fool if you believe he's the most powerful man in Westeros.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: A treasonous statement. Joffrey is king.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You really think a crown gives you power?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYRION sits back down at the table.
No. I think armies give you power.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Mm-hmm.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Robb Stark had one, never lost a battle, and you defeated him all the same.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Mm-hmm.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Oh, I know. Walder Frey gets all the credit. Or the blame, I suppose, depending on your allegiance. Walder Frey is many things, but a brave man? No. He never would have risked such an action if he didn't have certain assurances.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Which he got from me. Do you disapprove?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I'm all for cheating. This is war.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: But to slaughter them at a wedding. Explain to me why it is more noble to kill 10,000 men in battle than a dozen at dinner.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: So that's why you did it? To save lives?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: To end the war. To protect the family. Do you want to write a song for the dead Starks? Go ahead, write one. I'm in this world a little while longer to defend the Lannisters, to defend my blood.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: The northerners will never forget.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Good. Let them remember what happens when they march on the south. All the Stark men are dead. Winterfell is a ruin. Roose Bolton will be named Warden of the North until your son by Sansa comes of age.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYWIN gathers his paper and stands.
I believe you still have some work to do on that score.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Do you think she'll open her legs for me after I tell her how we murdered her mother and brother?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYWIN places the papers on his desk, as TYRION approaches.
One way or another, you will get that girl pregnant.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I will not rape her.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Shall I explain to you in one easy lesson how the world works?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Use small words. I'm not as bright as you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The house that puts family first will always defeat the house that puts the whims and wishes of its sons and daughters first. A good man does everything in his power to better his family's position regardless of his own selfish desires.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: (smirks)
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Does that amuse you?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: No, it's a very good lesson. Only it's easy for you to preach utter devotion to family when you're making all the decisions.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Easy for me, is it?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: When have you ever done something that wasn't in your interest but solely for the benefit of the family?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The day that you were born. I wanted to carry you into the sea and let the waves wash you away. Instead, I let you live. And I brought you as my son. Because you're a Lannister.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYWIN walks away.
TYRION's chambers
Speaker: INT

Text: TYRION enters to find SANSA staring out the window.
Sansa.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: SANSA turns to him. Her face is wet and swollen from crying. She looks at TYRION with disdain. She turns back to the window, and TYRION lets her be.
The North
Speaker: EXT

Text: MEERA jogs across the rough landscape, bow in her hand and Summer at her side. She reaches JOJEN, BRAN and HODOR.
It's empty.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Let's find a place to sleep.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: They walk together.
The abandonded Nightfort, a bit later.
Speaker: INT

Text: A fire crackles behind HODOR as he looks down into a well. He plays with his echo.
Hodor. Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: Don't, Hodor.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: HODOR stops and joins the others. MEERA whittles while JOJEN cooks at the fire. BRAN sits pensively, his hand exploring the rough wooden table at his side.
Maybe we shouldn't stay.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You'd rather be out there?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: There are a lot of stories about this place. Horrible stories.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I always quite liked the horrible stories.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: So did I. Once.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: JOJEN moves to sit with the others.
You ever heard about the Rat Cook?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: No. Who's he?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Just a cook in the Night's Watch. He was angry at the king for something, I don't remember. When the king was visiting the Nightfort, the cook killed the king's son, cooked him into a big pie with onions, carrots, mushrooms and bacon. That night he served the pie to the king. He liked the taste of his son so much, he asked for a second slice. The gods turned the cook into a giant white rat who could only eat his own young. He's been roaming the Nightfort ever since, devouring his own babies. But no matter what he does, he's always hungry.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: If the gods turned every killer into a giant white rat--
Speaker: MEERA

Text: It wasn't for murder the gods cursed the Rat Cook or for serving the king's son in a pie. He killed a guest beneath his roof. That's something the gods can't forgive.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: The Twins, dining hall.
Speaker: INT

Text: WALDER eats noisily in the large, empty dining hall. ROOSE BOLTON sands nearby. Servants scrub blood from the floor.

'The late Walder Frey,' old Hoster called me because I didn't get my men to the Trident in time for battle. He thought he was witty. Look at us now, Tully. You're dead, your daughter-Catelyn's dead, your grandson's dead, your son spent his wedding night in a dungeon and I'm Lord of Riverrun. (laughs)
Speaker: WALDER

Text: The Blackfish escaped.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: An old man on the run with no allies. I have Tywin Lannister backing me. Who does he have?
Speaker: WALDER

Text: As you say.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: They all laughed at me, all those high lords. They all thought they were better than me. Ned Stark, Hoster Tully. People snigger when I marry a young girl, but who said a word when Jon Arryn married the little Tully bitch?
Speaker: WALDER

Text: You'll be needing a new young girl.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: Yeah. Got that to look forward to.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: (grunts)
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: And you, the Warden of the North. No more Starks to bow and scrape to. Must have been torture following that stupid boy all over the country.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: He ignored my advice at every turn. If he'd been a trifle less arrogant--
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: Calling himself the Young Wolf. How's that for pomposity?
Speaker: WALDER

Text: (nods)
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: Well, here's to the Young Wolf! (howls)
Speaker: WALDER

Text: Forever young.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: They both laugh.
Will you move to Winterfell now that the war's over?
Speaker: WALDER

Text: At some point perhaps. But Winterfell's in ruins.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: Yeah. What happened up there? I heard the Greyjoy boy seized the place. I heard he killed all the ravens. And after that, nothing.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: I sent my bastard Ramsay to root him out.  Robb Stark offered amnesty for the ironborn if they gave us Theon.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: Oh. And?
Speaker: WALDER

Text: A Dungeon, somewhere.
Speaker: INT

Text: RAMSAY sits, merrily eating a sausage. THEON is strapped once again to the X-shaped cross.
Well, the girls weren't lying. You had a good-sized cock.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: THEON looks up accusingly at RAMSAY, who mugs a reaction of shock.
What? No. Pork sausage. You think I'm some sort of savage?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: THEON sulks.
People talk about phantom limbs. An amputee might have an itch where his foot used to be. So I've always wondered do eunuchs have a phantom cock?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: He holds up a pork sausage as a visual aid.
Next time you think about naked girls, would you feel an itch?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY shakes the sausage. THEON winces and whimpers. He begins to weep. RAMSAY takes a bite.
Sorry. I shouldn't make jokes. My mother taught me not to throw stones at cripples.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: (cries)
Speaker: THEON

Text: But my father taught me to aim for their head.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Kill me.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Sorry, what?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Kill me.
Speaker: THEON

Text: A little louder.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Kill me!
Speaker: THEON

Text: THEON begins to sob.
You're no good to me dead. We need you.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY rises from the table. He walks to THEON grabs THEON's hair and pulls his head back.
You don't look like a Theon Greyjoy anymore. That's a name for a lord. But you're not a lord, are you? You're just meat.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: (groans)
Speaker: THEON

Text: Stinking meat.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY sniffs THEON.
You reek. Reek! That's a good name for you. What's your name?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Theon Greyjoy.
Speaker: THEON

Text: RAMSAY gives THEON a powerful slap.
What's your name?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY punches THEON harder.
Please.
Speaker: THEON

Text: RAMSAY grabs THEON's neck with both hands and throttles him.
What is your name?!
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Reek. My name is Reek.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Satisfied and victorious, RAMSAY releases THEON and walks away. THEON weeps again.
The North, the abandoned Nightfort, night
Speaker: INT

Text: The wind howls outside. A distant gasp startles BRAN awake.  Summer paces as the gasping continues.
Hodor.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: HODOR wakes. MEERA draws her knife reflexively as she jumps to consciousness. The gasps continue. Summer growls. Footsteps approach. A figure rises from the well, clanging and groaning. The huge figure enters through the trap door, which clangs shut behind him. MEERA yells and jumps the figure, pinning him to the ground, knife at his throat. It is SAM.
Don't kill me!
Speaker: SAM

Text: Who are you?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: GILLY enters, frantic, holding her BABY.
Sam! Sam!
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Who are you?!
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Gilly. Don't hurt us.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: MEERA releases SAM and he gets up from the floor.
Where are you going?
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: To Castle Black. I'm a brother of the Night's Watch.
Speaker: SAM

Text: My brother, he's in the Night's--
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Shush.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: Who's your brother?
Speaker: SAM

Text: Doesn't matter.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: Summer growls. SAM realizes that BRAN has a direwolf.
You're Jon's brother. The one who fell from the window.
Speaker: SAM

Text: No, I'm not.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I've been around Ghost enough to know a direwolf when I see one. And I've heard all about Hodor.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: I'd be dead if it wasn't for Jon. If you're his brother, you're my brother, too. And anything I can do to help you, I will.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Take us north of the Wall.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: MEERA sheaths her knife and goes to inspect the well.
What? Why in the world would you want to go--
Speaker: SAM

Text: I don't want to. I have to.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: How did you get through the Wall?
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: Does the well lead to an underground river? Is that how you came here?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Come with us. There are steps carved into the south side of the Wall. Hodor can carry you to the top. We'll walk straight to Castle Black.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Come with us. There's nothing north but death.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: If Jon is alive, then Castle Black's where he'll be. It's the safest place for you.
Speaker: SAM

Text: There's nowhere safe any longer. You know that.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: What I know is what I saw. And if you saw it, too, you'd run the other way.
Speaker: SAM

Text: You saw the white walkers and the army of the dead.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: How do you know all that?
Speaker: SAM

Text: The Night's Watch can't stop them. The kings of Westeros and all their armies can't stop them.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: Everyone is silent. Birds call in the distance. The BABY fusses.
But you're going to stop them?
Speaker: SAM

Text: Please, Sam. I have to go north. I have to.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: The Iron Islands, day
Speaker: EXT

Text: A lone rider gallops towards the Pyke.
The Pyke
Speaker: INT

Text: BALON sits at a cluttered table. YARA stands nearby. BALON opens a leather tube to reveal a scroll. He draws out the scroll, and recognizes the wax seal of the Flayed Man. He breaks the seal and unrolls the scroll.
'Balon Greyjoy, Lord of the Iron Islands and invader of the North. I give you until the full moon to order all ironborn scum out of the North and back to those shit-stained rocks you call a home.
Speaker: BALON

Text: YARA carefully unwraps the burlap and twine from around a package. Inside is a small chest. She frees the clasp.
BALON stands as YARA opens the box. She is stonefaced. BALON joins her, and offers a similarly sober reaction.  He returns to reading the scroll.
'Leave the North now or more boxes will follow with more Theon. Signed Ramsay Snow, natural-born son of Roose Bolton, Lord of the Dreadfort and Warden of the North.' Get that out of my sight.
Speaker: BALON

Text: Yara looks at Balon.
Theon disobeyed my orders.
Speaker: BALON

Text: Yara gives Balon a challenging look.
The boy is a fool. He cannot further the Greyjoy line. I will not give up the lands I have seized, the strongholds I have taken. Get this away from me.
Speaker: BALON

Text: He's your son.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Son? He's not a man anymore.
Speaker: BALON

Text: He's your son. He's my brother. He's a Greyjoy.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Watch yourself. I've made my decision.
Speaker: BALON

Text: BALON sits by the fire.
And I've made mine. I'm going to pick the fastest ship in our fleet.
Speaker: YARA

Text: YARA aboard an ironborn ship. The crew stands at attention as she walks past
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: (voiceover)  I'm going to choose the 50 best killers on the Iron Islands.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Get those ropes!
Speaker: MAN

Text: The crew prepares the ship for travel. The Pyke stands in the distance. YARA is in command.
(voiceover) I'm going to sail up the Narrow Sea all the way to the Weeping Water. I'm going to march on the Dreadfort. I'm going to find my little brother and I'm going to bring him home.
Speaker: YARA

Text: The North, the secret tunnel between the Nightfort and North of the Wall.
Speaker: INT

Text: BRAN inspects the dragonglass knife.
What is it?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Dragonglass.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: We found them at the Fist. Someone buried them a long time ago. Someone wanted us to find them.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Jojen takes a dragonglass knife from SAM, and inspects it.
Why? What are they for?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: SAM and GILLY exchange a long look.
Killing white walkers.
Speaker: SAM

Text: How do you know that?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: The walker came for my Baby. And Sam--
Speaker: GILLY

Text: But no one's killed a white walker in thousands of years.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Well, I suppose someone had to be the first.
Speaker: SAM

Text: SAM offers a dragonglass knife to HODOR, who refuses it. BRAN takes it and hands it him.
Take it, Hodor.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: HODOR looks at the remarkable knife. SAM hands dragonglass arrowheads to MEERA.
And the archer. I got lucky with one of them. There are more. Many more. And for every one of them, the dead men, more than you could count. I wish you'd come with us.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I wish I could. I really do.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: BRAN, HODOR, MEERA and JOJEN walk to the northern exit of the tunnel. SAM and GILLY watch them go.
Dragonstone Dungeon
Speaker: INT

Text: DAVOS approaches GENDRY's cell. GENDRY sits with his back to the bars.
How are you keeping?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Great. Never better.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: It was just a bit of blood.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I should have known. Every time a highborn asks my name, it's trouble. We're not really people to you, are we? Just a million different ways to get what you want.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I'm not a highborn.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: She called you Ser. I heard it.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: DAVOS sits down, mirroring GENDRY on the other side of the bars.
A recent state of affairs. I was born in Flea Bottom just like you.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Sure, you were. You're my friend. You're here to help.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I lived below the Street of Flour.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: How far below? How close to the Red Keep were you?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: The shit that poured from their privy pipes flowed down the side of Aegon's Hill along Tanner's Row and right in front of my front door on Gin Alley.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Gin Alley.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: The Street of Steel, with your armor and your knights? Pfft. You lived in the fancy part of town. And here we are now. Two boys from Flea Bottom in the castle of a king.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Yeah, we've come a long way. We're all the same, really. She went to great pains to point that out to me.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: If you mistrust fancy people so much, why were you in such a hurry to trust her?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: She does know her way around a man's head, I'll give her that.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: They  both chuckle.
So how'd you become a lord?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Oh, that's a long story.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Better not, then. I'm a bit busy.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Many years ago I helped King Stannis out of a difficult situation. He rewarded me with a lordship. And this.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS shows GENDRY is half-fingers.
You see? Highborns.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I didn't want to be a lord. I nearly didn't accept.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Why did you?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I did it for my son. I didn't want him to step over a river of shit every time he stepped through his front door. I wanted him to have a better life.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Does he?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: He's dead.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS stands up.
How'd he die?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Following me.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS exits.
King's Landing, seaside garden
Speaker: EXT

Text: SHAE stares out at the ships in the harbor. VARYS approaches behind her.
When did you come to this strange country?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: When I was 13.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: You were only a child.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I stopped being a child when I was nine. My mother made sure of that.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: You've been a good influence on our mutual friend, you know. He used to drink from sundown to sunup, visit three brothels a night, gamble away his father's money. Now it's just the drinking.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: And now I'm his wife's servant. I brush her hair and clip her nails and empty her chamber pot.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: She is a sweet young thing. None of this is her fault.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I love that girl. I would kill for her. Do you think that makes it easier for me?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: No, I expect not.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: She's young and she's beautiful and highborn.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: We break bread with them, but that doesn't make us family. We've learned their language, but we'll never be their countrymen. If you let yourself believe that a foreign girl with no name could spend her life with the son of Tywin Lannister--
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I have a name.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: You have one name. As do I. Here only the family name matters.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: What do you want from me, Lord Varys?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Varys hands Shae a small bag of diamonds.

Diamonds. I'd tell you to beware carrying so much wealth, but you know how to protect yourself. Get on one of those ships. Sail to Pentos or Lys or Myr. You can buy a house with these diamonds, a very large house. Hire servants. Start a new life, a good life, far from here. The mysterious foreign beauty. You'll have suitors lining up.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Why do you want me to leave?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: VARYS moves to leave
Lord Varys.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: SHAE tosses the bag of diamonds at VARYS's feet.
If he wants me to leave, he can tell me himself.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: SHAE exits.
TYRION's chambers, evening
Speaker: INT

Text: TYRION and PODRICK sit drinking at his table.
Keep up.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I don't think I can, my lord.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: TYRION pours more wine for each of them.
It's not easy being drunk all the time. Everyone would do it if it were easy.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: CERSEI enters from the garden.
Leave.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: PODRICK stands and exits.
So, enjoying married life? An unhappy wife is a wine merchant's best friend.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI pours herself some wine.
She doesn't deserve this.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Deserve? Be careful with that. Start trying to work out who deserves what and before long you'll spend the rest of your days weeping for each and every person in the world.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: There's nothing worse than a late-blooming philosopher.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (chuckles)
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Will you be facing your marriage to Ser Loras with the same philosophical spirit?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I won't be marrying Ser Loras.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I seem to remember saying something similar about my own marriage.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You're not me. You want to make things better for Sansa? Give her a child.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: So you can tell Father it was you who finally talked me into it?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: So she can have some happiness in her life.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You have children. How happy would you say you are?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Not very. But if it weren't for my children, I'd have thrown myself from the highest window in the Red Keep. They're the reason I'm alive.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Even Joffrey?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: CERSEI sits.
How long does it go on?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Until we've dealt with all our enemies.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Every time we deal with an enemy, we create two more.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Then I suppose it will go on for quite a long time.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Riverlands woods
Speaker: EXT

Text: The HOUND and ARYA ride past four laughing Frey soldiers.
I'm telling you, that's what she did. Sounded like a cow in heat.
Speaker: FREY SOLDIER

Text: Aye, not for long.
Speaker: FREY SOLDIER #2

Text: That's right. Black Walder shut her up right quick. None of the Starks had much to say about the end of that meal.
Speaker: FREY SOLDIER #3

Text: I'll tell you what, though. The hardest thing was getting that wolf's head to stay on the body.
Speaker: FREY SOLDIER

Text: ARYA slides off the horse and lands on her feet.
You sewed it on?
Speaker: FREY SOLDIER #2

Text: I did.
Speaker: FREY SOLDIER

Text: I bet there were 1,000 men claiming they were the one.
Speaker: FREY SOLDIER #2

Text: It was me. And Malcolm and Talbott. Well, the thing was so heavy, it fell off the first time. Took the skin right with it. What we ended up having to do was hook the needle right under the collarbone. Give it a nice firm mooring and--
Speaker: FREY SOLDIER

Text: Arya comes up behind the men. They notice her.
What do you want?
Speaker: FREY SOLDIER

Text: Mind if I keep warm?  Frey Soldier #2: Fuck off.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: But I'm hungry.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Does fuck off mean something different where you're from?
Speaker: FREY SOLDIER

Text: I've got money.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Arya produces the silver Braavosi coin from her belt.
What kind of coin is that?
Speaker: FREY SOLDIER

Text: It's worth a lot.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA drops the coin in front of the FREY SOLDIER.
Sorry.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Little shit.
Speaker: FREY SOLDIER

Text: The FREY SOLDIER reaches down for the coin. ARYA pushes him down by the neck and stabs the FREY SOLDIER repeatedly.
Fool!
Speaker: FREY SOLDIER #2

Text: The other three soldiers rise to attack, but the HOUND appears to shield her. The Frey Soldiers attack the HOUND. He punches one in the face and slices another across the gut. He dodges a blow and disarms the third. He then dispatches the two soldiers who remain standing. ARYA watches, awestruck. She stands up as the HOUND deals a final blow.
Where did you get the knife?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: From you.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA holds up the knife, emotionless. The HOUND takes it.
Is that the first man you've killed?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The first man.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Next time you're going to do something like that, tell me first.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The HOUND walks to the soldier's fire and starts eating their meal. ARYA bends down and picks up her Braavosi coin.
(whispers) Valar morghulis.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The North.
Speaker: EXT

Text: JON cleans his facial wounds in a small pool. His horse grazes nearby. He hears the sound of a bow being drawn. He turns to see YGRITTE, an arrow notched and aimed at him. She is the picture of controlled anger. JON stands and faces her.
Ygritte, you know I didn't have a choice. You always knew who I was, what I am.
Speaker: JON

Text: (grunts)
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: I have to go home now. I know you won't hurt me.
Speaker: JON

Text: YGRITTE's emotions start to crack.
You know nothing, Jon Snow.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: I do know some things. I know I love you.
Speaker: JON

Text: YGRITTE grunts and draws her bow harder in rage.
I know you love me. But I have to go home now.
Speaker: JON

Text: YGRITTE fights back tears. JON turns, and she looses an arrow into  Jon's shoulder. Jon falls to the ground, grunting in pain. YGRITTE notches another arrow as JON lurches up and grabs onto his horse. YGRITTE hesitates. JON mounts and YGRITTE puts an arrow into his leg. JON cries out and spurs his horse. YGRITTE has found her resolve. She notches another arrow. She tracks him and shoots him a third time as he gallops away. She begins to weep.
Caslte Black courtyard
Speaker: EXT

Text: It is a grey day, and the courtyard is relatively quiet.
Castle Black interior.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: MAESTER AEMON sits by the fire. SAM and GILLY stand before him. She cradles her BABY.
I know how this must look. What I meant was--
Speaker: SAM

Text: I swear to you, my lord--
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I'm not a lord, my dear. Not for many, many years. Every man who joins the Night's Watch renounces all former titles. Among other things. What is your name?
Speaker: MAESTER AEMON

Text: Gilly.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Ah, for the gillyflower. Lovely.
Speaker: MAESTER AEMON

Text: Yes, my--
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Maester.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Master.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Maester.
Speaker: SAM

Text: And the child?
Speaker: MAESTER AEMON

Text: She hasn't chosen a name yet.
Speaker: SAM

Text: His name is Sam.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Tarly do you remember the oath you swore when you joined this order?
Speaker: MAESTER AEMON

Text: He's not my child, Maester Aemon. She's one of Craster's wives. I remember every word of the oath. Night gathers and my watch begins. I am the shield that guards the realms of men. The realms of men. That means her as well as us. We didn't build 500 miles of ice walls 700 feet high to keep men out. The night is gathering, Maester Aemon. I've seen it. It's coming for all of us.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Gilly, you and your son will be our guests for the time being. We certainly cannot send you back beyond the Wall.
Speaker: MAESTER AEMON

Text: Thank you Maester. I can cook and clean and I can--
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Good. Samwell, fetch a quill and inkwell. I hope your penmanship is better than your swordplay.
Speaker: MAESTER AEMON

Text: SAM sits at the writing desk and readies a quill.
Miles better.
Speaker: SAM

Text: We had 44 ravens at last count. Make sure they're all fed. Every one of them flies tonight.
Speaker: MAESTER AEMON

Text: Dragonstone
Speaker: INT

Text: DAVOS sits in a rough-hewn chamber. A pile of sealed scrolls sits on the table in front of him. SHIREEN sits reading a book nearby. DAVOS opens a scroll and tries to read it.
Night
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: 'First night of the full moon.' Why is there a G in night?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I don't know. There just is.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Well, your father's not going to go to that.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: SHIREEN sits next to DAVOS. He puts the scroll back on the table.
My books are better than these boring scrolls. You could read about Balerion the Dread. They say you can still see his skull in the dungeons beneath the Red Keep. I'd like to see that someday.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: I've been trying to stay out of those dungeons my whole life.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: 'His fangs were as long as bastard swords.'
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: SHIREEN moves back to the bed.

Aye, old Balerion's definitely better than anything your cousin Rylene's got on offer. But now that I'm your father's Hand again, I have to keep him informed. The king does not have time for this drudgery. 'To all the lords and knobble men of Westeros.'
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: ' Noblemen.'
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: What is it?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Bells ring out in the distance. SHIREEN puts down her book.
Why are they ringing the bells? Are we being attacked?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Stay here. Bar the door.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS stands and exits.
The Dragonstone War Room
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: MELISANDRE picks up some pieces from the war map. STANNIS is hunched over the table, holding a single scroll. MELISANDRE starts to drop the pieces in the fire, one by one. DAVOS enters.
Melisandre, Stannis, Davos
Speaker: CUT

Text: The usurper Robb Stark is dead. Betrayed by his bannerman.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: And you take credit because you dropped a leech into the fire?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I take no credit. I have faith and my faith has been rewarded.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Your Grace, the world has got so far bent. I've seen things crawl out of nightmares, but my eyes were open. I don't know if Robb Stark died because of the Red Woman's sorcery or because at war men die all the time, but I do know that uniting the Seven Kingdoms with blood magic is wrong. It is evil. And you are not an evil man.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Do you know who had this table carved and painted, Ser Davos?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Aegon Targaryen.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: And do you know how Aegon Targaryen conquered Westeros?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: On the back of his dragon Balerion the Dread.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: He had a smaller fleet than the kings he faced and a smaller army, but he had three dragons. Dragons are magic, Ser Davos. My enemies have made my kingdom bleed. I will not forget that. I will not forgive that. I will punish them with any arms at my disposal.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: You do not need to burn the boy. If what you say is true, a drop of his blood killed Robb Stark--
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: And our king is still no closer to the Iron Throne. A great gift requires a great sacrifice.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: MELISANDRE touches STANNIS's shoulder. He turns, and then walks to face the sea.
His name is Gendry. He's a good lad. A poor lad from Flea Bottom who happens to be your nephew.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: What is the life of one bastard boy against a kingdom?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Everything.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The boy must die.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Dragonstone Dungeon, night
Speaker: INT

Text: DAVOS enters, bearing a torch. He unlocks GENDRY's cell.
What are you doing?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: You're leaving.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Is this some kind of trick?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Yes, but not on you.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS throws a cloak to GENDRY.
Dragonstone shore.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: DAVOS and GENDRY walk to a rowboat. DAVOS tosses a bag into the boat and pushes it into the water.
Aim for that star. Don't stop. There's bread and water. Go slow with it. If you finish it off, no matter how thirsty you get, don't drink seawater.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: They wade into the water.
I know not to drink seawater.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Row for a full day and night and you'll reach Rook's Rest. You'll want to stop there. Don't. She'll find you.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Where should I go?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: You must keep the coast on your left side until you reach King's Landing.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The gold cloaks are looking for me.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: They were looking for me for 20 years. Do they know your face?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: No.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I'd worry more about the Red Woman.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Gendry boards the rowboat and sits
The other way.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Gendry turns around in the boat and sits at the oarlocks.
You ever been in a boat before?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: No.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: You know how to swim?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: No.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Don't fall out. Go on.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS pushes the rowboat away from the shore.
Why are you doing this?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Because it's right. And because I'm a slow learner.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: GENDRY begins to row away.
When you get to Flea Bottom, have a bowl of brown for me.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Castle Black
Speaker: EXT

Text: JON lies slumped on his horse's back as it approaches Castle Black. A GUARD calls from a high walkway.
Horse approaching! Halt! Halt!
Speaker: GUARD

Text: JON slides off the horse and lies motionless in the snow. The GUARD rushes down
Castle Black courtyard
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Two Night's Watchmen drag JON through the courtyard. Others come rushing in to see what is happening. They set JON down and roll him over. SAM and PYP stand over him.
Jon! Jon! Jon, it's us.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I don't think he can see us.
Speaker: PYP

Text: Pyp? Sam?
Speaker: JON

Text: Hush, now. You're home. Carry him inside. Gently.
Speaker: SAM

Text: They carry JON to the stairs.
The streets of King's Landing
Speaker: EXT

Text: The market is busy and teeming with daily life. JAIME enters the gate, soiled by days of travel. He marvels at being back in the capitol after so long. BRIENNE follows just behind.
Out of the way. Step aside, country boy. People working here.
Speaker: MAN

Text: JAIME is quiet and humble. He exchanges a look with BRIENNE, who nods encouragingly. They walk into the clamor.
Cersei's chambers
Speaker: INT

Text: CERSEI sits, admiring a collection of exotic shells, reliving some memory. JAIME enters quietly behind her.
Cersei.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: CERSEI looks up and gasps. They measure one another. She notices JAIME's hand. He looks down.
Dragonstone war room
Speaker: INT

Text: DAVOS stands before some guards. STANNIS and MELISANDRE interrogate him.
You don't deny it?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: No. I let him go.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Your mercy saved the boy's life. You feel good about that?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Aye, I do.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You saved one innocent. How many tens of thousands have you doomed?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: There has got to be another way.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: What other way?! Tell us about this other way.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I don't know, Your Grace. I can't see the future in the fire.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Very well, Ser Davos Seaworth. I, Stannis of the House Baratheon, First of My Name, Rightful King of the Andals and the First Men, sentence you to die.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I understand. But since you haven't yet unnamed me Hand of the King, it is my duty to advise you against it. You're gonna need me.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Take him away.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: The guards start to wrestle DAVOS away.
Why am I gonna need you?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Davos produces a scroll and holds it our for  Stannis.
My king.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Stannis takes the scroll and reads it.
Stannis hands scroll to Melisandre. She reads it.
When did you learn to read?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Matthos taught me before he died so I could be of better service to you.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Melisandre burns the scroll.
This War of Five Kings means nothing. The true war lies to the north, my king. Death marches on the Wall. Only you can stop him.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: You can't stop him alone. You need someone to rebuild your army for you, someone to convince this lord and that lord to fight for you, to bring sellswords and pirates to your side.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I've made my decision.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: He's right. You need him. He has a part to play in the war to come.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: (chuckles) You see, Ser Davos? You've been saved by that fire god you like to mock. You're in his army now.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: DAVOS and MELISANDRE look at one another.
Outside Yunkai
Speaker: EXT

Text: DAENERYS, MISSANDEI, JORAH, BARRISTAN and DAARIO stand on  the rocks, surrounded by the Unsullied and the Dothraki. The dragons chitter as they wait outside Yunkai.
They will come, Your Grace. When they're ready.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: Perhaps they didn't want to be conquered.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You didn't conquer them. You liberated them.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: People learn to love their chains.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The door opens and a crowd pours out. Each wears a collar around their neck. As they get close to DAENERYS, the Unsullied, as one,  take a defensive position, spears pointed at the crowd. A dragon screaches.
(speaking Valyrian) This is Daenerys Targaryen, the Stormborn, the Unburnt, the Queen of the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros, Mother of Dragons. It is to her you owe your freedom
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: No.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS surveys the crowd.

(speaking Valyrian)  You do not owe me your freedom.  I cannot give it to you. Your freedom is not mine to give. It belongs to you and you alone. If you want it back, you must take it for yourselves. Each and every one of you.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The crowd is silent until one man, holding his daughter, calls out.
Mhysa!
Speaker: MAN

Text: Mhysa!
Speaker: DAUGHTER

Text: The whole crowd joins in the shouting.
Mhysa! Mhysa! Mhysa! Mhysa! Mhysa!
Speaker: CROWD

Text: What does it mean?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: It is old Ghiscari, khaleesi. It means 'mother'.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: The crowd steps closer and they continue to call to DAENERYS. The Unsullied take a more threatening stance to hold them back. Panic and fear begin to ripple through the confused crowd. They regain their voice and renew their cries.
Mhysa! Mhysa!  Mhysa.
Speaker: CROWD

Text: It's all right. These people won't hurt me.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS steps forward  kneels next to her three dragons.
(in Valyrian) Fly.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The dragons screach and launch to the sky. DAENERYS steps down among the Unsullied.
Mhysa! Mhysa! Mhysa.
Speaker: CROWD

Text: (in Valyrian) Let me pass
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS walks into the crowd. The touch her gently as she passes through them. They are elated, and they continue to chant to her.
Mhysa! Mhysa! Mhysa. Mhysa!
Speaker: CROWD

Text: DAENERYS walks deep into the crowd. They lift her up above them, and she sits on their shoulders as the crowd reaches towards her. They spin slowly and the crowd forms rings around her. She smiles and the crowd tightens into a spiral of adulation. The Unsullied remain in formation. The dragons soar overhead.
The woods outside Winterfell
Speaker: EXT

Text: BRAN runs through the woods, holding a bow. He stops, eyes searching. He turns to move again, but a raven startles him as it swoops  past his face and alights in a tree. BRAN steps closer, notches an arrow and takes aim.
Don't think too much, Bran.
Speaker: JON

Text: Suddenly, JON and ROBB are by his side.
Relax your bow arm.
Speaker: JON

Text: BRAN carefully lets the arrow fly. It misses and the raven takes flight. JON and ROBB laugh.
And which one of you was a marksman at 10?
Speaker: NED

Text: BRAN looks to the sky, trying to locate his father's voice.
Father?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: JOJEN appears next to him.
You can't kill it, you know.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: Why not?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Because the raven is you.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: A field in the north
Speaker: EXT

Text: BRAN wakes suddenly and sits up. He was sleeping atop furs  in an open tent. RICKON, in the cart nearby is startled awake by BRAN's movements. Their direwolves, Summer and Shaggydog, stand near them. HODOR leans down to check on BRAN while OSHA sits nearby, sharpening sharpens a stick.
Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: It's all right, Hodor.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: Were you inside the wolf again, little lord?
Speaker: OSHA

Text: No, it was the three-eyed raven.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: He's back.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: I tried to kill it, but I couldn't. There was a boy.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I don't want to hear about it.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: But you asked.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: We've got plenty of worries. We don't need to pour black magic on top of them.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: I didn't ask for black magic dreams.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I know you didn't, little lord.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: Birds screech in the distance. OSHA looks up, concerned at their disturbance.
We need to move.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: She stands and puts away her knife.
We don't know who might be after us. No one even knows we're alive.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: And who told you that? The three-eyed raven tell you?
Speaker: OSHA

Text: No.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Some good he is, then.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: OSHA begins to pack up camp.
I don't know what other people know and what they don't. I only know the Wall is a long way off.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: Harrenhal chamber
Speaker: INT

Text: ROBB looks pensively into a fire. TALISA stands nearby.
My mother always told me you Westerosi were a grim lot. Grim, bearded, stinking barbarians that would row across the Narrow Sea and steal us from our beds.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: TALISA walks over to ROBB and half-embraces him
Did you ever think you'd marry one?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I never thought I'd marry anyone at all.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Never?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Not until I met the king of the grim, bearded, stinking barbarians.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Pardon me, Your Grace. My queen.
Speaker: They kiss. The chamber door opens and ROOSE BOLTON enters.  ROOSE BOLTON

Text: Lord Bolton.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: ROOSE holds two pieces raven messages, one in each hand.
Let me guess which one is the good news.  ROOSE BOLTON: Word from Riverrun and Winterfell.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Harrenhal courtyard
Speaker: EXT

Text: ROBB stands and and CATELYN sits in an archway. CATELYN is dejected.
I hadn't seen him in years. I don't even know how many.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: We'll travel to the funeral together. Lord Bolton will garrison here until we return.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Will I be wearing manacles when I lay my father to rest?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: ROBB does not answer.
Something else?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: By the time Bolton's bastard-RAMSAY got to Winterfell, the ironborn were gone. They massacred everyone and put the castle to the torch. And BRAN and RICKON have not been found. They may have escaped. Or Theon may have taken them back to the Iron Islands as hostages.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Have you received any demands?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: No.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Have you heard anything from Theon at all?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Dungeon
Speaker: INT

Text: THEON is bound on an X-shaped cross in a dungeon. Someone drenches him with a bucket of water to wake him. He wakes, shaking, and takes stock of his location. A blurry TORTURER looks on.
Where am I? Who are you? What do you want?
Speaker: THEON

Text: The TORTURER approaches and grabs THEON's hand, roughly.
I want to do this.
Speaker: TORTURER

Text: The TORTURER thrusts an awl under THEON's finger nail. THEON screams in pain.
A field in the Riverlands
Speaker: EXT

Text: JAIME and BRIENNE make their way through a hedge. JAIME's hands are bound, and BRIENNE has him leashed.
Do you know how long it's going to take us to get to King's Landing walking through fields and forests?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Yes.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: They walk through the field. BRIENNE occassionally pushes JAIME forward.
So how shall we pass the time?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: By putting one foot in front of the other.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: It's going to be a very dull walk.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I'm here to take you to King's Landing and bring back Lady Stark's daughters in exchange. Dull is fine.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You know, it doesn't matter how loyal a servant you are, no one enjoys the company of a humorless mute. Trust me on this. People have been serving me since I was born. You think Lady Stark is going to want a giant towheaded plank following her around for the rest of her life? A week's journey with you and she'll order you to fall on your sword.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: If Lady Stark is unhappy with any aspect of my service, I'm sure she'll let me know. She's an honest woman.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: All the good it's done her.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Riverlands forrest, a bit later.
Speaker: EXT

Text: JAIME relieves himself on a tree, while BRIENNE looks on.
How did you come into Lady Stark's service? There's something we can talk about.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Not your concern, Kingslayer.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: It had to be recently. You weren't with her at Winterfell.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: How would you know?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Because I visited Winterfell. I would have noticed your dour head smacking into the archways.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: She yanks on his leash and they move on.
Move.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Were you pledged to Stannis?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Gods, no.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Ah, Renly. Really? He wasn't fit to rule over anything more important than a 12-course meal.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Shut your mouth.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Why? I lived with him at court since he was a boy, don't forget. Could hardly escape the little tulip. Skipping down the corridors in his embroidered silks. I knew him far better than you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I knew him as well as anyone. As a member of his Kingsguard, he trusted me with everything. He would have been a wonderful king.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Sounds like you quite fancied him.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I did not fancy him.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Oh, gods, you did.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Did you ever tell him? No, of course not. You weren't Renly's type, I'm afraid.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE yanks on his leash in response.
He preferred curly-haired little girls like Loras Tyrell. You're far too much man for him.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I'm not interested in foul rumors.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Unless they're about me. It's all true about Renly. His proclivities were the worst kept secret at court. It's a shame the throne isn't made out of cocks. They'd have never got him off it.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE grabs the back of JAIME's head and yanks roughly. She puts her face directly in his.
Shut your mouth!
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I don't blame him. And I don't blame you, either. We don't get to choose who we love.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: A man approaches, leading  a horse.
Where are you headed, then?
Speaker: MAN

Text: South. You?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Riverrun. Staying off the kingsroad, are you? They get you no matter where you go. You can't win.
Speaker: MAN

Text: No, you really can't.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: They both laugh, kindly.
Looks like you're safe enough, though. Meaning no offense, my lady, but I wouldn't tangle with you. Seven blessings to you.
Speaker: MAN

Text: And you.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: The man starts to walk away, but looks back over his shoulder.
He knows who I am.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He doesn't.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Maybe you're right.  But what if you're not? What if he tells someone?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: We're not doing it. He's an innocent man.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: More innocent than Lady Stark's daughters?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE pushes JAIME forward, and leads him further along in the woods.
King's Landing, Joffrey's Chambers
Speaker: INT

Text: Joffrey is being fitted by a TAILOR. CERSEI, seated nearby, looks on.
Make it tighter here.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: That's better. It makes you look very strong.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The TAILOR lays some sample fabric on Joffrey's shoulder. Displeased, Joffrey snatches it away.
No flowers. I said no flowers. All these are wrong. Bring others.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: JOFFREY dismisses the TAILOR.
Yes, Your Grace.
Speaker: TAILOR

Text: The TAILOR exits.
Bloody flowers. On the king.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Looks like a Tyrell rose. Give it to Margaery for her wedding gown. Should be more than enough fabric.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Joffrey tosses the fabric away and moves to his bed to change back into his clothes.
Tell me what you think of her.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Who?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Margaery.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: She's an ideal match. With the Tyrells beside us, we'll crush the Northerners. Hang their lords, burn their strongholds, sow their fields with salt, and no one will think of rebelling for another century.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: It is a good match, but what do you think of her? She's beautiful and intelligent.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Yes, she is.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Her concern with the well-being of the common people is interesting.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Not to me.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: I only meant that to go out of your way to endanger yourself.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: This is becoming one of the most boring conversations I've ever had.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: CERSEI stands.
Margaery Tyrell dotes on filthy urchins for a reason. She dresses like a harlot for a reason. She married a traitor and known degenerate like Renly Baratheon for a reason.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: She married Renly Baratheon because she was told to. That's what intelligent women do-what they're told.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: CERSEI reaches out to him, but JOFFREY pushes her hand away.
You need to ask yourself
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I don't need to do anything.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: The TAILOR returns with a different fabric sample. He drapes it on JOFFREY's shoulder.
Better. Much better.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Sansa's room in King's Landing
Speaker: INT

Text: SHAE brushes SANSA's hair as SANSA sits before a mirror.
I still don't believe it.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: He didn't. He didn't want anything. He just takes an interest because he loved my mother.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Men only want one thing from a pretty girl.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Littlefinger's not in love with me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SHAE helps SANSA into her dress.
Love is not the thing he wants.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: He's too old.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: They never see it that way. He didn't ask you to do something for him? Spy on someone or?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: No.
Speaker: SANSA
