Text: If he does ask you for anything or try anything or touch you, I want you to tell me.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Why? What will you do? I will make him stop.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: There is a knock on the door.
Ser Loras Tyrell, my lady.
Speaker: GUARD

Text: Send him in.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SHAE opens the door and LORAS enters.
Lady Sansa.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Ser Loras.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: My sister Margaery invites you to take the air with her and our grandmother the Lady Olenna in the gardens. May I escort you to them?
Speaker: LORAS

Text: SANSA exits with LORAS, while SHAE watches with concern.
King's Landing garden
Speaker: EXT

Text: SANSA and LORAS stroll together through the garden, her arm in his.
I believe you grow more beautiful every day, Lady Sansa.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: You are too kind, Ser Loras. You probably don't remember the first time we met. At the Hand's tourney, you gave me your favor. A rose, a red rose.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Of course I did.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: They approach MARGAERY.
(to a maid)  It's more your color. You take it.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Thank you.
Speaker: MAID

Text: (to LORAS) You're such a dear.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I'll take my leave. Lady Sansa.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Thank you, Ser Loras.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: LORAS exits. MARGAERY leads SANSA to a patio, filled with maids.
Come. Lady Sansa, it is my honor to present my grandmother the Lady Olenna of House Tyrell.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: They walk to Olenna, who is seated in the patio.
Kiss me, child.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Olenna extends her hand, and SANSA kisses it in greeting.
It's so good of you to visit me and my foolish flock of hens. We're very sorry for your losses.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: And I was sorry when I heard of Lord Renly's death, Lady Margaery. He was very gallant.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Gallant, yes. And charming and very clean. He knew how to dress and smile and somehow this gave him the notion he was fit to be king.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Renly was brave and gentle, Grandmother. Father liked him and so did Loras.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Loras is young and very good at knocking men off horses with a stick. That does not make him wise. As to your fathead father-
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Grandmother! What will Sansa think of us?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: She might think we have some wits about us. One of us, at any rate. It was treason. I warned them. Robert has two sons and Renly has an older brother. How could he possibly have any claim to that ugly iron chair? We should have stayed well out of all this if you ask me. But once the cow's been milked, there's no squirting the cream back up her udders. So here we are to see things through. What do you say to that, Sansa? Shall we have some lemon cakes?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Lemon cake's my favorite.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: So we've been told. (To the SERVANT) Are you going to bring the food or do you mean to starve us to death? Here, Sansa, come sit with me. I'm much less boring than these others.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: They move to a table away from the others.
Do you know my son? The Lord of Highgarden?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: I haven't had the pleasure.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: No great pleasure, believe me. A ponderous oaf. His father was an oaf as well. My husband, the late Lord Luthor. He managed to ride off a cliff whilst hawking. They say he was looking up at the sky and paying no mind to where his horse was taking him. And now my son is doing the same, only this time he's riding a lion instead of a horse. Now I want you to tell me the truth about this royal boy, this Joffrey.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: You, you. Who else would know better? We've heard some troubling tales. Is there any truth to them? Has this boy mistreated you?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: SANSA looks down and doesn't reply.
Has he ripped out your tongue?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Joff-King Joffrey, he-His Grace is very fair and handsome and as brave as a lion
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Yes, all Lannisters are lions. And when a Tyrell farts, it smells like a rose. But how kind is he? How clever? Has he a good heart, a gentle hand?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: I'm to be his wife. I only want to know what that means.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: A SERVANT approaches and brings a platter.
Bring me some cheese.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The cheese will be served after the cakes, my lady.
Speaker: SERVANT

Text: The cheese will be served when I want it served. And I want it served now.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The SERVANT nods and exits quickly.
Are you frightened, child? No need for that. We're only women here. Tell us the truth. No harm will come to you.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: My father always told the truth.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Yes, he had that reputation. And they named him traitor and took his head.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Joffrey. Joffrey did that. He promised he would be merciful and he cut my father's head off. And he said that was mercy. Then he took me up on the walls and made me look at it.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA holds back tears.
Go on.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: SANSA regains her compsure.
I-I can't. I never meant-my father was a traitor. My brother as well. I have traitor's blood. Please don't make me say anymore.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: She's terrified, Grandmother. Just look at her.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Speak freely, child. We would never betray your confidence, I swear it.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: He's a monster.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Ah. That's a pity.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Please, don't stop the wedding.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Have no fear. The Lord Oaf of Highgarden is determined that Margaery shall be queen. Even so, we thank you for the truth. Ah, here comes my cheese.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The SERVANT sets down the tray and slips away. SANSA sighs in resignation.
Riverlands Woods
Speaker: EXT

Text: ROBB's forces move along a path through the woods. The direwolf Grey Wind watches as RICKARD KARSTARK and ROBB watch the men march past.
We're at war. This march is a distraction.
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: My grandfather's funeral is not a distraction.  RICKARD KARSTARK: Are we riding to battle at Riverrun?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: No.  RICKARD KARSTARK: Then it's a distraction.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: My Uncle Edmure has his forces garrisoned there. We need his men.  RICKARD KARSTARK: Unless he's been breeding them, he don't have enough to make a difference.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Have you lost faith in our cause?   RICKARD KARSTARK:  If it's revenge, I still got faith in it.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: You don't think we can win?  RICKARD KARSTARK:  May I speak my mind, Your Grace?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Have you not been speaking your mind, Lord Karstark?  RICKARD KARSTARK:  I think you lost this war the day you married her.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: TALISA rides past.
A bit further up the path
Speaker: EXT

Text: CATELYN weaves a wooden circle bound with twine . TALISA rides up and dismounts with the help of a soldier, her mount whinnying.
Whoa, whoa.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: MAN

Text: You're afraid of her. And she knows it.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I'm not afraid of her. May I help you, Lady Stark?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: No.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I'm sorry, I shouldn't have-
Speaker: TALISA

Text: You can't help because a mother makes one for her children to protect them. Only a mother can make them.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: You've made them before?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: TALISA sits.
Twice.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Did they work?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: After a fashion. I prayed for my son  Bran to survive his fall.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: (Nods.)
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Many years before that, one of the boys came down with the pox. Maester Luwin said if he made it through the night, he'd live. But it would be a very long night. So I sat with him all through the darkness. Listened to his ragged little breaths, his coughing, his whimpering.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Which boy?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Jon Snow. When my husband brought that baby home from the war, I couldn't bear to look at him. I didn't want to see those brown stranger's eyes staring up at me. So I prayed to the gods, take him away. Make him die. He got the pox. And I knew I was the worst woman who ever lived. A murderer. I'd condemned this poor, innocent child to a horrible death all because I was jealous of his mother. A woman he didn't even know. So I prayed to all seven gods, let the boy live. Let him live and I'll love him. I'll be a mother to him. I'll beg my husband to give him a true name, to call him Stark and be done with it, to make him one of us.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: And he lived.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: And he lived. And I couldn't keep my promise. And everything that's happened since then all this horror that's come to my family it's all because I couldn't love a motherless child.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: North of the Wall
Speaker: EXT

Text: The wildlings march through the mountains. JON and MANCE stop to talk.
Was it hard for you to kill the Halfhand?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Yes.
Speaker: JON

Text: You liked him? I like you, but if you're playing us false, it won't be hard for me to kill you. I've got wildling blood in my veins. These are my people.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: I understand.
Speaker: JON

Text: Well, how could you understand?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: You want to protect your people.
Speaker: JON

Text: Do you know what it takes to unite 90 clans, half of whom want to massacre the other half for one insult or another? They speak seven different languages in my army. The Thenns hate the Hornfoots. The Hornfoots hate the ice-river clans. Everyone hates the cave people. So you know how I got moon worshippers and cannibals and giants to march together in the same army?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: No.
Speaker: JON

Text: I told them we were all going to die if we don't get south. Because that's the truth.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: MANCE starts walking again.
A crag next to the marching forces.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: MANCE and JON join TORMUND, YGRITTE and ORREL. ORREL sits, eyes white, looking up to a raven.
Shouldn't be long now.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: What's wrong with him?
Speaker: JON

Text: He's a warg. He can enter the mind of animals, see through their eyes. He's scouting for us.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: What, you've never met a warg?
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: The raven continues to circle overhead.
Orell.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: ORELL returns to consciousness.
Where were you this time?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: The Fist of the First Men.
Speaker: ORELL

Text: What did you see?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Dead crows.
Speaker: ORELL

Text: North of the Wall
Speaker: EXT

Text: The Night's Watch march through the snow covered mountains, looking exhausted.

What's the matter, Piggy? You crying 'cause you're cold? There's 200 brothers killed by dead men and you're still here whimpering. That seem fair to you? I seen 'em torn to pieces fighting while you was off somewhere hiding in a hole. Why don't you lie down and rest for a while, eh? You know you want to.
Speaker: RAST

Text: RAST moves ahead. SAM is drained. He falls to his knees. RAST looks back, satisfied. Then GRENN notices that SAM has given up. GRENN and EDDISON TOLLETT walk back to him
Hey. Get up, Sam.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: No.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Get up.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: I can't.
Speaker: SAM

Text: If you stop, you'll die.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: 'Course if you don't stop, you'll probably die, too.
Speaker: EDDISON TOLLETT

Text: You don't care.  EDDISON TOLLETT: 'Course we care.
Speaker: SAM

Text: You left me. When the white walkers came, you left me.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Aye, we left you. You're fat and you're slow. We didn't want to die.
Speaker: EDDISON TOLLETT

Text: Help me get him up.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: GRENN and EDDISON TOLLETT try to help SAM to his feet. RAST comes back to the trio.
Looks like that piggy is done for.
Speaker: RAST

Text: Help us get him up.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: He's slowing us down.
Speaker: RAST

Text: Just get him up!
Speaker: GRENN

Text: Why? So the rest of us can die? We'll move faster without him.
Speaker: RAST

Text: JEOR comes back to see what is happening.
What is this? Get up, Tarly. Is he all right?
Speaker: JEOR

Text: Aye, I think so.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: If he can't, we may as well just go without him.
Speaker: RAST

Text: That's enough. Tarly, I forbid you to die. Do you hear me?
Speaker: JEOR

Text: (nods)
Speaker: SAM

Text: Why should the rest of us-
Speaker: RAST

Text: Rast you're responsible for him.
Speaker: JEOR

Text: What am I supposed to do?
Speaker: RAST

Text: Make sure he gets back alive. If he doesn't, you don't. Move on!
Speaker: JEOR

Text: JEOR exits. SAM starts to follow, dazed and exhausted.
I'm not dying for you, Piggy. You hear me?
Speaker: RAST

Text: They all walk on.
Woods in the North
Speaker: EXT

Text: BRAN lies sleeping on some furs. A branch snaps in the distance and he wakes with a start. OSHA and Summer are hunched and alert. OSHA has her makeshift spear at the ready.
Where's Rickon and Hodor?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Looking for food.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: What's out there?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: OSHA creeps forward and then runs into the woods. Summer growls. A young figure approaches. He looks curiously at BRAN. Summer growls more fiercely. From behind him, OSHA places her spearpoint on JOJEN's neck.
Not another step, boy. Unless you want to drown in your own blood.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: I'm unarmed.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: That was poor planning.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: My sister carries the weapons.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: MEERA appears quietly, slipping a knife to OSHA's throat, creating.a stand-off.
I'm better with them. Drop the spear.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: OSHA doesn't comply.
Drop it.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: OSHA releases the spear.
If you kill me, that wolf will tear you to bits.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: Summer continues to growl in warning. JOJEN approaches the direwolf.
You must be Summer.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: Summer immediately stops growling. JOJEN holds out his hand. Summer sniffs it, and is pleased. The direwolf walks away. JOJEN approaches BRAN.
I'm Jojen Reed. This is my sister Meera. We've come a long way to find you, Brandon. And we have much farther to go.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: Riverlands Woods
Speaker: EXT

Text: GENDRY, ARYA and HOT PIE walk through the woods, weapons drawn.
I'm just trying to understand.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Would you please shut up about it?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Jaqen H'ghar offered you three kills.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I'm not listening.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: But just explain it to me. He offered to kill any three people you wanted. Dead. All you had to do was give him the names. Anyone. You could have picked King Joffrey.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Shut up.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You could have picked Tywin Lannister.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Jaqen got us out of Harrenhal, so why are you complaining?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: But you could have ended the war.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Where are we going?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: North.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: They pause in the woods.
If we were going north, we should have come to the Red Fork River by now.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Maybe we already passed it.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: It's 100 feet wide. How could we have passed it? If we hit the Red Fork, we can follow it west to Riverrun. My mother grew up there. My grandfather he's a lord. He'll protect us.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: They hear some far-away singing.
Could be a minstrel.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Shut up.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A lion still has claws  HOT PIE:  A minstrel's got gold sometimes. We could jump him, tie him up, steal his gold, and buy some food.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Shh.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: They crouch to hide behind a broken wall, and watch a handful of men approach. One is singing.
And so he spoke, and so he spoke That Lord of Castamere But now the rains Weep o'er his hall With no one there to hear.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: An arrow whistles past the trio, surprising them. It embeds in a tree trunk behind them. They spin to hide out of sight.
What's lurking behind that wall? A lion? A wolf?
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Just a dirty little cub, I think.
Speaker: ANGUY

Text: Loose a few more shafts.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: ARYA steps out of hiding.
Don't.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: THOROS and ANGUY look down at her from the path. THOROS takes a deep drink.
Put the sword down, girl.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: You go on down the road. Just keep on singing so we know where you are. Leave us be and I won't kill you.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Generous.
Speaker: ANGUY

Text: You're a dangerous person. I like dangerous people. Why are your friends so shy?
Speaker: THOROS

Text: What friends?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The fat to your left and the lad beside him.
Speaker: ANGUY

Text: Resigned, GENDRY steps out and pulls HOT PIE with him. They ready their weapons. THOROS responds, and his party swiftly comes over the wall to face the trio. They do not draw weapons.
Three young ones on the run carrying castle-forged swords. You escape from Harrenhal?
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Who are you?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Thoros of Myr. And the fellow here with the bow is Anguy.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: No, who do you fight for?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The Brotherhood without Banners. Now come along. I want to hear how two boys and a very dangerous girl escaped Harrenhal.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: I'm not going with them. The Brotherhood? That's who the Mountain and them lot were looking for. They'll bring us back and put rats in us.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: You've got nothing to fear from us, son. The lords of Westeros want to burn the countryside. We're trying to save it. Now come on. We'll talk some more over brown bread and stew. And then you can go on your way.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: HOT PIE takes a few steps back. ANGUY notches an arrow in response. ARYA, GENDRY and HOT PIE raise their weapons, nervously.
Here's the thing, fat
Speaker: ANGUY

Text: ANGUY shoots the arrow into the sky.
When I'm done talking, that arrow's falling down on your fat head. So I advise you move, because I'm done talking.
Speaker: ANGUY

Text: HOT PIE lurches forward two steps. The arrow lands, burying itself where HOT PIE was just standing. THOROS motions for the trio to move with them. Some men chuckle, and then everyone scrambles over the broken wall in turn.
Half the country's starving and look at this one.
Speaker: ANGUY

Text: Maybe he's the reason half the country's starving.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: THOROS follows HOT PIE. ANGUY, pulls his arrow from the tree trunk.
Tyrion's Chambers in King's Landing
Speaker: INT

Text: TYRION returns to his quarters. SHAE lies waiting for him.
My lion.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: We've spoken of this. You cannot come here.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They kiss.
But you said I should come to you with any problems.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Did anyone see you? No.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: You sure? My father does not make idle threats. Having you killed would be the high point of his week. You have to be absolutely certain.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They kiss again.
All right. What is this problem?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm worried about Sansa. When she spoke with Lord Baelish, his friend warned me about him.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Baelish doesn't have friends.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I don't know her name.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Oh, Ros? The redhead?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: How do you know her?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: I try to know as many people as I can. You never know which one you'll need.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She's a whore.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Yes, well, we shouldn't be judgmental about these things.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You fucked her.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Oh, please. All right, yes, I fucked her once. Twice.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: SHAE slaps at his chest, playful, and stands up to walk from the bed to pout.
But since I met you, my lady, I've been with no one else.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And was she good? Did you like her?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Not as much as I like you, obviously, or she'd be the one torturing me right now. What did she say about Littlefinger?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: That Sansa shouldn't trust him.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Is there an idiot in any village who trusts Littlefinger?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We have to protect her.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: SHAE begins to pet him with affection.
We can't. Now that the Lannisters have discarded her, Sansa will have many suitors. A great beauty with a very old name.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: SHAE pushes him again.
A great beauty? Oh, a great beauty?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Yes, she is, objectively, very. Her face is quite pleasing-to other men and to women, people in general. But not to me, of course. I only have eyes for you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You pervert. You want her? This child?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: I don't even want to talk about her.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: But you are.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Only because you're making me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: SHAE grabs his chin and looks directly at him.
I didn't force you to open your mouth and make words come out.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: This is cruel and unfair. Cruelly unfair.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Oh, the cruelty. Shae is so cruel to me.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Hmm, yes.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They kiss.
Now do you think I'm cruel?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: She begins to undress him.
Only if you stop. But you mustn't come here again.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She kisses him,  loosens his cloths, and kisses him lower.
Do you hear me? You've come to a dangerous place full of dangerous people. Dangerous people.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: King's Landing Courtyard
Speaker: EXT

Text: MARGAERY walks through the courtyard, accompanied by guards.
Joffrey's Chambers in King's Landing
Speaker: INT

Text: JOFFREY sits holding his crossbow. A guard knocks on the door.
Lady Tyrell, my king.
Speaker: GUARD

Text: Send her in.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: The door opens, and MARGAERY enters.
You wanted to see me, Your Grace?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I'm leaving on a hunting trip. I just wanted to make sure you had everything you need before I left.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: That's very thoughtful, Your Grace. I have everything I could want.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Good. Good. How are you finding life in the capital? It must be quite a change after Renly's camp.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: She approaches.
A welcome one. A military encampment is no place for a lady.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: And the bedside of a traitor? Is that a place for a lady?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Your Grace, I tried to do my duty as a wife, that is all.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: What was your duty to this traitor as you saw it?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: The duty of any wife to any husband-to provide him with children.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: You failed to do this.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Why? I-I would not speak ill of the dead, Your Grace.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: You think one ought to speak kindly of a traitor merely because he's had a sword put through his heart?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: No. I do beg your pardon. The subtleties of politics are often lost on me. Renly I don't believe he was interested in the company of women.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: What makes you say this?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: MARGAERY sits next to JOFFREY.

Whenever I wanted to make a child with him, he-he had so many excuses, so many late-night war councils. He never wanted to try. Except one evening, after he'd had far too much wine to drink, he suggested something-something that sounded very painful and couldn't possibly result in children. Maybe the fault was with me.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: No, he was a known degenerate.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: It's such a relief to hear you say so, Your Grace.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Mmm. I've considered making his perversion punishable by death.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: As is your right. You must do whatever you need to do.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: MARGAERY strokes the crossbow.
You are the king.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Yes. I am.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: JOFFREY looks at his crossbow, a bit excited.
Do you like it? I just had it made. Probably one of the finest weapons in the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: It's beautiful. Will you show me how it works?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: It's a new design. Much easier to load. There's no crank. You use this lever to draw the string.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: JOFFREY uses the lever to cock the bow.
The bolt goes here.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: MARGAERY hands him the bolt, daintily. He takes it and arms the bow. He stands, weapon braced at his waist, and looks for a target.
And then you just aim and
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: JOFFREY releases the bolt and pierces the head of a stuffed boar. MARGAERY erupts in applause and laughs. She stands.
Would you take me hunting sometime? Forgive me, Your Grace. I know a hunt is no place for a woman.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: It's not unheard of.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: May I? Please.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: JOFFREY hands her the crossbow, and helps MARGAERY into a proper stance. They stand, posed and close.
I imagine it must be so exciting to squeeze your finger here and watch something die over there.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Could you do it? Could you kill something?.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: I don't know, Your Grace Do you think I could?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Yes.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Would you like to watch me?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Yes.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Torture chamber
Speaker: INT

Text: THEON screams as the TORTURER's ASSISTANT turns a huge screw that is planted on his foot.
Stop! Stop!
Speaker: THEON

Text: Tell us the truth.
Speaker: TORTURER

Text: (screaming) About what?
Speaker: THEON

Text: The ASSISTANT turns the screw again.
I don't know what you want.
Speaker: THEON

Text: I want the truth.
Speaker: TORTURER

Text: What truth?
Speaker: THEON

Text: Why'd you take Winterfell?
Speaker: TORTURER

Text: I took it to-I took it-
Speaker: THEON

Text: Who gave the orders?
Speaker: TORTURER

Text: No one. I took it on my own.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Why?
Speaker: TORTURER

Text: To take the North while it was vulnerable.
Speaker: THEON

Text: What were you going to do once you took it?
Speaker: TORTURER

Text: Hold it. Rule it.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Good. That's very good.
Speaker: TORTURER

Text: The ASSISTANT turns the screw again. Blood well ups around it as THEON screams.
Why did you do that?
Speaker: THEON

Text: I told you. Why did you take Winterfell?
Speaker: TORTURER

Text: I took it to bring glory to my house and my father.
Speaker: THEON

Text: The TORTURER approaches.
(panicking) Wait. Wait, wait, wait. I took it because I hated the Starks. I hated them for holding me prisoner. I wanted to hurt them.
Speaker: THEON

Text: The TORTURER steps even closer.
What are you doing?
Speaker: THEON

Text: The TORTURER places a hood over THEON's head.
Please.
Speaker: THEON

Text: The ASSISTANT turns the screw, and THEON screams. The TORTURER walks away, followed by his team. They leave one lowly cleaning boy, RAMSAY, behind.
I'll tell you anything. Just take it off. Please. Please, just take it off.
Speaker: THEON

Text: The door closes shut. RAMSAY removes the hood from THEON. He is surprised.
Your sister sent me.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Yara?
Speaker: THEON

Text: RAMSAY releases the pressure on his foot.
I'll come for you tonight when the castle sleeps.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY places the hood back onto THEON's head, and leaves.
No, don't go. Please, please. No, please don't leave me. Please, please. Please, please don't go! Please. Please. Don't leave me. Please don't go.
Speaker: THEON

Text: The North
Speaker: EXT

Text: HODOR, RICKON, OSHA, Jojan and MEERA walk along a narrow road. HODOR pulls the cart carrying BRAN. The direwolves are nearby. RICKON, runs excitedly down the hill.
Rickon, stay with us.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: It's all right. The wolves will protect him.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: BRAN nods to Summer, who turns to follow RICKON. They continue on the path.
You can get inside his head, see through his eyes.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: Only when I'm asleep.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: That's how it begins until you learn to control it. You're a warg.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: It's not just wolves. Sometimes in my dreams there's a-
Speaker: BRAN

Text: A three-eyed raven?
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: You've seen it?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: We saw him together. You haven't forgotten?
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: Does it have anything to do with warging?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: No, the raven is something different, something deeper. The raven brings the sight.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: Seeing things that haven't happened yet?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Or things that happened long before you were born or things that are happening right now thousands of miles away.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: What's he telling him?
Speaker: OSHA

Text: Why don't you ask?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Isn't he ashamed, your brother, needing you to protect him?
Speaker: OSHA

Text: Where's the shame in that?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Any boy his age who needs his sister to protect him is gonna find himself needing lots of protecting.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: Some people will always need help. That doesn't mean they're not worth helping.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: When my father died, I dreamt it.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You didn't dream it. You saw it. So did I.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: You have the sight, too?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: (Nods.) When I told my father about your father for the first time in my life, I saw him cry.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: Your father is Howland Reed? Yeah.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Yeah.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: He saved my father's life during the rebellion.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Your father told you about the rebellion? Mine never did. But I saw that, too.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: What else have you seen?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Only one thing that matters-you.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: Riverlands Tavern
Speaker: EXT

Text: The tavern is lively with  drinking and laughing
I never liked the skinny ones. Like drinking from a puddle. Not that I'm averse to drinking from a puddle every now and again, you understand.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Nearby, THOROS sits with ARYA, GENDRY and HOT PIE. He pours some ale for ARYA.
I don't drink ale.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: There's no story so good a drink won't make it better.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Yeah!
Speaker: MAN

Text: You see? They've all suffered through my bouts of sobriety. It's very tedious for all concerned. Now, how did three children-
Speaker: THOROS

Text: We're not children.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: How did three young persons such as yourselves, untrained in the art of war, escape from Harrenhal?
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Gendry's a smith. He was apprenticed in the armory.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A smith, eh? Where'd you train?
Speaker: THOROS

Text: King's Landing. Tobho Mott's shop.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: That criminal. He charges twice as much as every other armorer in the city.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: That's because he's twice as good.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Aha! A smith and a salesman.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Gendry stole us weapons.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Ah, fought your way out of Harrenhal, I see.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: He knows how to use a sword and so do I.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The men laugh.
My brothers taught me.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The men laugh again. ARYA stands to prove herself. She draws her sword and points it at THOROS's throat.
Ooh!
Speaker: MEN

Text: THOROS looks at the blade, and feints a drink. Instead, he rises, draws his sword and disarms ARYA with a sweeping move of his blade. Surprised, ARYA steps backward, afraid. The men cheer. THOROS takes some dramatic and slightly drunken steps, then relents. He turns to rejoin the table, taking up some ale along the way.
To your brothers!
Speaker: THOROS

Text: The men cheer. ARYA meekly picks up her weapon and sits back down at the table, next to the silent GENDRY and HOT PIE.
You can finish your meals before you go. It may be awhile before you see another.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: You'll free us?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I gave you my word.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: The trio rises. So does THOROS.  But before you go, allow me to raise a cup to your-
THOROS is interrupted by the smiling entrance of ANGUY and more brothers, with a large hooded captive. They are proud of their capture.
Hey, hey.
Speaker: ANGUY

Text: The men cheer.
Now that is an uncommonly large person. How does one manage to subdue such an uncommonly large person?
Speaker: THOROS

Text: One waits for him to drink until he passes out.
Speaker: ANGUY

Text: Poor man. You have my sympathy.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: He removes the hood. The captive is the HOUND. ARYA is worried, and turns away before she can be seen.
Aha, not a man at all. A Hound!
Speaker: THOROS

Text: The men howl in jest.
So good to see you again, Clegane.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Thoros? The fuck you doing here?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Drinking and talking too much. Same as ever.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: HOT PIE, GENDRY and ARYA start to leave.
A pretty prize, lads.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Yeah!
Speaker: MEN

Text: The HOUND recognizes ARYA.
Girl.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: ARYA freezes, then turns to face him.
What in seven hells are you doing with the Stark bitch?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Riverlands
Speaker: EXT

Text: JAIME and BRIENNE walk along a river and approach a stone bridge.
It's a tough decision-take the bridge and risk being seen or cross the great water.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Silence, Kingslayer.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Anyone can see us on the bridge, but cross by water and the current could take us or I could escape down the river.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Good luck.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: It's wonderful to watch you wrestle with these dilemmas. Which will she choose?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The bridge.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: BRIENNE and JAIME have chosen the bridge.
Gambler at heart. Wouldn't have guessed.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Be quick about it.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: When they reach the middle of the bridge, JAIME sits down, back to the wall.
I need to rest.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Get up.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I have these, you know, on your feet when you walk too far. What do you call them?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Get up now.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: She looks around, feeling nervous and exposed.
Corns. I never used to get corns. Of course I used to ride everywhere, not march around like a common foot soldier wearing the same shit boots for over a year.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE tires of his ploy. He grabs him and tries to make JAIME stand back up.
This heel is ruined. There's no way-
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME takes his opportunity and grabs BRIENNE's sword from its sheath. He runs as far as he can before the rope stops him. He cuts it with the sword. His hands are still bound, but he measures the feel of the sword, and chuckles.
I never understood why some knights felt the need to carry two swords.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE takes an aggressive stance. JAIME is playful and cavalier, trying to goad BRIENNE into making an ill-conceived move. She remains conservative in her tactics. They take stock of one another.
Ooh. You move well for a great beast of a woman.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME begins an attack. Their sword clash.
You shouldn't grimace before you lunge. It gives away the game.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME lunges again and pushes BRIENNE back. She counters, but he regains momentum. In a spinning move, they switch places.
Bit of a quandary for you. If you kill me, you fail Lady Stark. But if you don't kill me, I'm going to kill you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He attacks again. They end with their swords in contest and switch to a game of strength and leverage.
You're good. Graceless, but good.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE uses her hilt to break the deadlock with an upward thrust of her sword. They face off again. This time, BRIENNE goes on the attack. She gains the advantage, and knees him in the stomach.
See? If you were willing to hurt me, you might have had me there.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME spins to increase the force of his attacking blow, and drives BRIENNE back down the bridge. Their shouldersa collide and they face off once again, panting heavily. JAIME starts a new assault, but BRIENNE parries and gains the upper hand. She punches him in the jaw and he reels to the bridge wall. BRIENNE's next blow misses, but ignites sparks on the wall. BRIENNE grows stronger and confident as JAIME is beaten. Exhausted, he ends up on the ground. A horse neighs just off the bridge, and BRIENNE looks to locate who has joined them. Three mounted men ride out from the woods, with additional forces behind.
Looks like your woman's getting the better of you, if you can call that a woman.
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: We enjoy a good fight. Gets our juices flowing. The Flayed Man of House Bolton. A bit gruesome for my taste.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You sure he's the one?
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: The MAN that JAIME and BRIENNE encountered in the woods  is brought forth.
That's him, all right. I saw him fight at the tourney for Ser Willem Frey's wedding.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Give the man his silver.
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: Let us go and my father will pay you whatever you want.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Enough to buy me a new head? If the King in the North hears I had the Kingslayer and let him go, he'll be taking it right off. I'd rather he takes yours.
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: The mounted men move forward onto the bridge. BRIENNE and JAIME step backward, with no options available to hold off such numbers.
Riverrun
Speaker: EXT

Text: ROBB and BRYNDEN TULLY, waist deep in the river, release the funeral boat of HOSTER TULLY. They return to the dock to rejoin the somber and silent CATELYN and  TALISA.  EDMURE steps forward, holding a bow while the others look on. He lights the arrow and fires an arcing shot at the distant boat. The arrow splashes wide of its mark. Perturbed and embarrassed, EDMURE looks back, then draws another arrow to ignite. He shoots, and this arrow also splashes errantly, while the boat drifts further downstream. The large crowd near the dock murmurs. ROBB laughs under his breath and BRYNDEN looks impatient. EDUMRE takes a breath and unleashes a nervous shot that also splashes uselessly. Fed up, BRYNDEN pushes EDMURE aside and takes his bow. CATELYN, ROBB and TALISA try to maintain their composure. BRYNDEN lights an arrow, aims carefully, and unleashes an arcing shot. As the arrow flies, he turns and tosses the bow back to EDMURE, and walks off. Moments later, the arrow lands in the boat, setting it aflame. CATELYN is relieved. BRYNDEN continues to walk away. EDMURE watches as the flaming boat disappears at the river's bend.
Riverrun war room, later
Speaker: INT

Text: If I may, nephew, I encountered a situation with one of my lieutenants at the Stone Mill which may have some bearing--
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: Why don't you shut your mouth about that damned mill? And don't call him "nephew." He is your king.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: Robb knows I meant him no disr--
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: You're lucky I'm not your king. I wouldn't let you wave your blunders around like a victory flag.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: My blunder sent Tywin's mad scurrying back to Casterly Rock with his tail between his legs. I think King Robb understands we're not gonna win this war if he's the only one winning any battles. No, there's glory enough to go around.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: It's not about glory. Your instructions were to wait for him to come to you.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I seized an opportunity.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: What value was the mill?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: The Mountain was garrisoned across the river from it.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: Is he there now? Of course not.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: We took the fight to him. He could not withstand us.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: I wanted to draw the Mountain into the west, into our country where we could surround him and kill him. I wanted him to chase us, which he would have done because he is a mad without a strategic thought in his head. I could have that head on a spike by now. Instead, I have a mill.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: We took hostages. Willem Lannister. Martyn Lannister.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: Willem and Martyn Lannister are 14 years old.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Martyn is 15, I believe.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: Tywin Lannister has my sisters. Have I sued for peace?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: No.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: Do you think he'll sue for peace because we have his father's brother's great-grandsons?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: No.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: How many men did you lose?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: But for every man we lost, the Lannisters--
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: We need our men more than Tywin needs his!
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I'm sorry. I didn't know.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: You would have. Right here today at this gathering if you had been patient.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: We seem to be running short of patience here.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: You know who isn't? Tywin Lannister.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: King's Landing, the Small Council chamber.
Speaker: INT

Text: TYWIN stands by the head of the table. PYCELLE, VARYS, and LITTLEFINGER enter silently. TYRION enters next. TYWIN sits, then PYCELLE, VARYS, and LITTLEFINGER join him. TYRION remains still, while CERSEI enters and surveys the room.  She pauses, then walks to the table. She picks up one of the two remaining empty chairs and places it directly next to TYWIN, then sits while the others smirk. TYRION comes forward, and drags the final chair noisily (and comically) to the opposite head of the table. He sits.
Intimate. Lovely table. Better chairs than the old small council chamber. Conveniently close to your own quarters. I like it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What news of Jaime?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: No one answers.

20,000 unwashed northerns have known about his escape for weeks. Collectively, you control more spies and informants than the rest of the world combined. Do you mean to tell me that none of you has any notion of where he is?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: We are trying, my lord.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Try harder. What do we have, then?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Robb Stark and most of his bannermen are in Riverrun for the funeral of his grandfather Lord Hoster Tully. In Stark's absence, Roose Bolton holds Harrenhal, which would seem to make him Lord of Harrenhal, in practice if not in name.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Well, let him have it. The name suits our purposes far more than that useless pile of rubble. The Lord of Harrenhal will make a worthy suitor for the widow Arryn.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: For which I am extremely grateful to you, my lord.  Lady Arryn and I have known each other since we were children. She has always been positively predisposed toward me.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: A successful courtship would make Lord Baelish acting Lord of the Vale.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: Titles do seem to breed titles.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: You'll leave for the Eyrie as soon as possible and bring Lysa Arryn into the fold. Then the young wolf can add his own aunt to the list of people who have taken up arms against him.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Far be it from me to hinder true love, but Lord Baelish's absence would present certain problems. The royal wedding may end up being the most expensive event in living memory. Summer has ended, hard days lie ahead. Not a good time to leave the crown's finances unattended.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Fully agreed. Which is why I'm naming you new Master of Coin.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: (chuckles)
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Master of Coin?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It would appear to be a position that best suits your talents.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I'm quite good at spending money, but a lifetime of outrageous wealth hasn't taught me much about managing it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I have no doubt you will prove equal to this challenge.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Hear, hear.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: Riverlands Woods
Speaker: EXT

Text: LOCKE's forces ride through the woods, singing.

(singing) He lifted her high in the air. He sniffed and roared and smelled her there. She kicked and wailed, a maid so fair. But he licked the honey from her hair. From there to here, from here to there. All black and brown and covered with hair. He smelled that girl in the summer air. The bear, the bear and the maiden fair.
Speaker: MEN

Text: Behind the singing soldiers, BRIENNE and JAIME are bound together, back to back, atop a single horse. JAIME suffers the indignity of facing backwards.
I hope you're pleased. If you had armed me, they never would have taken us.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You were armed when we were taken.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I was in chains if you recall. Our little match would have ended quite quick if my hands weren't bound.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: All my life I've been hearing, 'Jaime Lannister, what a brilliant swordsman.' You were slower than I expected. And more predictable.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I've been sitting in a muddy pen wrapped in chains for the past year.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And I'm a woman. I was still beating you.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You were not beating me.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Maybe you were as good as people said once. Or maybe people just love to overpraise a famous name.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: When we make camp tonight, you'll be raped. More than once. None of these fellows have ever been with a noblewoman. You'd be wise not to resist.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Would I?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: They'll knock your teeth out.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You think I care about my teeth?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: No, I don't think you care about your teeth. If you fight them, they will kill you. Do you understand? I'm the prisoner of value, not you. Let them have what they want. What does it matter?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: What does it matter?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Close your eyes. Pretend they're Renly.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: If you were a woman, you wouldn't resist? You'd let them do what they wanted?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: If I was a woman, I'd make them kill me. But I'm not, thank the gods.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Riverlands
Speaker: EXT

Text: The camp of the Brotherhood without Banners is bustling. GENDRY helps THOROS to put on his armor. ARYA sits nearby, watching.
If I had a proper forge, I could make it good as new.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Doesn't have to look pretty. It just has to keep the arrows out of my heart.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Why are you helping him? He takes us prisoner and now he's our friend?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You're not our prisoner, little lady.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: What am I?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Our guest. No one's put any chains on you.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: So I can walk away, then?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: These woods aren't safe for Ned Stark's daughter. ou're lucky we found you.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Arya gets up and walks away, frustrated. ANGUY and some men lead the bound HOUND through the camp.
You think you're good with that bow, you little twat?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Better than anyone you've ever met.
Speaker: ANGUY

Text: A coward's weapon. I like to fight up close. I like to see a man's face when I put the steel in him.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Why? So you can kiss him?
Speaker: ANGUY

Text: You remember the last time you were here?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Looks like every other shit inn on the road.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: ANGUY places a hood over the HOUND's head.
Now, apologies, but you're one ugly fucker and I'd rather not see you no more.
Speaker: ANGUY

Text: ANGUY helps the HOUND into the wagon, and guides his hooded head to hit the top of the doorway.
(sarcastically) Watch your head. Off we go.
Speaker: ANGUY

Text: ANGUY pounds the side of the wagon.
Walk up!
Speaker: DRIVER

Text: ARYA watches the wagon drive away while GENDRY packs up. HOT PIE enters, holding some bread.
What are you doing? We're about to leave.  Hot PIE: I'm staying.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You're what?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I baked some brown bread for the innkeep and she said she never had better. Told Thoros she's keeping me as a payment for all the free meals she's given him. Anyway, it's not me the Brotherhood wants. My brother ain't no king. I'm not a Stark of Winterhell.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Winterfell.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You sure?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: I'm sure.  Hot PIE: Well, I made you something.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: HOT PIE hands ARYA the bread that he baked. It is shaped like an animal of some sort.
What is it?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: It's a wolf.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Yes, it is.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: That's the tail?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Yeah.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Well, be safe.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Yeah, you, too. Don't get stabbed.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: You don't burn your fingers.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: GENDRY pats HOT PIE's shoulder, grabs his pack, and exits.
Good-bye, Hot Pie.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Good-bye, Arry.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: ARYA walks away and joins a brother on a horse.
Up you go, little lady.
Speaker: MAN

Text: ARYA takes a bite of the bread as they ride away.
Hey, Hot Pie. It's really good.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Riverrun great hall
Speaker: INT

Text: CATELYN and BRYNDEN gaze out a grand window from within the castle, appreciating the beauty of the Riverlands.
A person could almost be forgiven for forgetting we're at war.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: It often comforts me to think that even in war's darkest days, in most places in the world absolutely nothing is happening.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: I've missed you, Uncle. Father missed you, too, from the day you left. Maybe he never said it in so many words--
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Maybe? Your father was a stubborn old ox. I was surprised when he died. Didn't think death had the patience.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: I'm glad you were with him. I wish to the gods I had been. Did you make peace in the end?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: After 30 years of fighting, I don't think he remembered what started it. He asked me to stop calling myself Blackfish. He said it was an old joke and it was never funny to begin with. I told him people had been calling me Blackfish for so long, they don't remember my real name.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: Every time he would leave for the capital or fight in a campaign, I'd see him off. 'Wait for me, little Cat,' he'd say. 'Wait for me and I'll come back to you.' And I would sit at this window every day when the sun came up, waiting. I wonder how many times did Bran or Rickon stare across the moors of Winterfell waiting for me to return. I will never see them again.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: CATELYN begins to weep. BRYNDEN sits to comfort her.

You mustn't think it. We don't know the truth. They could be in hiding. Robb believes they're alive. And he must go on believing. He's got to remain strong if he's to prevail. And you must remain strong for him.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: (Sighs.)
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Riverrun dungeon.
Speaker: INT

Text: TALISA tends to MARTYN LANNISTER's arm while WILLEM LANNISTER looks on.
You're Robb Stark's wife.
Speaker: MARTYN

Text: Hold still.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Is it true what they say about him?
Speaker: MARTYN

Text: I don't know. What do they say about him?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: That he can turn into a wolf at night.
Speaker: MARTYN

Text: True.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: And he eats the flesh of his enemies.
Speaker: MARTYN

Text: True. You're a Lannister, aren't you?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Martyn Lannister.
Speaker: MARTYN

Text: Martyn Lannister. You've nothing to fear. My husband doesn't eat children. Unless it's a full moon. It's not a full moon tonight, is it? See? Nothing to fear.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: North of the Wall
Speaker: EXT

Text: MANCE, TORMUND, JON, YGRITTE and ORELL walk through a winter storm. MANCE kneels down.
Always the artists.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: The camera pans up to reveal a huge spiral of  horse carcasses, dismembered and frozen in a horrific but almost beautiful.
It's only horses. No men.
Speaker: JON

Text: You said there was dead crows.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: There was.
Speaker: ORELL

Text: How many men were here?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: About 300.
Speaker: JON

Text: And you know what those men are now?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: (Nods)
Speaker: JON

Text: Do you think anyone got away?
Speaker: JON

Text: It's not impossible. You don't go far betting against Mormont. But dead or alive, he took a big gamble coming north. And he lost. His best fighting men are dead. And whether he's Lord Commander of the Night's Watch or a blue-eyed corpse, he's a long way from home. Tormund. Climb the Wall. Take Orell and 20 good men. And take this one. He knows Castle Black's defenses better than any of us. And if he's useful, good. If not throw him off the Wall. See if crows can fly.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: As a boy, I travelled with a troupe of actors through the Free Cities. One day in Myr, a certain man made my master an offer too tempting to refuse. I feared the man meant to use me as I'd heard some men used small boys. But what he wanted was far worse. He gave me a potion that made me powerless to move or speak, yet did nothing to dull my senses. With a hooked blade he sliced me, root and stem, chanting all the while. He burned my parts in a brazier. The flames turned blue and I heard a voice answer his call. I still dream of that night. Not of the sorcerer, not of his blade. I dream of the voice from the flames. Was it a god? A demon? A conjuror's trick? I don't know. But the sorcerer called and a voice answered. And ever since that day, I have hated magic and all those who practice it. But you can see why I was eager to aid in your fight against Stannis and his Red Priestess. A symbolic revenge of sorts.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: But influence is largely a matter of patience, I have found. Once I had served the sorcerer's purpose, he threw me out of his house to die. I resolved to live to spite him. I begged. I sold what parts of my body remained to me. I became an excellent thief and soon learned that the contents of a man's letters are more valuable than the contents of his purse. Step by step, one distasteful task after another, I made my way from the slums of Myr to the small council chamber. Influence grows like a weed. I tended mine patiently until its tendrils reached from the Red Keep all the way across to the far side of the world where I managed to wrap them around something very special.

Text: The HOUND readies his sword and loosens for battle. BERIC kneels before THOROS. BERIC offers his left hand, and THOROS slices open a long gash in his palm. He then places the sword in BERIC's right hand. BERIC slides the blade across the open wound and the weapon erupts in flame.  The HOUND is taken aback. Both men take up shields and they set to battle. BERIC gets first advantage, with the flames putting fear in the eyes of the HOUND. The HOUND finds his rhythm and the battle becomes more even. BERIC  dodges a blow and shoulders the HOUND to stumble into a fire, sparks erupting. The HOUND is enraged, and makes a poorly chosen charge. He ends up on his knees.

Text: Hmm.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: You seemed to like it.
Speaker: JON

Text: Aye, I liked it some. Who taught you that?
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: There's been no one else. Only you.
Speaker: JON

Text: A maid. You were a maid.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: I was a man of the Night's Watch. How about you? Were you a maid?
Speaker: JON

Text: What do you think?
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: Who was he?
Speaker: JON

Text: Just a boy. He came trading with his brothers. He had red hair like me. Kissed by fire. But he was weak. Not like you. That was the first one. Then there was this Thenn boy. Spoke no Common, but gods, he was built like a mammoth.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: Yeah, thanks. I think I've heard enough. We'd best get back. Tormund--
Speaker: JON

Text: YGRITTE sits astride JON.
I'm not done with you yet.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: THEY kiss.
How long's it been since you had a bath?
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: YGRITTE hops up and jumps into the pool beside the cascading water.  Jon joins her, and they kiss again.
Let's not go back. Let's stay here a while longer. I don't ever want to leave this cave, Jon Snow. Not ever.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: They kiss again.
Riverlands, the Brotherhood's cave.
Speaker: INT

Text: I want my gold.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: It says it clearly right there on that note you'll be repaid in full when the war is over.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Piss on that! You're nothing but thieves.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The HOUND throws down the note.
We're outlaws. Outlaws steal. You're lucky we didn't kill you.
Speaker: ANGUY

Text: Come try it, archer. I'll shove those arrows up your ass.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The HOUND walks towards ANGUY but THOROS holds him back.
You can't let him go. He's a murderer. He's guilty.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Not in the eyes of god.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: You can't!
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Enough! The judgment isn't ours to make.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: ANGUY tossed the HOUND his swords.
Go in peace, Sandor Clegane. The Lord of Light isn't done with you yet.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: A MAN places a hood over the HOUND's head and leads him out.
Harrnehal
Speaker: EXT

Text: Riders coming through!
Speaker: MAN

Text: The gates open to a courtyard and LOCKE's men ride in. BRIENNE looks at JAIME, who sits withered astride his mount.
The Kingslayer.
Speaker: MAN

Text: One of LOCKE's men forces BRIENNE and JAIME to kneel in the courtyard.
Down!
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: On your knees. Lord Bolton, I give you the Kingslayer.
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: Pick him up, Locke.
Speaker: LOCKE pushes JAIME down with his foot. JAIME falls on his face, without resistance. JAIME groans.  Roose BOLTON

Text: You've lost a hand.
Speaker: Locke picks up Jaime with the help of one of his men.  Roose BOLTON

Text: No, my lord, he has it here.
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: Take this away.
Speaker: LOCKE taunts JAIME with the dismembered hand tied around his neck. ROOSE pulls the hand from around JAIME's neck and hands it to LOCKE.  Roose BOLTON

Text: Send it to his father?  Roose BOLTON: You'll hold your tongue unless you want to lose it.  Roose BOLTON: Cut her free. Apologies, my lady. You're under my protection now.
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: BRIENNE is cut free.
Thank you, my lord.  Roose BOLTON: Find suitable rooms for our guests. We'll speak later.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: ROOSE starts to walk away.
Lord Bolton.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: ROOSE turns around.

Is there word from the capital?  Roose BOLTON: You haven't heard? Stannis Baratheon laid siege to King's Landing. Sailed into Blackwater Bay. Stormed the gates with thousands of men. And your sister How can I put this? Your sister is alive and well. Your father's forces prevailed.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME falls to his knees in relief.
Ser Jaime isn't well. Take him to Qyburn.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: His men pick JAIME up, and lead him and BRIENNE away.
INT; Harrenhal, Qyburn's workspace.
QYBURN tends to JAIME's, and he winces and groans. His severed wrist is wet and disgusting.
Will I die?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: No. The corruption has spread. I fear it must be cut away. The safest course would be to take the whole arm off.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Then you'll die. You're no maester. Where's your chain?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The Citadel stripped me of it. They found some of my experiments too bold. I can leave your upper arm, make the cut at your elbow.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: JAIME chokes QYBURN to make his point, then relents.
I don't need my right hand to kill you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Mmm.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: With any luck, that will suffice. You'll need milk of the poppy.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: No milk of the poppy.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: There will be pain.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: I'll scream.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Quite a bit of pain.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: I'll scream loudly.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: QYBURN straps and buckles JAIME's arm to staunch the bleeding. JAIME suffers and screams as QYBURN snips away the corruption.
KIng's Landing.
Speaker: EXT

Text: LITTLEFINGER walks into a courtyard, where CERSEI awaits.
Lord Baelish.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I wonder if I might ask you for a favor.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: She walks with him.
Of course, Your Grace.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I have reason to believe that House Tyrell do not hold the crown's best interests at heart.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I see. And have you shared these suspicions with Lord Tywin?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: My father's a practical man. He appreciates facts.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Myself, I often find them a hindrance.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: And he appreciates those who aid his family, as you well know. He's almost as generous to those who help us as he is unpleasant towards those who don't. You have a good working relationship with the Tyrells. I thought you might look into it before you leave the capital.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I shall do my best.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Thank you. And your best will prove better than when I asked you to locate Arya Stark?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I assure you that it will.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: CERSEI exits.
King's Landing, Tyrion's chambers.
Speaker: INT

Text: Podrick pours wine for Tyrion and Olenna.
Gods, boy, that's enough. We're not in a tavern.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Pardon, my lady.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: No need to speak. Are there any figs? Fetch some. I always take figs midafternoon. They help move the bowels. To what do I owe this summons?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: PODRICK extis.
Thank you for seeing me, my lady. I had hoped we might discuss a few financial matters.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I climbed all those steps to discuss financial matters?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: It's the royal wedding. I'm told you had a hand in planning it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Naturally.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: It's shaping up to be a very involved affair. The word extravagant has been used.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What good is the word extravagant if it can't be used to describe a royal wedding?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: I understand that.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Good.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: But, as Master of Coin, it falls upon me to calculate the cost for the crown. As of now, it's a huge expense.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: And we're at war, Lady Olenna.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Oh, I'd nearly forgotten.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Yes, and maintaining supply lines--
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I can't think how it slipped my mind. What is it, 12,000 infantrymen the Tyrell family has supplied? 2,000 in support. Provisions so this city might survive the winter. A million bushels of wheat. Half a million bushels each of barley, oats, and rye. 20,000 head of cattle. 50,000 sheep. You don't have to lecture me about wartime expenses. I'm quite familiar with them.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: And we are so grateful for your contributions which are necessary for the preservation of the realm.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: As is a royal wedding. The people are hungry for more than just food. They crave distractions. And if we don't provide them, they'll create their own. And their distractions are likely to end with us being torn to pieces. A royal wedding is much safer. Wouldn't you say?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: I would.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And traditionally paid for by the royal family.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: (nods)
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The door opens and PODRICK returns with figs.
I was told you were drunk, impertinent, and thoroughly debauched. You can imagine my disappointment at finding nothing but a browbeaten bookkeeper. Where did you go for them, Volantis?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: My lady--
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Oh, very well. I won't have it said that House Tyrell refuses to play its part. We'll pay for half the expenses and the celebrations will go on as planned. Is that sufficient?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Quite sufficient. Thank you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Very good, then. That's settled. Good day.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: TYRION and OLENNA stand, and she exits.
Give me that.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION takes a fig from PODRICK's tray.
Riverlands, the Brotherhood's cave.
Speaker: INT

Text: GENDRY works on BERIC's armor.
What are you doing?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Just mending Lord Beric's armor.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Why?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I'm going to stay on and smith for the Brotherhood.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Have you lost your mind? When the Lannisters find this place, you think they'll spare the smiths? They'll cave your head in with your own helmet.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The Lannisters wanted to kill me long before I joined the Brotherhood.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: You don't have to do this.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I want to. They need good men.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Robb needs good men, too. We're leaving tomorrow. And then you--
Speaker: ARYA

Text: What? Serve him? I've served men my entire life. I served Master Mott at King's Landing and he sold me to the Watch. I served Lord Tywin at Harrenhal, wondering every day if I'd get tortured or killed. I'm done serving.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: You just said you were serving Lord Beric.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: He may be their leader, but they chose him. These men are brothers. They're a family. I've never had a family.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I can be your family.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You wouldn't be my family. You'd be 'my lady.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: ARYA exits.
Riverrun
Speaker: INT

Text: WILLEM and MARTY lie sleeping. There are sounds of a battle outside their cell. MARTYN shakes WILLEM to wake him
'Willem. Willem!
Speaker: MARTYN

Text: The door bursts open, and RICKARD KARSTACK runs the guard through with his sword. He and his men enter.
Is this a rescue? Rickard KARSTARK: Lannister filth! Take him!
Speaker: WILLEM

Text: KARSTARK's men take WILLEM.  MARTYN  Please, I didn't do anything. I'm just a squire. Please--
RICKARD KARSTARK stabs MARTYN in the gut
Riverrun
Speaker: INT

Text: WILLEM and MARTYN lie dead on a blanket. TALISA kneels beside them and ROBB stands beside her. BRYDEN stands opposite, while CATELYN sits behind them.
Bring them in.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Brynden opens the door.  RICKARD KARSTARK and his men walk in, hands bound.
Is that all of them? It took five of you to murder two unarmed squires?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Not murder, Your Grace. Vengeance.
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: Vengeance? Those boys didn't kill your sons. I saw Harrion die on the battlefield and Torrhen--
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Was strangled by the Kingslayer. They were his kin.
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: They were boys! Look at them.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Tell your mother to look at them. She killed them as much as I.
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: My mother had nothing to do with this. This was your treason.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: It's treason to free your enemies. In war, you kill your enemies. Did your father not teach you that, boy?
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: Brynden punches Rickard Karstark
Leave him.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Aye. Leave me to the king. He wants to give me a scolding before he sets me free. That's how he deals with treason. Our King in the North. Or should I call him the King Who Lost the North?
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: Escort Lord Karstark to the dungeon. Hang the rest.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Mercy, sire! I didn't kill anyone. I only watched for the guards.
Speaker: MAN

Text: This one was only the watcher. Hang him last so he can watch the others die.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Please! Please, no. They made me do it! They made me! They made me!
Speaker: MAN

Text: BRYNDEN takes out RICKARD KARSTARK and men. ROBB sits at his table. TALISA and EDMURE approach.
Word of this can't leave Riverrun. They were Tywin Lannister's nephews. The Lannisters pay their debts. They never stop talking about it.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: Would you make me a liar as well as a murderer?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: It wouldn't be lying. We will bury them and remain silent until the war is done.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: I'm not fighting for justice if I don't serve justice to murderers in my ranks, no matter how highborn. He has to die.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: CATELYIN stands and approaches.
The Karstarks are Northmen. They won't forgive the killing of their lord.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Your mother's right. If you do this, the Karstarks will abandon you.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: You tended to their wounds. You brought them supper. Now they're dead.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: And more boys will keep dying until this war is over. You need Karstark men to end it.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Spare his life. Keep him as a hostage.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: A hostage. Tell the Karstarks that as long as they remain loyal, he will not be harmed.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: ROBB coniders.
Riverrun gards, later. Rain pours down.
Speaker: EXT

Text: Men bring out the bound RICKARD KARSTARK. ROBB appraoches.
That didn't stop you from betraying me. And it won't save you now.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I don't want it to save me. I want it to haunt you to the end of your days.
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: Kneel, my lord.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: RICKARD KARSTARK willingly leans over the table, before ROBB, who holds a great sword,
Rickard Karstark, Lord of Karhold, here in sight of gods and men, I sentence you to die. Would you speak a final word?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Kill me and be cursed. You are no king of mine.
Speaker: RICKARD KARSTARK

Text: ROBBB beheads RICKARD KARSTARK with a single great blow. He walks away, conflicted and frustrated.
RIverrun, the Brotherhood's caverns.
Speaker: INT

Text: ARYA stands by the fire. THOROS lies nearby.
Joffrey. Cersei. Ilyn Payne. Ser Meryn. The Hound. What are you going to do with me?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: At first light we'll ride for Riverrun. Your brother's there now. He'll make a contribution to our cause and you can go home.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: I'm a hostage and you're selling me.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Don't think of it that way.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: But it is that way.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: It is. And it isn't.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: More is than isn't.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Beric admired your father a great deal, you know. He wanted to refuse your ransom altogether.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: So why don't you?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: We need the gold.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: BERIC enters and sits. ARYA looks uncomfortable.
Do I frighten you, child?
Speaker: BERIC

Text: No.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You're angry with me. And I don't blame you. But letting him go was the right thing. I have more reason than most to want him hanged.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: I thought he killed you.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: He did.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: But how?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Thoros how many times have you brought me BACK?THOROS: It's the Lord of Light brings you back. I'm just the lucky drunk who says the words.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: How many times?
Speaker: BERIC

Text: Five, I think. No, this makes six.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Six.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: BERIC shows ARYA  the scar on his chest.
Then I was stabbed in the belly.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: Then it was an arrow in the back. And that axe in the side.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Then the Lannisters caught me and executed me for treason. Was it a hanging or a dagger in the eye?
Speaker: BERIC

Text: Both. Fuckers couldn't decide.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: BERIC shows ARYA his right eye, sewn shut behind his eye patch.
And the Hound makes six.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Second time I've been killed by a Clegane.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: You'd think you'd learn. It's not getting any easier, you know.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: I know. Every time I come back, I'm a bit less. Pieces of you get chipped away.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: Could you bring back a man without a head? Not six times. Just once.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I don't think it works that way, child.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: He was a good man, Ned Stark. He's at rest now, somewhere. I would never wish my life upon him.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: I would. You're alive.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Dragonstone.
Speaker: INT

Text: SELYSE prays with palms open to a fire in a roughly hewn room.
Lord, cast your light upon me. Protect me in the darkness. Burn away my sins. Help me serve you. Use me as you will. For the night is dark and full of terrors.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: The door opens and STANNIS enters. He stands at the threshold, silently. t
I have prayed day and night for you to come to me.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: My lady.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: SELYSE nods in greeting.
I meant to come sooner. The battle--
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I know of your troubles, My king. The Lady Melisandre has told me everything.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Yes, of course.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: You mustn't despair. Your claim is true. You will be victorious.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: I believed that once.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: You are the one god's champion and the finest man I've ever known.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Selyse. I've broken a sacred vow. I've sinned.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: No.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: I've wronged you. I have shamed you.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: You're doing god's work.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: I know, Stannis. The Lady Melisandre has told me everything. No act done in service of the Lord of Light can ever be a sin. When she told me, I wept with joy.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: SELYSE walks past STANNIS toward three specimen jars. Each contains a stillborn baby in a cloudy, green liquid.
That's not true.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: So you've come to see her as well? There is no need. You must keep away from such distractions.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: She's my daughter. I want to see her.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: You are a king. You don't need my permission.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Stannis exits.
The hallway.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: STANNIS walks up to another closed door. SHIREEN sings behind it.
(sings) Under the sea I know, I know/ Oh, oh, oh
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Inside SHIREEN's room.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: SHIREEN lies below a shuttered window. Sounds of seabird and crashing surf waft through the room.
(sings) The birds have scales  / And the fish take wing / I know, I know / Oh, oh, oh
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Shireen.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Father!
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: SHIREEN rushes up and hugs STANNIS. He sighs and does not return his embrace. She looks up at him, showing the greyscale that has consumed the left side of her face.
You've grown since I last saw you.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: She pulls him to sit on the bed.
Mother said you fought in a battle. Did you win?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: No.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Did the Onion Knight come back with you?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: He did. He fought bravely.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: He hasn't come to visit me. He said he'd bring me back a present from the capital.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: He won't be visiting, child.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Why not? He's my friend. Look.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: SHIREEN gets up and opens a nearby drawer. She returns with a carved two-masted boat.
He made this for me. But don't tell Mother I have it. It's a secret. Mother doesn't like the Onion Knight.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Ser Davos is a traitor. He's rotting in a dungeon cell for his crime. Best forget him.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: SHIREEN looks down, cradling her ship. STANNIS rises and exits.
Harenhall bathing chamber
Speaker: INT

Text: BRIENE sits in a large bath pool in an ornate bathing room, scrubbing the layers of filth from her arms with a bristle brush.
Not so hard. You'll scrub the skin off.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAMIE has entered with a SQUIRE. BRIENNE is surprised.
What are you doing here?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I need a bath. Help me out of these rags.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The SQUIRE helps JAIME undress. We see JAIME's stubbed wrist, wrapped cleanly and tightly.
Now get out.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The SQUIRE exits. JAIME removes his trousers and BRIENNE looks away in modesty. JAIME moves to  enter the tub with Brienne
There's another tub.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: BREINNE moves to the far corner of the tub, but JAIME walks to join her. He steps in
This one suits me fine. Don't worry. I'm not interested. If I faint, pull me out. I don't intend to be the first Lannister to die in a bathtub.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Why should I care how you die?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You swore a solemn vow, remember? You're supposed to get me to King's Landing in one piece. Not going so well, is it? No wonder Renly died with you guarding him.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE stands bold and naked, challenging JAIME to continue. He is shamed.
That was unworthy. Forgive me. You protected me better than most--
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Don't you mock me.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I'm apologizing. I'm sick of fighting. Let's call a truce.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You need trust to have a truce.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I trust you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE sits, appeased, but fuming.
There it is. There's the look. I've seen it for 17 years on face after face. You all despise me. Kingslayer. Oathbreaker. A man without honor. You've heard of wildfire?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Of course.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: BRIENNE stares wide-eyed, and doesn't answer.
If this is true why didn't you tell anyone? Why didn't you tell Lord Stark?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: JAIME is exhausted after his speech. He breaths heavily
Stark? You think the honorable Ned Stark wanted to hear my side? He judged me guilty the moment he set eyes on me. By what right does the wolf judge the lion? By what right?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME tries to stand, but collapses into BRIENNE's arms.
Help! Help! The Kingslayer!
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Jaime. My name is Jaime.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Dragonstone dungeon
Speaker: INT

Text: SHIREEN whispers to a sleeping DAVOS through the iron bars of his cell.
Onion Knight. Ser Onion Knight.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Princess? Gods, what are you doing here?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Shh, you'll wake Bert.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Bert?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS comes to the bars to talk.
He's the fat one. He's on guard duty tonight. He likes to drink wine and sleep a lot.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Go back to your room. You're not supposed to be here. If your father knew--
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: he said you Were a traitor. Are you?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: I am, child. I disobeyed my king, your father, and now I'm paying the price.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I don't care. You're my friend. You must get bored down here. I brought you something to read. It's about Aegon and his dragons. Aegon used to live here. Did you know that? And the Targaryens built this castle.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Aye. So they did.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You can hide the book under your cloak. It's a good one. I'll bring you more.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Thank you, my lady. I'm sure it's a fine book, but it's wasted on me.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Take it. I have more.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: My lady, I can't read the words.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You can't?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: (shakes his head no)
Speaker: DAVIS

Text: I'll teach you. I'll come when Bert's on duty and teach you.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: No. No. No.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: It's easy. It'll be fun.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Go. We can't.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Why not? What will they do, lock us in cells?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: (laughs) I wouldn't know where to start.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Slaver's Bay

Text: Unsullied and Dothraki march across the landscape. DAENERYS rides up on a white horse. JORAH and BARRISTAN talk on their mounts nearby.
It was a bitch of a siege.

Text: Mm, you were first through the breach at Pyke?
