Text: The second. Thoros of Myr went in alone, waving that flaming sword of his.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Thoros of Myr. Bloody madman. Robert knighted you after the battle?
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: Proudest moment of my life. One knee in the dust, the king's sword on my shoulder, listening to the words. 'In the name of the Warrior, I charge you to be brave.' All I could think of was how badly I had to piss.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: (laughs)
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: In full plate metal for 16 hours. Never occurred to me till the fighting was over. I was very nearly the first man knighted to piss on the king's boots.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: JORAH and BARRISTAN lead their horses to water.
Robert would have laughed. He was a good man, a great warrior. And a terrible king. I burned away my years fighting for terrible kings.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: You swore an oath.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Yes. And a man of honor keeps his vows, even if he's serving a drunk or a lunatic. Just once in my life before it's over, I want to know what it's like to serve with pride, to fight for someone I believe in. Do you believe in her?
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: BARRISTAN nods towards DAENERYS in the background.
With all my heart.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: just ahead at the river.

Text: These are the ones?

Text: Yes, khaleesi. The officers.

Text: A score of Unsullied march and halt in front of them.
(speaks Valyrian) You did not choose this life. But you are free men now. And free men make their own choices. Have you selected your own leader from amongst your ranks?

Text: The Unsullied part, revealing their chosen leader, GREY WORM
(speaks Valyrian)  Remove your helmet

(speaks Valyrian) This one has the honor

(speaks Valyrian) Grey Worm.

Text: (speaks Valeryan) From this day forward you will choose your own names. You will tell your fellow soldiers to do the same. Throw away your slave name. Choose the name your parents gave you, or any other. A name that gives you pride.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (speaks Valeryan) "Grey Worm" gives me pride. It is a very lucky name. The name this one was born with was cursed. That was the name he had when he was taken as a slave. But Grey Worm is the name this one had the day Daenerys Stormborn set him free.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Further back on the river.

Text: JORAH and BARRISTAN lead their horses.
King Robert wanted her dead.

Text: I suppose no one on the small council could speak sense to him.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I didn't sit on the small council.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: No? Doesn't the Lord of the Kingsguard traditionally--

Text: Traditionally, yes, but I killed a dozen of Robert's friends during his rebellion.

He didn't want advice on how to govern from a man who had fought for the Mad King. Can't say I minded much. I always hated the politics.

Mm-hmm.

Text: I don't know if your presence by her side will help our cause when we go home.

Text: ROBB surveys a battle map, in deep concentration.
Come to bed.

Text: You were right.

Text: Winter could last five years. Once my bannermen are home again, sitting by the fire, surrounded by their families, warm and safe, they'll never ride south again. When I gathered my lords together, we had a purpose, a mission. Now we're like a band of bickering children.

What is it?

Text: SANSA look out at a sailing ship in the bay.
She may not be the grandest ship in the world or the fastest, but she's mine. I've always wanted a ship. Now I want a dozen. Strange, isn't it?

Text: Of course. More than anything. But maybe it would be better to wait. I've been thinking how dangerous it would be. Not just for me, but for you. You've been so kind. I'd feel terrible if anything happened to you. I can't tell you how touched I am by your concern for my welfare.

Tywin's chambers
Speaker: INT

Text: TYRION enters, carrying a large tome. He spies CERSEI and pauses.
You're late.

You'll be pleased to learn that after one conversation with Olenna Tyrell, I've saved the crown hundreds of thousands on this wedding.

Text: I'm Master of Coin. Saving money is important.

Speaker: TYRION

Text: Your jokes are not appreciated.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: It wasn't my best, but--
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The Karstarks have marched home. The young wolf has lost half his army. His days are numbered. Theon Greyjoy murdered both his brothers. That makes Sansa Stark the heir to Winterfell. And I am not about to hand her over to the Tyrells.

Text: The Tyrell army is helping us to win this war. Do you really think it's wise to refuse them?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: There's nothing to refuse. This is a plot. Plots are not public knowledge. And the Tyrells won't carry this one out until after Joffrey's wedding. We need to act first and kill this union in its crib.

Text: And how do we do that?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We find Sansa Stark a different husband.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Wonderful.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (amused) Yes, it is.

You can't mean it.

Text: I can and I do.

Text: She's a child!
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She's flowered, I assure you. She and I have discussed it at length.
Speaker: CERSEI

Speaker: TYWIN

Text: And if I refuse?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You wanted to be rewarded for your valor in battle. Sansa Stark is a finer reward than you could ever dare hope for. And it is past time you were wed.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I was wed. Or don't you remember?

Text: Only too well.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: You should be thanking the gods for this. This is more than you deserve.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Tyrion will do as he's bid. As will you.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: What do you mean?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You'll marry Ser Loras.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I will not.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The boy is heir to Highgarden. Tyrion will secure the North, you will secure the Reach.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: No, I won't do it.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Yes, you will. You're still fertile. You need to marry again and breed.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I am Queen Regent, not some broodmare.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You're my daughter! You will do as I command and you will marry Loras Tyrell and put an end to the disgusting rumors about you once and for all.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Father, don't make me do it again, please.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: TYWIN slams his fist on the table and rises.
Not another word. My children. You've disgraced the Lannister name for far too long.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYWIN exits. Both CERSEI and TYRION brood.

Text: Six.

Text: (speaks Valerian) That's not possible.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: (speaks Valerian) The Lord has smiled upon me.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: (speaks Valerian) You should not have this power.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: (speaks Valerian) I have no power. I ask the Lord for His favor, and He responds as He will.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: THOROS sits and begins to drink again.

I've always been a terrible priest. Drank too much rum. Fucked all the whores in King's Landing. It's a terrible thing to say, but by the time I came to Westeros, I didn't believe in our Lord. I decided that He, that all the gods, were stories we told the children to make them behave. So I wore the robes and every now and then I'd recite the prayers, but it was just for show. A spectacle for the locals. Until the Mountain drove a lance through this one's heart. I knelt beside his cold body and said the old words. Not because I believed in them, but he was my friend and he was dead. And they were the only words I knew. And for the first time in my life, the Lord replied. Beric's eyes opened and I knew the truth. Our god is the one true god. And all men must serve Him.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: You've been to the other side.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: The other side? There is no other side. I have been to the darkness, my lady. He sent you to us for a reason.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: You have someone He needs.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: The woods outside the cavern.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: ANGUY hands an arrowhead to GENDRY.
Bodkin point. Penetrates plate at 200 yards. Can you make 'em?
Speaker: ANGUY

Text: Yeah, nothing tricky about it. Just need decent steel.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I'll get you the steel.
Speaker: ANGUY

Text: Come on.
Speaker: MAN

Text: MELISANDRE and her men pass nearby, pulling a wagon.
I don't like that woman.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: MELISANDRE, THOROS and BERIC approach.
That's 'cause you're a girl.
Speaker: ANGUY

Text: (laughs)
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: What does that have to do with anything?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Forgive me, lad.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: Two of MELISANDRE's guards grab and bind Gendry.
What are you doing? Let go of him.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA tries to intervene, but the guard pushes her away easily.
Tell them to stop. Come on. He wants to be one of you. He wants to join the Brotherhood. Stop them!
Speaker: ARYA

Text: We serve the Lord of Light and the Lord of Light needs this boy.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: Did the Lord of Light tell you that or did she?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A GUARD returns from the horses with two sacks of gold. He hands them to BERIC. MELISANDRE walks away.
You're not doing this for your god. You're doing it for gold.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: We're doing it for both, girl. We can't defend the people without weapons and horses and food. And we can't get weapons and horses and food without gold.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: You told me this was a Brotherhood. You told me I could be one of you.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: You are more than they can ever be. They're just foot soldiers in the great war. You will make kings rise and fall.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: ARYA approaches MELISANDRE from behind, and spins her around from the elbow.
You're a witch. You're going to hurt him.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Melisandre grabs Arya's chin.
The wagon carrying GENDRY drives away.
The wall.
Speaker: EXT

Text: TORMUND, ORELL, YGRITTE, JON climb the wall. Three more wildlings lag behind. The wind howls and the snow swirls. They use ropes, pitons and axes. The climb is slow and arduous.  The height is  dizzying.
You staring at my ass, Jon Snow?
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: JON smiles. Just above them, TORMUND's axe releases a cluster of ice from the wall.
Look out!
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: ORELL and YGRITTE dodge, but the falling ice hits JON in the face, and he loses his grip. His pitons gives way, and he slides helplessly down the wall until the slack of his rope is used up.
You all right?
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: JON begins to climb again.
Just seeing if you can take a hit, lad.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: A dungeon, somewhere.
Speaker: INT

Text: RAMSAY blows a horn, waking THEON, who is bound to the X-shaped cross.
Sorry. Were you sleeping?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Wa--
Speaker: THEON

Text: Wa--? Wa--? Water? You want some water. I wish I had some for you.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY holds up the mug from the table next to him. He slowly pours out the water to the floor. He rises and walks to THEON>
(whimpering)
Speaker: THEON

Text: So let's play a game. Which body part do you need the least?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Please.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Please is not a body part.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: I'll tell you everything, please.
Speaker: THEON

Text: But you've already told me everything. Remember? Your daddy was mean to you. The Starks didn't appreciate you. One good bit, though. The Stark boys, they're still alive. Wouldn't that be a hunt to remember? You failed, but I'm a better hunter than you.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Ramsay prods Theon.
Now how about your little finger? You don't use that for much, do you? No? Good. Let's start with that.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY works at the leather straps on THEON's right hand.
(groans)
Speaker: THEON

Text: You've been wondering why you're here. Haven't you? Where you are. Who I am. Why I'm doing this to you. So guess. If you guess right, I'll tell you. By the old gods and the new, I swear it. You win the game if you can figure out who I am and why I'm torturing you and I win the game if you beg me to cut off your finger.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: If I win, you'll let me go?
Speaker: THEON

Text: If you think this has a happy ending, you haven't been paying attention.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Please.
Speaker: THEON

Text: RAMSAY draws a knife brandishes just before THEON's chin.
You say please again and you'll wish you hadn't. You first. Where are we?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: The North.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Too vague.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Deepwood Motte.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Terrible guess.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY tortures THEON by stabbing his right pinky. THEON cries out.
Now, where?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Last Hearth.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Do I look like a fucking Umber to you?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: This time, RAMSAY holds the knife in THEON's pinky for much longer.
Karhold!
Speaker: THEON

Text: RAMSAY stops.
Karhold? How did you know that? Did you see any banners flying when we came in?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: No. It was just a guess.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Very good, Lord Theon. And who am I?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Torrhen Karstark.
Speaker: THEON

Text: He's dead. Strangled by the Kingslayer.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: He was your brother. Your father is Lord Rickard Karstark.
Speaker: THEON

Text: RAMSAY walks away.
You swore to tell me if I--
Speaker: THEON

Text: You're right.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Lord Rickard Karstark is Robb Stark's bannerman. I betrayed Robb. That's why you're torturing me.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Yes. You win.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: THEON is relieved. RAMSAY looks dejected. But get rises suddenly, full of energy.
Of course, you forgot to ask one question. You forgot to ask if I'm a liar.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Ramsay tortures Theon by twisting his knife in the tip of THEON's pinky.
(screams louder than before)
Speaker: THEON

Text: I'm afraid I am.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY squeezes THEON's pinkie.
Everything I told you is a lie.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY continues to punish THEON's pinky.
(screams in desperation)
Speaker: THEON

Text: The torture continues.
Please, cut it off! Cut it off! Cut it off!
Speaker: THEON

Text: RAMSAY stops and stands before THEON. He smiles.
I win.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Riverrun Great Hall
Speaker: INT

Text: Robb, Catelyn, Brynden, Edmure, Black Walder and Lothar sit around a large table.
Thank you for riding here so quickly. I know travel isn't easy in these times.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: The roads are crawling with cutthroats and bandits. But when the King of the North summons us, we come.
Speaker: BLACK WALDER

Text: Our father has instructed us to tell you that his alliance with the North can continue if his terms are met. Lord Frey requires a formal apology for your violation of your sacred oath to marry one of his daughters.
Speaker: LOTHAR

Text: Of course. He deserves as much. I was in the wrong.  Black WALDER: As restitution for this betrayal, he demands Harrenhal and all its attendant lands.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I don't think that's--
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: We are fighting for the North. Harrenhal is not in the North. It is his once the war is over and we have no further strategic need for it.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: And there's something else.
Speaker: BLACK WALDER

Text: We will do whatever we can to give Lord Frey what he needs.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Not what, whom.
Speaker: BLACK WALDER

Text: BLACK WALDER looks at EDMURE.
What?
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: BRYDEN, ROBB and LOTHAR also stare at. EDMURE.
(chuckles) No.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: How old is she?
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: Could I see her first?
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: You want to count her teeth? We depart for the Twins in the morning. We need an answer before we leave and a wedding not more than a fortnight thereafter or this alliance is at an end.
Speaker: BLACK WALDER

Text: Your father does realize we're in the middle of a war?
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: Father is old. It will put his heart at peace if he could see her wed to a good husband.  Black WALDER: And his recent experience has made him wary of long engagements.
Speaker: LOTHAR

Text: He has every right to be. Please excuse us while we discuss it.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: LOTHAR and BLACK WALDER exit.
Why should I let that old ferret choose my bride for me? At the very least, I should be offered the same choice you were. I'm his liege lord.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: EDMURE stands.
He's a proud man and we've wounded him.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I didn't wound him. My answer is no.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: BRYNDEN stands and walks to EDMURE.
Listen to me and listen very carefully. You--
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: The laws of gods and men are very clear. No man can compel another man to marry.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: The laws of my fist are about to compel your teeth.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: It's all right. You heard him. If you refuse, our alliance with the Freys is dead.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: BRYDEN sits.
He's wanted me for one of his daughters since I was 12. He's not gonna stop wanting it now. When I say no, he will come back and offer me a daughter of my choosing.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: You're willing to risk our freedom and our lives for a chance at a prettier wife?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: I have a war to fight. We can't win it without them. I have no time to haggle. You said you wanted to make amends for the Stone Mill.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: You recall that heroic engagement?
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: I had something less permanent in mind.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: I've won every battle, but I'm losing this war. If we don't do this and do it now, we're lost.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I'll marry her.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: You're paying for my sins, Uncle. It's not fair or right. I'll remember it.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Harenhall dining room
Speaker: INT

Text: JAIME struggles to feed himself one-handed. BRIENNE sits next to him in a gown, and ROOSE sits across from them both.
I see my men have finally found you something appropriate to wear.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: Yes. Most kind of them. You're a Stark bannerman, Lord Bolton. I am acting on Lady Stark's orders to return Jaime Lannister to King's Landing.  Roose BOLTON: When King Robb left Harrenhal, his mother was his prisoner. If she wasn't his mother, he'd have hanged her for treason.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Brienne stabs Jaime's steak so that he has leverage to cut it.
I should send you back to Robb Stark.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: You should. But instead, you're sitting here watching me fail at dinner. Why might that be?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Wars cost money. Many people would pay a great deal for you.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: We both know who would pay the most. Or make you pay the most if he found out you had captured me and sent me back up north for a summary execution.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You're right. Perhaps the safest thing to do is to kill you both and burn your bodies.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: It would be, if you honestly believed my father would never find out about it.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: King Robb is keeping your father quite busy. He doesn't have time for anything else.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: He'll make time for you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: As soon as you're well enough to travel, I will allow you to go to King's Landing as restitution for the mistakes my soldiers made. And you will swear to tell your father the truth, that I had nothing to do with your maiming.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: JAIME nods and reaches for a pitcher.
Shall we drink on it?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME begins to pour, but ROOSE stops him.
I don't partake.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: You do understand how suspicious that is to ordinary people?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME pours wine for BRIENNE and himself.
Very well. My lady, may our journey continue without further incident.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Oh, she won't be going with you.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: I am charged with bringing Ser Jaime to--
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You are charged with abetting treason.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: I'm afraid I must insist.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You're in no place to insist on anything. I would have hoped you'd learned your lesson about overplaying your position.
Speaker: ROOSE BOLTON

Text: King's Landing, Tywin's chambers.
Speaker: INT

Text: Impossible.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: TYWIN pours some wine.
Why?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: My grandson is the pride of Highgarden. The most desirable bachelor in all seven kingdoms. Your daughter--
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Is rich, the most beautiful woman in all seven kingdoms and the mother of the king.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYWIN hands a glass to OLENNA.
Old.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Old?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Old. I'm something of an expert on the subject. Her change will be upon her before long. I'll spare you the details of what will happen then. You men may have a stomach for bloodshed and slaughter, but this is another matter entirely.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The years punish us as well, I promise you that. My stomach remains quite strong, however. The only thing that might turn it are details of your grandson's nocturnal activities. Do you deny them?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Oh, not at all. A sword swallower through and through.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: And a boy with his affliction should be grateful for the opportunity to marry the most beautiful woman in the kingdoms and remove the stain from his name.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Did you grow up with boy cousins, Lord Tywin? Sons of your father's bannermen, squires, stable boys?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Of course.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: And you never--
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: No.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Not once? Not in any way?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Never.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I congratulate you upon your restraint. But it's a natural thing, two boys having a go at each other beneath the sheets.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Perhaps Highgarden has a high tolerance for unnatural behavior.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I will not breathe further life into a malicious lie by discussing it.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYWIN stands, offended. He pours himself more wine.
Lie or not, you must admit many people find it quite convincing. Convincing enough to put swords in their hands and send them off to kill Lannisters and Tyrells thanks to our new affiliation.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: I don't care what people believe. And neither do you.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: OLENNA refuses TYWIN's offer for more wine.
As an authority on myself, I must disagree.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Now, if the rumors about my children were true, then Joffrey is no king at all and House Tyrell is throwing its prized flower into the dirt.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: And if Cersei is too old to give Loras children, we're throwing another prized flower into the dirt. It is a chance we simply cannot take.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The uncertainty makes you uncomfortable. All right. I'll remove it for you.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYWIN sits back down at his desk.
If you refuse to marry Loras to Cersei, I will name him to the Kingsguard. I'm sure you're familiar with the Kingsguard vows. He will never marry. He will never have children.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Oh
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The Tyrell name will fade. And Highgarden will go to the children of Joffrey and Margaery.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: You would have your grandson protected by someone who disgusts you?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: I would have my grandson protected by a skilled warrior who takes his vows seriously. So, shall I draw up the order? Or do you consent to this marriage?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYWIN takes up a quill and prepares to write. OLENNA stands, and takes the quill from his hand.
OLENNA snaps the quill.
The Wall.
Speaker: EXT

Text: The weather has worsened for the climbers. They shout to be heard over the howling winds. Each blow of the axe takes great strength to penetrate the ice. YGRITTE buries her axe in the wall, but a great crack opens across it. The ice wall cracks and pops to her right as the fissure travels across it. Suddenly, a huge swath of the wall gives way, taking three wildlings with it. They scream amidst the roar.
No!
Speaker: ORELL

Text: ORELL digs his axe deep into the wall. TORMUND does the same, bracing himself in a wide stance. The wall under YGRITTE and JON gives way and they falls amid an avalanche of ice and snow.
(screams)
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: TORMUND prepares for the force of their fall on the rope that tethers them together.
(grunts)
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: (screams)
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: (screams)
Speaker: JON

Text: ORELL loses his grip on the wall. He dangles, trying to gain purchase with his climbing axe. TORMUND holds on as best he can.
(grunts)
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: We've gotta cut them loose!
Speaker: ORELL

Text: No!
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: ORELL unsheathes his knife and begins to saw at the rope that connects him to YGRITTE and JON. They hang and dangle helplessly far from the wall, swinging back and forth. ORELL continues to cut through the rope. JON finally swings far enough to plant his axe in solid ice. At the same moment, ORELL cuts through the rope and YGRITTE plummets, limbs spinning. Her fall halts when the rope to JON goes taught.
(grunts)
Speaker: JON

Text: (screams)
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: (grunts)
Speaker: JON

Text: (screams)
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: Jon tries to quiet the rope beneath him. YGRITTE hacks her axe into the wall. She climbs up to JON. He reaches out his hand.
Take my hand!
Speaker: JON

Text: They strain to connect, then clasp hands. JON pulls YGRITTE up to safety. They embrace, panting and exhausted. JON looks up to the sneering ORELL. They all begin to climb again.
King's Landing garden.
Speaker: EXT

Text: SANSA and LORAS sit by a garden pool.
That's a wonderful pin.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Oh, it's more of a brooch, really. Though I suppose a brooch is a sort of pin, so
Speaker: LORAS

Text: I'm very happy about
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Uh, yes. I-I am as well.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: I feel like I'm in a dream.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Yes, me, too. Definitely. I've dreamed of a large wedding since I was quite young. The guests, the food, the tournaments. And the bride, of course. The most beautiful bride in the world in a beautiful gown of gold and green brocade with fringed sleeves. Have you ever been to Highgarden, my lady?
Speaker: LORAS

Text: No. I had never left Winterfell before I came to King's Landing. But it sounds wonderful. I can't wait to see it. And to leave this place.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: It's terrible, isn't it? The most terrible place there is.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: LORAS stands and  takes Sansa's hand to lead her away
Garden overlook.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: TYRION and CERSEI watch SANSA and LORAS from afar.
I don't suppose there's anything we can do about this.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We can have them both killed.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: It's hard to say which of the four of us is getting the worst of this arrangement. Probably Sansa. Though Loras will certainly come to know a deep and singular misery.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Father doesn't discriminate. We're all being shipped off to hell together.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: They move inside and CERSEI sits.
On a boat you built.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The Tyrells were plotting to undermine our family. I did what I did to protect our family.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I'm your family. A member of your family who has actively contributed to that family's survival. Whether or not you or Father or anyone else wants to admit it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I do admit it. If it weren't for your trick with the wildfire, Stannis would have sacked the city before Father got here. Our heads would still be rotting on the city gate.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Trying to have me killed is an odd way of saying thank you. There are two people in King's Landing who can give an order to a Kingsguard. Did you or did you not order Ser Mandon to kill me during the Battle of the Blackwater?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Cersei doesn't answer.

The impulse I understand. He hates me because I'm the only one who tells him what he really is. So, fair enough. He wants me dead. But his stupidity? He could have had me poisoned and no one would have known. But the king orders a Kingsguard to murder the Hand of the King in full view of his own army. The boy's an idiot.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What do you want me to say?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I want you to tell me if my life is still in danger.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Probably. But not from Joffrey. He won't do anything now Father's here.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Seven kingdoms united in fear of Tywin Lannister.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Not the Tyrells. Soon they won't need to be afraid of him. Joffrey will belong to Margaery, the little doe-eyed whore. And so will his children and their children. History will be taken from our hands.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You may escape, at least. Once Jaime gets back, Ser Loras may come down with a terrible case of sword through bowels.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: When Jaime gets back, yes. But when do we think that's going to be? He's out there somewhere.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Jaime or not, I'm truly fucked.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Who's going to tell her?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Sansa's chambers.
Speaker: INT

Text: SHAE helps SANSA with her dress.
Do you think people will like it?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I don't think they will even notice it.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: You're right. It's not my wedding. Anyway, from what I can tell, the dressmakers in Highgarden will be far superior to the ones in King's Landing. They'd never make me anything as dull as this for my wedding. Loras likes green and gold brocade.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I'm sure he does.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Will they let me invite my family?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: They haven't asked my opinion.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: But do you think they will?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: No.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: The door opens.
Lady Sansa, Lord Tyrion to see you. Should I--
Speaker: MAID

Text: TYRION enters, catching SANSA partially dressed.
I beg your pardon, my lady.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: SHAE helps SANSA to recover her decency.
Good afternoon, Lord Tyrion. I was just trying on a gown for King Joffrey's wedding.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Yes, it should be quite a wedding. I need to speak with you, Lady Sansa.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Of course.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Alone, if I may.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Why do you need to speak to her alone?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Shae. Please excuse her, Lord Tyrion. She's not from here. But I trust her, even though she tells me not to.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Sometimes we think we want to hear something and it's only afterwards when it's too late that we realize we wished we'd heard it under entirely different circumstances.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It's all right, really.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: TYRION closes the door.
The Throne Room
Speaker: INT

Text: VARYS and LITTLEFINGER look at the Iron Throne.
1000 blades taken from the hands of Aegon's fallen enemies, forged in the fiery breath of Balerion the Dread.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: There aren't There aren't even 200. I've counted.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Ha, I'm sure you have. Ugly old thing. Yet it has a certain appeal. The Lysa Arryn of chairs. Shame you had to settle for your second choice.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Early days, my friend. It is flattering, really you feeling such dread at the prospect of me getting what I want.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Thwarting you has never been my primary ambition, I promise you. Although who doesn't like to see their friends fail now and then?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: You're so right. For instance, when I thwarted your plan to give Sansa Stark to the Tyrells. If I'm going to be honest, I did feel an unmistakable sense of enjoyment there. But your confidant, the one who fed you information about my plans, the one you swore to protect, you didn't bring her any enjoyment. And she didn't bring me any enjoyment. She was a bad investment on my part. Luckily, I have a friend who wanted to try something new. Something daring. And he was so grateful to me for providing this fresh experience.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

You can drink, you can joke, you can engage in juvenile attempts to make your father uncomfortable, but you will do your duty.
