Text: TYWIN returns to his own seat. LORAS stands above in the balustrade, surveying the scene from afar. TYRION salutes LORAS with his cup. LORAS looks away uncomfortably, and notices CERSEI on the balustrade, looking out at the sea. He approaches her.
Well, my father once told me--
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Nobody cares what your father once told you.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI exits.
The Wedding Celebration
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: SANSA walks through the revelry with SHAE. After opening a curtain for SANSA, SHAE quickly departs as JOFFREY intercepts SANSA.
Congratulations, my lady.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Thank you, Your Grace.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Well, you've done it. You've married a Lannister. Soon you'll have a Lannister baby. It's a dream come true for you, isn't it?  What a glorious day.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Yes, Your Grace.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I suppose it doesn't really matter which Lannister puts the baby into you. Maybe I'll pay you a visit tonight after my uncle passes out. How'd you like that?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: SANSA does not reply.
You wouldn't? That's all right. Ser Meryn and Ser Boros will hold you down.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: JOFFREY smirks cruelly as he turns back to the main hall and claps his hands for attention.
Time for the bedding ceremony.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: There will be no bedding ceremony.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JOFFREY takes SANSA's hand and leads her to the central banquet floor.

Where's your respect for tradition, Uncle? Come, everyone. Pick her up and carry her to her wedding bed. Get rid of her gown. She won't be needing it any longer. Ladies, attend to my uncle. He's not heavy.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: There will be no bedding ceremony.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: There will be if I command it.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: TYRION stabs his knife resoundingly into the table in front of him. JOFFREY is shocked.
Then you'll be fucking your own bride with a wooden cock.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tywin rises from his seat.
What did you say? What did you say?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: I believe we can dispense with the bedding, Your Grace. I'm sure Tyrion did not mean to threaten the king.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYRION's hand shakes with rage as he grips the knife with all his strength. Suddenly, he regains his drunken composure. He releases the knife and laughs obsequiously.
A bad joke, Your Grace. Made out of envy of your own royal manhood. Mine is so small. My poor wife won't even know I'm there.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Your uncle is clearly quite drunk, Your Grace.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYRION staggers from the head table, and tumbles into another as he walks.
My tiny drunk cock and I have a job to do. Come, wife.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION entreats SANSA to come with him. She follows, embarrassed and small.
I vomited on a girl once in the middle of the act. Not proud of it. But I think honesty is important between a man and wife, don't you agree?  Come, I'll tell you all about it. Put you in the mood.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion's Chambers
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: TYRION opens the door for SANSA. She enters nervously. TYRION closes the door, and staggers directly to the wine, and pours himself a glass.
Is that wise, my lord?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Tyrion, Sansa. My name is Tyrion.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Is that wise, Tyrion?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Nothing was ever wiser.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION sits on the side of the bed.
Astoundingly long.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Neck. You have one. How old are you exactly?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Well, talk won't make you any older. My lord father has commanded me to consummate this marriage.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: SANSA takes a breath. She pours herself some wine and drinks it. TYRION offers a drunken toast of solidarity. SANSA moves quietly and obediently to the bed and undresses her many layers while TYRION watches.
Stop. I can't. I could, I won't.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: But your father--
Speaker: SANSA

Text: If my father wants someone to get fucked, I know where he can start. I won't share your bed. Not until you want me to.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What if I never want you to?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: TYRION toasts SANSA.
And so my watch begins.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION drinks. He turns, sets down his glass, and passes out directly.  SANSA is speechless.
Encampment outside of Yunkai, night.
Speaker: EXT

Text: The encampment bustles in spite of the late hour, with the Unsullied patrolling the paths between the tents. One Unsullied trots through camp alone.
Daenerys's tent
Speaker: INT

Text: MISSANDEI bathes DAENERYS in a tub by candlelight
Yes, Your Grace.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: How can anyone speak 19 languages?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: It only took Your Grace a year to learn Dothraki reasonably well.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Dothraki is difficult for the mouth to master. So guttural and harsh.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: (in Dothraki) Drogo said I spoke Dothroaki like one born to it. It gave him great pride.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Athjahakar.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Athjahaka.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Ath-ja-hakar.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Athjahakar.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (nods)
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Well, I suppose I'm a bit out of practice.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your High Valyrian is very good, Your Grace. The gods could not devise a more perfect tongue. It is the only proper language for poetry.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: (gasps)
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: DAENERYS turns to see MISSANDEI held captive, her mouth covered and a knife at her throat. Her assailant, DAARIO, wears the uniform of the Unsullied.
No screaming or she dies.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAARIO leads MISSANDEI further into the tent. DAENERYS watches nervously, feeling vulnerable in her bath. DAARIO removes the knife from her throat, and lifts of the Unsullied helmet. His eyes smile at DAENERYS. She is confused and angry.
What do you want?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAARIO places the tip of his blade back onto MISSANDEI's throat.
You.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Let her go.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Don't scream, lovely girl.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAARIO releases MISSANDEI with a grand gesture. She scampers next to DAENERYS.
You were sent here to kill me?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (nods and chuckles)
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: So why haven't you?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I don't want to.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: What do your captains have to say about that?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You should ask them.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAARIO removes his satchel and dumps its contents on the floor. The heads of MERO and PRENDAHL thud as they hit the floor.
Why?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: We had philosophical differences.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Over what?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your beauty. It meant more to me than it did to them.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: You're a strange man.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I'm the simplest man you'll ever meet. I only do what I want to do.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: And this is supposed to impress me?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Yes.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Why would I trust a man who murders his comrades?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They ordered me to murder you. I told them I preferred not to. They told me I had no choice. I told them I am Daario Naharis. I always have a choice. They drew their swords and I drew mine.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAENERYS rises from her bath and steps to the floor. She stands naked before DAARIO, matching his confidence with her resolve. MISSANDEI steps behind her and slips her into a robe.
Will you fight for me?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (nods)
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAENERYS walks to him.
Swear to me.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAARIO unsheathes his sword and kneels, placing it across his knees.
The Second Sons are yours and so is Daario Naharis. My sword is yours, my life is yours, my heart is yours.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAARIO bows his head.
King's Landing, Tyrion's Chambers, morning.
Speaker: INT

Text: The door to TYRION's chamber opens. SANSA sleeps alone in TYRION's bed. TYRION lies on the settee that he passed out on the night before.  SHAE walks in without looking at TYRION and slam the breakfast tray the she holds onto the table. SANSA rises from the bed while TYRION struggles to even prop himself up.
You really ought to knock.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I brought your breakfast.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Irritated, SHAE moves quickly through the room. She snatches SANSA's dress from under TYRION's head. His head thumps into the chair's arm. SHAE helps SANSA to dress while TYRION struggles with his hang over. SHAE begins to strip the bed, and notices that the sheets are stain-free. She softens and exchanges a sympathetic and understanding look with TYRION. She exits with the sheets.
North of the Wall, dusk.
Speaker: EXT

Text: SAM, GILLY and her BABY walk across the snowy landscape, exhausted. The wind churns. GILLY stops by a tree while SAM examines a broken farmhouse. A crow lands in the godswood tree above them
(fusses)
Speaker: BABY

Text: It's getting dark. We could stay here for the night.
Speaker: SAM

Text: (fusses)
Speaker: BABY

Text: GILLY hands the BABY to SAM. SAM smiles at the child while  GILLY collects firewood. A second crow joins the first in the tree. SAM pauses, surprised at the coincidence.
The broken barn, a bit later.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The wind howls and whistles in the night. Inside the broken barn, SAM tries to strike a fire with his flint stones.
How hard can it be to build a fire?
Speaker: SAM

Text: It doesn't matter. Come under the furs. We can keep each other warm.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: SAM blinks rapidly, then sits next to GILLY. She spreads the furs over them both and looks at him.
(fusses)
Speaker: BABY

Text: He winked at me before.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I doubt it.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I saw him wink at me.
Speaker: SAM

Text: He blinked.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I suppose it's a rather philosophical difference between a wink and a blink.
Speaker: SAM

Text: A what?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Well, I mean, there's no real difference.
Speaker: SAM

Text: A wink is on purpose.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: You thought of a name yet? It would be easier to refer to him if he had a name.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Sometimes do you talk fancy on purpose to confuse me?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: What? No. This is just the way I talk.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I'll build that fire.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: GILLY sets down the BABY and stacks the wood. She tries to strike the flint.
Don't you think he should have a name?
Speaker: SAM

Text: I don't know many boys' names.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Let's see, there's Duncan, Kevan, Jon Guymon, Feldan, Tristifer.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Craster.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: SAM is taken aback. While he thinks of how to respond, the fire comes alive.
Uh, yes. Maybe that's not--
Speaker: SAM

Text: Mormont.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: GILLY feeds the fire.
That's a lovely idea, but Mormont's a last name.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Why is it a last name?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Well, it's a family name. For instance, I'm Samwell Tarly. Samwell is my birth name and Tarly is my family name. You see? So my father is also a Tarly.
Speaker: SAM

Text: His name is Samwell Tarly, too?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: No, Randyll Tarly.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Randyll is a handsome name.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Please don't name him Randyll.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Is your father cruel like mine?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Different manner of cruel.
Speaker: SAM

Text: GILLY blows on the fire. Crows caw outside the broken barn.
Not Randyll, then.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: GILLY sits back down next to SAM. The sounds of crows escalate into a chorus of relentless cawing. SAM and GILLY listen with fear. SAM nods at her with a slight smile, and rises.
Don't. Don't go out there.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: SAM takes a burning torch from the fire.
I'll be back. I just want to look.
Speaker: SAM

Text: SAM reaches the side of the barn and looks out. He grabs his sword as he exits. The godswood tree is swarmed by crows. They cry out in a cacophany. GILLY joins SAM outside, clutching her BABY. Every branch of the godswood is covered by crows. There must be hundreds.
Go inside. Go back inside. I'll--
Speaker: SAM

Text: Suddenly the crows fall silent. A growl comes out of the darkness beyond them. SAM looks into the woods, and drops his torch.
It's come for the baby.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: A lone figure walks towards them from the woods. SAM readies his sword, two handed. The figure comes closer. It is a WHITE WALKER, approaching calmly.
Stay back!
Speaker: SAM

Text: The WHITE WALKER continues to approach. SAM extends his sword in front of him, an unconvincing threat. The WHITE WALKER is nearly upon SAM.
You stay back!
Speaker: SAM

Text: The WHITE WALKER grabs SAM's sword. It sounds a resonant ring and suddenly shatters in his grip. He levels SAM with an uppercut that sends him sprawling to the ground. He turns his attention to GILLY and her BABY.
No, you can't have him! No!
Speaker: GILLY

Text: SAM draws the dragonglass knife from his furs.
No!
Speaker: GILLY

Text: SAM runs to intercept the WHITE WALKER. He lunged and plants the dragonglass knife in the shoulder blade of the WHITE WALKER. The ghoul screeches and turns to attack SAM. But the WALKER seizes up, howls, and falls to his knees,  his flesh hardening and cracking like ice. Suddenly, he shatters into tiny shards, practically vanishing into crystal dust. SAM and GILLY are stupefied. The crows begin to sound again. SAM grabs GILLY. They run away from the barn and into the woods. The crows take to flight, swarming them and cawing in a thunderous clamor.
[Opening Credits]

[First scene shows the location of Casterly Rock (ancestral seat of House Lannister) on a giant map of Westeros. There are several game pieces representing different House sigils located on different parts of the map. ROBB STARK and CATELYN STARK are at a campsite, within a tent lit up by candles]
Are you sure about this?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: No.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: It's dangerous.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: [ROBB nods in agreement]
If we take Tywin's castle from him, the lords of Westeros will realize he's not invincible.  Take his home, take his gold, take his power.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Why are you telling me?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: [ROBB pauses then walks around CATELYN]
You begged me not to send Theon to negotiate with his father and I ignored your advice.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [ROBB pours himself something to drink]
Now Winterfell is burned to the ground.  The North is overrun with Ironborn and Bran and Rickon are gone.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [ROBB pauses]
So, Casterly Rock?  I'm asking your advice.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [CATELYN pauses, staring at ROBB.  She then looks at the map]
We have enough men?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: [ROBB grabs a House Frey piece]
If Walder Frey cooperates.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: If Walder Frey cooperates.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: [Close up shots of the map showing the sigils of House Stark, House Frey and House Lannister]
If reinforcements arrive from King's Landing, before we take the castle, we'll be caught between Tywin's army and the sea.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: [ROBB moves the House Frey piece to the House Stark side of the map]
We'll lose the war and die the way father died. Or worse.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [A flash of anger spreads across CATELYN's face]
Show them how it feels to lose what they love.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: The next scene shows ROBB'S direwolf, Grey Wind, as he leads House Stark's army to The Twins castle, the ancestral seat of House Frey.  [The scene shifts to the inside of The Twins, as a servant walks around with a plate of bread and salt in observation of the Westerosi tradition of "Guest Right".  ROBB, his wife TALISA MAEGYR, his uncle EDMURE TULLY, his great uncle BRYNDEN "BLACKFISH" TULLY, CATELYN and the Stark army are in the presence of WALDER FREY and his family.  ROBB takes a piece of bread, dips it into the salt and eats it while looking intently at WALDER]
My honored guests, be welcome within my walls and at my table.  I extend to you my hospitality and protection in the light of the Seven.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: We thank you for your hospitality, my lord.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [Servant stops in front of WALDER.  He takes a piece of bread from the plate and eats it]
I have come to make my apologies, my lord, and to beg your forgiveness.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Don't beg my forgiveness, your Grace.  It wasn't me you spurned, it was my girls.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [WALDER signals for his female relatives to appear before ROBB]
One of them was supposed to be queen, now none of them are.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [As WALDER calls each relative by name, they briefly look up at ROBB]
This is Arwyn, my daughter.  My daughter Walda, my daughter Derwa, my daughter Waldra.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [WALDER pauses to chew]
My eldest granddaughters Ginia and Neila.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [EDMURE intently watches the Frey women]
Serra and Sarra, granddaughters, twins.  You could have had either.  Could have had both for all I care.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [EDMURE closes his eyes after hearing WALDER'S comments about his granddaughters]
My granddaughter Marianne.  My granddaughter Freya.  My granddaughter...W-W-Wertha? Waldra? Waldina?
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [WALDER guessing at his granddaughter's name.  EDMURE raises his eyebrows]
I'm Merry.
Speaker: MERRY

Text: Fine.  And here's my youngest daughter Shirei, though she hasn't bled yet.  Clearly you don't have the patience for all that.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [ROBB looks at the Frey women]

My ladies.  All men should keep their word, kings most of all.  I was pledged to marry one of you and I broke that vow.  The fault is not with you.  Any man would be lucky to have any one of you.  I did what I did not to slight you, but because I loved another.  I know these words cannot set right the wrong I have done to you and your house.  I beg your forgiveness and pledge to do all I can to make amends so the Freys of the Crossing and the Starks of Winterfell may once again be friends.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [WALDER claps to signal the dismissal of the Frey women]
Very good.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [WALDER focuses on TALISA]
There she is.  Come closer, let me have a look at you.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [TALISA takes a couple of steps towards WALDER.  WALDER moves forward in his seat and squints]
Still can't see you.  Old eyes.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [TALISA looks at ROBB who nods.  Frey men look on as she takes a couple more steps towards WALDER.  She bows her head]

Love.  That's what the Starks of Winterfell call it, eh?  Heh. Very honorable, I call it a pretty face.  Mmmm, very pretty.  Prettier than this lot, that's for sure.  Very shapely as well.  Oh, you try to hide her under that dress.  If you wanted to hide her, you shouldn't have brought her here in the first place.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [WALDER leans forward with a grin]
I can always see what's going on beneath a dress.  Been at this a long time.  I bet when you take that dress off, everything stays right where it is.  Doesn't drop an inch.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [WALDER grins, ROBB visibly uncomfortable]
Your king says he betrayed me for love.  I say he betrayed me for firm tits and a tight fit.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [ROBB starts to step forward before CATELYN stops him]

And I can respect that.  When I was your age, I'd have broken fifty oaths to get into that without a second thought.  Well, I've enough room in the hall for you lot.  We'll set up tents outside with food and ale for the rest of your men.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [ROBB visibly angry]
Thank you, my lord.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [WALDER stands up and claps]
Well, let's get ready.  The wine will flow red and the music will play loud and we'll put this mess behind us.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: DAARIO NAHARIS, BARRISTAN SELMY, JORAH MORMONT and GREY WORM.  They are looking at a map of Yunkai]
Speaker: [Scene changes to the desert outside of the city of Yunkai on the continent of Essos.  An army of Unsullied are standing guard outside of DAENERYS TARGARYEN'S tent.  Inside her tent are her closest advisers

Text: Where?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: [DAARIO points at a location on the map]
There.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: [DAARIO gets closer to DAENERYS, grabs and guides her hand to the location he was referring to.  JORAH watches him closely]
There, it's a back gate.  My men use it when they visit Yunkai's bed slaves.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Your men but not you?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I have no interest in slaves.  A man cannot make love to property.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: [DAENERYS briefly looks up at DAARIO and JORAH briefly looks at her]
This is where we enter the city.  Very few guards, they know me.  They let me inside.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: We're not gonna sneak an army through a back gate.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: I kill the guards.  I take your two best men and lead them through the back streets, which I know well, and open the front gates.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: [DAARIO nods at JORAH and GREY WORM.  JORAH looks at GREY WORM who briefly looks back]
Then comes the army.  Once the walls are breached, the city will fall in hours.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Or perhaps you'll lead Grey Worm and me to the slaughter, cutting the head off our army.  The masters of Yunkai will pay you your fee and you won't have to split it three ways cause you've already slaughtered your partners.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You have a very suspicious mind.  In my experience, only dishonest people think this way.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: [JORAH sighs and looks at Grey Worm]
You command the Unsullied.  What do you think?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: [Speaking to Grey Worm in Valyrian] Lo jention mirre nūmāzme ēza, iderenna qopsa verdagon issa.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: [In Valyrian] I trust him.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: [Speaking in the Common Tongue (in this case, English) again] You leave tonight.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Very good.  We'll prepare.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: [DAENERYS' advisers start to leave.  DAARIO grins at DAENERYS who looks back at him.  BARRISTAN walks towards JORAH]
Ser Jorah.  You can use an extra sword.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: You're the Queensguard, Ser Barristan.  Your place is by the Queen.  If we are truly her loyal servants, we'll do whatever needs to be done.  No matter the cost, no matter our pride.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: [Scene shifts to Beyond The Wall in the North.  SAMWELL TARLY, GILLY and her baby are walking south towards Castle Black]

We're west of Castle Black, but the Nightfort's closest to us.  It was the first castle on the Wall. The Watch abandoned it during the reign of King Jaehaerys I.  Too big, impossible to maintain.  Other than Castle Black itself, the Nightfort's the perfect castle for us.  It's got a secret sally port, the Black Gate, as old as the Wall itself.  No one's used it for centuries, most likely.  It leads through the Wall right down into the Nightfort, if no one knows how to find it, which, it just so happens I do.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: [GILLY stops and looks at SAMWELL in a confused manner]
How do you know all that?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I read about it in a very old book.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: You know all that from staring at marks on paper?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Yes.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: You're like a wizard.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: [SAMWELL smiles.  Next shot, GILLY and SAMWELL gaze up at the Wall]
Our father used to tell us that no wildling ever looked upon the Wall and lived.  Here we are.  Alive.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: [Scene changes to SANDOR "THE HOUND" CLEGANE and ARYA STARK on horseback in the Riverlands, on their way to The Twins, where THE HOUND plans on returning ARYA to her mother and brother in the hopes of receiving some reward.  They see a PIG FARMER along the way who's having trouble with the wheel spokes on his cart]
Remember what happens to children who run.  I'm your father and I'll do the talking.
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: [THE HOUND hands the horse reins to ARYA and walks over to the PIG FARMER]
The roads have gone right to hell, haven't they? Cracked three spokes this morning.
Speaker: PIG FARMER

Text: Need a hand?
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: Need about eight hands.
Speaker: PIG FARMER

Text: [THE HOUND lifts the cart up]
Got to get this salt pork to The Twins in time for the wedding.
Speaker: PIG FARMER

Text: [PIG FARMER fixes the wheel, THE HOUND sets the cart down]
Many thanks.
Speaker: PIG FARMER

Text: [THE HOUND punches the PIG FARMER in the face, knocking him to the ground.  THE HOUND then unsheathes his dagger and prepares to kill him, prompting ARYA to intervene]
Don't! Don't kill him.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Dead rats don't squeak.
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: You're so dangerous, aren't you? Saying scary things to little girls. Killing little boys and old people.  A real hard man you are.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: More than anyone you know.
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: You're wrong.  I know a killer. A real killer.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: That so?
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: You'd be like a kitten to him.  He'd kill you with his little finger.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: [THE HOUND looks at the PIG FARMER on the ground]
That him?
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: [Confused, ARYA turns her head to look down at the PIG FARMER]
No.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Good.
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: [THE HOUND again tries to approach the PIG FARMER in order to kill him but ARYA again intervenes pushing him back]
Don't kill him!  Please.  Please don't.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: [THE HOUND pauses then sheathes his dagger]
You're very kind.  Someday it'll get you killed.
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: [PIG FARMER starts to regain consciousness.  ARYA grabs a piece of wood from the cart and hits him across the face with it, knocking him out again.  She then walks back to the horse as THE HOUND looks on surprised]
[Scene changes to the North, south of the wall.  BRAN STARK, RICKON STARK, HODOR, JOJEN REED, MEERA REED and OSHA are walking past a windmill]
Where are we?
Speaker: OSHA

Text: The Gift, I think.  Brandon The Builder gave all this land south of the Wall to the Night’s Watch for their sustenance and support.  Maester Luwin taught me that.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Doesn’t seem to be supporting anyone at the moment.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: It’s good land and there’s no war up here.  Why leave?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Wildlings.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: [BRAN looks at OSHA who stares back at him]
Sorry.  But they come over the Wall and raid, steal, carry off women.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Old Nan said they turn your skull into a cup and make you drink your own blood from it.
Speaker: RICKON

Text: [OSHA stares at RICKON who looks back at her]
That’s what Old Nan said.
Speaker: RICKON

Text: There’s a storm coming.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: I don’t see any.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: [Thunder rumbling, everyone looks up at the sky and at the windmill]
It’s as good a place to shelter as any.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: [They begin walking back towards the windmill.  OSHA puts her hand on RICKON’S head]
We can drink some blood while we wait.  I don’t need much.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: [Scene changes showing ORELL’S eagle circling over an old horse breeder’s home.  JON SNOW, TORMUND GIANTSBANE, ORELL, YGRITTE are hiding, waiting for ORELL’S scouting report]
Only one old man and eight good horses.
Speaker: ORELL

Text: What’s one old man doing with eight horses?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: He breeds them for the Watch.
Speaker: JON

Text: How’s he keep folks from stealing them?
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: The Watch protects him.
Speaker: JON

Text: Not today they don’t.  He’s selling horses, he’s got some gold in there.
Speaker: ORELL

Text: And proper steel.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Let’s carve him up.
Speaker: ORELL

Text: We just take the horses and go.  The old man’s no threat.
Speaker: JON

Text: [ORELL looks at TORMUND]
I keep telling you.
Speaker: ORELL

Text: [YGRITTE looks at JON]
He’s an old man.  A spear through the heart’s a better way to die than coughing up your last with no one but your horses to hear.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: [JON looks at TORMUND]
The Watch might send a few men looking for a horse thief.  They’ll send a lot more to hunt down murderers.
Speaker: JON

Text: I hope so.  Killing crows in their castle is tough.  Killing them out here in the open, that’s what we do.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: [TORMUND announces to the rest of the wildlings]
Spread out.  Surround the hut and move in.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: [The wildlings run towards the OLD MAN’S home.  JON smacks his sword, Longclaw, against a rock to alert the OLD MAN and his horses. Upon hearing his horses moving about, the OLD MAN steps outside and sees the wildlings running towards his home.  He gets on one of the horses and starts riding off.  YGRITTE preps her bow and arrow, aiming for the OLD MAN]
Ygritte!
Speaker: JON

Text: [JON intervenes and YGRITTE hits a tree instead]
Clear the barn!
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: [Scene changes to ARYA looking at The Twins.  They’re relatively close.  Meanwhile, THE HOUND eats pig feet by the cart.  ARYA walks back to THE HOUND]
No one’s going to believe you’re a hog farmer if you eat them all.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: [THE HOUND waves a pig’s foot at ARYA]
Best part of the animal.
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: [THE HOUND continues to eat while ARYA gazes back at the Twins]
Don’t worry, they’re still there.
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: [ARYA angrily turns back and looks at THE HOUND]
I know they’re still there.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You check every five minutes like you’re afraid they’re gonna move.
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: I’m not afraid.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Of course you are.  You’re almost there and you’re afraid you won’t make it.  The closer you get, the worse the fear gets.  No point in trying to hide behind that face.  I know fear when I see it.  Seen it a lot.
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: I knew fear when I saw it in you.  You’re afraid of fire.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: [THE HOUND pauses]
When Beric’s sword went up in flames, you looked like a scared little girl.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: [ARYA moves in closer to THE HOUND]
And I know why, too.  I heard what your brother did to you.  Pressed your face to the fire like you’re a nice juicy mutton chop.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: That give you some ideas?
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: [ARYA turns her back to THE HOUND]
Might do.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Go ahead then.  You might get away.  Might even make it there on your own.  They’re just over the river.  The closest you’ve been to family since Ilyn Payne snipped your daddy’s neck.
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: [ARYA turns around and angrily stares at THE HOUND]
Someday I’m gonna put a sword through your eye and out the back of your skull.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: [THE HOUND stares back at ARYA as she walks away to get a closer look at the Twins as thunder rumbles in the sky]
[Scene changes back to BRAN and company inside of the windmill.  The storm has already begun]
How are we going to get past the Wall?  My uncle said it’s 700 feet high.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: [OSHA looks at Bran and he looks at her]
How did you get past it?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Got in a boat and rowed past the Bay of Seals.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: It would take us two months to get to the Bay of Seals.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Some climb straight up the ice.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: [BRAN looks at HODOR]
Even Hodor’s not strong enough to climb the Wall with me on his back.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: [HODOR visibly scared of the thunder]
Hodor!
Speaker: HODOR

Text: Nineteen castles guard the Wall.  Only three are still manned.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: [HODOR still shaken from the thunder]
Hodor!
Speaker: Hodor

Text: One of those abandoned fortresses will give us a way through.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: My uncle said the gates were sealed with ice and stone when the castles were deserted.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: [MEERA looks at Bran]
Well, we’ll have to open them up again.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: [MEERA gazes outside and sees the OLD MAN on horseback]
[From outside] Whoa, whoa, whoa!
Speaker: OLD MAN

Text: There’s a rider out there.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Just one?
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: [Thunder rumbles]
There’s more.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Hodor!
Speaker: HODOR

Text: [Horses neighing outside.  OSHA tries to quiet down HODOR]
It’s just thunder, sweet giant.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: [From outside]  I yield.  I yield.
Speaker: OLD MAN

Text: Wildlings.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: [OSHA starts turning her head then gazes outside]
[To BRAN and RICKON]  Where’s Shaggydog and Summer?
Speaker: OSHA

Text: Hunting.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: [Thunder rumbles]
Hodor!
Speaker: HODOR

Text: [HODOR stands up]
Shhh, quiet, Hodor.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: Hodor!
Speaker: HODOR

Text: [To BRAN] Make him shut up.  If they hear us…
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: [To Hodor] Hush, Hodor.  No, no more Hodoring.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: [OSHA tries to hold HODOR back but he pushes her aside and starts yelling and moving around anxiously]
Hodor!
Speaker: HODOR

Text: [HODOR continues Hodoring]
Hodor, calm down.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You need to keep quiet.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: They’re gonna hear us.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: [HODOR continues Hodoring.  ORELL hears voices coming out of the windmill.  He stops and looks up]
Hodor, be quiet.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: [HODOR continues Hodoring]
Hodor, calm down.  Hodor, be quiet!
Speaker: BRAN

Text: [BRAN’S eyes roll back as he wargs into HODOR.  HODOR stops making noises as he falls to his knees and then falls asleep on the ground.  ORELL is still looking up at the windmill from the outside.  Inside of the windmill, everybody is in shock at what just happened]
[To BRAN] What did you do?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Nothing.  I don’t know.
Speaker: Bran

Text: [The sound of a horse is heard from outside.  OSHA gets near the windmill opening]
What’s That?
Speaker: RICKON

Text: That’s a horse dying.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: [Scene shifts to the wildlings who are outside of the windmill with the OLD MAN.  ORELL is still looking up at the windmill]
Bring them over here.
Speaker: WILDLING 1

Text: That was the last of them.  The rest are dead.
Speaker: WILDLING 2

Text: [To TORMUND] I heard shouting up there.
Speaker: ORELL

Text: Thunder.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I know the difference between shouting and thunder.
Speaker: ORELL

Text: Maybe it's ghosts.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: [ORELL’s eagle is seen circling over the windmill.  TORMUND approaches the OLD MAN who is sitting on the ground.  He pulls a knife out on TORMUND, YGRITTE gets her bow and arrow out and aims for the OLD MAN]
That won’t help you, grandpa.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: [TORMUND sticks his hand out, asking for the knife.  The OLD MAN gives it to TORMUND, who tosses it aside]
Where you riding?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Doesn’t matter now, does it?
Speaker: OLD MAN

Text: No, it doesn’t matter now.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Cut his throat or he’ll tell the crows we’re here.
Speaker: ORELL

Text: [TORMUND unsheathes his sword]
You understand.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Let me stand at least.
Speaker: OLD MAN

Text: [BRAN and RICKON’S direwolves, Shaggydog and Summer, are seen hiding behind a cart, outside of the windmill]
Let me go with a bit of dignity.
Speaker: OLD MAN

Text: [TORMUND helps the OLD MAN get up.  He then gets in position for the kill]
[Looks at JON] Make the crow kill him. [Walks towards JON]  You’re one of us now.  Prove it.
Speaker: Orell

Text: [YGRITTE, TORMUND and the OLD MAN stare back at JON.  The scene changes to back inside of the windmill]
[Looks at BRAN]  The wolves are out there.
Speaker: Jojen

Text: I can’t do it by choice.  I don’t know how.  It happens in my dreams.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You’re a warg, Bran.  It’s in your blood.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: I can’t.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You just did, with him.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: [JOJEN looks at HODOR who is still resting]
A wolf is nothing compared to that.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: [Scene switches back to outside of the windmill.  JON unsheathes Longclaw.  He places his sword against the OLD MAN’S neck]
She looks sharp.
Speaker: OLD MAN

Text: [JON nods his head.  The OLD MAN closes his eyes and starts praying, JON hesitates]
[Looks at Jon]  Do it.  Do it.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: [JON looks back at YGRITTE]
Told ya.  He’s still one of them.
Speaker: ORELL

Text: Go on, boy.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: [JON glares back at TORMUND]
Go on!
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: [JON raises his sword but hesitates. YGRITTE shoots the OLD MAN in the chest with an arrow, killing him.  This prompts ORELL and TORMUND to reach for their swords]
He’s a crow.  He’ll always be a crow.  And here’s his crow wife guarding him.  He’ll stab us in the back first chance he gets.
Speaker: ORELL

Text: [JON and YGRITTE are standing side by side in defensive positions]
Kill him!
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: [YGRITTE prepares to shoot an arrow at either ORELL or TORMUND but JON pushes her to the ground first.  JON, ORELL and the other wildlings have a sword fight while TORMUND runs towards YGRITTE.  She starts yelling and screaming as TORMUND tries to restrain her]
He’s one of them!
Speaker: Tormund

Text: No!
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: Do you hear me?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: [YGRITTE bites TORMUND’S arm which causes him to lose his grip on her.  She starts running away but TORMUND grabs her and tackles her to the ground]
You’re not gonna die for one of them.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: [Scene switches back to inside of the windmill.  Everybody is looking at BRAN]
Do it.  They’ll find us if you don’t.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: [BRAN’S eyes roll back as he wargs into Summer.  Scene goes back outside to JON fighting the wildlings.  Suddenly, the direwolves start attacking the wildlings.  JON continues fighting ORELL until he impales him with Longclaw]
You were right the whole time.
Speaker: JON

Text: [JON twists his sword as ORELL wargs into his eagle right before dying.  The eagle attacks JON, biting and scratching his face.  JON tosses the eagle aside and makes a run for one of the OLD MAN’S horses.  He starts riding away as TORMUND and YGRITTE look on]
[The scene changes to Yunkai.  DAARIO, JORAH and GREY WORM are outside of the back gate]
When you hear a songbird’s whistle, you come.  I’m a great whistler, the greatest in the land.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: [DAARIO approaches the back gate, a guard yells at him in Valyrian]
Daario Naharis.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: [The guard lets DAARIO in as JORAH and GREY WORM wait.  In the distance, DAARIO whistles.  JORAH and GREY WORM go through the back gate and into Yunkai.  They see two dead guards and DAARIO sitting down]
That one was quick.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: [DAARIO wiping blood off his arakh, a Dothraki blade]
There may be others.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I doubt it.  The Yunkish prefer to let their slaves do their fighting for them.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: [Suddenly, they’re surrounded by Yunkai guards.  A brief fight ensues.  DAARIO throws a knife by JORAH’S head, killing a Yunkai guard who was behind him.  The trio defeat the first wave of guards]
[Addressing DAARIO] That’s what you call a few guards?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: [DAARIO smiles at JORAH as more Yunkish guards appear, surrounding the trio]

[The scene changes to right outside of The Twins, where the Stark army are set up in tents and passing the time with some wrestling.  It then switches to inside of The Twins, at the wedding ceremony of EDMURE and WALDER’S daughter, ROSLIN FREY. WALDER walks the bride to the altar, her face is covered with a veil.  EDMURE is standing at the altar, looking worried, as ROBB and his family are looking on.  ROBB turns his head back towards WALDER and ROSLIN, while ROOSE BOLTON stares at ROBB.  As WALDER approaches, he trades glances with ROBB.  When WALDER and ROSLIN finally reach the altar, he removes her veil.  EDMURE'S fear of an ugly bride are put to rest when he finally sees how beautiful ROSLIN is.  ROSLIN gets down on her knees in front of EDMURE]
Lord Edmure, I hope I’m not a disappointment to you.
Speaker: ROSLIN

Text: [EDMURE helps ROSLIN up]
You’re a delight to me, my lady.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: [ROSLIN smiles]
You may now cloak the bride and bring her under your protection.
Speaker: SEPTON

Text: [EDMURE removes his cloak as he goes behind ROSLIN to drape it over her shoulders.  ROSLIN and ROBB trade glances.  ROBB then looks at WALDER who gives him a strange look before grinning.  EDMURE finishes putting the cloak on ROSLIN, then looks at CATELYN who smiles at him.  He walks back to ROSLIN’S side and the SEPTON ties EDMURE and ROSLIN'S hands together]
In the sight of the Seven, I hereby seal these two souls, binding them as one for eternity.  Look upon each other and say the words.
Speaker: SEPTON

Text: [EDMURE and ROSLIN turn to each other]
Father, Smith, Warrior, Mother, Maiden, Crone, Stranger.  I am hers (I am his) and she is mine (he is mine) from this day until the end of my days.
Speaker: EDMURE & ROSLIN

Text: [BLACKFISH looks at the ugly Frey women who smile back at him.  He quickly turns around]
[Scene changes to inside of the windmill.  It’s nighttime.  OSHA lights a candle]
Is that safe?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: They’re long gone.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: [Looks at JOJEN] You were right.  I can get inside Summer’s mind whenever I want.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Of course you can.  North of the Wall there are wildlings who can control all sorts of animals.  But you did a lot more than that.  You got inside Hodor’s mind.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: [Shot of HODOR still resting]
They can’t do that north of the Wall?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: No one can do that.  Anywhere.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: [Looks at RICKON]  When I was looking through Summer’s eyes, I saw Jon.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Where?
Speaker: RICKON

Text: He was with the wildlings.  They tried to kill him but he got away.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: He’ll be heading back to Castle Black then.  That’s where we should go.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: For all we know, Castle Black’s already under attack.  If this many wildlings got through-
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I already told you.  I’m not going north of the Wall.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: Everything Jojen told me is true.  You saw what I did to Hodor.  I have to find the three-eyed raven.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: [OSHA grabs BRAN by the hand]
Listen to me, little lord.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: Don’t worry, I’m not asking you to come with me.  It won’t be safe for Rickon.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: [Surprised] Me? I’m coming with you.
Speaker: RICKON

Text: No.  You and Osha and Shaggydog head for the Last Hearth.  The Umbers are our bannermen.  They’ll protect you.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I’m coming with you.  I’m your brother.  I have to protect you.
Speaker: RICKON

Text: Right now, I have to protect you.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: [RICKON'S eyes start tearing up]
Robb’s at war and I’m going beyond the Wall.  If something happens to us, you’re the heir to Winterfell.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: [RICKON shakes his head with tears in his eyes]
[Looks at OSHA]  Will you know how to find the last Hearth?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You Southerners build your big castles and you never move.  You’re easy to find.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: [RICKON stands up and looks at OSHA]
We’re not Southerners.
Speaker: RICKON

Text: [RICKON turns around to look at BRAN]
And I don’t want to leave you.
Speaker: RICKON

Text: Shhh.  [She grabs RICKON by the waist and sits him on her lap]  Come here, little soldier.  You and me, we’re gonna have some adventures.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: [RICKON starts crying.  BRAN looks at OSHA]
You don’t have to do any of this.
Speaker: Bran

Text: [RICKON cries as OSHA strokes his hair]

Your family took me in and was good to me when they had no cause to be.  [To RICKON] Shhh.  We’ll be fine, you and me.  The Umbers are great warriors.  Even I heard about them growing up.  They’ll teach you how to swing a sword.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: [Crying, looks at OSHA]  I know how to swing a sword.
Speaker: RICKON

Text: [OSHA strokes RICKON’S hair and kisses him on the head.  She then gets up and helps RICKON up as well]
You’re leaving now?  It’s the middle of the night.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I learned to walk in darkness.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: [OSHA kisses RICKON on the head again]
Say your good-byes, little man.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: [RICKON walks one step before dropping to his knees to give BRAN a tight hug.  The Reeds look at BRAN and RICKON and then switch their gaze to OSHA]
[Looks at the Reeds] Keep this one safe.  [MEERA gives a slight nod]  He means the world to me.
Speaker: Osha

Text: [Final shot of BRAN and RICKON hugging followed by a shot of OSHA and RICKON exiting the windmill, with Shaggydog leading the way]

[Scene shifts to DAENERYS’ tent outside of the city of Yunkai.  It’s nighttime and there are Unsullied soldiers surrounding the tent.  The next shot is inside of the tent.  BARRISTAN is having a drink, MISSANDEI presents some food to DAENERYS who is sitting down.  She suddenly gets up and ignores the food, as she approaches BARRISTAN with impatience]
We’ve been waiting a long time. [BARRISTAN looks at her]  Haven’t we?  [BARRISTAN shrugs]  Well I don’t know, you tell me.  How long does it take to sack a city?
Speaker: Daenerys

Text: [BARRISTAN briefly ponders the question before JORAH, GREY WORM and several Unsullied guards arrive.  JORAH and GREY WORM are both tired and covered in blood]
[Looks at DAENERYS]  It was just as you said.  They did not believe until it was too late.  Their slave soldiers threw down their spears and surrendered.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: [DAENERYS likes the news but her face suddenly shows some worry]
And Daario Naharis?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: [JORAH’S face goes from a smile to a look of shock.  Suddenly, DAARIO emerges from behind the Unsullied guards, with a Yunkai flag draped over his shoulder and his face covered in blood.  He walks towards DAENERYS and drops to one knee.  He drapes the flag over his knee and looks up at DAENERYS]
The city is yours, my queen.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: [DAENERYS starts to smile]

[The scene shifts to the wedding celebration inside of The Twins.  A band is playing music on the balcony of the hall.  WALDER is seated on the high chair at the main table, underneath the balcony where the musicians are playing.  Seated to his left are ROSLIN and EDMURE.  Seated to his right is his wife, JOYEUSE FREY.  Stark men and Frey men and women are celebrating the marriage.  TALISA is seated at a table towards the front, near WALDER'S main table.  Next to her is LOTHAR FREY, one of WALDER'S many sons]
[Looking at the band and talking to LOTHAR] They’re good, aren’t they?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: They ought to be because they cost enough.
Speaker: LOTHAR

Text: [ROBB takes a drink and starts laughing.  Next shot is from across the hall, where ROOSE, BLACKFISH and CATELYN are seated, enjoying themselves]
Look at the crowd there.
Speaker: BLACKFISH

Text: [Seated next to BLACKFISH is WENDEL MANDERLY of House Manderly.  Next to him is BLACK WALDER FREY, another one of WALDER'S sons]
[Looking at EDMURE and talking to BLACKFISH] He complained about this marriage the entire ride from Riverrun and now look at him.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: [Shot of EDMURE whispering in ROSLIN'S ear as she smiles]
The God’s love to reward a fool.
Speaker: BLACKFISH

Text: [Laughs] Uncle.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: What? He’s my nephew, I love him.  And he’s a damned fool.
Speaker: BLACKFISH

Text: [CATELYN and BLACKFISH both laugh.  A servant tries to pour some wine into ROOSE'S cup but he covers it with his hand before she can pour anything.  CATELYN looks at ROOSE]
Don’t you drink, Lord Bolton?
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Never do, my lady.  Dulls the senses.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: That’s the point. [Still talking to ROOSE while the servant pours him more wine] Didn’t you marry one of these Frey girls?
Speaker: BLACKFISH

Text: Aye.  Lord Walder let me choose any of his granddaughters and promised me the girl’s weight in silver as a dowry.  So I have a fat, young bride.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: [ROOSE smiles and BLACKFISH laughs.  CATELYN gives ROOSE a serious look]
I hope she makes you very happy.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Well, she’s made me very rich.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Pardon, my lord, my lady.  I need to find a tree to piss on.
Speaker: BLACKFISH

Text: [BLACKFISH gets up from his seat and begins exiting the hall, as ROBB and TALISA look on]
My mother’s alone with Roose Bolton.  I should rescue her.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Your mother is less in need of rescue than any woman I’ve ever met.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Be kind.  She’s finally starting to like you.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: And I like her.  But if she had her way, I would be back in Volantis, playing my harp and you would be sitting over there [Looks at EDMURE and ROSLIN], eating blackberries out of Roslin Frey’s hand.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Perhaps I’ve made a terrible mistake.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [TALISA gasps and tries to strike ROBB but he catches her hand]
Striking your king is an act of treason.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [ROBB and TALISA look at each other before ROBB tries to kiss her.  TALISA stops him]
No, don’t.  Don’t insult them.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: [Addressing ROBB loudly so everybody can hear] Your Grace.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [Everybody starts knocking on the tables.  WALDER signals for the music and knocking to stop]

The Septon has prayed his prayers, some words were said and Lord Edmure has wrapped my daughter in a cloak.  But they are not yet man and wife.  A sword needs a sheath [Everybody laughs]. And a wedding needs a bedding [Everybody cheers].  What does my sire say?
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [Knocking on the tables, chanting] To bed! To bed! To bed!
Speaker: EVERYBODY

Text: [Gets up from his seat and addresses WALDER] If you think the time is right, Lord Walder, by all means, let us bed them.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [Everybody cheers, the band starts playing celebratory music again.  EDMURE smiles, ROSLIN looks concerned.  Men start getting up from their seats and approach the main table]
[Chanting] To bed! To bed! To bed!
Speaker: EVERYBODY

Text: [The men pick up ROSLIN and carry her out of the hall.  The women grab EDMURE and start bringing him out as well. TALISA looks worried when she sees ROSLIN being carried away.  Everybody is cheering on.  The men start removing some of ROSLIN'S clothes while the women start doing the same to EDMURE]
Ho-ho!  Careful now, ladies.  Once you set that monster free, there’s no caging him again [Laughs].
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: [ROBB looks on smiling and clapping.  TALISA looks at ROBB with a worried look]
[Chanting] To bed! To bed! To bed!
Speaker: EVERYBODY

Text: [ROOSE and CATELYN look at ROSLIN and EDMURE being carried out of the hall]
Poor girl.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: Every bride suffers the same.  I’m sure you endured yours with grace.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Oh, Ned forbade it.  He said it wouldn’t be right if he broke a man’s jaw on our wedding night.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: [ROOSE looks at CATELYN and chuckles before walking away]
[ROBB and TALISA watch as the bedding procession is almost finished]
That is a very strange custom.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: I suppose it does seem strange from a foreigner’s perspective.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: It seems normal to you?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: It’s tradition. [TALISA stares at ROBB]  Without the bedding ceremony, there’s no real proof the lord and lady consummated their marriage.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [TALISA puts her hand on ROBB'S shoulder, runs it down his arm, before grabbing his hand and placing it on her stomach]
No, but there are other ways of providing proof.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Boy or girl?
Speaker: ROBB

Text: I don’t know.  But if it’s a boy, I know what we should name him.
Speaker: TALISA

Text: Oh, do you?   It seems to me the father should have some say in his son’s naming.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: Eddard. [Catches ROBB by surprise] Don’t you want to teach little Ned Stark how to ride horses?
Speaker: TALISA

Text: I do.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [ROBB and TALISA kiss.  CATELYN looks on and smiles as BLACK WALDER walks towards the door of the hall to close it.  He walks back and the band starts playing the Lannister song, “The Rains of Castamere.”  The band’s expression is very serious and the song isn’t as cheerful as their previous songs.  CATELYN looks up at the band with a worried expression.  Scene changes to outside of The Twins, Grey Wind is locked up in a kennel, whimpering, sensing something is wrong as Frey soldiers are on the move.  The scene then changes again to the main gate of The Twins, where the tents are set up and men are still celebrating. THE HOUND and ARYA approach the gate, riding the pig farmer’s cart]
Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa.
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: [Three Frey guards stop THE HOUND and ARYA from entering The Twins]
Where are you going?
Speaker: FREY GUARD

Text: Got salt pork for the feast.
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: The feast is over.
Speaker: FREY GUARD

Text: It doesn’t sound like it’s over.
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: [ARYA watches as Frey soldiers run into the Twins]
If I tell you it’s over, it’s over.  [Angrily] Turn this cart around and get the hell out of here.
Speaker: FREY GUARD

Text: Got pig’s feet, too [ARYA looks up].
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: [Infuriated] Are you soft in the head?  Turn this cart around!
Speaker: FREY GUARD

Text: [THE HOUND gives up.  As he looks back, he notices that ARYA is not in the cart.  The scene then switches back to the hall inside of The Twins.  WALDER signals for everybody to be quiet.  He addresses ROBB]
Your Grace.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [WALDER stands up with a cup in his hand.  Everybody takes a seat except ROBB.  ROOSE returns to the hall and sits next to CATELYN]
I feel I’ve been remiss in my duties.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [CATELYN looks scared.  ROOSE slowly turns his head to look at CATELYN.  He's smiling as he looks down at his arm, inviting CATELYN to take a look]
I’ve given you meat and wine and music but I haven’t shown you the hospitality you deserve.  My king has married and I owe my new queen a wedding gift.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [CATELYN pulls back ROOSE'S sleeve, she sees that he’s wearing chainmail.  She starts gasping as ROOSE stares at her.  She suddenly gets up from her seat and slaps ROOSE across the face, prompting him to run to the other side of the hall]
Robb!
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: [LOTHAR pulls a knife out of his sleeve and repeatedly stabs TALISA in the stomach from behind.  She starts screaming as ROBB looks on in horror.  As ROBB starts to approach her, the band now have crossbows and they shoot arrows at Robb, hitting him.  The rest of the Frey men in the hall start slaughtering the Stark men.  ROBB is repeatedly shot with arrows and falls to the ground.  TALISA falls to the ground in agony.  CATELYN in shock over ROBB, gets hit in the shoulder by an arrow, making her fall down.  As the massacre continues, WALDER smiles and sips from his cup.  The scene then switches to ARYA sneaking into The Twins.  She hides behind a barrel and watches some Stark men eating with Frey men in front of the kennel that Grey Wind is in]
[Laughing] You ready to head home to Winterfell, eh? [Men laughing]
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: [ARYA grins]
Feast over yet, is it?
Speaker: MAN 2

Text: Aye, it’s over! [Slit’s the throat of a Stark soldier]
Speaker: FREY MAN

Text: [The Frey men kill the Stark men.  They flip over the table and march off as ARYA hides in the shadows of the barrels.  ARYA can hear Grey Wind whimpering as he tries to break out of the locked kennel.  She goes behind the flipped over table and sees Grey Wind jumping up and down.  Suddenly, Frey men appear with crossbows.  Grey Wind growls at them before they shoot him to death.  ARYA is horrified.  She watches as Grey Wind takes his last breath and dies.  She then notices more Frey men emerging from a doorway.  She starts walking towards the doorway until THE HOUND puts his hand on her shoulder and turns her around]
It’s too late.
Speaker: THE HOUND

Text: [THE HOUND hits ARYA on the back of the head, knocking her out.  He carries her over his shoulder and starts exiting The Twins.  The scene then changes to CATELYN crawling underneath the table at the hall with the arrow still lodged in her shoulder.  She notices JOYEUSE hiding underneath the main table.  ROBB gazes at TALISA laying on the ground with her hand on her bloodied stomach.  He starts crawling towards her.  WALDER notices and signals for everybody to stop]
The King in the North arises, heh heh.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [ROBB places one hand on TALISA'S stomach and lifts her head up with his other hand.  She has already died.  CATELYN grabs a dagger and emerges from under the table.  She grabs JOYEUSE by the hair and drags her out from under the main table.  CATELYN presses the dagger against JOYEUSE'S throat as WALDER looks on.  The archers fix their sights on CATELYN]

Lord Walder!  Lord Walder, enough!  Let it end!  Please!  He is my son! [ROBB is still cradling TALISA on the floor]  My first son!  Let him go and I swear that we will forget this!  I swear it by the Old Gods and New!  We will take no vengeance.
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: [Angrily] You already swore me one oath right here in my castle.  You swore by all the Gods, your son would marry my daughter!
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [ROBB lays TALISA'S head on the ground]
Take me for a hostage but let Robb go!  Robb, get up! Get up and walk out!  Please!  Please!
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: And why I would let him do that?
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [CATELYN straightens up and presses the dagger harder against JOYEUSE'S neck]
On my honor as a Tully, on my honor as a Stark, let him go or I will cut your wife’s throat!
Speaker: CATELYN

Text: [ROBB starts to stand up]
I’ll find another.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: [ROBB turns to CATELYN]
Mother.
Speaker: ROBB

Text: [CATELYN turns to ROBB with tears in her eyes as ROOSE suddenly reappears in front of ROBB.  He faces ROBB and grabs him by the shoulder]
The Lannisters send their regards.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: [ROOSE thrusts a dagger into ROBB'S heart. While still staring at CATELYN, ROBB dies and collapses to the floor next to TALISA.  CATELYN wails loudly while WALDER takes a sip from his cup.  She slits JOYEUSE'S throat with the dagger, killing her.  JOYEUSE falls to the ground with blood spraying from her neck and CATELYN drops the dagger.  She looks on hopelessly, in a dreary daze.  After a long pause, BLACK WALDER finally emerges behind CATELYN and slits her throat, killing her.  She falls to the floor with blood spraying from her neck]
[Cut To Black]
[End Credits.  No music]
INT. KING'S LANDING

The camera pans up to the hold of a sword hewn from Valeryan steel. Tywin draws it and hands it to a blacksmith, who knocks its hilt off with a hammer, and then places the blade into the forge. It melts into molten sludge and is then recast into two swords. Tywin throws the carcass of a wolf into the fire.
INT. Jaime holds up a sword, admiring it.
Magnificent.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Mm-hmm.

Speaker: JAIME

Text: It is.

Text: No one's made a Valyrian steel sword since the Doom of Valyria.

Text: There are three living smiths who know how to rework Valyrian steel. The finest of them was in Volantis. Came here to King's Landing at my invitation.

You've wanted one of these in the family for a long time.

Text: The original weapon was absurdly large. Plenty of steel for two swords.

Text: Well, thank you. It's glorious.
Speaker: JAIME

You'll have to train your left hand.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Any decent swordsman knows how to use both hands.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You'll never be as good.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: No. But as long as I'm better than everyone else, I suppose it doesn't matter.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You can't serve in the Kingsguard with one hand.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Where's that written? I can and I will. The Kingsguard oath is for life.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The war is over. The king is safe. The king is never safe.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: How many people in this city alone would love to see his head on a pike?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Other knights protected the king while you were a prisoner. They will continue to do so when you go home.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Home?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You'll return to Casterly Rock and rule in my stead.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: You are the Lord of Casterly Rock.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I am the King's Hand. My place is here. I don't expect to see the Rock again before I die.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: You know what they call me? Kingslayer. Oathbreaker. Man without honor. Now you want me to break another sacred vow.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You won't be breaking anything. There is a precedent to relieve a Kingsguard of his duties. The king will exercise that prerogative.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: No.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: No?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: No.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I don't believe I asked you a question.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: There's my answer.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: If you think your bloody honor comes before...
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: My bloody honor is beyond repair, but my answer is still no. I don't want Casterly Rock. I don't want a wife. I don't want children.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: What do you want?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Supper would be nice.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: For 40 years I've tried to teach you. If you haven't learned by now, you never will. Go. If serving as a glorified bodyguard is the sum of your ambition, go serve.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I suppose you want the sword back.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Keep it.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: JAIME grabs the sword.
A one-handed man with no family needs all the help he can get.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: JAIME picks up the sword and exits

Swaddled them, rocked them, fed them at her own breast. Elia wouldn't let the wet nurse touch them. And beautiful, noble Rhaegar Targaryen left her for another woman. Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: Where's Daario Naharis? Where's Grey Worm?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Gambling, Your Grace.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: Gambling?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Annoyed, DAENERYS strides forward. MISSANDEI follows briskly. They walk between rows and rows of unsullied.
ESSOS village exterior.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The crowd bows in reverence as DAENERYS and MISSANDEI stride past.
Mhysa. Mhysa. Mhysa...
Speaker: CROWD

Text: How long have they been at it?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Since midnight, Your Grace.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: They come upon DAARIO NAHARIS and GREY WORM, who sit cross legged facing one another. Each of them holds their arms extended straight before them,  their weapons resting atop. Apparently, this is a game of endurance.
Ser Worm is stronger than he looks. But I can see his arms beginning to shake.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: What's the prize to winning this stupid contest?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The honor of riding by your side on the road to Meereen.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: That honor goes to Ser Jorah and Ser Barristan as neither of them kept me waiting this morning. You two will ride in the rear guard and protect the livestock.
Speaker: DENERYS

Text: DAENERYS turns to leave, but neither of the men budge.
The last man holding his sword can find a new queen to fight for.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAARIO and GREY WORM drop their arms simultaneously. Their weapons fall to the sand. DAARIO groans, while MISSANDEI gives GREY WORM a look. DARIO nods to GREY WORM and they both stand.
(in valerian) You like this girl? Must be frustrating.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: (in valerian) You are not a smart man, Daario Naharis.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: (in valerian) I'd rather have no brains and two balls.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAARIO leaves, and GREY WORM watches, stretching his aching shoulders.
EXT. King's Landing.
MAREI stands in the background while. SHAE fills a plate from a garden banquet table, and places it before SANSA, who sits motionless.
You need to eat something.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: SANSA does not respond.
Pigeon pie.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: No, thank you.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SHAE looks back to the table for other options, and picks up SANSA's plate.
Lemon cakes?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: No, thank you.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You love lemon cakes.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: TYRION enters.
Tell her she needs to eat.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: My lady, you do need to eat.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I don't need to eat.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: If I could have a moment alone with my wife.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: MAREI leaves, but SHAE stays. TYRION nodes, imploringly.
She needs to eat.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: SHAE exits and TYRION sits at the table with SANSA. He takes her hand.
I can't let you starve.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: SHAE looks back in anger.
I swore to protect you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: SANSA looks away and removes her hand from Tyrion's.
My lady, I am your husband. Let me help you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: How can you help me?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I don't know, but I can try.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I lie awake all night staring at the canopy thinking about how they died.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I could get you essence of nightshade to help you sleep.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Do you know what they did to my brother? How they sewed his direwolf's head onto his body? And my mother. They say they cut her throat to the bone and threw her body in the river.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: What happened to your family was a terrible crime. I didn't know your brother. He seemed like a good man, but I didn't know him. Your mother, on the other hand, I admired her. She wanted to have me executed, but I admired her. She was a strong woman. And she was fierce when it came to protecting her children. Sansa. Your mother would want you to carry on. You know it's true.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: SANSA stands, and TYRION does as well, in politeness.
Will you pardon me, my lord? I'd like to visit the godswood.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Of course. Of course. Prayer can be helpful, I hear.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I don't pray anymore. It's the only place I can go where people don't talk to me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA exits and TYRION watches her go.
INT. TYRION's chambers.
Tyrion enters, and shuts the door. Shae lies in his bed.
My lion.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: What are you doing?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What does it look like I'm doing? Come here.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: How many times have I told you? You can't visit me here.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I know. I know. We have come to a dangerous place. Have you forgotten me? Do you know how long it's been?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Of course I haven't forgotten.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I want you. Don't you want me?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Things are a bit tense right now.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What things?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: My nephew the king wants to murder me. My wife hates me because my father murdered her family. Oberyn Martell wants to murder everyone whose last name is Lannister.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You need to relax.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: SHAE takes TYRION's fingers into her mouth to moisten them, then places his hand under her dress.
Don't you want to relax?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: SHAE tries to kiss him, but TYRION removes his hand in defiance.
What's wrong?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: I told you. It's not a good time.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It's never a good time. You have your child bride now.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Shae.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Do you love her?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Love her? I barely know her. She's a child. She despises me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: That's not an answer.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Of course I don't love her.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You tried to ship me away.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Ship you away?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Give me diamonds and make me disappear.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: What in the world are you talking about?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: If you want me to leave, just say it. Say it!
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Shh. I don't know what you're talking about.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You want me to stay?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: TYRION does not respond. SHAE picks up her shoe and leaves in anger. MAREI is eavesdropping behind a column.
INT. King's Landing.
QYBURN places a sleeve over the stump of JAIME's wrist. He then grabs a golden hand and pushes it onto Jaime's stump, twisting it into place. JAIME groans and grimaces.
(Groans)
Speaker: JAIME

Text: A work of art, really. The craftsmanship is excellent.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: CERSEI pours wine in the foreground.
You like it so much, you're welcome to chop off your own hand and take it.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Days?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Better part of an afternoon. There, how does that feel?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: JAIME moves his metal hand around for effect.
Uh... a hook would be more practical.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Elegant, I think.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: QYBURN squeeze the hand firmly into place, and JAIME winces. QYBURN starts to depart but CERSEI intercepts him.
Thank you for your help with the other matter.
Speaker: CERSIE

Text: The symptoms have abated?
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Gone completely. I am in your debt, Maester Qyburn.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Not a maester, Your Grace, but happy to help whenever I can.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: QYBURN turns to JAIME, who waves his fake hand meekly. QYBURN gives CERSEI one last look, and exits.
Odd little man.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I've grown rather fond of him. He's quite talented, you know?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: What symptoms?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Symptoms that are not your concern.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You let him touch you?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You jealous?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I'm surprised. You never let Pycelle near you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: (Laughs) You think I'd let that old lecher put his hands on me? He smells like a dead cat.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I'm not sure I've ever smelled a dead cat.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Well, they smell like Pycelle.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You drink more than you used to.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Yes.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Why?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Let's see, you started a brawl in the streets with Ned Stark and disappeared from the capital. My husband died in a tragic hunting accident.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: It must have been traumatic for you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: My only daughter was shipped off to Dorne. We suffered through a siege.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: A rather short siege.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: A rather short siege that I didn't expect to survive. And now I'm marrying my eldest son to a wicked little bitch from Highgarden while I'm supposed to marry her brother, a renowned pillow biter. So...
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: JAIME sits beside her.
Father disowned me today.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He can't disown you. You're all he's got.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You're forgetting Tyrion.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You don't really plan on staying in the Kingsguard, do you?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: JAIME takes her hand.
Staying in the Kingsguard means I live right here in the Red Keep with you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He moves to kiss her.
Not now.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I want... Not now? When? I've been back for weeks.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: CERSEI does not answer.
Something's changed.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Everything's changed. You come back after all this time with no apologies and one hand and expect everything to be the same?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: What do you want me to apologize for?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: For leaving me.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You think I wanted to be taken prisoner?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Don't know what you wanted. You weren't here. You left me alone.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Every day I was a prisoner, I plotted my escape. Every day. I murdered people so I could be here with you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You took too long.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I... What are you saying?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I'm saying you took too long.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: There is a knocking at the door.
Come in.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Go away.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: MAREI enters.
Forgive me, Your Grace. You told me to come at once if there was anything important.
Speaker: MAREI

Text: EXT. North of the wall.
YGRITTE sits fletching arrows. TORMUND approaches.
You plan on killing all the crows yourself?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Do you plan on sitting here scratching your balls till winter?
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: We wait for Mance's orders.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: You sent a man over the Wall at the full moon. If he's not back yet, he's not coming back.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: And what is it you want? March on Castle Black with just this lot? Your pretty crow said 1,000 men are nesting there.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Yeah, well, he's a liar.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: He is? Shouldn't it be "he was"? You said you put three arrows in him.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I did.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: I've seen you slip a shaft through a rabbit's eye at 200 yards. If that boy's still walking, it's 'cause you let him go.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: A wildling whistles from above. TORMUND and YGRITTE turn to look, and rise.
The crevice
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: YGRITTE and TORMUND lead a group of wildlings with weapons draw. Other wildings stand above the crevice where they advance.  Some Thenns approach, led by the menacing STYR.
Thenns. I fucking hate Thenns.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: TORMUND sheathes his sword. The Thenns come closer.
Mance sent you?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: (Grunts)
Speaker: STYR

Text: The Thenn party continues to walk through
How did you find us?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: STYR nods back at a THENN WARG, who releases a bird for reconnaisance.
You came from the south, not the north.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Took a detour. Got some supper from a village down that way.
Speaker: WARG

Text: A Thenn drops a heavy bag from his shoulder to the floor of the crevice.
Why does the meat down here taste so much better than it does on our side of the Wall?
Speaker: STYR

Text: Help yourself.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: (Chuckles) Maybe everything's just better fed down here.
Speaker: STYR

Text: The Thenns pull some bird meat off the spit that was on the fire.
Fat and lazy. Easier for us, hmm?
Speaker: STYR

Text: STYR pats TORMUND on the shoulder as he walks past. TORMUND follows, with YGRITTE further behind.
You didn't see us coming? Lost your warg? And that baby crow you had with you, lost him too?
Speaker: STYR

Text: I'll answer to Mance. I won't answer to you.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: She yours?
Speaker: STYR

Text: I'm not anybody's.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: YGRITTE notches an arrow and places it directly on  STYR's throat. Two of his Thenn companions draw their swords.  STYR stares YGRITTE down.
Too scrawny. Not like those crows at Castle Black.
Speaker: STYR

Text: STYR turns his attention to TORMUND. YGRITTE lowers her bow a TORMUND's command. The other Thenns continue to work at the fire.
Think of them stuck in their larders stuffing their faces with ham and blood sausage and stew, getting nice and fat and marbled.
Speaker: STYR

Text: STYR walks towards the fire.
I know we've had our differences, Tormund, but just one time before you die, you really ought to try crow.
Speaker: STYR

Text: STYR kneels before the fire, where the other Thenns have skewered a human arm on the spit roasting in the fire.
EXT. Winterfell. Some Knight's Watch recruits are practicing their archery.
Draw. Loose.
Speaker: OFFICER

Text: SAM walks by the recruits as they fire their arrows at a row of straw men, to varying effect. He then walks up the steps to JON's quarters.
Jon's quarters
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Jon is dressing in pain. SAM stands behind him.

Last time I saw him, he was in the courtyard at Winterfell. "He said, " Next time I see you, you'll be all in black." I was jealous of Robb my whole life. (Winces) The way my father looked at him, I wanted that. He was better than me at everything... fighting and hunting and riding and girls. Gods, the girls loved him. I wanted to hate him, but I never could.
Speaker: JON

Text: Sometimes I want to hate you.
Speaker: SAM

Text: JON turns in surprise.
Well, you're better than me at everything. Except reading.
Speaker: SAM

Text: (Chuckles)
Speaker: JON

Text: They're... they're ready for you.
Speaker: SAM

Text: JON picks up his leather armor and walks towards the door.
He's wanted to hang me for a while. Now's his chance.
Speaker: JON

Text: No one's going to hang you. You've done nothing wrong.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I've done plenty wrong.
Speaker: JON

Text: INT. Winterfell.
ALLISER THORNE questions JON SNOW. He is flanked by JANOS SLYNT and MAESTRE AEMON
So you admit you murdered Qhorin Halfhand?
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: I didn't murder him.
Speaker: JON

Text: No? You put your sword through a brother of the Night's Watch. What do you call that?
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: He wanted me to kill him.
Speaker: JON

Text: A bastard son of a traitor. What would you expect?
Speaker: JANOS SLYNT

Text: The Halfhand believed our only chance to stop Mance was to get a man inside his army.
Speaker: JON

Text: Don't talk about the Halfhand as if you knew him. He was my brother.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: Then you'd know he'd do anything to defend the Wall. The free folk would have boiled him alive, but letting me kill him...
Speaker: JON

Text: The free folk? Listen to him. He even talks like a wildling now.
Speaker: JANOS SLYNT

Text: Aye, I talk like a wildling. I ate with the wildlings. I climbed the Wall with the wildlings. I... I laid with a wildling girl.
Speaker: JON

Text: You admit to breaking your vows, then?
Speaker: JANOS SLYNT

Text: I do.
Speaker: JON

Text: The law is the law. The boy must die.
Speaker: JANOS SLYNT

Text: If we beheaded every ranger who lay with a girl, the Wall would be manned by headless men.
Speaker: MAESTER AEMON

Text: There's a difference between sneaking off to the Mole's Town brothel and sleeping with the enemy.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: While we sit here debating which rules I broke, Mance Rayder marches on the Wall with an army of 100,000.
Speaker: JON

Text: Impossible. You can't get 50 wildlings together before they start killing each other.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: 100,000. He's united the Thenns, the Hornfoots, the ice-river clans. He has giants fighting for him.
Speaker: JON

Text: (Laughs) Giants?
Speaker: JANOS SLYNT

Text: Have you ever been beyond the Wall, ser?
Speaker: JON

Text: I commanded the City Watch of King's Landing, boy.
Speaker: JANOS SLUNT

Text: And now you're here. You must not have been very good at your job.
Speaker: JON

Text: JANOS SLYNT stands in indignation.
How dare you?!
Speaker: JANOS SLYNT

Text: There's a band of wildlings south of the Wall already led by Tormund Giantsbane. I killed their warg and three others. They shot me full of arrows. Their orders are to attack Castle Black from the south when Mance hits it from the north. The signal for the attack will be a bonfire. Mance said it would be the greatest fire the North has ever seen. That's the truth. All the truth.
Speaker: JON

Text: JANOS SLYNT sits back down.
Do you intend to execute me or am I free to go?
Speaker: JON

Text: None of us are free. We are men of the Night's Watch. But we won't be taking your head today, Jon Snow. Go on.
Speaker: MAESTER AEMON

Text: JON nods and leaves. MAESTER AEMON stands to leave, frail and helped by his assistant. He moves slowly down the wooden stairs from the dais to the floor.
I am acting commander here, Maester Aemon.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: Yes, you are.
Speaker: MAESTER AEMON

Text: And I don't trust the bastard.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: He told the truth.
Speaker: MAESTER AEMON

Text: And you always know when a man's telling a lie? How did you acquire this magical power?
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: I grew up in King's Landing.
Speaker: MAESTER AEMON

Text: EXT. King's Landing garden.
OLENNA and MARGAERY consider necklace options for her wedding.
No. No. You're a queen, not an ox.
Speaker: OLENNA
