Text: OLENNA picks up one of the necklaces, sentimentally. MARGAERY smiles.
Your grandfather gave me a necklace just like this one for my 51st nameday.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: OLENNA tosses the necklace away, surprising MARGAERY.
The wedding is in a fortnight, Grandmother. You can't say no to everything.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Nonsense.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: OLENNA turns to the half dozen maids waiting.
My little dears. Go and speak to the jewelers of King's Landing. Tell them who you are, tell them who sent you. The one who brings me the best necklace will get to keep the next best.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The maids exit, laughing. OLENNA turns back to MARGAERY. They sit.
The Margaery Tyrell who walks into the sept a fortnight from now will inspire 1,000 songs. Now, how sad it will be if she's wearing rubbish like that.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Perhaps I should just let Joffrey choose it for me. End up with a string of dead sparrow heads around my neck.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: You watch that. Even here, even with me.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Footsteps approach and BRIENNE enters.
My word.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: My lady. My lady. Please pardon me for interrupting. My name is Brienne of Tarth.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: We know who you are. We've heard all about you. But hearing is one thing. Aren't you just marvelous? Absolutely singular.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: BRIENNE looks embarrassed.
I hear you knocked my grandson into the dirt like the silly little boy he is.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: My lady, I know this is a very busy time for you, but if I could just have a moment.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: OLENNA turns to MARGAERY, intrigued.
You dare not refuse.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Another part of the garden.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: BRIENNE and MARGAERY stroll next to a pond
A shadow?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: A shadow with the face of Stannis Baratheon. I swear to you by all the gods it was Stannis. He plunged his sword through Renly's heart and disappeared. One day, my lady, I will avenge our king.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Joffrey is our king now.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I meant no offense.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: And you've given none.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: MARGAERY gently touches BRIENNE on the shoulder.
INT. King's Landing.
JOFFREY, JAIME and MERYN TRANT are strategizing.
All the Kingsguard will be on duty, of course. Ser Boros will be stationed here. Ser Preston will be stationed here beside the primary entertainment. Your Grace?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Yes, yes, one guard at the... the thing. Go on.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Ser Meryn will guard Lady Margaery and Tommen.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I've always guarded the king himself, my lord. Ever since your absence.
Speaker: MERYN

Text: And I thank you for it, Ser Meryn. All very good. I don't expect any trouble.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The people love their king. They know who keeps them fed.
Speaker: MERYN

Text: Margaery Tyrell, I've heard.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: By my leave. They know I saved the city. They know I won the war.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: The war's not won. Not while Stannis lives.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I broke Stannis on the Blackwater. Pity you weren't there to help, Uncle.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: My apologies, Your Grace. I was rather busy.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Busy getting captured.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: JOFFREY thumbs through a large tome.

So this is the famous "Book of Brothers"? All the great deeds of all the great Kingsguard. Ser Arthur Dayne. The Sword of the Morning. (Chuckles) Led the attack on the Kingswood Brotherhood. Defeated the Smiling Knight in single combat. Ser Duncan the Tall. (Laughs) Four pages for Ser Duncan. He must have been quite a man.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: So they say.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Ser Jaime Lannister. (Chuckles)
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: There is very little written in the Book of Brothers about JAIME.
Someone forgot to write down all your great deeds.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: There's still time.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Is there? For a 40-year-old knight with one hand? How can you protect me with that?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: I use my left hand now, Your Grace. Makes for more of a contest.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JOFFREY and MERYN exit. JAIME walks over to the book, and slams it shut.
EXT. ESSOS
The unsullied are marching past DAENERYS and MISSANDEI, who stand on a cliff overlooking the shore.
Have you ever been to Meereen?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Several times, Your Grace, with Master Kraznys.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: And?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They say 1,000 slaves died building the Great Pyramid of Meereen.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: And now an army of former slaves is marching to her gates. You think the Great Masters are worried?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: If they're smart, Your Grace.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Footsteps approach, and DAARIO NAHARIS enters.
You were told to ride at the back of the train.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Yes, my queen. But I need to speak to you about something important. A matter of strategy.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAENERYS signals for MISSANDEI to leave them.
Your Grace.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: MISSANDEI exists.
All right, what is this matter of strategy?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAARIO presents DAENERYS with a purple flower.
A dusk rose.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Would you like to walk at the back of the train instead of riding?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS starts to walk away, but DAARIO follows and presents her with another small flowering plant, this one is white.
And this one's called lady's lace.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Would you like to walk without shoes?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You have to know a land to rule it. It's plants, it's rivers, it's roads, it's people. Dusk rose tea eases fever. Everyone in Meereen knows that. Especially the slaves who have to make the tea. If you want them to follow you, you have to become a part of their world. Strategy.
Speaker: DAAERIO

Text: DAARIO presents her with a red flower.
Harpy's Gold. No tea from this one. Beautiful but poisonous.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAARIO presents the three flowers to DAENERYS in a small bouquet.
You are a gambler, aren't you?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: She takes the flowers. DAARIO makes a small bow to depart.
Your Grace.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAENERYS ponders. A man shouts in valerian. She joins, BARRISTAN SELMY, JORAH, GREY WORM and MISSANDEI. They have found a mile marker, festooned by a woman's corpse who points the way to Mereen.s
There's one on every mile marker between here and Meereen.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: How many miles are there between here and Meereen?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: 163, Your Grace. I'll tell our men to ride ahead and bury them. You don't need to see this.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: You will do no such thing. I will see each and every one of their faces. Remove her collar before you bury her.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: EXT.  KING'S LANDING.
SANSA stands on the shore with eyes closed. BRIENNE and JAIME stand on the cliff above.
There she is.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Yes, there she is.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And? You made a promise.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: To return the Stark girls to their mother who is now dead.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: To keep them safe.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Well, Arya Stark hasn't been seen since her father was killed. Where do you think she is? My money's on dead. There's a certain safety in death, wouldn't you say? And Sansa Stark is now Sansa Lannister. Bit of a complication.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: A complication does not release you from a vow.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: What do you want me to do? Kidnap my sister-in-law? And take her where? Where would she be safer than here?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Look me in the eye and tell me that you think she'll be safe in King's Landing.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Are you sure we're not related? Ever since I've returned, every Lannister I've seen has been a miserable pain in my ass. Maybe you're a Lannister, too. You've got the hair for it if not the looks.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME exits. BRIENNE follows.

SANSA comes up from the shore. She hears something, and realizes that she is not alone. She quickens her pace through the woods. A man trails her, stealthily. She speeds her walk, and comes to a table. TOMMY taps her on the shoulder. She starts.
It's all right. It's all right. It's all right.
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: You're drunk.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Yes. I have good reason to be. Once I was a knight. Now I'm only a fool. Don't you know me?
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: Ser Dontos. The king's nameday celebration. I'm sorry. I should have remembered.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I can't accept your apology. I may be a fool, but I'm a living fool, thanks to you.
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: Anyone would have done the same.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: But only you did. I can never repay you. You gave me my life. But this, this is worth more than my life.
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: SER DONTOS gives SANSA a necklace with blue stones. SANSA looks closely at it.
It belonged to my mother and her mother before her. House Hollard was strong once. House on the rise. That's all that's left of those days, thanks to a few sad, fat drunks like me.
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: I can't take it. It's very, very kind of you, but I can't.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I don't have anything else left. That's all. Take it. Wear it. Let my name have one more moment in the sun before it disappears from the world.
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: I'll wear it with pride, Ser Dontos.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Yeah.
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: They both smile
EXT. THE RIVERLANDS
ARYA sits in front of the HOUND on his horse. They ride through a scene of brutal violence, with villagers slaughtered amongst their upended carts. Flies buzz at the corpses.
When am I going to get a horse of my own?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The little lady wants a pony.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The little lady wants away from your stench.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Horses aren't easy to come by. Even if they were, you think I'm gonna put you on your own horse? Watch the only thing of value I've got in the world ride away?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Why don't you have any money? Didn't you steal anything from Joffrey before you left?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: No.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: You're not very smart, are you?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I'm not a thief.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: You're fine with murdering little boys, but thieving is beneath you?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A man's got to have a code.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: You think I'm gonna escape? Where would I go? I'd be dead by nightfall without you. My family's gone. I've got no one.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You've got an aunt in the Vale. Your rich Aunt Lysa. After I sell you to her, maybe she'll have enough left over to buy you that pony you want so much.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: outside an Inn. Sounds of men can be heard in the buildings.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: I'm hungry. You're hungry.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Five horses, five men. More than I feel like killing on an empty stomach.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Two men exit the bulding, and ARYA recognizes POLLIVER.
I know him. The small one. His name is Polliver. He captured us and took us to Harrenhal.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The two men urinate into the bushes by the farm.
He killed Lommy.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: What the fuck's a Lommy?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: He was my friend. Polliver stole my sword and put it right through his neck. He's still got it.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Got what?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: My sword Needle.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Needle? Of course you named your sword.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Lots of people name their swords.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Lots of cunts.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The two men finish relieving themselves and return inside. The HOUND notices that ARYA has started towards the Inn.
What are you... get back here.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: My brother gave me that sword.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Get back here.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: He killed my friend.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The HOUND grabs ARYA roughly by the should and puts himself between her and the door.
I don't care if he ate your friend. We're not going in there.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The door opens behind him and a soldier meets his eye. The HOUND turns to face him fully. He retreats, allowing the HOUND to enter.
FARMHOUSE INTERIOR
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The HOUND enters the door, and a woman can be heard whimpering while the soldiers egg each other on.
Come on, give it up.
Speaker: MAN

Text: (Whimpers)
Speaker: INNKEEPER'S DAUGHER

Text: Come here.
Speaker: MAN

Text: (Whimpers)
Speaker: INNKEEPER'S DAUGHER

Text: Let's have a feel there.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Leave it.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: The INNKEEPER'S DAUGHER struggles in the grasp of one of the men ARYA enters behind the hound and shuts the door. The soldiers look warily at their the duo. Everyone goes quiet as the HOUND and ARYA enter the inn. The HOUND and ARYA sit at a table in the back. The men return to their assault on the girl.
Come here.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Please, she's a good girl.
Speaker: INNKEEPER

Text: Shut your mouth and pour us more ale and we may not take her with us when we're done with her.
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: POLLIVER turns to look at ARYA . He recognizes her.
I know you.
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: ARYA graps the hilt of the HOUND's sword. POLLIVER stnads.
You're the Hound.
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: ARYA is relieved. She releases her grip on the HOUND's sword. POLLIVER walks over and joins their table.
Pour our new friend some ale. What brings you so far north?
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: I could ask the same of you. What are you doing up here?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Just keeping the king's peace.
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: No need. The war's over.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The INNKEEPER pours them some ale. The HOUND drinks.
So I've heard. Stannis defeated at the Blackwater. Robb Stark killed at the Twins. And where am I for all of it? Stuck with your brother. Meaning no offense.
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: None taken.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: He's good, the Mountain is. Best at what he does. But torture, torture, torture, torture. You spend enough time putting the hammer to people, you start to feel like a carpenter making chairs. Drains the fun right out of it. And what's life without a little fun? (Chuckles)
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: POLLIVER turns to look at ARYA.
But I don't need to tell you that, eh?
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: She's all right. I've had better.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: (Laughs) You know what? You should come with us. His kind, they've always got something hidden away somewhere. Gold, silver, more daughters. Always something if you know how to make them talk. And there's plenty of him between here and King's Landing. You could do well for yourself. We certainly have been.
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: I'm not going to King's Landing.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Think about it. We could do whatever we like wherever we go. These are the king's colors. No one's standing in his way now. Which means no one's standing in ours.
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: Fuck the king.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The chatter in the inn stops.The HOUND takes a drink.
When I heard that Joffrey's dog had tucked tail and run from the Battle of the Blackwater, I didn't believe it. But here you are.
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: Here I am. Bring me one of those chickens.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: You got money to pay for it?
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: You paid for it?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: (Laughs) No. But we're the king's men. So, you got money?
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: Not a penny.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: I'll still take that chicken.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Tell you what. We'll trade you. One of our little chickens for one of yours. Give us a go at your friend. Lowell there likes them a bit broken in.
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: The men chuckle.
You're a talker. Listening to talkers makes me thirsty.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The HOUND takes POLLIVER's ale, and finishes it in one long drink.
Ah. And hungry. Think I'll take two chickens.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: You don't seem to understand the situation.
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: I understand that if any more words come pouring out of your cunt mouth, I'm gonna have to eat every fucking chicken in this room.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: You lived your life for the king. You're gonna die for some chickens?
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: Someone is.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The men stare one another down. POLLIVER rises to attack, but the HOUND turns over the table, knocking him down. He then sets to the room and dispatches the soldiers one by one, while the INNKEEPER cowers. The fight is brutal, using both sword and fist. POLLIVER and a companion. are able to get the upper hand, and the HOUND falls to the ground, where they kick at him violently. ARYA watches in fright. The HOUND manages to fend them off with his sword, even from the ground. He sweeps the legs out from under one of them, and POLLIVER scambles on all fours towards his sword. The HOUND steps on the blade and slugs POLLIVER violently, who crumples to the ground. The fight continues, and the HOUND gores another soldier before TOMMY pins the HOUND to the ground, a dagger to his throat. With great strength, the HOUND pulls the man's dagger away from his throat while gouging at his face. He positions the man's face over his own dagger, and swiftly slams the soldier's face into the dagger, repeatedly.

ARYA moves from shock into action. She shatters a jug over a soldier's head, then picks up a sword and stabs him through, slowly. She comes up behind POLLIVER, who is stalking the wounded HOUND, and stabs him through. She takes need from him before he falls forward to the ground. The HOUND runs another soldier through. ARYA walks calmly over POLLIVER, who lays on his back.
Something wrong with your leg, boy?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: What? What do you mean?
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: Can you walk? I've got to carry you?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Carry me?
Speaker: POLLIVER

Text: Fine little blade.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA puts the point of her blade under POLLIVER's chin. He raises his hands weakly in surrender.
Maybe I'll pick my teeth with it.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A light of recognition fills POLLIVER's eyes, met quickly by ARYA stabbing him through the chin, slowly. He gasps and gurgles. She removes her sword and watches the blood fill his mouth. He chokes, spurts, and dies.
EXT. Outside the inn
The HOUND rides his mount, chewing on some chicken. ARYA comes into view behind him on her own white horse. She looks pleased. They ride through the devastation of the countryside.

[Jon Snow leaves the tunnel and walks out into the snow. Smoking dead bodies lie all around him. As he walks into the forest he becomes surrounded by Wildlings. He has entered the Wildling camp unarmed]
You're wearing a black cloak again.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: I've been sent to negotiate with you.
Speaker: JON

Text: [Mance and Jon enter Mance's tent and take a seat]
It appears my trusting nature got the better of me. It's happened before. I was hoping your loyalty was real when you pledged yourself to us, Jon Snow, truly I was.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: The Halfhand ordered me to join your army and bring back whatever information I could to Castle Black. He made me kill him so you'd trust me. I was loyal, to him and to my Night's Watch vows.
Speaker: JON

Text: All of your vows? She wasn't enough to turn ya, eh? Were you enough to turn her?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: She put three arrows in me when I escaped.
Speaker: JON

Text: Did you see her again at Castle Black?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Yes.
Speaker: JON

Text: And?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: She's dead.
Speaker: JON

Text: Your doing?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: No.
Speaker: JON

Text: We'll drink to her.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: [One of the Wildlings gets two cups and fills them with liquid. Jon looks at Mance]
Of all the ways I'd kill you, poison would be the last.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: [They pick up their cups]
Ygritte.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Ygritte.
Speaker: JON

Text: [They take a sip and Jon begins to cough]
That's not wine.
Speaker: JON

Text: No, it's a proper Northern drink, Jon Snow. You did well. Fought hard. Killed some of our strongest men. One of our giants went into your tunnel and never came out again. Mag the Mighty.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: He's dead. He killed my friend Grenn.
Speaker: JON

Text: He was their king. Last of a bloodline that stretches back before the First Men.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Grenn came from a farm.
Speaker: JON

Text: [They lift their cups]
Mag and Grenn.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Grenn and Mag.
Speaker: JON

Text: Kullback, could I trouble you for something to eat? I don't imagine our guest has eaten anything in quite some time. So. You're here to strike a bargain?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Turn your army around and go home.
Speaker: JON

Text: You know I know you're low on arrows. You're low on oil. You're low on men. How many are left? 50?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: I told Tormund and Orell. We have more than a thousand men.
Speaker: JON

Text: I showed you everything I had. The whole army, a hundred thousand strong, and what did you do? You fired on us with everything you had. It wasn't much. Soon as I saw that I sent four hundred men to climb the wall. An unmanned stretch five miles west of here. A lot of them will die climbing, but most of them will be over by the end of the day. This is me being honest with you, Jon Snow, which is more than you've ever done for me. My people have bled enough. We're not here to conquer, we're here to hide behind your wall just like you. We need your tunnel. Now we both know that winter is coming and if my people aren't south of the wall when it comes in earnest, we'll all end up worse than dead. Wanna strike a bargain with me? Here's a bargain. You go back, you open the gates to us and I swear to you that no one else will die. Refuse and we'll kill every last man in Castle Black.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: [Jon looks over towards the knife. The Wildlings get their weapons ready]

Ah! Oh, that's why you're here. I reckon you could do it before any of them could stop ya. They'd kill you of course, they'd kill ya slow, but ya knew that when you came in here. Are you capable of that, Jon Snow? Killing a man in his own tent when he's just offered ya peace? Is that what the Night's Watch is? Is that what you are?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: [A horn blows in the distance. Everyone scrambles, Mance draws a knife to Jon's neck]
You attacking us?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: No, it's like you said, we don't have the men.
Speaker: JON

Text: [The Wildlings run around frantically. Men on horseback ride toward them]
Hold! To me. To me.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: [The horsemen continue toward the Wildlings, killing all in their path. The Wildlings fight back, clearly outnumbered]
Stand down! I said my people have bled enough and I meant it.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: [Stannis Baratheon and Davos Seaworth ride up toward Mance Rayder. They get off their horses. Mance disarms himself]
You're the king beyond the wall?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: [Mance nods]
You know who I am?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Never had the pleasure.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: This is Stannis Baratheon, the one true king of the seven kingdoms.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: We're not in the seven kingdoms and you're not dressed for this weather.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: It is customary to kneel when surrendering to a king.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: We do not kneel.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: I'll have thousands of your men in chains by nightfall, I'll have nowhere to put them and nothing to feed them. I'm not here to slaughter beat dogs. Their fate depends on their king.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: All the same, we do not kneel.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Take these men away.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: What are men of the Night's Watch doing in a Wildling camp?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I was sent to discuss terms with the king beyond the wall.
Speaker: JON

Text: You're speaking to the one true king boy. You'll address him as your grace.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I know he's the king. My father died for him. My name is Jon Snow, your grace. I'm Ned Stark's son.
Speaker: JON

Text: Your father was an honorable man.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: He was, your grace.
Speaker: JON

Text: What do you think he'd have done with him?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I was this man's prisoner once. He could've tortured me, he could've killed me, but he spared my life. I think my father would've taken him prisoner, listened to what he had to say.
Speaker: JON

Text: Very well. *to Davos* Take him.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Your grace. If my father'd seen the things that I've seen, he'd also tell you to burn the dead before nightfall. All of them.
Speaker: JON

Text: KING'S LANDING
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: [Qyburn is seen closely analyzing Gregor's body. He's in Pycelle's lab with Cersei]
I would suggest milk of the poppy to ease his pain but he is completely insensate.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: Bloody Martells.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The cause appears to be manticore venom.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: It is, yes, manticore.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: I've read a good deal about it. It's a horrible poison, usually Mantari in origin. Oh! Yes, yes. There's nothing to be done.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: Yes there is.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: May I ask what you think you're doing?
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: Saving him.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Your grace. I wish it were otherwise, but Ser Gregor is beyond saving. Well, well beyond. This man is not even a Maester, let alone Grand Maester.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: That's for the best. No Maester knows how to save him.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: That is exactly the sort of arrogance that had him expelled from the citadel, your grace. His curiosity was deemed dangerous and unnatural. Rightly so in my opinion.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: You're dismissed, Grand Maester.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your grace. This is my laboratory!
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: Not anymore.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: [Pycelle leaves the laboratory angrily as Qyburn tries to save Gregor's body]
You can save him?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Difficult to say, your grace, but if my past work is any guide. We stand a chance.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Do everything you can. Come to me with anything you need.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Thank you, your grace. You should know, the process may change him, somewhat.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Will it weaken him?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Oh no.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Very well then.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: [Cersei leaves as Qyburn drains Gregor's blood. Cersei is seen arguing with Tywin]
Not another word. We've been over this, the matter's closed.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I'm opening it again.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You are betrothed to Loras Tyrell. Still betrothed to Loras Tyrell and you will marry Loras Tyrell as soon as Tommen marries Margaery.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I will not.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Jaime cannot marry or inherit lands. Tyrion's sentence will be carried out tomorrow. You have, on several occasions, made great claims about your commitment to this family's future. Your role in that future is more vital now than it ever was.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I don't care. I will stay in King's Landing where I belong with my son, the king.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: When you were nine years old, I was called to the capital. I decided to take your brother with me and not you. You insisted that you would not be left at Casterly Rock under any circumstances and if you recall-
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I'm not interested in hearing another one of your smug stories about the time you won. This isn't going to be one of those times.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Do you think you'll be the first person dragged into a sept to be married against her will?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: When you marched into the throne room to tell me we'd won the Battle at Blackwater, do you remember?! I was sitting on the iron throne with Tommen. I was about to give him essence of nightshade, that's how far I was willing to go when I thought someone awful had come to take my son away. Someone awful is coming to take him away.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Joffrey is dead. Myrcella's been sold like livestock. And now you want to ship me off to Highgarden and steal my boy, my last boy. Margaery will dig her claws in and you will dig your claws in and you will fight over him like beasts until you rip him apart. I will burn our house to the ground before I let that happen.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: And how will you do that?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I'll tell everyone the truth.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: And what truth would that be?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: You don't know, do you? You never believed it. How is that possible? What am I saying, of course it's possible. How can someone so consumed by the idea of his family have any conception what his actual family was doing? We were right there in front of you and you didn't see us. One look in the past twenty years, one real look and you would've known.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Known what?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Everything they say is true. About Jaime and me.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No, no, no, no, no.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Your legacy is a lie.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I don't believe you.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Yes you do.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: [Cersei walks away, leaving Tywin standing there alone. Jaime is turning pages in a book in another room]
Jaime.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You won. One fewer brother. Must be proud of yourself. There's really nothing you wouldn't do, is there?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: For my family, no. I would do things for my family you couldn't imagine.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Tyrion is your family.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He's not.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You don't get to choose.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I do, so do you. You can choose the creature that killed our mother to come into this world-
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Are you really mad enough to blame him for that? He didn't decide to kill her. He was an infant.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: A disease doesn't decide to kill you, all the same you cut it out before it does. What do you decide? What do you choose?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The things I did to get back to you, to endure all that, only to find you-
Speaker: JAIME

Text: [Cersei kisses Jaime]
I choose you.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Those are words.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Yes. Like the ones I just said to father. I told him.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Told him what?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I told him about us.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You told him?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I told him I wouldn't marry Loras Tyrell. I told him I'm staying right here with Tommen, with you.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You think he'll just accept that?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Go and ask him.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: [Cersei kisses Jaime]
What did you say?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I don't want to talk about Tywin Lannister. I don't choose Tywin Lannister, I don't love Tywin Lannister. I love my brother. I love my lover. People will whisper, they'll make their jokes. Let them. They're all so small I can't even see them. I only see what matters.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: [Cersei kisses Jaime's metal hand. Jaime pulls her close and kisses her]
Someone will walk in.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I don't care.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: [Jaime picks Cersei up and lays her on the table as the start having sex.]
MEREEN
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: [Daenerys is sitting on her throne listening to her people's problems]

*in Valyrian* You stand before Daenerys Stormborn, the Unburnt, Queen of Mereen, Queen of the Andals and the Rhoynar and the First Men. Khaleesi of the Great Grass Sea, Breaker of Chains and Mother of Dragons.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: *in Valyrian* Thank you for seeing me, your grace. My name is Fennesz. I can speak the common tongue if you wish.
Speaker: FENNESZ

Text: You speak it very well.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Before you freed me, I belonged to Master Mighdal. I was tutor to his children. I taught them languages and history. They know a great deal about your family because of me. Little Calla is only seven, but she admires you very much.
Speaker: FENNESZ

Text: I hope I can prove worthy of her admiration. What can I do for you?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: When you took the city, the children begged me not to leave the house. But Master Mighdal and I agreed that I must. So I lost my home. Now I live on the streets.
Speaker: FENNESZ

Text: I have outfitted mess halls to feed all former slaves and barracks to shelter them.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I do not mean to offend, your grace. I went to one of these places. The young prey on the old. Take what they want and beat us if we resist.
Speaker: FENNESZ

Text: My Unsullied will make them safe again in short order my friend, this I promise you.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Even if they are safe, who would I be there? What purpose would I serve? With my master, I was a teacher. I had the respect and love of these children.
Speaker: FENNESZ

Text: What is it that you want from me?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your grace, I ask you to let me sell myself back to Master Mighdal.
Speaker: FENNESZ

Text: You want to return to a man who owned you, like a goat or a chair?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Please, your grace, the young may rejoice in the new world you've built for them. But for those of us too old to change there is only fear and squalor. I am not alone. There are many outside waiting to beg the same-
Speaker: FENNESZ

Text: I did not take this city to preside over the injustice I fought to destroy. I took it to bring people freedom. But freedom means making your own choices. I will allow you to sign a contract with your former master. It may not cover a period lasting longer than a year.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Thank you, your grace. Thank you.
Speaker: FENNESZ

Text: [Fennesz leaves slowly]
The masters will take advantage of this situation. The men serving them will be slaves in all but name.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: [Another man enters the hall]
Approach my friend.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: *in Low Valyrian* I do not understand, my queen. I do not understand, my queen.
Speaker: MAN

Text: *in Low Valyrian* The Queen says you may approach.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: *crying, speaking Low Valyrian*
Speaker: MAN

Text: *translating* I have brought you. He came from the sky. The black one. The winged shadow. He came from the sky and...
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: [The man kneels on the ground sobbing, laying a pile of burnt bones on the ground]
*translating* My girl. My little girl.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: [The man continues to sob. In another room Daenerys is speaking with Missandei]
What was her name?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Zala, your grace.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: How old was she?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Three.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Three. *in Valyrian* And still no word on Drogon?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: *in Valyrian* Sailors saw him flying over the Black Cliffs three days ago, my queen. Nothing since then.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: *in Valyrian* Meet me in the catacombs.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: [The entrance to the catacombs is rolled open. Daenerys' dragons enter followed by Daenerys. Inside there is food for them. They chomp at the food as Daenerys puts a chain collar around their necks. She walks away crying as they screech at her. She turns around as the catacombs close with tears in her eyes.]
CASTLE BLACK
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: [Aemon and the rest of the Night's Watch burn the bodies of their fallen comrades]

They came to us from White Harbor and Barrowton, from Fairmarket and King's Landing, from north and south, from east and west. They died protecting men, women, and children who will never know their names. It is for us to remember them. Our brothers, we shall never see their like again.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: And now their watch is ended.
Speaker: ALL TOGETHER

Text: And now their watch is ended.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: Aemon passes the torch around as each member of the Night's Watch helps burn the bodies. Stannis watches from above. [Jon Snow and Melisandre share a look]
Your old blind man patched me up. Why?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: He's sworn to treat all wounded men, friend or foe.
Speaker: JON

Text: You want me alive so you can torture me?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: No one's going to torture you.
Speaker: JON

Text: So how do we die? Hanging? Beheading? Drop us from the top of the wall?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I don't know what happens to the prisoners.
Speaker: JON

Text: Who decides?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I suppose Stannis does.
Speaker: JON

Text: He your king now?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I don't have a king.
Speaker: JON

Text: You spent too much time with us, Jon Snow. You can never be a kneeler again.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: We're gonna burn the bodies of your dead. Do you want to say any words over them?
Speaker: JON

Text: Words? What kind of words?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Funeral words. I don't know how the Free Folk do it.
Speaker: JON

Text: Do what?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Say farewell.
Speaker: JON

Text: The dead can't hear us, boy.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: [Jon walks away]
Snow. Did you love her? She loved you.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: She told you?
Speaker: JON

Text: No. All she ever talked about was killing you. That's how I know. She belongs in the North. The real North. You understand me?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: [Jon leaves and takes Ygritte's body out past The Wall. He burns her body in a pile of logs.]
BEYOND THE WALL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: [Hodor drags Bran through the snow followed by Jojen and Meera Reed]
We can stop, we can rest.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: We'll rest with the three-eyed raven.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: [Jojen falls to the ground]
We're not going to make it.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: We're already here.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: Jojen. Jojen! Look, Jojen, look.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: [The group stands at the edge of a cliff. A large tree is seen  not too far off in the distance. They head toward it. As they walk a skeleton hand reaches up and drags Jojen to the ground. It starts pulling him backwards as Meera runs towards him]
JOJEN! Hold on!
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Help them! Now!
Speaker: BRAN (to Hodor)

Text: Hold on to me!
Speaker: MEERA

Text: [More hands burst from the ground.]
Hodor...
Speaker: HODOR

Text: Help them!
Speaker: BRAN

Text: [Skeleton warriors have now emerged from the ground. They attack Jojen, Meera and Hodor. A brawl ensues. One of them attacks Bran until his direwolf, Summer, fights it off. Bran then wargs into Hodor and starts fighting back.]
Bran! Save yourself, now!
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: [Meera defeats a skeleton warrior, only to see another repeatedly stabbing Jojen. Just as two skeletons close in on the warging Bran, they’re destroyed by two fireballs, apparently controlled by a young girl.]
Come with me, Brandon Stark!
Speaker: GIRL

Text: [She looks at Meera and Jojen.]
He is lost. Come with me, or die with him.
Speaker: GIRL

Text: Go with them.
Speaker: [JOJEN

Text: The girl throws some more fireballs and the group move into a cave. When the skeletons try to follow, they explode.]
They cannot follow us. The power that moves them is powerless here.
Speaker: GIRL

Text: Who are you?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: The First Men called us The Children, but we were born long before them. Come, he waits for you.
Speaker: GIRL

Text: [They enter a room filled with tree roots. An old man is seated in the center. Bran approaches him.]
You’re the three-eyed raven.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I have been many things. Now, I am what you see.
Speaker: OLD MAN

Text: My brother, he led us to you, and now he…
Speaker: MEERA

Text: He knew what would happen. From the moment he left, he knew, and he went anyway.
Speaker: OLD MAN

Text: How do you know?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: I’ve been watching you. All of you, all of your lives, with a thousand eyes and one. Now you’ve come to me at last, Brandon Stark, though the hour is late.
Speaker: OLD MAN

Text: I didn’t want anyone to die for me.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: He died so that you could find what you have lost.
Speaker: OLD MAN

Text: You’re going to help me walk again?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You’ll never walk again. But you will fly.
Speaker: OLD MAN

Text: THE RIVERLANDS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: [Brienne and Podrick wake up in the open air on their way to the Eyrie.]
Podrick. Podrick! Where are the horses?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I hobbled them last night.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: What sort of hobble?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: A figure-eight, like you taught me.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: If you did it like I taught you then the horses would be here.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Thieves, maybe?
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: It’s at least thirty miles to the Eyrie from here. You’re carrying the saddle bags.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: [Brienne sees Arya Stark practising her river-dancing.]
People coming. You can shit later, there’s people coming!
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Morning!
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Morning.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I like your sword. Are we getting close to the bloody gate?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: About ten more miles.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Did you hear that Podrick? Only about ten more miles to the Bloody Gate.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Are you a knight?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: No.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: But you know how to use that sword.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I do.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Does it have a name?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: “Oathkeeper.”
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Mine’s “Needle.”
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Good name.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Who taught you how to fight?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: My father.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Mine never wanted to. Said fighting was for boys.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Mine said the same. But I kept fighting the boys anyway. Kept losing. Finally my father said, “If you’re going to do it, you might as well do it right.”
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: [Sandor “The Hound” Clegane emerges.]
Seven blessings. I’m Brienne of Tarth, this is Podrick Payne.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You want something?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: You’re Arya Stark.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I asked if you wanted something.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: I swore to your mother I would bring you home to her.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: My mother’s dead.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I know. I wish I could’ve been there to protect her.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You’re not a northerner.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I know, but I swore a sacred vow to protect her.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Why didn’t you?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: She commanded me to bring Jaime Lannister back to King’s Landing.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You’re paid by the Lannisters. You’re here for the bounty on me.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: I’m not paid by the Lannisters.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: No? Fancy sword you’ve got there. Where’d you get it? I’ve been looking at Lannister gold all my life. Go on, Brienne of fucking Tarth, tell me that’s not Lannister gold.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Jaime Lannister gave me this sword.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: The Bloody Gate’s ten miles.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I swore to your mother by the Old Gods and the New -
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I don’t care what you swore!
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Arya!
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You heard the girl! She’s not coming with you.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: She is.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: [Brienne and The Hound both draw their swords.]
Come with me Arya. I’ll take you to safety.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Safety?! Where the fuck’s that? Her aunt in the Eyrie’s dead. Her mother’s dead, her father’s dead, her brother’s dead. Winterfell’s a pile of rubble. There’s no safety, you dumb bitch. If you don’t know that by now, you’re the wrong one to watch over her.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: And that’s what you’re doing? Watching over her?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Aye, that’s what I’m doing.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: [They begin a swordfight. The Hound seems to have the upper hand but Brienne defends well and floors him.]
I have no wish to kill you Ser.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: [The Hound grabs Brienne’s blade with his palms, shoves it to one side and punches her.]
I’m not a knight.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: [They fight bare-handed, Brienne bites off The Hound's ear, then The Hound draws a knife, and Brienne grabs a rock. She pushes The Hound down a steep cliff.]
Arya! Arya! ARYA! Where is she?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: She was just here...
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Why weren’t you watching her?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I was watching you I thought you migth need some help…
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Which way Pod? Which way did she go?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Ah, I think that way.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Arya!
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: [The camera moves to show us Arya hiding just above Brienne. She walks down to The Hound.]
You’re still here? [Coughs] Big bitch saved you.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: I don’t need saving.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: No, not you. You’re a real killer. With your water dancing, and your needle.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: You’re gonna die?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Unless there’s a Maester hiding behind that rock, aye, I’m done. I’d skin you alive for wine. [Arya offers water.] Fuck water! Killed by a woman. (Chuckles) I bet you liked that. Go on, go after her. She’ll help you. Going out alone, you won’t last a day out there.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: I’ll last longer than you.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You remember where the heart is? Fuck it. I’m ready. Go on, girl. Another name off your list. You kept promising me. I cut down your butcher’s boy, the ginger. He was begging for mercy. Please sir, please don’t kill me, please, please. Bled all over my horse. Saddle stunk of butcher’s boy for weeks. And your sister, your pretty sister. I should’ve taken her. That night the Blackwater burned, I should’ve fucked her bloody. At least I’d have one happy memory! Do I have to beg you? Do it. Do it.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: [Arya stands up, takes The Hound’s coin purse, and walks away.]
Kill me. Kill me! Kill me! Kill me!
Speaker: HOUND

Text: KING'S LANDING
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: [We enter Tyrion’s cell. The door opens.]
Oh, get on with it you son of a whore.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Is that any way to speak about our mother?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: What’re you doing?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What do you think I’m doing? The galley’s waiting in the bay bound for the Free Cities.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Who’s helping you?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Varys.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Varys?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You have more friends than you thought.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: [They reach the end of the underground tunnel.]
There’s a locked door at the top of the stairs. Knock on it twice, and then twice again. Varys will open.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I suppose this is goodbye, then.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: [They hug.]
Farewell, little brother.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Jaime, thank you. For my life.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Quickly now.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: [Tyrion takes a torch and uses a trap door to enter a room. There is a woman sleeping on a double bed, and we see the booch of the Hand of the King.]
Tywin… my lion...
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: [We see that the woman is Shae. She grabs a knife, and she and Tyrion struggle. Tyrion eventually strangles her with the bedclothes, weeping.]
I’m sorry. I’m sorry.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: [Tyrion takes a crossbow from the wall and walks in on Tywin on the privy.]

Tyrion! Put down the crossbow. Who released you? Ah, your brother ,I expect. He always had a soft spot for you. Come, we’ll go and talk in my chambers. Is this how you want to speak to me? Shaming your father has always given you pleasure…
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: All my life, you’ve wanted me dead.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Yes. But you refused to die. I respect that, even admire it. You fight for what’s yours. I’d never let them execute you; is that what you fear? I’d never let Illyn Payne take your head. You’re a Lannister. You’re my son.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I loved her.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Who?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Shae.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Bah, Tyrion. Put down that crossbow.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I murdered her. With my own hands.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It doesn’t matter.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: It doesn’t matter?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She was a whore!
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Say that word again.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And what? You’ll kill your own father in the privy? No. You’re my son. Enough of this nonsense…
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I am your son, and you sentenced me to die. You knew I didn’t poison Joffrey, but you sentenced me all the same. Why?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Enough. We’ll go back to my chambers and speak with some dignity.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I can’t go back there. She’s in there.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What, are you afraid of a dead whore?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: [Tyrion fires the crossbow at Tywin.]
You shot me. You’re no son of mine.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I am your son. I have always been your son.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: [Tyrion fires again.]
What have you done? Quickly. Trust me, my friend, I’ve brought you this far.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: [Varys loads Tyrion, in a transport container, onto a ship. He goes to walk back to King's Landing, but turns around and boards the ship himself]
THE RIVERLANDS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: [We go back to Arya, alone. She rides her horse to a small port.]
I want to see the captain.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You’re seeing him.
Speaker: CAPTAIN

Text: I want to go north, to the wall.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: No you don’t.
Speaker: CAPTAIN

Text: I can pay.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: There is nothing in the north but ice and war and pirates.
Speaker: CAPTAIN

Text: I wouldn’t need a cabin. Please, I could work, scrubbing the floors, or…
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I’m not going north, child, we’re going home.
Speaker: CAPTAIN

Text: Where’s home?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The Free City of Braavos.
Speaker: CAPTAIN

Text: Wait, I have something else.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: More silver won’t make a difference.
Speaker: CAPTAIN

Text: It’s not silver, it’s iron.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: [Arya hands over the token she was given by Jaqen H'ghar.]
Valar morghulis.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: How did you… valar dohaeris. Of course, you shall have a cabin.
Speaker: CAPTAIN

Text: [We see Arya aboard the ship.]
Woods.
Speaker: EXT

Text: Dogs bark and a woman laughs. Another woman breathes in panic, gasping for breath
Tansy! Tansy! Tansy!
Speaker: Ramsay

Text: RAMSAY and MYRANDA run together, holding hands. They each hold a bow as they run.  They are happy, excited and enjoying themselves. THEON limps behind them, trying to keep up. The hunting dogs continue to bark.
Tansy! Tansy!
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: TANSY runs through the woods, the hunting dogs barking in pursuit. Further behind are RAMSAY, MYRANDA and THEON.
There you are.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: (screams)
Speaker: TANSAY

Text: (laughing) I can't see her, Ramsay.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: Tansy!
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY notches an arrow. TANSY pauses at a tree, gasping for breath. RAMSAY's arrow strikes the tree, just inches from her face. She screams, and begins running again.
If you make it out of the woods, you win! Run, Tansy, run!
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: MYRANDA expertly notches an arrow and lets it fly. It flies past TANSY, who stumbles down into a muddy stream, gasping and screaming. She scrambles on all fours in panic, pauses to hide in the shadowed stream bed. She sobs.
Tansy.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Where is she?
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: Tansy, Tansy, Tansy!
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: The hunting dogs come barreling down the stream bed towards TANSY. She shrieks and whimpers, and starts running once again. The dogs chase her through a small tunnel and back into the woods proper. MYRANDA lets another arrow fly, with concentration and precision. It hits TANSY in the leg, and she falls, sobbing. The dogs terrorize her. RAMSAY, MYRANDA and THEON catch up.
Good girls. Down, girls. Down. Well done. You, too.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: I only wounded her.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: You brought her down. That's what matters. A fine shot. Wasn't it, Reek?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: A fine shot, master. My lady.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Please, my lord. It hurts.
Speaker: TANSY

Text: Oh, sweet. Don't cry. It will be over soon.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: MYRANDA notches another arrow at takes aim.
She thinks she's pretty. Let me put one through her face.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: We have to reward the hounds, love. They did all the hard work.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Why? I did whatever you asked.
Speaker: TANSY

Text: But you made Myranda feel jealous.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: MYRANDA lowers her bow, a bit taken aback.
Me jealous of her?
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: My lord, please.
Speaker: TANSY

Text: You can see that your presence has become a bit of a problem.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY turns from jaunty to ferocious.
Rip her! Rip her! Rip her!
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Off camera, the dogs tear into TANSY. She screams. THEON watches, dejected and powerless. Sounds of ripping flesh and TANSY screaming fill the woods.
Not so pretty now.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: TANSY's screams have stopped, but the sounds of ripping flesh continue. THEON struggles to hold back tears.
King's Landing.
Speaker: INT

Text: PODRICK serves sausages to TYRION. JAIME sits at the table, uncomfortably.
Your new hand, it's nicer than the old one. Wouldn't you agree, Pod?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Is it solid gold?
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Gilded steel.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You're not eating. Why is no one eating? My wife wastes away and my brother starves himself.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm not hungry.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You lost a hand, not a stomach. Try the boar. Cersei can't get enough of it since one killed Robert for her.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION raises his cup.
A toast. To the proud Lannister children. The dwarf, the cripple, and the mother of madness.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JAIME moves to raise his own cup, but knocks it over clumsily with is left hand.
Oh!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I'll clean it up.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: No, I'll do it. Leave us.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: PODRICK exits, while JAIME places his cup right-side up.
It's only wine.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: He holds up his own cup and pours it out onto the table. JAIME sits back in resignation. TYRION stands and pours more wine.
I can't fight anymore.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: What about your left?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I can hold a sword, but all my instincts are wrong. How can I protect the king when I can hardly wipe my own ass?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You're the Lord Commander now. Command. Let others do the fighting. When was the last time Father used a sword?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm not Father. I'm the Kingslayer. When people find out I can't slay a pigeon...
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Train, then. Learn to fight with your other hand.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION sits back down.
With whom? You? Men talk. Soon as someone discovers I can't fight, he'll tell everyone.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You need a proper, discreet swordsman. As it happens, I have just the one.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: A rocky King's Landing shoreline.
Speaker: EXT

Text: BRONN appears, carrying some swords. He joins JAIME, who sits by the shore.
My brother tells me you can keep your mouth shut. Unusual talent for a sellsword.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He tells me you shit gold just like your father.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Is this place safe?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME tosses a pouch of gold to BRONN.
There's this knight, Leygood, got thunderbolts on his shield.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Uh-huh.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Right here is where I fuck his wife. She's a screamer, that one. If they don't hear her, they won't hear us.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: BRONN pockets the gold. JAIME gets his sword, and spins it in his wrist to warm it. BRONN whistles in admiration.
I've never seen Valyrian steel before. She's a beauty. The problem is, if you fight with an edged blade, I'll have to.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: BRONN stands, holding two sparring swords.
And if I fight with an edged blade, I'll have no one left to pay me.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: He drops one to the ground, clattering, and continues to walk forward.
I haven't used a sparring sword since I was nine.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME walks to the sparring sword, indignant. He reaches for it, but BRONN slaps his hand with his sword, just as he grabs it.
Ah! Bold warrior you are, attacking a man when his guard's down.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Best time to attack a man.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: BRONN swings at JAIME, who parries clumsily. BRONN pushes him, and JAIME falters to the wall.
Mind yourself. JAIME;  If I still had my right hand...
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Plan on growing it back?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: They engage in swordplay. JAIME parries defensively, but well. However, BRONN gets him off balance again and causes him to stumble with a forearm nudge. JAIME recovers and faces him. JAIME pants and resets.
Come on, then.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME makes an awkward attack, and they continue.
The Dreadfort at night.
Speaker: EXT

Text: Some riders gallops down the Dreadfort road,
Open the gates!
Speaker: MAN

Text: The Dreadfort courtyard
Speaker: EXT

Text: The men swing open the door and the riders enter.
Riders coming in! Let's get these horses seen to!
Speaker: MAN

Text: RAMSAY stands to greet the riders. ROOSE BOLTON and WALDA dismount and approach.
Father. Welcome home.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Walda, this is Ramsay Snow, my bastard.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: RAMSEY steps forward to greet her, warmly smiling.
A pleasure, Mother.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY kisses her cheek. WALDA smiles awkwardly.
Hello.
Speaker: WALDA

Text: See that the horses are fed, watered, and rubbed down. And take Lady Walda to her chambers.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: This way, my lady.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: WALDA and the WOMAN exit.
Where is your prize?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: With the hounds. I'll have a look at him.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: ROOSE exits, and RAMSAY greets LOCKE. They walk together
I hear you took a hand from the Kingslayer.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Word travels. How he screamed. You would have loved it.
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: (laughs)
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Dreadfort interior.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: ROOSE sits down by the fire, aching and exhausted from the ride. RAMSAY and THEON enter. A MAN stands in the background, sharpening a shaving razor against a strop.
Father.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: ROOSE rises to inspect THEON.
What did you do to him?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: I trained him. He was a slow learner, but he learned.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: You flayed him.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Peeled a few bits. Removed a few others.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: This was Balon Greyjoy's son and heir.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: We've been flaying our enemies for 1,000 years. The flayed man is on our banners.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: My banners, not yours. You're not a Bolton. You're a Snow. Tywin Lannister has given me the North. But he won't lift a finger to help me take it. As long as the ironborn hold Moat Cailin, our armies are trapped south of the Neck. Theon was a valuable hostage, not your plaything. I wanted to trade him for Moat Cailin.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: I already asked. Lord Greyjoy refused. Savages have no...
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: You sent terms to Balon Greyjoy without my consent?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: You made me acting Lord of the Dreadfort. I acted.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: I had to smuggle myself into my own lands thanks to the Greyjoys. I needed Theon. I needed him whole.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Theon was our enemy. But Reek, Reek will never betray us.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: I placed far too much trust in you.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Reek, how could you let me stand before my father unshaven? It's disrespectful.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: I'm sorry, my lord.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Give him the razor.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY sits.
If I'm not a Bolton, Father, what does it matter?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: THEON stakes the razor and the shaving cream.
Go on, Reek. A nice close shave.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: THEON lathers RAMSAY's face and begins to shave it carefully.
Reek, tell Father where are Bran and Rickon Stark?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: I don't know, my lord.
Speaker: THEON

Text: You murdered them and displayed their corpses at Winterfell.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Reek, did you murder the Stark boys?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: No, my lord. Just two farm boys.
Speaker: THEON

Text: And crisped them so no one would know.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Yes, my lord.
Speaker: THEON

Text: The Starks have always ruled the North. If Bran and Rickon are alive, the country will rally to their side now that Robb Stark is gone.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: THEON continues to shave RAMSAY and holds the razor on RAMSAY's throat. RAMSAY goads him.
Oh, that's right, Reek. Robb Stark is dead. Sorry. I know he was like a brother to you. But my father put a knife through his heart. How do you feel about that?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: THEON's hand twitches, and he struggles with himself. Then he continues to shave RAMSAY slowly.
You ready for a hunt?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Always. Find those boys and I'll give you 1,000 acres and a holdfast.
Speaker: MERYN TRANT

Text: Your pet rat have any thoughts on which way they went after Winterfell?
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: Jon Snow is at Castle Black.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Who the fuck is Jon Snow?
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: Their bastard brother. He could be sheltering them. He may know where they are.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: RAMSEY stands, cleanly shaven.
Even if he doesn't, he's half Stark himself. Could be a threat.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: You want to prove yourself a Bolton? Gather whatever men you can and ride for Moat Cailin. Bring this creature of yours. Maybe he'll be of some use. Take the Moat for the family, for our family, and I'll reconsider your position.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: King's Landing garden.
Speaker: EXT

Text: TYRION and PODRICK meet VARYS.
Lord Varys. Breakfasting with the king?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm afraid foreigners aren't welcome at such exclusive affairs.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Oh, to be foreign.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Ahem.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: PODRICK stands aside as TYRION and VARYS head down a more secluded path.
Shae has been noticed. Sansa's maid saw you with her. She already told your sister. It's only a matter of time before your father hears.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: So I'm guilty of being seen with my own wife's handmaiden. My father will ask you if there's anything more and you'll tell him some clever lie.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No, I will not. How long do you imagine your father and sister would let me live if they suspected me of lying? I have no pet sellsword to protect me. No legendary brother to avenge me. Only little birds who whisper in my ear.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Forgive me if I don't weep for you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No one weeps for spiders or whores. I have friends across the sea who could help her.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: She won't leave. I've told her this is a dangerous place so many times, she no longer believes it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Your father has promised to hang the next whore he finds you with. Have you ever known your father to make an idle threat?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: VARYS bows and leaves. TYRION fumes.
A garden party.
Speaker: EXT

Text: SANSA, TYRION, JOFFREY, TYWIN, CERSEI, TOMMEN and PYCELLE sit at an outdoor banquet table. MACE TYRELL stands before them.
From House Tyrell and the people of the Reach, Your Grace, it is my honor to present you with this wedding cup.
Speaker: MACE

Text: He places the up before JOFFREY.
May you and my daughter Margaery drink deep and live long.
Speaker: MACE

Text: A handsome goblet, my lord. Or shall I call you Father?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: I shall be honored, Your Grace.
Speaker: MACE

Text: MACE bows and exits. SHAE brings a tray to the table and sets it before SANSA.
She's the whore I told you about. The dark-haired one.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: SHAE exits.
Have her brought to the Tower of the Hand before the wedding.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYRION looks concerned. PODRICK places a large tome before JOFFREY and TYRION walks to the front of the table
A book?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: "The Lives of Four Kings." Grand Maester Kaeth's history of the reigns of Daeron the Young Dragon, Baelor the Blessed, Aegon the Unworthy, and Daeron the Good. A book every king should read.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JOFFREY is at a loss for words. TYWIN entreats him to respond.
Now that the war is won, we should all find time for wisdom. Thank you, Uncle.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: TYRION bows. SHAE watches. The MOUNTAIN brings forth a sword and lays it on the table before JOFFREY. TYWIN stands.
One of only two Valyrian steel swords in the capital, Your Grace, freshly forged in your honor.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Excitedly, JOFFREY walks around the table. Exuberantly, he unsheaths the sword.
Careful, Your Grace. Nothing cuts like Valyrian steel.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: So they say.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: JOFFREY steps away, then spins and cleaves the book that TYRION just gave him, repeatedly. People gasp in response. JOFFREY is very pleased.
Such a great sword should have a name. What shall I call her?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Stormbringer.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Terminus.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: Widow's Wail.
Speaker: MAN #3

Text: Wolfsbane. -
Speaker: MAN #4

Text: Widow's Wail. I like that. Every time I use it, it'll be like cutting off. Ned Stark's head all over again.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: JOFFREY sheaths the sword. SANSA looks dejected. He sits down next to MACE and SHAE continues to look on.
TYRION's chambers
Speaker: INT

Text: The door opens and SHAE walks in, smiling.
Don't.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You want me on the desk? What's wrong, my lion?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Don't call me that.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What should I call you?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: I'm afraid our friendship can't continue.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Our friendship?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: There's a ship waiting in the harbor bound for Pentos.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What? You'll have your own cabin, of course, and across the Narrow Sea a house, servants.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: What is this?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: I'm a married man. My wife has suffered a great deal, as you well know. I don't want her to suffer anymore on my account. I need to uphold my vows.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She doesn't want you.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: I need to do right by her.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You don't want her.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: By our children.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What are you afraid of?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: I'm not afraid.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You are. You are afraid of your father and your sister. You're going to run from them all your life?  I need you to leave.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: I'm not afraid of them. I'm not going to run.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: Shae.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We will fight them together. It's like you said, I am yours and you are mine.
Speaker: SHAE

Text: You're a whore! Sansa is fit to bear my children and you are not. I can't be in love with a whore. I can't have children with a whore. How many men have you been with? 500? 5,000?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: How many whores have you been with?
Speaker: SHAE

Text: I have enjoyed my time with all of them and I have enjoyed my time with you most of all. But now that time is over.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION walks over and opens the door. SHAE sobs. BRONN enters.
You'll have a comfortable life in Pentos. Bronn will escort you to your ship.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: SHAE continues to sob. BRONN clasps her shoulder to lead her out. She turns quickly and slaps him, then storms off, crying. BRONN looks to TYRION, then exits. TYRION walks to the table and violently slaps his cup to the ground.
Stannis's army camp in the  Stormlands at night.
Speaker: EXT

Text: A woman screams. A line of men are bound on top of unlit bonfires, including AXELL FLORENT. The soldiers mill about, carrying torches.
Hear us now. Accept these tokens of our faith, my lord, and lead us from the darkness.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Sire, I served you well.
Speaker: AXELL FLORENT

Text: The crowd chants along with MELISANDRE
Lord of Light, show us the way...
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Selyse, you're my sister!
Speaker: AXELL FLORENT

Text: (Chanting with the others) Yours are the stars that guide us.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Tell him! Tell him!
Speaker: AXELL FLORENT

Text: Lord of Light, protect us, for the night is dark and full of terrors.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: The bonfires ignite quickly. The men scream in agony and die.
(to STANNIS) Did you see? Their souls. It was their souls. Our lord took them. Did you see?
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: STANNIS leaves without responding. DAVOS trails him.
Lord Florent was your brother by law. STANNIS; He was an infidel.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: He worshipped the gods of his fathers and their fathers before him. They were the gods of your fathers, too.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I ordered him to tear down his idols. He disobeyed.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: How many ships did he bring to your 'cause? How many men?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: A good deal more than you.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: STANNIS exits and SELYSE catches up, accompanied by MELISANDRE.
Did you see, Ser Davos? They're with our lord now. Their sins all burned away. Did you see?
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: I'm sure they're more than grateful, my queen.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: MELISANDRE walks past DAVOS and he watches, silently.
Storm's End Dining room
Speaker: INT

Text: Stannis sits at table with SELYSE and MELISANDRE.
Meat's off.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Our larders are almost empty.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Serve fish, then. We're on an island.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: You hate fish.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: I hate a good many things, but I suffer them all the same.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: (to MELISANDRE) When Storm's End was under siege and I was starving, Stannis boiled soup for me from books. The binding glue is made from horses. One morning, he shot two seagulls on the beach. I've never tasted anything as good as grilled seagull. Do you remember?
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Of course I remember.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Have you ever known true hunger, my lady?
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: It's all I knew when I was a child.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Until you found the Lord of Light?
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Until he found me.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I fear for our daughter's soul.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Every mother should fear for her child's soul.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: She's a stubborn little beast.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: She's a child.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: You barely know her. You think she's sweet because she smiles when you visit. She's sullen and stubborn and sinful. Why else would the Lord of Light have seen fit to mark her face? She needs the rod.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: She's my daughter. You will not strike her.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: As you command. Perhaps the Lady Melisandre could speak with her.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: SHIREEN's bedroom after dinner.
Speaker: INT

Text: A knock on the door.
Come in.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: MELISANDRE enters.
Were you sleeping, Princess?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: (Shakes her head)
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Did you watch the ceremony on the beach?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I heard it.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: And it frightened you?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Ser Axell was my uncle. He was always kind to me.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: They're in a better place now, Princess. The fire cleansed them of the sins of the world.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: But they screamed.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Women scream when they give birth. Afterward they are filled with joy.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Afterward they aren't ash and bone.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: You have so many questions, don't you? So did I when I was a child. I was much like you. Only I wasn't a princess.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: And you didn't have this.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: No. But I suffered in other ways, sweet girl, believe me. What do you know of the gods?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I read "The Seven-Pointed Star."
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: MELISANDRE sits next to SHIREEN to comfort her.
Lies and fables. Septons speak of seven gods. There are but two... a god of light and love and joy and a god of darkness, evil, and fear. Eternally at war.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: There are no seven heavens and no seven hells?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: There's only one hell, Princess. The one we live in now.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: The North at night.
Speaker: EXT

Text: Hodor.
Speaker: Heavy breathing as the camera pans through the snowy woods. Suddenly, the camera lurches forward and comes upon a deer and the camera attacks viciously,  a wolf's hunt from the predator's point of view.  Hodor

Text: Bran awakening. HODOR, MEERA and JOJEN are with him. BRAN is frantic and panting.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Why did you wake me?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You've been gone for hours.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: I was hungry.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: We're all hungry.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: I was just eating.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Summer was eating. Your body can't live on the food your wolf consumes. Spending too much time in Summer's skin is dangerous. You're not a direwolf, Bran.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: BRAN eats some morsels given to him by MEERA.
Must be glorious, though. To run, to leap, to hunt. To be whole. I know that's tempting, but if you're trapped in Summer for too long, you'll forget what it was to be human.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: You'd forget us, Bran. You'd forget your mother and father. You'd forget your brothers and sisters. You'd forget Winterfell. You'd forget you. And if we lose you, we lose everything.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: The North.
Speaker: EXT

Text: HODOR pulls BRAN through the woods on a sled. MEERA and JOJEN walk beside them. A wolf barks. They pause and BRAN turns to see his wolf, Summer.
Hodor, take me to the tree.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: HODOR carries BRAN to the base of the tree, sets him down and steps back. The bark seems to have twisted into a human face. BRAN touches it and launches into a vision of the Godswood, a THREE-EYED RAVEN, a sword, NED STARK's worried face, the Godswood again. Time speeds forward.
Look for me... beneath the tree.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: The THREE-EYED RAVEN lands on the branch of a Godswood. A storm of crows flies into a standing BRAN. A castle interior, an undead horse,
He saw us.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: BRAN falls from the Winterfell tower. A dragon's shadow sweeps over King's Landing.
North.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: BRAN gasps and releases his hand from the twisted face on the tree. The vision has ended. MEERA and JOJEN approach.
I know where we have to go.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: King's Landing, the Sept of Baelor.
Speaker: INT

Text: MARGAERY and MACE walk down the aisle. MACE hands her to JOFFREY. The pair continue up the steps to the HIGH SEPTON. He places a cape over her shoulders. They clasp hands and they bar bound together.
Let it be known that Margaery of House Tyrell and Joffrey of the Houses Lannister and Baratheon are one heart, one flesh, one soul. Cursed be he who would seek to tear them asunder.
Speaker: HIGH SEPTON

Text: With this kiss, I pledge my love.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: JOFFREY and MARGAERY kiss. The crowd applauds.
We have a new queen.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Better her than you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: King's Landing Garden.
Speaker: EXT

Text: TYWIN and OLENNA talk in the garden as the wedding guests filter out.
Bit much, wouldn't you say?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: It feels proportionate.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Proportionate to what?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: The expected extravagance.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: People who spend their money on this sort of nonsense tend not to have it for long.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: You ought to try enjoying something before you die. You might find it suits you.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: MACE approaches and ties to join them.
Not now, Mace. Lord Tywin and I are speaking.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: TYWIN and OLENNA continue, while MACE rears back.
Anyway, I don't know what you're complaining about. I'm paying my share.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Shall we stick golden roses in half the meat pies to commemorate your generosity?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: No, your heartfelt thank-you is it's own reward. I would imagine I'd be hearing it again before long. Wars are rather expensive. "The Iron Bank will have it's due." How they love to remind everyone. Almost as much as you Lannisters with your debts.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: I'm not worried about the Iron Bank.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: We both know you're smarter than that. Come, Tywin, let us celebrate young love.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: CUT TO; The wedding reception.
Jugglers and firebreathers, some on stilts, entertain the crowd. BRONN, TYRION and PODRICK walk among the tables.
All taken care of.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You saw her board the ship?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Aye, she's on it.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You saw the ship sail away?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No one knows she's there but you, me, and Varys.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: How do you know?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Because if someone follows me without an invitation, I'm the last person they ever follow.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: There's someone following you?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: BRONN turns and clasps TYRION's shoulder.
She's gone. I know you don't want to believe it, but she is. Now, go drink till it feels like you did the right thing.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: BRONN exits.
TYRION and PODRICK walk through the party. They encounter OBERYN and ELLARIA.
Hello.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Hello.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Not you.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: OBERYN and ELLARIA are enthralled by a contortionist. TYRION and PODRICK walk on.
The head table.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: JOFFREY watches the party. OLENNA approaches SANSA.

You look exquisite, child. The wind has been at you, though. I haven't had the opportunity to tell you how sorry I was to hear about your brother. War is war, but killing a man at a wedding, horrid. What sort of monster would do such a thing? As if men need more reasons to fear marriage.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: TYRION enters and sits.
My lady. My lady.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Lord Tyrion, you see? Not as bad as all that. Perhaps if your pauper husband were to sell his mule and his last pair of shoes, he might be able to afford to bring you to Highgarden for a visit. Now that peace has come and all is right with the world, it would do you good to see some of it. You must excuse me. It's time I ate some of this food I paid for.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: A coat of gold / Or a coat of red / A lion still has claws And mine,  my lord...
Speaker: MUSICIAN

Text: MARGAERY is enjoying the performance, but JOFFREY is bored. He stands and throws some coins to them.
Very good. Very good. Off you go.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: The musicians scrabble to pick up the coins, and depart quickly. MARGAERY moves to calm JOFFREY. CERSEI watches jealously, TOMMEN at her side.  MARGAERY; My love, why don't we make the announcement?
JOFFREY stands and clanks his goblet for attention.
Everyone. The queen would like to say a few words.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: The crowd applauds as JOFFREY sits and MARGAERY stands.

We are so fortunate to enjoy this marvelous food and drink. Not all among us are so lucky. To thank the gods for bringing the recent war to a just end, King Joffrey has decreed that the leftovers from our feast be given to the poorest in his city.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: The crowd applauds, and JOFFREY adores it. CERSEI comes over to MARGAERY.
You're an example to us all.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI kisses her on each cheek.
LORAS stands in the distance, and catches OBERYN's eye as he cuddles with ELLARIA. LORAS accidentally backs into JAIME.
Ser Jaime, I'm very sorry.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Ser Loras, it's quite all right. Your sister looks very beautiful.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: As does yours.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: So, looking forward to your wedding?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Yes, very much.
Speaker: LORAS
