Text: Our fathers are both rather keen on the prospect.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: They certainly are.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Perhaps they should get married. If you were to marry Cersei, she'd murder you in your sleep. If you somehow managed to put a child in her first, she'd murder him, too, long before he drew his first breath. Luckily for you, none of this will happen because you'll never marry her.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And neither will you.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: LORAS pats JAIME on the shoulder, and exits. BRIENNE approaches the head table, and bows.
MARGAERY stands and shakes her hand.
Lady Brienne. So good of you to come.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I'm no lady, Your Grace.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Did you just bow?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Apologies, Your Grace. I never did master the curtsy.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You're the one who put a sword through Renly Baratheon.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: That's not true, my love. Brienne had nothing to do with it.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: A shame. I'd knight the man that put an end to that deviant's life.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: I just wanted to congratulate you both and wish you good fortune. The country has been at war too long. I hope your reign is long and peaceful.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Yes, yes.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Thank you. I hope we see more of you.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: BRIENNE departs, and the camera follows her. CERSEI intercepts her.
Lady Brienne. You're Lord Selwyn Tarth's daughter. That makes you a lady whether you want to be or not.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: As you say, Your Grace.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I owe you my gratitude. You returned my brother safely to King's Landing.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: In truth, he rescued me, Your Grace. More than once.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Did he? Haven't heard that story before.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Not such a fascinating story, I'm afraid.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I'm sure you have many fascinating stories. Sworn to Renly Baratheon. Sworn to Catelyn Stark. And now my brother. Must be exciting to flit from one camp to the next serving whichever lord or lady you fancy.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I don't serve your brother, Your Grace.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: But you love him.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: BREINNE does not answer.
Your Grace.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: BRIENNE exits, and JAIME notices their conversation.
CUT TO; The head table.
PYCELLE has cornered a maid.
No, no, come to my chambers and I will examine you personally.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: She'll do no such thing.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Oh, Your Grace. Yes, well, this young lady sought my advice...
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: You should see Qyburn. He's quite good.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: MAID

Text: The MAID exits.
Qyburn? Deplorable man. Brought shame on the Citadel with his repugnant experiments.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: More repugnant than your gnarled fingers on that girl's thighs?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your Grace, I am a man of learning.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: My little brother had you sent to the Black Cells when you annoyed him. What do you think I could do to you if you annoyed me?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I never meant to annoy anyone.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: But you are. You annoy me right now. Every breath you draw in my presence annoys me. So here's what I want you to do. I want you to leave my presence. Leave this wedding right now. Go to the kitchens and instruct them that all the leftovers from the feast will be brought to the kennels.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your Grace, Queen Margaery...
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: The queen is telling you the leftovers will feed the dogs or you will.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: PYCELLE exits, and CERSEI smiles.
the head table, where JOFFREY and MARGAERY watch a fool juggling. Once again, JOFFREY is not amused. He stands.
Speaker: CUT

Text: A gold dragon to whoever knocks my fool's hat off.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: The fool is suddenly pelted with food, and he runs off. CERSEI and TYWIN enter.
You're in rather a good mood.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I suppose I am.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I won't ask why.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Small pleasures.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: OBERYN and ELLARIA enter.
Your Grace. Lord Tywin.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Prince Oberyn.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I don't believe you have met Ellaria. This is the Lord Hand Tywin Lannister and Cersei Lannister the Queen Regent. I suppose it is former Queen Regent now. Lord Hand and Lady Cersei, Ellaria Sand.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: My lord. My lady.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Charmed.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Can't say I've ever met a Sand before.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: We are everywhere in Dorne. I have 10,000 brothers and sisters.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Bastards are born of passion, aren't they? We don't despise them in Dorne.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: No? How tolerant of you.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I expect it is a relief, Lady Cersei, giving up your regal responsibilities. Wearing the crown for so many years must have left your neck a bit crooked.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: I suppose you'll never know, Prince Oberyn. It's a shame your older brother couldn't attend the wedding.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Please give him our regards. With any luck, the gout will abate with time and he will be able to walk again.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: They call it the rich man's disease. A wonder you don't have it.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Noblemen in my part of the country don't enjoy the same lifestyle as our counterparts in Dorne.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: People everywhere have their differences. In some places the highborn frown upon those of low birth. In other places the rape and murder of women and children is considered distasteful. What a fortunate thing for you, former Queen Regent, that your daughter Myrcella has been sent to live in the latter sort of place.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: JOFFREY taps his goblet.

Everyone, silence! Clear the floor. There's been too much amusement here today. A royal wedding is not an amusement. A royal wedding is history. The time has come for all of us to contemplate our history. My lords... my ladies...
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: A lever is pulled. A giant lion's mouth opens. A red carpet rolls down.
I give you. King Joffrey... Renly, Stannis, Robb Stark, Balon Greyjoy. The War of the Five Kings.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Five dwarves come down from the lion's mouth, each dressed as one of the five kings. They run about,  playing their roles with comic glee. The crowd applauds. JOFFREY is very pleased. TYRION, less so.
I'm the rightful king.
Speaker: RENLY DWARF

Text: King in the North!
Speaker: ROBB DWARF

Text: Yes!
Speaker: JOFFREY DWARF

Text: Traitor. You're a traitor.
Speaker: BALON DWARF

Text: For the Seven Kingdoms!
Speaker: JOFFREY DWARF

Text: The dwarves line up on the stage.
Let the war begin.
Speaker: JOFFREY DWARF

Text: The crowd applauds. RENLY DWARF starts the prance about the stage.
Renly, you're no king.
Speaker: STANNIS DWARF

Text: Away, degenerate. Away. Away.
Speaker: BALON DWARF

Text: Ooh, careful.
Speaker: RENLY DWARF

Text: Go on.
Speaker: STANNIS DWARF

Text: I want you to be my prince. Stannis!
Speaker: RENLY DWARF

Text: STANNIS DWARF and RENLY DWARF feign some indecent acts. LORAS leaves in disgust.
Who's got the gold now, Stark?
Speaker: BALON DWARF

Text: I am the rightful king.
Speaker: ROBB DWARF

Text: Challenge me, ruffian.
Speaker: BALON DWARF

Text: Take that. -
Speaker: ROBB DWARF

Text: I'm drowning. I'm drowning.
Speaker: BALON DWARF

Text: I am the King in the North!
Speaker: ROBB DWARF

Text: TYRION and SANSA are not amused.
JOFFREY DWARF shoots and arrow and hits STANNIS DWARF.
Not wildfire!
Speaker: STANNIS DWARF

Text: The crowd applauds. STANNIS DWARF runs off the stage, crying.
Pay each of them 20 gold when this is done.
Speaker: TYRON

Text: Yes, my lord.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: We'll have to find another way to thank the king.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JOFFREY is enjoying the spectacle, but MARGAERY is not.
JOFFREY DWARF and ROBB DWARF are having a stand off.
Charge!
Speaker: JOFFREY DWARF

Text: They run past one another without landing a blow.
Ready, again.
Speaker: JOFFREY DWARF

Text: Charge! Yes!
Speaker: JOFFREY DWARF

Text: This time, JOFFREY DWARD knocks off ROBB DWARF"s wolf helmet.
Your head!
Speaker: JOFFREY DWARF

Text: SANSA is mortified. JOFFREY laughs hysterically while MARGAERY looks at him, appalled.
ROBB DWARF falls. The crowd applauds. JOFFREY DWARF claims victory.
JOFFREY grabs his golbet.
JOFFREY DWARF feigns sodomizing the wolf head. SANSA is motionless. JOFFREY spits out his wine, laughing.
Fine gentlemen.
Speaker: JOFFREY DWARF

Text: The players take their bow and the crowd applauds. JOFFREY stands.

Well fought. Well fought. Here you are. Champion's purse. Though you're not the champion yet, are you? A true champion defeats all the challengers. Surely there are others out there who still dare to challenge my reign. Uncle How about you? I'm sure they have a spare costume.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: The crowd laughs. Tyrion stands.

One taste of combat was enough for me, Your Grace. I would like to keep what remains of my face. I think you should fight him. This was but a poor imitation of your own bravery on the field of battle. I speak as a firsthand witness. Climb down from the high table with your new Valyrian sword and show everyone how a true king wins his throne. Be careful, though. This one is clearly mad with lust. It would be a tragedy for the king to lose his virtue hours before his wedding night.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION sits, and JOFFREY is angered at his insults. The crowd quiets. JOFFREY walks over and pours his wine on TYRION's head. MARGAERY sits motionless.
A fine vintage. Shame that it spilled.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It did not spill.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: My love, come back to me. It's time for my father's toast.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Well, how does he expect me to toast without wine? Uncle, you can be my cupbearer seeing as you're too cowardly to fight.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Your Grace does me a great honor.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It's not meant as an honor.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: TYRION stands and walks over to JOFFREY, who purposely drops his goblet. As TYRION tried to pick it up, he kicks it away.
Bring me my goblet.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: TYRION kneels down to get the goblet. SANSA watches JOFFREY. She picks up the goblet and hands it to TYRION. He brings it to JOFFREY.
What good is an empty cup? Fill it.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: TYRION pours wine for JOFFREY in front of CERSEI, and hands it to him.
Kneel. Kneel before your king.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: TYRION does not budge.
Kneel. I said... kneel!
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: (Standing) Look, the pie.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: The crowd applauds, and the attention turns to the giant pie carried in by four men.
My queen.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: JOFFREY strides forward, and hews the pie with his sword. To his surprise, doves are released from the pie. He looks triumphant.
Wonderful. Wonderful. My hero.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: The pie is served to the guests.
Can we leave now?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Let's find out.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: MARGAERY feeds a forkful of pie to JOFFREY.
Uncle. Where are you going? You're my cupbearer, remember?
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: I thought I might change out of these wet clothes, Your Grace.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No, no, no. No, you're perfect the way you are. Serve me my wine.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: TYRION looks to SANSA.
Well, hurry up. This pie is dry.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: TYRION and fumes has he gets the goblet for JOFFREY. JOFFREY drinks deeply.
Mm, good. Needs washing down.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: If it please Your Grace, Lady Sansa is very tired.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No. (coughing) No, you'll wait here... un...
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: JOFFREY grabs his own throat, choking.
Your Grace?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It's nothing.
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: He's choking!
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Help the poor boy.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: JOFFREY turns towards the crowd, choking and staggering.
Idiots, help your king. -
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Move away!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME runs to JOFFREY, as he vomits.
Joffrey! Joffrey!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: CERSEI runs to them.
Help him! Someone help him!
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: (gags)
Speaker: JOFFREY

Text: Joffrey!
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: (to SANSA) Come with me now.
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: Joffrey! Joffrey!
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: TYRION and MARGAERY watch, aghast. CERSEI and JAIME continue to try to help JOFFREY.
If you want to live, we have to leave.
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: Don't touch him!
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: JOFFREY gurgles and chokens. His face is turning purple, his eyes glazed, vomit lining his cheeks. He spasms.
Joffrey. Please, Joffrey. Joffrey, what is it? Help him!
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Blood streams out of JOFFREY's nose. He convulses painfully. CERSEI cries as she watches him. He reaches a hand out towards TYRION, who at that moment picks up the goblet from before him. JOFFREY gaps a final time as blood continues to stream from his nose, his face a horrid shade of purple. He dies.
My son.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: He's gone. Our king is gone.
Speaker: MAN

Text: He did this. He poisoned my son, your king. Take him. Take him! Take him! Take him!
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Two guards grab TYRION. CERSEI looks upon the lifeless body of JOFFREY.
EXT. KING'S LANDING

The wedding banquet for Margaery and Joffrey has turned shocking and horrific. Joffrey lays dead in his mother's lap. Blood pours from his nose and vomit clings around his mouth. Cersei turns to Tyrion.
You did this. You did this!
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Three guards grab Tyrion from behind. As Sansa looks on, Ser Dontos Hollard approaches her.
We have to leave.
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: Take him! Take him!
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Tyrion is dragged off by guards as Sansa and Ser Dontos rush off through the crowd.
Where is his wife? Where's Sansa?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Find her. Bar the gates of the city. Seize every ship in the harbor.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Where is she?!
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No one leaves the capital! No one!
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: EXT. KINGS LANDING DOCK AT DUSK
A bell tolls as Sansa and Ser Dontos rush down to a small boat, separate from the Harbor.
Get in.
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: Where are we going?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Somewhere safe.
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: Sansa and Ser Dontos sail out into the ocean, far from King's Landing.
EXT. MISTY OCEAN AT NIGHT
They come across a huge mysterious ship in the middle of the misty sea. Ser Dontos pulls his smaller boat up alongside it.
Up you go, my lady. You'll be fine. You're stronger than you know.
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: Sansa climbs the latter.
EXT. LITTLEFINGER'S SHIP, MOMENTS LATER
She climbs up a ladder on the side of the ship, as she reaches the top someone grabs her. She gasps before realizing who it is.
Lord Baelish?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Petyr... Are you hurt, my lady?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: (shakes her head.)
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Good. Good. I'm sure you've had quite a fright. Rest easy. The worst is past.  Ser Dontos shouts up from his boat.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Lord Baelish. I promised I'd get her to you safely.
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: Softly, my friend... Voices carry over water.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I should get back before someone thinks to look for me.  LITTLEFINGER First you'll want your pay. 10,000 was it?
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: Littlefinger clicks his finger and two men with crossbows walk to the edge of the ship. They aim at Ser Dontos.
Wait!
Speaker: SER DONTOS

Text: Both men shoot at Ser Dontos, he groans in pain before lying dead. Sansa screams and Littlefinger hushes her.
Shh. You don't want the queen to hear, do you? 1,000 gold cloaks are searching for you. And if they found you, how do you think they would punish the girl who murdered the king?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I didn't murder anyone.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I know. I know. But you must admit it looks suspicious. The king who executed your father, who tormented you for years, and you fled the scene of his murder.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Sansa glances back to Ser Dontos' body.
Why did you kill him?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Because he was a drunk and a fool and I don't trust drunk fools.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: He saved me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Saved you? My lady, he followed my orders. Every one of them. And he did it all for gold. Money buys a man's silence for a time. A bolt in the heart buys it forever.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: He was helping me because I saved his life.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Yes, and he gave you a priceless necklace that once belonged to his grandmother. The last legacy of House Hollard.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Littlefinger removes the necklace from around Sansa's neck and places it on the edge of the ship. He pull out a knife and hits one of the "crystals" and it smashes like glass. Sansa, confused, studies him.
I had it made a few weeks ago. What did I once tell you about the capital?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: We're all liars here.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Littlefinger pushes the necklace off the edge of the boat and it lands directly on Ser Dontos' lifeless body.
Come, my lady. I know you've had a difficult day. But you're safe now. I promise you that. You're safe with me and sailing home.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Margaery Tyrell sits at the table with Olenna Tyrell.
So am I the queen?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: More than you were with Renly. Less than you would have been if Joffrey had done you the courtesy of consummating the marriage before dying. In any case, this would not be an opportune moment to press the issue.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Clawing at his own throat, looking to his mother to make stop... it was horrible.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: The world is overflowing with horrible things. But they're all a tray of cakes next to death. They brought me your grandfather's body when he died, you know? Made me look at it.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: What was it like?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: They took me to the Great Hall and there he was. The man I'd married and suffered to father my children. A great doughy lump I'd sat next to at endless dinners and tedious gatherings. There he was... lying on a table.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: One of my husbands preferred the company of men and was stabbed through the heart. Another was happiest torturing animals and was poisoned at our wedding feast... I must be cursed.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Nonsense. Your circumstances have improved markedly. You may not have enjoyed watching him die, but you enjoyed it more than you would have enjoyed being married to him, I can promise you that.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: But I would have been the queen.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Our alliance with the Lannisters remains every bit as necessary to them as it is unpleasant for us. You did wonderful work on Joffrey. The next one should be easier.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Joffrey's body is laid on a table in the center on the room. Cersei, Tommen and Tywin and stand around him. Tywin turns to Tommen.
Your brother is dead. Do you know what that means?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Tommen stays quiet.
I'm not trying to trick you.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: It means I'll become king.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Yes, you will become king. What kind of king do you think you'll be?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: A good king?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Mm, I think so as well. You've got the right temperament for it. But what makes a good king? Hmm? What is a good king's single most important quality?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: This is hardly the place or the time.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Holiness?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Hmm. Baelor the Blessed was holy. And pious. He built this sept. He also named a six-year-old boy high septon because he thought the boy could work miracles. He ended up fasting himself into an early grave because food was of this world and this world was sinful.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Justice.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Yeah. A good king must be just. Orys I was just. Everyone applauded his reforms. Nobles and commoners alike. But he wasn't just for long. He was murdered in his sleep after less than a year by his own brother. Was that truly just of him? To abandon his subjects to an evil that he was too gullible to recognize?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: No.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: No.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: What about strength?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Yes. Strength. King Robert was strong. He won the rebellion and crushed the Targaryen dynasty. And he attended three small council meetings in 17 years. He spent his time whoring and hunting and drinking until the last two killed him. So, we have a man who starves himself to death, a man who lets his own brother murder him, and a man who thinks that winning and ruling are the same thing. What do they all lack?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Wisdom.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Yes!
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Wisdom is what makes a good king.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Yes. But what is wisdom? Hmm? A house with great wealth and fertile lands asks you for your protection against another house with a strong Navy that could one day oppose you. How do you know which choice is wise and which isn't? You've any experience of treasuries and granaries or shipyards and soldiers?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: No.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: No. Of course not. A wise king knows what he knows and what he doesn't. You're young. A wise young king listens to his counselors and heeds their advice until he comes of age. And the wisest kings continue to listen to them long afterwards... Your brother was not a wise king. Your brother was not a good king. If he had been, perhaps he'd still be alive. Now, as the king, you will have to marry. Do you understand why?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Tywin and Tommen begin walking up the steps to leave the Sept.
A king needs a queen.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Yes, but why? To further the family line. Do you know how that happens?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Yes.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Yes, but has anyone explained the details to you?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I don't think so. It's all relatively straightforward.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: JAIME enters.
How are you?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I'm all right.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: You are. You will be. I'll see to that.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: TYWIN and TOMMEN exit.
Please give the queen a moment alone with her son.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Yes, my lord. All of you.
Speaker: HIGH SEPTON

Text: The High Septon snaps his fingers and the priests exit.

It was Tyrion. He killed him. He told me he would. "A day will come when you think you are safe and happy and your joy will turn to ashes in your mouth." That's what he said to me. You saw it. You saw Joff point at him just before he...
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I don't know what I saw.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Avenge him. Avenge our son. Kill Tyrion.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Tyrion's my brother. Our brother. There'll be a trial. We'll get to the truth of what happened.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I don't want a trial. He'll squirm his way to freedom given the chance. I want him dead. (CRYING) Please, Jaime. You have to. He was our son. Our baby boy.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: JAIME consoles CERSEI. They kiss. CERSEI steps back and gasps.
You're a hateful woman. Why have the gods made me love a hateful woman?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME grabs CERSEI and forcefully kisses her. He presses against her.
Jaime, not here, please. Please.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: JAIME rips at her dress. They end up tangled on the floor by the altar.
Stop it. Stop it. Stop.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Stop it. Stop.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: She continues to resist, but her resolve is weakening. They kiss, and JAIME brings her to the ground and forces himself on her.
Stop.  Stop. It's not right.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: (GRUNTS)
Speaker: JAIME

Text: It's not right. It's not right.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I don't care.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: (CRYING)  Don't.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I don't care.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Don't. Jaime, don't.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I don't care.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: RIVERLANDS AT NIGHT
Speaker: EXT

Text: Thunder rumbles as the HOUND relieves himself and ARYA plucks the leaves from a plant.
Gonna rain soon. Where are we?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Near Fairmarket, I think.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: You think? You don't have a map?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: No, I don't have a map.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Maybe we should get one.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Just point out the next map shop you see and I'll buy you one.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: How far is it to the Eyrie?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Far.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: And you're sure we're going the right way?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The HOUND feed his mount some water.
Believe me, girl, I want you there as soon as I can. Get my gold, be on my way.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: On your way where?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Why do you care? Might book passage across the Narrow Sea. Fight as a sellsword. Second Sons, could be. Seems like a good fit for me.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: I'd like to see Braavos one day.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Why Braavos?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: I have friends there.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I doubt it.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Seven blessings to you.
Speaker: FARMER HAMLET

Text: FARMER HAMLET and SALLY sit in their wagon above them.
What do you want?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: What do I want? This is my land.
Speaker: FARMER HAMLET

Text: If I'm standing on it, it's my land.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: We were just watering the horses. We'll be on our way. Forgive my father. He was wounded fighting in the war. Our cottage burned down while he was gone and my mother with it.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: (nods)
Speaker: FARMER HAMLET

Text: He's never been the same.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Which house did he fight for?
Speaker: FARMER HAMLET

Text: The Tullys of Riverrun.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: There's a storm coming. You'll be wanting a roof tonight. There's fresh hay in the barn. And Sally here makes rabbit stew just like her mom used to do. We don't have much, but any man that bled for House Tully is welcome to it.
Speaker: FARMER HAMLET

Text: FARMER'S HOME.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Thunder rumbles and the rain patters. FARMER HAMLET and SALLY host ARYA and the HOUND for dinner.

We ask the Father to judge us with mercy accepting our human frailty. We ask the Mother to bless our crops so we may feed ourselves and all who come to our door. We ask the Warrior to give us courage in these days of strife and turmoil. We ask the Maiden to protect Sally's virtue to keep her from the clutches of depravity.
Speaker: FARMER HAMLET

Text: You got to do all seven of the fuckers?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Father!
Speaker: ARYA

Text: We ask the Smith to strengthen our hands and our backs so we may finish the work required of us. We ask the Crone to guide us on our journey from darkness to darkness.
Speaker: FARMER HAMLET

Text: And we ask the Stranger not to kill us in our beds tonight for no damn reason at all.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The HOUND impatiently grabs the pot and pours himself some soup.
I'm so sorry.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The HOUND and ARYA slurp hungrily. FARMER HAMLET and SALLY watch, a bit appalled at their manners.
Really good.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Did you fight at the Twins?
Speaker: FARMER HAMLET

Text: Call that a fight? Slaughtering livestock more like.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The Red Wedding they're calling it. Walder Frey committed sacrilege that day. He shared bread and salt with the Starks. He offered them guest right.
Speaker: FARMER HAMLET

Text: Guest right don't mean much anymore.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: It means something to me. The gods will have their vengeance. Frey will burn in the seventh hell for what he did. Things were different when Hoster Tully ruled the Riverlands. We had good years and bad years, same as anyone. But we were safe. Now with the Freys, raiders come plundering, steal our food, steal our silver. I was gonna send Sally north to stay with my brother, but the north's no better. The whole country's gone sour.
Speaker: FARMER HAMLET

Text: You got any ale?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Afraid not.
Speaker: FARMER HAMLET

Text: How can a man not keep ale in his home?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: You look like you could really swing that sword. A real warrior with proper training. Those raiders wouldn't stand a chance against you. How would it be if you stayed on till the new moon? I could use a man to help with the farmwork. Sally does what she can, but she can't lift a bale of hay. And if any thieves came looking for easy pickings, one look at you, I'd bet they'd run the other way. Meaning no offense.
Speaker: FARMER HAMLET

Text: What'll you pay? I don't have much. But I have hidden a bit of silver from the bandits. Fair wages for fair work?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: (Nods) Fair wages for fair work.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Chickens cluck as ARYA sleeps in the hay. Faint voices argue. A punch lands, a man groans and a girl screams.
BARN
Speaker: EXT

Text: ARYA leaves the barn and strides towards the HOUND, FARMER HAMLET and SALLY. The farmer lies on the ground and SALLY tends him. The HOUND has taken something and is walking away.
What did you do?!
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Get your horse saddled.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: You told me you weren't a thief.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I wasn't.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: He took us in. He fed us and you...
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Aye, he took us in. He's a good man and his daughter makes a nice stew. And they'll both be dead come winter.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: You don't know that.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I do know it. He's weak. He can't protect himself. They'll both be dead come winter. Dead men don't need silver.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: You're the worst shit in the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: There's plenty worse than me. I just understand the way things are. How many Starks they got to behead before you figure it out?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Two rangers walk through the courtyard, taking account of the new recruits.
Raper. Raper. Horse thief. Ninth born son. Raper. Thief. Thief and raper.
Speaker: RANGER

Text: SAM passes them and encounters ALLISER THORNE and JANOS SLYNT at the stairwell.
There he is, Sam the Slayer.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: Going to visit your wildling whore?
Speaker: JANOS SLYNT

Text: She's not a whore.
Speaker: SAM

Text: No? Maybe I'll give her a copper tonight and find out.
Speaker: JANOS SLYNT

Text: CASTLE BLACK
Speaker: INT.

Text: GILLY lets SAM into the room.
They all think I'm lying.
Speaker: SAM

Text: About what?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Killing the white Walker.
Speaker: SAM

Text: You're not lying. I'll never forget the way it screamed.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: GILLY touches LITTLE SAM.
But you're the only one that saw it. And they all think you're just a...
Speaker: SAM

Text: A what?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Well, a wildling.
Speaker: SAM

Text: My father hated that word.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: It's not a very nice word, I suppose.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I don't know. It makes me sound a bit dangerous, doesn't it?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: SAM sits next to her to help with the plucking.
So... are you all right? No one bothering you?
Speaker: SAM

Text: I get a lot of looks. I hear them making their jokes. But no one's touched me if that's what you mean.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I worry about it sometimes. All the time.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Why do you worry about it?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: 100 men, one woman.
Speaker: SAM

Text: They've got other things to think about.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: That's the only thing they think about.
Speaker: SAM

Text: You're being silly.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I'm not being silly. There's 100 men lying awake at night picturing you.
Speaker: SAM

Text: What about you?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: What about me? Gilly? I worry about you.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Thank you.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: For what?
Speaker: SAM

Text: For worrying about me.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I don't know if you're safe here. They're my brothers, but some of them were thieves before they came here. Some of them were rapers. You saw what they did at your father's keep.
Speaker: SAM

Text: So what are you saying?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Maybe you'd be safer in Mole's Town.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Are you bored of me?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Bored of you? I... I want to protect you.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I'll get these to Hobb. Keep an eye on little Sam.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: GILLY picks up the chickens and exits. SAM tends to LITTLE SAM.
INT. DRAGONSTONE AT NIGHT
STANNIS stands looking at the storm. DAVOS enters.
Your Grace.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You're a literary man now. What do you make of that?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: DAVOS picks up a scroll and struggles to read it.
Joffrey?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The usurper Joffrey Baratheon. I said those words when I tossed a leech into the fire. A leech filled with bastard blood. A bastard you set free. I am now faced with a great opportunity and I am powerless to take advantage of it.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I will find you an army, Your Grace. I've been working day and night...
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: What progress have you made?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: While DAVOS names houses, STANNIS picks up pieces from the war table, snaps them and discards them.
I've rallied House Peasebury to your 'cause.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: House Peasebury.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: House Musgood.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: House Musgood.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: And House Haigh.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: House Haigh. They don't have enough men between them to raid a pantry.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Westeros is not the world, Your Grace. We need to look east for ships and men. 10,000 skilled soldiers fight for the Golden Company.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The Golden Company?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: They've never broken a contract.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: They're sellswords.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: We're willing to use blood magic to put you on the throne, but we're not willing to pay men to fight? Now the Red Woman's magic is real. Her visions and prophecies may be, too, but I've never heard of visions and prophecies winning a war. Soldiers win wars. Soldiers on the ground. It's dirty on the ground.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: We don't have any gold.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Not yet.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: If I do not press my claim, my claim will be forgotten. I will not become a page in someone else's history book. I'm running out of time, Ser Davos. Which means you're running out of time. -
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: INT DRAGONSTONE, SHIREEN's room.
DAVOS knocks and enters.
You're late.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: I'm sorry, Princess.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I thought you weren't coming.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: The Hand of the King doesn't have much leisure time.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You won't be a very good Hand if you see the word knight and say "ka-nigit."
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: That happened once, weeks ago. You're your father's daughter, no mistake. Bloody relentless, the both of you.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: It's a new one today. Lots of tricky words. But I think you can manage.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: DAVOS sits and takes up a book to practice reading.
You'll never read well if you move your lips. That's how children do it.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: "The Life and Adventures of Elyo Grivas. First Sword of Braavos."
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: SHIREEN claps.
Thank you very much.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I like this one. It's full of sword fights and pirates. You were a pirate once.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: No, I was never a pirate. I was a smuggler.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: What's the difference?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Well, if you're a famous smuggler, you're not doing it right.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: My father says a criminal is a criminal.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Your father lacks an appreciation of the finer points of bad behavior. So do the Braavosi.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You've sailed to Braavos?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Of course. Almost got beheaded by a First Sword of Braavos. I tried to explain to him the difference between pirates and smugglers, but he didn't seem any more interested in the distinction than your father. I suppose if you work for the Iron Bank of Braavos and each one of your gold barges is worth half a kingdom, you tend not to be overly concerned with the kind of distinction...
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS has an inspired thought. He gets up, paces and then kisses SHIREEN on the forehead.
What was that for?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: I need you to write a message.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You should write it yourself. It's good practice.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: It's too important for me. I need a smart person to do it. Go on.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: He hands her a quill and scroll. She begins to write.
To the offices of the Iron Bank of Braavos from Stannis Baratheon the one true king of Westeros.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: But that's not you.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: I need to get their attention. Go on. Write.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: MOLE'S TOWN
Speaker: EXT

Text: SAM, GILLY and LITTLE SAM ride a cart through the busy town. LITTLE SAM coos.
He's seen some adventures, hasn't he?
Speaker: SAM

Text: INT. MOLE'S TOWN INN
SAM, GILLY and LITTLE SAM enter the tavern. A MOLE'S TOWN WHORE approaches GILLY while SAM talks to the MOLE'S TOWN MADAM.
Precious little thing.
Speaker: MOLE'S TOWN WHORE

Text: Thank you.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: What's his name?
Speaker: MOLE'S TOWN WHORE

Text: Sam.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Lovely. That the daddy?
Speaker: MOLE'S TOWN WHORE

Text: No.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Where's the daddy?
Speaker: MOLE'S TOWN WHORE

Text: He's dead.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Oh. Where you from?
Speaker: MOLE'S TOWN WHORE

Text: North of here.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: North of here? You a fucking wildling?
Speaker: MOLE'S TOWN WHORE

Text: Only room and board?
Speaker: MOLE'S TOWN MADAM

Text: That's right. She'll clean and cook and look after the other girls' babies.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Could find other work for her, too.
Speaker: MOLE'S TOWN MADAM

Text: No other work.
Speaker: SAM

Text: There'd be money. Give you a piece of it.
Speaker: MOLE'S TOWN MADAM

Text: No other work.
Speaker: SAM

Text: INT. MOLE'S TOWN BROTHEL BACK ROOM
I promise to come back and visit whenever I can. You'll be safer here. Who's gonna protect you at Castle Black? Me?
Speaker: SAM

Text: You protected me north of the Wall.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: This is different. They're brothers of the Night's Watch and I can't just stab them in the back and I can't run away, which is what we did at Craster's.
Speaker: SAM

Text: LITTLE SAM cries
You have to trust me. It's for the best.
Speaker: SAM

Text: GILLY puts LITTLE SAM down.
Best for you.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Oh, Gilly. Please don't.
Speaker: SAM

Text: LITTLE SAM cries and GILLY tends him. SAM exits
INT. KING'S LANDING
ELLARIA, MAREI, a WHORE, OBERYN and OLYVAR  are engaged in passionate sex. ELLARIA turns her attention from MAREI to OLYVAR.
Greedy.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: ELLARIA kissed OLYVAR deeply, but he does not return her ardor.
No?
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: I'm sorry. You're lovely, I just never acquired the taste.
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: You're calling my beauty an acquired taste?
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: That's quite all right, lover. It's more for you.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Your loss.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: OBERYN takes a drink.
You like them both the same? Boys and girls?
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: Does that surprise you?
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Everyone has a preference.
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: Then everyone is missing half the world's pleasure. The gods made that and it delights me. The gods made this and it delights me. When it comes to war, I fight for Dorne. When it comes to love, I don't choose sides.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: I hope I have as much stamina when I'm your age.
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: What are you, 25?
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Children.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: (CHUCKLES) Someday, if you're lucky, you will wake up and realize you are old. That pretty ass of yours will sag. Your belly will grow soft and your back will ache in the night and gray hairs will sprout from your ears. No one will want you anymore. Make sure you fucked your fill before that day.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Did you?
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: He is a prince of Dorne. Girls and boys will line up to fuck him till the day he dies.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: They will all have to line up behind you.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: A door opens. TYWIN enters.
Prince Oberyn.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Lord Tywin.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: May we have the room?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Call my name if you need me, lover.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: OLYVAR, MAREI, the WHORE and ELLARIA exit
Would you like to sit?
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: No, thank you.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Some wine?
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: No, thank you.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: OBERYN dresses and pours some wine.
I'm sorry about your grandson.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Are you?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I don't believe that a child is responsible for the sins of his father. Or his grandfather. An awful way to die.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Which way is that?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Are you interrogating me, Lord Tywin?
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Some believe the king choked.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Some believe the sky is blue because we live inside the eye of a blue-eyed giant. The king was poisoned.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: I hear you studied poisons at the Citadel.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I did. This is why I know.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Your hatred for my family is rather well known. You arrive at the capital, an expert in poisoning, some days later my grandson dies of poisoning.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Rather suspicious. Why haven't you thrown me in a dungeon?
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: You spoke with Tyrion in this very brothel on the day that you arrived. What did you discuss?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: You think we conspired together?
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: What did you discuss?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: The death of my sister.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: For which you blame me.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: She was raped and murdered by the Mountain. The Mountain follows your orders. Of course I blame you.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Here I stand unarmed, unguarded. Should I be concerned?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: You are unarmed and unguarded because you know me better than that. I am a man of reason. If I cut your throat today, I will be drawn and quartered tomorrow.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Men at war commit all kinds of crimes without their superiors' knowledge.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: So you deny involvement in Elia's murder?
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Categorically.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I would like to speak with the Mountain.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: I'm sure he would enjoy speaking with you.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: He might not enjoy it as much as he thinks he would.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: I could arrange for this meeting.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: But you want something in return.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: There will be a trial for my son. And as custom dictates, three judges will render a verdict. I will preside. Mace Tyrell will serve as the second judge. I would like you to be the third.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Why?
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Not long ago, the Tyrells sided with Renly Baratheon. Declared themselves enemies of the throne. Now they are our strongest allies.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Well, you made the Tyrell girl a queen. Asking me to judge at your son's trial isn't quite as tempting.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: I will also invite you to sit on the small council to serve as one of the new king's principal advisors.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I never realized you had such respect for Dorne, Lord Tywin.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: We are not the Seven Kingdoms until Dorne returns to the fold. The king is dead. The Greyjoys are in open rebellion. A wildling army marches on the Wall. And in the East, a Targaryen girl has three dragons. Before long, she will turn her eyes to Westeros. Only the Dornish managed to resist Aegon Targaryen and his dragons.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: You're saying you need us? That must be hard for you to admit.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: We need each other. You help me serve justice to the king's assassins and I will help you serve justice to Elia's.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: OBERYN considers
INT. KING'S LANDING JAIL CELL
TYRION sits on the floor. The door unlocks and PODRICK enters.
Podrick. Apologies for the stench.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I brought you some wine, my lord, but they took it from me.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: A noble effort.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They didn't find the candles, though. A quill, some parchment, duck sausage, almonds, and some hard cheese.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: You're a good lad. Any word of Shae?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I've heard nothing, my lord.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I suppose that's a good thing. What are they saying about me out there?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You're to stand trial in a fortnight for murdering the king.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Do you believe I murdered Joffrey?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No, my lord. You didn't?
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: No. Gods, no. The world is a better place without him, but I had nothing to do with it. I would like to think if I were arranging a royal assassination, I'd plan it in such a way that I wouldn't be standing there gawking like a fool when the king died. Trial in a fortnight. Have they announced the judges yet?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Your father.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Of course.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Mace Tyrell.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Who will vote exactly as my father tells him to vote.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And Prince Oberyn of Dorne.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Oberyn? Give it to my father. He never fails to take advantage of a family tragedy.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm supposed to get a list of names from you, my lord. Anyone who might testify on your behalf.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Oh, I can call my own witnesses? How generous of them. Very well, my wife. Sansa.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: My lord, she's gone.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Gone?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No one's seen her since the wedding. You don't think she...
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: No one had more 'cause to kill Joffrey than Sansa, but the girl is no assassin. Whoever killed the king wanted me to lose my head for it. And with my wife's disappearance, it makes me seem that much more guilty. Podrick.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Yes, my lord?
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: They'll be following you now.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Who will?
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I don't know. They. They. The ominous they. The man pulling the strings. Or woman. My father. Maybe Joffrey was too much work for him. Sweet Tommen will be so much easier to handle. Whenever something bad happens to me, I assume it's my sister that had a hand in it. But say what you will of Cersei, she loves her children. She is the only one I'm certain had nothing to do with this murder. Which makes it unique as King's Landing murders go.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Any other witnesses, my lord?
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Varys could vouch for me if he dared.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: He's already been called as a witness for the queen.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Of course. Fetch Bronn. I have a job for him.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I've already asked, my lord. They won't let him see you.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Why not?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They say he's a known cutthroat and your close associate. He's under investigation himself.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: And my brother? Will they at least allow me to see Jaime?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'll ask, my lord.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: PODRICK stands to go, but hesitates.

There's something else, my lord. A man, I didn't know his face, he came to ask if I'd testify against you. Said I'd be named Ser Podrick Payne if I told the judges you'd bought a poison called the Strangler.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Ser Podrick Payne? Has a nice ring to it. What did you tell him?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I didn't tell them anything, my lord.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Are you going to accept their offer?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: My lord.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Testifying against me wasn't a suggestion. If they can't tempt you with honey, they'll choose something less sweet.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You've been good to me, my lord.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Pod, the trial's in a fortnight. They'll want an answer before that.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I already gave them an answer, my lord.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I will not have you dying on my behalf. Do you hear me? If I have to take that long walk to the executioner's block, I don't want to see your head already mounted.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: My lord.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Pod, I am giving you an order. Go and find my brother. Tell him I need him. And get yourself out of King's Landing before it's too late. Pod! This is farewell.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Farewell, my lord.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: PODRICK nods and opens the door.
Pod. There has never lived a more loyal squire.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: PODRICK bows his head as he exits.
THE NORTH
Speaker: EXT

Text: A bustling small village south of the wall. OLLY and GUYMON walk together
Mother says it's time to eat.
Speaker: OLLY

Text: What's she got boiling? Wait. Wait. Let me guess.
Speaker: GUYMON

Text: Potatoes.
Speaker: OLLY

Text: Potatoes. Well, no one boils a potato better than your mom. Has she got...
Speaker: GUYMON

Text: An arrow whistles through the air and pierces OLLY'S FATHER's neck. He falls dead. YGRITTE is the archer, and she is resolute and angry.
The wildlings!
Speaker: MAN

Text: OLLY'S MOTHER notices that GUYMON has fallen. She runs to him and OLLY. She finds him lifeless.
Guymon! (to OLLY) Hide. Hide!
Speaker: OLLY'S MOTHER

Text: OLLY runs as OLLY'S MOTHER cradles to body. The Thenns and wildlings attack, and she is hewn by the war axe of STYR. The Wildings take the village as OLLY runs for his life. TORMUND attacks brtutally with his sword. YGRITTE shoots down a villiager attacking him from behind. He falls, and TORMUND slits his throat. YGRITTE draws her sword and joins the melee
Meanwhile, OLLY hides under a wagon with some chickens. He watches YGRITTE, whimpering. Suddenly, he is pulled from behind, and a Thenn brings him to STYR.
You know how to get to Castle Black?
Speaker: STYR

Text: Yes. Yes.
Speaker: OLLY

Text: STYR puts OLLY over his shoulder and begins walking. He shows OLLY how the Thenns are butchering his parents.
Those your parents? Open your eyes. I'm going to eat them. Do you hear me? I'm going to eat your dead mama and I'm going to eat your dead papa. Go tell the crows at Castle Black.
Speaker: STYR

Text: STYR releases him, and OLLY runs.
INT. CASTLE BLACK MAIN HALL
The rangers are gathered in the hall and YARWICK speaks. OLLY stands next to JON.
We need to teach them a lesson about the way we deal with their kind.
Speaker: YARWYCK

Text: Aye! Aye!
Speaker: MEN

Text: Three dozen bodies with slit throats tossed off the top of the Wall. Seems like that would be a good lesson.
Speaker: YARWYCK

Text: Aye!
Speaker: MEN

Text: If we go after them, we'll be giving them what they want. They want to draw us out, pick us off a few at a time.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: We have just over 100 men. And that's including stewards and builders. And me. We can't afford to lose a single man. We must remember our first responsibility. We are the watchers on the Wall.
Speaker: MAESTER AEMON

Text: There's got to be a way to protect them.
Speaker: PYP

Text: You're a champion of the common people, Lord Snow. What do you say to Brother Pyp's proposition?
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: Mance Rayder is coming. If the wildlings breach the Wall, they'll roll over everything and everyone for 1,000 Miles before they reach an army that can stop them.
Speaker: JON

Text: We need to shore up Castle Black and we need to defend the Wall. That is our job.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: A horn blows. (HORN BLOWS)
Rangers returning.
Speaker: PYP

Text: INT. THE GATE TO THE WALL
The heavy gate is opening, showing winter beyond. JON, PYP and the rangers help DOLOROUS EDD and GRENN.
Help him.
Speaker: JON

Text: Thought you'd have blue eyes by now.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: The courtyard.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: JON helps DOLOROUS EDD and GRENN to the courtyard. ALLISER THORN and JANOS SLYNT walk up
What took you so long?
Speaker: ALLISER THORN

Text: We were held up.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: By what?
Speaker: ALLISER THORN

Text: Chains.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: We were guests of the mutineers at Craster's Keep.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: And the mutineers stayed?
Speaker: JON

Text: They're not going anywhere. They've got Craster's food and his wives. Poor girls. Never thought they'd miss their daddy. Karl's running things now. He's the one who put a knife through Craster's mouth.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: We need to ride north and kill them all.
Speaker: JON

Text: We just went over this, boy. -Justice can wait.
Speaker: ALLISER THORN

Text: It's not about justice. I told the wildlings we had over 1,000 men at Castle Black alone. Karl and the others know the truth as well as we do. How long do you think they'll keep that information to themselves when the wildlings are peeling their fingernails off? Mance has all he needs to crush us, he just doesn't know it yet. As soon as he gets his hands on them, he will. Then he'll throw his full strength at us. And even if every one of us kills 100 wildlings, there's still not a thing we can do to stop them.
Speaker: JON

Text: I don't think I can kill 100 wildlings.
Speaker: PYP

Text: ESSOS
Speaker: EXT

Text: The unsullied march towards Meereen. DAENERYS, JORAH, SER BARRISTAN, MISSANDEI and DAARIO NAHARYS ride alongside. The riders dismount at the main gate while the unsullied stand at attention. The Meereen  citifolk watch from atop the walls.murmuring. The main door opens.
Are they attacking?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: A single rider. A champion of Meereen. They want you to send your own champion against him.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: A single rider advances, and the crowd cheers. He halts horse to the side of DAENERYS's band. He dismounts.
(SPEAKING VALYRIAN)
Speaker: CHAMPION

Text: What is he doing?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I believe he means to...
Speaker: BARRISTAN SELMY

Text: The CHAMPION urinates towards DAENERYS. The crowd laughs and cheers.
He says that we're an army of men without man parts. He claims you are no woman at all, but a man who... hides his cock in his own asshole.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Ignore him, Your Grace. These are meaningless words.
Speaker: BARRISTAN SELMY

Text: They're not meaningless if half the city you intend to take is listening to them.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: (CONTINUES SPEAKING VALYRIAN)
Speaker: CHAMPION

Text: I have something to say to the people of Meereen. First, I will need this one to be quiet. Do I have a champion?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (SPEAKING VALYRIAN) Allow me this honor, mother of dragons. I will not disappoint you.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: (valyrian) You are the commander of the Unsullied. I cannot risk you.
Speaker: DAEYNERYS

Text: Your Grace, I've won more single combats than any man alive.
Speaker: BARRISTAN SELMY

Text: Which is why you must remain by my side.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I've been by your side longer than any of them, Khaleesi. Let me stand for you today as well.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You are my most trusted advisor, my most valued general, and my dearest friend. I will not gamble with your life.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I was the last to join your army. I'm not your general or a member of your Queensguard or the commander of your Unsullied. My mother was a whore. I come from nothing. And before long, I will return to nothing. Let me kill this man for you.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Very well. You have quite an audience. Make it worth their while.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: He is very brave, Your Grace.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Yes, win or lose, as long as the whole city is watching.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: A squire helps the mounted CHAMPION arm himself. DAENERYS walks up to DAARIO.
You sure you don't want a horse?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Why would I want a horse?
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Horses are faster than men.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Horses are dumber than men.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAENERYS steps back and the CHAMPION charges. DAARIO turns to wink at DAENERYS. The CHAMPION closes in and DAARIO draws his dagger, holds it on his shoulder and kisses it. He then launches it at the charging CHAMPION, burying the blade in his horse's forehead. The horse falls in the sand, the CHAMPION rolling away. As he rises, DAARIO dispatches him with a single blow to the neck. He nods to DAENERYS.

The Meeren crowd is shocked. An order is given, and scores of archers on the wall fire at DAENERYS's band. The arrows plant in front of them. DAARIO urinates in response. DAENERYS paces and the Unsullied turn at attention.
(valyrian) I am Daenerys Stormborn.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The crowd quiets.

(valyrian) Your Masters may have told you lies about me, or they may have told you nothing. It does not matter. I have nothing to say to them. Only to you. First I went to Astapor. Those who were slaves in Astapor now stand behind me, free. Next I went to Yunkai. Those who were slaves in Yunkai now stand behind me, free. Now I have come to Meereen. I am not your enemy. Your enemy is beside you.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Meereen inhabitants start to move away from the wall, while the Meereen soldiers face outside the wall. The Meereen slaves listen carefully to DAENERYS, while their masters become uncomfortable.

Your enemy steals and murders your children. Your enemy has nothing for you but chains and suffering and commands. I do not bring commands. I bring you a choice. And I bring your enemies what they deserve. Forward!
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Unsullied move the seige weapons forward. The slaves are emboldened and the inhabitants are taken aback.
Fire!
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The unsullied fire the catapults. Cylindrical logs spin through the air and shatter on the sides of buildings, raining down the empty manacles inside. Civilians and slaves duck as the contents fall among them. A SLAVE picks up an empty choker and looks back at his fearful master.
EXT. MEEREEN AT NIGHT
A Tent outside of Meereen.
MISSANDEI is teaching GREY WORM how to read by a fire.
My name is Grey Worm. I come from the Summer "Ills."
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Isles. Summer Isles.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Summer Isles. (speaks Valyrian)
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: (speaks Valyrian) I am from an island called Naath.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: (speaks Valyrian) When they took you?
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: "When did they take me?" I was five years old.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: You remember your home?
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: I remember when they rowed us away from shore. How white the beaches were. How tall the trees. And I remember my village burning. Smoke rising into the sky. Do you remember your home?
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: (Shakes his head.) Unsullied. Always Unsullied. Before Unsullied, nothing.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: That's not true. Perhaps one day you will return to the Summer Isles.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: I don't want return. (Speaks Valyrian.)
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Kill the masters.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Kill the masters.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: DAENERYS and BARRISTAN SELMY enter. They stand
How are the lessons coming?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Very well, Your Grace.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Missandei is teacher good, my queen.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: You'll have to continue later. It's time.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS and BARRISTAN SELMY exit, followed by GREY WORM.
EXT. MEEREEN.

Overhead, the shadow of a flying dragon soars in the moonlight. On the ground, the Unsullied run through the rocky landscape. They strain to open a gate in the rockface. GREY WORM lights a torch as do the other Unsullied. They travel through the sewer tunnel.
Meereen slave's quarters.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Many slaves are gathered in the dark chamber, seating and standing.
(speaking Valyrian.) You heard her! She said she came to free us.
Speaker: MOSSADOR

Text: (speaking Valyrian.)  You are a fool. The masters are too strong.
Speaker: ELDER MEEREEN SLAVE

Text: (speaking Valyrian.) She will protect us. She defeated the masters' champion.
Speaker: MOSSADOR

Text: The slaves look at one another.
(speaking Valyrian.) She has a great army. You want to live the rest of your days in chains?
Speaker: MOSSADOR

Text: (speaking Valyrian.) I want to live. You saw what they did to those children. What do you think they'll do to us?
Speaker: MEEREEN SLAVE

Text: (speaking Valyrian.) I've been through two slave revolts, boy. They always end the same way: the Masters in power and the slaves dead.
Speaker: ELDER MEEREEN SLAVE

Text: GREY WORM and the Unsullied enter.
(speaking Valyrian.)  All men must die.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: The slaves are surprised to see them. ELDER MEEREEN SLAVE and MOSSADOR stand.
(speaking Valyrian.) But I promise you, a single day of freedom is worth more than a lifetime in chains.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: (speaking Valyrian.) Who are you?
Speaker: ELDER MEEREEN SLAVE

Text: (speaking Valyrian.) This one is called Grey Worm. I was taken as a baby by the Masters of Astapor, raised and trained as Unsullied. Now I fight for Daenerys, the Mother of Dragons and Breaker of Chains.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: (speaking Valyrian.) You are Unsullied? They taught you how to fight before you could walk. We are not soldiers.
Speaker: ELDER MEEREEN SLAVE

Text: (speaking Valyrian.) We have no training, weapons.
Speaker: MEEREEN SLAVE

Text: GREY WORM and the other Unsullied remove their bundles from around their shoulders. The weapons clank as they hit the ground. The salves gather round, and a few tentatively pick up some swords.
(speaking Valyrian.) There are three slaves in this city for every Master. No one can give you your freedom, brothers. If you want it, you must take it.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: EXT. Meereen streets at night
GREAT MASTER #1 and two guards  walk the empty streets. They encounter some grafitti reading "Kill the Masters."
(Curses in Valyrian.)
Speaker: GREAT MASTER #1

Text: They look up to a high tower where a Targaryen flag is waving. Suddenly, a mob of slaves comes running at them. The guards run, leaving GREAT MASTER #1 to his own devices. He tries to flee, but more slaves pour around each corner. The slaves shout and set upon him.
EXT. Meereen streets at day
DAENERYS walks among the cheering slaves, flanked by children.
Mhysa! Mhysa! Mhysa!
Speaker: SLAVES

Text: DAENERYS, JORAH and BARRISTAN SELMY walk down the steps on the cliff, surrounded by cheering slaves.
Mhysa! Mhysa! Mhysa! Mhysa!
Speaker: SLAVES

Text: They ascend to the overlook, joining GREY WORM and the Unsullied.
Mhysa! Mhysa!
Speaker: SLAVES

Text: Remind me, Ser Jorah, how many children did the Great Masters nail to mileposts?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: 163, Khaleesi.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Yes, that was it.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS looks to GREY WORM, who gives a nod to  UNSULLIED #1.
(shouts in Valyrian.)
Speaker: UNSULLIED #1

Text: The Unsullied march forth, pressing the citizens of Meereen.
Your Grace, may I have a word? The city is yours. All these people,they're your subjects now. Sometimes it is better to answer injustice with mercy.
Speaker: BARRISTAN SELMY

Text: I will answer injustice with justice.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The shores of Meeeen.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: An Unsullied nails a Meereen citizen to a cross. Others scream. They line the path up the mountainside, each with one hand nailed to the post, pointing the way. The citizens watch. DAENERYS stands on a platform above, surveying the city, under the Targaryen flag. The screams echo.
EXT. King's Landing.

BRONN and JAIME spar by the sea. JAIME attacks and BRONN parries. JAIME pauses, panting and spins his sword. His skills have improved. They exchange attacks. BRONN presses JAIME, and they deadlock. BRONN grabs JAIME's golden hand and swats him across the face. JAIME falls to the ground.
What the hell was that?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: That was me knocking your ass to the dirt with your own hand.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: BRONN tosses JAIME back his hand.
You're a rare talent. When you're fighting cripples, anyway.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You learned to fight like a good little boy. I'll bet that thrust through the MadKing's back was pretty as a picture. You want to fight pretty or you want to win?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You talk to my brother this way?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: All the time. He got used to it.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: They sit together on a low wall. JAIME drinks.
Do you think he did it?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: No. Oh, he hated the little twat, sure. But who didn't? And poison's not his style. Or murder, for that matter. You want to know for sure, why don't you ask him?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: JAIME doesn't answer.
You haven't been to see him yet, eh?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: We're done for today.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He tosses the water skin to BRONN and starts to walk way
Your brother ever tell you how I came into his service?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You stood for him in his trial by combat at the Eyrie.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Aye. But only when Lady Arryn demanded the trial take place that day. You were his first choice. He named you for his champion because he knew you would ride day and night to come fight for him. You gonna fight for him now?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: JAIME exits.
INT. Tyrion's cell
JAIME and TYRION sit in the cell.
To tell you the truth, this isn't so bad. Four walls. A pot to piss in. I was chained to a wooden post covered in my own shit for months.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Is that supposed to make me feel better?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Maybe a bit. I'm sorry I didn't come sooner.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: It's complicated, yes. So how is our sister?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: How do you think? Her son died in her arms.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Her son?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Don't. You know what's coming?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: My trial for regicide.Yes, I know. I know the whole bloody country thinks I'm guilty. I know that one of my three judges has wished me dead more times than I can count. And that judge is my father. As for Cersei, well, she's probably working on a way to avoid a trial altogether by having me killed.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Now that you mention it, she did ask.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: So, should I turn around and close my eyes?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Depends. Did you do it?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The Kingslayer brothers. You like it? I like it. You're really asking if I killed your son?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Are you really asking if I'd kill my brother? How can I help you?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Well, you could set me free.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You know I can't.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Then there's really nothing else to say.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What do you want me to do? Kill the guards? Sneak you out of the city in the back of a cart? I'm the Lord Commander of the Kingsguard.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Sorry, I'd forgotten. I'd hate for you to do something inappropriate.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Inappropriate? You're accused of killing the king.Freeing you is treason.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Except I didn't do it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Which is why we're having a trial. A trial. If the killer threw himself before the Iron Throne, confessed to his crimes, and gave irrefutable evidence of his guilt, it wouldn't matter to Cersei. She won't rest until my head's on a spike.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Not just yours. She's offering a knighthood to whomever finds Sansa Stark.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Sansa couldn't have done this. She had more reason than anyone in the Seven Kingdoms. Do you think it's a coincidence she disappeared the same night Joffrey died?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No, but... Sansa's not a killer. Not yet, anyway.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: INT. Littlefinger's ship.
SANSA looks out on the ocean. Littlefinger enters.
Where are you taking me?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I'm getting married to your Aunt Lysa. She's waiting for us at the Eyrie. You'll be safe there.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Did you kill Joffrey?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Did I kill Joffrey? I've been in the Vale for weeks.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I know it was you.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: And who helped me with this conspiracy?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Well, there was Ser Dontos. You used him to get me out of King's Landing, but you would never trust him to kill the king.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Why not?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Because you're too smart to trust a drunk.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Then perhaps it was your husband.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: No.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: How do you know?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I just do.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You're right. He wasn't involvedi n Joffrey's death. But you were. Do you remember that lovely necklace Dontos gave you? I don't suppose you noticed that a stone was missing after the feast.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: The poison. I don't understand. The Lannisters gave you wealth, power. Joffrey made you the Lord of Harrenhal.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: A man with no motive is a man no one suspects. Always keep your foes confused. If they don't know who you are or what you want, they can't know what you plan to do next.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I don't believe you. If they catch you, they'll put your head on a spike just like my father's. You'd risk that just to confuse them?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: So many men they risk so little. They spend their lives avoiding danger. And then they die. I'd risk everything to get what I want.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: And what do you want?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Everything. My friendship with the Lannisters was productive. But Joffrey, a vicious boy with a crown on his head, is not a reliable ally. And who could trust a friend like that?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Who could trust you?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I don't want friends like me. My new friends are predictable. Very reasonable people. As for what happened to Joffrey, well, that was something my new friends wanted very badly. Nothing like a thoughtful gift to make a new friendship grow strong.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: EXT. King's Landing garden
OLENNA and MARGAERY stroll arm-in-arm in the garden.
I can't believe you're going. Leaving me alone here with these people.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: The time has come, my dear. There's nothing more tedious than a trial. Except perhaps these gardens. If I have to take one more leisurely stroll through these gardens, I'll fling myself from the cliffs.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: (laughs)
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Have you been to see Tommen yet?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: No. Have they even agreed to the match? No one tells me anything.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I wasn't originally meant to marry your grandfather Luthor, you know. He was engaged to my sister, your great-aunt Viola. I was to be given to some Targaryen or other. Marrying a Targaryen was all the rage back then. But the momentI saw my intended, with his twitchy little ferret's face and ludicrous silver hair, I knew he wouldn't do. So the evening before Luthor was to propose to my sister, I got lost on my way back from my embroidery lesson and happened upon his chamber.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: (laughs)
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: How absentminded of me.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Mm-hmm.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: The following morning, Luthor never made it down the stairs to propose to my sister 'cause the boy couldn't bloody walk.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: (laughs)
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: And once he could, the only thing he wanted was what I'd given him the night before. I was good. I was very, very good. You are even better. But you need to act quickly. Cersei may be vicious, but she's not stupid. She'll turn the boy against you as soon as she can. And by the time you're married, it'll be too late. Luckily for you ,the Queen Regent is rather distracted at the moment, mourning her dear departed boy. Accusing her brother of his murder, which he didn't commit.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Well, he could have done.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: He could have done,but he didn't.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: You don't know, Grandmother.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: But I do know. You don't think I'd let you marry that beast, do you?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: What? I don't understand.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Shh. Don't you worry yourself about all that. You just do what needs to be done.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: EXT. Castle Black courtyard
Swords clang as the recruits train.
Bring it through! And again.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON and GRENN spar
Very nice. Good.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON and GRENN take a break. JON speaks to the recruits.
A lot of wildlings fight with a weapon in each hand. First thing you want to do is disarm them to try and even the odds.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON hands GRENN a second sword. They engage, and JON quickly knocks away one of GRENN's swords. GRENN takes a wide swing, JON ducks, then blocks his forearm and puts his blade to GRENN's throat. OLLY smiles in the crowd and GRENN nods, admitting defeat.
Let's see what you can do.
Speaker: JON

Text: OLLY steps forward, ready.
Olly, you just watch for now.
Speaker: JON

Text: I can fight.
Speaker: OLLY

Text: Have you ever held a sword before? OLLY I was the best archer in our hamlet.
Speaker: JON

Text: The recruits laugh.
I was!
Speaker: OLLY

Text: I believe you. We'll go hunting for rabbits one day. Right now, watch and learn.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: You two. Take it slow,  try and disarm each other.
Speaker: JON

Text: LOCKE and another ranger arm themselves. LOCKE bests the bald one.
You know how to fight. You could have gone easier on him.
Speaker: JON

Text: He wouldn't have learned anything that way.
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: ALLISER THORNE and JANOS SLYNT enter.
Lord Snow. What do you think you're doing?
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: Grenn and I were helping them.
Speaker: JON

Text: Grenn's a ranger.You're a steward. Maybe you forgot that while you were off with your wildling bitch, but I didn't.
Speaker: ALLISER THORN

Text: Someone has to train them.
Speaker: JON

Text: And that someone isn't you. Go find a chamber pot to empty. Go on. Do it. You traitor's bastard. Give me an excuse. Mormont's not hereto protect you now.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: JON exits.
Get back to work. Now! I said now!
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: The bastard's well-liked.You're not.
Speaker: JANOS SLYNT

Text: You think I care if they like me? We're at war.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: For now. But you can't be acting commander forever. There will be a choosing. The old maester will insist on it. You might reconsider his request to marchon Craster's. Let the mutineer stake care of Snow. Or you might be taking orders from him the rest of your life.
Speaker: JANOS SLYNT

Text: ALLISER THORNE exits.
the yard armory
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: JON returns his sword. RECRUIT joins him.
A bastard, eh? Took you for highborn.
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: My father was highborn. My mother wasn't.
Speaker: JON

Text: Name's Locke.
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: Jon Snow.
Speaker: JON

Text: They shake.
You fight well.
Speaker: JON

Text: What brought you up here? A sense of duty. I wanted to do my part for the safety of the realm. I was a game warden in the Stormlands. Fed a prized partridge to my hungry kids. I was stupid enough to get caught. Chose the Wall over losing my hand. Figured I wouldn't have to suck up to any highborn cunts here.
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: Come on, get on with it. What are you waiting for? Summer?
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: Guess I was wrong.
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: INT. King's Landing, CERSEI's chamber.
There is a knocking at CERSEI's door. She drinks, ignoring it. JAIME enters.
You sent for me, Your Grace?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Your Grace. How formal of you. How many Kingsguards are posted outside Tommen's door?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Ser Boros is on duty tonight. Tomorrow I believe...
Speaker: JAIME

Text: So one? You have one man guarding the future king?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I promise you Tommen's safe. We're protecting him.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The way you protected Joffrey? Why did Catelyn Stark set you free?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: What?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I've been wondering for months. Ever since that great cow brought you back to the capital. Why did she set you free?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You know why. She'd hoped I'd send her daughters back to her.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: She hoped or did you promise?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I swore by all the gods that if her daughters were alive, I'd return them to her.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: So you made a sacred vow to the enemy.

I'm going beyond the Wallto Craster's Keep. I'm going to capture the mutineers holed up there or kill them. I'm asking for volunteers to come with me. There's 60 miles of wilderness between here and Craster's and Mance Rayder has an army bearing down on us, but we have to do this. Our survival may depend on us getting to these mutineers before Mance does. They know the Wall. They know our defenses. If Mance learns what they know, we're lost. But if that's not enough, then consider this. If the Night's Watch are truly brothers, then Lord Commander Mormont was our father. He lived and died for the Watch and he was betrayed by his own men. Stabbed in the back by cowards. He deserved far better. All we can give him now is justice. Who will join me?

May the Warrior grant him courage and protect him in these perilous times. May the Smith grant him strength that he might bear this heavy burden.
