Text: Mummy said they killed your mother and they chopped off your brother's head.
Speaker: ROBIN

Text: They did, and my father's.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: They killed my father, too, with poison. I wanted to make the little Lannister baby man fly, but Mother said I couldn't.
Speaker: ROBIN

Text: Make him fly?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Through the Moon Door.
Speaker: ROBIN

Text: He drops the glass bird through the moon door.
(GIGGLES)
Speaker: ROBIN

Text: And on top of everything else, they made you marry that filthy troll.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: They did. They made us both. Lord Tyrion didn't want to.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I don't believe that for a moment. Did he force himself on you?
Speaker: LYSA

Text: Good. Robin, this is your cousin Sansa. But you're not to call her Sansa in front of anyone but Uncle Petyr and myself. Do you understand? Sansa, this is my son Robin.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: It's a pleasure to meet you, Robin.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Robin, show Sansa to her chamber. Take the back stairs.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: Go. We'll speak soon.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: ROBIN leads SANSA out by the hand. LYSA kisses LITTLEFINGER hungrily.
What took you so long?
Speaker: LYSA

Text: Arranging for the ascension of King Tommen I, extricating Sansa, getting her here alive.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: She's here. We've spent more than enough time on her for one evening.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: She kissed him.
Let's get married tonight.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: Ought we not... inform the Lords of the Vale about the ceremony?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: There's only one Lord of the Vale. The others can all hang. Lurking and simpering on the stairs like buzzards the moment my husband died, trying to get their claws in me.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: I do think that we could wait until...
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I'm done waiting, Petyr. We had our wedding night many years ago. Or don't you remember?
Speaker: LYSA

Text: Like it was yesterday.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: What wife would do for you the things I've done for you? What wife would trust you the way I've trusted you? When you gave me those drops and told me to pour them into Jon's wine, my husband's wine... when you told me to write a letter to Cat telling her it was the Lannisters...
Speaker: LYSA

Text: LITTLEFINGER kisses LYSA passionately to quiet her. She moans.
The deed is done. Faded into nothing. Only speaking of it can make it real.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: (nods)
Speaker: LYSA

Text: Tonight it is, then.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: (LAUGHS)
Speaker: LYSA

Text: Let me bathe and dress for the occasion. Once I'm presentable, I'll call on the septon immediately.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: LYSA opens the door and escorts in the septon.
I'm warning you. I'm going to scream when my husband makes love to me. I'm going to scream so loud, they'll hear me clear across the Narrow Sea.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: She kisses LITTLEFINGER
SANSA's room, at night
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: SANSA lies in bed. She can hear LYSA screaming and moaning in ecstacy. SANSA tries to ignore it.
INT. King's Landing, day
TYWIN and CERSEI meet in the Hand's residence.
When will the wedding take place in your mind?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: As soon as decency permits. After we've allowed Tommen the appropriate time to mourn his brother and Margaery to mourn her husband.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: A fortnight?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: That seems reasonable.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No jugglers, no jousting dwarves, no 77-course meals.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: (shakes her head)
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: And your wedding to Loras?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Shortly after Tommen's.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Shortly?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: A fortnight.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I know you don't like them. I didn't like your husband. Used to pat me on the back a lot. I didn't trust him.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: We had that in common.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You don't need to make formal alliances with people you trust.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Then whom can we trust?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Ourselves alone.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYWIN rises and pours some wine, handing it to CERSEI. He then pours some for himself.
The Tyrells are our only true rivals in terms of resources and we need them on our side.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Robert wasn't particularly rich.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Robert had me funding him. Wars swallow gold like a pit in the earth.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I suppose that explains why we did so well in the last one.
Speaker: CESEI

Text: Do you know how much gold was mined in the Westerlands this past year?
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Haven't a clue.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Go on, your best guess.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Pounds, tons, ounces?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Doesn't matter. The answer is the same.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: That can't be.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Our last working mine ran dry three years ago.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Then how do we pay for anything?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The crown owes the Iron Bank of Braavos a tremendous amount of money.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: How much?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: A tremendous amount.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: TYWIN sits.
There must be someone at the Iron Bank you can speak to, come to some arrangement.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The Iron Bank is the Iron Bank. There is no someone.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: Someone does work there. It is comprised of people.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: And a temple is comprised of stones. One stone crumbles and another takes its place. And the temple holds its form for 1,000 years or more. That's what the Iron Bank is... a temple. We all live in its shadow and almost none of us know it. You can't run from them. You can't cheat them. You can't sway them with excuses. If you owe them money and you don't want to crumble yourself, you pay it back. Vesting the Tyrells in the crown will help a great deal in this respect.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: It's for the good of the family, I understand that. I'm not sure my brothers do.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I know you're building a strong case against Tyrion. And as a mother, that is your right. But as a judge, I cannot discuss the trial with you.
Speaker: TYWIN

Text: I respect that. We don't need to discuss it.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: She puts her wine down and stands.

The Lannister legacy is the only thing that matters. You've started wars to protect this family. Turned your back on Jaime for refusing to contribute to its future. What does Tyrion deserve for lighting that future on fire?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: EXT. Westeros woods at night.
ARYA and the HOUND lie by their campfire.
Joffrey. Cersei. Walder Frey. Meryn Trant. Tywin Lannister. The Red Woman. Beric Dondarrion. Thoros of Myr. Ilyn Payne. The Mountain.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Would you shut up?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: I can't sleep until I say the names.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The names of every fucking person in Westeros?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Only the ones I'm going to kill.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: (CHUCKLES) Hate's as good a thing as any to keep a person going. Better than most. We come across my brother, maybe we can both cross a name off our list.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: If he were here right now, what would you do?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I'd tell him to shut the fuck up so I can get some sleep. Go on, get it over with, your list of doomed men.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: I'm almost done. Only one name left.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Go on.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The Hound.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: INT. An Aerie dining room, night
LYSA serves SANSA a pastry
Thank you.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Your mother always had a sweet tooth, you know?
Speaker: LYSA

Text: Really?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Oh, yes. At suppertime, she would go straight for honey cakes, candied almonds, custard. Anything sweet. Eventually, your grandfather had to assign a septa to watch her at meals. Cat was the firstborn daughter after all. It was important that she remain desirable so Father could arrange a good match for her and she was starting to get fat.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: My mother fat? She never let me have my pudding until I'd finished all my proper food.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: This is before she married your father and moved to the North. By the time you were born, your father's austerity had become hers. Marriage changes people. I didn't mean for you to stop. Go on, enjoy them. How do you like them?
Speaker: LYSA

Text: SANSA eats another. LYSA takes her hand.
They're delicious. Where did you get the lemons? You can't grow them up here.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Oh, gods, no. Petyr had three crates brought all the way from King's Landing. He knew you liked lemon cakes. He's so kind. He really cares for you. Think where you'd be without him. In their clutches and tried for murder.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: Yes. I'm very lucky.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: He feels responsible for you.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: Oh, I know he does. I'm so grateful.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Why? Why does he feel responsible for you?
Speaker: LYSA

Text: Well, I'm half Tully. He loved your family so much.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Loved your mother.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: No.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: That's what you wanted to say.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: He loves you, Aunt Lysa. He's married to you.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Your mother never loved him. Never. Cat always went straight for the sweetest thing. The most obvious thing. Your Uncle Brandon. Your handsome, arrogant, cruel Uncle Brandon. He almost killed Petyr in a duel. And your mother loved him anyway. And now Petyr is risking his life to save you, the daughter of a woman who didn't love him no more than those whores in his brothels. Has he told you about them?
Speaker: LYSA

Text: No.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: LYSA holds SANSA's hands firmly and won't let go.
He hasn't told you about the vile things they do with their bodies? The vile things they let him do with their bodies?
Speaker: LYSA

Text: No, never.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Are you pregnant?
Speaker: LYSA

Text: What? No, I told you. Lord Tyrion and I never...
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I wasn't asking about Tyrion. What have you let Petyr do with your body?
Speaker: LYSA

Text: Aunt Lysa, no, I...
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Your young, pretty body.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: Nothing. I'm a virgin.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Don't lie to me.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: You're hurting me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: LYSA grips harder.
I'll know if you lie.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: I'm a virgin, I swear it. He loves you, Aunt Lysa. All he says is that I'm stupid. I'm a stupid little girl with stupid dreams who never learns and I'm a terrible liar, so I should always tell the truth. And I swear to you that he has never touched me. Not once, not ever.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: LYSA stands up and hugs SANSA to her breast.

Shh. Shh. Shh. It's all right. It will all be all right. You'll be a widow soon. They'll execute that dwarf for murdering the king and you'll be free to marry Robin. You'll be the Lady of the Vale. Hmm.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: EXT. The Kingsroad.
BRIENNE and PODRICK ride the road. PODRICK struggles a bit.
Didn't they teach you how to ride a horse?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Yes, my lady, when I was young. There wasn't much call for it with Lord Tyrion, though. He preferred litters.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Perhaps you should have stayed with him. It's not going to be a pleasant journey for you. It could take weeks to get to the Wall, depending on the weather.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: That's a long way off.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Well, Lady Sansa's brother's at Castle Black. If I were her, that's where I'd go. Feel free to stop at any point.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Never, my lady. I'm your squire.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I've made it this far in the world without a squire. I don't see why I need one now.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: All knights have squires, my lady.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I'm not a knight. And I'm not a slaver, either. I don't own you.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I swore an oath, my lady.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I am releasing you from that oath. That means you could leave.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I know.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: What do you think will happen if you leave?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: They'll say I wasn't a very good squire.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: PODRICK's horse continues to squirm and whinny.
EXT. The camp of the HOUND and ARYA
The HOUND wakes, and notices that ARYA is gone. He panics, looking for her. Nearby, ARYA practices her agile footwork and swordwork with needle.
The hell you doing?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Practicing.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: She continues to practice her steps.
What, ways to die?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: No one's going to kill me.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: They will if you Nance around like that. That's no way to fight.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: It's not fighting. It's water dancing.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Dancing? Maybe you ought to put on a dress. Who taught you that shite?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: ARYA does a one-armed cartwheel.
The greatest swordsman who ever lived. Syrio Forel, the First Sword to the Sealord of Braavos.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Braavos. (SCOFFS) Greasy-haired little bastard, I bet. They all are.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: What do you know about anything?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I bet his hair is greasier than Joffrey's cunt.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: It was not.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Was? He dead?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Yes.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: How?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: He was killed.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Who by?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Meryn Trant. That's why Ser Meryn...
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Meryn Trant? The greatest swordsman who ever lived killed by Meryn fucking Trant?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: He was outnumbered.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Any boy whore with a sword could beat three Meryn Trants.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Syrio didn't have a sword. Or armor. Just a stick.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The greatest swordsman who ever lived didn't have a sword? (LAUGHS) All right. You have a sword. Let's see what he taught you. Go on, do it for your Braavosi friend. Dead like all the rest of your friends.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: ARYA stabs the HOUND in the gut as hard as she can, grunting. It doesn't pierce his armor. He backhands her, and she falls. He picks up Needle and threatens her with it.
Your friend's dead and Meryn Trant's not 'cause Trant had armor and a big fucking sword. (SCOFFS)
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The hound reverses the sword and hands it back to ARYA.
EXT. KIng's Landing garden.
OBERYN sits writing on a scroll. CERSEI enters, flanked by guards. He stands to greet her.
Your Grace.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Prince Oberyn. Writing letters?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: A poem, actually.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: May I show you the gardens?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I couldn't very well refuse a royal escort.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: No, you couldn't.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: They walk through the gardens.
I didn't realize you were a poet.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Not a very good one.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: For your paramour?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: For one of my daughters.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: You have several, don't you?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Eight.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Eight? Eight daughters?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The fifth is difficult. I named her after my sister Elia.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Beautiful name.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Yes. But I can't say it without turning sad. And after I turn sad, I grow angry.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Perhaps that's why she's difficult. The gods love their stupid jokes, don't they?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Which joke is that?
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: You're a prince of Dorne. A legendary fighter. A brilliant man feared throughout Westeros. But you could not save your sister. I'm a Lannister. Queen for 19 years. Daughter of the most powerful man alive. But I could not save my son. What good is power if you cannot protect the ones you love?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: We can avenge them.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Yes, we can avenge them.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You really believe Tyrion murdered your son?
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: I know he did.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: We will have a trial and we will learn the truth.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: We'll have a trial, anyway. I haven't seen my daughter in over a year.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The last time I saw her, she was swimming with two of my girls in the Water Gardens. Laughing in the sun.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: I want to believe that. I want to believe she's happy.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You have my word. We don't hurt little girls in Dorne.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Everywhere in the world, they hurt little girls. Would you bring her a gift for me? I wasn't there for her name day. I don't know when I'll see her again.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Anything at all.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: CERSEI points to a sailing ship in the bay.
The best shipwrights in King's Landing have been working on it for months. Myrcella loves the open water.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I will have it sailed down to Sunspear for her.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Please tell her... her mother misses her very much.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI exits.
EXT. The Kingsroad, day
PODRICK is roasting a rabbit. It catches fire.
Oh, no, no, no.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: He picks up the spit but the rabbit is engulfed in flames.
No, no, no, no.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: He drops the rabbit and stamps it out.
Hells. Gods.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: BRIENNE returns with firewood.
Did you remove the skin?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: No, my lady.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Have you ever cooked a rabbit before?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: No, my lady.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Did you ever cook anything for Lord Tyrion?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: No, my lady. That was the cooks.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: BRIENNE sits down, exasperated. She begins to remove her armor. PODRICK rushes over to help.
What are you doing?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I'm helping you with your armor.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I've been removing my own armor for quite some time, thank you very much.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: PODRICK backs away
What exactly did you do for Lord Tyrion?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I brought him his meals and cleared his table when he was finished. I kept his clothing and linens clean. Carried his messages and returned the replies. Mostly I poured wine.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Oh. Whilst in Lord Tyrion's service, did you ever do anything remotely related to combat?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I killed a man.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Who?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: A Kingsguard. He tried to kill Lord Tyrion at the Blackwater.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: How did you kill a Kingsguard?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I pushed a spear through the back of his head.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: BRIENNE starts to remove her armor straps again.
Bloody ridiculous. Help me with these straps.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: PODRICK gets up quickly to help.
EXT. Craster's Keep, evening.
RAST leads a WOMAN roughly away from the Keep. LOCKE is watching from behind a tree. RAST pushes the whimpering WOMAN down and laughs.
Hey. Hey, get up. Get up.
Speaker: RAST

Text: RAST grabs her shirt from behind and pulls her up. The WOMAN sobs. RAST pushes her forward.. They pass by LOCKE. A company of men emerges from the keep.
That's it lad, put it inside. Get the fire going again. We're all freezing.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Aye. What we need is a girl there.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: I've got to have a piss.
Speaker: MAN

Text: LOCKE sneaks into the grounds.
Now keep quiet.
Speaker: MAN

Text: LOCKE creeps closer to the main keep, knocking a lantern as he passes, causing it to rattle and then squeak as it swings. He looks into the keep and sees the bound captives as well as some of the traitor rangers.
INT, Craster's Keep.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Within the keep, BRAN hears the squeaking, looks up and sees the swinging lantern. MEERA is also curious. JOJEN coughs
You need water.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: It doesn't matter.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: Of course it matters.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: You mustn't let anything stop you.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: They already have stopped me.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: No. You're not here. You're far from here.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: What does that mean?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: JOJEN has a vision. The outer wall of the keep disappears, and behind the bound BRAN, the red leaves of a wierwood reaches out in the sunset.
At the hill. A great weirwood tree.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: You've seen it, too.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Meera and I, even Hodor, we're only here to guide you. He's waiting for you. We have to find it. You have to make it.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: We will.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: This... this isn't the end. Not for you. Not yet.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: How... will we know the end?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: JOJEN looks at his hand. In his vision, it is on fire.
You'll know.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: Exterior, Craster's Keep
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: LOCKE moves stealthily through the woods. He arrives back at the ranger encampment.
Brothers.
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: JON, DOLOROUS EDD and GRENN step to meet him.
You do move quiet.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: How many?
Speaker: JON

Text: 11 men. Most of them already drunk. No guards posted. They don't seem to have a care in the world. We'll carve them up like walnut pie.
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: Karl was a top paid cutthroat in Flea Bottom. I've seen what he can do with a knife.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: Have you seen what I can do with a knife?
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: (CHUCKLES) Not yet.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: There's a hut on the West Side of the keep. We should steer clear of it.
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: Why?
Speaker: JON

Text: They've got some hounds chained up inside. Closer we can get without the dogs sniffing us, the better.
Speaker: LOCKE

Text: New moon tonight.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: (SIGHS) Get some rest. We move at sundown.
Speaker: JON

Text: EXT Craster's Keep
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The Keep grounds are lit by torches. A door opens brusquely. KARL and some rangers stride forth, heading to the main keep.
I've always liked a girl with curls. A touch of class. You take whatever's left.
Speaker: KARL

Text: They enter the main building.
Get her up.
Speaker: TANNER

Text: Two rangers untie MEERA. She stuggles as they bring her to her feet. x
Stop.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Stop. What are you doing?
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: Hodor. Hodor. Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: Stop. Stop!
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Hodor. Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: The traitors raise MEERA's hands above her head to place them into manacles that hang from the beam above.
Stop! Please.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: Please, get off her!
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Hodor. Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: MEERA has been put into the manacles, hands raised over her head. JOJEN watches.
Please! Please, leave her alone!
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Please, stop. Stop.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: They bind her feet as well.
What are you doing? Leave her alone!
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Hodor. Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: No!
Speaker: BRAN

Text: KARL TANNER steps towards her.
Shh. Shh, shh, shh.
Speaker: KARL

Text: (gasps)
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Shh.
Speaker: KARL

Text: (whimpers)
Speaker: MEERA

Text: KARL touches her hair.

You've got pretty hair, don't you? Now what is a pretty little highborn girl like you doing out here in the deep, dark woods, eh? You left your daddy's castle looking for trouble, didn't you? No dresses for you. You like it rough, don't you? You like it in the gutter, don't you?
Speaker: KARL

Text: If you let my sister go, I can help you.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: You can help me?
Speaker: KARL

Text: I can.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: And how you gonna do that?
Speaker: KARL

Text: I have the sight. I can see things.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: That's very helpful.
Speaker: KARL

Text: Things that haven't happened yet.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: What a fine thing. A fine thing.
Speaker: KARL

Text: KARL kneels before JOJEN.
Have you seen what I'm gonna do to your sister? Have you seen what they're going to do to your sister?
Speaker: KARL

Text: No.
Speaker: JOJEN

Text: KARL draws a knife.
Don't close your eyes.
Speaker: KARL

Text: KARL TANNER turns and stands, stepping back towards MEERA.

Text: A GOATHERD and GOATHERD'S SON tend their flock. The GOATHERD'S SON throws stones in the river to amuse himself. He looks down, and suddenly Drogon flies overhead. He spits fire and takes a goat and flies off, screeching
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Meereen throne room.
Speaker: INT
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The GOATHERD stands before DAENERYS. JORAH, BARRISTAN SELMY and MISSANDEI stand with her, while GREY WORM stands guard.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: (speaking Valyrian) You stand before Daenerys Stormborn of the House Targaryen, the First of Her Name, Queen of Meereen, Queen of the Andals and the First Men, Khaleesi of the Great Sea, Breaker of Chains and Mother of Dragons. Don't be afraid, my friend.
Speaker: DAENERYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The GOATHERD stands motionless, head bowed.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The Queen says you may approach and speak.
Speaker: MISSANDEI
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The GOATHERD steps forward and ascends the stairs.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: (speaks Valyrian).
Speaker: GOATHERD
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: He is a goatherd. He says he prayed for your victory against the slave masters.
Speaker: MISSANDEI
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I thank him for his prayers.
Speaker: DAENERYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: (speaks Valyrian)
Speaker: MISSANDEI
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The GOATHERD places his bundle on the ground and reveals the charred of his goat.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: (speaks Valyrian).
Speaker: GOATHERD
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: It was your dragons, he says. They came this morning for his flock.
Speaker: MISSANDEI
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: (speaks Valyrian).
Speaker: GOATHERD
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: He hopes he has not offended Your Grace, but now he has nothing.
Speaker: MISSANDEI
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Tell this man I am sorry for his hardship. I cannot bring back his goats,
Speaker: DAENERYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: (translates)
Speaker: MISSANDEI
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: but I will see he is paid their value three times over.
Speaker: DAENERYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: (speaks Valyrian, excitedly thanking her).
Speaker: GOATHERD
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The GOATHERD gathers his bundle and exits. DAENERYS is pleased.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Send the next one in.
Speaker: DAENERYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: HIZDAHR ZO LORAQ and his MANSERVANT enters.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: (Speaking Valyrian) The noble Hizdahr zo Loraq begs an audience with the Queen.
Speaker: MANSERVANT
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: (Speaking Valyrian) The noble Hizdahr zo Loraq can speak to me himself.
Speaker: DAENERYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The MANSERVANT retreats and HIZDAHR comes forward and bows.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Queen Daenerys. Tales of your beauty were not exaggerated.
Speaker: HIZDAHR
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I thank you.
Speaker: DAENERYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Mine is one of the oldest and proudest families in Meereen.
Speaker: HIZDAHR
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Then it is my honor to receive you.
Speaker: DAENERYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: My father, one of Meereen's most respected and beloved citizens, oversaw the restoration and maintenance of its greatest landmarks. This pyramid included.
Speaker: HIZDAHR
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: For that, he has my gratitude. I should be honored to meet him.
Speaker: DAENERYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: You have, Your Grace. You crucified him. I pray you'll never live to see a member of your family treated so cruelly.
Speaker: HIZDAHR
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Your father crucified innocent children.
Speaker: DAENERYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: My father spoke out against crucifying those children. He decried it as a criminal act, but was overruled. Is it justice to answer one crime with another?
Speaker: HIZDAHR
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I am sorry you no longer have a father, but my treatment of the masters was no crime. You'd be wise to remember that.
Speaker: DAENERYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: What's done is done. You are the queen and I am a servant of Meereen. A servant who does not wish to see its traditions eradicated.
Speaker: HIZDAHR
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: And what traditions do you speak of?
Speaker: DAENERYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The tradition of funeral rite. Proper burial in the Temple of the Graces. My father and 162 noble Meereenese are still nailed to those posts, carrion for vultures, rotting in the sun.
Speaker: HIZDAHR
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: HIZDAHR kneels.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Your Grace, I ask that you order these men taken down so that they might receive proper burials.
Speaker: HIZDAHR
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: And what of the slave children these noble Meereenese crucified? They were rotting in the sun as well. Would you have begged me for their right to a proper burial?
Speaker: DAENERYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Your Grace, I cannot defend the actions of the masters. I can only speak to you as a son who loved his father. Let me take his body down. Let me have him brought to the temple and buried with dignity so that he might find peace in the next world.
Speaker: HIZDAHR
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Bury your father, Hizdahr zo Loraq.
Speaker: DAENERYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Thank you, my queen.
Speaker: HIZDAHR
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: HIZDAHR exits with his MANSERVANT
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: How many more?
Speaker: DAENERYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: There are 212 supplicants waiting, Your Grace.
Speaker: MISSANDEI
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Speaker: DAENERYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: She looks to JORAH, who shrugs.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Send the next one in.
Speaker: DAENERYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: King's Landing Small Council room.
Speaker: INT
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: OBERYN meets with CERSEI, VARYS, MACE TYRELL and PYCELLE.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: These meetings aren't always going to be this early, are they? I was up late last night. So, does this mean I am a master of something now? Coins, ships?
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Lord Tywin and I already determined that I shall be the Master of Ships long before you--
Speaker: MACE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: TYWIN enters and everyone rises, save OBERYN. TYWIN sits and the head of the table.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Lord Tywin, it's a great honor to have been granted a seat on this council. I--
Speaker: MACE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Everyone sits.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The trial begins this afternoon. We only have the morning for affairs of state. Shall we begin?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Sandor Clegane has been spotted in the Riverlands, my lord.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: A coward and a traitor.
Speaker: CERSEI
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: My birds tell me the Hound slaughtered five of our soldiers. I believe the phrase "fuck the king" was uttered.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Disgraceful.
Speaker: PYCELLE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: What would it take to make the common soldier stupid enough to try his luck with the Hound?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: 10 silver stags seems a generous bounty.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Make it 100. What else?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: More whispers from the east, my lord.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The Targaryen girl?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Daenerys has taken up residence in Meereen. She has conquered the city and rules as its queen.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Conquered with what?
Speaker: CERSEI
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Baby dragons. Larger every year, Your Grace.
Speaker: CERSEI
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Mormont is spying on her for us.
Speaker: PYCELLE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: No longer. He appears to be fully devoted to her. As for Ser Barristan, it would seem he took his dismissal from the Kingsguard a bit harder than anticipated.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: He's an old man. He wasn't fit to protect my son.
Speaker: CERSEI
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Joffrey didn't die on his watch. Dismissing him was as insulting as it was stupid.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Don't tell me you're worried about a child halfway across the world.
Speaker: CERSEI
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: A child with two seasoned warriors counseling her and a powerful army at her back, Your Grace.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Lord Varys is right. I have been to Essos and seen the Unsullied firsthand. They are very impressive on the battlefield. Less so in the bedroom.
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Dragons haven't won a war in 300 years. Armies win them all the time. She must be dealt with.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: How, my lord? By force?
Speaker: PYCELLE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Eventually, if it comes to that. Can your little birds find their way into Meereen?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Most certainly, my Lord Hand.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Mmm. Lord Tyrell, be a good man. Fetch my quill and paper.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: MACE stands to retrieve them, and exits.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The Iron Throne room
Speaker: INT
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Prince Oberyn.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Lord Varys...
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Only Varys. I'm not actually a nobleman. No one is under obligation to call me lord.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: And yet everyone does.
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: You seem quite knowledgeable about the Unsullied. Did you spend much time in Essos?
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Five years.
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: May I ask why?
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: 'Tis a big and beautiful world. Most of us live and die in the same corner where we were born and never get to see any of it. I don't want to be most of us.
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Most of us aren't princes.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: You are from Essos. Where? Lys?
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I have an ear for accents. I've lost my accent entirely.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I have an ear for that as well. How did you get here?
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: It's a long story.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: One you don't like telling people.
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: People I trust.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: My paramour Ellaria, she would find you very interesting. You should come to the brothel and meet her. We brought our own wine, not the swill they serve here. We have some lovely boys on retainer, but...
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: VARYS doesn't answer.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: You did like boys before?
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: (shakes his head)
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Really? Girls? Hmm. I hope you won't be offended when I say I never would have guessed.
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Not at all. But I was never interested in girls, either.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: What then?
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Nothing.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Everybody is interested in something.
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Not me. When I see what desire does to people, what it's done to this country, I am very glad to have no part in it. Besides, the absence of desire leaves one free to pursue other things.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Such as?
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: VARYS doesn't answer, but looks over to the throne instead. He exits.  OBERYN ponders.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: TYRION's cell
Speaker: INT
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: JAIME peeks through the window of the cell. TYRION sits on his bed. JAIME asks the guard to open the door, then enters the cell.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Let me guess, I've been pardoned.
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: JAIME nods an order to the guards behind him. They put him in manacles.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Really?
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Father's orders.
Speaker: JAIME
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Well, we mustn't disappoint Father.
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: King's Landing,  the Iron Throne room
Speaker: INT
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: A door opens, and JAIME and TYRION enter. TYRION walks down the aisle through the crowd,  flanked by two guards.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Kingslayer!
Speaker: MAN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: TOMMEN sits on the Iron Throne, TYWIN at his side. TYRION Is led to the accused dais, where his wrists are freed. JAIME steps away, as do the guards. OBERYN and MACE TYRELL stand just to the right of the Iron Throne. TYRION takes measure of the room.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: TYWIN motions to TOMMEN, who rises in response. Everyone in the hall does as well, including MARGAERY, LORAS and CERSEI.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I, Tommen of the House Baratheon, First of my Name, King of the Andals and the First Men, and Lord of the Seven Kingdoms, do hereby recuse myself from this trial. Tywin of the House Lannister, Hand of the King, Protector of the Realm, will sit as judge in my stead. And with him Prince Oberyn of the House Martell and Lord Mace of the House Tyrell. And if found guilty... may the gods punish the accused.
Speaker: TOMMEN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: TOMMEN exits, walking past both TYRION and JAIME. OBERYN and MACE TYRELL join TYWIN on the main platform. Everyone sits, save TYRION.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Tyrion of the House Lannister, you stand accused by the Queen Regent of regicide. Did you kill King Joffrey?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: No.
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Did your wife, the Lady Sansa?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Not that I know of.
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: How would you say he died, then?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Choked on his pigeon pie.
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: So you would blame the bakers?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Or the pigeons. Just leave me out of it.
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The crown may call its first witness.
Speaker: TWYIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The throne room, a bit later.
Speaker: CUT TO
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: MERYN TRANT is on the stand.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Once we'd got King Joffrey safely away from the mob, the Imp rounded on him. He slapped the king across the face and called him a vicious idiot and a fool. It wasn't the first time the Imp threatened Joffrey. Right here in this throne room, he marched up those steps and called our king a halfwit. Compared His Grace to the Mad King and suggested he'd meet the same fate. And when I spoke in the king's defense, he threatened to have me killed.
Speaker: MERYN TRANT
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Oh, why don't you tell them what Joffrey was doing?
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Silence.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Pointing a loaded crossbow at Sansa Stark while you tore at her clothes and beat her.
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Silence! You will not speak unless called upon. You're dismissed, Ser Meryn.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: MERYN TRANT exits, eyeing TYRION on his way out.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The throne room, a bit later.
Speaker: CUT TO
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: PYCELLE is on the stand.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Basilisk venom, widow's blood, wolfsbane, essence of nightshade, sweetsleep, tears of Lys, demon's dance... blind eye--
Speaker: PYCELLE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I think you have made your point, Grand Maester. You have a lot of poison in your store.
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Had, Prince Oberyn. My stores were plundered.
Speaker: PYCELLE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: By whom?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: By the accused, Tyrion Lannister, after he had me wrongfully imprisoned.
Speaker: PYCELLE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Grand Maester, you examined King Joffrey's corpse. Was it without question poison that killed him?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Without question.
Speaker: PYCELLE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The crowd murmurs. PYCELLE removes a necklace from his sleeve.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: This was found on the body of Dontos Hollard, the king's fool. He was last seen spiriting Sansa Stark, the wife of the accused, away from the feast. She wore this necklace the day of the wedding. Residue of a most rare and terrible poison was found inside.
Speaker: PYCELLE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Was this one of the poisons stolen from your store?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: It was. The Strangler. A poison few in the Seven Kingdoms possess. And used to strike down the most noble child the gods ever put on this good earth.
Speaker: PYELLE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The crowd murmurs.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The throne room, a bit later.
Speaker: CUT TO
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: CERSEI is on the stand.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: "I will hurt you for this. A day will come when you think you are safe and happy and your joy will turn to ashes in your mouth and you will know the debt is paid."
Speaker: CERSEI
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Your own brother said this to you?
Speaker: MACE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: (Nods.) Shortly before the Battle of Blackwater Bay. I confronted him about his plans to put Joffrey on the front lines. As it turned out, when the attack came, Joff insisted on remaining at the battlements. He believed his presence would inspire the troops.
Speaker: CERSEI
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Tyrion said, "And you will know the debt is paid." What debt?
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I discovered he'd been keeping whores in the Tower of the Hand. I asked him to confine his salacious acts to the brothel where such behavior belongs. He wasn't pleased.
Speaker: CERSEI
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: (shakes his head)
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Thank you, Your Grace, for the courage of your testimony.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: MARGAERY sighs. CERSEI leaves the witness stand. JAIME watches her return to her seat, and their eyes lock.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The throne room, a bit later.
Speaker: CUT TO
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: VARYS is on the stand.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Do you remember the precise nature of this threat?
Speaker: MACE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I'm afraid I do, my lord. He said, "Perhaps you should speak more softly to me, then. Monsters are dangerous and just now kings are dying like flies."
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: And he said this to you at a meeting of the small council?
Speaker: MACE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Yes. After we received word of Robb Stark's death. He didn't seem gladdened by the news. Perhaps his marriage to Sansa Stark had made him more sympathetic to the northern cause.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The crowd murmurs.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: You're excused, Lord Varys.
Speaker: TWYIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: VARYS nods and leaves the stand.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Father, may I ask the witness one question?
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: One.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: You once said that without me, this city would have faced certain defeat. You said the histories would never mention me, but you would not forget. Have you forgotten, Lord Varys?
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Sadly, my lord, I never forget a thing.
Speaker: VARYS
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: VARYS bows and exits. TYRION watches him go.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: We will adjourn for now.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: TYWIN, OBERYN and MACE stand.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Toll the bells in an hour's time.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Clear the court!
Speaker: GUARD
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The crowd stands.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: JAIME and CERSEI look at one another. The crowd files out and TYRION sits, dejected.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: INT; Tywin's chambers.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: TYWIN sits eating. JAIME stands.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: You'd condemn your own son to death?
Speaker: JAIME
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I've condemned no one. The trial is not over.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: This isn't a trial. It's a farce. Cersei has manipulated everything and you know it.
Speaker: JAIME
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I know nothing of the sort.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: You've always hated Tyrion.
Speaker: JAIME
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: He killed his king.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: As did I. Do you know the last order the Mad King gave me? To bring him your head. I saved your life so you could murder my brother?
Speaker: JAIME
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: It won't be murder. It'll be justice.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Justice?

Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: He'll be executed.
Speaker: JAIME
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: No, he'll be punished accordingly.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Once you said family is what lives on. All that lives on. You told me about a dynasty that would last 1,000 years. What happens to your dynasty when Tyrion dies? I'm a Kingsguard, forbidden by oath to carry on the family line.
Speaker: JAIME
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: What happens to my dynasty if I spare the life of my grandson's killer?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: It survives through me. I'll leave the Kingsguard. I'll take my place as your son and heir if you let Tyrion live.
Speaker: JAIME
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Done.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: JAIME is speechless.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: When the testimony's concluded and a guilty verdict rendered, Tyrion will be given the chance to speak. He'll plead for mercy. I'll allow him to join the Night's Watch. In three days' time, he'll depart for Castle Black and live out his days at the Wall. You'll remove your white cloak immediately. You will leave King's Landing to assume your rightful place at Casterly Rock. You will marry a suitable woman and father children named Lannister. And you'll never turn your back on your family again.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Speaker: JAIME
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: And you have mine.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Yes. Tyrion Lannister.
Speaker: SHAE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: How do you know him?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I was handmaiden to his wife Lady Sansa.
Speaker: SHAE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: This man stands accused of murdering King Joffrey. What do you know of this?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I know that he's guilty.
Speaker: SHAE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The crowd gasps.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: He and Sansa planned it together.
Speaker: SHAE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The crowd murmurs.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Silence! Continue.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: TYRION sits, shocked.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: She wanted revenge for her father, her mother, her brother. She blamed their deaths on the king. Tyrion was happy to help. He hated Joffrey. He hated the queen. He hated you, my lord.
Speaker: SHAE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The crowd murmurs.

Speaker: SHAE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I wasn't just her maid. I was his whore.
Speaker: SHAE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The crowd murmurs.

Text: I beg your pardon? You said you were his...
