Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: His whore.
Speaker: SHAE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: How did you come to be in his service?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: He stole me. I was with another man, a knight in your lordship's army. But when Tyrion arrived at the camp, he sent one of his cutthroats into our tent. He broke the knight's arm and brought me to Lord Tyrion. "You belong to me now," he said. "I want you to fuck me like it's my last night in this world."
Speaker: SHAE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The crowd laughs.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Silence. Silence!
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: And did you?
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Did I what?
Speaker: SHAE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Fuck him like it was his last night in this world.
Speaker: OBERYN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I did everything he wanted. Whatever he told me to do to him. Whatever he felt like doing to me. I kissed him where he wanted. I licked him where he wanted. I let him put himself where he wanted. I was his property. I would wait in his chambers for hours so he could use me when he was bored. He ordered me to call him "my lion," so I did. I took his face in my hands and said, "I am yours and you are mine."
Speaker: SHAE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Shae. Please don't.
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I am a whore. Remember? That was before he married Sansa. After that, all he wanted was her. But she wouldn't let him into her bed. So he promised to kill King Joffrey for her.
Speaker: SHAE
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The crowd clamors.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Father, I wish to confess. I wish... to confess.
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: JAIME is shocked.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: You wish to confess?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: TYRION turns to the crowd.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I saved you. I saved this city and all your worthless lives. I should have let Stannis kill you all.
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The crowd clamors.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Tyrion. Do you wish to confess?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Yes, Father. I'm guilty. Guilty. Is that what you want to hear?
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: You admit you poisoned the king?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: No, of that I'm innocent. I'm guilty of a far more monstrous crime. I am guilty of being a dwarf.
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: You are not on trial for being a dwarf.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Oh, yes, I am. I've been on trial for that my entire life.
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Have you nothing to say in your defense?
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: (To Cersei) Watching your vicious bastard die gave me more relief than 1,000 lying whores.
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: (To the crowd) I wish I was the monster you think I am. I wish I had enough poison for the whole pack of you. I would gladly give my life to watch you all swallow it.
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: Ser Meryn. Ser Meryn. Escort the prisoner back to his cell.
Speaker: TYWIN
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: I will not give my life for Joffrey's murder. And I know I'll get no justice here. So I will let the gods decide my fate. I demand a trial by combat.
Speaker: TYRION
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: The crowd clamors.
Episode: e6-The Laws of God and Men

Text: INT. King's Landing, Tyrion's Cell, day
JAIME and TYRION stand in the jail cell.
I made a deal for you to keep your ungrateful head on your ungrateful neck a little while longer.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I'm sorry, what am I grateful for? The opportunity to live and die at the Wall as punishment for a crime I did not commit?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You threw your life away. You threw it away. It's not a joke. You understand that, don't you?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You fell in love with a whore.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Yes, I fell in love with a whore. And I was stupid enough to think that she had fallen in love with me. That deal you made, it was everything Father wanted. You do see that? He gets you back as his heir. The future Lord of the Rock. And he ships me off to Castle Black, out of sight at last. All so perfect. It felt good to take that from him. He knows I'm innocent and he's willing to sacrifice me anyway. He's willing to sacrifice any of us. Not you. You're the golden son. You could kill a king, lose a hand, fuck your own sister, you'll always be the golden son.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Careful. I'm the last friend you've got.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: At least I got to tell them what they really are.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Yes, brilliant speech. They'll be talking about it for days to come. I thought you were a realist. Didn't realize you'd die for pride.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Don't give up on me just yet. I survived one trial by combat, even though you weren't there to save me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I can't save you this time either. My training has proved that I can't beat a stable boy with my left hand.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Where's your sense of adventure? Even if you lose, imagine the look on Father's face when you fall.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (laughs)
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Our family name snuffed out with a single swing of the sword.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It is tempting.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Well... Bronn fought for me once, he'll do it again. If he wins, I expect I'll be in his debt for the rest of my life.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: If he wins.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Will you find him for me? Who does Cersei plan on naming as a champion? I hope it's Ser Meryn Trant. I'd enjoy watching Bronn disembowel that pompous child beater.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No. Not Ser Meryn.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: EXT. King's Landing battle pit, day

The MOUNTAIN gores a prisoner on his great sword, heaving him mightily into the air. Blood streams from his mouth as the MOUNTAIN discards his body onto the sand. CERSEI watches. A line of filthy prisoners wait for a similar fate, a pair of guards behind them. A GUARD pushes the next PRISONER forward.
Go on, move it.
Speaker: GUARD

Text: The GUARD pushes PRISONER #2 forward. They reach
And you. Come on.
Speaker: GUARD

Text: The prisoners reach down to pick up meager weapons. PRISONER #1 attacks the MOUNTAIN, who parries and then disembowels him with a single blow. He takes a step forward. PRISONER #2 throws down his weapon and drops to his knees. The line of prisoners panics and the guards work to contain them.
Mercy. Please. Please, mercy.
Speaker: PRISONER #2

Text: CERSEI enters as the MOUNTAIN dispatches PRISONER #2 with a series of overhead blows.
Ser Gregor. Welcome to the capital. Thank you for riding here so quickly.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI looks down.
You seem to be in good form.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Who am I fighting?
Speaker: MOUNTAIN

Text: Does it matter?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: (Shakes his head.)
Speaker: MOUNTAIN

Text: EXT. The Riverlands.
ARYA and the HOUND ride up to a smoldering farm.
Could be food.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Could be soldiers.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA and the HOUND dismount and explore the farm. They come upon a DYING MAN, who sits propped up with a gut wound.
You shouldn't be sitting out here like this.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Where else to sit? Tried to walk back to my hut, hurt too much. Then I remembered they burned my hut down.
Speaker: DYING MAN

Text: Who were "they"?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: I stopped asking a while ago.
Speaker: DYING MAN

Text: The HOUND kneels down to inspect his wound.
That's not gonna get better.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Doesn't seem so.
Speaker: DYING MAN

Text: A bad way to go. Haven't you had enough?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Of what? I know. Time to go. Take matters into my own hands. The thought has occurred to me.
Speaker: DYING MAN

Text: ARYA kneels.
So why go on?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Habit.
Speaker: DYING MAN

Text: Nothing could be worse than this.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Maybe nothing is worse than this.
Speaker: DYING MAN

Text: Nothing isn't better or worse than anything. Nothing is just nothing.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Who are you?
Speaker: DYING MAN

Text: My name is Arya. Arya Stark.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You her father?
Speaker: DYING MAN

Text: (Shakes his head.) Her captor. Bringing her to her aunt for ransom.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: A fair exchange, that is. Always held to the notion of fair exchange in all my dealings. You give me, I give you. Fair. A balance. No balance anymore. Could I have a drink? Dying is thirsty work.
Speaker: DYING MAN

Text: The HOUND gives him a drink of water.
Wish it were wine.
Speaker: DYING MAN

Text: So do I.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The HOUND stabs the DYING MAN in the heart. He dies. The HOUND wipes the blood from his knife on the man's arm.
That's where the heart is. That's how you kill a man.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Suddenly, BITER jumps onto the the HOUND's back, shouting and biting his neck. The HOUND throws BITER down, breaking his neck in the process. He turns to see RORGE, weapon drawn.
The fuck you doing?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: There's a price on your head.
Speaker: RORGE

Text: Guess that's what the king does when you tell him to fuck off.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The king's dead. He drank poisoned wine at his own wedding. The bounty on you is for killing Lannister soldiers. 100 silver stags.
Speaker: RORGE

Text: And you thought you were going to collect it? Didn't think very hard, did you?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: You were Yoren's prisoners when he was taking me to the Wall. He told me he'd fuck me bloody with a stick.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: This day's really not working out the way you planned. He on your little list?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: He can't be. I don't know his name.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: What's your name?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Rorge.
Speaker: RORGE

Text: Thank you.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA draws needle quickly and pierces RORGE in the heart. He groans and falls. ARYA wipes her sword clean on his body.
You're learning.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: EXT. Castle Black courtyard.
The rangers train in the yard.  A horn blows
Rangers returning!
Speaker: MAN

Text: They return!
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: JON, GRENN, DOLOROUS EDD and their party enter. The men in the yard greet them, including SAM.
Rangers returning!
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: Greetings.
Speaker: JON

Text: Didn't think I'd see you again.
Speaker: MAN #3

Text: JON and SAM hug.
All right, Jon?
Speaker: SAM

Text: Welcome back, brother.
Speaker: MAN #4

Text: ALLISER THORNE and JANOS SLYNT enter on the platform above.
Lord Snow.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: JON finishes greeting OLLY. They all look up. Ghost barks.
This is no place for wild beasts. Lock him away or I'll let Hobb throw him in tonight's stew.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: JON turns and walks away
Come on, Ghost.
Speaker: JON

Text: INT. Castle Black Hall.
The Night's Watch is gathered for a meeting. From the floor, JON addresses ALLISER THRONE who sits at the elevated table with JANOS SLYNT. First builder YARWICK also sits at the head table.
Mance's army was closing in on Craster's Keep when we left. We saw their campfires from Osric's Hill. They'll reach the Wall before the next full moon.
Speaker: JON

Text: I'm surprised you didn't ride over and say hello. The King-beyond-the-Wall is your old friend, isn't he?
Speaker: JANOS SLYNT

Text: We need to prepare.
Speaker: JON

Text: We've been preparing.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: We should seal the tunnel. Plug it with rocks and ice. Flood it and let it freeze.
Speaker: JON

Text: And how would we range north?
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: We wouldn't.
Speaker: JON

Text: Coward. You would cut off our legs, pluck out our eyes, leave us cowering behind the Wall hoping for the storm to pass?
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: We can't defend the gate against 100,000 men.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: This castle has stood for thousands of years. The Night's Watch has defended her for thousands of years. And in all those centuries, we have never sealed the tunnel.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: Have you ever seen a giant, Ser Alliser? I have.
Speaker: JON

Text: The bars on those gates are four inches thick. Cold-rolled steel.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: They won't stop them.
Speaker: JON

Text: Remind me which order you belong to, Lord Snow.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: The stewards.
Speaker: JON

Text: Are the stewards responsible for maintaining the tunnel?
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: No.
Speaker: JON

Text: Who would that be?
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: The builders.
Speaker: JON

Text: Ah, the builders. First Builder Yarwyck, Lord Snow here recommends sealing the tunnel, leaving us unable to carry out our duties as sworn brothers of the Night's Watch. Do you agree with him?
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: (Pauses.) No.
Speaker: YARWICK

Text: Given your deep knowledge of the wildling army, Lord Snow, you and Tarly will take night duties atop the Wall until the full moon.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: The room laughs.
Moving on. First Builder, we'll need 100 barrels of pitch brought atop the wall.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: Aye.
Speaker: YARWICK

Text: JON sits in frustration.
INT. TYRION's cell.
TYRION sits and looks out the window. A door opens beyond his cell. BRONN walks down the stairs and is let into the cell.
My lord.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You have new clothes.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Do you like 'em? Eh? Gloves are doeskin. Softer than a virgin's thighs.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I sent for you days ago.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I've been a bit busy.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Doing what?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: My lonesome bachelor days are over. I'm to wed Lollys Stokeworth.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Lollys Stokeworth? She doesn't strike me as your sort of girl.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I wouldn't say I had a single sort of girl.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: She's dim-witted.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: If I wanted wits, I'd marry you.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: When my sister arranged this love match, did she mention that Lollys has an older sister?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Falyse. Aye, I did know about the older sister.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: And you understand the rules of inheritance?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Falyse is 40 and barren.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: She still gets Castle Stokeworth when her father dies.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She does. Unless she happens to perish before her father. Then Lollys gets the castle.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: (scoffs.)
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What? Ladies fall from their horses and snap their pretty necks all the time.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You and my sister deserve each other. Why did you bother to come here?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: BRONN sits.
You once said if anyone ever asked me to sell you out, you'd double their price.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Is it two wives you want or two castles?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: One of each will do. But if you want me to kill the Mountain for you, it'd better be a damn big castle.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I'm a bit short on castles at the moment. But I can offer you gold and gratitude.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I have gold. What can I buy with gratitude?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You might be surprised. A Lannister always pays his debts.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Your sister's a Lannister, too.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: My wife is heir to Winterfell. If I emerge from this with my head still on my shoulders, I may one day rule the North in her name. I could carve you out a big piece of it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: If and may and could. It's bloody cold up north. Lollys is soft and warm. And close. If I gave you the choice between fucking Lollys and fighting the Mountain, you'd have your britches down and your cock out before I could blink.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Does he frighten you so much?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'd be a bloody fool if he didn't frighten me. He's freakish big and freakish strong. And quicker than you'd expect for a man of that size. Maybe I could take him, dance around until he's so tired of hacking at me, he dropped his sword, get him off his feet somehow. But one misstep... ...and I'm dead. Why should I risk it?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Because you're my friend.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Aye, I'm your friend. And when have you ever risked your life for me?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: TYRION doesn't answer. BRONN stands.
I like you, pampered little shit that you are. I just like myself more.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I understand.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm sorry it has to be this way.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Why are you sorry? Because you're an evil bastard with no conscience and no heart? That's what I liked about you in the first place.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION extends his hand and BRONN shakes it heartily.
We had some good days together.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Yes, we did.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: BRONN pats TYRION's arm, then walks to knock on the door.
What will you do?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I suppose I'll have to kill the Mountain myself. Won't that make for a great song?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I hope to hear them sing it one day.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: BRONN exits.
INT. Meereen, DAENERYS's chambers at night.
DAENERYS enters to find DAARIO in her chambers.
How did you get in here? Your door is well guarded,
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: but your window is not.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAENERYS walks to DAARIO, and he hands her some flowers.
I swam to an island a mile offshore for these.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: She hands them back.
Don't do that again.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Never met a woman who didn't like wildflowers.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: These are my private quarters. If I want you here, I will summon you.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS sits. DAARIO kneels playfully for forgiveness.
Forgive me, my queen. I live to serve you.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Tell me why you're here.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAARIO rises.
I've ordered the Second Sons to patrol the streets to stop the revenge killing.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You've ordered us to be night watchmen.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: And as for women, there are thousands in Meereen you can pursue.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: There is only one, and she does not want me.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: You swore me your sword.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: My sword is yours till the day I die.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: So if I command you to stay in Meereen and patrol the streets?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I'll stay in Meereen and patrol the streets. Send me to kill your enemies. Any enemy anywhere. Let me do what I do best.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Very well.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS stands and pours herself some wine.
Do what you do best.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: She sits.
Take off your clothes.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAARIO smiles. DAENERYS watches has he removes his clothes.
INT. Bathing room at Storm's End, night
MELISANDRE lies in the bath. After knocking, SELYSE enters.
Oh.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Come in, my queen. Please.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I didn't mean to disturb you, my lady.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: You could never disturb me.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I just wanted to speak with you before we left.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Could you bring me that vial over there? The blue one.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: SELYSE reaches for a vial, but MELISANDRE stops her.
No, no, no. Not that one. You don't even want to touch that one. Next to it. That's the one.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: SELYSE brings over the vial and MELISANDRE shakes some into the bath. She sighs.
When I looked into the flames this morning, the Lord spoke to me. He said, "Tonight, you will have your last good bath in a long while. Make it count." A joke. Not a very good one, I'm afraid.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: That's because most jokes are lies and you're devoted to the truth.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: If they're lies, my lady, aren't they best avoided?
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Not always.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: MELISANDRE leaves the bath and walks to the potions
Did you use it with Stannis?
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: No. Don't be upset. Men never crave what they already have.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: MELISANDRE touches SELYSE on the cheek.
It's only flesh. It needs what it needs.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: MELISANDRE puts on her robe.

No act done in service of the Lord can ever be called a sin. I thank God every day for bringing you to us. And Stannis to you. He wants to bring Shireen with us. I think that would be ill-advised. My daughter has heretical tendencies, as you're well aware. I don't know if her doubt is real or simply meant to spite me, but whichever the case, she should stay home.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: MELISANDRE takes her hand.
I understand how you feel.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Hmm.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: But that is impossible.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Why?
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: You don't need powders and potions, my queen. You don't need lies. You are strong enough to look into the Lord's light and see his truth for yourself.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: They look into the fire.
However harsh it is. However hard for us to understand. You don't need my help, but I will need yours soon. When we set sail, your daughter must be with us. The Lord needs her.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: INT. Meeren hallway.
DAARIO walks down the hall, encountering JORAH.
Jorah the Andal. Are you here to see our queen? She's in a good mood.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAARIO pats JORAH on the shoulder and exits.
INT. DAENERYS's chambers.
DAENERYS stands in her chambers. JORAH enters.
Khaleesi.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You're here early.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Later than some.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You don't approve?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: It's not a question of approval, it's a question of trust.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You neither approve nor trust.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Why would I? The man's a sellsword.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Didn't you fight for the Golden Company before pledging your sword to my brother?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I did.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I trust you.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Daario Naharis killed his captains and dumped their heads at your feet when he grew tired of their commands. How could you ever have faith in a man like that?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I could never have faith in a man like Daario. That's why I've sent him and the Second Sons to retake Yunkai.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You have?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I have.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Without you there to rule, Khaleesi, I fear the masters will simply bide their time, wait for the invaders to leave and reassert control.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: That is why I've ordered Daario to execute every master in Yunkai. The masters tear babies from their mothers' arms. They mutilate little boys by the thousands. They train little girls in the art of pleasuring old men. They treat men like beasts, as you said yourself.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Herding the masters into pens and slaughtering them by the thousands is also treating men like beasts. The slaves you freed, brutality is all they've ever known. If you want them to know something else, you'll have to show it to them.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: And repay the slavers with what? Kindness? A fine? A stern warning?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: It's tempting to see your enemies as evil, all of them, but there's good and evil on both sides in every war ever fought.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Let the priests argue over good and evil. Slavery is real. I can end it. I will end it. And I will end those behind it.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I sold men into slavery, Khaleesi.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: And now you are helping me show them to freedom.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I wouldn't be here to help you if Ned Stark had done to me what you want to do to the masters of Yunkai.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: DAENERYS considers.
The man who came to me the other day about burying his father.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Hizdahr zo Loraq?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: He will accompany the Second Sons and serve as my ambassador to Yunkai. He will tell the masters what has happened in Meereen. He will explain the choice they have before them. They can live in my new world or they can die in their old one.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (Nods.)
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Well, go and catch Daario before he leaves. Tell him I changed my mind.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Yes, Khaleesi.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: JORAH starts to exit.
No. Tell him you changed my mind.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JORAH exits.
EXT. The Riverlands, day
The HOUND and ARYA sit by the fire. The HOUND tends clumsily to his neck wound.
Rat cunts. Fucking whore.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: You're doing it wrong. You need to burn away that horrible bit there. Otherwise it's gonna get infected and fester. I know you don't like fire, but if you don't do it right--
Speaker: ARYA

Text: No fire.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: ARYA stands and takes a flaming stick to the HOUND.
It'll only take a second. It won't hurt that much.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The HOUND stands and backs away.
No fire!
Speaker: HOUND

Text: They stand silently. ARYA turns and puts the stick back in the fire. She sits and polishes Needle.
Shut up about it. Shut up about everything. Thanks to you, I'm a walking bag of silver anywhere the Lannisters hold sway. Which is everywhere between where we are now and where we're going.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The HOUND sits.

I'm as stupid as that hog you stuck back in the village, getting myself cut and stabbed and bitten. No reward is worth this much trouble. Wish I'd never laid eyes on you. You say your brother gave you that sword.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: He points to his face.
My brother gave me this. It was just like you said a while back. Pressed me to the fire like I was a nice juicy mutton chop.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Why?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Thought I stole one of his toys. I didn't steal it. I was just playing with it. The pain was bad. The smell was worse. But the worst thing was that it was my brother who did it. My father, who protected him... told everyone my bedding caught fire. You think you're on your own?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Let me wash it out and help you sew it up at least.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The HOUND doesn't answer. ARYA stands and walks to him. She pours water on his wound and begins to sew it.
INT. An Inn, night.
BRIENNE and PODRICK sit for dinner. The server places a pie in front of them.
Bit of comfort never hurt anyone. We've been sleeping in ditches the last few weeks. I think we can treat ourselves to a featherbed for the night and a hot meal not cooked by you.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: PODRICK drinks greedily from his cup.
Couldn't agree more, my lady.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Just don't start expecting silk underclothes. Not working for your former lord any longer.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Yes, my lady.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: BRIENNE stops PODRICK from drinking.
Don't get drunk.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: No, my lady.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Can I get you anything else?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: No, this will do nicely, thank you. Kidney pie is wonderful.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Thanks. I do my best.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: HOT PIE sits.

A good kidney pie is all about the ingredients. Flour, lard, water, eggs, milk. Easy enough. But the meat, peacetime or not, getting your hands on a good bottom round steak and calves' kidneys is not easy. I mean, some people settle for plain old beef kidneys. Got no right to cook anything, them. Oh, and the gravy. Don't get me started on the gravy. Very difficult to get right. See, a lot of people give up on the gravy. You cannot give up on the gravy. No gravy, no pie. Simple as that. That's nice armor. Are you a knight?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: No.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Oh, it's just people with armor are usually knights. Generally speaking. From King's Landing, though, aren't you? From there myself originally. Flea Bottom born and bred. What brings you to these parts?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: We're looking for someone.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Someone in particular? Maybe they came in here. A lot of people come in here. Just the other day we had 17--
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: A girl, tall, red hair, very pretty. Her name is Sansa Stark, but she may be using a different name.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Starks? What, like them lot from "Winterhell"?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: HOT PIE stands and starts to go.
sNo, ain't seen anyone like that. I heard they was all traitors. Don't need no traitors in here.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: I pledged my life to their mother Catelyn Stark. I swore to her I'd bring her daughters home.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Sure I can't get you a bit more kidney pie?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: EXT. Outside the Inn.
BRIENNE and PODRICK prepare the horses.
What?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: It's nothing, my lady.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: You wouldn't be screwing your face up like that if it was nothing.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Don't want to offend, my lady. Truly, I don't.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: You're not interesting enough to be offensive.

Text: The Lannisters want Lady Sansa. The Lannisters have money. People kill for money. I don't think we should be telling people we're searching for Lady Sansa.

Text: HOT PIE enters.
My lady. My lord. Could I have a word?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: What about? Not kidney pie.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You seem like a proper lady. Someone who could be trusted. I never met no Sansa Stark. But I know her sister... Arya.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: No one's seen Arya Stark since her father was beheaded. She's presumed dead.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: She weren't when I last spoke to her.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: When was that?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Heading up north with the Night's Watch. She was all dressed up as a boy. Like your ladyship, only without the armor. Going by the name Arry.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: So what happened to her?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Well--
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: The quick version.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: The Lannisters took us prisoner. We escaped. The Brotherhood took us prisoner. They sold me to the innkeep. They were gonna sell Arya to her mother at Riverrun along with another prisoner. Big ugly fellow. Foul mouth and a face like a half-burnt ham. Not friendly.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: The Hound.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: That's the one. If you find her, could you give her this? She liked the last one I gave her, but, well, this one turned out better.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: PODRICK hands a small bundle to BRIENNE. He exits. BRIENNE opens the bundle to reveal a bread shaped like a wolf.
Um, you were saying?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: EXT. The King's Road
BRIENNE and PODRICK walk their horses down the road.
Her mother's dead, grandfather's dead, Walder Frey is the new lord of Riverrun. The Brotherhood isn't going to Riverrun.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: They'll take her to the Eyrie, my lady.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Why the Eyrie?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Her aunt, Lysa Arryn. Catelyn Stark's sister. She's Arya's last living relative with money. She hates the Lannisters. Lord Tyrion made sure I knew which house married which and who hated who.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Sansa could be there, too.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Aye, my lady. Could be.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: You sure about this?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: No.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: They continue through the woods.
INT. TYRION's cell, night.
TYRION sits in the dark, sadly. The door opens and OBERYN enters, bearing a torch..
I imagined you'd be back at the brothel at this hour.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I did spend some time with an absolutely stunning blonde the other day.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Mm, do tell. I've got every kind of filth down here except the kind I like.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: OBERYN puts down his torch and sits.
Your sister.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Oh.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Cersei approached me. We spoke a great deal about her daughter. How worried your sister is about her. She was trying very hard to pretend she had not come to sway me against you. I think she may have even believed it herself.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Making honest feelings do dishonest work is one of her many gifts.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It was difficult for her to hide her true intentions. It is rare to meet a Lannister who shares my enthusiasm for dead Lannisters. She desperately wants to see you killed.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: She didn't need to bother you. It looks as though I've taken care of that myself. The joy she will feel when my head leaves my neck. She's wanted this for a long time.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Yes, I know. We met, you and I. Many years ago.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: I think I would have remembered that.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Unlikely. You had just been born. Our father brought me and my sister Elia with him on a visit to Casterly Rock. My first time away from Dorne. I didn't like anything about the Rock. Not the food, not the weather, your accents. Nothing. But the biggest disappointment... you.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: You and my family have more in common than you might admit.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The whole way from Dorne all anyone talked about was the monster that had been born to Tywin Lannister. A head twice the size of his body, a tail between his legs, claws, one red eye, the privates of both a girl and a boy.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: That would have made things so much easier.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: When we met your sister, she promised she would show you to us. Every day we would ask. Every day she would say, "Soon." Then she and your brother took us to your nursery and... she unveiled the freak. Your head was a bit large. Your arms and legs were a bit small, but no claw. No red eye. No tail between your legs. Just a tiny pink cock. We didn't try to hide our disappointment. "That's not a monster," I told Cersei. "That's just a baby." And she said, "He killed my mother." And she pinched your little cock so hard, I thought she might pull it off. Until your brother made her stop. "It doesn't matter," she told us. "Everyone says he will die soon. I hope they are right. He should not have lived this long."
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Well... sooner or later, Cersei always gets what she wants.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And what about what I want? Justice for my sister and her children.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: If you want justice, you've come to the wrong place.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I disagree.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: OBERYN rises.

I've come to the perfect place. I want to bring those who have wronged me to justice. And all those who have wronged me are right here. I will begin with Ser Gregor Clegane, who killed my sister's children and then raped her with their blood still on his hands before killing her, too. I will be your champion.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: EXT; The Aerie courtyard.
SANSA walks out to the courtyard. It is snowing. She builds a model of Winterfell from snow. ROBIN enters.
Hello, Robin.

Careful. You've ruined it. Now I'm going to have to rebuild the whole thing.

Speaker: ROBIN

Text: You did.

Speaker: SANSA

Text: I didn't ruin it!

Robin, I'm sorry, I--

Children.

Text: I loved your mother more than you could ever know. Given the opportunity, what do we do to those who've hurt the ones we love? In a better world, one where love could overcome strength and duty, you might have been my child. But we don't live in that world.

You're more beautiful than she ever was.

Text: LITTLEFINGER kisses SANSA. Above them, LYSA has been watching, and she exits quickly.
INT. The Aerie throne room.
SANSA enters. LYSA stands looking out the moon door.
You wanted to see me, Aunt Lysa?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Come here, Sansa.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: SANSA joins her beside the moon door.
Do you know how far the fall is?
Speaker: LYSA

Text: No.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Neither do I, precisely. Hundreds of feet. It's fascinating what happens to bodies when they hit the rocks from such a height. The impact breaks them right apart. Like eggs dropped on the floor. Sometimes pieces remain intact. You'll find the head sitting on its own. Every hair in place. Blue eyes staring at nothing. I know what you did.
Speaker: LYSA

Text: I'm so sorry, Aunt Lysa. I never should have hit Robin, I know it. I promise it won't happen--

Text: Don't be coy with me, you little whore. You kissed him. You kissed Petyr.

I saw you! You can't lie to me because I saw it with my own eyes.

Liar! Whore! He is mine!

Please!
Speaker: SANSA

Text: My father, my husband, my sister, they all stood between us and now they're all dead. That's what happens to people who stand between Petyr and me. Look down! Look down! Look down! Look down!
Speaker: LYSA

Text: Lysa! Let her go.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: You want her? This empty-headed child?
Speaker: LYSA

Text: Let her go.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: She's just like her mother. She'll never love you. I lied for you. I killed for you. Why did you bring her here? Why?
Speaker: LYSA

Text: I'll send her away. I swear on my life. I swear to all the gods. Let her go, Lysa.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: LYSA cries. She pushes SANSA away from the moon door and begins weeping. LITTLEFINGER approaches her and hugs her.
Oh, my sweet wife. My sweet, silly wife.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: LITTLEFINGER helps LYSA to stand.
I have only loved one woman... only one, my entire life. Your sister.

Text: LITTLEFINGER pushes LYSA through the moon door. She screams as she falls.

Text: Bracken. Mmm, strong. As long as they're in the see. But when you take them out of the water, no bones. They collapse under their proud weight and slum into a heap of nothing. You'd think they'd know that. Unfortunately they're not very bright. What do you tell them?

...shame fought with honor.

A great-grandfather from Braavos, yes. I suppose all of our ancestors came from somewhere else originally.

Text: Lord Baelish has told many lies. All to protect me. Since my father was executed, I have been a hostage in King's Landing. A plaything for Joffrey to torture or Queen Cersei to torment. They beat me, they humiliated me, they married me to the Imp. I had no friends in King's Landing...except one. He saved me. Smuggled me away when he had the chance. He knew I'd be safe here in the Eyrie with my own blood, my Aunt Lysa. The Lannisters have friends everywhere. Even the Vale. He made me swear not to tell anyone my true name.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Your secret is safe with us, my lady.
Speaker: SER VANCE

Text: Your father grew up right here in these halls. We hunted together many times. He was a fine man.
Speaker: LORD ROYCE

Text: Tell us what happened to your aunt, Sansa.
Speaker: LADY ANYA

Text: You knew her well, my lords, my lady. You knew she was a troubled woman. She always loved Lord Baelish. She told me herself. From the moment he arrived at the gates of Riverrun, a boy of eight carrying everything he owned in a little sack. She confessed to me she never loved Lord Arryn. She did as her father commanded, as so many of us have. When the gods finally allowed her to be with Lord Baelish, she was so happy. For a time. My aunt was a jealous lady. She was terrified that Lord Baelish didn't love her anymore. That he would abandon her for a younger woman. And then...one day she saw him kiss me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Lady Sansa.
Speaker: LORD ROYCE

Text: It was a peck on the cheek, Lord Royce, nothing more. Lord Baelish is my uncle now, in truth, by marriage. He's always been so kind to me. I was so happy to be here, to be free. All because of him. But my aunt turned on me. She cursed me. Called me a whore. Promised to throw me through the Moon Door. When Lord Baelish tried to calm her, she struck him. She said she didn't want to live anymore. She stood on the edge of that Moon Door. He tried to reason with her. Promised her she was the only one he had ever loved, but she stepped through those doors and she was...*begins sobbing*
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Shh. Shh, it's not your fault, sweet girl. It's not your fault.
Speaker: LADY ANYA

Text: [Sansa looks up at Petyr]
[Lord Royce, Lady Anya, and Petyr walk down the stairs]
You could see it in the way she raised that boy. Feeding him from her own teats when he was 10 years old.

And since then, Arryn and Royce, Corbray, Waynwood, all the great houses of the Vale watched from the corner. A timid boy at a tavern brawl.

Text: Seems rather ordinary. And he was my nephew as well, so what is that? Fratricide is brothers. Filicide is sons. Nepoticide. That's the one. Matricide, patricide, infanticide, suicide. There's no kind of killing that doesn't have its own word.
