Text: Why?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I was curious. Why was he smashing all those beetles? What did he get out of it? First thing I did was ask him. "Orson, why are you smashing all those beetles?" He gave me an answer. "Smash the beetles. Smash 'em. Khuu! Khuu! Khuu!" I wasn't deterred. I was the smartest person I knew. Certainly I had the wherewithal to unravel the mysteries that lay at the heart of a moron. So I went to Maester Volarik's library.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Volarik. Tried to touch me once.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Turns out, far too much has been written about great men and not nearly enough about morons. Doesn't seem right. In any case, I found nothing that illuminated the nature of Orson's affliction or the reason behind his relentless beetle slaughter. So I went back to the source. I may not have been able to speak with Orson, but I could observe him, watch him the way men watch animals to come to a deeper understanding of their behavior. *picks up a beetle* And as I watched, I became more and more sure of it. There was something happening there. His face was like the page of a book written in a language I didn't understand. But he wasn't mindless. He had his reasons. And I became possessed with knowing what they were. I began to spend inordinate amounts of time watching him. I would eat my lunch in the garden, chewing my mutton to the music of "khuu, khuu, khuu". And when I wasn't watching him, I was thinking about him. Father droned on about the family legacy and I thought about Orson's beetles. I read the histories of Targaryen conquests. Did I hear dragon wings? No. I heard "khuu, khuu, khuu" and I still couldn't figure out why he was doing it. And I had to know, because it was horrible that all these beetles should be dying for no reason.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Every day around the world, men, women, and children are murdered by the score. Who gives a dusty fuck about a bunch of beetles?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I know, I know. But still, it filled me with dread. Piles and piles of them, years and years of them. How many countless living crawling things smashed and dried out and returned to the dirt? In my dreams I found myself standing on a beach made of beetle husks stretching as far as the eye could see. I woke up crying, weeping for their shattered little bodies. I tried to stop Orson once.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: He was twice your size.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He just pushed me aside with a "khuu" and kept on smashing. Every day until that mule kicked him in the chest and killed him. *puts the beetle back on the ground* So what do you think? Why did he do it? What was it all about?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I don't know.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: [Bells begin chiming in the distance. Jaime goes to leave]
Good luck today.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: [Tyrion walks out toward the arena. The Lannisters are there, Oberyn is there getting ready for the battle. Tyrion passes him in handcuffs]
Looks like very light armor.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I like to move around.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: You could at least wear a helmet. You shouldn't drink before a fight.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You learn this during your years in the fighting pits? I always drink before a fight.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: It could get you killed. It could get me killed.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Today is not the day I die.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: You're going to fight that?
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: I'm going to kill that.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: He is the biggest man I've ever seen.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Size does not matter when you are flat on your back.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Thank the gods.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: In the sight of gods and men, we gather to ascertain the guilt or innocence of this...man Tyrion Lannister. May the Mother grant them mercy. May the Father give them such justice as they deserve. And may the Warrior guide the hand of our champion...
Speaker: PYCELL

Text: [Tywin speeds the process along in boredom. Horns sound to start the fight. Oberyn kisses Ellaria]
Don't leave me alone in this world.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Never.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: [Oberyn is tossed his weapon. He's very good with it. The crowd cheers]
Have they told you who I am?
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Some dead man.
Speaker: MOUNTAIN

Text: [The Mountain lunges forward as the battle begins]
I am the brother of Elia Martell. Do you know why I have come all the way to this stinking shit-pile of a city? For you.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: I'm going to hear you confess before you die. You raped my sister. You murdered her. You killed her children. Say it now and we can make this quick.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: Say it. You raped her. You murdered her. You killed her children.
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: You raped her! You murdered her! You killed her children!
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: [Oberyn stabs the Mountain in the gut]
You raped her! You murdered her!
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: [Oberyn charges at the Mountain to give him one final blow]
You killed her children!
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: [Everyone looks down, surprised. Oberyn pulls his weapon out of the Mountain and starts walking around his body]

Wait. Are you dying? No, no, no. You can't die yet. You haven't confessed. Say it. Say her name. Elia Martell. You raped her. You killed her children. Elia Martell. Who gave you the order? Who gave you the order?! Say her name! You raped her! You murdered her! You killed her children. Say it. Say her name. Say it!
Speaker: OBERYN

Text: [The Mountain trips Oberyn and grabs him in his massive hands. He punches out his teeth and gets on top of Oberyn, squeezing his head]
Elia Martell. I killed her children. Then I raped her. Then I smashed her head in like this!
Speaker: MOUNTAIN

Text: [Ellaria screams in agony. Tyrion looks dead inside]
*standing up* The gods have made their will known. Tyrion Lannister, in the name of King Tommen of the House Baratheon, First of His Name, you are hereby sentenced to death.
Speaker: TYWEN

Text: [Opens on Jon Snow and Samwell Tarly standing on the edge of The Wall. It's night]
What was she like?
Speaker: SAM

Text: She...she had red hair.
Speaker: JON

Text: Oh? How big were her feet?
Speaker: SAM

Text: Well what do you want me to say?
Speaker: JON

Text: I want you to tell me what it was like to have someone. To be with someone. To love someone and have them love you back. We're all gonna die a lot sooner than I'd planned. You're the closest I'll ever get to know it.
Speaker: SAM

Text: So you and Gilly never-
Speaker: JON

Text: No...she just had a baby! ...and she never offered.
Speaker: SAM

Text: But if she had, you would've? You'd have broken your vows?
Speaker: JON

Text: The interesting thing is, our vows never specifically forbid intimate relations with women.
Speaker: SAM

Text: What?
Speaker: JON

Text: "I shall take no wife" yes, that's in there, there's no denying that. "I shall father no children" it's very specific. But what our vows have to say about other...activities...is open to interpretation.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I don't think Ser Alliser cares much for interpretation.
Speaker: JON

Text: Anyway, there's nothing for him to interpret. We didn't. So what's it like?
Speaker: SAM

Text: It's...there's this person, this whole other person. And you're wrapped up in them and they're wrapped up in you and...you...for a little...for a little while you're more than just you, you're...well I don't know, I'm not a bleedin' poet!
Speaker: JON

Text: No, you're really not.
Speaker: SAM

Text: And what did I get for it? An arrow six inches from my heart.
Speaker: JON

Text: There'll be arrows for all of us soon I imagine.
Speaker: SAM

Text: There will.
Speaker: JON

Text: They've already done the worst thing to me they could ever do.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Go get some sleep, Sam. I'll take this watch.
Speaker: JON

Text: [Sam gets in the lift back down off the wall. An owl perches on a post. Cut to the Wildlings where Thenn warg is standing with his eyes white. Ygritte, Tormund, and Styr are sitting in the background]
Did I ever tell you about her? My Sheila?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Yes.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: Oh that was a night to remember. Of course, I'd had a good bit to drink *laughs* the fangs were sharp, but she knew how to use them. And she was nice and soft down below. No, she was no ordinary beast. Many's the man who--
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I know you never fucked a bear. You know you never fucked a bear. Right now I don't wanna think about the bear you never fucked. Right now all I want to think about is each one of these arrows finding its way into a Crow's heart.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: We could be waiting here a while.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Good. The longer we wait, the more arrows I'll have. When they came up here, to our land, and put up a big wall and said it was their's. Then they started hunting us down. But this time, we're the one's doing the hunting.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: You've got a lot to say about killing. Even more words than arrows.
Speaker: STYR

Text: Back in those villages I killed just as many of them as you did. More, I reckon.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: Yes. But none of those were your Crow lover.
Speaker: STYR

Text: I probably killed him already.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: So you've said.
Speaker: STYR

Text: And if not. The only thing left of him is gonna be his fun-bits hanging around me neck.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: And more words. Know what I think you do when you see him? Serve him up a nice juicy slice of ginger minge.
Speaker: STYR

Text: [Everyone laughs. Ygritte gets up and rushes towards Styr]
What, you been thinkin' about that ginger minge? Wondering what it tastes like?
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: Maybe I have.
Speaker: STYR

Text: Jon Snow is mine. *shouting* Anyone else tries to kill him, I'll have an arrow for them. *to Styr* And not one of your bald friends is fast enough to stop me.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: [Gilly walks along the top of the hill with her baby, looking down at the Wildling camp. She walks away quickly. Cut to Sam in the library reading]
And what is it that couldn't wait until morning, Tarly?
Speaker: AEMON

Text: Maester Aemon. How did you know-
Speaker: SAM

Text: That it was you? Who else but Samwell Tarly would be wasting candles to read in the middle of the night?
Speaker: AEMON

Text: Let me help you.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Oh, no need. I know my way around this library better than any other place in Castle Black. Thousands of books and no eyes to read them. Old age is a wonderful source of ironies if nothing else. But you didn't answer my question, what are you reading?
Speaker: AEMON

Text: Maester Faull
Speaker: SAM

Text: Ah, the Wildlings. I can assure you that the closest Maester Faull ever got to a Wildling was this very library.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: But what he says about what they do...it's all true. It's exactly what the survivors of their raids report.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Yes. Imagine the stories Wildlings tell about us! Love is the death of duty. I told that to your friend Jon Snow once. He didn't listen and neither did you. That's why you abandoned your watch atop the wall to come here and read about the things that may have happened to the girl you love.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: I don't love her.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Yes you do.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: No.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Yes you do! I heard it in your voice when you first brought her to me. I remember how it sounds! I was in love once.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: You were?
Speaker: SAM

Text: You can imagine all manner of horrors befalling that poor girl and her child, is it so difficult to imagine that an old person was once, more or less, like you?
Speaker: AEMON

Text: I'm sorry Maester, I didn't mean it like that.
Speaker: SAM

Text: You know who I was before I came here? What I could've been if I'd only said the word? Of course you do. I met many girls when I was Aemon Targaryen. A future king always does. Some of them were quite forward in their attempts to win my affections. One of them succeeded. I was very young.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: Who was she?
Speaker: SAM

Text: Ah ha. I could tell you everything about her. Who she was. How we met. The color of her eyes and the shape of her nose. I can see her right in front of me. She's more real than you are. We could spend all night trading tales of lost love. Nothing makes the past a sweeter place to visit than the prospect of imminent death. Go to bed Tarly.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: [Aemon gets up and blows out the candle. Sam leaves the room and outside hears Gilly at the gate talking with Pypar]
I'm sorry, I can't open the gate for nobody. It's orders!
Speaker: PYP

Text: They killed everyone! Everyone but me and my baby. And they're out there. I saw them on the way here, they may have seen me, they may have followed me please!
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I'm sorry, I can't.
Speaker: PYP

Text: If they find the boy, you don't know what they'll do.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Pyp! Open the gate.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I can't.
Speaker: PYP

Text: Sam, is that you?!
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Yes!
Speaker: SAM

Text: Thorne gave me strict orders to not open the gate.
Speaker: PYP

Text: Oh, Pyp. Open the fucking gate!
Speaker: SAM

Text: [Pyp goes to open the gate]
I've never heard you curse before.
Speaker: PYP

Text: Yes, well, best get used to it.
Speaker: SAM

Text: [Gilly runs inside and Sam embraces her]
Are you alright? Shh, you're alright. Yeah, of course you are my brave little fella.
Speaker: SAM

Text: It was horrible.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I'm so so sorry. I didn't know until I got back.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Don't let them send me away, Sam.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Never.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I know there's no women allowed.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Anyone who tries to throw you out will be having words with me. From now on, wherever you go, I go too.
Speaker: SAM

Text: [A horn sounds in the distance]
Get ready!
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: [Members of the Night's Watch can be heard shouting frantically. The owl screeches. Cut to Thenn warg whose eyes turn back to normal]
It's time.
Speaker: THENN WARG

Text: [The Wildlings get up and look at the hill. The owl flies away as the Night's Watch prepare for battle. Jon Snow walks out to the edge of The Wall and looks down upon flames in the distance. The Night's Watch light torches preparing for battle. Barrels are rolled to the edge of The Wall]
Pick up the pace!
Speaker: JANOS

Text: [The barrels are rolled into place]
There we go, boys. That's one. There's two. Come on, let's get the next lot. That's the last of the oil, Ser Alliser.
Speaker: JON

Text: A hundred thousand you say?
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: Yes sir.
Speaker: JON

Text: You can say it if you like. We should've sealed the tunnel while we had the chance like you suggested.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: It was a difficult decision either way, Ser.
Speaker: JON

Text: Do you know what leadership means, Lord Snow? It means that the person in charge gets second-guessed by every clever little twat with a mouth. But if he starts second-guessing himself, that's the end. For him. For the clever little twats. For everyone. This is not the end. Not for us. Not if you lot do your duty for however long it takes to beat them back. And then you get to go on hating me and I get to go on wishing your Wildling whore had finished the job.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: [Sam and Gilly are walking down a hall. Sam unlocks a door and they both enter. The room is filled with supplies. Gilly lays her baby on a sack of something]
You'll be safe down here. I'll check on you as soon as I can.
Speaker: SAM

Text: You're leaving me again?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I'm not leaving you!
Speaker: SAM

Text: You're going up there and we're staying down here. That's leaving. You said from now on we'd stay together.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I...I didn't mean in the same room.
Speaker: SAM

Text: What are you going to do out there?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Help my brothers.
Speaker: SAM

Text: How?! You going to fight the Free Folk when they come? They'll kill you. In Molestown they killed everyone.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I can't just hide here with you while they're fighting out there.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Why not? You won't matter up there, you will down here.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Look. I am a man of the Night's Watch, Gilly. I made a promise to defend The Wall and I have to keep it, because that's what men do.
Speaker: SAM

Text: [Sam kisses Gilly]
Promise me you won't die.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I promise you I won't die.
Speaker: SAM

Text: [Sam turns around and leaves the room. Outside the Night's Watch is still getting ready for battle. Pyp sets some arrows up then stands back, scared]
There's a lot more Wildlings on the other side of the wall than this side. We've got us some weapons and things. This is the perfect place for us to be.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I've never thrown a spear before. I've never held a sword with a proper edge. There's no place for me to be. You're not afraid?
Speaker: PYP

Text: Of course I'm afraid, there's a band of Wildlings coming to kill us.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Well if you're afraid of a band of Wildlings, how in seven hells did you manage to kill a White Walker?
Speaker: PYP

Text: I didn't know I was going to kill it, but I had to do something I didn't have any choice, he was going to kill Gilly and take the baby. If someone had asked me my name right then, I wouldn't have known. I wasn't Samwell Tarly anymore. I wasn't a Steward in the Night's Watch or son of Randyll Tarly or any of that. I was nothing at all. And when you're nothing at all, there's no more reason to be afraid.
Speaker: SAM

Text: But you're afraid now?
Speaker: PYP

Text: Yes, well, I'm not nothing anymore.
Speaker: SAM

Text: [Ygritte looks up at Castle Black. She sees Sam in the tower and she runs down the hill toward the other Wildlings]
Most of their men are up top. Didn't count more than twenty down there. Leftovers. They've got a little fat one and a little bony one manning the front.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: How high are the walls?
Speaker: STYR

Text: Well, we'll be up and over before they know what's happened.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: Let's kill some Crows!
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: [Everyone cheers]
*yells* Come on! *puts out the fire*
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: [The Wildlings head towards Castle Black. Overhead shot pans to show the castle, The Wall, and then the flames in the distance. Mance Rayder's forces are seen stomping and yelling through the woods. A giant rides a giant mammoth. The Night's Watch perched upon the wall look down at them in awe]
Archers knock, everyone else hold.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: [The archers get ready to shoot, Grenn accidentally drops a barrel]
I said knock and hold you cunts! Does knock mean draw?!
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: No Ser!
Speaker: NIGHT'S WATCH

Text: Does fucking hold mean fucking drop?!
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: No Ser!
Speaker: NIGHT'S WATCH

Text: You all plan to die here tonight?
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: No Ser!
Speaker: NIGHT'S WATCH

Text: That's very good to hear. Draw!
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: Help, down below.
Speaker: MEMBER 1

Text: [Tormund and his men rush Castle Black as archers shoot at them. Ygritte grabs flaming arrows from the ground and shots up at the Night's Watch]
They're attacking the southern gates!
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Now?
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: Now!
Speaker: JANOS

Text: I'm going down then. Brother Slynt, you have The Wall.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: What?!
Speaker: JANOS

Text: What are you fucking waiting for, loose!
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: You heard the man. Loose!
Speaker: JANOS

Text: [The archers on The Wall let loose a barrage of arrows downward at Rayder's troops. They back up, then cheer. On the other side, Ygritte continues to let loose flaming arrows]
You, over there.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: [Pyp shoots a crossbow down at Tormund's troops]
Did you get one?
Speaker: SAM

Text: No. Ah shit, Pyp. Shit. Sam.
Speaker: PYP

Text: Yeah?
Speaker: SAM

Text: I think we're gonna die.
Speaker: PYP

Text: If you keep missing we will.
Speaker: SAM

Text: [Tormund's troops throw rope up at the gate. Alliser steps off the lift and walks towards the Night's Watch]

Brothers! A hundred generations have defended this castle. We've never fallen before. She will not fall tongiht. Those are Things at our walls. They eat the flesh of the men they kill. Do you want to fill the belly of a Thing tonight?
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: No!
Speaker: NIGHT'S WATCH

Text: Tonight we fight. And when the sun rises I promise you, Castle Black will stand.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: [Night's Watch cheers]
The Night's Watch will stand.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: [Night's Watch cheers]
With me now! Now, with me!
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: [Alliser and the Night's Watch rush at the Wildlings that have scaled the gate. Pyp and Sam leave their position as Tormund scales the gate. On the other side Rayder's troops advance]
No discipline. No training. Gang of thieves, that's all this is. I commanded the city watch of King's Landing. Those men obeyed orders.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: We can't just let them attack the gate!
Speaker: JON

Text: The bars of those gates are four inches of cold, rolled steel.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Those are giants riding mammoths down there. Do you think your cold, rolled steel's gonna stop them?
Speaker: JON

Text: No such thing as giants. They're stories for the children.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Brother Slynt! I've just got word that Ser Alliser needs you below. You're the most experienced man he's got, he said he needs ya.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: Needed below? Yes. Yes.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: [Janos runs away. Jon and Grenn nod at each other]
Archers! Knock your arrows! Draw! Loose!
Speaker: JON

Text: [The archers let loose a bunch of arrows at Rayder's men as they rush the wall and begin to climb]
They won't summit before dawn.
Speaker: JON

Text: How do you know that?
Speaker: GRENN

Text: Because I've made that claim.
Speaker: JON

Text: I think they're in a bigger hurry than you were.
Speaker: ED

Text: [Archers of the Night's Watch are lowered perpendicular to The Wall]
Knock! Draw! Loose!
Speaker: JON

Text: [A Wildling tries to shoot an arrow up at The Wall unsuccessfully. A giant stands next to him and shoots his own arrow up. The first rips through one of the posts. The second clears one of the Night's Watch straight off the wall. At Castle Black the fighting continues. Styr kills a man, the blood splatters on Olly's face. Janos comes down off the lift and Olly returns the lift to the top. Wildlings break into the kitchen. Janos cowardly runs down a hall toward where Gilly and her baby are hiding. He looks at her in shock. Outside Pyp finally hits someone with his crossbow.]
I got one. Right through the heart, he's dead.
Speaker: PYP

Text: Oh, is it over?
Speaker: SAM

Text: Huh?
Speaker: PYP

Text: Well then. *hands Pyp a loaded crossbow*
Speaker: SAM

Text: [Pyp goes up to shoot a Wildling, but Ygrytte shoots an arrow right through his neck. He falls into Sam's arms]
You're alright. You're alright. I'll get help. Shh, shh. Maester Aemon is coming, he's gonna make it alright.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Now!
Speaker: JON

Text: Now!
Speaker: ED

Text: [The Night's Watch drop barrels down toward the Wildlings that approach the gate. Two giants and a mammoth approach the gate and begin pulling at it with long ropes]
*to Grenn* The outer gate won't hold. Take five men, hold the inner gate.
Speaker: JON

Text: Alright.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: *grabs Grenn's arm* Hold the gate. If they make it through...
Speaker: JON

Text: They won't. Come on Hill! And you Cooper! You three, on me! Come on you lazy bastards!
Speaker: GRENN

Text: Oil!
Speaker: JON

Text: Oil on the ramp!
Speaker: ED

Text: Protect the gate!
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: [Alliser and Tormund start fighting each other like badasses. Tormund slices Alliser in the gut. Alliser falls to the ground and gets dragged  underneath]
Hold the fucking gate! Hold it!
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: [Sam sits with Pyp on his lap, dead. He lays him on the ground and grabs the crossbow. He makes a run for the lift as Thenn warg sees him and chases after him. Sam shoots him in the head with his crossbow. Grenn and the men that came down with him get off the lift]
*to Grenn* We need more men down here.
Speaker: SAM

Text: We have to hold the gate.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: But we need men here.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Tell Jon! He's in command. *to the men behind him* Let's go!
Speaker: GRENN

Text: [Sam gets in the lift]
*to Olly* Get me to the top! You hear me?!
Speaker: SAM

Text: [Olly sits on the ground with his hands over his ears in fear]
Your name's Olly, right? Listen to me Olly, get me to the top and when we give a signal, bring us back down. Do you hear me?
Speaker: SAM

Text: [Olly raises the lift]
And find a weapon, Olly. Fight them!
Speaker: SAM

Text: [Olly looks down at a bow and arrow. On The Wall, barrels of flaming oil are dropped down on the giants and the mammoth. The mammoth goes running off and one of the giants chases after it. Up top, one of the barrels got stuck and the men of the Night's Watch frantically try to get it off the ramp. A spear is fired down at one of the giants and it hits him right in the back. The other giant shouts in anger and goes to raise the gate with his bare hands. The barrel explodes on the ramp. Sam approaches Jon]
What are you doing up here?
Speaker: JON

Text: The Wildlings are over the walls. Ser Alliser has fallen. The castle walls can't stand much longer.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Ed. You have The Wall. If they try the mammoths again, drop fire on them. If the climbers get too high, drop the scythe on them.
Speaker: JON

Text: [Jon leaves his post and grabs his sword]
Two brothers now fight with me.
Speaker: JON

Text: Might as well enjoy our last night, right boys? Light the fuckers up. Knock! Draw! Loose!
Speaker: ED

Text: [Grenn gets to the inner gate with his men as the giant continues to raise the gate]
How are we gonna stop that?
Speaker: DONNEL

Text: We shot twenty-eight arrows in him already.
Speaker: COOPER

Text: You heard Jon, we hold the gate.
Speaker: GRENN

Text: Jon Snow's not Lord Commander.
Speaker: DONNEL

Text: We hold the gate!
Speaker: GRENN

Text: [The giant lifts the gate and goes under it]
Mother save me. Father save me.
Speaker: DONNEL

Text: The gods aren't down here. It's the six of us, you hear me?
Speaker: GRENN

Text: No, please.
Speaker: DONNEL

Text: [The giant rushes toward the inner gate as Grenn and his men stand in fear, ready to fight]
Night gathers, and now my watch begins. It shall not end until my death. I shall take no wife, hold no lands, father no children. I shall wear no crowns
Speaker: GRENN

Text: And win no glory. I shall live and die at my post. I am the sword in the darkness. I am the watcher on the walls. I am the shield that guards the realms of men. I pledge my life and honor to the Night's Watch, for this night and all the nights to come!
Speaker: All TOGETHER

Text: [Jon, Sam, and the other men ride the lift to the bottom]
*to Sam* I don't want you out there.
Speaker: JON

Text: You can't protect me forever. There won't be anywhere to hide if the castle falls.
Speaker: SAM

Text: [Jon hands Sam a key]
I need him more than I need you.
Speaker: JON

Text: [Sam nods as Jon opens the lift door early and leaps out and begins fighting. So begins the most incredible shot in the series, as the camera pans around the entire battlefield showing us glimpses of this truly epic battle. Sam runs to a door and unlocks it]
We need you boy.
Speaker: SAM

Text: [Ghost runs out and attacks one of the men that Jon was fighting. Tormund gets his first arrow to the back. Styr sees Jon and rushes to fight him. They go at it for a bit. Ygritte runs out of arrows so she jumps down and steals some from a dead body. Styr and Jon are still fighting as Ygritte finally spots Jon. Styr slams Jon's face against an anvil. Jon kills Styr with a hammer. As he turns around he sees Yrgitte with an arrow aimed right at him. They both stare, Jon smiles. An arrow goes straight through Ygritte's chest. She falls to the ground. It was Olly, that bastard. Jon rushes to catch Ygritte]
Jon Snow.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: No, shh, don't talk.
Speaker: JON

Text: Do you remember that cave?
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: [Jon nods]
We should've stayed in that cave.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: We'll go back there.
Speaker: JON

Text: You know nothing, Jon Snow.
Speaker: YGRITTE

Text: [Ygritte dies. The battle rages on as Jon holds Ygritte's dead body. On the other side, Rayder's troops are climbing the wall]
Drop the scythe, boys!
Speaker: ED

Text: [A massive scythe drops down on the men]
Hoister up!
Speaker: ED

Text: [Rayder's troops retreat]
They've had enough for one night.
Speaker: ED

Text: [The Night's Watch cheers in excitement]
Don't cheer too loud. They still outnumber us a thousand to one.
Speaker: ED

Text: [Inside Castle Black's walls Tormund is still alive, swinging his sword with two arrows in his back]
Tormund. It's over, let it end.
Speaker: JON

Text: This is how a man ends.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: [Jon grabs a crossbow and shoots Tormund in the leg then kicks away his weapon]
Put him in chains. We'll question him later.
Speaker: JON

Text: I should've thrown you from the top of your wall boy!
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Aye, you should've.
Speaker: JON

Text: [Gilly hears someone entering her room. She grabs a leg of meat as a weapon and rushes the door]
Woah! It's me. It's me. I promised you, didn't I?
Speaker: SAM

Text: [Sam turns around and sees Janos. Outside the Night's Watch clean up after the battle. Sam and Jon descend the stairs]
We held them off.
Speaker: SAM

Text: For one night.
Speaker: JON

Text: This is a great victory.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Great victory? Mance was testing our defenses. He almost made it through. And he has more giants, he has more mammoths. He has a thousand times as many men. They'll hit us again tonight. Maybe we can hold them off for a day or two, but we can never beat them.
Speaker: JON

Text: Where are you going?
Speaker: SAM

Text: I'm going to find Mance.
Speaker: JON

Text: To...you can't do that. No one gave you any orders.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Who's left to give orders? The Wildling army is only an army because of Mance. He united a hundred warring tribes. Without Mance they lose their leader. They lose their purpose, they go back to fighting each other, scatter back to their home.
Speaker: JON

Text: Without Mance? You're going to kill him?
Speaker: SAM

Text: I'm going to try.
Speaker: JON

Text: They'll never let you within a hundred yards of him. And if you did, even if you managed to kill him.
Speaker: SAM

Text: He'll kill me. If I don't go he'll kill me anyway. They'll kill the rest of us too.
Speaker: JON

Text: He won't just kill ya. They'll boil you. They'll filet you. They'll make it last days!
Speaker: SAM

Text: You're right. It's a bad plan. What's your plan?
Speaker: JON

Text: [Jon stands there for a second as he and Sam look at each other, then he walks off, Sam scampering after him. They walk down the tunnel toward the gate. The giant and Grenn and his men are dead on the ground]
They held the gate. Get some brothers down here to help you. You need to burn the bodies. Raise the outer gate, then lower it again as soon as I'm out.
Speaker: JON

Text: [Sam waves his torch to signal the raising of the gate. Jon removes his sword]
What are you doing?
Speaker: SAM

Text: I promised Jeor I'd never lose it again. *he hands the sword to Sam* In case I don't come back.
Speaker: JON

Text: Jon. Come back.
Speaker: SAM

Text: [The gate raises and Jon walks through it]
TITLE SEQUENCE
EXT. WOODS
A younger Cersei and her friend Melara are walking in the woods.
We shouldn’t be out here alone.
Speaker: MELARA

Text: Why not?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: If your father hears…
Speaker: MELARA

Text: He’ll never know we’ve been gone.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: But if he finds out…
Speaker: MELARA

Text: Cersei takes her hands.
You don’t need to be afraid of my father.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: They walk until they see a hut with smoke coming out of it.
Are you sure?
Speaker: MELARA

Text: Yes.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: We shouldn’t go in.
Speaker: MELARA

Text: Of course we should.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: INT. MAGGY’S HUT
A fire is burning and various plants are hanging from the ceiling. They hear a shriek then…
Get out. Get out!
Speaker: MAGGY

Text: Let’s go…
Speaker: MELARA

Text: No.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Listen to your friend.
Speaker: MAGGY

Text: They said that you were terrifying. With cat’s teeth and three eyes. You’re not terrifying. You’re boring.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You don’t know what I am.
Speaker: MAGGY

Text: I know you’re a witch and you can see the future. Tell me mine.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Everybody wants to know their future. Until they know their future.
Speaker: MAGGY

Text: This is my father’s land. My land. Tell me my future or I’ll have your two boring eyes gouged out of your head.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Maggy chuckles then hands Cersei a knife.
Your blood. Give me a taste.
Speaker: MAGGY

Text: Cersei cuts her thumb then Maggy grabs her hand to suck her blood.
Three questions you get. You won’t like the answers.
Speaker: MAGGY

Text: I’ve been promised to the prince. When will we marry?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You’ll never wed the prince. You’ll wed the king.
Speaker: MAGGY

Text: But I will be queen?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Oh yes, you’ll be queen. For a time. In comes another. Younger, more beautiful, to cast you down and take all you hold dear.
Speaker: MAGGY

Text: Will the king and I have children?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No. The king will have 20 children, and you will have 3.
Speaker: MAGGY

Text: That doesn’t make sense.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Gold will be their crowns. Gold their shrouds.
Speaker: MAGGY

Text: Maggy starts laughing. Cersei’s thumb starts dripping blood.
Come on, we have to go. We have to go! Cersei!
Speaker: MELARA

Text: Cersei gets out of a cart to a funeral procession outside of the Great Sept of Baelor. She walks to the top of the stairs.
Your grace, we are honored by your presence. The mourners are waiting.
Speaker: PRIEST

Text: They will keep waiting. I want a moment alone with him.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: But your grace, many of these lords and ladies have travelled day and night to be here…
Speaker: PRIEST

Text: Cersei starts walking away.
From all seven kingdoms…
Speaker: PRIEST

Text: They will wait.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: INT. GREAT SEPT OF BAELOR
Tywin’s body rests with hand-painted stones on top of his eyes. Jaime presides over the body. Cersei walks next to him.
He never wanted you to be a King’s Guard, but here you are, protecting his dead body.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: What he built. The towers. He built it for us. He meant it for us. They’re going to try to take it away, all of it.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: They?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: All of them out there are enemies. They’re waiting a night to make sure he’s really dead and as soon as they see the stones on his eyes they’ll set to work on tearing us apart.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: They had nothing to do with it. The man who murdered our father, he tore us apart, he’s the enemy. I’ve been telling you for years, you’ve been defending him for years…
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: This is exactly what they want.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: ...and now our father is dead. And that little monster is out there somewhere drawing breath. Did you set him free?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No response from Jaime.

Tyrion may be a monster but at least he killed our father on purpose. You killed him by mistake. With stupidity. You’re a man of action, aren’t you? When it occurs to you to do something you do it, nevermind the consequences. Take a look. (gestures towards Tywin) Look at the consequences. Here they are. He loved you more than anyone in this world.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Cersei kisses Tywin on the head then leaves.
We see men working with rope, merchants carrying boxes, and trees through a hole in the crate. The crate is set down and opened up. Tyrion comes out with Varys standing over him.
Apologies.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I still don’t see why I had to stay in this fucking crate once we set sail.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I saved your life. If they catch you, they catch me. I cannot say I feel overly guilty about leaving you in that “fucking crate”.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Do you know what it’s like to stuff your shit through one of those air holes?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No. I only know what it’s like to pick up your shit and throw it overboard.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Tyrion looks around.
Pentos?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Varys nods.

The home of my colleague. Ilyrio Mopatis. A merchant. He and I met many years ago, through mutual friends. A group of people who saw Robert Baratheon for the disaster he was. We tried to do what was best for the realm by supporting the Targaryen restoration. And thus began the chain of mistakes that has led us both here. Things have gotten worse, not better. Westeros needs to be saved from itself.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Tyrion pours himself a cup of wine and drinks it.
Much better.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: My lord?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I don’t think I am anymore. A lord. Are you a lord if you kill your father? I don’t suppose they revoke your nobility for killing a whore. That has to be happen all the time.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You already drank yourself across the Narrow Sea.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: In a box. Why stop now?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Because we are talking about the future of our country.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Tyrion finishes his wine.
The future is shit. Just like the past.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: He pukes up his wine and then pours himself another cup.
MEEREEN
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The giant bronze Harpy statue is pulled down from the top of the pyramid.
An Unsullied soldier, White Rat, walks up to a prostitute and hands her a coin. She takes him into her room and starts undressing him.
You want the same? Same as always?
Speaker: PROSTITUTE

Text: She undresses herself
You… you don’t have to.
Speaker: WHITE RAT

Text: Habit.
Speaker: PROSTITUTE

Text: She puts her clothes back on and lays down next to him in bed, stroking his head and humming. A knife slits his throat. White Rat looks up and sees a member of the Sons of the Harpy holding the knife
A golden Sons of the Harpy mask rests on the table.
Sons of the Harpy?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Yes, your grace. They left it on the body.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: They’ve never killed before.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: It was only a matter of time, your grace. Conquerors are always met with resistance.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: I didn’t conquer them. Their own people did.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They do not see us as people, Your Grace.
Speaker: MOSSADOR

Text: Then they will have to learn to see things differently, Mossador. He did not risk his life fighting for freedom so cowards in masks could take it away. And I did not take up residence in this pyramid so I could watch the city below decline into chaos. What was the name of the man you lost?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: White Rat, your grace.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: I want him buried with honor. Publicly. In the Temple of the Graces.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Sons of the Harpy will hear that message.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: Make them very angry.
Speaker: MOSSADOR

Text: Angry snakes lash out. Makes chopping off their heads that much easier. Find the men who did this and bring them to me.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: INT. HALLWAY
The Unsullied are putting their armor on. Missandei walks up to Grey Worm.
Torgo Nudho.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Missandei hin Naath.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: I wanted to speak with you.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: The other Unsullied leave the room.
Why do you come?
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: White Rat, the Unsullied who… I have heard they found his body in a brothel. I have heard that more than one Unsullied has been known to visit Meereen’s brothels. May I ask you why? Why would an Unsullied go to a brothel?
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: I do not know. I must go.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: CASTLE BLACK
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Jon Snow is parrying with Olly. Jon puts his sword to Olly’s neck.
Get your shield up.
Speaker: JON

Text: It’s too heavy.
Speaker: OLLY

Text: If it wasn’t heavy it wouldn’t stop a sword, now get it up.
Speaker: JON

Text: Jon knocks Olly into the ground then helps him up.
Come. Try it again. Drive at me. Keep your shield up. Or I’ll ring your head like a bell.
Speaker: JON

Text: Sam and Gilly are watching them parry from afar.
Shouldn’t you be training, too?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Well, I’m hardly a new recruit. How many brothers can say they’ve killed a white walker and a Thenn? I might be the first in history!
Speaker: SAM

Text: Ser Alliser walks by.
These men need a firm hand. Always have. They’re poachers and thieves.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: He gives Sam and Gilly a look.
Not soldiers.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: He walks away.
That one hates me.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: If Ser Alliser is chosen as the new Lord Commander… he hates the wildlings.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Sam looks at Gilly’s baby.
All the wildlings.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Don’t let them send us away.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: It’s not a sure thing. Ser Denys Mallister has commanded the Shadow Tower for 20 years, and people say he’s a good man. He’s running against Ser Alliser--
Speaker: SAM

Text: Sam! Don’t let them send us away.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I told you. Wherever you go, I go, too.
Speaker: SAM

Text: You can’t leave, they’ll execute you.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Cut back to Jon and Olly parrying. Olly is on the offensive.
Good, good, pivot! Don’t forget to pivot! Shield up!
Speaker: JON

Text: Jon turns and sees Melisandre waiting.
The king wants a word.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Jon looks uncomfortably at Melisandre.
You’re not cold, my lady?
Speaker: JON

Text: Never. The Lord’s fire lives within me, Jon Snow.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: She takes his hand to her face.
Feel.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Jon feels her face.
Are you a virgin?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: No.
Speaker: JON

Text: Good.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: EXT. THE WALL
Your grace. The bastard of Winterfell.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Jon bows to Stannis. Stannis motions for him to get up.
You know who rules at Winterfell now?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Roose Bolton.
Speaker: JON

Text: The traitor who plunged a dagger into Robb Stark’s heart. Don’t you want to avenge him?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I want a great many things, your grace. But I’m a sworn brother of the Night’s Watch now.
Speaker: JON

Text: I’ve been talking to your sworn brothers. Many of them love you.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: They’re good men.
Speaker: JON

Text: Many don’t. You were seen taking the body of a wildling girl north of the Wall. Why?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: It’s where she belonged.
Speaker: JON

Text: Some of the Night’s Watch feel you have too much affection for the wildlings.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: They were born on the wrong side of the wall. That doesn’t make them monsters.
Speaker: JON

Text: No matter. I shall take back the North from the thieves who stole it. Tywin Lannister is dead. He can’t protect them now. I shall mount Roose Bolton’s head on a spike. But if I’m to take Winterfell I’ll need more men.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: The men of the Night’s Watch are sworn to play no part--
Speaker: JON

Text: I’m not talking about the damn Night’s Watch. I’m talking about the wildlings.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Your grace, you want the wildlings to march in your army?
Speaker: JON

Text: If they swear to follow me, I’ll pardon them. We’ll take Winterfell. Once the North is won, I’ll declare them citizens of the realm. I’ll give them land to live on.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: It’s a fair offer. More than fair.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I’ll offer them their lives and their freedom if Mance kneels before me and swears his loyalty.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I don’t think that’s likely.
Speaker: JON

Text: You admire him, don’t you?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I respect him.
Speaker: JON

Text: He likes you. Convince him to bend the knee...
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Your grace…
Speaker: JON

Text: ...or he burns.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: How much time do I have?
Speaker: JON

Text: Nightfall. The sun drops fast this time of year. Hurry, Jon Snow.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: THE VALE OF ARRYN
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Sansa, Littlefinger, and Yohn Royce are watching Robin parry. He is being beaten badly.
Sword up! Attack, my lord! Attack! Don’t cross your feet!
Speaker: MASTER OF ARMS

Text: My sons have had swords in their hands from the time they could walk. This one…
Speaker: YOHN ROYCE

Text: Lord Arryn will never be a great warrior.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Great warrior? He sings a sword like a girl with palsy.
Speaker: ROYCE

Text: My lord. (hands Baelish a note)
Speaker: SQUIRE

Text: Sword up, my lord!
Speaker: MASTER OF ARMS (O.S.)

Text: Some boys develop more slowly. He’s still young.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: He’s 13. Boys go to war at 13.
Speaker: ROYCE

Text: He has other gifts.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Does he?
Speaker: ROYCE

Text: The gift of a great name. Sometimes that’s all one needs.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: He offers his hand to Sansa and takes her away from the swordfight. Lord Royce follows.
Goodbye Lord Royce, and thank you for all you’ve done for me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I have done nothing more than my duty, my lady.
Speaker: ROYCE

Text: I have no doubt that upon my return, Robin’s skills will have improved immeasurably.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: He’ll be safe here. As for his skills, I make no promises.
Speaker: ROYCE

Text: COUNTRYSIDE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Podrick sits down next to Brienne, who is sharpening her sword.
Will we head north at some point? He said Sansa had a brother at Castle Black. We’re a few days ride from the Kingsroad, but that will take us--
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Us? The only reason you’re here is that Jaime Lannister told me you weren’t safe in the capital. You’re hundreds of miles from King’s Landing. No one knows what you look like. No one cares. You’re safe.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: But I’m you’re squire.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Do you even know what a squire is?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: An attendant to a knight?
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I’m not a knight. That means you’re not a squire.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Well, where would I go?
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I don’t care, I’m not your mother.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You swore to find the Stark girls.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I found Arya. She didn’t want my protection.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Sansa still might.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Will you shut your mouth? I didn’t ask for advice. I don’t want anyone following me. I’m not a leader. All I ever wanted is to fight for a Lord I believed in. The good lords are dead and the rest are monsters.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: A horse and carriage rides by.
INT. CARRIAGE
You told Lord Royce we were going to the Fingers.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I did.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: But we’re heading west.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: We are.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: If he wanted to betray us, he already would have.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Lord Royce may be as honorable as he thinks he is, but he’s not alone in that castle. Do you trust all those knights and ladies, stable boys and serving girls?
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: No. Do you trust the carriage driver or the knights escorting us?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Baelish smiles.
No. But I pay them well, and they’ve seen what happens to men who disappoint me.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: So where are we going? To a land where you trust everyone?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: So a land so far from here, even Cersei Lannister can’t get her hands on you.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: KING’S LANDING
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Close-up on Cersei drinking wine while Loras talks in the background.
It was such a deep, deep shock to us all. Your father was a force to be reckoned with. He truly was. I wouldn’t presume to claim to have known him as such…
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Cut to Tommen talking and smiling with Margaery.
But just being in his presence was enough to make it so clear just how formidable a person you were dealing with. What a… what a force to be reckoned with.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Thank you so much for your kind words.
Speaker: CERSEI (sighs)

Text: Cersei walks away and heads down the stairs.
Deepest condolences, your grace. This tragedy… I never trusted Varys. I often warned…
Speaker: GRAND MAESTER PYRCELLE

Text: Cersei walks away from him. A barefooted man in a robe walks up to Cersei.
Your grace.
Speaker: LANCEL LANNISTER

Text: Cersei inspects him for a moment.
Cousin Lancel. I hardly recognized you.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: My deepest sympathies.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: I apologize for my son’s appearance.
Speaker: KEVAN LANNISTER

Text: Uncle, it’s quite alright.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Lancel walks away.
They call themselves sparrows. Bloody fanatics. Religion has its place, of course, but at a certain point… They never would have come to the capital when Tywin was alive.
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: I’m sure he’ll grow out of it. Whatever it is. Excuse me.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Of course.
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: Cersei walks away, grabs a glass of wine, and heads to a room alone. Lancel greets her after some time.
Your wounds from the Blackwater seem to have healed.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: It wasn’t my wounds that needed healing.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: What can I do for you?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You can forgive me.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: What could you possibly have done to warrant my forgiveness?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I led you into the darkness.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: I doubt you’ve ever led anyone anywhere.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I tempted you into our unnatural relations. And, of course, there was the king. His boar hunt. His wine.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: I don’t know what you’re talking about.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I’m a different person now. I found peace in the light of the Seven. You can too. They watch over all of us, ready to dole out mercy… or justice. Their world is at hand. I will pray for your father’s soul.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: Cersei laughs.
The day Tywin Lannister’s soul needs your help…
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Cersei takes a sip of wine and Lancel walks away.
LORAS’ BEDROOM
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Close-up of Loras' birth mark.
It looks like Dorne.
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: No it doesn’t.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: It does. That’s the Sunspear bit right there. And that’s where the mountains are. And over here is… Sunsnake? Stonespear?
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: Sandstone.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Yes. Yes, Sandstone. Just there.
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: Fine.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: They start kissing.
It’s Dorne.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: We should go there. I think we would have a lovely time.
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: Judging by my experience, that would be wonderful. Dorne, Highgarden. Anywhere but here.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: They kiss. Margaery walks in.
We’re late for dinner as it is.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: You’re very respectful.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: I’m very hungry.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: She closes the door.
What’s your name?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Olyvar, my lady.
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: I’m afraid my brother is keeping the king waiting, Olyvar.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Olyvar kisses Loras then leaves the room.
Perhaps you might consider being a bit more discreet?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Why? They all know about me anyway. Everybody knows everything about everyone. What’s the point in trying to keep a secret in a place like this?
Speaker: LORAS

Text: In any event… (throws Loras his clothes) you shouldn’t keep your intended waiting.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: My intended? Please. Tywin’s dead. That means no one can force Cersei to marry me.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Lucky you.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Unlucky you.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: You think I want that woman married to my brother?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: If she doesn’t marry me, she doesn’t go to Highgarden. Which means she stays in King’s Landing. Which means you’re trapped here with Cersei Lannister as your mother-by-law.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Perhaps.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Perhaps?
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Perhaps?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: PENTOS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Tyrion is standing on a balcony with a glass of wine. Varys approaches him.
Eunuch, the spider, the master of whisperers.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Imp, half-man.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Tyrion raises his glass.
There are faster ways to kill yourself.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Not for a coward.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You are many things, my friend, but not a coward.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: You never told me why you set me free.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Your brother asked me to.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: You could have said no.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Refuse the Kingslayer? A dangerous proposition.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Not as dangerous as releasing me. You risked your life, your position, everything. Why? You’re not family, you owe me nothing.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I didn’t do it for you. I did it for the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: A drunken dwarf will never be the savior of the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I don’t believe in saviors. I believe men of talent have a role to play in the war to come.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: You’re going to have to find another soldier. I’m done with Westeros and Westeros is done with me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You have many admirable qualities, self-pity is not one of them. Any fool with a bit of luck can find himself born into power. But earning it for yourself, that takes work.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I’m not well-suited for work.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I think you are. You have your father’s instinct for politics, and you have compassion.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Compassion? Yes. I killed my lover with my bare hands. I shot my own father with a crossbow.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I never said you were perfect.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: What is it you want exactly?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Peace. Prosperity. A land where the powerful do not prey on the powerless.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Where the castles are made of gingerbread and the moats are filled with blackberry wine. The powerful have always preyed on the powerless, that’s how they became powerful in the first place.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Perhaps. And perhaps we’ve grown so used to horror we assume there’s no other way. If you sat on the Iron Throne, would you spread misery throughout the land?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I will never sit on the Iron Throne.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No, you won’t. But you could help another climb those steps and take that seat. The Seven Kingdoms need someone stronger than Tommen, but gentler than Stannis. A monarch who can intimidate the high lord and inspire the people. A ruler loved by millions with a powerful army and the right family name.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Good luck finding him.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Who said anything about him? You have a choice my friend. You can stay here at Ilyrio’s palace and drink yourself to death, or you can ride with me to Mereen, meet Daenerys Targaryen, and decide if the world is worth fighting for.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Can I drink myself to death on the road to Meereen?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: MEEREEN
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The Unsullied march through the streets.
When did the Unsullied start patrolling the streets of Meereen? Looks like your friends haven’t been behaving themselves.
Speaker: DAARIO NAHARIS

Text: The mission to Yunkai was a resounding success. The Wise Masters of Yunkai have agreed to cede power to a council of elders, made up of both the freedmen and the former slaveholders. All matters of consequence will be brought to you for review.
Speaker: HIZDAHR ZO LORAQ

Text: Good.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They did ask for some concessions.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: Concessions?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Politics is the art of compromise, your grace.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: I’m not a politician. I’m a queen.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Forgive me. You’re right, of course. Still, it’s easier to rule happy subjects than angry ones.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: I don’t expect the Wise Masters to be happy. Slavery made them rich, I ended slavery.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They do not ask for the return of slavery. They ask for the re-opening of the fighting pits.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: The fighting pits? Where slaves fought slaves to the death?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: In the new world that you’ve brought to us, free men would fight free men.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: Daario takes out his sword and smiles at Daenerys.
The pitfighters that you liberated plead for this opportunity. Bring some here and ask them yourself.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: No fighting pits.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Opening them would show the people of Yunkai and Meereen that you respect their traditions.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: I do not respect the tradition of human cockfighting.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: If you--
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: How many times must I say no before you understand?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Whatever he wants from me he’s not going to get it. If he really believes I’m going to reopen the fighting pits…
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You should reopen the fighting pits.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: What?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: My mother was a whore, I told you that. She liked to drink pear brandy. The older she got, the less she made selling her body, the more she wanted to drink. So one day when I was 12, she sold me to a slaver she fucked the night before.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Why?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I was a bad child. I wasn’t big, but I was quick. And I loved to fight. So they sold me to a man in Tolos who trained fighters for the pits. I had my first match when I was 16.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: You were sold into slavery, forced to fight to the death for the amusement of the masters, and you’re defending the fighting pits?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I’m only here because of those pits. I learned to fight like a Dothraki screamer, a Norvoshi priest, a Westerosi knight. Soon I was famous. 10,000 men and women screamed my name when I stepped into the pit. I made so much money for my master he set me free when I died. I joined the Second Sons, and then I met you.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: A long pause.

You’re the queen. Everyone’s too afraid of you to speak truth. Everyone but me. You’ve made thousands of enemies all across the world. As soon as they see weakness, they’ll attack. Show your strength here, now.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: That’s why I have the Unsullied patrolling the streets.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Anyone with a chest full of gold can buy an army of Unsullied. You’re not the Mother of Unsullied. You’re the Mother of Dragons.
Speaker: DAARIO (scoffs)

Text: I don’t want another child’s bones dropped at my feet. No one’s seen Drogon in weeks. For all I know he’s flown halfway across the world. I can’t control them anymore.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: A dragon queen with no dragons is not a queen.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: INT. DRAGON PIT
Daenerys walks into the room the dragons are being held. She hears chains rattling.
Viserion? Rhaegal?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The two fully grown dragons start snapping, screaming, and breathing fire at her.
Easy. Easy. Easy.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They keep breathing fire and roaring so she leaves the room, terrified.
CASTLE BLACK
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Members of the Night’s Watch are constructing a funeral pyre.
INT. MANCE’S CELL
Jon Snow enters the room.
So here we are.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Here we are.
Speaker: JON

Text: When we first met you were my prisoner. And now, for our last meeting…
Speaker: MANCE

Text: This doesn’t have to be our last meeting.
Speaker: JON

Text: No, but it will be.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: You know what Stannis wants?
Speaker: JON

Text: He wants me to bend the knee. And he wants the free folk to fight for him. I’ll give him this much: he’s bold.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Shouldn’t a king be bold?
Speaker: JON

Text: Oh, aye. I respect him. If he gets what he wants, I expect he’ll be a better ruler than the fools sitting on the Iron Throne the last hundred years. But I’ll never serve him.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: You told me you weren’t here to conquer. You told me your people have bled enough.
Speaker: JON

Text: That’s right. But I don’t want them bleeding for Stannis Baratheon either.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: You spent your life convincing 90 clans to come together for the first time in history. Thenns and Hornfoots, the ice-river clans, even the giants. A life’s work uniting them. You didn’t do it for power. You didn’t do it for glory. You brought them together to save them because none of them will survive the winter, not if they’re north of the wall. Isn’t their survival more important than your pride?
Speaker: JON

Text: Pride? Fuck my pride. This isn’t about that.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Then bend the knee and save your people.
Speaker: JON

Text: They followed me because they respected me. Because they believed in me. The moment I kneel for a Southern king that’s all gone.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: And how many tens of thousands are out there right now? How many women? How many children? And you won’t go out and rescue them because why? You’re afraid of looking afraid.
Speaker: JON

Text: Oh, I am afraid. No shame in that. How will they do it? Beheading? Hanging?
Speaker: MANCE

Text: They’ll burn you alive.
Speaker: JON

Text: Bad way to go. I’ll be honest with you, I don’t want to die. And burnt to death, I don’t want people to remember me like that. Scorched and screaming. But it’s better than betraying everything I believe.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: And what happens to your people? You preserve your dignity and die standing, and they’ll sing songs about you. “You’d rather burn than kneel. The great hero.” Until winter comes, and the white walkers come for us all, and there’s no one left to sing.
Speaker: JON

Text: You’re a good lad. Truly, you are. But if you can’t understand why I won’t enlist my people in a foreigner’s war, there’s no point explaining.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Jon walks to the door, then turns around.
I think you’re making a terrible mistake.
Speaker: JON

Text: The freedom to make my own mistakes was all I ever wanted.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Jon nods then leaves the room.
Members of the Night’s Watch escort Mance to Stannis.
Mance Rayder, you’ve been called the King Beyond the Wall. Westeros only has one king. Bend the knee, I promise you mercy.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Mance looks at the Free Folk, including Tormund, the Night’s Watch have chained up. Then he looks at Jon Snow.
Kneel and live.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: This was my home for many years. I wish you good fortune in the wars to come.
Speaker: MANCE

Text: Stannis nods. His men take Mance onto the burning funeral pyre and tie him to it. Melisandre walks to the front of the pyre.
Man or woman, young or old, lord or peasant, our choices are the same. We choose light, or we choose darkness. We choose good, or we choose evil. We choose the true god or the false.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: She picks up a torch.
Free folk, there is only one true king, and his name is Stannis. Here stands the king of lies. Behold the fate of those who choose the darkness.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: She lights the pyre. Mance starts panicking as the fire reaches his legs. Jon Snow walks up to a high point and shoots Mance in the heart with an arrow, killing him.
Melisandre looks at the icicles hanging outside her tent and sees that they are melting.
Melisandre walks to find Stannis, stepping in a pile of mud on the way.
Stannis straps his armor on.
The Lord of Light has made good on his promise, my king. His fires have melted the snows away. The way ahead is clear.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: We ride for Winterfell.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: And you will take it. The Lord has shown me Bolton banners burning. You will receive what is yours by right.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Melisandre wraps her arms around Stannis. He brushes her off then exits the tent. She follows after him.
INT. STANNIS’S CAMP
Stannis walks by his men as they prepare for battle. One soldier approaches him.
Your Grace.
Speaker: SOLDIER

Text: Prepare to form up.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: SOLDIER

Text: The soldier waits for a response from Stannis.
Tell me.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: The men. Many deserted before dawn.
Speaker: SOLDIER

Text: How many?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Nearly half. All the sell-swords, with all the horses.
Speaker: SOLDIER

Text: Stannis is speechless. He looks to Melisandre who appears even more devastated than he. Another soldier comes up to Stannis.
Your Grace?
Speaker: SOLDIER 2

Text: Speak up. It can’t be worse than mutiny.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: The man is silent.
EXT. WOODS OUTSIDE STANNIS’S CAMP
Stannis is led by his men to a tree. Stannis looks up and sees Selyse hanging from it. Stannis takes a long look but tries not to reveal his emotions.
Cut her down.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: The men cut the noose and bring her to the ground.
Your Grace. The Lady Melisandre was just seen riding out of camp.
Speaker: SOLDIER

Text: Stannis seethes but says nothing.
Get the men into marching formation. On to Winterfell.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Stannis walks from the woods back to camp.
He raised his hands. And they all stood up at once. Tens of thousands of them, the biggest army in the world.
Speaker: JON

Text: So what are you gonna do?
Speaker: SAM

Text: I’m gonna hope they don’t learn how to climb the wall.
Speaker: JON

Text: But… the Dragonglass?
Speaker: SAM

Text: No one’s ever getting that back, now. It wouldn’t have mattered anyway, unless we had a mountain of it.
Speaker: JON (shakes his head)

Text: But… you killed a White Walker.
Speaker: SAM (confused)

Text: With Longclaw. I saw them shatter steel axes like they were glass. But Longclaw…
Speaker: JON

Text: He’s made of Valyrian steel. How many Valyrian steel swords are left in the Seven Kingdoms?
Speaker: SAM

Text: Not enough. (pause) The first Lord Commander in history to sacrifice the lives of sworn Brothers to save the lives of Wildlings. How’s it feel to be friends with the most hated man in Castle Black? (smiles)
Speaker: JON

Text: You were friends with me when I first got here. And I wasn’t winning any elections back then.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Here’s to us then. Long may they sneer.
Speaker: JON

Text: Jon and Sam clink glasses and drink. Sam looks to Jon.
What?
Speaker: JON

Text: I wanted to ask you something. To ask something of you. Send me, Gilly, and the baby to Oldtown so I can become a Maester. That’s what I’m meant to be, not this.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I need you here, Sam. If you leave, who’s left to give me advice I trust?
Speaker: JON

Text: Well, there’s Edd.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Jon gives Sam a look.

I’ll be more use to you as a Maester. More use to everyone now that Maester Aemon’s gone. The Citadel has the world’s greatest library. I’ll learn about history, strategy, healing. And other things. Things that will help when they come.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Jon stares at Sam, saying nothing.

If Gilly stays here then she’ll die. And the baby that she named after me will die. And I’ll end up dying, too, trying to protect them. Which means that the last thing that I’ll see in this world will be the look in her eyes when I fail them. (pause) I’d rather see a thousand White Walkers than see that.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Jon inhales, exhales, then nods somberly. Sam smiles.
Thank you.
Speaker: SAM

Text: You know that The Citadel will make you swear off women, too.
Speaker: JON

Text: They’ll bloody try.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Jon looks at Sam incredulously.
Sam?
Speaker: JON

Text: What?
Speaker: SAM

Text: Sam…
Speaker: JON

Text: Sam smiles.
You’ve just been beaten half to death. How did you--
Speaker: JON

Text: Very carefully.
Speaker: SAM (smiling)

Text: Jon smiles and lets out a small laugh.
I’m glad the end of the world’s working out for someone.
Speaker: JON

Text: They sit in silence for a moment.
I’ll come back.
Speaker: SAM

Text: To your return.
Speaker: JON (raises a glass)

Text: To my return.
Speaker: SAM

Text: EXT. CASTLE BLACK
Sam, Gilly, and little Sam mount the horses. Sam looks up to see Jon watching from the top of his steps.They exchange a wave, and then Sam begins riding out of Castle Black.
EXT. OUTSIDE OF WINTERFELL
Stannis’s depleted army marches onto Winterfell. Stannis is at the front with flaming heart banners flying all around him.
The Bolton army is preparing for battle.
Sansa uses the device she previously picked up to unlock her door. She drops the device and then exits her tower with a hood on.
Sansa walks by the Bolton men as they are preparing for battle.

Podrick returns to he and Brienne’s camp with firewood and dead rabbits. He hears screaming then looks down to see Stannis’s army marching for Winterfell. He drops the wood and rabbits and sprints back to Brienne.
Brienne is staring at the Broken Tower.
My lady! Stannis. Stannis Baratheon is coming. His whole army.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: How do you know it’s Stannis?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: He’s carrying his flaming heart banners. From the Blackwater. I’ll never forget it.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Brienne takes one last look at the Broken Tower. She sees there is still no candle in the window.
Sansa approaches the Tower with a candle in hand.

Brienne takes one last, hard look at the Tower, then turns around and heads for Stannis’s army. Podrick grabs his axe and follows her. Right as they turn away, a candle appears at the top of the Broken Tower.
EXT. OUTSIDE OF WINTERFELL
Trench here. Another one 300 yards from the castle wall. Hurry them along. And send out a foraging party immediately. The siege begins at sunrise.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: There’s not going to be a siege, Your Grace.
Speaker: SOLDIER

Text: Stannis looks to the distance and sees the Bolton army racing towards him as they come over the top of a hill.
Sansa looks down at the ensuing battle from the top of the Broken Tower with a candle in the window.
EXT. OUTSIDE OF WINTERFELL
Stannis sees he the army approaching. He takes a deep breath then unsheathes his sword. Cut to an overhead shot revealing Stannis is badly outnumbered.
Sansa watches from the window as the fight begins. She walks away from the window.

Pan across the ground to reveal all but one of Stannis’s men are slaughtered alongside various banners and shields with his sigil. Stannis hobbles away from these men, using his sword as a crutch. Two Bolton men arrive on horse and kill the lone survivor of Stannis’s men. They charge at Stannis, one slices his leg, but he kills them both with a dagger and sword then falls to the ground.
Stannis leans onto a tree and groans. He looks down to his bleeding leg with a resigned look, then looks up to the sound of a horse riding.
Bolton has women fighting for him.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Cut up to Brienne of Tarth.
I do not fight for the Boltons. I’m Brienne of Tarth. I was Kingsguard to Renly Baratheon. I was there when he was murdered by a shadow with your face. You murdered him? With blood magic?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Stannis is silent for a long moment.
I did.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Brienne approaches him and unsheathes her sword.

In the name of Renly of House Baratheon, First of his Name, Rightful King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms, and Protector of the Realm, I, Brienne of Tarth, sentence you to die. Do you have any last words?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Go on, do your duty.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Brienne unsheathes her sword, pulls it back, swings forward, and--
Ramsay plunges his sword into a survivor. Then he surveys the corpses on the battlefield.
Looks like we’re done here.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Ramsay heads back towards his horse but sees one of Stannis’s men is survive, and is attempting to crawl away.
I surrender. I surrender!
Speaker: SURVIVOR

Text: And I accept your surrender.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Ramsay plunges his sword into the man then pulls it out and wipes the blood off.
Let’s head back. My wife must be lonely.
Speaker: RAMSAY (to squire)

Text: Pan out to reveal the bodies on the battlefield.
Sansa hurries through Winterfell with her hood on. She heads up the stairs, sees one of the Bolton men walking her way, and doubles back.
Sansa rushes through a door towards the exit. She finds Myranda and Theon waiting for her, with Myranda’s bow drawn.
My lady. I have come to escort you back to your chamber.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: Go with her. Please.
Speaker: THEON

Text: I know what Ramsay is. I know what he’ll do to me. (looks to Theon) If I’m going to die, let it happen while there’s some of me left.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Die? (lowers the bow) Who said anything about dying? You can’t die yet. Your father was Warden of the North, and Ramsay needs you. Though I suppose he doesn’t need all of you. Just the parts he’ll use to make his heir. Until you’ve given him a boy or two and he’s finished using them. (raises bow) He’s got incredible plans for those parts. So. Shall we wait for him to come back, or shall we begin now?
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: Sansa says nothing.
You’re leaving it to me? Good. Let’s begin.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: She draws her arrow back. Just as she goes to release it, Theon tackles her into a wall, causing the arrow to miss Sansa. They struggle for a moment.
Stop! Stop!
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: Theon throws her over the edge, killing her on impact. As Sansa and Theon go to the edge to inspect the body, a horn begins to blare.
Open the gates!
Speaker: MAN

Text: Bolton men return from the battle and ride through the gates to Winterfell.
He’s coming back.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Theon grabs Sansa’s hand and leads her along the walls. They climb to the top of the wall and look down to see a pile of snow at the bottom. Theon offers his hand to Sansa, she takes it, and they leap off of the wall.

Meryn Trant looks to 3 young girls in front of him and tightens his grip on the stick in his hand. He walks behind the first one and whips her, she starts crying. He does the same to the second and she cries as well. He walks up to the third girl, whose face is hidden by her hair, and whips her in the back. She doesn’t react. He whips her harder in the side and doesn’t get a reaction. He whips her a third time across the face and the girl still doesn’t make a sound.
I can see I have my work cut out for me.You two. Out.
Speaker: MERYN

Text: The two other girls flee the room. The third removes her hair to show an unknown face. Meryn punches her in the stomach. She falls to the ground doubled over. Meryn smiles but loses the smile when he sees she is reaching for something. The girl pulls off her face, revealing she is Arya, and leaps towards Trant, stabbing him in the eye. She stabs his other eye then gags him with his shirt as he screams. He grabs at her but she stabs him in the chest until he rolls on his side.

You were the first person on my list, you know. For killing Syrio Forel, remember him? Probably not. I’ve gotten a few of the others. The Many Faced God stole a few more for me. I’m glad he left me you. Do you know who I am?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Trant struggles to make a noise through the gag.
I can’t hear you.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: She stabs him in the stomach.
You know who I am. I’m Arya Stark.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A look of surprise comes across Trant’s face, he grunts, and then Arya stabs him in the back. She removes the gag.
Do you know who you are?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Trant whimpers.
You’re no one. You’re nothing.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: She slowly slits his throat and he keels over.
Arya walks into the room holding the face of the girl she wore to the brothel. She returns it to where she took it from.
A girl has taken a life. The wrong life.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: I was right about her.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: You were.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: You’re not ready. Not at all.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: The waif grabs Arya and holds her in front of Jaqen.
That man’s life wasn’t yours to take. A girl stole from the Many Faced God. Now a debt is owed.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Jaqen holds up the same vial he gave to Arya to give to the Thin Man. The waif holds Arya’s face up near the vial as she struggles.
Only death can pay for life.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Jaqen drinks the vial and then falls straight to the ground.
No! No! No, you don’t die! Don’t die! (sobs)
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Why are you crying?
Speaker: WAIF

Text: He was my friend.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: No he wasn’t. Didn’t you listen to him?
Speaker: WAIF

Text: He was no one.
Speaker: JAQEN (O.S.)

Text: Arya turns to see a man looking identical to Jaqen standing behind her.
But if you’re… (looks to the Jaqen who drank the potion and is seemingly dead) Who’s this?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: No one at all. Just as a girl should have been before she took a face from the hall.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Arya reaches and pulls off the Jaqen face, revealing the face of an old man.
The faces are for no one.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Arya pulls off the old man face to reveal a younger man’s face.
You are still someone.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Arya pulls off the young man’s face to reveal a different old man.
And to someone…

Text: I know you didn’t want to leave Dorne. But I’m glad you’re coming home. Your mother’s desperate to see you. And I’m glad Trystane’s coming with us. He seems like a nice boy. You’re lucky. Arranged marriages are rarely so… so well arranged.

Text: I’m not so sure about that. Listen. There’s something I’ve wanted to tell you. Something I should have told you long ago. So. Now that you’ve seen more of the world, you’ve learned how complicated things can be. People can be. The Lannisters and the Martells have hated each other for years, but you’ve fallen in love with Trystane. It was an accident, really, I mean what were the chances? You happen to fall in love with the man you were assigned to marry? (Myrcella laughs) My point is… we don’t choose whom we love. We just… It’s beyond our control. I sound like an idiot.

Cersei is knelt before the High Sparrow in the room where she was taken away.

Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I bow to the wisdom of your High Holiness. But if I might beg for just one drop of the Mother’s mercy. I haven’t seen my son… I don’t know how long it’s been. I need to see him. Please.

Text: INT. CERSEI’S CELL

Cersei is stripped naked and has the dirt washed off of her by the septas. After they scrub her clean, they sit her down and begin chopping her hair away with a knife. They leave her naked, with short hair and a bloody scalp, and then shut the door on her.
Cersei is carried to the top of the steps, in front of a massive crowd of King’s Landing citizens.

A sinner comes before you. Cersei of House Lannister, mother to his Grace King Tommen, widow to his Grace King Robert. She has committed the acts of falsehood and fornication. She has confessed her sins and begged for forgiveness. To demonstrate her repentance, she will cast aside all pride, all artifice, and present herself as the gods made her, to you. The good people of the city. She comes before you with a solemn heart. Shorn of secrets. Naked before the eyes of gods and men. To make her walk of atonement.

Text: The septas remove her robe. She stands naked before the citizens of King’s Landing, who gasp. They force her to start walking down the stairs.
Shame. Shame. Shame. (rings bell)

Text: The septa repeats “Shame. Shame. Shame.” and rings the bell through the duration of Cersei’s walk. Cersei is escorted by the Sparrows through the crowd of people. Silence at first, but once one man yells “Cunt!”, she begins to be heckled.
Bitch! Whore! All hail her royal tits!
