She is knocked to her knees at the end of her walk, but gets back to her feet when she sees the Red Keep in the distance. She finally reaches the end of the walk of atonement, and enters the Red Keep, sobbing.
INT. RED KEEP
Kevan Lannister, Grand Maester Pycelle, Qyburn, and the Lannister guards wait for her. Qyburn rushes to cover her naked body with a blanket as Cersei begins weeping.
Your Grace. It’s good to have you back. Come. We’ll take you inside. I need to have a look at those feet.

If it please Your Grace, he’s taken a holy vow of silence. He has sworn that he will not speak until all his Grace’s enemies are dead, and the evil has been driven from the realm.

For the Watch.

For the Watch.

For the Watch.

For the Watch.

Olly…

For the Watch.

Text: Jon stays on his knees, then falls backwards. The Brothers walk away from him. Jon lays on the ground, expressionless. A puddle of blood spreads to the top of the screen.

He asked you to stay.
Speaker: KNIGHT 1

Text: Brienne elbows him in the face after Knight 1 and Knight 2 attempt to get in her way. Brienne rushes out of the inn to the stables. She frees some horses then rides away with Podrick.
After her!
Speaker: GUARD

Text: The knights chase after Brienne and Podrick. Podrick and Brienne separate.
Podrick! (Podrick screams as he loses control of the horse)
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Podrick gets away from the knights and stops at a river
Stop, stop, stop! (Horse stops) That’s a good boy.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Podrick turnsthe horse around and he loses control again, only this time he falls off the horse. He tries to run after it, but stops.
Enter knight, who sees Podrick. Podrick sees him and throws a rock at him and misses.
I guess that means you’re unarmed.
Speaker: KNIGHT

Text: Knight pulls out his sword and races towards Podrick.
Down, Podrick, down!
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Podrick gets down. Brienne slices the knight off his horse before he can get to Podrick. Another knight on a horse rushes towards her, and she stabs him in the neck.
Podrick?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Yes, my lady?
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: You can stand now.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Yes, my lady. (stands) Sansa Stark?
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Wary of strangers, as she should me. I saw her riding on the East Trail with Littlefinger. We’ll follow them.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: My lady, if those Stark girls refused your service, maybe you’re released from your vow.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I swore to their mother I’d protect those girls.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: If they don’t want your protection--
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Do you think she’s safe from Littlefinger?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: (pause) No, my lady.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Get your horse.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: A summons from the queen.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Cersei looks farefully at a box on her desk. Jaime opens it, and a viper with a necklace in its mouth comes out. Jaime inspects the necklace; it has the Lannister lion on it.
There are only two like it in the world: the one I’m wearing and the one I gave to Myrcella.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: It’s a threat.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Of course it’s a threat! Our daughter’s in Dorne surrounded by people who hate our family. (mocking) "It's a threat."
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No note.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: They blame us for the death of Oberyn and his sister, and every other tragedy that’s befallen their cursed country. I will burn their cities to the ground if they touch her!
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Softer.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: What?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Not so loud.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Our daughter’s in danger, and you’re worried I’m speaking too loudly!
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The world can't know knows she’s our daughter.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Then don’t call her your daughter. You’ve never been a father to her.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: If I was the father to any of my children, they’d be stoned in the streets.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And what has your caution brought? Our eldest child murdered at his own wedding. Our only daughter shipped off to Dorne. Our baby boy sent to marry that smirking whore from Highgarden.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I’ll make things better.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You never made anything better.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I’m going to Dorne. I’ll bring our daughter home.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You can’t just ask Prince Doran to give her back! She’s promised his son.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I’m not going to ask him anything.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You go there with an army, it’s an act of war.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No army. Do you know where they’re keeping her?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Oberyn mentioned the Water Gardens.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I’ll find her. Is there anything else, your grace?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: (scoffs) You’re going to Dorne? A one-handed man? Alone?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I never said I was going alone. (exit Jaime)
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Bronn is skipping stones.

No sunflowers. I don't like yellow. Roses are very nice, definitely roses. And music. I adore music. But no flutes, I hate flutes! We can have a harp if you like, but no flutes. Then there's the food. Food is the most important thing, don't you agree? We're going to need pigeon pies. That's what they eat in the capital, don't they?
Speaker: LOLLYS STOKEWORTH

Text: Bronn has been skipping stones and ignoring her.
Don't they?
Speaker: LOLLYS

Text: Don't who?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: People eat pigeon pie in the capital.
Speaker: LOLLYS

Text: Bronn puts his arm around her.
They certainly do, my dear. They certainly do.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Pan up to Castle Stokeworth.
It's a fine place, isn't it? A fine place. I never thought I'd end up settling down in a place like this.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You won't.
Speaker: LOLLYS

Text: Pardon?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: We won't get to live at Stokeworth. When Mother dies, my sister gets the castle because she's older.
Speaker: LOLLYS

Text: Oh.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: She hates me. She calls me mean names, and sometimes even still she pulls my hair when Mother isn't looking.
Speaker: LOLLYS

Text: You know what I think? I think you're a good person. And your sister is a mean person.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: She is.
Speaker: LOLLYS

Text: I've been all over the world. And if there's one thing I've learned, it's that meanness comes around. People like your sister, they always get what's coming to them eventually. One way or another.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: They stop walking. Bronn looks at someone in the distance.
Who's that?
Speaker: LOLLYS

Text: Jaime is sitting on a stone wall, waiting for Bronn.
Jaime fucking Lannister.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Bronn leaves Lollys and starts walking towards Jaime.
Ser Jaime.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Ser Bronn of the Blackwater.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I was very sorry to hear about your father.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Thank you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: This is my betrothed, Lollys.
Speaker: BRONN (gestures to Lollys)

Text: A pleasure. (he kisses her hand)
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Run along, love.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Lollys starts walking back to the Castle.
Beautiful bride you've chosen. When were you planning on getting married?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Just get on with it.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: On with what?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: What you're here for. There's no way this little visit could possibly mean anything good for me.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: It's very good for you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Jaime goes into his coat and pulls out a scroll. He hands it to Bronn.
Lollys will be marrying Ser Wyllis Bracken.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Mmm.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: We made a deal, your sister and I.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I would have advised against that.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: How is this good for me?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: 'Cause you're going to come with me and help me with something important. And when we return, I'm going to give you a much better girl, and a much better castle.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Return from where?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: As far south as south goes.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Ellaria coils her first in rage. A bracelet with a viper's mouth coils around her hand. The camera pans up to reveal she is still in mourning clothes.
My future queen.
Speaker: TRYSTANE (O.S.)

Text: Ellaria glowers from the balcony at Trystane Martell escorting Myrcella through the Water Gardens. Trystane looks up and sees her. Ellaria walks towards Doran's place on the balcony and is blocked by Areo Hotah.
The prince does not wish to be disturbed.
Speaker: AREO

Text: Remove myself from my path, or I'll take that long axe and shove it--
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Captain. Let her pass.
Speaker: DORAN

Text: Areo reluctantly steps to the side. Ellaria approaches Prince Doran, staring at the Water Gardens from his wheelchair.
Your brother was murdered, and you sit here at the Water Gardens, staring at the sky and doing nothing.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Oberyn was slain during a trial by combat. By law, that is not murder.
Speaker: DORAN

Text: Your brother--
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: You don't have to remind me. He was my brother long before he was anything to you.
Speaker: DORAN

Text: What will you do about his death.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: I will bury him. I will mourn for him.
Speaker: DORAN

Text: You would have me go to war?
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: You would have me go to war?
Speaker: DORAN

Text: The whole country would have you go to war.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Then we are lucky the whole country does not decide.
Speaker: DORAN

Text: The Sand Snakes are with me. They have the love of their people. They will avenge your father while you sit here in your chair doing nothing.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Doran says nothing. Cut back to Trystane and Myrcella in the Water Gardens.
Oberyn is dead. And this Lannister girl skips about the Water Gardens eating our food, breathing our air. How many of your brothers and sisters do they have to kill?
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Let me have her. Let me send her to Cersei one finger at a time.
I loved my brother. And you made him very happy. For that you will always have a place in my heart. But we do not mutilate little girls for vengeance. Not here. Not while I rule.
Speaker: DORAN

Text: And how long will that be?
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Ellaria exits the room. Areo goes back to guarding the door. Doran shakes his head.
The Unsullied march through the street.
The Unsullied are too conspicuous.
Speaker: DAARIO (O.S.)

Text: Daario and Grey Worm are walking through an alley together.
Anyone can see you coming from a mile off. Of course you haven't found any Sons of the Harpy. You haven't, have you?
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Grey Worm grunts a "no".

My Second Sons, on the other hand, they drink, they whore, fight in the streets--they blend in. They overhear things in taverns, follow people from the taverns to nice, quiet alleys, break a few fingers, overhear a few more things. Before you know it...
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Daario has brought them to a door. Grey Worm knocks it in and rushes the room. He, Daario, and an Unsullied inspect the room quietly.
No one here. We go.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: In a hurry? You're afraid?
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Unsullied fear nothing.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Right. That's your problem. You understood fear once, long ago, but you've forgotten what it means. Someone who's forgotten fear has forgotten how to hide.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Daario quickly pulls a dagger out, and stabs into a wall covered by a bookcase that immediately gives way. A man screams and falls out of the wall.
Fear is useful that way.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: He pats Grey Worm on the shoulder. The Unsullied soldier grabs the man. Grey Worm searches the hiding place and finds daggers laying on the ground with a Sons of the Harpy mask.
Sons of the Harpy, they want to put a collar back on my neck. On all of our necks. Please, Your Grace, you must kill him.
Speaker: MOSSADOR

Text: It would send a message.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I think you should exercise restraint, Your Grace.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: Why?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: For one thing, he may have valuable information.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: The Son of the Harpy has no more valuable information.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: How do you know that?
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: Because I questioned him.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: And the information you did get, he is young and poor.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: He is born free.
Speaker: MOSSADOR

Text: Why should he want to bring back slavery? What did it do for him?
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: Perhaps the only thing that gave him pride was knowing that there was someone lower than he was.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They pay him. Great families afraid to do a thing. They pay poor man to do it for them.
Speaker: MOSSADOR

Text: And how do you know this?
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: Everyone knows this.
Speaker: MOSSADOR

Text: I don't know it, and I'm the head of a great family.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: We do not know what this man did or didn't do. (to Daenerys) Give him a trial, at least. A fair trial. Show all of the citizens of Meereen that you are better than those who would depose. Teach them a better way.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: I do not know the place from where Old Ser comes. Things maybe are different there, I hope. But here, in Meereen, before Daenerys Stormborn, they own us. So we learn much about them or we do not live long. They teach me what they are. Mercy, fair trial: these mean nothing to them. All they understand is blood!
Speaker: MOSSADOR

Text: They all look to Daenerys.
Thank you all for your counsel.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Everyone gets up from the table and exits the room besides Ser Barristan.
Your Grace, a word, please, I beg you.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: About what?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: About your father. About the Mad King.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: The Mad King? You're here to remind me of my enemies' lies? Consider me reminded.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your Grace, I served in his Kingsguard. I was at his side from the first.  Your enemies did not lie.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: Go on.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: When the people rose in revolt against him, your father set their towns and castles aflame. He murdered sons in front of their fathers. He burned men alive with Wildfire, and laughed as they screamed. And his efforts to stamp out dissent led to rebellion that killed every Targaryen except two.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: I'm not my father.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: No, Your Grace. Thank the gods. But the Mad King gave his enemies the justice he thought they deserved. And each time it made him feel powerful and right. Until the very end.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: I will not have the Son of the Harpy executed without a fair trial.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: BARRISTAN (nods)

Text: There's a bug.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Yes, best be careful. You might accidentally consume some solid food.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: When I agreed to come with you, did I misrepresent my intentions? (finishes his cup of wine) Besides, what is there for me to do inside this fucking box?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You don't like it?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I want to take a walk.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You can't. Cersei has offered a lordship to the man who brings her your head.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: She ought to offer her cunt. Best part of her for the best part of me. Well, I suppose a box is as good a place for me as anywhere.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Are we really going to spend the entire road to Volantis talking about the futility of everything?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: You're right. No point. (realizing) The road to Volantis? You said we were going to Meereen. What's in Volantis?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The road to Meereen.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: And what do you hope to find at the end of the road to Meereen?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I told you. A ruler.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: We've already got a ruler. Everywhere has already got a ruler. Every pile of shit on the side of every road has someone's banner hanging from it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You were quite good, you know. At ruling. During your brief tenure as Hand.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I didn't rule. I was a servant.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Still, a man of talent.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Managed to kill a lot of people.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Yes, but showed great promise in other areas as well.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: She wanted me to leave King's Landing. She begged me. I wouldn't go.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Why?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: 'Cause I liked it. Power. Even as a servant. (takes a drink of wine)
Speaker: TYRION

Text: People follow leaders. And they will never follow us. They find us repulsive.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I find us repulsive.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And we find them repulsive, which is why we surround ourselves with large, comfortable boxes to keep them away. And yet, no matter what we do, people like you and me are never really satisfied inside the box. Not for long.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: You're right. Let's go for a walk.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: How many dwarves are there in the world? Is Cersei going to kill them all?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: A dwarf head is placed on her desk.
Not him.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Are you trying to deceive your Queen? Shall I throw them in a cell, Your Grace?
Speaker: MERYN

Text: That won't be necessary, Ser Meryn. I don't want to dissuade the other hunters. Mistakes will be made.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Thank you, Your Grace. Thank you.
Speaker: HUNTERS

Text: Take the head.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Pardon me, Your Grace. I would take it, if you don't mind. It could prove useful for my work.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Very good.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: She and Qyburn exit the room.
Over there will be fine.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: You heard the man. Over there.
Speaker: MERYN (to hunters)

Text: The hunters pick up the dwarf head.
Cersei and Qyburn enter the room, taking the open seats on the small council. Cersei sits at the head of the table.
You're the Hand of the King?
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: No, Uncle. Clearly it would not be appropriate for a woman to assume that role. I'm merely advising my son until he comes of age and chooses a Hand for himself.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your Grace, I would be willing to serve provisionally as the King's Hand until he becomes old enough--
Speaker: MACE TYRELL

Text: You're a good man, Lord Tyrell, but I don't imagine you'll have the time. In addition to being Master of Ships, the king has appointed you Master of Coin.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Oh, Your Grace.
Speaker: MACE

Text: He called your experience and wisdom in financial matters unparalleled. He said he would be honored to have you represent the crown's interests in the same.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The honor is all mine, Your Grace.
Speaker: MACE

Text: Your Grace, in the past on several occasions, a Grand Maester has served as the King's Hand.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: The King has named Qyburn the new Master of Whisperers.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your Grace, him? This man? This embarrassment to the Citadel? Your Grace, what qualifications can he possibly have for this post?
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: The qualification of loyalty, Grand Maester. That's far more than the eunuch ever had. Far more than many ever have.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I must say I cannot see--
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: Uncle Kevan, in light of your position as commander of the Lannister armies, it would please the king if you would serve as his Master of War. No man living better deserves the title.
Speaker: CERSEI (cutting him off)

Text: That is kind of you to say. I would like to hear it from the king himself.
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: The king is very busy at this moment.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: He should be here, learning what it means to rule.
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: He is learning. On this occasion, in his capacity as ruler, he's asked me to speak on his behalf.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I returned to the capital to pay my respects to my brother. And to you. And to serve the king. I did not return to the capital to serve as your puppet. To watch you stack the small council with sycophants. (looks to Qyburn) Sending your own brother away so he wouldn't be--
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: My brother has left the capital to lead a sensitive diplomatic mission.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: What mission?
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: That is not your concern as Master of War.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I do not recognize your authority to dictate what is and is not my concern. You are the Queen Mother. Nothing more.
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: Kevan gets up from his seat.
You would abandon your king in his time of need?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: If he wants to send for me, I will be waiting for him. At Casterly Rock.
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: He exits the room and closes the door.
Shireen runs her finger over the letter "S" in her book.
Come on. You know this one. It looks like an animal.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Snake. Snake... S! It's an S!
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Right, very good!
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Sam is reading in a different aisle in the library.
Hmm! Did you know that the youngest Lord Commander in history, Osric Stark, was elected at the age of 10?
Speaker: SAM

Text: Gilly and Shireen look to him and then back at their book.
I know "S".
Speaker: GILLY

Text: You'll learn, I promise. I taught Ser Davos, and old people are terrible at learning new things.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Well, you're a wonderful teacher. (to Sam) Very patient!
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I only said that the more time you spend practicing, the faster you'll be able to read.
Speaker: SAM

Text: That's alright. We're doing just fine. I'm sure you and Ostrich Stark have a lot to talk about.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Sam goes back to his book.
How old were you when you learned to read?
Speaker: GILLY (to Shireen)

Text: Three.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Three?! Who taught you, your mother?
Speaker: SAM (interjecting)

Text: No. Old Maester Cressen did. I had a lot of time to practice. My mother kept me inside because... (trails off)
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: What do you call it in the South, what happened to your face?
Speaker: GILLY (gently)

Text: Greyscale. What do you call it north of the Wall?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: I don't know. But two of my sisters had it. They both died. How did they cure you?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I don't remember. I was a baby. Lots of people came and tried, I think. Whatever they did, it went away. What happened to your sisters?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: My father made them move out of the keep into the huts outside. None of us were allowed to go near them. But we heard them. Especially at night. They started to sound... not like themselves.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Did you ever see them?
Speaker: SAM

Text: Only once at the end. They were covered with it. Their faces, their arms. They acted like animals. My father had to drag them out to the woods on a rope.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: What did he do to them in the woods?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Gilly is afraid to answer. Selyse enters the room before she can.
Mother.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Leave us.
Speaker: SELYSE (to Sam and Gilly)

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: SAM (nodding)

Text: Sam and Gilly exit the room.
You need to stay away from that girl.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Why?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: She's a wildling.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Her name's Gilly. She's nice. I'm teaching her to read.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: She's a wildling. Your father defeated their people. He executed her king for treason. They could strike at him by striking at you.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Gilly wouldn't do that.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: You have no idea what people will do. All your books and you still don't know.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Selyse exits the library.

I ordered Mance Rayder burnt at the stake. You prevented that order from being carried out. You showed mercy to Mance Rayder. A king's word is law. Perhaps you should ask Ser Davos how much mercy I show to lawbreakers. Show too much kindness, people won't fear you. If people don't fear you, they don't follow you.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: With respect, Your Grace, the free folk will never follow you, no matter what you do. You're the man who burned their king alive.
Speaker: JON

Text: Who then? You?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: No. Only one of their own.
Speaker: JON

Text: Do you know this wretched girl Lyanna Mormont?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: The Lord Commander's niece.
Speaker: JON

Text: Lady of Bear Island, and a child of 10. I asked her to commit her house to my cause, that's her response.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: "Bear Island knows no king but the King in the North, whose name is Stark." (Jon smiles)
Speaker: JON

Text: That amuses you?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I apologize, Your Grace. Northerners can be a bit like the free folk. Loyal to their own.
Speaker: JON

Text: Tonight, the Night's Watch elect a new Lord Commander. Ser Alliser Thorne is going to win.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Most likely.
Speaker: JON

Text: Unpleasant man. He thinks you're a traitor. What's your life going to be like on the Wall with Thorne in command?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Unpleasant, I expect.
Speaker: JON

Text: Your bravery made him look weak. He'll punish you for it. I don't punish men for bravery. I reward them.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I don't doubt it, Your Grace. But I'm a brother of the Night's Watch. I've pledged them my life, my honor, my sword. I don't know what I have left to give you.
Speaker: JON

Text: You can give me the North.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I can't. Even if I wanted to, I'm a bastard. A Snow.
Speaker: JON

Text: Kneel before me. Lay your sword at my feet. Pledge me your service and you'll rise again as Jon Stark, Lord of Winterfell.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Jon stares at Stannis deeply without saying a word.
He'll make you a Stark with the stroke of a pen?
Speaker: SAM

Text: It's the first thing I ever remember wanting. I'd daydream that my father would ask the king, and just like that I would never be the bastard of Winterfell again.
Speaker: JON

Text: You deserve this. You do. I couldn't be happier for you.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I'm going to refuse him.
Speaker: JON

Text: But you'd be Lord of Winterfell.
Speaker: SAM (confused)

Text: I swore a vow to the Night's Watch. If I don't take my own word seriously, what sort of Lord of Winterfell would I be?
Speaker: JON

Text: Jon walks away from Sam and takes a seat.
Crowded. You'd think we were serving venison stew.
Speaker: ALLISER (O.S.)

Text: Maester Aemon rises slowly from the table at the front.
Does anyone wish to speak for candidates before we cast our tokens for the 998th Lord Commander of the Night's Watch?
Speaker: AEMON

Text: Janos Slynt stands up.
Ser Alliser Thorne is not just a knight, he's a man of true nobility. He was acting commander when the Wall came under attack, and led us to victory against the wildlings.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Hear, hear.
Speaker: MEN

Text: He's a veteran of 100 battles and has been a defender of the Watch and the Wall almost all of his life. He's the only true choice.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Alliser smiles. Men cheer and beat on the tables.
Is there anyone else?
Speaker: AEMON

Text: Ser Denys Mallister joined the Watch as a boy and has served loyally longer than any other ranger. Through 10 winters he served. As commander of the Shadow Tower, he kept the wildlings away. We could do no better.
Speaker: SHADOW TOWER BROTHER

Text: Men, including Jon, bang their cups on the table, but the reaction is much weaker.
If there's no one else, we will begin the voting. The triangular tokens count for Ser Alliser Thorne. The square tokens for Ser Denys Mallister. Each brother will--
Speaker: AEMON

Text: Maester Aemon.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Every Brother, including Jon, look to Sam at the back of the room in shock.
Samwell Tarly. Go on.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: Jon shakes his head "no" at Sam.
Sam the Slayer.
Speaker: JANOS (O.S.)

Text: The whole room laughs.
Another wildling lover just like his friend Jon Snow. How's your lady love Slayer?
Speaker: JANOS

Text: More laughs.
Her name is Gilly. Brother Slynt knows her quite well. They cowered together in the larder during the battle for the Wall.
Speaker: SAM

Text: The men start laughing at Janos now.
Lies!
Speaker: JANOS

Text: A wildling girl, a baby, and Lord Janos. I found him there when the battle was over in a puddle of his own making.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Stronger laughter. Maester Aemon cracks a smile.
Whilst Lord Janos was hiding with the women and children, Jon Snow was leading.
Speaker: SAM

Text: The men go quiet.

Ser Alliser fought bravely, it is true. And when he was wounded, it is Jon who saved us. He took charge of the wall's defense. He killed the Magnar of the Thenns. (a man next to Sam nods) He went North to deal with Mance Rayder, knowing it almost certainly meant his own death. Before that, he led the mission to avenge Lord Commander Mormont. Mormont himself chose Jon to be his steward. He saw something in Jon, and now we've all seen it, too. He may be young, but he's the commander we turned to when the night was darkest.
Speaker: SAM

Text: The men give Jon a strong cheer.

I can't argue with any of that. (stands up) But who does Jon Snow want to command? Night's Watch or the wildlings? Everyone knows he loved a wildling girl and spoke with Mance Rayder many times. What would have happened in that tent between those two old friends if Stannis's army hadn't come along? We all saw him put the King-beyond-the-Wall out of his misery. Do you want to choose a man who has fought the wildlings all his life, or a man who makes love to them?
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: Jon doesn't respond. Maester Aemon rises again.
It is time.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: Brothers of the Night's Watch walk to the front of the room, placing their tokens into a jar. A brother breaks the jar and counts the tokens. Alliser and Jon have the same amount of tokens.
It appears to be a tie, Maester.
Speaker: BROTHER

Text: Maester Aemon rises once more, feels each stack of tokens to determine which is which, and casts his own vote for Jon. The men near Alliser look angry. The men grouped around Mallister are content. Everyone else cheers.
Jon Snow! Jon Snow! Jon Snow! Jon Snow!
Speaker: BROTHERS

Text: Jon rises, sees Alliser glaring at him, and lets out a small smile for the first time since he entered the room.

Arya creeps up on a pigeon in an alleyway and cuts its head off with Needle. She walks down the street with the pigeon in a pouch and Needle dangling from her hip. Three men walk by, see Needle, and approach her.
You. You!
Speaker: MAN

Text: Arya stops and turns around to face them.
What have you got there?
Speaker: MAN

Text: Arya doesn't respond.
I said--
Speaker: MAN

Text: Turn around and go. (pulls out Needle) Turn around and go.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: That's a nice little sword. Worth 100 pieces, a sword like that. (pulls out his own sword)
Speaker: Man

Text: Nothing's worth anything to dead men.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The man approaches her with his sword, but then sees the Old Man from the House of Black and White walking towards the altercation and backs off.
Quickly, go, go!
Speaker: MEN

Text: They flee. The man looks at Arya then begins walking away.
The Old Man leads Arya back to the doorstep.
Who are you? Why were they scared of you?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You lost this.
Speaker: OLD MAN

Text: He tosses Arya her coin, then reaches to his face, pulls it off, and reveals the face of Jaqen H'ghar
You said there was no Jaqen H'ghar here.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: There isn't. A man is not Jaqen H'ghar.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: He begins to head back inside the House of Black and White.
Well who are you then?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: He turns back around.
No one. And that is who a girl must become.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Jaqen opens the door and waits for Arya. After a moment, she follows him into the House of Black and White. The door closes behind them.
Mossador is let into the Son of the Harpy's cell. The guards hold him up for Mossador.
She doesn't belong here. And no matter how many of your traitors call her "Mhysa", she will never be your mother.
Speaker: HARPY (Valyrian)

Text: Mossador stares at him.
The Harpy is displayed in the street with his mask on, but the eye holes are cut out. A knife is in his stomach and skull, and "Kill the Masters" is written in blood on the wall next to the body.
Why?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: For you, Mhysa. (kneels) You wanted the Harpy dead, but your hands were tied. I set you free, as you did all of us.
Speaker: MOSSADOR (Valyrian)

Text: He was our prisoner, awaiting trial. You had no right.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: He would rather rip your city apart than see slaves lifted from the dirt.
Speaker: MOSSADOR

Text: There are no more slaves. There are no more Masters.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Then who lives in the Pyramids? Who wears gold masks and murders your children? (beat) When Grey Worm came to us, I was the first to take up the knife for you. I remember the look on my father's face as I struck down his Master, who had traded his infant son for a dog. My father died in the fighting. If we allow the Sons of the Harpy to return us to chains, he never lived.
Speaker: MOSSADOR

Text: The Harpy's life was not yours to take. Once, the Masters were the law--
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: --and now you are the law!
Speaker: MOSADOR

Text: The law is the law. Take him.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Two Unsullieds carry Mossador out of the room.
The Unsullied escort Daenerys and her small council. A large crowd surrounds them.
Mhysa! Myhsa!
Speaker: CROWD

Text: They settle in front of the courthouse, surrounded by both former Masters and former slaves. The Unsullied form a ring around her.
She should have cut off the traitor's head in the Great Pyramid and been done with it.
Speaker: HIZDAHR (to Daario)

Text: Which is what I keep telling her to do to you.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: The former slaves continues to yell to their Mhysa while the masters leer at her.
You opened your gates to me because I promised you freedom and justice. One cannot exist without the other.
Speaker: DAENERYS (Valyrian, to crowd)

Text: Mossador is carried into the scene by Unsullied and set before Daenerys on his knees.
Brother! Brother!
Speaker: CROWD (Valyrian)

Text: Mhysa, please! Forgive me!
Speaker: MOSSADOR (Valyrian)

Text: A citizen of Meereen was awaiting trial and this man murdered him. The punishment is death.
Speaker: DAENERYS (Valyrian)

Text: Mercy! Mercy!
Speaker: CROWD (Valyrian)

Text: Mossador looks to Daenerys, pleading. She looks to Daario and nods. He takes out his arakh, walks to Mossador, and puts it to his neck. The crowd starts protesting and the Masters look on uncertainly.
Mhysa... (prays in Valyrian)
Speaker: MOSSADOR

Text: The crowd begs and pleads for mercy. Daenerys stares out to the crowd, then gives a nod to Daario, who swiftly decapitates Mossador.
Mhysa...
Speaker: CROWD

Text: The crowd goes silent. Suddenly, they start hissing at Daenerys. The Unsullied brace themselves. A former slave throws a rock at a former Master, and the Unsullied attempt to hold back the fight. Barristan and Grey Worm escort Missandei and Daenerys away from the crowd. The Unsullied cover her with their shields.
Former slaves and masters begin killing each other in the streets. Rocks are thrown at the Unsullied shields in attempts to hit Daenerys.
I'll stand guard outside your door tonight, Your Grace.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: We all guard tonight.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Leave me.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Barristan, Daario, Missandei, and Grey Worm leave the room. Daenerys hears a noise coming from outside, and goes out on her balcony to investigate.
When she's out she hears a soft growl, and turns to see Drogon, perched on the top of the pyramid and close to fully grown.
Drogon...
Speaker: DAENERYS (shocked)

Text: He slowly climbs down to her balcony. Daenerys extends her hand. Drogon sniffs it hesitantly, and then takes off into the night, soaring over Meereen.
END EPISODE
BRAAVOS
Speaker: TITLE SEQUENCECUT TO

Text: INT. THE HOUSE OF BLACK AND WHITE

Water drips down a statue of a woman with her eyes closed. Two more statues are shown, a lion sitting in a throne, and a rams head. Behind a large heart surrounded by gold flames, a glowing fire can be seen. A statue of a knight is shown, then a statue of a king’s face. A statue of a contorted tree is covered in a hair-like substance. There is a large pit filled with liquid in the center of the room. Arya can be heard, and then seen, sweeping. The waif carries a bucket past her. Sitting on the edge of the pit, Jaqen whisper to a man. Arya looks up and watches as Jaqen scoops up a cup of liquid from the pit, and hands it to the man. The man looks up at Jaqen, and hesitates before taking it.
Valar morghulis.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Valar dohaeris.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: The man drinks the liquid, and watches as he approaches the statue of the woman with her eyes closed. He kneels down in front of it. Arya puts her broom down and approaches Jaqen.
I've been sweeping this floor for days.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Good.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: I didn't come here to sweep floors.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: No? Why come, then?
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: You said that I could be your apprentice. You said you'd teach me how to a Faceless Man.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A man teaches a girl. (Stands up). Valar dohaeris. All men must serve. Faceless men, most of all. (Walks away).
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: I want to serve. (Jaqen stops).
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A girl wants to serve herself. Here we serve the Many-Faced God, to serve well. A girl must become no-one.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Which one is the Many-Faced God? I see the Stranger. I see the Drowned God. I see the Weirwood Face.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: There is only one god. A girl knows his name. And all men know his gift.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Jaqen leaves. Arya looks down at the man who had been kneeling. He is lying on his back, dead. Two men come into the room with a stretcher. They places the man’s body on it and begin walking to an open door at the end of the room. The waif walks past Arya.
Where are they taking him?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The waif doesn’t respond, but continues walking. Arya turns to watch as the door closes behind the men carrying the stretcher.
KING’S LANDING
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. STREET
Bells are ringing, and people are cheering and shouting. Many are on the sides of the road, waving as a number of carriages are carried past.
Queen Margaery! Queen Margaery! Queen Margaery!
Speaker: BYSTANDERS

Text: Inside her carriage, Cersei watches the people on the street, a sullen look on her face. She closes her curtains.
INT. GREAT SEPT
I am his/hers, and she/he is mine. From this day, until the end of my days.
Speaker: MARGAERY & TOMMEN

Text: Tommen and Margaery share a kiss. Cersei watches them from the crowd, emotionless. The newlyweds turn to the crowd, holding hands. Everyone claps. They smile and laugh. Cersei claps as well, and forces herself to smile.
Tommen breathes heavily as he and Margaery finish having sex. She turns onto her side and smiles.
Did I hurt you?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: No. You were lovely.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: It all happened so fast.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Yes. (Chuckles).
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I was scared maybe I hurt you, it sounded
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: No, no, no. You're very sweet. The sweetest king who ever lived.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: This is what I want to do all day, every day for the rest of my life.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Wouldn't that be glorious? (They laugh. Tommen leans in to kiss her). Shouldn't we rest a little while? Just to catch our breath, there's no rush, is there?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Of course not. Are you hungry? Shall I have them bring you some cake or pomegranate juice?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: No, I'm fine. I just want you all to myself. I want to know everything there is to know about King Tommen First of His Name.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: King Tommen. It still sounds strange to me. Does Queen Margaery sound strange to you?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: So strange… Husband.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Wife. (They laugh). Sometimes it feels odd. I'm the king, I've married the most beautiful woman in the world, (She chuckles), and it's all because my brother died.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: I understand. But it's not your fault, you know that, don't you? You mustn't feel guilty.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I don't feel guilty. That's what's odd.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Margaery looks at him curiously. He suddenly sits up.
Do you like to sail?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: (Sits up). I love to sail.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I do, too.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: I think we're going to be very happy, you and I.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I do, too.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: She kisses him and turns around. She gets up, wrapping a bedsheet around herself as a cover.
Living in a tower so high, it touches the clouds. Of course my grandmother couldn't wait to go home. The capital is not for everyone, I suppose. Does your mother like it here?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I don't think so. She told me never to trust anyone in King's Landing.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: It's so wonderful to have her watching over you. A lioness guiding her cub. (Pours them some wine).
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Well, but I'm a man now.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: You are. And the king. (Hands him win). But you'll always be her baby-boy.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I suppose.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: I adore how she has always been so generous with me, so kind. And the horror she's had to injure. (Sits down and begins to comb her hair). Losing her husband, her eldest child and her father. It's no wonder she's so protective of you. She'll never let you out of her sight.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: EXT. CASTLE WALL
Cersei and Tommen walk together, her arm around his. A group of guards walk behind them.

You look very much in love. The first days of marriage are often so blissful. She's certainly very pretty, isn't she? Like a doll, she smiles quite a lot. Do you think she's intelligent? I can't quite tell. Not that it matters.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Do you ever miss Casterly Rock?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: There's nothing for me in Casterly Rock.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: That's where you grew up. (They stop). You always told me that you liked the people there better. You said that King's Landing smelled of horse dung and sour milk.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: (Chuckles). Why are we speaking of Casterly Rock?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The way that you talked about it, I always thought that you missed it. That you... That it was your real home.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: This is my real home now. Where my family lives.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I want you to be happy, mother.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: I know that. I know you do, my sweet boy.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: But wouldn't you be happier in Casterly Rock?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: INT. ROOM
Cersei approaches a room with two guards. Inside, Margaery is having tea with some of her friends.
I said, "Darling, surely 4 times is enough, are you trying to set a new record?" (Laugher). And he said, "Well, what is the record? I'm sure we can break it."
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Margaery’s friends laugh. As Cersei walks in, they all get up and bow.
Mother! (Gets up and hugs Cersei). Welcome.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Don't you look lovely. Marriage agrees with you.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Can we bring you anything to eat or drink? I wish we had some wine for you. It's a bit early in the day for us.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: No, no. I, I can't stay. I just wanted to let you know if, there is ever anything I can do for you.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You are very sweet.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Tommen seems quite taken with his new queen.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I absolutely adore him. You raised a gallant young man. I'm forever grateful.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Good. Good. I'm glad to hear you're happy.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Ecstatic. I really am. Exhausted, to be honest, but what can I expect, he is half lion, half stag. (Margaery’s friends laugh).
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I'll leave you to it then. (Turns to leave).
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Oh, forgive me, I haven't been at Court for long, I get so confused. What's the proper way to address you now? Queen Mother or Dowager Queen?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: There's no need for such formalities.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: In any event, judging from the King's enthusiasm, the Queen Mother will be a Queen Grandmother soon.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Won’t that be a lovely day.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Can you imagine the celebrations? They'll ring the bells all day and night.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Remember. Anything you need.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Margaery smiles. Cersei leaves. Margaery’s smile fades. It returns when her friends begin laughing, and she turns back around. Cersei walks away with her two guards, still able to hear the laughter.
WINTERFELL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. COURTYARD

A horse whinnies. Bolton bannermen ride to the keep. In the keep, a number of workmen are busy building and repairing things. Some men carry some raven cages through the middle of the courtyard. Theon, carrying a dead bird, walks through for a moment. He then comes across some soldiers lifting up some flayed bodies with rope. He becomes very tense and forces himself to keep walking, head down. A raven picks at a body in a cart.
INT. DINING HALL
Roose and Ramsay sit at a table as Theon cuts some food. Ramsay talks with his face stuffed.
We can't hold the North with terror alone.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: You can't hold the North if you let these lesser lords insult us.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: I sent you there to collect taxes, not bodies.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Lord Cerwyn refused to pay. Said the Warden of the North would always be a Stark, and he'd be damned if he kissed a traitor's boot.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Theon holds the food in front of Ramsay. He takes some of it and puts it on his plate.
He left you no choice.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: I flayed him living, along with his wife and brother. Made his son watch.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: And?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: The new Lord Cerwyn paid his taxes.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: (After a moment). I have something important to tell you. Stop eating and listen.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Ramsay, who had been heavily engrossed in his eating, stops suddenly and looks up. Theon slowly puts down a plate nearby. Ramsay puts down his silverware and sits back, looking at his father.
We don't have enough men to hold the North if the other Houses rise up against us. Do you understand that?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Our pact with the Lannisters protects -
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: I had a pact with Tywin Lannister, and Tywin Lannister is dead. The remaining Lannisters are a thousand miles away dealing with that fact. They've never once in the history of the Seven Kingdoms sent their army this far north. If you think they will for us, you're a fool. We become a great house by entering in alliances with other houses, and parleying those alliances into greater power. The best way to forge a lasting alliance isn't by peeling a man's skin off. The best way is marriage. (Stands up). Now that you're a Bolton by royal decree, it's time you married a suitable bride. And as it happens, I found the perfect girl to solidify our hold in the North.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: MOAT CAILIN
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. NEARBY HILLS

Sansa, Baelish, and a number of knights ride towards Moat Cailin. The party stops. Baelish leads Sansa on foot to a spot where they can easily overlook the keep. The keep is shown, surrounded by swampy riverlands.
That's Moat Cailin.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Yes. A bit shabby, isn't it? You've been here before.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: On our way down to King's Landing, with my father and Arya and… where are you taking me?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Home.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: The Boltons have Winterfell. (He nods). The marriage proposal, it wasn't for you?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: (Shakes his head). No.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Roose Bolton murdered my brother. He betrayed my family!
Speaker: SANSA

Text: He did.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: He serves the Lannisters.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: For now.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: I won't go.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Winterfell is your home.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Not anymore.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Always. You're a Stark. Dyeing your hair doesn't change that. You're Sansa Stark. The eldest surviving child of Ned and Catelyn Stark. Your place is in the North.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: I can't marry him. You can't make me. He's a traitor. A murderer.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You're not marrying Roose Bolton. No, you'll be marrying his son and heir, Ramsay. One day he'll be Warden of the North and you will -
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: No!
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Sansa -
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: No, you can't make me. I will starve myself. I will die before I have to go there.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: (Grabbing her). I won't force you to do anything. Don't you know by now how much I care for you? Say the word and we turn the horses round, but listen to me. Listen. (Quietly). You've been running all your life. Terrible things happened to your family and you weep. You sit alone in a darkened room, mourning their fates. You've been a bystander to tragedy from the day they executed your father. Stop being a bystander, do you hear me? Stop running. There's no justice in the world. Not unless we make it. You loved your family. Avenge them.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: He kisses her forehead. He walks back to their horses. After a few moments, she regains her composure and gets on her horse. The party starts moving again. On top of a large hill nearby, Brienne and Podrick watch as the party arrives at the keep.
How do we get through there?
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: We don't. We go around. (She turns her horse and begins leaving).
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: It sets miles out of the way. We'll lose sight of them.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Doesn't matter. I know where they're going.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: EXT. CAMPSITE
Podrick sits scrubbing a boot.
Aren't you getting a bit old to be a squire? How did you end up squiring for the Imp?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: He hates that nickname.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Well, he's not here to complain about it, is he?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Podrick finishes scrubbing and hands the boot to Brienne. He puts the brush down. Brienne begins putting the boot on.
I squired for a knight name Ser Lorimer during the War of the Five Kings. One night, he had a bit too much to drink. And he was famished, so he borrowed a ham.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: He borrowed it?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: He wasn't a thief. He was drunk and hungry and he wasn't thinking. I was drunk too. He gave me half the ham. Next morning, one of the guards saw him passed out, under a wagon, with the ham bone still in his hand. They hanged the man afternoon. They tied the noose for me too, but, Lord Tywin heard my family name was Payne. So he pardoned me, and sent me to King's Landing to squire for his son.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: As punishment. For both of you.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: It didn't seem that way. Lord Tyrion was always very good to me.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: (Walks away to get firewood). Yes, all of your lords were very kind to you. All except me. Sorry you have to squire such a nasty person.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I'm not sorry. You're the best fighter I've ever seen. You beat The Hound. I'm proud to be your squire.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I'm sorry I'm always snapping at you.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: If you wouldn't snap at me I wouldn't learn anything.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: You want to be a knight, Pod?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Yes.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Starting tomorrow, we'll train with the sword twice a day, before we ride in the morning and after we camp for the evening. (Sits down). And I'm going to show you how to ride properly.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Thank you.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I can't knight you, but I can teach you how to fight.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I suppose that's more important.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Podrick leans over the campfire with some rocks. He strikes them together until he gets a spark, and blows until the fire starts going. He wipes himself off and stands up, walking over to Brienne. He begins taking her armor off.
You weren't a knight, but you were a Kingsguard to Renly Baratheon, weren't you?
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I was.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Lord Tyrion said he was a good man.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: He was.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: But how did you end up serving Renly?
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: (After a few moments). When I was a girl, my father held a ball. I'm his only living child, so he wants to make a good match for me. He invited dozens of young lords to Tarth. I didn't want to go, but he dragged me to the ballroom. (Pauses). And it was wonderful. None of the boys noticed how mulish and tall I was. The shoved each other, and threatened to duel if they thought it was their turn to dance. And whispered in my ear how they wanted to marry me and take me back to their castles. (Smiles). My father smiled at me and I smiled at him. I'd never been so happy. (Her smile drops). Till I saw a few of the boys sniggering. And then they all started to laugh, they couldn't keep the game going any longer. They were toying with me. ‘Brienne the Beauty’, they called me. Great joke. And I realized I was the ugliest girl alive. A great lumbering beast. I tried to run away, but Renly Baratheon took me in his arms. “Don't let them see your tears,” he told me. “They’re nasty little shits. The nasty little shits aren't worth crying over.” He danced with me and none of the other boys could say a word. And he was the king's brother after all.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: But wasn't he... Lord Tyrion said he was...
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Yes, Pod, he liked men, I'm not an idiot. He didn't love me, he didn't want me, he danced with me because he was kind and he wouldn't see me hurt. He saved me from being a joke. From that day until his last day. And I couldn't save him in return. Nothing's more hateful than failing to protect the one you love. One day, I will avenge King Renly.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: But you said a shadow murdered him. How do you fight a shadow?
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: A shadow with the face of Stannis Baratheon. I know it was Stannis. I know it in my heart. Stannis is a man, not a shadow. And a man can be killed.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: CASTLE BLACK
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. LORD COMMANDER’S ROOM
Olly opens the door for Stannis and Davos. Jon sits at his desk.
Lord Commander.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: (Stands up). Your Grace.
Speaker: JON

Text: (To Olly as he closes the door). I'd like to speak alone.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Olly is my steward now, as I was Lord Commander Mormont's. I want him to attend my meetings, to learn from men with experience. One day, he might command.
Speaker: JON

Text: Very well. (They all sit down). Have you considered my offer?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I have. And I thank you for it. You do me great honor. All my life I wanted to be Jon Stark.
Speaker: JON

Text: Say the word and you will be.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: But I have to refuse you. I'm Lord Commander of the Night's Watch. My place is here.
Speaker: JON

Text: I'm giving you a chance to avenge your family. To take back the castle where you grew up. To rule the North.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I wish I could fight beside you. Believe me, I do. But I swore a sacred vow at the Godswood. I pledged my life to the Night's Watch.
Speaker: JON

Text: You're as stubborn as your father. And as honorable.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I can imagine no higher praise.
Speaker: JON

Text: I didn't mean it as praise. Honor got your father killed. (Stands up). But if your mind’s made up, I won't try to persuade you.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: May I ask, Your Grace, how long you plan to stay at Castle Black?
Speaker: JON

Text: Are you bored of us already?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: You saved us from Mance Rayder's army. We will never forget that. But it's a question of survival. The Night's Watch can't continue to feed your men and the wildling prisoners indefinitely. Winter is coming.
Speaker: JON

Text: I know it. We march on Winterfell within the fortnight. Before the snows trap us here.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: And the wildlings?
Speaker: JON

Text: They'd rather burn than fight for me, so be it. I leave their fate to you. You could execute them, that's the safest course. (After a moment). Or you could see if this Tormund fellow is more willing to compromise than Mance ever was. I assume the brothers of the Night's Watch would rather see the wildlings dead.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Most of the brothers, yes. There's little love for the free folk here. (Olly stares at him).
Speaker: JON

Text: You're the Lord Commander. Your decision.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Stannis begins to leave. Olly opens the door.
You have many enemies in Castle Black. Have you considered sending Alliser Thorne elsewhere? Give him command of  Eastwatch-by-the-Sea.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I heard it was best to keep your enemies close.
Speaker: JON

Text: Whoever said that didn't have many enemies.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Stannis leaves. Davos begins to leave, but turns to Jon as Jon begins to pace.
He sees something in you. (Jon looks up). Might not be apparent from his tone, but it's the truth. He believes in you.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I'm sorry I disappointed him.
Speaker: JON

Text: Davos walks forward and takes a seat. Olly closes the door again.
The king is a complicated man. But he wants what's right for the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: As long as he's ruling them.
Speaker: JON

Text: He's the one true king. He has the blood right to that throne.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I’ve sworn to stay clear of the politics of the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: JON

Text: Have you now? (Turning to Olly). How does the Night's Watch vow go again? I bet you've got it memorized since you got here.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Olly looks to Jon. Jon looks at him, crosses his arms, and nods.
Night gathers and now my watch begins -
Speaker: OLLY

Text: Not that bit, the bit at the end.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I'm the sword in the darkness, the watcher on the walls, the shield that guards the realm of men. I pledge my life -
Speaker: OLLY

Text: Wait, that's enough. “The shield that guards the realm of men.” That's what you swore to be. Now I'm not a learned man, but the best way of helping the most people might not be sitting in a frozen castle at the edge of the world. It just might mean wading in the muck, getting your boots dirty, and doing what needs to be doing.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: And what needs to be done?
Speaker: JON

Text: As long as the Boltons rule the North, (Stands up), the North will suffer. Just one man's opinion.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Davos nods and turns to leave. Olly opens the door for him. Jon sits at his desk and sighs.
BRAAVOS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. ARYA’S ROOM
Arya lays on her bed, playing with her coin in her hand. Suddenly, the door opens, and she sits up. The waif enters with a cane, and begins pacing.
What do you want?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Who are you?
Speaker: WAIF

Text: What?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You, who walk in here with a coin you never earned, whose value you do not respect. (Stops and walks to Arya). Who are you?
Speaker: WAIF

Text: (After a moment, perks up). No one.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The waif quickly swings her cane at Arya, hitting her arm. Arya, now on her feet, turns to face the waif, holding her arm in pain.
Ow! Cunt!
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A lie, a sad little lie. Who are you?
Speaker: WAIF

Text: The waif hits her a third time, sending her to the ground.
Who are you?
Speaker: WAIF

Text: You're about to find out.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Arya reaches for her sword. Before she can pick it up, Jaqen appears.
What are you doing?
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: We were only playing. The game of faces.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: A girl is not ready.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Clearly not.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: (Stands up). I am ready.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: For what? For whatever you want. To be a Faceless Man. To be no one.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: The waif turns to her. Jaqen looks at the sword on Arya’s bed.
Whose sword is that? It belongs to Arya Stark. Arya Stark's sword, Arya Stark's clothes, Arya Stark's stolen silver. A man wonders how is it that no one came to be surrounded by Arya Stark's things?
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: The waif, looking smug, leaves.
EXT. DOCK

On a dock near the house of Black and White, Arya wraps a rock in her clothes. She is wearing new clothes, similar to the ones the waif wears. She ties them up and drops them into the water, the rock causing them to sink. She picks up her coin purse and throws it in the water. After a moment of examining her original coin in her hand, she throws it in the water as well. She looks at her sword Needle for a moment, and then picks it up. She prepares to throw it in the sea, but finds herself unable to, and begins to sob. She turns and walks over to some nearby rocks, and hides the sword under some of them.
INT. THE HOUSE OF BLACK AND WHITE

Arya is again sweeping the floor in the main room. She notices the men from the beginning of the episode carrying another dead body into the back room. However, after a moment, she realizes that she didn’t hear the door close, and she looks up to find it wide open. Jaqen surprises her by suddenly putting his hand on her shoulder. He nods towards the door, and begins walking over to it. Arya follows him, leaving the broom outside. They go down a fire-lit tunnel. Jaqen opens the door at the end of the tunnel to reveal a chamber. Inside, the waif stands motionless next to a large stone slab. On it is the dead man. Jaqen leaves through the back door. After Jaqen closes the door, the waif begins to remove the dead man’s clothes. She looks up at Arya, who walks over and begins to do so as well. The waif inspects his body. She wets a rag and begins cleaning off the man.
What do we do with them after we wash them?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The waif only looks up and smiles lightly, making no other response. She goes back to washing him, and Arya wets a rag of her own to help.
WINTERFELL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. COURTYARD
Open gates!
Speaker: MAN

Text: The gates are opened. Sansa, Baelish, and a number of knights on horseback gallop through. They stop. Theon watches from nearby through some metal bars, trembling. Baelish gets off of his horse. Roose, Ramsay, and Walda watch as Sansa gets off hers. Roose walks forward. Baelish leads Sansa towards him, rubbing her hands.
Lady Sansa, welcome.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: After a tense moment, Sansa smiles and curtsies.
(Smiles). Lord Bolton.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: May I introduce my son, (Stands aside), Ramsay Bolton?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Ramsay smiles and walks forwards, removing his gloves. Sansa smiles at him.
It's an honor to meet you, my Lady.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: He takes her hand and kisses it. Nearby, Myranda and other women watch.
INT. HALLWAY
An old servant woman leads Sansa down a hallway to her chambers. She opens the door.
I'll bring you a bowl of hot water. You must want to wash.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: Thank you.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Welcome home, Lady Stark. (Quieter) The North remembers.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: Sansa watches as the woman leaves.
CASTLE BLACK
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. DINING HALL
Jon sits at a table, tapping his fingers anxiously. The men in the room talk amongst themselves.
Sam. (Sam looks up. Jon looks at Maester Aemon’s chair). Maester Aemon?
Speaker: JON

Text: He apologizes for not being here. He's not feeling well.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Take good care of him. (To the group). Brothers. As you all know too well, it's long past time to dig a new latrine pit. (Laughter. Jon looks at Alliser). First Builder Yarwyck and I have decided to appoint a latrine captain to oversee this crucial task. (Laughter. After a moment, he continues). Brian. Seems like a good job for a ginger.
Speaker: JON

Text: Everyone laughs. Some of the men jokingly pat Brian on his back, and Brian laughs as well.

Ser Alliser. (Silence). You have more experience than any other soldier at Castle Black. You proved your valour many times over, while defending the Wall from the wildling attack. I name you First Ranger.
Speaker: JON

Text: Some of the men shout in approval. Alliser looks up surprised. Edd and Sam look at each other. Janos pats him on the shoulder.
Lord Janos. I'm giving you command of Greyguard.
Speaker: JON

Text: (Scoffs). Greyguard is a ruin.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Yes, the fort is in a sorry state. Restore it as best you can. First Builder Yarwyck can spare ten of his -
Speaker: JON

Text: I was charged with the defense of King's Landing when you were soiling your swaddling clothes. Keep your ruin.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Some of the men begin talking loudly. Olly shifts in his seat.
Alright, alright! Enough of that.
Speaker: SAM

Text: You mistake me, my Lord. That was a command, not an offer. Pack your arms and armour, say your farewells, and ride for Greyguard.
Speaker: JON

Text: (Stands up, angrily shouts). I will not go meekly off to freeze and die! Give it to one of the fools who cast a stone for you. I will not have it. Do you hear me, boy? I will not have it!
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Are you refusing to obey my order?
Speaker: JON

Text: The men in the room all turn to look at Janos.
You can stick your order up your bastard arse.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Some of the men whisper in shock. Janos looks pleased with himself. Alliser turns to Jon smugly.
Take Lord Janos outside.
Speaker: JON

Text: The men begin to stand up. Janos scoffs.
Olly, bring me my sword.
Speaker: JON

Text: Olly turns quickly to Jon, then gets up. Janos looks more unsure of himself as more men get up. Alliser turns and looks at Janos disapprovingly. Edd walks over to get Janos. Alliser stands in his way for a moment. Jon looks at the confrontation, worried. Alliser raises his eyebrows for a moment and moves out of the way. Janos looks at him shocked. Edd grabs Janos, and some other men assist in dragging him outside.
You cannot do this! Get your hands off me! (Everyone moves outside). Scum, all of you! If the boy thinks he can frighten me, he's mistaken, yes, very mistaken.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Someone puts a chopping block down. Janos is taken up to it.
A disgrace! I have friends, important friends in the capital! You'll see!
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Jon takes a final sip of his wine, gets up, and goes outside. The watchmen all gather in the courtyard. Olly hands Jon his sword. Jon walks up to where Janos is being held. Stannis watches from afar. Jon unsheathes his sword, and Janos looks up at it.
If you have any last words, my Lord, now is the time.
Speaker: JON

Text: (Trembling). I was wrong. You're the Lord Commander! We all serve you. I'm sorry. Not only for this, for all I've done and said. I was wrong! (Jon brings his sword up). My Lord, please, mercy! Mercy! I'll go! I will! Please. I'm afraid. I've always been afraid.
Speaker: JANOS

Text: Janos sobs for a few moments. Jon hesitates, and then brings his sword down, decapitating Janos. He hands his sword to a watchman standing nearby. He looks up and makes eye contact with Stannis.
KING’S LANDING
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. BROTHEL

The High Septon kneels in the center of a room. Seven prostitutes, dressed as each of the new gods, circle around him. Olyvar stands behind the High Septon, wearing a fake beard and holding a scale. The prostitutes giggle as the High Septon eyes them all.
You have served us well, my son.
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: Thank you, Father.
Speaker: HIGH SEPTON

Text: Which of the Seven will you worship today?
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: The Maiden.
Speaker: HIGH SEPTON

Text: Where is the Maiden?
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: And the Stranger.
Speaker: HIGH SEPTON

Text: (Leaning forward). Two is extra, you realize?
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: Yes, yes.
Speaker: HIGH SEPTON

Text: Olyvar snaps his fingers. He and five of the prostitutes step aside. The two dressed as the Maiden and the Stranger remain and approach the High Septon, who smiles. Suddenly, some men led by Lancel Lannister barge into the room. The High Septon gasps and turns around.
What are you doing? This establishment belong to Lord Petyr Baelish. You can't -
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: The men force the High Septon to his feet. One of the men rips off Olyvar’s fake beard, hits him to the ground, and begins kicking him. The prostitutes run out of the room.
You have profaned our faith. The faith of our fathers and forefathers.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: I am the High Septon of the -
Speaker: HIGH SEPTON

Text: (Grabs his neck). You are a sinner. And you shall be punished.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: The men drag the High Septon out of the room. He is forced out into the street naked, and begin walking. He tries to cover his penis with his hands, but one of the men hits him with a stick. People gather on the sides of the street to watch, and begin chanting.
Sinner! Sinner! Sinner!
Speaker: CROWD

Text: Repent!
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: Sinner! Sinner! Sinner! Sinner! Sinner! Sinner!
Speaker: CROWD

Text: Shame on you!
Speaker: MAN 2

Text: Sinner! Sinner!
Speaker: CROWD

Text: INT. SMALL COUNCIL CHAMBER

Mace opens the door for the High Septon. He approaches the table. In better light, it is clear that his face is heavily bruised. Mace closes the door and walks over. The High Septon addresses each of the member present.
(To Cersei) Your Grace, (To Pycelle), Grandmaester, (To Mace) Lord Tyrell, (To Qyburn), uh…
Speaker: HIGH SEPTON

Text: It doesn't matter. (Mace sits down).
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: As the High Septon of the Faith of the Seven I give voice to the will of the Gods and am their foremost servant in this world. An insult to me is an insult to the Gods. An assault on my person, is an assault on our very religion.
Speaker: HIGH SEPTON

Text: You were assaulted?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I was, by those fanatics who call themselves ‘sparrows’. They humiliated me, they they beat me, they left me naked and bleeding on the cobblestones. I am lucky to be alive.
Speaker: HIGH SEPTON

Text: I heard this all began in Littlefinger's brothel.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: High Septon, this is a rather shocking thing to hear.
Speaker: MACE

Text: I tend to both the highest born, and the lowliest amongst us. Even prostitutes may earn the mercy of the Mother.
Speaker: HIGH SEPTON

Text: So you were administering to the needs of these devout prostitutes?
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: A man's private affairs ought to stay private!
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: What do you want from us, High Septon?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Justice! I ask that you protect our Faith by arresting these criminals and throwing them in the black cells. I ask that you execute their leader, this so-called High Sparrow. He's a threat to everything we hold sacred. If he goes unpunished -
Speaker: HIGH SEPTON

Text: And where do I find this man? This High Sparrow?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: EXT. STREET
A soldier helps Cersei out of her carriage. She begins walking forward. Ser Meryn stands ahead of her.
I don't think this is a good idea, Your Grace.
Speaker: MERYN

Text: Nonsense, Ser Meryn. These are deeply religious people. (To a man at the bottom of some stairs). Where can I find the High Sparrow?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The man points up the stairs. They are crowded with people. Cersei and Ser Meryn ascend them.
Seven blessings.
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: Cersei covers her nose. At the top of the stairs is a large room. She watches as many people eat at tables.
Thank you.
Speaker: MAN 2

Text: Just a little more...
Speaker: MAN 3

Text: Thank you ever so for the soup!
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: In the center of the room, an old man is giving soup to people in line. Cersei approaches him.
A young man said I would find the High Sparrow back here. Where is he?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: High Sparrow? Sounds ridiculous, doesn't it? Like Lord Duckling, or King Turtle. (Laughs). So, it's meant to. We're often stuck with the names our enemies give to us. (Prepares soup for the next person in line). The notion that we are all equal in the eyes of Seven doesn't sit well with some, so they belittle me.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Seven blessings to you.
Speaker: WOMAN 2

Text: Seven blessings to you, my dear. It's only a name, quite an easy burden to wear. Far easier than hers. (Prepares soup for the next person in line).
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Why no shoes?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Because I gave them away to someone who needed them more. We all do that. It stops us from forgetting what we really are.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Is that why you came to King's Landing? To remind everyone?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Everyone? I have a hard enough job reminding myself. Oh, I tell them no one's special. And they think I'm special for telling them so.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: (Smiles). Perhaps they're right.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: It would be comforting to believe that, wouldn't it? The Gods sent you here to tempt me? I hope not. I had assumed you'd only come here to arrest me. For that incident with the High Septon.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: An unacceptable way to treat the chosen representative of the Gods in this world, wouldn't you say?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Hypocrisy is a boil. Lancing a is never pleasant. Although, they could have been more careful with the blade.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: The High Septon came to speak to me today. He doesn't want me to arrest you, he wants me to execute you.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I wouldn't presume to know your thoughts on the matter.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: (After a moment). My thoughts on the matter align with your own. The High Septon's behaviour was corrosive, as was his attitude. Having a man like that reside in the Sept eats away the Faith from the inside. So now he resides in the Red Keep's dungeons instead. (The High Sparrow looks up at her surprised). The Faith and the Crown are the two pillars that hold up this world. If one collapses, so does the other. We must do everything necessary to protect one another.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: INT. QYBURN’S LAB

Qyburn pulls a rat out of a cage. He brings it over to a desk and holds a knife above it. The camera switches to his face, and blood splatters onto a protective lens. Cersei enters the room with a letter.
Your Grace.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Send a raven with this message to Littlefinger in the Eyrie, or wherever he's slithering about. (Hands him the letter).
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: At once, Your Grace. (Walks to his desk).
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: How's your work coming along?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Very well.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: You've made progress?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: More than I've expected. Still a way to go, but…
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Very good. I'll leave you to it then. Make sure Littlefinger is clear on the meaning of the word "immediately".
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Cersei leaves the room. Qyburn begins writing something down. Behind him on a table is a large object, covered by a sheet. After a few moments of writing, the object begins violently jerking around, and then stops.
Shh. Easy, friend.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: WINTERFELL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: COURTYARD

Sansa walks through the busy courtyard. Theon is shoveling dirt nearby. He looks up to see her walking in his direction, and looks away, tense. On a platform above, Ramsay and Baelish stand, watching her.
She really is lovely. I hope I can make her happy.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: I hope so too. I've become quite fond of Lady Sansa during our travels together. She’s suffered enough.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: I'll never hurt her. You have my word.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: I've heard very little about you. Which makes you quite a rare thing, as lords go.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: I haven't been a lord very long. I was a bastard.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: (Approaching). And you're not anymore. Allow me a moment alone with Lord Baelish.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Yes, father. And thank you, Lord Baelish. I'm forever in your debt. (Bows).
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: He seems pleased.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Shouldn't he be?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: (They begin walking). I assure you she's still a virgin. Tyrion never consummated the marriage. By the law of the land, she's no man's wife. Inspect her, if you must.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: I leave that to the brothel keeper. It's her name I need, not her virtue.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Then I have delivered everything I've promised.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: And you prepared for the consequences. When the Lannisters hear I've wed Sansa Stark to Ramsay.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: The Lannister name doesn't mean what it once did. Tywin is dead. He kept his house in power through sheer will. Without him, Jaime has one hand and no allies, Tommen is a soft boy, not a king to fear.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: The Queen will be enraged.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Queen Margaery adores Sansa. Cersei is Queen Mother, a title whose importance wanes with each passing day.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: And yet she still has friends. Men in important places, whom she can ask for favours. (They stop, and Roose holds up a letter). A message for you, from Cersei Lannister. A rider arrived from Eyrie, shortly before dawn. Apparently, she thinks you're still in the Vale.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: A message for me, you say. Strange that the seal is broken.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: I'm sure you understand my position, Lord Baelish. If you received word in the night from the Queen Mother, it does make me question our new alliance. The Lannisters made you one of the great lords of Westeros. Yet, here you are in the North, undermining them. Why gamble with your position?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Every ambitious move is a gamble. You gambled when you drove a dagger into Robb Stark's heart. It appears that your gamble paid off. You're Warden of the North.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: I had Tywin Lannister backing. Who supports me now? You?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: The Eyrie is mine. The last time the lords of the Eyrie formed an alliance with the lords of the North, they brought down the greatest dynasty this world has ever known. I'd like to borrow one of your birds. Cersei will expect a reply.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: I'd like to read the reply.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Roose walks away.
VOLANTIS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. VARYS AND TYRION’S CARRIAGE
Tyrion repeatedly opens and closes a window.
I have to get out of this wheelhouse.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Volantis is a large city.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I have to get out of this wheelhouse.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The likelihood of you being spotted here increases a hundredfold.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Mm, I have to get out of this wheelhouse.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm not sure how many new ways I can find of saying this.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: (Walks over to him). I will not be of any use to Daenerys Targaryen if I lose my mind. I can't remember the last face I saw that wasn't yours.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It's a perfectly good face.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I'm losing my mind.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: If anyone recognizes you, you'll lose more than that.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Look, we are thousands of miles from Westeros. (Pulls his hood up). What am I? (Varys shakes his head). One more drunk dwarf.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion knocks on the front of the carriage. The camera then pans over part of the city. Varys and Tyrion walk through a busy marketplace.
Slaves.
Speaker: TYRION
