Text: Yes. The Volantene masters are very organized. (Shot of a man with a fly tattooed onto his cheek). Flies for dung shovelers. (Shot of a man with a hammer tattooed onto his cheek). Hammers for builders. (Shot of a man inspecting women with tears tattooed onto their cheeks). Tears for whores. Lest they forget.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Varys and Tyrion arrive at a clearing in the market and stop. A woman speaks before a large crowd.
(Valyrian) Lord cast your light upon us.
Speaker: PRIESTESS

Text: (Valyrian, in unison) Lord cast your light upon us.
Speaker: CROWD

Text: (Valyrian) For the night is dark and full of terrors.
Speaker: PRIESTESS

Text: (Aside) We should keep moving.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Noticing Tyrion is no longer next to him, he frantically looks around.
(Valyrian, in unison) For the night is dark and full of terrors.
Speaker: CROWD

Text: (Valyrian) I was once as you are now.
Speaker: PRIESTESS

Text: The woman points to her cheek. Tyrion watches from some nearby steps, and drinks some wine.
(Valyrian) Bought and sold, (Varys approaches Tyrion), scourged and branded...
Speaker: PRIESTESS

Text: The only red priest we had in King's Landing was Thoros of Myr. This one's much better looking.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (Valyrian) The Lord of Light hears your voice. He hears the king as he hears the slave; he hears the Stone Men in their misery...
Speaker: PRIESTESS

Text: Stone men. Good luck stopping this spread of grayscale with prayer. You'd have better luck dancing away the plague. (Varys shushes him worriedly).
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (Valyrian) He has sent you a saviour! From the fire she was reborn to remake the world! The Dragon Queen!
Speaker: PRIESTESS

Text: We're going to meet the Saviour! You should have told me. Who doesn't want to meet the Saviour?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The priestess slowly turns her head to lock eyes with Tyrion.
(Covering his face). Come on. Let's find a brothel.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They return to the marketplace and continue walking. They stop at a large door, which a man is guarding. He rubs Tyrion’s head.
(Valyrian) It’s good luck to rub a dwarf’s head.
Speaker: MAN

Text: It's even better luck to suck a dwarf's cock.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Varys rolls his eyes, exasperated. The man stares at him unamused.
INT. BROTHEL
See? We blend right in. Just two more travellers, mad with lust.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Elsewhere in the brothel, Jorah sets his cup down. Tyrion and Varys sit down at a table, and a woman comes to bring them wine.
Thank you.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Tyrion clinks his glass against Varys’s. A prostitute dressed as Daenerys walks through the brothel. Tyrion looks at her.
Curious... hair. (She looks at him).
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (Across the room). The mother of dragons!
Speaker: MAN

Text: He gestures for her to come over. She approaches their table.
It appears you're not the only Targaryen supporter.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Jorah watches the prostitute, and then looks away.
Someone who inspires priests and whores is worth taking seriously.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: What makes you worth that much?
Speaker: MAN

Text: I’m magic. (They laugh).
Speaker: BLONDE PROSTITUTE

Text: I bet you bloody are.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Jorah listens to this, appearing extremely uncomfortable.
Well, (Watches her kiss the man), she's taken.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion spots another prostitute, with shorter dark hair. He gets up.
Where're you going?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I need to speak to someone with hair.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion approaches the black haired prostitute.
Hello?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Hello.
Speaker: BLACK HAIRED PROSTITUTE

Text: You've got no drink.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You've got no money.
Speaker: BLACK HAIRED PROSTITUTE

Text: Do I look like a man without money? (She looks at him incredulously). Never trust looks. Until quite recently, I was one of the richest men in the world. (She laughs). But who needs wealth when you can make a woman laugh? (Sits down). I always pay my debts, I'm well known for it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The blonde prostitute and the man giggle. Tyrion glances over at them.
You like her? They all like her. They all want to fuck a queen.
Speaker: BLACK HAIRED PROSTITUTE

Text: That’s because they’ve never met a queen.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You're just saying that.
Speaker: BLACK HAIRED PROSTITUTE

Text: You know how to spot a liar. If I could pick any girl here, I would pick you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Why?
Speaker: BLACK HAIRED PROSTITUTE

Text: Because you have a skeptical mind.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (Smiles). Alright, then. I'm warning you. We’re gonna have to wash you first.
Speaker: BLACK HAIRED PROSTITUTE

Text: She takes his hand, but Tyrion doesn’t get up.
Come on.
Speaker: BLACK HAIRED PROSTITUTE

Text: (After a moment). I'm, I'm sorry, I can't.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Of course you can. You're shy.
Speaker: BLACK HAIRED PROSTITUTE

Text: I'm not.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Have another drink.
Speaker: BLACK HAIRED PROSTITUTE

Text: Gladly, but this, I can't do. Believe me, no one is more shocked than I am. I hope it passes. What will I do in my spare time? I’ll go for a piss, that’s a start.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She looks confused. Tyrion walks away. Varys, noticing that Tyrion is no longer in his view, gets up worriedly.
INT./EXT. WINDOW
Tyrion pisses out of a window, and sips his wine. He throws the cup out into the water below. He notices that someone is behind him.
Jorah looks behind him. As Tyrion pulls up his pants, Jorah puts a rope around him and begins tying it.
You made some kind of mistake. Why don't you tell me what you think you are doing and -
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Jorah puts a rag over Tyrion’s mouth.
I'm taking you to the Queen.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Tyrion’s eyes widen. Jorah picks him up and leaves.
END EPISODE
TITLE SEQUENCEEXT. BEACH

A man hops out of his boat at night, and grabs a basket of fish. As he carries it on shore, Jorah knocks him out with a punch to the face. Looking around, he drags the man out of the water, and throws two coins on him. Jorah walks over to where he has Tyrion tied up. Tyrion is grunting, trying to cut the ropes binding him with a knife. Jorah picks up the knife and Tyrion. He throws Tyrion and his supplies into the boat, and then pushes it out to sea. Once it gains momentum, he hops in himself.
EXT. BOAT
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: A number of men walk around doing various tasks on deck. Jaime Lannister looks out from the side of the boat. He turns to the captain.
Is that Estermont?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Tarth, Ser Jaime. (Shot of an island). The Sapphire Isle.
Speaker: CAPTAIN

Text: INT. BELOW DECK
A knife hits a sandbag.
Why are we on a merchant ship? Why no Lannister sails?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: This ship's sailing to Oldtown. We'll get off earlier, not far from Sunspear. Row ourselves to the Dornish shores in the night.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You ever been to Dorne?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: No.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I have. The Dornish are crazy. All they want to do is fight and fuck. Fuck and fight.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You should be happy to go back. (Drinks some water).
Speaker: JAIME

Text: (Gets up, walking to his knife). There's nothing like a good fight to get you in the mood for fucking. (Pulls out his knife from the sandbag). And there's nothing like a fuck-mad Dornish girl to clear your head for the next fight. It's how the two work together. And we're gonna do a lot of fighting, I am sure. Well, I am. But I don't imagine we'll get to stick around for the rest. Not after we've kidnapped their princess.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: We are not kidnapping their princess. We are rescuing my niece, bringing her back to the family,
Speaker: JAIME

Text: (Incredulously) Your niece?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Jaime and Bronn have a stare-off. After a moment, Jaime looks away. Bronn drinks some water.
I've been doing this sort of thing a long time. I'm good at it. (Sits down).
Speaker: BRONN

Text: That's why you're here.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I know. Why are you here? Why not send 40 of me, or an army? Unlike most folks, you actually got one.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Because I don't want to start a war.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: That still doesn't explain why you're doing it.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: It has to be me.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: (Gets up starts walking). If I'm putting something of a lit together, a one-handed man, (Grabs some rope and walks back), who happens to be one of the most recognizable faces in Westeros, is not -
Speaker: BRONN

Text: It has to be me.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: (Sheaths his sword). You set your brother free, didn't you? I bet your sister didn't like that.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: (Quietly) Varys set him free.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Well, if you ever see the little fucker, (Lays down), give him my regards.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: He murdered my father. If I ever see him, I'll split him in two. And then I'll give him your regards.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: KING’S LANDING
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. SMALL COUNCIL CHAMBER
Cersei sits in her chair, looking angry. At the table is Maester Pycelle, Qyburn, Mace Tyrell, and an empty chair.
The Iron Bank has called one tenth of the Crown's debts. Given the expense of rebuilding the royal -
Speaker: MACE

Text: How much can the Crown afford?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: With winter coming, half what they ask. Less.
Speaker: MACE

Text: You're the Master of Coin. How do we pay them?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Well, House Tyrell could front the gold, and the the Crown will pay us back in time, or I'll have words with my daughter.
Speaker: MACE

Text: Mace smiles, as if expecting a laugh. Qyburn and Pycelle both look down. Mace’s smile fades. Cersei smiles.
You've already given us too much. (Gets up and walks to a window). No, we must arrange better terms with the Iron Bank.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Absolutely.
Speaker: MACE

Text: In person.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: (After a moment, looks at her surprised). Me? (Qyburn smiles).
Speaker: MACE

Text: We must send an envoy to the Iron Bank, someone of importance, to show these bankers our respect. As the King's Master of Coin, I can think of no one more qualified.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I will be honored, Your Grace.
Speaker: MACE

Text: The King has expressed concern about his father-in-law's safety on this voyage. (Smiling). He's ordered Ser Meryn to personally lead your escort.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Ser Meryn walks into the room. Mace turns to look at him, and then back at Cersei.
My very own Kingsguard? Please express -
Speaker: MACE

Text: Safe travels, Lord Tyrell.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: (Raises his hands). Of course, of course, (Gathers his belongings, and then gets up). I'll give your regards to the Titan of Braavos.
Speaker: MACE

Text: Mace laughs. Qyburn looks down, lightly chuckling. Mace exits, followed by Ser Meryn.
The Small Council grows smaller and smaller.
Speaker: PYCELLE

Text: (Walking out). Not small enough.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Pycelle watches her leave.
INT. HIGH SPARROW’S CHAMBER
A note lies on the desk, stamped with the seal of the High Sparrow. The High Sparrow sits behind his desk, across from Cersei. She pours a glass of wine.
May I offer you some wine, Your Holiness?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No. (Smiles).
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Cersei looks unsure, presumably having expected him to say yes. After a moment she smiles and pushes the wine away.
The old High Septon would have asked the vintage. (Smiles).
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I could say that our minds are temples to the Seven and should be kept pure. But the truth is, (Chuckles), I don't like the taste.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Hmm.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: (After a moment). How may I serve?
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: All over Westeros we hear about septs being burned. Silent sisters raped. Bodies of holy men piled in the streets.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Wars teach people to obey the sword, not the Gods.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Perhaps the Gods need a sword of their own. (HS raises an eyebrow). In the days before the Targaryens, the Faith Militant dispensed the justice of the Seven.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Well, the Faith Militant was disarmed more than two centuries ago.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: If I explain the holy purpose to my son, the king, I have no doubt he will sign a decree arming the believers you felt worthy.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: An army that defends the bodies and souls of the common people.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: An army and service to the Gods themselves. And to you, of course. As the chosen representative of the Seven.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: An honor I never expected. Or indeed, ever wished for.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Which is why you were chosen. (HS smiles). You and I both know how the world works. Too often the wicked are the wealthiest, beyond the reach of justice. The king himself cannot always punish those who deserve it most.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: All sinners are equal before the Gods.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: (Smiles. Continues after a moment). What would you say if I told you we have a great sinner in our very midst? Shielded by gold and privilege.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: May the Father judge him justly. (Smiles).
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: EXT. STREET

A group of Faith Militant, wearing black robes and chains, walk down the street. Many nearby people chatter amongst themselves and look on. They begin breaking open casks of wine, and people begin screaming. One throws some men out of a building. Wine from the broken casks flows down some steps.
INT. A ROOM
We see a man in pain, sweating heavily and biting down on a piece of cloth. Someone begins carving something on his forehead, and his hand scratches and grabs at the table.
EXT. MARKETPLACE

Outside, the Faith Militant destroy a marketplace, smashing things for sale, flipping over tables, and attacking merchants. One merchant, laying on the ground, looks up at some gold cloaks on a castle wall.
Help me! Help me!
Speaker: MERCHANT

Text: The gold cloaks turn around, ignoring him.
INT. A ROOM
The man in the room continues to sweat and bite down on the cloth. His face trembles. The symbol continues being carved.
INT. BROTHEL

A prostitute moans while having sex with a client. Some Faith Militant walk in and interrupt. She shrieks as one grabs her by the hair and pulls her off of the man. Another comes in grinning and strikes the man with a stick. The prostitute is forced out of the room. Some more men interrupt an orgy. Two women start screaming. They begin beating some of the participants, and taking others out of the room. Olyvar attempts to confront a member of the Faith Militant as the man drags out a prostitute.
(Angrily). This is Lord Petyr Baelish's establishment.
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: The man elbows Olyvar in the face and continues on his way. After most of the Faith’s Militant are gone, Olyvar hears a scream. He walks towards the source of the scream, blood running from his noise, and hears another scream.
Cocksucker! (Man screams). Boy fucker! You barbaric filth! There's a special place in the Seventh Hell for your kind.
Speaker: MILITANT

Text: Olyvar stands just outside the doorway of a large room. Inside, a group of militants, most of them armed, stand around a male prostitute and his male client. Both are naked and bloody on the floor.
Please, please, I'll pay! I'll pay all of you.
Speaker: CLIENT

Text: (Pulls out a knife). Yes, you will! Seize him.
Speaker: MILITANT

Text: The client begins crying. Olyvar backs out of the doorway and begins running away. The client screams.
INT. A ROOM

Someone finishes carving the symbol on the man’s head. The carver walks away and the man, revealed to be Lancel Lannister, sits up, breathing heavily. The symbol on his forehead is the symbol of the Faith Militant.
EXT. STAIRWELL

A number of Faith’s Militant, all armed, walk down a stairwell. They enter a clearing, where Loras Tyrell is sparring with another man. Some people are spectating. The militants, including Lancel, approach the fight. Loras, having knocked the other man to the ground, removes his helmet. He hands his sword to another man, who hands Loras a drink. He suddenly becomes aware of the presence of the militants.
Seize him.
Speaker: MILITANT

Text: The militants grab Loras.
Get your hands off of me.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Ser Loras of House Tyrell, you have broken the laws of Gods and men.
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: Who do you think you are?
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Justice. (Loras grunts and struggles).
Speaker: LANCEL

Text: INT. HALLWAY
Margaery walks down a hallway. She pushes a set of doors open, enters Tommen’s chambers, and angrily puts her hands on a table. Tommen is eating, and looks up at her, surprised.
Why is my brother in a cell?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I, I don't know. I, I didn't order it.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: We both know who did. (Walks away). You told me she was returning to Casterly Rock.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: (Standing up). Are you saying my mother is behind this?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: She's jealous you're not hers anymore. Arresting my brother is her revenge.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Aren't you and mother getting along?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: (Scoffs). Oh, my sweet, sweet King. (Sits down). Do you have any affection for me at all?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: (Takes her hand). Of course I do. You're my Queen.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: I can't bear to think of my brother locked away in some grimy cell.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I'll set him free for you.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Do you promise?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: INT. CERSEI’S CHAMBERS
Tommen walks into Cersei’s chambers. Cersei is staring out of a window and drinking wine.
I demand that Ser Loras be freed now!
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: (Turns around). Did I arrest him?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Well, no... But you armed the Faith Militant. You gave the High Sparrow an army.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: I did. And your wife has every right to criticize. (Begins walking towards her desk). Can't allow fanatics to arrest the Queen's brother, no matter his perversions.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Then can I tell Margaery you'll have Ser Loras released?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: I told you I am not holding Ser Loras. You're the King. I'm sure if you speak to the High Sparrow, he'll release the poor boy.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: EXT. THE GREAT SEPT
A group of kingsguard lead Tommen to the Great Sept.
Halt!
Speaker: KINGSGUARD

Text: The party stops. Tommen gets out and goes to the steps of the Sept on foot, followed by guards. A number of people are seen milling about around the base of the steps. Some Faith Militant stand guarding the steps. They block Tommen and his guards from walking up.
His Holiness is praying. He will not be disturbed.
Speaker: MILITANT

Text: Give the order and we'll tear out this rebel.
Speaker: KINGSGUARD

Text: You mean, kill them? Here, in the sept?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: You'll be sending them to meet the Gods that they love.
Speaker: KINGSGUARD

Text: The kingsguard and militants both adjust their stances, ready for a fight. A number of other people begin to watch. Some people begin yelling at Tommen.
Bastard!
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: You're an abomination!
Speaker: MAN 2

Text: You're born of sin!
Speaker: MAN 3

Text: Filthy bastard!
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: We'll find another way.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Tommen begins walking away, followed by his guards.
Abomination!
Speaker: MAN 4

Text: INT. TOMMEN’S CHAMBERS
Tommen opens the doors to his chambers, finding it empty.
My Queen?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Margaery enters from outside.
There was no way to free Ser Loras without violence.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: You're the King of the Andals, the Lord of the Seven Kingdoms, the Protector of the Realm. And you let a band of fanatics imprison your brother by law.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I'm going to speak to the High Sparrow.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Are you? When?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I--I don't know.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: You don't know?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: He was praying just now.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: (Walking out). I have to send word to Grandmother.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Will you come back later? (Margaery stops).
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: I need to be with my family, Your Grace. (Continues walking).
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Of course.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: THE WALL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. CASTLE BLACK
Some Night’s Watchmen spar in the courtyard. A number of others look on. Stannis and Selyse watch from some stairs.
You think highly of this boy.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: (To some of the men sparring). Good.
Speaker: JON

Text: Lord Commander of the Night's Watch.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: A bastard by some tavern slut.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Perhaps, but that wasn't Ned Stark's way.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I should have given you a son.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Not your fault.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Whose then? (Looks at their daughter Shireen). I gave you nothing but weakness. (Turns back). And deformity. (Stannis shakes his head).
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: (Walking towards them). Those scars mean nothing to the Lord of Light.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: My Lady.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Her father is the Lord's chosen King. And her father's blood runs through her veins.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Melisandre and Selyse stare at each other. After a moment, Selyse walks away.
You march on Winterfell soon?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: We must. To beat the snows.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Once before you put your faith in Ser Davos and left me behind. I hope you won't make that mistake again.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I won't. I need you.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: You only need faith, my King.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: (Walking away). And you, my Lady, what do you need?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: To serve my Lord.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Stannis turns back. They both watch Jon sparring.
INT. JON’S CHAMBER
Jon sits at his desk. Sam hands him various letters to sign, one by one.
Lord Ashford. (Jon signs). Lady Caulfield. (Jon signs). Lord Smallwood.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Never even heard of these people.
Speaker: JON

Text: They haven't heard of you either. (Jon signs). But we need men and they have some.
Speaker: SAM

Text: And how many men does this Lord Mazin have to send us?
Speaker: JON

Text: (Chuckles, looking at the next letter). More than Lord Wibberley.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Sam’s face grows dark after reading the next letter. When Jon finishes signing the letter to Lord Wibberley, Sam hands it to him, saying nothing. Jon begins signing, but hesitates.
Not him.
Speaker: JON

Text: I know, I'm sorry, but we need men and supplies. And Roose Bolton is the Warden of The North.
Speaker: SAM

Text: He murdered my brother.
Speaker: JON

Text: We swore to be the Watchers on the Wall. We can't watch the Wall with 50 men. And we can't get more men without help from the Warden of the North.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Jon hesitates another moment, and then relents and signs the letter. He leans his chair back, and Sam gathers up all of the signed letters. He walks away, almost bumping into Melisandre as she enters Jon’s chambers.
Apologies, my Lady.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Sam and Melisandre both look at Jon. Jon nods at Sam, and he leaves. Melisandre closes the door behind him, and Jon straightens up his posture.
Lord Commander.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: How can I help you?
Speaker: JON

Text: Come with us when we ride south. (Walks forwards). None of us know the castle as well as you do. Its hidden tunnels, its weaknesses, its people. Winterfell was your home once. Don't you want to chase the rats out of it? (Turns to Jon).
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Castle Black is my home now. Night's Watch takes no part in the wars of the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: JON

Text: There's only one war. Life against death. Come. Let me show what you're fighting for. (Walks in front of Jon).
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: You're gonna show me some vision in the fire. Forgive me, my Lady. But I don't trust in visions.
Speaker: JON

Text: No visions. No magic. Just life.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: She opens up her robes, naked underneath. She leans back, and takes Jon’s hand, slowly leading it up her body to cup her breast.
Do you feel my heart beating? This power in you, you resist it, and that's your mistake. Embrace it.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Melisandre smiles and looks down at Jon’s hand. Jon looks too. Realizing that she is no longer holding it there, he quickly pulls it away. Melisandre caresses Jon’s face and sits on his lap.
The Lord of Light made us male and female. Two parts of a greater whole. We are joining this power. Power to make life, power to make light, and power to cast shadows.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I don't think Stannis would like that very much.
Speaker: JON

Text: Then we shouldn't tell him. (Starts unbuttoning Jon’s coat).
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I can't.
Speaker: JON

Text: Why?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I swore a vow. (Melisandre looks at him incredulously). I loved another.
Speaker: JON

Text: The dead don't need lovers. Only the living.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Jon keeps her from unbuttoning his coat any further, breathing heavily.
I know. But I still love her.
Speaker: JON

Text: Melisandre stands up, closes her robes, and walks away. After opening the door to leave, she turns to Jon.
You know nothing, Jon Snow.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Jon’s mouth opens a bit. She smirks and leaves.
INT. STANNIS’S ROOM

Stannis sits at his desk, reading something. There’s a knock at the door. After a moment, Shireen enters. Stannis looks up at her and then back down at his reading material. She closes the door. She smiles, but after Stannis doesn’t return her smile, she walks over to a nearby dresser and begins playing with the objects on top of it.
Are you lonely?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: (Turns around, holding something). Just bored.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: My father used to tell me that boredom indicates a lack of inner resources.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: (Looks up). Were you bored a lot, too?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: I know Castle Black is no place for a child, but I -
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I like it. (Walks to a table). I thought I'd be left at home. I know mother didn't want to bring me. (Picks up an X from the table).
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Why do you say that?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: She told me, "I don't want to bring you."
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Shireen fiddles with the objects in her hands. Stannis looks down.
She shouldn't have said that.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Shireen puts down the objects she was playing with, and turns to leave. Before opening the door, she turns back to Stannis.
Are you ashamed of me, father?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Stannis looks up surprised. He puts down what he was doing. Shireen looks down.

When you were an infant, (Stands up and walks around his desk), the Dornish trailer landed on Dragonstone. His goods were junk except for one wooden doll. He'd even sewn a dress on it in the colors of our House. No doubt he'd heard of your birth, and assumed new fathers were easy targets. I still remember how you smiled when I put that doll in your cradle, (Shireen smiles), and you pressed it to your cheek. (Looks down. Shireen’s smile drops). By the time we burnt the doll, it was too late. (Walks to the table and adjusts the objects on it). I was told you would die. Or worse, the grayscale would go slow. (Turns to her). Let you grow just enough to know the world before taking it away from you. Everyone advised me to send you to the ruins of Valyria to live out your short life with the Stone men, before the sickness spread to the castle. I told them all to go to hell. (Shireen smiles). I called in every maester on this side of the world. Every healer, every apothecary. They stopped the disease and saved your life. Because you did not belong across the world with the bloody Stone men. (Walks towards her). You are the Princess Shireen of House Baratheon. And you are my daughter.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: After a moment, Shireen hugs Stannis. At first hesitant, he hugs her back.
WINTERFELL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. TOMBS UNDERNEATH WINTERFELL

Sansa lights a candle on a tomb. She then walks over to Lyanna’s tomb and places a candle in the hand of Lyanna’s statue. She then leans down to pick a dusty feather off of the ground. As she blows off the dust, a figure is seen approaching in the background.
I thought I might find you here. (Sansa turns to him). Your Aunt Lyanna.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Father never talked about her. Sometimes I'd find him down here, lighting the candles. They say she was beautiful.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I saw her once. I was a boy, living with your mother's family. Lord Whent had a great tourney at Harrenhal. Everyone was there. The Mad King, your father, Robert Baratheon. And Lyanna, she was already promised to Robert. You can imagine what it was like for me, a boy from nowhere, with nothing to his name, watching these legendary men, tilting at the lists. The last two riders were Barristan Selmy and Rhaegar Targaryen. When Rhaegar won, everyone cheered for the prince. I remember the girls laughing when he took off his helmet and they saw that silver hair. How handsome he was. Until he rode right past his wife, Elia Martell, and all the smiles died. I've never seen so many people so quiet. He rode past his wife, and he lay a crown of winter roses in Lyanna's lap. Blue as frost. How many tens of thousands had to die because Rhaegar chose your aunt?
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Yes, he chose her… and then he kidnapped her and raped her.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Come. (Takes her arm). Let's speak somewhere the dead can't hear us. (They begin walking away).
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Dressed for riding?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I am.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Where are you going?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: King's Landing.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: King's Landing?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Cersei sent for me. (They stop). We must not let her sniff out any trouble.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: You can't leave me here!
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I know how hard it is to live with people you despise, believe me. But it won't be for long.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: How do you know?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: (They begin walking again). Stannis Baratheon garrisons at Castle Black. He'll march south to King's Landing before the winter snows block his way. But first, he has to take Winterfell.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: You don't know that.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I do. Once he liberates these lands from the Boltons he'll rally your father's bannermen to his cause. With the North behind him, Stannis can finally take the Iron Throne.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: You think he'll defeat the Boltons?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: He has a larger army. He's the finest military commander in Westeros. A betting man would put his money on Stannis. (They stop). As it happens, I am a betting man.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: And if you're right?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Stannis takes Winterfell, he rescues you from the most despised family in the North. Grateful for your late father's courageous support for his claim, he names you Wardeness of the North.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: But I, I wouldn't… Wardeness of the North
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You are the last surviving Stark. He needs you.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: What if you're wrong? What if Stannis never attacks Winterfell, or he does and the Boltons defeat him?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Then you will take this Bolton boy, Ramsay, and make him yours.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: I don't know how to do that.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Of course you do. He's already fallen for you.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: His father frightens me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: He should, he's a dangerous man. But even the most dangerous men can be outmaneuvered. And you’ve learnt to maneuver from the very best. (Puts a hand on her shoulder). I return before too long. (Puts a hand behind her head). You'll be strong without me. (She nods, and he kisses her). The North will be yours. Do you believe me?
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: I expect I'll be a married woman by the time you return.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Baelish chuckles and pats her shoulder. He turns and leaves as Sansa watches him.
DORNE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. BOAT

At night, Bronn and Jaime sit in a boat. Bronn rows to shore alone. Looking across at Jaime, Jaime holds up his fake hand. Bronn begrudgingly goes back to rowing alone. After they get to shore, they carry their boat in, and hide it in some tall grass. They then both walk away.

Jaime awakens to find Bronn standing over him with a knife. His eyes widens and he moves to the side as Bronn brings his knife down on a snake that was about to bite Jaime. Jaime looks at the snake and Bronn pulls his knife out of it.
Breakfast.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Bronn and Jaime sit at a fire. Bronn cooks the snake while Jaime puts gloves on.
That would have been a shit way to die.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: As far as I've seen, they're all shit ways to die.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Aye. But your lot like to give the singers a good ending.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I don't care what's sung about me when I'm dead.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: No? Two knights, off to rescue a princess. Sounds like a good song to me.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Sounds like all the rest.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: While Bronn is distracted eating, Jaime gets rid of his food.
What about you? What shit way would you choose?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: In my own keep, drinking my own wine, watching my sons grovel for my fortune.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: How disappointing. I thought you'd have something more exciting planned.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I've had an exciting life. I want my death to be boring. How do you want to go?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: In the arms of the woman I love.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: She want the same thing?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Let's go.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: They both get up and gather their things. Bronn stomps out the fire. The scene cuts to them walking through some tall grass later.
The captain to that ship… What was he, Braavosi?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Pentoshi.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And he's headed to Oldtown?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: As I said. Why?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: What's to stop him from docking down the coast and telling the locals that Jaime Lannister's in Dorne?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: A bag of gold.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I'm not sure you understand how much people hate your family in this part of the world.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: It was a heavy bag.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And I bet he swore all kinds of oaths to get it. But you won't be around if he breaks them.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: A horse neighs in the distance. Jaime looks around. A group of Dornish riders approach. Bronn and Jaime hide in the grass. Jaime watches the riders.
How many you count?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Four.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: How many you think you can take?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: One, if he's slow.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Bronn turns to look at the riders.
Halt!
Speaker: RIDER

Text: The rider holds up his hand, and the party stops, having spotted Jaime and Bronn’s footsteps.
Fucked in the arse. (Both get up). Hiya! (The riders approach them). Morning, lads. Glad we found you.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Who are you?
Speaker: RIDER

Text: Cooper. (Points to Jaime). This is Darnell.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You're from King's Landing.
Speaker: RIDER

Text: Accent gave me away? Flea Bottom. Whelped and whipped.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Why are you here?
Speaker: RIDER

Text: Our ship capsized in the night. We managed to swim ashore. It was a near thing, really.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I thought the sharks would get us. (Bronn looks at him).
Speaker: JAIME

Text: There are no sharks in Dorne.
Speaker: RIDER

Text: I could have sworn those were shark fins.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Dolphins maybe.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Throw your swords in the sand.
Speaker: RIDER

Text: Boys, there's no need for this. Just, point us in the right direction. We'll find our way home.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Swords in the sand! Now!
Speaker: RIDER

Text: Bronn and Jaime look at each other. They pull out their swords. Bronn puts his down in the sand, and then flings a knife into the throat of a rider. He then kills another, stabbing him and knocking him off of his horse. A third charges him, and Bronn knocks him off of his horse as well. However, he survives. Bronn turns to Jaime.
That one should be slow enough.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Bronn approaches the fourth and final rider. Jaime turns to the injured rider, who is revealed to be much larger than Jaime. They begin fighting. In the background, Bronn knocks the fourth rider off of his horse. As Jaime and the man fight, Jaime is slowly pushed back, down a hill. He falls over and begins rolling to escape his attacker. He loses his balance and his sword is knocked away. As the attacker brings his sword down to kill Jaime, Jaime brings his gold hand up to block it. The sword gets stuck in Jaime’s hand. As the attacker is stuck trying to remove the sword, Jaime picks his back up, kills him, and kicks him down the hill.
Nice move! (Jaime turns to him).
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Luck.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You had a wonderful teacher.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Bronn turns and walks away. Jaime looks back down the hill, and then to his hand. Failing to shake the sword off, he is forced to dislodge it by kicking it out of his own hand. Bronn is then seen cleaning his sword off on the clothes of one of the dead riders. He sheaths his sword as Jaime approaches.
Always wanted a Dornish stallion. Beasts can run a day and night without tiring. We'll ride to the Water Gardens with a nice breeze in our face.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: First we need to bury these bodies.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Birds have to eat too.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Corpses raise questions, questions raise armies. We're not here to start a war.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Do you know how long it will take us to dig all those holes?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: (Holding out his hand). I can't dig very well with one hand. Not at all, really.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Jaime walks away as Bronn’s face drops. He begins dragging a body.
EXT. BEACH

Elaria, in all black, swiftly rides down a beach on horseback. She approaches a tent. Nearby are some more horses, and in the tent are Nymeria, Obara, and Tyene. Tyene exits the tent to meet her as she dismounts.
Nama!
Speaker: TYENE

Text: Tyene and Elaria embrace.
Nym, Obara.
Speaker: ELARIA

Text: Will it be war?
Speaker: OBARA

Text: Prince Doran will weep for your father, but nothing else. We must avenge Oberyn ourselves.
Speaker: ELARIA

Text: Without Doran we have no army to march against the Lannisters.
Speaker: OBARA

Text: We don't need an army to start a war. (Drinks water). Queen Cersei loves her children, and we have one of them.
Speaker: ELARIA

Text: We may have a problem.
Speaker: NYMERIA

Text: Nymeria uses a whip to knock a bucket away. Underneath is the captain who brought Jaime and Bronn to Dorne, buried neck-deep in sand and covered in scorpions.
A ship's captain, who found me in Planky Town, claiming he had information to sell. He told me he smuggled Jaime Lannister into Dorne.
Speaker: OBARA

Text: He's come for Myrcella. If he gets to her before we do, we lose our only chance for revenge. You must choose. Doran's way and peace, or my way and war.
Speaker: ELARIA

Text: (Walks towards her). I'm with you. Always. (Elaria puts a hand to her face).
Speaker: TYENE

Text: Nym? (Nymeria nods). Obara?
Speaker: ELARIA

Text: When I was a child, (Begins walking), Oberyn came to take me to court. I'd never seen this man, and yet he called himself my father. My mother wept, said I was too young, and a girl.
Speaker: OBARA

Text: Oberyn tossed his spear at my feet and said, "Girl or boy, we fight our battles. But the Gods let us choose our weapons." My father pointed to the spear, and then to my mother's tears.
Obara picks up a spear that was sticking out of the sand. She twirls it around for a moment, and then tosses it through the captain’s head, killing him.
(Smiles). I made my choice long ago.
Speaker: OBARA

Text: Elaria and Tyene smile.
EXT. BOAT AT SEA
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Jorah steers the boat as Tyrion, tied up and gagged, tries to speak. He only succeeds in mumbling. Eventually he stops trying to say real words, and instead only tries to be as loud as possible, to annoy Jorah. Jorah comes over and ungags him, and then walks back over to continue steering.
Thank you. (After a long pause). Who are you?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Your captor.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Do you have wine?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I can't sleep without wine.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Then stay awake.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You're going the wrong way. My sister's in Westeros. Westeros is west! We're heading east.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm not taking you to your sister.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You said you were taking me to the Queen.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I am. Queen Daenerys Targaryen. She's the Queen I serve.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: (Chuckles). What a waste of a good kidnapping. So happens I was heading there myself!
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What business would you have with the Queen?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Gold and glory. Oh, and hate. If you've ever met my sister, you'd understand. So now that it's clear we're on the same side? (Holds out his hands expectantly. Jorah makes no move to respond). A high born knight from the North of Westeros, down on his luck in Essos. Dragon epaulettes? Bear sigil breast plate. You're Jorah Mormont. I have to ask how, exactly, were you serving your Queen in a whore house, half a world away? Is it possible, that you were running? Why would you be running? And why would she have sent you away? Oh, wait! You were spying on her, weren't you? It's all coming back to me! I was drunk through most of the Small Council meetings, but it's all coming back. You passed notes to Varys's little birds. She found out, didn't she? Found out, and exiled you. (Jorah looks downtrodden). And now you hope to win back her favor with a gift. A risky scheme. One might even say, desperate. Do you think Daenerys would execute me, and pardon you? I'd say the reverse is just as likely.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Jorah stops steering and approaches Tyrion. Tyrion holds out his hands again, but Jorah strikes him, knocking him unconscious. He then goes back to steering, looking worried.
YUNKAI
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. BALCONY OVERLOOKING THE CITY
Daenerys and Ser Barristan stand on the balcony.
Everyone looks happy enough from up here. (Barristan chuckles). What?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I was thinking of all the times your brother made me go with him down from the Red Keep, into the streets of King's Landing.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: Why?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: He liked to walk among the people, he liked to sing to them.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: He sang to them?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Yes. Rhaegar would take a spot on the Hook or the Street of Seeds and then he'd sing. Just like all the other minstrels.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: And what did you do?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I made sure no one killed him. And I collected the money. (Daenerys looks surprised). Well he liked to see how much he could make.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: He was good?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: He was very good. Viserys never told you?
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: He told me Rhaegar was good at killing people. (Sits down).
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Rhaegar never liked killing. He loved singing.
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: And what did you do with the money?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Well, one time, he gave it to the next minstrel down the street. One time, he gave it to an orphanage in Flea Bottom. One time... we got horribly drunk. (They both laugh).
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: (Entering). Your Grace. Hizdahr is here, waiting in your audience chamber.
Speaker: DARIO

Text: How many others are there?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Fifty a hundred.
Speaker: DARIO

Text: Will you be joining us, Ser Barristan?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I think I can protect you from Hizdahr Zo Loraq.
Speaker: DARIO

Text: I think I can protect me from Hizdahr Zo Loraq. Go, Ser Barristan. Sing a song for me.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your Grace. (Leaves).
Speaker: BARRISTAN

Text: INT. AUDIENCE CHAMBER
All men must die. But not all can die in glory.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: Glory?
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Why else do men fight? Why did your ancestors cross the Narrow Sea and conquer the Seven Kingdoms? So their names would live on. Those who find victory in the fighting pits, will never become kings, but their names will live on. It's the best chance they'll ever have.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: Is that what you used to tell men before you set them to butchering each other for sport?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your Grace, today is the traditional start of the fighting season.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: I do not recognize this tradition.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Traditions are the only thing that will hold this city, your city, together. (Shots of Sons of the Harpy walking through tunnels with torches). Without them, former slaves and former masters have nothing in common. Nothing but centuries of mistrust and resentment. I can't promise this is the answer to all our problems, but it's a start.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: EXT. MARKETPLACE

A prostitute and a soldier laugh with each other. Another soldier talks with some women. Some Sons of the Harpy kill all of the soldiers in the area, causing panic. In a nearby alley, some Unsullied march. Hearing the chaos, they begin running towards the market. They find the prostitute crying over the body of the dead soldier.
(Speaking another language) Sons of the Harpy.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: She gestures in the direction the sons went. The Unsullied run in that direction. When they are out of view, she stops her act and wipes the tears away. The Unsullied enter a corridor, expecting to catch the sons. Instead, they themselves are ambushed from every direction by Sons of the Harpy. After a tense few moments, a fight breaks out. During the fight, one of the Unsullied’s helmet is knocked off, and is revealed to be Grey Worm. Another fight breaks out elsewhere. The two Unsullied there are killed almost immediately. Barristan walks down an alley and, upon noticing the chaos, heads to the fighting. Grey Worm is badly injured, and with his party killed, also badly outnumbered. Unsullied are shown being killed elsewhere. Grey Worm continues holding off the sons, and Barristan arrives to assist him. They are able to kill all of the sons, but are both seriously injured in the process. They fall unconscious, and the camera pans up to show them surrounded by all of the dead sons and Unsullied.
END EPISODE
TITLE SEQUENCEINT. ROOM
Grey Worm lays in a bed, asleep. Missandei stands over him, crying.
INT. THRONE ROOM
The room is dark, except for some candles. Daenerys and Daario stand over the body of Barristan. Hizdahr enters with two men.
I am so sorry, my queen. He was a good man.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: "Barristan the Bold" they called him. He crossed a continent to serve me. He was a loyal friend. And he died in an alley, butchered by cowards who hide behind masks.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: We could pull back to the pyramid district, secure it, and use it as a base from which to operate. Then we clean the city out, neighborhood by neighborhood, street by street, until the rats have nowhere left to hide.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Daario walks over the Daenerys and looks at Hizdahr. He looks back. Daenerys turns around.
I prefer your earlier suggestion. Round up the leaders of each of Meereen's great families and bring them to me.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: But... I'm the leader of my family.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: Daario nods. The two men behind Hizdahr grab and restrain him. He is taken away.
No, Your Grace! I had nothing to do with this. Your Grace!
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: INT. DRAGON CHAMBER

Daenerys, Daario, some Unsullied, and a number of men stand in the chamber. Daario holds a torch. After a few moments, Daenerys turns around and begins walking. Daario follows her. Then a chain can be heard rattling. Daenerys and Daario turn around.
(in Valyrian) Walk forward.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Unsullied lower their spears at the other men.
(Valyrian) You cannot do this.
Speaker: MAN

Text: The Unsullied begin walking forward, forcing the men to move. After a few moments, they stop. Chains rattle again.
(Valyrian) Another step.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Unsullied and the men take another step. Chains rattle and an unseen dragon snarls. Daenerys walks through the Unsullied to the front of the group.

(Valyrian) They will eat you, if I tell them to. They may eat you even if I don’t. Children. Some say I should give up on them. (One of the men is mumbling). But a good mother never gives up on her children. She disciplines them if she must.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Daenerys looks at Daario. He walks over and pushes the mumbling man forward, onto his knees.
(Valyrian) But she does not give up on them.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The man’s eyes widen. A dragon comes out of the shadows and breathes fire on him. He screams and dies. The dragons take his corpse, tear it in two, and eat it.
(Valyrian) Who is innocent? Maybe all of you are, (Looks at Hizdahr), maybe none of you are. Maybe, (Touching Hizdahr’s arm), I should let the dragons decide.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (Valyrian) All men must die.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: The other men besides Hizdahr grovel before Daenerys. The dragons continue eating. After a moment, she takes her hand off of Hizdahr.
Don't want to overfeed them. Tomorrow perhaps.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Daario and the Unsullied take the men out. Daenerys watches her dragons eat for a moment, and then walks out herself.
CASTLE BLACK
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. LIBRARY
Sam sits at a table, reading a letter. Aemon is with him.

"And though Daenerys maintains her grip on Slaver's Bay, forces rise against her from within and without. She refuses to leave until the freedom of the former slaves is secure." She sounds like quite a woman.
Speaker: SAM

Text: And she's alone, under siege, no family to guide her or protect her. Her last relation thousands of miles away, useless, dying.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: Don't say that, Maester Aemon.
Speaker: SAM

Text: A Targaryen, alone in the world, is a terrible thing.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: Jon walks in.
Maester Aemon.
Speaker: JON

Text: Lord Commander.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: Sam, I'd like to speak to the maester alone.
Speaker: JON

Text: Sam gets up, grabs his papers, and leaves. Jon walks over and sits at the table.
How are you feeling?
Speaker: JON

Text: Oh, like a hundred-year-old man slowly freezing to death.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: I need your advice. There's something I want to do, something I have to do. But it'll divide the Night's Watch. Bitterly. Half the men will hate me the moment I give the order.
Speaker: JON

Text: Half the men hate you already, Lord Commander. Do it.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: But you don't know what it is.
Speaker: JON

Text: That doesn't matter. You do. You will find little joy in your command. But with luck, you will find the strength to do what needs to be done. Kill the boy, Jon Snow. Winter is almost upon us. Kill the boy, and let the man be born.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: INT. ROOM
Jon and Tormund sit across from each other at a table.
Where are the rest of the free folk now? (Tormund scoffs). Where have they gone? (No response). Who leads them?
Speaker: JON

Text: They followed Mance. They won't follow anyone else.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: What about you?
Speaker: JON

Text: Hard to lead when you're in chains.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: What if I unchained you?
Speaker: JON

Text: Why would you do that?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Because you are not my enemy. And I'm not yours.
Speaker: JON

Text: You sure seemed like my enemy when you were killing my friends.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: For 8,000 years the Night's Watch have sworn an oath to be the shield that guards the realms of men. And for 8,000 years we've fallen short of that oath. You belong to the realms of men. All of you.
Speaker: JON

Text: And now everything is going to change?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: It is.
Speaker: JON

Text: Why now?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Because now, (Leans forward), I am Lord Commander of the Night's Watch.
Speaker: JON

Text: What would you have me do, (Leans forward), Lord Commander?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: (Stands up). I'd have you go north of the Wall. Gather the remaining free folk wherever they are and bring them back here. I'll open the gates for them and let them through. I'll find them lands to settle south of the Wall.
Speaker: JON

Text: They won't kneel for you and neither will I.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I don't want them to kneel for me. I want them to fight with me when the time comes.
Speaker: JON

Text: The day I ask my people to fight with the crows is the day my people cut my guts from my belly and make me eat them.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: And how many of your people can't fight? The women, the children, the old, the sick, what happens to them? You're condemning them to death. Worse than death because you're too proud to make peace. Or maybe you're not proud. Maybe you're just a coward.
Speaker: JON

Text: (Stands up). Easy thing to say to a man in chains.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Jon unchains Tormund. Tormund’s eyes widen as he feels his hands.

Your people need a leader. And they need to get south of the Wall before it's too late. We don't have much time and they have less. The walkers are coming and they'll hit your people first. I'm not asking you to make peace to save your skin. Make peace to save your people.
Speaker: JON

Text: Most of them are at Hardhome. You know where that is?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Up on Storrold's Point. I can give you 10 horses and nine other men. You can get there in a week.
Speaker: JON

Text: We'll need ships.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I'll talk to King Stannis about lending you his fleet.
Speaker: JON

Text: All right, then. You're coming with me. You're the Lord Commander of the Night's Watch. They need to hear it from you. They need to know the ships they are boarding won’t be torched in the middle of the sea. You come with me, or I don't go.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: INT. DINING HALL
The Night’s Watchmen present talk amongst themselves. Stannis and Davos are present. Jon stands at a table in the front of the room with Allister and two others. One of them addresses Jon.
You'd bring wildlings here, through our gates?
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: Men, women, and children will die by the thousands if we do nothing.
Speaker: JON

Text: Let them die. We got our own to worry about. Less enemies for us.
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: Some of the men in the crowd cheer.
Fewer.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: What?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Nothing.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: (Standing up) There is good farmland in the Gift. (Laughter). Land that no one uses now. A dozen abandoned villages.
Speaker: SAM

Text: And why do you think the farmers abandoned those villages? Because the wildlings raided them for years. Cut them down! Just like they did this boy's people.
Speaker: MAN 2

Text: The man points to Olly, who lowers his head. Sam sits down.
We've been fighting them all for thousands of years. They've slaughtered villages. They've slaughtered our brothers.
Speaker: ALLISTER

Text: And we've slaughtered theirs.
Speaker: JON

Text: I will follow you anywhere, you know that. But they killed Grenn. And they killed Pyp. (Men mumble in agreement). They killed 50 of our brothers. I can't forget that. I can't forgive it.
Speaker: EDD

Text: You were at the Fist of the First Men. If we abandon them, you know what they become. We can learn to live with the wildlings or we can add them to the army of the dead. Whatever they are now, they're better than that.
Speaker: JON

Text: The men in the room return to bickering loudly.
INT. LORD COMMANDER’S ROOM
Jon walks in, takes off his coat, and puts his hands on his desk. Olly knocks and walks in with a plate of food, and sets it down.
Thank you. (Olly walks away). Olly. (He stops). If you have something you want to say to me, say it. It's all right.
Speaker: JON

Text: You don't mean it, do you? Telling the wildlings you want to make peace. You're just doing it to trick them.
Speaker: OLLY

Text: It's not a trick.
Speaker: JON

Text: They burned my village. They put an arrow through my father's head right in front of me. They butchered my mother, everyone I ever knew.
Speaker: OLLY

Text: I know what it's like to lose the people you love. I know this is hard for you. But winter is coming. We know what's coming with it. We can't face it alone.
Speaker: JON

Text: Will there be anything else you need, Lord Commander?
Speaker: OLLY

Text: No.
Speaker: JON

Text: Olly leaves. Jon sighs.
WINTERFELL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. COURTYARD
Podrick walks carrying some supplies. He enters a building. Inside, Brienne stares out of a window. Podrick sets down the supplies.
She's far away from the Lannisters. This is her home. Maybe Lady Sansa is better off here.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: (Turns around). Better off with the Boltons who murdered her mother and brother? Sansa's in danger even if she doesn't realize it.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: A man enters with some water and a towel.
Thank you. You've lived here a long time?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Aye.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Did you know Lord Eddard?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I knew him and his father before him. The Starks are gone now.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Not all of them. I know who's inside that castle.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Everyone knows. The Boltons.
Speaker: MAN

Text: I'm not talking about the Boltons. I need to get a message to her. To Sansa Stark.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Who are you?
Speaker: MAN

Text: Someone who swore to keep her safe.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Swore to who?
Speaker: MAN

Text: Her mother.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Her mother's dead.
Speaker: MAN

Text: That doesn't release me from an oath. I served Lady Catelyn. I serve her still. Who do you serve?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: INT. RAMSAY’S CHAMBERS
Myranda stands naked in front of a window.
Come back here. Myranda.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: I saw you staring at her.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: I'm going to marry her. That will involve looking at her from time to time.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: You said you'd marry me.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: And I meant it. When I was a bastard named Snow. But I'm a Bolton now. What I want is no longer the primary consideration. I'm furthering a dynasty.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Do you think she's pretty?
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: Of course I do. I'm not blind.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Ramsay sighs and gets up. He walks over to Myranda and grabs her waist.
You think she's pretty, too. I'm looking forward to our wedding night. But don't worry, I'll have plenty of time for you.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Perhaps I'll marry, too.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: (Laughs). You're the kennel master's daughter. Who are you going to marry, the stable keeper's son? (She tries to hit him, but he restrains her). You're mine. You're not going anywhere. Unless I have to listen to more of your jealousy. Jealousy bores me. You remember what happens to people who bore me. You're not going to bore me, are you, Myranda?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: After a moment, Myranda kisses him. She then bites down hard on his lower lip, causing it to bleed.
(Smiles). Never.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: Ramsay smiles back. They begin having sex.
INT. SANSA’S CHAMBERS
Sansa sits alone at a table. There’s a knock on the door. She turns, gets up, and opens it. An old servant woman comes in.
Beg pardon, my lady. I've come to refill the wash basin.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: Oh, I don't need-
Speaker: SANSA

Text: (Closes the door). You still have friends in the North. If you're ever in trouble, light a candle in the highest window of the broken tower.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: But who -
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You're not alone.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: The woman leaves, and closes the door.
EXT. OUTSIDE
Sansa walks through the snow, looking up at the broken tower. Myranda approaches her.
I like your dress. Who made it for you?
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: I made it myself.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Really?
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: Who, who are you?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I'm Myranda, the kennel master's daughter. May I? (Takes Sansa’s arm and inspects her sleeve). Oh, wonderful. The stitching. Who taught you?
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: My mother. (Pulls away).
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I'm sorry for what happened to her.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: Thank you.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: It's good that she taught you. It was a gift. Now every time you wear something you made, you can remember her.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: I'd rather have a mother.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I know. It's not the same. Still, it's good to remember. Remember the way things were. I almost forgot. There's something else to help you remember.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: INT. DUNGEON ENTRANCE
Myranda opens the gate and lets Sansa in. Some dogs bark.
Down there at the end.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: What is it?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: That would spoil the surprise. Go ahead, it's perfectly safe. You won't believe it when you see it.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: The dogs continue barking and growling. Sansa walks down the aisle of cages. Most contain dogs. Sansa looks behind to see Myranda has disappeared. She comes to the last cage, which is open. Inside is Theon, on the floor. He gets up and notices her.
Theon?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You shouldn't be here.
Speaker: THEON

Text: She looks at him angrily. He backs away from her. She leaves.
INT. RAMSAY’S CHAMBERS
Theon unties Ramsay’s jacket.
You smell particularly ripe this evening. Pour me some wine.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Theon walks over to a table and pours some wine. He then brings it over to Ramsay, who drinks it.
Do you have something to tell me?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: No, my lord.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Reek.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: (Stuttering). She saw me.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Who?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Sansa. Lady Sansa. She came to the kennels.
Speaker: THEON

Text: She saw you?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Yes. I'm sorry, master. Forgive me. I didn't think -
Speaker: THEON

Text: Come here.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Theon walks forward. Ramsay holds his chin.
You mustn't keep secrets from me, Reek. Get on your knees.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Theon gets on his knees. Ramsay sips his wine, and then puts it aside. Theon looks down.
Give me your hand.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Theon hesitantly holds his hand up. As Ramsay takes it, Theon begins stammering. After a moment, Ramsay cups Theon’s hand with his own hands.
I forgive you.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Theon looks up. Ramsay smiles.
INT. DINING HALL
Sansa, Ramsay, Roose, and Walda sit at a table, eating.
I trust you find your chamber suitable, my lady.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Yes, thank you, my lord.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Allow me.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Ramsay pours Sansa some wine.
Mother.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Thank you, Ramsay.
Speaker: WALDA

Text: He pours her some wine as well. She smiles. Ramsay gets up and holds his wine up.
My lady, we are all a family, we northerners. Our blood ties go back thousands of years. So I'd like to drink to our wedding. May our happiness spread from Moat Cailin to the Last Hearth.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: (Raises his cup). To your wedding.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: (Raises her cup). To your wedding.
Speaker: WALDA

Text: Ramsay takes a large sip of wine. Sansa puts her own glass down. Ramsay sits down.
It must be difficult for you being in a strange place.
Speaker: WALDA

Text: This isn't a strange place. This is my home. It's the people who are strange.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You're right. Very strange. More wine, please.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Theon enters the room with some wine. Sansa looks away.
(Turns around). Yes, master.
Speaker: THEON

Text: That's his new name, Reek.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Why are you doing this?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Because Reek has something to say to you. Don't you, Reek? (He gestures Theon over). An apology. Apologize to Lady Sansa for what you did. Apologize for murdering her two brothers.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Theon shakes his head "no" when Ramsay looks away
(After a moment, stuttering). I'm sorry.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Look at her, Reek. An apology doesn't mean anything if you're not looking the person in the eye.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: I'm sorry.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Sorry about what?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: For killing your brothers.
Speaker: THEON

Text: There, over and done with. Doesn't everyone feel better? I do. That was getting very tense. Whew. (Theon turns to leave). You know what, my lady? What with him having murdered your brothers and the rest of your family gone Reek here is the nearest thing to living kin that you have left. Reek. You will give away the bride. Someone has to. What better person? Good? Good?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Yes, yes, very good.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Wonderful. (Sips wine).
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Walda and I have some good news as well, since we're all together.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: We're going to have a baby.
Speaker: WALDA

Text: I'm very happy for you.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: From the way she's carrying, Maester Wolkan says it looks like a boy.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Ramsay sips some wine and angrily sets his cup down. Sansa looks at him smugly.
INT. ROOSE’S WAR ROOM
Ramsay and Roose sit at a war table.
How can you be sure?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Sure of what?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: That she's pregnant. I mean how can you tell?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Maester Wolkan has assured us beyond all doubt.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Ramsay gets up and walks around to the other side of the table, wine in hand.
So how did you manage it?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Manage what?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Getting her pregnant.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: I imagine you're familiar with the procedure.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Of course, but how did you find it?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: You disgraced yourself at dinner, parading that creature before the Stark girl.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: And if it's a boy?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: You're worried about your position.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: My position is quite clear. I'm your son until a better alternative comes along.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Ramsay finished his wine and goes to get more.
You've never asked me about your mother.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Why would I? She had me, she died. And here we are.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: She was a peasant girl. Pretty in a common sort of way. She was the miller's wife. Apparently they had married without my knowledge or consent. So I had him hanged and I took her beneath the tree where he was swaying. She fought me the whole time. She was lucky I didn't hang her, too. A year later she came to my gates with a squalling baby in her arms. A baby she claimed was mine. I nearly had her whipped and the child thrown in the river. (Stands up). But then I looked at you and I saw then what I see now. You are my son. (After a moment). Stannis Baratheon has an army at Castle Black. But he won't stay for long. He wants the Iron Throne, and the road to King's Landing comes right through Winterfell. He means to take the North. But the North is ours. It's yours and mine. Will you help me defeat him?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Yes.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: CASTLE BLACK
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. LIBRARY
Gilly walks through the bookshelves, examining them. Sam sits at the table reading.
Is this every book there is?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Every book there is?
Speaker: SAM

Text: In the world.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Well, no. There are thousands and thousands of books out there. This library is rather small, actually.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Where you grew up, were there more books?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: My father's not the most literate man. They say the Citadel has the largest library in the world.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Where's that?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: The Citadel? In Oldtown.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I'm sorry I don't know things.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Gilly, look at me. You know how to do a hundred things I can never do. You can build a fire with wet wood. You can cook. You can stitch a wound.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I can wash the linens. I can sweep the floor.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Well -
Speaker: SAM

Text: Why does the Citadel have the biggest library?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: It's where they train the maesters.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Like Maester Aemon?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I wanted to be one when I was young. Instead, I became a man of the Night's Watch. Far more adventure up here anyway. I wouldn't have met you.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Stannis enters the library. Sam stands up.
Ah, Your Grace.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Gilly quickly exits.
You're Samwell Tarly?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I am, Your Grace.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Your father is Randyll Tarly. He defeated my brother at the Battle of Ashford. Only battle Robert ever lost. I told him he shouldn't go so far west so soon, but he never listened. Fine soldier, your father. You don't look like a soldier. But I'm told you killed a white walker.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I did, Your Grace.
Speaker: SAM

Text: How?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: With a dagger made of dragonglass.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Dragonglass?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: What the maesters call obsidian -
Speaker: SAM

Text: I know what it is. We have it in Dragonstone. Why would obsidian kill a walker?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I don't know. I've been going through all the old manuscripts hoping to find something, and all I've learned is that the children of the forest used to hunt with dragonglass.
Speaker: SAM

Text: The Lady Melisandre told me that death marches on the Wall.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I've seen it, Your Grace.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Seen what?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: The army of the dead. And when they come -
Speaker: SAM

Text: We have to know how to fight them. (After a moment). Keep reading, Samwell Tarly.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Stannis leaves.
INT. DINING HALL
Davos carves away at a piece of wood. Stannis approaches him.
It's time.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Uh, Your Grace. Wouldn't it be better to wait? When Jon Snow returns with the wildlings, we could have thousands more men.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: If Jon Snow returns with the wildlings. We can't wait that long. We have the advantage, more men, more horses, all fed and rested. But every day we wait, the odds shift in Bolton's favor. This could turn to winter at any moment. We have to act now. Give the order. We march at sunrise.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I'll choose a dozen men to stay and guard the queen and the princess.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: No need, they're coming with us.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: It's a tough road ahead, Your Grace. Won't they be safer -
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Here? Half these watchmen are killers and rapists. No, they march with us.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: They walk outside.
As you wish, Your Grace.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Stannis walks away. Davos spots Melisandre.
Stannis’s men prepare to ride out. Sam and Gilly watch. Gilly holds baby Sam. Olly, Edd, and some other watchmen are also shown watching.
(On horseback). Do you think Father will let me go down into the crypt?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Beg your pardon?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: At Winterfell. All the Kings in the North are buried there. Bran the Builder and King Dorren and-
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: First things first. It's a long march ahead. And then we have to take the castle.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Is there going to be a battle?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Aye, princess, but you won't be anywhere near -
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: That's enough talk of battle, Ser Davos. You'll scare the child.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Yes, my queen.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I'm not scared.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Well, I am. When the battle comes, promise you'll protect me.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: (Smiling). I promise.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Shireen looks back at Gilly. Selyse catches her, and she looks down and away. Jon walks through the courtyard. He and Stannis meet on some stairs.
I hope you know what you're doing with these wildlings. I need those ships.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: You'll get them back, I swear it. Have a safe journey, Your Grace. And thank you.
Speaker: JON

Text: Jon watches Stannis walk away and get on his horse. He makes eye contact with Melisandre, but she looks away. Stannis and his army begin leaving.
MEEREN
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: INT. GREY WORM’S ROOM
Missandei watches over Grey Worm. He suddenly gets up, startling her.
You're still too weak. (He lays back down).
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: (Valyrian) How long have I been here?
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: (Valyrian) Three days.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: He looks at her. His face is bruised.
Ser Barristan?
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Missandei shakes her head.
(Valyrian) I failed him. I failed my men, I failed my queen.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: (Valyrian) You failed no one. You fought bravely. You’ll fight again. (In Common Tongue) Are you ashamed? You were ambushed, outnumbered. There was no way you could have known.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: This is not why. Wounded in war, there is no shame for this. I am ashamed because when the knife go in and I fall to the ground, I am afraid.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: All men fear death.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: No, not death. I fear I never again see Missandei from the Island of Naath.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Missandei looks down, on the verge of tears. She gets up and lies down in the bed with him, caressing his face, and then kissing him.
INT. DAENERYS’S CHAMBERS
Missandei and Daenerys stand, talking.
Now you have given the Masters what they deserve.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: If I give everyone what they deserve, I'll have no one left to rule. Ser Barristan counseled mercy when I took this city right up to the morning he died. Daario Naharis thinks I should kill the former Masters and let the rest of the city fend for itself. What do you think?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your Grace, I think that I am not fit to have an opinion on these matters.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: (Sitting down). You are as fit as anyone I know. You know why I'm here. And you know who will suffer the most if this all falls apart. So what do you think?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I can only tell you what I have seen, Your Grace. (Sitting down). I have seen you listen to your counselors. I have seen you lean on their experience when your own was lacking and weigh the choices they put before you. And I have seen you ignore your counselors, because there was a better choice. One that only you could see.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: INT. DUNGEONS
Daenerys is led by Unsullied to a room in a dungeon. The door is opened to reveal Hizdahr. She enters, and he kneels before her.
My, my queen, please do not do this.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: What about "Valar Morghulis"?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I did not want to die a coward. Apparently I do not want to die at all. (Sniffles).
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: It takes courage to admit fear. And to admit a mistake. I came here to tell you that I was wrong. I was wrong and you were right. About tradition. About bringing the people of this city together. I will reopen the fighting pits. To free men only. Slavery will never return to Meereen, not while I live.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Yes, my queen.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: And in order to forge a lasting bond with the Meereenese people, I will marry the leader of an ancient family. (Hizdahr nods). Thankfully a suitor is already on his knees.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Hizdahr looks surprised. Daenerys faintly smiles, and then leaves. Hizdahr is left in the cell, with the door wide open.
SEA
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EXT. JORAH’S BOAT
Tyrion wakes up and feels his head.

Don't worry. I'll be fine. Nothing broken, I don't think. Where are we now? Not the Rhoyne. (No response). Long, sullen silences and an occasional punch in the face. The Mormont way. Let's start over. I apologize for before. My mouth sometimes runs away from me. This doesn't have to be an unpleasant trip. We're going to be spending a lot of time together on the way to Meereen.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We are.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: What would make our time together truly enjoyable would be some wine.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No wine.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I am a person who drinks. People who drink need to keep drinking. Otherwise, they're not…
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Jorah stands up and looks ahead. Tyrion turns as well. A large bank of fog lies ahead of the boat.
I know where we are. You're taking us through Valyria.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I am.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Have you sailed this route before?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You're going to bring Daenerys a souvenir from her ancestral homeland in case I'm not enough?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I think you'll be plenty.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You know what they say. The Doom still rules Valyria. What about the demons and the flames? Aren't you afraid of the Doom?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No. But the pirates are.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Oh.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: EXT. RIVER SURROUNDED BY WOODS
The Smoking Sea. How many centuries before we learn how to build cities like this again? Thousands of years the Valyrians were the best in the world at almost everything. And then -

Text: And then they weren't.

Text: And then they weren't. "They held each other close and turned their backs upon the end. The hills that split asunder and the black that ate the skies; The flames that shot so high and hot that even dragons burned; Would never be the final sights that fell upon their eyes. A fly upon a wall, the waves the sea wind whipped and churned -"
Speaker: TYRION

Text: "The city of a thousand years, and all that men had learned; The Doom consumed it all alike, and neither of them turned."

What was that?

Mormont! Mormont!

A stone man grabs his ankle and begins attempting to pull him down. The screen fades to black. After a few moments, we see Tyrion’s perspective. Jorah stands over him as his eyes slowly blink open.

(Faintly). Tyrion? Tyrion. Tyrion. Tyrion. You're all right.

Speaker: TYRION

Text: Jorah walks away. After looking out for a moment, he stops, and pulls up his sleeve. He examines his wrist, which has the beginnings of greyscale. After a moment, he begins walking again.

Speaker: RIDER

Text: Cut to inside the carriage.
Oh! You can smell the shit from 5 miles away. Well, why are we stopped, go on.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Rumors and gossip, that’s all they got. It’s theater, nothing more. If they arrested all the pillow biters in King’s Landing there’d be no room left in the dungeons for anyone else.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Everyone knew about him and Renly.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Renly Baratheon shagged half the stable boys in the Seven Kingdoms. Everyone knew. No one cared.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: But he was the king’s brother.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: And Loras is the queen’s brother. No, no, no, no, this is unacceptable.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Cersei is behind this.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Of course she is. She wants to drag our names through the dirt. Put us in our place. Get some rest, dear, you look appalling. Let me deal with Cersei Lannister.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: INT. CERSEI’S ROOM
Cersei writes at her desk without acknowledging Olenna.
Your Grace, I have travelled a long way.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: You must be exhausted.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Put the pen down, dear, we all know you aren’t writing anything.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Ah, yes, the famously tart-tongued queen of thorns.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: And the famous tart Queen Cersei.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Beg your pardon.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I know you’re behind this absurd incarceration of my grandson.
Speaker: OLENNA
