Text: If you apologize for that comment perhaps--
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You’ll get your apology when I get Loras.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: I was as shocked as anyone when The Faith arrested Ser Loras. I have no love for these fanatics. But what can the queen mother do?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Has the crown suddenly stopped needing the troops, gold, and wheat my house supplies?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: I assure you our alliance with House Tyrell remains--
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Do you expect the alliance to continue after you’ve thrown our future into prison?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: As I said, i didn’t imprison anyone. As for your veiled threats--
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: What veil?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The Lannister-Tyrell alliance brought peace to a war-torn country. Do you really want to see the Seven Kingdoms slide back into warfare?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I didn’t trust your father. I didn’t particularly like him. But I respected him. He was no fool. He understood that sometimes we must work with our rivals rather than destroy them.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: House Lannister has no rival. The High Septon has called for an inquest, not a trial. Just a small hearing to determine whether the charges against Loras have merit, which I’m sure they don’t. Loras will be freed, our happy alliance will continue, and we’ll forget this unfortunate conversation ever happened. Good day, Lady Olenna.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: INT. HIGH SEPTON’S ROOM
You are aware of the rumors concerning you and Renly?
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: I don’t pay attention to rumors.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: You were said to be despondent when he died. Witnesses said that you refused to leave his bedside, even as Stannis’ army closed in
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: He was my friend. He was my king.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Wasn’t Joffrey your king? He was anointed by the 7, not Renly.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: I was wrong to support Renly’s claim. I know that. But I was forgiven by Joffrey. I fought for him at the Battle of the Blackwater.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Wearing Renly’s armor.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Why does it matter what I wore?
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Do you deny all of the charges against you? Fornication, buggery, blasphemy.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Of course I deny them.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: You never lay with Renly Baratheon.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Never.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Nor any other man.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Never.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: That will be all Ser Loras.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Loras walks back to his seat.
Well I think that’s quite enough of that.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Faith calls Queen Margaery forward.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: You call me forward?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Yes. We have some questions for you.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: I am the queen.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: You are. And according to Law of the Seven, neither kings nor queens are exempt from testimony at a holy inquest.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Margaery walks to the stand.
How do you respond to these charges against your brother?
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: They are lies.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: All of them?
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: All of them.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Queen Margaery, in the presence of the gods, do you swear that your brother is innocent of these charges against him, to the best of your knowledge?
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Yes, I swear it.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Thank you, your grace.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: The Faith brings Olyvar in. Loras looks shocked. Cersei gives a thin smile.
Do you know this man?
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Yes, very well. He is Ser Loras Tyrell, heir to Highgarden.
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: How did you come to meet?
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: I squired for him. He took a liking to me. He summoned me to his chamber the first day we met.
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: And what occurred in his chamber?
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: We engaged in intimate relations.
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: You laid with him?
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: That night and many others.
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: Liar! He’s a liar!
Speaker: LORAS

Text: Is there anyone else who can support your claim?
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Yes, yes, Queen Margaery. She walked in on us once not long ago. She didn’t seem surprised.
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: This testimony is an insult to a great house. Why should The Faith or anyone else take the word of a squire over the heir to Highgarden?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: He has a birthmark, your grace. Quite high on his thigh, wine-colored, and roughly the shape of Dorne.
Speaker: OLYVAR

Text: Loras jumps at Olyvar and The Faith restrains him. Margaery and Olenna get up to leave and The Faith blocks their way.
Liar!
Speaker: LORAS

Text: What are you doing? Let us pass.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The Faith is satisfied that there is enough evidence to bring a formal trial for Ser Loras... and Queen Margaery.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: What?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Bearing false witness before the gods is as grave a sin as any. Take her.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: The Faith grabs her and carries her out of the room.
Tommen! Tommen!
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: King Tommen looks around the room, unsure of what to do.
You can’t do this, I am the queen! Tommen, Tommen! I am your queen, how dare you!
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Olenna glares at Cersei. Cersei smiles back.
Sansa looks at herself in the mirror. She hears a knock and opens the door. It's Myranda.
What do you want?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Lord Ramsay sent me to draw your bath, my lady. You want to be clean and fresh for your new husband don’t you?
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: Cut to Sansa in the bath. Myranda washes the black dye out of Sansa’s hair.
You’re so beautiful. But if you need to keep him happy. Ramsay gets bored easily. You dont want to end up like... Well, like the others.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: What others?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I shouldn’t gossip. It’s good to see the red again. No point in hiding anymore.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: What others?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Let’s see. There was Kiera. The blacksmith’s daughter. She was tall. Like you. Lovely figure. But she talked and talked and talked and… Ramsay got tired of that. Then there was Violet. She had gorgeous blond hair. But she got pregnant and, well, that was boring. Then Tamsay. Such a sweet girl. Of course sweet girls get a bit dull after a while, don’t they? Ramsay let me come with him on that hunt.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: Hunt?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Mm. Have you ever seen a body after the dogs have been at it? Not so pretty. But it’s your wedding day, why am I talking about such things?
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: What was your name again?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Myranda.
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: And how long have you loved him, Myranda. Did you imagine that he would be with you forever, is that it? Then I came along and ruined it. I am Sansa Stark of Winterfell. This is my home and you can’t frighten me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Are you done with your bath, my lady?
Speaker: MYRANDA

Text: Go. I can finish on my own.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Snow falls outside. There is a knock on the door.
Yes?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: INT. SANSA’S ROOM
Theon enters.
I’ve come to escort you to the Godswood, my lady. If you please, my lady, will you take my arm?
Speaker: THEON

Text: No.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Lord Ramsay, he said I'm to take your arm.
Speaker: THEON

Text: I’m not touching you.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Please. He’ll punish me.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Do you think I care what he does to you.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Sansa leaves the room without Theon.
EXT. THE GODSWOOD
Sansa walks to the Godswood with Theon. Ramsay is waiting alongside his father and with the Bolton men forming an aisle. Roose walks forward.
Who comes before the Old Gods this night?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Sansa of the House Stark comes here to be wed. A woman grown, trueborn and noble. She comes to beg the blessings of the gods. Who comes to claim her?
Speaker: THEON

Text: Ramsay steps forward.
Ramsay of House Bolton. Heir to the Dreadfort and Winterfell. Who gives her?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Theon of House Greyjoy. Who was… who was her father’s ward.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Lady Sansa, will you take this man?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Long pause. Cut to Ramsay, Walda, and Myranda. Sansa steps forward.
I take this man.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Ramsay smiles.
INT. RAMSAY’S CHAMBERS
Theon opens the door for Ramsay and Sansa.
Are you pleased my lady?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Sansa nods.
Good. I want you to be happy. My father said you’re still a virgin.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Yes.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Why? Why are you still a virgin? Afraid of dwarves?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Lord Tyrion was kind, he was gentle, he never touched me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You’re not lying to me?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: No, my lord.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Lying to your husband on his wedding night, that would be a very bad way to start a marriage. We are man and wife now, we should be honest with each other, don’t you think?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Yes sir.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Ramsay kisses her.
Good. Now take off your clothes.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Theon starts to leave.
Oh, no no no. You stay here Reek. You watch. (to Sansa) Do I need to ask a second time? I hate asking a second time.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Sansa starts to undo her coat. Theon closes the door.
Reek? I told you to watch.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Theon looks up.
You’ve known Sansa since she was a girl. Now watch her become a woman.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Ramsay rips Sansa’s coat open and pushes her onto the bed. We hear clothes ripping. A belt being undone. Sansa starts moaning. Close up on Theon crying.
END EPISODE
EXT. CASTLE BLACK

Men of the Night’s Watch prepare the horses as snow falls on Castle Black. Thormund is brought before Jon. Jon looks at him, nods, and  a Brother removes Tormund’s chains. Thormund raises his free hands to Ser Alliser in the distance and is carried away. Jon walks over to Alliser.
First Ranger, you have command of Castle Black.
Speaker: JON

Text: Lord Commander, it is my duty to tell you I believe this mission to be reckless, foolhardy, and an insult to all of the Brothers that have died fighting the wildlings.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: Cut to Olly watching their conversation from afar.
As always, thank you for your honesty.
Speaker: JON

Text: Jon walks away to Sam.
Safe travels, Lord Commander.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Thank you, Sam.
Speaker: JON

Text: Oh, and…
Speaker: SAM

Text: Sam hands him a wrapped package. Jon opens it to find a sword.
It’s Dragonglass. It’s what I used to kill the White Walker. I hope you don’t need them.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Me too.
Speaker: JON

Text: They hug. Jon gets on a horse next to Tormund and rides away.
There he is. That laugh. Egg! Egg laughed like that. One of the first things I remember about him.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: Gilly looks at Sam, confused.
His little brother, Aegon. He became king.
Speaker: SAM

Text: And before that, he was a jolly fellow. Like this one.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: Aemon’s mood changes, he suddenly becomes panicked.
Get him south, Gillyflower. Before it’s too late.
Speaker: AEMON

Text: Theon carries a food plate across the hall. He arrives at a door and unlocks it.
INT. SANSA’S ROOM
Sansa is sleeping. Theon approaches and closes a window, waking Sansa.
Theon, wait.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Not Theon, my lady. Reek.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Sansa sits up in bed, revealing cuts and bruises along her arms.
Help me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You’re his wife now.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Theon
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Do what he says. Do what he says or he’ll hurt you.
Speaker: THEON

Text: He already hurts me every night. All day I’m locked in this room and every night he comes. It can’t be worse.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: It can. It can always be worse.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Sansa stands up.
What did he do to you?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Please…
Speaker: THEON

Text: Theon goes for the door. Sansa runs to the door and blocks him from leaving.
You betrayed my family!
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I’m sorry. I’m sorry!
Speaker: THEON

Text: You have to help me!
Speaker: SANSA

Text: He’ll see us. You don’t know him.
Speaker: THEON

Text: My family still has friends in the North. All I have to do is give a signal and they’ll rescue me. Climb to the top of the Broken Tower, light this candle, and put it in the window. Promise me, Theon.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Reek, my lady, Reek!
Speaker: THEON

Text: Your name is Theon Greyjoy. Last surviving son of Balon Greyjoy, Lord of the Iron Islands, do you hear me? Theon. Promise me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Theon hesitates, nods, and exits the room.
EXT. WINTERFELL
Theon walks across Winterfell with the Broken Tower in the background.
Theon climbs the stairs to the top floor. He opens the door to see Ramsay eating.
Yes, Reek?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: EXT. OUTSIDE WINTERFELL
Brienne stares at the top floor of the Broken Tower from beyond the walls of Winterfell.
Close-up on a candle, then Gilly’s baby.
Egg! Egg! Mothers looking for you! Egg!
Speaker: AEMON

Text: Get some sleep, Sam. You’ll have to speak for him tomorrow.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: You don’t know that.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Get some sleep. I’ll watch over him.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I’ll stay too. He’s always been good to me. I can’t leave him now.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Egg! Egg.. I dreamed... that I was old
Speaker: AEMON (panicked)

Text: EXT. CASTLE BLACK
Close up on Maester Aemon’s funeral pyre.

His name was Aemon Targaryen. He came to us from King’s Landing, a Maester of the Citadel, chained and sworn. And a sworn brother of the Night’s Watch, ever faithful. No man was wiser or gentler or kinder. At the Wall a dozen Lord Commanders came and went during his years of service, but he was always there to counsel them. He was the blood of the dragon, but now his fire has gone out. And now his watch has ended.
Speaker: SAM

Text: And now his watch has ended.
Speaker: BROTHERS

Text: Sam lights the pyre, then hands the torch to Alliser, who lights it then passes it along.
You’re losing all your friends, Tarly.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: Sam looks up to see a Brother glaring at him.
EXT. WINTERFELL
Sansa walks up to Ramsay.
My beautiful wife.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: He kisses her.
When my father told me we were marrying I half expected a fat, bearded beast. Do you know how pleased I was when I saw you? You’ve made me very happy.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: They start walking down stairs. Sansa grabs a cross in the snow before they leave.

Our scouts report that Stannis Baratheon rides for Winterfell. He’s a respected commander. His troops are loyal and battle tested. He’s hired thousands of foreign sell swords to bolster his army. But this storm was a stroke of luck for us northerners. Our people are used to fighting in frost. His army’s out there now, suffering in the snow. One day I’ll be Lord of Winterfell, and Warden of the North. You’ll be my Lady and Wardeness.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: But isn’t your step mother pregnant?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: What of it?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: What happens if she has a boy?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Then I’ll have a baby brother.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: But he’ll be the heir.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I’m Lord Bolton’s eldest son.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: But you’re a bastard, a true born will always have the stronger claim.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Ramsay stops walking.
I’ve been naturalized by a royal decree of--
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Tommen Baratheon. Another bastard.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: They start walking again.
Bastards can rise high in the world. Like your half-brother Jon Snow. Born The Bastard of Winterfell, now the Lord Commander of the Night’s Watch.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Sansa looks shocked.
You didn’t know? Yes, he’s done very well for himself. Ah. I near forgot why I asked you to join me. Come, my lady.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: EXT. WINTERFELL
The woman who visited Sansa’s chamber previously is out in the open, flayed to death.
Your Northern friend. Reek told me you wanted to leave.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Cut to Theon looking terrified.
Why? Winterfell is your home and I am your husband.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Sansa continues to look at the woman, horrified.

Tough old bird. Everyone talks when I start beating them. But this one. Her heart gave out before I got to her face. We do breed them tough in the North. Bring my wife back to her chamber. It’s far too cold out here for a lady. You should hold on to your candles. The nights are so long now.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: He kisses her on the cheek then she is carried away.
EXT. STANNIS’ CAMP
Davos rides through the camp on horseback, observing the men as they cough and huddle around each other. The snow is falling hard.
40 horses died in the night. We’ll lose more come sunset. We’re running out of food. We can’t open the supply line until the snow clears.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: What else?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: The Stormcrows rode off last night.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: 500 men.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Davos nods. Stannis removes a Baratheon piece from his chess board.
Sell swords, loyal to nothing but gold.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: We still have a hard march to Wintefell and we won’t be marching anywhere in this weather.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: And?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: This isn’t our time, we should head back to Castle Black when the snow clears.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I retreated from King’s Landing, Ser Davos. If I retreat again, I become “The King Who Ran.”
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Your Grace..
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Winter is coming. Those arent just the Stark words, it’s a fact. If we march back to Castle Black, we winter at Castle Black. And who can say how many years this winter will last.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: It’s better to wait for the right time than to risk everything.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: This is the right time, and I will risk everything. Because if I don't, we’ve lost. We march to victory or we march to defeat, but we go forward only forward,
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Davos looks to Melisandre, lurking in the back of the tent.
Your Grace. (leaves)
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I’ve trusted in your visions, in your prophecies for years.
Speaker: STANNIS (to Melisandre)

Text: You saw it yourself, my king, when you stared into the flames. A great battle in the snow.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I don’t know what I saw.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: You do know. Trust yourself.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: And you, do you trust yourself?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I trust in the Lord.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Are you sure?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I have seen myself walk along the battlements of Wintefell. I have seen the flayed men banners lowered to the ground.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: She flips the Bolton pieces over on Stannis’ board.
But sometimes sacrifices must be made to ensure victory. I have shown you the power of king's blood. The Usurper Robb Stark. The Usurper Joffrey Baratheon.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: We don’t have Robert’s bastard here.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: No, we have someone better, and your blood runs through her veins.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Have you lost your mind?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Do you doubt me still? After all that you’ve seen?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: There must be another way. Leeches or something.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: There is only one way. You must become king before the Long Night begins. Only you can lead the living against the dead. All your life has led us to this moment. To this decision.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: She’s my daughter.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Melisandre embraces him.
Get out.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Gilly washes clothes. Two Brothers walk into the room.
The beauty from beyond The Wall.
Speaker: DERRYK

Text: Gilly starts walking away.
Where are you going, huh? Aren’t we better looking than the fat man?
Speaker: BRAND

Text: The question is, is she pretty down south in the real world, or is she pretty because she’s the only girl here?
Speaker: DERRYK

Text: Even in White Harbor, I’d want a kiss.
Speaker: BRAND

Text: Come on love, give us a kiss.
Speaker: DERRYK

Text: Leave me alone.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: If you were my girl I wouldn’t leave you alone.
Speaker: DERRYK

Text: One little kiss.
Speaker: BRAND

Text: Come on, give him a kiss.
Speaker: DERRYK

Text: A man gets lonely guarding the Wall.
Speaker: BRAND

Text: She tries to walk away. They slap the laundry basket out of her hands and trap her.
There’s no need to be rude.
Speaker: BRAND

Text: We just want a little affection.
Speaker: DERRYK

Text: She slaps Derryk across the face. Sam enters the room and pulls out his sword.
Get your hands off her. Brother Derryk. Brother Brand. I believe you both have guard duty tonight.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Sam the Slayer. Are you gonna slay me with that sword?
Speaker: BRAND

Text: Look at his hands shaking.
Speaker: DERRYK

Text: Gilly go on, Get back to your room and lock the door.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Derryk throws her to the floor.
I’m warning you.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Come on! Come on!
Speaker: DERRYK

Text: Sam swings the sword. It is deflected and he is subdued. Derryk punches him in the gut then starts kicking him.
You lying sack of shit! Killed a White Walker, eh? You fatass fuck. Come on, get up. (to Gilly) He’s your hero. He’s a hog!
Speaker: DERRYK

Text: Leave him alone!
Speaker: GILLY

Text: She charges at Derryk. He subdues her.
Stubborn little wilding bitch aren’t ya?
Speaker: DERRYK

Text: Brand kicks Sam in the face.
Sam! Sam! Sam!
Speaker: GILLY

Text: He punches Sam repeatedly in the face until he seems to lose consciousness.
Alright. Hold still.
Speaker: BRAND

Text: They both hold Gilly down as she screams. Sam gets back up.
I said get your hands off her.
Speaker: SAM

Text: You’re gonna get yourself killed.
Speaker: BRAND

Text: Roll over. Jon Snow’s not here to save you.
Speaker: DERRYK

Text: I killed a White Walker. I killed a Thenn. I’ll take my chances with you.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Ghost shows up and growls at the brothers. They sprint out of the room. Sam falls to his knees.
Sam!
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I’m alright.
Speaker: SAM

Text: You’re not.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Just a bit woozy.
Speaker: SAMMY

Text: Sam collapses onto his side.
Gilly washes out Sam’s wounds with a wash cloth.
The next time you see something like that you leave it alone.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I will not. They would’ve… I don’t know what they would have done
Speaker: SAM

Text: I know they would have killed you if Ghost hadn’t come.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: No. They were tiring out. I had them in the palm of my hand.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Don’t be stupid Sam, you’re not a fighter.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: What kind of man would I be if I ran away when I saw someone hurting you?
Speaker: SAM

Text: Just promise me that whatever happens you’ll take care of little Sam.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Of course I will. And I’ll take care of you, too.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I need more water.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: She gets up. Sam grabs her arm.
Stay. Please.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Gilly gets on top of Sam and starts kissing him. She gets back up, and puts her hands around his neck and starts kissing him again.
Am I hurting you?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: He shakes his head no.
Are you sure?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Sam nods yes. She pulls his pants down, pulls her dress up, and starts riding him.
Oh. Oh my.
Speaker: SAM

Text: The slaves are carried up to the auction stage. One of Malko’s men whips Tyrion.

A rare find for the fighting pits, my friends. Not your usual street tough old drunken pirate. This one’s a Westerosi knight from an ancient house, trained in sword and lance. he fought beside the Stag King Robert on the far side of the Narrow Sea. He was first from the breach during the siege of Pyke, slaughtering 50 men with his flaming sword. He killed the great Khal Drogo in single combat. Betrayed by his woman, he sold himself into slavery to repay his debts. Bidding begins at 12 gold honors.
Speaker: MALKO

Text: A hand goes up.
13. Do I have 14?
Speaker: MALKO

Text: A hand goes up.
15? 15 golds honors. Do I have 16?
Speaker: MALKO

Text: A man in the front who has been studying Jorah intently raises his hand.
Sold!
Speaker: MALKO

Text: Jorah is taken away.
Wait! You have to buy me as well.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Why?
Speaker: BUYER

Text: We’re a team. I’m a great fighter, too.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The crowd laughs.
He’s funny. You have to give him that.
Speaker: MALKO

Text: The man holding Tyrion’s chains laughs at him. Tyrion yanks his chains, pulling the man to the ground, and starts beating on him with the chains as the crowd roars. Tyrion kicks him in the head then looks to the buyer.
Alright. He’s funny.
Speaker: BUYER

Text: He hands Malko coins.
Thank you my Lord. Thank you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Yes.
Speaker: BUYER

Text: My Lord, if I may. I’ve heard Mereen’s become a free city. You might run into trouble if you try to fight slaves in the fighting pits. Now if you were to fight free men who were paid a wage…
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The buyer hits Tyrion in the mouth then tosses him a few coins.
Here’s your wages, funny man. It’ll last the rest of your life.
Speaker: BUER

Text: How long before the king of Mereen comes to claim my pillow?
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Don’t be ridiculous. My marriage to Hizdahr is political. I think he’s smart enough to understand that.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I think the Sons of the Harpy have stopped killing because their leader was made king.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Are you jealous?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Do you think I’m petty enough to speak ill of a man just because he represents competition?
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: I do.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Daario laughs.
You’re right. My motivations are entirely impure.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: They start kissing.
Doesn’t make me wrong.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: You told me yourself, I can’t fight enemies within and without. So when enemies from without come knocking, I need the city of Mereen behind me. I have no choice.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Everyone has a choice. Even slaves have a choice. Death or slavery.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: So what else can I do?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Marry me instead.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Even if I wanted to do such an inadviseable thing, I couldn’t.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Why not? You’re our queen, you can do as you like.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: No. I can’t
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Then you are the only person in Mereen who’s not free.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Daenerys sits up in bed.
I know I’m here to serve my queen and not to give advice, but can I make one more suggestion?
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Of course
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: On the day of the Great Games, gather all the great masters, and wise masters, and worthy masters you can find, and slaughter them all.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: I am a queen. Not a butcher.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: All rulers are either butchers or meat.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: You there! Where would I find the High Septon, or High Sparrow, or whatever bloody fool name he’s got.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: It’s not as good a name as Queen of Thorns, I’ll admit.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: You should have the decency to stand when you talk to a lady.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: You should have the decency to kneel before the gods
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Don’t spar with me little fellow.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The High Septon gets up.
For me, it’s the knees. You?
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Hips.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Huh.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: A man of the people, is that your game? It’s an old game. dull and unconvincing. A man of the people who does Cersei’s dirty work for her.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The people always do the dirty work.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Spare me the homilies, I can smell a fraud from a mile away.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: A useful talent.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: I’m here for my grandson and granddaughter.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Your grandson and granddaughter swore sacred vows and lied. The Father judges us all. Sons of high lords, sons of fishermen. If you break his laws you will be punished.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: The High Sparrow heads for the door.
Don’t you walk away from me.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: You don’t give commands here, Lady Olenna.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: What is it you want? Gold? I’ll make you the richest septon who ever lived.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The High Sparrow laughs.
What then?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: I imagine this is strange for you. Everyone you meet has a hidden motive, and you pride yourself on slitting in and out. But I’m telling you a simple truth: I serve the gods. The gods demand justice.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: How do they communicate their demands? By raven or horse?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: By the holy text. The seven pointed star. If you don’t have one in your library I’ll give you my own.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: I’ve read the seven pointed star.
Speaker: OLENNA (with contempt)

Text: Then you’ll remember the passages concerning buggery and perjury. Your grandchildren will be punished in the same manner as anyone who breaks the sacred laws.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Half the men, women, and children in this foul city break the sacred laws. You live among murderers, thieves, and rapists. And yet you punish Loras for shagging and Margaery for defending her brother?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Yes. The Gods’ laws must be applied to all equally.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: If it’s equality you want then so be it. When House Tyrell stops sending our crops to the capital, everyone here will starve. And I’ll make sure the hungry know who to blame,
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Have you ever served the field, Lady Olenna? Have you ever reaped the grain? Has anyone in House Tyrell? A lifetime of wealth and power has left you blind in one eye. You are the few. We are the many. And when the many stop fearing the few…
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: He walks out of the room.
EXT. SEPT OF BAELOR
Lady Olenna.
Speaker: SQUIRE

Text: He hands her a letter with Baelish's mockingbird sigil.
Starving yourself won't make things any better for her, my love.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: She’s in a prison cell and there’s nothing I can do. I am the king! The queen is in prison and there’s nothing I can do!
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Tommen walks to the window. Cersei joins him.
No matter who you are, no matter how strong you are, sooner or later, you'll face circumstances beyond your control.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I’ll call in the army. I’ll take back the sept and kill every last one of them. I’ll start a war if I have to.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: You know as well as I do who the first casualty in that war would be.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I love her. I love her. I can’t help her.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: We must be strong for those we love. We cannot give in to despair.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I will speak to the high sparrow. There must be something--
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Let me speak to him on your behalf. The king cannot dirty sully himself negotiating with an unwashed fanatic.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your happiness is all I want in this world
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I know.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: No you don’t. You can’t possibly. Not until you have children of your own. I would do anything for you. Anything to keep you from harm. I would burn cities to the ground. That is all that matters. You and your sister. From the moment you came into this world, my boy. My only boy.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Cersei embraces him and starts crying.
INT. DORNE
Jaime is being kept in a closely monitored room.
Prince Doran hopes this satisfies your concerns about the princess’s wellbeing.
Speaker: AREO

Text: Areo brings Myrcella into the room.
You looked different when I left. You had more hair.
Speaker: MYRCELLA

Text: And more hands. How’s Trystane?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He’ll be alright.
Speaker: MYRCELLA

Text: I’m sorry for that. It wasn’t supposed to happen that way.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Why is it happening at all?
Speaker: MYRCELLA

Text: Your mother’s worried about you. Threats have been made. Dorne is too dangerous for you. I’ve come to take you home.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: This is my home, this has been my home for years. I didn’t want to come here but she told me to. I did what she said, I did my duty and now she’s forcing me to go back?
Speaker: MYRCELLA

Text: It's for your own good. These are complicated matters.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: It’s not complicated at all, it’s simple. I love Trystane, I’m going to marry him, and we’re staying right here.
Speaker: MYRCELLA

Text: I don’t understand.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Of course you don’t! You don’t know me!
Speaker: MYRCELLA

Text: Myrcella leaves the room.

Brothers oh brothers, my days here are done, the Dornishman’s taken my life. Bur what does it matter, for all men must die, and I’ve tasted the Dornishman’s wife! Yes I’ve tasted the Dornishman’s wife!
Speaker: BRONN (singing)

Text: In the adjacent cell to Bronn, Tyene claps as the other Snakes glare at her.
He’s got a good voice.
Speaker: TYENE

Text: We’re lucky he’s a singer. If he were a fighter we might have been in trouble.
Speaker: OBARA

Text: It’s against my code to hurt a woman.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: It’s amazing how many men we beat seem to have this code.
Speaker: OBARA

Text: I wouldn’t say you beat me.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: How’s your arm?
Speaker: TYENE

Text: Wonderful. Wouldn’t feel right to leave Dorne without a new scar.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You think you’re leaving Dorne?
Speaker: TYENE

Text: No great hurry. Dornish women are the most beautiful women in the world.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Thank you.
Speaker: TYENE

Text: I said Dornish women. I didn’t say you.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I’m not the most beautiful woman you’ve ever seen?
Speaker: TYENE

Text: I’ve seen quite a few women in all the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Name one more beautiful than I am.
Speaker: TYENE

Text: Well now, in King’s Landing there was an absolutely gorgeous...
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Tyene takes one of her breasts out of her tunic.
There was a what? In King’s Landing you were saying.
Speaker: TYENE

Text: Was I?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: There was a woman more beautiful than I am.
Speaker: TYENE

Text: Tyene takes both her breasts out.
Was there? My memory’s not what it was earlier.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: How’s your arm now?
Speaker: TYENE

Text: You seem concerned with it. You must really like me.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Tyene undoes the rest of her tunic.
And how about your head?
Speaker: TYENE

Text: My head… You don’t even wanna know what’s going on in…
Speaker: BRONN

Text: As Bronn scans her naked body, his vision starts to blur and he collapses to the ground.
Your nose is bleeding.
Speaker: TYENE

Text: It’s nothing. It’s the dry air.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: My dagger was coated with a special ointment from Asshei. They call it the Long Farewell. It takes time to work, but if a single drop makes contact with the skin, death.
Speaker: TYENE

Text: She holds a tiny blue cap up to Bronn from her cell.
The only antidote. Who’s the most beautiful woman in the world?
Speaker: TYENE

Text: Bronn gasps for breath.
Sorry? Who?
Speaker: TYENE

Text: You.
Speaker: BRONN (finally)

Text: Don’t drop it.
Speaker: TYENE

Text: Tyene tosses it into his cell and Bronn downs it.
I think you’re very handsome as well.
Speaker: TYENE

Text: Littlefinger peers at the Great Sept of Baelor through the window. The brothel is destroyed, with many seven-pointed stars scribbled on the floor, walls, and artwork.
I’m sorry about the locale.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: No you’re not.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: It felt like the safest place.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Not for your clientele, clearly.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: It was an establishment like no other. The sheer range of appetites catered to, desires that didn’t exist until we invented them.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: You’ve always been rather impressed with yourself, haven’t you?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The past is the past. The future is all that’s worth discussing. The future of House Tyrell.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Don’t pretend to have any concern for my house, my grandchildren, or me. I should have known you’d return to the capital once things started going wrong.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: I promise you..
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: I promise you, Lord Baelish, that our fates are joined. Together we murdered a king. And if my house should fall, I would have nothing to hide. And if i should meet with some accident here at this broken little flesh market, they’ll never even find what’s left of you. So do you deny a part in all of this?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Cersei summoned me to King’s Landing. I dared not refuse her.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: And what did she want?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: A piece of info that she know that I had. Neither silence nor lies were an option. But I have other information of which she is unaware. And as you say, our interests are aligned. I have a gift for you.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: What kind of gift?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The same kind I gave Cersei. A handsome young man.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Gladiators prepare their swords and armor.

Many worthy fighters have died trying to make it to the Great Games. When most of you worthless scum join them in death this afternoon it will represent a significant rise in your station. But if you happen to triumph here you will fight at the great pit of Daznak itself in front of the queen. So whatever happens, the gods have smiled upon you today. Today is the day your lives actually start to mean something.
Speaker: SLAVE OWNER

Text: Close-up on Jorah.
You and you, you, you two, you, you, and you.
Speaker: OWNER (O.S.)

Text: Jorah is not one of the gladiators selected.
Valar morghulis.
Speaker: OWNER

Text: Valar dohaeris.
Speaker: MEN

Text: Prepare yourselves.
Speaker: OWNER

Text: EXT. FIGHTING PIT
Sitting through the great games will be bad enough.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: For generations, in the days leading up to the great games, it has been customary for our ruler to make the rounds to the lower pits to pay the fighters there the honor of her presence.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: The fighters enter the pit.
Move yourselves!
Speaker: OWNER

Text: The slave owner sees Daenerys and runs in front of her and Hizdahr.
Your Grace. Your Future Grace. You honor us all.
Speaker: OWNER

Text: The owner gets all his gladiators to face Dany, whispering instructions to them.
“We fight and die for your glory, O glorious queen.”
Speaker: OWNER

Text: “We fight and die for your glory, O glorious queen.”
Speaker: MEN

Text: The fight begins
Jorah hears “O glorious queen” and runs to the edge of the pit. He sees Daenerys through the grated entrance to the ring.
EXT. FIGHTING PIT
One bald gladiator dominates the pit. He slits one fighter’s throat, and slices another fighter’s leg as he runs away.
I think I’ve seen enough.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your Grace, it’s a tradition for the queen to stay until the victor has emerged.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: I’ve sacrificed more than enough for your traditions.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Jorah straps a helmet on.
What are you doing?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: EXT. FIGHTING PIT

Jorah rushes the pit. His owner tries to stop him but he knocks him out with the butt of his sword. Jorah takes out the bald man as he was smashing a man’s head in with a rock. Daenerys takes notice of the fighter but can’t see his face.
The other gladiators that weren’t chosen to fight follow Jorah’s lead and enter the ring. Tyrion tries but is chained up. He starts sawing at his chain.
EXT. FIGHTING PIT
Jorah melees a fighter with a shield, then knocks another out with his own helmet.
A giant man sees Tyrion sawing at his chains. He raises a giant sword above Tyrion’s head, but comes down on the chain, freeing Tyrion. Tyrion nods in thanks.
EXT. FIGHTING PIT
Daenerys is watching intently now. Jorah is the last man standing. He walks up to Daenerys and Hizdahr and removes his helmet. She stares at him for a moment.
Get him out of my sight.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Her men grab Jorah.
Khaleesi, please, I just need a moment of your time. I brought you a gift.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: It’s true. He has.
Speaker: TYRION (O.S.)

Text: Tyrion enters the pit.
Who are you?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I am the gift. It’s a pleasure to meet you, Your Grace. My name is Tyrion Lannister.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Cut to Dany in shock and deep thought after hearing his name.
Cersei enters Margaery’s cell.

This is horrible. Unacceptable. Are they feeding you enough at least? I brought you this. Venison. It’s quite good. I had it myself for supper only last night. We did everything we could from the moment they took your brother. Tommen even went to the sept himself to confront the high sparrow, but I fear The Faith has left reason behind.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I know you did this.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: We are making every effort on your behalf. I swear to you by all the seven gods.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Lies come easily to you. Everyone knows that. But innocence, decency, concern? You’re not very good at those, I’m afraid. Perhaps that’s why your son was so eager to cast you aside for me.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: You’re upset. You’re not thinking clearly. I’ll visit again when you’ve had a chance to calm down.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I don’t want to see you again.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I do hope you change your mind about that. I’ve been told men often go mad in the Black Cells below the Red Keep, but I suppose your isolation will end once your trial begins.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Leave.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Yes, I’m afraid I must. My son needs me now more than ever.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Margaery throws the medicine at Cersei.
Get out you hateful bitch!
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Sleep well, sister.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Cersei walks out smiling. She is taken to High Septon’s room by a Sparrow.
Thank you. (to Cersei) You saw her?
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW (to Sparrow)

Text: Yes.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: And?
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Her accommodations seem sufficient. What happens to her now?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Well she and her brother are both being held under fair suspicion. A trial will be held for each of them to determine if they are guilty of any acts that might constitute a violation of the tenants of the faith.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Who will stand judge?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Seven septons. As it was in all trials before the Targaryens.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Will you be one of them?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I will.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: If one or both of them were to confess before the trial…
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Then they will be at The Mother’s mercy.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: What does The Mother’s mercy entail?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: It depends on the situation. The acts themselves, the degree of contrition.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Thank you High Septon for bringing them whatever justice they deserve in the eyes of the Seven.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Did you know this chapel is one of the oldest structures in King’s Landing?
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: I think I may have heard at one point.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Baelor built his sept around it. But men worshipped here long before him.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: The High Septon gestures to a stone altar with seven-pointed stars engraved into it.
Who carved this altar do you know?
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: I’m afraid i don’t.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No one does. There’s no name on it. Or anywhere else in the chapel. The people who built this place didn’t inflict their vanity on the people who came after them. The way Baelor did with that great gilded monstrosity out there. Their faith was clean.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Strip away the gold and the ornaments, knock down the statues and the pillars, and this is what remains. Something simple, solid, and true. The Tyrell’s finery will be stripped away. Their lives knocked down, their true hearts laid bare for all to see. And so it will be for all of us, high and low alike. What will we find when we strip away your finery?
The High Septon stares intently at Cersei.

A young man came to us not long ago, broken in body and spirit. He had so much to strip away, so much weighing him down. But piece by piece he unburdened himself. Let go of vanity, pride, sin, now his soul is so light he will float through the Seven Heaves like a bird.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Cersei gives a faint laugh.
And he has much to say about you.
Speaker: SPARROW

Text: Lancell enters the room and stands next to the High Septon. Cersei goes for the door and is blocked.
Move. Let me go immediately.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Cersei is grabbed and carried away from the room.
You will order her to let me go! I am the queen! I am the queen! Have you lost your mind? Let me go! You filthy… I am the queen! Let me go!
Speaker: CERSEI (O.S.)

Text: INT. BLACK CELL
Cersei is thrown into the cell. She looks up at the people who put her there.
Look at me. Look at my face. It’s the last thing you’ll see before you die.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The door slams closed and is bolted shut.
END EPISODE
Your Grace, I want to say--
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You will not speak. How do I know you are who you say you are?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: If only I were otherwise.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: If you are Tyrion Lannister why shouldn’t I kill you? To pay your family back for what it did to mine
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You want revenge against the Lannisters? I killed my mother Joanna Lannister the day I was born. I killed my father Tywin Lannister with a bow to the heart. I am the greatest Lannister killer of our time.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: So I should welcome you into my service because you murdered members of your own family?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Into your service? Your Grace we have only just met. It’s too soon to know if you deserve my service.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: If you’d rather return to the fighting pits just say the word.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: When I was a young man I heard a story about a baby born during the worst storm in living memory. She had no wealth, no lands, no army, only a name and a handful of supporters, most of whom probably thought they could use that name to benefit themselves. They kept her alive, moving her from place to place, often hours ahead of the men who had been sent to kill her. She was eventually sold off to some warlord on the edge of the world and that appeared to be that. And then a few years later the most well informed person I knew told me that this girl without wealth, lands, or armies had somehow acquired all 3 in a very short span of time, along with three dragons. He thought she was our best, last chance to build a better world. I thought you were worth meeting at the very least.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And why are you worth meeting? Why should I spend my time listening to you?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Because you can not build a better world on your own. You have no one at your side who understands that land you want to rule. The strengths and the weaknesses of the houses that will either support or oppose you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I have a very large army and very large dragons.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Killing and politics aren’t always the same thing. When I served as Hand of the King I did quite well with the latter considering the king in question preferred torturing animals to leading his people. I could do an even better job advising a ruler worth the name.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: So you want to advise me. Very well. (looks to Jorah) What would you have me do with him? I swore I would kill him if he ever returned.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I know.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Why should the people trust a queen who can’t keep her promises?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Whomever Ser Jorah was when he started informing on you, he is no longer that man. I can’t remember seeing the same man as devoted to anything as he is to serving you. He claims he would kill for you and die for you, and nothing I have witnessed gives me reason to doubt him. And yet he did betray you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tyrion approaches Daenerys and Missandei. Her guards raise their spears to her. Daenerys waves them off.
Did he have an opportunity to confess his betrayals?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Yes, many opportunities.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: And did he?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No. Not until forced to do so.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: So I should kill him?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: A ruler who kills those that are devoted to her is not a ruler that inspires devotion. And you’re going to need to inspire devotion, and lots of it, if you’re ever going to rule across the Narrow Sea. But you cannot have him by your side when you do.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Remove Ser Jorah from the city.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Daenerys and Jorah hold back tears. Jorah is escorted out of the Pyramid. Jorah checks his Greyscale and walks away.
INT. BLACK CELLS
The Septa holds water out to Cersei.
Confess.
Speaker: SEPTA

Text: My son. Let me speak to--
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: She slaps Cersei with a spoon.
Confess. I meant it.
Speaker: SEPTA

Text: My face will be the last thing you see before--
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: She slaps her with a spoon again then leaves. Cersei starts screaming.
INT. HOUSE OF BLACK AND WHITE
My name is Lana. I’m an orphan. When I was 8 I begged enough money to buy my first bucket of oysters, and I sold that bucket and made enough money to buy 2 more.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Arya pushes an oyster cart through a crowded market.

Iit took a while but I finally saved enough to buy myself an oyster cart. Now every morning I make my way down to the canals. I pass the fish mongers and the bakers. I usually see Lhara, my first customer of the day on my way home. Then I turn left onto Moonsinger Lane--
Speaker: ARYA (V.O.)

Text: INT. HOUSE OF BLACK AND WHITE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Jaqen slaps her.
Left onto Ragman Lane, where I do most of my trade.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Lana is very impressive. Very industrious. She will make a fine servant for the Many Faced God.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: How will she serve him?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: She will no longer turn left onto Ragman Lane. She will turn right and go to Ragman Harbor.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: What will she do there?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: She will see.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: See what?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: How can a man tell a girl this. If he knew what she would see, there would be no reason to send her.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Oysters, clams and cockles!
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Arya takes a right with the cart.
Oysters clams and cockles! Oysters clams and cockles!
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Your oysters fresh?
Speaker: THIN MAN

Text: Best in the city.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You wouldn’t lie to an old man would you?
Speaker: THIN MAN

Text: Arya cracks an oyster and hands him one he slurps it.
Very nice. Give me 4. With vinegar.
Speaker: THIN MAN

Text: A man throws a bag of money and a map on the Thin Man’s table.
It’s my 18th voyage. I’ve returned from all of them without a scratch on me.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Can’t do it.
Speaker: THIN MAN

Text: He is carried away as the Thin Man slurps the oyster
INT. THE HOUSE OF BLACK AND WHITE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The man is a gambler. He wages that his sailor's ship will make it to its destination. It is a strange wager for the captain. He only wins if he loses his life.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: So why would a captain make the wager in the first place?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A girl tells a man that she has seen.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: If the captain dies, the thin man pays his family a lot of money.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: But perhaps the gambler loses his bet and decides that he doesn’t have to pay after all. A destitute woman and her small child, what can they do to such a man if he keeps their money for himself? To whom can they turn for recourse?
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Arya looks to see a man praying on the floor.
The Many Faced God. You said you didn’t know what I would see at the docks.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A man had no idea what she would see and what she would not. A girl named Lana will return to the docks. She will watch the gambler. She will come to know as much about him as she knows about herself.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: And then what?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A gift for the Thin Man.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: He holds up a clear vile. Arya takes the vile, smiling.
She is not ready.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: Perhaps she is, perhaps she’s not.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: And if she’s not?
Speaker: WAIF

Text: It is all the same to the Many Faced God.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: INT. BLACK CELLS
Qyburn enters the cell and bows.
The trial will take place. The High Sparrow will be presenting a substantial case against you.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: The charges?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Fornication, treason, incest, the murder of King Robert.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: All lies.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Of course, Your Grace. My concern is that The Faith does not adhere to the same standards of proof as the crown. And I hope you’ll excuse me for saying it, but belief is so often the death of reason.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: I wish you’d said it sooner. Any word from Jaime?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I’m afraid not. Your Grace, Grand Maester Pycelle has summoned your Uncle Kevan back from Casterly Rock to serve as Hand of the King. He now presides over the small council.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Tell him I need to speak to him.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I implored him to visit you but he would not.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: What about my son, the king? If you can visit me then surely the king--
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your arrest, and Queen Margaery’s arrest, the king has not taken well. He remains in his chambers, his servants often find his food in the hall. Left untouched.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: You need to talk to him, you need to talk to my son to come and see me, come and see his mother.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I tried my grace, he wouldn’t see me. He wouldn’t see anyone.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: I can’t stay here.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: There is a way, Your Grace. A way out.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Confess? To the High Sparrow? I won’t. I made him. I rose him up from nothing, I will not kneel before some barefooted commoner and beg his forgiveness.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The septa enters the room.
Goodbye my queen. The work continues.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Qyburn leaves the cell.
Theon enters Sansa’s room and sets food down.
Why. Why Theon.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Not Theon. There is no Theon. Reek.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Reek. Why did you tell him, Reek?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I was helping you. You were trying to escape, there is no escape. Not ever. Theon Greyjoy tried to escape. The master knew. He knows everything. He hunted him, he caught him, he strapped him to a cross, and cut away piece after piece until there was no Theon left.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Good. If it weren’t for you I’d still have a family. If I could do to you what Ramsay did to you right here, right now, I would.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I deserved everything. I deserve to be Reek. I did terrible things. Turned on Robb. Captured Winterfell. Killed those boys.
Speaker: THEON

Text: They weren’t “those boys”, they were Bran and Rickon. They were your brothers, you’d know them since they were born.
Speaker: THEON

Text: They weren’t. They were only--
Speaker: THEON

Text: Only what?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I can’t..
Speaker: THEON

Text: Tell me!
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I can’t, not unless the master says...
Speaker: THEON

Text: Tell me, they weren’t what?!
Speaker: SANSA

Text: They weren’t...
Speaker: THEON

Text: SANSA Tell me why Bran and Rickon should be dead while you still breathe the air. Tell me to my face Theon, tell me that they weren’t your brothers!
They weren’t Bran and Rickon! I couldn’t find them. It was two farm boys. I killed them and burned them so no one would know.
Speaker: THEON

Text: You didn’t…?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Theon shakes his head no.
Do you know where they went, Bran and Rickon?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I can’t talk to you anymore.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Theon, you have to tell me, do you have any idea where Bran and Rickon--
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Not Theon, Reek!
Speaker: THEON

Text: Theon runs out the door.
Our scouts tells us he’s got no more than 6000 men. More than half of them are mounted, however.
Speaker: BOLTON BANNERMAN

Text: And how high can Stannis’ horses jump? Our walls have been full repaired our walls have been reinforced. We have enough food for six months. We are more prepared for a siege than they could have ever been. All we have to do is wait for them to freeze, starve, and mutiny.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Ramsay gives a disagreeing look.
You disagree?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Stannis isn’t from the North. You are, father. I think you’re missing an opportunity to show the people of the North how House Bolton treats southern invaders.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: And what do you recommend?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: That we not sit and wait to let Stannis to decide what type of fight this is going to be. That we hit first, and hit hard, and leave a feast for the crows.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: A smart commander does not surrender a defensive advantage. As long as we stay behind these walls they can’t touch us. Not to mention that the snow is so deep that we couldn’t get an army through if we wanted to.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: I don’t need an army. I need 20 good men.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: INT. MEEREEN
So have you decided yet? Whether I’m worthy of your service?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Have you decided yet whether you’re going to have me killed?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It’s probably my safest option.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I can see why you would think so. It’s what your father would have done.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And what would your father do?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: My father? Who publicly sentenced me to death? I’d say his thoughts on having me killed were abundantly clear.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Is that why you killed him?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Some day if you decide not to execute me, I’ll tell you all about why I killed my father. And on that day, should it ever come, we’ll need more wine than this.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I know what my father was. What he did. I know the Mad King earned his name.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: So here we sit, two terrible children of two terrible fathers.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I’m terrible?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I’ve heard stories.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Why did you travel to the other side of the world to meet someone terrible?
Speaker: DANERYS

Text: To see if you were the right kind of terrible.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Which kind is that?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The kind that prevents your people from being even more so.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I did reopen the fighting pits. Under my rule murder will once again become entertainment.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Yes, that was wise. And you agreed to marry someone you loathed for the greater good. Very impressive. My own sister married someone she loathed as well, though not by choice and certainly not for the greater good, Gods forbid. She ended up having him killed.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Perhaps it won’t come to that.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: It’s not impossible that Varys was right about you after all.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Varys? King Robert’s spy master?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Yes. He was the one who convinced me to come find you. He was my travelling companion before Ser Jorah seized that role for himself.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Jorah sent my secrets to Varys. For 20 years the spider oversaw the campaign to find and kill me.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: He did what he had to do to survive. He did a lot of other things that he didn’t have to do. I suspect he’s the main reason you weren’t slaughtered in your crib.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: But you trust him?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Yes, oddly. He might be the only person in the world that I trust. Besides my brother.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The brother who killed my father.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: That’s the one.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Perhaps I will have you killed after all.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your queenly prerogative. I had given up on life until Varys convinced me you might be worth living for. You chop off my head? Well, my final days were interesting.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I’m not going to kill you.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: No? Banish me?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: So if I’m not going to be murdered, and I’m not going to be banished...
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You’re going to advise me. (takes his wine cup) While you can still speak in complete sentences.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Advise you on what?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: How to get what I want.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Iron Throne. Perhaps you should try wanting something else.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: If I want jokes I’ll get myself a proper fool.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I’m not entirely joking. There’s more to the world than Westeros after all. How many hundreds of thousands of lives have you changed for the better here? Perhaps this is where you belong. Where you can do the most good.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I fought so that no child born into Slaver’s Bay would ever know what it was like to be bought or sold. I will continue that fight here and beyond. But this is not my home.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: And when you get back to your home, who supports you?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The common people.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Let’s be generous and assume that’s going to happen. Here in Slaver’s Bay you had the support of the common people and only the common people. What was that like, ruling without the rich? House Targaryen is gone, not a single person who shares your blood is alive to support you. The Starks are gone as well, our two terrible fathers saw to that. The remaining Lannisters won’t back you, not ever. Stannis Baratheon won’t back you either, his entire claim to the Throne depends on the illegitimacy of yours. That leaves the Tyrells. Not impossible, but not enough.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Lannister, Targaryen, Baratheon, Stark, Tyrell. They’re all just spokes on a wheel. This one's on top, then that ones on top and on and on it spins, crushing the people on the ground.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: It’s a beautiful dream. Stopping the wheel. You’re not the first person to have dreamt it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I’m not going to stop the wheel. I’m going to break the wheel.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: EXT. FIGHTING PIT
Two gladiators spar. Jorah walks to the pit. The master whistles for them to stop fighting. Jorah flips him a coin.
You said whoever wins would fight at the Great Pit in front of the queen. I won.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You struck me.
Speaker: MASTER

Text: I’ve been flogged if it makes you happy. I’m the best you’ve got. If I win at the Great Pit how much can you sell me for?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You’re a free man, you could have gone anywhere, why did you come back?
Speaker: MASTER

Text: Let me fight for her and I belong to you.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: INT. BLACK CELLS
Thirsty? Confess.
Speaker: SEPTA

Text: I’ll get out of here, you realize. Before long.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Confess.
Speaker: SEPTA

Text: I can make you a wealthy woman. A lady of the court.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Confess.
Speaker: SEPTA

Text: I can make sure you die in the most hideous way imaginable, and all I do is sit here imagining ways for you to die.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: She dumps her water out on the floor. Cersei licks it from the floor when she leaves.
Does it hurt?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: No.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Good.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: How are you?
Speaker: SAM

Text: I’m not the one who got punched and kicked in the face.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: You know what I mean.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I’m good.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Are you scared?
Speaker: SAM

Text: A little.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Me too.
Speaker: SAM

Text: There is a knock on the door. Sam grabs his knife.
Who’s there?
Speaker: SAM

Text: Olly.
Speaker: OLLY

Text: Sam puts the knife down.
Come in.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I heard what happened.
Speaker: OLLY

Text: Not to worry. Men brawl from time to time. It’s only natural.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Olly sets a tray of food on Sam’s bed.
Figured you were hungry.
Speaker: OLLY

Text: You’re a good lad.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Wanted to ask you something. (Olly looks at Gilly) If you’ve got the time.
Speaker: OLLY

Text: I need to check on baby Sam.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: She exits the room.
Now then. How can I help?
Speaker: SAM

Text: It’s about the Lord Commander.
Speaker: OLLY

Text: Yes?
Speaker: SAM

Text: He’s going up to Hardhome to save all them wildlings. Wildlings killed my mom and dad. They killed everyone in my village.
Speaker: OLLY

Text: We’ve been fighting them for years.
Speaker: SAM

Text: This wasn’t a fight. We were farmers and they slaughtered us. So why’s he saving them?
Speaker: OLLY

Text: Wildlings are people, just like us. There are good ones and bad ones.
Speaker: SAM

Text: The one he’s travelling with, the one with the red beard, he led the raid on my village.
Speaker: OLLY

Text: Olly...
Speaker: SAM

Text: How can he trust him?
Speaker: OLLY

Text: I’ve seen the army of the dead. I’ve seen the white walkers, and they’re coming for us, for all the living. And when it’s time we’ll need every last man we can find.
Speaker: SAM

Text: But what if we let the wildings through the gates and they cut our throats while we sleep?
Speaker: OLLY

Text: Jon’s taking a risk, but he has to. We don’t stand a chance otherwise. Sometimes a man has to make hard choices, choices that might look wrong to others but you know are right in the long run.
Speaker: SAM

Text: You believe that?
Speaker: OLLY

Text: With all my heart.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Olly looks conflicted. He walks towards the door.
Try not to worry Olly. I’ve been worrying about Jon for years. He always comes back.
Speaker: SAM

Text: The ships full of Crows and wildlings dock at Hardhome. Jon and Tormund get out together. The camera fixates on the swords on their hips.
You trust me Jon Snow?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Does that make me a fool?
Speaker: JON

Text: We are fools together now.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: They walk to meet the men and women of Hardhome, lead by the Lord of Bones.
Lord of Bones. Been a long time.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Last time I saw you the little crow was your prisoner. The other way around now. What happened?
Speaker: LORD OF BONES

Text: War.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: You call that a war? The greatest army the North has ever seen cut to pieces by a southern king.
Speaker: LORD OF BONES

Text: We should gather the elders find somewhere quiet to talk.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: You don’t give the orders here.
Speaker: LORD OF BONES

Text: I’m not giving an order.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Why aren’t you in chains?
Speaker: LORD OF BONES

Text: He’s not my prisoner.
Speaker: JON

Text: What is he?
Speaker: LORD OF BONES

Text: We’re allies.
Speaker: JON

Text: The Hardhome wildlings complain loudly.
You fucking traitor! You fight for the crows now.
Speaker: LORD OF BONES

Text: I don’t fight for the crows.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: We’re not here to fight. We’re here to talk.
Speaker: JON

Text: Is that right? You and the pretty crow do a lot of talking, Tormund. And when you’re done talking, do you get down on your knees and suck his cock--
Speaker: LORD OF BONES

Text: Tormund grabs the Lord of Bones’ staff from him and beats him to death with it.
Gather the elders and let’s talk.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Jon is surrounded by Karsi, a Wildling chieftess, Loboda, a Thenn, a Wildling elder, and various other Wildlings.

My name’s Jon Snow. I’m Lord Commander of the Night’s Watch. We’re not friends. We’ve never been friends. We won’t become friends today. This isn’t about friendship. This is about survival. This is about putting a 700 foot wall between you and what’s out there.
Speaker: JON

Text: You built that wall to keep us out.
Speaker: KARSI

Text: Since when do the crows give 2 shits if we live?
Speaker: LOBODA

Text: In normal times we wouldn’t. But these aren’t normal times. The white walkers don’t care if a man’s Free Folk or Crow. We’re all the same to them. Meat to their army. But together we can beat them.
Speaker: JON

Text: Beat the white walkers? Good luck with that. Run from them, maybe.
Speaker: KARSI

Text: Jon holds the bag full of Dragonstone to Karsi. She looks at it hesitantly.
It’s not a trick. It’s a gift for those who join us.
Speaker: JON

Text: Karsi examine the glass in shock.
Dragonglass. A man of the Night’s Watch used one of these daggers to kill a walker.
Speaker: JON

Text: You saw this?
Speaker: LOBODA

Text: No. But I trust the man.
Speaker: JON

Text: There are old stories about Dragonglass.
Speaker: KARSI

Text: There are old stories about ice spiders big as hounds.
Speaker: LOBODA

Text: And with the things we’ve seen you don’t believe them?
Speaker: KARSI

Text: Come with me and I'll share these weapons.
Speaker: JON

Text: Come with you where?
Speaker: KARSI

Text: There are good lands south of the wall.  The Night's Watch will allow you through the tunnel and allow your people to farm those lands.
Speaker: JON

Text: There is hesitation.
I knew Mance Rayder. He never wanted a war with the Night’s Watch, he wanted a new life for his people. For you. We’re prepared to give you that new life.
Speaker: JON

Text: If…?
Speaker: KARSI

Text: If you swear you join us when the real war begins.
Speaker: JON

Text: Where is Mance?
Speaker: LOBODA

Text: He died.
Speaker: JON

Text: How?
Speaker: LOBODA

Text: I put an arrow through his heart.
Speaker: JON (after a long pause)

Text: The wildlings in the cabin start to riot.
I say we send the Lord Commander back to Castle Black with no eyes.
Speaker: LOBODA

Text: Loboda brandishes his axe. Tormund steps forward.

None of you saw Mance die! I did. The Southern King who broke our army, Stannis, wanted to burn him alive to send him a message. Jon Snow defied that cunt’s orders. His arrow was mercy. What it did took courage, and that’s what we need today: the courage to make peace with men we’ve been fighting for generations.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I lost my father, my uncle, and 2 brothers fighting the damn crows.
Speaker: KARSI

Text: I’m not asking you to forget your dead. I’ll never forget mine. I lost 50 brothers the night that Mance attacked the wall. But I’m asking you to think about your children now. They’ll never have children of their own if we don’t band together. The Long Night is coming and the dead come with it. No clan can stop them. The free folk can’t stop them. The Night’s Watch can’t stop them. And all the southern kings can’t stop them. Only together, all of us, and even then it might not be enough, but at least then we’ll give the fuckers a fight.
Speaker: JON

Text: There are small nods of approval throughout the room.
You vouch for this man, Tormund?
Speaker: KARSI

Text: He’s prettier than both my daughters, but he knows how to fight. He’s young, but he knows how to lead. He didn’t have to come to Hardhome. He came because he needs us. And we need him.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: My ancestors would spit on me if I broke bread with a crow.
Speaker: LOBODA

Text: So would mine, but fuck 'em, they’re dead.
Speaker: KARSI

Text: Karsi walks in front of Jon.
I’ll never trust a man in black.
Karsi walks over to Tormund.
But I trust you, Tormund. If you say this is the way, we’re with you.
This is the way.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I’m with Tormund. We stay here we’re dead men. At least with King Crow there’s a chance.
Speaker: WILDLING ELDER

Text: Tormund.
Speaker: GIANT

Text: Keep that new life you want to give us. Keep your glass, King Crow. Soon as you get on his ships they’re gonna slit your throats and dump your bodies to the bottom of the Shivering Sea. That’s our enemy. That has always been our enemy.
Speaker: LOBODA

Text: Wildlings start leaving the cabin and head towards the boats.
I fucking hate Thenns.
Speaker: KARSI (to Tormund)

Text: Tormund nods.
Jon, Tormund, and Karsi lead the Wildlings to the boats.
How many are with us? 5000?
Speaker: JON

Text: I’m not good at counting.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: We’re leaving too many behind.
Speaker: JON

Text: The free folk are stubborn. You know how long it took Mance to band them together. 20 fucking years.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: And he knew them better than I ever will.
Speaker: JON

Text: They’re running out of food and there’s nothing to hunt. They’ll come around.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Cut to Karsi loading two children onto a boat.
Johnna is gonna look after you. She’s in charge, you listen to her.
Speaker: KARSI

Text: I wanna go with you.
Speaker: DAUGHTER

Text: I need to get the old folks on the boats. I’m right behind you, I promise. (she kisses them on the forehead) Go on.
Speaker: KARSI

Text: The Giant picks up a piece of Dragonglass and strokes it intently. Edd begins picking up the pieces of glass and looks at the giant with his piece of glass. Wun Wun turns to Edd and stares at him annoyed.
Lokh kif rukh?
Speaker: WUN WUN

Text: Edd leaves. Dogs are barking outside.

Jon loads girls onto a boat then turns to hear the dogs barking. The wind starts whipping from a neighboring cliff and the dogs start whimpering. Every wildling and Crow slowly turns to the source of the noise.
Shut the gate.
Speaker: LOBODA

Text: Men hurry towards the gate to board it up. More howling from the distance. The Wildlings on the other side of the gate begin charging the gate.
Shut the gate!!
Speaker: LOBODA

Text: Men rush to put a board in place to hold the gate shut.
Wait! Open the gate! Let us in! Help us! Please open it!
Speaker: SHOUTING

Text: Loboda walks to the gate with his axe and peers through a small hole in the wall. There is a faint scream in the distance, then a wight charges at the hole in the wall.
Ready your arrows!
Speaker: LOBODA

Text: The wights claw at the gate. Arrows are nocked and fired. A wight sticks his hand through the gate and Loboda chops it off.
There is a mad rush towards the boats with many people jumping in the water to catch one.
Get in line! Get in line!
Speaker: JON

Text: A wight tries to climb the gate.
Wights crawl to the top of the cabin and jumps through the hole in the roof. The men prepare their weapons and the giant growls.

One wight tries to climb under the gate. A barrage of arrows flies at the wights trying to get through the wall. Most of them land. The wight crawls even further under the gate. The wights start making holes in the gate. A sword sticks through the gate coming close to Loboda on the gate. Loboda dodges the sword, looks down to see the wight crawling under the gate, and stomps its head in.
The people continue to rush onto the boats with Jon, Tormund, and Karsi leading them.
Hold the line! Hold the line!
Speaker: JON

Text: Lord Commander!
Speaker: NIGHT’S WATCH BROTHER

Text: Get them to the ship and come back for me!
Speaker: JON

Text: But you’ll never make it--
Speaker: BROTHER

Text: Now!
Speaker: JON

Text: Karsi approaches Jon.
You should be on one of those boats.
Speaker: JON

Text: So should you ! My little girl has gone on. They're gonna let them pass the wall even if you’re not there ?
Speaker: KARSI

Text: You have my word. I’ve given orders.
Speaker: JON

Text: Don’t think you’re gonna be there to enforce those orders !
Speaker: KARSI

Text: Karsi heads back to helping people onto the boats.
If they get through, everyone dies !
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Night’s Watch with me! Move! Move! Move!
Speaker: JON

Text: Jon, Tormund, Karsi, and the Night’s Watch brothers charge from the shore to the gate.

The wights have knocked a hole into the gate big enough to crawl out of. One breaks through, tears someone apart, and then is taken down. A group of wights storm through the same hole. Cut to an overhead that shows just how many wights are behind the gate.

Jon arrives at the gate. He pins a wight to the gate with Longclaw as Tormund and Karsi kill the wights that have already gotten through. The archers take out the wight Jon pinned to the gate, and then the men cover the hole the wights had been escaping from with a sled.
Fighting continues. A group of wights tear into a Crow. Loboda and Karsi continue to kill the wights.
Jon looks up through the mist and sees 4 White Walkers on horseback on the top of the cliff.
The Dragonglass!
Speaker: JON

Text: You’re with me, lad! Now!
Speaker: LOBODA

Text: Jon and Loboda charge towards the cabin. Jon cuts a wight in half then kills another. The giant breaks through a wall in the cabin as the cabin starts to go down in flames. He shakes the wights off of his back, snapping some in half and stomping others into pieces. Jon and Loboda storm the cabin.
The entire cabin is on fire. A White Walker wielding a staff walks towards them through the fire.
Get the glass.
Speaker: LOBODA

Text: Loboda walks towards the White Walker as Jon scrambles towards the Dragonglass. Loboda misses with his axe twice, getting it caught in the wall. He pulls it out to parry in time, but the Walker’s spear shatters his axe. The Walker plunges his spear through Loboda's stomach.

Jon reaches the glass but is thrown across the room by the Walker before he can pick it up, causing Longclaw to fly out of the cabin. Jon ducks from the Walker’s swings with his spear, and runs out to grab another sword. The Walker swings and shatters the sword. He knocks Jon down again. Jon struggles, then gets up again, running to pick up Longclaw. He stumbles and drops the sword. The White Walker staggers towards him. Jon picks up Longclaw just in time to match the White Walker, and to both of their surprises, Longclaw stops the Walker’s spear. The Walker deflects one blow from Jon, but then he swings and shatters the Walker into pieces.
Jon falls to the ground after the struggle. The Night’s King watches him alone from the top of the cliff.

Tormund and Karsi continue to tear through wights. Karsi looks up, and sees a group of blue-eyed wight children staring at her. They do nothing for a moment, then charge at her, chewing and clawing her to death.
Cut to Jon crawling across the snow, coughing up blood. A man grabs him and Jon puts Longclaw to his neck. The man turns out to be Edd and they lower their weapons.
The Dragonglass!
Speaker: JON

Text: Fuck the glass! We’re gonna die here.
Speaker: EDD

Text: A screech comes from the top of the cliff. Hundreds of wights dive from the top of the cliff. They appear to have died for a brief moment after landing, but then wake up and charge at Jon and Edd.
Cut to Tormund continuing to hold the gate. The gate starts creaking then comes down. Tormund runs to the boat.

The giant starts roaring as the other gate comes down, swinging a fiery log. Jon, Tormund, and Edd sprint towards the boat with the giant clearing a path for them with the log. The Night’s King continues to watch them from the top of the cliff.
Jon, Tormund, and the Crow jump off the dock onto the boat.
Go! Go! Go!
Speaker: JON

Text: Wun Wun, to the sea.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: The giant stays back, continuing to take out loads of wights by swinging his flaming log. He begins to walk towards the boat, ripping the wights hanging onto him off of his back and throwing them into the water to die.
Let’s go now! Now!
Speaker: JON

Text: Jon looks back to shore to see the Wights, along with a White Walker, killing the last surviving wildlings.

Slowly, a figure walks to the end of the dock. The camera pans up to reveal the Night’s King. He stares at Jon and Jon stares back. The Night’s King turns his head to the carnage at the edge of the shore and then looks back to Jon. He slowly starts raising his arms.The dead wildlings twitch, then open their eyes to reveal blue. Karsii comes back to life, blue-eyed . They all start standing up, joining the army of the dead, and staring at Jon.
