Jon can do nothing but stare back at the Night’s King back as the boat drifts away.
END EPISODE
A man walks by each of the tents.
INT. MELISANDRE’S TENT
Melisandre stares into the fire. She exits the tent.
Melisandre surveys the camp. In the distance, a tent catches on fire. Men start screaming and rushing out of their tents. A burning horse runs by Melisandre.
A band of 20 men, maybe less. They were in and out before anyone spotted them, burnt our food stores to the ground, all our siege weapons were destroyed, dozens of tents were--
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Horses?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: We’re still getting a count, but hundreds are dead.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: 20 men rode into our camp without a single guard sounding the alarm?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: The northerners know more about their land than we ever will.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Put last night’s guards in chains, either they fell asleep or they were conspiring with the enemy. Find out the truth and then hang them.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Unless there’s a thaw, we can’t press forward to Winterfell, and we don’t have enough food to get us back to Castle Black.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: We’re not returning to Castle Black.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Forgive me, Your Grace, I never claimed to be an expert in military matters. But if we can’t march forward, and we won’t march back…
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Stannis looks to Melisandre and Selyse. Davos follows his gaze then looks back.
Have the dead horses butchered for meat.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Stannis walks over to Melisandre.
EXT. THE WALL
The Hardhome survivors, led by Jon, Tormund, Tollett, and Wun-Wun, approach the wall. Alliser looks down at the group. Jon steps forward, Alliser stares for a moment, then--
Open the gates.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: The lower gate is lifted.
EXT. CASTLE BLACK
The Hardhome Wildlings are being escorted through Castle Black.
It was a failure.
Speaker: JON

Text: It wasn’t.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I went to save them, I failed.
Speaker: JON

Text: You didn’t fail him, or him, or her. Every one of them is alive because of you, and no one else.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I don’t think that fact’s lost on them.
Speaker: JON

Text: Cut to many men of the Night’s Watch glaring at Jon, then Olly who exchanges a long look with Jon from the top of the stairs. Alliser walks down the steps to Jon.
You have a good heart, Jon Snow. It will get us all killed.
Speaker: ALLISER

Text: INT. STANNIS’ TENT
Stannis is studying his chessboard. There are 2 Baratheon pieces next to a sword and opposed to 2 Bolton pieces. Davos enters the tent.
You sent for me, Your Grace.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Find you some healthy horses and a few good men to guard you, I’m sending you back to Castle Black. Tell the Lord Commander to send food, supplies, fresh horses, in return when I take the throne I’ll make sure the Night’s Watch has all the men it requires. He can guard all 19 castles if he so wishes.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Your Grace, you’ve named me your Hand.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Yes.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: The King’s Hand should never abandon the King, especially in a time of war.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You’re not abandoning me, you’re obeying a command.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: A boy with a scroll could deliver this message.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: And if Jon Snow refuses a boy with a scroll, what does the boy say? I didn’t name you hand for your expertise in military matters, ride for Castle Black, don’t come back empty handed.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Your Grace, perhaps Queen and Princess Shireen could accompany me.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: My family stays with me.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: At least let me take Shireen. A siege is no place for a little girl.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: My family stays with me.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: EXT. STANNIS’ CAMP
The men are shivering, waiting in line for food. Davos walks by.
INT. SHIREEN’S TENT
Shireen is reading one of her books. Davos enters.
What’s this one now?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: "The Dance of Dragons: A True Telling" by Grand Maester Munkun.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Well that sounds like a proper story.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Ser Byron Swann wanted to kill the dragon Vhagar. He polished his shield for a week, til the steel was like a mirror. Then he crouched behind it, and crept forward, hoping the dragon would only see his own reflection.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: But the dragon only saw a dumb man, holding a mirrored shield.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: And burnt him to a crisp.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Davos and Shireen share a laugh.
Thus ending the dragonslaying career of Ser Byron Swann. I made you something, Princess.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Davos hands her a stag carved out of wood.
Do you like it?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: He’s beautiful.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Shireen kisses him on the cheek.
Thank you.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: You’re very welcome.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Will you make me a doe, too, so that he can have company?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Of course I will.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: But why am I getting a present?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Because you deserve it. My son was always on me trying to teach me to read. Gods, I was stubborn about it. Made it this far without reading, seemed to me I could make it to the grave. I wish I had listened to them. This is my own poor way of saying thank you for teaching me to be a grown up. (beat) I’ll be gone for a few days, Princess. I’ll want to hear all about the dance of dragons when I’m back.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You’ll just have to read it yourself.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Davos kisses Shireen on her forehead then leaves. Shireen looks over the stag.
Jaime is escorted by Areo to Doran’s room.
Prince Doran. (bows)
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Forgive us, we started without you. Please, sit.
Speaker: DORAN

Text: Princess Myrcella.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Uncle.
Speaker: MYRCELLA

Text: What a lovely dress.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You don’t like it?
Speaker: MYRCELLA

Text: You must be cold.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Not at all. The Dornish climate agrees with me.
Speaker: MYRCELLA

Text: Prince Trystane. How’s your jaw?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: A fleabite.
Speaker: TRYSTANE

Text: What are you doing in Dorne?
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Looking out for the safety of my niece, the princess Myrcella.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And rather than send a raven or speak to me directly you decided to enter my country in secret and abduct our guest by force.
Speaker: DORAN

Text: We received a threatening message. The princess’s necklace in the jaws of a viper.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Jaime looks at Ellaria.
That necklace was stolen from my room.
Speaker: MYRCELLA (surprised)

Text: Doran looks at Ellaria. A servant sets down food and drink before Jaime.
Ah. Excellent. The last meal before the beheading.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: We can’t behead you. Many in Dorne want war. But I’ve seen war. I’ve seen the bodies piled on the battlefields. I’ve seen the orphans starving in the cities. I don’t want to lead my people into that hell.
Speaker: DORAN

Text: No, you want to break bread with the Lannisters.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: And that is precisely what we are doing. (raises glass) Let us drink to Tommen, the first of his name, the King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: DORAN

Text: Everyone drinks. Ellaria dumps her cup out on the floor and looks at Doran.
King Tommen insists on his sister’s return to the capital?
Speaker: DORAN

Text: I’m afraid he does.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I cannot disobey my King’s command. (Ellaria glares at Doran) She will return with you to King’s Landing. And my son, Prince Trystane, will accompany you both. If the alliance between Dorne and the Iron Throne is to continue, their engagement must stand.
Speaker: DORAN

Text: I accept.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: One more thing. My brother was named to the small council before his death. Your father understood the importance of keeping Dorne in the loop. With Oberyn gone, Trystane will take his place on the small council.
Speaker: DORAN

Text: You have my word.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The word of a Kingslayer.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Ellaria gets up and walks to Doran.
No wonder you can’t stand. You have no spine.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Ellaria tries to leave the room. Doran grabs her wrist.
You are mother to four of my nieces, girls I love very much. For their sake, I hope you live a long life. Talk to me that way again and you won’t.
Speaker: DORAN

Text: Doran lets go. Ellaria leaves the room.
May I inquire into the fate of my man?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Tell me, Ser Jaime, in King’s Landing, how do they punish a commoner who strikes a prince?
Speaker: DORAN

Text: He said it was just a fleabite. The fault is mine. Bronn is merely a soldier following my orders. If anyone should be punished it’s me.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Prince Trystane must learn judgement if he’s to rule one day. I’ll let him decide.
Speaker: DORAN

Text: Jaime looks to Trystane. Trystane considers.
I have learned the value of mercy from my father. I will set your man free.
Speaker: TRYSTANE

Text: You’re a good man.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: On one condition.
Speaker: TRYSTANE

Text: Bronn is laying on the ground in his cell. Tyene and Nymeria are playing a game where one tries to slap the other’s hand before they pull their hands away. Nymeria slaps Tyene.
You’re going to miss.
Speaker: TYENE

Text: I never miss.
Speaker: NYMERIA

Text: You will. You’re thinking too much. Now you’re nervous. “What if she’s right?”
Speaker: TYENE

Text: Nymeria slaps at Tyene and Tyene gets out of the way in time.
Luck.
Speaker: NYMERIA

Text: Now it’s my turn.
Speaker: TYENE

Text: You’re too slow. You’ve always been too slow.
Speaker: NYMERIA

Text: Nymeria sticks her hands out and blows a kiss to Tyene. Tyene slaps her across the face then blows one back. They get in fighting stances as the guards arrive. They take Bronn out of his cell.
Am I going to be happy at the end of this walk?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You’ll find out very soon.
Speaker: AREO

Text: Bronn starts leaving the prison.
Say it one more time, handsome. Who am I?
Speaker: TYENE

Text: The most beautiful woman in the world.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: And that’s the truth!
Speaker: TYENE

Text: Slut.
Speaker: NYMERIA

Text: Tyene laughs.
Areo escorts Bronn into Doran’s room.
Prince Doran, Ser Bronn of the Blackwater.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: : I didn’t realize there were knights of the Blackwater.
Speaker: DORAN

Text: Only the one.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I believe you’ve already met Prince Trystane.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Prince. Sorry about the other day.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Prince Trystane here is a man of mercy. He’s agreed to grant you your freedom.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I’m glad to hear it. The pie looks good.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: There was one condition.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Jaime nods to Areo. Areo elbows Bronn in the jaw, knocking him to the ground.
Perhaps some soup instead?
Speaker: DORAN

Text: Arya pushes her oyster cart through the street.
Oysters, clams, and cockels! Oysters, clams, and cockels! Oysters, clams, and cockels! Oysters, clams, and cock--
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Two shady looking men approach her.
How much for your little clam?
Speaker: MAN

Text: They laugh and walk away. Arya looks down the street and sees the Thin Man, looking over another sailor’s application.
Oysters, clams, and cockels! Oysters, clams, and cockels!
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Arya stops her cart, inspects the vile Jaqen gave to her, and tucks it back in her pouch. She starts pushing the cart again and makes eye contact with the Thin Man.
Come on.
Speaker: THIN MAN (waving)

Text: Arya stares off into the distance.
Some oysters, girl! I’m talking to you! Girl?! Are you deaf? Girl?!
Speaker: THIN MAN

Text: Arya looks to the dock, and sees Meryn Trant and Mace Tyrell being helped off the boat. A Iron Banker approaches him and Arya starts walking away from the Thin Man and towards them.
Lord Tyrell! On behalf of the Iron Bank, may I be the first to welcome you to the free city of Braavos. I hope your journey was trouble free.
Speaker: BANKER

Text: Bit of chop the last few days but nothing too awful. Good to see the old chap is still guarding the Harbor.
Speaker: MACE

Text: And how goes the harvest in the Reach?
Speaker: BANKER

Text: Vintnors say this might be the best year for red grapes in half a century. If we come to a satisfactory arrangement, I’ll be sure to send the Arbor’s finest your way.
Speaker: MACE

Text: I’m afraid I don’t partake.
Speaker: BANKER

Text: Arya studies the group, focuses in on Meryn, and begins following them with her cart.
Some consider usury distasteful, dishonorable. Pure nonsense, of course.
Speaker: MACE

Text: I'm glad we see eye-to-eye on this matter.
Speaker: BANKER

Text: Did you know that at one point Maegor the third tried to outlaw it in the Seven Kingdoms? Wanted to arrest anyone caught charging interest and cut off both their hands.
Speaker: MACE

Text: Meryn and Arya exchange quick looks at each other.
Most unfortunate for the glovers.
Speaker: BANKER

Text: If a man charges low interest on a loan then he has nothing to gain and everything to lose, so why charge him? Whereas a reward makes a man willing to gamble.
Speaker: MACE

Text: We are not gamblers here at the Iron Bank, Lord Tyrell.
Speaker: BANKER

Text: You are the world's best gamblers. And all those bets you won built this.
Speaker: MACE

Text: Mace gestures to the Iron Bank and the camera cuts to it.
Arya is waiting on the steps of the building opposite the bank, eating her oysters. The men start walking out of the Bank.
I’m afraid I still have a good deal of work to do.
Speaker: BANKER

Text: Oh, nonsense. Work's over. Do you sing?
Speaker: MACE

Text: I don't have that gift.
Speaker: BANKER

Text: It's not a gift, it’s a skill, anyone can learn it. “So give me a kiss by the Long Canall and give me two kisses in Salty Town, for we are going to die, tomorrow. The bareheaded beggar, the king with his crown…”
Speaker: MACE

Text: Meryn Trant and his men walk through the doorway.
I thought that old shit would never stop singing.
Speaker: MERYN

Text: It wasn’t bad, though.
Speaker: MAN

Text: The Tyrells can all rot in hell, treasonous cunts. They were going to make that boy-fucker Renly king.
Speaker: MERYN

Text: They arrive at a door.
This is the place, lads. The sleekest little minks in Braavos.
Speaker: MERYN

Text: You’re buying?
Speaker: MAN

Text: Oh, I’m buying. But I never was good at sharing.
Speaker: MERYN

Text: They enter the brothel. Arya pulls up to the doorway with her cart and sees the men entering.
INT. BROTHEL
Arya walks through the door with a tray of oysters. The brothel keeper stops her.
Sell your fish somewhere else.
Speaker: BROTHEL KEEPER

Text: Oh let her in, Brusco, I’m hungry. Come here, sweetness.
Speaker: PROSTITUTE

Text: The brothel keeper gestures nods for Arya to go on. She walks to the prostitute and the man she’s with.
They say oyster’s get the juices flowing. We’ll take half a dozen.
Speaker: PROSTITUTE

Text: Three coppers.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Arya begins cutting an oyster open.
Here’s a silver because the lady likes you.
Speaker: JOHN

Text: The man places a silver on her tray in exchange for the oysters. Arya turns and sees Trant’s men being taken to a back room.
Arya enters the room and peers through a divider to see a prostitute posing for Meryn.
Too old.
Speaker: MERYN

Text: Brea.
Speaker: HEAD PROSTITUTE

Text: Brea poses for Meryn.
Too old.
Speaker: MERYN

Text: I have just the one. Anara our most expensive girl, but well worth it, I assure you.
Speaker: HEAD

Text: A younger, 20-something prostitute poses for Meryn.
Too old.
Speaker: MERYN

Text: The people in the room share uneasy glances as they realize what he’s asking for.
Do you have what I want or not?
Speaker: MERYN

Text: Of course. Of course.
Speaker: HEAD

Text: One of Trant’s men crosses to the other side of the divider and confronts Arya.
Fresh? Come on, the lads are hungry.
Speaker: MAN

Text: The man drags her into the room.
Nothing better for you cock stand than fresh oysters.
Speaker: MAN

Text: I’ll have one.
Speaker: MAN 2

Text: Meryn stares at Arya.
Who let this girl in? Shoo shoo!
Speaker: HEAD

Text: The head prostitute brings in a child.
Good.
Speaker: MERYN

Text: The head prostitute hands Meryn an hourglass. He hands it back.
I’ll tell you when we’re done.
Speaker: MERYN

Text: He leads the girl towards a bedroom.
You’ll have a fresh one for me tomorrow.
Speaker: MERYN

Text: Of course.
Speaker: HEAD

Text: The head prostitute realizes Arya is still standing there.
I’ll have you whipped, girl! Go on!
Speaker: HEAD

Text: Arya leaves the room, but takes one last glance at where Meryn is taking the girl.
INT. HOUSE OF BLACK AND WHITE
Jaqen kneels next to a man at the fountain of the center of the room and offers him a drink from the fountain.
Valaar morghulis.
Speaker: MAN

Text: The man takes a drink. Arya approaches Jaqen.
And?
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: The Thin Man wasn’t hungry today.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Perhaps that’s why the man is thin.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: The man drops to the ground, creating a thud off-screen.
Tomorrow.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Tomorrow.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: A girl has work to do.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: Arya walks towards the man who is now collapsed on the ground.
Doran is addressing Ellaria with Areo standing guard next to the three Sand Snakes.
Your rebellion is over. You can swear your allegiance to me now, or you can die.
Speaker: DORAN

Text: She kneels and kisses his ring, crying. Nymeria and Obara look disgusted, Tyene’s face reveals less.
I believe in second chances. I don’t believe in third chances.
Speaker: DORAN

Text: Jaime is writing a letter in his former cell that is now unlocked. Ellaria enters.
You write like a 7 year old.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Your maester kindly agreed to copy it over for me.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He didn’t try to make you pay?
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Then maybe he’s changed. The Queen will be thrilled to know you’ll be bringing her daughter home
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: She will.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You love her very much, don’t you?
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Of course, she’s my niece.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I wasn’t talking about her.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Jaime looks up from his writing at Ellaria.

You think I disapprove. Why? Because people disapprove of that sort of thing where you are from? They disapproved of Oberyn and me where you are from. Here, no one blinked an eye. 100 years ago, no one would have blinked an eye at you if you had been named Targaryen.  It’s always changing, who we’re supposed to love and who we’re not.The only thing that stays the same is that we want who we want.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Ellaria pauses, taking a walks around the room.
I know your daughter had no part in the terrible thing that happened to the man I loved. Perhaps even you were innocent of that.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Ellaria exits the room.
INT. SHIREEN’S TENT
Shireen plays with her stag figurine next to a fire and on top of her book. Stannis enters the tent.
Father. Aren’t you cold?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: No. What are you reading?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: The Dance of Dragons.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: What’s it about?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: It’s the story of the fight between Rhaenyra Targaryen and her half-brother Aegon for control of the Seven Kingdoms. Both of them thought they belonged on the Iron Throne. When people started for declaring for one of them or the other, their fight divided the kingdom in two. Brothers fought brothers. Dragons fought dragons. By the time it was over, thousands were dead. And it was a disaster for the Targaryens as well. They never truly recovered.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: “The dance of dragons”? Why is that a dance?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: That’s just what they call it.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Doesn’t make much sense.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I think it’s poetic.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: If you had to choose between Rhaenyra and Aegon, who would you have chosen?
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: I wouldn’t have chosen either. It’s all the choosing sides that made things so horrible.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Sometimes a person has to choose. Sometimes the world forces his hand. If a man knows what he is and remains true to himself, the choice is not choice at all. He must fulfill his destiny and become who he is meant to be. However much he may hate it.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: It’s alright, father.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: You don’t even know what I’m talking about.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: It doesn’t matter. I want to help you. Is there any way I can help?
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Yes there is.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Good, I want to. I’m the Princess Shireen of House Baratheon and I’m your daughter.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: They hug.
Forgive me.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: EXT. STANNIS’ CAMP
Shireen is flanked by guards as she walks towards a pyre, clutching the stag Davos gave her. When she arrives at the pyre Melisandre steps to the front.
Where’s my father? I want to see my father.
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: It will all be over soon, Princess.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: The men drag her to the pyre and tie her up.
Where’s my father? No you can’t do this, father where are you?!
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Stannis watches on from the crowd.
Let me see my father! Where are you, please?!
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: It’s what the Lord wants. It’s a good thing. A great thing.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: The year is now, my Lord. For you we offer up this girl, that you may cleanse her with your fire and that its light may lead our way.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: If we don’t act then we’ll all starve here all of us, but if we make this sacrifice…
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Accept this token of our faith, my lord and lead us from the darkness. Lord of Light show us the way!
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Mother, please mother! Mother, please mother!
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: I can’t.
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: There’s no other way. She has King’s blood.
Speaker: STANNIS

Text: Lord of Light protect us, for the night is dark and full of terrors!
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Mother, don’t do this please! Please help! Don’t do this! Please, father! Mother, help!
Speaker: SHIREEN

Text: Melisandre lights the pyre. Selyse runs towards the pyre and is stopped by Stannis’ men. Shireen burns as Melisandre, Selyse, and Stannis look on, Melisandre pleased, Selyse horrified, and Stannis conflicted.
No...
Speaker: SELYSE

Text: Daenerys sits next to Missandei at the top of the pit, with an open seat between her and Tyrion at the end, and Daario standing behind them. Hizdahr takes the open seat.
Where have you been?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Just making sure everything’s in order.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: Camera pans through the fighting pit to reveal it is covered with House Targaryen sigils. An announcer steps to the middle of the pit and waves his arm to silence the crowd.
Free citizens of Meereen! By the blessings of the Graces and her majesty the Queen, welcome to the Great Games!
Speaker: ANNOUNCER (Valyrian)

Text: My queen, our first contest. Who will triumph: the strong or the quick?
Speaker: ANNOUNCER

Text: I fight and die for your glory, oh glorious queen.
Speaker: QUICK

Text: I fight and die for your glory, oh glorious queen.
Speaker: STRONG

Text: They stand waiting in front of her. The crowd is silent.
They’re waiting for you. Clap your hands.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: Daenerys looks down at the two men. After a moment, and with a look of disgust on her face, she claps her hands. The crowd roars and they start fighting. After some parries, the Quick man slices at the Strong man’s neck.
That one, the smaller man, no question, that’s where you should put your money.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: The smaller man it is.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I’m not putting my money anywhere.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Kings and queens never bet on the games. Perhaps you should go find someone who does.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: People used to bet against me when I fought in the pits. (looks at Hizdahr) He would have bet against me. Common novice mistake.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: I have spent much of my life in Meereen, and in my experience, larger men do triumph over smaller man, far more often than not.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: Has your experience ever involved any actual fighting? You, yourself, have you ever tried to kill a man that was trying to kill you?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Hizdahr is silent.

Whenever I got into the pit against a beast like that one, the crowd saw me, all skin and bone back then, then they saw a pile of angry muscles ready to murder me. They couldn’t get their money out fast enough. But the pile of angry muscles never had any muscles here (he puts a dagger to his neck) or here (he puts the dagger to Hizdahr’s neck). And the big men were always too slow to stop my dagger from going where their muscles weren’t. Yes, whenever I saw a beast like that one, standing across from me making his beast faces, I knew I could rest easy.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: The Strong man decapitates the Quick man with one quick stroke. Hizdahr smiles and Daario looks turns away angrily. Tyrion says nothing.
You don’t approve?
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: There’s always been more than enough death in the world for my taste. I can do without it in my leisure time.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It’s easy to confuse what is with what ought to be. Especially when what is has worked in your favor.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I’m not talking about myself. I’m talking about the necessary conditions of greatness.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: Cut to pit workers carrying the decapitated head out of the pit, leaving a trail of blood behind.
That is greatness?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: That is a vital part of the great city of Meereen. Which has existed long before you arrived and will remain standing long after we have returned to the dirt.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: My father would have liked you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We ask again: who will triumph?
Speaker: ANNOUNCER

Text: One day your great city will return to the dirt as well.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: At your command?
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: If need be.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: A Meereenese champion?
Speaker: ANNOUNCER

Text: The crowd applauds.
How many people will die to make this happen?
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: If it comes to that they would have died for a good reason.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Those men think they’re dying for a good reason.
Speaker: HIZDAHR (looks at pit)

Text: Someone else’s reason.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: So your reasons are true, and theirs are false. They don’t know their own minds, but you do.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: Well said, you’re an eloquent man. Doesn’t mean you’re wrong. In my experience, eloquent men are right every bit as often as imbeciles.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: ...or a Westerosi Knight?!
Speaker: ANNOUNCER

Text: Crowd jeers.
I fight and die for your glory, oh glorious Queen.
Speaker: JORAH (O.S.)

Text: Daenerys stares at Jorah. They both hold back emotion.
Your Grace--
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: Shut your mouth.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Daenerys claps. Jorah nods. They begin fighting, with Daenerys’ eyes following Jorah. He takes a blow to the mouth, is knocked down and starts bleeding. He gets up, has his sword knocked away, and pulls out a dagger. He wrestles with the man trying to choke him, throws him off, then stabs him in the chest. He pulls the dagger out, looking at Daenerys, throws it away, and picks up his longsword.

Jorah squares off against a flashy fighter that just brutally stabbed another fighter through the back. He slices Jorah in the cheek. The other two fighters square off, with a heavily armored fighter wielding a spear killing his opponent. The crowd cheers.
Jorah’s opponent slices Jorah’s arm then knocks him over, knocking his sword out of his hand. He holds his blade to Jorah’s throat. Both he and Jorah look to Daenerys.
You can end this.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She cannot.
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: You can!
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The fighter holds his blade to Jorah’s throat. He is about to make a move when the other fighter comes over and stabs Jorah’s opponent in the back, killing him. Jorah gets up and faces the final opponent. Jorah matches the spearman, is knocked over, but catches the spear before it reaches his throat. He gets back up and the two face off again. Jorah spins, somersaults, and stabs him through the stomach, killing him. He looks up to Daenerys.

Jorah reaches for his opponent’s spear. He picks it up and hurls it towards Daenerys’ seat. Daario rushes to protect Daenerys and everyone else gets out of the way. It connects with a Son of the Harpy.
Cut to the crowd. Many audience members have put on Sons of the Harpy masks.
Protect your queen!
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: The Sons of the Harpy start slitting the throats of former slaves and Unsullied in the crowd. Unsullied guards and Daario surround Daenerys and Missandei, fighting off the Harpys. Hizdahr starts running towards Daenerys.
Your Grace, Your Grace, come with me! I know a way out! I know a way--
Speaker: HIZDAHR

Text: Two Sons of the Harpy come up on Hizdahr from behind and stab him to death. They run at Daenerys. Daario takes one out, and Jorah comes up from the pit to take Hizdahr’s spot and take out the other. He offers his hand to Daenerys and she takes it. He leads her down to the pit with Daario and the Unsullied, leaving Tyrion and Missandei.
A Harpy comes towards Missandei. Tyrion comes from behind, pulls him to his knees, and slits his throat. He leads her down to the pit.
Stay close!
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Sons of the Harpy have began to rush the pit. Unsullied fight them off as Daenerys, Daario, and Jorah head towards a side exit.
This way!
Speaker: JORAH

Text: They run through the exit, but a door swings shut. A Son of the Harpy steps out and Jorah kills him.
The other side, follow me!
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: They rush towards the other side and join up with Tyrion and Missandei.
Protect your queen!
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Jorah, Daario, and the Unsullied form a ring around Missandei, Daenerys, and Tyrion in the center of the pit. Sons of the Harpy begin to rush from the other exit they were heading towards. They surround the ring, testing out the outer ring before they begin rushing. A few make it past the outer ring but are killed by Daario. Missandei and Daenerys join hands and Daenerys closes her eyes.

A roar is heard in the distance. All of the Harpys look up. Drogon appears, breathing fire and circling the pit. The Sons run away from Daenerys to the edge of the pit. One charges at her and Drogon rips him apart. He breathes fire on 4-5 of them at a time before a spear hits his back. 2 more spears connect and he starts slowing down.
Drogon!
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: She takes a spear from his neck. He roars at her, but then closes his mouth. She slowly reaches to touch his nose. More spears are thrown at him by Sons of the Harpy and he turns to them and roars. Daario continues to fight off every Harpy that comes near her.
Daenerys climbs onto Drogon’s back slowly.
Valahd..
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Drogon runs towards the Harpys, starts flapping and then takes off from the Pit. He flies past the Pyramid and into the sky as Tyrion, Jorah, Daario, and Missandei stare up at him.
A dragon roars in the distance.
END EPISODE

DAVOS hears GHOST’s howling and exits, then peers across the courtyard and sees JON SNOW’s body. He immediately runs down the steps. He slows as he approaches JON SNOW’s body. Other brothers of the Night’s Watch approach. DAVOS kneels beside JON SNOW’s body.
It’s the Lord Commander!
Speaker: NIGHT’S WATCHMAN

Text: DOLOROUS EDD and other Night’s Watchmen rush up behind DAVOS.
Help me get him inside.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The other Night’s Watch brothers pick up JON SNOW’s body and carry it away. DAVOS remains, staring at the left over pool of blood.
DOLOROUS EDD wipes the table clean. The other Night’s Watch brothers place JON SNOW’s body on the table. DOLOROUS EDD places his hand on JON SNOW’s wounds, then brushes JON SNOW’s eyes closed.
Thorne did this.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: How many of your brothers do you think you can trust?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Trust? The men in this room.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: Does the wolf know you?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DOLOROUS EDD looks at DAVOS over his shoulder and nods.
We need all the help we can get.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: As DOLOROUS EDD moves towards the door, someone knocks on it. The Night’s Watch brothers draw their blades.
Ser Davos.
Speaker: MELISANDRE (O.S.)

Text: DOLOROUS EDD looks over his shoulder at DAVOS. DAVOS nods. The Night’s Watch brothers sheathe their swords. DOLOROUS EDD walks to the door and opens it. MELISANDRE enters. DOLOROUS EDD closes the door behind her. MELISANDRE is distressed at the sight of JON SNOW’s body.
I saw him in the flames, fighting at Winterfell.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I can’t speak for the flames, but he’s gone.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: MELISANDRE touches JON SNOW’s cheek.
ALLISER THORNE sits at the high table among the other leaders of the Night’s Watch. The rest of the Night’s Watch brothers are shouting at each other.
He was our Lord Commander!
Speaker: MALE VOICE #1

Text: He never should have been!
Speaker: MALE VOICE #2

Text: ALLISER THORNE pounds his fist three times on the high table, then stands. The room quiets.
You all know why you’re here. Jon Snow is dead.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: Who killed him?
Speaker: NIGHT’S WATCHMAN #1

Text: I did.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: The Night’s Watch brothers resume shouting.
And Bowen Marsh and Othell Yarwyck and the other officers in this castle.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: Murderers!
Speaker: NIGHT’S WATCHMEN #1

Text: Traitors!
Speaker: NIGHT’S WATCHMAN #2

Text: The shouting resumes. OLLIE walks up beside the high table. ALLISER THORNE pounds the high table again.
You’re right!
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: The shouting stops.

We’ve committed treason, all of us. Jon Snow was my Lord Commander. I had no love for him. That was no secret. But I never once disobeyed an order. Loyalty is the foundation on which the Night’s Watch is built, and the Watch means everything to me. I have given my life, we have all given our lives to the Night’s Watch. Jon Snow was going to destroy the Night’s Watch. He let the wildlings through our gates, as no Lord Commander has ever done before. He gave them the very land on which they reaved and raped and murdered. Lord Commander Snow did what he thought was right, I’ve no doubt about that. And what he thought was right would have been the end of us. He thrust a terrible choice upon us, and we made it.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: The men begin to murmur among themselves.
GHOST nudges JON SNOW’s hand and whimpers.
He’ll have seen we didn’t come. Thorne will have made it official by now. Castle Black is his.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I don’t care who’s sitting at the high table. Jon was my friend, and those fuckers butchered him. Now we return the favor.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: We don’t have the numbers.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: We have a direwolf.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: It’s not enough. I didn’t know Lord Commander Snow for long, but I have to believe he wouldn’t have wanted his friends to die for nothing.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: If you were planning to see tomorrow, you picked the wrong room. We all die today. I say we do our best to take Thorne with us when we go.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: We need to fight, but we don’t need to die. Not if we have help.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Who’s gonna help us?
Speaker: NIGHT’S WATCHMAN

Text: You’re not the only ones who owe your lives to Jon Snow.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DOLOROUS EDD’s washes over with realization. He turns to the Night’s Watchman at his side.
Bolt the door. Don’t let anyone in. I’ll be back as soon as I can.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: DOLOROUS EDD leaves through the door.
She was 11 the first time I saw her.
Speaker: RAMSAY (V.O.)

Text: MYRANDA’s body lies on a table.
The kennelmaster’s daughter. She smelled of dog. I wasn’t much older, but everybody was already afraid of me. You certainly were.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY turns and looks at MAESTER WOLKAN, then looks back at MYRANDA’s body..
Myranda wasn’t, though. What could I do to her that those hounds couldn’t? She was fearless. There was nothing she wouldn’t do.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY stands and places his hand on MYRANDA’s forehead.
Your pain will be paid for a thousand times over. I wish you could be here to watch.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY looks as though he is going to cry.
Shall I have a grave dug for her, my lord? Or would you rather the men build a pyre?
Speaker: MAESTER WOLKAN

Text: Buried, burned?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY walks past MAESTER WOLKAN as he exits the room.
This is good meat. Feed it to the hounds.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY is walking with ROOSE.
Your command of the cavalry was impressive. Thanks to you, the false king Stannis Baratheon is dead. Do you know who struck the killing blow?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: No.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: A shame.  I’d reward the man.  Still, a great victory. Do you feel like a victor?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: RAMSAY and ROOSE stop walking. RAMSAY looks back over his shoulder at ROOSE.

I rebelled against the crown to arrange your marriage to Sansa Stark. Do you think that burning wagons in the night and mowing down tired, outnumbered Baratheons is the same as facing a prepared and provisioned Lannister army?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: No.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: ROOSE walks past RAMSAY into Winterfell’s great hall.

A reckoning will come. We need the North to face it. The entire North. They won’t back us without Sansa Stark. We no longer have Sansa Stark. You played your games with her. You played your games with the heir to the Iron Islands and now they’re both gone.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: I have a team of men after them with some of my best hounds. They won’t get far.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: I’m glad to hear it. Without Sansa, you won’t be able to produce an heir. And without an heir, well…
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: ROOSE sits at the dinner table. RAMSAY stares at him, astonished.
...let’s hope the maesters are right and Lady Walder’s carrying a boy.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: EXT. NORTHERN WILDERNESSSANSA and THEON are running through the woods frantically. The barking of dogs can be heard in the distance. SANSA tires. THEON runs back to hear and pulls her onward.
We can’t stop.
Speaker: THEON

Text: The pair resume running. They happen upon a large, snowy river.
We have to cross here.
Speaker: THEON

Text: SANSA steps on a patch of thin ice and gasps.
I can’t.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: It’s the only way to throw off the hounds.
Speaker: THEON

Text: But it’s too cold. I can’t. I won’t make it. I’ll die.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I’ve seen what his hounds do to a person. This way is better.
Speaker: THEON

Text: THEON guides SANSA into the water. SANSA gasps at the cold. The both wade across.
THEON and SANSA are walking together. They are blue with cold. Barking can no longer be heard. THEON spots something off camera.
Over here. Come on.
Speaker: THEON

Text: THEON leads SANSA to an overturned tree. Its roots provide shelter from the snow. They sit down under the roots, shivering.
Sansa. Sansa.
Speaker: THEON

Text: THEON wraps his arms around SANSA. She rests her head on his shoulder and closes her eyes. Dogs barking can suddenly be heard closeby.
Stay here. I’ll lure them away.
Speaker: THEON

Text: No, I won’t make it without you.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You will. Go north, only north. Jon is Lord Commander at Castle Black. He’ll help you.
Speaker: THEON

Text: THEON runs into the woods but is immediately confronted by House Bolton soldiers and hounds.
Where is Lady Bolton?
Speaker: BOLTON OFFICER

Text: Dead.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Liar.
Speaker: BOLTON OFFICER

Text: She broke her leg jumping from the ramparts. I left her to die in the snow.
Speaker: THEON

Text: The dogs catch SANSA’s scent and begin barking. They lead the soldiers to SANSA under the roots of the tree. SANSA cowers from them.
I can’t wait to see what parts Ramsay cuts off you this time.
Speaker: BOLTON OFFICER

Text: One of the soldiers grabs SANSA and pulls her to her feet. A horse whinnies in the distance. The soldiers draw their weapons. BRIENNE and PODRICK ride towards the soldiers with their sword drawn.
It’s a bloody woman.
Speaker: BOLTON OFFICER

Text: BRIENNE cuts down BOLTON OFFICER as she rides past. PODRICK engages one of the soldiers in mounted combat. BRIENNE faces off with another mounted soldier. Their blades clash, but neither is hit. As BRIENNE rides past him, another soldier knocks her from her horse. She drops her blade but scrambles to retrieve it when she sees a soldier advancing towards her on foot. When she reaches the blade, the soldier kicks her. She retrieves the blade again and stands, engaging him in a swordfight. She cuts him down. A mounted soldier charges at BRIENNE. She jumps and strikes him, causing his horse to fall over, trapping him beneath it. While PODRICK continues his mounted sword fight, THEON grabs the blade of a fallen soldier off the ground. PODRICK cuts down the soldier he is fighting and they both fall from their horses. Another soldier advances on PODRICK, and they begin fighting. BRIENNE crawls over to the man trapped beneath his horse and slits his throat with a dagger. The soldier PODRICK is fighting knocks PODRICK’s sword out of his hand. PODRICK falls to the ground. Just before the soldier is about to strike PODRICK, THEON stabs the soldier from behind. PODRICK stands up. BRIENNE walks over to SANSA. SANSA stands up to confront her. BRIENNE places her blade on the ground in front of SANSA and kneels before her.
Lady Sansa, I offer my services once again. I will shield your back and keep your council and give my life for yours if need be. I swear it by the old gods and the new.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: SANSA turns at looks at THEON for confirmation. THEON nods his head.
And I vow...that you shall always have a place by my hearth and…
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Meat and mead at my table.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Meat and mead at my table. And I pledge to ask no service of you that might bring you dishonor. I swear it by the old gods and the new. Arise.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: BRIENNE stands up. SANSA smiles at BRIENNE.
CERSEI is sitting in the dark by a table. The door to her chamber opens and a handmaiden enters.
Your Grace, I’m sorry to disturb you. A ship from Dorne has sailed into the harbor.
Speaker: HANDMAIDEN

Text: CERSEI smiles.
Myrcella…
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI runs through the courtyard and out to the harbor. She descends the steps to the harbor where a small boat is coming to shore. Her smile fades. As the small boat gets closer to shore, it is revealed to be carrying JAIME and a casket. CERSEI begins to tear up.
JAIME is standing on the balcony, looking out. A bell tolls in the background. JAIME turns and looks back into CERSEI’s room, then enters it.
Do you remember the first time you saw a dead body?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Mother.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: All I could think about when she died was what would happen to her now. Every day, every night, what does Mama look like now? Has she started to bloat? Has her skin turned black? Have her lips peeled back from her teeth?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI begins to tear up.
I think about locking Myrcella in a crypt.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: JAIME walks over to CERSEI and kneels in front of her.
I think about her beautiful little face starting to collapse.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Shh, shh. Don’t think about it.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I have to. I have to. It’s not right she has to suffer alone.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: She’s not suffering. She’s gone. No one can hurt her anymore.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: She was good. From her first breath, she was so sweet. I don’t know where she came from. She was nothing like me. No meanness, no jealous, just good.
Speaker: CERSEI (crying)

Text: I know.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I thought if I could make something so good, so pure...maybe I’m not a monster.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No, I knew this would happen. The witch told me years ago. She promised me three children. She promised me they’d die. “And gold their shrouds.” Everything she said came true. You couldn’t have stopped it. It’s prophecy. It’s fate.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You don’t believe that.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Of course I do. You told me yourself when Father died. You said we had to stay together. You said people would try to tear us apart, take what’s ours. That was a prophecy, too. I didn’t listen to you, and everything you said came true.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: JAIME places his hand on CERSEI’s cheek..
Fuck prophecy. Fuck fate. Fuck everyone who isn’t us. We’re the only ones who matter, the only ones in this world. And everything they’ve taken from us, we’re going to take back and more.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME embraces CERSEI.
We’re going to take everything there is.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: “The Seven Hells brim with the souls of saintly men. They scream in agony and their shame is so great, they do not feel the flames, for now they see if not for a single sin they concealed, they were saved.”
Speaker: SEPTA UNELLA

Text: I’d like to see my brother.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Confess.
Speaker: SEPTA UNELLA

Text: Please. How is he? At least tell me that.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Confess.
Speaker: SEPTA UNELLA

Text: I am the queen and I demand to see my brother.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Sinners don’t make commands. They make confessions.
Speaker: SEPTA UNELLA

Text: SEPTA UNELLA slams the scripture book closed and approaches MARGAERY aggressively.
The door opens and HIGH SPARROW enters.
Septa Unella.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: HIGH SPARROW sighs.
Our other guests need you.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: SEPTA UNELLA exits. HIGH SPARROW walks over to MARGAERY and gently pulls her hair away from her face.
There.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW (whispering)

Text: MARGAERY looks up at HIGH SPARROW.
Septa Unella can be overzealous at times. I’ll speak with her.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: My brother, can you tell me how he is?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: HIGH SPARROW sits on a stool beside MARGAERY.

Speaker: CUT TO

Text: MARGAERY hurries towards the exit with LORAS. The crowd begins to panic and also heads towards the exit. Two Faith Militant block MARGAERY’s path to the exit.
Let me through. Let me through. Get out of my way.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: MARGAERY pushes against the guards. The HIGH SPARROW looks around at the crowd.
Let us through!
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: LANCEL reaches the candles. He tries to blow out the flame with his breath, but it won’t go out.
GREAT SEPT OF BAELOR
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: MARGAERY looks over her shoulder at the HIGH SPARROW. They stare into each other’s eyes.

The flame from the candle touches the pool of green liquid and ignites it. The surrounding barrels are ignited and explode in a mass of green flame. LANCEL is incinerated. The explosion travels down the tunnel, igniting all of the barrels.
GREAT SEPT OF BAELOR
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The sound of an explosion can be heard. The green flame erupts from the center of the sept, incinerating the HIGH SPARROW and then engulfing the entire sept, killing everyone inside. The sept crumbles from the force of the explosion. The bell from its tower is flung down into the city, smashing into a bystander. The flames rush out from the sept.
CERSEI watches the explosion. She cocks her head back, then smiles, sips her wine, and walks away.
GREGOR is standing in the hallway.TOMMEN is staring out the window at the explosion with his mouth hanging open. GREGOR exits.
SEPTA UNELLA is lying strapped to a table. CERSEI stands over her and pours wine in her face. SEPTA UNELLA sputters and struggles against her bindings.
Confess. Confess.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI raises a pitcher of wine over SEPTA UNELLA’s head.
No.
Speaker: SEPTA UNELLA

Text: Confess.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI pours the pitcher into SEPTA UNELLA’s face. SEPTA UNELLA sputters and struggles. When the pitcher is empty, SEPTA UNELLA gasps for air.

Confess. It felt good. Beating me, starving me, frightening me, humiliating me. You didn’t do it because you cared about my atonement. You did it because it felt good. I understand. I do things because they feel good. I drink because it feels good. I killed my husband because it felt good to be rid of him. I fuck my brother because it feels good to feel him inside me. I lie about fucking my brother… because it feels good to keep our son safe from hateful hypocrites. I killed your High Sparrow… and all his little sparrows… all his septons, all his septas, all his filthy soldiers, because it felt good to watch them burn. It felt good to imagine their shock and their pain. No thought has ever given me greater joy. Even confessing feels good under the right circumstances.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI touches SEPTA UNELLA’s face.
You’ve always been quiet.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI walks around the table.
I said my face would be the last thing you saw before you died. Do you remember?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Good. I’m glad to see your face. I’m ready to meet the gods.
Speaker: SEPTA UNELLA

Text: What? Now? Today? You’re not going to die today. You’re not going to die for quite a while. Ser Gregor.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: GREGOR enters the room.
This is Ser Gregor Clegane. He’s quiet, too.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: SEPTA UNELLA looks at GREGOR. GREGOR removes his helmet. His face is cloaked in shadow.
Your gods have forsaken you. This is your god now.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI walks towards the exit. GREGOR enters. His face is purple and mangled. He puts his helmet down on the table next to SEPTA UNELLA.
No.
Speaker: SEPTA UNELLA

Text: SEPTA UNELLA struggles against her bindings, then cries out in pain.
Shame.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI take hold of the door and closes it behind her.
Shame.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: SEPTA UNELLA screams.
Shame.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI closes the latch on the door’s porthole and walks away. SEPTA UNELLA screams.
TOMMEN is staring out the window.
I’m very sorry, Your Grace. Very sorry.
Speaker: ATTENDANT

Text: The attendant exits. TOMMEN takes his crown off his head and walks to another part of the room. He returns to the window, stands up on the sill, and plummets off the edge.
INT. THE TWINSA banquet is underway. WALDER FREY is making a toast. JAIME and BRONN sit at the tables with the Frey and Lannister men, listening.
For House Lannister!
Speaker: WALDER

Text: Hear me roar!
Speaker: MEN

Text: The men cheer.
For House Frey!
Speaker: WALDER

Text: We stand together!
Speaker: MEN

Text: The men cheer.
May we stand together through the centuries, good friends to the last.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: The men cheer.
And when we drive our swords through our enemies’ hearts, may we speak the words of our alliance, “The Freys and the Lannisters send their regards.”
Speaker: WALDER

Text: The men cheer. A handmaiden looks at BRONN and then at JAIME.
You don’t even have to do anything, do you?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: JAIME looks at the handmaiden.
You just sit there, a rich slab of beef, and all the birds come pecking.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You’re welcome to her.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: She doesn’t want me. She wants your golden fingers up her twat.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: JAIME nods at two women standing on the other side of the room.
Those two have their eyes on you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRONN looks at the women.
They have their eyes on you, cunt.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Not my type.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Not blonde enough?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Ladies, have you met Ser Bronn of the Blackwater, hero of the Battle of Blackwater Bay.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME looks at BRONN.
There you go.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Maybe I’m not in the mood.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: The girls approach Bronn.
Fuck it.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: BRONN stands and approaches the girls.
No need to call me ser just because I’m an anointed knight.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: WALDER sits down next to JAIME.
This came together rather well. Your father would be pleased.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: I’m sure he would be.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Edmure is back in a cell. Can’t go killing my son by law. It wouldn’t be right. Give the family a bad name.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: WALDER sips his wine.
So the famous Blackfish killed by footsoldiers, eh? Legendary warrior, everyone said.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: Have you done much fighting yourself, Lord Frey?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I’m a bit old for all that.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: No, but back in your day.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The purpose of fighting is defeating your enemies, isn’t it?
Speaker: WALDER

Text: JAIME nods.
I’ve defeated mine. Riverrun belonged to House Tully for a thousand years. Now it’s mine. What do you call that? Victory.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: Yes, you’re a great conqueror.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Go on, mock me, boy. You think I mind? The Tullys mocked me for years. The Starks mocked me. Where are they now? You talk about war as if you’re an expert but the one battle I remember you fighting, you were captured by Robb Stark, the Young Wolf. But it doesn’t matter. Here we are now, two kingslayers. We know what it’s like to have them grovel to our faces and snigger behind our backs. We don’t mind, do we? Fear is a marvelous thing.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: They don’t fear the Freys, though. They fear the Lannisters. We gave you the Riverlands to hold the Riverlands. If we have to ride north and take them back for you every time you lose them, why do we need you?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME stands and exits. WALDER watches him go.
CERSEI and QYBURN are standing over TOMMEN’s body. His body is covered in a veil.
Show me.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your Grace, there’s no need--
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Show me.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: QYBURN uncovers TOMMEN’s body. CERSEI stares at it.
What are your thoughts concerning the king’s funeral? As the Sept of Baelor is no longer an option, perhaps a ceremony in the throne room?
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: He should be with his grandfather, his brother, his sister. Burn him and bury his ashes where the sept once stood.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: THE CITADEL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: SAM and GILLY enter and walk to the front desk. A maester is sitting behind the desk, holding spectacles up to his eyes and reading.
Hello.
Speaker: SAM

Text: The maester keeps reading and then looks up at SAM, removing his spectacles.
From Lord Commander Snow at Castle Black.
Speaker: SAM

Text: SAM holds up a letter. The maester puts down his spectacles and opens his palm. SAM reaches across the table with the letter, offering it to the maester. The maester does not retrieve it. SAM presses himself against the desk, leans further in, and places the letter directly in the maester’s hand. The maester takes the letter, breaks the seal, and reads it.
The maester looks at SAM and then opens a large book. He flips a few pages.
Oh.
Speaker: MAESTER

Text: The maester points his finger to a line of text on the open page.
According to our records, Jeor Mormont is Lord Commander.
Speaker: MAESTER

Text: He died.
Speaker: SAM

Text: We received no report from the maester at Castle Black.
Speaker: MAESTER

Text: Maester Aemon became quite ill shortly after the election. He’s since passed away. Which is why I’m here.
Speaker: SAM

Text: This is irregular.
Speaker: MAESTER

Text: Yes, well, I suppose that life is irregular.
Speaker: SAM

Text: The maester stares blankly at SAM, then picks up a quill and crosses off two lines of text in the open book.
The archmaester will discuss these irregularities with you. In the meantime, you are permitted to use the library. Follow me.
Speaker: MAESTER

Text: The maester stands and begins walking away. SAM and GILLY start to follow him. He turns back and looks at GILLY.
No women or children!
Speaker: MAESTER

Text: The maester turns and walks away. SAM makes several baffled gestures to GILLY and then follows the maester. They enter a small hallway full of books. The maester stops in front of a dark side passage and gestures towards it. SAM starts down the passage. The maester leaves. On his way through, SAM touches several of the books lining the shelves. SAM emerges onto the other side of the passage. The passage opens onto an enormous library with a chandelier dangling from the ceiling that reflects light. SAM gets teary and smiles.
JON SNOW is standing behind the high table, staring across the hall. MELISANDRE stands by his side.
When we had feasts, our family would sit up here… and I’d sit down there.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: JON SNOW points to the other end of the hall.
Could have been worse, Jon Snow. You had a family. You had feasts.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: JON SNOW chuckles.
Aye, you’re right. I was luckier than most.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: DAVOS enters the hall and tosses the charred stag statuette at MELISANDRE. MELISANDRE catches it.
What is that?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Tell him. Tell him who it belonged to.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The Princess Shireen.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Tell him what you did to her. Tell him!
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: We burned her at the stake.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Why?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The army was trapped. The horses were dying. It was the only way.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: You burned a little girl alive!
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I only do what my Lord commands!
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: If he commands you to burn children, your Lord is evil!
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: We are standing here because of him. Jon Snow is alive because the Lord willed it.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I loved that girl like she was my own. She was good. She was kind. And you killed her!
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: So did her father. So did her mother. Her own blood knew it was the only way.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: The only way for what? They all died anyway! You told everyone Stannis was the one. You had him believing it, all of them fooled. And you lied.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I didn’t lie. I was wrong.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Aye, you were wrong. How many died because you were wrong?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS and MELISANDRE stare at each other in silence.
I ask your leave to execute this woman for murder. She admits to the crime.
Speaker: DAVOS (to JON SNOW)

Text: Do you have anything to say for yourself?
Speaker: JON SNOW (to MELISANDRE)

Text: I’ve been ready to die for many years. If the Lord was done with me, so be it, but he’s not. You’ve seen the Night King, Jon Snow. You know the great war is still to come. You know the army of the dead will be upon us soon. And you know I can help you win that war.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: JON SNOW approaches MELISANDRE.
Ride south today. If you return to the North, I’ll have you hanged as a murderer.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: MELISANDRE puts the stag statuette down on the high table and begins to walk away. DAVOS moves in her way.
If you ever come back this way, I will execute you myself.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: MELISANDRE moves past DAVOS and exits.
JON SNOW stands atop the outer wall watching MELISANDRE ride south on her horse. SANSA appears.
I’m having the lord’s chamber prepared for you.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Mother and Father’s room? You should take it.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I’m not a Stark.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: You are to me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You’re the Lady of Winterfell. You deserve it. We’re standing here because of you. The battle was lost until the Knights of the Vale rode in. They came because of you. You told me Lord Baelish sold you to the Boltons.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: He did.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: And you trust him?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Only a fool would trust Littlefinger. I should have told you about him, about the Knights of the Vale. I’m sorry.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JON SNOW approaches SANSA.
We need to trust each other. We can’t fight a war amongst ourselves. We have so many enemies now.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: JON SNOW touches SANSA’s face and kisses her on the forehead, then turns to walk away.
Jon.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JON SNOW turns back to face SANSA.
A raven came from the Citadel. A white raven. Winter is here.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JON SNOW smiles and looks up at the sky.
Well, Father always promised, didn’t he?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: JON SNOW exits. SANSA looks out at the wilderness.
The last time a Tyrell came to Dorne, he was assassinated. 100 red scorpions, was it?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: You have nothing to fear from us, Lady Olenna.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: You murder your own prince, but you expect me to trust you?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: We invited you to Dorne because we needed your help. You came to Dorne because you needed our help?
Speaker: OBARA

Text: What is your name again? Barbaro?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Obara.
Speaker: OBARA

Text: Obara. You look like an angry little boy. Don’t presume to tell me what I need.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Forgive my sister. What she lacks in diplomacy, she makes--
Speaker: NYMERIA

Text: Do shut up, dear.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: OLENNA looks at TYENE.
Anything from you?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: TYENE opens her mouth to speak.
No? Good. Let the grown women speak.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The Lannisters have declared war on House Tyrell. They have declared war on Dorne. We must be allies now if we wish to survive.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Cersei stole the future from me. She killed my son. She killed my grandson. She killed my granddaughter. Survival is not what I’m after now.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: You’re absolutely right. I chose the wrong words. It is not survival I offer. It is your heart’s desire.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: ELLARIA rings a bell.
And what is my heart’s desire?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Vengeance. Justice.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: VARYS emerges from a hallway.
Fire and blood.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Your ships are nearly ready. I saw them painting the sails.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAARIO pours himself a glass of wine.
I’m curious to see how the Dothraki do on the poison water.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: You’re not coming with us.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: New strategy? You want the Second Sons to attack from the west coast? If we take Casterly Rock, the Lannisters will have nowhere to run when you hit King’s Landing.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAARIO approaches DAENERYS and stands in front of her.
You’re not going to Westeros. You’re staying here with the Second Sons. There’s finally peace in Meereen. You will keep the peace while the people choose their own leaders.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAARIO sets his glass of wine down on a table.
Fuck Meereen. Fuck the people. I’m here for you, not them.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: You promised me. “My sword is yours. My life is yours.” This is what I command. If I’m going to rule in Westeros, I’ll need to make alliances. The best way to make alliances is with marriage.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAARIO sits down.
Who are you marrying this time?
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: I don’t know. Maybe no one.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: But you need to lure all the noble houses to the table? Are you a queen or fish bait?
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: I can’t bring a lover to Westeros.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: A king wouldn’t think twice about it.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: So that’s what you want? To be my mistress?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I’m not proud. I don’t care what perfumed aristocrat sits beside you in the throne room. I don’t want a crown. I want you.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAARIO approaches DAENERYS and kneels in front of her.
I love you. And I make you happy. You know I do. Bring me with you. Let me fight for you.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAENERYS touches DAARIO’s face.
I can’t.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAARIO stands.
The dwarf told you to do this.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: No one tells me to do anything.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Clever fellow. Can’t argue with his logic. I’m no use to you over there.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Don’t get angry.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I’m not angry. I’m full of self-pity. Who comes after you? Who can ever follow Daenerys Stormborn, the Mother of Dragons?
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: A great number of women, I imagine. Specific orders will be left for you regarding the welfare of Meereen and the Bay of Dragons.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS stands.
Bay of Dragons?
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: We can’t call it Slaver’s Bay anymore, can we?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You’ll get that throne you want so badly, I’m sure of it. I hope it brings you happiness.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAARIO sips his wine.
I pity the lord of Westeros. They have no idea what’s coming for them.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Farewell, Daario Naharis.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAARIO nods and exits.
TYRION is sitting off to the side of the room on a bench. DAENERYS enters, walking down the steps from the throne.
How did he take it?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No tears.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I know it was hard for you. You turned away a man who truly loves you because he would have been a liability in the Seven Kingdoms. That’s the kind of self-sacrifice that makes for a good ruler, if it’s any consolation.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: DAENERYS reaches the bottom of the steps and approaches TYRION.
It’s not.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: No, I suppose not. I’m terrible at consoling.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: DAENERYS sits down on the bench next to TYRION.
Yes, you really are.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: All right, how about the fact that this is actually happening? You have your armies, you have your ships, you have your dragons. Everything you’ve ever wanted since you were old enough to want anything. It’s all yours for the taking. Are you afraid?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: DAENERYS nods.
Good. You’re in the great game now. And the great game’s terrifying. The only people who aren’t afraid of failure are madmen like your father.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Do you know what frightens me? I said farewell to a man who loves me. A man I thought I cared for. And I felt nothing. Just impatient to get on with it.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: He wasn’t the first to love you and he won’t be the last.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Well, you have completely failed to console me.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS stands and turns to face TYRION.
TYRION stands on the bench.
I believe in you. It’s embarrassing, really. I’d swear you my sword, but I don’t actually own a sword.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It’s your counsel I need.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: It’s yours. Now and always.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Good. I, um… I had something made for you. I’m not sure if it’s right.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS pins a Hand of the King’s brooch on TYRION’s chest.
Tyrion Lannister, I name you Hand of the Queen.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: TYRION holds back tears, then kneels.
INT. THE TWINSWALDER FREY is sitting at the high table, eating and drinking. The rest of the dining hall is empty. A handmaiden approaches and sets down a platter of pie on the table in front of him.
You’re not one of mine, are you?
Speaker: WALDER

Text: No, my lord.
Speaker: HANDMAIDEN

Text: Didn’t think so. Too pretty.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: WALDER slaps the handmaiden on the buttocks and smiles.
Where are my damn moron sons? Black Walder and Lothar promised to be here by midday.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: They’re here, my lord.
Speaker: HANDMAIDEN

Text: Well, what are they doing, trimming their cunt hairs? Tell them to come here now.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: But they’re already here, my lord.
Speaker: HANDMAIDEN

Text: WALDER looks around the hall. The handmaiden points to the pie.
Here, my lord.
Speaker: HANDMAIDEN

Text: WALDER pulls back the top layer of the pie. A finger protrudes from the center of the slice.
They weren’t easy to carve. Especially Black Walder.
Speaker: HANDMAIDEN

Text: WALDER breathes heavily.
What…
Speaker: WALDER

Text: The handmaiden reaches up to her face and pulls it away, revealing her true identity is ARYA.
My name is Arya Stark. I want you to know that. The last thing you’re ever going to see is a Stark smiling down at you as you die.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA brandishes a knife. WALDER gets up to run, but ARYA grabs him and pulls him back down. She grabs him by the forehead and slits his throat. He convulses and groans as he dies. ARYA smiles and stares at him.
Forgive me, my lady… if you’re at prayer.
Speaker: PETYR

Text: I’m done with all that. I came here every day when I was a girl. I prayed to be somewhere else. Back then I only ever thought about what I wanted, never about what I had.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA stands and walks towards PETYR.
I was a stupid girl.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You were a child.
Speaker: PETYR

Text: What do you want?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I thought you knew what I wanted.
Speaker: PETYR

Text: I was wrong.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: No, you weren’t. Every time I’m faced with a decision, I close my eyes and see the same picture. Whenever I consider an action, I ask myself will this action help to make this picture a reality? Pull it out of my mind and into the world? And I only act if the answer is yes. A picture of me on the Iron Throne… and you by my side.
Speaker: PETYR

Text: PETYR leans in to kiss SANSA, but SANSA puts her hand on his chest to stop him.
It’s a pretty picture.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA walks past PETYR.
News of this battle will spread quickly through the Seven Kingdoms. I’ve declared for House Stark for all to hear.
Speaker: PETYR

Text: You’ve declared for other houses before, Lord Baelish. It’s never stopped you from serving yourself.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: The past is gone for good. You can sit here mourning its departure or you can prepare for the future. You, my love, are the future of House Stark. Who should the North rally behind? A trueborn daughter of Ned and Catelyn Stark born here at Winterfell or a motherless bastard born in the south?
Speaker: PETYR

Text: SANSA exits.
EXT. BEYOND THE WALLBENJEN stares up at The Wall. BRAN and MEERA wait nearby.
This is where I leave you.
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: You’re not coming with us?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: The Wall is not just ice and stone. Ancient spells were carved into its foundations. Strong magic to protect men from what lies beyond. And while it stands, the dead cannot pass. I cannot pass.
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: BENJEN approaches his horse and lifts BRAN off of it. He carries BRAN to the foot of a nearby weirwood, then walks back to his horse.
Where will you go?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: The great war is coming and I still fight for the living. I’ll do what I can… as long as I can.
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: BENJEN mounts his horse.
Thank you, Uncle Benjen.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I wish you both good fortune.
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: BENJEN rides away. BRAN looks at the weirwood and then starts to crawl towards it. MEERA helps him. BRAN reaches out to the weirwood but MEERA grabs his wrist.
Are you sure you’re ready for this?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: I’m the Three-Eyed Raven now. I have to be ready for this.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: BRAN touches the weirwood tree.
Ned?
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: Lyanna.
Speaker: NED

Text: NED rushes to LYANNA’s side.
Is that you? Is that really you?
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: LYANNA lifts her hand. NED takes it.
You’re not a dream.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: No, I’m not a dream. I’m here. Right here.
Speaker: NED

Text: I’ve missed you, big brother.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: NED begins to cry.
I’ve missed you, too.
Speaker: NED

Text: I want to be brave.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: Shh. You are.
Speaker: NED

Text: I’m not.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: NED lifts his hand from LYANNA’s stomach. His palm is covered in blood.
I don’t want to die.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: You’re not going to die.
Speaker: NED

Text: NED looks at the handmaiden.
Get her some water!
Speaker: NED

Text: No, no water.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: Is there a maester?
Speaker: NED

Text: Please. Listen to me, Ned.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: LYANNA whispers in NED’s ear.
If Robert finds out, he’ll kill him, you know he will. You have to protect him. Promise me, Ned. Promise me.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: The handmaiden hands NED the child.
Promise me, Ned. Promise me.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: NED stares down at the baby. The baby opens its eyes. Zoom on the baby’s face.
You can’t expect Knights of the Vale to side with wildling invaders.
Speaker: VALE KNIGHT

Text: We didn’t invade. We were invited.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Not by me.
Speaker: VALE KNIGHT

Text: JON SNOW stands.
The free folk, the northerners, and the Knights of the Vale fought bravely, fought together, and we won. My father uses to say we find our true friends on the battlefield.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: One of the houses’ representatives stands.
The Boltons are defeated. The war is over. Winter has come. If the maesters are right, it’ll be the coldest one in a thousand years. We should ride home and wait out the coming storms.
Speaker: MAN

Text: The war is not over. And I promise you, friend, the true enemy won’t wait out the storm. He brings the storm.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: The men begin to murmur. LYANNA MORMONT stands.

Your son was butchered at the Red Wedding, Lord Manderly. But you refused the call. You swore allegiance to House Stark, Lord Glover, but in their hour of greatest need, you refused the call. And you, Lord Cerwyn, your father was skinned alive by Ramsay Bolton. Still you refuse the call. But House Mormont remembers. The North remembers. We know no king but the King in the North whose name is Stark. I don’t care if he’s a bastard. Ned Stark’s blood runs through his veins. He’s my king from this day until his last day.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: The men resume murmuring. LORD MANDERLY stands.

Lady Mormont speaks harshly and truly. My son died for Robb Stark, the Young Wolf. I didn’t think we’d find another king in my lifetime. I didn’t commit my men to your cause ‘cause I didn’t want more Manderlys dying for nothing. But I was wrong. Jon Snow avenged the Red Wedding. He is the White Wolf. The King in the North.
Speaker: MANDERLY

Text: MANDERLY draws his blade, then rests it point-down on the ground and kneels. LORD GLOVER stands.
I did not fight beside you on the field and I will regret that until my dying day. A man can only admit when he was wrong and ask forgiveness.
Speaker: GLOVER

Text: There’s nothing to forgive, my lord.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: There will be more fights to come. House Glover will stand behind House Stark as we have for a thousands years. And I will stand behind Jon Snow… the King in the North!
Speaker: GLOVER

Text: GLOVER draws his blade, then rests it point-down on the ground and kneels.
The King in the North!
Speaker: GLOVER

Text: Everyone in the hall stands and draws their blades.
The King in the North! The King in the North! The King in the North! The King in the North! The King in the North! The King in the North! The King in the North! The King in the North!
Speaker: ALL

Text: JON SNOW stands. SANSA and PETYR look at each other.
Come on.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME rides on.

CERSEI enters, escorted by GREGOR and the Kingsguard. The room is full of nobles and city soldiers. QYBURN stands next to the Iron Throne, holding a crown. CERSEI and GREGOR approach the throne. CERSEI stands in front of the throne. JAIME enters through a side passage and watches.
I now proclaim Cersei of the House Lannister First of Her Name, Queen of the Andals and the First Men, Protector of the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: QYBURN places the crown on CERSEI’s head. CERSEI sits in the Iron Throne. She and JAIME look at each other.
Long may she reign.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Long may she reign.
Speaker: ALL

Text: EXT. SUMMER SEATHEON and YARA are standing on their ship. They look out at the sea. A vessel appears with a dragon as its ram. GREY WORM and the Unsullied are riding in it. Hundreds of other ships are sailing around them. Some of the ships carry the Dothraki and their horses. DROGON, VISERION, and RHAEGAL fly overhead. They fly over the boat leading the convoy DAENERYS, TYRION, VARYS, and MISSANDEI are riding in it. DAENERYS and TYRION look at each other, then DAENERYS looks out at the ocean ahead. The dragons screech.
CREDITS
THREE-EYED RAVEN is tangled in the roots of the great weirwood. His eyes are pure white. BRAN is lying below the tangle, gripping a single root. His eyes are also pure white.

YOUNG NED and YOUNG BENJEN are sparring with wooden swords in the commons. BRAN and THREE-EYED RAVEN are standing on a balcony above the courtyard, watching. YOUNG NED knocks YOUNG BENJEN to the ground.
Give him another go, Ned.
Speaker: YOUNG RODRIK

Text: YOUNG NED helps YOUNG BENJEN to his feet.
That’s my father. And my Uncle Benjen.
Speaker: BRAN (to THREE-EYED RAVEN)

Text: Keep your shield up or I’ll ring your head like a bell.
Speaker: YOUNG NED (to YOUNG BENJEN)

Text: YOUNG NED and YOUNG BENJEN begin sparring again. BRAN looks around the commons at the citizens of Winterfell going about their business.
They were all so happy.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: So were you once.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: YOUNG LYANNA rides into the courtyard on a horse. She circles around YOUNG NED and YOUNG BENJEN.
Stop showing off.
Speaker: YOUNG NED

Text: Lyanna!
Speaker: YOUNG BENJEN

Text: My Aunt Lyanna. I’ve seen her statue in the crypt. My father never talked about her.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Closeup on THREE-EYED RAVEN. He turns to look at BRAN, but BRAN has already walked away. BRAN walks closer to the group. YOUNG LYANNA is being helped off her horse by YOUNG HODOR.
Would you get out of here? We’re sparring.
Speaker: YOUNG BENJEN

Text: Who are you gonna spar with when Ned goes off to the Eyrie?
Speaker: YOUNG LYANNA

Text: I don’t know.
Speaker: YOUNG BENJEN

Text: YOUNG LYANNA turns and looks at YOUNG HODOR.
What about him?
Speaker: YOUNG LYANNA

Text: Wylis, come here.
Speaker: YOUNG NED

Text: BRAN turns to look at YOUNG HODOR. THREE-EYED RAVEN reaches BRAN’s side.
Hodor?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: YOUNG LYANNA walks over to YOUNG HODOR with a wooden sword and shield.
But he’s got giant’s blood.
Speaker: YOUNG BENJEN

Text: And you’ve got training. Sounds like a fair match to me.
Speaker: YOUNG NED

Text: Benjen always lifts his chin when he’s about to charge.
Speaker: YOUNG LYANNA

Text: YOUNG HODOR takes the sword and shield.
And lowers it when he’s going to dodge, my lady.
Speaker: YOUNG HODOR

Text: Hodor talks?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: YOUNG HODOR walks over to YOUNG BENJEN. They both ready to commence sparring, but stop when NAN appears.
You leave the fighting to the little lords, Wylis. Come along, now. It’s no place for you.
Speaker: NAN

Text: NAN takes YOUNG HODOR by the ear and leads him away.
Oh, Nan, look at the size of him. If he ever learned to fight, he’d be unstoppable.
Speaker: YOUNG NED

Text: Well, he’s never going to learn to fight because he’s a stable boy. So leave him be.
Speaker: NAN

Text: It is time to go.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN (to BRAN)

Text: Please, a little longer.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: THREE-EYED RAVEN touches BRAN on the shoulder.

BRAN is released from the vision. He gasps, then lets go of the root. The white fades from his eyes. A CHILD OF THE FOREST is sitting nearby, staring at him. He props himself up on his wrists and looks at THREE-EYED RAVEN.
You finally show me something I care about and then you drag me away.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: It is beautiful beneath the sea, but if you stay too long, you’ll drown.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: I wasn’t drowning. I was home.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: CHILD OF THE FOREST and THREE-EYED RAVEN exchange a glance. BRAN turns to HODOR, who is sitting with his back against a wall.
Wylis.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR
