Text: I saw you as a boy. You could talk. What happened?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: Where’s Meera?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: HODOR carries BRAN outside and sets him down in the snow. MEERA is sitting in the snow at the base of the great weirwood, staring out at the tundra.
You shouldn’t be here. It’s not safe outside the cave.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: It’s not safe anywhere.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: I saw that Hodor wasn’t always Hodor.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: MEERA turns and looks at BRAN.
What’s wrong?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: MEERA casts her eyes down and looks away.
The Three-Eyed Raven says there’s a war coming.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: And we’re going to fight it in there.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: MEERA scoffs and turns away. HODOR picks BRAN up and carries him back inside. A side view of MEERA reveals the same CHILD OF THE FOREST who was watching BRAN, sitting among some stones and frozen shrubbery..
Brandon Stark needs you.
Speaker: CHILD OF THE FOREST

Text: For what? I sit in there and I watch him have his visions and nothing ever happens.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: He isn’t going to stay there forever. And out there he needs you.
Speaker: CHILD OF THE FOREST

Text: It’s time, Ser Davos. Open the door and the men inside can rejoin their brothers in peace. We’ll even set the wolf free north of the Wall where it belongs. Nobody needs to die tonight.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: DAVOS turns to address the Night’s Watch faithfuls.
I’ve never been much of a fighter.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS walks over to Longclaw, JON SNOW’s sword, and picks it up.
Apologies for what you’re about to see.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS unsheathes Longclaw. The faithfuls follow suit, drawing their own blades.ALLISER THORNE turns to address a Night’s Watchman.
Come on.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: The Night’s Watchman lifts and large hammer and walks over to the door. He begins slamming the hammer against the door repeatedly. GHOST begins to growl and bark. DAVOS and company ready themselves for battle. After a number of swings, the Night’s Watchman with the hammer breaks a hole in the door. A loud thudding can be heard somewhere behind ALLISER THORNE and company. They turn to see what the noise is. The thudding is coming from one of the courtyard’s main gates. WUN WUN breaks down the gate and the Wildlings led by TORMUND and DOLOROUS EDD rush into the courtyard. The Night’s Watch loyal to ALLISER THORNE have bows drawn at the Wildlings but do not fire. They back up slowly.
Attack!
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: ALLISER THORNE draws his sword. A Night’s Watchman charged TORMUND. TORMUND cuts him down. The other Night’s Watch members do not retaliate.
Fight, you cowards!
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: A Night’s Watchman on a balcony shoots WUN WUN in the shoulder with a crossbow bolt. WUN WUN turns to face the man, then grabs him by the legs, slams him against a wall, and tosses his body to the ground in front of ALLISER THORNE. The Night’s Watch members allied to ALLISER THORNE begin dropping their weaponry. TORMUND and DOLOROUS EDD approach ALLISER THORNE, swords drawn.
You fucking traitor.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE (to DOLOROUS EDD)

Text: The only traitors here are the ones who shoved their knives into their Lord Commander’s heart.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: For thousands of years the Night’s Watch has held Castle Black against the Wildlings.
Speaker: ALLISER THORNE

Text: Until you.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: OLLY shouts and charges at TORMUND with his sword. TORMUND grabs OLLY and disarms him, then tosses him to another man who restrains him. Two men take ALLISER THORNE by the arms.
Throw them into the cells where they belong.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: The men drag ALLISER THORNE, OLLY, and the Night’s Watch betrayers away. TORMUND, DOLOROUS EDD, and DAVOS enter the room where JON SNOW’s body is. They stare down at him and his wounds.
Took a lot of knives. I’ll have my men get the wood for a fire. Bodies to burn.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Right, so there she is, high and mighty Queen Cersei, tits and ass jiggling in the breeze.
Speaker: STORYTELLER

Text: The commoners laugh.

All of a sudden she looks my way. Gives me a little smile like, “Well?” So, all right, you know, I’ve never been shy and I’m blessed down south, so I put it right out. She’s never seen anything like it. I mean, she’s used to her brother, and from what I hear, Jaime Lannister’s half an inch shy of an inch. She sees it and I swear to the gods she licks her lips. Well, you all know me. You know I wouldn’t lie about this.
Speaker: STORYTELLER

Text: The STORYTELLER walks into a dark alleyway to relieve himself. He is drunk. GREGOR walks up behind him. The STORYTELLER looks up at GREGOR. GREGOR bounces his head off the wall, killing him, then walks away.

CERSEI is standing in the center of the room,. She pulls a loose thread from the sleeve of her dress and examines it. GREGOR enters. CERSEI walks past him and exits her chamber. GREGOR follows. When they reach the bottom of the steps, they are confronted by a group of the king’s soldiers.
Get out of my way.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: King’s orders, Your Grace.
Speaker: KING’S SOLDIER

Text: What are the king’s orders?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: He would like you to remain in the Red Keep, Your Grace, for your own protection.
Speaker: KING’S SOLDIER

Text: You’re barring me from attending my own daughter’s funeral?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Forgive me, Your Grace, by the king’s command, I cannot let you pass.
Speaker: KING’S SOLDIER

Text: I would like to speak to my son.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: He has left the Red Keep, Your Grace.
Speaker: KING’S SOLDIER

Text: GREGOR grabs the hilt of his sword. The king’s soldiers also take hold of their weapons. GREGOR looks at CERSEI. CERSEI turns and walks back up the stairs. GREGOR follows.
TOMMEN and JAIME are standing beside the body of MYRCELLA. She has funeral stones over her eyes, with painted eyes on them.
She grew up.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Almost.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Have we caught Prince Trystane’s killers? I expect it was Mother.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Your mother wouldn’t do that.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Yes, she would.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Are you angry with her?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Of course not.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Then why didn’t you let her come? She has every right to be here.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: They told me she wouldn’t be allowed in the sept. If she had tried --
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: They’re not putting your mother in a cell ever again. Not while I’m here. Why haven’t you gone to see her? Everything she endured, she did it for you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Don’t you think I know that? I’m sorry. But I can’t.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Why not?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: When the Faith Militant seized her and Margaery, what did I do? When they paraded her through the streets like a whore, what did I do?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: We all fail sometimes.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The king is supposed to be the Protector of the Realm. If I can’t even protect my own wife or my own mother, what good am I?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: The HIGH SPARROW enters the sept. JAIME takes TOMMEN by the shoulder.
Go and see your mother and ask her to forgive you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME and TOMMEN to address the HIGH SPARROW.
Your Grace. Lord Commander.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: I want to see my wife.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: The gods wait for Queen Margaery to confess her crimes and seek their mercy. The king must wait as well.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Go and see your mother, Tommen.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: TOMMEN exits.
You’re a bold man.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: On the contrary. I fear a great deal. The Father, the Mother, the Warrior.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: The HIGH SPARROW approaches MYRCELLA’s body.
Do you know why we use these stones? To remind us not to fear death. We close our eyes on this world and open them on the next.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: You must long for the next life.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: In truth, I fear that, too.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: You imprisoned and humiliated my sister.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Your sister sought the gods’ mercy and atoned for her sin.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: What about my sins?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME approaches the HIGH SPARROW.
I broke a sacred oath and stabbed my king in the back. I killed my own cousin. When the gods judged my brother guilty, I helped him escape their justice. What atonement do I deserve?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME grips the hilt of his dagger and partially draws it.
You would spill blood in this holy place?
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Oh, the gods won’t mind. They’ve spilled more blood than the rest of us combined.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Go on, then. I deserve it. We all do. We are weak, vain creatures. We live only by the Mother’s mercy.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: A great number of the Faith Militant encircle JAIME and the HIGH SPARROW on the steps of the sept.
They should be closer if you mean for them to save you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I don’t. They’d never reach me before you struck.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: I’ve fought against worse odds.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: No doubt many of us would fall. But who are we, hmm? We have no names, no family. Every one of us is poor and powerless. And yet together, we can overthrow an empire.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: The HIGH SPARROW walks slowly away from JAIME.
CERSEI is looking over the balcony at King’s Landing. TOMMEN enters her chamber.
Mother.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: CERSEI walks in from the balcony.
Did they put her in the red gown or the gold?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Gold.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Good. It was always her color.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI walks over to a side table and drinks a sip of wine. Her back is facing TOMMEN.
I understand. I’m glad to see you.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I know I should have come sooner. I wanted to. I was wrong.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: It’s all right.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No, it isn’t.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: CERSEI turns to face TOMMEN.

I should have executed all of them. I should have pulled down the sept onto the High Sparrow’s head before I let them do that to you, as you would have for me. You raised me to be strong...and I wasn’t. But I want to be. Help me.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Always.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI and TOMMEN embrace.
TYRION, VARYS, MISSANDEI, and GREY WORM are gathered together in council. TYRION pours himself a glass of wine. VARYS tsks at him.
If I lost my cock, I’d drink all the time.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION looks at GREY WORM.
Meaning no offense. He makes dwarf jokes, I make eunuch jokes.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I do not make dwarf jokes.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: You think them.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: VARYS sighs.
So, the fleet. It’s been burned.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: We are searching for the men who burned the ships, but nobody saw anything.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Surely there’s some good news lurking somewhere.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Astapor and Yunkai have stopped asking us for aid.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Perhaps they can tell us their secret.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The Masters have retaken both cities. Outside of Meereen, the whole of Slaver’s Bay has returned to the slavers.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: What about the dragons? We have two of them here beneath the pyramid.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They are not eating. They haven’t touched any food since Queen Daenerys left.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Daenerys is the dragon queen. Can’t very well let the dragons starve, that’s obvious.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: If a dragon does not want to eat, how do you force him to eat?
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Dragons do not do well in captivity.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: How do you know this?
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: That’s what I do. I drink and I know things.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION finishes his glass of wine and walks over to the pitcher to pour himself another glass.

The dragons Aegon used to conquer Westeros ranged over hundreds of miles. Then Daenerys’s ancestors started chaining them up in pens. A few generations later, the last dragons were no larger than cats. They must be unchained or they’ll waste away. Missandei, how many times were you in the company of these dragons?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Many times.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: And did they ever harm you?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Never.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Dragons are intelligent. More intelligent than men according to some maesters. They have affection for their friends and fury for their enemies. I am their friend.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Do they know that?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: They will. It’s time they had their supper.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION and VARYS enter the dragons’ holding chamber bearing torches. TYRION begins walking slowly down the steps. VARYS remains at the top. When TYRION reaches the floor, he pauses and stares into the darkness. Faint growling can be heard. TYRION stops and looks back at VARYS momentarily. RHAEGAL and VISERION emerge from the shadows. VISERION lights a fire in his mouth and roars at TYRION. RHAEGAL approaches with a small roar.
I’m friends with your mother. I’m here to help. Don’t eat the help.
Speaker: TYRION (to RHAEGAL)

Text: TYRION chuckles nervously. RHAEGAL growls at TYRION. TYRION approaches cautiously.
When I was a child an uncle asked what gift I wanted for my name day. I begged him for one of you. “It wouldn’t even have to be a big dragon,” I told him. “It could be little, like me.”
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION sets down his torch and gets closer to RHAEGAL.
Everyone laughed like it was the funniest thing they had ever heard. Then my father told me the last dragon had died a century ago. I cried myself to sleep that night.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION touches RHAEGAL on the neck.
But here you are.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION takes hold of the piston keeping RHAEGAL’s shackle closed and pulls it free. The shackle falls the ground. TYRION turns around to see VISERION growling at him. VISERION exposes his neck to TYRION. TYRION approaches and releases the piston from VISERION’s shackle. RHAEGAL and VISERION return to the shadows. TYRION picks up his torch and hurries up the steps.
Next time I have an idea like that, punch me in the face.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: ARYA is sitting on the ground against the wall of a street. The WAIF appears, staff in hand.
What’s your name?
Speaker: WAIF

Text: ARYA grabs her staff and rushes to her feet. The WAIF smacks ARYA in the face, drawing blood. ARYA approaches the sound of the WAIF’s voice, but the WAIF has already moved to the side.
What’s your name?
Speaker: WAIF

Text: No one.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I don’t believe that.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: ARYA swings her staff at the WAIF, but misses. The WAIF hits ARYA in the side.
You don’t believe that.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: ARYA swings her staff at the WAIF again, but misses again. The WAIF hits ARYAoin the other side. ARYA rushes towards the WAIF and trips on some steps, falling to the ground. She grabs her staff and stands back up. The WAIF hits ARYA three more times, knocking her to the ground on the third. ARYA stands up and swings at the WAIF again, and misses for a third time. The WAIF hits ARYA in the face, knocking her to the ground again. ARYA is panting heavily. She returns to her feet, screams, and swings her staff around her many times. The WAIF has disappeared. The Faceless Man, taking on the visage of JAQEN H’GHAR, catches ARYA’s staff mid-swing.
Who are you?
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: No one.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: If a girl says her name, a man will let her sleep under a roof tonight.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: A girl has no name.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: If a girl says her name, a man will feed her tonight.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: A girl has no name.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: If a girl says her name, a man will give her eyes back.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: A girl has no name.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: JAQEN releases ARYA’s staff.
Come.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: ARYA turns around and walks to her beggar basket.
Leave it. A girl is not a beggar anymore.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: ARYA follows JAQEN.
ROOSE, RAMSAY, and LORD KARSTARK are gathered at the dining table, talking. RAMSAY and LORD KARSTARK are standing, while ROOSE remains seated at the head of the table.
He came upon the bodies on our way here.
Speaker: LORD KARSTARK

Text: Half a dozen men? Your best hunters?
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: They obviously had help.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: I didn’t think lady Sansa killed them all by herself. Thank you for this report, Lord Kastark.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: We know where she’s going. Her brother’s at Castle Black.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Ned Stark’s last surviving son?
Speaker: LORD KARSTARK

Text: Jon Snow is a bastard, not a Stark.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: So was I, Father.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Your hold on the North will never be secure as long as a Stark can walk through that door.
Speaker: LORD KARSTARK

Text: Castle Black isn’t defended on the southern side. And the few men left are barely men at all. Farm boys and thieves. With a small force we could storm the castle, kill Jon Snow --
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Murder the Lord Commander of the Night’s Watch? You’d unite every house in the North against us.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: We don’t need every house in the North. The Umbers, the Manderlys, and the Karstarks. command more soldiers than all the other houses combined. With their support, none could challenge us.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: The Starks lost my house the day King Rob cut off my father’s head. It’s time for new blood in the North.
Speaker: LORD KARSTARK

Text: ROOSE looks at both his son and lord Karstark. He gets up and stands in front of them.
If you acquire a reputation as a mad dog, you’ll be treated as a mad dog. Taken out back and slaughtered for pig feed.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: MAESTER WOLKAN enters and interrupts them.
My lords. Lady Walda has given birth. A boy. Red-cheeked and healthy.
Speaker: MAESTER WOLKAN

Text: My congratulations, Lord Bolton.
Speaker: LORD KARSTARK

Text: RAMSAY steps towards his father. They hug.
Congratulations, Father. I look forward to meeting my new brother.
Speaker: RAMSEY

Text: ROOSE puts his hand on RAMSAY’s shoulder.
You’ll always be my firstborn.
Speaker: ROOSE

Text: Thank you for saying that. It means a great deal to me.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY stabs ROOSE in the gut with a knife. ROOSE falls to the ground. ROOSE dies. RAMSAY steps away from ROOSE and cleans his knife.
Maester Wolkan, send ravens to all the Northern houses. Roose Bolton is dead. Poisoned by our enemies.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: MAESTER WOLKAN does not respond.
How did he die?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Poisoned by his enemies.
Speaker: MAESTER WOLKAN

Text: You're talking to your lord. Use respect.
Speaker: LORD KARSTARK

Text: Forgive me, my lord.
Speaker: MAESTER WOLKAN

Text: Send for Lady Walda and the baby.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: She’s resting, my lord.
Speaker: MAESTER WOLKAN

Text: RAMSAY glares at MAESTER WOLKAN.
At once, my lord.
Speaker: MAESTER WOLKAN

Text: RAMSAY looks down at ROOSE's body.
RAMSAY is standing alone. LADY WALDA walks to RAMSAY carrying her newborn son.
There he is.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Isn’t he wonderful?
Speaker: LADY WALDA

Text: LADY WALDA shows RAMSAY her son.
May I hold him?
Speaker: RAMSEY

Text: Of course.
Speaker: LADY WALDA

Text: RAMSAY takes the baby.
Little brother.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Lord Bolton sent for us. Have you seen him?
Speaker: LADY WALDA

Text: LADY WALDA reaches for the baby. RAMSAY hands the baby to her.
Of course. Follow me, Mother.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY and LADY WALDA walk to the kennel and enter. RAMSAY opens the gate. The dogs bark. RAMSAY closes the gate and locks it. LADY WALDA looks around.
Where is Lord Bolton?
Speaker: LADY WALDA

Text: The dogs bark even louder.
Down!
Speaker: RAMSAY (to the dogs)

Text: The baby starts crying. LADY WALDA tries to soothe the baby.
It’s all right. Come on, shh.
Speaker: LADY WALDA

Text: RAMSAY opens the door of a kennel.
It’s cold out here, Ramsay. I need to feed him.
Speaker: LADY WALDA

Text: RAMSAY opens the doors of all the kennels one by one.
Ramsay, where is your father? Ramsay? Where is Lord Bolton?
Speaker: LADY WALDA

Text: RAMSAY walks back over to LADY WALDA.
I am Lord Bolton.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: LADY WALDA looks at her baby.
Ramsay. Ramsay, please. I’ll leave Winterfell. I’ll go back to the Riverlands. Please. Ramsay. He’s your brother.
Speaker: LADY WALDA

Text: I prefer being an only child.
Speaker: RAMSEY

Text: RAMSEY whisles at the dogs. They exit their pens and attack LADY WALDA and the baby. LADY WALDA screams. The dogs kill them.
THEON is gathering wood. He glances at SANSA and BRIENNE, who are in conversation. PODRICK is making a fire.
I saw her with a man. I don’t think he hurt her. She didn’t want to leave him, he didn’t want to leave her.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You don’t know which way she went?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I spent three days looking for her. She disappeared.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: How did she look?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: She looked good. She wasn’t exactly dressed like a lady.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: SANSA smiles.
No, she wouldn’t be.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: What happened at Winterfell?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: SANSA pauses and tears up.
I should’ve gone with you while I had the chance.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: It was a difficult choice, my lady.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: BRIENNE looks at THEON.
We’ve all had to make difficult choices.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: THEON stands up and walks away from PODRICK. SANSA stands and walks to THEON.
We shouldn’t be lighting fires. It’s not safe. He won’t stop hunting us.
Speaker: THEON

Text: We just have to make it to Castle Black. Once we’re with Jon, Ramsay won’t be able to touch us.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Jon will have me killed the moment I step through the gate.
Speaker: THEON

Text: I won’t let him. I’ll tell him the truth about Bran and Rickon.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: And the truth about the farm boys I killed in their place? The truth about Ser Rodrik, who I beheaded?
Speaker: THEON

Text: SANSA looks to the ground.
And the truth about Rob, who I betrayed?
Speaker: THEON

Text: When you take the black, all your crimes are forgiven.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I don’t want to be forgiven. I can never make amends to your family for all the things that I’ve done. They’ll keep you safer than I ever could.
Speaker: THEON

Text: You’re not coming with us?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I would have taken you all the way to the Wall. I would have died to get you there.
Speaker: THEON

Text: SANSA hugs THEON. They both cry.
May I take one of the horses?
Speaker: THEON

Text: Where will you go?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Home.
Speaker: THEON

Text: A storm is raging.
YARA and BALON are standing and speaking. BALON stands at the fireplace with his back to YARA.
The Glovers have retaken Deepwood Motte.
Speaker: YARA

Text: And the Ironborn who held it?
Speaker: BALON

Text: They died fighting to a man.
Speaker: YARA

Text: What is dead may never die.
Speaker: BALON

Text: What is dead may never die.
Speaker: YARA

Text: YARA places the piece of paper she was reading from on a table.
But they did and our invasion died with them. Deepwood Motte was our last stronghold on the mainland.
Speaker: YARA

Text: They we will take more.
Speaker: BALON

Text: Why? For more pinecones and rocks?
Speaker: YARA

Text: BALON turns around to face YARA.
Because I order it.
Speaker: BALON

Text: We can defeat anyone at sea, but we’ll never hold lands and castles against mainland armies.
Speaker: YARA

Text: BALON walks to YARA.
Not if our captains defy my orders, abandon their posts, and sacrifice our men on foolish mission.
Speaker: BALON

Text: I won’t apologize for trying to rescue Theon.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Then where is he?
Speaker: BALON

Text: Where is your kingdom? We took those castles because the northerners marched off to war. That war is over. The last time we provoked them too far, I watched from that window as they breached our walls and knocked down our towers. I lost two brothers that day.
Speaker: YARA

Text: And I lost three sons. The War of the Five Kings, they call it. Well, the other four are dead. When you rule the Iron Islands, you can wage all the peace you wan. But for now, shut your mouth and obey or I will make another heir who will.
Speaker: BALON

Text: BALON exits the hall.
Rain is pouring down. BALON begins to cross the unsteady bridge. He leans on the ropes and looks down at the ocean, then sees a cloaked figure on the other side of the bridge.
Let me pass. You fool, move aside for your king.
Speaker: BALON

Text: Haven’t I always, brother?
Speaker: HOODED FIGURE

Text: The hooded figure takes off his hood, revealing his identity. He is EURON GREYJOY. BALON walks a few steps closer.
I thought you’d be rotting under some foreign sea by now.
Speaker: BALON

Text: What is dead may never die.
Speaker: EURON

Text: BALON does not respond.
Has the custom changed since I’ve been gone? Aren’t you supposed to repeat the words?
Speaker: EURON

Text: You can mock our god without my help.
Speaker: BALON

Text: I don’t mock the Drowned God. I am the Drowned God. From Oldtown to Qarth, when men see my sails, they pray.
Speaker: EURON

Text: The wind buffets the bridge back and forth. BALON tries to hold his balance. EURON chuckles.
You’re old, brother. You've had your time. Now let another rule.
Speaker: EURON

Text: BALON walks towards his brother.
I heard you lost your mind during the storm on the Jade Sea. They tied you to the mast to keep you from jumping overboard.
Speaker: BALON

Text: They did.
Speaker: EURON

Text: And when the storm passed, you cut out their tongues.
Speaker: BALON

Text: I needed silence.
Speaker: EURON

Text: What kind of an Ironborn loses his senses during a storm?
Speaker: BALON

Text: I am the storm, brother. The first storm and the last. And you’re in my way.
Speaker: EURON

Text: BALON draws a knife and slashes EURON across the face. EURON throws BALON off the bridge. BALON falls to his death.

Many Ironborn are in attendance for BALON's funeral. AERON GREYJOY and several Drowned Men are gathered around BALON's body. They are performing funeral rites, covering it with rocks, seaweed, and wood. YARA approaches. YARA and the Drowned Men walk BALON's body through the shallows.
Lord, take your servant Balon back beneath the waves. Feed the creatures of your kingdom on his flesh. Pull his bones down to your depths to rest beside his ancestors and his children.
Speaker: AERON

Text: What is dead may never die.
Speaker: ALL

Text: I’m going to find out who did this. I’m going to feed them to the sharks while they live. I swear it by the Salt Throne.
Speaker: YARA

Text: The Salt Throne is not yours to swear upon, not unless the kingsmoot chooses you.
Speaker: AERON

Text: My father would’ve wanted me to rule.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Your father does not get to choose. The law is clear. Perhaps you'll win. Perhaps you’ll be the first woman in history to rule the Ironborn. And perhaps not.
Speaker: AERON

Text: Come in.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: DAVOS enters.
I'm sorry, my lady. I didn’t mean to interrupt.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You interrupt nothing.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: DAVOS looks at the fireplace and then at MELISANDRE.
I assume you know why I’m here.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I will after you tell me.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: It’s about the Lord Commander.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The former Lord Commander.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Does he have to be?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: MELISANDRE looks at DAVOS.
What are you asking?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Do you know of any magic...that could help him? Bring him back?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: If you want to help him, leave him be.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Can it be done?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: There are some with his power.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: How?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I don’t know.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Have you seen it done?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: But it was. It could be now.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Not for me.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: MELISANDRE stands and walks away from her chair. DAVOS walks towards her.
Not for you? I saw you drink poison that should’ve killed you. I saw you give birth to a demon made of shadows.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Everything I believed, the great victory I saw in the flames, all of it was a lie.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: MELISANDRE looks at DAVOS.
You were right all along. The Lord never spoke to me.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Fuck him, then. Fuck all of them. I’m not a devout man, obviously. Seven Gods, drowned gods, tree gods, it's all the same.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS comes a step closer to MELISANDRE
I’m not asking the Lord of Light for help.I’m asking the woman who showed me that miracles exist.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I never had this gift.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Have you ever tried?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS, TORMUND, DOLOROUS EDD, and MELISANDRE are gathered around JON SNOW's body. GHOST is sleeping on the floor. MELISANDRE is performing a ritual on JON SNOW's body. She wrings out a wet cloth with which she cleans out the wounds of JON SNOW. She cuts his hair and beard and throws the hairs in a firepit. Then she places her hands on JON SNOW's chest and utters an incantation in Valyrian. She sighs.
Please.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: MELISANDRE lets her hands down slowly. She has tears in her eyes and looks to DAVOS. TORMUND scoffs and exits, followed by MELISANDRE and DOLOROUS EDD. DAVOS lingers and stares at JON SNOW's body, but eventually exits. GHOST suddenly wakes up and looks at JON SNOW. JON SNOW's eyes snap open and he gasps for breath.
CREDITS

TITLE SEQUENCEINT. CASTLE BLACK ROOMDAVOS is staring at JON SNOW. JON SNOW slowly sits up on the table, breathing heavily. He turns his head to look at DAVOS. GHOST is standing in front of JON SNOW, also staring at him. JON SNOW looks down at his body and sees his stab wounds. He begins gasping and shaking. DAVOS takes off his cloak and rushes over to JON SNOW. JON SNOW attempts to stand but falters. DAVOS catches JON SNOW and wraps him in his cloak.
Easy, easy. Easy.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS ushers JON SNOW back into a sitting position. MELISANDRE enters and stares at JON SNOW.
What do you remember?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: They stabbed me. Olly...he put a knife in my heart. I shouldn’t be here.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: The lady brought you back.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: MELISANDRE approaches JON SNOW and kneels in front of him.
Afterwards, after they stabbed you, after you died, where did you go? What did you see?
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Nothing. There was nothing at all.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: The Lord let you come back for a reason. Stannis was not the prince who was promised, but someone has to be.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Could you give us a moment?
Speaker: DAVOS (to MELISANDRE)

Text: MELISANDRE rises and exits the room. DAVOS closes the door behind her, grabs a stool, and sits down in front of JON SNOW.
You were dead. And now you’re not. That’s completely fucking mad, seems to me. I can only imagine how it seems to you.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I did what I thought was right. And I got murdered for it. And now I’m back. Why?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: I don’t know. Maybe we’ll never know. What does it matter? You go on. You fight for as long as you can. You clean up as much of the shit as you can.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I don’t know how to do that. I thought I did, but...I failed.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Good. Now go fail again.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DOLOROUS EDD, TORMUND, the faithful Night’s Watch members, and the Wildlings are all gathered in the courtyard, staring up at the entrance to the room JON SNOW was in. JON SNOW emerges on the balcony, supported by DAVOS. He stares out at the crowd, then walks down the steps with the help of DAVOS and begins walking through the crowd. The men on either side part to let him pass. TORMUND walks up the middle to confront JON SNOW.
They think you’re some kind of god. The man who returned from the dead.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I’m not a god.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: I know that.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: TORMUND moves closer to JON SNOW and whispers in his ear.
I saw your pecker. What kind of god would have a pecker that small?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: JON SNOW and TORMUND both chuckle and embrace. JON SNOW winces, then spies DOLOROUS EDD and begins walking towards him. They embrace, and JON SNOW winces again.
Your eyes are still brown. Is that still you in there?
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: I think so. Hold off on burning my body for now.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: DOLOROUS EDD laughs.
That’s funny. You sure that’s still you in there?
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: Both men laugh.
GILLY is sitting on the edge of a cot with LITTLE SAM. Various crewmembers are going about their business. SAMWELL is huddled over a bucket, quivering. He groans and gags. GILLY approaches him.
You all right?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Yes. Yes, I’m fine.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Did I ever tell you I used to think the sea was called the see because it was nothing but water as far as the eye could see?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I don’t think so.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Sea, see. They’re spelled different, but they sound the same.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Yeah, they do.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: It was before I learned how to read, obviously.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: SAMWELL scrunches up his face.
Sam, are you going to be sick?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: SAMWELL shakes his head and then vomits into the bucket. GILLY retrieves a water skin and hands it to SAMWELL. He washes out his mouth with water.
Won’t be long. We’ll be in the south soon. I’m excited to see Oldtown. Captain says it’s the most beautiful city in Westeros. Are you going to vomit again?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: No. No, no, no. The Citadel doesn’t admit women. There won’t be a place for you there or for Little Sam.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: I stayed at Castle Black. There’s no women allowed there.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: The Citadel isn’t Castle Black. I don’t have a Jon Snow or a Maester Aemon to help me bend the rules.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: I’ll stay in Oldtown, then.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: By yourself? With a baby and no money?
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: GILLY stands.
So if we’re not going to Oldtown, where are you taking me?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: “Wherever you go, I go, too.” That’s what you said.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: GILLY returns to LITTLE SAM and sits down on the cot. SAMWELL rises and follows her.
Us and everyone else in the world.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I don’t care about them. Well, no, I do, but I don’t really. I care about you and him.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: I know that, Sam. And he does, too. You're the only one who ever has.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: GILLY places her hand on SAMWELL’s back.
If you think it’s for the best, we trust you.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I’d feel better if you threw something at me and stormed off.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: I’d never do that to the father of my son.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: SAMWELL smiles and looks at LITTLE SAM, then vomits into a bucket and coughs.
That’s my father.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: The man beside him is Howland Reed, Meera’s father.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: The Kingsguard walk past BRAN and THREE-EYED RAVEN.
Ser Arthur Dayne.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: The Sword of the Morning.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: Father said he was the best swordsman he ever saw.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: NED and his companions confront the Kingsguard. ARTHUR stabs his sword into the dirt.
Lord Stark.
Speaker: ARTHUR

Text: I looked for you on the Trident.
Speaker: NED

Text: We weren’t there.
Speaker: ARTHUR

Text: Your friend the usurper would lie beneath the ground if we had been.
Speaker: KINGSGUARD

Text: The Mad King is dead. Rhaegar lies beneath the ground. Why weren’t you there to protect your prince?
Speaker: NED

Text: Our prince wanted us here.
Speaker: ARTHUR

Text: Where’s my sister?
Speaker: NED

Text: I wish you good fortune in the wars to come.
Speaker: ARTHUR

Text: ARTHUR and the other Kingsguard put on their helmets.
And now it begins.
Speaker: ARTHUR

Text: The Kingsguard draw their blades.
No. Now it ends.
Speaker: NED

Text: NED and his men draw their blades and attack. ARTHUR cuts down HOWLAND. The other Kingsguard runs one of NED’s men through with his sword. NED engages in single combat with the other Kingsguard and stabs him through the throat. NED and his three remaining men surround ARTHUR. NED and his men attack all at once, but ARTHUR deflects all of their blows repeatedly, then repositions himself. He kills one of NED’s men with a downward strike from both of his blades. NED and the two remaining men advance on ARTHUR. ARTHUR deflects their blows again and slices the throat of another man, then runs another through with his blade. NED engages ARTHUR in single combat.
He’s better than my father.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Far better.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: But Father beat him.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Did he?
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: I know he did. Heard the story a thousand times.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: ARTHUR traps NED’s blade and wrenches it from his hands. ARTHUR makes a motion to strike NED down, but HOWLAND stabs ARTHUR in the back. ARTHUR falls to his knees.
He stabbed him in the back.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: NED retrieves a sword and slashes ARTHUR with it, killing him. A woman screams from the Tower and NED storms towards it.
What’s in the tower?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: That’s enough for one day. We’ll visit again another time.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: I want to see where he’s going.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Time to go.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: Father!
Speaker: BRAN

Text: NED stops on the stairs and turns around in the direction of BRAN’s yelling but sees nothing and proceeds up the stairs. BRAN chases after him but is intercepted by the THREE-EYED RAVEN, who touches him on the shoulder.
The white leaves BRAN’s eyes as the vision fades. The THREE-EYED RAVEN is tangled in his roots. A child of the forest looks on. BRAN crawls towards the THREE-EYED RAVEN.
Why did you do that? Take me back there. I want to go back.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: No.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: He heard me.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Maybe. Maybe he heard the wind.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: He heard me.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: The past is already written. The ink is dry.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: What’s in that tower? I want to go back there.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I’ve told you many times, stay too long where you don’t belong and you will never return.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: Why do I want to return? So I can be a cripple again? So I can talk to an old man in a tree?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You think I wanted to sit here for 1,000 years watching the world from a distance as the roots grew through me?
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: So why did you?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I was waiting for you.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: I don’t want to be you.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I don’t blame you. You won’t be here forever. You won’t be an old man in a tree. But before you leave, you must learn.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: Learn what?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Everything.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: Hey, Great Khaleesi. Move your ass.
Speaker: BLOODRIDER (speaking Dothraki)

Text: DAENERYS approaches a domed structure. KHAL MORO and two of his Bloodriders are waiting for atop their horses.
Welcome home, Khaleesi.
Speaker: KHAL MORO

Text: Another Bloodrider ushers DAENERYS into the building. Inside, DAENERYS stands in front of a platform atop which a middle-aged Dothraki woman is standing. A group of younger Dothraki women encircle DAENERYS. They speak in Dothraki.
Go.
Speaker: DOTHRAKI WOMAN

Text: The Bloodriders who ushered DAENERYS in exit. The older Dothraki woman nods to the younger women, who swarm DAENERYS and remove all of her clothing.
What are you doing?! Take your hands off me! I will have your heads!
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: One of the younger woman approaches DAENERYS with a simple brown garment, which DAENERYS takes and wears.
You have made a mistake. One you will regret. I am the wife of the Great Khal.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: We know who you are. I remember you eating the stallion’s heart. Why didn’t you come to us after Khal Drogo died?
Speaker: DOTHRAKI MATRON

Text: Because I am Daenerys Stormborn, the Breaker of Chains, the Queen of Meereen and the Mother of Dragons. My place is not here with you.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You were the wife of the Great Khal. You thought he would conquer the world with you at his side. He didn’t. I was the wife of the Great Khal. Khal Savo. I thought he would conquer the world with me at his side. You’re young. We were all young once. But we all understand the way things are. You will learn as well, if you are fortunate enough to stay with us.
Speaker: DOTHRAKI MATRON

Text: Where else would I go? Every khaleesi becomes Dosh Khaleen.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Yes. Immediately after the death of their khal. But you went out into the world. That is forbidden. All the khalasars have returned for the Khalar Vezhven. They will decide which cities will be sacked and which tribes will be enslaved. And now they must decide what to do with Khal Drogo’s silver-haired widow. With luck, your place will be here with us, Mother of Dragons. It is the best you can hope for, now.
Speaker: DOTHRAKI MATRON

Text: INT. MEEREEN GREAT PYRAMID THRONE ROOMVARYS is sitting on the steps of the throne, fanning himself. Several Unsullied stand around the perimeters of the room.
I don’t know how you stand it in all that leather.
Speaker: VARYS (to an Unsullied)

Text: Two Unsullied usher a woman into the room.
If we could have the room.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: All the Unsullied guards exit.
You look lovely today, my dear. You really do. How you climbed all those steps without breaking a sweat.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: If you’re going to torture me, just call them back and get on with it.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: I am not a torturer.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: VARYS stands.
Though it so often is what people deserve.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: VARYS approaches the woman.

And it does provide answers. But they’re usually the wrong answers. My job is to find the right answers. Do you know how I do that? I do it by making people happy. I’d like to make you happy, Vala. That’s your name, isn’t it, Vala?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: VALA looks away. VARYS chuckles.

That’s all right. I know who you are and what you’ve done. You’ve done a lot. You’ve sacrificed your body for a cause, which is more than most people do. And you’ve helped the Sons of the Harpy murder the Unsullied and the Second Sons.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: The Unsullied and the Second Songs are foreign soldiers brought here by a foreign queen to destroy our city and our history.
Speaker: VALA

Text: Yes, you’re a true liberator, aren’t you? You won’t torture me, you’ll just threaten my son.
Speaker: VALA

Text: Children are blameless. I have never hurt them. Your boy is in no immediate danger, this I swear to you. But between us, dear, you did conspire to kill the queen’s soldiers. We both know the penalty for that crime. How will poor Dom get on without his mother? And with his breathing problem.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: If I tell you anything, they’ll kill me. So either you kill me or they do.
Speaker: VALA

Text: Yes, from your perspective, this is a problem. There is a third option, though. A ship leaving tomorrow for Pentos. I’ve already booked passage for a woman and her young son. I’ll even throw in a bag of silver to help you start again.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: VARYS kicks a large brown bag at his feet.
Though I’m afraid we’ll have to ask one of our leather-clad friends back in to carry it. Far too heavy for me. The boat sails at dawn. You need to decide now. A new life for you and Dom or…
Speaker: VARYS

Text: TYRION, MISSANDEI, and GREY WORM are sitting together around a table. TYRION smiles at MISSANDEI, and MISSANDEI smiles back. TYRION smiles at GREY WORM, and GREY WORM remains expressionless.
What should we do while we wait? To pass the time, what should we do? What should we talk about?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: MISSANDEI and GREY WORM look at each other, then at TYRION.
You speak 19 languages. You must occasionally use some of them to talk about things.
Speaker: TYRION (to MISSANDEI)

Text: MISSANDEI says nothing.
You two, you spend a great deal of time together. What would you be talking about if I weren’t here?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Patrol. When I am going on patrol with the Unsullied. What we see on patrol. Who we captured on patrol.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: That’s good. That’s very good.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION stands and carries his wine glass over to the decanter to refill it.
But that’s a report. I was thinking more of a conversation. A wise man once said the truth history of the world is the history of great conversation in elegant rooms.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Who said this?
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Me. Just now. All right, no conversations. Let’s play a game.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION returns to the table. GREY WORM and MISSANDEI say nothing.
You don’t play games, either one of you, ever?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Games are for children.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: My master Kraznys would sometimes make us play games.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: There, that’s a start.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Only the girls.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Oh no, no, no. Not that, of course not that. Innocent games, fun games, drinking games.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We do not drink.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Until you do.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: GREY WORM and MISSANDEI look interrogatively at TYRION.
VARYS enters the room.
Oh, you took your time.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Sorry. I was busy learning who funds the Sons of the Harpy. Some things you can’t rush.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: You found out?
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: The good masters of Astapor. And the wise masters of Yunkai. With help from their friends in Volantis.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: You see? You don’t even have to worry about the local rebellion. We only have to worry about the three rich foreign cities paying for it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We conquered Asatapor and Yunkai once. We will do it again and execute the Masters.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: If the Unsullied march off to reconquer Asatapor and Yunkai, who remain to defend the free people of Meereen?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: If we do not fight them, how can we stop them?
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: We cannot. The Masters only speak one language. They spoke it to me for many years. I know it better than my mother tongue. If we want them to hear us, we must speak it back to them. May it be the last thing they ever hear.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: TYRION nods.
You may be right.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: So we will fight them?
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Possibly.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Possibly?
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: It’s a conversation.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION turns to VARYS.
Tell me, can the little birds get a message to the good Masters of Astapor, the wise Masters of Yunkai, the benevolent enslavers of Volantis?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Of course. Man can be fickle, but birds always trust.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: A group of Varys' child spies are gathered together. One LITTLE BIRD picks up a model of a planet. Another child plays with an hourglass.
Your eye looks much better, Arthur. How’s your mother’s jaw?
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Better.
Speaker: ARTHUR

Text: And your father?
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: No one’s seen him.
Speaker: ARTHUR

Text: And no one will. That worked out rather nicely.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Will Lord Varys ever come back?
Speaker: LITTLE BIRD

Text: I don’t think so. Do you miss him?
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: He was nice.
Speaker: LITTLE BIRD

Text: He called us his little birds. He gave us sweets.
Speaker: ARTHUR

Text: QYBURN stands up and walks to a table.
It’s funny you should mention that. Guess what I happened to find today. Candied plums from Dorne.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: He nods at the boxes. Eeach child picks one. They nibble at the plums.
Now remember, if any of your friends like sweets or need help, they can always come to me. All I need in return are whispers.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: The door opens. GREGOR walks in, followed by JAIME and CERSEI.
No need to be afraid. This is Ser Gregor. He’s friends with all my friends.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: GREGOR looks at the children. They stare at him, motionless.
Run along now.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: The children run up the stairs.
Varys's little birds?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your little birds now, your Grace.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: JAIME is admiring GREGOR.
What did you do to him exactly? I haven't been able to get a clear answer.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Oh, a number of things.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Does he understand what we’re saying? I mean, to the extent that he ever understood complete sentences in the first place.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: GREGOR turns his head to JAIME. JAIME recoils.
He understands well enough.
Speaker: QYBURNS

Text: So tell him to march into the sept and crush the High Sparrow’s head like a melon.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The High Sparrow has hundreds of Faith Militant surrounding him. Ser Gregor will can’t face them all. And he won’t have to. He’ll only have to face one.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Has the Faith leveled official charges yet?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Not yet.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: That is one trial by combat I look forward to watching.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Don’t stop at the city. I want little birds in Dorne, in Highgarden, in the North. If someone is planning on making our losses their gains I want to hear it. If someone is laughing at the queen who walk naked through the streets covered in shit, I want to hear. I want to know who they are. I want to where they are.
Speaker: CERSEI (to QYBURN)

Text: QYBURN bows his head to CERSEI.
KEVAN LANNISTER chairs a meeting of the Small Council. MAESTER PYCELLE, MACE TYRELL and LADY OLENNA have all gathered around him.

As bad as Lord Varys was Varys was, Qyburn is worse. I told them all. I told them. He’s arrogant, dangerous. You don’t get thrown out of the Citadel without good reason. And no one listened to my advice, so here we are.
Speaker: MAESTER PYCELLE

Text: JAIME, CERSEI and SER GREGOR enter the room.
And what he's done to Gregor Clegane is an abomination. We never sanctioned this, this experiment. And I for one think it would be in our best interest to have the beast dest --
Speaker: MAESTER PYCELLE

Text: MAESTER PYCELLE notices the new guests. He farts.
Can I help you?
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: Why are you here?
Speaker: CERSEI (to LADY OLENNA)

Text: My mother...
Speaker: MACE TYRELL

Text: I was invited, my dear, o help deal with several troublesome issues, such as the queen’s imprisonment.
Speaker: LADY OLENNA

Text: Thank you for bringing it up. It’s well past time we addressed the abuses I endured.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Margaery is the queen. You are not the queen because you’re not married to the king. I do appreciate these things can get a bit confusing in your family.
Speaker: LADY OLENNA

Text: This is a Small Council meeting. You have no position on the Small Council.
Speaker: KEVAN (to CERSEI & company)

Text: I’m Lord Commander of the Kingsguard. The Lord Commander of the Kingsguard does have a position on the Small Council.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Grand Maester Pycelle, would you sanction that statement?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Well, um...I would say Ser Gerold Hightower had a seat on the Mad King’s council. Of course, that was the Mad King. King Robert saw things differently.
Speaker: MAESTER PYCELLE

Text: JAIME pushes two chairs to the table. JAIME and CERSEI sit down. MAESTER PYCELLE keeps his mouth. The members of the Council look at JAIME and CERSEI.
What about Myrcella’s death, Uncle? Do you consider the murder of your own blood a troublesome issue?
Speaker: CERSEI (to KEVAN)

Text: The same women who murdered Myrcella have overthrown House Martell and taken control of Dorne. We've got a lot to discuss. All of us together.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And seeing as you cannot make us leave, we best get on with it.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No, we cannot make you leave. And you cannot make us stay. Not unless you're gonna have that thing murder us all.
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: One by one, KEVAN LANNISTER, LADY OLENNA and MACE TYRELL leave the room. MAESTER PYCELLE picks up his paperwork and shuffles slowly. He then runs out of the door when SER GREGOR looks at him threateningly. JAIME, CERSEI and SER GREGOR are left alone in the room.
The HIGH SPARROW is praying. TOMMEN enters the room with his guards. The HIGH SPARROW stands up.
Oh, your Grace.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: My mother would like to see her daughter’s final resting place.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Oh, I'm, sorry, your Grace. That’s not possible. Not yet.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: When will it be possible?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: When she's fully atoned for her sins.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: You’ve cut off her hair and marched her naked through the streets in front of the whole city. That wasn’t a full atonement?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: No. She must stand trial before seven septons, so we can learn the true extant of her sins.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: I want you to let her see Myrcella’s resting place.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Several Faith Militant gather behind the HIGH SPARROW.
I am the king.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: You are.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: And what does that mean to you?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: It means a great deal to me. The crown and the faith are the twin pillars of the world. Do you know who told me that? Your mother.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: TOMMEN walks closer to the HIGH SPARROW. He guards tense.
My mother who is unclean? My mother who still needs to atone after all you’ve put her through?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: The HIGH SPARROW signs that his guards need to leave. They leave. TOMMEN puts his hand in the air and points to his guards. They leave. HIGH SPARROW closes the book lying on the table behind him.

How do you think the Mother Above first came to us? How did men and women first come to feel the Mother’s presence? It was through their own mothers. There is a great deal of falsehood in Cersei, you know that. But when she speaks of you, the Mother’s love outshines it all. Her love for you is more real than anything else in this world. Because it doesn’t come from this world. But you know that. You’ve felt it. You’ve seen her when she talks to you.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Yes.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: It’s a great gift. One I never had. Envy. One more thing for me to atone for.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: HIGH SPARROW points to a bench in the room.
You Grace, may I? Do you mind? It's my knees.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Of course.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: HIGH SPARROW sighs and sits down.
When your mother made her walk of atonement, she did it to get back to you.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: I still don’t understand why you want to put her through any more than she's already endured.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: It’s not what I want. It’s what the gods want. They make their will known to us and it’s up to us to either accept or reject it.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: The HIGH SPARROW palms the seat next to him.
Please.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: TOMMEN sits down next to him.
If we’re to be just and good, then we accept it, all of us, even kings. A true leader avails himself of the wisest council he can. And no one is wiser than the gods.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: My grandfather once said something similar. Except for the part about the gods.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: The gods worked through him whether he knew it or not. As they work through your mother. There’s so much good in all of us. The best we can do is to help each other bring it out.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: INT. HOUSE OF BLACK AND WHITE

The WAIF and ARYA are standing on a raised platform. The WAIF scrapes her staff on the floor around ARYA, then pushes the end of it against ARYA's head. ARYA turns around. The WAIF nudges her and she flinches. Cut to the WAIF and ARYA sitting on the ground across from each other.
Who are you?
Speaker: WAIF

Text: No one.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The WAIF hits ARYA with a stick. ARYA falls on the ground but gets up.
Who were you before you came here?
Speaker: WAIF

Text: Arya Stark.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Cut to ARYA and the WAIF on the combat platform.  ARYA tries to fight but the WAIF beats her. ARYA falls to the ground. Her mouth's bleeding. Cut back to the WAIF and ARYA sitting across from each other.
Tell me about Arya Stark’s family.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: Her father was Eddard Stark. Her mother was Catelyn Stark. She had one sister, Sansa, and four brothers.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The WAIF corrects her with a whip of the stick. Cut to the fighting platform. The WAIF kicks ARYA's staff back into her grasp. Cut back to the pair sitting across from each other.
Three brothers.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Cut back to the fighting platform. As ARYA speaks each of her brothers' names, the WAIF strikes her.
Rob, Bran, Rickon. And a half-brother, Jon.
Speaker: ARYA (V.O.)

Text: And where are they now?
Speaker: WAIF

Text: Cut to ARYA standing in front of a small table. Several bowls are filled with powder. A glass bottle stands behind each bowel.
They may be dead for all a girl knows.
Speaker: ARYA (V.O.)

Text: ARYA sniffs one of the bowls of powder, then recoils. She sniffs another bowl and wafts the scent with her hand. Cut back to the pair sitting across from each other.
Tell me about The Hound.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: Cut back to the fighting platform.
Also dead.
Speaker: ARYA (V.O.)

Text: ARYA deflects several of the WAIF's blows, but is pushed to the edge of the platform and falls when the WAIF smacks her across the face with her staff.
Arya Stark left him to die. He was on her list.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Cut to the pair sitting across from each other. The WAIF smacks ARYA with the stick.
He was not on her list anymore. She’d taken him off it.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Why? Didn’t she want him dead any longer?
Speaker: WAIF

Text: Cut back to the power table.
She did and she did not.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA lifts a spoon of the powder to the jar behind it. The Faceless Man, taking on the form of JAQEN H'GHAR, looks on. Cut back to the pair sitting across from each other.
She sounds confused.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: Yes, she was.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Cut back to the powder table. ARYA dumps the spoonful of powder in the bottle. Cut back to the pair sitting across from each other.
Who else was on Arya Stark’s funny little list?
Speaker: WAIF

Text: Cut back to the fighting platform. The WAIF beats down ARYA repeatedly until ARYA can no longer get up.
Cersei Lannister, Gregor Clegane, Walder Frey.
Speaker: ARYA (V.O.)

Text: The WAIF walks away from ARYA, but stops when ARYA begins to stand up. The WAIF turns back to face ARYA.
That’s a short list. That can’t be everyone you want to kill.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: ARYA stands up and holds her staff out at the WAIF. Cut back to the pair sitting across from each other.
Are you sure you’re not forgetting someone?
Speaker: WAIF

Text: Which name would you like a girl to speak?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Cut back to the fighting platform. ARYA and the WAIF exchange blows, but ARYA knocks back the WAIF. JAQN H'GHAR looks on.The WAIF returns with a heavy blow, but ARYA blocks it. The WAIF walks away. ARYA turns to face JAQEN H'GHAR.
ARYA is sitting in front of a fireplace. JAQEN is standing in front of the well in the center of the room.
If a girl tells me her name, I will give her eyes back.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: A girl has no name.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Come.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: ARYA walks to the well. JAQEN gives ARYA a bowl of water. ARYA hesitates to drink it.
If a girl is truly no one, she has nothing to fear.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: ARYA drinks the water. She closes her eyes. She slowly opens them to reveal the blindness has left them. She looks to JAQEN.
Who are you?
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: No one.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: EXT. NORTHERN WILDERNESS
A horse and carriage are toting a few members of House Umber towards Winterfell.
RAMSAY and LORD KARSTARK are seated at the dining table. A lady serves them drinks. SMALLJON is standing in front of them.
The Umbers are a famously loyal house.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Famously loyal to the Starks.
Speaker: LORD KARSTARK

Text: And you, Lord Karstark? Your people share blood with the Starks, don’t they?  But here we are. Times change.
Speaker: SMALLJON

Text: When my father became Warden of the North, your house refused to pledge their banners.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Your father was a cunt.
Speaker: SMALLJON

Text: My beloved father, the Warden --
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Your father was a cunt and that’s why you killed him.  I might’ve done the same to my father, if he hadn’t have done me the favor of dying on his own.
Speaker: SMALLJON

Text: My father was poisoned by our enemies.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Mmm.
Speaker: SMALLJON

Text: Why have you come to Winterfell, Lord Umber?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: The bastard Jon Snow led an army of wildlings past the Wall.  We’re farther north than any of you fuckers. Wildlings come down, we always have to fight them first.  I like fighting wildlings, been doing it all my life.  But there are too many of them for us to beat back alone.
Speaker: SMALLJON

Text: So now you’ve come seeking help?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: We need to help each other.  The colder it gets, the farther South those goat fuckers will roam. Won't take them long to get here.
Speaker: SMALLJON

Text: You think a horde of wildlings can take Winterfell?
Speaker: LORD KARSTARK

Text: If they get Jon Snow leading them, maybe.  He knows this place better than we ever will.
Speaker: SMALLJON

Text: Pledge your banners to House Bolton.  Swear loyalty to me as Warden of the North and we will fight together to destroy the bastard and all his wildling friends.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: I’m not kissing your fucking hand.
Speaker: SMALLJON

Text: Traditionally a bannerman kneels before his lord.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: I’m not doing that either.
Speaker: SMALLJON

Text: Why would I trust a man who won’t honor tradition?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Your father honored tradition. Knelt for Robb Stark. Called him King of the North. Was Robb Stark right to trust your father?
Speaker: SMALLJON

Text: Then it appears we're at a bit of an impasse.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Fuck kneeling and fuck oaths. I've got a gift for you.
Speaker: SMALLJON

Text: A girl, I hope. I prefer redheads.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Two hooded people are dragged into the hall.
A girl, aye.  A wild one.
Speaker: SMALLJON

Text: SMALLJON pulls the hood off one of the people, revealing OSHA. RAMSAY stands up.
I like them wild.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: And the boy, nice and young. The way Karstark likes them.
Speaker: SMALLJON

Text: LORD KARSTARK stands up. SMALLJON pulls the hood off the other person, revealing RICKON STARK.
Who’s this?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Rickon Stark.
Speaker: SMALLJON

Text: How do I know that’s Rickon Stark?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: SMALLJOY retrieves the severed head of Rickon's direwolf SHAGGYDOG and places it on the table. RAMSAY examines the head, looks at SMALLJON, and then smiles at RICKON.
Welcome home, Lord Stark.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: INT. CASTLE BLACK – JON SNOW’S CHAMBER
JON SNOW is sitting by the fireplace. He is looking to the ground. Someone knocks on the door. DOLOROUS EDD walks in.
It’s time.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: JON SNOW gets up, drops his vest with the stab holes in it on the table, and grabs his sword Longclaw.
CASTLE BLACK – COURTYARD
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: MELISANDRE is standing on a balcony overlooking the courtyard. TORMUND, DAVOS, the wildlings, and the Night's Watch are all in attendance. JON SNOW walks past them, going up the stairs towards the gallows. DOLOROUS EDD accompanies him. BOWEN MARSH, OTHELL YARWICK, ALLISER THORNE, and OLLY are standing on a platform with their hands tied and ropes around their necks. JON SNOW looks up at them.
If you have any last words, now is the time.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: You shouldn’t be alive. It’s not right.
Speaker: BOWEN MARSH

Text: Neither was killing me.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: My mother's still living at White Harbor. Could you write her? Tell her I died fighting the wildings.
Speaker: OTHELL YARWICK

Text: I had a choice, Lord Commander. Betray you or betray the Night’s Watch. You brought an army of wildlings into our lands. An army of muderers and raiders. If I had to do it all over knowing where I’d end up, I pray I’d make the right choice again.
Speaker: ALLISER THRONE

Text: I’m sure you would, Ser Alliser.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: I fought, I lost. Now I rest. But you, Lord Snow, you’ll be fighting their battles forever.
Speaker: ALLISER THRONE

Text: JON SNOW looks at OLLY. OLLY stares back at him, unwavering. JON SNOW turns his back and unsheathes Longclaw. He breathes heavily. JON SNOW cuts the rope. The platform is pulled out from under the traitors’ feet. They are hung. They choke and die. JON SNOW looks at OLLY again. OLLY's face is blue and swollen. JON SNOW sheathes his sword, then walks up to DOLOROUS EDD.
We should burn the bodies.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: You should.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: JON SNOW takes off his cape and hands it to DOLOROUS EDD.
What do you want me to do with this?
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: Wear it. Burn it. Whatever you want. You have Castle Black.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: JON SNOW walks down the stairs.
My watch is ended.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Everyone in attendance watches JON SNOW walk away.
CREDITS
Longclaw is lying on a table. DOLOROUS EDD lifts and admires it, then turns to JON SNOW who is putting some items in a bag.
Where you gonna go?
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: South.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: What are you gonna do?
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: Get warm.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: JON SNOW smiles. DOLOROUS EDD places Longclaw on the table.
I was with you at Hardhome. We saw what’s out there. We know it’s coming here. How can you leave us now?
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: I did everything I could. You know that.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: You swore a vow.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: Aye, I pledged my life to the Night’s Watch. I gave my life.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: For all nights to come.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: They killed me, Edd! My own brothers. You want me to stay here after that?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: A single horn sounds outside. JON SNOW and DOLOROUS EDD look to the doorway.
Riders approaching!
Speaker: MAN (O.S.)

Text: Open the gate!
Speaker: MAN #2 (O.S.)

Text: The southern gates open. SANSA, BRIENNE, and PODRICK enter the courtyard on horseback. The Night’s Watch and the Wildlings all watfch them. TORMUND stares intently at BRIENNE. The trio dismount from their horses. JON SNOW and DOLOROUS EDD emerge onto a balcony overlooking the courtyard. SANSA slowly spins around until she and JON SNOW lock eyes. JON SNOW descends from the balcony and walks to SANSA. They stare at each other and then embrace.
JON SNOW and SANSA are sitting by the fire. SANSA lifts a bowl to her lips and drinks from it.
This is good soup. Do you remember those kidney pies Old Nan used to make?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: With the peas and onions?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Mmm.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: We never should have left Winterfell.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Don’t you wish we could go back to the day we left? I want to scream at myself, “Don’t go, you idiot.”
Speaker: SANSA

Text: How could we know?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: I spent a lot of time thinking about what as ass I was to you. I wish I could change everything.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: We were children.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: I was awful, just admit it.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JON SNOW chuckles.
You were occasionally awful. I’m sure I can’t have been great fun. Always sulking in the corner while the rest of you played.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Can you forgive me?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: There’s nothing to forgive.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Forgive me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: All right. All right, I forgive you.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: SANSA laughs, then holds out her hand for JON SNOW’s horn of ale. JON SNOW gives it to her. She sips, then coughs. JON SNOW laughs.
You’d think after thousands of years, the Night’s Watch would have learned how to make a good ale.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Where will you go?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Where will we go? If I don’t watch over you, Father’s ghost will come back and murder me.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Where will we go?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I can’t stay here, not after what happened.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: There’s only one place we can go. Home.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Should we tell the Boltons to pack up and leave?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: We’ll take it back from them.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I don’t have an army.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: How many wildlings did you save?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: They didn’t come here to serve me.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: They owe you their lives.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA stands and walks to a table. She places her bowl down on it.
You think they’ll be safe here if Roose Bolton remains Warden of the North?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Sansa.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Winterfell is our home. It’s ours and Arya’s and Bran’s and Rickon’s. Wherever they are, it belongs to our family. We have to fight for it.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I’m tired of fighting.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: JON SNOW stands and turns to face SANSA.
It’s all I’ve done since I left home. I’ve killed brothers of the Night’s Watch. I’ve killed wildlings. I’ve killed men that I admire. I hanged a boy younger than Bran. I fought and I lost.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: If we don’t take back the North, we’ll never be safe. I want you to help me. But I’ll do it myself if I have to.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: MELISANDRE is looking out over the edge of the balcony. DAVOS approaches her.
My lady.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Ser Davos.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Will you stay here at Castle Black?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I will do as Jon Snow commands.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: You serve Jon Snow now?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: He’s the prince that was promised.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Forgive me, my lady, I thought that was Stannis.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: MELISANDRE walks away from DAVOS and down into the courtyard. DAVOS follows her.
What happened down there?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: There was a battle. Stannis was defeated.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: MELISANDRE continues to walk away, but DAVOS grabs her arm to stop her.
And Shireen? What happened to the princess?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: BRIENNE approaches.
I saw what happened. I saw Stannis’ forces defeated in the field.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: My lady, I’m Ser Davos Seaworth.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: We’ve met before. I was Kingsguard to Renly Baratheon. Before Renly was assassinated with bloodmagic.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: BRIENNE stares at MELISANDRE.
That’s in the past now.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Yes, it’s in the past. It doesn’t mean I forget. Or forgive. He admitted it, you know.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Who did?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Stannis. Just before I executed him.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: BRIENNE walks away. MELISANDRE walks in the opposite direction. DAVOS stares at BRIENNE.
The Defender of the Vale!
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER (to ROBIN)

Text: Uncle Petyr!
Speaker: ROBIN

Text: ROBIN drops the bow and arrow and runs to LITTLEFINGER. They embrace.
My lord. Come and see.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: LITTLEFINGER ushers ROBIN to the rear of the carriage.
I missed your name day. Go on.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: ROBIN and LITTLEFINGER pull a sheet from the back of the carriage, revealing a cage with a falcon inside. The falcon squawks. ROBIN gasps.
A falcon!
Speaker: ROBIN

Text: A gyrfalcon. The greatest and rarest of birds.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Last time I saw you, Baelish, you told me you were taking Sansa Stark home with you to the Fingers.
Speaker: YOHN ROYCE

Text: Indeed I was.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: And yet not long ago, we received reports that she has been married to Ramsay Bolton in Winterfell.
Speaker: YOHN ROYCE

Text: On our way to the Fingers, we were set upon by a large force of Bolton men. Seemed to know exactly when we were traveling and exactly whom we were transporting.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Do you take me for a fool?
Speaker: YOHN ROYCE

Text: Tell me, Lord Royce, how many people knew of my travel plans with Sansa Stark? I shared my intentions with you and no one else.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: The ensuing conversation momentarily distracts ROBIN from admiring the falcon. YOHN ROYCE approaches LITTLEFINGER slowly.
Slander a man in his own home, you might find yourself crossing swords with him.
Speaker: YOHN ROYCE

Text: Your home is the Vale. The Lord of the Vale stands before us. And only his judgment concerns me.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: YOHN ROYCE looks to ROBIN.
Shall we throw him through the Moon Door?
Speaker: ROBIN

Text: The surrounding knights begin to approach YOHN ROYCE. YOHN ROYCE walks closer to ROBIN.
My lord. My lord, I have always been faithful to House Arryn. To your father, to your mother, and now to you.
Speaker: YOHN ROYCE

Text: Do you believe him, Uncle Petyr?
Speaker: ROBIN

Text: YOHN ROYCE turns back to look at LITTLEFINGER.
Lord Royce has served the Vale well. He;s enjoyed a distinguished military career. If we could trust his absolute loyalty, he would make a capable commander in the wars to come.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: YOHN ROYCE turns back to ROBIN.
You can trust my absolute loyalty, my lord.
Speaker: YOHN ROYCE

Text: I think he deserves one more chance. What do you say?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Fine.
Speaker: ROBIN

Text: YOHN ROYCE bows and walks a few feet away from the engagement.

I bring good news. My friends in the North tell me Sansa has escaped Winterfell. I expect she’s headed to Castle Black where her brother serves as Lord Commander. But she won’t be safe there, not with the Boltons after her.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER (to ROBIN)

Text: She’s my cousin. We should help her.
Speaker: ROBIN

Text: That was my instinct as well.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: LITTLEFINGER turns and walks towards YOHN ROYCE.
Our lord has spoken. Gather the Knights of the Vale. The time has come to join the fray.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: You invite the enemy into our city?
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: I did. As a clever man once told me, “We make peace with our enemies, not our friends.”
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION begins walking away. The others follow.
I don’t make peace with the queen’s enemies. I kill the queen’s enemies.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Yes, that’s the military approach. And how has that worked here in Meereen? I represent the diplomatic approach.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION and VARYS begin ascending the stairs to the Great Pyramid.
Our queen tried to make peace with the Masters and they tried to murder her.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: TYRION and VARYS turn back to face MISSANDEI and GREY WORM.
TYRION We enter these negotiations with open eyes. Trust me. My own recent experience with slavery has taught me the horrors of that institution.
How many days were you a slave?
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: TYRION stammers.
Long enough to know.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Not long enough to understand.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: TYRION and VARYS proceed up the steps. MISSANDEI and GREY WORM follow.
TYRION, VARYS, MISSANDEI, and GREY WORM are sitting in attendance to three masters, YEZZAN ZO QAGGAZ, RAZDAL MO ERAZ, and BELICHO PAENYMION.
I bought this dwarf for a single gold honor. And somehow you’ve risen to the top of the Great Pyramid of Meereen. It’s most impressive.
Speaker: YEZZAN

Text: And now you speak for the Good Masters of Astapor.Here’s to reversals of fortune.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We came here to meet the queen and instead we’re greeted by a dwarf and a eunuch.
Speaker: RAZDAL

Text: Let’s make this simple, shall we? Tell me what you want.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We want you to leave Slaver’s Bay. Take your dragons and your mercenaries and go.
Speaker: BELICHO

Text: Queen Daenerys won’t stay in Meereen forever. Her path takes her westward.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: When we last met, I offered her ships so she could return to Westeros where she belongs. She refused them.
Speaker: RAZDAL

Text: She refused them because hundreds of thousands of men, women, and children still lived in chains.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: As they have since the dawn of time.
Speaker: RAZDAL

Text: Not anymore.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: You think you’re a free man now? You still follow orders. Just because your master has silver hair and tits doesn’t mean she’s not a master.
Speaker: YEZZAN

Text: Friends, friends, friends, please.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: GREY WORM stares intently at YEZZAN.
There have always been those with wealth and power and those with nothing. That is the way of the world. I’m not here to change the way of the world.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Slavery is the way of our world.
Speaker: YEZZAN

Text: You don’t need slaves to make money. There haven’t been slaves in Westeros for hundreds of years and I grew up richer than any of you. But our queen recognizes that she erred by abolishing slavery without providing a new system to replace it. So here is the queen’s proposal. Slavery will never return to Meereen but she will give the other cities of Slaver’s Bay time to adjust to the new order.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What does that mean?
Speaker: YEZZAN

Text: Instead of abolishing slavery overnight, we will give you seven years to end the practice.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The masters look at each others.
Slaveholders will be compensated for their losses, of course, at fair prices. In exchange, you will cut off your support for the Sons of the Harpy.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We do not support the Sons of the Harpy.
Speaker: YEZZAN

Text: Fine, fine, but you will cut it off all the same. I do hope you accept, my friends. You will not receive a better offer.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION picks up a bell from the table beside him and rings it.
Let us sail on the tide of freedom instead of being drowned by it. And as a parting gift to our honored guests…
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Three women enter. Each one sits in the lap of one of the masters.
Give freedom a chance. See if it doesn’t taste every bit as good as what came before.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION exits. VARYS, MISSANDEI, and GREY WORM follow.
A group of commoner representatives are gathered together at the foot of the throne, whispering in Valyrian. TYRION, MISSANDEI, and GREY WORM enter on the throne platform.
My friends! Large sorry...you wait so fat time.
Speaker: TYRION (speaking Valyrian)

Text: Perhaps I should translate for you.
Speaker: MISSANDEI (to TYRION)

Text: We speak the Common Tongue.
Speaker: MAN #1

Text: Excellent.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You met with the slavers today.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: I did.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Our brothers and sister died fighting these scum. Now you invite them to our city and drink wine with them.
Speaker: MAN #1

Text: I imagine this room was built so the rulers could intimidate the ruled.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION begins to descend the steps towards the men. MISSANDEI and GREY WORM follow.
But I am not your ruler. I’m not the Breaker of Chains. I’m not the Unburnt. And I am certainly not the Mother of Dragons.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION and company reach the bottom of the steps so they are face to face with the men.
You are a stranger here. So why do you represent Meereen in these talks with our enemies?
Speaker: MAN #1
