Text: Because our queen chose me as her advisor. Until she returns from her travels --
Speaker: TYRION

Text: When does she return?
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: Soon. You have my word.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We don’t know you. We don’t trust you. We know Torgo Nudho. We fight with him against the Masters. We trust him.
Speaker: MAN #1

Text: And that is exactly why Grey Worm took part in these negotiations. As commander of the Unsullied, he knows hot to defeat the slavers and he knows when it is time to make peace.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You have made peace with the slavers?
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: We offered terms.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And you, Grey Worm? You want to drink wine with these men? The men who tore us from our mothers’ arms and sold us at auction like cattle?
Speaker: MAN #1 (speaking Valyrian)

Text: Missandei, you know what these men are. How can you trust them?
Speaker: MAN #2 (speaking Valyrian)

Text: I do not trust them. I will never trust them.
Speaker: MISSANDEI (speaking Valyrian)

Text: MISSANDEI pauses and looks at TYRION.
But as a wise man once said, “We make peace with our enemies, not our friends.”
Speaker: MISSANDEI (speaking Valyrian)

Text: TYRION smiles.
TYRION, GREY WORM, and MISSANDEI are walking together.
Do not use me for your lies.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Those men respect you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They respect me because they know who I am. They know I am loyal.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: As do I.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I am loyal to my queen, not you. If you betray her work, you are my enemy.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: I am not betraying her work. I am trying to save her city.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You promised the slavers they could keep slavery.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: For a short time.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Seven years is not a short time for a slave.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: You’re right. Slavery is a horror that should be ended at once. War is a horror that should be ended at once. I can’t do both today.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You are wrong to trust these men.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: I don’t trust the Masters. I trust their self-interest. They’re trustworthy if they’re convinced that working with me is in their self-interest.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You don’t know them. You don’t understand them. We are not human in their eyes. They look at me and see a weapon. They look at her and see a whore.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: They look at me and they see a misshapen little beast. Their contempt is their weakness. They’ll underestimate us every time and we will use that to our advantage.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You will not use them. They will use you. That is what they do.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: JORAH and DAARIO are walking to the top of a mountain crag. JORAH lags behind and stops to catch his breath. DAARIO turns back to him.
You all right? Why don’t you sit and catch your breath?
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: I’m fine.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: DAARIO chuckles.
I don’t think you could ride the dragon. 20 years ago, maybe.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: What?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Our queen. She’s wild, you know. Don’t let her size fool you. It’s hard enough for me and I’m a young man. You, I don’t think your heart could take it.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: JORAH stares at DAARIO for a few moments and then continues along the path.
Must make you angry that our queen chose me.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Makes me sad. You’ll disappoint her before long. She’ll move on.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: We’ll all disappoint her before long.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: JORAH turns back to face DAARIO.
We need each other right now. After we’re done needing each other --
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Oh, I don’t want to fight you, Jorah the Andal. What do I have to gain? If I win, I’m the shit who killed an old man. If I lose, I’m the shit who was killed by an old man.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: You didn’t get much discipline as a child, did you?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: None.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: JORAH and DAARIO crawl to the edge of the ridge and look below. Vaes Dothrak sprawls across the valley floor.
The road running through the Horse Gate, they call that the godsway.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: JORAH points to the eastern division of Vaes Dothrak, and then to the western division.

Eastern Market, Western Market. When Khal Drogo died, she was supposed to come here and join the Dosh Khaleen, the widows of the dead khals. That’s where they would have taken her, the Temple of the Dosh Khaleen.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: JORAH stands and walks off to the side. He begins undoing his sword belt.
What are you doing?
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: It’s forbidden to carry weapons in the sacred city.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Isn’t it forbidden to sneak into their city and steal their khaleesi?
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: If they spot us and we’re unarmed, we’ll say we’re traders heading for the Western Market. But if they see weapons…
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You’re asking a dog to hand over his teeth.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: There’s 100,000 of them down there. We can’t fight our way out. We wait till dark, and then we’ll find her.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: DAARIO hands over his weapons, except for his dagger. JORAH holds his hand out for the dagger.
Uh…
Speaker: DARRIO

Text: DAARIO flips the knife around in his hand.
I’m very attached to this knife.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAARIO kisses and strokes the knife, then motions to hand it to JORAH. He spots the patch of greyscale on JORAH’s arm through a hole in his sleeve. JORAH pinches the fabric of his sleeve together to cover up the greyscale.
Don’t worry. it didn’t touch you.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You know what happens?
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: I know what happens.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: DAARIO gestures with the dagger.
I’ll do it myself.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: JORAH walks to the side and stares into space.
Dothraki men and women are celebrating in the streets. JORAH and DAARIO are sneaking through the stables. They crouch down in front of a railing and see a Dothraki man and woman fornicating.
I should have been born a Dothraki.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: JORAH and DAARIO sneak into an alleyway. They move through the alley, but spot two Dothraki men coming their way. JORAH grabs DAARIO.
Come on.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: JORAN and DAARIO walk out to greet the Dothraki men. They proceed to speak in Dothraki.
My friends...We wandered off from the Western Market and got lost. Could you show us the way back?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: What do you sell?
Speaker: DOTHRAKI #1

Text: Wine. Come down to my stall tomorrow, I’ll give you a cask of the Arbor’s finest.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You’re not merchants.
Speaker: DOTHRAKI #1

Text: The Dothraki man inclines his head towards his fellow man.
Get the others.
Speaker: DOTHRAKI #1

Text: The second Dothraki man runs down the alleyway. DAARIO darts after him. JORAH swings at the first Dothraki man, but misses. The Dothraki man knees him in the face, knocking him to the ground. DAARIO continues to pursue the other Dothraki man. JORAH strikes his foe twice, but both are blocked. The Dothraki man strikes back with a punch to the face that sends JORAH sprawling. In the alley, just before the other Dothraki man reaches the common area, DAARIO grabs him from behind, places his hand over his mouth, and then snaps his neck. JORAH is rebuffed by his foe a third time. He attempts to throw sand in the Dothraki man’s face, but he dodges out of the way. JORAH climbs to his knees, but the Dothraki man grabs him by the throat and begins choking him. DAARIO stabs the Dothraki man from behind, killing him.
Told you, I’m very attached to this knife.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAARIO tucks the dagger away in his shirt. JORAH climbs to his feet.
You all right?
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: If they find a body with a stab wound, the whole city will be looking for us.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: DAARIO grabs a large rock and smashes the dead Dothraki man with it several times.
Huh.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: DAENERYS is sitting among the Dosh Khaleen. The women whisper among themselves, but the leader sits beside DAENERYS. They begin to speak in Dothraki.

Some of them don’t think Dothraki should breed with foreigners. They are stupid old women. They don’t realize that we have always diluted our blood. This one is Lhazareen. Her Khal found her hiding in a well after he burned her village. How old were you?
Speaker: LEADER

Text: Twelve.
Speaker: LHAZAREEN WOMAN

Text: A year later, she bore her Khal a daughter. How did he show his happiness?
Speaker: LEADER

Text: He broke my ribs.
Speaker: LHAZAREEN WOMAN

Text: We are not queens here, but the khals depend on us for our wisdom. Our lives have meaning.
Speaker: LEADER

Text: That is more than most have.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: When the khals meet for the Khalar Vezhven tomorrow night, I hope they let you live out your days with us. The other possibilities are not so pleasant.
Speaker: LEADER

Text: I need to make water.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You can’t run from Dothraki. You know this.
Speaker: LEADER

Text: I will never run from Dothraki.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Go, show her.
Speaker: LEADER (to LHAZAREEN WOMAN)

Text: The Lhazareen woman takes DAENERYS outside the temple. They walk together.
I needed fresh air. The old women stink.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They do stink.
Speaker: LHAZAREEN WOMAN

Text: You must have been very young when your Khal died.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Sixteen.
Speaker: LHAZAREEN WOMAN

Text: Too bad he didn’t die sooner.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS and the Lhazareen woman smile at each other.
Yes, too bad.
Speaker: LHAZAREEN WOMAN

Text: The pair round a bend to a secluded desert outcropping.
Is it true you have three dragons?
Speaker: LHAZAREEN WOMAN

Text: Mm-hmm.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: And they breathe fire?
Speaker: LHAZAREEN WOMAN

Text: They do. Would you like to see them one day?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I am Dosh Khaleen. I can never leave Vaes Dothrak, until I rise as smoke from the pyre on the day I die.
Speaker: LHAZAREEN WOMAN

Text: DAARIO grabs the Lhazareen woman from behind, covers her mouth, and places his dagger against her neck. JORAH is standing behind DAARIO.
No, don’t hurt her.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: She’ll give us away.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: We have to go now.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: DAENERYS grabs DAARIO’s dagger-carrying hand, and he drops it away from the Lhazareen woman’s neck.
We will never get out of Vaes Dothrak alive.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: All we can do is try.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: No. We can do more than that. And you’re going to help me.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS looks at the Lhazareen woman.
And you...Have faith in me, Khaleesi. Do not betray me.
Speaker: DAENERYS (speaking Dothraki)

Text: The Lhazareen woman nods. DAENERYS looks at DAARIO. DAARIO slowly removes his hand from her mouth.

INT. GREAT SEPT OF BAELOR CELLMARGAERY is sitting in the corner of her cell. SEPTA UNELLA enters, then guides MARGAERY out into the prayer room where the HIGH SPARROW waits. MARGAERY walks into the room and shields her eyes from the sunlight. SEPTA UNELLA pushes MARGAERY to her knees, then exits.
If I were to let you leave right now, where would you go? What would you seek out?
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: I’d go to my brother, my husband, my family.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Of course, but for you, that means seeking out money, finery, power. Seeking out your family means seeking out sin. I’m not maligning you. I sought those things out, too. To the exclusion of all else. My father was a cobbler. He died with I was young and I took over his shop. He was a simple man and he made simple shoes. But I found that the more work I put into my shoes, the more people wanted them. Fine leather, ornamentation, detailing, and time. Time most of all. Dozens of hours spent on a single pair.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Quality takes time.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Yes. I imagine you’ve worn a year of someone’s life on your back. The highborn liked to cover their feet with my time and they paid well for the privilege. I used their money to buy a taste of their lives for myself. Each time I indulged, I felt myself ascending to something better.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: And one day you walked through a graveyard and realized it was all for nothing and set out on the path to righteousness. Book of the Stranger, verse 25.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: You know The Seven-Pointed Star.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Septa Unella reads it to me. At me.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Yes, yes, she does enjoy reading at people. You’re close. But it wasn’t a graveyard. It was a feast. I bought old fine wine and young pretty girls and invited my friends to come share it all. We passed around the wine, passed around the women, and soon we fell into a stupor. I woke before dawn. I could barely stand. Everyone else was asleep on the couches or on the floor, lying in heaps next to their fine clothes. The truth of their bodies laid bare. I could smell them beneath the incense and the perfume and the fine food that had already started to turn. And I saw it with perfect clarity. I saw what my sins were. The gold I had, the wine I drank, the women I used, my ceaseless struggle to maintain my position. It was all part of a story. A story I was telling myself about who I was. A collection of lies that would disappear in the light. The people I was trying to climb away from, the beggars in the street, the poor, they were closer to the truth than I ever was.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: So what did you do?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I left to go and find them. I didn’t even put on my shoes. I walked out the door and never went back.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: The HIGH SPARROW stands and extends his hand out to MARGAERY.
Come, let’s go and see him.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Who?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Your brother.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: GREAT SEPT OF BAELOR – LORAS’ CELL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: MARGAERY enters her brother’s cell. The door closes and locks behind her. Loras is lying on the floor.
Loras. Loras.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: MARGAERY helps LORAS to his knees. He cries.
Listen to me. You need to stay strong.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I can’t stay strong. I never was strong.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: You are strong. You are the future of our house, the future of our family.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I don’t care about that.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: I just want it to stop. Help me.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: They want me to help you. They want me told help tear you down. That’s why he’s letting me see you, I know it is. And if either of us give in to what they want, then they win.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Let them win. Just make it stop. Please.
Speaker: LORAS

Text: LORAS begins sobbing. MARGAERY embraces him.
All right.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: RED KEEP – TOMMEN'S CHAMBER
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: CERSEI is walking down the hall to TOMMEN’s chamber. She hears MAESTER PYCELLE talking.

And now, how to avert disaster with our current predicament. This High Sparrow. I have dealt with fanatics of every description, Your Grace. Not setting them off, that’s the most important thing. You are beset with enemies both within and without.
Speaker: MAESTER PYCELLE

Text: CERSEI enters the room
What are you doing here?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I am advising the king on our current predicament.
Speaker: MAESTER PYCELLE

Text: Leave.
Speaker: CERSEi

Text: I am a member of the Small Council. The king’s small --
Speaker: MAESTER PYCELL

Text: Is this a Small Council meeting?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Obviously not. I’m here to lend my wisdom and my support.
Speaker: MAESTER PYCELL

Text: Thank you for your counsel, Grand Maester. That will be all for now.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: MAESTER PYCELL

Text: MAESTER PYCELLE hobbles towards the door. As he leaves, he flashes CERSEI a smile. CERSEI closes the door.
Since I’ve missed the past several Small Coucil meetings, I wanted to speak to you about a few things.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I’ve been thinking about the High Sparrow.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: As have we all, unfortunately.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: We need to be careful in dealing with such a man. To prevent things from escalating any further. We have to be careful not to antagonize him. He has Margaery. We can’t put her at risk. He’s dangerous.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: CERSEI takes TOMMEN by the chin.
Look at me. What did they do to me? To the king’s own mother?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: TOMMEN looks down.
It’s all right. It's done. It’s in the past. And of course Margaery’s safety is paramount.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You don’t like Margaery, do you?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Whether I like her or not is completely unimportant. Margaery is the queen. Queens must command respect. Kings even more so. Not just for their own sake, but for everyone’s. The High Sparrow has no respect for kings or queens. No respect for anything in this world. He has no use for the things of this world. He want to knock them down and replace them with what? With fantasies. With beggars in the street. With nothing.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Mother...there’s something I want to tell you. Something the High Sparrow told me.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: You’ve spoken with him?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I promised him I wouldn’t tell anyone. If he found out I told --
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: It would be a breach of confidence which he would not take lightly, given his constant prattling about the truth. I am your mother. You can always trust me.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: RED KEEP – SMALL COUNCIL CHAMBER
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: KEVAN and LADY OLENNA are waiting in the Small Council chamber for the meeting to start. CERSEI and JAIME enter.
The Small Council meeting has been postponed on the king’s orders.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: KEVIN and LADY OLENNA stand up.
I would have thought we were perfectly clear the first time. You’re not welcome.
Speaker: LADY OLENNA

Text: You once spoke of your respect for our father because he understood the necessity of working with one’s rivals.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: My dear, you have been stripped of your dignity and authority, publicly shamed, and confined to the Red Keep. What’s left to work with?
Speaker: LADY OLENNA

Text: Cersei is the mother of the king. She has the king’s ear and his trust. And the king has been speaking regularly with the High Sparrow about Queen Margaery and Ser Loras.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The High Sparrow seized power knowing full well we'd bicker amongst ourselves instead of seizing it back. Here we are. Well done to us. Now the future of the Seven Kingdoms rest in his dirty, peasant hands. In a few days, he’ll have a trial for me. But before that, Queen Margaery will make her walk of atonement. Yes, Margaery will repent her sins before the good people of the city.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Oh, no. That cannot happen. That will not happen.
Speaker: LADY OLENNA

Text: I agree.
Speaker: CERSEi

Text: You’ve got the second largest army in Westeros. You'll bring them into the city, stop queen Margaery’s humiliation before it starts, and take her back into Crown custody.
Speaker: JAIME (to KEVAN)

Text: The king has ordered me to take no action against the High Sparrow or the Faith Militant out of fear for the queen’s safety.
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: You’ll take no action at all. When the Tyrell armies come, you will stand down. Are you expressly forbidden from standing down?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: No, but if the king should call on me --
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: The whole thing will be over before anyone can call on you to do anything. When the High Sparrow is in custody or dead, preferably, and Margaery's back at Tommen’s side, do you think the king will be angry at the outcome?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You hate these fanatics as much as we do. You hate what they’ve done to your son.  Do you want Lancel back or have you given him up for good?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Of course I want him back.
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: Then stand aside and let the people that took him from you be destroyed.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: If it doesn’t go as planned, the Sparrows have many friends in the city. We’ll have civil war. Many will die.
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: Many will die no matter what we do. Better them than us.
Speaker: LADY OLENNA

Text: PYKE CASTLE – GREAT HALL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: THEON enters. YARA is sitting by the fire.
They told me you were home and I didn’t believe it. “Theon Greyjoy?” I said. “He’s dead. He’s been dead a long time." He let you go?
Speaker: YARA

Text: I escaped.
Speaker: THEON

Text: YARA turns and looks at THEON.
I can’t hear you.
Speaker: YARA

Text: I escaped.
Speaker: THEON

Text: YARA stands up and then walks towards THEON.
Look at me. Look at me! Men died trying to rescue you. Good men. My men.
Speaker: YARA

Text: I’m sorry.
Speaker: THEON

Text: You were my brother. You’re a spoiled little cunt, but you were my brother and I risked everything for you and you betrayed me.
Speaker: YARA

Text: I know. I know and I’m sorry.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Stop saying that.
Speaker: YARA

Text: He broke me. He broke me into a thousand pieces.
Speaker: THEON

Text: I know.
Speaker: YARA

Text: You don’t know.
Speaker: THEON

Text: He send us one of those pieces. That’s why I came for you.
Speaker: YARA

Text: THEON sobs.
Why did you come here?
Speaker: YARA

Text: Where else could I go?
Speaker: THEON

Text: You heard father was dead and thought you’d claim the crown?
Speaker: YARA

Text: No, no. I only heard he died after we docked.

Text: You happen to show up on Pyke right before the Kingsmoot?
Speaker: YARA

Text: I didn’t know.
Speaker: THEON

Text: You think any Ironborn wants you to be king? After what you’ve done?
Speaker: YARA

Text: I don’t want to be king.
Speaker: THEON

Text: What do you want?
Speaker: YARA

Text: I should’ve listened to you. You’re the only one --
Speaker: THEON

Text: That doesn’t matter anymore. Stop crying.  Look at me. Tell me what you want.
Speaker: YARA

Text: You should rule the Iron Islands. Let me help you.
Speaker: THEON

Text: INT. WINTERFELL – ROOM
RAMSAY peels an apple with a knife. The door opens. A guard ushers OSHA into the room. RAMSAY nods. The guard leaves and closes the door.
They've cleaned you up nicely. You know who I am?

Speaker: RAMSAY

You served the Starks?

Text: Aye. They put me in chains and put a sword at my throat, so I’ve served them.
Speaker: OSHA

Text: The Starks have been gone for a long time, but you kept protecting Rickon.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: He'd fetch a good price to the right buyer. I served his family a long time. Didn’t get no wages. Way I see it, I’m owed.

Same thing men always want. And when they really want it, they give it a bath first.

Text: OSHA slowly begins to reach for the knife on the table.
You’re a good talker.

I like that.

Text: RAMSAY kisses OSHA'S neck. She reaches into his pants.
You’re a much better talker than Theon Greyjoy.

Text: That so?

Text: I had to work hard to get him talking. But he talked. They all do.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: OSHA's hand inches closer to the knife.
He told me everything. All about the Stark boys. Who helped them escape, and how she did it.

Text: OSHA gets up and tries to stab RAMSAY with the knife, but RAMSAY stabs her in the neck first. She falls on the ground, with blood running from her neck. She dies. RAMSAY cleans his knife and continues to peel the apple. He bites a piece.

Open the gate!

CASTLE BLACK – MESS HALL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: SANSA, JON SNOW, BRIENNE, TORMUND, and DOLOROUS EDD are eating at a table. SANSA looks at the meat on her fork. JON SNOW, DOLOROUS EDD, and TORMUND eat vigorously. BRIENNE looks around at the men eating. TORMUND stares intently at BRIENNE. BRIENNE looks away. TORMUND smiles. DOLOROUS EDD notices their interaction.
Sorry about the food. It’s not what we’re known for.

A letter for you, Lord Commander.

Text: I’m not Lord Commander anymore.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: JON SNOW takes the letter. The man leaves. JON SNOW sees the seal of House Bolton. He opens the scroll and starts reading.

"To the traitor and bastard Jon Snow. You allowed thousands of wildlings past the Wall. You have betrayed your own kind. You have betrayed the North. Winterfell is mine, bastard. Come and see. Your brother Rickon is in my dungeon.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: JON SNOW looks at SANSA.

His direwolf's skin is on my floor. Come and see. I want my bride back. Send her to me, bastard, and I will not trouble you or your wildling lovers. Keep her from me and I will ride north and slaughter every wildling man, woman, and babe living under your protection. You will watch as I skin them living. You --
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Go on.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: It's just more of the same.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: JON SNOW puts the letter away, but SANSA takes it and continues reading.

"You will watch as my soldiers take turns raping your sister. You will watch as my dogs your wild little brother. Then I will spoon your eyes from their sockets and let my dogs do the rest. Come and see. Ramsay Bolton, Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: His father's dead. Ramsay killed him. And now he has Rickon.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: We don’t know that.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Yes, we do.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: How many men does he have in his army?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I heard him say 5,000 once when he was talking about Stannis’s attack.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: How many do you have?
Speaker: JON SNOW (to TORMUND)

Text: That can march and fight? 2,000. The rest are children and old people.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: You're the son of the last true Warden of the North. Northern families are loyal. They’ll fight for you if you ask.
Speaker: SANSA (to JON SNOW)

Text: SANSA takes JON SNOW's hand.
A monster has taken our home and our brother. We have to go back to Winterfell and save them both.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JON SNOW nods.
INT. VAES DOTHRAK – TEMPLE OF THE DOSH KHALEEN
All the khals are gathered in council. They speak in Dothraki.
It is forbidden to spill blood in the sacred city. It is forbidden to carry weapons in the sacred city.
Speaker: KHAL MORO

Text: So we don’t spill blood.
Speaker: KHAL #1

Text: Well… there’s always a little blood.
Speaker: KHAL MORO

Text: Someone crushed his head with a rock.
Speaker: KHAL #1

Text: Aggo belonged to my khalaser. He served me well. He got his head smashed in by a rock. Fuck Aggo.
Speaker: KHAL MORO

Text: KHAL #1 sits down.
Bring in Drogo’s widow.
Speaker: KHAL MORO

Text: DAENARYS enters, ushered by the Lhazareen woman and the leader of the Dosh Khaleen. The khals bow their heads.
Who cares about her? She’s a midget.

Text: I like her.
Speaker: KHAL #1

Text: She’s paler than milk.
Speaker: KHAL #2

Text: I’d like to know what a khaleesi tastes like.
Speaker: KHAL #3

Text: Good. You can suck my dick.
Speaker: KHAL #1

Text: The Khals laugh.
She belongs with the Dosh Khaleen.
Speaker: KHAL MORO

Text: The Wise Masters of Yunkai want her. They’re offering ten thousand horses In exchange. What's worth more, one pink little girl or ten thousand horses?
Speaker: KHAL #4

Text: Fuck the Wise Masters in their perfumed asses. I’ll take their horses for myself.
Speaker: KHAL MORO

Text: Don’t you want to know what I think?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: All the khals raise their heads and stare at DAENERYS
You’d rather be sold to slavery? Or maybe you’d like to show Rhalko here what you taste like?
Speaker: KHAL MORO

Text: No. I don’t want either of those things.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: We don’t care what you want. This is the Temple of the Dosh Khaleen. You have no voice here, unless you are Dosh Khaleen. Which you are not, until we decide you are.
Speaker: KHAL MORO

Text: I know where I am. I have been here before. This is where the Dosh Khaleen pronounced my child the Stallion Who Mounts the World.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: And what happened? You trusted a sorceress, like a fool. Your baby is dead because of you. And so is Khal Drogo.
Speaker: KHAL MORO

Text: This is where Drogo promised to take his khalasar west to where the world ends. To ride wooden horses across the Black Salt Sea as no khal has done before. He promised to kill the men in their iron suits and tear down their stone houses. He swore to me before the Mother of Mountains.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: And you were dumb enough to believe him?
Speaker: KHAL MORO

Text: And here, now, what great matters do the Great Khals discuss? Which little villages you’ll raid, how many girls you’ll get to fuck, how many horses you’ll demand in tribute. You are small men. None of you are fit to lead the Dothraki. But I am. So I will.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The khals laugh.
All right. No Dosh Khaleen for you. Instead we’ll take turns fucking you. And then we’ll let our bloodriders fuck you.
Speaker: KHAL MORO

Text: KHAL MORO stands.
And If there’s anything left of you, we’ll give our horses a turn. You crazy cunt. Did you really think we would serve you?
Speaker: KHAL MORO

Text: DAENERYS lays her hand on a fire pit.
You’re not going to serve. You’re going to die.

Text: DAENERYS knocks down all the fire pits one by one. The khals cower away from the flame. The flame begins to cover the entire temple. The khals run to the door and try to escape, but the door has been barred. JORAH and DAARIO watch the temple burning from the outside. The Dothraki people gather around the burning temple. DAENERYS grabs the final fire pit and knocks it in KHAL MORO's direction. The fire engulfs the entire temple and kills all the khals. DAENERYS walks out of the fire, unharmed and naked. All the Dothraki bow to DAENERYS. JORAH and DAARIO walk up to the steps burning temple. JORAH bows to DAENERYS. DAARIO stares at her and then bows.
CREDITS
SANSA is knitting. There is a knock at the door.
Yes?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: A man of the Night’s Watch enters.
For you, my lady.
Speaker: MAN

Text: The man hands SANSA a scroll. It bears the mockingbird sigil of House Baelish. SANSA unrolls the scroll and reads it.
How far is Mole’s Town?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: LITTLEFINGER is standing in the center of the room. SANSA and BRIENNE enter. LITTLEFINGER turns to greet them.
Sansa. Lady Brienne. When I heard you had escaped WInterfell, I feared the worst. You have no idea how happy I am to see you unharmed.

Text: Unharmed? What are you doing here?

Text: I rode north with the Knights of the Vale to come to your aid. They’re encamped at Moat Cailin as we speak.

Text: To come to my aid? Did you know about Ramsay? If you didn’t know, you’re an idiot. If you did know, you’re my enemy.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA steps closer to LITTLEFINGER.

Would you like to hear about our wedding night? He never hurt my face. He needed my face, the face of Ned Stark’s daughter. But the rest of me, he did what he liked with the rest of me as long as I could still give him an heir. What do you think he did?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I can’t begin to contemplate --
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: What do you think he did to me?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Lady Sansa asked you a question.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: He beat you.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Yes, he enjoyed that. What else do you think he did?

Text: Sansa, I --
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: What else?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Did he cut you?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Maybe you did know about Ramsay all along.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I didn’t know.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I thought you knew everyone’s secrets.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I made a mistake, a horrible mistake. I underestimated a stranger.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: The other things he did, ladies aren’t supposed to talk about those things, but I imagine brothel keepers talk about them all the time. I can still feel it. I don’t mean in my tender heart it still pains me so. I can still feel what he did in my body standing here right now.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I’m so sorry.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: You said you would protect me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: And I will. You must believe me when I tell you that I will.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I don’t believe you anymore. I don’t need you anymore. You can’t protect me. You won’t even be able to protect yourself if I tell Brienne to cut you down. And why shouldn’t I?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Do you want me to beg for my life? If that’s what you want, I will. Whatever you ask that is in my power, I will do.

Text: What if I want you to die here and now?

Text: Then I will die.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: You freed me from the monsters who murdered my family and you gave me to other monsters who murdered my family. Go back to Moat Cailin. My brother and I will take back the North on our own. I never want to see you again.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I would do anything to undo what’s been done to you. I know that I can’t. Will you allow me to say one more thing before I go? Your great-uncle Brynden the Blackfish has gathered what remains of the Tully forces and retaken Riverrun. You might consider seeking him out. The time may come when you need an army loyal to you.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I have an army.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Your brother’s army.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: LITTLEFINGER walks beside SANSA.
Half-brother.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: LITTLEFINGER exits.
You’re not ready. You should go home before it’s too late.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: The WAIF begins to walk away. ARYA jumps to her feet. The WAIF turns around and drops her staff, then approaches ARYA. ARYA swings at the WAIF several times, but the WAIF dodges and redirects the blows. The WAIF kicks ARYA in her midsection, sending her off the platform. ARYA hops back on the platform and advances. The WAIF disarms ARYA and punches her multiple times, knocking her off the platform and onto the ground.
You’ll never be one of us, Lady Stark.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: The Faceless Man taking on the visage of JAQEN H’GHAR appears.
She has a point.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: JAQEN walks away. ARYA follows. They enter the Hall of Faces.
None of the first Faceless Men were born to lords and ladies. They began as slaves in the mines of Valyria.

Text: Who was the first?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: He was no one. The Many-Faced God taught him how to shed his face and how to give the gift. The man taught others in exchange for their service. Many served, many more gifts were given. Soon all the masters and overseers were gone and the Faceless Men fled.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: A girl has no desires.

Text: JAQEN holds up a small bottle.
Who?

An actress who calls herself Lady Crane. She performs at the theater in Sheelba Square. A girl has been given a second chance. There will not be a third. One way or another, a face will be added to the hall.

Text: Actors are performing a play. An audience has gathered to watch. ARYA is among them. On stage, an actor named IZEMBARO dressed as ROBERT BARATHEON walks back and forth. Two prop men mirror his movements, carrying a tarp that displays a forest landscape. Another prop man carries a cut-out of a boar and rams it into the actor’s rear end. The sound man makes a farting noise.
Ahh!
Speaker: IZEMBARO

Text: ARYA laughs along with the crowd. The prop man strikes IZEMBARO with the boar prop again, this time in front. The actor recoils and the prop men replace the forest background with a black background.
Oh, murdered by a boar. The great big hairy whore. He dug in his tusks and dug out my guts and soon I am no more.

Text: BRAN and the THREE-EYED RAVEN are walking together. They approach a weirwood tree encircled by many stones. The stones form a spiral. A Child of the Forest runs between the stones. BRAN and the THREE-EYED RAVEN follow her. They find a group of the Children crouching in a circle, whispering to each other. LEAF stands, carrying a shard of dragonglass. She approaches a man who is bound to the weirwood tree.
No! No! No!
Speaker: MAN

Text: LEAF slowly drives the shard into the man’s heart until it disappears inside his chest. The man’s eyes turn blue.
LEAF is watching BRAN. BRAN releases the root of the tree and wakes up from his vision.
It was you. You made the White Walkers.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: We were at war. We were being slaughtered. Our sacred trees cut down. We needed to defend ourselves.

Text: From whom?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: From you. From men.
Speaker: LEAF

Text: LEAF exits. BRAN and the THREE-EYED RAVEN stare at each other.
We speak in the presence of the Drowned God. In his name we father today to choose a new king as our leader. Who makes a claim?
Speaker: AERON

Text: YARA walks out into the open.
I am Yara Greyjoy, daughter of Balon Greyjoy, King of the Iron Islands. I claim the Salt Throne.
Speaker: YARA

Text: We’ve never had a queen. Not once.
Speaker: MAN #1

Text: There are many things we’ve never done. We’ve never made our mark upon the world. The great lords of Westeros pay us no mind until our little raids buzz through their kingdoms long enough to become a nuisance. Then they swat us down. They conquer us, humiliate us, and go right back to forgetting we exist.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Aye!
Speaker: ALL

Text: We are a sea people.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Aye!
Speaker: ALL

Text: Our god is a sea god.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Aye!
Speaker: ALL

Text: When I am queen, we will build a fleet that —

Text: I am not finished!

Text: Yes, you are! A woman will not lead us. Not when Balon’s own male heir has returned.

Text: The man looks at THEON. THEON emerges from the crowd and turns to face them.
I am Theon Greyjoy...last living son of Balon Greyjoy.
Speaker: THEON

Text: THEON points at YARA.
And she is your rightful ruler. Those of you that have sailed under her, and there are many of you here, you know what she is.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Aye!
Speaker: ALL

Text: She is a reaver!
Speaker: THEON

Text: Aye!
Speaker: ALL

Text: She is a warrior!
Speaker: THEON

Text: Aye!
Speaker: ALL

Text: She is ironborn!
Speaker: THEON

Text: Aye!
Speaker: ALL

I’m Euron Greyjoy.
Speaker: EURON

Text: The men fall silent. EURON appears and walks through the crowd towards YARA and THEON.
I claim the Salt Throne.
Speaker: EURON

Text: EURON emerges from the crowd and stands before YARA and THEON. He looks at YARA.
Niece.
Speaker: EURON

Text: EURON looks at THEON and then walks up to him.
Nephew. Little Theon.
Speaker: EURON

Text: EURON pats THEON on the cheek, then turns to face the crowd.
Heard you managed to fuck things right into the ground. Captured a castle you couldn’t keep. Got yourself taken prisoner. Even heard you have no cock.
Speaker: EURON

Text: The Ironborn laugh. EURON points at YARA.
Explains why you think a woman can be king.
Speaker: EURON

Text: When did you return, Uncle?
Speaker: YARA

Text: A few days ago. I had some things to take care of. Long overdue.
Speaker: EURON

Text: I’m glad you’re here. Now I know what my first act as queen will be. To execute the man who killed my father.
Speaker: YARA

Text: The men murmur to each other.

I did. I killed him. Threw him right over a rope bridge and watched him fall. He was leading us nowhere and we would still be heading there if it weren’t for me. No one loved him. No one wanted to follow him. He led ius into two wars we couldn’t win. I apologize to you all for not killing him years ago.
Speaker: EURON

Text: That would have been hard to do. You weren’t here. Last I heard, you were gallivanting around the world having a grand old time.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Gallivanting? That the sort of thing you start to say once your dick gets chopped off?
Speaker: EURON

Text: The Ironborn laugh.
Did the great lord of Westeros teach you words like that?
Speaker: EURON

Text: You were gone. Yara was here. Being Ironborn. Leading Ironborn. Getting ready to bring us back to glory.
Speaker: THEON

Text: And how will she do that?
Speaker: EURON

Text: I will build the largest fleet the world has ever seen.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Right idea, except I’m the one who’s going to build the Iron Fleet because I’m the one who knows how to use it. I’ve been all over the world. I’ve seen more of it than all of you combined. And across the sea there is a person who hates the great lords of Westeros just as much as we do. Someone with a large army, three large dragons, and no husband. I’m going to build that fleet and I’m going to gallivant right over and give it to Daenerys Targaryen along with my big cock.
Speaker: EURON

Text: The Ironborn laugh.
You’re going to seduce the Dragon Queen?

Text: I’m not going to seduce her. The Iron Fleet will seduce her. And together we’re going to take the Seven Kingdoms. I wasn’t born to be king. I paid the iron price and here I stand.

Text: The Ironborn cheer and chant EURON’s name. THEON and YARA exchange a glance.
Several Ironborn carrying flags stand on the shore. EURON is kneeling in the water. AERON pushes him underwater. Meanwhile, YARA, THEON, and some Ironborn run through a cave tunnel.
May Euron, your servant, be born again from the sea as you were. Bless him with salt. Bless him with stone. Bless him with steel.
Speaker: AERON

Text: THEON, YARA, and the men with them run out onto a beach and into awaiting rowboats.

Listen to the waves. Listen to the god. He is speaking to us and he says we shall have no king but Euron Greyjoy. Let the sea wash your follies and your vanities away. Let the old Euron drown. Let his lungs fill with seawater.
Speaker: AERSON

Text: EURON drowns.
Let the fish eat the scales off his eyes.
Speaker: AERON

Text: YARA, THEON, and the men board a large ship.
What is dead may never die, but rises again harder and stronger.
Speaker: AERON

Text: AERON releases his grip on EURON. Two Ironborn carrying EURON onto shore. AERON and the other Ironborn gathered in attendance all stare at EURON. EURON does not move.One man begins to walk closer to him. EURON gags and coughs. He props himself up on his arms and legs, then spits up water and gasps for air. AERON retrieves a crown made of driftwood and places it on EURON’s head.
What is dead may never die.
Speaker: AERON

Text: What is dead may never die.
Speaker: ALL

Text: The Ironborn cheer. EURON rises to his feet and looks around at the crowd.
Where are my niece and nephew? Let’s go murder them.
Speaker: EURON

Text: EURON leads AERON and the Ironborn up to a seaside cliff. They stare out at the ocean. A fleet of ships is sailing away from Pyke.
They stole our best ships.
Speaker: AERON

Text: Won’t be enough to save them.
Speaker: EURON

Text: EURON turns to face the Ironborn.

Go back to your homes. Chop down every tree you can find. Quarter-saw the timber and start building. I want every man bending planks. I want every woman spinning flax for sails. Build me a thousand ships and I will give you this world.
Speaker: EURON

Text: I banished you twice. You came back twice. And you saved my life. So I can’t take you back and I can’t send you away.
Speaker: DAENERYS (to JORAH)

Text: DAENERYS approaches JORAH, but he recoils.
You must send me away.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: JORAH rolls up his sleeve to reveal the greyscale covering his forearm.
Is there a cure?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I don’t know.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: How long does it take?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I don’t know that either. But I’ve seen what happens when it goes far enough. I’ll end things before that.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: DAENERYS begins to cry.
I’m sorry. I’m so sorry.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Don’t be. All I’ve ever wanted was to serve you. Tyrion Lannister was right. I love you. I’ll always love you. Goodbye, Khaleesi.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: JORAH begins to walk away.
Do not walk away from your queen, Jorah the Andal.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JORAH turns back to face DAENERYS. She approaches him.
You have not been dismissed. You pledged yourself to me. You swore to obey my commands for the rest of your life.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JORAH nods.
Well, I command you to find the cure wherever it is in this world. I command you to heal yourself and then return to me. When I take the Seven Kingdoms, I need you by my side.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JORAH sits on a horse, watching DAENERYS and DAARIO lead the Dothraki horde out of Vaes Dothrak. He turns his horse around and starts off into the wilderness.
In the last fortnight since our pact with the Masters, how many killings have been carried out by the Sons of the Harpy?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: None.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: And how many Masters have been butchered by the free men.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Two, but that was the day of the pact. Since then, nothing.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: So it’s safe to say that a fragile peace has taken hold.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: For now.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: For now is the best we get in our profession.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: It’s not enough.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Considering the city was on the brink of civil war, I’d say it’s a good start.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: It’s not enough for Meereen to have peace. They need to know Daenerys is responsible for it. The Sons of the Harpy have a good story. Resist the foreign invaders. Our queen has an even better story. Mother of Dragons, Breaker of Chains and...all that.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The people know who brought them freedom.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Yes, but do they know who brought them security? Who brought about an end to the violence? We need someone the people trust, someone they know who cannot be bought or influenced.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Sounds like quite the hero. Where would we find him?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Who said anything about “him”?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION and VARYS stand on the plateau above the audience chamber. A woman stans  at the bottom of the steps, and a man stand a few steps in front of her.
You stand in the presence of Kinvara, High Priestess of the Red Temple of Volantis, the Flame of Truth, the Light of Wisdom, the First Servant of the Lord of Light.
Speaker: MAN (speaking Valyrian)

Text: The man steps aside. KINVARA walks up a few steps.
Welcome to Meereen.
Speaker: TYRION (speaking Valyrian)

Text: KINVARA stops on the middle plateau.
That’s about the extent of my Valyrian.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: KINVARA says nothing.
Thank you for travelling all this way. I know from personal experience how uncomfortable the journey can be.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION looks at VARYS. KINVARA says nothing.
The truth is we need your help. We had hoped that we could somehow persuade you to --
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You don’t need to persuade me. I came to help.
Speaker: KINVARA

Text: KINVARA continues up the steps.
Daenerys Stormborn is the one who was promised. From the fire she was reborn to remake the world.
Speaker: KINVARA

Text: Yes.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She has freed the slaves from their chains and crucified the Masters for their sins.
Speaker: KINVARA

Text: She did indeed.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Her dragons are fire made flesh, a gift from the Lord of Light. But you heard all this before, haven’t you? On the Long Bridge of Volantis. The dragons will purify nonbelievers by the thousands, burning their sins and flesh away.
Speaker: KINVARA

Text: Ideally we’d avoid purifying too many nonbelievers. The Mother of Dragons has followers of many different faiths.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You want your queen to be worshipped and obeyed. And while she’s gone, you want her advisors to be worshipped and obeyed.
Speaker: KINVARA

Text: I’d settle for obeyed.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I will summon my most eloquent priests. They will spread the word. Daenerys has been sent to lead the people against the darkness in this war and in the great war still to come.
Speaker: KINVARA

Text: That sounds most excellent --
Speaker: TYRION

Text: A man named Stannis Baratheon was anointed as the chosen one by one of your priestesses. He, too, had a glorious destiny. He attacked King’s Landing and was soundly defeated by the man standing beside me. Last I had heard, he’d been defeated again, this time at Winterfell and this time for good.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: We’d be most grateful for any support you could provide the queen.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I suppose it’s hard for a fanatic to admit a mistake. Isn’t that the whole point of being a fanatic? You’re always right. Everything is the Lord’s will.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Everything is the Lord’s will. But men and women make mistakes. Even honest servants of the Lord.
Speaker: KINVARA

Text: And you, an honest servant of the lord, why should I trust you to know any more than the priestess who counseled Stannis?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: My friend has a healthy skepticism of religion, but we are all loyal supporters of the queen.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: VARYS nods. KINVARA takes two more steps. She is one step away from TYRION and VARYS.

Everyone is what they are and where they are for a reason. Terrible things happen for a reason. Take what happened to you, Lord Varys, when you were a child. If not for your mutilation at the hand of a second-rate sorcerer, you wouldn’t be here helping the Lord’s Chosen bring his light into the world. Knowledge has made you powerful. But there’s still so much you don’t know. Do you remember what you heard that night when the sorcerer tossed your parts in the fire? You heard a voice call out from the flames. Do you remember? Should I tell you what the voice said?
Speaker: KINVARA

Text: KINVARA approaches VARYS and places her hand on his arm.
Should I tell you the name of the one who spoke?
Speaker: KINVARA

Text: VARYS scrunches up his face and stares at KINVARA. KINVARA smiles.
We serve the same queen. If you are her true friend, you have nothing to fear from me.
Speaker: KINVARA

Text: KINVARA turns and walks back down the steps.

BRAN walks among the spiraling stones surrounding the weirwood tree from before, only now everything is covered in snow. He stares at the tree, then turns around. The army of the undead stands in attendance.
What?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: BRAN walks towards them, and then among their ranks. They do not react. He inspects several of them as he walks by. On the other side of the army, he finds the Night King and four White Walkers on horseback. The Night King stares at him. BRAN turns around to find the entire army of the undead staring at him. When he turns back around, the Night King is standing right behind him. He recoils, but the Night King grabs his forearm. He screams.
BRAN screams as he releases the tree root and the vision ends. MEERA jumps to her feet.
He saw me, the Night King! He saw me!
Speaker: BRAN

Text: He touched you.

I don’t know. He was close, but --
Speaker: BRAN

Text: He touched you.

He knows you are here. He’ll come for you.

Speaker: BRAN

Text: He can now. His mark is on you. You must leave, all of you.

Text: Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: But am I ready?

Text: No.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: BRAN’s eyes turn white.
We can’t defend the north from the Walkers and the south from the Boltons. If we want to survive, we need Winterfell, and to take Winterfell, we need more men.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Aside from the Starks and the Boltons, the most powerful houses in the North are the Umbers, the Karstarks, and the Manderlys.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS stands and moves some of the tokens to Winterfell.
The Umbers and the Karstarks have already declared for the Boltons, so we’re not doing so well there.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The Umbers gave Rickon to our enemies. They can hang. But the Karstarks declared for Ramsay without knowing they had another choice.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I beg your pardon, my lady, but they know that a Stark beheaded their father. I don’t think we can count on them either.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: How well do you know the North, Ser Davos?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Precious little, my lady.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: My father always said Northerners are different. More loyal, more suspicious of outsiders.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: They may well be loyal, but how many rose up against the Boltons when they betrayed your family? I may not know the North, but I know men. They’re more or less the same in any corner of the world and even the bravest of them don’t want to see their wives and children skinned for a lost cause. If Jon’s going to convince them to fight alongside him, they need to believe it’s a fight they can win.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The North remembers. They remember the Stark name. People will still risk everything for it, from White Harbor to Ramsay’s own door.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I don’t doubt it. But Jon doesn’t have the Stark name.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: No, but I do.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JON SNOW stares at SANSA.
Jon is every bit as much Ned Stark’s son as Ramsay is Roose Bolton’s. Ant there are also the Tullys. They’re not Northern, but they will back us against the Boltons without question.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I didn’t know the Tullys still had an army.

Speaker: SANSA

Text: How do you know that?

Text: Ramsay received a raven before I escaped Winterfell.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: That’s good. The Blackfish is a legend. His support would mean a great deal. Stark, Tully, a few more houses, almost starts to look like a winning side.
