Text: SANSA smiles.
BRIENNE follows SANSA down the stairs and along a walkway.
I’ve sworn to protect you, my lady.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You heard them. We need more men and my uncle has an army.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: We can send the Blackfish a raven.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Can’t risk Ramsay intercepting it. It has to be you.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: BRIENNE and SANSA enter SANSA’s chamber. BRIENNE closes the door behind them.
Ride for Riverrun. My uncle will talk to you and you’ll know how to talk to him.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA sits down on her bed.
What is it?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I don’t like leaving you here alone.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: With Jon?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Not him. He seems trustworthy. A bit brooding, perhaps. I suppose that’s understandable, considering. The others, though. Davos and the Red Woman helped a man murder his own brother with blood magic. And when Stannis paid for his crime, where were they? Already out looking for a leader with better prospects. And that wildling fellow with the beard --
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Jon isn’t Tormund. Jon isn’t Davos, the Red Woman, or Stannis for that matter. Jon is Jon. He’s my brother. He’ll keep me safe. I trust him.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Then why did you lie to him when he asked you how you learned about Riverrun?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Several men of the Night’s Watch are readying horses. JON SNOW stands beside them. MELISANDRE sits on her horse behind them. BRIENNE walks past. SANSA approaches JON SNOW, carrying a bundled cloak.
New dress?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: I made it myself. Do you like it?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Good, because I made this for you.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA hands JON SNOW the cloak. JON SNOW looks at it. The direwolf sigil of House Stark is pressed into the leather straps.
I made it like the one Father used to wear. As near as I can remember.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Thank you, Sansa.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: You’re welcome.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA walks away. BRIENNE is sitting on horseback beside TORMUND. TORMUND stares at her. She catches him staring and looks away. He grins. DOLOROUS EDD approaches JON SNOW, who is donning his new cloak.
Don’t knock it down while I’m gone.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: I’ll do my best.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: They embrace.
Good luck.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: JON SNOW walks to his horse and climbs atop it. He leads SANSA, MELISANDRE, PODRICK, BRIENNE, TORMUND, and the rest of the party out through the southern gates. A man of the Night’s Watch approaches DOLOROUS EDD, who is watching them leave.
Should we close the gate, Lord Commander?
Speaker: MAN

Text: I’m not the Lord Comman --
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: The men of the Night’s Watch gather around DOLOROUS EDD.
Yeah, ahem, close the bloody gate.
Speaker: DOLOROUS EDD

Text: We can go home now, Hodor. Well, maybe not home home, but somewhere that isn’t a cave.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: HODOR chuckles.
Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: Eat something that isn’t moss. I want an egg. How do you like ‘em? Boiled? Fried up with some butter?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: HODOR laughs.
Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: With a rasher of bacon and some blood sausage.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: MEERA notices she can see her breath. She looks at BRAN and then runs to the entrance of the cave. LEAF and the other Children of the Forest are gathered outside. Across the field, the Night King, three White Walkers, and the army of the dead are gathered. The Night King steps forward, kneels, and places his hand on the ground. A rift cracks through the ice all across the field and into the Great Weirwood Tree.
Get Bran and run!
Speaker: LEAF

Text: MEERA runs back into the cave, retrieving a sword on the way back. The Night King unsheathes his blade and leads the White Walkers and the army of the dead towards the Great Weirwood. Inside, MEERA runs to BRAN and shakes him.
Bran. Bran, wake up. Bran.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: HODOR sits in the corner, rocking back and forth.
Hodor. Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: Bran, wake up.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: BRAN and the THREE-EYED RAVEN watch YOUNG NED and YOUNG BENJEN embrace. BRAN smiles.
MEERA hauls the sledge over to BRAN and tries to drag him onto it.
Hodor.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Hodor. Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: Help me!
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Outside, LEAF and the Children of the Forest throw magic spheres at the army of the undead. The spheres explode upon contact, killing some of the wights. With one of the last bombs, LEAF lights a half-circle of flame in front of the entrance to the cave. She and the Children of the Forest run inside. The Night King and the White Walkers approach the flame. The flame parts to let them pass, then reforms. The army of the dead cannot pass through the flame. They go around it and climb the crag to the top of the Great Weirwood. Inside, MEERA places BRAN on the sledge.
BRAN and the THREE-EYED RAVEN continue to watch.
Remember that you are a Stark. Comport yourself with dignity at the Vale and try to stay out of fights.
Speaker: RICKARD (to YOUNG NED)

Text: NAN walks over to YOUNG HODOR and takes his arm.
Yes, Father.
Speaker: YOUNG NED

Text: RICKARD takes YOUNG NED by the chin.
But if you have to fight, win.
Speaker: RICKARD

Text: MEERA continues shaking BRAN.
Bran! Bran, wake up!
Speaker: MEERA

Text: A wight falls through the ceiling. It advances on MEERA. MEERA grabs her sword and cuts it down. Another wight falls from the ceiling. MEERA recoils. SUMMER tackles it. MEERA drops her blade and returns to BRAN.
Bran! Bran! Bran, wake up.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Hodor. Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: LEAF enters and runs up to BRAN and MEERA. A third wight falls from the ceiling, suspended upside down by its feet. LEAF rushes over to it and beheads it with her knife.
You have to wake up. We need Hodor.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Hodor. Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: Another wight rushes, but LEAF shoots it with an arrow. A Child of the Forest enters to combat another wight, but the wight knocks her down and kills her. LEAF shoots it with an arrow.
Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: A number of wights begin piling in. LEAF and the Children of the Forest try to fight them off. One wight kills another Child of the Forest.
Bran, we’re all going to die!
Speaker: MEERA

Text: BRAN hears MEERA shouting at him from the other side.
Bran, wake up! We’re all going to die! Bran! Bran!
Speaker: MEERA (V.O.)

Text: Bran, you have to wake up! We need Hodor!
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Hodor. Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR

Text: Warg into Hodor now!
Speaker: MEERA

Text: BRAN looks at YOUNG HODOR and NAN.
Bran, wake up. We need Hodor. We need Hodor. Warg into Hodor now! Now!
Speaker: MEERA (V.O.)

Text: Listen to your friend, Brandon.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: Hodor. Hodor. Hodor. Hodor.
Speaker: HODOR (V.O.)

Text: HODOR’s eyes flash white. More wights enter the cave. One of them kills another Child of the Forest. MEERA cuts it down. Another Child of the Forest  jumps forward and stabs another wight with a spear. HODOR stands and walks over to BRAN.  A White Walker enters. The spear-bearing Child of the Forest lunges at it and stabs it in the chest, but the blow has no effect. The White Walker pushes the spear aside and stabs the Child of the Forest, killing her. HODOR lifts the sledge with BRAN atop it. MEERA grabs a dragonglass spear and launches it into the White Walker’s neck. The White Walker shatters and dies. MEERA and LEAF follow HODOR towards the back entrance. SUMMER growls and bares his teeth at the wights entering the cave.
Summer!
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Go. Go!
Speaker: LEAF

Text: LEAF and MEERA run into the back tunnel. SUMMER attacks the wights. The wights encircle him and stab him to death. LEAF, MEERA, and HODOR hurry down the back tunnel. BRAN is still engaged in a vision on the sledge. A slew of wights pursues them. Back in the cave, the Night King enters and approaches the THREE-EYED RAVEN.
The time has come. Leave me.
Speaker: THREE-EYED RAVEN

Text: Back in the Great Weirwood tree, the Night King slashes the THREE-EYED RAVEN. The THREE-EYED RAVEN dissolves into a black mist in front of BRAN.
The undead army is advancing. LEAF stops running.
What are you doing?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Go!
Speaker: LEAF

Text: LEAF turns to face the undead. She brandishes a magic bomb and primes it. The wights overtake her and knock her to the ground, stabbing her repeatedly. LEAF detonates the bomb, killing herself and the wights surrounding her. HODOR reaches the rear door. He puts down the sledge and begins ramming the door. More wights appear and begin advancing.
Hodor, hurry!
Speaker: MEERA

Text: HODOR heaves the door open and drags the sledge outside. He drops the sledge and returns to the door, holding it closed. MEERA lifts the sledge and begins dragging it away.
Hold the door!
Speaker: MEERA

Text: BRAN turns and stares at YOUNG HODOR, who stares back at him.
Hold the door! Hold the door! Hold the door!
Speaker: MEERA (V.O.)

Text: YOUNG HODOR’s eyes turn white. He falls to the ground and convulses.
HODOR puts his weight against the door.
Hold the door!
Speaker: MEERA

Text: YOUNG HODOR continues convulsing.
Hold the door!
Speaker: MEERA (V.O.)

Text: Wylis! What’s the matter?
Speaker: NAN

Text: NAN kneels down beside YOUNG HODOR. BRAN walks over to them.
Hold the door!
Speaker: MEERA (V.O.)

Text: Hold the door!
Speaker: YOUNG HODOR

Text: In the present day, HODOR struggles against the door.
Hold the door! Hold the door! Hold the door! Hold the door! Hold the door! Hold the door!
Speaker: YOUNG HODOR

Text: The wights begin to break through the door. They clutch HODOR’s clothing and begin tearing at his flesh.

Hold the door! Hold the door! Hold the door! Hold the door! Hold the door! Hold the door! Hold the door! Hold the door! Hold door! Hold door! Hold door! Hold door! Hodor! Hodor! Hodor! Hodor! Hodor! Hodor! Hodor!
Speaker: YOUNG HODOR

Text: TITLE SEQUENCEEXT. BEYOND THE WALLHeavy snow is falling. MEERA is dragging BRAN’s sledge through the forest. BRAN’s eyes are glazed white. He experiences many visions of the past all at once. MEERA staggers and falls against the base of a tree. She puts all her weight into pulling the sledge, but it does not budge. She begins crying and goes to BRAN, cradling his head. BRAN continues to have rapid fire visions, then sees a group of wights running through the woods. He wakes up from the visions and looks at MEERA.
Meera. They found us.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: MEERA looks out into the woods and sees the group of wights. She begins crying and embraces BRAN.
I’m so sorry.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: The wights converge on MEERA and BRAN. Moments before they reach them, a cloaked rider appears. The rider’s horse kicks one of the wights out of the way, then the rider extends a chain which lights on fire at the end. Two wights charge, and the rider hits them both with the chain, setting them on fire. A third wight tries to attack his horse, but the horse’s bulk rebuffs it into a tree and it crumbles. The rider plunges a chain-sickle into the chest of another wight, then rides forward, dragging the wight behind his horse. He sets another wight on fire with the chain, launching it into the air, and then approaches BRAN and MEERA.
Come with me, now.
Speaker: RIDER

Text: A large group of wights approaches.
The dead don’t rest.
Speaker: RIDER

Text: The rider leans down and hoists BRAN up onto his horse. MEERA takes the rider’s hand and joins them on the horse’s back. The three of them ride off into the forest with wights in pursuit.
EXT. ROAD TO HORN HILLSAM, GILLY, and LITTLE SAMare riding in a carriage escorted by several soldiers. GILLY looks out the window. SAM is holding LITTLE SAM.
It’s so green.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Oh, yes. Once you get south of the Riverlands, very different sorts of trees start to take over. Maple, elm, beech, poplar. The odd willow. And of course now that summer’s over, you’ll start seeing the autumn colors coming in. Still, you’ll find more green here than anywhere else.
Speaker: SAM

Text: You’re nervous. You’re a nervous talker.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: SAM looks away.
That’s not any better being a nervous mute.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I didn’t think I’d ever come back here after my father made me renounce my title and inheritance and, well, threaten to kill me if I didn’t. A person just doesn’t feel welcome at that point.
Speaker: SAM

Text: GILLY looks at LITTLE SAM.
And I certainly didn’t expect to be introducing him to my family. So you know what to tell them.
Speaker: SAM

Text: That Little Sam is your baby.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Yes, now that’s very important. If he thinks that Little Sam is his grandchild, he’ll take you in. He’ll get an education. He’ll learn to read. And you can help teach him. Huh?
Speaker: SAM

Text: What did you tell your family about me?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I told them I met you in the North.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Did you tell them how far north?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Well, it wasn’t a very large piece of parchment.
Speaker: SAM

Text: You didn’t tell them where I’m really from? You didn’t tell them I’m a wildling?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: The thing is...my father doesn’t like wildlings. He hoped I’d make a man of myself by “killing some bloody wildlings,” so it’s probably a good subject to avoid if at all possible.
Speaker: SAM

Text: GILLY looks out the window.
I think we’re here.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: SAM looks out the window. The carriage is approaching the castle on Horn Hill.

A party of guests is lined up at the entrance to the castle courtyard. GILLY and SAM enter. GILLY is carrying LITTLE SAM. SAM’s mother, MELESS, and his sister, TALLA, descend a set of stairs and approach them.
Sam. Oh, Sam.
Speaker: MELESSA

Text: SAM and MELESSA embrace.
Oh, hello, Mother.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I never thought I’d see you again. You look wonderful.
Speaker: MELESSA

Text: Oh.
Speaker: SAM

Text: TALLA embraces SAM and he grunts.
Talla? Gods, you’re a woman now.
Speaker: SAM

Text: That’s enough, Talla.
Speaker: MELESSA

Text: Oh, um, Mother, this is Gilly.
Speaker: SAM

Text: GILLY bows her head and curtsies.
Oh, my. You are lovely.
Speaker: MELESSA

Text: I am happy to know you, Lady Tarly.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Oh, and this, this is our son Samwell.
Speaker: SAM

Text: MELESSA and TALLA smile at each other. MELESSA approaches the baby and smiles.
Hello, little one. It’s me, your grandmother.
Speaker: MELESSA

Text: LITTLE SAM smiles and touches MELESSA’s face.
May I hold him?
Speaker: MELESSA

Text: Yes, of course.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: GILLY passes LITTLE SAM to MELESSA.
You have a curious mind, I can tell. You’ll be a scholar like your father.
Speaker: MELESSA (to LITTLE SAM)

Text: Where is Father? And Dickon?
Speaker: SAM

Text: They’re on a hunt. They’ll join us for dinner. Come inside. Such a journey. You must be exhausted.
Speaker: MELESSA

Text: MELESSA passes LITTLE SAM back to GILLY. SAM and MELESSA proceed up the steps. TALLA takes GILLY’s arm and they follow.

Come, you’ll be wanting a bath after all that travel. Oh, and a dress for dinner. You can wear one of mine. What’s your color? Midnight blue or silver? Silver, maybe. Come. You can choose one of my bedrooms if you want.
Speaker: TALLA

Text: INT. GREAT SEPT OF BAELORTOMMEN and the HIGH SPARROW are standing in the central chamber. TOMMEN lights a candle.
Is there no other way?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: You’re afraid for her?
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Of course I’m afraid for her! It just seems very dangerous.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: She’ll be protected the entire way. The Faith Militant are very stern with those who overstep their bounds. And Queen Margaery isn’t your mother. I suspect the gods will predispose the common people to gentleness on her behalf. She’s truly opened her heart to them.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: She’s always been very devoted to the poor and the unfortunate.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: And now she’s devoted to the gods as well. Would you like to see her?
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: MARGAERY is sitting on a bench reading a book. The door opens. TOMMEN and the HIGH SPARROW are visible outside. TOMMEN enters and stares at MARGAERY. The HIGH SPARROW closes the door behind TOMMEN. MARGAERY sets down her book and stands. They embrace.
Have they hurt you? Have they mistreated you?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: No, Your Grace.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I’ve missed you. More than you could know.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: We’ll be together again soon and everything will be better than it was before.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Have you spoken to him at all, the High Sparrow?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Yes, a few times. Have you?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Yes, I have. He’s not quite what we thought he was, is he?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: TOMMEN scrunches up his face. MARGAERY chuckles and turns away.
You think I’m mad. I sound mad.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: He is. There’s something about him. His way of looking at the world. It’s not an easy thing admitting to yourself what you really are. It’s taken me a while. He’s helped me.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: What are you talking about? You’re a good person. You’ve always been a good person. You’re the best person I know.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: MARGAERY chuckles and retrieves her book from the bench.
I was just telling him about your devotion to the poor.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Ah, yes, I visited their hovels and I fed them soup and I made sure I was seen doing it. I never gave them what they really needed, though. I’ve had lots of time to think about how good I was at seeming good. All those stories I told myself about who I was and why I did the things I did. There were so many lies in those stories.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I don’t understand.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: MARGAERY rushes to TOMMEN and takes his hand.
It’s all right. It really is. It’s such a relief to let go of those lies.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: MARGAERY leads him to the bench and they sit down on it together.
What about Loras?
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: I love my brother. I will always love my brother. His soul is pure and perfect. His sins don’t erase that purity, they only obscure it. He just needs to atone for them. We all do. Sooner or later, one way or another. The gods have a plan for us all.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: It’s hard to walk in this.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: It’s beautiful. You’re beautiful.
Speaker: SAM

Text: GILLY takes SAM’s arm and they walk down the hall together.

SAM, GILLY, MELESSA, TALLA, DICKON, and RANDYLL are sitting around the dinner table eating. RANDYLL takes a bite and stares at SAM. GILLY looks around at others using their utensils and mimics them. SAM looks at DICKON.
This venison, it’s very tasty. Is it from today’s hunt?
Speaker: SAM

Text: Well, no. We haven’t been able to cure that one yet. This is last week’s.
Speaker: DICKON

Text: Oh, of course. Sorry. Long journey.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Brought it down from 70 yards. One shot.
Speaker: DICKON

Text: Oh, that’s a fair distance.
Speaker: SAM

Text: So do you do much hunting up at the wall?
Speaker: DICKON

Text: Oh, yes. Yes. A good amount. North of the Wall, you don’t hunt, you don’t eat.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Mm-hmmm. Mostly deer or is it elk as well?
Speaker: DICKON

Text: I imagine it’s common where you’re from. We once met a man, Lord Umber from Last Hearth, wasn’t it, Randyll, who said he taught all his daughters how to hunt.
Speaker: MELESSA (to GILLY)

Text: Your father taught you to hunt? Our father would never teach us. I think our father could learn a thing or two from your father.
Speaker: TALLA

Text: That’s enough of that.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: Samwell, would you care for more bread?
Speaker: MELESSA

Text: Oh, yes. Yes, please. Thank you, Mother.
Speaker: SAM

Text: A servant girl retrieves the basket of bread. She holds out the basket to SAM. SAM reaches for the bread.
Not fat enough already?
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: SAM waves the servant away.
I read your letter. You’re to be a maester.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: Yes. And once I have my chain, I’ll return to Castle Black.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I thought the Night’s Watch might make a man of you. Something resembling a man at least. You managed to stay soft and fat.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: SAM puts down his utensils.
Your nose buried in books. Spending your life reading about the achievements of better men. I’ll wager you still can’t sit a horse or wield a sword.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: Randyll, to be maester of the Night’s Watch is a great honor.
Speaker: MELESSA

Text: He can wield a sword. He killed a Thenn. He killed a White Walker.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: DICKON laughs.
There’s no such thing.
Speaker: DICKON

Text: I saw it with my own eyes on our way down to Castle Black. He drove a dagger into the walker’s heart. He risked his own life to save mine more than once. He’s a greater warrior than either of you will ever be.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Your way down to Castle Black? Where did he kill a white walker? Where are you from? How’d you come to meet my son?
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: The Night’s Watch came to our keep.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Where?
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: Gilly.
Speaker: SAM

Text: North of the Wall.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: North of the Wall? You’re a Wildling. The Seven Kingdoms have waged war against these savages for centuries and here I sit hosting one in my hall thanks to my son. See that sword?
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: RANDYLL points to a blade mounted on a mantle beside the table.

It’s called Heartsbane. It’s been in our family for 500 years. It’s Valyrian steel. Only a handful of them left in the world. It’s supposed to go to my firstborn son after I die. To him. He will never wield that sword. If he were to become Lord Tarly of Horn Hill, it would be the end of this house. I took you for a Mole’s Town whore when I saw you and I made my peace with that. Who else would have him? But I overestimated him. No. It was a wildling whore that seduced my son. This you getting back at me, boy? Hmm? Bring that to my table and making me dine with it. And you got what you were after, didn’t you? A bastard. A half-breed bastard. Your invitation into our home.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: MELESSA throws down her utensils and stands. She walks to GILLY.
Come, my dear. Talla.
Speaker: MELESSA

Text: TALLA and GILLY stand and begin to follow MELESSA out of the hall.
I’ve lost my appetite.
Speaker: MELESSA

Text: He dishonors us.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: You dishonor yourself.
Speaker: MELESSA

Text: Your mother’s a fine woman. You’re not worthy of her. To please her, I’ll take the wildling in. She can work in the kitchens. The bastard will be raised here. But this will be the last night you ever spend at Horn Hill.
Speaker: RANDYLL (to SAM)

Text: GILLY is sitting at the foot of the bed. LITTLE SAM is in a crib beside her. SAM stands before them both. He hangs his head.
I’m sorry I let him treat you that way. I was afraid he’d turn you and Little Sam away.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I’m not angry at you. I’m angry that horrible people can treat good people that way and get away with it. When do you have to go?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: First light.
Speaker: SAM

Text: LITTLE SAM fusses and reaches for SAM. SAM takes his hand.
Say good-bye to him for me.
Speaker: SAM

Text: SAM starts off but GILLY stands and gets in his way. She places her hands on his chest and kisses him.
You’re not what he thinks you are, Sam. He doesn’t know what you are.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Good-bye, Gilly.
Speaker: SAM

Text: SAM walks to the door. He turns back and stares at GILLY before closing the doors. GILLY looks around the guest chamber and then goes to LITTLE SAM. She pulls his blanket up higher and comforts him. SAM bursts back into the room.
Sam?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: We’re leaving.
Speaker: SAM

Text: What?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Get your things.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I don’t have any things.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: SAM picks up LITTLE SAM.
What are you doing?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: We belong together. All of us.
Speaker: SAM

Text: SAM and GILLY walk briskly through the hall. GILLY is carrying LITTLE SAM.
What about your mother and sister?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Oh, they’ll understand.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Your sister’s dress.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: SAM grabs a stool and carries it in front of the mantle hosting Heartsbane.
She won’t mind. Looks better on you anyway.
Speaker: SAM

Text: SAM climbs on top of the stool.
Sam. That’s your father’s sword.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: SAM lifts Heartsbane off the mantle. He groans and slides it into its scabbard.
It’s my family’s sword.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Sam. Won’t he come for it?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: He can bloody well try.
Speaker: SAM

Text: SAM hops down off the stool.
The lion and the rose are one. I thank the gods above.
Speaker: CLARENZO

Text: The actress portraying MARGAERY runs to CLARENZO.
And to you, my beauteous bridge, I pledge undying love.
Speaker: CLARENZO

Text: Hail King Joffrey. Hail Queen Margaery.
Speaker: ALL

Text: I’ll drink a toast to my new queen, for there is no one fairer. Dear Uncle, will you share my joy and be my royal cupbearer?
Speaker: CLARENZO

Text: BOBONO approaches CLARENZO and hands him a prop cup.
Drink long and deep, my noble king, from this cup of sweet wine.
Speaker: BOBONO

Text: CLARNEZO takes the prop cup and BOBONO walks to center stage, addressing the audience.
The last drink he shall ever take. And vengeance shall be mine.
Speaker: BOBONO

Text: BOBONO laughs and the audience boos. CLARENZO takes a sip from the prop cup, then gags and sputters. The audience gasps. He moves to center stage.
ARYA smiles and laughs in the crowd.
I limp. And it was he…
Speaker: CLARENZO

Text: CLARENZO points at BOBONO. BOBONO holds up a prop vial of poison. The audience gasps and boos.
...that poisoned me. My evil Uncle Imp.
Speaker: CLARENZO

Text: BOBONO laughs and exits with BIANCA. The audience boos. CLARENZO collapses and LADY CRANE kneels down beside him. ARYA laughs. LADY CRANE cradles the head of the actor portraying JOFFREY.
My firstborn son. My golden lion foully, falsely slain. I pray you found a lasting peace free from strife and pain.
Speaker: LADY CRANE

Text: ARYA’s smile fades.
Hear my prayer, O cruel gods. Take my life instead. For I cannot face another day when my sweet boy is dead. Oh, woe. Oh grief.
Speaker: LADY CRANE

Text: ARYA notices BIANCA standing offstage. BIANCA is watching LADY CRANE’s performance and mouths her lines as she utters them.
Oh, darkest day, my heart is full of sorrow. All hope is lost. All joy is gone. And there is no tomorrow.
Speaker: LADY CRANE

Text: LADY CRANE kisses CLARENZO’s cheek and lays his head down. The audience claps. The actors clear out the stage and the prop men change the scene. BOBONO enters carrying a prop crossbow. IZEMBARO, portraying TYWIN, is sitting on a prop toilet.
What is that I hear and smell? Someone I’ll soon send to hell.
Speaker: BOBONO

Text: ARYA leaves the front row and moves through the crowd.
It’s time to see if truth they told who said Tywin Lannister shits gold.
Speaker: BOBONO

Text: BOBONO pretends to shoot IZEMBARO with the crossbow. IZEMBARO cries out.
You beast. You beast. You killed my wife and now you’ve taken your father’s life.
Speaker: IZEMBARO

Text: SHEELBA SQUARE BACKSTAGE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: ARYA enters and walks further inward. On her way through the entrance hall, she sees the prop head the performers use for NED’s execution scene.
No worse child ever stained this land.
Speaker: IZEMBARO (O.S.)

Text: SHEELBA SQUARE STAGE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Curse the day I named you.
Speaker: IZEMBARO

Text: IZEMBARO groans as though dying and turns to the side. The sound guy makes a farting noise.
My greatest crime. Now I must flee.
Speaker: BOBONO

Text: SHEELBA SQUARE BACKSTAGE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: ARYA walks into the actor’s break room.
Then sail across the Narrow Sea to do unto you more treachery.
Speaker: BOBONO (O.S.)

Text: ARYA draws the curtain and stares at LADY CRANE’s bottle of rum.
Don’t fear the winter.
Speaker: BOBONO (O.S.)

Text: SHEELBA SQUARE STAGE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Fear me!
Speaker: BOBONO

Text: BOBONO shoots a prop arrow into the audience and laughs. The audience gasps and boos him offstage.
SHEELBA SQUARE BACKSTAGE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Thank you. Ladies and gentlemen, I give you Bianca, Clarenzo.
Speaker: IZEMBARO (O.S.)

Text: ARYA retrieves a vial of from her satchel. She uncorks LADY CRANE’s bottle of rum.
SHEELBA SQUARE STAGE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: IZEMBARO, BIANCA, and CLARENZO stand center stage.
I give you Bobono.
Speaker: IZEMBARO

Text: BOBONO enters the stage and the audience boos.
I give you Camello.
Speaker: IZEMBARO

Text: SHEELBA SQUARE BACKSTAGE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: ARYA pours the contents of the vial into LADY CRANE’s rum bottle and corks it.
And last but not least, sweet Lady Crane.
Speaker: IZEMBARO (O.S.)

Text: On stage, LADY CRANE enters and bows. The crowd cheers wildly. AYRA hears the cheering. She tucks the away the vial, draws back the curtain, and exits the break room. The actors are all piling into the area. CAMELLO approaches ARYA in the entrance hallway and hands her his costume cloak.
Give this a good beating. Shake those fleas out. That’s a dear.
Speaker: CAMELLO

Text: IZEMBARO and BIANCA enter.
That crowd was shit.
Speaker: IZEMBARO (to BIANCA)

Text: ARYA walks past them and puts down the cloak. She moves to leave. LADY CRANE enters and sees her.
Girl.
Speaker: LADY CRANE

Text: ARYA stops on the steps and looks at LADY CRANE.
What are you doing back here?
Speaker: LADY CRANE

Text: Nothing.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I saw you the other day in the audience. How many times have you seen this stupid play?
Speaker: LADY CRANE

Text: Three times.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Did you pay?
Speaker: LADY CRANE

Text: ARYA smiles.
No.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA walks off the steps to get out of the way of the prop men.

I remember when the players came to my village. I didn’t have any money, so I snuck in. Just like you. Saw the painted faces, the costumes, listened to the songs, cried when the young lovers died in each other’s arms. I ran off and joined them the next day, never looked back.
Speaker: LADY CRANE

Text: You’re very good.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: My final speech is shit.
Speaker: LADY CRANE

Text: LADY CRANE takes ARYA by the waist and ushers her towards the break room.
But to be fair to myself, which I always like to be, the writing’s no good.
Speaker: LADY CRANE

Text: They stop in a side corridor.
So change it. It would all just be farting, belching, and slapping without you.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: How would you change it?
Speaker: LADY CRANE

Text: The queen loves her son more than anything. And he was taken from her before she could say good-bye. She wouldn’t just cry. She would be angry. She would want to kill the person who did this to her.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: What’s your name?
Speaker: LADY CRANE

Text: Mercy.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You have very expressive eyes, Mercy.
Speaker: LADY CRANE

Text: ARYA smiles.
Wonderful eyebrows. Do you like pretending to be other people?
Speaker: LADY CRANE

Text: I have to go. My father’s waiting for me.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA exits. LADY CRANE enter the break room. BIANCA takes off her wig and notices LADY CRANE.
Lady Crane, they loved you.
Speaker: BIANCA

Text: LADY CRANE removes her wig.
They were sweet. Or drunk. Drunkenly sweet.
Speaker: LADY CRANE

Text: No laugh for Ned’s death. These people are worse than animals.
Speaker: IZEMBARO

Text: IZEMBARO sips from a mug and gestures to LADY CRANE.
But they loved her. They all love her.
Speaker: IZEMBARO

Text: CAMELLO removes his wig and approaches LADY CRANE.
Yes, you are adored by people and animals alike.
Speaker: CAMELLO

Text: I do what I can with what I’m given.
Speaker: LADY CRANE

Text: With what you’re given?
Speaker: IZEMBARO

Text: Oh, we’re all thinkers now, are we?
Speaker: IZEMBARO

Text: IZEMBARO stands, slaps his chest, and walks closer to LADY CRANE.
Full to the tits with ideas.
Speaker: IZEMBARO

Text: You have ideas, I have ideas, he has ideas. Why should my ideas have any more value than yours simply because I’ve been doing this my whole life? Who is anyone to judge my work? This is my profession. I know what I’m doing.
Speaker: IZEMBARO

Text: IZEMBARO removes his wig.
You have no right to an opinion.
Speaker: IZEMBARO

Text: LADY CRANE brings a glass of rum to her lips. Just before she drinks, ARYA appears and slaps the glass out of her hands. Everyone in the room stares at ARYA. ARYA points at BIANCA.
Careful of that one. She wants you dead.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA exits. The WAIF is revealed to have been watching.
ARYA pulls the stones away from where she hid Needle. She pulls Needle from inside the rocks and stares at it.
JAQEN is cutting the face of a corpse. The WAIF enters.
And?
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: As I expected.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: A shame. A girl had many gifts.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: JAQEN begins lifting the face off of the corpse.
You promised me.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: Don’t let her suffer.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: The WAIF nods and exits. JAQEN pulls the face from the corpse.
UNKNOWN ALLEY
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: ARYA sets down a lit candle and brandishes Needle. She places Needle on the ground, sits down beside it, and blows out the candle.

EXT. KING’S LANDINGJAIME is wearing armor and sitting atop a horse. He watches as MACE TYRELL, also wearing armor, leads a force of many soldiers down the street. MACE stops in front of JAIME and the soldiers halt.
My lord.
Speaker: MACE

Text: My lord.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: MACE turns his horse to face the soldiers.
My friends, the hour has come. Madness has overtaken this city and grasped in its claws my children. But now we must drive it back under the rocks whence it came. Madness has had its day!
Speaker: MACE

Text: MACE turns his horse back the other way and nods at JAIME. JAIME nods back.
Forward, march!
Speaker: CAPTAIN

Text: The HIGH SPARROW is standing on the steps beside MARGAERY and SEPTA UNELLA.. They are surrounded by Faith Militant, including LANCEL. The HIGH SPARROW is addressing a large gathering of commoners who stand at the foot of the steps.

Rich or poor, noble or common, if we win, we must atone. Margaery of House Tyrell came to us a sinner. She stood before the gods in the holy sept and lied. She turned a blind eye to her brother’s sins. She disgraces her house, the king, and herself.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: The crowd murmurs and parts. JAIME and MACE enter, leading the soldiers. MARGAERY gasps to herself. On the side, a smaller group of soldiers sets down a carriage. OLENNA steps out of the carriage.
Company, halt! Face front! Turn!
Speaker: CAPTAIN

Text: The soldiers form up and turn to face the steps.
Lord Tyrell.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: MACE nods at the HIGH SPARROW.
Ser Jaime.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Sorry to interrupt. We’re here for Queen Margaery and Ser Loras Tyrell. Give them to us and we’ll be on our way.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I don’t have the authority to give them to you. And you don’t have the authority to take them.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: The crowd murmurs. JAIME ushers his horse forward and rides it up the steps. He halts in front of the Faith Militant.
Lock spears!
Speaker: CAPTAIN

Text: The soldiers grunt and point their spears towards the Faith Militant.
I speak for King Tommen of House Baratheon, First of His Name.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The gods don’t recognize his authority in this matter.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: You already insulted one great house. It won’t happen twice. Every last sparrow will die before Margaery walks down that street.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: To die in the service of the gods would please each and every one of us. We yearn for it. But there is no call for it today. There will be no walk of atonement.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: The crowd murmurs. OLENNA motions to MACE with her fan. MACE motions to one of the high ranking soldiers, who nods to the Captain.
Order up!
Speaker: CAPTAIN

Text: The soldiers return to a relaxed position.
Queen Margaery has already atoned for her sins by bringing another into the true light of the Seven.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: The doors to the Great Sept of Baelor open. TOMMEN emerges, accompanied by the Kingsguard. The crowd murmurs. JAIME looks back at OLENNA, who looks down. TOMMEN and the Kingsguard walk down the steps until TOMMEN stands beside MARGAERY. TOMMEN takes MARGAERY’s hand.
Together we announce a new age of harmony. A holy alliance between the Crown and the Faith.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: The crowd cheers.
Long live King Tommen and bless you, Queen Margaery!
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: TOMMEN looks at JAIME. JAIME shakes his head. TOMMEN looks at the crowd.
The crown and the faith are the twin pillars upon which the world rests. Together we will restore the Seven Kingdoms to glory.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: The crowd cheers.
What’s happening?
Speaker: MACE (to OLENNA)

Text: He’s beaten us. That’s what’s happening.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The HIGH SPARROW smiles at JAIME.
The room is lined with soldiers on either side. TOMMEN is sitting on the throne. KEVAN stands beside him. JAIME stands at the foot of the throne and removes his armor, letting it drop to the floor.
When you attack the Faith, you attack the Crown. Anyone who attacks the Crown is unfit to serve as Lord Commander of the Kingsguard.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: I’ve been a member of the Kingsguard since before you were born. You don’t have to do this. You don’t have to do anything.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I have to answer to the gods.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Not when you’re sitting in that chair.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The Crown’s decision on this matter is final.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Will I be walking naked in the streets? Or will I spend a few months in the sept dungeons first to teach me about the gods’ mercy?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: TOMMEN and KEVAN look at each other.
You have served your house and your king faithfully for many years. And you will continue to do so. But not in this city.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: You’ve lost it?
Speaker: WALDER

Text: Yes, father.
Speaker: BLACK WALDER

Text: It’s a castle, not a bloody sheep. Presumably you still know where it is. You didn’t lose Riverrun. You let the Blackfish take it from you.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: He surprised us. He knows the castle better than anyone.
Speaker: LOTHAR

Text: You did lose the Blackfish after the Red Wedding. You had him right here in this hall and you let him leave. Then when I told you to hunt him down and kill him, you couldn’t find him. That’s what it means to lose something. Now he’s come back and taken Riverrun.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: For 300 years we kissed Tully boots, swore oaths to them and their stinking fish banners. Not again. Riverrun is ours. Take it back.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: We don’t have the men.
Speaker: BLACK WALDER

Text: We’ve got 10 times as many men as the damn Blackfish.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: The Mallisters have risen against us. And the Blackwoods.
Speaker: BLACK WALDER

Text: The Brotherhood Without Banners is rallying the commoners against us, raiding our supply trains and camps.
Speaker: LOTHAR

Text: Riverrun can withstand a siege for a year.
Speaker: BLACK WALDER

Text: WALDER slaps his daughter on on the buttocks.
If I want excuses, I’ll put her in charge. They’re laughing at us. All across the Riverlands right down to King’s Landing, they’re laughing at us.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: WALDER stands. Many family members stare at him.
I hear it in my sleep! I’m not dead yet, unfortunately for you. And I’ll not leave this world until they all choke on that laughter. Take that castle back.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: He’ll never yield, Father.
Speaker: LOTHAR

Text: Oh, he’ll yield.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: WALDER nods at some servants at the rear of the hall. LOTHAR looks back at the servants. The servants exit. WALDER points first at LOTHAR and then at BLACK WALDER.

You’ll show him the knife you used to kill Robb Stark’s child in his whore mother’s belly, and you’ll show him the knife you used to open his niece’s throat. And you’ll remind him who it was that got married at the Red Wedding in the first place. His nephew.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: WALDER pulls his daughter into his lap. The servants return, ushering in a man bound in chains. They undo his chains. The man is EDMURE TULLY. EDMURE stares at WALDER.
Cheer up, Lord Edmure. You’re going home.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: I’m being sent to deal with the Blackfish. Apparently Walder Frey can’t manage it on his own because he’s 400 years old. Sent me with an army to the Riverlands and a siege that could last months.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME stands and paces.
BEtter you’re elsewhere at the head of an army than in the sept dungeons.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I’m not going to the Riverlands.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME pours himself a cup of wine.
What, then?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I’m going to give Bronn the largest bag of gold anyone’s ever seen and have him gather the best killers he knows. I’ll take them to the sept and I’ll remove the High Sparrow’s head and every other sparrow head I can find.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You can’t.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: He has our son! He stole our son! He’s torn our family apart. How should we treat people who tear us apart?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: We should treat them without mercy and we will. But if you kill the High Sparrow, you won’t leave the sept alive. And without you, this is all for nothing. Stand at the head of our army where you belong, where Father wanted you. Show our men where their loyalties belong. Show them what lannisters are, what we do to our enemies. And take that stupid little castle back because it’s ours and because you can.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You’ll stand trial soon. I need to he here for you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: It will be a trial by combat. I have the Mountain. They’ve made us both stronger, all of them.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI stands and approaches JAIME.
They have no idea how strong we are. No idea what we’re going to do to them.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: JAIME and CERSEI embrace and kiss. CERSEI whispers into JAIME’s ear.
We’ve always been together. We’ll always be together. We’re the only two people in the world.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: They resume kissing.
EXT. BEYOND THE WALLMEERA, BRAN, and the rider are gathered around a campfire. The rider beheads a rabbit and begins draining its blood. MEERA watches him.
Why did you help us?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: The rider looks at MEERA from behind his face mask.
The Three-Eyed Raven sent for me.
Speaker: RIDER

Text: The Three-Eyed Raven’s dead.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Now he lives again.
Speaker: RIDER

Text: BRAN startles as he comes out of a vision. MEERA goes to him.
When I last saw you, you were a boy. A fearless boy. Loved to climb the castle walls, frighten his mother.
Speaker: RIDER (to BRAN)

Text: Who are you?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: The rider removes his hood and face mask. He is BENJEN STARK. His skin is gray and he has blemishes on his face.
Uncle Benjen. The last letter Jon wrote me said you had been lost beyond the Wall.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I led a ranging party deep into the North to find White Walkers. They found us. A white walker stabbed me in the gut with a sword of ice. Left me there to die. To turn. The Children found me. Stopped the walker’s magic from taking hold.
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: How?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: The same way they made the Walkers in the first place. You saw it yourself.
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: Dragonglass. A shard of dragonglass plunged into your heart.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You are the Three-Eyed Raven now.
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: I didn’t have time to learn. I can’t control anything.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: BENJEN stands and walks over to BRAN and MEERA.
You must learn to control it before the Night King comes.
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: BENJEN kneels beside BRAN and offers him a cup.
Drink.
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: BRAN takes the cup and drinks.
One way or another, he will find his way to the world of men. When he does, you will be there waiting for him. And you will be ready.
Speaker: BENJEN

Text: EXT. ESSOS ARID LANDSDAENERYS and DAARIO are leading the Dothraki horde on horseback. DAARIO shouts in Dothraki and raises his hand, halting the horde. DAENERYS stares at the face of a mountain crag in the distance.
Everything all right?
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: How many days’ ride to Meereen?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: A week at best.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: How many ships will I need to bring my khalasar to Westeros?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: And who has that many?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Nobody.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: Nobody yet.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: So we ride for Meereen and after that we sail for Westeros. What then?
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: I take what is mine.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You weren’t made to sit on a chair in a palance.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: What was I made for?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You’re a conqueror, Daenerys Stormborn.
Speaker: DAARIO

Text: The wind howls. DAENERYS stares beyond the mountain crag
Wait here.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS rides away from the horde and around the bend. Time passes. The Dothraki are growing antsy.
I’m going after her. Wait for me here.
Speaker: DAARIO (speaking Dothraki)

Text: DAARIO starts off, but stops when a dragon’s roar erupts from the sky. The Dothraki look around. The shadow of a dragon appears on the mountainside. DROGON flies over the Dothraki horde with DAENERYS on its back. DROGON circles around and lands in front of the horde. He roars.
Every khal who ever lived chose three blood riders to fight beside him and guard his way. But I am not a khal. I will not choose three blood riders. I choose you all.
Speaker: DAENERYS (speaking Dothraki)

Text: The Dothraki cheer.
I will ask more of you than any khal has ever asked of his khalassar! Will you ride the wooden horses across the black salt sea?
Speaker: DAENERYS (speaking Dothraki)

Text: The Dothraki cheer.
Will you kill my enemies in their iron suits and tear down their stone houses?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Dothraki cheer.
Will you give me the Seven Kingdoms, the gift Khal Drogo promised me before the Mother of Mountains?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Dothraki cheer.
Are you with me?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Dothraki continue to cheer.
Now and always?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DROGON spreads his wings and roars.
CREDITS
That’s it. Get it to the top.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Steady. Steady.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: BROTHER RAY is standing beneath the framing, addressing two men who are hoisting up a log.
Up she goes.
Speaker: RAY

Text: RAY turns to another man and slaps him on the back.
Hey, come on. Put your back into it, huh?
Speaker: RAY

Text: RAY walks a few paces away, grabs an ax, and lifts it up to a man standing on the church framing.
Here you are, son.
Speaker: RAY

Text: The man standing on the framing takes the ax. RAY turns to see two men carrying a log into the opening beneath the framing. He waves them in.
Oh, gentlemen, please.
Speaker: RAY

Text: RAY walks out from beneath the framing and addresses more men carrying logs.
RAY. And you lot, come on. Come on, get it moving. Come on, come on.

RAY hurries beneath one of the logs and laughs. He turns and looks up at the church framing, smiles, and nods. In a field a little ways off, more men are carrying larger logs towards the church framing. Four men carry each log. A man carrying one of these heavy logs by himself comes into view. He drops the log in front of the church framing and pants, then turns to look out over the landscape. The man is SANDOR CLEGANE, The Hound.
In all my days I’ve never seen a man swing an ax like that. How many men did it take to cut you down?
Speaker: RAY

Text: Just one.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Ooh. he must have been some kind of monster.
Speaker: RAY

Text: SANDOR sinks the ax into the log.
He was a woman.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: RAY laughs. SANDOR continues chopping. RAY walks away.
BROTHER RAY’S ENCAMPMENT
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: A man standing beneath the church framing rings a bell. All of  the men rush down off the church framing and father at the food stations. The women divvy out food. RAY pours a cup of water and walks among the people. They are all sitting down on the ground and eating. SANDOR is sitting on a rock away from everyone else, eating. RAY approaches him from behind and hands him the cup of water. SANDOR takes it.
I think some of the men are a bit afraid of you.
Speaker: RAY

Text: I’m used to it.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: SANDOR drinks the entire cup of water.
When I found you, I thought you’d been dead for days. The way you were stinking already and you had bugs all over you and bone was coming through right there.
Speaker: RAY

Text: RAY sits down next to SANDOR and points at SANDOR’s right knee.

I was gonna give you a proper burial and then you coughed. Oh, nearly shit myself. I reckoned you were gonna die by the time I loaded you on the wagon, but you didn’t. Now, I reckoned you’d die a dozen more times over the next few days, but you didn’t. What kept you going?
Speaker: RAY

Text: SANDOR pauses and stares ahead.
Hate.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: SANDOR continues eating.
No, there’s a reason you’re still here.
Speaker: RAY

Text: Aye, there’s a reason. I’m a big fucker and I’m tough to kill.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: No, a reason. Gods aren’t done with you yet.
Speaker: RAY

Text: SANDOR smiles. RAY stands and walks a few paces away from SANDOR, then turns to face him.
I’ve heard that before. Man was talking about a different god, though.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Well, maybe he was right. I don’t know much about the gods.
Speaker: RAY

Text: You’re in the wrong line of work.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Oh, there’s plenty of pious sons of bitches who think they know the word of god or gods. I don’t. I don’t even know their real names. Maybe it is the Seven. Or maybe it’s the old gods. Or maybe it’s the Lord of Light. Or maybe they’re all the same fucking thing. I don’t know. What matters, I believe, is that there’s something greater than us. And whatever it is, it’s got plans for Sandor Clegane.
Speaker: RAY

Text: SANDOR stops eating and stares up at RAY. RAY nods at him.
You didn’t know me back in my time. You don’t know the things I’ve done.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: I’ve heard stories.
Speaker: RAY

Text: If the gods are real...why haven’t they punished me?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: They have.
Speaker: RAY

Text: RAY walks away. SANDOR stares out across the fields.
Your Grace. What are we reading today?
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: The Book of the Mother, Your Holiness. Chapter three, verse 12.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: “Smoothing what was jagged, so does a woman’s love calm a man’s brute nature. A wife salves her husband’s wounds, a mother sings her son to sleep.”
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: You learn quickly. There are some who know every verse of the sacred text, but don’t have a drop of the Mother’s mercy in their blood and savages who can’t read at all who understand the Father’s wisdom.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: For year I pretended to love the poor, the afflicted. I had pity for them, but I never loved them. They disgusted me.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: They are hard to love.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: The HIGH SPARROW sits down on a bench.
The poor disgust us because they are us, shorn of our illusions. They show us what we’d look like without our fine clothes. How’d we smell without perfume.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: The HIGH SPARROW sighs.
Can I ask you about a personal matter?
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Of course.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: MARGAERY sits on the bench beside the HIGH SPARROW.
The king mentioned that since your reunion, you haven’t joined him in the marriage bed.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: No.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: You have a duty, Your Grace. To your husband, your king, your country, to the gods themselves.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: It’s just...the desires that once drove me no longer do.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Congress does not require desire on the woman’s part, only patience. The king must have an heir if we are to continue our good work.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: Forgive me. Sometimes the truth path is hard to find.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Hard to find and harder still to walk upon. But you’ve made great progress. I only pray your grandmother follows your lead.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: The HIGH SPARROW stands.
My grandmother?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Yes. The Queen of Thorns is a remarkable woman, a strong woman, and an unrepentant sinner. You must teach her the new way as she taught you the old. Or I fear for her safety, body and soul.
Speaker: HIGH SPARROW

Text: MARGAERY and OLENNA are sitting at a table. SEPTA UNELLA stands several feet away, watching them.
Does it move or talk? I want to speak with you alone.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Septa Unella has been my true friend and counselor.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: OLENNA stands.
Oh, this is madness!
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: OLENNA takes MARGAERY’s hand and leads her out onto the balcony to a different table. SEPTA UNELLA follows them out. MARGAERY sits at the table.
You’re not in your sanctuary now, my dear. All I have to do is whistle and my men will stroll in here and bash you about...
Speaker: OLENNA (to SEPTA UNELLA)

Text: Grandmother.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: ...until I tell them to stop. If I tell them to stop. You could use a good bashing.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Grandmother, please.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: OLENNA sits across from MARGAERY.
What have they done to you?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: You marched against the High Sparrow, against the Faith.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: We marched for you.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The gods could have punished you and Father, but they didn’t. They showed mercy.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: And what about your brother? What mercy did they show him?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Loras’s only hope is to confess his crimes and repent. If he does, the Faith will allow him to return to Highgarden. He’ll have to renounce his name and title...
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: Have you lost your mind?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: ...and live his life as a penitent.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: He is the heir to Highgarden, the future of House Tyrell.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: He can begin again.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: As a mindless fanatic.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: As a free man.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: You will leave for Highgarden today. There is no law that says you must stay here.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: MARGAERY stands.
I am the queen. It is my duty to serve my husband the king.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: MARGAERY walks around the table and kneels before OLENNA. Her back is to SEPTA UNELLA.
But you should leave, Grandmother. Your place is at home.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: I will never leave you. Never.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: You must.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: MARGAERY slips a piece of paper into OLENNA’s hand. MARGAERY’s eyes widen.
Go home. Find comfort in prayer and good works.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: MARGAERY stands.
The Mother watches over us all.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: OLENNA stands.
I’ll see you soon, my dear.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: MARGAERY and OLENNA embrace. MARGAERY closes her eyes and then steps back.
Seven blessings to you, Grandmother.
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: OLENNA nods and walks back into her chamber. MARGAERY stifles tears. She regains her composure and turns to face SEPTA UNELLA.
Shall we pray?
Speaker: MARGAERY

Text: OLENNA walks out onto the balcony and shuts the door behind her. She looks around and then unfolds the piece of paper MARGAERY placed in her hand and looks at it. There is a drawing of a rose on it. OLENNA looks up and smiles.
We said we’d fight with you, King Crow, when the time comes and we meant it, but this isn’t what we agreed to. These aren’t White Walkers. This isn’t an army of the dead. This isn’t our find.
Speaker: DIM DALBA

Text: If it weren’t for him, none of us would be here. All of you would be meat in the Night King’s army. And I’d be a pile of charred bones just like Mance.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Remember Mance’s camp? It stretched all the way to the horizon. And look at us now. Look what’s left of us. And if we lose this, we’re gone. Dozens of tribes, hundreds of generations. Be like we were never there at all. We’ll be the last of the free folk.
Speaker: DIM DALBA

Text: That’s what’ll happen to you if we lose. The Boltons, the Karstarks, the Umbers, they know you’re here. They know that more than half of you are women and children. After they finish with me, they’ll come for you. You’re right. This isn’t your fight. You shouldn’t have to come to Winterfell with me. I shouldn’t be asking you. It’s not the deal we made. I need you with me if we’re gonna beat them, and we need to beat them if you’re going to survive.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: TORMUND gestures to JON SNOW.

The crows killed him because he spoke for the free folk when no other southerners would. He died for us. If we are not willing to do the same for him, we’re cowards. And if that’s what we are, we deserve to be the last of the free folk.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: WUN WUN stands.
Snow.
Speaker: WUN WUN

Text: WUN WUN walks away. DIM DALBA looks at the men around him. One of them nods. DIM DALBA walks up to JON SNOW and holds out his hand. JON takes it. DIM DALBA returns to his men.
Are you sure they’ll come?
Speaker: JON SNOW (to TORMUND)

Text: We’re not clever like you southerners. When we say we’ll do something, we do it.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: JON SNOW exhales.
I heard you were leaving King’s Landing.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: That is hardly your concern.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Your grandson is still a prisoner. You’ll leave him rotting in a cell?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Loras rots in a cell because of you. THe High Sparrow rules this city because of you. Our two ancient houses face collapse because of you and your stupidity.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: You’re right. I made a terrible mistake. I carry it with me every single day.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Good.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: I delivered an army of fanatics onto our doorstep. And now we must fight them together. We need each other.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I wonder if you’re the worst person I’ve ever met. At a certain age, it’s hard to recall. But the truly vile do stand out through the years. Do you remember the way you smirked at me when my grandson and granddaughter were dragged off to their cells? I do. I’ll never forget it.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: You love your granddaughter. I love my son. It’s the only truth I know. We must defend them.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I’m leaving this wretched city as fast as I can before that shoeless zealot throws me into one of his cells. If you’re half as bright as you think you are, you’ll find your way out of here, too.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Never. I’ll never leave my son.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: What’ll you do, then? You have no support. Not anymore. Your brother’s gone. The High Sparrow saw to that. The rest of your family have abandoned you. The people despise you. You’re surrounded by enemies, thousands of them. You’re going to kill them all by yourself? You’ve lost, Cersei. It’s the only joy I can find in all this misery.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: OLENNA goes back to writing.
Pick the pace up. Keep going.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Keep it moving!
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: Now, that is a sorry attempt at a siege. Someone needs to teach those sad twats how to dig trenches.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Someone certainly does.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME looks at BRONN.
Oh, no. Not me. I’m just an upjumped sellsword.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You’re an anointed knight. There’s quite a difference.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Aye, knights don’t get paid.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You have better instincts than any officer in the Lannister army.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: That’s like saying I have a bigger cock than anyone in the Unsullied army.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I expect to command all the Lannister forces before long. You can be the right hand I lost.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You promised me a lordship and a castle and a highborn beauty for a wife.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Don’t say it. Don’t fucking say it.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: BRONN ushers his horse onwards.

JAIME and BRONN lead a group of Lannister soldiers through the encampment. Some Frey men gather around and stare at them. LOTHAR is standing at the foot of Riverrun, shouting up at the castle walls. BLACK WALDER is behind him, standing on a makeshift hangman’s platform. EDMURE is also on the platform with a noose around his neck. JAIME and BRONN watch them.
Come out and fight us, Blackfish. Yield the castle or we’ll hang him.
Speaker: LOTHAR

Text: BRYNDEN TULLY, the Blackfish, walks along Riverrun’s castle wall and comes to a stop in front of an arrowslit. He stares out at LOTHAR, BLACK WALDER, and EDMURE.
This is your last warning. Yield the castle.
Speaker: LOTHAR

Text: LOTHAR looks back at BLACK WALDER. BLACK WALDER takes the noose off of EDMURE’s neck and draws a knife.
You think I won’t do it, old man?
Speaker: BLACK WALDER

Text: BLACK WALDER holds the knife to EDMURE’s neck.
I sliced your niece’s throat from ear to ear. And where were you? Running and hiding like a fucking coward. Yield the castle or I cut his throat.
Speaker: BLACK WALDER

Text: Go on, then. Cut his throat.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: BRYNDEN walks away. LOTHAR looks at BLACK WALDER and shrugs. BLACK WALDER takes the knife away from EDMURE’s neck. Some Frey men take EDMURE away. JAIME, BRONN, and the Lannister army advance towards LOTHAR and BLACK WALDER, and stop in front of them.
Lothar, is it?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Ser Jaime. We didn’t know you were coming.
Speaker: LOTHAR

Text: ‘Cause you didn’t set up a proper perimeter. You just allowed 8,000 men to approach unchallenged.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Good thing we’re friends or we’d be fucking you in the ass right now.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Have Lord Edmure bathed and fed.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BLACK WALDER waves at the Frey men escorting EDMURE.
Whoa, whoa.
Speaker: BLACK WALDER

Text: The Frey men stop walking. BLACK WALDER approaches JAIME.
Walder.
Speaker: LOTHAR

Text: LOTHAR puts his hand out to stop BLACK WALDER, but BLACK WALDER pushes him away. BLACK WALDER walks up to JAIME.
Edmure is a prisoner of House Frey.
Speaker: BLACK WALDER

Text: JAIME looks BLACK WALDER up and down.
Only a fool makes threats he’s not prepared to carry out. Now let’s say I threatened to hit you unless you shut your mouth, but you kept talking. What do you think I’d do?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME hits BLACK WALDER across the face with his gold hand. BLACK WALDER staggers back beside LOTHAR.
I’m here by the king’s command to take back this castle. Have him bathed and fed. Unless you’d like to take his place.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Apologies, Ser Jaime.
Speaker: LOTHAR

Text: LOTHAR waves at the Frey men escorting EDMURE.
Do as he says.
Speaker: LOTHAR

Text: The siege is now under my command. The next time the Blackfish looks out from those ramparts, he’ll see an army at his gates, not whatever this is.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Have your lads start digging perimeter trenches. Set pickets every hundred yards. And work double-time on those siege towers and trebuchets.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: As I said, the siege is under my command. If that’s not to your liking, go home.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: LOTHAR and BLACK WALDER walk away. BRONN walks up behind JAIME.
Get word to the Blackfish. I want a parley.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: A parley or a fight?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: He’s an old man.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You’ve got one hand. My money’s on the old boy.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: EXT. BEAR ISLANDThe castle of House Mormont sits atop a high hill. Waterfalls pour out below. A bird screeches.
LYANNA MORMONT sits at a high table flanked by a commander and a maester. JON SNOW, SANSA, and DAVOS enter. Some guards close the doors behind them.
Lady Mormont.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Welcome to Bear Island.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: JON SNOW looks at SANSA.
I remember when you were born, my lady. You were named for my Aunt Lyanna. It was said she was a great beauty. I’m sure you will be, too.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I doubt it. My mother wasn’t a great beauty or any other kind of beauty. She was a great warrior, though. She died fighting for your brother, Robb.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: I think we’ve had enough small talk. What are you here?
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: I remember what it said. “Bear Island knows no king but the King in the North whose name is Stark.”
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: Robb is gone, but House Stark is not. And it needs your support now more than ever. I’ve come with my sister to ask for House Mormont’s allegiance.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: LYANNA leans towards her maester. They whisper to each other. LYANNA turns back to face JON SNOW.
As far as I understand, you’re a Snow and Lady Sansa is a Bolton. Or is she a Lannister? I’ve heard conflicting reports.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: I did what I had to do to survive, my lady. But I am a Stark. I will always be a Stark.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: If you say so. In any case, you don’t just want my allegiance. You want my fighting men.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: I understand that I’m responsible for Bear Island and all who live here. So why should I sacrifice one more Mormont life for someone else’s war?
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: JON SNOW and SANSA fall silent. DAVOS steps forward.
If it please, my lady, I understand how you feel.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I don’t know you, Ser…?
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: Davos, my lady, of House Seaworth.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: LYANNA turns to her maester.
You needn’t ask your maester about my house. It’s rather new.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: LYANNA settles back into her chair.
All right, Ser Davos of House Seaworth. How is it you understand how I feel?
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: You never thought you’d find yourself in your position. Being responsible for so many lives at such a young age. I never thought I’d be in my position. I was a crabber’s son, then I was a smuggler. And now I found myself addressing the lady of a great house in time of war. But I’m here because this isn’t someone else’s war. It’s our war.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Go on, Ser Davos.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: Your uncle, Lord Commander Mormont, made that man his steward. He chose Jon to be his successor because he knew had the courage to do what was right, even if it meant giving his life. Because Jeor Mormont and Jon Snow both understood that the real war isn’t between a few squabbling houses. It’s between the living and the dead. And make no mistake, my lady, the dead are coming.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Is this true?
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: JON SNOW nods.
Your uncle fought them at the Fist of the First Men. I fought them at Hardhome. We both lost.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: As long as the Boltons hold Winterfell, the North is divided. And a divided North won’t stand a chance against the Night King. You want to protect your people, my lady. I understand. But there’s no hiding from this. We have to fight and we need to do it together.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: LYANNA’s maester leans over to whisper in her ear, but she waves him away.
House Mormont has kept faith with House Stark for 1,000 years. We will not break faith today.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: Thank you, my lady. How many fighting men can we expect?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: LYANNA leans to her military commander and they whisper to each other.
We are not a large house, but we’re a proud one. And every man from Bear Island fights with the strength of 10 mainlanders.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: If they’re half as ferocious as their lady, the Boltons are doomed.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: LYANNA smiles and nods.
Kingslayer.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: Blackfish.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I assume you’re here to fulfill the vow you gave my niece. I don’t see Sansa and Arya.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: I don’t have them.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Pity. Do you wish to resume your captivity?
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: JAIME shakes his head.
Then why are you here?
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: Or you’ll kill Edmure?
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: BRYNDEN walks past JAIME.
My nephew’s marked for death no matter what. Hang him and be done with it.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: It won’t stop with Edmure. You’ll force me to storm the castle. Hundreds will die.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Hundreds of mine. Thousands of yours. If you can breach the walls.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: JAIME positions himself beside BRYNDEN.
We’ll breach them and kill every last one of you. But if you surrender, I’ll spare the lives of your men. On my honor.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Your honor? Bargaining with oathbreakers is like building on quicksand.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: The war is over, ser. Why sacrifice living men to a lost cause?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRYNDEN turns to face JAIME and walks close to him.

As long as I’m standing, the war is not over. This is my home. I was born in this castle and I’m ready to die in it. So you can either attack or try to starve us out. We have enough provisions for two years. Do you have two years, Kingslayer?
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: BRYNDEN walks past JAIME and continues back across the drawbridge.
You clearly have no intention of saving your men’s lives. Why did you come to treat with me?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRYNDEN turns back to face JAIME.
Sieges are dull. And I wanted to see you in person, get the measure of you.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: Well, now you have.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Aye, now I have. I’m disappointed.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: BRYNDEN turns around and walks back inside the castle. The drawbridge begins to close. JAIME scrunches up his face, turns around, and walks back across the bridge.
The answer is no.
Speaker: ROBETT

Text: Lord Glover, if you could just hear us out.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: I’ve heard enough. We’ve only just taken back this castle from the Ironborn. The Boltons helped us do it. Now you want me to fight against them? I could be skinned for even talking to you.
Speaker: ROBETT

Text: Have other northern houses pledged to fight for you?
Speaker: ROBETT

Text: House Mormont.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: And?
Speaker: ROBETT

Text: I don’t care about ravens. You’re asking me to join your army. Who is fighting in this army?
Speaker: ROBETT

Text: The bulk of the force is made up of wildlings.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: ROBETT laughs.

Then the rumors are true. I didn’t dare believe them. I received you out of respect for your father. Now I would like you to leave. House Glover will not abandon its ancestral home to fight alongside wildlings.
Speaker: ROBETT

Text: ROBETT turns around and heads up the stairs towards a door attended by his men.
Lord Glover.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: There’s nothing else to say.
Speaker: ROBETT

Text: I would remind you that House Glover is pledged to House Stark. Sworn to answer when called upon.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JON SNOW glares at SANSA. ROBETT turns on his heel and walks up close to SANSA.
Yes, my family served House Stark for centuries. We wept when we heard of your father’s death. When my brother was lord of this castle, he answered Robb’s call and hailed him King in the North.
Speaker: ROBETT

Text: ROBETT gets closer to SANSA.

And where was King Robb when the Ironborn attacked this castle? When they threw my wife and children in prison and brutalized and killed our subjects? Taking up with a foreign whore. Getting himself and those who followed him killed.
Speaker: ROBETT

Text: ROBETT looks at JON SNOW and then back at SANSA.
I served House Stark once, but House Stark is dead.
Speaker: ROBETT

Text: ROBETT turns, climbs the stairs to the door, and walks through it. SANSA and JON SNOW look down.

Many Ironborn men are communing with prostitutes. THEON sits at a table alone, looking back at forth at them. YARA sits down at his table accompanied by a prostitute. She and the prostitute kiss at length. THEON does not look at them.
Why did we have to come here?
Speaker: THEON

Text: Some of us still like it. Have a drink at least.
Speaker: YARA

Text: I don’t want one.
Speaker: THEON

Text: YARA sighs and turns back to the prostitute..
Don’t go far, love.
Speaker: YARA

Text: YARA kisses the prostitutes breast.
I’ll find you in a bit.
Speaker: YARA

Text: The prostitute stands. YARA kisses her backside and then slaps it. The prostitute giggles and runs away. YARA laughs and grabs a drink.
Nothing on the Iron Islands has an ass like that. Doesn’t interest you anymore?
Speaker: YARA

Text: THEON scrunches up his face.
I’m sorry. I won’t joke about it. I’ll never hurt you, little brother. Don’t you know that?
Speaker: YARA

Text: YARA pours herself another drink.
You think Uncle Euron’s hunting for us?
Speaker: THEON

Text: Of course he is. As long as we’re alive, we’re a threat.
Speaker: YARA

Text: He’ll find us.
Speaker: THEON

Text: It’s a great big world and we have fast ships. Drink.
Speaker: YARA

Text: I don’t want any.
Speaker: THEON

Text: I don’t care what you want. Drink.
Speaker: YARA

Text: THEON takes a small sip of his drink.
Drink it all.
Speaker: YARA

Text: THEON drinks deeper.
You’re Ironborn, Theon. I know you’ve had some bad years.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Some bad years?
Speaker: THEON

Text: But I’m tired of watching you cower like a beat dog. Drink the goddamn ale.
Speaker: YARA

Text: THEON takes another deep drink.
Now listen to me. I need you. The real Theon Greyjoy, not this rat shit pretender. Can you find him for me? Drink.
Speaker: YARA

Text: THEON drinks more deeply..
You escaped, do you hear me? You got away and you’re never going back. We’ll get justice for you.
Speaker: YARA

Text: If I got justice, my burnt body would hang over the gates of Winterfell.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Fuck justice, then. We’ll get revenge. Drink.
Speaker: YARA

Text: THEON downs the rest of his ale. YARA moves closer to THEON.

Listen to me. If you’re so broken that there’s no coming back, take a knife and cut your wrists. End it. But if you’re staying, Theon, I need you. We’re gonna sail to Meereen. We’re gonna make a pact with this Dragon Queen. And we’re gonna take back the Iron Islands.
Speaker: YARA

Text: YARA places her hand on the back of THEON’s neck.
Are you with me? Are you really with me?
Speaker: YARA

Text: THEON slowly raises his head up and locks eyes with YARA. He nods. YARA smiles and kisses his forehead.
Now, since it’s my last night ashore for a long while, I’m gonna go fuck the tits off this one.
Speaker: YARA

Text: YARA stands, pats THEON on the back, walks over to the prostitute she was communing with earlier, and takes her hand. THEON stares blankly to the side.
Stannis camped here on his way to Winterfell.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: And that’s a good thing?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: He was the most experienced commander in Westeros. He chose this place for a reason. Those mountains are a natural fortification. There’s a stream down there for the horses.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: We’re not staying here long. Another storm could hit any day..
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Aye, the snows defeated Stannis as much as the Boltons did.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: We have to march on Winterfell now while we still can.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: They all dismount their horses and begin walking side by side.
62 Mormonts.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: It’s not what we’d hoped for. But we still have a chance if we’re careful and smart.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS spots two men fighting.
For fuck’s sake.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS hurries over to the men. JON SNOW and SANSA watch him go and then continue walking.
So he’s your most trusted advisor now? Because he secured 62 men from a ten year old?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Ser Davos is the reason I’m standing here talking to you and he served Stannis for years.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Stannis who lost the Blackwater, who murdered his own brother, who doesn’t have a head?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA spies the maester of Bear Island handling some crates containing ravens. He holds up one of the crates to LYANNA MORMONT.
SANSA is writing a letter. She signs her name, pours wax, and presses the wax with the direwolf sigil of House Stark. She picks up the letter and rereads it, then stares ahead.

I was a soldier once. All my superiors thought I was brave. I wasn’t. I mean, I never ran from a fight. Only because I was afraid my friends would see I was afraid. That’s all I was, a coward. We followed orders no matter the orders. Burn that village. Fine, I’m your arsonist. Steal that farmer’s crops. Good, I’m your thief. Kill those young lads so they won’t take up arms against us. I’m your murderer. I remember once a woman screaming at us, calling us animals as we dragged her son from their hut. But we weren’t animals. Animals are true to their nature and we had betrayed ours. I cut that young boy’s throat myself as his mother screamed and my friends held her back.
Speaker: RAY

Text: RAY sits down on a stump next to one of the men and rests his arm on the man’s shoulder.
That night...I felt such shame. Shame was so heavy on me, I couldn’t eat, I couldn’t sleep.
Speaker: RAY

Text: SANDOR looks down.
All I could do was stare into that dark sky and listen to that mother screaming her son’s name. I’ll hear her screaming the rest of my life.
Speaker: RAY

Text: RAY stands and walks back to the center of the circle.

Now, I know I can never bring that lad back. All I can do with time I’ve got left is bring a little goodness into the world. That’s all any of us can do, isn’t it? Never too late to stop robbing people, to stop killing people. Start helping people.
Speaker: RAY

Text: RAY stares at SANDOR.
It’s never too late to come back.
Speaker: RAY

Text: SANDOR returns RAY’s gaze but is distracted by three horsemen coming up the way. RAY turns to look at them. SANDOR walks a few paces into the midst of RAY’s followers and stares at the riders.
And it’s not about waiting for the gods to answer your prayers. It’s not even about the gods. It’s about you. Learning you have to answer your prayers yourself.

Text: The three riders reach the group and stop. RAY walks out to meet them. All of RAY’s followers stand. The riders are FLYNN, MORGAN, and LEM LEMONCLOAK.
Seven save you, friends. How can we help you?

ARYA bursts through the surface of the water, gasping. She pulls herself up onto some steps , turns onto her back, and clutches her bleeding stomach.
ARYA stumbles through the crowd, clutching her bleeding stomach and shivering. She looks from face to face. Everyone stares at her blankly.

The dead bodies of RAY’s followers are strewn all over the ground. SANDOR walks among them. He approaches the church framing. RAY is hanging by the neck from the framing, dead. SANDOR looks up at him and sighs. He walks to a nearby stump and retrieves an ax.

My son. My firstborn son. My child king, hush. Listen to the gods, for you they sing. Fight no more, sweet child. Your wars are won. The wolves are buried and the false stag done. Shut your blue eyes, my love. Let the crown fall. The Father above beckons you into his hall. In Seventh Heaven I’ll see you once more. But now I seek vengeance on Sansa the whore and my brother the Imp who killed his own king. Born amongst lions, our curse from within. I will slay him, I swear. With noose or with knife, though it take me a fortnight, a moon, or my life.

ARYA is lying on the ground behind the rack, bleeding from her stomach.
