He pulls it loose and reels back for another swing, but GREGOR takes him by the throat with one hand and lifts him up off the ground. LANCEL and the other Faith Militant regroup in the courtyard. The man in GREGOR’s grasp gasps and drops his club. GREGOR tosses him out into the courtyard, then follows him out. GREGOR kneels over the man, grabs him by the jaw, and rips his head off. Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: And if he were here now, I’d tell him the same I’m telling you.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: BRYNDEN makes his way down a set of steps.
If you think I’m abandoning my family’s seat on the Kingslayer’s word of honor, you’re a bloody fool.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: Riverrun cannot stand against the Lannisters and the Freys.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: We can stand longer than your one-handed friend thinks we can.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: BRYNDEN, BRIENNE, and PODRICK emerge into Riverrun’s main courtyard.
He’s not my friend.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: No?
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: BRYNDEN stops and turns back to face BRIENNE.
Who gave you permission to cross the siege line and enter the castle? Who gave you that sword with the gold lion on the pommel?
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: Ser Jaime kept his word to your niece Catelyn Stark. He sent me to find Sansa, to help her as Catelyn wanted. He gave me this sword to protect her. That is what I have done and I will continue to do until the day I die.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: BRIENNE holds out the piece of parchment to BRYNDEN. BRYNDEN takes it, unfolds it, and reads its contents. He smiles and chuckles under his breath.
She’s exactly like her mother.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: BRIENNE smiles. BRYNDEN turns back to face her.
I don’t have enough men to help her take Winterfell.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: You have more than she does.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: She wants her home back. I understand that. But this is my home. And if Jaime Lannister wants it, he can bloody well take it the way everyone else does.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: BRYNDEN hands the letter back to BRIENNE. She takes it. BRYNDEN walks away.
Find the maester. We need to get a raven north to Sansa.
Speaker: BRIENNE (to PODRICK)

Text: What should I write?
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: Tell her I failed.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: There’s to be a royal announcement?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: There is.
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: Why wasn’t I informed?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: There is to be a royal announcement in the throne room at this very moment.
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: CERSEi starts up the steps but KEVAN blocks her with his arm.
Where are you going?
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: To stand by my son.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your place is in the gallery with the other ladies of the court.
Speaker: KEVAN

Text: CERSEI stares at TOMMEN. TOMMEN looks away. MAESTER PYCELLE whispers to him. CERSEI, QYBURN, and GREGOR move to one of the nearby balconies. TOMMEN sits on the Iron Throne and addresses the crowd.

Lords and ladies, the Faith and the Crown are the two pillars that hold up this world. One collapses, so does the other. The Father judges us all. If you break his laws...you will be punished. After conferring with His Holiness the High Septon, we have determined that Loras Tyrell and Cersei lannister’s trial will be held in the Great Sept of Baelor on the first day of the Festival of the Mother.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Members of the crowd murmur to one another.

Furthermore, after much prayer and reflection, the Crown has decided that from this day forward, trial by combat will be forbidden throughout the Seven Kingdoms. The tradition is a brutish one, a scheme devised by corrupt rulers in order to avoid true judgment from the gods. Cersei Lannister and Loras Tyrell will stand trial before seven septons as it was in the earliest days of the Faith. Seven blessings to all.
Speaker: TOMMEN

Text: Seven blessings.
Speaker: CROWD

Text: TOMMEN stands and makes his way out of the hall, accompanied by the goldcloaks. CERSEI watches him leave. QYBURN walks up beside CERSEi and whispers to her.
Your Grace...that old rumor you told me about. My little birds investigated.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: And? Was it just a rumor or something more?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: More. Much more.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: You seem happy.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: I am happy. You should both be as well. Not so long ago, this city was ready to devour itself.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION puts down his glass of wine on a table and pours another glass of wine.
Now it’s like a man reborn.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I will be happy when our queen returns.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Why don’t you drink? Why don’t either of you ever drink?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION pours a third glass of wine.
Unsullied never drink.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Why not?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Rules.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: And who made these rules? Your former masters?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: GREY WORM and MISSANDEI look at each other.
Those miserable old shits didn’t want you to be human. Have a drink with me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION hands GREY WORM one of the glasses of wine. GREY WORM takes it.
And you? What’s your excuse?
Speaker: TYRION (to MISSANDEI)

Text: GREY WORM sniffs his glass of wine and scrunches up his face. TYRION hands MISSANDEI the second glass of wine. She takes it.
I have tried wine before. It made me feel funny.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: That’s how you know it’s working.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION returns to his glass of wine and raises it up.
Here’s to our queen. Anyone not drinking is disrespecting our queen.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: GREY WORM and MISSANDEI raise their glasses.
To Daenerys Stormborn, Mother of Dragons, Breaker of Chains, long may she reign.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Long may she reign.
Speaker: GREY WORM & MISSANDEI

Text: GREY WORM and MISSANDEI sip from their glasses. TYRION drinks all of his.
Do you like it?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Tastes like it has turned.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: TYRION walks to another decanter on the opposite side of the room and pours himself another glass of wine.
Yes, yes. Fermentation. One day, after our queen has taken the Seven Kingdoms...I’d like to have my own vineyard. Make my own wine. The Imp’s Delight. Only my close friends could drink it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION sips his wine.
Tell me a joke, Missandei of Naath.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION walks back in front of GREY WORM and MISSANDEI.
I do not know any jokes.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Grey worm?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: GREY WORM stares and says nothing.
MISSANDEI sips her wine.

...but when the barkeep brings them over, each of them finds a fly in his cup. The Lannister, outraged, shoves the cup aside and demands another. The Martell plucks the fly out and swallows it whole. The Stark reaches into his cup, pulls out the fly and shouts, “Spit it out, you see shit. Spit it out.”
Speaker: TYRION

Text: GREY WORM and MISSANDEI do not laugh.
It’s funnier in Westeros.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The Starks and the lannisters, i thought these were enemies.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Yes.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: A joke is like a story, Torgo Nudho. Not a true story, necessarily.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: A story that’s supposed to make you laugh, ideally. Not at the moment, perhaps.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: MISSANDEI sips her wine again.
Missandei, do you like the wine?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I do.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Tell a joke.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Two translators are on a sinking ship.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: TYRION smiles.
The first says, “Do you know how to swim?” The second says, “No, but I can shout for help in 19 languages.”
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: There is a pause.
TYRION Ah!
TYRION begins to laugh. MISSANDEI smiles and sips her wine.
That is the worst joke I ever heard.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: You don’t even know what a joke is.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: I am soldier all my life. You think I never hear joke?
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: You lied to us.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I make joke.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: MISSANDEI and TYRION laugh. GREY WORM smiles.
More jokes.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Bells begin to ring. GREY WORM stands and runs out of the room, shouting in Valyrian.
A fleet of white-sailed ships approaches Meereen. TYRION and MISSANDEI stare at at the ships.
The Masters have come for their property.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Lord Edmure.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: EDMURE’s hands are behind his back, his wrists bound around a vertical pole in the center of the tent. He is kneeling.
I apologize for the way the Freys treated you. A man of your birth deserved better. You have my word you’ll be properly fed and clothes from now on.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: EDMURE stands.
I have your word?
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: EDMURE scoffs.
The Blackfish is an old man. A good death is all he can hope for. But you, you have a child now, I’ve heard. A son you sired on your wedding night. You’re a potent man.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: A son I’ve never met born of a wife that I haven’t seen since our first night together.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: You should be with them both. I can arrange that, you realize? Comfortable rooms for you at Casterly Rock. A tutor for your boy, knights to train him to fight and to ride. And when he comes of age, he’ll have a keep of his own.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Do you imagine yourself a decent person? Is that it? After you’ve massacred my family. Kept me in a cell for years. Stolen our lands.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: I’ll remind you that our houses are at war. I’m sorry if this conflict has inconvenienced you, but rebelling against the Crown does have consequences.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Says the man who shoved his sword through his king’s back.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: Did I give you the impression that this was a negotiation? It’s not.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME sits on a barrel in the corner of the room.
You understand. On some level you understand that you’re an evil man.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: I’ll leave the judgments to the gods.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Well, that is convenient for you. You’re a fine-looking fellow, aren’t you?
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: EDMURE chuckles.

Your square jaw, your golden armor. Tell me, I want to know. I truly do. How do you live with yourself? All of us have to believe that we’re decent, don’t we? You have to sleep at night. How do you tell yourself that you’re decent after everything that you’ve done?
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: I was your sister’s prisoner once. She hit me on the head with a rock if I remember correctly.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: EDMURE laughs.
Yeah. She should have killed you.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: Perhaps, but she didn’t. Catelyn Stark hated me just like you hate me. But I didn’t hate her. I admired her. Far more than her husband or her son.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Do you think I care whom you admire and whom you don’t?
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: No, I don’t, but I’m telling you anyway because you’re my prisoner. You don’t have a choice. The love she had for her children, I was a little awed by it. Reminded me of my sister.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Oh. Oh, I see. You’re a madman.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: Don’t talk about Cat!
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: I’ll talk about whomever I want.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: EDMURE grunts and struggles against his bindings.
She loved her children. I suppose all mothers do, but Catelyn and Cersei, there’s a fierceness you don’t often see.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME stands and walks closer to EDMURE.
They’d do anything to protect their babies.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME gets in EDMURE’s face.
Start a war. Burn cities to ash. Free their worst enemies. The things we do for love.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You didn’t come here to talk about our sisters.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: That’s exactly why I came here. I love Cersei. You can laugh at that if you want. You can sneer. It doesn’t matter. She needs me. And to get back to her, I have to take Riverrun. I’ll send for your baby boy.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: EDMURE struggles against his bindings, pushing himself towards JAIME.

And I’ll launch him into Riverrun with a catapult. Because you don’t matter to me, Lord Edmure. Your son doesn’t matter to me. The people in the castle don’t matter to me. Only Cersei. And if I have to slaughter every Tully who ever lived to get back to her, that’s what I’ll do.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: EDMURE crosses the bridge over Riverrun’s moat, carrying a torch. Several guards point crossbows down at him. He stops at the end of the bridge.
Who goes there?
Speaker: GUARD CAPTAIN

Text: Edmure Tully, son of Hoster Tully, and the rightful Lord of Riverrun. I demand entry.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: BRYNDEN appears on the wall with the guards.
Don’t let him in.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: He’s the Lord of Riverrun. I have to obey his commands.
Speaker: GUARD CAPTAIN

Text: He’s been their captive ever since they murdered his king at the Red Wedding. Why do you think the people who murdered his king at the Red Wedding would decide to let him come home? Because it’s a trap, you idiot. Don’t let him in.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: BRYNDEN turns to walk away.
He’s my lord, my lord. I’ve sworn to serve the Lord of Riverrun and obey his commands.
Speaker: GUARD CAPTAIN

Text: BRYNDEN turns back.
You’re not obeying Edmure’s commands. You’re obeying the fucking Kinglsayer’s commands.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: I demand entry.
Speaker: EDMURE (O.S.)

Text: My lord has given an order.
Speaker: GUARD CAPTAIN

Text: WIth a knife to his throat. That is not a valid order.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: The guard captain turns to his fellow guards.
BRYNDEN unsheathes his sword halfway. The guard captain and the other guards show their steel.
I’ll have your head before I surrender Riverrun.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: You are not lord of this castle, my lord.
Speaker: GUARD CAPTAIN

Text: BRYNDEN looks around at the other guards, sheathes his sword, and walks away.
Lower the drawbridge!
Speaker: GUARD CAPTAIN

Text: Aye, ser!
Speaker: GUARD

Text: The drawbridge begins to open. EDMURE stares back across the Lannister/Frey encampment. JAIME waits on his horse. BLACK WALDER rides up beside JAIME. The drawbridge fully extends. EDMURE walks inside.
If you’re wrong, we’re just surrendered our most valuable prisoner.
Speaker: BLACK WALDER (to JAIME)

Text: The drawbridge closes behind EDMURE. Riverrun soldiers are gathered to meet him. BRYNDEN appears in the rear of their ranks. EDMURE spots BRYNDEN, hands his torch to one of the soldiers, and walks up the stairs to the top of the outer wall.
Welcome home, my lord.
Speaker: GUARD CAPTAIN

Text: Command all the forces within the castle to lay down their arms. Open the gates.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: Your lord has given a command.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: The drawbridge opens. JAIME glances at BLACK WALDER and rides towards Riverrun. The Lannister and Frey forces follow him into Riverrun.
Find the Blackfish. Put him in irons and hand him over to the Freys.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: Find him.
Speaker: GUARD CAPTAIN (to a guard)

Text: The Riverrun soldiers lay down their arms in a pile as the Lannister forces enter the castle.

BRYNDEN, PODRICK, and BRIENNE emerge from a doorway. BRYNDEN places the torch in a sconce and stands in the doorway. PODRICK gets onto a small rowboat floating on the surface of the river. BRIENNE kneels to steady the rowboat for PODRICK, then turns back to look at BRYNDEN.
Go on.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: BRYNDEN stands and faces him.
Come with us.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I’ve run before from the Red Wedding. I’m not running again. This is my family home.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: Your family is in the North. Come with us. Don’t die for pride when you can fight for your blood.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You’ll serve Sansa far better than I ever could.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: Some guards begin shouting in the background.
Go on, now.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: BRYNDEN unsheathes his sword.
I haven’t had a proper sword fight in years. I expect I’ll make a damn fool of myself.
Speaker: BRYNDEN

Text: BRYNDEN heads through the doorway and back up the steps. BRIENNE watches him leave and then gets on the rowboat.
Lannister and Frey banners are being draped all over the courtyard. Lannister soldiers walk over the fallen Tully banners.
JAIME stands atop the outer wall. A Lannister guard enters and approaches him.
We found the Blackfish, my lord.
Speaker: GUARD

Text: Good. Bring him to me.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He died fighting, my lord.
Speaker: GUARD

Text: JAIME nods to the guard. The guard exits. JAIME stares out at the river and sees BRIENNE and PODRICK rowing away from Riverrun. He looks around to see if anyone else is watching. BRIENNE looks over her shoulder and sees JAIME standing atop the wall. JAIME waves to her. BRIENNE waves back.
TYRION and MISSANDEI enter. GREY WORM is waiting for them. Many Unsullied stand guard around the room.
I was wrong. I admit it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: That changes nothing.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: No more talking from you. Your talking gave us this.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: You’re trying to tell me what the army should do. You do not know what the army should do.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: All right, what should the army do?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We’ll not go to the beach. If we go to the beach, the Masters will take the pyramid. The pyramid is the only place in the city we can defend. We stay here.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: And then?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We wait for them to come to us. Then we fight them.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Something thuds and rattles the roof of the pyramid. Footsteps can be heard. Everyone looks up. MISSANDEI grabs a knife from a table and stands beside TYRION. GREY WORM and the Unsullied form up in front of the door to the balcony. One Unsullied opens the door. Another inches out through it, shield and spear in hand. The Unsullied man looks side to side and sees nothing, but then sees something and kneels. The rest of the Unsullied follow suit. DAENERYS enters. A dragon screeches and flies away in the background.
Clegane.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: What the fuck you doing here?
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Chasing them. You?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Hanging them.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Any particular reason?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: They’re our men. Or they were. They attacked a nearby sept and murdered the villagers. Why do you want them?
Speaker: BERIC

Text: Same reason. I was helping build it. They killed a friend of mine.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: You’ve got friends?
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Not anymore. They’re mine.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: SANDOR advances. BERIC and another member of the Brotherhood block his path.
It’s the Brotherhood’s good name they’ve dragged through the dirt.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: Fuck your name. They’re mine. I killed you once before, Dondarrion. Happy to do it again.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: One of the Brotherhood members notches an arrow and points his bow at SANDOR.
Drop that arrow, you bloody girl.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: SANDOR points his ax at the man but keeps his eyes locked on BERIC.
Tougher girls than you have tried to kill me.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: SANDOR walks towards the bowman.
You can have one of them.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: SANDOR turns back to face BERIC, glances at the men about to be hanged, then looks back at BERIC.
Two.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: BERIC looks at THOROS. THOROS nods. BERIC nods to SANDOR. SANDOR approaches one of the men and raises his ax above his head to swing. THOROS catches the ax’s handle from behind.
No, no, no.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: SANDOR turns to face THOROS and tries to wrench his ax free.
We’re not butchers. We hang them.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: THOROS releases SANDOR’s ax.
hanging? All over in an instant. Where’s the punishment in that?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: They die.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: We all bloody die.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: SANDOR gestures to BERIC.
Except this one here. I’ll only gut one of them.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: No.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: I’ll chop off one hand.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: We gave you two of the three out of respect for your loss. That’s generous.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: Bunch of nancies.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: SANDOR throws down his ax.
There was a time I would have killed all seven of you just to gut these three.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: You’re getting old, Clegane.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: He’s not.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: SANDOR kicks the box out from underneath one of the men, hanging him. He moves in front of LEM.
Please don’t. I’ll give you anything.
Speaker: LEM

Text: SANDOR kicks the box out from underneath LEM, hanging him. LEM gasps for air. BERIC hangs the third man. SANDOR pulls the boot off of LEM’s foot. BERIC and THOROS begin to walk away, but turn back to look at SANDOR. SANDOR takes off his own boot and sizes up LEM’s boot to his own foot. He shoves his foot into LEM’s boot and looks up at BERIC and THOROS.
Got anything to eat?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Several members of the Brotherhood are sitting around small campfires. SANDOR, BERIC, and some other Brothers are sitting at one such campfire. SANDOR is eating a piece of meat. THOROS approaches and sits beside them.
Enjoying yourself?
Speaker: THOROS (to SANDOR)

Text: I prefer chicken.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: THOROS hands SANDOR a water skin. SANDOR drinks from it.
You ought to join us. We could use you.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: I tried joining. Didn’t work out for me.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Clegane, we’re here for a reason. The Lord of Light is keeping Beric alive for a reason. He gave a failed, drunk priest the power to bring him back for a reason. We are part of something larger than ourselves.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Lots of horrible shit in this world gets done for something larger than ourselves.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: SANDOR returns the water skin to THOROS, stands, walks to the river, and urinates into it.
Cold winds are rising in the North.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: And you’re going to go stop them?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: We need good men to help us.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: Last time you saw me, you wanted to execute me.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: True enough. But the Lord of Light gave you the power to defeat me. Why?
Speaker: BERIC

Text: SANDOR laughs.
I beat you because I’m better than you, Beric. I was better than you before you started yammering on about the Lord and I’m better than you now.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: SANDOR returns to his spot by the campfire and sits.

Aye, you’re probably right. You’re a fighter. You were born a fighter. You walked away from the fight. How did that go? Good and bad, young and old, the things we’re fighting will destroy them all alike. You can still help a lot more than you’ve harmed Clegane, it’s not too late for you.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: Lady Crane?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA gets out of bed and winces. She walks towards the abutting room.
Lady Crane?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA enters the abutting room and sees LADY CRANE lying crumpled on top of the stool, dead. Blood is pooled on the ground beneath her.
If you’d have done your job, she would have died painlessly.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: ARYA turns to see the WAIF standing in the doorway with a knife. The WAIF approaches ARYA slowly and ARYA backs away, matching her pace.
Instead…
Speaker: WAIF

Text: The WAIF holds out her arms.
The Many-Faced God was promised a name. He must always receive what is his. You can’t change that. I can’t change that. No one can. And now he’s been promised another name.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: ARYA turns around, runs out onto the balcony, and jumps off. She grunts as her hands and feet connect with the ground. The sprints off through the streets, pushing people out of the way. The WAIF emerges from the door to LADY CRANE’s apartment, spies ARYA, and chases after her. ARYA runs through an alleyway. A man pushes a cart in her way. She slides underneath it and continues running. The WAIF jumps clean over the cart. ARYA turns a corner and runs down a set of stairs. A woman dumps a barrel of water on the ground outside the door to a room at the bottom of the steps. ARYA sees her and darts into the room. The WAIF turns the corner to the steps but stops when she does not see ARYA. The room ARYA has entered is a sauna. She moves through it. A number of men in towels are relaxing in the heat. ARYA emerges from the door on the opposite side of the sauna and looks around. She enters the crowd, walking through it. The WAIF appears on a high wall behind her, then jumps down into the crowd. ARYA turns back to see her and runs away. The WAIF pursues her. ARYA reaches the end of the marketplace and jumps off a high wall. She lands on a large set of steps where many fruit merchants have laid their baskets. She tumbles down the steps, knocking over the baskets as she goes and grunting with pain. The crowd clamors. ARYA comes to a stop at the bottom of the steps. She puts her hand to her stomach. Her hand comes away bloody. The WAIF appears at the top of the steps. ARYA sees her, stands, and throws herself over a small wall into an alleyway. The WAIF follows her. ARYA whimpers as she moves through the alleyway. She leaves blood stains on everything she touches. She enters a small, dark room, lit by a single candle. The WAIF follows her inside, knife in hand. ARYA kneels in the small living space she has made for herself. The WAIF enters and shuts the door behind her.
It will all be over soon. On your knees or on your feet?
Speaker: WAIF

Text: ARYA retrieves Needle from beneath a blanket and stands.
Haven’t we been through this already? That won’t help you.
Speaker: WAIF

Text: The WAIF advances. ARYA holds Needle up in front of her face, closes her eyes, and cuts the candle in half. The room goes dark.

JAQEN enters the main hall. He notices a blood trail on the floor leading to the Hall of Faces. He follows the trail and enters the Hall. The trail leads to one of the columns bearing the faces. The WAIF’s bloody face rests in one of the sconces.
You told her to kill me.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA appears behind JAQEN, pointing Needle at him. JAQEN turns to face her.
Yes. But here you are. And there she is.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: JAQEN pushes his chest against Needle’s point.
Finally a girl is no one.
Speaker: JAQEN

Text: A girl is Arya Stark of Winterfell and I’m going home.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: JAQEN smiles. ARYA turns and exits.
CREDITS
Despite appearances, I think you’ll find the city’s on the rise.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: An explosion occurs outside.
Perhaps we should take shelter.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: An explosion occurs outside.
The city is on the rise?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Meereen is strong. Commerce has returned to the markets. The people are behind you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: An explosion occurs outside.

Well, not all the people, of course. No ruler that ever lived had the support of all the people. But the rebirth of Meereen is the cause of this violence. The Masters cannot let Meereen succeed. Because if Meereen succeeds, a city without slavery, a city without Masters…
Speaker: TYRION

Text: An explosion occurs outside.
...it proves that no one needs a Master.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Good. Shall we begin?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Do we have a plan?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I will crucify the Masters. I will set their fleets afire, kill every last one of their soldiers, and return their cities to the dirt. That is my plan.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: TYRION tightens his jaw and looks away.
You don’t approve?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You once told me you knew what your father was. Did you know his plans for King’s Landing when the Lannister armies were at his gates?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: An explosion occurs outside.

Probably not. Well, he told my brother and Jaime told me. He had caches of wildfire hidden under the Red Keep, the Guildhalls, the Sept of Baelor, all the major thoroughfares. He would have burned every one of his citizens. The loyal ones and the trators. Every man, woman, and child. That’s why Jaime killed him.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: This is entirely different.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You’re talking about destroying cities. It’s not entirely different. I’d like to suggest an alternate approach.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: A blast causes the window across the room to explode inward, sending shards of wood flying everywhere. DAENERYS and TYRION duck, then turn to look at the window.
DAENERYS, TYRION, GREY WORM, MISSANDEI, and an assembly of Unsullied stand across from the three Masters, YEZZAN ZO QAGGAZ, RAZDAL MO ERAZ, and BELICHO PAENYMION, and a group of their soldiers.

Once before, I offered you peace. If you had not been so arrogant, you could have returned to your homeland with a fleet of ships. Instead, you will flee Slaver’s Bay on foot like the beggar queen you are.
Speaker: RAZDAL (to DAENERYS)

Text: We are here to discuss terms of surrender, not to trade insults.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The terms are simple. You and your foreign friends will abandon the Great Pyramid and the city of Meereen. The Unsullied you stole from Kraznys mo Nakloz will remain to be sold again to the highest bidder. The translator you stole from Kraznys mo Nakloz will remain to be sold again to the highest bidder. The dragons beneath the Great Pyramid will be slaughtered.
Speaker: YEZZAN

Text: We obviously didn’t communicate clearly. We’re here to discuss your surrender, not mine.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I imagine it’s difficult adjust to the new reality. Your reign is over.
Speaker: RAZDAL

Text: My reign has just begun.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: A dragon screeches in the distance. YEZZAN turns to look in the direction of the screech. DROGON flies up over the plateau and lands on an overlooking structure. He roars and drops down beside DAENERYS. DAENERYS climbs on his back and they fly off over Meereen. When they pass over the entrance to the catacombs, RHAEGAL and VISERION bust down the door with flame and take flight to join them. The ensemble flies over the beach entrance to Meereen.

A group of the Sons of the Harpy are slaughtering citizens of Meereen. Galloping footsteps can be heard in the distance. One of the Sons of the Harpy turns to look in the direction of the sound. The Dothraki horde led by DAARIO rounds the bend of a nearby cliff, yelling war cries and charging full force towards the Sons of the Harpy on horseback. DAARIO beheads a Son of the Harpy.

DAENERYS and the dragons fly over the Masters’ ships. The soldiers on the ships stop what they’re doing and stare up at the dragons. DAENERYS and DROGON come to a halt and hover in front of one of the ships.
Dracarys.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The dragons shoot stream of fire down at the the ship. The ship becomes engulfed in flame and the soldiers scream as they die. The ship incinerates and capsizes.
GREY WORM steps forward and addresses the Masters’ soldiers.
You men have a choice:
Speaker: GREY WORM (speaking Valyrian)

Text: The Unsullied ready their spears. The Masters’ soldiers ready their swords.
...fight and die for the masters who would never fight and die for you, or go home to your families.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: A dragon screeches in the distance. The Masters’ soldiers lay down their arms and run away.

Thank you for the armada. Our queen does love ships. Now, last time we spoke, we made a pact. You violated that pact. You declared war upon us. Though our queen does have a forgiving nature, this cannot be forgiven.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Our queen insists that one of you must die as punishment for your crimes.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: It always seems a bit abstract, doesn’t it, other people dying?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: RAZDAL grabs YEZZAN.
Him. He should die.
Speaker: RAZDAL

Text: Yes, him.
Speaker: BELICHO

Text: TYRION looks at GREY WORM.
He’s not one of us. He’s an outsider, a lowborn. He does not speak for us.
Speaker: RAZDAL

Text: GREY WORM approaches the YEZZAN and stares in his eyes.
Please.
Speaker: YEZZAN

Text: YEZZAN falls to his knees. GREY WORM unsheathes his dagger and slices RAZDAL and BELICHO’s throats. He sheathes his dagger and steps back. TYRION approaches YEZZAN and puts his hand on his shoulder.

Tell your people what happened here. Tell them you live by the grace of Her Majesty. When they come forward with notions of retribution or ideas about returning the slave cities to their former glory, remind the what happened when Daenerys Stormborn and her dragons came to Meereen.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION pats YEZZAN on the shoulder. He, GREY WORM, and MISSANDEI walk away.
You don’t have to be here.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Yes, I do.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: My beloved wife. I’ve missed you terribly.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY looks at JON SNOW.

Thank you for returning Lady Bolton safely. Now, dismount and kneel before me, surrender your army and proclaim me the true Lord of Winterfell and Warden of the North. I will pardon you for deserting the Night’s Watch. I will pardon these treasonous lords for betraying my house. Come, bastard, you don’t have the men, you don’t have the horses, and you don’t have Winterfell. Why lead those pour souls into slaughter? There’s no need for a battle. Get off your hose and kneel. I’m a man of mercy.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: You’re right. There’s no need for a battle. Thousands of men don’t need to die. Only one of us. Let’s end this the old way. You against me.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: RAMSAY chuckles.

I keep hearing stories about you, bastard. The way people in the North talk about you, you’re the greatest swordsman who ever walked. Maybe you are that good. Maybe not. I don’t know if I’d beat you. But I know that my army will beat yours. I have 6,000 men. You have, what, half that? Not even?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Aye, you have the numbers. Will your men want to fight for you when they hear you wouldn’t fight for them?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: RAMSAY points at JON SNOW.
He’s good. Very good. Tell me, will you let your little brother die because you’re too proud to surrender?
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: How do we know you have him?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: RAMSAY nods to SMALLJON. SMALLJON pulls SHAGGYDOG’s head out from a satchel and throws it on the ground.
Now, if you want to save —
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: You’re going to die tomorrow, Lord Bolton. Sleep well.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA turns her horse and rides away.

She’s a fine woman, your sister. I look forward to having her back in my bed. And you’re all fine-looking men. My dogs are desperate to meet you. I haven’t fed them for seven days. They’re ravenous. I wonder which parts they’ll try first. Your eyes? Your balls? We’ll find out soon enough. In the morning, then, bastard.
Speaker: RAMSAY (to JON SNOW)

Text: RAMSAY and company ride back towards Winterfell. JON SNOW looks down.
JON SNOW, DAVOS, TORMUND, and SANSA are standing around a planning table.
If he was smart, he’d stay inside the walls of Winterfell and wait us out.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: That’s not his way. He knows the North is watching. If the other houses sense weakness on his part, they’ll stop fearing him. He can’t have that. Fear is his power.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: It’s his weakness, too. His mean don’t want to fight for him. They’re forced to fight for him. If they feel the tide turning...
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: It’s not his men that worry me. It’s his horses. I know what mounted knights can do to us.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: TORMUND looks at DAVOS.
You and Stannis cut through us like piss through snow.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: We’re digging trenches all along our flanks. They won’t be able to hit us the way that Stannis hit you, in a double envelopment.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: TORMUND stares blankly at JON SNOW.
A pincer move.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: TORMUND stares blankly at JON SNOW. JON SNOW and DAVOS look at each other briefly.
They won’t be able to hit us from the sides.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Good.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: It’s crucial that we let them charge at us. They’ve got the numbers, we need the patience. If we let him buckle our center, he’ll pursue. Then we’ll have him surrounded on three sides.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Did you really think that cunt would fight you man to man?
Speaker: TORMUND (to JON SNOW)

Text: No. But I wanted to make him angry. I want him coming at us full tilt.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: We should all get some sleep.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Rest, Jon Snow. We need you sharp tomorrow.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: DAVOS, TORMUND, and any remaining attendants exit. JON SNOW sits down at the head of the table.
So you’ve met the enemy, drawn up your battle plans.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Aye, for what they’re worth.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: You’ve known him for the space of a single conversation, you and your trusted advisors, and you sit around and make your plans on how to defeat a man you don’t know. I lived with him. I know the way his mind works. I know how he likes to hurt people. Did it ever once occur to you that I might have some insight?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You’re right.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: You think he’s going to fall into your trap. He won’t He’s the one who lays traps.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: He’s overconfident.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: He plays with people. He’s far better at it than you. He’s been doing it all his life.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JON SNOW stands.
Aye, and what have I been doing all my life? Playing with broomsticks? I fought beyond the Wall against worse than Ramsay Bolton. I’ve defended the Wall from worse than Ramsay Bolton.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: You don’t know him.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: All right, tell me. What should we do? How do we get Rickon back?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: We’ll never get him back. Rickon is Ned Starks trueborn son, which makes him a greater threat to Ramsay than you, a bastard, or me, a girl. As long as he lives, Ramsay’s claim to Winterfell will be contested, which means he won’t live long.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: We can’t give up on our brother.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Listen to me, please. He wants you to make a mistake.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Of course he does. What should I do differently?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: I don’t know! I don’t know anything about battles! Just don’t do what he wants you to do.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Aye, that’s good advice.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: You think that’s obvious?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Well, it is a bit obvious.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: If you had asked for my advice earlier, I would have told you not to attack Winterfell until we have a larger force, or is that obvious, too?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: When will we have a larger force?! We’ve pleaded with every house that’ll have us! The Blackfish can’t help us! We’re lucky to have this many men!
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: It’s not enough!
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Now, it’s not enough! It’s what we have! Battles have been won against greater odds.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: If Ramsay wins, I’m not going back there alive. Do you understand me?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JON SNOW I won’t ever let him touch you again. I’ll protect you, I promise.
No one can protect me. No one can protect anyone.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA exits. JON SNOW turns, looks at the table, and sighs.
STARK ENCAMPMENT
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: DAVOS and TORMUND are walking together through the encampment.
You think there’s hope?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I’ve never seen these Bolton fuckers fight. And they’ve never seen the free folk fight, so, yes, there’s hope. You want to avenge your king, don’t you?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: It wasn’t the Boltons defeated Stannis. It was Stannis himself. I loved the man. He lifted me up and made me something. But he had demons in his skull whispering foul things.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You saw these demons?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: What?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: They stop walking. DAVOS looks at TORMUND.
No, it’s a manner of speaking. Not actual demons.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Oh. Well, you loved that cunt Stannis and I loved the man he burned. Mance didn’t have demons in his skull. He didn’t torch people or listen to some red witch. I believed in him. I thought he was the man to lead us through the Long Night. But I was wrong just like you.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Maybe that was our mistake, believing in kings.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Jon Snow’s not a king.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: No, he’s not.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: TORMUND and DAVOS smile at each other.
I need a good drink to help me sleep the night before a fight. You want some? I have a jug of sour goat’s milk stronger than any of that grape water you southern twats like sucking on.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: No, thanks. It does sound delicious, but I better keep a clear head. I can never sleep the night before a battle.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: So what do you do all night?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I walk. Think and walk. Think and walk until I’m far enough away from camp that no one can hear me shitting my guts out.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: TORMUND laughs.
Happy shitting.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: TORMUND walks away.
MELISANDRE is sitting at a desk with a mirror and candles on it, staring into a fire pit. JON SNOW enters and approaches her.
My lady. You weren’t at the war council.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: I’m not a soldier.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Any advice?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: Don’t lose.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: If I do, if I fall, don’t bring me back.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: I’ll have to try.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I’m ordering you not to bring me back.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: I am not your servant, Jon Snow.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: You’re in my camp. I’m the commander.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: I serve the Lord of Light. I do what he commands.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: How do you know what he commands?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: I interpret his signs as well as I can. If the Lord didn’t want me to bring you back, how did I bring you back? I have no power. Only what he gives me and he gave me you.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Why?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: I don’t know. Maybe you’re only needed for this small part of his plan and nothing else. Maybe he brought you here to die again.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: What kind of god would do something like that?
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: The one we’ve got.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: JON SNOW stares into the fire pit and then exits.

DAVOS is walking alone through the snow. He happens upon a pile of wooden rubble and stops to inspect it. He sees a charred statuette of a stag in the wood and stops to pick it up. He looks back at the pile of wood. A horn blows in the distance. DAVOS looks in the direction of the horn, then hands his head.

Last time we saw each other was at Winterfell, yes? You were making jokes about my height, I seem to recall. Everyone who makes a joke about a dwarf’s height thinks he’s the only person ever to make a joke about a dwarf’s height. “The height of nobility,” “a man of your stature,” “someone to look up to.” You’re all making the same five or six jokes.
Speaker: TYRION (to THEON)

Text: It was a long time ago.
Speaker: THEON

Text: It was. And how have things been going for you since then? Not so well, I gather. Can’t imagine you would have murdered the Stark boys if things had been going well.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I didn’t murder the Stark boys. But I did things that were just as bad or worse.
Speaker: THEON

Text: And he paid for them.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Doesn’t seem like it. He’s still alive. It was complicated for you, I’m sure, growing up at Winterfell. Never quite knowing who you were. But then, we all live complicated lives, don’t we?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You’ve brought us 100 ships from the Iron Fleet with men to sail them. In return, I expect you want me to support your claim to the throne of the Iron Islands?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Not my claim. Hers.
Speaker: THEON

Text: And what’s wrong with you?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I’m not fit to rule.
Speaker: THEON

Text: We can agree upon that at least.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Has the Iron Islands ever had a queen before?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: No more than Westeros.
Speaker: YARA

Text: DAENERYS smiles.
Our Uncle Euron returned home after a long absence. He murdered our father and took the Salt Throne from yara. He would have murdered us if we had stayed.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Lord Tyrion tells me your father was a terrible king.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You and I have that in common.
Speaker: YARA

Text: We do. And both murdered by a usurper as well.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS turns to TYRION.
Will their ships be enough?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: With the former Masters’ fleet, possibly. Barely. There are more than 100 ships in the Iron Fleet.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: There are and Euron is building more. He’s going to offer them to you.
Speaker: THEON

Text: So why shouldn’t I wait for him?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Iron Fleet isn’t all he’s bringing. He also wants to give you --
Speaker: THEON

Text: His big cock, I think he said. Euron’s offer is also an offer of marriage, you see. You won’t get one without the other.
Speaker: YARA

Text: And I imagine your offer is free of any marriage demands?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I never demand, but I’m up for anything, really.
Speaker: YARA

Text: He murdered our father and would have murdered us. He’ll murder you as soon as you have what he wants.
Speaker: THEON

Text: The Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: All of them.
Speaker: THEON

Text: And you don’t want the Seven Kingdoms?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your ancestors defeated ours and took the Iron Islands. We ask you to give them back.
Speaker: THEON

Text: And that’s all?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: We’d like you to help us murder an uncle or two who don’t think a woman’s fit to rule.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Reasonable.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: What if everyone starts demanding their independence?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She’s not demanding, she’s asking. The others are free to ask as well. Our father were evil men, all of us here. They left the world worse than they found it. We’re not going to do that. We’re going to leave the world better than we found it.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS stands and approaches YARA.
You will support my claim as queen of the Seven Kingdoms and respect the integrity of the Seven Kingdoms. No more reaving, roving, raiding, or raping.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: That’s our way of life.
Speaker: YARA

Text: No more.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: YARA and THEON look at each other. THEON nods. YARA turns back to DAENERYS.
No more.
Speaker: YARA

Text: YARA extends her hand to DAENERYS. DAENERYS looks back at TYRION. TYRION makes a shaking motion with his hand. DAENERYS and YARA grab each other’s arms.
Do you like games, little man? Let’s play a game. Run to your brother. The sooner you make it to him, the sooner you get to see him. That’s it. That’s the game. Easy. Ready? Go.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RICKON starts walking out into the field, then looks back at RAMSAY.
No, you have to run, remember? Those are the rules.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: A soldier approaches and hands RAMSAY his bow. RICKON starts running across the field. RAMSAY draws an arrow from his quiver. JON SNOW jumps on his horse and begins galloping across the field towards RICKON. RAMSAY notches an arrow and fires. The arrow lands in the ground next to RICKON. RAMSAY fires another arrow. It lands on the ground next to RICKON. JON SNOW and RICKON are getting closer. JON SNOW extends his hand out to RICKON. RAMSAY shoots another arrow. It misses. JON SNOW and RICKON are feet away from each other. An arrow pierces through RICKON’s chest from behind. RICKON falls to the ground. JON comes to a halt beside him and looks down at him. RICKON gasps and then dies. JON SNOW looks up at RAMSAY.
Don’t.
Speaker: TORMUND (to himself)

Text: RAMSAY smiles and gives his bow back to the soldier.
Prepare to charge! Prepare to charge!
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The Bolton archers draw and loose a volley of arrows. JON SNOW ushers his horse into a gallop straight towards the Bolton army.
Go! Go! Follow your commander!
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Run and fight!
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: WUN WUN roars. The bulk of the Stark forces charge across the field towards the Boltons. JON SNOW continues to rush the Bolton forces alone. The Bolton arches released a volley of arrows, some of which land in the body of JON SNOW’s horse, causing him and his horse to tumble to the ground.
Now.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Cavalry, charge!
Speaker: KARSTARK

Text: JON SNOW stands to face the Bolton cavalry, charging at him. He takes off his sword belt and draws his sword. The cavalry approaches. Just before it’s upon him, the Stark forces rush past JON SNOW and collide with the Bolton charge. Men on both sides die in the frenzy. Bodies and weaponry fly everywhere. Archers on both sides of the battlefield nock arrows and draw their bows.
We’ll just kill our own men. Stand down.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The Stark arches do not fire.
Loose!
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: The Bolton archers fire. Their arrows rain down on Stark and Bolton men alike. In the fray, JON SNOW dodges several horses which gallop past him. One Bolton cavalryman charges with his horse, but JON SNOW cuts him down. JON SNOW rushes forward and kills a man on the ground, then slices the belly of a second man. A volley of arrows rains down around JON SNOW. He ducks. None of the arrows hit him. He returns to his feet and cuts down another man, dodges the strike of a passing Bolton cavalryman, and runs through another Bolton footsoldier. A Stark footsoldier helps him finish the Bolton man, and JON SNOW grabs him by the shirt.
Get word --
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: The Stark footsoldier is taken in the head by an arrow. JON SNOW stares down at the man and then flies into a rage, killing two more Bolton soldiers. A third man runs at him but is knocked down by a galloping horse. JON SNOW runs over to where he landed and stabs him several times. A horseman gallops at JON SNOW with his ax ready, but a passing Stark cavalryman spears him. Another Bolton footsoldier approaches JON SNOW, but JON SNOW cuts him down. The bodies are beginning to pile up on the battlefield. RAMSAY’s archers loose several more volleys. JON SNOW goes into a frenzy, killing many Bolton men. The bodies have piled up high enough to create small mountains of bodies. Men continue to fight atop and around them.
We may as well be taking shits back here.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS dismounts his horse.
Follow!
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS unsheathes his sword and charges across the field. The remainder of the Stark forces charge after him. On the other side of the battlefield, RAMSAY smiles and acknowledges SMALLJON.
It’s time, go.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: SMALLJON brandishes his sword and walks back and forth in front of his men.
Who owns the North?
Speaker: SMALLJON

Text: We do!
Speaker: ALL

Text: Who owns the North?
Speaker: SMALLJON

Text: We do!
Speaker: ALL

Text: Show me!
Speaker: SMALLJON

Text: SMALLJON and his men cheer and charge across the battlefield. JON SNOW continues fighting, but is knocked to the ground by a Bolton footsoldier. TORMUND appears and stabs the footsoldier through the back, then helps JON SNOW to his feet.
Hey!
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: WUN WUN and the Wildlings charge up behind TORMUND and JON SNOW. SMALLJON and his men are charging from the other side. WUN WUN points at them and grunts. A force of Bolton men appear bearing tall shields and spears. They create a half-circle around JON SNOW, TORMUND, DAVOS, WUN WUN, and the entire Stark forces. The other half of the circle is blocked by the piles of bodies on the battlefield. The shield soldiers set their shields firmly in the dirt, then point their spears inward towards the Stark forces.
Infantry, advance!
Speaker: MAN

Text: The shield soldiers grunt in unison, lift their shields, and move in towards the Stark forces. With each wave of movement, they stab more and more Stark soldiers with their spears. One Stark soldier tries to climb up over the piles of bodies but gets cut down by SMALLJON. SMALLJON and his men charge down over the bodies, taking the Stark forces from the rear.
With me, lads! Break their line!
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: WUN WUN rushes the shield wall and swipes at the spears. TORMUND jumps to the side of some spears and attacks a man behind the shield wall. Several other Stark men rush towards the shield wall. JON SNOW and other Stark soldiers defend against SMALLJON’s men. Many soldiers die on both sides, and the bodies begin to pile up again. WUN WUN rips a man in half. TORMUND pulls a shieldbearer down and kills him, but gets sliced across the arm and is fored to fall back among the Stark ranks.
Tormund!
Speaker: MAN

Text: Get him back!
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: The shieldbearers advance, pushing the Stark forces further in on themselves. More Stark men die.
Fuck this, come on!
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: TORMUND leads the Wildlings back towards the piles of bodies. JON SNOW and SMALLJON spot each other, but before they can engage, the Wildling charge overtakes them. In the fray, JON SNOW is pushes to the bottom of several bodies and starts getting crushed. He struggles to get out, but can’t get a hold. TORMUND faces off against SMALLJON. TORMUND punches SMALLJON in the face, and SMALLJON responds with an overhead swing of his sword. TORMUND blocks it. More and more bodies are piling on top of JON SNOW. He can see glimpses of clashes and flailing limbs above, but nothing else. He gasps for air. SMALLJON knocks TORMUND to the ground and punches him in the face multiple times. Men are dying all around JON SNOW as he is being trampled. JON SNOW grabs onto the clothes of a standing men and hoists himself up. He emerges in the center of a tightly packed group of his men and fills his lungs with air. He spots WUN WUN fighting off some shieldbearers. WUN WUN is stabbed in the side, grunts, and pulls the spear out. SMALLJON repeatedly headbutts TORMUND in the face. DAVOS and JON SNOW look at each other. A horn begins to sound in the distance. SMALLJON stops headbutting TORMUND. TORMUND seizes the opportunity and tears into the skin of SMALLJON’s neck with his teeth, then draws a small knife and stabs SMALLJON repeatedly. RAMSAY looks in the direction of the sounding horn. A force of cavalry appears across the battlefield carrying flags bearing the white falcon sigil of House Arryn. SANSA and PETYR BAELISH sit on horseback beside the charging Arryn cavalry. TORMUND kills SMALLJON and screams. The Arryn cavalry takes the Bolton shieldbearers from the rear, then circles around and knocks them all down. SANSA smiles. JON SNOW climbs up to the top of the piles of bodies and spots RAMSAY on his horse. WUN WUN and TORMUND climb up beside JON SNOW. RAMSAY sees JON SNOW, turns his horse around, and rides back towards Winterfell. JON SNOW, TORMUND, and WUN WUN chase after him. SANSA watches them go.
RAMSAY and several Bolton soldiers enter the courtyard through Winterfell’s main gate. Some men close and bar the gate behind them and they dismount.
Their army’s gone.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Our army’s gone.
Speaker: MAN

Text: We have Winterfell. They don’t have the men for a siege. All we have to do is wait.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Something thuds against the gate. RAMSAY turns to look at it. Several Bolton archers nock arrows. Several more thuds occur against the other side of the gate. WUN WUN busts a hole in the gate. BOLTON archers shoot arrows at his hand and down at his body over the side of the castle wall. WUN WUN roars and punches another hole in the gate. RAMSAY moves farther away from the gate’s interior. WUN WUN reaches in and grabs the wooden bar holding the gate, but a Bolton soldier throws a spear through the back of his hand. WUN WUN rips his hand away and then bursts through the gate, opening it. He sprints into the courtyard, then falls to his knees. The Bolton archers continue shooting arrows into him. He roars. Stark soldiers flood the courtyard and beginning killing the Bolton soldiers, quickly overtaking them. JON SNOW enters the courtyard and runs up beside WUN WUN. They look at each other. TORMUND runs up beside WUN WUN, on his other side. JON SNOW reaches out to WUN WUN, but RAMSAY shoots WUN WUN in the eye with an arrow, killing him.
You suggested one on one combat, didn’t you?
Speaker: RAMSAY (to JON SNOW)

Text: Stark archers aim their bows at RAMSAY.
I’ve reconsidered. I think that sounds like a wonderful idea.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: RAMSAY notches an arrow. JON SNOW drops his sword and picks up a shield. RAMSAY aims at JON SNOW and fires. JON SNOW raises his shield and blocks the arrow. JON SNOW advances. RAMSAY nocks another arrow and fires. JON SNOW raises his shield and blocks the arrow. JON SNOW advances. RAMSAY nocks a third arrow and fires. JON SNOW raises his shield and blocks the arrow. JON SNOW advances. Before RAMSAY can nock a fourth arrow, JON SNOW overtakes him. JON SNOW bashes RAMSAY with his shield twice, knocking him over. JON SNOW drops his shield and jumps on top of RAMSAY, then punches him in the raise over and over. RAMSAY’s faces becomes mangled and bleeds. SANSA enters the courtyard. JON SNOW sees her and stops punching RAMSAY. He stands and walks away. The Bolton flags fall away from the walls of Winterfell and are replaced by Stark flags. MELISANDRE watches from a balcony. DAVOS, holding the charred stag statuette, stares up at her. Some Stark men carry RICKON’s body into the courtyard on a stretcher and stop in front of JON SNOW, TORMUND, and SANSA.
We’re going to bury my brother in the crypt next to my father.
Speaker: JON SNOW

Text: The stretcher men continue on. JON SNOW turns to walk away.
Jon.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JON SNOW turns back to face SANSA.
Where is he?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: RAMSAY is tied to a chair inside the kennel gates. He is mangled and bleeding. He groans and coughs, then raises his head to see SANSA standing outside the gate.
Ah. Sansa. Hello, Sansa. Is this where I’ll be staying now? No. Our time together is about to come to an end. That’s all right. You can’t kill me. I’m part of you now.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: Your words will disappear. Your house will disappear. Your name will disappear. All memory of you will disappear.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: The dogs growl in their cells and begin filtering out into the kennel.
My hounds will never harm me.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: You haven’t fed them in seven days. You said it yourself.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: They’re loyal beasts.
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: They were. Now they’re starving.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: The dogs growl. One approaches RAMSAY from the front and puts its front paws up on his legs. It sniffs RAMSAY’s face.
Sit. Down! Down! Down! Down! Down!
Speaker: RAMSAY

Text: The dog bites RAMSAY’s face. RAMSAY screams. The dogs converge on RAMSAY and begin tearing him apart. SANSA turns as though she might leave, but lingers for a moment to watch. SANSA turns and walks away, then smiles.
CREDITS
You're wonder why I brought you all here. After all, we just had a feast. Since when does old Walder give us two feasts in a single fortnight?
Speaker: WALDER FREY

Text: The Freys laugh.
Well, it's no good being lord of the Riverlands if you can't celebrate with your family. That's what I say!
Speaker: WALDER FREY

Text: The Freys cheer and slam their fists on their tables. WALDER snaps his fingers at a servant girl. The girl begins serving flasks of wine.

I've gathered every Frey who means a damn thing so I can tell you my plans for this great house now that winter has come. But first, a toast! No more of that Dornish horse piss! This is the finest Arbor gold! Proper wine for proper heroes!
Speaker: WALDER FREY

Text: The Freys cheer. WALDER raises his glass.
Stand together!
Speaker: WALDERY FREY

Text: The Freys stand in unison.
Stand together!
Speaker: ALL

Text: The Freys drink. WALDER holds his cup to his lips but does not drink. The servant girl picks up her cup and motions to drink.
Not you. I'm not wasting good wine on a damn woman.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: WALDER addresses the hall again.
Maybe I'm not the most pleasant man. I'll admit it. But I'm proud of you lot. You're my family, the men who helped me slaughter the Starks at the Red Wedding.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: The Freys cheer.

Yes, yes. Cheer. Brave men, all of you. Butchered a woman pregnant with her babe. Cut the throat of a mother of five. Slaughtered your guests after inviting them into your home. But you didn't slaughter every one of the Starks.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: Some of the Freys groan.
No, no, that was your mistake. You should have ripped them all out, root and stem.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: The Freys choke, cough, and spit up blood.
Leave one wolf alive and the sheep are never safe.
Speaker: WALDER

Text: The Freys collapse and die. WALDER takes hold of his own face and removes it, revealing ARYA's face. ARYA turns to the servant girl.
When people ask you what happened here, tell them the North remembers. Tell them winter came for House Frey.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA walks through the hall, staring at the Frey bodies. She smiles and exits.

TITLE SEQUENCEEXT. BEYOND THE WALLThe wind blows over the tundra. A dark cloud starts forming on the horizon, growing larger until it consumes everything. A white walker rides into view, accompanied by several other white walkers. The army of the dead files through the darkness. An undead giant walks into view. Zoom on the giant's eye.

BRAN is lying in his sled. His eyes are pure white. They wash to their normal color. MEERA is standing in front of him, holding the ropes to the sled. The gate rises. DOLOROUS EDD walks through the gate, accompanied by several members of the Night's Watch.
You wildlings?
Speaker: EDD

Text: I'm Meera Reed, daughter of Howland Reed. This is Brandon Stark, son of Ned Stark.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: How do I know that's true?
Speaker: EDD

Text: BRAN raises his head and stares at EDD.
You were at the Fist of the First Men. You were at Hardhome. You've seen the Army of the Dead. You've seen the Night King. He's coming for us. For all of us.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: EDD pauses and looks down, then looks to his men.
Okay, come on. Let's get them inside.
Speaker: EDD

Text: Two Night's Watch men sheathe their swords, approach BRAN's sled, grab the ropes, and pull him inside the gate. MEERA follows. EDD lingers and stares out into the wild, then turns on his heel and walks through the gate. The gate closes behind him.

I want every northern maester to scour their records for any mention of dragonglass. Dragonglass kills white walkers. It's more valuable to us now than gold. We need to find it, we need to mine it, we need to make weapons from it. Everyone aged 10 to 60 will drill daily with spears, pikes, bow and arrow.
Speaker: JON

Text: It's about time we taught these boys of summer how to fight.
Speaker: ROBETT

Text: The northern lords laugh.
Not just the boys.
Speaker: JON

Text: BRIENNE looks at JON.
We can't defend the North if only half the population is fighting.
Speaker: JON

Text: ROBETT stands.
You expect me to put a spear in my granddaughter's hand?
Speaker: ROBETT

Text: LYANNA stands.
I don't plan on knitting by the fire while men fight for me. I might be small, Lord Glover, and I might be a girl, but I am every bit as much a Northerner as you.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: Indeed you are, my lady. No one has questioned--
Speaker: ROBETT

Text: And I don't need your permission to defend the North.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: DAVOS smiles. LYANNA turns to JON.
We'll begin training every man, woman, boy, and girl on Bear Island.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: The men pound their tables and shout in agreement. ROBETT nods at LYANNA. ROBETT and LYANNA sit.

While we're preparing for attack, we need to shore up our defenses. The only thing standing between us and the Army of the Dead is the Wall and the Wall hasn't been properly manned in centuries. I'm not the king of the Free Folk.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON looks at TORMUND. TORMUND turns and looks at JON.
But if we're going to survive this winter together...
Speaker: JON

Text: TORMUND grunts and stands.
You want us to man the castles for you?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: The men murmur.
Last time we saw the Night King was at Hardhome. The closest castle to Hardhome is Eastwatch-by-the-Sea.
Speaker: JON

Text: Then that's where I'll go. Looks like we're the Night's Watch now.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: TORMUND sits.
If they breach the wall, the first two castles in their path are Last Hearth and Karhold.
Speaker: JON

Text: YOHN stands.
The Umbers and the Karstarks betrayed the North. Their castles should be torn down with not a stone left standing.
Speaker: YOHN

Text: The castles committed no crimes. And we need every fortress we have for the war to come. We should give the Last Hearth and Karhold to new families, loyal families who supported us against Ramsay.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Aye!
Speaker: ALL

Text: YOHN sits.
The Umbers and the Karstarks have fought beside the Starks for centuries. They've kept faith for generation after generation.
Speaker: JON

Text: And then they broke faith.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I'm not going to strip these families of their ancestral homes because of the crimes of a few reckless sons.
Speaker: JON

Text: So there's no punishment for treason and no reward for loyalty?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: The hall goes silent.
The punishment for treason is death. Smalljon Umber died on the field of battle. Harald Karstark died on the field of battle.
Speaker: JON

Text: They died fighting for Ramsay. Give the castles to the families of the men who died fighting for you.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: The men chatter and pound the tables.

When I was Lord Commander of the Night's Watch I executed men who betrayed me. I executed men who refused to follow orders. My father always said, "The man who passes the sentence should swing the sword," and I have tried to live by those words. But I will not punish a son for his father's sins, and I will not take a family home away from a family it has belonged to for centuries. That is my decision, and my decision is final.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON stares at SANSA. SANSA looks away. JON addresses the hall.
Ned Umber.
Speaker: JON

Text: NED UMBER, a boy, stands.
Alys Karstark.
Speaker: JON

Text: ALYS KARSTARK, a young woman, stands. NED and ALYS approach the high table.
For centuries, our families fought side by side on the battlefield. I ask you to pledge your loyalty once again to House Stark, to serve as our bannermen and come to our aid whenever called upon.
Speaker: JON

Text: NED and ALYS unsheathe their swords and kneel.
Stand.
Speaker: JON

Text: NED and ALYS stand.
Yesterday's wars don't matter anymore. The North needs to band together, all the living north. Will you stand beside me, Ned and Alys, now and always?
Speaker: JON

Text: Now and always!
Speaker: NED & ALYS

Text: The men cheer and pound the tables.
JON walks briskly along the walkway. SANSA follows him.
You are my sister, but I am king now.
Speaker: JON

Text: Will you start wearing a crown?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: When you question my decisions in front of the other lords and ladies, you undermine me.
Speaker: JON

Text: So I can't question your decisions anymore?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Of course you can, but--
Speaker: JON

Text: Joffrey never let anyone question his authority. You think he was a good king?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JON stops walking. SANSA walks past him, then stops and turns to face him.
Do you think I'm Joffrey?
Speaker: JON

Text: You're as far from Joffrey as anyone I've ever met.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Thank you.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON stares out at the yard below.
You're good at this, you know.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: At what?
Speaker: JON

Text: At ruling.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JON sighs.
No.
Speaker: JON

Text: You are. You are. They respect you, they really do, but you have to--
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JON chuckles.
Why are you laughing?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JON continues walking. SANSA follows.
What did father used to say? Everything before the word "but" is horse shit.
Speaker: JON

Text: He never said that to me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: No. No, he never cursed in front of his girls.
Speaker: JON

Text: Because he was trying to protect us. He never wanted us to see how dirty the world really is, but Father couldn't protect me and neither can you. Stop trying.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: All right, I'll stop trying to protect you and you stop trying to undermine me.
Speaker: JON

Text: I'm not trying to undermine you.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA grabs JON's arm and spins him to face her.
You have to be smarter than Father. You need to be smarter than Robb. I loved them, I miss them, but they made stupid mistakes, and they both lost their heads for it.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: And how should I be smarter? By listening to you?
Speaker: JON

Text: Would that be so terrible?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: MAESTER WOLKAN approaches.
A raven from King's Landing, Your Grace.
Speaker: WOLKAN

Text: WOLKAN hands a bound note to JON, then bows and leaves. JON unravels the note.
"Cersei of House Lannister, First of Her Name, Queen of the Andals and the First Men, Protector of the Seven Kingdoms--"
Speaker: JON

Text: What does she want?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Come to King's Landing. Bend the knee or suffer the fate of all traitors.
Speaker: JON

Text: You've been so consumed with the enemy to the north, you've forgotten about the one to the south.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I'm consumed with the Night King because I've seen him. And believe me, you'd think of little else if you had, too.
Speaker: JON

Text: We still have a wall between us and the Night King. Theres nothing between us and Cersei.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: There's a thousand miles between us and Cersei. Winter is here. The Lannisters are a southern army. They've never ranged this far north.
Speaker: JON

Text: You're the military man, but I know her. If you're her enemy, she'll never stop until she's destroyed you. Everyone who's ever crossed her, she's found a way to murder.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You almost sound as if you admire her.
Speaker: JON

Text: I learned a great deal from her.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: What is this?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Its what we've been waiting for our whole lives. It's what Father trained us for, whether he knew it or not.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: He knew it. Made me memorize every damn city, town, lake, forest, and mountain.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: It's ours now, we just have to take it.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI turns to face JAIME.
You've been quiet since you came home. Are you angry with me?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: No, not angry.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Are you afraid of me?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Should I be?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Daenerys Targaryen has chosen Tyrion to be her Hand. Right now, they're sailing across the Narrow Sea, hoping to take back her father's throne. Our little brother, the one you love so much, the one you set free, the one who murdered our father and our first-born son, now he stands beside our enemies and gives them counsel. He's out there somewhere at the head of an armada. Where will they land?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Dragonstone.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME approaches the depiction of Dragonstone in the mural and stands over it.
They have deep-water ports for the ships. Stannis left the castle unoccupied, and that's where she was born.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Enemies to the east.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI walks towards Dorne on the mural.
Enemies to the south--Ellaria Sand and her brood of bitches.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI walks towards Highgarden on the mural.
Enemies to the west--Olenna, the old cunt. Another traitor.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEi walks towards the North on the mural.

Enemies to the north. Ned Stark's bastard has been named King in the North and that murdering whore Sansa stands beside him. Enemies everywhere. We're surrounded by traitors. You're in command of the Lannister army now. How do we proceed?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Winter is here. We can't win a war if we can't feed our men and our horses. The Tyrells have the grain, the Tyrells have the livestock.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Will the Tyrell bannermen stand alongside a Dothraki horde and Unsullied slave soldiers?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: If they think Daenerys will win. No one wants to fight on the losing side. Right now, we look like the losing side.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I'm the Queen of the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Three kingdoms, at best. I'm not sure you understand how much danger we're in.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I understand we're in a war for survival. I understand whoever loses dies. I understand whoever wins could launch a dynasty that lasts a thousand years.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: A dynasty for whom? Our children are dead. We're the last of us.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: A dynasty for us, then.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: We never talked about Tommen.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: CERSEi turns and walks to a nearby table and pours herself a glass of wine.
There's nothing to say.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Our baby boy killed himself.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He betrayed me. He betrayed us both. Should we spend our days mourning the dead--mother, father, and all our children?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Cersei--
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I loved them. I did. But they're ashes now and we're still flesh and blood. We're the last Lannisters, the last ones who count.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Even Lannisters can't survive without allies. Where are our allies now? You saw what happened to Walder Frey and his family.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I heard. How could we ever trust a man like that?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: We couldn't. He was a useless, old coward, but the Freys supported us. Now they're all dead. Whoever killed them is no friend of ours. We need allies. Stronger, better allies. We can't win this war alone.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You think I listened to Father for 40 years and learned nothing?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Ships bearing the kraken sigil of House Greyjoy are sailing into port. CERSEI and JAIME watch the boats from the shore, escorted by GREGOR CLEGANE and several other guards.
The Greyjoys? You invited the Greyjoys to King's Landing?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Not all of them.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Well, it looks like all of them.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I invited Euron Greyjoy, the new King of the Iron Islands. You said yourself we needed stronger, better allies. There you are.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: How are they better allies? How are they different from the Freys? They both broke their promises and murdered their former friends as soon as it suited them.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: So does everyone when it suits them. Unlike the Freys, they have ships. And they're good at killing.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: They're not good at anything. I know the Ironborn. They're bitter, angry little people. All they know how to do is steal things they can't build or grow themselves.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Euron Greyjoy didn't come here for that.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Oh, what did he come here for, then?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: A queen.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI exits, followed by GREGOR and the guards.
CERSEI sits on the Iron Throne, flanked by JAIME and GREGOR. EURON GREYJOY stands at the foot of the throne. Guards line the hall.

The moment I was chosen Lord of the Iron Islands, they turned on me. Their own uncle. They stole my best ships and ran. Sailed the right across the world and gave them to the Dragon Queen so she could bring her armies here to attack you.
Speaker: EURON

Text: EURON points at CERSEI.

It's nothing compares to the treason you suffered at the hands of a family members, from what I hear. But still, it bothers me. Murdering them would make me feel a lot better. And since it appears that all our treasonous family members are fighting for the same side, I thought we rightful monarchs could murder them together.
Speaker: EURON

Text: EURON starts walking up towards the throne. GREGOR takes a step towards him. EURON stops walking and looks up at him.
You're not a rightful monarch, though, are you?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: EURON smiles and walks backwards off the steps. GREGOR returns to his previous position.

The Greyjoys rebelled agains the throne for the right to be monarchs, but as I recall, you were soundly defeated. Come to mention it, weren't you the one who started that rebellion by sailing to Casterly Rock and burning the Lannister fleet? You certainly caught us there. Very smart move on your part. Of course, we all made it to the Iron Islands anyway. I was there.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I remember very well. I saw you. I heard so much talk. The best in the world. No one can stop him. I didn't believe it, to be honesty. But I must say, when you rushed through the breach and started cutting people down...it was glorious. Like a dance.
Speaker: EURON

Text: The people I was cutting down were your own kin.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The place was getting crowded. I enjoyed watching it. I truly did.
Speaker: EURON

Text: And I enjoyed killing Greyjoys.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: A good thing for me. If you hadn't crushed us, I wouldn't have gone into exile. If I hadn't done that, I wouldn't be the greatest captain on the 14 seas.
Speaker: EURON

Text: If not the most humble.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You're not humble. You're the queen of a great nation. You don't care about the Iron Islands. They're nothing but rocks and bird shit and--and a lot of very unattractive people. The Iron Fleet, on the other hand, that's something else entirely. It's the greatest armada Westeros has ever seen. With the Iron Fleet, you own the seas. You can defeat the invaders of the east and the pretenders of the north and south.
Speaker: EURON

Text: What do you want in return?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Ever since I was a little boy, I wanted to grow up and mary the most beautiful woman in the world. So here I am, with a thousand ships and two good hands.
Speaker: EURON

Text: EURON raises his arms. JAIME's face twists.
I decline your proposal.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Why?
Speaker: EURON

Text: You're not trustworthy. You've broken promises to allies before and murdered them at the nearest opportunity. You murdered your own brother.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You should try it. Feels wonderful.
Speaker: EURON

Text: EURON chuckles. JAIME looks at CERSEI.

I don't expect you to trust me outright. You need proof of my honest intentions. In my experience, the surest way to a woman's heart is with a gift. A priceless gift. I won't return to King's Landing until I have that for you.
Speaker: EURON

Text: EURON turns and exits the Great Hall.
SAM retrieves a bedpan from beneath one of the beds. He gags.
SAM opens the lid of the toilet. He coughs, empties a bedpan, then cleans out a bedpan.
SAM is carry a stack of books. A maester walks by and places another book on top of the pile as he passes. SAM grunts and sighs.
A number of maesters are gathered for a meal. SAM pours soup into their bowls.
SAM places books on the shelves. He looks at a gate.
SAM retrieves a bedpan from beneath one of the beds. He gags.
SAM pours soup into a maester's bowl.
SAM opens the lid of the toilet. He empties a bedpan and sighs.
A maester places a book on top of the pile SAM is carrying. SAM places books on the shelves.
SAM empties a bedpan.
SAM pours soup into a maester's bowl.
SAM retrieves a bedpan from beneath one of the beds.
SAM gags. He pours water and places down a bedpan.
SAM pours soup into a maester's bowl.
SAM empties a bedpan. He retches. He pours water and cleans a bedpan.
SAM pours soup into a maester's bowl.
SAM pours water and places down a bedpan.
SAM pours soup into a maester's bowl.
SAM opens the toilet and empties a bedpan. He places down a bedpan and pours water.
SAM places books on the shelves. A maester places a book on top of the pile he's carrying. He puts more books on the shelves.
SAM continues his duties.
