SAM wipes his brow. He stares at the gate, then looks over his shoulder, then back at the gate. He walks over to the gate, takes hold of the bars, and looks through. The gate rattles. He focuses on an open book. He hears a chain rattling, hurries to a bookshelf,
and pretends to be placing a book on it. A maester comes around the corner, walks down past him to the gate, unlocks it, enters, and locks it behind him. SAM watches him.
ARCHMAESTER MARWYN is performing an autopsy. SAM stands on the other side of the table, watching.
Ah, Maester Weyland. A drinker's liver if ever I saw one.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: MARWYN removes the liver and hands it to SAM.
Weigh that.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: SAM walks over to the scales.
The triumph of transitory pleasures. Mankind's curse.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: SAM puts the liver on one side of the scale and places weights on the other side.
Archmaester, I was wondering...
Speaker: SAM

Text: What's the weight?
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: MARWYN walks over to an open ledger, picks up a quill, and writes the number 147.
I was wondering if you had considered my proposition.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I don't remember your proposition.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: I asked you if, in light of what I've seen in the North, if I could have access to the restricted area of the library.
Speaker: SAM

Text: That area is reserved for maesters. Are you a maester?
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: No.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Not a very strong proposition, is it?
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: MARWYN hands SAM the heart. SAM takes it to the scales.

Archmaester, with respect, I've seen them--the Army of the Dead. The white walkers. W was sent here to learn how to defeat them, but everyone in the Citadel, those who will even talk to me, they all doubt the walkers ever existed in the first place.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Everyone in the Citadel doubts everything. It's their job. But the tales of the Long Night can't be pure fabrication. Too many similarities from unconnected sources.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: Sources in the restricted area?
Speaker: SAM

Text: The very same. And the simplest explanation for your grating obsession with the white walkers is that you're telling the truth and that you saw what you say you saw.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: So, you believe me.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I do. You'll finish weighing that heart?
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: That makes you the only person south of the Twins who does.
Speaker: SAM

Text: We're not lie the people south of the Twins. And we're not like the people north of the Twins. In the Citadel, we lead different lives for different reasons. We are this world's memory, Samwell Tarly. Without us, men would be little better than dogs. Don't remember any meal but the last, can't see forward to any but the next. And every time you leave the house and shut the door, they howl like you're gone forever. When Robert's Rebellion was raging, people that the end was near. The end of the Targaryen dynasty. "How will we survive?" When Aegon Targaryen turned his eye westward and flew his dragons to Blackwater Rush--"The end is near! How will we survive?" And thousands of year before that, during the Long Night, we can forgive them for thinking it truly was the end. But it wasn't. None of it was. The Wall has stood through it all. And every winter that ever came has ended.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: MARWYN closes the ledger.
Be a good lad. Clean this up.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: MARWYN exits. SAM stares at the body.
SAM rolls in a cart of clean bedpans. He walks over to a sleeping maester and grabs a ring of keys fro his bedside table.
SAM opens the gate, steps through, and closes it behind him.
He grabs several books and stuffs them in a satchel.
Nope.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: They reset. POD advances and they exchange several sword blows but POD missteps again and BRIENNE tags him on the behind. POD grunts.
Nope.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: TORMUND approaches and stares at BRIENNE. BRIENNE looks at him. POD catches her off guard and tags her shoulder with his blade. She punches him in his gut and tosses him in the snow. TORMUND looks at POD.
You're a lucky man.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: PETYR BAELISH and SANSA stand on a walkway above the courtyard, watching BRIENNE and POD.
I've heard she beat the Hound in single combat. She's a very impressive woman.
Speaker: PETYR

Text: What do you want, Lord Baelish?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I want you to be happy. I want you to be safe.
Speaker: PETYR

Text: I am safe. I'm at home, surrounded by friends. I have Brienne to protect me from anyone who would harm me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: What about happy? Why aren't you happy? What do you want that you do not have?
Speaker: PETYR

Text: At the moment, peace and quiet.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: BRIENNE walks up the stairs. PETYR motions to speak.
No need to seize the last word, Lord Baelish. I'll assume it was something clever.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: PETYR looks at BRIENNE.
My lady.
Speaker: PETYR

Text: PETYR looks at SANSA.
My lady.
Speaker: PETYR

Text: PETYR walks down the steps and into the courtyard.
Why is he still here?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: SANSA sighs.
We need his men. Without the Vale, Ramsay Bolton would still hold this castle. Littlefinger saved us.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: BRIENNE nods and watches PETYR walk across the courtyard.
He wants something.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I know exactly what he wants.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: He rode through the streets of the city / Down from his hill on high / O'er the winds and the steps and the cobble / He rode to a woman's sigh / For she was his secret treasure / She was his shame and his bliss / And a chain and a keep are nothing / Compared to a woman's kiss / For hands of gold are always cold / But a woman's hands are warm / For hands of gold are always cold / But a woman's hands are--
Speaker: MAN (singing)

Text: ARYA's horse neighs. The men turn to look at her. One stands.
That's a pretty song. I've never heard it before.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: It's a new one.
Speaker: MAN

Text: Are you hungry? We've got some rabbit.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: I don't want to steal your food.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You're not stealing, we're offering. Come on, it's gonna be a cold night.
Speaker: MAN #3

Text: ARYA dismounts her horse, leads it nearer to the fire, and ties it reigns off on a tree. She approaches the camp.
You heading south?
Speaker: MAN #3

Text: King's Landing.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Poor girl.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: The men chuckle.
Not so bad, is it?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Depends on your taste, I guess. If you like your streets covered in shit and pig's blood, it's the town for you.
Speaker: MAN #3

Text: The men chuckle.

All my life, I wanted to see the Red Keep, the Sept of Baelor, the Dragonpit. Then when I finally make it, they wouldn't let me within a mile of the Red Keep, the Sept of Baelor's blown to hell, and the Dragonpit is a damn ruin.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: The people who live there, they'd skin you alive if they could make two coppers off your hide.
Speaker: MAN #3

Text: Worst place in the world.
Speaker: MAN

Text: What are you doing in the Riverlands?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: There's been some trouble with the Freys up at The Twins, so we're part of the army that's been sent to keep the peace.
Speaker: MAN #3

Text: Here you go. Guests first.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: MAN #2 passes ARYA a cooked rabbit.
Oh, no, I couldn't. You don't have enough.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: My mother always told me to be kind to strangers. Strangers will be kind to you.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: ARYA pulls some meat of the rabbit's bone and eats it.
You're a long way from home. I'm sure you've had some adventures, though.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Yeah, endless adventures. They'll be singing about us for a thousand years.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: The men laugh.
MAN #3; The truth is when we left home, we couldn't wait to get away. But now we've been gone a while, we can't wait to get home.
I just think about my dad out there on his boat all alone. I ought o be out there with him.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: My wife's just had our first baby.
Speaker: MAN #3

Text: Boy or girl?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Oh, who knows? You think soldiers get ravens with news from home?
Speaker: MAN #3

Text: The men laugh.
I hope it's a girl.
Speaker: MAN #3

Text: Why?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Girls take care of their papas when their papas grow old. Boys just go off to fight in someone else's wars.
Speaker: MAN #3

Text: Are you old enough to drink?
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: ARYA nods. MAN #2 passes a skin of wine to ARYA. She uncorks it and drinks.
It's blackberry wine. I made it myself.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: It's really good.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: So, why is a nice girl on her own heading to King's Landing?
Speaker: MAN #3

Text: ARYA drinks.
I'm going to kill the queen.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The men fall silent, then everyone laughs.
The farm is covered in snow and the wind howls. SANDOR CLEGANE, THOROS OF MYR, BERIC DONDARRION, and several other members of the Brotherhood Without Banners ride into view.
Bad night to be outdoors.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: You've got real powerful magic to figure that out. Did the Lord of Light whisper that in your ear? "It's snowing, Thoros. It's windy. It's gonna be a cold night."
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: You're a grouchy old bear, aren't you, Clegane? You want some rum?
Speaker: THOROS

Text: THOROS holds out a skin of rum to SANDOR.
Don't like that shit. It's too sweet.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Why are you always in such a foul mood?
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Experience.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: The horses all stop.
This seems like a good place to spend the night.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: They all stare at a nearby farmhouse.
These people don't want us here.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Seems deserted to me. No livestock. No smoke coming from the chimney.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: BERIC urges his horse onward. The others follow.
I don't like the look of it.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: THOROS dismounts his horse.
For a big, hard man, you scare easy.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: I'll tell you what doesn't scare me: bald cocksuckers like you. You think you're fooling anyone with that top knot? Bald cunt.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: THOROS smiles.
Come on. Maybe they've got some ale hidden away.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: They don't.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Some of the Brothers enter the farmhouse, followed by THOROS.
See if there's a larder. They always leave something behind.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: The Brothers rummage around the farmhouse. SANDOR enters.
He stares at two skeletons in the corner, one adult-sized and the other child-sized. BERIC enters, sees the skeletons, and walks up beside SANDOR.
How do you think it ended for them?
Speaker: BERIC

Text: With death.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Girl died in her father's arms. Both of them covered in blood and a knife at their feet. I'd say they were starving. And rather than letting his little girl suffer, he ended it for both of them.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: Doesn't matter now.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: No, doesn't matter now.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: SANDOR sits at the table. BERIC joins him. SANDOR bites into a hunk of bread. THOROS starts a fire in the fireplace.
I've known you a long time, Dondarrion.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Aye. I think the first time we met was at that tournament--
Speaker: BERIC

Text: And I always thought you were dull as dirt.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: BERIC chuckles.
You're not bad. I don't hate you. Don't like, but you're not bad.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Thank you, Clegane. That warms the heart.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: But there's nothing special about you.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: You're right about that.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: So why does the Lord of Light keep bringing you back? I've met better men than you, and they've been hanged from crossbeams, or beheaded, or just shat themselves to death in a field somewhere. None of them came back. So, why you?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: You think I don't ask myself that? Every hour of every day? Why am I here? What am I supposed to do? What does the Lord see in me?
Speaker: BERIC

Text: And?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: I don't know. I don't understand our Lord.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: Your Lord.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: I don't know what He wants from me. I only know that He wants me alive.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: If he's so all-powerful, why doesn't he just tell you what the fuck he wants?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Clegane.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: SANDOR looks at THOROS, who is kneeling by the fire.
Come over here. Don't worry. The fire won't bite. I want to show you something.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: It's my fucking luck I end up with a band of fire worshippers.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Aye. Almost seems like divine justice.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: There's no divine justice, you dumb cunt. If there was, you'd be dead...and that girl would be alive.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: SANDOR stands and walks closer to the fire.
What do you want?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Look into the flames.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: I don't want to look in the damn flames.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: You saw me bring him back from the dead after you cut him down. Don't you want to know what gave me the power?
Speaker: THOROS

Text: I keep asking and no one wants to tell me.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: We can't tell you. Only the fire can tell you.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: SANDOR approaches the fire and looks into it.
What do you see?
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Logs burning.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Keep looking. What do you see?
Speaker: THOROS

Text: SANDOR's face twists.
Ice. A wall of ice. The Wall.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: What else?
Speaker: THOROS

Text: It's where the Wall meets the sea. There's a castle there.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: The fire crackles.
There's a mountain. Looks like an arrowhead. The dead are marching past.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: BERIC stands and approaches the fire.
Thousands of them.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Do you believe me now, Clegane? Do you believe we're here for a reason?
Speaker: BERIC

Text: Thoros wakes to the sound of shoveling. He picks up his sword and a lantern and exits the farmhouse. SANDOR is outside digging a grave.
What the hell are you doing, Clegane?
Speaker: THOROS

Text: SANDOR plants his shovel in the ground.
Burying the dead.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: SANDOR walks over to the body of the child, lifts it up, kneels down, and places it in the hole.
You knew these people.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Not really.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: SANDOR stands, walks over to the body of the adult, lifts it up, kneels down, and places it in the hole. Then he stands and starts shoveling dirt into the hole. THOROS plants his sword in the ground and puts down his lantern, then picks up a shovel and begins helping SANDOR bury the bodies. When they're finished,
they stand over the grave.
We ask the Father to judge us with mercy. We ask the Mother to... Fuck it, I don't remember the rest. I'm sorry you're dead. You deserved better. Both of you.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: SANDOR tosses down his shovel and exits. THOROS watches him leave.
Mom.
Speaker: LITTLE SAM

Text: GILLY turns to SAM.
You should really sleep, Sam.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: The dead don't.
Speaker: SAM

Text: GILLY stands, carries a book over to the table, and sits.
"Legends of the Long Night."
Speaker: GILLY

Text: GILLY opens the book.
The Targaryens used dragonglass to decorate their weapons without even knowing what the First Men used it for.
Speaker: SAM

Text: SAM sighs and turns the page. There is a diagram of a knife on the page. He turns the page again. There is a map on the page. SAM looks more closely at the map.
What is it?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: It's a map of Dragonstone. The Targaryens built their first stronghold there when they invaded Westeros.
Speaker: SAM

Text: SAM points to a section of the map depicting a cave surrounded by a black mass.
That's dragonglass?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: A mountain of it. Beneath the ground. Stannis told me, but I didn't think... This is important. Jon needs to know.
Speaker: SAM

Text: SAM grabs a quill and begins writing.

SAM wheels a cart along the hall. He removes a bowl from a folded-out plank in the door beside him and folds the plank back up. He puts the bowl on the cart and pushes it further down the hall. He approaches the next door, picks up the bowl, and folds in the plank. A man can be heard vomiting and coughing inside. SAM puts the bowl on the cart and pushes it further down the hall. He approaches the next door and reaches for the bowl, but a hand lurches out from the hole in the door and grabs the bowl. SAM jumps backwards and gasps. The arm of the person behind the door is covered in grayscale, revealing it belongs to JORAH MORMONT. JORAH drops the bowl on the floor.
Has she come yet?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Who?
Speaker: SAM

Text: The Dragon Queen. Daenerys Stormborn.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Haven't heard anything.
Speaker: SAM

Text: JORAH pulls his hand back inside the cell. SAM approaches and folds up the plank.

Everyone gets out of the rowboat. DAENERYS walks on ahead. She kneels down and presses her palm to the sand, then stares up at the castle and walks further down the beach. The others follow. They climb the steps and approach a gate flanked by two statues of dragon heads. Two Unsullied approach the gate and push it open, revealing a walkway up to the castle. DAENERYS, TYRION, MISSANDEI, GREY WORM, and VARYS walk through the gates and up the walkway. They enter the foyer. A tapestry bearing the stag sigil of House Baratheon is hanging off to the side. DAENERYS approaches it and tears it down. DAENERYS approaches a set of doors. Two Unsullied open them for her. She enters the throne room, followed by the others. VARYS and MISSANDEI stop following her. GREY WORM starts to continue onward but MISSANDEI puts her hand on his chest to stop him. DAENERYS approaches the throne and stares at it. TYRION looks around the hall. DAENERYS ascends the steps but walks past the throne into the Chamber of the Painted Table. TYRION follows. DAENERYS walks alongside the table and runs her fingers across it. TYRION walks alongside the table opposite her and stares at the dragon carvings on the wall. DAENERYS stands at the head of the table and stares down at the map of Westeros. TYRION looks at her.
Shall we begin?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: CREDITS
On a night like this, you came into the world.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I remember that storm. All the dogs in King's Landing howled through the night.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I wish I could remember it.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS turns away from the window and walks over to the table.
I always thought this would be a homecoming. It doesn't feel like home.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: We won't stay on Dragonstone for long.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Good.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS looks at the figurines placed on the table
Not so many lions.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Cersei controls fewer than half the Seven Kingdoms. The lord of Westeros despise her. Even before your arrival, they plotted against her. Now...
Speaker: VARYS

Text: They cry out for their true queen? They drink secret toasts to my health?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS walks closer to VARYS.
People used to tell my brother that sort of thing, and he was stupid enough to believe them.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS picks up a dragon figurine from the table.
If Viserys had three dragons and an army at his back, he'd have invaded King's Landing already.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Conquering Westeros would be easy for you. But you're not here to be queen of the ashes.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS puts down the dragon figurine.

We can take the Seven Kingdoms without turning it into a slaughterhouse. If the great houses support your claim against Cersei, the game is won. With the Tyrell army and the Dornish on our side, we have powerful allies in the south.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: DAENERYS looks at VARYS.
I never properly thanked you for that.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They joined our side, my queen, because they believe in you.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: You served my father, didn't you, Lord Varys?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I did.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: And then you served the man who overthrew him?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I had a choice, Your Grace--serve Robert Baratheon or face the headman's axe.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: But you didn't serve him long. You turned against him.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Robert was an improvement on your father, to be sure. There have been few rulers in history as cruel as the Mad King. Robert was neither mad nor cruel. He simply had no interest in being king.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: So you took it upon yourself to find a better one.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your Grace, when I was ready to drink myself into a small coffin, Lord Varys told me about a queen in the east who--
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Before I came to power, you favored my brother. All your spies, your little birds, did they tell you Viserys was cruel, stupid, and weak? Would those qualities have made for a good king in your learned opinion?
Speaker: DAENERYS (to VARYS)

Text: Until your marriage to Khal Drogo, Your Grace, I knew nothing about you, save your existence and that you were said to be beautiful.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: So you and your friends traded me like a prized horse to the Dothraki.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Which you turned to your advantage.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Who gave the order to kill me?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: King Robert.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Who hired the assassins?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS walks closer to VARYS.
Who sent word to Essos to murder Daenerys Targaryen?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your Grace, I did what had to be done to--
Speaker: VARYS

Text: To keep yourself alive.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Lord Varys has proven himself a loyal servant.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Proven himself loyal? Quite the opposite. If he dislikes one monarch, he conspires to crown the next one. What king of a servant is that?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The kind the realm needs. Incompetence should not be rewarded with blind loyalty. As long as I have my eyes, I'll use them. I wasn't born into a great house. I came from nothing. I was sold as a slave and carved up as an offering. When I was a child, I lived in alleys, gutters, abandoned houses. You wish to know where my true loyalties lie? Not with any king or queen, but with the people. The people who suffer under despots and prosper under just rule. The people whose hearts you aim to win. If you demand blind allegiance, I respect your wishes. Grey Worm can behead me or your dragons can devour me. But if you let me live, I will serve you well. I will dedicate myself to seeing you on the Iron Throne because I choose you. Because I know the people have no better chance than you.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Swear this to me, Varys. If you ever think I'm failing the people, you won't conspire behind my back. You'll look me in the eye as you have done today, and you'll tell me how I'm failing them.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I swear it, my queen.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: And I swear this--if you ever betray me, I'll burn you alive.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: VARYS smiles.
I would expect nothing less from the Mother of Dragons.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Forgive me, my queen. A red priestess from As'shai has come to see you.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: MELISANDRE is standing alone in the throne room. DAENERYS enters, accompanied by TYRION, VARYS, MISSANDEI, and GREY WORM. They approach MELISANDRE.
MELISANDRE begins speaking Valyrian.
Queen Daeneys, I was a slave once, bought and sold, scourged and branded.  It is an honor to meet the Breaker of Chains.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: The Red Priests helped bring peace to Meereen.  You are very welcome here.  What is your name?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I am called Melisandre.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: VARYS begins speaking English.
She once served another who wanted the Iron Throne.  It didn't end well for Stannis Baratheon, did it?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: No, it didn't.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: You chose an auspicious day to arrive at Dragonstone.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS turns to look at Varys.
We've just decided to pardon those who served the wrong king.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: VARYS bows his head to DAENERYS.  DAENERYS turns back to MELISANDRE.
The Lord of Light doesn't have  many followers in Westeros, does he?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Not yet.   But even those who don't worship the Lord can serve his cause.
Speaker: MELISDANDRE

Text: What does your Lord expect from me?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: MELISANDRE begins speaking Valyrian again.
The Long Night is coming.  Only the prince who was promised can bring the dawn.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: DAENERYS speaking in English.
The prince who was promised will bring the dawn.  I'm afraid I'm not a prince.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your Grace, forgive me, but your translation is not quite accurate.  That noun has no gender in High Valyrian, so the proper translation for that prophecy would be the prince or princess who was promised will bring the dawn.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Doesn't really roll off the tongue, does it?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No, but I like it better.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS turns back to MELISANDRE.
And you believe this prophecy refers to me?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Prophecies are dangerous things.  I believe you have a role to play, as does another.  The King in the North, Jon Snow.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Jon Snow?  Ned Stark's bastard?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You know him?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I traveled with him to the Wall when he joined the Night's Watch.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And why do you think the Lord of Light singled out this Jon Snow aside from the visions you've seen in the flames, that is?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: As Lord Commander of the Night's Watch he allowed the Wildlings south of the Wall to protect them from great danger.  As King in the North he has united those Wildlings with the northern houses so together they may face their common enemy.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: He sounds like quite a man.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Summon Jon Snow.  Let him stand before you and tell you things that have happened to him, the things that he has seen with his own eyes.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: I can't speak to prophecies or visions in the flames, but I like Jon Snow and I trusted him, and I am an excellent judge of character.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: DARNERYS smiles at Tyrion.
If he does rule the north, he would make a valuable ally.  The Lannisters executed his father and conspired to murder his brother.  Jon Snow has even more reason to hate Cersei than you do.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: DAENERYS pauses for a moment.
Very well.  Send a raven north.  Tell Jon Snow that his Queen invites him to come to Drangonstone...and bend the knee.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Young boys and girls are practicing archery.  JON, SANSA and DAVOS stand on the upper level watching the training.
Do you think it's really Tyrion?  It could be someone trying to lure you into a trap.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Read the last bit.
Speaker: JON

Text: "All dwarfs are bastards in their father's eyes."  What does that mean?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: It's something he said to me the first night we met.  You know him better than any of us.  What do you think?
Speaker: JON

Text: Tyrion is not like the other Lannisters.  He was always kind to me, but it's too great a risk.  "The Seven Kingdoms will bleed as long as Cersei sits on the Iron Throne.  Join us.  Together we can end her tyranny."
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Sounds like a charmer.  Of course, the casual mention of a Dothraki horde, a legion of Unsullied and three dragons, a bit less charming.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS pauses to ponder something.
What?
Speaker: JON

Text: Fire kills Whites, you told me.  What breathes fire?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You're not suggesting Jon meet with her?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: No, too dangerous.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: But?
Speaker: JON

Text: But if the Army of the Dead makes it passed the Wall, do we have enough men to fight them?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: JON gazes back to the courtyard looking concerned.
CERSEI sits on the Iron Throne.  She is surrounded by JAIME, QYBURN, THE MOUNTAIN and members of her Queensguard.  Many lords are in attendance including RANDYLL TARLEY.

If the Mad King's daughter takes the Iron Throne, she will destroy the Realm as we know it.  Some of you are bannermen of House Tyrell.  But House Tyrell is in open rebellion against the Crown.  With their help the Mad King's daughter has ferried an army of savages to our shores.  Mindless Unsullied soldiers who will destroy your castles and your holdfasts.  Dothraki heathens who will burn your villages to the ground, rape and enslave your women, and butcher your children without a second thought.  This is how Olenna Tyrell rewards centuries of service and loyalty.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The lords begin murmuring amongst themselves.

You all remember the Mad King.  You remember the horrors he inflicted upon his people.  His daughter is no different.  In Essos her brutality is already legendary.  She crucified hundreds of noblemen in Slaver's Bay.  And when she grew bored of that, she fed them to her dragons.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The lords murmur louder
It is my solemn duty to protect the people, and I will but I need your help, My Lords.  We must stand together, all of us, if we hope to stop her.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: RANDYLL TARLEY slowly approaches the throne.
She has three full-grown dragons, Your Grace.  The same as Aegon when he conquered the Seven Kingdoms.  How do you propose to stop them?
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: CERSEI glances over to QYBURN.
We are currently at work on a solution, My Lord.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: The meeting disbands.  All the lords walk out into the hall outside of the throne room.  JAIME approaches RANDYLL TARLEY and begins to walk with him.
Lord Tarley.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Ser, Jaime.  I believe you know my son.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: Ser, Jaime.
Speaker: DICKON

Text: Rickon, isn't it?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Dickon.
Speaker: DICKON

Text: That's it.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME walks past Dickon and begins a discussion with Randyll
Thank you for coming.  The other lords of the Reach look to you for guidance now more than ever.  They might not have come if you hadn't.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: If my queen summons me, I answer the call.  And I've heard what she does to those that defy her.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: JAIME and RANDYLL walk to an unoccupied hallway and continue their conversation.
Do you ride for Hornhill today?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I have an army to mobilize.  It won't be long until the fighting starts.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: And what side will you be fighting for?  You were the only man to defeat Robert Baratheon in battle.  Not even Rhaegar Targaryen could --
Speaker: JAIME

Text: It's a long ride back to the reach, Ser Jaime.  How may I serve?
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: I want you to be my ranking general in the wars to come.  I want you to swear allegiance to Cersei and I want you to help her destroy her enemies.  All of her enemies.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Including Olenna Tyrell?  I'm a Tarley.  That name means something.  We're not oath breakers.  We're not schemers.  We don't stab our rivals in the back or cut their throats at weddings.   I swore an oath to House Tyrell.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: You swore an oath to the Crown as well, Lord Tarley.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I've known Olenna since I was a child.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: She was a great woman, once.  Now she's broken.  She wants revenge so badly she brought the Dothraki to our shores.  The Dothraki in Westeros for the first time in history.  I know you don't like my sister, but you have to make a choice.  Do you fight with us or with the foreign savages and eunuchs?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: RANDYLL nods his head in agreement
When the war is won the queen will need a new warden of the south.  I can think of no better man than Randyll Tarley.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: ARCHMAESTER MARWYN, SAMWELL and JORAH are standing together in the quarantine room.  JORAH's upper body is covered in Greyscale except his face.
The infection has spread too far.  You should have cut off your arm the moment you were touched.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: How long?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: It will be years before it kills you.  It could be 10, could be 20.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: But how long 'till...
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Your mind?  Six months, maybe fewer.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: JORAH sighs and sits down on his bed.  SAMWELL approaches MARWYN.
Pardon, Archmaester.  I met Stannis Baratheon's daughter at Castle Black.  She had Greyscale as a baby and was cured.  Isn't there some way --
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Does this look like a baby to you?
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: No.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Have you studied the varying rates of Greyscale progression in infants and fully grown men?
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: No.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Maester Chrissen discovered Shireen Baratheon's affliction immediately.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: MARWYN turns to face JORAH.

This is quite advanced and beyond our skills, Ser.  Were you a commoner I'd have you shipped to Valyria at once to live out your life with the Stone Men.  As an anointed Knight I'll allow you one more day.  How you choose to spend that time is up to you.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: JORAH nods his head.  MARWYN turns to leave the room and begins walking to the door.
Come, Samwell.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: Should we send word to your family, Ser...
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Jorah.  Jorah Mormont.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Mormont?
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: There's no need.  I've been dead to them for years.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: MARWYN is waiting for SAMWELL in the hallway
Come, Samwell.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: SAMWELL turns and walks out of the room.  He closes the door to the quarantine room.
QYBURN and CERSEI are walking along the torch lit dungeon passing the dragon skulls.
Have you ever been down here, Your Grace?
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: No, I can't say I have.  I haven't seen these since Robert had them removed from the Throne Room.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Curious that King Robert did not have them destroyed.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: They were his trophies.  He couldn't keep them around.  They would have made him look small.  Sometimes he would come down here and look at them.  I believe he brought his whores on occasion.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: QYBURN and CERSEI arrive at the end of the dungeon.  They are looking at the largest dragon skull in the room.
Balerion the Dread.  The beast that Aegon rode across the sea.  Its flames forged the Iron Throne and brought the Seven Kingdoms to heel.  Powerful, but not invincible.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: QYBURN turns and starts walking away from the dragon skull.
Apparently one of Daenarys' dragons was wounded by spears in the fighting pits of Meereen.  If they can be wounded, they can be killed.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: QYBURN walks up to a machine covered by a cloth.  He reaches up and removes the cloth revealing an artillery-sized crossbow aimed at Balerion's skull.
The finest artilleters and blacksmiths in King's Landing have been laboring day and night, Your Grace.  If you'd kindly pull that lever.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: CERSEI releases a lever on the machine and launches a giant bolt directly into Balerion's eye socket.  The bolt buries deep into the skull and gets stuck.  CERSEI stands behind the machine smirking.
DAENERYS, YARA GREYJOY, THEON GREYJOY, ELLARIA SAND, OLENNA TYRELL, VARYS, GREY WORM, MISSANDEI, and TYRION LANNISTER are standing around a carved table of Westeros having a discussion.
If you want the Iron Throne, take it.  We have an army, a fleet, and three dragons.  We should hit King's Landing now.  Hard.  With everything we have.  The city will fall within a day.
Speaker: YARA

Text: If we turn the dragons loose, tens of thousands will die in the firestorms.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: ELLARIA looks at TYRION with disgust.
It's called war.  You don't have the stomach for it, scurry back into hiding.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: I know how you wage war.  We don't poison little girls here.  Myrcella was innocent.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She was a Lannister.  There are no innocent Lannisters.  My greatest regret is that Oberyn died fighting for you.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: That's enough.  Tyrion is the Hand of the Queen.  You will treat him with respect.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS pauses for a moment.
I am not here to be queen of the ashes.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: OLENNA addresses DAENERYS from across the table.

That's very nice to hear.  Of course, I can't remember a queen who was better loved than my grand daughter.  The common people loved her, the nobles loved her.  And what is left of her now?  Ashes.  Commoners, nobles, they're all just children really.  They won't obey you unless they fear you.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: I'm grateful to you, Lady Olenna, for your council.  I'm grateful to all of you.  But you have chosen to follow me.  I will not attack King's Landing.  We will not attack King's Landing.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Then how do you mean to take the Iron Throne?  By asking nicely?
Speaker: OLEANNA

Text: We will lay siege to the capital surrounding the city on all sides.  Cersei will have the Iron Throne but no food for her army or the people.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: But we won't use Dothraki and Unsullied.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION begins walking around the carved table of Westeros.
Cersei will try to rally the lords of Westeros by appealing to their loyalty, their love for their country.  If we besiege the city with foreigners, we prove her point.  Our army should be Westerosi.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And I suppose we're providing the Westerosi?
Speaker: ELLIA

Text: You are.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION reaches down and picks up a figurine that resembles a Kraken in a longship.
Lady Greyjoy will escort you home to Sunspear and her Iron Fleet will ferry the Dornish army back up to King's Landing.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION walks to the south of the map and picks up a figurine that resembles a sun.  He takes both figurines and places them at King's Landing.
The Dornish will lay siege to the capital alongside the Tyrell army.  Two great kingdoms united against Cersei.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: So, your master plan is to use our armies?  Forgive me for asking, but why did you bother to bring your own?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: TYRION reaches down and picks up the figurine resembling an Unsullied helmet.  He begins walking back around the map of Westeros.

The unsullied will have another objective.  For decades House Lannister has been the true power in Westeros.  And the seat of that power is Casterly Rock.  Grey Worm and the Unsullied will sail for the Rock and take it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION stops in front of Casterly Rock.  There is a figurine that resembles a lion.  He knocks the lion over with the Unsullied figurine.  Everyone in the room nods in agreement.
Do I have your support?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You have mine.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Dorne is with you, Your Grace.
Speaker: ELLIA

Text: Lady Olenna nods her head in agreement.
Thank you all.  Lady Olenna, may I speak with you alone?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Everyone except DAENERYS and OLENNA leave the Chamber of the Painted Table.  DAENERYS walks to the end and sits next to OLENNA.
I realize you're here out of hatred for Cersei and not love for me.  But I swear to you she will pay for what she's done and we will bring peace back to Westeros.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Peace.  Do you think that's what we had under your father or his father or his?  Peace never lasts, my dear.  Would you take a bit of advice from an old woman?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: DAENERYS nods her hod in agreement

He's a clever man, your Hand.  I've known a great many clever men.  I've outlived them all.  Do you know why?  I ignored them.  The lords of Westeros are sheep.  Are you a sheep?  No.  You're a dragon.  Be a dragon.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: GREY WORM is sitting sharpening his sword.  Someone knocks on his door.  He begins speaking Valyrian.
Enter.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: MISSANDEI walks in.  She speaks in English.
You leave tomorrow.  Were you going to say goodbye?
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: I will see you when I return.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: But you don't know when that will be.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: No one knows.
Speaker: GREYWORM

Text: I wish you good fortune.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: MISSANDEI turns and starts to walk out of the room.
Missandei --
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: MISSANDEI stops and turns back towards GREY WORM.
It is hard for me to say goodbye to you.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Why?
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: You know why.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: I don't.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: You are my weakness.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: MISSANDEI appears offended.
That's what I am?  Your weakness?
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: When Unsullied are young their masters learn their fears.  One boy is scared of dogs.  One boy hates high places.  One is frightened of the ocean.  They make the boy sleep with dogs or climb a cliff.  They throw him in the water.  If he learns to swim, good.  If he drowns, good.  Either way, strong Unsullied.  But I had no fears.  I was never the biggest, never the strongest, but I was bravest always.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: I believe it.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Until I meet Missandei from the Isle of Naarth.  Now I have fear.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: I do too.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: GREY WORM steps forward and kisses MISSANDEI.  MISSANDEI grabs his hands and stops him.  She begins to undress herself.  MISSANDEI steps forward and begins to undress GREY WORM.
No.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: I want to see you.  Please.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: GREY WORM hesitates for a moment, then nods his head in agreement.  MISSANDEI finishes undressing GREY WORM.  Sex scene ensues.
MARWYN and SAMWELL are walking by various shelves in the library.  SAMWELL is carrying a stack of books for MARWYN.
It might be useful.  Fouthen was a dreadful writer but an excellent researcher.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: Archmaester, I wanted to --
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: And this one.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: MARWYN places another book on the stack SAMWELL is carrying.
Maester Faol was quite the opposite.  A brilliant stylist who invented half the stories he tells.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: MARWYN continues walking
I wanted to ask you --
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: If you need to write histories, Tarley, you have to do the research.  If you want people to read your histories, you need a bit of style.  I'm not writing the Chronicle of the Wars Following the Death of King Robert the First so it can sit on a shelf unread.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: SAMWELL says nothing.
What?  You don't like the title?  What would you call it then?
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: Possibly something a bit more poetic?
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: We're not poets, Tarley.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: Archmaester, if I could just have a moment.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: This is your moment.  Use it wisely.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: MARWYN begins looking through books on the shelf.
I may have found a way to treat Ser Jorah.  There are two recorded cases of advanced Greyscale being cured.  I found the procedure in the Study of Rare Diseases by Archmaester Pilos.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: MARWYN places a book on SAMWELL's stack.  He continues looking at more books.
I'm familiar with Archmaester Pylos and the Study of Rare Diseases.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: Oh, you are?
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Yes.  Should I tell you how he died?  From Greyscale.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: MARWYN places another book on SAMWELL's stack.
Oh.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: The procedure is far too dangerous which is why it's now forbidden.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: MARWYN turns and walks out of the library.
QUARANTINE ROOMS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: A few hours have passed.  JORAH is writing a letter to DAENERYS by candlelight in his quarantine room.  He hears a noise in the hallway and stands to face the door.  SAMWELL opens the door and rolls in a cart filled with medical tools and containers.
Hello.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: What are you doing?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You're Jorah Mormont.  You're the only son of Jeor Mormont.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: SAMWELL picks up a roll of leather and sets it on the table.  He unrolls it revealing an assortment of scalpels and knives.

My name is Samwell Tarley.  I'm a sworn brother of the Night's Watch training to serve as maester of Castle Black.  I knew your father.  I was with him when he died.  You're not dying today, Ser Jorah.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: SAMWELL picks up a large flask and hands it to JORAH.
Drink this.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: What is it?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Rum.  Drink it all, please.  I'm afraid this is going to hurt.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: JORAH reaches for the bottle.  SAMWELL grabs it back and drinks some himself before handing it back to JORAH.  JORAH drains the flask.  SAMWELL picks up a thick book from the medical cart and sets it on the table.
If you could take off your shirt.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: SAMWELL gives JORAH a strap made of leather.
If you wouldn't mind, bite down hard.  I'm sorry but no one knows I'm here.  If they hear you screaming then we're both finished.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Have you ever done this before?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: No.  No one else will try, so I'm the best you've got.  Have a seat.  I'm going to remove the entire layer of infected tissue, then apply a medicinal ointment to the --
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: JORAH looks at SAMWELL to stop him from explaining.  SAMWELL picks up a pair of tweezers and a scalpel.  He grabs a section of Greyscale to cut it off.  JORAH recoils in pain.
Shh,  shhh.  Again, I'm sorry.  Please try not to scream.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: SAMWELL cuts into the Greyscale.  JORAH begins to writhe in agony and whimper.  Pus is dripping from the wound.  SAMWELL continues cutting and slices a layer of Greyscale off JORAH's skin.
INN AT THE CROSSROADS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Two men are at a table having a conversation.
They say her dragons are bigger than Aegons.
Speaker: MAN #1

Text: Horse shit.  Cersei is just trying to frighten us.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: If it's true, if she lays siege to King's Landing prices will triple.
Speaker: MAN #1

Text: The camera zooms out showing Arya eavesdropping on the men.
As long as we get back there before they start.
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: One more round.  It's a long ride.
Speaker: MAN #1

Text: A waiter approaches Arya's table.
Ary!
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Hello, Hot Pie.  Sit down.  Who's that for?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Arya reaches over and grabs a potpie from the tray and starts eating it.
Mmm.  This is good.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You think so?  The secret is browning the butter before making the dough.  Most people don't don't do that because it takes up too much time.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: I didn't do that.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You've been making pies?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: One or two.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I can't believe you're here.  Did you meet the big lady?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Big lady?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The lady knight.  I figured she was a knight because she had armor on.  She was looking for your sister but I told her about you.  Did she ever find you?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: She found me.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: What happened to you Ary?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: ARYA pauses and doesn't answer HOT PIE.
You got any ale?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Hot Pie starts to reach for a pitcher on the tray.  Arya reaches over and grabs it before him, pouring herself a cup.
Where are you heading?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: King's Landing.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Why?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: I heard Cersei's queen now.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I heard she blew up the Great Sept.  That must have been something to see.  Boom.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Hmm.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Arya nods in agreement.
I can't believe someone could do that.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Cersei would do that.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I thought you'd be heading for Winterfell.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Why would I go there?  The Boltons have it.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: No.  The Boltons are dead.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Arya stops eating and drops her food.
What?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Jon Snow came down from Castle Black with a Wildling army and won the Battle of the Bastards.  He's King in the North now.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: You're lying.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Why would I lie about that?  He's your brother right?
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: ARYA starts picking up her things to leave.
Thanks for the pie.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Arya reaches to her side and produces a bag of gold.  She starts to open the pouch.
Friends don't pay.  I can't believe I thought you were a boy.  You're pretty.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: Thanks.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Arya stands and walks past Hot Pie.  She turns and puts her hand on his shoulder.
Take care of yourself, Hot Pie.  Try not to get killed.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: No, I won't.  I'm like you, Ary.  I'm a survivor.
Speaker: HOT PIE

Text: ARYA turns and exits the Inn
EXT. INN AT THE CROSSROADS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: ARYA climbs on her horse.  She looks towards the south, then the north.  She makes a decision and turns around to head back north.  She rides off into the distance.
JON is bent over his desk looking at maps.  There's a knock at the door.
Come in.
Speaker: JON

Text: A raven, My King, from the Citadel.
Speaker: WOLKAN

Text: JON begins reading the scroll.

The room is filled with northern lords and ladies including SANSA, JON, BRIENNE, LYANNA MORMONT, ROBETT GLOVER, YOHN ROYCE, and PETER BAELISH.  JON is standing in the great hall holding a message up for the lords to see.

This message was sent to me by Samwell Tarley.  He was my brother at the Night's Watch.  A man I trust as much as anyone in this world.  He's discovered proof that Dragonstone sits on a mountain of Dragonglass.
Speaker: JON

Text: The lords murmur amongst themselves.  JON hands the first note to ROBETT GLOVER.  JON holds up a different note for the lords to see.
I received this a few days ago from Dragonstone.  It was sent to me by Tyrion Lannister.
Speaker: JON

Text: The lords murmur louder.

He's now Hand of the Queen to Daenerys Targaryen.  She intends to take the Iron Throne from Cersei Lannister.  She has a powerful army at her back and if this message is to be believed, three dragons.
Speaker: JON

Text: The lords speak among themselves and look concerned.
Lord Tyrion has invited me to Dragonstone to meet with Daenerys and I'm going to accept.
Speaker: JON

Text: There is a negative outcry from the lords gathered in the hall
We need this Dragonglass, My Lords.  We know that Dragonglass can destroy both White Walkers and their army.  We need to mine it and turn it into weapons.
Speaker: JON

Text: The lords nod in agreement

But more importantly, we need allies.  The Night King's army grows larger by the day.  We can't defeat them on our own.  We don't have the numbers.  Daenerys has her own army and she has dragon fire.  I need to try and persuade her to fight with us.  Ser Davos and I will ride for White Harbor tomorrow, then sail for Dragonstone.
Speaker: JON

Text: Have you forgotten what happened to our grandfather?  The Mad King invited him to King's Landing and roasted him alive.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I know that.
Speaker: JON

Text: She is here to reclaim the Iron Throne and the Seven Kingdoms.  The north is one of those seven kingdoms.  This isn't an invitation, it's a trap.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: It could be, but I don't believe Tyrion would do that.  You know him.  He's a good man.
Speaker: JON

Text: YOHN ROYCE stands up and turns to face JON.
Your Grace, with respect I must agree with Lady Sansa.  I remember the Mad King all too well.  A Targaryen cannot be trusted, nor can a Lannister.
Speaker: YOHN ROYCE

Text: The lords shout in agreement.
We called your brother king, and then he rode south and lost his kingdom.
Speaker: ROBETT GLOVER

Text: Winter is here, Your Grace.  We need the King in the North in the north.
Speaker: LYANNA MORMONT

Text: The lords pound the tables in agreement.

You all crowned me your king.  I never wanted it, I never asked for it, but I accepted it because the north is my home.  It's part of me and I will never stop fighting for it, no matter the odds.  But the odds are against us.  None of you have seen the Army of the Dead.  None of you.  We can never hope to defeat them alone.  We need allies, powerful allies.  I know it's a risk.  But I have to take it.
Speaker: JON

Text: Then send an emissary.  Don't go yourself.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Daenerys is a queen.  Only a king can convince her to help us.  It has to be me.
Speaker: JON

Text: You're abandoning your people.  Your abandoning your home.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I'm leaving both in good hands.
Speaker: JON

Text: Whose?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Yours.  You are my sister.  You are the only Stark in Winterfell.  Until I return, the north is yours.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON stands in the torchlit crypt looking at a statue of Ned Stark.  LORD BAELISH approaches him.
I delivered his bones myself.  I presented them to Lady Catlyn as a gesture of goodwill from Tyrion Lannister.  It seems like a lifetime ago.  Do give Lord Tyrion my best when you see him.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Baelish looks up at the statue of Ned Stark.

I was sorry when he died.  Your father and I had our differences but he loved Cat very much.  So did I.  She wasn't fond of you, was she?  Well, it appears she vastly underestimated you.  Your father and brothers are gone, yet here you stand King in the North.  Last best hope against the coming storm.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: JON turns to face BAELISH.
You don't belong down here.
Speaker: JON

Text: Forgive me.  We have never talked properly.  I wanted to remedy that.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: I have nothing to say to you.
Speaker: JON

Text: Not even thank you?  If it weren't for me you'd have been slaughtered at that battlefield.  You have many enemies, My King, but I swear to you I'm not one of them.  I love Sansa as I loved her mother.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: JON grabs BAELISH by the throat and pushes him against the wall.  BAELISH begins choking.
Touch my sister and I'll kill you myself.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON releases BAELISH.  JON turns and walks to exit the crypt.

JON walks into the courtyard towards his horse.  SER DAVOS is seated on his own horse awaiting him.  JON climbs onto his horse and looks back.  He sees SANSA on the upper level of the courtyard.  JON waves goodbye and SANSA waves back.  JON, DAVOS and Winterfell guards ride out of the gate and exit the courtyard.  BAELISH exits from the crypt looking shaken.
RIVERLANDS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: ARYA is building a fire.  Her horse is tied to a tree.  The horse begins to whinny.  ARYA stands and grabs her sword from beside the fire.  Multiple wolves come from the woods and begin to circle her.  A large grey and white dire wolf approaches her barring teeth.
Nymeria?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA sets her sword down and begins to approach the dire wolf.
Nymeria, it's me, Arya.  I'm heading north, girl, back to Winterfell.  I'm finally going home.  Come with me.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA stretches her hand out towards the dire wolf.
Come with me.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The dire wolf turns and begins to leave.  All the other wolves walk away with it.  ARYA whispers to herself.
That's not you.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: SEA OF DORNE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: It's nighttime.  There are dozens of ships sailing on the Sea of Dorne.
ELLARIA SAND's daughters TYENE, OBARA, and NYMERIA are laying in hammocks next to each other having a conversation.
You can't have them all.  It's not fair.
Speaker: NYMERIA

Text: I'm oldest.
Speaker: OBARA

Text: Momma will want Cersei for herself.
Speaker: TYENE

Text: She's not my momma.  You can have Cersei.  I want The Mountain.
Speaker: OBARA

Text: The Mountain killed father.  He'll crush you with one hand.
Speaker: NYMERIA

Text: Father got careless.  That's what Momma says.
Speaker: TYENE

Text: Will you shut up about Momma?  Momma, momma.
Speaker: OBARA

Text: OBARA begins mocking TYENE.
Maybe I'll kill you both before we take King's Landing and then I won't have to share.
Speaker: TYENE

Text: OBARA and NYMERIA mock TYENE in unison.
YARA GREYJOY, ELLARIA SAND are seated at a table drinking together.  THEON GREYJOY is standing next to them.
How can you drink this piss?  When we reach Sunspear I'll treat you to a Dornish red, the best in the world.  Have you ever been to Dorne?
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: A few times.  Never stayed long.
Speaker: YARA

Text: A boy in every port?
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: A boy, a girl.  Depends on the port.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Could we get some more?
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: ELLARIA hands her empty cup back to THEON.
I thought it wasn't for you.
Speaker: YARA

Text: I'm developing a taste for it.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: YARA looks at THEON
He's not your servant.
Speaker: YARA

Text: It's fine.
Speaker: THEON

Text: THEON begins filling the cup from a barrel of wine.
So, you're going to be Queen of the Iron Islands.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: Once I kill my uncle.
Speaker: YARA

Text: And what will you be, handsome?
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: ELLARIA stands and gropes THEON.
Whatever my queen demands.
Speaker: THEON

Text: He'll be my advisor, my protector.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Oh, I see.  Your protector.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: ELLARIA slowly walks towards YARA.
So if someone gets too close to you --
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: He might have to intervene.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Until they've made their intentions known.
Speaker: YARA

Text: ELLARIA sits next to YARA and spreads her legs apart, then looks at THEON.
Why are you standing all the way over there then?  A foreign invasion is under way.  It seems like you don't need a protector.
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: A large crash is heard and the ship rocks back and forth.  YARA turns to ELLARIA.
Stay here.
Speaker: YARA

Text: YARA stands, picks up her sword and rushes for the stairs to the upper deck.  THEON follows her.

YARA climbs onto the deck and sees mayhem.  There are flaming arrows and flares in the sky.  YARA turns to survey the madness.  A ship bearing the Greyjoy sigil comes sailing out of the smoke and fog directly at YARA's ship.
Euron.
Speaker: YARA

Text: EURON'S ship crashes into YARA's.  An armored gang plank is dropped onto YARA's ship.  Euron Greyjoy is riding on top of the plank as it crashes onto YARA's ship.  A sailor is crushed in the process.  Euron boards YARA's boat and begins cutting men down with an ax and laughing maniacally.  Dozens of men are rushing behind him to board YARA'S ship.  YARA and THEON both yell and leap into battle.  Many people are killed instantly.  More men are running over the gang plank.  TYENE SAND comes from below deck.  She throws a dagger and lodges it in an invader's eye.  She moves to the body to retrieve her knife.  YARA approaches her and kneels beside her.
Your mother is below deck.  Keep her safe.
Speaker: YARA

Text: TYENE nods in agreement.  She stands up and heads down into the captain's quarters.

TYENE walks down the stairs and sees her mother, ELLARIA SAND.  TYENE runs to her mother and hugs her.  Immediately three men climb down the stairs and surround the women.  TYENE begins striking at the invaders with her knife.

THEON is fighting several men with his sword.  He cuts down two men and looks at YARA.  YARA looks around her at the scene.  Severel ships are engulfed in flames.  Flaming arrows are streaking in and men are shouting.  A flaming bolt flies through the air and hits YARA's mast causing it to burst into flames.  More men are rushing from EURON'S boat onto the deck.  YARA is slowly walking and watching the scene unfold.  She then turns and continues fighting.  EURON is cutting through men with ease.  He has just killed another when a whip lashes around his throat.  NYMERIA pulls on the whip and brings EURON towards her.  Euron turns and punches her in the face.  OBARA comes from behind EURON and stabs him in his arm.  He is knocked to the ground but quickly regains his feet.  They continue fighting
TYENE is still fighting the men.  She slices one man and stabs another in the testicles.

OBARA attempts to attack EURON again.  He blocks her attack and disarms her spear.  EURON grabs her by the throat and headbutts her then pushes her to her knees.  He rams her spear through her stomach and lifts her off the ground.  NYMERIA turns and sees her sister and screams, running at EURON.  She whips him several times but EURON graps the end of the whip and pulls NYMERIA towards him.  She is attacking with a knife.  EURON punches her and knocks her down.  EURON then takes NYMERIA'S whip and wraps it around her throat choking her.
TYENE is now getting overpowered by the men.  They punch her and grab her from behind.  One of the men walks to ELLARIA and grabs her.
Kill us!  Get it over with!
Speaker: ELLARIA

Text: The man in charge smirks at ELLARIA and shakes his head.  The men begin to push ELLARIA and TYENE upstairs to take them as hostages.
Nearly every ship in YARA's fleet is burning.  There are flaming bolts in the sky.  YARA spots EURON below her.  She jumps from the upper deck and knocks EURON down.  He gets back up.
Give your uncle a kiss.
Speaker: EURON

Text: YARA quickly steps forward and slaps EURON.  They begin fighting.  YARA is being overpowered by EURON.
Theon!
Speaker: EURON

Text: THEON is still fighting.  He hears his uncle's yell and turns to look.  EURON is holding YARA and has his ax to her neck.  THEON stops and is frozen in place.  EURON begins smirking at him.
Ah, come on your cockless hound.  I have her.  Come and get her.
Speaker: EURON

Text: THEON is looking around.  Men are being killed and everything is on fire.  One invader is pulling someone's teeth out.  THEON begins to shake and whimper.  His eye twitches.  He turns, drops his sword and jumps off of the rail of the ship into the water.  EURON begins to laugh and look at YARA.
SEA OF DORNE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: THEON is in the water holding onto some flotsam.  He is watching the ships burn and the Iron Fleet sail away into the distance.
END CREDITS
The bastard of Winterfell.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The dwarf of Casterly Rock.
Speaker: JON

Text: TYRION and JON both stare at each for a moment, then break into a smile.  They step forward and shake hands.
I believe we last saw each other on top of the wall.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You were pissing off the edge, if I remember right.  You picked up some scars along the road.
Speaker: JON

Text: TYRION nods his head in agreement.
It's been a long road.  But we're both still here.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION turns to address DAVOS.
I'm Tyrion Lannister.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Davos Seaworth.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: TYRION and DAVOS shake hands.
Ah, the Onion Knight.  We fought on opposite sides at the Battle of Blackwater Bay.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Unluckily for me.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Missandei is the queen's most trusted advisor.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Welcome to Dragonstone.  Our queen knows this is a long journey.  She appreciates the effort you have made on her behalf.  If you wouldn't mind handing over your weapons.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: JON looks at DAVOS and his men.
Of course.
Speaker: JON

Text: The Dothraki guard move to take the weapons.  JON unties his sword and hands it over.  The Dothraki pick up JON's boat and begin to carry it away.
Please, this way.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: DAVOS begins walking with MISSANDEI and TYRION.  JON is following a few steps behind.
Where are you from?  I can't place the accent.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I was born on the Island of Naarth.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Ah.  I hear it's beautiful down there.  Palm trees and butterflies.  I haven't been myself.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: MISSANDEI nods and DAVOS slows pace to talk with JON.
This place has changed.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The group are making their way up to Dragonstone along a narrow stone pathway built into the cliffs leading to the castle.  TYRION begins speaking to JON.
And Sansa, I hear she's alive and well.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She is.
Speaker: JON

Text: Does she miss me terribly?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JON looks at TYRION and doesn't say anything.
A sham marriage and unconsummated.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I didn't ask --
Speaker: JON

Text: Well, it was.  It wasn't.  Anyway, she's much smarter than she lets on.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She's starting to let on.
Speaker: JON

Text: Good.  At some point I want to hear how a Knight's Watch recruit became King in the North.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: As long as you tell me how a Lannister became Hand to Daenerys Targaryen.
Speaker: JON

Text: A long and bloody tale.  To be honest, I was drunk for most of it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: My bannermen think I'm a fool for coming here.
Speaker: JON

Text: Of course they do.  If I was your hand I would have advised against it.  General rule of thumb, Stark men don't fare well when they travel south.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: True.  But I'm not a Stark.
Speaker: JON

Text: A loud roar is heard from overhead.  JON and DAVOS dive to the ground.  Drogon flies over them, turns and flies over the castle.  JON and DAVOS look at each other in astonishment.  DAVOS looks back to MISSANDEI who is still standing and smirking.  Tyrion walks over and helps JON up to his feet.
I'd say you get used to them, but you never really do.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JON looks back to the sky.  All three dragons are circling above the castle.
Come.  Their mother is waiting for you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JON and DAVOS exchange glances.  They continue walking up the path.  The camera shifts focus to MELISANDRE who is far above the group watching them from a cliff.  VARYS approaches MELISANDRE from behind and stands next to her.
I wondered why you weren't there to meet our guests.  You begged us to summon the King in the North.  Don't you want to see him again?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I've done my part.  I've brought ice and fire together.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Strange.  You spoke so highly of Jon Snow but when he arrives you hide on a cliff.  I didn't take you for a bashful girl.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: My time whispering in the ears of kings has come to an end.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Oh, I doubt that.  Give us common folk one taste of power we're like the lion who tasted man.  Nothing is ever so sweet again.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Neither of us is common folk anymore.  I did not part on good terms with the King in the North, or his advisor.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Why?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Because of mistakes I made.  Terrible mistakes.  I would only be a distraction if I stayed.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: So where will you go?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Volantis.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: Good.  If you don't mind my saying, I don't think you should return to Westeros.  I'm not sure you'd be safe here.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I will return, dear spider.  One last time.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: VARYS begins shaking his head.
My Lady --
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I have to die in this strange country, just like you.
Speaker: MELISANDRE

Text: MELISANDRE turns and walks away leaving VARYS alone on the cliff.

JON approaches the throne room.  Dothraki guards open the doors and allow him in.  He is walking with TYRION, MISSANDEI, DAVOS and other Dothraki guards.  DAENERYS is sitting on the throne.  MISSANDEI begins addressing JON and DAVOS.

You stand in the presence of Daenerys Stormborn of House Targaryen, rightful heir to the Iron Throne, rightful Queen of the Andals and the First Men, Protector of the Seven Kingdoms, the Mother of Dragons, the Khaleesi of the Great Grass Sea, The Unburnt, The Breaker of Chains.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: JON turns and looks at DAVOS.
This is Jon Snow.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS nods and pauses.
He's King in the North.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: TYRION smirks to himself.
Thank you for traveling so far, My Lords.  I hope the seas weren't too rough.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The winds were kind, Your Grace.
Speaker: JON

Text: Apologies.  I have a Flea Bottom accent, I know.  But Jon Snow is King in the North, Your Grace.  He's not a lord.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Forgive me --
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your Grace, this is Ser Davos Seaworth.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Forgive me, Ser Davos.  I never did receive a formal education, but I could have sworn the last King in the North was Torren Stark who bent the knee to my ancestor Aegon Targaryen in exchange for his life and the lives of the northmen.  Torren Stark swore fealty to House Targaryen in perpetuity.  But do I have my facts wrong?
Speaker: DAERNEYS

Text: I wasn't there, Your Grace.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Forever.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Forever.  So I assume, My Lord, that you're here to bend the knee.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I am not.
Speaker: JON

Text: Oh.  Well, that is unfortunate.  You've travelled all this way to break faith with House Targaryen?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Break faith?  Your father burned my grandfather alive.  He burned my uncle alive.  He would have burned the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: JON

Text: My father was an evil man.  On behalf of House Targaryen I ask your forgiveness for the crimes he committed against your family.  And I ask you not to judge a daughter by the sins of her father.  Our two houses were allies for centuries.  Those were the best centuries the kingdom's ever known.  Centuries of peace and prosperity with the Targaryens sitting on the Iron Throne and a Stark serving as Warden of the North.  I am the last Targaryen, Jon Snow.  Honor the pledge your ancestor made to mine.  Bend the knee and I will name you Warden of the North.  Together we will save this country from those who would destroy it.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You're right.  You're not guilty of your father's crime.  And I'm not beholden to my ancestor's vows.
Speaker: JON

Text: Then why are you here?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Because I need your help and you need mine.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS smirks and looks over at TYRION.  She starts speaking to JON again.
Did you see three dragons flying overhead when you arrived?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I did.
Speaker: JON

Text: And did you see the Dothraki, all of whom have sworn to kill for me?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They're hard to miss.
Speaker: JON

Text: But still, I need your help?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Not to defeat Cersei.  You could storm King's Landing tomorrow and the city would fall.  Hell, we almost took it and we didn't even have dragons.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Almost.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: But you haven't stormed King's Landing.  Why not?  The only reason I can see is you don't want to kill thousands of innocent people.  It's the fastest way to win the war but you won't do it.  Which means at the very least you're better than Cersei.
Speaker: JON

Text: Still, that doesn't explain why I need your help.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Because right now you and I and Cersei and everyone else, we're children playing at a game screaming that the rules aren't fair.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS turns to TYRION.
You told me you liked this man.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I do.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: In the time since he's met me he's refused to call me queen, he's refused to bow and now he's calling me a child.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I believe he's calling all of us children.  Figure of speech.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Your Grace, everone you know will die before winter is over if we don't defeat the enemy to the north.
Speaker: JON

Text: As far as I can see, you are the enemy to the north.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I am not your enemy.  The dead are the enemy.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS pauses and is incredulous.
The dead?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS addresses TYRION.
Is that another figure of speech?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON answers her before Tyrion.
The Army of the Dead is on the march.
Speaker: JON

Text: The Army of the Dead?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You don't know me well, My Lord, but do you think I am a liar or a madman?
Speaker: JON

Text: No, I don't think you're either of those things.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The Army of the Dead is real.  The White Walkers are real.  The Knight King is real.  I've seen them.  If they get past the wall and we're squabbling amongst ourselves --
Speaker: JON

Text: JON begins walking closer to the throne.  The Dothraki guards step towards him to halt him.
DAENERYS pauses a moment.
I was born at Dragonstone.  Not that I can remember it.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS stands from the throne and begins walking down the stairs towards JON.

We fled before Robert's assassins could find us.  Robert was your father's best friend, no?  I wonder if your father knew his best friend sent assassins to murder a baby girl in her crib.  Not that it matters now of course.  I spent my life in foreign lands.  So many men have tried to kill me.  I don't remember all of their names.  I have been sold like a brood mare.  I have been chained and betrayed, raped and defiled.  Do you know what kept me standing through all those years in exile?  Faith.  Not in any gods.  Not in myths and legends.  In myself.  In Daenerys Targaryen.  The world hadn't seen a dragon in centuries until my children were born.  The Dothraki hadn't crossed the sea.  Any sea.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS stops walking and is face to face with JON.
They did for me.  I was born to rule the Seven Kingdoms.  And I will.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You'll be ruling over a graveyard if we don't defeat the Night King.
Speaker: JON

Text: Tyrion steps up to stand next to DAENERYS and speaks to JON.
The war against my sister has already begun.  You can't expect us to halt hostilities and join you in fighting --
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION pauses a moment.
You don't believe him.  I understand that.  It sounds like nonsense.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: JON nods in agreement.

But if destiny has brough Daenerys Targaryen back to our shores, it has also made Jon Snow King in the North.  You were the first to bring Dothraki to Westeros.  He was the first to make allies with Wildlings and northmen.  He was named Lord Commander of the Night's Watch.  He was named King in the North.  Not because of his birthright.  He has no birthright.  He's a damn bastard.  All those hard son's of bitches chose him as their leader because they believe in him.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAENERYS stops looking at DAVOS and begins looking at JON.

All those things you don't believe in, he faced those things.  He fought those things for the good of his people.  He risked his life for his people.  He took a knife in the heart for his people.  He gave his own --
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: JON looks at DAVOS to cut him off.  DAVOS stops talking.  DAENERYS and TYRION exchange glances.
If we don't put asside our enmities and band together we will die.  And then it doesn't matter whose skeleton sits on the Iron Throne.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: If it doesn't matter you might as well kneel.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JON shakes his head and looks at the floor.
Swear your allegiance to Queen Daenerys.  Help her to defeat my sister and together our armies will protect the north.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: There's no time for that.  There's no time for any of this.  While we stand here debating --
Speaker: JON

Text: It takes no time to bend the knee.  Pledge your sword to her cause.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And why would I do that?
Speaker: JON

Text: JON turns to speak to DAENERYS.

I mean no offense, Your Grace, but I don't know you.  As far as I can tell your claim to the throne rests entirely on your father's name.  And my own father fought to overthrow the Mad King.  The lords of the north placed their trust in me to lead them.  And I will continue to do so as well as I can.
Speaker: JON

Text: That's fair.  It's also fair to point out that I'm the rightful queen of the Seven Kingdoms.  By declaring yourself king of the northern most kingdom, you are in open rebellion.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: VARYS walks quickly into the throne room and approaches DAENERYS.  He begins whispering in her ear.
You must forgive my manners.  You will both be tired after your long journey.  We'll have baths drawn for you and supper sent to your rooms.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS begins speaking Valyrian to her Queensguard.  Her guard steps forward to escort JON and DAVOS.  JON speaks to DAENERYS.
Am I your prisoner?
Speaker: JON

Text: Not yet.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS begins walking back to the throne.  JON and DAVOS exit the throne room with a member of the Queensguard.  The Dothraki close the door to the throne room after JON and DAVOS exit.  VARYS begins speaking to DAENERYS.
Our Iron Born and Dornish allies were attacked on route to Dorne.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: And?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Two or three ships escaped.  The rest sunk our captured.  Ellaria and the sand snakes dead or captured.  The Greyjoys are dead or captured.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: All of them?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: SEA OF DORNE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Theon is hanging on to flotsam on the ocean.  A friendly Greyjoy ship is pulling him out of the water with a rope.  They haul him onto the ship and drop him on deck.  He is shivering and dishelveled.  The captain of the boat approaches THEON and speaks to him while THEON is laying on the deck.
Your sister's dead?
Speaker: CAPTAIN

Text: Euron has her.
Speaker: THEON

Text: You saw him take her?  And you got away?
Speaker: CAPTAIN

Text: I couldn't save her.  I tried.
Speaker: THEON

Text: You wouldn't be here if you tried.
Speaker: CAPTAIN

Text: THEON turns his eyes away from the captain.  The captain turns and walks away.  The men go back to their duties, some stepping over THEON as he continues to lay on the deck.

EURON is escorting prisoners YARA GREYJOY, ELLARIA and TYENE SAND.  The prisoners are chained.  EURON is riding a horse.  He has a rope tied to YARA's neck and is leading her towards the Red Keep.  There is a large crowd shouting and cheering as they bring the prisoners through the streets.  EURON is smiling and showing off for the crowd.  The crowd shouts obscenities and curses at the prisoners.
This is the life.  Look at them.  Cheering for a Greyjoy.
Speaker: EURON(to YARA)

Text: EURON pulls on the rope around YARA's neck forcing her to run forward to stand next to EURON's horse.
I have to be honest, it's making me hard.  Did you see little Theon's face right before he jumped overboard?
Speaker: EURON

Text: EURON begins mocking Theon in a high pitched voice.
Oh no!
Speaker: EURON

Text: EURON laughs.
What a twat.
Speaker: EURON

Text: CERSEI is sitting on the throne surrounded by QYBURN, JAIME, and THE MOUNTAIN.  There is a crowd gathered and they're clapping as EURON brings the prisoners down the aisle towards the throne.  EURON climbs down from his horse and grabs the chains that bind ELLARIA and TYENE and starts walking them to the throne.
My queen.  Please accept this gift on behalf of all of your loyal subjects in the Iron Islands.
Speaker: EURON

Text: EURON throws the chains at the feet of CERSEI.
I give you --
Speaker: EURON

Text: EURON looks over to JAIME.
ELLARIA spits onto the floor near the throne and CERSEI smiles.  CERSEI begins speaking to EURON.
You've proven yourself the greatest captain on the 14 seas and a true friend to the crown.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: EURON leans in and speaks to CERSEI so the crowd can't hear.
A bit more than a true friend.
Speaker: EURON

Text: And you deserve a proper reward for your heroism.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: There's only one reward I want.
Speaker: EURON
