Text: You shall have what your heart desires --
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: JAIME looks over at CERSEI.
CERSEI stands and addresses the people gathered in the throne room.
With Euron Greyjoy commanding our naval forces and Jaime Lannister leading our armies, the sons and daugters of Westeros shall defend our country.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The crowd starts cheering and clapping.  CERSEI turns and walks back to the throne and sits.  EURON is waving to the crowd and begins speaking to JAIME.
There's nothing quite like it, is there?  The love of the people.  I suppose you wouldn't know.
Speaker: EURON

Text: This same mob spat at my sister not long ago, and if you turn on us, they'll cheer to see your head mounted on a spike.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Or yours.  They just like severed heads really.  Listen, if you have any advice at all I'd love to hear it when we have an hour or two to speak as brothers.
Speaker: EURON

Text: Advice?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Does she like it gentle or rough?  A finger in the bum?
Speaker: EURON

Text: JAIME turns to EURON angrily.
Shhh, shhh, shhh, not now.  We'll talk later.
Speaker: EURON

Text: EURON bows to the queen.  He walks down and collects YARA and walks out with her and his guards.

THE MOUNTAIN, CERSEI and QYBURN are standing in a torch lit dungeon beneath the Red Keep.  ELLARIA and TYENE are chained to walls opposite of each other.  They are both gagged.  CERSEI speaks to ELLARIA.

I want you to know I understand.  Even though we're enemies, you and I, I understand the fear that drives you.  I was there that day when Ser Gregor crushed your lover's head.  I close my eyes I can hear the sound of Oberyn's skull breaking.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: ELLARIA struggles against her restraints

The sound of your scream.  I never heard a sound like that.  I thought, that's true love.  Oberyn looked beautiful that day.  He really did.  No one moved like him.  No one had such skill with a spear.  Even Ser Gregor couldn't stop him.  If only he hadn't taunted him.  He could have walked away and left poor Ser Gregor to die.  But that wasn't your lover's way, was it?  Now he's burried somewhere.  And here Ser Gregor is stronger than ever.  That must be difficult for you.  When my daughter was taken from me, my only daughter, well, you can't imagine how that feels unless you've lost a child.  I fed her at my own breast even though they told me to give her to the wet nurse.  I couldn't bear to see her in another woman's arms.  I never got to have a mother.  But Myrcella did.  She was mine and you took her from me.  Why did you do that?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI pauses and looks at ELLARIA.
It doesn't matter now.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI walks across the room and stands next to TYENE looking at her but continues speaking to ELLARIA.
Your daughter is a beauty too.  Brown eyes, those lips.  A perfect Dornish beauty.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: TYENE is looking from CERSEI to her mother, ELLARIA.  CERSAI stops looking at TYENE and turns back to ELLARIA.
I imagine she is your favorite.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: ELLARIA pulls on her restraints.
I know, I know, we're not supposed to have favorites.  But still, we're only human.  We love who we love.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: ELLARIA begins gasping and trying to speak through her gag.
I'm sorry.  I can't understand you.  The gag makes it difficult to understand what you're saying.  It must be frustrating.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: ELLARIA whimpers.
We all make our choices.  You chose to murder my daughter.  You must have felt powerful after you made that choice.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: ELLARIA screams and pulls against her restraints.  She takes the slack out of the chain but is held in place inches from CERSEI.

Do you feel powerful now?  I don't sleep very well, not at all really.  I lie in bed and I stare at the canopy and imagine ways of killing my enemies.  How to destroy Ellaria Sand, the woman who murdered my only daughter.  I thought about having Ser Gregor crush your skull the way he did Oberyn's.  It would be poetic I suppose but fast.  Too fast.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI turns away from ELLARIA and walks back to TYENE and takes TYENE's face in her hands.  She continues talking to ELLARIA.
I thought about having him crush your daughter's skull.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI removes the gag from TYENE's mouth.
She's so beautiful.  The thought of this lovely face cracking open like a duck egg, no, it's just not right.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI is caressing TYENE's face.  CERSEI looks at ELLARIA, then turns back and kisses TYENE.  TYENE is whimpering.  CERSEI stops kissing TYENE and looks back at ELLARIA.
Momma!
Speaker: TYENE

Text: ELLARIA screams and looks at CERSEI.  QYBURN steps to TYENE and puts the gag back on her mouth.  TYENE is crying.  QYBURN walks over to CERSEI and hands her a cloth.  ELLARIA falls down to her knees and is watching her daughter.  CERSEI starts wiping off the red lipstick she was wearing.  CERSEI speaks to ELLARIA.
Qyburn, he's the cleverest man I know.  Clever enough to learn what poison you used to murder Myrcella.  The long goodbye, was that it?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The Long Farewell.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: QYBURN hands CERSEI a vile containing the posion antidote.
That's the one.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI drinks the antidote.
How long does the poison take?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Difficult to say.  Hours, days, it depends on the subject's constitution.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: But death is certain?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Oh yes, Your Grace, quite certain.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: ELLARIA is still on her knees crying.  CERSEI squats down to talk to her.

Your daughter will die here in this cell.  You will be here watching when she does.  You will be here the rest of your days.  If you refuse to eat we will force food down your throat.  You will live to watch your daughter rot, to watch that beautiful face collapse to bone and dust all the while contemplating the choices you've made.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI continues looking at ELLARIA but speaks to QYBURN.
Make sure the guards change the torches every few hours.  I don't want her to miss a thing.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI stands and walks out of the chamber with her entourage.  TYENE and ELLARIA both strain against their chains but can't reach each other.
JAIME sets his gold hand down on the table and pours himself a glass of wine.  CERSEI barges in and approaches him.  CERSEI starts kissing JAIME.
No.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: CERSEI kisses JAIME.  JAIME stands.  CERSEI unties his pants and gets on her knees.  Sex scene ensues.  Some time has passed.  CERSEI is asleep and JAIME is watching her in bed.  There's a knock at the door.
Don't.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: CERSEI kisses JAIME, gets out of bed and covers herself with a robe.  JAIME sits up concerned.
What are you doing?  No one can see us like this ?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I am queen of the Seven Kingdoms.  I'll do as I please.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI walks over and opens the door.  A messenger looks in and sees JAIME in the bed.
Forgive me, Your Grace.  The visitor from Braavos has arrived.
Speaker: MESSENGER

Text: Good.  And we'll need fresh sheets for the bed.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: At once, Your Grace.
Speaker: MESSENGER

Text: CERSEI closes the door.  JAIME lays his head against his pillows and laughs nervously.
CERSEI is pouring two glasses of wine.  She carries them over and offers one to TYCHO NESTORIS of the Iron Bank.
No, thank you.
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: CERSEI carries both glasses to her desk and sits down.
My condolences, Your Grace, on the death of your son.  From all reports he was a fine young man.
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: The Iron Bank didn't send you hear to offer condolences.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Condolences and congratulations.  You've become the first ruling queen in the Seven Kingdoms.  That's quite an accomplishment.  The Iron Bank appreciates how you cast off the yoke of superstition freeing the crown from elements that sought to subvert the rule of law.
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: The destruction of the Sept of Baelor was a tragic accident.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Indeed.  But sometimes tragedies are necessary to restore order and rational leadership.
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: The Iron Bank wants its gold back.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your father never minced words either.  But, yes, your debts are considerable.  And you are now engaged in a conflict on several fronts.  We both know how expensive war can be.
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: And we both know gold wins wars.  Your vaults are empty.  Your late husband's profligacy saw to that.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your wealthiest ally is the Tyrells who are now your enemies.  You're surrounded on all sides by rivals for the throne.
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: And the Iron Bank wants to bet on a winner.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: We don't make bets.  We invest in endeavors we deem likely to be successful.
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: That's a fancy way of saying bet.  The war has already begun.  I've drawn first blood.  I decapitated the Dornish snake.  My armada owns the Narrow Sea.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Euron Greyjoy's armada owns the Narrow Sea.
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: Euron Greyjoy is loyal to me.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: For now.  Daenerys Targaryen has three full grown dragons.  How well do wooden ships fare against fire breathing dragons?
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: Her dragons might not be as invulnerable as some think.  Now, let's talk about the Targaryen girl.  You want to invest in her?  I'm guessing the Iron Bank invested considerable gold in the slave trade.  How are you profits now that Daenerys has freed all the slaves?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The slave trade has entered a down turn, it's true.
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: From what I gather she considers herself more of a revolutionary that a monarch.  In your experience how do bankers usually fare with revoltionaries?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: TYCHO begins to speak but CERSEI cuts him off.
The Lannisters owe the Iron Bank quite a lot of money but Lannisters always pay their debts.  Do former slaves or Dothraki or dragons?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your father's daughter indeed.
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: Give me a fortnight.  Stay in King's Landing as my honored guest and when you return to Braavos I swear to you my debt will be paid in full.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: TYRION is walking along the cliffs and sees JON standing alone looking out into the ocean.  TYRION approaches JON and speaks to him.

I came out here to brood over my failure to predict the Greyjoy attack.  You're making it difficult.  You look a lot better brooding than I do.  You make me feel like I'm failing at brooding over failing.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm a prisoner on this island.
Speaker: JON

Text: I wouldn't say you're a prisoner on this island.  You're free to walk the castle, the beaches, to go wherever you want.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Except to my ship.  They took my ship.
Speaker: JON

Text: I wouldn't say we took your ship.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm not playing word games with you.  The dead are coming for us all.
Speaker: JON

Text: Why don't you figure out what to do about my missing fleet and murdered allies, and I'll figure out what to do about your walking dead men.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It's hard for me to fathom.  It really is.  If someone told me about the White Walkers and the Night King --
Speaker: JON

Text: JON pauses and hangs his head.
You probably don't believe me.
Speaker: JON

Text: I do actually.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You didn't before.  Grumpkins and snarks you called them.  Do you remember?  You said it was all nonsense.
Speaker: JON

Text: It was all nonsense.  Everybody knew it.  But then Mormont saw them and you saw them, and I trust the eyes of an honest man more than I trust what everybody knows.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: How do I convince people who don't know me that an enemey they don't believe in is coming to kill them all?
Speaker: JON

Text: Good question.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I know it's a good question.  I'm looking for an answer.
Speaker: JON

Text: People's minds aren't made for problems that large.  White Walkers, the Night King, Army of the Dead, it's almost a relief to confront a familiar monster like my sister.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I need to help prepare my people for what's coming.  I can't help them from here.  I'd like to leave.
Speaker: JON

Text: It seems unlikely that you became King in the North by giving up that easily.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Everyone told me to learn from my father's mistakes.  Don't go south.  Don't answer a summons from the Mad King's daughter, a foreign invader.  And here I am.  A northern fool.
Speaker: JON

Text: Children are not their fathers, luckily for all of us.  And sometimes there's more to foreign invaders than northern fools that meets the eye.  Daenerys could have sailed for Westeros long ago but she didn't.  Instead she stayed where she was and saved many people from horrible fates some of whom are on this island with us right now.  While you're our guest here you might consider asking them what they think of the Mad King's daughter.  She protects people from monsters, just as you do.  That's why she came here.  And she's not about to head north to fight an enemy she's never seen on a word of a man she doesn't know after a single meeting.  That's not a reasonable thing to ask.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JON turns from TYRION and begins to walk away.
So do you have anything reasonable to ask?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JON stops and turns back around.
What do you mean?
Speaker: JON

Text: Maybe you are a northern fool.  I'm asking if there's something I can do to help you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: DAENERYS and TYRION are having a discussion.
Dragonglass?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Yes.  Volcanic glass, obsidian.  He says you have a tremendous amount of it here.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Why are we talking about glass?  We just lost two of our allies.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Which is why I was speaking to Jon Snow, a potential ally.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And what does the King in the North want with Dragonglass?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Apparently it can be turned into weapons that kill White Walkers and their foot soldiers, or stop them, destroy them.  I'm unsure of the nomenclature.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And what do you think of this Army of the Dead and White Walkers and Night Kings?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I'd very much like to believe that Jon Snow is wrong, but a wise man once said that you should never believe a thing simply because you want to believe it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Which wise man said this?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I don't remember.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Are you trying to present your own statements as ancient wisdom?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I would never do that...to you.  The reason I believe Jon Snow is because he's here.  All of his advisors would have told him not to come.  I would have told him not to come, yet he's here anyway.  You don't have to believe him.  Let him mine the Dragonglass.  If he's wrong it's worthless.  You didn't even know it was here.  It's nothing to you.  Give him something by giving him nothing.  Take a step toward a more productive relationship with a possible ally.  Keep him occupied while we focus on the task at hand.  Casterly Rock.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What was that Ser Davos said about taking a knife in the heart for his people?  Did you notice that?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You must allow them their flights of fancy.  It's dreary in the north.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: DAENERYS is at the bottom of the path looking out into the ocean.  Dragons are flying over the ocean and over the mountains in the distance.  JON approaches DAENERYS from the top of the stairs.
Amazing thing to see.
Speaker: JON

Text: I named them for my brothers Vicerys and Rhaegon. They're both gone now.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS turns to look at JON.
You lost two brothers as well?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON shakes his head.
People thought dragons were gone forever but here they are.  Perhaps we should all be examining what we think we know.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You've been talking to Tyrion?
Speaker: JON

Text: He is my Hand.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: He enjoys talking.
Speaker: JON

Text: We all enjoy what we're good at.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I don't.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS pauses and looks at JON.
You know I'm not going to let Cersei stay on the Iron Throne.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I never expected that you would.
Speaker: JON

Text: And I haven't changed my mind about which kingdoms belong to the throne.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I haven't either.
Speaker: JON

Text: I will allow you to mine the Dragonglass and forge weapons from it.  Any resources or men you need I will provide for you.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Thank you.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS turns back to the ocean.
So you believe me then about the Night King and the Army of the Dead?
Speaker: JON

Text: You better get to work, Jon Snow.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON turns and quickly walks up the stairs towards the castly.

Men are working in the courtyard rolling carts of hey and carrying water.  A blacksmith is working the forge.  SANSA, PETER BAELISH, YOHN ROYCE and MAESTER WOLKAN are standing on the upper level of the courtyard having a discussion.
How much do we have?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: 4,000 bushels, My Lady.
Speaker: WOLKAN

Text: What does that mean?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: For the current occupants of the castle it's enough food for a year, perhaps more.
Speaker: YOHN

Text: SANSA begins walking and everyone follows.
What's the longest winter in the past 100 years?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I'm not entirely certain.  I'll check Maester Llewyn's records.  He kept a copy of every raven scroll.
Speaker: WOLKAN

Text: SANSA and the men walk from the upper level down into the courtyard.
You're telling me we don't have enough food, especially not if the armies of the north come back to defend Winterfell.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: No, My Lady, most likely not.
Speaker: WOLKAN

Text: We must prepare for that eventuality.  Every direction the threat comes from, this is the best place to be.  We need to start building up our grain stores with regular shipments from every keep in the north.  If we don't use it by winter's end we'll give it back to them, but if the entire north has to flee to Winterfell there won't be enough time to bring wagonloads of grain with them.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Very wise, My Lady.
Speaker: YOHN

Text: Maester Wolkan, you'll see to it?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: WOLKAN bows and leaves.  SANSA and the others keep walking through the courtyard.  SANSA sees smiths hammering breastplate.
Are they covering those breastplates in leather?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: No, My Lady.
Speaker: YOHN

Text: Well, shouldn't they be once the real cold comes?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: They should indeed.  Pardon me, My Lady.
Speaker: YOHN

Text: YOHN steps over to the blacksmith.
You there, why isn't there leather on these?
Speaker: YOHN

Text: SANSA and BAELISH continue walking.
Command suits you.  The northerns are all facing north worried about the threat beyond the wall.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: So they should be.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I know Cersei better than anyone here.  If you turn your back on her --
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: You don't know Cersei better than anyone here.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I only meant to say --
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: That the woman who murdered my mother, father and brother is dangerous?  Thank you for your wise council.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: One of two things will happen.  Either the dead will defeat the living, in which case all our troubles come to an end.  Or life will win out.  And what then?
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: BAELISH walks in front of SANSA and stops her.

Don't fight in the north or the south.  Fight every battle everywhere always in your mind.  Everyone is your enemy, everyone is your friend, every possible series of events is happening all at once.  Live that way and nothing will surprise you.  Everything that happens will be something that you've seen before.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: A Winterfell guard approaches SANSA and BAELISH.
Lady Sansa, at the gate.
Speaker: GUARD

Text: SANSA turns and walks away from BAELISH.  There is a commotion at the gate.  People are gathered around.  SANSA rushes over to see what's going on.  Bran is in a cart in the Winterfell courtyard.  Bran looks at SANSA for a few moments without saying anything.
Hello, Sansa.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: SANSA begins to cry and hugs BRAN.
SANSA and BRAN are sitting next to the Weirwood Tree having a discussion.
I wish Jon was here.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Yes.  I need to speak to him.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Your father's last living true born son.  You're Lord of Winterfell.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I can never be the Lord of Winterfell.  I can never be lord of anything.  I'm the three-eyed raven.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I don't know what that means.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: It's difficult to explain.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Try, please, for me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: It means I can see everything.  Everything that's ever happened to everyone.  Everything that's happening right now.  It's all pieces, fragments.  I need to learn to see better.  When the long night comes again I need to be ready.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: How do you know all of this?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: The three-eyed raven taught me.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I thought you were the three-eyed raven.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I told you it's difficult to explain.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Bran --
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I'm sorry for all that's happened to you.  I'm sorry it had to happen here at our home.  It was so beautiful that night.  Snow falling just like now.  And you were so beautiful in your white wedding dress.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: SANSA appears shaken.  She quickly stands up to leave.
I have to go back inside, Bran.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I'll stay a bit longer.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: ARCHMAESTER MARWYN, SAMWELL TARLEY and JORAH MORMONT are standing in JORAH's quarantine room.  JORAH's skin has scars over the surface and the Greyscale is completely gone.  MARWYN extends a medical tool and begins poking around to examine JORAH.
Hmm.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: MARWYN walks around JORAH and continues to exam him.
Hmm.  Does it hurt?
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: A bit.  Less than before.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: The infection no longer appears to be active.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: JORAH sighs with relief and looks at the floor.
Unusual.  Unlikely.  One could almost be forgiven for thinking the entire upper layer of diseased skin was debrided and the underlying region treated with some sort of ointment.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: I don't know anything about that.  I just started feeling better.  I assumed it was the rest that did it.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: SAMWELL begins nodding his head in agreement.
And the climate.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: The climate?  You're free to go, Ser.  This chamber is needed for the infectious, which you are no longer.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: MARWYN begins walking out of the room.
Tarley, I'd like to speak with you in my study this evening.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: JORAH and SAMWELL stay in the room and have a discussion.
How bad is it?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I suppose I'll find out this evening.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: JORAH smiles and nods at SAMWELL.   He turns around and picks up his shirt.
Where will you go?
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: JORAH puts on his shirt and begins tying it up.
I surrendered to this sickness the moment I first saw it.  I knew it would kill me or I'd kill myself before it could.  Daenerys Stormborn convinced me otherwise.  The only place for me is with her.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: JORAH turns to face SAMWELL.
I owe my life to her and you.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Your father saved me more than once.  It's the least I could do.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: JORAH nods his head.
Perhaps our paths will cross again?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I hope they do.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: SAMWELL reaches out to shake JORAH's hand.  JORAH hesitates for a moment, then takes SAMWELL's hand.  JORAH places his second hand over SAMWELL's.  SAMWELL turns and walks out of the room leaving JORAH alone.  JORAH looks out the window and smiles.
ARCHMAESTER'S STUDY
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: MARWYN AND SAMWELL are having a discussion.
You treated him?
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: Yes.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Who told you to treat him?
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: No one.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Who forbade you or anyone to attempt to treat him?
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: I seem to remember you.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: But you treated him anyway?
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: I did.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: I forbade it because it's dangerous and rarely successful.  Especially on someone of that age.  You could have infected yourself and others.  You could have devastated the entire Citadel.  But you didn't.  It's a meticulous, difficult procedure.  Many maesters whose chains are heavy with healing links have attempted it and failed.  But you succeeded.  How?
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: I read the books and followed the instructions.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: MARWYN stands up and walks from behind his desk.
That man is alive because of you.  You should be proud.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: Thank you, Archmaester.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Come here.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: MARWYN and SAMWELL walk to a table in the study.  It's covered in moldy books and scrolls.
All these manuscripts and scrolls and rotting away.  I need you to make copies of them.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: SAMWELL says nothing.
You were expecting a reward?  Your reward is not being immediately expelled from the Citadel.  You'd better get started.  Be mindful of the paper mites.  They like flesh as well.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: MARWYN walks out of the room to leave SAMWELL to his work.
DAENERYS, VARYS, MISSANDEI and TYRION are standing around the painted table having a discussion.  TYRION knocks over one of the figurines as DAENERYS and VARYS speak.
We need to find Euron Greyjoy's fleet and sink it.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your Grace, he's already destroyed a good portion of our fleet.  To send our remaining ships after him --
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I'm not talking about sending our ships after him.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS pauses and looks at VARYS.  VARYS looks at TYRION.
But you'll have to go yourself.  Euron's ships could be anywhere or in more than one place.  You'd be flying around the open seas alone for who knows how long.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I wouldn't be alone.  I'd have Drogon, Vicerion and Rhaegal.  What can anyone do to them?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They can still do something to you.  It only takes one arrow.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: It's too great a risk.  You're too important.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: DAENERYS looks down at the painted table.
What about Casterly Rock?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Unsullied will be there soon.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: And what will they face?
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: A difficult situation.  They know we're coming.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Yes.  Cersei believes my sole purpose in life is to destroy House Lannister.  She will be ready.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: CASTERLY ROCK
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: TYRION continues narrating as the castle is seen in the distance on top of some cliffs.
No one has ever taken the rock.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Lannister archers are shown on top of the battlements.  There are hundreds of ships sailing in the ocean heading to Casterly Rock.
The Lannister army is still the army my father built.  Well trained and well provisioned.  10,000 men at least.  They will see us coming.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: GREY WORM is standing in a landing boat with other Unsullied on their way to the beach.  He puts on his helmet and readies himself for battle.
They will be ready.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: A man is running across the battlements stocking arrows for the archers.  Men are stacking rocks along the wall to throw down at the invaders.
Draw!  Loose!
Speaker: MAN

Text: Archers loose a set of arrows down onto rows of Unsullied marching on the walls of the castle.
The gates of Casterly Rock are impregnable.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Unsullied are being killed by incoming arrows.  Unsullied soldiers begin setting up ladders to scale the battlements.  The Lannister army throws rocks from the top of the wall.
The fight up the walls will be hard.  We'll be at a disadvantage.  Many men will die.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The archers are easily defending the castle and killing Unsullied soldiers.
TYRION starts narrating a different battle plan.

Interesting thing about my father.  He built our house up from near ruin.  He built our army.  He built Casterly Rock as we know it, but he didn't build the sewers.  That was beneath him.  So he gave the job to the lowest person he could find.  Me.  He was right.  I was low.  The company I kept low, women mostly.  They weren't welcome at the Rock.  Father disapproved of that sort of behavior.  I couldn't walk them through the front gates.  I couldn't have them in my chambers.  So in the process of building the sewers I threw in something for myself.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION continues to narrate.  GREY WORM is in a landing boat sailing for a small opening in the side of a cliff.
It was a passage that began by the sea and ended beneath one of the main guard towers.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The Unsullied sail into the passage.  They jump out of the boat and rush into the sewers.  GREY WORM pushes up a manhole cover and emerges into the castle.  Guards are seen running by and don't notice GREY WORM and the other Unsullied soldiers sneaking in.
No better place for low pursuits.  Casterly Rock, the impregnable fortress.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The Unsullied are running through the courtyard cutting down Lannister men.
As a good friend of mine once said, "give me 10 good men and I'll impregnate the bitch."
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The Unsullied fight their way to the main door in the courtyard.  GREY WORM lifts off the bar and opens the door.  Unsullied soldiers coming rushing through the gate by the hundreds.  They begin cutting down every Lannister in their way.
And so it begins.  They will face the bulk of the Lannister forces.  They will be outnumbered.  They will have less armor and fewer weapons.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: There is general mayhem as the battle rages on in the courtyard.  GREY WORM breaks from the main fight and starts climbing to the battlements.  He is disposing of men with his spear on the way.

But as my sister's armies fights for her, the Unsullied will be fighting for something greater.  They will be fighting for freedom and the person who gave it to them.  They will be fighting for you.  And that is why they will triump.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: GREY WORM is fighting in a hallway killing men from both directions.  A Lannister charges towards GREY WORM.  GREY WORM throws his spear and impales the Lannister soldier to a door.  The battle is over.  GREY WORM and other Unsullied soldiers are stepping over dozens of dead Lannisters on the battlements.  GREY WORM removes his helmet and one of his men speak in Valyrian.
There are none left.
Speaker: UNSULLIED 1

Text: There are supposed to be more than this.  Many more.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: GREY WORM turns to look out from the battlements towards the ocean.  The Unsullied fleet is under attack from the Iron Fleet and many boats are sunk or in flames.  GREY WORM's face twists in anger.  GREY WORM steps down from the battlement and grabs a bleeding Lannister soldier.  GREY WORM begins speaking English.
Where are they?  Where are the rest of the Lannisters?
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Thousands of fully armored Lannister soldiers are marching towards Highgarden.  JAIME is riding his horse inspecting the lines of soldiers.  He rides over and joins BRONN, RANDYLL TARLEY and DICKON TARLEY.  The camera shifts focus to Lady Olenna who is watching the advancing army from a balcony in Highgarden.  She turns and walks back into her castle.
Some time has passed.  The battle is already over.  JAIME is walking in the courtyard and there are dead Tyrell men scattered everywhere.  JAIME climbs to the top of the tower to meet OLENNA TYRELL.
OLENNA'S QUARTERS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Olenna is sitting alone at a table wearing all black.  JAIME opens the door and enters the room.
It's done?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: It is.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And now the rains weep for our whores.  Did we fight well?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: I suppose as well as can be expected.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME walks to the wine and pours two glasses.
It was never our forte.  Golden roses indeed.  Your brother and his new queen thought you would be defending Casterly Rock.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: The truth is Casterly Rock isn't worth much anymore.  Well, it is to me.  My fond childhood memories won't keep Cersei on the throne.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: So you'll just let them take it?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: For now.  They won't be able to hold it.  Euron Greyjoy's navy burned their ships, we emptied the larders before we left.  Eventually they'll be forced to abandon their position and march all the way across Westeros.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME walks to where OLENNA is sitting and places both wine glasses on the table and sits down.
And you took your army, your real army, and went where they weren't?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: As Robb Stark did to me at Whispering Wood.  There are always lessons in failures.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Yes.  You must be very wise by now.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: My father always said I was a slow learner.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: If he was so clever why didn't he take Highgarden the moment your gold mines ran dry?  I suppose I'll be able to ask him myself soon enough.  No more learning from my mistakes, eh?  How will you do it?  With that sword?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: JAIME shakes his head no.
That was Joffrey's sword, wasn't it?  Not that he ever used it.  What did he call it?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Widow's Wail.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He really was a cunt, wasn't he?  I did unspeakable things to protect my family, or watched them being done on my orders.  I never lost a night's sleep over them.  They were necessary.  And whatever I imagined necessary for the safety of House Tyrell I did.  But your sister has done things I wasn't capable of imagining.  That was my prize mistake, a failure of imagination.  She's a monster, you do know that?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: To you, sure.  To others as well.  But after we've won and there's no one left to oppose us, the people living peaceful in the world she built, do you really think they'll wring their hands over the way she built it?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You love her.  You really do love her.  You poor fool.  She'll be the end of you.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Possibly.  Not much to be gained from discussing it with you though, is there?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: What better person to discuss it with?  What better guarantee could you have that the things you say will never leave this room?  But perhaps you're right.  If she's driven you this far it's gone beyond your control.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Yes, it has.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: She's a disease.  I regret my role in spreading it.  You will too.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: I think we're done here.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME stands up and moves closer to OLENNA.
How will it happen?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: Cersei had several ideas.  Whipping you through the streets and beheading you in front of the Red Keep.  Flaying you alive and hanging you from the walls of King's Landing.  I talked her out of those.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: OLENNA looks up at JAIME.  JAIME produces a small vial from a pouch on his belt and pops the cork off with his thumb.  He pours the contents of the vial into one of the glasses of wine and slides it in front of OLENNA.
Will there be pain?
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: No.  I made sure of that.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: That's good.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: OLENNA reaches out and takes the wine.  She drinks the entire cup.  She looks back to JAIME.

I'd hate to die like your son clawing at my neck, foam and bile spilling from my mouth, eyes blood red, skin purple.  It must have been horrible for you as a Kingsguard, as a father.  It was horrible enough for me.  A shocking scene.  Not at all what I intended.  You see, I'd never seen the posion work before.  Tell Cersei.  I want her to know it was me.
Speaker: OLENNA

Text: JAIME's face twists in anger.  He turns and walks out of the room leaving OLENNA alone.
END CREDITS
Halt that wagon!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME opens the carriage.  It is filled with gold bars and coins.  He picks up a large sack and hands it to BRONN.
You just won the biggest prize in the world.  What could you possibly have to be upset about?  Come on.  You can tell me.  Queen of Thorns give you one last prick in the balls before saying goodbye?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I'll save my confessions for the High Septon.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: There is no more High Septon.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: No, there isn't, is there?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: There is still the question of my prize.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: JAIME is putting a padlock on the wagon bearing the gold.  He stops and turns to BRONN.
That's a lot of money I just gave you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: It's not a castle.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: BRONN turns and points to Highgarden.
How about that one?  It's available.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You don't want Highgarden.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I beg to differ.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: We're at war.  Daenerys Targaryen could come take it back the day after you move in.  Besides, think of the upkeep.  The more you own, the more it weighs you down.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Oh, is that why you're so fucking glum, eh?  All your new riches weighing you down?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: JAIME pounds on the back of the carriage and the horses start trotting.
They're not mine.  The gold belongs to the Iron Bank.  We pay our debts.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Right.  Just not to me.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Bronn of the Blackwater, formerly of whatever nameless shit heap you're from with a saddlebag full of gold complaining about not getting paid.  When we win this war all the castles in the Seven Kingdoms will be yours to choose from with no one left to take them away from you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Yes, I'm sure Queen Cersei's reign will be quiet and peaceful.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Stranger things have happened.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Like what?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: RANDYLL TARLEY and his son DICKON come riding up on horseback.  RANDYLL addresses JAIME.
The granaries are being emptied and loaded into wagons, My Lord.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: The current harvest?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: We have teams of men collecting it and more farmers in the Reach.
Speaker: DICKON

Text: JAIME looks over to BRONN.
Ser Bronn, will you accompany the Tarleys and help them accelerate this process?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I'm not much for shoveling weight.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: No, but motivating reluctant farmers to hand over their harvest, I've heard you guys have a real talent for that.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: My Lord.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: My Lord.
Speaker: DICKON

Text: RANDYLL, DICKON and BRONN break away from the Lannister army and ride into the distance.  Horse drawn carts are carrying spoils from Highgarden and Lannister men are marching down the road.
CERSEI and TYCHO NESTORIS from the Iron Bank of Braavos are sitting having a discussion.

I must say, I don't think the Iron Bank has ever had a debt of this magnitude repaid in a single installment.  I always considered your father a very effective and efficient man, but you appear to be redefining those terms entirely.
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: You're too kind, My Lord.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I am neither kind, nor a lord, Your Grace.  I am merely an instrument of the institution I represent, its wellbeing is a matter of arithmetic, not sentiment.  And the current arithmetic is outstanding.  The gold --
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: Is on its way.  My brother is supervising its transportation himself.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Some at the Iron Bank will be disappointed.  They've grown rather fond of your interest payments.
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: We must devise a way to raise their spirits.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Yes.  Perhaps we could be of assistance in some current venture.
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: My only venture at the moment is reestablishing control over this continent and every person on it.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I see a great deal of potential in that venture.  I imagine that it would require outside investment?
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: It will indeed.  I need to expand my armies, my navies.  My hand, Qyburn, had made overtures to the Golden Company in Essos.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I know them well.  They've helped us recover significant sums from parties who had fallen into deep arrears.
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: That's good to hear.  I too would like them to recover some things that belong to me.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Rest assured, Your Grace, you can count on the Iron Bank's support, as soon as the gold arrives.
Speaker: TYCHO

Text: BRAN is sitting in a wheelchair.  PETER BAELISH is sitting next to him.  BAELISH unsheathes a Valyrian steel dagger and shows it to BRAN.  It's the same dagger used in the attempt to assassinate BRAN years ago.
This is for you.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: BAELISH flips the knife in his hand and extends it towards BRAN.
The last man who wielded it meant to cut your throat, but your mother fought him off.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: BRAN reaches out and takes the knife, turning it and looking it over carefully.

The other dagger, the one that took her life, I would have stopped that dagger with my own heart if I could have.  I wasn't there for her when she needed me most.  But I am here for her now.  To do what she would have done, to protect her children.  Anything I can do for you, Brandon, you need only ask.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Do you know who this belonged to?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: No.  That very question was what started the War of the Five Kings.  In a way, that dagger made you what you are today.  Forced from your home, driven out to the wilds beyond the Wall.  I imagine you've seen things most men wouldn't believe.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: BAELISH hands the sheath of the knife to BRAN.  BRAN slides the knife into the sheath.
To go through all of that and make your way home again only to find such chaos in the world, I can only imagine --
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Chaos is a ladder.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: BRAN is staring at BAELISH.  BAELISH stops speaking.  The door opens and Meera appears.
I'm sorry to have disturbed you, Lord Stark.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: BAELISH stands up to leave.
I'm not Lord Stark.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: BAELISH bows and walks past Meera and closes the door.
MEERA notices BRAN sitting in a wheelchair.
What's that?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Maester Wolkan built it for me so I can move around more easily.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: It's a very good idea.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: You're leaving?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I don't want to leave you, but when they come I need to be with my family.  And you're safe, safe as anyone can be now.  You don't need me anymore.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: No, I don't.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: That's all you've got to say?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: Thank you.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Thank you?
Speaker: MEERA

Text: For helping me.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: My brother died for you.  Hodor and Summer died for you.  I almost died for you.  Bran!
Speaker: MEERA

Text: I'm not really, not anymore.  I remember what it felt like to be Brandon Stark, but I remember so much else now.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: MEERA begins to cry.
You died in that cave.
Speaker: MEERA

Text: MEERA turns to walk out the door.  She hesitates looking at BRAN, then walks out.
EXT WINTERFELL:
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: There is a snow blown field.  ARYA is riding on a horse.  Winterfell can be seen far in the distance.
ARYA approaches the main gate on foot.  Two guards are huddled by a brazier getting warm.  There's indistinct chatter.  One of the men notice ARYA walking to the gate and approach her.
Hey, oh.  Where are you going?
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: In there.  I live here.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Fuck off.
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: I'm Arya Stark.  This is my home.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Both men look at each and start laughing.
Arya Stark is dead.
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: Send for Maester Llewyn or Ser Rodrick.  They'll tell you who I am.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: There's no Rodrick here.
Speaker: MAN 2

Text: Maester's name is Wolkan.
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: Go ask Jon Snow then, the King in the North.  He's my brother
Speaker: ARYA

Text: He's a thousand miles away.
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: It's cold.  We're busy.  So, you know, best fuck off.
Speaker: MAN 2

Text: Mm-hmm.
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: If Jon Snow is gone who is in charge of Winterfell?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The Lady of Winterfell, Lady Stark.
Speaker: MAN 2

Text: Which Lady Stark?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You tell us.  You're the one impersonating her sister.
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: Tell Sansa her sister is home.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Lady Sansa is too busy to waster her breath on you, just like us.  So for the last time, fuck off.
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: MAN 1 goes to grab Arya but she easily dodges out of his grasp.
I'm getting into this castle one way or another.  If I'm not who I say I am, I won't last long.  But if I am, and Sansa finds out that you turned me away...
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA keeps glancing at the men.  They look uneasy.  They bring her inside of the gate.  They indicate towards a cart near the entrance.
You sit there.  Right there.  Don't move.
Speaker: MAN 2

Text: Both guards have a conversation out of earshot of Arya.
Go tell Lady Stark.  I'll watch her.
Speaker: MAN 2

Text: ARYA is glancing around Winterfell.  Men are working building tools and cutting wood.  ARYA looks over and sees a Winterfell flag sigil hanging from the wall.  The two guards are still arguing.
You tell her.
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: I'm not.
Speaker: MAN 2

Text: Because if you don't I'll hit you right in the fucking face as hard as I can.
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: The guards turn around and ARYA is gone.
Sansa is sitting at a table reviewing documents.  The two guards are in Sansa's room explaining what happened.
We told her to wait.  We were standing right next to her.
Speaker: MAN 2

Text: SANSA sighs.
When we turned around she had gone, My Lady.  She was nothing.  Some winter town girl.
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: She comes in asking for Ser Rodrick and Maester Llewyn.
Speaker: MAN 2

Text: Don't trouble yourself over it, My Lady.  We'll find her.
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: You don't have to.  I know where she is.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: ARYA is standing look at a statue of Ned Stark holding his sword.  ARYA hears a sound and turns to see SANSA approaching.  SANSA stops when she sees ARYA.
Do I have to call you Lady Stark now?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: SANSA hesitates for a moment.
Yes.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA begins smiling then walking towards ARYA.  SANSA reaches out and hugs ARYA.
You shouldn't have run from the guards.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I didn't run.  You need better guards.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: SANSA smirks at ARYA.
It suits you, Lady Stark.  Jon left you in charge?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: He did.  I hope he comes back soon.  I remember how happy he was to see me.  When he sees you, his heart will probably stop.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Both girls turn and look at the statue of Ned Stark.
That doesn't look like him.  It should have been carved by someone who knew his face.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Everyone who knew his face is dead.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: We're not.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA turns to face SANSA.
They say you killed Joffrey.  Did you?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I wish I had.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Me too.  I was angry when I heard someone else had done it.  However long my list got he was always first.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Your list?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Of people I'm going to kill.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: SANSA begins to laugh.  ARYA joins her.
How did you get back to Winterfell?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: It's a long story.  I imagine yours is too.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Yes.  It's not a very pleasant one.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Mine neither, but our stories aren't over yet.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: No, they're not.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: The girls both embrace again.
Arya, Bran's home too.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: ARYA smiles and looks at SANSA.  SANSA doesn't smile back.  The smile fades from ARYA's face.
BRAN is sitting next to the Weirwood tree.  SANSA and ARYA approach.  BRAN turns to look at them.  BRAN begins speaking to ARYA.
You came home.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: ARYA steps forward and throws her arms around BRAN.  SANSA smiles in the background.  ARYA lets go and steps back.
I saw you at the crossroads.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You saw me?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I see quite a lot now.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Bran has visions.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I thought you might go to King's Landing.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: So did I.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Why would you go back there?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Cersei is on her list of names.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: ARYA stares at BRAN.  ARYA turns to look at SANSA.
Who else is on your list?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Most of them are dead already.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: BRAN produces the Valyrian dagger that BAELISH gave him and unsheathes it.
Where did you get this?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Littlefinger gave it to me.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Littlefinger, he's here?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA turns to look at SANSA.
He's declared for House Stark.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA steps up closer to BRAN and speaks to him.
Why would he give you a dagger?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: He thought I'd want it.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Why?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Because it was meant to kill me.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: The cutthroat after your fall?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Why would a cutthroat have a Valyrian steel dagger?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Someone very wealthy wanted me dead.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: He's not a generous man.  He wouldn't give you anything unless he thought he was getting something back.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: It doesn't matter.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: What do you mean it doesn't matter?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I don't want it.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: BRAN holds the knife out to ARYA.  ARYA looks at BRAN.
Are you sure?  It's Valyrian steel.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: It's wasted on a cripple.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: ARYA looks down at the dagger.  She steps forward and takes it from BRAN.

ARYA is pushing BRAN in his wheelchair and SANSA is next to them.  The Stark children are walking back through the gate of Winterfell.  Men are milling around doing various jobs.  BRIENNE and PODRICK see the Stark children all back at Winterfell together.
Catelyn Stark would be proud.  You kept your vow.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I did next to nothing.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You're too hard on yourself, My Lady.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I'm not a --
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: BRIENNE pauses for a moment.
Thank you, Podrick.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: DRAGONSTONE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: DAENERYS and MISSANDEI are walking along a path outside of Dragonstone followed by members of the Queensguard.
Your Grace, there's still no word from the Unsullied.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Soon.  They will come back to me.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: He better.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: DAENERYS stops and turns to look at MISSANDEI.  She then continues walking.
What happened?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: MISSANDEI begins smirking.
Many things.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Many things?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Jon Snow appears at the bottom of the path.
Your Grace.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS looks at MISSANDEI then her Queensguard.  She speaks in Valyrian and motions to her guard to stand down.
It's all right.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS descends the stairs with MISSANDEI and they begin walking with JON.  They walk along the beach until they reach a cave.  DAVOS is waiting for them with a lit torch.
I wanted you to see it before we start hacking it to bits.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON leads DAENERYS and MISSANDEI into the cave.  He lights a brazier and illuminates the Dragonglass along the walls.  He continues walking deeper into the cave.
So this is it, all we'll ever need.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS is looking up at the walls of Dragonglass.
There is something else I want to show your, Your Grace.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON and DAENERYS go to a further chamber in the cave.  There are murals painted on the walls of Dragonglass.
The Children of the Forest made these.
Speaker: JON

Text: When?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: A very long time ago.
Speaker: JON

Text: They were right here standing where we're standing before there were Targaryens or Starks or Lannisters.  Maybe even before there were men.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: No.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS stops looking at the walls and turns to look at JON.  JON walks to another wall and begins to examine the murals.  The murals depict Children of the Forest and the First Men standing together.
They were here together the Children and the First Men.
Speaker: JON

Text: Doing what?  Fighting each other?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON takes DAENERYS by the arm and swings her torch to another part of the wall.  There is a mural of the Night King and White Walkers.
They fought together against their common enemy.  Despite their differences, despite their suspicions, together.  We need to do the same if we're going to survive.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON and DAENERYS look back at the wall with the Night King.
Because the enemy is real.  It's always been real.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS turns to look at JON.
And you say you can't defeat them without my armies and my dragons?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: No, I don't think I can.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS steps forward closer to JON.
I will fight for you.  I will fight for the north...when you bend the knee.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: My people won't accept a southern ruler, not after everything they've suffered.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS steps even closer to JON until they're face to face.
They will if their king does.  They chose you to lead them.  They chose you to protect them.  Isn't their survival more important than your pride?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON and DAENERYS, DAVOS and MISSANDEI are walking out of the cave.  As they exit TYRION and VARYS are standing on the beach awaiting them.  DAENERYS begins addressing Tyrion.
What is it?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: We took Casterly Rock.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: That's very good to hear.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: TYRION and VARYS look at each other.  They aren't eager to deliver the bad news.
Isn't it?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The group are all walking along the beach.  Daenerys is displeased.
You'll want to discuss this amongst yourselves.  Perhaps --
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You will stay.  All my allies are gone.  They've been taken from me while I've been sitting here on this island.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: We still have the largest army.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Who won't be able to eat because Cersei has taken all the food from the Reach.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Call Grey Worm and the Unsullied back.  We still have enough ships to carry the Dothraki to the mainland.  Commit to the blockade of King's Landing.  We have a plan.  It's still the right plan.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: DAENERYS stops walking, turns and speaks harshly to Tyrion.
The right plan?  Your strategy has lost us Dorne, the Iron Islands and the Reach.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: If I've underestimated our enemies --
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Our enemies?  Your family, you mean.  Perhaps you don't want to hurt them after all.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS begins looking out to the ocean.  Three dragons are flying in the sky over the water.
Enough with the clever plans.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS turns back and looks at TYRION.
I have three large dragons.  I'm going to fly them to the Red Keep.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: We've discussed this.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: My enemies are in the Red Keep.  What kind of a queen am I if I'm not willing to risk my life to fight them?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: A smart one.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: DAENERYS looks over to JON SNOW.
What do you think I should do?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I would never presume to --
Speaker: JON

Text: I'm at war.  I'm losing.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS begins walking close to JON.
What do you think I should do?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON looks over the ocean at the dragons flying.

I never thought that dragons would exist again.  No one did.  The people who follow you know that you made something impossible happen.  Maybe that helps them believe that you can make other impossible things happen.  Build a world that's different from the shit one they've always known.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON glances back towards the dragons.
But if you use them to melt castles and burn cities, you're not different.  You're just more of the same.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS looks back out to her dragons flying along the water.
BRIENNE and PODRICK are sparring.  BRIENNE kicks PODS foot out from under him and he lands face first in the dirt.
Don't lunge.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: PODRICK pushes himself back up and picks up his sword.  PODRICK attacks again.  Brienne blocks his blows and kicks his foot out again.
Don't go where your enemy leads you.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: ARYA is watching the sparring session from across the courtyard.  She begins to approach Brienne.
Up.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: BRIENNE begins striking at PODRICK while he blocks her blows.  BRIENNE hits PODRICK in the stomach with the hilt of her sword and PODRICK lands on the ground.
And don't --
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Don't fight someone like her in the first place.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: PODRICK stands up and retrieves his sword.  ARYA walks closer to speak to BRIENNE.
Nice sword.  Very nice dagger.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: ARYA looks down at the Valyrian dagger and unsheathes it.  She approaches BRIENNE flipping the knife several times in her fingers.  BRIENNE takes the dagger and examines it.
SANSA and BAELISH are walking along the upper section of the courtyard having a conversation.
If they haven't contributed the right amount of grain to the stores then I'm afraid they'll have to make due with --
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA sees ARYA in the courtyard speaking with BRIENNE and stops to watch her.
It's been awhile since I've trained.
Speaker: ARYA(TO BRIENNE)

Text: I can go and find the Master of Arms for you, My Lady.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: He didn't beat the hound.  You did.  I want to train with you.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: BRIENNE chuckles.
You swore to serve both of my mother's daughters, didn't you?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: BRIENNE nods her head in agreement.
Move aside, Podrick.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: PODRICK backs away.  ARYA draws her sword, Needle.
You can't use that, My Lady.  It's too small.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I won't cut you.  Don't worry.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: BRIENNE smirks and raises her sword to a fighting posture.
I'll try not to.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: BRIENNE strikes at ARYA who quickly sidesteps and parries the attack.  BRIENNE attacks again and ARYA sidesteps, dodges multiple strikes and parries BRIENNE while smiling.  ARYA strikes at BRIENNE and hits her hand causing BRIENNE to flinch and lose her two-handed grip on her sword.  BRIENNE regains composure and starts to circle ARYA.  BAELISH and SANSA are still watching from the upper balcony.  ARYA is waiting for an attack with her sword behind her back.  BRIENNE strikes and ARYA blocks her attacks, spins and stabs behind her back and hits BRIENNE in the knee causing BRIENNE's sword to strike the dirt.  BRIENNE kicks ARYA in the stomach and sends ARYA to the ground.  ARYA quickly gets back to her feet.  BRIENNE overpowers ARYA and ARYA drops her sword on the ground.  BRIENNE strikes again but ARYA dodges, draws her Valyrian dagger and puts it near BRIENNE's neck.  BRIENNE and ARYA both stop fighting and sheathe their weapons smiling.
Who taught you to do that?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: No one.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA collects her sword.  SANSA walks away.  BAELISH remains on the balcony staring at ARYA who looks up at him.  BAELISH bows to ARYA and walks away.
DRAGONSTONE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: JON and DAVOS are walking along the paths outside of Dragonstone having a discussion.
What do you think of her?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Who?
Speaker: JON

Text: DAVOS sighs
I believe you know of whom I speak.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I think she has a good heart.
Speaker: JON

Text: A good heart?  I've noticed you starring at that good heart.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: There's no time for that.  I saw the Night King, Davos.  I looked into his eyes.  How many men do we have in the north to fight him?  10,000?  Less?
Speaker: JON

Text: Fewer.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: What?
Speaker: JON

Text: DAVOS and JON near the end of the path.  MISSANDEI is standing along the path looking at the ocean.
Speaking of good hearts, Missandei of Naarth.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: MISSANDEI turns to looks at DAVOS and JON.
Ser Davos, Lord Snow.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: King Snow, isn't it?  No?  That doesn't sound right.  King Jon?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: It doesn't matter.
Speaker: JON

Text: Forgive me, but may I ask a question?
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Of course.
Speaker: JON

Text: Your name is Jon Snow, but your father's name was Ned Stark?
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: I'm a bastard.  My mother and father weren't married.
Speaker: JON

Text: Is the custom different in Naarth?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: We don't have marriage in Naarth so the concept of a bastard doesn't exist.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: The sounds liberating.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Why did you leave your homeland?
Speaker: JON

Text: I was stolen away by slavers.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: I'm sorry.
Speaker: JON

Text: If I may, how did a slave girl come to advise Daenerys Targaryen?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: She bought me from my master and set me free.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: That was good of her.  Of course you're serving her now, aren't you?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I serve my queen because I want to serve my queen.  Because I believe in her.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: And if you wanted to sail home to Naarth tomorrow --
Speaker: JON

Text: Then she would give me a ship and wish me good fortune.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: You believe that?
Speaker: JON

Text: I know it.  All of us who came with her from Essos, we believe in her.  She's not our queen because she's the daughter of some king we never knew.  She's the queen we chose.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: You'll forgive me if I switch sides.
Speaker: DAVOS(to JON)

Text: JON notices a single ship sailing into the bay.  It has a kraken sigil.  MISSANDEI turns to look.
Is that a Greyjoy ship?
Speaker: JON

Text: THEON GREYJOY and other Iron Born are pulling their landing boat onto the beach wading through the surf.  They pull the boat onto the sand.  JON SNOW, MISSANDEI, DAVOS and Dothraki guards are waiting to meet them.  JON sees THEON and both men freeze and stare at each other.  JON steps forward towards THEON.
Jon.  I didn't know you were here.
Speaker: THEON

Text: THEON steps closer to JON.
Sansa, is she all right?
Speaker: THEON

Text: JON grabs THEON by his shirt and pulls him face to face.
What you did for her is the only reason I'm not killing you.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON releases THEON.
We heard your uncle attacked your fleet.  We thought you were dead.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I should be.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Your sister?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Euron has her.  I came to ask the queen to help get her back.
Speaker: THEON

Text: The queen is gone.
Speaker: JON

Text: Where did she go?
Speaker: THEON

Text: The Lannister army is returning from sacking Highgarden.  They are delivering gold and food to King's Landing.  There are carts and men that haven't made it into the city gates yet.  JAIME and BRONN are supervising the procession.  RANDYLL TARLEY comes riding up on his horse.
All of the gold is safely through the gates of King's Landing.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: Good.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: We need to get the last of these wagons over the Blackwater Rush before nightfall.  If the head of the line is ambushed, the tail will never be able to reinforce in time.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: We are stretched a bit thin.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: With your permission, flogging stragglers has a marked effect on mobility.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: Let's give them fair warning first.  These men fought well at Highgarden.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: RANDYLL is clearly disappointed.  He turns and rides off back to the line of soldiers.  JAIME and BRONN exchange glances, then follow RANDYLL.  BRONN and JAIME are riding through the ranks.  DICKON TARLEY sees JAIME and starts a conversation.
Ser Jaime.
Speaker: DICKON

Text: Rickon.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Dickon.
Speaker: DICKON

Text: BRONN openly laughs in DICKON's face and looks at JAIME.
I hear you fought bravely at Highgarden.  Your first battle?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: DICKON nods his head in agreement.
And?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: It was glorious.
Speaker: DICKON

Text: Come on.  Your father's not here.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: All my life we've been pledged to House Tyrell.  I knew some of those men.  I hunted with them.
Speaker: DICKON

Text: They didn't deserve to die.  But Lady Olenna chose to betray the queen and support the Targaryen girl.  So here we are.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I didn't expect it to smell like that.
Speaker: DICKON

Text: Men shit themselves when they die.  Didn't they teach you that at fancy lad school?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: JAIME looks over at BRONN
Well, I learned it when I was 5.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: BRONN pauses and strains to hear a noise far in the distance.
What?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Listen.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Horses and high pitched war cries are heard  beyond the hill in the distance.  JAIME takes off at a gallop yelling orders to the soldiers on the road.
Spears and shields!  Spears and shields!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The men jump into action and start arming themselves.
Spears and shields!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: In line now!
Speaker: BRONN

Text: RANDYLL is riding across the battlefield yelling orders to men.
Come on, lads.  Not those wagons.  Fall in line.  Fall in line.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: The Lannister army gets in formation to repel the invading horde.   Lannister archers line up behind the pikemen.  The horde is drawing closer.  The Dothraki come riding over the hill with curved swords held overhead and screaming.  There are a thousand of them or more.
DICKON draws his sword.  RANDYLL is yelling orders to the men.
Spears armed!
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: The Lannister pikemen drop their spears into a fighting position and ready their shields.  BRONN rides up to JAIME.
Get back to King's Landing.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I'm not abandoning my army.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You're a commander, not a damned infantryman.  These fuckers are about to swamp us.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: We can hold them off.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: A dragon can be heard roaring in the distance.  DAENERYS and DROGON come flying over the Dothraki and over the battlefield.  DAENERYS commands DROGON to attack.
Dracarys!
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DROGON breathes fire into the first line of Lannister soldiers.  The men burst into flames and start screaming.  DICKON looks on in shock.  A flanking group of Dothraki Screamers ride over the flames through the hole created by Drogon and start cutting men down.  JAIME attempts to issue orders to the men.
Hold the line!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The main force of Dothraki crashes into shielded pikemen.  Men on both sides are being slaughtered.  A second wave of Dothraki Screamers ride in.  They switch from a seated position to standing atop their saddles shooting bow and arrow.  The Lannister archers fire back and many men are killed.  DAENERYS and DROGON circle around and billow flames across the battlefield.  DAENERYS steers DROGON down the King's Road.  DROGON spews flames and destroys the carriages along the road.  Carts are exploding into pieces, barrels are flying through the air.  JAIME is looking at the carnage in astonishment.
Archers!  Archers with me!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: A group of archers break from the main battle and follow JAIME and BRONN.  JAIME lines the men up to counter DAENERYS and DROGON.
Knock!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Knock!  Draw!
Speaker: ARCHERS

Text: DROGON loops around and is making a pass on JAIME and the archers.  DAENERYS and DROGON are diving at the group of men.
Loose!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The archers fire their arrows in unison.  DAENERYS sees the projectiles and turns Drogon so the arrows bounce harmlessly off his breast.  She makes a run on another line of carriages and DROGON burns them in a single breath.  Men are screaming and catching on fire.  JAIME and BRONN survey the damage.
Qyburn's scorpion is over there.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Go get it then.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I can't shoot with one hand.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME holds up his gold hand to illustrate his point.
BRONN hesitates for a moment.  He turns his horse and rides to man the artillery crossbow.  JAIME draws his sword and rides into battle.
Come on!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: A Dothraki screamer wielding two swords charges JAIME.  JAIME is blocking the attacks but is getting overpowered.  DICKON stabs the screamer through his back.  JAIME nods at DICKON.  BRONN is making his way to the crossbow.  A Dothraki screamer sees him and charges.  BRONN reaches behind him and retrieves a small sword.  He throws the sword at the Dothraki but the screamer parries it.  BRONN draws his primary sword and the two men charge at each other.  As BRONN is about to strike, the screamer leans over and cuts BRONN's horse's leg off causing BRONN to fall to the ground.  BRONN's bag of gold hits the ground and splits open.  The screamer is turning his horse around and is about to attack BRONN again.  BRONN abandons the gold and runs into the mayhem trying to lose the mounted rider.  BRONN pushes a flaming Lannister soldier out of the way.  He pulls a sword out of a dead man and uses it to start fighting Dothraki.  DROGON flies overhead and spews flames through the air.  BRONN manages to escape the mounted rider and disappear into the fog.  The screamer dismounts and continues the search on foot.  The screamer climbs onto a covered wagon to check for BRONN.  When he pulls the canvas back he see's BRONN behind the crossbow with a bolt pointed at him.  BRONN fires the bolt and impales the Dothraki screamer.  BRONN pulls a lever and the sides of the wagon drop down revealing the crossbow.  BRONN reloads the weapon and begins making adjustments to line up a shot on DROGON.
Where are you?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: TYRION walks to the edge of the battlefield accompanied by Dothraki guards.  He can see Lannisters being slaughtered.  One of the Dothraki guards begin to speak.
Your people can't fight.
Speaker: GUARD

Text: TYRION is watching the mayhem.  Men are screaming and engulfed in flames.  Horses and carriages run wild with no driver.  JAIME is still on the battlefield struggling against the horde.  Burning Lannister men are taking off their helmets revealing melted faces.  Men crawl to the river in search of relief from the dragonfire.  DROGON and DAENERYS are flying over the river creating wake in the water.  JAIME sees her approaching his position.
Take cover!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: DROGON spits flames into the Lannister position.  The men standing there are reduced to standing ash.  The wind blows them away.  BRONN is lining up DROGON in the sights of the crossbow.  He reaches down and pulls the lever to fire.  A bolt sails past DROGON and misses.  BRONN reloads the machine.  DROGON and DAENERYS circle around and dive on the crossbow.  BRONN takes his time aiming his shot.
Come on you fucker.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: DAENERYS commands DROGON to fire at the crossbow.
Dracarys!
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Before DROGON can send flames, BRONN fires a bolt that strikes DROGON in the wing.  DROGON begins to pinwheel out of control towards the ground.  BRONN is smiling.  He whips the machine around and begins reloading.  DAENERYS and DROGON are falling from the sky.  DROGON regains control and begins hovering over the river.  BRONN realizes he doesn't have time to reload and dives out of the way of the incoming dragonfire.  DROGON spits flames at the machine and instantly destroys it.  Flames lick over BRONN but he is uninjured.  DROGON is forced to land on the edge of the river due to his wound.  DAENERYS climbs from her mount and rushes to pull the spear from DROGON's wing.  JAIME is 100 yards from DAENERYS watching her.  She is all alone.  JAIME sees a spear sticking out of a dead man.  TYRION spots JAIME across the battlefield.
Flee, you idiot!
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JAIME looks at DAENERYS and readies himself.  He spurs his horse onward.
Come on, boy.  Come on!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME grabs the spear as he rides by and brings it up to position.  JAIME's horse is galloping full speed on the edge of the river kicking up water.  TYRION is watching JAIME's attempt to kill DAENERYS.
You fucking idiot.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JAIME is getting close.  DAENERYS turns at the last moment to see JAIME bearing down on her spear in hand.  DROGON notices JAIME, turns his head and spews flames.  BRONN appears from nowhere and manages to dive off of his horse and knock JAIME and himself in the water before they're both consumed by fire.  Their horses are instantly burned to death.  JAIME is being dragged down by a full set of armor into the dark water.  JAIME sinks into blackness and out of sight.
END CREDITS
You could have killed me.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: What the fuck were you doing back there?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Ending the war by killing her.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You saw the dragon between you and her?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: BRONN looks incredulously at JAIME.
And?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: JAIME sits up and says nothing to BRONN.  BRONN sits up and faces JAIME.
Listen to me, cunt.  Till I get what I'm owed, a dragon doesn't get to kill you.  You don't get to kill you.  Only I get to kill you.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: That was only one of them.  She has two more.  If she decides to use them, to really use them --
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You're fucked.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Don't you mean we're fucked?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: No, I do not.  Dragons are where our partnership ends.  I'm not going to be around when those things start spitting fire on King's Landing.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I have to tell Cersei.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRONN pauses and looks at JAIME.
Best well jump back in that river.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: BRONN stands up and walks away.  JAIME continues sitting on the shore looking at the smoke and fire from the distant battle.

TYRION is walking over an ash covered ground.  There are burned bodies and cargo strewn about.  Dothraki are looting dead Lannister soldies.  A group of mounted Dothraki are escorting captured Lannister soldiers to where DAENERYS and DROGON are awaiting the prisoners.  DAENERYS addresses the captured soldiers.
I know what Cersei has told you, that I've come to destroy your cities --
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The camera pans around the prisoners.  The men are covered in filth and blood from the battle.

A few Lannister men kneel to the ground, while most remain standing.  DROGON roars and moves closer to the men.  Almost all the Lannister men quickly kneel while a few still remain standing including RANDYLL and DICKON TARLEY.  DAENERYS speaks to RANDYLL.
Step forward, My Lord.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: RANDYLL takes several steps towards DAENERYS and stands in front of the kneeling Lannister men.
You will not kneel?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I already have a queen.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: My sister, she wasn't your queen until recently though, was she, until she murdered your rightful queen and destroyed House Tyrell for all time.  So it appears your allegiances are somewhat flexible.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: There are no easy choices in war.  Say what you will about your sister, she was born in Westeros, has lived here all her life.  You on the other hand, you murdered your own father and chose to support a foreign invader.  One with no ties to this land, an army of savages at her back.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: You will not trade your honor for your life.  I respect that.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: TYRION turns to speak to DAENERYS.
Perhaps he could take the black, Your Grace.  Whatever else he is, he is a true soldier.  He would be invaluable at the Wall.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You cannot send me to the Wall.  You are not my queen.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: DAENERYS turns to look at her Dothraki escort.  The Dothraki walk forward to collect RANDYLL.  As the men are pulling RANDYLL away DICKON steps forward.
You will have to kill me too.
Speaker: DICKON

Text: RANDYLL pulls away from the Dothraki and turns to face his son.
Step back and shut your mouth.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: Who are you?
Speaker: DAENERYS(to DICKON)

Text: A stupid boy.
Speaker: RANDYLL

Text: I'm Dickon Tarley, son of Randyll Tarley.
Speaker: DICKON

Text: You are the future of your house.  This war has already wiped one great house from the world.  Don't let it happen again.  Bend the knee.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: DICKON looks to RANDYLL.  RANDYLL nods to his son.
I will not.
Speaker: DICKON

Text: TYRION turns to speak to DAENERYS.  He speaks softly so no one but the queen can hear.
Your Grace, nothing strips bold notions from a man's head like a few weeks in a dark cell.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I meant what I said.  I'm not here to put men in chains.  If that becomes an option many will take it.  I gave them a choice.  They made it.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your Grace, if you begin beheading entire families --
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm not beheading anyone.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: TYRION pauses and looks over the DROGON.  DRGON roars and shakes his head and flexes his wings.
Your Grace --
Speaker: TYRION

Text: DAENERYS looks to her Dothraki escort and gives a signal.  The men grab RANDYLL and DICKON and walk them over to DROGON.  RANDYLL takes DICKON by the arm.
Lord Randyll Tarley, Dickon Tarley, I, Daenerys of House Targaryen, First of my name, Breaker of Chains and Mother of Dragons, sentence you to die.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS pauses a moment and looks at RANDYLL and DICKON.
Dracarys.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DROGON draws a deep breath and begins spewing dragonfire at the two men.  They are instantly engulfed in flames.  They both collapse into ash after a few seconds.  There are two craters left where RANDYLL and DICKON stood.  The Lannister men recoil in horror.  Any Lannister soldier that was still standing kneels to the ground.  DAENERYS silently turns and begins to walk off the battlefield.
JAIME is quickly walking down the hall leading to CERSEI's room.  As he approaches, QYBURN exits the queen's chambers.
My Lord.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: JAIME passes by QYBURN without saying a word and barges into CERSEI's quarters.  CERSEI stand and walks over to JAIME.
How many men did we lose?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: We haven't done a full counting.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: It's armies that win wars.  We have the Tyrell gold, we have the Iron Bank behind us.  We can buy mercenaries.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: JAIME shakes his head.
They're not the same as our men but they'll fight if they're well paid, which they will be.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I just saw the Dothraki fight.  They'll beat any mercenary army.  They'll beat any army I've ever seen.  Killing our men wasn't war for them, it was sport.
