Her dragon burned a thousand wagons.  Qyburn's scorpion fired bolts bigger than you.  They couldn't stop it.  And she has three of them.  This isn't a war we can win.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: So what do we do?  Sue for peace?  I sit on her father's throne, the father you betrayed and murdered.  And in her mind she's winning.  What sort of offer do you think she'd make?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI turns and walks away from JAIME.
Maybe we can count on Tyrion to intercede on our behalf by way of apology for murdering our father and our son.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: He didn't.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You saw the crossbow, you saw his body.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: JAIME walks across the room to where CERSEI is standing.
I'm not talking about father.  Tyrion didn't kill Joffrey.  He had nothing to do with it.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: After all this time it still amazes me --
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: It was Olenna.  She confessed before she died.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And this was before or after she drank the poison you so kindly provided her?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: After.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And you believed her?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: If you were Olenna would you rather have seen your granddaughter married to Joffrey or Tommen?  Which one would Margerey been better able to control?  Which one would have made Olenna the true ruler of the Seven Kingdoms?  She was telling the truth.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: CERSEI looks away, then sits down.
I shouldn't have listened to you.  She should have died screaming.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: She's dead like her son, her grandchildren, her whole house.  And if we don't find a way out of this war we'll follow them.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: So we fight and die or we submit and die.  I know my choice.  A soldier should know his.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: JON SNOW is standing on the edge of a cliff looking towards the ocean.   DROGON roars and flies over him with DAENERYS on his back.  DROGON lands next to JON and charges towards him.  DROGON opens his jaws and roars in JON's face.  DROGON creeps closer until he is inches  from JON.  JON removes his glove and slowly extends his hand toward DROGON.  DROGON lowers his head and allows JON to touch him.  DAENERYS  looks surprised and steps down from her mount.  DROGON turns and flies away.
They're beautiful, aren't they?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: That wasn't the word I was thinking of, but, yes, they are.  Gorgeous beasts.
Speaker: JON

Text: They're not beasts to me.  No matter how big they get, how terrifying to everyone else, they're my children.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS turns to look at her three dragons as they fly over Dragonstone in the distance.
You weren't gone long.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS turns back to JON.
No.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: And?
Speaker: JON

Text: And I have fewer enemies today than I did yesterday.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON pauses and doesn't say anything.
You're not sure how you feel about that?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: No, I'm not.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS turns and starts walking towards the castle, JON follows.
How many men did your army kill taking Winterfell back from the Boltons?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Thousands.
Speaker: JON

Text: We both want to help people.  We can only help them from a position of strength.  Sometimes strength is terrible.  When you first came here Ser Davos said you took a knife in the heart for your people.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Ser Davos gets carried away.
Speaker: JON

Text: So it was a figure of speech?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON doesn't say anything.  A group of Dothraki guards approach DAENERYS and speak in their native tongue.
This man says he is your friend, Khaleesi.
Speaker: GUARD

Text: The guard steps to the side and JORAH MORMONT stands behind him.  DAENERYS answers the guard in Dothraki.
He is my friend.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JORAH kneels before DAENERYS.
Your Grace.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: JORAH stands.
Jon Snow, this is Ser Jorah Mormont, an old friend.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I served with your father.  He was a great man.
Speaker: JON

Text: JORAH nods to JON.
You look strong.  You found a cure?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I wouldn't be here if I hadn't.  I return to your service, my queen, if you'll have me.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: It would be my honor.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS steps forward and hugs JORAH.
EXT. WINTERFELL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: A group of ravens are resting on a tree.  Several of the ravens' eyes wash white.  They take off and fly over Winterfell.  They cross frozen fields and over a snowy mountain.  They arrive at The Wall at Eastwatch-by-the-sea and continue over the Wall.  The ravens fly many miles over tundra and more mountains.  The birds crest a hill and thousands of dead men can be seen marching south.  A group of riders and the Night King are on top of an outcrop watching the dead file past.  As the ravens approach the Night King peers in their direction and the birds scatter and disperse.
BRAN's eyes are pure white.  They wash back to their normal color.  He is sitting in front of the Weirwood.  Maester Wolkan stands next to him.
Ravens.  We need to send ravens.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: WOLKAN nods his head to BRAN.

ARCHMAESTER MARWYN and other citadel maesters are seated at a council table.  MARWYN has a raven scroll in his hand and the maesters are discussing the contents.  SAMWELL enters the room carrying a large stock of books and scrolls.  MARWYN points SAM to a nearby table to offload the books.
I put very little stock in it myself.  Prophecies of doom are never in short supply, especially when winter comes.
Speaker: MAESTER 1

Text: I remember Wolkan.   A bit timid but a sharp mind.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: The north has dulled many good maester's wits.  I'm not sure if it's the cold, the drink, or the company.
Speaker: MAESTER 1

Text: All the maesters chuckle.
A crippled boy claims to have seen dead men on the march beyond the wall thanks to the magical help of a raven with three eyes.
Speaker: MAESTER 1

Text: SAM stops working and turns around.
It is a bit much.  Still we ought to --
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: Brandon Stark --
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: The maesters all turn in their seats to look at SAMWELL.
Do you know him?
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: I let him through the Wall years ago.  I saw him go beyond the wall.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: And?
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: Somehow a crippled boy survived for years beyond the wall when no one else could.  Not the Night's Watch, not the Wildlings, no one.  Perhaps we ought to listen to what he has to say.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Perhaps you need more scribing work to discipline your mind.
Speaker: MAESTER 1

Text: I sense a more detailed proposal is forthcoming.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: SAMWELL steps forward and clears his throat.

Everyone in Westeros trusts and respects you.  If you tell people the threat is real they'll believe it.  If you advise all the lords to send their men north to hold the wall they'll do it.  And if you tell every maester in the Citadel to search every word of every faded scroll about the long night, they may find something that lets us defeat the Army of the Dead for good.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: It could be done.  And this news could be authentic.  It's possible.  It's also possible this message is part of a ploy by the dragon queen to lure southern armies away from the lands they are currently defending to open those lands to easy conquest.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: That does seem far more likely than magic birds talking to cripples.
Speaker: MAESTER 1

Text: Archmaester, please.  It's real.  I've seen it.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: We will write to Maester Wolkan at Winterfell for clarification.  I promise you we will get to the truth of it one way or another.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: Archmaester --
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: That will be all, Tarley.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: SAM turns to collect his work and leave.  The maesters begin talking to one another.
It brings to mind the work of Davy Moonstone, the charlatan who claimed to see the children of the forest.
Speaker: MAESTER 2

Text: The maesters all chuckle.
Don't forget the Prophet Lodock that promised the Drowned God would rise up and destroy Aegon the Conquerer.
Speaker: MAESTER 1

Text: The maesters continue laughing.  SAMWELL gets the last of his work and walks out of the door in disgust.  MAESTER 1 turns to look at MARWYN.
Is he the one whose father and brother were just burned alive?
Speaker: MAESTER 1

Text: I'm afraid so.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: Horrible business.
Speaker: MAESTER 2

Text: I don't have the heart to tell him yet.  He's a good lad.
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: MARWYN crumples the raven scroll and throws it dismissevely on the table.
Right.  The ravenry was falling apart last time I checked...
Speaker: MARWYN

Text: VARYS and TYRION are sitting on the stairs of the Throne Room alone.  VARYS has a sealed raven scroll in his hand tapping it on the stone.  TYRION is drinking a glass of wine having a discussion with VARYS.
All rulers demand that people bend the knee.  It's why they're rulers.  She gave Tarley a choice.  A man who had taken up arms against her.  What else could she do?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Not burn him alive alongside his son.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I am her hand, not her head.  I can't make her decisions for her.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: That's what I used to tell myself about her father.  I found the traitors but I wasn't the one burning them alive.  I was only a purveyor of information.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: VARYS reaches over to TYRION's cup of wine, picks it up and begins to drink from it.  He grimaces as he drinks.

It's what I told myself when I watched them beg for mercy, "I'm not the one doing it."  As the pitch of their screams rose higher, "I'm not the one doing it."  When their hair caught fire and the smell of the burning flesh filled the Thone Room, "I'm not the one doing it."
Speaker: VARYS

Text: VARYS drinks again and sets the cup down next to TYRION.  TYRION picks it up.
Daenerys is not her father.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And she never will be... with the right counsel.  You need to find a way to make her listen.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: TYRION looks down at the note in VARYS's hand.
Who is that for?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Jon Snow.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Did you read it?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It's a sealed scroll for the King in the North.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: TYRION pauses and drinks from his cup of wine.
What's it say?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Nothing good.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: DAENERYS and VARYS are seated at the painted table.  TYRION and JORAH stand near the queen.  DAVOS and JON SNOW are standing on the other end of the table.  JON is holding a raven scroll and reading it.
I thought Arya was dead.  I thought Bran was dead.
Speaker: JON

Text: I'm happy for you.  You don't look happy.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Bran saw the Night King and his army marching towards Eastwatch.  If they make it past the wall --
Speaker: JON

Text: The Wall has kept them out for thousands of years.  Presumably --
Speaker: VARYS

Text: JON interrupts VARYS.
I need to go home.
Speaker: JON

Text: You said you don't have enough men.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: We'll fight with the men we have.  Unless you'll join us.
Speaker: JON

Text: And give the country to Cersei?  As soon as I march away she marches in.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Perhaps not.  Cersei thinks the Army of the Dead is nothing but a story made up by wet nurses to frighten children.  What if we prove her wrong?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I don't think she'll come see the dead at my invitation.
Speaker: JON

Text: TYRION begins walking around the table closer to JON.
So bring the dead to her.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I thought that was what we are trying to avoid.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: We don't have to bring the whole army.  Only one soldier.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Is that possible?
Speaker: DAVOS(to JON)

Text: The first White I ever saw was brought into Castle Black from beyond the Wall.
Speaker: JON

Text: Bring one of these things down to King's Landing and show her the truth.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Anything you bring back will be useless unless Cersei grants us an audience and is somehow convinced not to murder us the moment we set foot in the capital.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: The only person she listens to is Jaime.  He may listen to me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And how would you get into King's Landing.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Everyone in the room stops and looks at DAVOS.
I can smuggle you in, but if the Goldcloaks were to recognize you, I'm warning you, I'm not a fighter.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: TYRION nods his head.
Well, it will all be for nothing if we don't have one of these dead men.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Fair point.  How do you propose to find one?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: JON pauses and stares at the ground.  JORAH breaks the silence.
With the queen's permission I'll go north and take one.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: DAENERYS turns to look at JORAH.
You asked me to find a cure so I could serve you.  Allow me to serve you.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: The free folk will help us.  They know the real north better than anyone.
Speaker: JON

Text: They won't follow Ser Jorah.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: They won't have to.
Speaker: JON

Text: You can't lead a raid beyond the wall.  You're not in the Night's Watch anymore.  You're King in the North.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I'm the only one here whose fought them.  I'm the only one here who knows them.
Speaker: JON

Text: I haven't given you permission to leave.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: With respect, Your Grace, I don't need your permission.  I am a king.  And I came here knowing that you could have your men behead me or your dragons burn me alive.  I put my trust in you, a stranger, because I knew it was the best chance for my people, for all our people.  Now I'm asking you to trust in a stranger because it's our best chance.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS pauses for a moment then nods her head in agreement.

Northen lords including ROBETT GLOVER, YOHN ROYCE and LYANNA MORMONT are congregated in the Great Hall.  ARYA walks into the room and hears a loud discussion.  The lords are adressing SANSA who is seated at the head table.
The King in the North should stay in the north.  We did not choose you to rule us, My Lady, but perhaps we should have.
Speaker: ROBETT

Text: The men agree in unison.  YOHN ROYCE stands up and walks in front of SANSA.
The Knights of the Vale came here for you, Lady Stark.
Speaker: YOHN

Text: You're very kind, my lords, but Jon is our king.  He is doing what he thinks is best.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: The men sit down and everyone in the hall begins talking to one another.
SANSA and ARYA are walking through the hall to SANSA's quarters having a discussion.
I warned Jon this would happen.  He can't leave the north and expect it to just sit and wait for him like Ghost.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: He didn't.  He trusted you to hold it for him.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Well, he's not making it easy.  The northern lords are proud.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: The girls arrive at SANSA's quarters.  ARYA is glancing around the room.
These are mother and father's chambers.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: And?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Nothing.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Don't do that.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA turns around to face ARYA.
What?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Say what you mean.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You always liked nice things.  It made you feel better than everyone.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: SANSA drops the papers in her hand on a table and looks at ARYA.
Are you angry with me?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: They were insulting Jon and you sat there and listened.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I listened to their complaints, which is my responsibility as Lady of Winterfell.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Their opinions are important to you?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Glover has 500 men.  Royce has 2,000.  Offend them and Jon loses his army.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Not if they lose their heads first.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Winterfell didn't just fall into our hands.  We took it back, and the Mormonts and the Hornwoods and the Wildlings and the Vale, all of us working together.  Now, I'm sure cutting off heads is very satisfying, but that's not the way you get people to work together.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: And if Jon doesn't come back, you'll need their support, so you can work together to give you what you really want.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: How can you even think such a horrible thing?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You're thinking it right now.  You don't want to be, but the thought just won't go away.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: SANSA and ARYA stare at each in silence for a moment.
I have work to do.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA turns and walks away from ARYA.
My lady.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA exits the room.
DAVOS and TYRION are standing on the beach of King's Landing.  DAVOS is securing a small row boat.  TYRION is looking up towards the city walls.
Last time I was here I killed my father with a crossbow.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Last time I was here you killed my son with wildfire.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: TYRION turns to look at DAVOS.  DAVOS walks next to TYRION and stakes the boat anchor into the sand.
There's a path to the left that hugs the cliff.  The guards hardly ever patrol it.  Too many steps.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: TYRION begins walking towards the path.  DAVOS follows him and quickly takes the lead.  TYRION stops and looks back towards the unattended boat.
You're not staying here?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I've got my own business in Flea Bottom.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: What if someone takes the boat?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Then we're fucked.  Best hurry.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: BRONN and JAIME are walking by the dragon skulls.  Both men have sparring swords in their hand.
We don't have time for this.  We should be preparing the city for a siege.  The Dothraki are coming.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: All the more reason for you to train.  Unless you plan on fighting Dothraki 12 year olds.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I seem to recall them giving you a bit of trouble as well.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And here I am ready to train.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Why down here?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I don't think you want people to see how you look swinging that thing yet.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Today might be the day I kill you by accident.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Oh, you won't be swinging it at me.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: BRONN stops walking and holds his torch out.  TYRION steps from around a pillar and looks at JAIME.  JAIME looks angrily at BRONN.
I'll leave you to it.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: BRONN turns and walks away leaving JAIME and TYRION alone.
I needed to see you and I knew you'd never agree to meet.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JAIME remains silent and stares at TYRION.

You made me look like a complete fool.  I thought I'd surprise you by hitting Casterly Rock, but you were three steps ahead of me.  You abandoned the family home.  Completely unsentimental.  Father would have been proud.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Don't talk about our father.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Listen to me --
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I once told Bronn that if I ever saw you again I'd cut you in half.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: TYRION glances down at the sword in JAIME's hand.
It would take you awhile with a sparring sword.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JAIME shakes his head and says nothing.

He was going to execute me.  He knew I was innocent.  He didn't hate me because of anything I did, he hated me because of what I am.  The little monster sent to punish him.  Do you think I wanted to be born this way?  Did he think I chose --
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What do you want?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Daenerys will win this war.  You're a military man.  You must know there is no way around it.  Daenerys is not her father.  She's even willing to suspend hostilities if Cersei agrees to certain terms.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You want Cersei to bend the knee you can ask her yourself.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Men are in the market selling their wares.  A blacksmith sharpens a sword on a grinding wheel.  DAVOS is walking through the market glancing around.  A man in a blacksmith shop pulls a sword from the fire and begins to hammer it on his anvil.  DAVOS walks into the shop.
I wasn't sure I'd find you.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The blacksmith puts the sword down and turns around, revealing GENDRY, the bastard son of Robert Baratheon.
I thought you might still be rowing.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: GENDRY chuckles and DAVOS smiles.
I looked in shops, taverns, brothels.  I should have known to come straight to the Street of Steel.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Weren't you worried about the Goldcloaks?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I haven't been here in years.  Why should they recognize me?  Sometimes I hardly do.  Nothing fucks you harder than time.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS walks to the side of the shop and inspects a rack of swords.  He pulls one, nods in approval and puts it back in its place.  He turns back to GENDRY.
Anybody give you any trouble?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Here I am arming Lannisters.  I never get a second look.  You were right.  Safest place for me was right under the queen's nose.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Don't be so sure.  Safety is never a permanent state of affairs.  Bad things are coming.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: GENDRY nods.
You came to get me.  You want me to come with you.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I think you need to understand --
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I'm ready.  Let's go.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: You should know what you're heading into.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Don't you think I've been thinking about it every swing of the hammer... how happy I am making weapons for the family that killed my father?  They tried to kill me.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: GENDRY is tossing his tools and apron to the side.  He picks up a satchel and swings it over his head.
I've been getting ready.  I never knew what for, but I've always known I'd know it when it comes.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: You might want to bring one of those swords.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: GENDRY smiles at DAVOS and begins walking towards the weapons.
I don't know much about swinging swords, but this --
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: GENDRY removes a giant war hammer from the wall.
GENDRY and DAVOS turn and walk out of the shop.
DAVOS and GENDRY are walking towards the boat DAVOS left on the beach.
Keep your father's name to yourself.  The situation is complicated enough already.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: GENDRY and DAVOS arrive at the boat.  GENDRY lays his hammer on top of the boat cargo.  DAVOS is gathering the anchor and rope.  Two Goldcloaks begin walking down the beach towards the boat unnoticed by DAVOS and GENDRY.
Who should I say I am?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: DAVOS turns and notices the two guards approaching the boat.  He turns and loudly addresses GENDRY.
I told you, Clovis, if we don't get out of here soon someone is going to --
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You there.
Speaker: GUARD 1

Text: Both guards have their hands on their weapons ready to draw.  DAVOS starts walking towards the guards and spreads his cloak open.  GENDRY remains by the boat.
No weapons, friends.  I promise.  What can I do for you?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Is that your boat?
Speaker: GUARD 1

Text: It is.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: GENDRY looks down into the boat and sees his weapon in plain view.
The docks are that way.
Speaker: GUARD 2

Text: That they are.  I try to stay away from them to avoid good men such as yourselves.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: The two guards look at each other and chuckle.  DAVOS retrieves a coin purse and opens it.
Still five gold dragons?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Are you joking?
Speaker: GUARD 1

Text: You must be even older than you look.  15.
Speaker: GUARD 2

Text: Apiece.
Speaker: GUARD 1

Text: DAVOS angrily reaches into his pouch and pays the men.
I can't say it was a pleasure doing business with you.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS turns and begins walking back to his boat.
What's in the boat?
Speaker: GUARD 1

Text: DAVOS pauses and turns back to the guards.
Not more gold.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Wine?
Speaker: GUARD 2

Text: Mmm.
Speaker: GUARD 1

Text: I like wine.
Speaker: GUARD 2

Text: Or hams.
Speaker: GUARD 1

Text: Come and have a look.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The guards walk over to the boat.  As they approach, DAVOS walks to the boat and pulls a cover to reveal the cargo.  As he pulls back the canvas, he throws it over GENDRY's exposed weapon covering it from view.  There are several baskets of fermented meat.  The guards twist their faces in disgust.
Fermented crab.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: What?
Speaker: GUARD 2

Text: Fermented crab.  One bucket of this triples the brothel's earnings for the week.  A man thinks he's done, he's ready to go back to his loving family, but before he gets his britches up his lady of the hour pops a tiny spoon of that into his mouth.  Five minutes later, he's back in the race.  Here, have a taste.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS scoops up a bit of fermented crab and offers it to the guards.  Both men reach out and take a pinch.  The guards sniff the crab and put it in their mouth.  They both recoil from the taste and look at each other.
I'd hurry to your favorite establishment or you'll put a whole in that chainmail.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The guards and DAVOS laugh.  The guards turn and start walking back towards the city.  GENDRY nods at them as they go.  TYRION appears at the top of the stairs leading to the beach.  The Goldcloaks see him as he's walking down the path.  TYRION walks by the guards and they exchange glances.  The guards stop and turn back toward the boat.
Oi, Dwarf!
Speaker: GUARD 2

Text: DAVOS quickly walks to cut the guards off.
I really wouldn't try anymore until you see how the first bite hits you.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: That dwarf --
Speaker: GUARD 2

Text: The guards blow past DAVOS and begin talking to TYRION.
Where did you get that scar?
Speaker: GUARD 1

Text: Fish hook.  Some men you just can't teach.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We was looking for a dwarf with a scar like that awhile back.
Speaker: GUARD 2

Text: DAVOS is still standing behind the guards.  He retrieves his gold pouch again and holds it up shaking it.
Perhaps there's some arrangement?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The two guards turn back to DAVOS.
Arrangement?  You gonna arrange to pay us more than Queen Cersei?
Speaker: GUARD 2

Text: GENDRY can be seen behind the backs of the guards.  He slowly retrieves his hammer and creeps up behind GUARD 2.  He swings his hammer and connects with the side of the guard's head.  The man drops.  As GENDRY transitions onto the second guard and swings his hammer, GUARD 1 turns to look and catches a hammer blow to the face.
DAVOS is looking at TYRION and motions towards GENDRY.
This is Gendry.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: He'll do.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The men grab onto the boat and begin to push it into the water.
JAIME opens the door and step into the queen's room.  CERSEI is seated near a window speaking to QYBURN.
That won't be necessary.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: QYBURN bows his head and walks to leave the room.  As he passes by JAIME he addresses him.
Ser Jaime.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: QYBURN closes the door as he leaves.  JAIME and CERSEI are alone.  CERSEI begins walking over to a chair in front of JAIME and sits.
Why was QYBURN here?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He's Hand of the Queen.  Why are you here?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I met with Tyrion.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: CERSEI pauses for a moment making JAIME uncomfortable.
What did our brother have to say?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Daenerys wants to meet.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: To discuss a surrender?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: To discuss an armistice.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: She just won a great victory.  Why would she want a truce now?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Because an army of dead men is marching on the Seven Kingdoms.  Tyrion claims he'll have proof.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: CERSEI smirks and looks away from JAIME.
Are you going to punish him?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Tyrion?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Bronn.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: JAIME looks confused.
He betrayed you.  He set up a meeting without your knowledge or consent.  Do you think anything of importance happens in this city without me knowing?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: JAIME shakes his head.
You let it happen.  Why?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I've come to believe that accomodation with the Dragon Queen could be in our immediate interest.  She has the numbers.  If we want to beat her we have to be clever.  We have to fight her like father would have.  Dead men, dragons and Dragon Queens, whatever stands in our way we will defeat it ourselves for our house.  For this.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI lifts her hands from the chair and places them both on her stomach indicating she's pregnant.  JAIME looks shocked.
Who will you say is the father?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: People won't like that.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: CERSEI stands from her chair and walks in front of JAIME.
Do you remember what father used to say about people?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The lion doesn't concern himself with the opinions of the sheep.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME reaches forward and takes CERSEI and kisses her.  While they embrace CERSEI speaks to JAIME.
Never betray me again.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: GENDRY and DAVOS are walking down the beach near the Dragonglass cave.  Groups of men are carrying boxes filled with Dragonglass out of the cave.  DAVOS and GENDRY are having a discussion.
We're leaving today.  The king's got a lot on his mind.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I understand.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: He doesn't need to be thinking about harboring the bastard of a dead king.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You don't have to worry.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: You're just Clovis, a smith who's come to pay his respects before he heads off to work at the Winterfell forges.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Understood.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: DAVOS and GENDRY enter the mouth of the cave.  JON is walking along the corridor.
Begging your pardon, Your Grace.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: JON stops and turns around to face DAVOS.
You survived King's Landing.
Speaker: JON

Text: Yet again.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Your Grace, this is --
Speaker: JON

Text: GENDRY steps forward in front of DAVOS.
It's Gendry, Your Grace.  I'm Robert Baratheon's son.  Bastard son.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: JON looks to DAVOS.
He was meant to keep that to himself.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Our fathers trusted each other.  Why shouldn't we?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I saw your father once at Winterfell.
Speaker: JON

Text: I met yours in my shop.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: You're a lot leaner.
Speaker: JON

Text: You're a lot shorter.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: JON stops smiling and pauses a moment.  Then he chuckles.
I grew up on stories about them.
Speaker: JON

Text: All I ever knew was they fought together and won.  Ser Davos told me where you're going, Your Grace, and why.  Let me come with you.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Don't be a fool.  You're not a soldier.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: No, but I'm a fighter.  And he won't be needing a smith with a sword like that.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Do you know how to use one?
Speaker: JON

Text: GENDRY shakes his head.
Well, that's a problem.
Speaker: JON

Text: I prefer a hammer.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: GENDRY looks to DAVOS.
He can handle himself.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: JON nods.
We could use the help.
Speaker: JON

Text: As my father used to say, it's better to be a coward for a minute than dead for the rest of your life.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I owe you my life.  Twice over.  But if what you said is true about what's out there, I can't wait out this war.
Speaker: GENDRY(to DAVOS)

Text: Yeah.  Nobody mind me.  All I've ever done is live to a ripe old age.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Two landing boats are sitting on the beach surrounded by two groups of men.  A large sailboat is anchored in the bay.  JORAH places his sword and a case of Dragonglass into the boat.  TYRION walks down the beach and stands next to JORAH.
You may not believe it, but I've missed you Mormont.  Nobody glowers quite like you.  Not even Grey Worm.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION retrieves a gold coin from his pocket and turns it in his hands.
This is the coin the slaver gave me when I suggested he free us and pay us.  Remember?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It was supposed to last us the rest of our lives.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: TYRION smiles and hands the coin to JORAH.
Take it with you.  You'll bring it back.  Our queen needs you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JORAH nods to TYRION.  DAENERYS appears and walks up to JORAH.
We should be better at saying farewell by now.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Your Grace, I --
Speaker: JORAH

Text: DAENERYS reaches forward and takes JORAH by his hands.  JON SNOW, DAVOS and GENDRY exit the cave and walk towards the boats.  JORAH bends and kisses DAENERY's hand.  He turns and continues readying the boat.  JON stands in front of DAENERYS.
If I don't return at least you won't have to deal with the King in the North anymore.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS smiles.
But I've grown used to him.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I wish you good fortune in the wars to come, Your Grace.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS nods to JON.  JON turns and walks to the head of the boat.  The men take hold of it.
Heave!
Speaker: JON

Text: The men push the boat into the sea.  DAENERYS and TYRION remain on the beach watching them go.
SAM is seated at a table surround by papers and candles.  He is writing notes into a book.  Gilly is seated across from him reading aloud from a tome.  SAM JR. is playing on the bed.
Do you know how many steps there are in the Citadel?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: No.
Speaker: SAM

Text: SAM looks up from his work annoyed.  He remains silent and continues working.
Guess how many windows are in the Great Sept of Baelor.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: SAMWELL looks away and pauses.
None anymore.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: That's true.  This High Septon Meynard, he recorded everything.  He even recorded his own bowel movements.  What does "annulment" mean?
Speaker: GILLY

Text: It's when a man sets asside his lawful wife.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Meynard says here that he issued an anullment for Prince Rhaegar and remarried him to someone else at the same time in a secret ceremony in Dorne.  Is that a common thing --
Speaker: GILLY

Text: SAMWELL isn't paying much attention to GILLY.  He loudly interrupts her.

These maesters, they set me to the task of preserving that man's window counting and anullments and bowel movements for all eternity while the secret to defeating the Night King's probably sitting on some dusty shelf somewhere completely ignored.  But that's all right, isn't it.  We could all become slavering, murderous imbecils enthralled to evil incarnate as long as we can have access to the full records of High Septon Meynard's 15,782 shits.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Steps.  That number was steps.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: SAMWELL is dismayed.  He sets his quill down and grabs the book he was writing in and hands it to SAM Jr.  He retrieves his cloak and walks out the door.

SAM is walking through a dark library.  He heads to the restricted section and unlocks the barred gate.  He begins removing books and scrolls from shelfs and stuff them in his satchel.  After retrieving what he needs, SAM quickly walks to the exit of the library.  He pauses before he leaves and turns around.  He glances back at the library.  It is many stories tall lined with countless  shelves of books.  SAMWELL looks at the library one last time, turns and walks out of the door.
EXT. CITADEL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: SAMWELL is loading a wagon with his things.  He walks around to the driver seat.  GILLY and SAM JR. are already in the wagon dressed for the road.  SAM climbs aboard and takes the reins in his hand.
Are you sure you want to do this?  You always wanted to be a maester.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I'm tired of reading about the achievements of better men.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: The horse neighs and begins pulling the carriage away from the city.  The Citadel can be seen with a torch burning bright on top of the tallest tower.

ARYA is in the kennels observing PETER BAELISH and a Winterfell servant having a conversation.  The servent is whispering in BAELISH's ear.  ARYA can't hear the conversation.  ARYA sees BAELISH hand the servant a raven scroll.  The servant turns to leave.  BAELISH senses someone is watching him and he looks to where ARYA stood but she has already vanished.  BAELISH turns and leaves the kennels.

ARYA is on the upper level looking down at BAELISH.  He is having a conversation with ROBETT GLOVER and YOHN ROYCE.  She can't hear what's being said.  BAELISH finishes his conversation and walks away from the men.  ARYA disappears behind the corner and continues following BAELISH.

ARYA is walking down the hallway.  She pauses, peers around a corner and looks towards the door of BAELISH's quarters.  BAELISH appears and unlocks his door.  Before he walks in MAESTER WOLKAN approaches him.  She continues watching the men.
I found it, my Lord.
Speaker: WOLKAN

Text: WOLKAN hands BAELISH a raven scroll.
It took some searching.  Maester Llewyn's archives are thorough.
Speaker: WOLKAN

Text: BAELISH reads the note then looks at WOLKAN.
Are you sure this is the only copy at Winterfell?
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: Yes, my Lord.
Speaker: WOLKAN

Text: Lady Stark thanks you for your service.
Speaker: BAELISH

Text: WOLKAN turns and walks away.  BAELISH enters his room and shuts the door.  ARYA continues watching.  A moment later BAELISH opens the door and exits the room, locking the door as he leaves.  After he is gone ARYA walks to the door and produces a lockpick from her sleeve.  She enters the room and begins searching for the raven scroll.  She opens a cabinet but finds nothing of value.  She checks another cabinet, then looks in the fireplace and above the mantle finding nothing.  She lifts up the mattress and finds a small hole cut into the bedding.  She reaches in and retrives the raven scroll.  She unrolls it and reads the contents.
come to King's Landing, swear fealty to King Joffrey and prevent any strife between the great houses of Lannister and Stark. Your faithfull sister, Sansa."
Speaker: "Robb, I write to you with a heavy heart. Our good king Robert is dead, killed from wounds he took in a boar hunt. Father has been charged with treason. He conspired with Robert's brothers against my beloved Joffrey and tried to steal his throne. The Lannisters are treating me very well and provide me with every comfort. I beg you

Text: Arya rerolls the note and exits the room.  She locks the door behind her and leaves the hallway.  After a moment BAELISH emerges from a dark corner, watching ARYA with a smirk on his face.
JON and the raiding party land on the Beach of Eastwatch.  JON looks up at the castle.  The men collect their equipment and make for the castle.
TORMUND, JON, DAVOS, GENDRY, and JORAH sit at a table having a conversation.
Isn't it your job to talk him out of stupid fucking ideas like this?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I've been failing at that job of late.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: How many queens are there now?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Two.
Speaker: JON

Text: And you need to convince the one with the dragons or the one who fucks her brother?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Both.
Speaker: JON

Text: How many men did you bring?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: JON looks around the table.
Not enough.
Speaker: JON

Text: The big woman?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: JON smiles and shakes his head.  TORMUND is disappointed.
We were hoping some of your men could help.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I'll be staying behind.  I'm a liability out there as you well know.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: TORMUND nods his head.
You are.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: TORMUND turns to look at JON.
You really want to go out there again?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: JON nods.
You're not the only ones.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: The raiding party walk down to the Eastwatch cells.  TORMUND is leading them.
My scouts found them a mile south of the Wall.  Said they were on their way here.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: The men look into the cells.  It is occupied by SANDOR CLEGANE, THOROS of MYR, and BERIC DONDARRION.
You're The Hound.  I saw you once at Winterfell.
Speaker: JON

Text: SANDOR pulls a blanket tight around himself and sits up from the table he was laying on.
They want to go beyond the Wall too.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: We don't want to go beyond the Wall, we have to.  Our lord told us the great war is coming.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: Don't trust them.  Don't trust any of them.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: The men turn to look at GENDRY.  GENDRY walks up and presses his face to the bars of the cell.
They're the Brotherhood.  And the last thing their Lord told them to do was sell me to a Red Witch to be murdered.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Thoros?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: THOROS sits up from a dark corner.
I hardly recognized you.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Ser Jorah Mormont --
Speaker: THOROS

Text: TORMUND turns and angrily looks at JORAH.
They won't give me anything to drink down here.  I haven't been feeling like myself.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: You're a fucking Mormont?  Like the last Lord Commander?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: He was my father.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: He hunted us like animals.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: You returned the favor, as I recall.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Here we all are at the edge of the world at the same moment heading in the same direction for the same reason.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: Our reasons aren't your reasons.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: It doesn't matter what we think our reasons are.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: BERIC stands up and walks towards the bars of the cell.
There's a greater purpose at work and we serve it together whether we know it or not.  We may take the steps but the Lord of Light --
Speaker: BERIC

Text: For fuck's sake, will you shut your hole.  Are we coming with you or not?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Don't you want to know what we're doing?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Is it worse than sitting in a freezing cell waiting to die?
Speaker: THOROS

Text: He's right.  We're all on the same side.
Speaker: JON

Text: How can we be?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: We're all breathing.
Speaker: JON

Text: TORMUND hands the cell keys to JON.  JON opens the door and let the men out.

The ranger gate opens and the raiding party consisting of TORMUND, JON, GENDRY, THOROS, SANDOR, JORAH and BERIC stand at the edge of the true north.  There is a blizzard raging and snow blows over the tundra.  JON looks back at the party and the men glance at each other.  THOROS drinks from a flask of wine.  JON looks back to the north and the men begin marching into the wild.  A group of Wildlings pull a sled loaded with equipment behind the raiding party.  The men disappear into the white of the blizzard.
END CREDITS
Script in progress
The camera floats over the painted table showing detailed carvings of rivers, holdfasts, and cities.  A fire burns in the hearth.
BEYOND THE WALL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: A raiding party consisting of JON SNOW, TORMUND, GENDRY BRATHEON, JORAH MORMONT, SANDOR CLEGANE, BERIC DONDARRIAN, THOROS of MYR and several Wildlings are ranging beyond the wall of Eastwatch-by-the-Sea.  The men trek through a frozen valley filled with jagged rocks.  The Wildlings are pulling a sled loaded with gear and provisions.  The camera shifts and the men are climbing a steep mountain covered in snow.
Are you all right?
Speaker: JON(to Gendry)

Text: GENDRY faces JON and grunts.
Ever been north before?
Speaker: JON

Text: Never seen snow before.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Beautiful, eh?  I can breath again.  Down south the air smells like pig shit.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: You've never been down south.
Speaker: JON

Text: I've been to Winterfell.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: That's the north.
Speaker: JON

Text: The group of men continue north.  A Wildling scout is ahead of the group surveying the area.
How do you live up here?  How do you keep your balls from freezing off?
Speaker: GENDRY(to TORMUND)

Text: You have to keep moving.  That's the secret.  Walking is good, fighting is better, fucking is best.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: There's not another woman within 100 miles of here.
Speaker: JON

Text: TORMUND turns to look at JON and GENDRY.
We have to make due with what we've got.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: JON glances at GENDRY.  GENDRY backs away from JON and TORMUND.
This one is maybe not so smart.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Davos says he is a strong fighter.
Speaker: JON

Text: Good.  That's more important than being smart.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: TORMUND looks at JON as they continue to walk.
Smart people don't come up here looking for the dead.  So, you met this Dragon Queen, huh?  And?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: She'll only fight beside us if I bend the knee.
Speaker: JON

Text: You spent too much time with the free folk and now you don't like kneeling.  Mance Rayder was a great man, a proud man.  The king beyond the wall never bent the knee.  How many of his people died for his pride?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: The camera pans out to a frozen vista.  The men are walking across broken slabs of ice and tundra.  There are mountains and a lake of ice in the distance.  The view shifts to GENDRY walking along with THOROS, BERIC and SANDOR.  THOROS is carrying his wine flask.
Are you still mad at us, boy?
Speaker: THOROS

Text: You sold me to a witch.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Priestess.  I'll admit, it is a subtle distinction.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: We're fighting a great war.  Wars cost money.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: I wanted to be one of you.  I wanted to join the Brotherhood but you sold me off like a slave.  Do you know what she did to me?  She strapped me down on a bed, she stripped me naked --
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Sounds all right so far.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Was she naked too?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: She needed your blood.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: Yes. Thank you.  I know that.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: SANDOR steps in front of GENDRY to halt him.
It could have been worse.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: She wanted to kill me.  They would have killed me if it wasn't for Davos --
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: But they didn't, did they?  So what you whinging about?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: I'm not whinging.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Your lips are moving and you're complaining about something.  That's whinging.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: SANDOR motions to BERIC.
This one's been killed six times.  You don't hear him bitching about it.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: SANDOR walks away to join the group.  BERIC and THOROS smile to each other.  THOROS holds his wine flask out to GENDRY who takes a large gulp and hands it back to THOROS.
Good lad.
Speaker: THOROS

Text: The camera shifts to the head of the line.  JON is walking with JORAH.
The first time I went north of the wall was with your father.
Speaker: JON

Text: He was a good man.  He deserved a better son.  Were you with him at the end?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I was a prisoner of the Wildlings.  But we avenged him.  I want you to know that every mutineer found justice.
Speaker: JON

Text: I can't think of a worse way for him to go.  The Night's Watch was his life.  He would have died to protect every one of those men, and they butchered him.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I hate that he died that way.  My father was the most honorable man I ever met.  He was good all the way through.  And he died on the executioner's block.
Speaker: JON

Text: Your father wanted to execute me.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I heard.
Speaker: JON

Text: He was in the right of course.  It didn't make me hate him any less.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: JORAH and JON glance at each other.
I'm glad he didn't capture you.
Speaker: JON

Text: Me too.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: JON stops walking and loosens the belt holding his sword.
Your father gave me this sword.  He changed the pommel from a bear to a wolf, but it's still Long Claw.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON hands the sword to JORAH.  JORAH slowly takes the sword and looks it over in his hands.
Lord Commander Mormont thought you'd never come back to Westeros.
Speaker: JON

Text: JORAH stops examining the sword and looks up to JON.
But you are back and it's been in your family for centuries.  It's not right for me to have it.
Speaker: JON

Text: JORAH pauses, then nods at JON.
He gave it to you.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I'm not his son.
Speaker: JON

Text: JORAH pulls the sword halfway out of the sheath and inspects the blade, turning it in his hands.
I brought shame to my house.  I broke my father's heart.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: JORAH resheaths the blade and hands it back to JON.
I forfeited the right to claim this sword.  It's yours.  May it serve you well and your children after you.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Snow is falling into the courtyard.  The ground is covered with several inches of snow.  Several braziers are burning and a servant carries a bucket of steaming water across the grounds.  ARYA is standing on the upper level looking into the courtyard.  SANSA approaches her from behind.
Father used to watch us from up here.  He wouldn't say much.  You probably don't remember.  You were inside knitting all the time.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I remember.
Speaker: SANSA

Speaker: JAIME

Text: We both saw what just happened. We both saw that thing.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Yes, and I'm not looking forward to seeing more of them. But I'm loyal to the queen and you're loyal to Sansa and her dolt brother.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE hits JAIME on the arm
Oh, fuck loyalty!
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Fuck loyalty?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: This goes beyond houses and honor and oaths. Talk to the queen.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: JAIME looks to CERSEI, who turns and walks away with QYBURN.
And tell her what?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME exits.
Those that remain contemplate what has happened.
I wish you hadn't done that.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I'm grateful for your loyalty, but my dragon died so that we could be here. If it's all for nothing, then he died for nothing.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I know!
Speaker: JON

Text: I'm pleased you bent the knee to our queen
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I'm not going to swear an oath I can't uphold. Talk about my father.
Speaker: JON

Text: That is indeed a problem. The more immediate problem is that we're fucked.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Any ideas as to how we might change that state of affairs?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Only one. Everyone stays here, and I go and talk to my sister.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I didn't come all this way to have my Hand
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I don't want Cersei to murder me either. I could have stayed in my cell and saved a great deal of trouble.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I did this. I should go.
Speaker: JON

Text: She'll definitely murder you. I go see my sister.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (Nods)
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Tyrion exits.
King's Landing portico
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Tyrion walks the halls of the castle, followed by the MOUNTAIN. He meets with JAIME.
You spoke with her?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: At her until she kicked me out. She thinks I was an idiot to trust you. A lot of people seem to think that, actually.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I'm about to step into a room with the most murderous woman in the world who's already tried to kill me twice, that I know of. Who's an idiot?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I suppose we should say goodbye, one idiot to another.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: TYRION advances, and the MOUNTAIN leads him inside
Council Chamber.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The MOUNTAIN accompanies TYRION into the chamber to meet CERSEI.
I shouldn't be surprised, I suppose. She's your kind of woman a foreign whore who doesn't know her place.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: A foreign whore you can't abduct, beat, or intimidate. That must be difficult for you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: So you bring her here with her pet Northerner,  whom you've convinced to bow down before her.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I didn't know about that.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And now you've got them both working towards the same goal, the goal you've worked towards your entire life.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Cersei, I didn't know.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: the destruction of this family.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I am the one preventing that from happening. Daenerys didn't want to debate and negotiate. She didn't want to bring you words. She wanted to bring you fire and blood until I advised her otherwise. I don't want to destroy our family. I never have.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You killed our father
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: After he sentenced me to death for a crime I didn't commit, yes, I killed him. Hate me for it if you want. I hate myself for it in spite of what he was, in spite of what he did to me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Oh, poor little man. Your papa was mean to you. Do you have any idea what you did when you fired that crossbow? You left us open. You laid us bare for the vultures, and the vultures came and tore us apart. You may not have killed Joffrey, but you killed Myrcella, you killed Tommen. No one would've touched them if Father--
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I have never been more sorry about anything.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I will not hear it, not from you.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: (starts)
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I will not hear it!
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: All right. You love your family, and I have destroyed it. I will always be a threat. So put an end to me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: CERSEI pauses.
If it weren't for me, you'd have a motherIf it weren't for me, you'd have a father.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The MOUNTAIN readies to draw his sword. CERSEI sighs and sits back, eyes closed. The MOUNTAIN stands back. TYRION pours himself some wine and drinks it down. He pours another glass, and walks back to CERSEI, placing his cup on her desk. He takes another glass..
I am more sorry about the children than you could ever know.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I will not
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I don't care. I loved them. You know I did. You know it in your heart if there's anything left of it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION pours himself wine and takes a drink.
It doesn't matter. Your love doesn't matter. Your feelings don't matter. I don't care why you did what you did. I only care what it cost us. It cost us our future.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: If there's no future, then why are we here? Why did you allow me to come?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Not to help my enemies collaborate in my destruction.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Yes, no, not what you hoped for, but you must have hoped for something.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What did you hope for?  To make Jon Snow submit to your queen.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Mm, not like this.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: But eventually, you want everyone to bend the knee to her.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Yes.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Why?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Because I think she will make the world a better place.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You said she'd destroy King's Landing.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: She knows herself. She chose an advisor who would check her worst impulses instead of feeding them.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: That's the difference between you. I don't care about checking my worst impulses. I don't care about making the world a better place. Hang the world.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI cradles her belly and TYRION notices. She takes a deep breath.

That thing you dragged here, I know what it is, I know what it means. And when it came at me, I didn't think about the world. Not at all. As soon as it opened its mouth, the world disappeared for me, right down its black throat. All I could think about was keeping those gnashing teeth away from the ones who matter most, away from my family. Maybe Euron Greyjoy had the right idea. Get on a boat, take those who matter.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You're pregnant.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: CERSEI does not answer.
Side Area of the Dragon Pit
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: JON picks up some bleached bones from the dirt floor. DAENERYS approaches him.
No one is less happy about this than I am.
Speaker: JON

Text: I know. I respect what you did. Wish you hadn't done it, but I respect it.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS takes the bone from JON.

This place was the beginning of the end for my family. (Speaks Valerian.) A dragon is not a slave. They were terrifying. Extraordinary. They filled people with wonder and awe, and we locked them in here. They wasted away. They grew small. And we grew small as well. We weren't extraordinary without them. We were just like everyone else.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: She hands the bone back to JON.
You're not like everyone else. And your family hasn't seen its end. You're still here.
Speaker: JON

Text: I can't have children.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Who told you that?
Speaker: JON

Text: The witch who murdered my husband.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Has it occurred to you she might not have been a reliable source of information?
Speaker: JON

Text: You were right from the beginning. If I had trusted you, everything would be different.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: So, what now?
Speaker: JON

Text: I can't forget what I saw north of the Wall. And I can't pretend that Cersei won't take back half the country the moment I march north.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: It appears Tyrion's assessment was correct. We're fucked.
Speaker: JON

Text: (Laughs)
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They hear footsteps, and they walk back to the others. The camera shifts to the main area of the Dragon Pit. TYRION walks in alone. He is followed by CERSEI, the MOUNTAIN, QYBURN, JAIME and the Lannister guards. The northern delegation watches as they approach the dais.

My armies will not stand down. I will not pull them back to the capital. I will march them north to fight alongside you in the Great War. The darkness is coming for us all. We'll face it together. And when the Great War is over, perhaps you'll remember I chose to help with no promises or assurances from any of you. I expect not. Call our banners. All of them.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The North
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: A raven flies in the wintery night towards Winterfell.
Winterfell interior
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: It's not easy for ravens to fly in these storms. Perhaps Jon tried to send word earlier.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: No, this is the way he is, the way he's always been. He never asked for my opinion. Why would he start now?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I can't believe he'd surrender the Northern crown without consulting you.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: This is his writing, his signature. He pledged to fight for Daenerys Targaryen. He's bent the knee.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I've heard gossip that the Dragon Queen is quite beautiful.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: What does that have to do with anything?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Jon is young and unmarried. Daenerys is young and unmarried.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: You think he wants to marry her?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: An alliance makes sense. Together, they'd be difficult to defeat. He was named King.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Even if I wanted to, Arya would never go along. She always loved Jon far more than she ever loved me, and she'd kill anyone who betrayed her family.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You are family, too. Would Arya really murder her own sister?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Do you know what she is now? Do you know what the Faceless Men are?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Only by reputation. They worship the God of Death, I believe. I never trust godly men.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: They're killers. And Arya was one of them. What do you think she's after?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: She's your sister
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: She could want me dead because she thinks I wronged my family.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Why did she come to Winterfell?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: To kill me for marrying our enemies and betraying my family.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Why did she unearth the letter Cersei made you write?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: To provide proof of my betrayals. To provide justification after she murders me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: And after she murders you, what does she become?
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Lady
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA contemplates.
Dragonstone Map Room
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: JON, DAENERYS, DAVOS, JORAH, THEON, VARYS, MISSANDEI, GREY WORM and TYRION strategize.
If we have the Dothraki ride hard on the kingsroad, they'll arrive at Winterfell within the fortnight.
Speaker: JON

Text: And the Unsullied? We can sail with them to White Harbor, meet the Dothraki here on the kingsroad, then ride together to Winterfell.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Perhaps you should fly to Winterfell, Your Grace. You have many enemies in the North. Thousands fell fighting your fatherAll it takes is one angry man with a crossbow. He'll see your silver hair on the kingsroad and know that one well-placed bolt will make him a hero. The man who killed the conqueror.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: It's your decision, Your Grace. But if we're going to be allies in this war, it's important for the Northerners to see us as allies. If we sail to White Harbor together, I think it sends a better message.
Speaker: JON

Text: I've not come to conquer the North. I'm coming to save the North. We sail together.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Dragonstone Throne Room
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: JON and DAVOS walk through the room, away from the meeting. THEON trails behind.
Jon.
Speaker: THEON

Text: JON and DAVOS stop and turn.
Can I speak with you?
Speaker: THEON

Text: All right.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAVOS exits.
What you did in King's Landing, what you said... You could've lied to Cersei about bending the knee to Daenerys. You risked everything to tell an enemy the truth.
Speaker: THEON

Text: We went down there to make peace. And it seems to me we need to be honest with each other if we're going to fight together.
Speaker: JON

Text: You've always known what was right. Even when we were all young and stupid, you always knew. Every step you take it's always the right step.
Speaker: THEON

Text: It's not. It may seem that way from the outside, but I promise you, it's not true. I've done plenty of things that I regret.
Speaker: JON

Text: Not compared to me, you haven't.
Speaker: THEON

Text: No. Not compared to you.
Speaker: JON

Text: I always wanted to do the right thing. Be the right kind of person. But I never knew what that meant. It always seemed like there's like there was an impossible choice I had to make. Stark or Greyjoy.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Our father was more of a father.
Speaker: JON

Text: He was.
Speaker: THEON

Text: And you betrayed him. Betrayed his memory.
Speaker: JON

Text: I did.
Speaker: THEON

Text: (SIGHS) But you never lost him. He's a part of you. Just like he's a part of me.
Speaker: JON

Text: But the things I've done.
Speaker: THEON

Text: It's not my place to forgive you for all of it. But what I can forgive, I do. You don't need to choose. You're a Greyjoy and you're a Stark.
Speaker: JON

Text: When I was Ramsay's prisoner, Yara tried to save me. She's the only one who tried to save me. (SNIFFLES) She needs me now.
Speaker: THEON

Text: So, why are you still talking to me?
Speaker: JON

Text: JON exits.
The shores of King's Landing
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: HARRAG and the ironborn load their skiffs, preparing to depart.
Load up. Load up, lads. Go on. Tide's coming in.
Speaker: HARRAG

Text: THEON approaches
All of us chose to follow Yara. We left the Iron Islands for Yara. She would never leave one of us behind. We're not leaving her behind.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Your sister--
Speaker: HARRAG

Text: She's not dead.
Speaker: THEON

Text: She's dead. Even if Euron hasn't cut her throat yet, she's dead.
Speaker: HARRAG

Text: She's our queen
Speaker: THEON

Text: She's your sister
Speaker: HARRAG

Text: I did. I ran from my uncle.
Speaker: THEON

Text: So, why in fuck's name should we listen to you? They say the dead can't swim. We're going to sail east, find a nice, quiet island, kill all the men, and take their wives for ourselves.
Speaker: HARRAG

Text: We're done with all that.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Who says we are?
Speaker: HARRAG

Text: Yara did. She made a pledge. We're going to find her, and we're going to set her free.
Speaker: THEON

Text: HARRAG spits in THEON's face. The men laugh.
Run away, little Theon. It's what you do best.
Speaker: HARRAG

Text: He needs to shut his mouth.
Speaker: MAN

Text: HARRAG swings a strong blow to THEON's chin. THEON reels, but recovers to throw a counter-punch. HARRAG evades the blow, they grapple and THEON is thrown to the ground.
Hey!
Speaker: MAN

Text: The ironborn are enjoying the fight. THEON gets up and the grapple, before HARRAG lands a head butt. Followed by a leveling punch to the face.
Oh, yes!
Speaker: MAN #2

Text: That's more like it.
Speaker: MAN #3

Text: THEON charges, grabbing HARRAG around the waist. But HARRAG gets the better of him, and THEON ends up back on the sand, bloodied.
Stay down or I'll kill you!
Speaker: HARRAG

Text: THEON gets up, woozy. HARRAG punches him again, and he crumbles to the sand, groaning.
(panting) I said stay down or I'll kill you!
Speaker: HARRAG

Text: THEON gets up again, and they set on one another. HARRAG knees THEON in the groin, but there is no reaction. He does it again. THEON is emboldened. He head butts HARRAG, then tackles him. He sits astride HARRAG and delivers repeated, punishing blows to his bloodied face. HARRAG is defeated.
Not for me. For Yara!
Speaker: THEON

Text: Yara!
Speaker: MEN

Text: THEON staggers to the water, and he cleanses his face.
King's Landing Exterior
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Sansa contemplates the landscape on a grey, snowy day from the ramparts of Winterfell. She makes up her mind and walks towards a guard.
Have my sister
Speaker: SANSA

Text: The Great Hall of Winterfell
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: SANSA and BRAN sit at the great table, with WOLKAN standing to the side. The room is filled with northmen. The guards escort ARYA into the hall, and leave her standing alone in front of the table. ARYA looks around and spies YOHN ROYCE, then LITTLEFINGER.
Are you sure you want to do this?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: It's not what I want. It's what honor demands.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: And what does honor demand?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: That I defend my family from those who would harm us. That I defend the North from those who would betray us.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: All right, then. Get on with it.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You stand accused of murder. You stand accused of treason. How do you answer these charges Lord Baelish?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA and ARYA turn their heads towards LITTLEFINGER, as do the others in the room. LITTLEFINGER is dumbfounded.
My sister asked you a question.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Lady Sansa, forgive me I'm a bit confused.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Which charges confuse you? Let's start with the simplest one you murdered our aunt, Lysa Arryn. You pushed her through the Moon Door and watched her fall. Do you deny it?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I did it to protect you.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: You did it to take power in the Vale. Earlier, you conspired to murder Jon.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Whatever your aunt
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: You had Aunt Lysa send a letter to our parents telling them it was the Lannisters who murdered Jon.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I know of no such letter.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: You conspired with Cersei Lannister and Joffrey Baratheon to betray our father.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I deny it! None of you were there to see what happened. None of you knows the truth.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: You held a knife to his throat.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: LITTLEFINGER turns to face BRAN, surprised at this knowledge he has.
You said, "I did warn you not the trust me."
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You told our mother
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA draws the knife.
Lady Sansa, I have known you since you were a girl. I've protected you.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Protected me? By selling me to the Boltons?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: If we could speak alone, I can explain everything.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: Sometimes when I'm trying to understand a person's motives, I play a little game. I assume the worst. What's the worst reason you have for turning me against my sisterThat's what you do, isn't it? That's what you've always done turn family against family, turn sister against sister. That's what you did to our mother.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Sansa, please.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I'm a slow learner, it's true. But I learn.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Give me a chance to defend myself. I deserve that.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: (Nods.)
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I am Lord Protector of the Vale and I command you to escort me safely back to the Eyrie.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: I think not.
Speaker: JOHN ROYCE

Text: LITTLEFINGER kneels before SANSA.
Sansa, I beg you! I loved your mother since the time I was a boy.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: And yet, you betrayed her.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I loved you. More than anyone.
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: And yet, you betrayed me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA rises.
When you brought me back to Winterfell, you told me there's no justice in the world, not unless we make it. Thank you for all your many lessons, Lord Baelish. I will never forget them.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: ARYA steps briskly towards LITTLEFINGER, and slashes his throat with his own knife, swiftly.
Sansa! (GASPS) I--
Speaker: LITTLEFINGER

Text: ARYA returns tableside, and everyone watches as LITTLEFINGER dies.
An Interior Courtyard in King's Landing.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Jaime paces into the yard. CERSEI watches from the upper level.
Our men in King's Landing will march north in three days' time.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: It'll take us a fortnight just to gather supplies for the train.
Speaker: MAN

Text: We don't have a fortnight. If the North falls, we fall. Three days. The remaining forces in the Westerlands will take the river road east. We'll meet at Lord Harroway's Town and march together to Winterfell.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Ser Jaime.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The lords bow in union to CERSEI
My lords, I need a moment with my brother.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: MEN

Text: JAIME dismisses them and the lords exit. CERSEI walks down to ground level to join him.
What are you doing?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Preparing the expedition north.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Expedition north? I always knew you were the stupidest Lannister. The Starks and Targaryens have united against us, and you want to fight alongside them? Are you a traitor or an idiot?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You pledged our forces to fight our common enemy.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I'll say whatever I need to say to ensure the survival of our house. You expect me to trust the man who murdered our father.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You saw it with your own eyes. You saw a dead man trying to kill us.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I saw it burn. If dragons can't stop them, if Dothraki and Unsullied and Northmen can't stop them, how will our armies make a difference?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: This isn't about noble houses, this is about the living and the dead!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And I intend to stay amongst the living. Let the Stark boy and his new queen--
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I made a promise.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Our child will rule Westeros.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Our child will never be born if the dead come south.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The monsters are real. The white walkers, the dragons, the Dothraki screamers all the frightening stories we heard when we were young, they're all real. So be it. Let the monsters kill each other. And while they battle in the North, we take back the lands that belong to us.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: And then what?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And then we rule.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: When the fighting in the North is over, someone wins. You understand that, don't you? If the dead win, they march south and kill us all. If the living win, and we've betrayed them, they march south and kill us all!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The Targaryens and the Starks already want to kill us all. Most of them will die in the North.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I faced them in the field. We can't beat them. We can't beat their dragons.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: How many dragons did you see at the pit?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Two.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: What happened to the third?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: For all we know, it's guarding her fleet!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: She came here with her dragons and her Dothraki and her Unsullied. She came here to show us all her power. No, something happened.The dragons are vulnerable.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: We can't beat the Dothraki. We don't have the numbers. We don't have the support of the other houses!
Speaker: JAIME

Text: No, we have something better. We have the Iron Bank. You should've listened more when Father--
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: The Golden Company is not here. They're in Essos. How is a mercenary company in Essos going to help us?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Do you really think Euron Greyjoy turned tail and sailed back to the Iron Islands? Do you think he abandoned the chance to marry the queen?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: You plotted with Euron Greyjoy without telling me, the commander.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And you conspired with Tyrion, the man who murdered our father without telling me, your queen.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I didn't conspire with him.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You met with him in secret without my consent. You planned to promote my enemies' interests. That is the definition of conspiracy.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I pledged to ride north. I intend to honor that pledge.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: And that will be treason.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Treason?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Disobeying your queen
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Doesn't matter what I'd call it.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME starts to exit, but he is blocked by the MOUNTAIN.
I told you no one walks away from me.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Are you going to order him to kill me? I'm the only one you have left. Our children are gone, our father
Speaker: JAIME

Text: There's one more yet to come.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Give the order, then.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: CERSEI hesitates, and JAIME thinks that he has called her bluff. Then CERSEI nods to the MOUNTAIN, who unsheathes his sword. JAIME looks nervous, then makes up his mind.
I  don't believe you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME moves past the MOUNTAIN, who lets him go. CERSEI starts after him, but lets him go.
Outside King's Landing.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: JAIME rides his horse away from KIng's Landing. He inspects his golden hand, then fits his glove over it. He looks up into the grey day, as snow flurries come down. He rides off.
Montage of King's Landing at night.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Winterfell Interior
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: BRAN sits by the fire. There is a knocking on the door.
Come in.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: SAM enters.
Samwell Tarly.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I wasn't sure if you'd remember me.
Speaker: SAM

Text: I remember everything.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Sam closes the door.

Text: Only eighteen goats and eleven sheep.
