Text: The Dothraki men ride away.
What's the matter?
Speaker: JON (speaking the Common Tongue)

Text: The dragons are barely eating.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS walks off and JON follows.
EXT. FLAT CLEARINGJON and DAENERYS walk up to DROGON and RHAEGAL who are standing either side of a pile of bones. The dragons growl softly as they approach.
What's wrong with them?
Speaker: JON

Text: They don't like the North.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: She touches DROGON's nose and RHAEGAL looks at JON and gets close. DAENERYS climbs on DROGON's back and, smiling, nods towards RHAEGAL.
Go on.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON looks at the dragon, unsure as to what to do.
I don't know how to ride a dragon.
Speaker: JON

Text: Nobody does. Until they ride a dragon.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: What if he doesn't want me to?
Speaker: JON

Text: Then I've enjoyed your company, Jon Snow.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Defeated, JON walks around the side of RHAEGAL and then climbs on top whilst grunting.
What do I hold onto?
Speaker: JON

Text: Whatever you can.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON grabs onto the dragon, which then proceeds to lift off whilst chittering. DAENERYS watches and smiles, before leaning forwards, cuing DROGON to follow suit. The dragons continue to fly higher, RHAEGAL turns side-to-side causing JON to yell out. They fly over the soldiers outside Winterfell and past TYRION, DAVOS and VARYS who are standing at the castle wall, staring in disbelief as they watch. DROGON flies ahead of RHAEGAL and continues higher before nosediving; RHAEGAL follows after his brother. They continue calmly before reaching a canyon, where the dragons dive straight down, before flying along the canyon floor. Once out of the canyon, RHAEGAL turns off, so DAENERYS instructs DROGON to do the same. She lands down next to JON. JON and DAENERYS, now dismounted from their dragons, walk together away from the dragons.
You've completely ruined horses for me.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS giggles and then notices a large waterfall, they stop.
We could stay a thousand years-
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: She turns back to look at JON.
No one would find us.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: We'd be pretty old.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS chuckles and the two walk up to one another.
It's cold up here for a southern girl.
Speaker: JON

Text: So keep your queen warm.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON pulls her in and kisses her. The dragons start to growl softly causing JON to pull away.
Don't be afraid.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They smile and continue their kiss in each other's embrace. JON opens his eyes to see DROGON staring at them.
GENDRY amongst other men occupy the forge, using the furnaces to create weapons from dragonglass
Gendry?
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: He's here.
Speaker: MAN 2

Text: GENDRY hears and grabs a large axe made from dragonglass. He hands it over to SANDOR.
It isn't easy making a blade that big with dragonglass.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: You're saying you're good, is that it?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: I'm just saying it's a tricky material to-
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: You know who makes weapons for the wildlings? Cripples and cocksuckers. Which one are you?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Leave him be.
Speaker: ARYA (O.S.)

Text: GENDRY and SANDOR turn to see ARYA and stare at her.
I heard you were here. You left me to die.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: First I robbed you.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: SANDOR stands up and walks over to her, not breaking eye-contact.
You're a cold little bitch, aren't you? Guess that's why you're still alive.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: SANDOR exits and GENDRY walks up to ARYA.
That was a nice ax you made for him. You've gotten better.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Yeah, thanks. So have you.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: He pauses.
I mean, you look good.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Thanks. So do you.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: GENDRY pauses, he then walks away whilst still talking to her.
It's not a bad place to grow up, if it wasn't so cold.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: ARYA follows.
Stay close to that forge, then.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Is that a command, Lady Stark?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Don't call me that.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: As you wish, milady.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: She smiles and chuckles.
Here's my wish.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA hands GENDRY a piece of parchment with a detachable spear drawn on it, with a dragonglass tip.
Can you make it?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: What do you need something like this for?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Can you make it or not?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You already have a sword. What's that?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: ARYA removes a Valyrian steel dagger from her person and hands it to him.
It's Valyrian steel. I always knew you were just another rich girl.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: ARYA smirks and takes the dagger back.
You don't know any other rich girls.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA walks off before turning back and smiling and then back around again without breaking stride.
WINTERFELL – SANSA'S QUARTERS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: SANSA is reading a letter when there is a knock on the door.
Come in.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: The door creaks open and then shuts. JON walks in before stopping next to her. SANSA sighs.
Lord Glover wishes us good fortune, but he's staying in Deepwood Motte with his men.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: "House Glover will stand behind House Stark as we have for a thousand years." Isn't that what he said?
Speaker: JON

Text: "I will stand behind Jon Snow," he said.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA stands up and walks a bit before stopping and turning to look at him
"The King in the North."
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I told you we needed allies.
Speaker: JON

Text: You didn't tell me you were going to abandon your crown.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I never wanted a crown. All I wanted was to protect the North. I brought two armies home with me, two dragons.
Speaker: JON

Text: And a Targaryen queen.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JON sighs.

Do you think we can beat the Army of the Dead without her? I fought them, Sansa. Twice. You want to worry about who holds what title, I'm telling you it doesn't matter. Without her, we don't stand a chance.
Speaker: JON

Text: They fall silent and JON sighs.
Do you have any faith in me at all?
Speaker: JON

Text: You know I do.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: She'll be a good queen. For all of us. She's not her father.
Speaker: JON

Text: SANSA sighs.
No, she's much prettier.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JON scoffs.
Did you bend the knee to save the North or because you love her?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: He looks up at her.
A door creaks open and then shuts as DAENERYS and JORAH enter the library. They walk to where SAMWELL TARLY sits and JORAH nods in his direction. DAENERYS clears her throat.
Oh!
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Startled, SAMWELL stands up and dusts himself off.
So you're the man?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Um. Which man am I, Your Grace?
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: The one who saved Ser Jorah when no one else could.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They could, they just wouldn't.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I'll have to make some changes in the Citadel when I take my throne. A great service merits a great reward.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Oh, it's my honor to serve you, Your Grace.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Well, there must be something I could give you.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: SAMWELL nods.
If it's not too much trouble, I could use a pardon.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: For what crime?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Um, I borrowed a few books from the Citadel.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: JORAH and DAENERYS both smile to themselves.
And also a sword.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: DAENERYS looks at him, confused.
From the Citadel?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: From my family. It's been in House Tarly for generations.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: DAENERYS' face drops and she looks concerned.
It would've been mine anyway, eventually, but my father had other ideas.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Not Randyll Tarly?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You know him?
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: He looks at her, surprised. JORAH looks guilty.
I offered to let him retain his lands and titles if he bent the knee. He refused.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JORAH looks down as SAMWELL tried to hold it together. He gulps.
Well At least I'll be allowed home again, now that my brother's the lord.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: DAENERYS' face is stern.
Your brother stood with your father.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: SAMWELL's lips start quivering and his breathe becomes shaky.
Of course.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: SAMWELL exits quickly, and DAENERYS and JORAH look at each other.
SAMWELL heads outside before being startled by a horse carrying a wagon. He stops and sees BRAN staring at him from across the courtyard. He walks over.
What are you doing out here?
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Waiting, for an old friend. It's time to tell Jon the truth.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: SAMWELL shakes his head.
No, no. You're his brother. Shouldn't you tell him?
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: I'm not his brother. He trusts you more than anyone. Now's the time.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: JON blows out a candle and stands back to look at his father, EDDARD STARK's, statue. He sighs and hears a man grunting and a thud. He walks around the corner to see SAMWELL stand up.
Sam?
Speaker: JON

Text: I'm sorry, I know I'm not supposed to be down here.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: JON grabs SAMWELL and hugs him tightly.
Were you hiding from me?
Speaker: JON

Text: Of course not.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: What are you doing in Winterfell? Or did you read every book in the Citadel already?
Speaker: JON

Text: He looks at SAMWELL's face and sees he is worried.
What's wrong? Gilly? Is she all right?
Speaker: JON

Text: She's good.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Little Sam?
Speaker: JON

Text: Don't you know?
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Know what?
Speaker: JON

Text: Daenerys. She executed my father and brother. They were her prisoners.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: JON looks at SAMWELL, shocked at the news he was hearing.
She didn't tell you.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: I'm so sorry. We need to end this war.
Speaker: JON

Text: Would you have done it?
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Well, I've executed men who disobeyed me.
Speaker: JON

Text: You've also spared men. Thousands of wildlings when they refused to kneel.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: I wasn't a king.
Speaker: JON

Text: But you were. You've always been.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: I gave up my crown, Sam.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON starts walking away, SAMWELL follows.
I bent the knee. I'm not King in the North anymore.
Speaker: JON

Text: I'm not talking about the King in the North. I'm talking about the King of the bloody Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: JON stops immediately, pauses and turns around.
Bran and I worked it out. I had a High Septon's diary. Bran had whatever Bran has.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: What are you talking about?
Speaker: JON

Text: Your mother was Lyanna Stark.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: JON exhales sharply.
My father was the most honorable man I ever met. You're saying he lied to me all my life.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON takes a couple of steps back whilst breathing heavily.
Daenerys is our queen.
Speaker: JON

Text: She shouldn't be.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: That's treason.
Speaker: JON

Text: It's the truth. You gave up your crown to save your people. Would she do the same?
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Stay back, he's got blue eyes!
Speaker: EDD

Text: I've always had blue eyes!
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Everyone pauses and lowers their weapons.
Did you find anyone?
Speaker: BERIC

Text: EDD leads BERIC and TORMUND through a large hall, faintly illuminated by BERIC's ignited sword. When they reach the far wall there is a young boy impaled on the wall with several spirals of limbs surrounding him.
The Umber boy.
Speaker: EDD

Text: It's a message. From the Night King.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: His army's between us and Winterfell. We're on foot.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: We rode down from Castle Black. We can double up on the horses.
Speaker: EDD

Text: If the horses last, we'll get there before the dead.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: UMBER's eyes open.
We just have to hope the Night King doesn't come first-
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: UMBER starts shrieking, the three men start clamouring and BERIC shoves his sword in the boy, both igniting him and causing him to shriek even louder. The shrieking eventually stops, but not before the entire mosaic of appendages has been engulfed by flames.
WINTERFELL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The cloaked man rides the horse up to the stable and dismounts as men around shout indistinctly. He removes his hood and JAIME LANNISTER's face is revealed. He sighs and looks around the courtyard before BRAN catches his eye. JAIME stares at him in disbelief at the camera zooms in on BRAN's face.
CREDITS
JAIME LANNISTER stands in the Great Hall of Winterfell.
When I was a child, my brother would tell me a bedtime story about the man who murdered our father.
Speaker: DAENERYS TARGARYEN

Text: The camera cuts to a wide view of the hall and we see a multitude of guards placed around the room and the many who ally with House Stark. Sitting at the head of the room is DAENERYS in the centre of a long table; JON SNOW sits on her left and SANSA STARK on her right and JAIME is standing in the middle of the room facing DAENERYS. On the left of the room there is a shorter table where TYRION LANNISTER, LORD VARYS, MISSANDEI and JORAH MORMONT sit. On the right there is another table where DAVOS SEAWORTH, LYANNA MORMONT, LORD YOHN ROYCE, ALYS KARSTARK and BRIENNE OF TARTH sit
Who stabbed him in the back and cut his throat. Who sat down on the Iron Throne and watched as his blood poured onto the floor.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JAIME’s eyes lowered.
He told me other stories as well. About all the things we would do to that man once we took back the Seven Kingdoms and had him in our grasp.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: She pauses.
Your sister pledged to send her army north.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: She did.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I don't see an army. I see one man, with one hand. It appears your sister lied to me.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: TYRION looks up at his brother and JAIME looks back.
She lied to me as well. She never had any intention of sending her army north.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: DAENERYS turned her glare towards TYRION.
She has Euron Greyjoy's fleet and 20,000 fresh troops. The Golden Company from Essos, bought and paid for. Even if we defeat the dead, she'll have more than enough to destroy the survivors.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: "We"?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I promised to fight for the living. I intend to keep that promise.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: TYRION steps forwards towards DAENERYS.
Your Grace, I know my brother-
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Like you knew your sister?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: He came here alone, knowing full well how he'd be received. Why would he do that if he weren't telling the truth?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Perhaps he trusts his little brother to defend him, right up to the moment he slits my throat.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: TYRION looks to JON and SANSA.
You're right. We can't trust him. He attacked my father in the streets. He tried to destroy my house and my family, the same as he did yours.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Do you want me to apologize? I won't. We were at war. Everything I did, I did for my house and my family. I'd do it all again.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The things we do for love.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: DAENERYS, SANSA and JON all turn slowly to look at BRAN who sits to the side of SANSA. JAIME looks at him and BRAN maintains eye-contact.
So why have you abandoned your house and family now?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Because this goes beyond loyalty.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He looks around to see BRIENNE, then turns back.
This is about survival.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: TYRION turns to look at DAENERYS. BRIENNE then stands up.
You don't know me well, Your Grace.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: She walks from behind her table to stand in the middle of the Hall beside JAIME.

But I know Ser Jaime. He is a man of honor. I was his captor once. But when we were both taken prisoner and the men holding us tried to force themselves on me, Ser Jaime defended me. And lost his hand because of it.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: She then addresses SANSA.
Without him, my lady, you would not be alive. He armed me, armored me, and sent me to find you and bring you home because he'd sworn an oath to your mother.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: SANSA looks down and then back up at BRIENNE.
You vouch for him?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I do.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You would fight beside him?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I would.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I trust you with my life. If you trust him with yours, we should let him stay.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: What does the Warden of the North say about it?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: She turns to JON who sighs.
We need every man we can get.
Speaker: JON

Text: The room falls silent as DAENERYS thinks to herself.
Very well.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: TYRION exhales sharply in relief. GREY WORM picks up JAIME’s sword, walks over to him, handing it over aggressively.
Thank you, Your Grace.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: DAENERYS stands up and the rest of the room does as she does. SANSA exits. DAENERYS turns to JON who exits after his sister. DAENERYS then exits followed by TYRION, VARYS, JORAH and MISSANDEI. JAIME then catches BRIENNE’s eye as she leaves and then he ends up looking at BRAN again who mimics his stare.
WINTERFELL – HALLWAY
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: DAENERYS walks along the hallway outside the hall followed by TYRION, VARYS and JORAH.
Either you knew Cersei was lying and let me believe otherwise, or you didn't know at all. Which makes you either a traitor or a fool.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I was a fool.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Not for the first time.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS stops walking and turns to TYRION.
Cersei still sits on the throne. If you can't help me take it back, I'll find another Hand who can.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS exits. TYRION turns to VARYS and JORAH.
I suspect one of you will be wearing this before it's all over.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Men chatter indistinctly as they forge the weapons. GENDRY walks into frame, dumping dragonglass out of a bucket. He then walks up to furnace and pulls out some dragonglass, moulding it and then dousing it in a bucket of water. ARYA STARK walks towards him. As the steam rises from the bucket she catches his eye.
Don't you have something better to do?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: You make my weapon yet?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Just as soon as I'm done making a few thousand of these.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: GENDRY hands her a small axe with a blade made of dragonglass.
You should make mine first. And make sure it's stronger than this.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: GENDRY grabs the axe and brings it down harshly on a wooden stump.
It's strong enough.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: GENDRY moves to a pile of dragonglass spearheads and checks on it, ARYA follows.
It's going to be safer down in the crypt, you know.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Are you going to be down in the crypt?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: No, but-
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: But you're a fighter.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: He glances up at her.
I've done my share.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: You've fought them?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I did. Some of them.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: How many?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: A few. That was enough.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: What are they like?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Bad. Really bad.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: "Really bad"?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: She walks behind him and around the other side of the table so she is facing him.
Even a smith's apprentice can do better than "really bad." What do they look like? What do they smell like? How do they move? How hard are they to kill?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Look, I know you want to fight. And I know you're not scared of rapers or murderers or-This is different. This is-This is death. You want to know what they're like? Death. That's what they're like.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: ARYA picks up one of the spearheads, turning it in her hand.
I know Death.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: She throws the spearhead, narrowly missing a blacksmith’s head. GENDRY exhales, staring in disbelief at the dragonglass impaled on the wooden beam.
He's got many faces.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: She tosses another landing next to the first. The blacksmith quickly runs away. GENDRY slowly turns back to ARYA who picks up a third spearhead.
I look forward to seeing this one.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: She throws it and it lands with the first two. GENDRY chuckles to himself and ARYA walks back round the table and past GENDRY.
My weapon?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I'll get right on it.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: ARYA walks off as GENDRY watches. He smirks to himself.
The camera pans from behind a tree to show BRAN sitting in his wheelchair facing the weirwood tree. JAIME walks towards him. He stops a couple feet from him and looks down.
I'm sorry for what I did to you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRAN turns his head towards JAIME.
You weren't sorry then. You were protecting your family.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: JAIME walks around in front of BRAN.
I'm not that person anymore.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You still would be, if you hadn't pushed me out of that window. And I would still be Brandon Stark.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You're not?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: No. I'm something else now.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You're not angry at me.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I'm not angry at anyone.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Why didn't you tell them?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You won't be able to help us in this fight if I let them murder you first.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: JAIME nods and raises an eyebrow.
What about afterwards?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: How do you know there is an afterwards?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: JAIME stares at BRAN.
All of the northerners are busy building defences in preparation for the army of the dead as TYRION walks past. JAIME approaches him.
Well, here we are.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Yes, here we are.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Together again.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: A man standing above them clears his throat and then spits on the floor beside them.
And the masses rejoice.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: How do they feel about their new queen?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: She's your new queen too.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They start walking together.
They remember what happened the last time Targaryens brought dragons north. They'll come around once they see Daenerys is different.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And she is? Different?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: She is.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You're sure about her?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I am.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She didn't seem sure about you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: It's hard to blame her. I made a mistake common to clever people. I underestimated my opponents.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Hmm.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Cersei told me the pregnancy had changed her. A chance for you both to start again. And I believed her.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They stop walking and TYRION turns to look up at JAIME.
Was she lying about the baby too?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No, that part is real.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: TYRION thinks to himself and they both start walking again.
She's always been good at using the truth to tell lies. I wouldn't be too hard on yourself. She's fooled me more than anybody.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: They start to walk up a staircase and TYRION turns to look at JAIME.
What?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: She never fooled you. You always knew exactly what she was, and you loved her anyway.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION walks ahead as JAIME remains in the same spot. After a couple seconds, he follows. They both walk along the walls of castle looking over the courtyard.
So we're going to die at Winterfell. Not the death I would've chosen. I always pictured myself dying in my own bed, the age of 80, with a belly full of wine and-
Speaker: TYRION

Text: A girl's mouth around-
Speaker: BOTH

Text: Your cock.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: My cock.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION smiles up at JAIME.
At least Cersei won't get to murder me. I'm sure I'll feel some satisfaction denying her that pleasure while I'm being ripped apart by dead men.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JAIME notices something whilst TYRION continues to talk and walks off.
Maybe after I'm dead I'll march down to King's Landing and rip her apart.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION glances up where JAIME was and notices he is gone, he looks behind to see JAIME looking over the wall. The camera cuts to show BRIENNE walking outside the walls among the Unsullied.
WINTERFELL – OUTSIDE FRONT GATE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: GREY WORM is seen testing out the traps around the castle as other Unsullied and northerners work around him. JAIME walks out the front gate. We see PODRICK PAYNE training with a soldier as BRIENNE watches on, smiling proudly. JAIME stands next to her and she glances at him.
Ser Jaime.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Lady Brienne.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: PODRICK blocks the soldier and pushes him back, bettering him. They continue to fight with their swords.
He's come a long way.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He's all right. Still has a lot to learn.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: BRIENNE starts walking away and JAIME follows.
I'm sure you'll teach him. I've been told you're commanding the left flank.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I am. It's, uh-It's good ground.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: It is.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The rise, it should give us some advantage.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: They stop walking.
If we can keep a tight formation, we might be able to beat them back.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Yes, I think you're right.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE quickly turns to face JAIME.
What are you doing?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: What?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I think you know.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I truly don't.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: We have never had a conversation last this long without you insulting me. Not once.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You want me to insult you?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: No!
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Good.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He pauses.
I came to Winterfell because-I'm not the fighter I used to be. But I'd be honored to serve under your command, if you'll have me.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE goes silent and looks down briefly. She returns his gaze.
I better get back.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: BRIENNE walks off, leaving JAIME standing alone.
DAENERYS’ door opens and JORAH walks in.
Forgive me, khaleesi.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Have you done something to offend me?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Many things.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Long ago and long forgiven.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: But you did forgive, despite my failures. When I heard you'd named Tyrion your Hand, it broke my heart.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: When I named him Hand, I didn't know if I'd ever see you again.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You made the right choice.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I wasn't under the impression you liked him very much.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I didn't. His mouth hardly stopped moving between Volantis and Meereen. It was all I could do not to throw him in the sea.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: JORAH chuckles.
But the mind behind all those words-
Speaker: JORAH

Text: He's made mistakes. Serious mistakes.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: As have we all. He owns his and learns from them.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: You're advising me to forgive the man who stole your position?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I am. And one other suggestion, if you'll allow me.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: DAENERYS walks into the library.
The moment we can get the last infantryman out onto the field, we should shut the gates.
Speaker: ROYCE

Text: The camera pans to show ROYCE and SANSA sitting at a table together.
Keep them open for as long as you can. There are still people coming in from the countryside.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: They both notice DAENERYS’ presence and stand up.
Lady Sansa, I was hoping we could speak alone.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: ROYCE looks at SANSA who nods, granting him leave. ROYCE walks towards DAENERYS, bows and then exits. DAENERYS turns to watch him leave before turning back.
I thought you and I were on the verge of agreement before. About Ser Jaime.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Brienne has been loyal to me, always. I trust her more than anyone.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I wish I could have that kind of faith in my advisors.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Tyrion is a good man. He was never anything but decent towards me.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I didn't ask him to be my Hand simply because he was good.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: She starts walking towards SANSA.
I asked him to be my Hand because he was good, and intelligent, and ruthless when he had to be. He never should have trusted Cersei.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You never should have either.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I thought he knew his sister.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Families are complicated.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Ours certainly have been.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They both sit down in the seats SANSA and ROYCE were previously occupying.
A sad thing to have in common.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: We have other things in common. We've both known what it means to lead people who aren't inclined to accept a woman's rule. And we've both done a damn good job of it, from what I can tell.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: SANSA returns her uneasy smile.
And yet, I can't help but feel we're at odds with one another. Why is that? Your brother.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: He loves you, you know that.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: That bothers you.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Men do stupid things for women. They're easily manipulated.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: All my life, I've known one goal: the Iron Throne. Taking it back from the people who destroyed my family, and almost destroyed yours. My war was against them. Until I met Jon. Now I'm here, half a world away, fighting Jon's war alongside him. Tell me, who manipulated whom?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: SANSA scoffs; she then leans forward and places her hand on DAENERYS’ hand.
I should have thanked you the moment you arrived. That was a mistake.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: DAENERYS places her other hand on top of SANSA’s.
I'm here because I love your brother and I trust him, and I know he's true to his word. He's only the second man in my life I can say that about.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Who was the first?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Someone taller.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They both chuckle with one another.
And what happens afterwards? We defeat the dead, we destroy Cersei. What happens then?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I take the Iron Throne.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: What about the North? It was taken from us, and we took it back. And we said we'd never bow to anyone else again. What about the North?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: DAENERYS removes her hand and looks away from SANSA. MAESTER WOLKAN enters the library.
Apologies, my lady. Your Grace.
Speaker: WOLKAN

Text: DAENERYS turns in her seat, agitated.
What is it?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: WINTERFELL – GREAT HALL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: WOLKAN leads DAENERYS and SANSA into the great hall, where we see THEON GREYJOY standing in the centre of the hall surrounded by many of the Ironborn. DAENERYS looks shocked, THEON walks up to her and bends his knee.
My queen.
Speaker: THEON

Text: Your sister?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: She only has a few ships, and she couldn't sail them here. So, she's sailing to the Iron Islands instead, to take them back in your name.
Speaker: THEON

Text: But why aren't you with her?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: THEON looks at SANSA.
I want to fight for Winterfell, Lady Sansa, if you'll have me.
Speaker: THEON

Text: SANSA walks up to THEON quickly and hugs him tightly. THEON hugs back.
WINTERFELL – COURTYARD
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Many northerners wait in line to be served food. DAVOS is filling the bowls.
Milord, we're not soldiers.
Speaker: MAN

Text: You are now. Look, I made it through most of my years without ever getting near a fight, but then I survived the Battle of the Bastards. Right outside these walls. If I can live through that, you can live through this. They'll outfit you with weapons at the forge. Right that way.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Thank you.
Speaker: MAN

Text: He nods towards DAVOS and walks off with his bowl.
When the time comes, you'll be down in the crypts.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: The camera pans to show GILLY leading a young woman and an older couple, showing them where they will stay during the battle.
They're the safest place to be. Through that archway right over there.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: Thank you.
Speaker: WOMAN

Text: TEELA, a young girl, walks up to where the food is being served and holds her bowl up. DAVOS has his back turned.
Which way should I go?
Speaker: TEELA

Text: DAVOS turns back around and looks at her.
Which way do you want to go?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: All the children will be going below when the time comes.
Speaker: TEELA

Text: GILLY overhears the conversation and starts to walk over.
But both me brothers were soldiers. I want to fight too.
Speaker: TEELA

Text: DAVOS takes her bowl and fills it up as GILLY sits down next to her.
That's good to hear. I'm going to be in the crypt with my son, and I'd feel a lot better with you down there to protect us.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I'm sure a lot of people would.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: He hands her bowl back to her.
All right. I'll defend the crypt, then.
Speaker: TEELA

Text: TEELA walks off and DAVOS smiles at GILLY. A horn is then blared and the gates are opened as the remaining members of the nights watch return with TORMUND GIANTSBANE and BERIC DONDARRION. SAMWELL TARLY greets DOLOROUS EDD who has just returned. JON sees them and quickly heads over. Before he can embrace EDD, TORMUND hugs him first.
My little crow.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I thought we'd lost you.
Speaker: JON

Text: Almost.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: JON turns to hug EDD. He then turn to BERIC and shakes his hand.
How did you find each other?
Speaker: JON

Text: We met up at the Last Hearth.
Speaker: EDD

Text: The dead got there first.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: The Umbers?
Speaker: JON

Text: Fighting for the Night King now.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: We had to travel around them to get here. Whoever's not here now is with them.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: How long do we have?
Speaker: JON

Text: Before the sun comes up tomorrow.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: JON looks at SAMWELL with a concerned look. TORMUND looks back over his shoulder, surveying his surroundings.
The big woman still here?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Northern soldiers jog around the walls of Winterfell
They're coming.
Speaker: JON (V.O.)

Text: Men are removing dragonglass weapons from carriages and handing to soldier. The camera pans and GENDRY lifts a dragonglass axe up and hands it to a man.
We have dragonglass and Valyrian steel.
Speaker: JON (V.O.)

Text: WINTERFELL – OUTSIDE FRONT GATE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The Unsullied pull ropes, causing a large boulder to be thrown into the air by a large trebuchet. More soldiers march out of the gates of Winterfell.
But there are too many of them.
Speaker: JON(V.O.)

Text: WINTERFELL – BATTLEMENTS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Archers walk up to the edge of the battlements with their bow and arrows. We see a man stretch the bow string
Far too many.
Speaker: JON (V.O.)

Text: A horse neighs and the man looks up over the wall.
WINTERFELL – FRONT GATE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The Dothraki ride along the outside of the wall as the camera pans past the trench of spikes used to defend from the Army of the Dead.
Our enemy doesn't tire.
Speaker: JON (V.O.)

Text: The camera moves farther down until it reaches a gap in the trench outside the gate, the Dothraki ride through the center as Unsullied soldiers emerge from the gate.
Doesn't stop. Doesn't feel.
Speaker: JON (V.O.)

Text: In the library, a large table has a map of Winterfell laid out over it, with various markers placed outside the castle. The Unsullied are organized in three groups in the middle outside the front of the. To either side of the Unsullied are markers representing the Northerners and in front are the Dothraki. Facing towards all these troops are markers representing the Army of the Dead, these markers far outnumber the allies of Winterfell. Standing around the table (clockwise) is SANSA, JON, ARYA, SAMWELL, THEON, ALYS, BRIENNE, JAIME, BERIC, TORMUND, DAVOS, LYANNA, ROYCE, QHONO, GREY WORM, VARYS, DAENERYS, JORAH and TYRION. BRAN is seated behind JON.
We can't beat them in a straight fight.
Speaker: JON

Text: So, what can we do?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: The Night King made them all. They follow his command. If he falls Getting to him may be our best chance.
Speaker: JON

Text: If that's true, he'll never expose himself.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Yes, he will.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Everyone in the room turns to look at Bran.
He'll come for me. He's tried before, many times, with many Three-Eyed Ravens.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Why? What does he want?
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: An endless night. He wants to erase this world, and I am its memory.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: That's what death is, isn't it? Forgetting. Being forgotten. If we forget where we've been and what we've done, we're not men anymore. Just animals. Your memories don't come from books. Your stories aren't just stories. If I wanted to erase the world of men, I'd start with you.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: How will he find you?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: His mark is on me.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: BRAN lifts the cuff of his right arm, revealing a red mark in the shape of a hand.
He always knows where I am.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: We'll put you in the crypt, where it's safest.
Speaker: JON

Text: No. We need to lure him into the open before his army destroys us all. I'll wait for him in the Godswood.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: The camera pans over the map of Winterfell, to the East, yet still within the walls, is the Godswood.
You want us to use you as bait?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: We're not leaving you alone out there.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: He won't be. I'll stay with him. With the Ironborn. I took this castle from you. Let me defend you now.
Speaker: THEON

Text: We'll hold off the rest of them for as long as we can.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: When the time comes, Ser Davos and I will be on the walls, to give you the signal to light the trench.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Ser Davos is perfectly capable of waving a torch on his own. You'll be in the crypt.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: TYRION looks shocked and turns to her.
Your Grace, I have fought before, I can do it again. Alongside the men and women risking their lives.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: There are thousands of them and only one of you. You can't fight as well as they can, but you can think better than any of them. You're here because of your mind. If we survive, I'll need it.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: TYRION nods.
The dragons should give us an edge in the field.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: If they're in the field, they're not protecting Bran. We need to be near him. Not too near, or the Night King won't come. But close enough to pursue him when he does.
Speaker: JON

Text: Dragonfire will stop him?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I don't know. No one's ever tried.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: We're all going to die.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: He turns to look at BRIENNE.
But at least we die together.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Let's get some rest.
Speaker: JON

Text: Everyone begins to leave the library as JON and DAENERYS remain at the table.
Your Grace.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON then exits along with almost everyone else. Only TYRION and BRAN remain.
Do you need help?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You've had a strange journey.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Stranger than most.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I'd like to hear about it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION grabs a wooden chair and drags it over next to BRAN.
It's a long story.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: TYRION sits in the chair.
If only we were trapped in a castle in the middle of winter, with nowhere to go.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Unsullied soldiers clean their weapons as GREY WORM walks past. MISSANDEI walks into the courtyard and sees two young girls.
Hello.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: The girls quickly grab one another’s hands and run off. GREY WORM stands behind her as she turns around to face him. GREY WORM walks up to her.

When Daenerys takes her throne there will be no place for us here. I am loyal to my queen. I will fight for her until her enemies are defeated, but when the war is over and she has won, do you want to grow old in this place? Is there nothing else you want to do, nothing else you want to see?
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Naath. I'd like to see the beaches again.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Then I will take you there.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: My people are peaceful. We cannot protect ourselves.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: My people are not peaceful. We will protect you.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: The camera pans up over the wall and SAMWELL and JON stand next to each other with GHOST, JON’s direwolf, behind them. SAMWELL leans over slightly towards JON.
Have you told her yet?
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: No.
Speaker: JON

Text: Mm-hmm. Being careful. Biding your time. Waiting for the perfect-
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: He pauses and they both look at each other and fall silent. EDD walks up the stair behind them and stands between them.
And now our watch begins.
Speaker: EDD

Text: Gilly? Little Sam?
Speaker: JON

Text: They'll be safe down in the crypt.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: If you want to join them.
Speaker: JON

Text: SAMWELL looks at him and frowns.
To protect them.
Speaker: JON

Text: Everyone seems to forget that I was the first man to kill a White Walker. I've killed Thenns.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Thenn.
Speaker: EDD

Text: I've saved Gilly more than once. I stole a considerable number of books from the Citadel library, survived the Fist of the First Men. You need me out there.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Well, if that's what it's come to, we really are fucked.
Speaker: EDD

Text: Well, calling you "fucked" wouldn't be strictly accurate.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: SAMWELL chuckles and EDD looks at him. He turns to see JON laughing too.
Samwell Tarly. Slayer of White Walkers. Lover of Ladies. As if we needed any more signs the world was ending.
Speaker: EDD

Text: SAMWELL sighs.
Think back to where we started. Us, Grenn, Pyp.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: Now it's just us three.
Speaker: JON

Text: Last man left, burn the rest of us.
Speaker: EDD

Text: The camera rises over the wall and the silhouette of the trees in the distance block the light slowly fading over the horizon.
WINTERFELL – GREAT HALL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The fire in the hearth of the hall is lit. Two wooden chairs sit facing it, occupied by JAIME to the left of the fire and TYRION to the right. They both sip on wine.
I wish Father were here.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JAIME looks at TYRION in shock.
I would love to see the look on his face when he realizes his two sons are about to die defending Winterfell.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JAIME snorts.
That would be something to see.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I remember the first time we were here, the first time I saw this hall.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Mm.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: You were a golden lion. I was a drunken whore-monger. It was all so simple.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It wasn't so simple. I was sleeping with my sister and you had one friend in the world who was sleeping with his sister.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I was speaking in relative terms.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Do you miss it?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Of course I miss it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Well, my golden-lion days are done, but whore-mongering is still an option for you.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: TYRION sighs
It's not. Things would be easier if it were.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION raises his cup to toast.
The perils of self-betterment.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JAIME raises his and they both go to drink. JAIME stops himself when the door to the hall opens and BRIENNE and PODRICK walk in. JAIME stands up quickly and they both turn to look at the visitors.
Oh! My lady.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Oh, we didn't mean to interrupt. We were just looking for somewhere warm to-
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: To contemplate your imminent death. You've come to the right place. You want some of this piss? It's not bad. It's not good either.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION walks over to where the wine is kept, PODRICK starts to walk to him.
Thank you, milord.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: I don't think that's wise.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: PODRICK turns back to BRIENNE.
The battle might start at any moment.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: She pauses.
Half cup.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: And you?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION continues to pour PODRICK’s drink until the cup overflows with wine.
No, thank you. I should try and get some sleep.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You really think any of us are going to sleep tonight? Join us.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME places another chair in front of the fire.
All right. Just a bit.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: TYRION pours BRIENNE a drink and hands it to her as she sits down. PODRICK grabs a chair and brings it over and sits down. DAVOS and TORMUND enter the hall.
Well, what do we have here?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Ser Davos, join us.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No, not for me, thanks. Came here for this.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS stands in front of the fire to warm up.
I figured I could wait to die freezing my balls off out there or wait to die nice and warm in here.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: TORMUND walks up to BRIENNE and stands in front of her.
It could be our last night in this world, you know.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: JAIME, now sitting down next to BRIENNE, glances up.
Yes, well, I'm glad you're here.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: She pauses and quickly tries to recover.
Here fighting with us. Glad you survived Eastwatch.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Would you like a drink?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TORMUND turns to TYRION and raises his drinking horn.
Brought my own.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: TORMUND looks at JAIME, over to BRIENNE, and then back to JAIME again.
They call you "King Killer."
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I'm sure someone does.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: They call me "Giantsbane." Want to know why?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: JAIME sighs and looks over at TYRION who is still standing to the side of the room with his wine. TORMUND grabs a wooden chair and places it with his back to the fire so that he is facing JAIME and BRIENNE. He sits down and leans forwards.
I killed a giant when I was 10. Then I climbed right into bed with his wife.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: DAVOS glances at TORMUND, clearly perplexed.
When she woke up, you know what she did? Suckled me at her teat for three months. Thought I was her baby. That's how I got so strong. Giant's milk.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: TORMUND raises the horn to his mouth and starts drinking from it whilst gulping noisily. Everyone stares at him as the drink pours out the horn, mostly down his front.
Maybe I will have that drink.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: SANDOR “THE HOUND” CLEGANE sits with back against the battlements drinking alone. ARYA walks up to him and he notices her. She walks closer and SANDOR silently offers the drink. ARYA sits down next to SANDOR and takes a swig. They sit silently staring ahead.
You never used to shut up. Now you're just sitting there like a mute.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: Guess I've changed.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: She pauses.
What are you doing up here?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: What's it look like?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: No, I mean, what are you doing up here? You joined the Brotherhood. You went beyond the Wall with Jon. You're here now. Why? When was the last time you fought for anyone but yourself?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: SANDOR turns to her.
I fought for you, didn't I?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: BERIC walks up to the two of them and stops in front of them.
Oh, for fuck's sake. May as well be at a bloody wedding.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: BERIC smiles. He turns to look at ARYA.
My lady. It's good to see you again. I'm sorry we parted the way we did.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: SANDOR turns to ARYA.
Was he on your list?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: For a little while.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: That's all right.
Speaker: BERIC

Text: BERIC sits down on a barrel opposite the two.
The Lord of Light has brought us together all the same. This is his moment. When light-
Speaker: BERIC

Text: Thoros isn't here anymore, so I hope you're not about to give a sermon. Because if you are, the Lord of Light's gonna wonder why he brought you back 19 times just to watch you die when I chuck you over this fucking wall.
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: He points to the wall he’s leaning against. BERIC chuckles and holds his hand out. SANDOR passes him the drink. ARYA stands up and starts walking away from them.
Where are you going?
Speaker: SANDOR

Text: ARYA turns around to look at them.
I'm not spending my final hours with you two miserable old shits.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA exits and SANDOR and BERIC sit in silence.

A bowstring creaks as an arrow is fired. It hits its target next to two other arrows previously shot. The camera cuts to see ARYA holding a large bow in a dimly lit hallway. She lowers it and picks up another arrow. GENDRY watches from a doorway. She fires another arrow and turns as GENDRY walks up to her.
That for me?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: GENDRY raises a spear with a dragonglass head. ARYA lays down her bow and takes the spear.
This'll work.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Last time you saw me, you wanted me to come to Winterfell. Took the long road, but…
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: What did the Red Woman want with you?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: She wanted my blood for some kind of spell.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Why your blood?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I'm Robert Baratheon's bastard. I didn't know until she told me. Then she tied me up, stripped me down, put leeches all over me.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Was that your first time?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: No, yeah, I've never had leeches put all over my cock.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Your first time with a woman.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: What? I-I didn't-I wasn't with her.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Were you with other girls before that in King's Landing?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: GENDRY scoffs.
Or after?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: GENDRY stammers indistinctly.
You don't remember?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: GENDRY scoffs.
Yes, I was.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: One? Two? Twenty?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Well, I didn't keep count.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Yes, you did.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: GENDRY sighs.
Three.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: ARYA pauses and walks up to him.
We're probably going to die soon. I want to know what it's like before that happens.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Arya, I-
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: ARYA inhales sharply as she pulls GENDRY in and starts kissing him. They start undressing themselves and each other whilst still kissing. She pushes GENDRY back onto a pile of bags as she takes off her top. GENDRY, who is still just wearing his pants, notices a couple scars on ARYA’s side.
I'm not the Red Woman. Take your own bloody pants off.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: She pulls her own pants off and climbs on top of GENDRY and starts kissing him.
WINTERFELL – GREAT HALL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The fire is still lit and the people who were in there earlier still sit there. Opposite the fire sits (from left to right) TORMUND, BRIENNE, JAIME, DAVOS, TYRION and PODRICK. They sit in silence before TYRION breaks it.
It's strange, isn't it? Almost everyone here's fought the Starks at one time or another. And here we are in their castle, ready to defend it. Together.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: At least we'll die with honor.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I think we might live.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: DAVOS and PODRICK both start laughing.
I-I do. How many battles have we survived between us? Ser Davos Seaworth. Survivor of both the Blackwater and the Battle of the Bastards.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: All without a shred of combat ability.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Mm. Ser Jaime Lannister, fabled hero of the Siege of Pyke.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Fabled loser of the Battle of Whispering Wood.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME stands up to get himself another drink.
Hear, hear! Ser Brienne of Tarth. Defeated the Hound in-Pardon me, Lady Brienne.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She's not a ser? You're not a knight?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Women can't be knights.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Why not?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Tradition.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Fuck tradition.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I don't even want to be a knight.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: PODRICK looks at her, slightly confused. BRIENNE ignores him.
I'm no king. But if I were, I'd knight you 10 times over.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: You don't need a king. Any knight can make another knight.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME places his cup on the table where the wine is kept.
I'll prove it.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME unsheathes his sword and stands in the middle of the room and holds his sword out.
Kneel, Lady Brienne.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE scoffs.
Do you want to be a knight or not? Kneel.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE looks at PODRICK who nods. She stands up, walks to the middle of the room opposite JAIME and kneels before him. PODRICK and DAVOS both turn in their seats to see and TYRION and TORMUND both stand. JAIME places the sword on her right shoulder.
In the name of the Warrior, I charge you to be brave.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He raises it over her head and places it on her left shoulder.
In the name of the Father, I charge you to be just.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He raises the sword and places it on her right shoulder again.
In the name of the Mother, I charge you to defend the innocent.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: He lowers the sword to his side.
Arise, Brienne of Tarth a knight of the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE smiles as she stands up and the rest of the room all applaud.
Ser Brienne of Tarth! Knight of the Seven Kingdoms!
Speaker: TYRION

Text: BRIENNE smiles ecstatically.
SAMWELL is walking down the stairs from the battlements
We have all we need to win this war.
Speaker: JORAH (O.S.)

Text: I have trained my men, women and children. I have fought before. I can fight again.
Speaker: LYANNA (O.S.)

Text: Please, listen to me. You're the future of our house.
Speaker: JORAH (O.S.)

Text: SAMWELL notices the two talking down in the courtyard and starts to walk towards them.
I don't need you to remind me of that.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: You'll be safer in the crypt. These things we're fighting-
Speaker: JORAH

Text: We now see JORAH and LYANNA up close.
I will not hide underground. I pledged to fight for the North, and I will fight.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: LYANNA turns around to see SAMWELL facing them both
Oh, I'm sorry, I didn't mean to-
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: It's all right. We're done here.
Speaker: LYANN

Text: LYANNA starts to walk off but stops and turns back to JORAH.
I wish you good fortune, cousin.
Speaker: LYANNA

Text: Thank you, my lady.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: LYANNA exits and SAMWELL walks closer to JORAH.
What have you got there?
Speaker: JORAH

Text: SAMWELL raises his sword.
It's called Heartsbane. It's my family sword.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: You still have a family.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: Yes. And I'd love to defend them with it. But I can't really hold it upright. Your father, he taught me how to be a man. How to do what's right. This is right. It's Valyrian steel. I'd be honored if you'd take it.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: He hands JORAH the sword and JORAH removes it from its sheath slightly to examine it.
I'll wield it in his memory to guard the realms of men.
Speaker: JORAH

Text: I'll see you when it's through.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: SAMWELL walks off but stops several feet away and turns back to JORAH.
I hope we win.
Speaker: SAMWELL

Text: WINTERFELL – GREAT HALL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Everyone sits around the fire still but DAVOS is standing next to where the wine is.
We'd better get some rest.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: No, let's stay a bit longer.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We're out of wine.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS sits back down.
How about a song? One of you must know one. Ser Davos?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You'll pray for a quick death.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: TYRION chuckles.
Ser Brienne?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: BRIENNE shakes her head. TYRION turns to TORMUND who shakes his head too.
Mm-mm.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Mmm.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: PODRICK starts singing “Jenny of Oldstones”.
High in the halls of the kings who are gone, Jenny would dance with her ghosts, the ones she had lost and the ones she had found and the ones who had loved her the most.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: WINTERFELL – SAMWELL’S QUARTERS
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: As PODRICK continues to sing, SAMWELL and GILLY lay in bed with LITTLE SAME between them.
The ones who'd been gone for so very long.
Speaker: PODRICK (V.O.)

Text: The camera pans down to show SANSA and THEON sitting opposite each other. PODRICK's singing continues.
She couldn't remember their names. They spun her around on the damp old stones.
Speaker: PODRICK (V.O.)

Text: The camera pans and we see GENDRY sleeping on the pile of bags and ARYA lays next to him with her eyes open. PODRICK’s singing continues.
Spun away all her sorrow and pain. And she never wanted to leave
Speaker: PODRICK (V.O.)

Text: The Unsullied start walking out of the courtyard as MISSANDEI and GREY WORM walk together before he stops her, turns to her, and kisses her. He then turns to leave with the Unsullied and MISSANDEI watches as he leaves. PODRICK’s singing continues.
Never wanted to leave. Never wanted to leave. Never wanted to leave.
Speaker: PODRICK (V.O.)

Text: WINTERFELL – OUTSIDE FRONT GATE
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Everyone gathers outside the castle as they prepare for battle. JORAH rides on his horse and gazes at the horizon to see only darkness. PODRICK’s singing continues.
Never wanted to leave. Never wanted to leave.
Speaker: PODRICK (V.O.)

Text: DAENERYS turns a corner as she sees JON staring at a statute of his biological mother, LYANNA STARK. She walks up to him. He glances at her and smiles as she walks closer. She holds his arm as they both look at the statute together.
Who's that?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Lyanna Stark.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS looks troubled.
My brother, Rhaegar, everyone told me he was decent and kind. He liked to sing. Gave money to poor children. And he raped her.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: He didn't. He loved her.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON turns to face DAENERYS.

They were married in secret. After Rhaegar fell on the Trident, she had a son. Robert would have murdered the baby if he ever found out, and Lyanna knew it. So the last thing she did, as she bled to death on her birthing bed, was give the boy to her brother, Ned Stark, to raise as his bastard.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS starts to look at him, slightly concerned.
My name. My real name is Aegon Targaryen.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS exhales sharply as she pulls away.
That's impossible.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I wish it were.
Speaker: JON

Text: Who told you this?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Bran. He saw it.
Speaker: JON

Text: He saw it?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: And Samwell confirmed it. He read about their marriage at the Citadel without even knowing what it meant.
Speaker: JON

Text: A secret no one in the world knew except your brother and your best friend. Doesn't seem strange to you?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: It's true, Dany. I know it is.
Speaker: JON

Text: If it were true, it would make you the last male heir of House Targaryen. You'd have a claim to the Iron Throne.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Suddenly a horn blares and JON turns around.
JON and DAENERYS walk behind the battlements and stand next to TYRION as the three stare out over the wall.
Form up! Get yourselves back!
Speaker: MAN

Text: JON nods at DAENERYS and they both quickly exit. TYRION watches but turns his attention back over the wall. The camera pans away.
PATH TO WINTERFELL
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: In an icy haze, the mangled legs of a dead horse trot forward before stopping. The camera pans up to show a white walker sitting upon the dead horse and the entire army of white walkers standing in a line upon their horses is slowly revealed. The camera pans around their backs before settling on the faint glow of Winterfell in the distance.
CREDITS
Lyrics for this song have yet to be released. Please check back once the song has been released.
Winterfell, day
Speaker: EXT

Text: JORAH's body lies on an unlit funeral pyre. DAENERYS looks down on his prone body, crying in mourning. She leans down and kisses him gently on the forehead. She then whispers something in his ear.
SANSA weeps over THEON’s dead body, her hand on his chest. She steps back and takes a Stark wolf pin from her chest and secures it on THEON's.

JON, ARYA, SAM and BRAN stand amidst the Stark men, some of whom bear torches. DAENERYS joins the crowd a bit further down, next to GREY WORM, VARYS, MISSANDEI and TYRION. In front of the crowd sits scores of funeral pyres in a grid. Stark soldiers stand at intervals with more torches. SANSA returns to the somber crowd, joining her siblings. Even Grey Wolf stands obediently in mourning. JON steps forward to address those assembled.

We're here to say goodbye to our  brothers and sisters. To our fathers and mothers. To our friends. Our fellow men and women who set aside their differences to fight together and die together so that others might live. Everyone in this world owes them a debt that can never be repaid. It is our duty and our honor to keep them alive in memory for those who come after us and those who come after them for as long as men draw breath. They were the shields that guarded the realms of men. And we shall never see their like again.
Speaker: JON

Text: ARYA  to BERIC, SAM to EDDISON TOLLETT, JON to LYANNA MORMONT. JON looks at DAENERYS. As one, they ignite the pyres. DAENYRYS watches the flames spread under JORAH, then turns away. The living return to the crowd and the flames rise higher. The air fills with a thick black smoke.
Speaker: Soldiers and freefolk hand torches to JON, SANSA, ARYA, SAM, TORMUND, DAENERYS and GREY WORM. They fan out to various pyres in the field, joining their fallen comrades for one final VISIT

Text: Winterfell Great Hall
Speaker: INT

Text: The victory feast is somber and quiet, even though the hall is filled to capacity. At the head table sites BRAN, SANSA, JON, DAENERYS and TYRION.
To your health.
Speaker: MAN

Text: In the crowd, GENDRY looks around. He turns back to the table where the HOUND eats hungrily. GENDRY takes a drink.
Have you seen Arya?
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: You can still smell the burning bodies, and that’s where your head is at.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: I just want to thank her for--
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I'm sure you do.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Look, it's not about that.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Of course it's about that, you twat. Why shouldn't it be? The dead are dead. You're not.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The HOUND takes a deep gulp of his wine. GENDRY gets up, insulted. He walks the length of the hall to exit, but DAENERYS notices him as he passes the head table.
Gendry.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: GENDRY stops and faces her. The hall goes even quieter.
THAT'S right, isn't it?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Yes, Your Grace.

Text: You’re Robert Baratheon’s son.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (nods)
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I didn’t even know he was my father until after he was dead.
Speaker: GENDRY

Speaker: DAENERYS

Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Does anyone?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: No one in the hall responds.
I think you should be Lord of Storm's End.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The crowd murmurs.
I can't be. I'm a bastard.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: No, you are Lord Gendry Baratheon of Storm's End, the lawful son of Robert Baratheon. Because that is what I have made you.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: GENDRY nods in shock and surprise. At a nearby table, DAVOS stands and raises his glass.
To Lord Gendry Baratheon of Storm's End.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Everyone in the hall rises to their feet to salute GENDRY.
To Gendry!
Speaker: ALL

Text: Lord Gendry!
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: Gendry!
Speaker: MAN 2

Text: Gendry!
Speaker: MAN 3

Text: Gendry!
Speaker: MAN 4

Text: GENDRY takes a goblet from the smiling JON SNOW.
Lord Gendry!
Speaker: MAN 5

Text: GENDRY salutes the hall. They cheer in response.
Gendry!
Speaker: MAN 6

Text: The HOUND, still sitting, shakes his head and returns to shoveling food into his mouth. The hall contiunes to cheer.
That's easy, isn't it?
Speaker: MAN 7

Text: TYRION; A fitting reward for a hero.
(to GENDRY) Uh, hold on.
Speaker: SAM

Text: And a Lord of Storm's End who will be forever loyal to you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (to GENDRY) Come, my lord.
Speaker: MAN 8

Text: See? You're not the only one who's clever.

I have to go down and get another barrel.

Text: The Winterfell Great Hall, a bit later.

Text: The mood has lightened. The merry crowd laughs and enjoys themselves. The wine flows freely. A server places a carafe of wine on the table in front of JAIME and BRIENNE.
We fought dead things and lived to talk about it. If this isn't the time to drink, when is?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME pours wine for BRIENNE and himself. BRIENNE watches, a bit nervous. They clink glasses and drink together.
Another part of the Hall
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: DAVOS and TYRION stand talking.
The last time I saw her, I told her I'd kill her if I ever saw her again.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I'm sure you had your reasons.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I did. I do.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: So did you?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Never got the chance. She did it to herself. Or her god did it to her. Lord of Light. We play his game for him, we fight his war and win, and then he fucks off. No signs, no blessings. Who knows what he wants?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I don't imagine thinking about that subject will leave you any happier than before.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And what if I'm not trying to be happy?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Then you're in luck. We may have defeated them, but we still have us to contend with.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Thank you. I feel much better.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: DAVOS takes the wine that TYRION has poured for him and drinks. TYRION exits.
Another part of the hall

A fireplace in the hall
Speaker: CUT TO

More ale!

Text: TYRION address BRAN, who sits nearby.
This is clever. Even better than the saddle I designed for you.

Text: You know our history better than anyone. That will be useful as Lord of Winterfell.

Text: You're the only surviving trueborn son of Ned Stark.

Text: BRAN doesn't answer.
You don't want it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I don't really want anymore.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I envy you.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You shouldn't envy me. Mostly I live in the past.
Speaker: BRAN

All of it.

Text: Go on.

Ah! To the Dragon Queen!

To Arya Stark, the hero of Winterfell!

Rah! Rah! Rah! Rah!
Speaker: ALL

Text: Drink!

I'm fine!

Text: DAENERYS returns to her seat, sitting alone while TORMUND continues to spur on the drunken revelry nearby. The hall is abuzz with merriment.
A table nearby.

(drunkenly) Your turn.

Text: (to BRIENNE) Um You are an only child.

Text: I told you I was.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You didn't.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I did.

Text: I surmised it.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Drink.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Humorously scoffing, BRIENNE drinks.
Go again.

Text: You have danced with Renly Baratheon.

Text: Drink.

Text: TORMUND is quite drunk and vociferous as he celebrates with JON, DAVOS and some free folk.
The other way around!
Speaker: MAN

Text: I saw him riding that thing.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: We all did.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: No. No. I saw him riding that thing.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: JON SNOW, sitting behind him, shakes his head and laughs. He takes another drink as he listens.
That's right, you did.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I did. That's why we all agreed to follow him. That's the kind of man he is.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: Sitting just beyond the group, DAENERYS notices the praise that JON is getting. She watches closely. TORMUND  puts his hand of JON's shoulder with drunken affection. He then throws his arm around JON's shoulder.
(laughing) He's little but he's strong. Strong enough to befriend an enemy and get murdered for it!
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: DAERNERYS continues to jealously observe the adulation that JON receives. A coffee cup rests on the table next to her.
Most people get bloody murdered, they stay that way.

Not this one.

Text: The men laugh.
Yeah, I didn't have much say in that.
Speaker: JON

Text: Ah! He comes back and keeps fighting. Here, north of the Wall, and then back here again. He keeps fighting. He keeps fighting.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: DAENERYS grows more unhappy with the attention that JON is getting instead of her.
He climbed on a fucking dragon and fought. What kind of person climbs on a fucking dragon? A madman or a king!
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: The crowd cheers. JON looks at DAENERYS. She toasts him with her glass. TORMUND continues to laugh as DAENERYS looks around the room, with VARYS standing in the wings behind her. She looks at the drinking game between TYRION, JAIME, BRIENNE and PODRICK.
Drink.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Drink.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Drink.
Speaker: PODRICK

Text: BRIENNE drinks. They all laugh.
DAENERYS looks back at JON and TORMUND, deeling let out. She stands quickly. VARYS stands in response. As she exits, VARYS bows to her, then watches her go with concern.
The drinking game.

Text: TYRION, JAIME, BRIENNE and PODRICK are deep in their cups.
Wrong! Wrong, wrong, wrong! Drink!

Text: BRIENNE and TYRION laugh. TYRION drinks.
Mm!
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You were married. Before Sansa.
Speaker: BRINEE

Text: Drink.

Text: TYRION growls and drinks.
You're drinking wine, but you prefer ale!
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: No!
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION laughs drunkenly, and BRIENNE drinks, smiling.
You're a virgin.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: BRIENNE's face falls. PODRICK drinks nervously. JAIME tries to save the mood.
That's a statement about the present.

Text: At no point in the past, up until this very moment, have you slept with a man. Or a woman.

Text: BRIENNE goes from flabbergasted to angry in the course a moment. She stands.
I have to piss.

Text: TORMUND approaches them
We did it! We faced those icy fucks. Looked right into their blue eyes, and here we are. Now, which one of you cowards shit in my pants?

Please pardon me for a moment.

Text: BRIENNE exits, and the drunken TORMUND moves to follow. JAIME stands quickly and blocks him. They exchange a look. JAIME jovially pats TORMUND on the shoulder to stay him, then turns to follow BRIENNE. Woundedly, TORMUND watches BRIENNE leave, tailed by JAIME. TYRION gets his attention by pouring his wine into TORMUND's drinking horn.
Drink it!

Text: TYRION's eyes hold TORMUND's gaze as he  clinks his glass with the drinking horn. He exits and PODRICK smirks. TORMUND digests the reality of the situation. He returns to his freefolk friends. PODRICK watches him go, and his eyes meet those of a Stark maiden, who smiles at him. He smiles back.
The main hall, later.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: TORMUND, confessional and teary, pours his heart out to the HOUND.  TORMUND; And after all that, this fucker comes north and takes her from me. sJust takes her, like that. I mean it, Clegane. My heart is broken.
TORMUND clasps the HOUND's shoulder.
Don't touch me.

Text: You can touch me.
Speaker: WILLA

Text: TORMUND swivels quickly to find WILLA and SARRA standing nearby.
I'm not afraid of wildlings.

Text: Maybe you should be.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: SANSA watches their interaction from afar. TORMUND chuckles and hugs WILLA close to him
Well, Clegane it's time to drown our sorrows.

Text: I'm not done with my drink.

You saved the day.

Text: You owe me one.  Don't forget that.
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: For the rest of my days.

Text: While the HOUND drains his glass and plunks it on the table, SARRA  walks to the other side of him and sits.
Are you ready now?

Text: The HOUND grabs a large pitcher from the table in front of him and refills his glass.
This is my drink.

Text: SARRA looks across the room to SANSA. She tries to re-engage the HOUND, but he lurches agressively at her, growling. SARRA recoils, then exits quickly
All right!

She could have made you happy, for a little while.

Text: And what's that?

Text: That's my fucking business.

Text: SANSA returns his brush off with silence.
Used to be you couldn't look at me.

Text: That was a long time ago. I've seen much worse than you since then.

Text: Yes, I've heard. Heard you were broken in. Heard you were broken in rough.

Text: And he got what he deserved. I gave it to him.

Text: How?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Hounds.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: The HOUND chuckles.
You've changed, Little Bird.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: The HOUND takes a deep drink.
None of it would have happened if you'd left King's Landing with me. No Littlefinger, no Ramsay none of it.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: SANSA clasps his hand, gently. He looks down at the kindness, then back at her eyes.
Without Littlefinger, and Ramsay and the rest, I would have stayed a Little Bird all my life.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA gathers herself, stands and exits. The HOUND ponders.
Winterfell courtyard.
Speaker: EXT

Text: The rowdiness continues to increase, as the party spills out into the courtyard
Hey!
Speaker: MAN 1

Text: Pour another one.
Speaker: MAN 2

Text: GENDRY searches for ARYA. He enters a passageway away from the festivities. He is startled by an arrow that pierces the wall just in front of his face. He turns to see ARYA holding the bow. He raises both hands in surrender, and enters.
Don't shoot.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: ARYA notches another bow.
It's nighttime, it's freezing, and everyone's celebrating. You should be celebrating with them.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I am celebrating.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: She launches the arrow at a makeshift target tacked to a barrel. She picks up another arrow.
Yeah, I am too. I'm not Gendry Rivers anymore. I'm Gendry Baratheon, Lord of Storm's End. By order of the queen.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: Congratulations.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: GENDRY grabs her quickly and kisses her.

I don't know how to be lord of anything. I hardly know how to use a fork. All I know is that you're beautiful, and I love you, and none of it will be worth anything if you're not with me. So be with me.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: GENDRY kneels before ARYA
Be my wife. Be the Lady of Storm's End.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: ARYA bends down and kisses GENDRY. They stand together.
You'll be a wonderful lord, and any lady would be lucky to have you. But I'm not a lady. I never have been. That's not me.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: ARYA readies another arrow, and lets it fly.
BRIENNE chambers, night.
Speaker: INT

Text: BRIENNE adds a log to the fire that burns in the hearth. There is a knock on the door. BRIENNE walks over and opens the door. JAIME stands at, leaning drunkenly against the wall.
You didn't drink.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME invites himself in. He places a pitcher on the table, and grabs the two glasses nestled the elbow of his right arm. BRIENNE is a bit confused, but she closes the door and walks over.
I didn't drink?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: In the game.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I drank.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: JAIME picks up the pitcher to pour a glass of  wine.
In the game. This is Dornish.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: This is not the game. This is only drinking.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: JAIME hands her a full glass.
Suit yourself.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE drinks, a puzzled look on her face.
You keep it warm enough in here.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME slides off his jacket, with a bit of difficultly, and throws it down on the table.
It's the first thing I learnt when I came to the North. Keep your fire going. Every time you leave the room, put more wood on.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: That's very diligent. Very responsible.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Piss off.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You know the first thing I learned in the North? I hate the fucking North.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: It grows on you.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I don't want things growing on me.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME fills the other glass with a sloppy pour.
How about Tormund Giantsbane? Has he grown on you? He was very sad when you left.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME drinks. BRIENNE's expression softens.
(almost whispering) You sound quite jealous.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: (nods) I do, don't I? It's bloody hot in here.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME works to undo the lacing of his shirt. It is not easy to do it one-handed. He chuckles in embarrassment at his ineptitude. He tries using his left hand and his teeth. BRIENNE realizes that this is a drunken seduction. She swats his hand away.
Oh, move aside.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: BRIENNE undoes JAIME's shirt. He starts doing the same for her.
What are you doing?
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I'm taking your shirt off.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: They both pause at look at one another. BRIENNE undoes her own shirt as he watches. She them helps JAIME to pull his shirt over his heads. She then peels off her own shirt.
I've never slept with a knight before.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I've never slept with anyone before.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Then you have to drink. Those are the rules.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I told you--
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: JAIME cuts her short with a hungry kiss. She returns in kind.
Winterfell, JON's chambers, night
Speaker: INT

Text: JON sits at the table, his head propped up on one fist, tired or drunk or both. DAENERYS opens the door and enters.
Are you drunk?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON looks at her for a beat.
No.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON stands and stumbles a bit. He laughs at himself.
Only a little.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS shuts the door and moves closer.
I didn't know Ser Jorah well but I know this. If he could have chosen a way to die, it would have been protecting you.
Speaker: JON

Text: He loved me. And I couldn't love him back. Not the way he wanted. Not the way I love you.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: They embrace.
Is that all right?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON and DAENERYS kiss, gently at first. Their passion builds and they start to undress one another while still kissing. JON pulls back, a conflicted look on his face. DAENERYS responds with dejection. JON moves away.
I wish you'd never told me. If I didn't know, I'd be happy right now.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: She sits.

I try to forget. Tonight I did for a while, and then I saw them gathered around you. I saw the way they looked at you. I know that look. So many people have looked at me that way, but never here. Never on this side of the sea.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I told you I don't want it.
Speaker: JON

Text: (angrily) It doesn't matter what you want. You didn't want to be King in the North. What happens when they demand you press your claim, and take what is mine?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON kneels before her.
I'll refuse. You are my queen. I don't know what else I can say.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS quickly takes JON's face in her hands and looks him straight in the eye.

(desperately)You can say nothing. To anyone, ever. Never tell them who you really are. Swear your brother and Samwell Tarly to secrecy, and tell no one else. Or it will take on a life of its own and you won't be able to control it or what it does to people. No matter how many times you bend the knee, no matter what you swear.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON stands. DAENERYS takes his hand in hers.
I want it to be the way it was between us.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON returns her touch.
I have to tell Sansa and Arya.
Speaker: JON

Text: Sansa will want to see me gone and you on the Iron Throne.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: She won't.
Speaker: JON

Text: She's not the girl you grew up with. Not after what she's seen, not after what they've done to her.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I owe them the truth.
Speaker: JON

Text: Even if the truth destroys us?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: It won't.
Speaker: JON

Text: It will. I've never begged for anything but I'm begging you. Don't do this. Please.
