Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON cups her face in his hands.
You are my queen. Nothing will change that. And they are my family. We can live together.
Speaker: JON

Text: We can. I've just told you how.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: JON lets his hands fall. DAENERYS walks away.
BRIENNE's chambers, night
Speaker: INT

Text: BRIENNE and JAIME lie in bed, naked. BRIENNE is fast asleep. JAMIE looks at her, breaths deeply, then stares towards the ceiling.
WInterfell war room, day.
Speaker: INT

Text: The room contains a map of Westeros with stone pieces representing the forces at Winterfell and King's Landing. The war council consists of MISSANDEI, DAENERYS, VARYS, GREY WORM, TYRION, JON, ARYA, SANSA, QHONO, SAM, BRAN, MAESTER WOLKAN, DAVOS and BRIENNE. The mood is somber and tense.
GREY WORM picks up a handful of Winterfell markers.
Half are gone.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: The Northmen as well.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON slides of some other markers. MAESTER WOLKAN slides away some more. VARYS places additional markers in King's Landing.
And the Golden Company has arrived in King's Landing, courtesy of the Greyjoy fleet. The balance has grown distressingly even.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: When the people find out what we have done for them, that we saved them--
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Cersei will make sure they don't believe it. We will hit her hard. We will rip her out root and stem.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The objective here is to remove Cersei without destroying King's Landing.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Thankfully, she's losing allies by the day. Yara Greyjoy has retaken the Iron Islands in her queen's name. The new Prince of Dorne pledges his support.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: No matter how many lords turn against her, as long as she sits on the Iron Throne, she can call herself Queen of the Seven Kingdoms. We need the capital.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I watched the people of King's Landing rebel against their king when they were hungry, and that was before winter began. Give them the opportunity and they will cast Cersei aside.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We'll surround the city. If the Iron Fleet tries to ferry in more food, the dragons will destroy them. If the Lannisters and the Golden Company attack, we'll defeat them in the field.
Speaker: JON

Text: Once the people see that Cersei is our only enemy, her reign is over.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: DAENERYS thinks before responding.
All right.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The men we have left are exhausted. Many of them are wounded. They'll fight better if they have time to rest and recuperate.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: How long do you suggest?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I can't say for certain, not without talking to the officers.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I came north to fight alongside you at great cost to my armies and myself. Now that the time has come to reciprocate, you want to postpone.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: It's not just our people. It's yours. You want to throw them into a war they're not ready to fight?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: THE longer I leave my enemies alone, the stronger they become.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (to SANSA and ARYA) The Northern forces will honor their promises and their allegiance to the Queen of the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON turns to face DAENERYS
What you command, we will obey.
Speaker: JON

Text: ARYA and SANSA exchange a glance.
So if all are in agreement Jon and Ser Davos will ride down the Kingsroad with the Northern troops and the bulk of the remaining Dothraki and Unsullied.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JON moves the corresponding markers on the map.
A smaller group of us will ride to White Harbor, and sail from there to Dragonstone with our queen and her dragons accompanying us from above.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: GREY WORM moves those markers into position.
Ser Jaime has chosen to remain here, as a guest of the Lady of Winterfell.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We have won the Great War. Now we will win the Last War. In all Seven Kingdoms, men will live without fear and cruelty under their rightful queen.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Everyone exits, except for the Stark children. ARYA intercepts JON as he begins to leave. SANSA moves to stand beside BRAN.
We need a word.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Winterfell godswood, day
Speaker: EXT

Text: The Stark children discuss the situation in the godswood.
You understand we'd all be dead if not for her. We'd be corpses marching down to King's Landing.
Speaker: JON

Text: Arya's the one that killed the Night King.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Her men gave their lives defending Winterfell--
Speaker: JON

Text: And we will never forget them. That doesn't mean that I want to kneel to someone who--
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I swore myself and the North to her cause.
Speaker: JON

Text: I respect that.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You respect it?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: We needed her. We needed her army, her dragons. You did the right thing. And we're doing the right thing telling you we don't trust your queen.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You don't know her yet.
Speaker: JON

Text: I'll never know her. She's not one of us.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: If you only trust the people you grew up with, you won't make many allies.
Speaker: JON

Text: That's all right. I don't need many allies.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Arya -
Speaker: JON

Text: We're family. The four of us. The last of the Starks.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I've never been a Stark.
Speaker: JON

Text: You are. You're just as much Ned Stark's child as any of us.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You're my brother. Not my half-brother or my bastard brother. My brother.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: JON hesitates.
It's your choice.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: SANSA and ARYA look to BRAN, confused.
I need to tell you something. But you have to swear you'll never tell another soul.
Speaker: JON

Text: What is it?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You have to swear it, before I tell you.
Speaker: JON

Text: How can I promise to keep a secret if I don't even know what it is?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Because we're family. Swear it.
Speaker: JON

Text: I swear it.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I swear it.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: (to BRAN) Tell them.
Speaker: JON

Text: SANSA and ARYA turn to BRAN.
A Winterfell house, night
Speaker: EXT

Text: Two cloaked people walk by the modest house
The Winterfell house
Speaker: INT

Text: JAIME and TYRION talk by the fire.
So she's going to stay here with you?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She's sworn to protect the Stark girls, so... Say something snide.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I'm happy. I'm happy that you're happy. I'm happy that you'll finally have to climb for it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They both laugh
Do you know how long I've waited to tell tall-person jokes? To climbing mountains.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION and JAIME clink their glasses in a toast.
To climbing mountains.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: They drink.
What's she like down there?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What? That's not your concern.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I haven't been with a woman for years. Give me a morsel.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You're a dog.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I am the Imp, and I demand to know.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: BRONN enters. He cavalierly holds JOFFREY's crossbow
I knew you were fucking her. A pair of tall, blond toffs. Must be like looking in the mirror.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: JAIME motions to the crossbow.
What are you doing with that?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Oh, this? This is for you. For both of you.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You're supposed to be south.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: BRONN sits next to them.
You boys are a pair of gold-plated cunts. Do you know that?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: That's a bit rude.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You're a knight, thanks to me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Thanks to me. And that title's worth as much as a blond hair from your brother's ballsack.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Power resides where men believe--
Speaker: JAIME

Text: Shut your mouth.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I'm just trying--
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I've never hit a dwarf before, but say another word and I will belt you.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: See, I don't believe you'd do that, after all--
Speaker: TYRION

Text: BRONN pivots in his seat and gives TYRION a left hook to the face. JAIME jerks to his feet. In a fluid motion, BRONN leans back and threatens JAIME with the crossbow
You couldn't do it on your best day, you one-handed fuck. And your best days are long gone.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: TYRION tips his head back and groans, holding his nose with both hands.
You broke my nose!
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I did not break your nose.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: How do you know?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Because I've been breaking noses since I was your size, and I know what it sounds like. Now listen. Your sister offered me Riverrun. Nice big castle, good lands, plenty of peasants who do what they're told.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: And you trust Cersei--
Speaker: JAIME

Text: I knew your sister was dead the second I saw those dragons. Now, your army may be torn to shit, but I'd still bet on your Dragon Queen to win. And it just so happens I'm a betting man. If Cersei's dead, she can't pay up.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: BRONN picks up a cup of wine and drinks deeply.
Mmm, that's good. Of course, the odds change if the Dragon Queen's Hand turns up dead. Maybe a few of her top generals get picked off one by one. All of a sudden -
Speaker: BRONN

Text: May I speak?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Why not? Only death will shut you up.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: We made a deal long ago. Do you remember?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: If anyone offered me money to kill you, you'd pay me double. What's double Riverrun?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Highgarden. You could be Lord of the Reach.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Highgarden? Are you mad?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: It's better than being dead.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: He's not going to kill us. He wouldn't be talking to us if--
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRONN unleashes a crossbow bolt just past JAIME's head. They both are taken by surprise, and go silent at the threat. BRONN reloads.
The way I see it, I only need one of the Lannister brothers alive.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Highgarden will never belong to a cutthroat.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: No? Who were your ancestors, the ones who made your family rich? Fancy lads in silk? They were fucking cutthroats. That's how all the great houses started, isn't it? With a hard bastard who was good at killing people. Kill a few hundred people, they make you a lord. Kill a few thousand, they make you king. And then all your cocksucking grandsons can ruin the family with their cocksucking ways.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: BRONN takes another drink
Highgarden. Give me your word.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: You have my word. None of this means a thing until we take King's Landing. We ride south in the morning. We could use an officer with knowledge of the city's defenses.  BRONN; (chuckles)  Oh, no. No, my fighting days are done. But I still got a few killing days left, you hear me? I'll come find you when the war is done. Till then, don't die.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: BRONN stands up and backs out of the room, keeping the crossbow trained on the the Lannisters. He shuts the door behind him. JAIME and TYRION look to one another.
Outside of Winterfell, day.
Speaker: EXT

Text: The HOUND rides though the gray and snowy landscape, chewing on some jerky. He sees something in the distance.
For fuck's sake.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: ARYA rides up next to him. Annoyed, the HOUND throws his jerky on the ground .
On your own?
Speaker: ARAY

Text: They ride side by side.
Not anymore. I don't like crowds.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Me neither.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Why not? They all love you now. You're the big hero.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Don't like heroes.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: It must have felt good sticking a knife in that horned fucker.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Felt better than dying. You're heading to King's Landing?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I have some unfinished business.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Me too.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: I don't plan on coming back.
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Neither do I.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Gonna leave me to die again if I get hurt?
Speaker: HOUND

Text: Probably.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: The HOUND laughs. ARYA smiles.
Hills outside Winterfell.
Speaker: EXT

Text: DAENERYS pets the growling RHAEGAL, who then takes flight. DROGON and DAENERYS watch RHAEGAL take flight. DAENERYS smiles and turns to climb onto DROGON.
Winterfell walkway
Speaker: EXT

Text: SANSA watches the dragons soar through the air. TYRION approaches.
My lady.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Distracted by the flying dragons, SANSA does not answer.
"My lord" is the standard response.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Why her?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You know she loves your brother.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: That doesn't mean she'll be a good queen.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: You seem determined to dislike her. A good relationship between the Iron Throne and the North has been the core of every peaceful, prosperous reign we've ever known.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Jon will be Warden of the North, so a good relationship seems likely.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: I don't expect him to spend much time here going forward.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Well, I suppose that's up to him.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Sansa, look at me.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: SANSA takes her eyes off the dragons and slowly turns to look at TYRION.
With Jon in the capital, you'll be the true power in the North. I'd feel much better about the future if I left here today believing that you and Daenerys were allies.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What are you worried about? Jon's taking our army with him. Your queen still has her dragons--
Speaker: SANSA

Text: She's your queen too.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: The Unsullied march in time out the main gate of Winterfell. SANSA and TYRION both turn to watch.
You're afraid of her.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Every good ruler needs to inspire a bit of fear.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I don't want Jon to go down there. The men in my family don't do well in the capital.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: No, but as your brother once told me, he's not a Stark.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: SANSA gives an exasperated sigh and turns away.
Are you all right?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: SANSA mulls the information she knows about JON's heritage.
Her people love her, you've seen that. You've seen how they fight for her. She wants to make the world a better place. I believe in her.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION starts to walk away.
Tyrion. What if there's someone else? Someone better?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Winterfell courtyard.
Speaker: EXT

Text: DAVOS mounts his steed while JON packs his saddle. TORMUND approachs.
You're not gonna ride the dragon south?
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: JON shakes is head, amused by the jibe. He walks to meet TORMUND half way.
Just a horse. Rhaegal needs to heal. He doesn't need me weighing him down.
Speaker: JON

Text: (scoffs). You weigh as much as two fleas fucking.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: (laughs)
Speaker: JON

Text: I'm taking the Free Folk home. We've had enough of the south. The women down here don't like me.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: This is the North, you know. And the Free Folk are welcome to stay.
Speaker: JON

Text: It isn't home. We need room to wander. I'll take them back through Castle Black as soon as the winter storms pass. Back where we belong.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: JON looks at Ghost.
It's where he belongs too. A direwolf has no place in the south. Will you take him with you? He'll be happier up there.
Speaker: JON

Text: So would you.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: I wish I was going with you. This is farewell, then.
Speaker: JON

Text: You never know.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: TORMUND and JON hug.
You've got the North in you. The real North.
Speaker: TORMUND

Text: TORMUND exits. JON walks to meet SAM and GILLY. JON gives GILLY a hug, and is surprised by her baby bump. She looks at her belly, smiling. SAM nods to confirm that she is pregnant.
Yes, well, the nights have been getting longer and there wasn't that much to do in Oldtown. There's only so many books a person can read, so we--
Speaker: SAM

Text: I'm sure he knows how it happens, Sam. If it's a boy, we want to name him Jon.
Speaker: GILLY

Text: I hope it's a girl.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON and SAM hug, both of them holding back tears.
You're the best friend I ever had.
Speaker: SAM

Text: You too, Sam.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON walks away. Ghost whines as he passes. JON mounts, and rides out of the gate with DAVOS. TORMUND, Ghost, SAM and GILLY watch him go.
The open sea
Speaker: EXT

Text: The Targaryen fleet cuts sails at a fine clip. GREY WORM and MISSANDEI stand together on deck. MISSANDEI discreetly clasps GREY WORM's hand. He looks down at their hands and the smile at one another.
The captain's quarters
Speaker: INT

Text: TYRION sits, talking with VARYS, who stands nearby.
Think of the past 20 years. The war, the murder, the misery. All of it because Robert Baratheon loved someone who didn't love him back.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: How many others know?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: VARYS sits.
Including us? Eight.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Well, then it's not a secret anymore. It's information. If a handful of people know now, hundreds will know soon. Then what happens?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: She loses the North. She loses the Vale, Sansa will make sure of that.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No, it's worse than that. He has the better claim to the throne.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: He doesn't want the throne.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION begins to pace.
I'm not sure it matters what he wants. The fact is, people are drawn to him. Wildlings, Northmen. He's a war hero.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: He loves our queen. And she loves him. If we marry them, they could rule together.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She's his aunt.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: That never stopped a Targaryen before.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No, but Jon grew up in Winterfell. Is marrying your aunt common in the North? You know our queen better than I do. Do you think she wants to share the throne? She does not like to have her authority questioned.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Something she has in common with every monarch who ever lived.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I worry about her state of mind.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: We are advisors to the queen. Worrying about her state of mind is our job. We still have to take King's Landing. Maybe Cersei will win and kill us all. That would solve our problems.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Dragonstone harbor.
Speaker: EXT

Text: A ship drops anchor, and another furls its sails.  Others in the distance have already set anchor. Rhaegal and Drogon fly overhead, with DAENERYS riding. They soar over the castle, enjoying themselves. Suddenly, a huge bolt pierces Rhaegal's chest. He screeches in pain. DAENERYS is baffled and distraught. Rhaegal struggles to continue flying. Another bolt plunges into his chest, and a third pierces his neck. Blood spurts and the mighty dragon tumbles towards the sea.
The Targaryen fleet.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: TYRION and VARYS race to the deck, in time to see Rhaegal plunge into the sea just off the side of their ship, upside down and unconscious. Men shout in confusion and race around the deck. Rhaegel disappears below the foamy splash.
The sky overhead.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: DAENERYS looks down in horror. Another giant bolt zooms just above her head. She ducks in surprise, and looks up to see the Ironborn fleet appear from behind the craggy shores of Blackwater. Scorpions have been mounted on their foredecks. EURON himself mans one of the scorpions. His crew repositions the huge siege weapon for another shot. Rage takes over DAENERYS as she guides Drogon to dive towards the Ironborn. She screams a war cry. EURON patiently waits for his shot. The Ironborn let loose a volley of bolts, forcing DAENERYS to veer away from her attack dive. Drogon escapes unscathed, tailed by bolts as he retreats. DAENERYS reels and seeths.
The Targaryen fleet
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: MISSANDEI and TYRION watch DAENERYS fly away.
The sky overhead
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: DAENERYS is consumed by fury. Then she lowers he head in mourning.
The Ironborn fleet
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EURON watches DAENERYS fly away. He smiles as his men repositions his weapon towards the vulnerable Targaryen ships.
The Targaryen fleet
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: MISSANDEI runs to GREY WORM's side.
Get to the skiff.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: MISSANDEI hesitates.
Now!
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: MISSANDEI retreats.
TYRION takes stock of the attacking Ironborn ships, coming towards them at full sail.
Spears!
Speaker: SOLDIER 1

Text: They're coming round again!
Speaker: SOLDIER 2

Text: The Ironborn fleet
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: EURON takes aim with a menacing smile. He lets loose the bolt with a grunt. The other ships follow suit, sending off a brutal assault
The Targaryen fleet
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The volley of giant bolts takes apart the Targaryen ships. GREY WORM is knocked off his feet by the devastating force of impact.
Go!
Speaker: SOLDIER 3

Text: Clear!
Speaker: SOLDIER 4

Text: Man your stations!
Speaker: SOLDIER 5

Text: No!
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: The sea spurts over the railings as the massive bolts destroy the hull. TYRION pivots away from the attacking side and is nearly impaled  on a whistling bolt. He falls backwards with a grunt. He quickly swivels back to his feet and changes direction. Another mighty bolt screams through the air in front of him, and destroys the railing on the far side of the deck. TYRION tries to continue towards the stern of the ship, but the dangerous bolts continue relentlessly, causing devastation and carnage. With no other options, TYRION jumps overboard to escape.
Go! Go!
Speaker: SOLDIER 4

Text: Clear!
Speaker: SOLDIER 5

Text: TYRION treads water. He looks up as a felled mast comes down on top of him. The screen goes black.
The shore of Blackwater Bay.
Speaker: EXT

Text: Unsullied drag their comrades through the surf and onto the shore. They cough and gasp. VARYS and TYRION lie on the shore, VARYS coughing uncontrollably. TYRION pants. GREY WORM staggers to the shore and desperately looks around.
Missandei? Missandei!
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: GREY WORM runs back into the water, his eyes scanning for his love.
Missandei!
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: He dives into the water and swims out to search for her.
King's Landing, the Red Keep
Speaker: INT

Text: CERSEI looks out into the courtyard of the Red Keep. A crowd files in through the main entrance from the city beyond.
Our message was well-received, then?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Your people have heard the Usurper is coming. They are grateful for your protection within the walls of the Red Keep.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: EURON approaches.
You're certain about the dragon?
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: I saw it sink beneath the waves.
Speaker: EURION

Text: That must have been glorious.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: EURON kneels before her.
The glory is yours, my queen.
Speaker: EURON

Text: CERSEI strokes his face.
When the war is won, the Lion shall rule the land, the Kraken shall rule the sea and our child shall one day rule them all.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: EURON rises, and looks to QYBURN, who nods, confirming CERSEI's pregnancy. Elated, EURON stokes CERSEI affectionately. She does not enjoy it.
She's coming for you.
Speaker: EURON

Text: Of course she is. Keep the gates open. If she wants to take the castle, she'll have to murder thousands of innocent people first.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI moves away from the window and walks past the MOUNTAIN, who guards MISSANDEI, hands shackled and weeping.
So much for "the Breaker of Chains."
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: CERSEI, QYBURN and EURON exit.
Dragonstone War Room
Speaker: INT

Text: DAENERYS lays down the lion figure on the war map.
We will storm the city, my queen. We will kill your enemies. All of them.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Your Grace. I promised you I would look you in the eye and speak directly if I ever thought you were making a mistake. This is a mistake.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: You saw my child fall from the sky.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: (nods)
Speaker: VARYS

Text: They took Missandei.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Cersei needs to be destroyed, but if we attack King's Landing with Drogon and the Unsullied and the Dothraki, tens of thousands of innocents will die. That is why Cersei is bringing them into the Red Keep. These are the people you came here to protect. I beg you, Your Grace. Do not destroy the city you came to save. Do not become what you have always struggled to defeat.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Do you believe we're here for a reason, Lord Varys? I'm here to free the world from tyrants. That is my destiny and I will serve it, no matter the cost.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: VARYS is silent.

It could be a fortnight before Jon and the allied armies make it to King's Landing. In the meantime, demand Cersei surrender. Offer her her life in exchange for the throne. If there's a chance to avoid the coming slaughter, we should make the effort.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Speaking to Cersei will not prevent a slaughter. But perhaps it's good the people see that Daenerys Stormborn made every effort to avoid bloodshed, and Cersei Lannister refused. They should know whom to blame when the sky falls down upon them.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS and GREY WORM exit.
Dragonstone Throne Room
Speaker: INT

Text: I've served tyrants most of my life. They all talk about destiny.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: She's a girl who walked into a fire with three stones and walked out with three dragons. How could she not believe in destiny?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Perhaps that's the problem. Her life has convinced her that she was sent here to save us all.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: And how do you know she wasn't?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Then there's the problem of Jon Snow. Perhaps it's actually a solution. You know them both. Tell me, who do you think would make a better ruler?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: TYRION pours himself some wine.
He doesn't want the throne. That's why he bent the knee.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Have you considered the best ruler might be someone who doesn't want to rule?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: We're discussing treason.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Don't pretend you haven't thought about it.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Of course I've thought about it. Thoughts aren't treason.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: He's temperate and measured. He's a man, which makes him more appealing to the lords of Westeros, whose support we are going to need.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: Joffrey was a man. I don't think a cock is a true qualification, as I'm sure you'd agree.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And he's the heir to the throne. Yes, because he's a man. Cocks are important, I'm afraid.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: What about my earlier proposal? They could rule together as king and queen.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She's too strong for him. She'd bend him to her will, as she already has.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: He could temper her worst impulses.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: As you have? You're drinking quite a lot. A Targaryen father and a Stark mother. Jon's the one man alive who might actually be able to keep the North in the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: How many kings and queens have you served? Five? Six? I've lost count.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You've always known my reasons.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: At a certain point, you choose a person you believe in, and you fight for that person.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Even if you know it's a mistake?
Speaker: VARYS

Text: I believe in our queen. She'll make the right choice. With the help of her loyal advisors.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You know where my loyalty stands. You know I will never betray the realm.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: What is the realm? A vast continent, home to millions of people, most of whom don't care who sits on the Iron Throne.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Millions of people, many of whom will die if the wrong person sits on that throne. We don't know their names, but they're just as real as you and I. They deserve to live. They deserve food for their children. I will act in their interest, no matter the personal cost.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: So, what happens to her?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: VARYS looks at TYRION with a knowing lock, not putting words to the unspeakable. TYRION shakes his head.
Please. Don't.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I've spoken as honestly as I can. Each of us has a choice to make. I pray we choose wisely.
Speaker: VARYS

Text: VARYS exits.
Winterfell courtyard
Speaker: EXT

Text: I'm just about to start it.  WOMAN 1: Good luck.  MAN 2: Protect shell right up to the wall.  MAN 1: All right, I'll put another one on it.   MAN 3: He's headed down to the cellar. I'll need a cart over here.  MAN 4: That's it, thanks. Thank you.
Speaker: A man breaks coal in the busy courtyard.  MAN 1

Text: It's really heavy, mind you.  MAN 5: We need some more water.  MAN 3: Take it down there!
Speaker: JAIME enters the courtyard. He looks over at SANSA, BRIENNE and MAESTER WOLKAN, who are engaged in conversation. WOLKAN exits one way and SANSA and BRIENNE leave in another. JAIME follows them.  WOMAN 2

Text: Another part of the courtyard
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: JAIME finds SANSA talking to BRIENNE.
. . . as are the rest of her advisors.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JAIME approaches them cautiously.
What happened?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: SANSA and BRIENNE exchange a glance. SANSA nods, giving BRIENNE permission to discuss it with JAIME.
Euron Greyjoy ambushed Queen Daenerys and her fleet. One of the dragons was killed, several ships destroyed, Missandei captured.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I always wanted to be there when they execute your sister. Seems like I won't get the chance.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: SANSA exits. JAIME's face falls.
BRIENNE's chambers, night.
Speaker: INT

Text: JAIME sits awake and and fully dressed at the foot of the bed. BRIENNE lies sleeping. He tries to slip away quietly, but the sound of his exit wakes BRIENNE. She sits up, alarmed, looking for him.
Winterfell courtyard, night
Speaker: EXT

Text: JAIME readies his horse for departure. BRIENNE approaches.
They're going to destroy that city. You know they will.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Have you ever run away from a fight?
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE takes JAIME's face in her hands, entreating him.
You're not like your sister. You're not. You're better than she is. You're a good man and you can't save her. You don't need to die with her. Stay here. Stay with me. (voice breaking) Please. Stay.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: You think I'm a good man? I pushed a boy out a tower window, crippled him for life for Cersei. I strangled my cousin with my own hands just to get back to Cersei. I would have murdered every man, woman and child in Riverrun for Cersei.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: BRIENNE inhales deeply, holding back her tears.
She's hateful. And so am I.
Speaker: JAIME

Text: JAIME turns and mounts his horse. BRIENNE sobs. JAIME rides away, leaving her alone with her tears.
Outside King's Landing, day
Speaker: EXT

Text: VARYS, GREY WORM, DAENERYS and TYRION stand in front of the phalanx of Unsullied soldiers. High above them atop the gate, CERSEI, EURON and the MOUNTAIN look down upon them. MISSANDEI stands with them, bound and very scared. They are flanked by a long line of scorpions, loaded, manned and ready. The small company of Unsullied are vastly outnumbered by the archers and soldiers of King's Landing. An Unsullied solder shout and the company thump their spears to attention.
The gate rattles and QYBURN walks out. TYRION steps forward to meet him. They come together half way between the gate and the Unsullied.
My lord.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Queen Daenerys demands Cersei's unconditional surrender and the immediate release of Missandei of Naath.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Queen Cersei demands Daenerys's unconditional surrender. If she refuses, Missandei of Naath will die here and now.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Qyburn, you're a rational man.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Or so I flatter myself, my lord.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: We have a chance here, perhaps our last chance, to avoid carnage.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Yes.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Help me. I don't want to see this city burn. I don't want to hear the screams of children burning alive.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No, it is not a pleasant sound.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: My lord, I am only a mouthpiece for our queen.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Your queen.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Cersei is Queen of the Seven Kingdoms. You are her subject.
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Her reign is over. You understand this. Help her understand it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We understand nothing of the sort. Your queen's last dragon is vulnerable. Your armies are battle-weary and depleted, while ours have been reinforced with the Golden Compan--
Speaker: QYBURN

Text: Having heard enough, TYRION walks past QYBURN so that he can address CERSEI directly. As he approaches the wall, The Kingsguard respond to the thread.
Ready! Nock! Draw!
Speaker: CAPTAIN

Text: The scores of archers draw their bows back, aiming at TYRION. The Imp continues to approach until he is within shouting distance. Looking down on him with contempt, CERSEI raises her hand, ready to give the order to her soldiers. She makes a fist and brings her arm gently to her side. Her men stand down. TYRION nods, gratefully.

I know you don't care about your people. Why should you? They hate you and you hate them. But you're not a monster. I know this. I know this because I've seen it. You've always loved your children. More than yourself, more than Jaime more than anything. I beg you. If not for yourself, then for your child. Your reign is over, but that doesn't mean your life has to end. It doesn't mean your baby has to die.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: CERSEI weights his words. DAENERYS looks on, both anxious and angry. CERSEI steps forward next to MISSANDEI. In response, DAENERYS and GREY WORM move closer.
(to MISSANEDEI) If you have any last words, now is the time.
Speaker: CERSEI

Text: Dracarys.
Speaker: MISSANDEI

Text: Horror and disbelief shows on the faces of DAENERYS and GREY WORM. TYRION mouths "No". CERSEI smiles cruelly. She looks to the MOUNTAIN, who steps forward, drawing his great sword. He sliced through MISSANDEI's neck in sweeping cut. Her head and body fall from the top of the gate to the ground below. GREY WORM turns away, unable to watch. His face twitches and be breathes raggedly.

Atop the wall, CERSEI looks down, satisfied. EURON looks pleased. TYRION turns around, dejected. He looks at DAENERYS, who struggles to contain her anger. She turns and walk away, though the Unsullied soldiers. TYRION knows he has failed her. CERSEI savors her cruel moment. DAENERYS fumes and boils with fury as she walks away.
Lyrics for this song have yet to be released. Please check back once the song has been released.
The ruins of King's Landing
Speaker: EXT

Text: TYRION walks silently through the smoldering desolation of King's Landing as soldiers mill in the distance. Everything is covered in filthy soot, and small fires continue to burn in the ruin. His eyes looks skyward as his memories replay. Flakes of ash drift in the air. He passes piles of brick and broken beams, and small fires speckle the devastation. He passes the prone body of a blond girl, the first of many charred and incinerated corpses. He does not pause.

A man comes towards TYRION, shambling in a state of shock.  His bare chest is streaked with soot, and his pants are in tatters.  TYRION looks back as he passes. The whole of the man's back is burned away severely. TYRION continues forward, with JON and DAVOS trailing behind him. TYRION chokes down his rage as he walks. The bodies here have been reduced to skeletons, even those who were hiding indoors.
TYRION, JON and DAVOS pause at mangled body of a Kingsguard.
I'll find you later.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It's not safe. Let me send some men with you.
Speaker: JON

Text: I'm going alone.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION walks forward, alone. He turns a corner and pauses to take in the  Red Keep, and continues onward.
The streets of King's Landing
Speaker: EXT

Text: Unsullied soldiers stand at attention behind a line of kneeling Kingsguard prisoners. GREY WORM paces in front of them.
In the name of the one true queen, Daenerys Targaryen, I sentence you to die.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Grey Worm!
Speaker: JON

Text: JON and DAVOS enter, along with their men. JON comes face-to-face with GREY WORM.
It's over.
Speaker: JON

Text: These men are prisoners. It is not over until the queen's enemies are defeated.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: How much more defeated do you want them to be? They're on their knees.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: They are breathing.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Look around you, friend. We won.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I obey my queen's commands, not yours.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: And what are the queen's commands?
Speaker: JON

Text: "Kill all who follow Cersei Lannister." These are free men. They chose to fight for her.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: GREY WORM draws his dagger, but JON grabs hold of his arm to stay him. As one, the Unsullied  lower their spears and step into battle stance. The Stark soldiers respond by drawing their weapons to defend their King.
Easy, men. Easy! Easy.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: GREY WORM and JON continue to stare each other down.
Jon. We should speak with the queen.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The tension is broken, and JON looks down. Accepting DAVOS's council,  he releases GREY WORM's arm. They begin to walk away and the Unsullied return to attention. GREY WORM slits the throat of the first Kingsguard, The guard grunts softly as GREY WORM pushes him forward to die. JON and DAVOS exit.
The Red Keep
Speaker: EXT

Text: TYRION walks under the arcade leading to the map courtyard of the Red Keep. A great crack runs the length of the Westeros map, and piles of debris cover both sides of the broken floor. Ash flakes fall like snow. TYRION enters the chamber at the far side. He picks up a metal torch from the floor and continues further into the castle.
The Red Keep Cellar
Speaker: INT

Text: TYRION moves by torchlight down a circular stairway leading below the Keep. He reaches the bottom, and his eyes search the cavernous room.  Archways are filled with rubble, impassable. TYRION spies a crack of light in one archway. He places the torch on the ground.
The Dragon Skull Chamber
Speaker: INT

Text: TYRION enters the cellar chamber containing the dragon skulls. He climbs a pile of rubble and comes upon JAIME's golden hand, half buried amongst the bricks. TYRION kneels, then bows as he touches the hand in grief. As he straightens, he takes away a single heavy brick and tosses it aside. He moves a second brick and then a third. JAIME's body starts to become visible. TRYION begins to weep, painfully. He fights back the tears, and begins to work again. After a few bricks, his sobs overtake him. Still mostly buried corpses, JAIME lays holding CERSEI. TYRION bawls, and smashes a brick repeatedly in frustration. He props himself up to look at his siblings. He sobs again.
Streets of King's Landing.
Speaker: EXT

Text: ARYA walks through the streets, taking in the piles of debris and bodies. She is soot covered, he face bloody and filthy. Nearby, the Dothraki shout. She looks beyond the arches where the mounted Dothraki forces have amassed.

Amongst the Dothraki, JON strides forward. They are still filled with battle lust, and their horses are antsy for action. After passing through the wild Dothraki, JON reaches the phalanx of disciplined Unsullied. He continues forward to a great staircase leading to a ruined structure. An expansive Targaryan flag hangs over the left side of the ruined facade.
The adjacent arcade
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: Further back, ARYA also walks forward, staying under the arcade to the left of the riled Dothraki.
The steps
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: JON reaches the foot of the staircase, lined by Unsullied on each side. He ascends towards GREY WORM above. A dragon roars in the distance. JON takes a deep breath as he looks up at GREY WORM at the top of the stairs. Drogon roars again. As the dragon files over the Dothraki, they cheer wildly. Drogon glides over the ruined facade. JON renews his ascent.

JON reaches the top of the stairs. DAENERYS walks stoically from within the ruin of the building. Drogon roars and unfurls behind her. His wings appearing to expand from her soldiers, making her the image of a true dragon queen. Drogon then launches into the air. DAENERYS reaches the grand terrace, its staircase flanked by the disciplined Unsullied. She surveys the devastation of King's Landing, which continues to burn and smolder as far as the eye can see. JON walks to the wings as she takes her place in the center of the terrace, looking out over the ranks of the Unsullied, and the shouting Dothraki horde behind them. DAENERYS breathes deeply as she takes in her triumph, her destiny.
The courtyard.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: The Unsullied stand at rigid attention.  The controlled stillness of the Unsullied provides stark contrast to the wild Dothraoki ululations behind them.

The Dothraki, still mounted continue to celebrate in their visceral fashion. They waive their raises swords and cheer wildly. Their horses churn amongst themselves, feeding on the energy of their riders.
The terrace.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: (in Dothraki) Blood of my blood.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Dothraki horde quiets and looks up to their khaleesi.
You kept all your promises to me. You killed my enemies in their iron suits.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Dothraki cheer.
Your tore down their stone houses. You gave me the Seven Kingdoms.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Drogon lands on a ruined building to her left, and lets out a screeching roar. The Dothraki return the cheer, and resume their wild cries of celebration, waiving their weapons once again. From DAENERYS"s left, JON looks on with concern. DAENERYS surveys her forces with pride and satisfaction. She turns to speak to GREY WORM.
Torgo Nudho.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: GREY WORM steps forward from her right.
(in Valyrian) You have walked beside me since the Plaza of Pride. You are the bravest of men, the most loyal of soldiers. I name you commander of all my forces, the Queen's Master of War.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Unsullied thump their spears in a unison of slow triplets. GREY WORM steps back. From behind the terrace, TYRION approaches, his face a mask of malice.
(in Valyrian) Unsullied. All of you were torn from your mother's arms and raised as slaves. Now you are liberators. You have freed the people of King's Landing from the grip of a tyrant!
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Unsullied thump their spears.
(in Valyrian) But the war is not over. We will not lay down our spears until we have liberated all the people of the world!
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The Unsullied thump their spears as DAENERYS continues her speech. JON and TYRION watch her, stone faced and roiling.
(in Valyrian) From Winterfell to Dorne, from Lannisport to Qarth, from the Summer Isles to the Jade Sea! Women, men and children have suffered too long beneath the wheel.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Drogon roars and the Unsullied thump in threes.
(in Valyrian) Will you break the wheel with me?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Drogon answers with a roar. The Unsullied  answer by thumping their spears rhythmically. Behind them, ARYA looks on with disgust.
DAENERYS savors the moment. The Unsullied thump. Drogon roards. The Dothraki go wild, horses rearing.

TYRION takes a deep breath, passes JON and approaches DAENERYS  cautiously from behind. He stands to her left to take in the scene. DAENERYS looks at him, satisfied. DROGON roars. The celebrations continue, spears thumping in rhythm and Dothraki screaming amok.
You freed your brother. You committed treason.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I freed my brother. And you slaughtered a city.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They face one another. TYRION devastated and DAENERYS haughty. They lock eyes. TYRION removes his Queen's Hand brooch. He tosses it away in disgust. The brooch bounces half way down the steps, landing at the feet of an Unsullied warrior. The celebrations come to a quiet. DAENERYS and TYRION continue to take measure of one another. DAENERYS makes her decision.
(In Valyrian) Take him.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Two Unsullied step forward and flank TYRION. The dwarf accepts his fate, turns his back to the courtyard, and walks slowly away. The Unsullied pivot and walks beside him. TYRION gives JON a look that demands that JON come to his own reckoning of DAENERYS's slaughter of King's Landing. JON's sorrowful visage is weighed by the gravity of the situation. He watches GREY WORM lead TYRION away. JON turns back to look at DAENERYS. She is both transcendent and horrible. She sees JON's inner conflict, and chooses to let him think. She walks away from the courtyard, her Unsullied falling in line behind her. JON watches her go.
JON steps into the courtyard behind the terrace and looks on as DAENERYS continues to walk on. He suddenly notices that ARYA has appeared silently at his side.
What are you doing here?
Speaker: JON

Text: Gathering himself, JON notices the cuts and wounds across ARYA's face. He takes hold of her.
Hey, what happened?
Speaker: JON

Text: I came to kill Cersei. Your queen got there first.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: (sighs) She's everyone's queen now.
Speaker: JON

Text: They watch DAENERYS walk away with her Unsullied.
Try telling Sansa.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Wait for me outside the city gates. I'll come find you.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON starts to leave, but ARYA grabs his arm to halt him.
Jon. She knows who you are. Who you really are. You'll always be a threat to her. And I know a killer when I see one.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: King's Landing Cellar
Speaker: INT

Text: JON descends a staircase, followed by an Unsullied warrior. He looks at the two Unsullied guards at the foot of the staircase, then hands Longclaw back to his minder. He strides past the Unsullied.
Tyrion's makeshift cell.
Speaker: INT

Text: An Unsullied warrior opens the door for JON, who walks past him into a large, darkened storeroom strewn with cabinets, tables, pots and crates.  The door shuts behind JON as he comes upon TYRION who sits on the floor, back against a small wooden pen.
Did you bring any wine?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: No.
Speaker: JON

Text: Ah... Well... thank you for coming to see me. Our queen doesn't keep prisoners for long. I suppose there's a crude kind of justice. I betrayed my closest friend and watched him burn. Now Varys's ashes can tell my ASHES: "See, I told you." It just occurred to me. I'm talking to the only man alive who knows where I'm going.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (sighs)
Speaker: JON

Text: So is there life after death?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Not that I've seen.
Speaker: JON

Text: I should be thankful. Oblivion is the best I could hope for. I strangled my lover. I shot my own father with a crossbow. I betrayed my queen.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You didn't.
Speaker: JON

Text: I did. And I'd do it again, now that I've seen what I've seen. I chose my fate. The people of King's Landing did not.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I can't justify what happened. I won't try. But the war is over now.
Speaker: JON

Text: Is it? When you heard her talking to her soldiers, did she sound like someone who's done fighting?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION stands and approaches JON.
She liberated the people of Slaver's Bay. She liberated the people of King's Landing. And she'll go on liberating until the people of the world are free and she rules them all.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And you've been by her side, counseling her. Until today.
Speaker: JON

Text: Until today. Varys was right. I was wrong. It was vanity to think I could guide her. Our queen's nature is fire and blood.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You think our house words are stamped on our bodies when we're born and that's who we are? Then I'd be fire and blood too. She's not her father, no more than you're Tywin Lannister.
Speaker: JON

Text: My father was an evil man. My sister was an evil woman. Pile up all the bodies of all the people they ever killed, there still won't be half as many as our beautiful queen slaughtered in a single day.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Cersei left her no choice.
Speaker: JON

Text: The moment the gates fell, the battle was over.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She saw her friend beheaded. She saw her dragon shot out of the sky.
Speaker: JON

Text: And she burned down a city for it.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Ah, it's easy to judge when you're standing far from the battlefield.
Speaker: JON

Text: Would you have done it?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What?
Speaker: JON

Text: You've been up there, on a dragon's back. You've had that power. Would you have burned the city down?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I don't know.
Speaker: JON

Text: (scoffs) Yes, you do. You won't say because you don't want to betray her but you know.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: What's it matter what I'd do?
Speaker: JON

Text: It matters more than anything. When she murdered the slavers of Astapor, I'm sure no one but the slavers complained. After all, they were evil men.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (sighs)
Speaker: JON

Text: When she crucified hundreds of Meereenese nobles, who could argue? They were evil men. The Dothraki khals she burned alive? They would have done worse to her. Everywhere she goes, evil men die and we cheer her for it. And she grows more powerful and more sure that she is good and right. She believes her destiny is to build a better world for everyone. If you believed that if you truly believed it, wouldn't you kill whoever stood between you and paradise?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JON sits, overwhelmed, and inhales deeply. TYRION walks closer to him.
I know you love her. I love her too. Not as successfully as you. But I believed in her with all my heart. Love is more powerful than reason. We all know that. Look at my brother.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: "Love is the death of duty."
Speaker: JON

Text: You just came up with that?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Maester Aemon said it a long time ago.
Speaker: JON

Text: Sometimes duty is the death of love. You are the shield that guards the realms of men. And you've always tried to do the right thing. No matter the cost, you've tried to protect people. Who is the greatest threat to the people now?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JON weighs TYRION's words, somber and distraught.
It's a terrible thing I'm asking. It's also the right thing. Do you think I'm the last man she'll execute? Who is more dangerous than the rightful heir to the Iron Throne?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: JON exhales shakily. Then he stands, regaining his composure.
That's her decision. She is the queen.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON pats TYRION's shoulder, and rests his hand there.
I'm sorry it came to this.
Speaker: JON

Text: JON walks back to the door and knocks to call the guards.
And your sisters? Do you see them bending the knee?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: My sisters will be loyal to the throne.
Speaker: JON

Text: Why do you think Sansa told me the truth about you? Because she doesn't want Dany to be queen.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: She doesn't get to choose.
Speaker: JON

Text: No. But you do. And you have to choose now.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Keys rattle outside the door and it swings open. The guard stands at attention. JON ponders, then leaves quickly. The Unsullied guard shuts the door.
King's Landing arcade.
Speaker: EXT

Text: JON strides the length of an arcade that is lined by Unsullied soldiers.
King's Landing courtyard.
Speaker: EXT

Text: JON walks in the snowy courtyard. The piles of rubble are covered by a layer of snow. More snow falls from the grey and blustery sky. He looks up at the Red Keep as he walks, approaching a passageway that leads to the Keep. As he approaches the passage, the large pile before him cracks, then undulates and expands. It is Drogon, wakened from slumber. The blanket of snow that enveloped him falls away. The dragon growls and extends himself to smell JON, who stands motionless before the great beast. Drogon growls softly, and curls back around himself, accepting JON's presence. JON walks past him and into the dark passage.
The Throne Room
Speaker: INT

Text: DAENERYS walks out of the darkness, into the half-demolished throne room. The Iron Throne sits untouched, surrounded by dust and snow. Open sky extends beyond it, where the wall of the Keep once stood. The wind blows and snow falls directly into the room. DAENERYS pauses, then walks to the throne, past the twisted and broken waste. She touches the hilt of one of the countless swords that have been forged into the throne. With a faint smile, DAENERYS takes in the enormity of the completion of her life's quest. She turns and looks back across the length of the hall.
JON emerges from the same entryway that DAENERYS used. He walks towards her. She descends the steps to meet him, happy to share her victory with him.

When I was a girl, my brother told me it was made with 1000 swords from Aegon's fallen enemies. What do 1000 swords look like in the mind of a little girl who can't count to 20? I imagined a mountain of swords too high to climb. So many fallen enemies, you could only see the soles of Aegon's feet.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I saw them executing Lannister prisoners in the street. They said they were acting on your orders.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS takes on a defensive demeanor in response to JON's anger.
It was necessary.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Necessary? Have you been down there? Have you seen? Children, little children, burned!
Speaker: JON

Text: I tried to make peace with Cersei. She used their innocence as a weapon against me. She thought it would cripple me.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: And Tyrion?
Speaker: JON

Text: He conspired behind my back with my enemies. How have you treated people who've done the same to you, even when it broke your heart?
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: Forgive him.
Speaker: JON

Text: I can't.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You can. You can forgive all of them, make them see they made a mistake. Make them understand.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS does not respond.
Please, Dany.
Speaker: JON

Text: We can't hide behind small mercies. The world we need won't be built by men loyal to the world we have.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: The world we need is a world of mercy. It has to be.
Speaker: JON

Text: DAENERYS comes closer, hopeful and bright.
And it will be. It's not easy to see something that's never been before. A good world.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: How do you know? How do you know it'll be good?
Speaker: JON

Text: Because I know what is good. And so do you.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: I don't.
Speaker: JON

Text: You do. You do. You've always known.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: What about everyone else? All the other people who think they know what's good.
Speaker: JON

Text: They don't get to choose.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: DAENERYS embraces JON.

Be with me. Build the new world with me. This is our reason. It has been from the beginning, since you were a little boy with a bastard's name and I was a little girl who couldn't count to 20. We do it together. We break the wheel together.
Speaker: DAENERYS

Text: You are my queen. Now, and always.
Speaker: JON

Text: They kiss, passionately. JON's right arm thrusts as they kiss. He grunts as his blade pierces DAENERYS through the heart. Their lips part. Panting, DAENERYS looks down at the blade in her torso, then up into JON's eyes. They both pant and gasp. DAENERYS falls back, JON holding her up with both arms. Her eyes glaze in pain and disbelief. She takes shallow, panting breaths as small rivulets of blood run from her mouth and nose. She dies. JON exhales sharply and begins to weep.

JON cradles her dead body. In the distance, DROGON screeches. The dragon past, then circles back to the throne room. Drogon roars and growls as he scrambles slowly towards JON and DAENERYS. He sniffs, confused and curious. JON tenderly lays DAENERYS down onto the snow-covered floor and continues his half-embrace as he takes her in.

Behind him, Drogon, pushes forward, growling. JON stands and faces the dragon. He steps carefully back to make room. Drogon nuzzles DAENERYS and coos. When she doesn't move, he nuzzles more firmly with his chin. Recognizing she is dead, Drogon gives a short, piercing whistle, then looks directly at JON. A rumbling growl builds as Drogon bares his teeth at JON. He rears back, screeching and whistling, then turns to the sky for a deafening roar. He spreads his wings, balancing on his haunches, roaring and roaring. He brings his forearms down, and looks directly down at JON. He roars and his throat glows as the fire builds in his belly. JON prepares for his immolation.

Drogon lets loose his inferno, extending his neck so that the flames surge past JON's head burn the castle walls around the Iron Throne. Drogon stops, takes a deep breath, then blasts the Iron Throne with an unyielding conflagration. The mighty throne slowly gives way as Drogon spews fire and roars. The sword tips melt and bend. The throne becomes a glowing, amorphous slag under the relentless flames. It spills and melts away in a molten, flaming heap.

Drogon stops his assault. JON looks at the oozing, burning slag in amazement. Behind him, Drogon nuzzles DAENERYS again. Then the dragon grabs her gently in his hind claw. He takes to the sky, launching over the remains of the Iron Throne. He gives a final roar, and flies gently away.
Tyrion's Makeshift Cell.
Speaker: INT

Text: TYRION lies silently on the floor, eyes open, hands shackled. Footsteps approach and the door rattles open. GREY WORM enters, flanked by two Unsullied.
An arcade
Speaker: EXT

Text: TYRION walks with his hands chained. GREY WORM leads him to the Dragon Pit, with four unsullied marching behind them.
EXT; The Dragon Pit

GREY WORM and TYRION reach the entrance to the Dragon Pit. The pass the Unsullied footmen who stand at attention. The large awning tent stands in the center of the pit, with many people seated underneath. GREY WORM and TYRION approach the central dais. Seated there are SAM, a RIVERLANDS LORD, and EDMURE, then ARYA, BRAN and SANSA,  then  BRIENNE, DAVOS, GENDRY and a VALE LORD, then an IRONBORN LORD, YARA and a DORNISH PRINCE and finally ROBIN ARRYN,  MAESTER WOLKAN and YOHN ROYCE. TYRION glowers at them, meets their eyes, and looks down in shame. GREY WORM stands with disciplined posture at his side.
Where's Jon?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: He is our prisoner.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: So is Lord Tyrion. They were both to be brought to this gathering.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: We will decide what we do with our prisoners. This is our city now.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: If you look outside the walls of your city, you'll find thousands of Northmen who will explain to you why harming Jon Snow is not in your interest.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: And you will find thousands of Unsullied who believe that it is.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Some of you may be quick to forgive. The Ironborn are not. I swore to follow Daenerys Targaryen.
Speaker: YARA

Text: You swore to follow a tyrant.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: She freed us from a tyrant. Cersei is gone because of her, and Jon Snow put a knife in her heart. Let the Unsullied give him what he deserves.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Say another word about killing my brother and I'll cut your throat.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: DAVOS stands.
Friends, please. We've been cutting each other's throats long enough. Torgo Nudho. Am I saying that properly?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: GREY WORM does not respond.

If it weren't for you and your men, we would've lost the war with the dead. This country owes you a debt it can never repay, but let us try. There is land in the Reach. Good land. The people that used to live there are gone. Make it your own. Start your own house with the Unsullied as your bannermen. We've had enough war. Thousands of you, thousands of them. You know how it ends. We need to find a better way.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: We do not need payment. We need justice. Jon Snow cannot go free.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: DAVOS sits.
It's not for you to decide.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: You are not here to speak! Everyone has heard enough words from you.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: (nods) You're right. And no one's any better for it. But it's not for you to decide. Jon committed his crime here. His fate is for our king to decide. Or our queen.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We don't have a king or queen.
Speaker: MAESTER WOLKAN

Text: You're the most powerful people in Westeros. Choose one.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION looks at GREY WORM, who shakes his head dismissively.
Make your choice, then.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Those on the dais exchange glances. EDMURE seizes the moment. He stands and moves towards the center of the dais.
Uncle? Please sit.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: EDMURE scoffs and looks around for support. He only finds muted laughter and averted gazes as he engages ROBIN, YOHN ROYCE, MAESTER WOLKAN and SAM. He turns to SANSA, whose eyes instruct him to take his seat. Humiliated, Edmure turns and stumbles as his sword crashes into the post at his side. He sits, then sighs.
Well, we have to choose someone.
Speaker: MAESTER WOLKAN

Text: SAM clears his throat to get everyone's attention.
Why just us?
Speaker: SAM

Text: SAM stands.
Those gather ponder SAM's suggestion. YOHN ROYCE bursts out laughing, and others follow.
Maybe we should give the dogs a vote as well.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: I'll ask my horse.
Speaker: YOHN ROYCE

Text: SAM nods uncomfortably at their rejection, then sits.
I suppose you want the crown.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: Me? The Imp? Half the people hate me for serving Daenerys, the other half hate me for betraying her.  Can't think of a worse choice.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Who, then?
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: I've had nothing to do but think these past few weeks. About our bloody history. About the mistakes we've made.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION looks at GREY WORM, who rebuffs him.

What unites people? Armies? Gold? Flags? Stories. There's nothing in the world more powerful than a good story. Nothing can stop it. No enemy can defeat it. And who has a better story than Bran the Broken? The boy who fell from a high tower and lived. He knew he'd never walk again, so he learned to fly. He crossed beyond the Wall, a crippled boy, and became the Three-Eyed Raven. He is our memory, the keeper of all our stories. The wars, weddings, births, massacres, famines. Our triumphs, mm, our defeats, our past. Who better to lead us into the future?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Bran has no interest in ruling and he can't father children.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Good. Sons of kings can be cruel and stupid, as you well know. His will never torment us. That is the wheel our queen wanted to break.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION looks at GREY WORM again. This time, he holds the Imp's gaze.
From now on, rulers will not be born. They will be chosen on this spot by the lords and ladies of Westeros to serve the realm.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION walks to BRAN.

I know you don't want it. I know you don't care about power. But I ask you now, if we choose you will you wear the crown? Will you lead the Seven Kingdoms to the best of your abilities from this day until your last day?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Why do you think I came all this way?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: To Brandon of House Stark I say aye.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: They consider
Aye.
Speaker: SAM

Text: TYRION nods in return.
Aye.
Speaker: EDMURE

Text: Aye.
Speaker: RIVERLANDS LORD

Text: Aye.
Speaker: YOHN ROYCE

Text: TYRION turns to YOHN ROYCE, who nods in approval.
Aye.
Speaker: MAESTER WOLKAN

Text: Aye.
Speaker: ROBIN

Text: Aye.
Speaker: DORNISH PRINCE

Text: Aye.
Speaker: YARA

Text: Aye.
Speaker: IRONBORN LORD

Text: Aye.
Speaker: VALE LORD

Text: Aye.
Speaker: GENDRY

Text: I'm not sure I get a vote, but aye.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Aye.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: SANSA turns to BRAN.

I love you, little brother. I always will. You'll be a good king. But tens of thousands of Northmen fell in the Great War defending all of Westeros. And those who survived have seen too much and fought too hard ever to kneel again. The North will remain an independent kingdom, as it was for thousands of years.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: BRAN nods, accepting SANSA's terms.
All hail Bran the Broken, First of His Name, King of the Andals and the First Men, Lord of the Six Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Everyone stands (except BRAN).
All hail Bran the Broken!
Speaker: ALL

Text: They sit. TYRION bows to BRAN and turns to leave.
Lord Tyrion you will be my Hand.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: And I don't want to be king.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: I don't deserve it. I thought I was wise, but I wasn't. I thought I knew what was right, but I didn't. Choose Ser Davos. Choose anyone else.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I choose you.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: You cannot.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: Yes, I can. I'm king.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: This man is a criminal. He deserves justice.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: He just got it. He's made many terrible mistakes. He's going to spend the rest of his life fixing them.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: It is not enough.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: JON's makeshift cell.
Speaker: INT

Text: TYRION councils JON in his cell.
Giving you to the Unsullied would start a war. Letting you walk free would start a war. So our new king has chosen to send you to the Night's Watch.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: There's still a Night's Watch?
Speaker: JON

Text: The world will always need a home for bastards and broken men.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (sighs)
Speaker: JON

Text: You shall take no wife, hold no lands, father no children. The Unsullied wanted your head of course, but Grey Worm has accepted the justice of a life sentence. Sansa and Arya wanted you freed, but they understand our new king needs to make peace. No one is very happy. Which means it's a good compromise, I suppose.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Was it right? What I did?
Speaker: JON

Text: What we did.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: It doesn't feel right.
Speaker: JON

Text: Ask me again in 10 years.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: TYRION approaches JON, and rests his hand on JON's shoulder. He starts to walk away.
I don't expect we'll ever see each other again.
Speaker: JON

Text: I wouldn't be so sure. A few years as Hand of the King would make anyone want to piss off the edge of the world.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (nods)
Speaker: JON

Text: TYRION exits.
King's Landing seaward stairs.
Speaker: EXT

Text: JON descends the stairs. The surf roars and seagulls call. Two men of the Night's Watch await him at the bottom of the stairs. They follow him as he continues towards the water. The bay is filled with ships.
the wharfs
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: JON walks through the busy wharf. He looks up to see GREY WORM in the ship that he is passing. They take measure of one another, then JON looks down and continues on. An UNSULLIED CAPTAIN joins GREY WORM
(in Valyrian) All the men have boarded.
Speaker: UNSULLIED CAPTAIN

Text: (in Valyrian) Good. We sail for the isle of Naath.
Speaker: GREY WORM

Text: The UNSULLIED CAPTAIN nods and exits. The Unsullied prepare their ship for embarkment.
King's Landing sea walk.
Speaker: CUT TO

Text: JON walks along the sea wall. SANSA, ARYA and BRAN are waiting for him.
I wish there had been another way. Can you forgive me?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: JON struggles to find any words.
The North is free, thanks to you.
Speaker: JON

Text: But they lost their king.
Speaker: SANSA

Text: Ned Stark's daughter will speak for them. She's the best they could ask for.
Speaker: JON

Text: SANSA gives JON a tearful hug. He holds her close. JON then places his hand on ARYA's shoulder.
You can come see me, you know, at Castle Black.
Speaker: JON

Text: I can't.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: You think anyone will dare tell you women aren't allowed?
Speaker: JON

Text: (chuckles)  I'm not going back north.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: Where are you going?
Speaker: SANSA

Text: What's west of Westeros?
Speaker: ARYA

Text: (chuckles) I don't know.
Speaker: JON

Text: No one knows. It's where all the maps stop. That's where I'm going.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: JON and ARYA trade nods.
You have your Needle?
Speaker: JON

Text: Right here.
Speaker: ARYA

Text: JON and ARYA embrace, tearfully. JON then kneels before BRAN.
Your Grace. I'm sorry I wasn't there when you needed me.
Speaker: JON

Text: You were exactly where you were supposed to be.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: JON rises and sighs. He gives a last look at his three siblings, and walks to the ship's boat filled with night's watchmen.
King's Landing library
Speaker: INT

Text: BRIENNE sits in the library, paging through the history of the knights of Westeros. She comes to the page for Ser Jaime Lannister. It is only half written, and somewhat sloppily done. She fills his pages in careful script. She has to think about how to end the entry. Her final written line is "Died protecting his Queen." She closes the massive tome.
Small Council Chamber.
Speaker: INT

Text: TYRION enters first, and looks at the chair inscribed for the hand. He sits down and sighs. He gets up quickly to straighten the other chairs at the table to make the room more presentable. The door opens, and he sits back down at the head of the table. BRONN, DAVOS and SAM (dressed in Maester's garb) enter. BRONN and DAVOS noisily and uncouthly take their seats. TYRION quietly emits some futile protests.
SAM places a large book in front of TYRION.
What's this?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: A Song of Ice and Fire. Archmaester Ebrose's history of the wars following the death of King Robert. I helped him with the title.
Speaker: SAM

Text: TYRION starts to flip through the pages.
I suppose I come in for some heavy criticism.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Oh, I wouldn't say that.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Oh, he's kind to me. Never would've guessed.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: SAM does not respond.
He's not kind?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: He -
Speaker: SAM

Text: He what? What does he say about me?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: I don't believe you're mentioned, ahem.
Speaker: SAM

Text: TYRION cannot believe it. BRONN smirks. TYRION pushes the book aside as the door opens. They stand as BRAN enters, his chair pushed by BRIENNE, now captain of the Kingsguard.
Your Grace.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Your Grace.
Speaker: SAM

Text: BRIENNE places BRAN at the other head of the table. TYRION sits, and the others follow his lead. They look to BRAN.
We appear to be missing a Master of Whisperers. And a Master of Laws. And a Master of War.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: Yes, Your Grace. Suitable prospects will be brought to you for an audience in the coming weeks.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: And Drogon? Any word?
Speaker: BRAN

Text: He was last spotted flying east, toward--
Speaker: SAM

Text: The farther away, the better.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Perhaps I can find him. Do carry on with the rest.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: As you wish, Your Grace.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Ser Podrick.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: PODRICK enters, also a kingsguard. The small council stands.
(clearing his throat) We serve at your pleasure, King Bran the Broken, ruler of the Six Kingdoms and Protector of the Realm. Long may he reign.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Long may he reign.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Long may he reign.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: Long may he reign.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: Long may he reign.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: PODRICK wheels BRAN around.
That will improve.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: (smiling) I'm sure it will.
Speaker: BRAN

Text: BRAN and PODRICK exit. Everyone sits back down.
Ser Bronn of the Blackwater, Lord of Highgarden, Lord Paramount of the Reach and Master of Coin, would you say the crown's debt to you has been paid?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: In full, my lord Hand.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Good. Time to start incurring a new one. We have hungry people to feed. Can we expect some assistance in this regard?
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Indeed we can.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Lord Davos, we have an armada to rebuild and ports to repair.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: We have. These projects will begin as soon as the Master of Coin and Lord of Lofty Titles provides funding.
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: The Master of Coin looks forward to helping the Master of Ships, but first he has to ensure we're not wasting coin, or soon there won't be no more coin.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: "Any more."
Speaker: DAVOS

Text: You Master of Grammar now too?
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Grandmaester, ahem, it is my theory, based on my years of work on the Casterly Rock sewers, that clean water leads to a healthier population.
Speaker: SAM

Text: The Archmaester has done some research on this subject and it turns out--
Speaker: SAM

Text: The strong live and the weak don't.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Find the best builders and set them to the task.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Oh, speaking of builders, all the best brothels burned down. The Master of Coin is willing to fund reconstruction.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: Uh the Archmaester is less than enthusiastic about the salutary effects of brothels.
Speaker: SAM

Text: Well, I imagine he isn't using them properly.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I think we can all agree that ships take precedence over brothels.
Speaker: BRIENNE

Text: I think that's a very presumptuous statement.
Speaker: BRONN

Text: I once brought a jackass and a honeycomb into a brothel.
Speaker: TYRION

Text: Castle Black.

Text: The wind whistles on a grey day at the wall. A horn sounds as JON and two night's watchmen arrive on horseback. The doors are opened for them. Jon breathes deeply, gathering his emotional strength. In the courtyard, TORMUND stands, resting. JON spurs his mount forward. The gate closes behind him.

Text: JON makes his way through the ragtag crowd of wildling women, children, and men. They part to make way for him. Ghost whines, and JON smiles. The direwolf is missing an ear, and has other cuts and abrasions. JON kneels down to pet him. Ghost licks him in return.

Text: JON rides through the tunnel, with TORMUND behind him. Ghost reaches the other side of the wall first. The free folk follow behind them. The move out into the snowy expanse. The freefolk chatter happily as they walk. JON looks back as the external gate closes. They reach the first expanse of woods, and continue northward.
